cursed man shall make carued molten image vvhiche abhomination vnto lorde cursed bee hee cofirmeth vvordes law doe cursed hee hath fulfilled law israell doe god vvill set vp high aboue nation earth israell dooe god hee shall bee fylled wyth maner blessinges fruite thy bodie shalbe blessed fruit thy ground fruite thy cattell b people earth shall see name lorde called vppon ouer godly shall feare god maketh godly abounde rich fruite body israell vvill obey voyce lorde cursed shall bee fruite body fruite lande fruite kyne sheepe vvhosoeuer obeyeth voyce lorde shall bee afflicted diuers sortes b lorde smite trensgressours lavve swoorde pursue till hee make peryshe heauen shall bee ouer thy heade shall bee brasse earth vnder thee shall bee iron b b lorde shall cause transgressour law fall enemy rebel shall plant vineyardes shall gather grape people vnknowen shall eate fruite earthe wicked labour thou shalt sowe gather lyttle thou shalt plant vineyarde shalt drinke wyne thou shalt haue oliue tree shalt anointe thy selfe vvith oyle transgressour lawe shall serue enemie vvhich lorde shall sende vppon lord shall rayse transgressours law people farre euen endes earth flying swift eagle god vvill giue trembling heart vnto transgressours lavve dazeling eye sorrovvfull minde thy lyfe shall hange beefore thee thou shalt feare night day haue none assuraunce thy lyfe thou shalt saye morning would god eueninge eueninge thou shalt saye woulde god morning feare thine heart thou shalt feare sight thine eys thou shalt see b thy lyfe shall hang thee thou shalt say morning would god euening b lorde hath giuen hart perceiue eye see care heare vnto day secret lorde reuealed vnto v doe aii word law lorde circumcise thine hart hart thy seede thou mayest loue lord thine hart thy soule thou mayest liue vvho shall goe beyonde sea shal goe vp heauen shall goe dovvne deepe bring v worde nere v call heauen earth record day haue set life death blessing cursing therfore chuse life thou mayest liue doctrine shall droppe raine woorde shall distill doth devv god keepeth people apple eye b eagle fluttereth ouer byrdes stretcheth winges taketh beareth winges b haue ben vpight vvaxed fat hath spurned fyre kindled wrath shall burne vnto bottom hell shall consume earth incrase set fire soundations mountaynes althings shut vp god cofers b layd store wyth sealed vp among treasure god killeth maketh liue woundeth maketh whole none deliuer hand b iosua sunne stay moon til people reuenged enemy b terah nachor graundefathers elium serue straunge god b samuell lorde kylleth maketh neyther sonne daughter deliuered thy natiuitie day thou wast borne thy nauell cut thou wast washed water purge thee thou wast salted salt swadled cloutes b passed thee looked vpon thee beholde thy time time loue spread skirtes garmente ouer thee couered thy filthynesse entered intoo couenaunt thee thou becamest myne b thou haste opened thy feete euerie one passed multiplyed thy whoredome iniquitie sodome fulnesse breade aboundance idlenesse b soule sinneth shall dye sonne shall beare iniquitie father b wicked repent shall liue dye man obseruing iudgementes god shall liue b thou shalte euen drinke wring dregges thou shalte breake sherdes therof teare thyne owne brest weake haue yee strengthened sicke haue yee healed neyther haue yee bound vppe broken brought agayne driuen awaye neyther haue yee sought lost crueltie rigor haue ye ruled seemeth small thing vntoo haue eaten vppe good pasture yee must treade downe feete residue pasture haue drunk deepe water yee muste trouble residue fee e newe heart giue israell take awaye stonie heart bodie giue hart flesh poure cleane water vpon behold people open graues cause come vp sepulcher b bring vppe sepulcher b winde blewe bone returned life daniell king thou arte king kinges god heauen hathe giuen thee kingdome power strength glorie place child men dwell beast fielde foules heauen hath gyuen thine hand hath made thee ruler ouer thou king arte greate mightie thy greatnesse growne reacheth vntoo heauen thy dominion endes earthe thousande thousandes ministred vntoo ten thousande thousandes stoode b vvee haue sinned haue committed iniquitie haue doone wickedly yea wee haue rebelled haue departed thy preceptes b lorde tightuousnesse belongeth vntoo thee vntoo v open shame appeereth daye vntoo euerie manne iudah inhabitaunts ierusalem yea vntoo israell neere farre bycause offence haue comitted thee osea daye make couenaunte wilde beastes foules heauen creepeth vppon earthe breake bowe sword battle earth make sleepe safely saye people thou art people shall say thou arte god b lorde shall rayse vp third day b israell wylde asse alone selfe wicked shall say mountaines couer v b ledde ephraim one beare armes b ephraim ledde wind iacob tooke brother heele wombe strength power god b wynde lorde shall come vppe wildernesse shall drye vppe veyne shall spoyle treasure pleasant vessel ioell tvrne vntoo mee scourged eue extremitie thus haue excellent mirrour moreouer haue cosider patience iob also issue sainct iames sayth iob continued miserie albeit hee angelical strength yet bene happie issue see disappointed hope found grace bycause humbled himselfe god vpon sight suche issue wee may conclude ther nothing better submit ourselues vnto god suffer peaceably whatsoeuer sendeth v vntill hee deliuer v owne mere goodnesse herewithal besides storie haue consider doctrine comprised booke wit concerning came vnto iob vnder pretence comfort yet tormeted much owne misery concerning answeres vsed repulse check wherwith seemed would haue dauted first respect affliction haue note although god send proceede yet notwithstanding diuell also stirreth vp v according paule telleth v haue war spirituall power diuel hath kindled fire hath also bellow say findeth men fit pricke v always forwarde feede euill encrease shall see iob besides miserie endured also tormented friendes wyfe aboue came tempt spiritually call spirituall temptation wee smitten afflicted body also dyuell come put toy head god deadly enimie v resort vnto rather assure selues henceforthe hee shew v mercy see whervnto al discours tendeth iobs friend layd afore make beleeue man forsaken god deceiued imagining god would mercifull vnto surely spirituall battelles farre harder borne misery aduersities suffer persecution yet doth god let satan ninne farre vpon brydle also bringeth seruants giue v assault wee see iob hath endured marke well speciall poynt withall haue marke disputation iob mainteineth good case yet iob mainteining good quarell handle il setting forth vniust matter conuey well vnderstanding key open vnto v whole booke howe iob mainteineth good case hee knoweth god dothe euer punishe menne according measure sinnes hath secrete iudgementes whereof maketh v priuie therefore behoueth v wait till reueale vnto v cause doth thus whole discourse persuaded god doth always punish according measure sinnes therevpon assureth himselfe man reiected god woulde make beleeue beholde heere good true case notwithstanding ill handled iob raungeth boundes vseth excessiue outrageous talke many pointes seemeth desparate person specially chafeth seemeth would euen resist god thus may vee see good case missehandled contrarie part vndertake euill case wit god doth alwayes punishe men according measure sinnes haue goodly holie sentence nothing whole talk would entice v receyue holy ghost himselfe vttered plaine truth groundes religion treate god prouidence treat iustice treate mennes sinnes thus see wee doctrine whiche wee must receyue without gaynsaying yet drifte euill namely men labour thereby cast iob despaire drowne altogither hereby see haue sure grounde behooueth v looke wee builde vpon wise thing answerable therevnto according sainct paule sayth himselfe builded well much founded church vpon pure doctrine iesus christ therfore hath conformitie come shal make foundation eyther chaffe stubble brittle stuffe haue good foundation stedfast substantiall readie layd hand likewise whole lyfe haue looke vnto point namely wee grounded vpon good rightfull reason behoueth eche one v stande vpon garde reele ne wauer one way ther nothing easier marre good rightfull matter sinfull nature wee finde experience time god grace may giue v good case yet may bee stinged enimies wee holde selues within boundes simply followe whiche god hath enioyned v without adding som trick seing easily caried away ought rather pray vnto god wee haue good case himselfe voutsafe guide v singlenesse holie spirit may passe boundes hath set v word herewithall also put mynde apply god truth euill vse dishonour like men doe heere although speake holily haue shewed already shall see fully hereafter notwithstanding traytours god corrupt god truth abuse falsly applying thing euil end selfe good rightfull whensoeuer god giueth v knowledge woord let v learne receiue reuerence receiuing may deface good thing sette colour vpon euyll thing oftentimes bee sharpwitted cunning ouershoote themselues abuse knowledge god hath giuen vnto deceyt naughtinesse turning thing topsituruie suche wise doe nothing snarle themselues considering therefore men giuen infirmitie standeth v much hand pray god giue v grace apply word vse hath ordeyned wit purenesse simplicitie thus ye see ought consider effecte vnderstande booke wee muste lay foorthe matter length sorte thing haue lightly touched may layd forth large according processe historie sayde man lande hus named iob sounde vpright man fearing god withdrawing selfe euill vve knowe neyther guesse tyme iob liued sauing man may perceiue great antiquitie howbeit iewes haue bin opinion moyses author boke set loking glasse people intent childre abraha whose race came might knowe god shewed fauour others line thervpon ashamed theselues walked purely fear god seing man mark god couenant circumcised panim behaued well forasmuch certeine must leaue suspence neuerthelesse let v take doubt wit holie ghost hath endited booke ende iewes knowe god hath people serue albeit haue beene separated rest worlde although signe circumcision yet notwithstanding walked purenesse conuersation knowledge whereof iewes haue occasion much diligent kepe lawe god sith hee voutsafed fauour prerogatiue gather among strange nation ought dedicate themselues wholly vnto also man may perceiue booke ezechiel name iob renoumed amog people israell xiiij chap see sayd noe iob daniel wer amog people shuld perish saue mo men liues rest people destroyed see howe prophete speaketh three men suche knowne renoumed among iewes haue touched alredie thereby see intent holy ghost namely iewes haue mirror pattern whereby knowe ought keepe doctrine saluation giuen vnto seing man whiche straunge nation kepte himselfe puritie chiefe thing haue remember concerning name set downe heere sayth land hus true men place land far eastward neuerthelesse speaking magnifie god mercy towards iewes telleth choze worthynesse person cosidering reiected iacobs eldest brother birthrith belonged chozen yonger inferior although man borne esau line yet notwithstanding see soudly liued serued god vpright couersatio equitie amog men also pure religion defiled idolatry superstitios infidel touching name iob interprete signify weeping wayling take vtter enimie one hateth one wer white men shoot ther cause dout whether whose coutrey marked whose name expressed wer liued whether thing written come passe thinke tale contriued shuld vnder counterfaite name set thing vntoo v neuer done haue already alledged record ezechiell also sainct iames shewed right well iob deede seeing story selfe declareth wise deface thing whiche holy ghost meant vtter precysely resydue wee haue marke time although world falne away true seruing god pure religion yet notwithstanding still farre soundnesse great deale day specially papacie deede wee see abraham time melchisedech god churche sacrifice without defilement albeit part worlde wrapped manyfolde erroures false wicked imagination yet notwithstanding god reserued little seede himselfe always hilde still vnder pure truth yea whiche waited continually whe god stablish church choose one people wit ofspring abraham end might know picked rest whole world true iob liued time howbeit church god well established afterward know child israell liued aegypt like haue come naught specially see afterdeale come ende pharao commaunded menchildren shoulde bee killed wildernesse wher seemed god reiected vvhen come countrey canaan great battels againste enimies specially seruice god tabernacle yet well apointed requisite god therfore hauing yet settled apparat state church would always remayne small seedes amog paynim intent hee might worshipped also conuince turned aside right way like paynim iob alone inough codemne whole countrey noe also condemned whole world scriptur saieth bicause hild always purenesse walked god time euery man forgotten menne gone astray superstition heere noe iudge whole world codemne vnbeleeuers rebelles much sayd iob hath condemned al people countrey hath serued god purely residue full idolatrie shamefull deedes many error came passe bicause hild scorne know true liuing god sort honored great regard hath god always haue sayd make wicked vnbeleuers alwais vnexcusable cause always folow thing shewed anciet father one iob scripture telleth v preset story sheweth ful wel serued god purely liued vprightly among men said sound man word sound scripture taken playnnesse poynt sayning couterfayting hypocrisie man sheweth himselfe outwardly inwardly specially whe hath starting hole shift god layeth open heart thought affection desireth nothing consecrate dedicate himselfe wholly vnto god sayde word hath also bene translated perfect well greekes latines much worde perfecte hath afterwarde bene misconstrued much better v vse word sound many ignorante persones knowing howe sayde perfection bee taken haue thoughte thus beholde heere man called perfect therefore foloweth possible v haue perfection oureselues euen tyme walke thys present lyfe deface grace god whereof wee haue neede continually euen haue lyued moste vprightly must haue recourse god mercie except sinnes forgyuen god vphold must need al perish although whiche haue vsed word perfect haue ment well yet notwithstanding muche haue ben haue wrested contrary sense haue sayd lette v keepe still word sound looke vpo iob called sound bicause hypocrisie dissimulation doublenesse heart scripture meaneth sette vice contrary vertue soudnesse sayth hart hart meaning thereby double heart let v marke fyrst al title attributed vnto iob shew pure simple mind bare two face one whood serued god halues laboured giue himselfe wholly vnto true nowe sounde attayne marke wished touching follow right way although goe forward limping yet lame dragge legges wing case standeth v long wrapped mortall bodie vntill suche time god haue quit discharged v misery wherevnto wee subiect shall neuer perfect soundnesse v haue said afore yet behoueth v neuerthelesse come said playnnesse gyue ouer counterfaytnesse leasing lette v note true holynesse beginneth within v somuch shewe fayrest countenance world men lyfe bee well guyded euery man shall commend v yet haue thys playnnesse soundnesse god right nought behoueth fountayne bee fyrste pure afterwarde streames runne bee pure also otherwise water may well bee cleere yet neuerthelesse bee bitter else haue filthie corruption therefore behoueth v begin alwayes text god serued spirite truth spirit regardeth truth heart sayd fifth hieremie ought learne first formoste frame heart obeying god iob hath bene reported haue ben sound also sayd vpright vprightnesse ment lyfe led frute said roote holy ghost planted afore iob vpright soud hart life simple say walked liued amog neybours without hurting person without wrog trouble body without setting mind guyle naughtinesse without seeking owne profit hinderace folkes vve see vprightnesse importeth added place herby admonished haue agreablenesse betweene hearte outwarde sens true haue saide afore wee may well withold selues yldoing may wel haue fayre shewe men shall bee nothing ther hipocrisy couert dissimulation god commeth roote within hearte vvhat must vve must begin foresayd poynt haue told afore haue perfecte soudnesse behoueth eye hand feete armes leg answering thervnto whole life may shew serue god howe vaine wee pretende meaning keepe soundnesse within heere ye maye see sainct paule also exhorteth galathians walke spirite liue spirite shoulde saye verily behoueth spirit god dwell v gouern v purpose haue gay life pleaseth men great estimatio vnlesse renued grace god behoueth v walk say behoueth v shew effect work spirit god reigneth mind hand stained robberie crueltie anoyances eies caried leud vnchast lokes coueting men goodes pride vanitie feete scripture saith swift euill therby well declare hart full naughtinesse corruption neither feete hads eies guide theselues guiding cometh mind hart vvherfore let v indeuer haue said agreablenes scripture sheweth v saithe iob hauing soundnesse plain meaning also liue vprightly say couersant amog neybors without anoying without seeking peculiar profit kept eue hand world also ye see reason god proueth whether serue faithfully hath neede seruice thing ca bicause deale well neybours kepe faithfulnesse toward al according nature selfe teacheth v doyng yeld assurace feare god vve see many beare face verie zelous christias log dispute hold long talke beare men hand study serue god honor yet soone haue neybours man shall perceiue haue hart seeke aduatage make coscience rake theselues beguile folk whe haue danger meanes soeuer doubt seke aduantage profit hypocrite hart corrupt earnest christias soeuer seme outwardly god bewrayeth haue nothing dung poyson theyr heart looke soundnesse must nedes vprightnesse also say affection pure within wil folow whe haue deale men shall procure welfare euery wise shal giue selues priuate comoditie shall haue indifferencie iesus christ auoucheth rule life whole summe law prophet namely thing wold haue done selues perceiue comendatio iob many men condemned asmuch holy ghost declareth onely soundnesse god also vprightnesse plain deling amog men plain dealing speaketh shal serue giue sentence damnation vpo ful maliciousnesse vpon passe snatche rake themselues good passe spoyle men liuings sort men condemned present texte foloweth feared god yea hee man whiche feared god withdrew himselfe euill seeing iob prayse keping right equitie among behoued also walk god without rest nothing worth true haue said afore ca liue neybors harme none good al vnlesse haue eye vnto god folow natur albeit indued goodly vertues wil seeme yet uertake self loue nothing else vayngloriousnes respect thrusteth forward much shew vertue appeered marred therby although haue sayde vprightnesse without fearing god yet notwithsta ding seruing god regarding neybors ar two seueral thing likewise god hath distinguished law time pleased haue writte two table let v beare mind like heretofore vnder word vprightnesse holye ghoste ment shew manner iob liued amog men also saith iob feared god meaneth set religion hereby warned frame life aright must first haue eie vnto god neibors say must haue eie vnto god giue selues ouer vnto yeld due honor must haue ey neybors discharge selues dutie towards according comaunded helpe liue equitie vprightnesse finally forasmuch god hath knit v ech euery man study imploy whole abilitie como comoditie al thus ye see case standeth v hauing eye god wel ordering life loketh sure hath nothing vanitie man wer able order life wise might seeme faultlesse world yet notwithsta ding god disliked shal gain ouerlaboring walk wise al might magnify godward nothing else vncleannes needes must sentence writte luke verifyed namely thing high excellet abhominable god let v beare mind ca neuer order life ought except haue eye fastned vpon god neybour vpon god wherfore ende may know created glory serue worship although haue neede v neybors haue either better worse seruice yet wil haue resonable creature shuld know knowing yeeld whiche belogeth vnto furthermore wheras speaketh feare god haue vnderstande slauish feare men terme tearmed respect honor whiche owe hee father maister feare god certaine desire nothing honor wholly know must wyse hath vttered himselfe wit maker mainteyner one hath shewed suche fatherly goodnes towards v dutie ought child towards wee vtterly vnthankfull also behoueth v acknowledge dominio superioritie ouer v ende euery v yeelding due honour may learne please respect thus see vnder fearing god compreheded al religion wit seruice honour creature owe vnto god surely ryght excellente vertue iob feare god manner cosidering whole world turned asyde fro right way vvhen heare wee perceiue although wee liue among veriest naugtypackes whole world shall vtterly vnexcusable giuen seruing god ought well marked bycause many men opinio amog thornes god hold acquit excused afterward corrupt themselues prouerbe saith hold hare hunt hound whyche one god pardon contrariwise loke vppon iob called man feared god cou trey iewry citie hierusalem temple defyled place middes vtterly peruerted albeit hee among people yet hee stay himselfe liued wise walked purely among neybours notwithstanding time full crueltie outrage robberie like enormity place vvherevpon haue consider shall turne much greater shame behalfe haue care keepe selues pure seruice god neighbour seing giueth v occasion haue witte god worde continually preached vnto v exhorted vnto refourmeth v haue done amisse standeth v giue eare shewed v therefore conclusion let v marke added text namely withdrew himselfe euill see cause iob ouercame lettes incounters might hinder seruing god liuing vprightly among men stay himselfe knew right well taken libertie like men hee shoulde haue bene giuen al vice haue bene enimie god iob walked feare god plaine dealing soundnesse without great store incounters without diuels heauing ouerthrow cast filthinesse whole worlde bee withdrew himselfe euill say withhild himselfe vvhat must although church god yet see great abundance euils howsoeuer happeneth shal neuer plainenesse purenesse shalbe mingled store skorners vnthrifts firebronds hell deadly plague infect therefore behoueth v ware seing many stumblingblocks great loocenesse whereby trayne v foorthwith vnto vnthriftinesse vvhat remedie let v withdraw selues euill say let v fight assaultes example iob see abundance vice corruption reigne world albeit fayne intermedled yet let v defiled say commonly men woont namely wee must needes doo men rather let v take counsell iobs example withdraw ourselues euill retyre sort sathan may able make v yeelde temptation hee shal cast v wee may suffer god clenze v filthinesse infection according hath promised v name iesus christ vntill hee haue pulled v quite soyle vncleannesse thys world match v angel make v parttakers endlesse felicitie must labour continually therfore let v present selues face good god acknowledgemet sinnes praying giue v suche feeling acknowledging owne poorenesse may always haue recourse remedie giueth v pardoning al offeces gouerne v holy spirit although sata named prince world haue scope amog men part peruerted see yet notwithstanding may harried away rather good god holde v backe vnder obeysance wee may knowe thing wherevnto called may follow maintaine brotherlinesse hath ordeyned amog v linking selues one another may desire nothing procure welfare neybors end may settled grace hath graunted v lord iesus christ vntill make v receyue frute heauenly glory may please c second sermon vpon first chapter hee seuen sonnes borne vnto three daughter hee greate substance cattell vvitte seuen thousand sheepe three thousande camelles fiue hundred yoke ox fiue hundred shee ass greate householde somuch surmounted east sonnes vvent made feast house euery man day called three sister also eate drinke vvith vvhen made end feasting iob sent child sanctified rising vp betymes morning offered sacrifice according number sayde may child haue sinned haue blissed lord theyr harte thus iob euery day yesterday wee heard prayses whyche holye ghoste gaue vnto iob muche himselfe instruction end know ought rule life namely walke singlenesse hearte bee peece counterfaitenesse v therewithall workes also may yeelde witnesse singlenesse moreouer feare god knowing whome must referre whole lyfe honoure thing must gyue selues vnto asmuch wee bee continually beset many stumbling blockes diuell practizeth thrust v right way wee stande vpon gard withdraw selues euill recouer selues vnto god vntill suche time quite dispatched defilementes world death inseweth texte iob exceeding riche man great part possession specially recyted v smal thing haue seuen thousand head small cattell fiue hundred yoke ox many shee ass many camells lo great substance one man therefore sayde surmounted east anon shal see wherefore rehersed vntoo v patience much prayseworthy hee beeing bereft greate goodes brought extreame pouertie notwithstanding continue quiet hee lost little nothing see god hath muche better tryed herewithall wee haue consider vertuouse mind iob seeing rich blinded pride caused set much world discharge himselfe seruing god commonly see many men reason great rich become loftie vnpossible tame abusing credite oppressing poore folke besides full crueltie also stately full pompe rich accompanied many inconueniences therefore vayne told v heere iob rich neuerthelesse alwayes persisted seruing god held himselfe sayde singlenesse whereof mention made example riche men world warned dutie whych take good heede god hath put abundance intoo hand entangled according also psalme exhorteth according sainct paule speaketh timothie bee puffed vp pride put trust transitorie thing world wherein certaintie rich day may become poore morrow whensoeuer pleaseth god seeing goodes world tickle may soone bereft rich men sayth sainct paule ought take good heede rest themselues vpon make ydoll though sure possesse enioy euer must ready yeeld vp short according sayd another text haue field vineyardes medowes corne ground money ware must haue care vse sort none may poore heart thus see haue note vpon sentence least man might alledge hard behaue himselfe purely middes great rich considering christ calleth thornes therefore example iob shall condemne suche keepe themselues vndefiled hardly soeuer bee done certaine rich man shall haue ado walke feare god shall poore man true also pouertie selfe bringeth store temptation man necessitie falleth thinking himselfe shall become diuell thrusteth forward distrust herevpon shall induced murmure god according see many fal rage seemeth god doth wrong wot side turne themselues wherevpon conclude thus sith get liuyng labor without men wrong must take way wood herevppon take leaue rob reaue many shrewde turnes harmes damage neighboures behold pray temptation whiche pouertie bringeth man make coparison betweene rich certain richer sort haue far greater assault forasmuch satan euer elbowe blindfold theyr eye ende ouershoote themselues forgetting state lift vp themselues god tye themselues wholly world make mock heauenly life beare selues hande nothing hurt abuse credite sundrie wise haue regarde nothing loth beare yoke bee vnwilling yeelde reason thinke men base company muche possible woulde plucke away light sun poore finally beare themselues deserue good right shoaled set aside row themselues vve see corruptios infinite misery rich bring yet excuse rich vvherefore shall iob made iudge afore god forasmuch corupted peruerted great abudance quatitie goodes hee alwayes serued god singlenesse heart rich men made vnexcusable let poorer sort also looke well themselues haue tolde already easyer man walke simply whome god hathe giuen great abundaunce suche haue great raunge cace like man little boate small riuer like ynough hee might bee tossed like ynough hee might rushe stub banke riuer hee suche daunger hee shippe middes sea waues stormes farre violent euen say stand cace betweene poore rich surely long thys worlde rowe vpon water wee may bee tossed tempestes rushe agaynste thing euermore daunger thus poore little ryuer ryche middes sea hardly scape synkyng whyrlepoole excuse rych sorte shal become whome god giueth meane holde themselues simplicite vve see therefore generall lesson serue men aswel great small behoueth ech man benefit himselfe example set eye yet herewithall vertue iob right commendable wee heare iudgement lorde iesu christe right hard rich man enter kingdome heauen rich themselues hinder v seruing god haue sayde hapneth naughtinesse corruption becommeth v take occasion drawen vnto god benefit bestoweth vpon v drawen backe vvherefore see iob man wonderfull vertue seeing midst rich eye blyndfolded conceiue pride hart hee tread folkes vnder feete forget god become dissolute vaine pompous person hilde race whyche begon lo vertue commendable done end wee attayne full equal yet euery one v shuld looke himselfe goe forward marke sette afore furthermore see also rich themselues condemned fantasticall person surmise hold opinion riche man christian let fynd pore may compared iob vertue let condemne rich shal haue sought throughout poore men worlde hardly shall hee fynde one shall come thing neere thys man seeing case lette v marke rich themselues nature condemned specially great blasphemie god man find fault rich thinketh partie possesseth vtterly mard whence come rich god therfore man condemneth hee setteth hymselfe agaynste god behoueth v marke god must nedes work farre maruellously rich man pore man haue sayde afore haue alreadye shewed difficultie man hathe mayntayne himselfe simplicitie vprightnesse hee hath abundaunce goodes god neede vtter singular force hys holie spirite preserue rich menne corrupting themselues man despyze suche grace god doth hee lyfte vp hymselfe agaynst god hereby warned co demne ryches selues lyke also see howe lord iesus christe hath shewed v matching poore rich togither kingdome heauen hee speaketh lazarus sainct luke sayeth angells caried lazarus albeit hee outcast among men poore creature whome account made somuch forsaken men yet neuerthelesse behold angells carie soule abraham bosome thys abraham man rich cattell money houshold thing sauing house land lawfull haue bycause behoued tary god leysure till gaue land canaan inherite true purchased burying place inheritance notwithstanding mouables greate therfore see soule lazarus caried angel bosome abraham father faithfull wee perceiue god infinite grace goodnesse calleth riche poore saluation vnto purpose maketh also whiche paule sayth namely god wil haue al men saued speketh king prince ordinarie missebehaue themselues greatnesse find hart stoup vnto god yea seemeth themselues mortall men yet god picketh himselfe haue al lost perish thus ye see haue marke yet rich must flatter themselues rather know howe stand wer vpon yee may soone slide among thornes behoueth looke diligetly themselues pricked lo eche one v ought touched carefulnesse comend selues vnto god may walke according vpon saying iob seuen sonnes three daughter note doth v wit god sent blissing vpon make prosper meanes haue touched heretofore shal herafter better see cause al expressed intent holie ghost wit incomparable vertue iob beare paciently god taking away thing put hand wel declared also child behaued themselues also part gouerned feare god done end vnderstand god afflicteth v sheweth effect dispose hys creature pleasure although wit ende see reason god handleth men roughly yet becommeth v cast downe eye confesse rightuous wait hys leysure vntil discouer vnto v cause disposeth thing let v proceede rehersed v sayd iobs child feasted one another day day euery one turne called sister beare company true nature may well stirre vp brother loue one yet men become euill fewe consider brotherhood importeth proofe herof wee shall see manye brother agree like cattes dogges brother yet cease spite malice one another one would eate vve see suche according men grow kynde crueltie brother acquainted concord louingnesse althogh yet euery man addicted himselfe ther loue one wise god teacheth thus doth holy ghost set looking glasse eye make v beholde good agreemet loue among iobs childre specially exercised themselues continually therein end woulde giue occasion euill mistrust one feastes made none end yeld record brotherlynesse agreement see said precisely wente seeke sister intent frendship might vtter selfe poyntes behold great vertue albeit man may perceyue iob feared fault thing ordeyned good purpose good end yet neuerthelesse see thought eue god might bee offended surely notable example doubt good agreement frendship among specially among brother pleasant thing vnto god vve heare said psalme ioyfull thyng brother agree one like deawe falleth downe giue foyzon nourishment grounde lyke oyle dropped downe aaron bearde sente shead oute ouer hys rayment lo two similitude shewe howe god loueth peace amitie among men aboue thinges among brother doe v vnderstande men embrace one heartie loue one fieldes herbes receyue nourishement deawe heauen also thing yeeldeth sweete sauoure afore god good acceptable sacrifize vnto euen like sent holy oyle poured vpo aaron head neuerthelater spoken imbrace one godly maner may well wicked men shall beare affection loue one towards maye peraduenture lynke themselues togither accomplishe appoyntmentes thys naught frendship must come god go god marke name brotherhood set downe ende wee shoulde taught lift vp eye vnto god looke vnto ofte question louing one furthermore see best thinges world may eftsoones bee corrupted naughtinesse men hereby wee see also nature euer since adam sinned say euer since ouershot himselfe hithertoo good hath bene turned euill notwithstanding intent meaning good example vvhen husband loueth wyfe father loueth hys child good holy commendable thing yet neuerthelesse found whole world loueth wife suche measure nothing may founde faulte loue loueth child pure heartie loue shall always bee medlie corruption seing god hath ordeyned man shall loue wyfe precisely sayd loue wyues youre owne body shall imputed faulte good turned intoo euill doubtlesse commeth cursed nature lyke one grayne salt one droppe vineger fayleth marre great deale wine euen men holding selues measure haue affection well ruled maye fault bee found condemned many respect straunge cace iob thought himselfe hys child might haue offended god thing selfe good commendable condemned feasting brother togither specially sith making good cheere one another mainteine themselues mutuall amitie thing iob founde fault asmuch throughly acquainted man infirmitie hee knewe harde keepe measure vice intermedled way therefore tooke good heede himselfe sanctifyed child yet neuerthelesse haue note iob well marked borne away thing experience sheweth vnto v namely feastes banquet disorder wherethrough god well honored ought first suche meeting alwayes superfluitie meates come thither company sake eate drinke ordinarie hardly could man thinke excesse much euen holiest men feare god best ouerseene true play glutton stuffing paunch cramming themselues like swine much lesse drunken bee theyr wittes like beast much may done may somewhat passe measure see man ouershootes himselfe case ere aware see inconuenience hapneth feast notwithstading made good cause intent well biddeth freeds come keepe company good hardly escaped shall faulte wherof doer himselfe shall priuie furthermore whe deale vaine fond talke shall haue hold withall vvhere man ought eate presence god merrie angel shall store vanity shall carie men suche wyse many yea euen good men theselues shall thinke make good cheere except disguise theselues tell howe yet many euill incoueniences wherby see god offended diuers wayes according men finde themselues afterwarde let v marke well iob without cause mistrust doubt least child sinned agaynste god seeing made feastes wise notwithstanding faithfull sort haue sayde afore feastes banquet best ruled yet fault god misliketh driue god copanie fro table men commonly wont doo shall speake feasting whereat men begin calling vpon name god nay woulde bee thoughte sad matter therfore name god must buried hath man well suffized appetite tyme say grace behoueth remember good cheere haue made saye swyne man make mention god thought pleasure haue taken feasting turned sorow afterward al must runne ryot sorte shall talke ribawdrie wantonesse rather trecherie malice shall none newes backbiting theyr neyghboure practising deuises agaynst man man see banqueting breedeth nowe sith men inclined vice possible must faulte notwithstanding gyue themselues brydle poyntes pray must needes gulfe hell meete togither make copactes wickednesse treason therfore let v marke well sentence end sith know men much inclined vice marre thing good turne euill wee may take heede selues eate drinke one confesse oure selues alway sinner offending god thereby true deede wee muste bee scrupulous superstitious bee eate bit breade quietnesse conscience man tell ought aduise themselues doo therevpon conclude men neyther eate drinke withoute offending god come suche scrupulousnesse thinke sinne thing doo fall concluding vvell let v set randon say suche founde wee ought doo scripture leadeth v therefore let v wake keepe sure watche wee taken vnwares vvhen wee set table drinke eate let v pray vnto god beseeching gracious goodnesse keepe v suche sobrietie nourished giftes wee may bee better disposed serue meates may serue ouercharge v susteine v giue v strength may bee better able occupie selues seruice god hee graunte v grace passe corruptible thing may alwaies labour heauenly lyfe wherevnto calleth v woorde god maynteyneth v worlde liue day ten fiftie yeares intent come sayd heauenly glorie let v consider howe wee ought behaue selues wee bee table let v feede repaste suche wise god himselfe dieted v althoughe worlde taking nourishment foode wee knowe let v looke vp vnto god sheweth himselfe father towardes v hath witnessed vnto v wee child much hee hath care poore body haue loue exted euen vnto notwithstanding bee rottennesse therefore see god doth nourish susteyne v may meryer better assured goodnesse fatherly loue towardes v hereby see paule sayeth whither wee drinke whither wee eate wee muste doo altogither name god many suppose bee thinking vpon god men come eating aud drinking whereas deede therefore thinke muche god seeing god giueth vertue vnto breade woorde susteyned haue v acknowledge presence hath hand stretched ouer v rather cause wee thinke vpon god see eating drinking sanctified yelding honor name therfore commeth saying grace let v acknowledge fault may haue escaped v god surely forgiue v misdoing bee wee repayre vnto thus see cause sayde precysely iobs child made ende feasting eche turnes iob commaunded sanctifie themselues afterwarde offered solemne sacrifize eche one saying may bee child haue sinned haue blissed god wee speake whole matter ende vvee see iob none sorte haue made nycenesse doo finally conclude set randon hee goeth remedie say god beare v infirmity albeit sayeth child haue done dutie pointes yet sure god haue pitie bothe vpon vpon therefore let v aske forgiuenesse yet iob forbade child vse accustomed feasting wherefore thing selfe good haue sayde afore iob sayde see leawd matter truly made sacrifize bene abuse god name make cloke euil sacrifizes ordeyned mainteyne v euil man fode flatter himselfe sinnes say may sacrifize god contented iob therefore sacrifized haue sayde hee mayneteyned euill thing hee knew child well gyuing interteynement one another commendable thing forasmuche hee knewe ment finde faulte thing good sought remedie faulte laye hid vnder myght please god amende hee shoulde say good reason ought craue pardon god hand end may supply infirmitie vve see maner iob proceedeth also maner wee muste proceede furthermore let v marke iob comaunding child sanctifie themselues hath shewed maner bringing vp gaue childehood wit serue god bene simply sayde iob sanctified lorde man myght say well good man owne behalfe greate regard child inough discharging himselfe godwarde hath laide bridle necke others contrarily sayd commanded sanctifie themselues thing bene vayne vnauaylable doo bene taught long afore howe ought walke feare god although mengrowen euery house owne kept table himselfe yet notwithstanding iob ceassed keepe cotinually vnder awe behold doctrine profitable v parentes must guyde child god may bee honored behoueth v marke doctrine better forasmuch see ill put vre dayes haue child coulde well finde hart haue taught hardly shall ye finde one among hundred led zeale affection godward led euery man mindeth owne profite hee may well say woulde fayne haue sonne taught good wit may come forewarde may make himselfe braue maye gather good may come credite honour lo respect father haue desire haue childre brought vp man found well aduised bent simplicitie say ynough mee childe serue god sure god blisse make prosper although bee poore worldewarde ynough god father god also render rewarde vnto father haue deserued imagine haue done muche child haue aduaunced god suffereth child put eye bee hangman torment vve see eye yet perceiue howe god chastyzeth iustly therfore much hehoueth v marke well doctrine holy ghost sheweth v vnder example iob witte father mother holde child awe may cause serue god specially circumstance forgotten namely although iobs child growen full yeeres discretion yet neuerthelesse father hilde alwayes vnder awe warning aske forgiuenesse god offended purifie themselues adayes soone child ten yeeres old thinke themselues men notwithstanding meete gyue rodde fiftene yeeres weare furniture man seeme selues bee maruelous sellowes bee better sillie offskoorings suffer correctio instruction straunge yea woulde thinke greate wrong iniurie offered contrariwise see sayde father worthie haue child disobedidient stubborne agaynst vvhy meete wil honored honorable wit requisite shoulde shewe cause honored howe shall father purchace himselfe authoritie towardes child bee obeyed keepe feare euen hauing suche grauitie stayednesse himselfe child ought ashamed gaynsay stand agaynst thing father shake feare god howe bee child obey thern sith themselues yeelde god honour belongeth vnto lo heere cause child shew themselues loth bee corrected cannot kept awe namely father disobedient vnto god father child condemned heere father negligence taking heede bring vp child feare god child suffering themselues bee gouerned father heere haue goodly example spoken suche may saye father hath kept awe long yong yet must still alwayes vnder rod iobs child might haue sayde wee see although come haue householdes owne yet still vnder gouernance father text sayde gaynesayde thing commaunded reported child hely rather obeyed ende myght parttakers sacrifizes offered wee heare inough condemne petie roysters make brauerie carie crest high know awefulnesse wise meaneth offskoorings yet neuerthelesse beare countenaunce men wee see age discretion guyde household orderly hilde still vnder gouernment obedience father furthermore concerning worde sacrifize ment according ordinarie custome lawe whereby intent man myght partetaker sacrifizes behoued purisyed myght dewly disposed therevnto albeit iob countrie lawe moyses written rather likelyhood moyses borne yet notwithstanding hath alwayes bene custome among faithfull shoulde sacrifize vnto god signe clenzing witte purging themselues filthinesse bene imbrewed defiled inuented man must thinke haue bene deuised tryfling toy men god shoulde bee wherefore meaning put men remembrance worthie approche vnto vvhen wee come vnto god behoueth v acknowledge owne poorenesse ashamed say howe dare preace maiestie god fauour shall find god haue knowen age although wee haue sayde ceremonic clenzing selues yet behoueth v haue meaning v wit time oft come vnto god make prayer petition vnto wee must acknowledge vnworthie sauing wee knowe meane wherby receyueth v wit cleze selues beleeuing lord iesu christ knowing onely wasshing whereby spottes may made cleane vvill acceptable vnto god behoueth v attayne meanes lorde iesus christ shrowding v vnder grace hath purchaced v death pasion full perfection accomplishment thing haue bene giuen forth old time figure shadowes therefore let v caste selues flat face good god acknowledgmet offence beseeching make v know better haue lefte vndone long wee liue corruptible worlde acknowledging selues bee wrapped many sinnes may resist temptation fleshe buckie selues battell agaynste thing may turne v aside fro obeying god although faile diuerse sort yet neuerthelesse let v pray may walke soundnesse afore may desire nothing dedicate selues wholy vnto may please accept seruice wee offer vnto name lord iesus christ notwithstanding vnperfect vntill time glory shall shine fully v may please bestowe benefite grace onely vpon v also vpon people nation earth c third sermon vpon first chapter sermon yet still vpon text fifth verse set downe laste sermon afore according also bath partly bene shewed alreadie began tell yesterdaye ment saying iob sanctified child commaunded euerye shoulde sanctifie himselfe vnder lawe lawe men offered sacrifizes behoueth offerer bee clenzed hande doe wit howe wee worthie approche vnto god reason vnclennesse filthinesse wee come vnto god wee bee selues wee deserue bee shaken taken hand stinking carions therfore standeth v hand make selues cleane may done men old time certaine ceremony according needefull haue suche healpes coming lorde iesu christ reason rawenesse tyme nowe dayes know ought haue recourse preciouse bloud god sonne shedde washe v withall therefore meane receyued cleane god behoueth v repayre bloude lorde iesus christ furthermore wee must also sighe sinnes meanes clenzed namely acknowledging euill v causeth sorinesse hatred ourselues wee haue bene vnhappie displease god thus see haue figure comming lorde iesus christ yet keepe still truth substance vvhat bee done time oft call vpon god euery one v must haue eye owne poorenesse vnclennesse displeased himselfe therewithall also desire lorde iesus christ washe v make v cleane bloud may appeare pure cleane presence god father done onely one day weeke certayne tyme continually life long must beare mind sainct paule sayeth lorde iesu christ sacrifized true easterlambe end shoulde still coparteners sacrifyze specially sayeth purenesse sayeth christian ought sanctifie themselues vnto god yeere ought continewe holinesse lyfe vvherefore bycause sacrifize iesus christ hath offered whereof wee made coparteners euerlasting vertue thereof indureth euer let v euery morning euening apply indeuour shewed v wit sanctifie selues vntill please god graciouse vnto v dwell v euer time lawe published god specially comaunded iewes saying sanctifie selues morrow saieth moyses lord shew glorie god openly shewed vnto v person sonne yea wise may behold face face gospel preached ther hath god discouered himselfe familiarly vnto v therefore becommeth v haue sayd affection zel haue spoken wit wholly fully giuen vnto forsaking filthinesse may hinder v seruing honouring foloweth iob offred sacrifyzes according number child vve haue alreadie briefly shewed although iob feared least child offended god yet notwithstanding hee forbade keepe companie stil togither bicause good thing sought remedie infirmity wherevnto men inclined subiect moreouer may demaunded came passe iob durst offer sacrifize seeing instructed lawe specially asmuch likely liued moyses borne sacrifyzes offer vnto god without fayth deserue mislyked coulde iob offer sacrifyze hauing assurance god vve muste call agayne minde hath bene touched first lecture wit god haue alwaies seede remnat people world call vpon pure hart vntill time church setled among iewes law published writing true flud no child corrupted meane descended race hauing yet freshe remembrance god horrible vengeance ceased inuent many superstition dissannll true seruing god yet notwithstanding alwayes fewe remayning whiche maynteyned themselues sayde purenesse god commaundeth end god might cotinually haue church world small nuber people worship herwithal would also turne danation vnbeleeuers made vnexcusable vve know men labour continually shroude theselues vnder couert ignorace beare theselues hand cleared god haue gotten buckler god hath wayes bene euer bee smal nuber people serue purenesse haue euermore bene iudges turned aside gone astray fro right way hath also bene cocerning iob yea wee know also god hath ordeyned sacrifizings euen fro beginning world bene inuented man pleasure bene trifle apishe toyes god woulde haue reiected furthermore know sacrifizes abel preferred sacrifizes cain reason faith abel deuised sayd maner sacrifizing god head could haue faith chiefe point god le devs gouerne v faith neuer without obediece must needes answerable god hath ordeyned see god author sacrifizes haue bene euer since creatio world commaunded men sacrifize vnto without shewing end marke wherto teded offred brute beastes without vnderstanding bene valew serued mockery know god instructeth vnto saluation therfore doubt god comauding sacrifyzes also shew true vse might profite men saluation ende might know themselues vtterly vnworthy come neare deserued death behoued acknowledge themselues wholly blameworthie therewithall also vnderstande yet meanes whereby reconcyle themselues vnto first place wee note suche haue vsed sacrifizes rightly according god haue graunted themselues haue bene gilty death case man passe lawfull obligation bond debt also cause wherefore sainct paul speaking colossian ceremony lawe termeth obligation bond handwriting serue hold men bondage god shewe could shunne iudgement endelesse death one remedie god hath giuen owne free mercie good profitable lesson men acknowledge confesse themselues giltie god set owne eye haue deserued brute beaste slayne know sinnes sake lo howe god minde allure men lowlinesse herewithall also nourish hope although wretched yet notwithstanding one sacrifize offred wherby sinnes washed away behold father old time vsed sacrifizes heerevpon heathen olke haue done like hath bene without faith bycause knew god vnto whome ought haue done honour side knew seruice acceptable god therefore sure ground stad vpon short knew neither end purpose made sacrifize reason whereof done auenture say needelesse labour specially asmuch god hated abhorred sacrifizes made without knowledge faith true solemnitie ynough auailed nothing asmuche behoueth alwaies holde rule apostl giueth v namely outward sacrifizes boote furtherforth grounded vpon obedience vnto god word true iob law written ynough doctrine came god noe giuen vnto child perseuered taught although hard doctrine men yet notwithstanding hilde rule therof rule god ynough god gaue knowledge without vsing meane prophet afterwards vve see iobs sacrifizes made aduenture vpon assured grounded faith vvhen sayde noe flud tooke cleane beast sacrifize therby see instructio fro heauen lay discerne betwene beaste beaste say amog see pure cleane residew bee vncleane needes muste god haue taught euen also iob made sacrifize deuiser yeelded himselfe god wherby guyded gouerned property faith according haue sayd alreadie herevpon haue consider first fro beginning world god hath wise suffered go darknesse yet notwithstading hath left certayne recordes whereby might couicted cursednesse much nothing else outwarde ceremony fully ynough condene vnbeleeuers furthermore see also men wholly giuen euill much peruert thing good holie god hath declared vnto turne altogither backward flat contrarie asmuch see men fleeting vnconstant may perceyue haue neede pray vnto god keepe v awe suffer v step aside purenesse seruice befall v holde v backe herewithall also warned seruing god outward shew setting fayre face vpo bee done chiefest poynt serue deede knowing one ende hold selues thereunto hath bene greate pompe sacrifice paynim yea euen haue serued god aright yet notwithstading one sort haue bene reiected god hath abhorred sort haue bene acceptable vnto heathe men made sacrifizes great pompe incense perfume suche like thing iewes specially law asmuch paynim ment honor god without knowing asmuch knew whit god maiestie needes must sacrifyze vnto idol forged set vp brayne god accepteth seruice done vnto one knoweth thus much first point secod behoueth seruing god bee spirituall pagan haue surmyzed god woulde bee appeased man offered oxe calfe greate mockery would say god transfigured angry men coulde appease meane aforesayd therefore behoueth men set downe rule firste namely seruing god spirituall wee must mounte farre hygher visible shape must leade v heauenly ende holde v downe worlde without lifting vp mindes vnto heauen yee see howe faythfull alwayes eye vpon god made sacrifice therby put minde vice sinnes ende displeased themselues paynim knewe whit perceyue wee may rest vpon outwarde shewe wee deale seruing god must come well heade wit must know god whome worship must vnderstand wise becommeth v preace vnto ceremony vse leade v spirituall seruice wherof mention made example dayes papist haue many ceremony like vnto v well bow downe knee purpose pray haue thing yet see know wherevnto shape themselues much go kneele downe puppet wodde stone whereby shew know god must needes bee religio thinke themselues haue vncleane vnholie haue store apishe toyes turne vpside downe bycause regard god hath commaunded rather folow owne inuentions bearing themselues hande haue done much haue patched greate sorte ragges togither labour vayne asmuch holde themselues vnder rule god worde behold wherin differ know one god whome ought worship vnto whome must come meanes lord iesus christe behoueth v serue according worde vvhen know wee may well say sacrifizes wee offer vnto god acceptable vnto taketh good woorth obserue also many men abuse euen sayde manner worshipping god good holy asmuch beastly maner true haue idolles true haue none fine masking knackes papacy wherwith seruice god infected marred yet thinke haue well quit themselues haue done ceremony whe haue put cap made cursie beholde discharge themselues afore god beare themselues hand yet meane regard lowlinesse haue spoken namely wee preace vnto god becommeth v acknowledge selues giltie reason sinnes regard meane seeking fauour lorde iesus christ regarde yeelding themselues vnto god purenesse may bee holy vnto himward passe whit geere haue good store outward ceremony yea verely haue sayde nothing nowe let v learne serue god spirit truth faith good guide therevnto haue eye fastened vpon god worde leade v alwayes lorde iesus christ heauely patterne mirrour wherin must behold god father frame selues thereafter thus much concerning sacrifizing whereof mention made place nowe sayde iob offred sacrifizes according number child shew spared substace god indewed withall hee bene poore man bene neuer whit lesse welcome vnto god though brought sacrifize asmuch meane abilitie wherwith sayde imployed thereabout let v apply selues haue told already wee haue sacrifizing comming lorde iesus christ cace concerneth praying vnto god according principall seruice hee demaundeth handes shoulde call vpon professe whole welfare depend vpo giue thankes benefites inforce ourselues holy body soule euen end whole may consecrated honour must also serue neighbour turnes thing hath giuen v assuring selues world end shoulde partaker one another wise ought giuen himselfe v ought profite member wherewith god hath knit vnited v togither seeing let euery man haue eye himselfe true pray vnto god thing common men neuerthelesse behoueth eche one v pricke forward himselfe according knowledge hee hath vvhen man better taught others certayne ought much earnest feruent praying vnto god also haue greater care himselfe thus ye see howe wee ought consider abilitie measure afterwarde commeth offering selues vnto god behoueth v haue eye hee hath indewed v withall according euery v hath receyued shall blameworthy glorifie god whensoeuer god giueth abundance spirit vnto v men must looke well make neighbour parte taker v suche haue wisedome giue cousell vnto others haue abundance succour haue neede lo heere howe wee ought frame selues vnto spoken iob namely hee offered sacrifizes according number child residewe whereas sayde iob offered sacrifize child shew v suche haue charge others must watchfull fault happeneth muste hold themselues blameworthie god well worthie marked see ambition reigneth worlde man haue many child glad hath many reasonable creature vnder comaundement haue wherwith finde great household liketh well himselfe meere ambition vayneglorye regarde charge matched true god doeth men great honour gyueth whome hath created owne image vnto vnderlings yet therewithall honour carieth greate bonde namely haue householdes gouerne must alwayes watchfull offence bee committed agaynst god household head maister house must thinke himselfe blameworthie must mourne god himselfe partie done deede although bee consenting vnto yet must thinke thus himselfe haue discharged selfe dutie albeit watch night day although exhort well child also men seruants mayde seruants serue god yet impossible doe ought see childre offend see fault men seruants maide seruantes whome take although take payne instructe yet many thing founde fault haue giuen example ought walked feare god becommeth muste needes haue folowed steppe may stepping aside right way hath bene defaulte offence therefore must shew example would haue folow father maisters haue child seruants vnder hand regarde thing would better ordered bee aboue others prince magistrate ought marke president behoueth watchfull set good gard vpon committed charge fault must thinke themselues blame espie disorder loocenesse must assure themselues bicause theselues haue discharged dutie likewise minister god worde perceyue church behaueth selfe ought haue trouble contrariety specially god name blasphemed behoueth sigh beare burthen assuring themselues god sheweth vnto haue discharged themselues haue done heere ye see sainct paule sayeth hee brought lowe bicause fault church corinth behold god sayeth shame sainct paule consented whoredome robberie wantonesse vice corinthian laboured rebuke meanes possible sayde shewed way riot whit although hee discharged vttermost towards men yet notwithstanding ceassed feele still god ment disgrace part faine bewayle offence disorder happened church wherof direction charge sainct paule zeale dutie neuerthelesse feele blameworthy befell misorder church pray become v colde yce respect shall become whiche make account whither god honored one may make theyr owne profite mainteyne owne state let v marke well said iob sacrifized according nuber child let v likewise take good aduice huble selues afore god onely aske forgiuenesse mischiefe come passe also preuent much possible parent holde child short maisters looke well god serued honored house well ruled purenesse may litle church also suche haue honorable charge authoritie much diliget example magistrate circumspect make lawes conuenient hold people good order cut thing seruice honour god haue done diligent see good order kept whe appointed shut eye make countenance perceyuing misorder whit faulte committed alwayes haue medicine preseruatiue hande minister god word tarie tyll marred till diuell haue gotten full scope assoone perceyue breach thing folow good aray indeuour remedy speede possible end thing go hauocke comonly wont foloweth iob sayd may bee child haue sinned haue blissed god worde worde worde blisse sometimes taken curse sayde naboth blissed god king say cursed shall see suche example againe hereafter declare large maner word put two contrarie signification wee come let v mark reported text iob sayde may child haue sinned heere see iob wayted god shoulde sende message threaten sinnes child preuented matter careful without man warning saying maye bee child haue done amisse poynt ought marke well adayes abide admonished told fault although fault notorious al respect yet possible finde shift excuse hide theselues much man rebuke amisse must prepare sustaine mortall war hand shal deadly foe procuring welfare men cannot abide rebuked amisse wil theselues owne good blame themselues worthie reproued say possible haue committed fault either mine se iob thought always possible child haue sinned holy ghoste hath shewed v oure duetie wit perceiue selues faultie worthie bee condemned euery v muste pricke spurre vp himselfe make owne accusation owne good vpon farre stronger reason say god gracious vnto v prouoke v haue others exhort v duty stubborne god vpon sending suche messenger vnto v suffer selues reproued certaine wee set selues mortall men bende selues agaynst maiestie god would fayne plucke v backe saluation hee seeth v readie throwe selues headlong euerlasting destruction marke speciall point waye see iob tooke thought onely himselfe also committed charge according haue sayd adayes men cleane contrarie excuse taketh couert fast may hath man done hee streyt make leazing discharge himselfe maye acknowne faulte haue eyther child seruants seeke discharge way saying yea marie haue heard thing done long thus wee see parte men seeke startingholes bene muche iobs behoofe haue layde burden vpon others knewe child amisse himselfe yeeld account let v learne soothe selues hypocrisie deuise howe cherish vice wee ought redresse muche v lieth behold shewed v way may demauded whither iob ought haue tormented himselfe vaine long faultes vnknowne seemeth bee sufficient man humble himselfe afore god soone perceiueth hath done amisse imagine may haue done amisse may haue committed suche fault seemeth needeth first let v beare mynde salomon sayeth xxviij chapter right happie sayeth hee man feareth maketh himselfe feare doth word import say iniureth himselfe afrayde hardneth hart sayeth shall runne headlong euill saying salomo sheweth v must walke heedefully looking styll afore v whither may haue committed fault feare doubled doe v vnderstand must feare wel come past feare come muste namely wee beare minde howe wee ought walke aright al way haue forecast skill aske cousell lordes mouth prophet esay commaundeth v betake ourselues holy spirit ende may giue v wisedome keepe ourselues swaruing one waye maner soeuer thus ye see howe feare time comming feare past ought although wee knowe faultes haue committed haue scaped many vice ouerthwart eye without perceiuing yet neuerthelesse behooueth v bethinke v thereof mislike condemne selues thus see sort behoueth v afrayd time past tyme come haue note vpon sayde sentence whe iob sayd maye child haue sinned notwithstanding ment care wee ought haue prouoke ourselues call vpon god pardon offence end hee suffer v steppe aside way wee maye continue pathe hee sheweth v conclusion iob sayeth may bee child haue blissed lorde wee must marke worde blisse taken curse notwithstanding signifie blisse done make matter odious intent may know fault blisse god say yelde prayse hath deserued oure handes suche deede heares ought stand vp vpon heade wee shake quake feare mention made cursing god ye see wherfore wo blisse god hath bene applyed contrarie vse ment short wordes sayd iob feared least child blissed god became blissed one cursed principall point wee haue consider ought glorifie god lyfe hereby wee see also ende wee bee created wherefore liue therfore desirous haue life allowable god wee must alwayes ame marke namely hee blissed glorified v haue burning zeale affection serue glorie may assure selues intollerable yea euen horrible thing respect name shoulde bee blasphemed cursed v say cause glory defaced specially sithe hath put image v ende shine forth v intent therefore ouershoote selues many liue blaspheme god say bee accursed bycause name blasphemed let v beare mynde suche people monster made kynde neuerthelesse let v pray god giue v grace know hath set v world whiche ende wee magnifie wayting happie daye wherein shall gather v vp wholly himselfe wee haue liued suche wise world haue sought bee gouerned otherwise submitting oure selues vnto respectes caces let v cast downe selues face good god acknowledgement sinnes praying goodnesse make v fele better haue done specially sort may com present selues vnto without desire thing saue onely finde mercifull lord iesus christes sake asmuch know beset great infirmity finde selues phisition heale v let v pray purge v vntill haue brought v perfection long continually set v say almightie god heauenly father acknowledge ourselues confesse truth c fourth sermon vpon first chapter came passe one day sonnes god came appeare lorde satan also came amongst lord sayde satan vvhence commest thou satan ansvvering sayde vnto lorde vvalking hunting vpon earth lord sayde vnto satan hast thou taken heede seruant iob vvho hath matche vpon earth sounde vpright man fearing god vvithdravving himselfe euill haue seene premiss life conuersation iob among men shewed wise god disposed ende might knowe liue heere belowe wee gouerned fortune god hath eye vpon v ful authoritie ouer v good reason shuld haue seing creature anon shal see howe pleased god afflict iob wherein chiefe thing principally touched god hath direction world thing done disposed expresse scripture vseth fashion agreeable rudenesse weake neuer coprehend god maiestie ful highnesse therof possibly attain vnto therfore behoueth god come comprehended v wit shew himselfe glory infinite according smal capacitie seeth v wherevnto applyeth short shall neuer knowe god shall know measure shall please manifest vnto v wit according knoweth bee profitable saluatio maner speach wee see sayd angel appeared god solemne high day borowed king world kepe estate assyses certaine scripture sheweth many place angel euermore god notwithstanding execute commaundemets according sayd pitch tent round v gard v god hath appointed guide v end vnder protection also sayd execute wrath vengeance vpon wicked yet angel spirit hindered serue god obey execute iudgement albeit cotinually presence therefore lorde iesus christ saith angel haue keeping litle infant cotinually see behold face father thereby giuen v vnderstand although angel assist v feele vertue maintaining v yet notwithstanding ioy still whyle glory god separated therefore wheras sayd text appeared ment god sendeth forth bee separated maiestie depriued heauenly life time voyage asmuch rude grosse scripture ment like god earthly prince end homely familiar maner might know angel thing owne proper mouing god comaudeth hath dominion ouer come yeelde account nothing hid fro much angel haue proper peculiar authoritie themselues although called power principality vertues god hath resigned office vnto hath despoyled power abideth ydle heauen angel instrument power end spread ouerall vve see haue gather text wit god worketh suche wise meane angel gouerning worldly matter come accout afore sort nothing escape furthermore whereas sayd satan also came among angel wound himselfe thither haue vnderstood crowded copanie make himselfe good page contrariwise holy ghostment v vnderstand angel heauen obey god willingly wholy inclyned giuen way yeelde account vnto also diuels hell enimies rebel vttermost power laboure subuert maiestie practize confound thing forced spite teeth bee subiect vnto god yeelde account doings doe thing without permission leaue thus ye see wise satan appeared among angel yet way maner dealing diuers angel guyde v thing god hath commaunded haue nature apply themselues vnto haue none inclination obey otherside dwelleth reigneth holy spirit lo cause say thy done earth heauen bycause wee see muche counterfayting many horrible rebellion god belowe wee desire settle kingdome peaceably heere aloft angel wholly obedient vnto diuelles obey inforced say goodwill bicause god copelleth would hart resist power oppresse could fayne followe pointes whether euer listeth leade herby see angel place expresly termed childre god diuel propre title aduersarie doth word satan signifie hebrew true ofte time called child god bicause hee hath printed image specially faithfull asmuch reformed likenesse lord iesus christ liuely image god father also haue receyued spirit adoptio warrat vnto god beareth fatherly loue towards rightly therfore may called childre god may also prince magistrate haue honourable title giue vnto bycause god hath aduauced set hie estate intent knowen person vve see name god child may well applyed angel called scripture bycause drawe vnto god bearnes brightnesse therefore asmuche god calleth principality vertues highness good reason wee also shoulde acknowledge sonnes god asmuch may separate vertue fro vertue god bicause streames gushe fountaine spring must alwaies repaire thither let v know honour taken reputed child god belogeth angel bycause glorie vttereth sheweth selfe therefore much beholden infinite goodnesse god hath appoynted seruats meanes lord iesus christ asmuche lorde iesus christe onely sonne god father yea euen naturall sonne belonging honour vnto befalne vnto grace naturall sonne cause onely sonne also asmuche say lorde iesus christ hath bene spared redemption saluation angel also child god meane appoynted serue v apostle sheweth epistle hebrewes also shewed iacobs ladder sayd angel came downe fro heauen earth iesus christ affirmeth thing accomplished kingdome shall see angel sayeth come downe heauen vnto men seeing perceyue god hath ordeyned angel serue welfare much wee bound mercie moreouer hath done v greate honour sone redeeme v hath taken vpo nature angel apostle sayeth hath clothed himselfe nature substance vvhen see sone god come neere vnto v vouchsaue parttaker man nature wee may perceyue verie welsping whence proceedeth grace angel trauell watch behalfe also peculiar charge vocatio procure welfare according herevnto holy ghost sholeth satan sheweth willingly seruats god wise euen child vvhe childe obeyeth father doeth doeth bicause inclined revnto bicause owne nature teacheth bicause hath certaine louingnesse induceth discharge himselfe duetie euen angel otherside satan aduersarie albeit appeareth god fayne render account yet yeelded owne accorde hee willing subiect vnto god rather rowzed himselfe inflamed excessiue rage woulde haue ouerthrowen god power bene possible hild still natural corruption wit alwaies enemie yet costreined come homage hath soueraine dominion ouer creature satan also subiect vnto god therfore may surmyzed satan hath authoritie giuen god good reason shoulde subiect sith al thing proceede fro diuels created god well angel howbeit suche vve must alwayes hold certaintie naughtinesse diuels proceedeth theselues became apostataes separate themselues fountaine rightuousnesse forsooke god turned themselues away fro lo peruerted became altogither euill likewise wheras sinne ma nature god putting creation reason sata spreade naughtinesse abrode time beguiled wylinesse disappoint benefit god thus ye see diuels became accursed selues cruell full rebellion full lying full wickednesse came altogither turning away fro creator scripture teacheth v yet cease alwayes vnder god therfore thing knowledge therof whe sayde diuell prince worlde inough make v afrayde knowe bridle alofte reyneth backe hindreth would satas power limited hee would hand haue full fling v vve knowe desireth nothing destruction according also deadly enemie sayd another place goeth like roring lyon alwayes hard pray deuour diuels subiect god could attempt list selues leaue without limitation god withhild backe ala full wretched shoulde state cast vp pray without remedie shoulde faith bee certaintie assurance defence shoulde haue enemy ouermightie one necessariest article haue know diuel hild short soeuer play mad feende agaynste saluation yet nothing permitted aboue also scripture telleth v rightly thing wit satan prince world reygneth ayre aboue v wee bee power able deuour v subiects vnto finally bondslaues nature fast tied fetter yet notwithstanding subiect vnto god whither wil two point diuers yet haue contrarietie right profitable v bring v good instruction scripture telleth v diuell hath power raigneth men vnder feete vnder tyrannie holdeth bondes ende wee know owne wretchednesse wee see pride men glorifie themselues wise would stie vp aboue clowdes bothe wisedome vertue thing men bee hoysed aloft god cotrarie part auoucheth bondslaues satan hild bodage slauery vnder go chalenge great nobilitie go wayes auaunce selues yet shall diuell haue dominion ouer euer lo howe god cutteth men combes maketh ashamed hee hath brought downe waketh vp agayne ende shoulde walke feare wee thought wee enemie woulde make warre vpon v puissant would slouthfull lyue peace beholde god telleth v sata like roaring lion hath throte euer open swalow v vp wee haue weapon resist except giue v force muste come make v bethink selues well stand vpon garde sleepie diuell straightwayes take v vnprouided thus see scripture sayeth diuell prince world namely euen intent first bring v lowe afterward teach v feare warenesse wee may call vpon god beseeching suffer v fall satan snare strengthen v hath promised may alwayes keepe good watch furthermore also side intent satan puissance bee ouer terrible vnto v make courage quayle cast v despayre sayd vnto v nothing without god comission must fayne aske leaue hee hath spit fire flame nothing god permitteth good pleasure true diuell cease furious venture himselfe vpon pykes shall boote sith god neuer suffer otherwise shall thinke good vve see purpose declared vnto v diuell steppeth among child god wounde himselfe though hee bene companie order angel shewe v vnder god obeysance well angel howbeit farre qualitie holy ghost nameth aduersarie wheras angel called childre god signifie vnto v angel obey good willing seruants wheras sata inforced nothing necessitie constraynt let v nowe come whiche scripture addeth namely god demaunded satan whence came satan answered going aboute earth yea euen bunt vvhen suche rehearsal made know alwayes infirmitie god needed enquire satan done worlde asmuch rudenesse small measure vnderstanding comprehend thing behoueth v sayd afore declaration agreable v herein wee see goodnesse god frameth himselfe vnto v bycause canot attayne vnto mount high humbleth v transformeth himselfe end shoulde know good conuenient v seeing god cometh vnto v pray ought confounded shame slowe heare hereby see villanie would bereue poore ideotes doctrine say holie scripture ouerhard bite vpon true respect nothing else darknesse v scripture hard v yet withall man must consider god hath promised enlighten little one lowly deede see hath proceeded purpose set vnto v homely maner men god sheweth v howe meaning onely instruct greate clerkes suche suttle well exercised schooles also apply self vnto v rudest vnskilfullest sort seing god proceedeth part vnthankefulnesse men drawe backewarde shrowd themselues vnder shadow colour saying impossible vnderstande meaning holie scripture see god hath applied vnto v way wee haue gather chiefely minde holy ghost shewe satan office nature aboute busieth applyeth himselfe altogither haue sayd hunt pray without ceassing like roring lyon peter vseth sayd similitude purposely waken v might stande vpon garde night day call vpon god defende v agaynste assaultes enemie agaynst practize v true see satan ne perceyue eyesight hee prepareth practizeth destruction therfore haue much cause afrayde guile pollicies lo cause paule sayeth fighting fleashe bloud hereby meaneth deale visible enemy wee myght well escape handes shift might finde meane resist behold saieth spirituall guile fight v haue sight except god giue v eye fayth espie howe satan agaynst v specially teptations triumpheth way wherby eggeth v euill laboureth marre v wee mustefully resolue ourselues poynte namely diuels alwaies buzy procure destruction go earth bee neuer away v bee euer seeking meanes get v soone finde neuer small breach enter v throwe v endlesse destruction wee surpryzed mistrust assayled according euery man knoweth experience perceyue diuell neere v yet meane wee see selues wouded death vvherfore feele wicked desire selues caried one lewde ust another must marke enemie worketh craftily thus finde experience diuels euer practizing v specially againste god hath giuen wisedome knowledge although diuel possesse wicked reprobate worke effectualnesse sainct paule speaketh thessalonian yet perceyue diuell thing make sporte vice bewitched euill feele whit bee become blockish sainct paule sayeth another place whe faithfull finde mindes attaynted euyll affection satan hath preuailed much make entrance know satan hath preuented vnwares perceyued gaue battell alarme vve must tarie till haue assault must afrayd take heede sayde god sheweth care hee hath v taken vnwares wante knowing aduersaries hee sayeth diuelles go earth continually hunting theyr pray man shoulde tell v enemy hande certayne bandes comming vpon v euery v would stande vpon garde deuise meanes possible defend selues withstande bycause wee bee fleashly haue care preserue transitorie lyfe beholde enemie satan hath store wyles suttleties daungerous mischieuous enemy world desire cast v headlong destructio know strength hath bene declared alreadie expresly sayd v besiegeth v side hee hath thousande wayes winde v vvhen told v yet neuer warer token tha beastly blockishnesse haue mind heauenly lyfe coceyue tha see like brute beast whe tolde v satan ceasseth go worlde continually foloweth chace neuer idle wee muste profit selues doctrine bicause enemie welfare desireth nothing el leade v destruction whervnto himselfe come cocerning god sayeth hast thou marked seruant iob bow vpright sounde man feareth god withdraweth himselfe euill v vnderstand god spyteth satan hath giuen grace walke according herein see vpon codition god hath set v worlde namely shoulde mirror vertue hee giueth v grace gouerne selues holie spirite setteth v vpon scaffolde end gracious goodnesse mercie knowen vnto v thervpon himselfe might glorified satan person sure honor inestimable god doth vnto v whe choozeth v say choozeth v poore wormes earth glorified v satan make triumphes v let v consider thing towards men ala god draw thing men may serue glory certaine cannot nothing euill god hath chozen v sheadeth holie spirite vpon v giueth v grace bee glorified persones maketh tryumphes agaynste enemy heerby wee admonished thinke straunge matter please god exercise v store incouters teptations rather perceyue god keepeth v occupied frute cometh incouters ought content v throughly wit god glorirified power knowen wise satan cofounded assaultes seeing issue coflictes happy pray ought beare paciently moreouer like god spyteth satan person iob also haue wee wherewith spite enemy whe protection god well printed harte wee knowe howe hee dwelleth reygneth harte holy spirit fenceth v bulwark fortresse v marke also sainct paule sayeth viij romanes hee hath shewed faithfull inuincible spirit god beareth record lyfe saieth although haue receyued fully perfectly yet notwithstanding yea though receyued one small drop seede lyfe assure god accomplish hath begonne seeing faithfull haue assurance god hath gyuen holy spirit shew vnto bee father ende thervpon maye lift vp voyces mindes vaunt themselues satan death thing wherefore bicause nothing able put fro sayd loue god beareth hath shewed lord iesus christ thus see must haue hold v shall laide forth large hereafter specially whe come declare mischiefes sata wrought againste iob howe ought take present touche whiche necessarye present purpose let v come text mencion made iobs vprightnesse true haue already declared al matter superfluous make new discourse thing haue bene touched hertofore shall suffize v make short rehearsall intent bring thing remembrance whiche greatly profite know marke
