wherefore holy ghost hath declared lyfe iob new againe ende shoulde patterne v shape selues like vnto desire frame liues godward seruice muste firste haue sayde soundnesse hart double serue god outward appearance onely feete handes eye hart march afore haue pure single meaning giue selues ouer vnto god bee wholly abhorre hypocrisie beholde poynt must beginne meane haue lyfe well ruled allowed god vprightnesse muste wise spring feare god say muste shewe outwardly lieth hid within v roote good shall bring forth good fruites workes may beare record protestation seruing god assuring selues thing hande vayne consisteth two thing namely deale vprightnesse equitie among neighbor mark speciall point also haue religiousnesse v serue god imputing vnto vprightnesse tedeth end ech one v shrinke aside seeke owne profite shoulde comunicate togither according god hath bounde knit v togither one bodie euery man haue care serue neighboures turne mainteine brotherly communion equitie another would haue done selues thus see god proueth wit whither liue vprightly amog men without hurting hindering man rather whither labour doo seruice vnto men principall poynt referre vnto god acknowledging selues wholy reason life death offered vnto sacrifize worship homage vnto thing hath giuen handes confesse howe ought haue superioritie ouer v wee protest prayer requestes shewe howe whole refuge whome beholding thing lo record behoueth v yeelde soundnesse hidden harte roote hidden earth asmuche cace standeth wee walke becommeth v god lyking except wee vtterly withdraw selues euill also well attributed vnto iob vnder persone wee aduertised wee shall neuer serue god without greate difficulty many hinderance diuell styrreth vp wee keepe ryght way behoueth v leape ouer trench steppe ouer stone marche among thornes thus wee see manifold incombrances cast afore v turne v aside walking god hath appoynted yea eue marre v altogither let v learne put lesso vre iob serued god withdrawing himselfe fro euill whe see whole world corrupted amog brier ca see nothing euill example let v resist suche thing lazie make excuse bycause world wicked froward wee may well ouerfond lo iob set v condemne v dayes withdrewe himselfe fro euill ought wee like dayes specially seeing god gyueth v warning wee cannot lyue holily without greate battelles great hardinesse hee gyueth v grace ouercome satan assaultes suche wise excuse v wee iob hath done lyued tyme thing well ordered men angelles hee lyued among idolater abundance wickednesse reigned time greate store vyce worlde day yet iob folowed bent men bowes prouerb sayeth retired himselfe beeing well assured hee ought serue god let v dayes alledge corruptnesse tyme turned top iteruie rather let v consider god meane thereof prouoketh v bee muche carefuller shunne thing may infect v asmuche see howe vyces euill ayre wee must flee cace one shoulde tell meate poysoned woulde haue minde meddle man tell daunger place woulde come wee carefull seeing god himselfe sheweth v vice worlde badde deadly plague sith god hath gyuen iob grace withholde himselfe euill let v doubte hee assist v day like power finally conclusion sayde satan ment haue spyted god saying iob serued naught muche blissed suche wise euen day hee prospered affayres sayeth satan iob may hypocrite ought knowe thou touche thine thou shalt see come vve see howe diuell laboureth side ouerwhelme v seeth getteth nothing one poynt deuiseth practiseth newe tricke wyles infinite forgeth shop therfore behoueth v stande vpon garde certayne haue sayde already prosperitie corrupteth men affliction worlde doo rich willingly accompanied pryde pompe contempt god crueltie craftinesse like thing bring delightes pleasure suche sort man becommeth altogither beastely satan came farre short winning thing iobs hande meanes turned himselfe side made sure might tryed affliction way must consider god knoweth right well requisite tryall well fayth obedience needeth counselled diuell sayde expressely vnto v doo v wit god sende pouertie vpon v afflict v doeth partely ende wee shoulde bethinke selues bee puffed vppe prosperitie tha aduersitie partly teache v pray vnto according necessity oppresse v herewithall must also marke diuell alwayes elbow ouerthrow v scape one side stirres vp new temptatio agayne side shorte sayde one word zacharie declared v large wit sata accuser aduersarie child god according also apocalips sayde accuser brother expressely shewed vnto zacharie vision satan sette himselfe accuse iosua hygh prieste heade churche figure lorde iesus christe whome hee came thither accuse god considering wee haue strong partie satan laboreth meanes possible throw v downe notwithstanding wee haue bene long tyme fenced hande god wee perceyue haue great nede iesus christ aduocate maynteyne v power agaynst satan wee intrapped wile pollicies thus see wherof wee bee warned sentence ende shoulde betake selues god beseeching strengthen v agaynste temptation satan suche wise wee may neuer vanquished asmuche lorde shall stablish v inuincible power holy spirite therefore let v caste selues downe face good god acknowledgement sinnes beseeching make v feele better wee may bee displeased selues mourne maiestie desiring pardon according measure offence may request also suffer v turned obedience rather wee may continue end print harte sayde soundnesse whiche hee hath inioyned v wee may respecte couet thing saue onely yeelde whiche dewe wit hee may bee knowledged bee author goodnesse welfare wee may seruice lyuing true brotherlynesse neyghboures withholding v wrong good men ende withstand trouble temptation world vntill come kingdome heaue may please giue grace onely v also people nation earth bringing backe poore ignorant soules fro miserable bondage error darkenesse right way saluation thereof may please rayse vp true faythfull minister word seeke owne profite vayneglorie onely aduancement holy name welfare flocke c fifth sermon vpon first chapter satan sayde lorde doth iob feare lord nothing haste thou bene bulwarke side haste thou fenced house hee hath doest thou prosper affayres possession farre inlarged lay thy hande vpon touche whiche hee hath see curse thee thy face lord sayde vnto satan gyue thee power ouer hee possesseth touche person satan went presence lorde albeit diuell office wit peruerte goodnesse falsely accuse iob though hee hypocrite yet neuerthelesse doyng hee discouereth euill men willingly wherevnto wee bee inclyned nature beeing wilye polityke hee knoweth full well side assayle v let v marke diuell bewrayeth disease wherewith v atteynted vntill god haue healed v grace wit time prosperitie blisse god afflict v change minde thenceforth beginne grudge agaynste forgetting prayse whiche wee gyuen long hee dealte v oure desire bee many hypocrite whiche cannot bee knowen discouered vntill god sende aduersitie long bee ease rest shew rebelliousnesse within let lie hid lo heere cause scripture oftentymes sheweth v god tryeth ting affliction casting golde furnace onely purge also make knowne twoo purpose affliction serue witte god killeth vyces v hee punisheth v wee tamed hee commaundeth v withdrawe ourselues worlde bee gyuen pleasure fleshlie delyghtes yet thing wit lyke furnace golde tryed knowe whither haue drosse also god sheweth wee bee afflicting v men knowe themselues haue bene proued wee haue passed iue wee seeme selues feare god nothing mislyked v yet manie vice v wee knowe god sheweth vnto v maketh v perceyue hee sendeth v trouble aduersitie finde wee infirmitie nowe god make affliction faythfull one serue mirror wherein beholde themselues muche likely shewe men whither haue fayth obedientnesse harte whither bee hypocrite whither serue truthe yee see wee haue marke streyne experience sheweth v wee see greate number god sendeth thing theyr pleasure doo speake sweete sugre say yee woulde maruell heare howe good god shall bee praysed speciallie finde theyr dish full furnished nothing wanting well lyketh confesse god good hee beginne handle thing roughly thing fall contentation take sore harte god proceede plucke theyr fethers fall yet outrage murmuring yea belke blasphemyes agaynste albeit vtter mouthe yet theyr harte full poyson within chafe vpon bytte repine god handling otherwise lyke ye see tyme prosperitie ynow blisse god hypocrisie speake meane deede bee worste sooth themselues suche wyse perceyue owne vice sithe cace standeth let v marke satan hath poynte eye disease wherwith men atteynted see enemie haue lieth wayte v prieth v side spie hee may haue entrance wounde v therefore let v beare well minde wee shall haue praysed god serued tyme prosperitie haue must put selues readinesse soeuer shal please god scourge v exercise v manifolde misery inconueniences withstanding must bridle selues haue lowlinesse submit selues vnto receyue chastyzements pacietly quietly come trial say wee pacient whe god scourgeth v al seruice vnto wil great matter true god well accept eue tyme prosperitie howbeit asmuch behoueth v consider hee maketh v passe thorowe sayde boultell affliction therefore must wee better beareaway lesson heere furthermore wheras sayd men curse god face bee combered affliction true commeth passe firste pushe yet remayne reuerence god imprinted v put harde pinche doubte wee groyne repine agaynste secretely open mouth blaspheme god yet go agaynst nature wee haue thus fretted chafed miserie increace styll continew long doeth impaciencie kindle fyre wee beginne flushe erst bene locked vp harte thus wee see howe length afflicted doo curse god face say howe ouershoote themselues measure regarde maiestie god humble themselues vnto ne consider become rebelles agaynst shall attayne take holde iudgement whiche restreyned rushing outrage therefore good cause haue wee pray vnto god bridle tunges well harte suffer v time fall excesse curse openly rather issue chastyzementes whiche sendeth may lucky v may turne profite welfare according intent hee scourgeth v lo wee haue gather streyne way let v marke although satan father lying yet speaketh truthe hee sayeth god bad bene ulwa ke iob fenced bouse side made im prosper beholde howe hee turneth himselfe angell light asmuche hee god stoode hande set fayre colour matter place vse suche trumperie hee vseth towardes men deceyue thus satan groundeth himselfe vpen true principle apply vnto euill desire nothing el destroy iob hee sayeth god bene bulwarke let v vnderstand wee bee maynteyned worlde god muste needes put hand lyfe many necessity subiect therefore could stand one minute houre wee preserued grace god like wise thing possesse god must fayne fence v pray hee speaketh heere euen satan whose comming purpose ouerwhelme v good persones would say well walled god serue v bulwarke according also shall see processe texte soone satan hath leaue wee see howe hee taketh away iobs good violence go therfore requisite iob shoulde fenced whyle aforehand grace god shoulde serue rapire round lesson greatly profite heereby wee bee warned pray vnto god may please defende v asmuche wee worlde wee wilde woode full robber wee see also scripture attribute title vnto namely buckler shielde wall trenche rampyre bulwarke tower fortresse vvherefore dothe scripture vse many woordes betoken god protection force teache v without shoulde perishe hundred thousande time day therefore must fayne watch continually safetie vve see haue sayde requisite men acknowledge lyfe bee nothing considering frayle nothing subiect infinite number death much thereby stirred vp pray god take tuicion shall haue lyued one day muste acknowledge mainteyned god vnto must yeeld prayse lo wee haue marke streyne satan enemie truthe cofesse god man defence copelled say vpo racke seeing god hath made v taste woorking made v feele vnthankfulnesse shall confesse lesse satan hath done desireth nothing el deface rather vtterly abolishe god gracious goodnesse lying myght bee knowne wee see suche thinke protection god worse diuell needes muste turned brute beastes rather altogither bewitched thus much concerning woorde consequently sayde god gaue satan leaue listed iobs goodes condicionally bee touched persone heere firste blushe man myght maruell god gyue ouer seruaunt iob satan pleasure meete diuell haue credite god craueth leaue woorke v mischiefe god shoulde graunte seemeth god fauoureth maketh sporte v meane tennis ball let v marke whe god grauteth satan thing doth pleasure neyther moued fauour hee beareth towards cause hath ordeyned owne purpose moued satas sute perswaded suffer iob bee punished hee alreadie determined owne purpose satan vttered woorde made petition god minded punishe seruaunt minded ust cause hath disclozed vnto v though v vnknowne yet muste wee lay hand vpon mouth say god rightuous vnpartiall doeth thus ye see first pointe haue marke wit god grau ted satan request though hee bene moued sute asmuche minded owne good wil chastyze iob therfore graunted satan demaunde verily euen spyte satan haue greater triumph agaynst putting confusion satan made full reckening iob haue cursed god face say haue blasphemed open mouth came beaten roughly satan hee considered selues wit fleeting water stregth nothing meane vnderstanding god grace strong inuincible v true feeleth hath experience spite hart yet knoweth whit see deceyued see wherevpon maketh reckening namely ca get leaue torment v shal vanquished hande shall bee swalowed vp heauinesse fall despayre blaspheme god lo satan hopeth pretendeth marke well god resist disappoint hope sende grace holy ghost hand shall satan cofounded see hath power compasse thing ment haue attempted god seruauntes go backward cleane contrarie intent god therefore knowing issue iobs affliction determined owne purpose scourge may see satan instigation vvhy doth holy scripture tell v done satan request two cause firste beaten god roddes myght knowe satan procured yea euen cast v despayre paule sheweth v text hath bene alleaged dayes ago namely haue battaile spirituall power agaynst fleash bloud often euill befalls v let v sure satan hath practized v end may withstad faith fensed armed mightie power god knowing satan hath great power ouer v may retyre selues refuge able strengthen v heere ye see whervnto scripture eye cace secod point scripture meaneth shew god fatherly loue towards v somuch supporteth v little babe giueth libertie ouer v enimie would fayne haue specially might take pleasure afflicting v knoweth howe singular welfare true must fully resolued vpon poynte namely though knowe wherefore god punisheth v muste alwayes acknowledge rightfull yet therwithall behoueth v ouer haue lesson printed hart namely god loueth v tenderly desireth nothing bring v home againe muche spareth v holdeth v lap wee see scripture speaketh see satan come kindle fyre hath sewed vnto god haue iob persecuted let v marke scripture sheweth v god hadleth v roughly without cause yet sute enemie woulde desire nothing much keepe v rest ease expedient v bicause good v exercised affliction yea eue satan hand well doth god permit forasmuche knoweth good profitable v mark say haue note proue let v take contrary example last chapter first booke king likewise sayd god hild assyse suche another description prophet seene god set chayre estate hee demaunded vvho shall beguyle achab satan preueted god cace nother came aforehande say thou wilt gyue leaue beguile achab whatsoeuer thou wilt haue god beginneth saying shall finde lying spirit go deceyue achab see needes drowned euen bottome hell wherfore god speaketh euen bycause cace stood vpon executing iust vengeance vpon hypocrite despyser ful crueltie mortall enemie goodnesse achab man peruerted al god seruice vtterly wholly defiled owne idolles therwithall also full sturdinesse malice prophetes woulde giue eare admonition vvhen thus hardened sinnes sort man could gayne nothing seking bring right way god assayed wayes saw man forlorne hild assyses demaunded hee would deceiue achab god execute office iudge vve see god meaneth punish wicked folke execute wrath vpon according desert tarieth till moued satan preueteth present text question punishing iob saye god dealeth roughlie one owne child needes muste come passe pursute enimie lo diuersitie whiche sheweth v reason satan request graunted text let v marke well scripture meaneth meanes teache v glorifie god continually wee knowing goodnesse towardes v myght take occasion magnifie therewithall vnderstande howe vengeance iuste agaynst wicked person hee punishe hee doeth office ende hee may bee feared reuerenced honored worlde thus ye see wee haue beare minde way man may thinke straunge god serued satan haue tolde alreadie wee shall wanze away like water wee bee fully persuaded poynte diuelles suche wise vnder god guydance doo nothing without leaue yet matter wit diuells god hangman execute iudgements punishment hee haue done vpon wicked also roddes whereby chastizeth child bee shorte behoueth diuell bee instrument god wrath execute doeth owne voluntarie good haue sayde bycause god hath soueraine dominion ouer creature must needes yeelde vnto turne themselues whither soeuer hee thinketh good heere one greate diuersitie muste marke god hath gyuen satan leaue punishe iob hee sayeth beholde thou mayst woorke thy spite vpon substance touche persone agayne hath destroyed goodes sayeth thou mayst touch person thou shalt come neere soule herein agayne wee see howe god reserueth alwayes soule iob satan torment good mortall lyfe honour hee power enter soule seduce make burst impatiencie wyll better vnderstode contrarie similitude vvhen god giueth satan commission execute wrath vpon vnbeleeuers onely permitteth punishe good sicknesse disease maner also goeth giueth power leade error deceyue wee haue alreadie alleaged example achab beholde god sayeth vvho shall beguyle achab satan sayde lying spirit mouth prophet vve see ther farre larger co mission matter onely achab beguiled outwarde meanes see prophet must beguile vnder shadow truth paule meaneth saying men haue minde obey god truth wil frame themselues thervnto aboue god hath bene gracious manifest himselfe vnto shew way saluation vnhappie reiect great grace god refuze behold god sendeth falseprophets deceyuers onely shall peruert good doctrine also shall beleued giue speedinesse error behoueth v wey well saying according also importeth much met speedefulnesse error god withdraweth brightnesse v wherby wittes dazeled become dull discerne brute beast although pitte lye wyde open v yet wee stumble without seeing whit bicause aduisednesse wisedome v asmuch god hath giuen satan power mocke v beguile v yea euen blinde v bewitch v wise wote way turne v tumble new snare beholde say god worketh towarde vnbeleeuers reprobate namely giueth satan speedinesse error intrap shall neuer perceyue dealeth towardes suche afflicteth although satan assault yet notwithstanding alwayes preserued haue wherewith beate back temptation god hath armed owne power satan hath leaue god putteth barre way suche sort hild short euery mischiefe steppeth forthe vnto nothing god good pleasure liceceth thus ye see haue mark herewithall wee haue obserue god iudgments suche sort executeth bothe vpon good bad true folowe owne opinion myght wonder come passe god gyueth suche authoritie preeminence vnto satan able leade v amisse straunge thing owne imagination seing scripture telleth v behoueth v humble selues wayte till day come may better conceyue god secretes incomprehesible v day therfore must learne magnifie honour god iudgements hauing reuerence admiratio vntill may better knowen vnto v wee haue small capacitie know throughly therefore must walke humilitie cotenting selues know part vntill full knowledge disclosed vnto v latter daye soeuer cace stand must ignorat scripture sheweth v wit god serueth turne satan wise satan alwayes readie seduce men haue deserued specially refuze obey truth must needes caried away vnto lye cocerning faithfull god doth leaue also vnto satan seduced like iob exempted inconuenience ende also see said dauid holy story wherof came numbered people text reporteth diuell stirred vp mischief dauid numbered people god dauid one god child notwithstanding sometimes deliuered power satan bee beguiled see thys haue good cause pray vnto god come shrowd selues vnder shadow wing hide v suche thing befell vnto dauid shall become v herewithall let v also marke whe god giueth satan sway ouer faithfull little ye may see said satan dominion ouer vnbeleeuers vpon stubborneharted without cause sainct paule maketh thys distinction worketh euen sayeth vnbeleeuers thus placeth reigne satan separated god cut hys church wherefore se owne boundes hath power wound child god lorde permitteth humble end grieuously tormented yet whyle resist assaultes made vpon shoulde vnderstand commeth themselues vphild otherwise witte grace god power holy spirit god giueth satan leaue tempte faithfull one ordinarily make serued therewith medicine herein see goddes maruelous goodnesse turneth euil good satan bring ranke poyson venim yea know hath nothing death called prince thereof whatsoeuer satan ca bring tendeth altogither men destruction drowning endlesse damnation yet notwithstanding god findeth meane euill satan turned welfare wee see sainct paule physiked himselfe confesseth spoken hygh reuelacions bene giuen vnto god sayeth hath prouided exalt selfe much lo good prouision profitable sainct paule wee know pride ready throw v headlong intoo bottomlesse pit nothing prouoketh god displeasure needes must alway shewe himselfe enemie prowde presume vpon theyr owne strength wise euer sainct paule daunger god remedied sort sayeth paule sending messenger satan buffet see satan worketh sainct paule yea euen goddes permission issue doubt satan ment haue ouerwhelmed paule intente haue driuen wickednesse end hee shoulde haue giuen ouer seruice god little little withdraw himselfe christianitie reason wearisome trouble misery whiche hee endured without ceassing lo satan intended god purposed another ende namely brydle seruant forget himselfe exalt himselfe much thys cause buffeted vseth sayd similitude buffetting nonce would say god vsed hym man armes fighteth fielde giue glorious victory buffeted hym lyke boy hys shame reproch thus holy apostle whome god endewed excellent giftes holy ghoste farre made vnderling satan satan spitted face wrought marry villanies vve see god turneth euill intoo good maketh al satan sting serue v medicine whereby hee purgeth v vyces lye hid v therefore haue cause prayse god respectes yea euen though first sight iudgementes bee ouer boystous imagination able conceiue fleshly vnderstanding vvhen haue well considered wee shall euermore haue wherefore magnifie god thus muche touching streyne wherein saide god gaue satan leaue punish iob howbeit hee forwarned touch persone effect wee haue marke god giueth satan libertie assayle v sorte maketh many sore assaultes vpon v yet neuerthelesse hee goeth measure one knoweth able beare expedient v finally sayde satan wente presence lord satan hee list god saw signifie vntoo v furie satan accustomed manner dealing witte hee worst could without regarding subiect god vsed owne rebelliousnesse making hauock iobs goodes howbeit yet one thing ment saying wit satan effectuall deede shew leaue gotten haue told already streyt determination god whiche vnknowen men nowe declared v whereas scripture telleth v thyngs whiche apparant vnto v iob spoyled goodes hys child slayne himselfe sore plagued owne persone thing commonly knowen men men knew rehearsed afore witte god hild assyses disposed ordinance nothing happened without prouidence haue eye faithe comprehend thys haue vnderstanding residue perceyue onely thing done outwardly see wherefore sayde satan went presence lord holye scripture putteth difference betweene outwarde thing done purpose god whiche knowen faythfull lift vp themselues aboue owne reason aboue naturall wittes shall neuer attayne knowledge god maiestie except wee bee caried vp aboue owne abilitie nowe scripture returneth story sayeth satan departed presence lord say visibly perceyued apparant manner punished iob thus see meant thereby residue alwayes expresse nature satan hee inordinate rage casteth fyre flame though would make cleane dispatch togyther bee short hys office tempte men appeareth place iesus christ tempted sayd behold tempteth terme title tempter attributed peculiarly vnto satan ende wee know seeketh nothing destroy put mankind confusion thus see al diligence al going trotting vp downe leade v destruction purpose desireth exempted obedience vnto god hee myght turne vpside downe seeing know ought bee much prouoked pray vnto god take v hande tuition receyueth v safetie trouble satan practize v god withdraw hymselfe v onely slacke hande little wee shall ouercome satan vve see taught one side humble selues walke feare warinesse side call vppon god assuring selues long succoured shall want nothing yea although fayne fight great distress yet shall sure victorie hath promised let v fall maiestie god praying hym make v perceiue euilles v vpon knowing euery one v may feele himselfe full infirmity yea euen outrageous vice wee well deserue thrust presence herewithall let v pray strengthen v wise holy spirite may blisse continually prosperitie aduersitie wee may desire thing please poynts yeelde ourselues wholly vnto although haue enemie ouerstrong ouer boystous whome able resist beare backe blowes yet notwithstanding maintenance power good god may continue obeysance vnto end say euen vntill hee haue gathered v home himselfe make v partaker happie triumph hath prepared v heauenly glory graunt benefite grace vnto v also c sixth sermon vpon first chapter one day sonnes daughter vvere eating drinking vvine elder brother house messenger came vnto iob sayde ox vvere laboring shee ass vvere feeding behold sabeans brake vppon tooke haue slayne thy seruantes vvith edge svvord escaped alone bring thee vvord vvas yet speaking behold vvas another vvhich sayd fyre god fallen heauen hath burned vpthy sheepe thy seruauntes escaped bring thee vvord vvas yet speaking behold another vvhich sayd chaldee haue made three band brake vpon thy camel haue taken avvay haue also smitten thy seruants vvith edge svvord escaped come tell thee vvas speaking behold another saying thy sonnes thy daughter vvere eating drinking vvine elder brother house behold hideous vvinde vvildernesse rushed house crushed four corner togither fallen vpon yong folke dead escaped alone tell thee sayd goddes angells incampe themselues round faithfull present story sheweth v howe greatly behoofe garded fenced round see rage satan al feare god consider well state life shall find selues subiect hundred thousand kind death wee cannot treade one step shall wounded haue skill enough say man nothing considering frailtie meane consider sufficiently malice satan vnderpryeth v practizeth v cast v despayre therefore lord minded aduertise v neede haue garded angells whych fight al assault satan intedeth v like sathan aduersarie v doth god appoint angel mainteine v wil haue worker welfare may better vnderstad haue touched let v first marke iob punished sundrie sort wit good child sathan hilde shorte could attempt thing againste person good sheweth ful wel god giuen vp hand afterward iobs childre also deare owne life ther yet one poynt iob forewent good child one manner diuell policie send diuers temptation stirred vp enemy one side hee himselfe serued send downe lightening heaue tempest ayre side lo seruant god tormented diuers sort might augmet griefe trouble yet thinke thus himselfe onely men contrarie mee also god himselfe fighteth agaynst beholde crastynesse satan true seeme straunge v first push may see hath moued men opinion god hath set v downe certaine potrayture pacience aplayne storie deede done suche men vnderstande god dealeth seruantes according measure sayth hee hath distrybuted vnto howe vve tempted alyke god hath made v strong requisite weakelinges god supporteth chastize humble ende take heede themselues call vpon god earnestly farre strong stoute wherefore bycause god hath powred spirite vppon much greater abundance haue earst sayde accordingly god dealeth vnto v strength himselfe doth exercise v haue fayth tried thing sure agaynst profit howbeit know wherefore doth bound v giue v one droppe strength hee may leaue v owne weakenesse cause v bee oppressed vtterly destroyed euery minute houre selues wee haue meane resist sauing farre foorth god strengthneth v grace yet notwithstanding haue sayde one fashion one sorte abyde weake styll sorte haue farre greater strength wee see wherefore holye men haue beene indued excellent grace haue also beene much tormented life vvhich v hath beene roughly dealt abraham hath miserable life neuer rest wee see god commaunded forsake natiue countrie hee done hee taryed lingring middes hys iourney vntill father deceassed way ende hee went countrye yet hee wyst way shoulde take whither go god vouchsaued tell countrie hee called vnto hilde foule vpon water vvhen come thither troubled othersome spyted nothing vnquietnesse vvithin men wrought muche spyte coulde famine persecuted faine get away wife taken warde returned new begin againe faine go another place seeke pasture yet god sayde take thought giue thee lande thou shalt lord maister yea sawe nothing place settle yet notwithstanding god promyseth make heire whole worlde afterwarde lykely shoulde haue issue none yet thing haue bin comfort olde drouping yet god sayeth vnto thou canst haue welfare except thou haue issue howe could bee alreadie aged could well tarric god hath giuen ismaell must banished cut house end isaac according promise god plucked sunne sayd go kill yet haue heard iob father heare child slaine lightning else bodie hath murdered surely muste needes great griefe hard beare go kill childe owne hande thing extreme doe abraham must come place againe heere afterwarde god giuen hym sonne againe though bin raysed vp fro death hee shewed maner promise hee made vnto hitherto sayth god haue borne thee hande thou shouldest inherite lande farre art thou enioying thy selfe taking possession thy life thine ofspring muste bee dryuen hence dwell strange lande vnder exceeding cruell tirannie space foure hundred yeares vve see howe god exercised seruaunt abraham straunge fashion vnaccustomed among men wherefore also strengthened holy spirite therefore hee gaue great verie rough assaultes see howe god woorketh excellenter sort ende shoulde bee mirrours example vnto v follow good sooth man shal neuer make workemanship little shop great one hee may haue stuffe store workemen thing well furnished good order haue small shop hee shall able doo great peece woorke euen dooth god vvee see howe conuenient iob shoulde set foorth vnto v patterne god shoulde plague vttermost intent compare selues euery one v may bee ashamed seeing able suffer affliction neuer light meane tender pitie see god sende v aduersitie wee neuer consider wherein spareth v minde vpon present griefe bee comforted taking holde god goodnesse holdeth v vp howe man sicke hee taketh suche inwarde conceyte hys disease hee thinketh vpon none thing neyther considereth matter thus god hath giuen many meanes ease mee withall succoured distresse men haue care mee serued tended one man hath wife child seruantes tende therefore see god doth punishe mee measure say hee hath remedy readinesse either hath store else shal releued vve neuer thinke vpon thing griefe doth possesse v sort still chawing bitte torment rack selues yea euen angry god villanous vnthankfulnesse inconuenience troubleth v wee must euer thinke selues ala good god pitie shall become endure griefe also farre greater haue deserued god finde meanes ynowe punish sayd hath rod layd vp cofers pleaseth bring foorth agaynst v must fayne feele maner strypes hande wee haue doone yet wee mynde thing certain middest greatest misery trouble haue worlde shall comforted feele assuagement oure greefes nothing behalfe insomuch lesson written vaine let v beare mynd person iob god giue v looking glasse wherein behold scourged must take aduersities sore hart nice saye haue worse let v take good heed prouoke god wrath wise many vnaduised person let v bethink selues thus surely aduersitie ouer burdensom bicause tender shoulde done god reache hand vnto question haue trouble alone hath store farre greater farre excessiue god knoweth measure keepe punishing please cast bottomlesse depthes shall caried euen hell therfore becommeth nowe haue eye goodnesse thanke hath pitied spared proofe hereof beholde iob man seemed bee throughly fensed vttermost yet see howe god hath afflicted onely one kinde diuers fashion weigh selfe balance good reason pacient shuld humble selfe vnder mightie hande god applie selfe hys good desyring gouerne mee dispose mee creature hande deale thus shall perceiue god euer present succour suche trust rest themselues vppon albeeit see wonderfull strength iob yet verily fraile man proofe howe could hee haue bin strengthned god lent hande strength god vttered iob abated daye hath god altred eyther purpose nature wee see god hath strengthned iob wee come promise belong one man alone men lo god sheweth bee dismayde feeblenesse owne fleshe hee hathe remedie flee refuge beaten hath wherwith strengthen v yea though wee otherwise altogither forsaken seeing god offereth v remedie suche wise whereby relieue feeblenesse let v doubt hath vphild seruant iob wil worke v also day meaning nothing else seale vp promise common al men giue v assurance experience person one man ende wee doubt good woorde therefore let v alledge excuse lo man vvas iob man abraham man dauid whereof came resisted temptation yes ayded god day hee chaunged since tyme minde ayde three foure vvhen sayd fortresse bulwarke stick needes ment iob abraham dauid ment whole church vnlesse wee charge god vntruth wee must boldely conclude like assisted iob also assist v wee bee destitute grace god holy spirite proceedeth owne naughtinesse cause regarde good turne readie v giueth v promise although preuent v seeking nothing vtter power mainteyning v yet notwithstanding shut gate agaynst well perceyue intent story written v wit haue sayd already might knowe howe god afflicteth withall vnderstand hee forgetteth succour neede according greatnesse necessitie remedie alwayes redy due season furthermore wee haue godly recorde affliction alwayes signes god hareth v haue beliefe impossible shoulde pacient aduersitie naught saint paule sayth ought haue comfort pacience man comfort himselfe god though hee shewe neuer great inuincible courage yet called pacience pacient ought pacience lumbard say prouerbe say pacience perforce oure mule chawing vpon hys bit true suche sort woulde faine make themselues constant woulde wise bowe say see wicked fortune thoughe wee must constant ye see pacience vnbeleeuers although bee renowmed worlde courageous stout fellowes yet ceasse lift vp themselues agaynst god finde fault bee short euery wyll needes cleare himselfe know say happened bee fortune agaynst god idle hath minde thing rather else man state suche meane suche manner men ceasse haue heart full venim god haue v pacient another manner wit hee haue v readye endure thinges assuring oure selues good euill proceede hande hee wyll haue v abyde chastizemente desyring nothing gouerned hym renouncyng oure owne affection thoughe seeme troublesome v hee wyll haue v fyghte agaynste oure owne wicked lustes resyste suche wyse hee alone maye continue oure maister possible haue pacientnesse franke free v wee take occasion comfort oure selues god howe wyll bee behoueth v bee well assured god scourgeth v hee purposeth oure destruction rather procureth oure welfare hym imagineth deemeth god bee bente agaynste hym hee fall intoo griefe anguishe mynde yea euen frenzie play sauage beast lift vp selfe agaynst god wee loue god wee persuade selues seeketh nothing vndoo v destroy v necessarie v fully resolued god punisheth v toke hateth v holdeth v enemy rather meane procureth saluation see sainct paule sayth victorie consisteth taking holde loue god iesus christ throughly persuaded god hath adopted v child haue principle shall dismayd affliction vvhy sith god loueth v shall neuer bee confounded little shall affliction hinder welfare shal turne furtherance god worke wise saluation shall aduanced meanes therof seeing iob beloued god one excellentest men euer worlde hath bin grieuously afflicted let v assure selues god suffer v abyde ouer hard painfull aduersities yet ceasseth hee keepe v still vnder protection loue v loue prouide v thing good profitable wee must come set downe wit god punished iob good also child marked well sometimes sheweth stout one kind temptation wil quayled example may man wyse despizeth goodes worlde hee haue bin verie riche afterward sore impouerished ye shall see shrink continue stil good quiet say well haue bin riche god chastize bereft al good substance god praysed man would thinke man constant shoulde seeme hee hath feeling aduersitie beholde great vertue yea hee bee assayled otherside happeneth newe temptation yee shall see encombred hee hath meanes comfort himselfe ynough v pacient agaynst one kynde aduersitie must withstand trouble wee see also lorde exerciseth v diuers maners thing bee marked aduisedly god hath sent v aduersitie wee suppose selues bee escaped wee thinke straunge see mischiefe come backe againe necke say verie harde imagination god hath good reason quicken v vp diuers temptation ende oure pacience maye shewe selfe haue sayde heretofore nowe man goodes bee deare much precious must child needes bee see also lordes last tydings though iob beene set vppon racke vvhen man layde vpon racke tormentes continually incresed vntil come vttermost satan vsed like policie wyth iob hee caused woorde brought beholde thine ox thy shee ass takeen awaye sabeans robber come haue slaine thy seruants hee fyrst put corde vvell wee see man layde vppon racke vvhen one came tolde beholde fire falne downe heauen hathe consumed thy cattell man shuld haue hanged great weight feete encrease paine put griefe see extremitie came ende one brought word death child let v learne wee haue scaped one aduersitie thought ouer heauie ouerhard suffer god able send v another shall farre exceede wente afore sathan preaceth vppon v one syde god gyueth leaue doo end aforesayde passe tryall intent god might glorifyed v might haue much greater cause yeeld thankes shal haue deliuered v assaultes suche enemie mightie satan sometymes also doth hardnesse sake vvhen seeth dull vpon spurre ouerslowe restie hee must needes pricke v much roughly according commonly say rough horse must haue rough ryder haue wee nothing example iob marke haue touched alreadie also whiche haue spoken afore namely iobs temptation diuers respect robber caryed away goodes cattell lightning heauen burnt vp greate part greate tempest wynde ouerthrowen house hys child slayne vnder although enemy come caryed away cattel end broken house vpon child bin hard strange matter sayd lightning fel heauen mightie boystous wind killed childre cace iob prouoked say thing men agaynst mee god hath made himselfe mine enemie whence commeth lightning ayre whence come hideous windes sayd windes god messenger execute commaundements though heraulds sayd fire heauen signe presence iob therfore might haue concluded thus see god warreth one side men neyther heauen earth agaynst mee ala whither may goe herevpon hee might haue bin altogither plunged dispayre vvee see temptation diuers much troubled experience also sheweth euery man may feele selfe tormented one sort yea though bee euen vttermoste yet doo wee still conceyue hope one man persecuteth v one syde ryseth vp agaynst v another syde nuber enemy encreaseth layd side seemeth god v lo ger holde quite quayle say like poore soules past hope nowe see befell vnto iob let v marke well may take profit assuring selues god wyll also throughly trye say constancie diuers temptation vvhen men trouble v doo v harme seemeth v god doth v wrong hee auenge v incontinently woulde haue euen heauen bend selfe agaynst enimies reuenge iniurie haue done v consider whit howe god tryeth v wise hee knoweth profitable expedient v better selues waye manne might demaunde heere howe happened fyre came downe heauen burne vp iobs cattell diuell hath lightning tempest power wee graunt soueraintie haue dominion ayre rayse whirlewynds tempest pleasure answere herevnto easie howbeit matter shall handled fully next sermon neuerthelater let v mark although windes god heraulds execute lightning haue like nature yet diuell woorketh god vseth seruice hath bin declared heretofore let v think strange god giue diuell libertie able rayse vp lightning whirlewindes tempestes hee able doo often much hee himselfe listeth god serueth owne turne pleaseth himselfe thus yee see question assoyled yee neede maruell diuell hath raysed vp suche tempest rage foule weather beate downe house hee hath styrred vp lightning heauen witte farre foorth god permitted specially seeing god directed exercise fayth pacience seruaunt heerewithall syde wee haue also marke iobs pacience muche vertuous commendable hee fell suche heighte hee seemed bee well fensed yet notwithstanding ceassed blisse god euen hee vtterly forlorne saye woorthie singular commendation wee knowe suche prosperitie forgette themselues saye onely worldling suche thinke vpon god also faythfull whiche haue walked feare god theyr life long yea euen keepe still mynde ouerseene haue thing forget themselues knowe themselues lette v marke happened ezechias although hee wholly gyuen serue god doo owne duetie yet notwithstanding hee sawe himselfe aduaunced aboue ordinarie hee sent prophete esaye medled seeking councell god hande thing owne fansie magnifyed himselfe soo muche hee prouoked god displeasure turning hande shewing ryches vaingloriously muche hande god fayne fall verye roughlye vpon bycause follye ouerweening wherewith hee caryed awaye hee dauid meeneth sayeth sayde abundance prosperitie shall neuer bee remoued dauid knewe well howe hee bin aduaunced god hee neuer darkened grace rather minde mighte bee remembraunce worldes ende god drawne vp dung cattell settled state kingdome hee magnifyed shuld spoken death vaunted nobilitie chalenged nothing himselfe yet god stablished kingdom saw himselfe rest hee began aduaunce himselfe sayde hee brought thing point hee shoulde neuer bee remoued dauid sheweth bee bee ease namely bee sotted sayde folly seemeth vnto v god neuer change estate pleasure iolities lo haue marke namely wonderfull stregth mind iob considering resisteth said temptation sodein great one temptatio many came vpon altogither one blow yet see hee outstoode little afore bin prosperitie might seeme men fauoured hym man dydde magnifye hym bee short satan himselfe sayeth shoulde seeme god hilde lappe hee thy hande sayeth satan thou preseruest suche wise seeme thou makest cockney herewithall wee seehowe hee handled turning hande thing might haue bin verye hard matter hym much warned ceasse looke well selues god sendeth v prosperitie certain iob oftentymes bin waked trumpet saye estate hee bin vtterly confounded soone god afflicted vvherefore let v take heed walk feare trembling chiefly wee see god sendeth v wordly prosperitie tyme diuell watcheth narrowliest surprize v cast temptation v neuer thought thus yee see wee haue marke vpon sentence sayd time iob well settled seemed many bulwarkes euill could touche one momente lighnings heauen whirlewynde ayre enimies stripped al brought vtter extremitie sauing person god reserued still greeuous temptation residue let v returne sentence haue touched alreadie wit know rage satan agaynst faythfull vvee haue seene heretofore god holdeth shorte saying thou shalt touche person iob herewithall wee see furiousnesse hee hath proceeded let v consider meanes hath torment v looke many infirmity haue looke howe many kindes aduersityes world looke many ouerthwart thing v many sharp dartes satan hath euer readinesse agaynst v many woundes deadly strypes able giue v god prouide otherwise seeing diuell hath continually suche weapon side altogither naked pray shoulde become v god remedie much therfore haue cause render thanks god seeing perceyue sathan doo hee giueth leaue doe therewithall haue neede also call vpon god continually say ala lord vnder thy protection shall become v vve bee sure thou chastizest v time therwithall thou shewest v thy fatherly goodnesse thou sufferest v vtterly rooted cosidering outrageousnesse enemie haue doo shuldest thou giue brydle agaynst v must needes deuoured sodeynly euen one poore sillie sheepe among hundred thousand woolues vve see ought kepe good warde watch stande vpon guarde pray vntoo god suffer v left vp pray vnto satan satan durst hardie offer battell sauior world according see lord iesus christ assailed wee may sure hardie runne vppon v therfore let v take armour god hath giuen v resist withall worde whervnto saint paule sendeth v meaneth arme v thoroughly agaynst temptation worlde diuell let v receyue god giueth v wee negligent helpe selues meanes putteth hand may succour selues neede thus wee see wee haue summe remember concerning lesson wee take profite shewed v example iob wayting till residue set large let v fall downe face god acknowledgement offence praying make v vnderstand better yea eue wise afflicteth v wee may assure selues sinnes offence therewithall knowe mortifie v worldward drawe v continually making v passe affliction must much sweete amiable vnto v whe see ted welfare furthermore wil giue v grace mortified may desire nothing bee subiect suche wise obeysaunce may neuer swarue perseuer eue vntil haue drawne v eternall rest may please giue thys grace vnto v also people nation c seuenth sermon vpon first chapter iob rose vp rent clothes shore head cast himselfe grounde vvorshipped sayd naked came mother vvombe naked shall returne againe lord hath giuen lord hath taken avvay blissed name lorde iob sinned ne charged god vvith vnreasonablenesse wee well saye pacience great vertue deede yet verye fewe knowe worde pacience meaneth whereby man maye iudge wee bee verie hastie pacient haue vertue esteme much god perceyuing carelesnesse mindeth set eies thing need full v pacient fayth must needes vanishe away able mainteyne hir selfe without forasmuch god middes misery worlde wee shoulde alwayes haue quiet heart bee well assured goodnesse may make v mery contented may boast selues agaynst satan enimies possible looked higher worlde ne considered although estate miserable opinion flesh yet ought contented seing god loueth v present text excellent holy scripture shewe v woorde pacience importeth behoueth v bee taught wee haue god acknowledge v paciente oure affliction vve commonly say man pacient although hee haue poynt true pacience whosoeuer suffereth aduersitie doo men call pacient way let v holde rule pacient behoueth v moderate sorrow aduersitie must bee assuaged considering god ceasseth procure welfare continually ought subiect vntoo good reason gouerne v according good pleasure lo wherin pacience sheweth selfe nothing better behouefull looke vpon glasse sette v vvee haue seene iob might haue bin ouerwhelmed report manye euill tydings sayd rose vp rent clothes polled heade caste himselfe vpon grounde humble himselfe afore god wee see first pacient sure griefe feele great sorrowe anguish hart block wood stone vertue v man worthy praysed hath feeling aduersitie vvee see sometimes poore madman laugh scorne whole worlde yea euen deathes doore bicause hath feeling miserie therefore deserueth taken esteemed vertue rather blockishnesse brute beast haue sometime feeling yet pacient let v marke worde pacient pacientnesse betokeneth shoulde become blockishe haue heauinesse combered griefe feele aduersities vertue moderate themselues holde suche measure cease glorifie god middest theyr miseryes bee ouercombred swallowed vp sorrowe anguishe quaile altogither fight owne passion vntill maye bee able frame themselues good god conclude iob doth finally say righteous respect let v see wee haue marke saide iob rent garmente shore hys head fashion customable east country according knowe mo ceremony countryes colde country dwell happened thing might moue men great trouble rent theyr garment token sorrowe marke speciall poynt lykewise countrey men wont weare long head polled themselues mourned like contrary part men vse poll heades let heare growe make sorrowe therefore iobs rending hys garment polling heade token heauinesse conceyueth certaine vpon hypocrisie oftentimes meane counterfeit disguise themselues ende men thinke bee great heauinesse ceasse laugh heart iob vsed hypocrisie let v assure selues tare garment shore heade full extreme anguish sorrowe hee cast himselfe grounde another lyke recorde thereof seemeth iob gaue brydle heauinesse fault condemned know men wont excessiue inordinate passion though restreine represse theselues much yet ceasse passe measure nothing hard moderate man selfe wise wee may keepe rule compasse see men cannot make mery excepte ouer mery sorrowe heauinesse passion yet farre headdie carying men awaye wyth farre greater force gladnesse doth therefore haue cause stande vpon guard oftentimes long god shall sende v aduersitie thing wherein wont ouershoote selues sayde iob rent garment seemeth hee ment pricke himselfe forwarde bee sorrowfull man beholdeth himselfe defaced astonished himselfe afterward whe came eare man might saye hee soughte helpes sharpen increace griefe much strike spurres owne side haue sayde may seeme woorthie condemned first must vnderstand scripture purposeth expresse sorrowe holy man great vehement able staye himselfe vsing ordinarie fashion yea euen tearing hys garment shew felt anguishe wounded euen bottome hys hart scripture ment expresse way although men ought stande vpon guarde swallowed vp sorrowe bee afflicted yet notwithstanding god sendeth v aduersitie meete shoulde thinke vpon common fashion putting awaye griefe starke naught yet wee see howe men haue falne insomuch haue ment haue pacience haue quenched consideration theyr missehaps thrust farre chased quite away short haue labored brutish might know discerne thing cleane contrarywise god scourgeth v giue v blowes head beetle ende wee shoulde astonished cast swound mind induce v thinke vpon misery besides ought call sinnes remembrance craue pardon bee much warer afterwarde walke becommeth v instructed also life ende haue ouerliking puffed vp vanitie presumption rather acknowledge bond stand bound god vsing v gently cary v lappe finally forasmuch see hath care life wee shoulde looke great way afore v say keepe way still euerlasting kingdom wher true ioy rest vve see god ceasseth bee mercifull vnto v sendeth affliction vnto v doth ende trying v also might knowe estate moreouer good profitable faythfull god afflicteth shoulde enforce themselues thinke wherefore thus afflicted say meete think vpon thing see iob could rend hys garment sheare head without offending god intended thereby cast himselfe ouergreat heauinesse doings tended humilitie like also signe repentance among men olde tyme god sent plague warre among clothed themselues sackcloth cast dust vpon heades vvhy feede euill sorrowe whereof saint paule speaketh saith manner worlde must eschue fault another sorrowe whiche affirmeth godly men acknowledging themselues wretched sinner doe come iudge condemne themselues shewe worthy cofounded clotheth himselfe sackcloth casteth dust vpon heade witnesseth hath thing wherof glory must holde mouth shut cace already buried faine say worthy go vpon earth meete earth vpon god cast lowe might trampled vpon men feete thus ye see howe iob behaued himselfe vvhen hee sawe god called lowlinesse contented frame himselfe hys good cause rent clothes shore head hereby perceyue haue touched alredie pacience without griefe therfore behoueth god child bee sad feele theyr owne sorowes yet ceasse haue vertue pacientnesse resist owne passion wise conceyue hartburning agaynst god passe measure sorrowing kicke agaynst spurre rather giue glorie vnto god followeth immediately texte iob cast himselfe vnto earth worship god true woorde whiche sette heere signifyeth incline bowe downe man selfe meaning humble god reuerence vvee see many cast themselues ground al ceasse rage wyse possible would mount aboue cloudes giue battell vnto god see also caryed away rage bicause cannot rushe god would co trariwise iob cast himselfe earth purpose worship god hauing speciall eye vnto humble high maiestie feele god hand intent reuerence haue done afore surely god handle v gently ought moue v come according allureth v vvherfore vseth great goodnesse purpose draw v vnto forasmuch wee bee loth come faine summon v shew authoritie hath ouer v like whe prince seeth subiect slow dutie sendeth officer summon also god perceiuing passe comming vnto rather come willing earnest affection requisite prouoketh v summoneth v iob therfore knowing ende true vse affliction cast ground purpose reuerence vnto god say lord true haue serued honored thee heretofore tyme haue flourished bene chiefest tryumph haue pleasure thee seruice haue knowne myselfe inough see frailtie v wretched creature therefore lord come nowe mine homage newe againe thee seeing pleaseth thee afflicte mee world lord willingly yeld selfe vnto thee desire nothing put self subiect thy hand howsoeuer world go thus much concerning saying iob cast himselfe ground purpose worship god nowe let v come whiche saide wit iob acknowledged men naked came mother wombe naked sayth shall returne againe vvhereas hee nameth mother wombe hee meaneth another thing witte wombe earth mother thing else man pinched heart hee vttereth word full cutteth halfe according see extremitie sorrow expresse wordes full neuerthelesse protestation cleere inough wit iob ment say thus well must faine return earth euen plyght came oute mother wombe true man maye take saying two way first generall sentence behold men come naked world passe come point againe brought ryches theyr honoure theyr pompe pleasure must fain go away rottennesse earth must receiue exposition agreeable namely iob applyed sayde sentence hys owne person say came naked mother womb hath bin god pleasure enrich tyme haue great heards cattell great houshold goodly sort chyldren short gloriously decked benefit blessing god bestowed vpon wil shal go hence starke naked hath enriched al thinges taketh away intent returne fyrst state dispose selfe creepe foorthwith graue sentence well worthy bee marked iob coulde make better proofe pacience determining bee starke naked syth god good pleasure hee shoulde bee true men haue fayre excuse force nature spyte teethe muste bee fayne returne naked theyr graues euen paynim haue sayde thing deathe whiche sheweth howe small thyng man vvhy wee haue gulfe couetousnesse v wee coulde finde heartes swallowe vppe whole earth man haue plentie ryches vyneyardes meddowes possession suffyseth god muste bee fayne create newe worldes v hee mynde satisfye v yet bee wee deade wee muste haue ground oure owne lengthe wherein rotte consume awaye nothing death sheweth wee bee oure nature yet neuerthelesse yee shall see many striue necessitie make gorgeous tombes haue triumphant funeral seeme suche men coulde finde heartes resist god attayne theyr purpose truely suche generall state man v becommeth v suffer paciently losse goodes ryches euer wee bee berefte say becommeth v suffer god strippe v euen oure bare naked skynne prepare oure selues returne oure graue state beholde saye wherein wee maye proue oure selues bee pacient iob ment sentence also ofte long wee wante goodes worlde indure hunger colde bee nipped anye aduersitie haue reliefe let v thinke v oure byrthe let v consyder selues bothe wee bee whence wee come men abuse fatherly care god hathe prouiding thinges whiche haue neede true ought haue lesson wel imprinted oure hearte namely god wyll haue v wante anye thing hathe put v worlde wythout mynding nourishe v yet muste wee alwayes acknowledge commeth elsewhere selues may thinke wee haue thinges owne right wee holde free goodnesse god man fynde mee owne free coste say vnto mee come dayly mee thou shalte haue thus muche wyne thus much breade intertaine thee beit bynde selfe thee gyue thee freely woulde herevpon holde plea bynde whose hande ought begge euery daye whose hande receyue substaunce make rente whiche hee gyueth mee hys free lyberalitie shoulde bee verye heynous vnthankefulnesse shoulde deserue spitted face therefore muche wee bounde receyue god benefites modestie assuring selues oweth v thing much wee bee poore becommeth v repayre vnto begge endlesse liberalitie euery day soeuer wee bee driuen necessitie lette v haue recourse backe haue sayde examine whence came euen mother wombe starke naked poore wretched creature able helpe selfe ridde mee pouertie wherein must needes haue perished altogither ben succoured others pleased god foster mee intertayne mee euen houre gyue mee gracious benefites without number therfore please scourge good reason beare paciently seeing commeth hande thus yee see wee haue marke vppon whyche iob sheweth v saying naked came mother wombe naked shall returne agayne graue fynally god gyueth goodes intoo handes wee imagine wee shall possesse long tyme ownership shall contynue v wee shall accompanyed wyth oure ryches shall goe v oure graue shall neuer departe v lette v make suche accompte deceyue oure selues contrarywyse lette v assure oure selues bee god good pleasure take away goodes hee hath lente v whither bee nighte morrowe wee muste bee readye forgoe hee dothe v wrong bereaue v one minute houre wee coulde get oure whole lyfe concerning resydue iob leadeth v yet saying god gyuen god taken awaye name lorde blissed therefore vvhen hee sayeth god gyuen hee sheweth howe good reason god shoulde haue disposing thinges hee hathe put intoo oure handes seeing bee god sendeth v ryches hee releaseth owne right hee haue soueraintie hee ought haue maker world worde maker importeth hee hath made thing suche sorte meete power souerain dominion remain vnto self albeit men possesse portion according portion good hath giuen world yet meete stil continue lord maister iob therefore knowing submitted himselfe wholly god good thing v confesse rightful notwithstanding meane whyle man willing frame himselfe thereafter proofe heereof god giue v leaue ioy two three dayes benefite wee thinke hee doth v great wrong hee take v againe wee grudge agaynste dooing meaneth vnthankfulnesse spake euen nowe namely god hathe shewed himselfe lyberall v owne free goodnesse wee opynion hee ought neuer fayle v euer wee doe lo sentence common ynoughe talke howbeeit yll practised man may well see vnderstoode fewe much behoueth v consider meant thys saying lorde hathe gyuen lorde hathe taken awaye wee may know maner authoritie lord hath giue v enioying benefit also take away v euery minute houre pleasure heere see sainct paule exhorteth v forasmuch shape world passeth away thing therin glide vanishe awaye wee shoulde possesse wee possessed saye haue mynds tied saide another place must settle selues vpon vncertaintie ryches god shall haue bereft v gaue v wee must always ready say iob well thou lord hast vsed thyne owne right thou hast gyuen thou hast taken away thy pleasure thus yee see effecte streine namely often whensoeuer wee thinke vpon goodes worlde wee must alwayes beare mynd hold god vpon condition feesimple pretend title bee maister vpon condition please put intoo oure handes hee may also plucke v hee thinkes good let v vnderstand wee much bound causeth v enioy benefite daye moneth space time must thinke strange bereaue v afterward haue recourse said knowledge haue spoken namely god dothe euermore holde superioritie ouer v hee may dispose hys owne hee lysteth hymselfe bee lawfull mortall menne dispose goodes liste themselues ought wee graunt much lyuing god seeing god ought haue maistership onely ouer thinges wee possesse also ouer oure owne person ouer chyldren let v humble oure selues afore submit oure selues wholly holy without gainsaying yea verye fewe yeelde muche honor vnto god true men easily saye god hath gyuen possesse chalendge selues vaunte selues spyte praye anye better flatte mockerie yea verelye grosse hypocrisie wee haue protested hold thing god yet notwithstanding wee meane nothing lesse hee shoulde haue disposition hee shoulde chaunge anye thing wee woulde haue let v alone set v free libertie separated exempted iurisdiction muche manne say well contented acknowledge suche one prince wil doe mine homage alegeance vnto howbeit enter house hee come demaunde anye thing hande hee trouble mee worlde coulde beare vilanie yet neuerthelesse see howe men dallye god wee meane confession wee holde meane whyle abyde hee shoulde touch thyng vvee see worlde doth openly playe mockholyday god yet becommeth v alwayes follow shewed v wit forasmuche god hath gyuen v possesse may call backe againe withdraw v yet added byandby namely name god shoulde blissed importeth heerein iob submitteth hym selfe suche wyse vntoo god hee confesseth bee good iuste notwithstanding scourged roughly hande haue sayde importeth bycause euery man may graunt power soueraintie vnto god may say well seeing hath gyuen hee may also take meane whyle hee acknowledge god dealeth iustly good reason ther many bee scourged doe blame god crueltie ouergreat roughnesse reserue vnto right withdrawe thing hee hath giuen consider haue sayde afore possesse goodes condition maye stripped day morrowe fewe haue consideration rest quietly vpon confesse nothing better submit thing god maiestie acknowledge let v follow owne sway way v confusion hee gouerne v according bee profit welfare lo wherevnto behoueth v come also see muche imported sentence sayde blissed bee name lorde wee must onely picke word also consider mynde proceede spoken truly vnfaynedly howe possible wee shoulde blisse name god wee doe first acknowledge rightuous hee grudgeth god though cruell vnkynd cursseth god bicause much lyeth hee lifteth himselfe vp acknowledgeth god bee father himselfe god chyld ne yeldeth recorde goodnesse blisseth god tast mercie grace god sheweth men afflicteth must needes grynd teeth cast vp vomit oute poyson therefore blisse lordes name importeth much persuade selues iust rightfull owne nature also good mercyfull lo howe may blisse god name example iob acknowledging iustice vprightnesse moreouer also grace fatherly goodnesse towards v see also text addeth conclusion al thing iob sinned charged god anye vnreasonablenesse vvorde worde thus iob dyd laye afore god put vpon god vnreasonable thing maner speaking well worthie bee marked vvhereof commeth men martyr selues suche wyse god sendeth thing cleane contrarie theyr desire knowe god doth reason hath iust cause well printed heart thing god dothe grounded vpon good reason certaine woulde ashamed encounter doe considering saye knowe hath iust occasion dispose thing wise see nowe purposely sayde iob imputed vnreasonable dealing vnto god saye imagined god doe thing iust vpright marke speciall poynt behoueth v marke wordes vnto god verye muche implyed consider horrible matter talke god workes suche sorte wee doe god sende v euer wee wyshe wee fall reasonyng wyth hym wee holde plea wyth hym wee seeme doe deede selfe sheweth neuertherlesse vvee haue eye euerye blowe saying howe commes passe mynde spoken euen venemous heart man saye matter shoulde haue gone otherwyse see reason meane whyle god condemned among v beholde howe menne rushe without theyr boundes one shoulde accuse god bee either nt brainlesse person seeketh nothing bring confusion lo horrible blasphemie followeth euery blast men mouth yet consider yet great mater hath pleased holy ghost teach v mynd giue glorie vnto god blisse name becommeth v muste fully persuaded god doeth anye thing without reason let v charge nother crueltie ignoraunce though hee thing spyte randon let v acknowledge poynts respect procedeth wonderfull iustice exceeding great goodnesse infinite wisedome nothing vpryghtnesse equitie doings true remayneth one point debate wit howe iob acknowledged god bee taker awaye thing spoyled theeues whiche seemeth strange thing vnto v much time serue declare nowe wee reserue till morrow shall suffice shew wee bee afflicted wee muste thinke happeneth withoute reason rather god hath iust cause therefore wee troubled greeued must haue recourse vnto praye graunt v grace know nothing befalleth v worlde ordinance yea assured disposeth thing wise turne continually welfare wee haue maner knowledge make v beare paciently affliction hee sendeth vpon v also serue humble v hath made v tast fatherly goodnesse shall desire nothing gloryfye meanes well aduersitie prosperitie let v fall downe presence good god acknowledgement fault praying hym brydle v may ouershoote oure selues vayne imagination rather knowing benefit welfare lyeth may come seeke resting oure selues wholly vpon mercie hath made v tast wee may fully persuaded loue whiche beareth v although hee cause v walke many trouble aduersities worlde yet wee maye neuer ceasse cleaue faste hym continually walke feare obedience vntoo hym vntill hee haue rid v mortall bodye oute imprysonment bondage sinne wherein wee bee gather v vp intoo heauenly glory shal haue let maye reioyce god partaker glory goodes graunt grace onely v also c eight sermon first vpon second chapter sermon contayneth ende former chapter lord hath giuen lord hath taken away c also followeth second chapter befell day child god presented themselues lord among came satan also present himselfe lord lorde sayde satan vvhence commest thou satan aunsvvered lorde sayde going vvalking vpon earth lorde sayde satan haste thou taken heede seruaunt iob vvho hathe matche vpon earth sounde vpright man fearing god vvithdravving himselfe euill vvhich keepeth still soundnesse hast thou sought mee ende haue destroyed vvithout cause satan ansvvered lord man vvill giue skin skin al hath saue life novve lay thy hande vpon punishe fleshe thou shalte see hee vvill cursse thee thy face lord sayde satan beholde thy hande spare soule haue declared heretofore howe diuell beeing god mortall enemie hee deede fayne yeelde obedience maker whome subiect doth willingly force muche although diuell sore inraged anoy destroye whole world yet notwithstanding whatsoeuer attempteth whatsoeuer deuise practise able bring nothing passe without god like satan hild awe also wicked men world true passe bound far bear themselues hand withstand god wanteth good yet meane god accomplisheth tooles wherwith worketh serueth purpose poynt well vttered v confession iob maketh saith god giuen good possessed also taken away certain satan doer al raysing horrible tepest spoyling iob substance killing child vvherfore imputeth thing vnto god specially seeing wee haue seene heeretofore theeues robber spoyled hys goodes meete god bee vttered authour theeuing robberie seeme ment wrap sinnes men cannot excuse came inuade good cattell iob vve see theeues may condemne yet notwithstanding iob sayeth satan hath wholly spoyled mee bee theeues haue robbed sayth god hath done doth iob blaspheme god saying god alloweth saying haue seene alreadie charged god vnreasonable dealing hath confessed god rightuous full equitie hath gloryfyed meete yet neuerthelesse saith flatly god dooer thing whiche theeues dyd dyuell doer nowe wee see heere howe god euermore soueraine degree guiding disposing thing belowe leade suche ende hee thinketh good heere matter v iudge owne vnderstanding ouerweening person doe needes wyse making god whole worlde subiect owne fansie beastes yea beetleheaded beastes bee haue neither knowledge wit yet purchase selues estimation saye see reason god doer thing authour sin controll holy ghost speaking must need yeld man hath debated matter throughly fro hee must needes come sayde conclusion namely comprehende greatnesse heigth god dooings pleaseth gyue v tast leastwyse according oure capacitie whiche ouersmall none knoweth god workes himselfe alone bottomelesse depe scripture saith haue mean attain muche search shalbe confounded except goe reuerence lowlynesse therefore belongeth onely vnto god giue v knowledge howe wherfore doth therewithal behoueth v content selues scripture telleth v although seeme straunge vnto v able comprehende oure capacitie reason yet must confesse god ryghtuous forasmuch wee attaine let v tary comming latter daye time shall knowe parcelmeale dimnesse sainct paule sayth wee shall behold thing face face shewed v glasse thus wee see excellente texte shewe v howe god guydeth gouerneth whole worlde hys prouidence wee haue note purpose holye ghoste telleth v god dothe nothing come passe without consent ende wee myght despise sathan wicked menne wee see practyze inuente neuer manye thinges bycause wee sure able bring theyr enterpryses see howe god meaneth assure v protection shewe v howe sathan farre beeing mayster himselfe accomplishe thing hee would hee fayne serue god tourne seeing case standeth lette v apply holie scripture suche vse namely althoughe wee bee hemmed enemy rounde heere sheepe woules throate yet notwithstanding must ceasse trust god warrant oure selues long vnder shadow wing shall sure saluation howe bycause hee hath soueraine dominion ouer al creature sort holdeth euen satan himselfe wicked person world awe leadeth thing issue thinketh good lo whervpon ought stay maye call vpon god quietly wee haue called vpon assure selues hee guyde v heerewithall behoueth v beare mynd haue touched wit become iudges god ouergreat presumption vvere diuelish pryde men shoulde acknowledge god rightuous except could perceiue would haue god humble abase himselfe muche u say wel see must accomptable aduaunce themselues pryde al well worthy quite ouerwhelmed god yes certesse also wee see salomon sayth whiche ouerinquisitiue searching god maiestie farre requisite shall ouerwhelmed owne pryde shall bee confounded remayneth nothing v haue sayde sobrietie praying vnto god teach v much benefite behoofe receiue whatsoeuer saith good rightful pleading contrarie thus ye see howe ought proceede many men thinke themselues haue gained muche haue founde trifling cauillation vpholde god doth thinges doone sathan wicked men commonly alledged answere wicked folke doe anye euill god worketh onely suffereth simply giueth leaue seeing hee hath authoritie power let suffering permission one hee himselfe therfore fonde excuse god hath neede oure leasings maintayne truth ryghtuousnesse wythall vvee must finde startingholes stoppe wicked folkes mouthes withall woulde speake blasphemie god holinesse inough haue whiche holie scripture telleth v god onely permitteth giueth leaue also executeth diuell wicked person appeareth scripture sayth lorde thou haste permitted lorde thou haste doone like dauid confesseth sinnes offence god punished grieuously sayth lord whome shall complayne see thy hande although dauid persecuted wicked men yet called hande god beholde howe lorde speaketh vvill wee bee wiser hee shall make beleeue neede gaye coloures warrante man may offer reproch see speaketh owne woorkes vvhen mynded punishe dauid rauishing bethsabee hee sayde vnto thou hast doone thing priuilye make sunne beare witnesse howe vvhat god would vnto dauid absolom rauish father wiues defile presence people sight sunne ye see inceste horrible nature yet neuerthelesse god saith flatly word vve see single leaue permission god himselfe worketh wise wicked must needes bee instrumentes wee haue sayd pray touching office iudge giue hangman leaue list vvhen iudge muste set vpon offender giue sentence according law conscience beare hee say hangma giue thee leaue go thou wilt man contrarywise hee peonounceth sentence afterwarde according putteth offender intoo hangmannes handes doe execution vpon beholde god soueraine iudge worlde doe wee dishonour hym saying hee doth giue sathan leaue doe li teth much mocke god iustice peruert order yes doubt let v marke wicked runne ryot seeke nothing else put al confusion god neuerthelesse aboue guyding gouerning thinges suche sorte nothing commeth passe without prouidence otherwyse hee hath disposed see expressely sayde god wageth whiche caryed awaye owne ambition couetousnesse make warres cause trouble worlde hee entertayneth seruice hee termeth seruauntes seruaunt nabuchodonozor sayeth hee maner one nabuchodonozor firste formoste hee idolater secondly wicked caytife desired nothing sheade mannes bloud turmoyle whole worlde muche hym laye neyther equitie vprightnesse hym yet notwithstanding god auoucheth bee seruant wyse hee muste onely permitte giue leaue beastlynesse talke ass coulde speake woulde behaue themselues reasonably pretend themselues bee wyse sort nowe wee see howe god executeth commaundementes ordinance yea erewithall lette v beare mynde euyll anye meanes bee fathered vppon hym sathan muste beare blame styll owne naughtynesse menne reproued condemned theyr owne conscience whiche shall bee theyr iudge god shall bee gloryfyed hee doth howe vvee knowe thinges oughte bee esteemed according intente ende men ame let v nowe consider sort god guydeth gouerneth thinges doone heere beneath true wee haue seene alreadye sathans desyre nothyng else destroye bryng thynges ruyne god syde intendeth cleane contrarie ende woorkes called iudgementes saying holie scripture one woorde alone meaneth take awaye lewde imagination myghte come oure myndes marke iustifye woorkes god wit iudgementes rightfulnesse proofe hereof god punisheth haue offended hee able pleade hee doth well moreouer meaning inure faythfull one pacience mortifye fleshly affection teache lowlinesse vvhat say wee thinges wee condemne certayne take euen wickeddest men liue demaund whither bee lawfull god chastize mennes sinnes transgression whither belong vnto humble exercyse obedientnesse fayth tame end may lerne renownce world shalbee fayne glorifye god spyte teethe seing god leueleth marke foloweth work iust ryghtfull notwithstanding men cauill true wicked cease grunte barke god though cannot byte yet muste nedes come passe dauid sayeth one fyftith psalme wit god shall bee iustifyed founde rightuouse iudging without cause dauid speaketh hee knewe howe ouergreat boldnesse naughtinesse men desyre nothing lift vp themselues againste god caste foorth woordes aduenture dauid therefore perceyuing malapertnesse frowardnesse worlde sayeth verye well true creature passe boundes far excesse god muste needes bee blasphemed put reproche creature become iudges yet shall found cleere vvhen men haue grudged fill ende knitting vppe rightuousnesse appeare spight teeth let v maruel though murmuring doctrine must needes holy ghost hath prophecied beforehand see let v walke singlenesse mynde hold selues cotented god declareth v concerning thus see ought practise sayde lesson therwithall let v hold fast comfort giuen v let v fence oure selues wit sathan wicked folke worlde may lifte vp themselues v yet must passe vnder hand god execute shall bee perforce spyte teethe yet shall bycause god hath soueraine preeminence ouer world well diuel wicked sort subiecte nothing without consent see sayd againe sathan appeared among child god hym haue declared heeretofore sathan ment disguyze himselfe thorough hypocrisie hee myghte intermeddle himselfe among angel hee fayne appeare god yeelde accompt doings thing one place certayne scripture speaketh applye selfe oure rudenesse bycause wee conceiue howe thinges presente afore god hee suche power preeminence nothing hidde vvhen vttered vnto v must acknowledge scripture applyeth selfe oure reason teacheth v meane conuenient v moste agreeable vnderstanding god therefore lykened heere prince holdeth assyses court whervnto men muste come bee iudged thus yee see sayde vpon certayne daye dyuell made hys apparance angelles lette v marke lyke god sendeth angel guyde v minister welfare bee handes instrumentes power maynteine v also contrarie part sendeth diuell vexe torment v knoweth ende hee doth true first may well bee astonished see cause god doth whereby shall faith approued tryed glorifying god whereas wit end yet neuerthelesse conclude euer proceedeth god rightfull iust nothing stedfastnesse wayes thus mynded howe shall fayth allowed surely presente storie goodly instruction v behalfe vnlesse wee consider wherefore god intended persecute seruant iob seeme v haue good cause complayne god punishe wicked folke well done yea gaynesay man walke vprightnesse simplicitie dothe god delyuer sathans hande man saye hee dothe permitte suffer onely sathan hys owne libertie consydering howe outrageous hee wee also lefte vppe praye shoulde wee necessitie bee ouerwhelmed first pushe contrarywyse wee see howe god purpose haue pacience seruaunt made knowne althoughe hee haue reason whiche hidde v tyme yea euen oure lyfe long yet muste wee holde oure selues short confesse doth good yea though wee perceyue ende hee doeth albeit wee see neyther dyuels v yet angel yet must assure selues god sendeth one verily maintayne v one syde trouble v standeth v alwayes hande knowe god hath iust cause chastize v hee ouerwhelme v hundred tymes daye well worthie yet haue sayde alreadie god hath alwayes respecte vnto hee afflicteth v nowe satan torment v intente wee might obtayne victorie agaynste victorie shoulde bee much honourable assayling v hath ben terrible also meaning exercise v practise intente wee maye stande awe take occasion aduaunce oure selues ouersleepe oure selues vayne selftrust presumption haue bene wont doe god wakeneth v wyse wee perceiue vphyld hym woulde bee sorowe specially wee relieued muche woulde bee chaunce fall stumble downe euery blowe therefore requisite god put hande vnder v else falles woulde bee deadly therefore god wee feele aboue wee must vnderstande angel haue speciall care v guide v according god hath appoynted bee minister welfare committed v keeping hereby wee see called power principality meane whyle diuelles ceasse turmoyle destroye thinges neare thing happeneth without god howbeit done ende wee bee wakened inured temptation tryall ende wee may haue muche greater excellenter victorie wee haue fought valiantly fynally ende sathan may gayne nothing oure hande muche wee bee garded strengthe aboue withstande temptation lo haue briefly beare mynde concerning sentence much hath bin expounded already hereto fore stande vpon briefly put remembraunce hath bene touched god demaundeth satan whence came satan telleth hath royled ouer whole worlde hath made vagary outleapes rounde touching iob asketh haste thou taken heede seruant iob heerein scripture yet agayne applyeth selfe oure rawnesse god hath neede aske satan thing haue sayde presente wyth howbeit forasmuche vnderstande oure behoofe haue suche maner speech wee better acquaynted god shoulde shewe himselfe suche one hee owne infinite wee bee swalowed vp may conceiue may beare heerein wee see great goodnesse towardes v whereas wee bee able come vp vnto hee commeth downe vnto v ende wee mighte knowe leaste wyse farre foorthe oure profyte wee shoulde presume enter intoo greate maiestie wee shoulde bee ouerwhelmed wee bee able looke vppon sunne oure eye shall dazeled praye howe shall beholde glorye god full perfectenesse impossible v doe tyll wee bee made newe againe according sainct iohn sayeth wee shall see wee become lyke vnto meane lette v contented child grace adoption sealed oure heartes holie ghoste consequently lette v knowe image wherein sheweth himselfe vntoo v thus muche concerning hath bene touched namely sainct peter sayeth sathan ceasseth goe aboute lyke roaring lyon whiche seeketh continually newe praye seeing lette v keepe good watche stande vpon garde
