sainct peter hath threatned v wise hee addeth vvithstand stedfastly faith hereby sheweth v must afrayd although sathan haue suche power called prince world say neede afrayd ouerwhelme v long armed faith shall haue strength inough shall sure victorie rest vpon god leane vnto grace lorde iesus christe wherof mention made tenth chapter iohn father sayeth hee hath put hande stronger feare ye satan shall ouercome maker god hath put v handes oure lord iesus christ intent good faithfull keeper soules body therefore let v rest selues vpon yet let v ceasse still ware carefull suche negligent shall fynde selues ouertaken euerie blowe surenesse whiche wee haue god maketh v dull forget owne daungers wherein wee bee vpholdeth v wee quayle fyghting drouzie flatter themselues despise god ayde relief lord sayth hold vp afrayde although satan gyue charge vpon wyth thundring assaultes seemeth shall goe wrecke yet shall ye safe vnder vnder hande sayth meaning men shoulde presume vpon themselues goe contrariwise sayeth come mee retire yourselues vnder protection maye bee tresse deuise myschiefe towardes syth fynd selues assayled many enemy behoueth v much knowe great neede wee haue god helpe vnder protection wee sure neyther sathau wicked menne worlde bring thing aboute whiche haue enterprised agaynst v let v marke howe diuell painted liuely vnto v holie ghost sayeth hee ceasseth keepe course circuites earth standeth v hande keepe always sure watch euermore awake purpose pray vnto god haue recourse vnto also arme selues faith may enter fielde battell fyght couragiously vntill suche time god graunte v enioye victorie hath promised v whereas sayde heere iob god questioned sathan specially token haue declared alreadie euen dayes hee fewe fellowes serued god purely heere see precisely sayde hee withdrewe himselfe euill full corruption nothing else ouerflowing iniquity bene good store rightuous menne world iob many like himselfe giuen themselues serue god hee god spoken one man alone heere sayde expressely iob hee hath matche lyke wee bee warned marre selues wee bee among wicked person though wee see whole worlde sette vpon mischiefe turned vpside downe wee must take example thereat suffer oure selues caried away keepe v still right obedience vnder guidance god beseching strengthen v holie spirite heeles tripped vp stumblingblockes wee see diuell casteth afore v thruste v waye seing iob liued sort soundnesse notwithstanding corruption world wer rife time corrupted let v mark although thing neuer farre order wee must giue selues libertie doe euil wee muste haue eye vnto god bee throughly setled walke presence wee see recorde giuen holie father liued rightuously wit regarded men saye shall haue leaue much bee better neybours could saye beholde god seeth v howe wee walke worlde therefore must behaue selues muste haue eye fastned settled vpon haue tolde heretofore quality tytles importe whiche god gyueth vnto iob namely firste hee sayde substantialnesse soundnesse hearte true foundation wherevpon wee must grounde selues admit wee haue vertues worlde wee bee praysed honoured men wee seeme bee angel yet shal whole life dung stark filthinesse god vnlesse sayd fountaine heart pure cleane according therevnto shall workes bee esteemed therfore let euery man enter himselfe searche owne conscience may wel liked men alme may wel contented v yea maye clappe handes v yet wee shall neuerthelesse curssed afore god hypocrisie heart purged cleane dissimulation may bee doublenesse v two heartes scripture sayeth place nowe mynded serue god lyfe also answerable therevnto shall walke becommeth v vve see diuers woulde fayne bee taken ryghtuousest folke worlde verie life sheweth contrarie menne good behauioure woonder see yea full mouth full eye full eares full feete full handes bee fullye dyuelles incarnate deadely plague infecte whole worlde let v marke well sayd soundnesse muste bee matched honestie vpright dealyng wee maye bee conuersante among menne without anoying anye man indeuoring helpe oure neybours shewing friendlinesse god commaundeth v see wherein shewe soundnesse true touchestone whereby god proueth v like golde tryed either touchstone furnace euen soundhartednesse sheweth selfe honest vpright dealing wee lyue among men without annoying without desire drawe mennes goodes vnto v beeing voyde erueltie voyde pryde aud voyde vaynegloriousnesse contrarywise beeyng courtuouse helpe euerie man pitifull succoure suche necessitie diligente imploye selues according abilitie god gyueth v like behooueth v walke vprightly faithfully neighbour behoueth v also feare god reason men haue right dutie god meane go without must begin according highest degree must wise apply selues seruing oure neighboures meane time god bee forgotten thing well worth marking somtimes shal see outward coutenance vertue men man would saye bee petie angelles man fynde faulte regard god rather despize therefore without cause god purposing heere commende seruante iob matcheth two thing together namely liued vprightly among men also sayde deuoutnesse witte true mynde worship liuing god yet dwelled worlde among many corruption consider soundnesse wherein lyued ouerlazie resist euils wherewith inuironed sayde iob withdrewe selfe euill therefore let v thinke serue god without trouble wee shall prouoked doe euill side shall walke becommeth v behoueth v indeuer withdraw selues euill yea euen euill within v euill neere vnto v yet woulde stande v hand heedefull withdrawing selues smell stinche continently turne awaye face pray satan seeketh poyson v full infection haue wee good cause withdrawe oure selues sayde euill within v burning ouen looke howe many wicked lustes bee carye v awaye many aduersaries god whole nature man sayth sainct paule nothing else enmitie agaynst god therefore behoueth v carefull put doctrine vre wit withdrawing oure selues euill howe shall withdrawe oure selues firste let v take heede oure selues wicked affection serue turne v aside god afterwarde let v beware leude person fyrebrandes set mischiefe fyre mortall plague nowe wee see muche iniquitie muche loosenesse muche outrage worlde vice haue full scope bee done let v withdrawe selues lette v shunne occasion according also sainct paule alledgeth recorde saying vvithdrawe selues ee farre babylon carrie lordes vessel hereby paule meaneth baptized name lorde iesus christe behoueth v bee holie body mynde bee gyuen wholly vnto god dedicated seruice whiche thing bee doone withdrawing oure selues defylementes maye corrupt v lette v eschue occasion euill wee see worlde ouerflowed vice let v aduisedly withdraw selues fasten eye vpon god maketh v holy nowe oure lorde addeth tytle hee vsed afore iob kepte still soundnesse herein oure lorde commendeth constancie whiche apparant vntill time hee beene wounded quicke iob heretofore bene man feared god hee bene sounde hee sayde substancialnesse spake hee foresayde honest vpright dealing conuersation neyghbours truely verye much hym haue many goodly vertues yet knowne constancie holde soundnesse nowe iob bereft goodes hee hath loste child yet hee blisseth name god acknowledging hee ought liue vnder condition god giue goodes vse afterwarde take againe hee ought prepare himselfe nakednesse myserie kicke hathe power authoritie lo heere inuincible constancie knowne bee iob whiche heeretofore suche tryall heereby wee see necessarie v afflicted although wee fynd harde paynefull first sighte yet behoouefull v wee thinke vpon god helpe becommeth v vntill wee haue trauelled thorough many daungers hath bene chaunce get vpper hande ouer temptation lette v marke well lyke god hath told v iob kept stil soudnesse notwithstanding ben sore persecuted also must passe gate wit must continuall readynesse serue god giue oure selues wholly vnto notwithstanding wee bee tryed diuers sortes wherefore euen holde still oure soundnesse vve see howe needefull euerie one v exercised ende one syde wee may knowe neede wee haue god helpe syde say maye better tryed power holie ghost shewe vtter selfe better v getting vpper hande temptation battelles put vnto v satan god graunt v bee armed aforehande sayde heauenly vertue constancie wythstande incounters vntill haue full victorie wee shall gathered ouerlasting rest heauenly kingdome let v cast selues downe presence good god acknowledgement faultes beseeching make v feele better intent crauing pardon hande wee may rightfull sory displeased oure selues therewithall wee may bee forestrengthened holy spirite diuell may able gayne thing handes wee may get victorie whole worlde oure fleshly affection let v saye almightie god heauenly father c ninth sermon second vpon second chapter satan vvent presence lorde smote iob vvith euill sore sole foote crovvne head tooke potsherd scrape himselfe sate dovvne duste vvife sayde vnto dost thou yet holde still thy singlenesse blisse god die ansvvered hir thou speakest like foolishe vvoman vvee haue receyued good lord shall vve receiue euill iob sinned vvith lippes haue marke heere whe god hath withdrawne hande v wee must prepare oure selues suffer muche greater misery wee haue escaped see maner god proceedeth hee afflicteth seruantes nouices bee acquainted suffering aduersitie spareth like wee would laye great burthen vpon litle chyld vpo man god hath regarde ablenesse beare according practized induring trouble sendeth v smaller greater inured may better lay full lode vpon v hee hath also giuen v wherewith beare see speaketh peter saying time yong lefte owne ease rest thou art olde sayth hee shal gird thee thou shalt tyed bound thou shalt haled whither thou wouldest vve see regarde god hath hold v vp yet tender afterward hath made v strong hee sendeth v greeuous heauie affliction much vse ought haue strengthened v alreadie aforehand hath bene shewed person iob ende euery v might receiue instruction hymselfe right harde thing vnto iob spoyled good lost child hee brought pouertie manner thing satan smote body full paynefull botch whereof man coulde tell kinde sauing one whole leprosie yea holy scripture sheweth v necessitie disease must needes haue bin extreme lo heere cast men company euen heretofore bene honored men heere rotten carion muche hee like fall peeces yee would say owne stinch endure extremest payne world suche sore coulde bee without great burning tormented euen vttermost see heere later miserie farre excessiue misery happened vnto afore satan mente also sayde yea man alwayes quitte skinne skinne giue owne childe hys raunsome may scape selfe hath saued owne life thinkes still hath gayned muche although haue lost yet hath wherewith comfort selfe assuage sorrowe beholde suttlenesse satan hee groundeth vppon nature man truely thys poynte founde iob yet case standeth v enclyned mind namely lyfe precious vnto v easie v beare residue mischaunces light vpon owne person case standeth see heere inuincible constancie seruant god continued hys soundnesse god punished goodes child also like persecuted roughly body hee one whole place full matter extreme greefe torment soeuer world went ceassed blesse god god graunt v escape one inconuenience let v followe counsell haue gyuen afore learne dispose selues suffering three foure moe whyche shall bee greater excessiuer firste good reason god shoulde encrease weighte oure burden according strength hath inabled v withall hee hath eye oure welfare specially behoueth v marke well circumstance iob long respite betweene continuall growing misery vppon hym god oftentimes gyue v respite hee hath tryed pacience aduersitie wee may haue laysure take breath agayne assuage griefe heauinesse wee haue endured afterwarde god sendeth v heartsore heere hee layd stroke vpon stroke assoone iob bene visited one sorte hys goodes wee see afflicted immediatly another vvhen robber made cleane riddaunce great cattell lightning came heauen consume rest child dyed hande god bene enemie plagued hys owne person heere inoughe haue ouerwhelmed iob notwithstanding wonderfull stoutnesse god wyll worke suche manner hym intente euery one v wee bee afflicted shoulde consider god ceasseth bee father still hee neuer forsooke seruaunt iob althoughe hee come suehe extremity wee suffer one halfe yea tenthe parte whyche endured shall wee bee excused murmure nay rather haue wee cause thanke god regarding oure infirmitie hee punisheth v according whyche seeth v able endure letteth wee shoulde bee afflicted much iob god hathe muche authoritie ouer v satan become gentle nowe dayes vve bee sure rage mortall enemie satan selfe hee mynde still hee keepeth still accustomed nature witte bee lyon roaring open mouthe swallowe v vp god gyue hym brydle wee bee sure shall endure muche iob affliction meane sweete man compare affliction spoken heere therfore let v conclude god sheweth hymselfe curteous pitifull towardes v seeing chastized gently hande hee keepeth suche measure bee racked vttermost vseth greate excessiue rigoure wee see heere person iob furthermore heere shewed v howe men oughte renounce themselues may gyue selues wholly ouer vnto god long man standeth owne conceyte yea euen though hee bee well accustomed serue god bee hee shall rather goe backward forwarde proofe whereof hee standeth hys owne conceyte delighteth also owne pleasure owne ease hee desireth haue owne commodity lust leadeth god meaneth handle v cleane contrarywise god delighteth trouble v bycause behoofefull v tamed brought lowe may shewe subiection wee oughte yeelde vnto god god frame himselfe thing sendeth vpon v man could well discerne obedient handleth v cleane contrary appetite bee subiect vnto holde affection vnder hys brydle ende frame ourselues lure yeelde honor gouerning v yea euen hys owne good listeth dispose v therein wee shewe obedient thus see declared v text see iob fayne fighte hys owne affection bereeue hymselfe hold himselfe prisoner otherwyse hee shoulde leape boundes lift vp himselfe god leastwise hee shoulde fall intoo anger hee shoulde nothing storme within himselfe god shoulde haue nother credite superioritie let v take example iob resist affection bring vnderfoote intende serue god impossible hee haue ful vse v til become point witte till wee renounce ourselues set much store oure lyfe wee better finde harte yeelde selues subiect hym whose wee whome becommeth v dedicate lyfe giuen owne commoditie ease true may well desire god assist v sende v euer meete v yet therewithall wee must holde v stay namely hee may knoweth good though agaynst appetite yet hee graunt v grace frame selues vnto folow hym throughout whither soeuer hee call v thing haue practise time lyfe vvhen trade occupation handicraft hard must haue time learne hath cunning belonging lesson hard v learne yea ouerhard say v put vre true well ynough confesse good reason god bee chiefe mayster reygne ouer v wee striue commeth deede fewe demeane themselues thereafter therefore let v time lyfe learne remember sayd lesson inure selues vntill haue profited haue neede asmuch shall bee handled large heereafter glaunce thinges passe lette v come added text witte iobs wife commeth prouoke despayre howe nowe sayeth continuest thou yet still thy singlenesse blisse god dye diuell findeth meanes ynow incomber v without hauing bellowes quicken vp fire wee know great sturdinesse nature pitie see steade quiet submitting selues vntoo god vnto holie spirit ought wee conceyue wandering imagination v hath whole storehouse full dotage brayne made drunken according knowe lustes fleshe enemy god none v ouershooteth himselfe though wee haue intycers prouoke v agaynst god drawe v vnto despayre short though satan take instrumentes without v deceyue v withall hee shall finde ynow within owne person enemy already within v haue sayd wauering fancy vtter enemy god affection armed agaynst make v striue punishment sendeth vnto v therefore dubble warre vnto iob besides possibilitie tempted himselfe hys owne wife prouoked despaire full measure al miserie god permitteth happen faithful one inespecially hee purposeth trye quicke lighted vpon iob alone wee see dauid yea wee see also lorde iesus chryste beholde heere two mirroures wherein god mente represente said kind temptation vnto v one greeuousest complaintes dauid maketh mocked puttyng hys trust god somuche hee became laughingstocke euery man men bleared tung saying see la bare himselfe hand sate god lappe called protector buckler fortresse bragged calling vpon hym resorting refuge bee shorte seemed god shoulde neuer haue forsaken hym man may see howe hee hath esteemed misery dauid endured hard disgest ne wounded deadly reproches men offered hym verely satan seeth holdeth v throte hee hath wonne thys poynte oure handes hee standeth skanning whether hee may pricke v wounde v arme legge hee commeth righte hearte throate v hee hathe doone muche wicked folke fall mocking v thoughe wee hadde trusted god vayne disappointed hope wayted hys hande vve see faythe goeth vtter wrecke wee gyue place suche temptation looke befell vntoo dauid accomplished oure lord iesus chryste therefore behoueth v hys member bee fashioned lyke vnto hym likenesse fulfilled person put selues readinesse resist indure aduersities wicked person come sting v scoffing faith purpose cast v intoo despayre harte myght misgyue v god agaynste v cut short trust wee reposed finde succoure wee looked hande let v arme ourselues agaynste suche temptation quayle vnder true haue erst sayde right harde temptation ouercome see written heere iob vphild strong ynough helpe v also may quayle neuerthelesse haue heere example satan hath tormented v wee haue bene visited bothe body goodes thing el knit vp matter withall wee muste bee fayne bee mocked haue fayth assaulted thys cannot bee done name god must bee blasphemed therefore wee muste needes bee grieued sorie heart happeneth vnfaythfull skorne v reiected god blame vntruthe thoughe hee beguyled v therefore muste needes greeue v torment v soeuer worlde goe let v faynte let v call remembrance hathe happened vntoo iob vntoo dauid iesus chryste hath shewed v ende wee may thinke straunge wee bee fashioned like vnto image heere wee see vpon condition god hath greffed v body sonne generall patrone faythfull saincte paule declareth viij romanes let v nowe consider imported sayde temptation iobs wyfe bringeth saying dost thou yet hold still thy singlenesse said gaynest thou seruing god thyne intent seruing hath bene bee supported hee shoulde haue lyked well thee hee shoulde haue shewed dooyngs hee thy father thou seest howe hee enemie thee persecuteth thee thy soundnesse booteth thee nothing lo heere hir conclusion concerning whyche followeth namely blisse god dye expounded diuers maners haue seene word blisse somtimes taken curse custome saye manner speaking serueth teach v detest blasphemie againste god thing ought named done vnderstand grudge againste god spite cast foorth word may sound dishonor detestable thing must euen shudder quake according wee see sainct paule speaketh whoredome villainous loosenesse gluttonie robberie let sayth named among therefore expounde sentence thus blisse lord saye prouoke god anger thou dyest reuenge thy selfe ere thou dye thou seest well inough hath deceyued thee douted woman instrument sathan therefore bee maruelled though bee sheediuell feend hell sette iob rage shoulde lift vp himselfe god fall rushing maiestie matter bee throughly considered naturall meaning rather blisse god dye say well mayst thou persist blisse god much thou wilt thou hast done thou shalt gayne nothing lost labour thou must fayne die thou canst fully determined shall thou seest god hath heard thy prayer whether thou glorifye one none shall come heauen therefore thou hast spunne fayre threde humbling thy selfe afore god nay sith thou must dye lyke poore forlorne caitife looke god appeased towards thee wrathe assuaged thou must needes passe true sense commes continually one poynte therefore behoueth stande greatlye vpon wordes principall point haue suche doctrine holy ghost giueth v first poynte without difficultie word themselues conteyne certayne marke whereat iobs wyfe shotte dryue despayre ende hee shoulde haue fretted chafed againste god haue loste whole vnderstanding stede blissing god earst done haue prouoked wrath finally haue flinged himselfe ouer al fieldes lyke wood beaste heere haue consider throughly sayd iob common instruction faithfull therefore let v beare well away apply owne vse true saying heere came woman mouth many found say lyke thys daye ordinarie custome world wee serue god adayes indenture say yea men themselues ashamed confesse owne vnbeleefe prouerbes say man trust much boughes let goe hys holde body tree much say must trust altogither vnto god vvherevntoo tend thing shewe wee yeeld honor vntoo god wee conceiue accordingly thing themselues import god doo v good peraduenture may shewe beholden handle v amisse incontinently tung end say purpose wee ouerlabour selues also let v marke well iob tempted prouoked owne wyfe satan shal haue store vnderminers dayes leade v intoo lyke temptatio armed fenced resist thus see haue doo besides happen wicked come pricke v forward manner yet may euen haue profited god schole may conceyue imagination themselues vve see euen dauid confesseth himselfe stoode vpon yce thought haue slyded entred intoo discourse himselfe saw wicked sort oftentimes well intreated glutted themselues pleasure world pyned away good men contrarye part poore faithfull one drinke water sorow god ceasseth punish vvherefore protesteth ende hee came say haue indeuored haue cleane pure hand better loste time vnprofitable labour dauid confesseth encombred temptation ouerthrowe came hee resisted stedfastly let v marke diuell bringeth match set v fire agaynste god affliction must giue eare least entrap v therefore must bethinke v lesson long time aforehand whiche serueth gyue v victorie suche encounter see wherefore sayd esay say ye reward rightuous saye conclude selues vvhen see thing confounded may seeme order turned vpside downe god fauoreth wicked hateth godly rather fortune beareth sway god sleepe heauen gouerneth thing beneath yet must alwayes assure selues rightuous shall reape frute labour true worse temptation thinke wee lose labour seruing god praysing name holding selues vnder hym therefore behoueth v fully perswaded god wise disappoint honour serue haue opinion impossible euer haue least desire bee world giue selues vnto god wee imagin god turneth backe vpon v hee make sporte see v turmoyle hee shutteth hys eye lost time walke carefulnes bende himselfe well forasmuch behoueth serue god come neerest vntoo hym bee fully resolued hee rewardeth feare see woorst deadliest temptation satan trumpe way beares v hand doo lose tyme wee praye vntoo god make recourse vntoo much must wee watchfull againste temptation perceiue bee wicked daungerous herewithall let v beare mynd behoueth v ready fenced againste greatest freendes haue cace heere may yeeld nother wyfe neighbour simply euen whome trust best linking one another must wee alwayes haue regard god bond cocord fredship proceede also let v remember man haue diuell house disquiet hee haue two three much neede hath hee stande vpon gard may wise serue excuse setting themselues chafe god declareth vnto v wee must gard selues sydes satan oure mortall enimie ouerwilye spieth side may best enter feeble place make breach easiest entrance hath v loue husbande beareth wife singular freend vnto trusteth satan see well ynough gyue way manner person therefore laboreth earnestly serue hys owne turne v yet must diminishe frendships good godly husband must pray god suffer wife firebronde hell kindle fire impacience distrust prouoke blaspheme also behoueth wife pray god hir husband may guide hir co uenient alwayes able instructe hir aright hir head superioure moreouer god hath gyuen v freends acquaintance must pray hym may serue hys honoure eche v maye way saluation entice one another vnto wickednesse thus see haue firste poynte consequently let v aduise selues well euery one wiues husband freends kinsfolke may helpe v serue god wee selues may ame alwayes marke specially whe see god dwelleth vseth owne hand guide v withall freend kinsman wife go driue v despaire peraduenture wee must renounce god must bee preferred frendship must begin leuell true mark haue marke streyne according also iob sheweth v owne example saying thou hast spoken lyke foolish woman verely haue receyued good hand lord shall wee also receyue euill vvhen iob answereth wyfe hath spoken foolishly thereby admonished ought reproue suche blasphemy sharply asmuche bee spewed satan see sword drawen v foyne cast v wound v vnto deathe would behalfe would suffer selues slayne without making countenance thyng would take heede shift blowe ward set store life euen iob saw himselfe persecuted owne wife wente worke harme body sende deepe pit hell resisted hir stoutly vve see corage ought proceede suche case dalying satan seing find furious enemie going matter though went light skirmishe easy ouercome furthermore iob also eye hath bene recyted heretofore haue sayd man vpbrayd v vayn thing trust god true troubleth v ynough quench fayth therewithall god accused misdealing mocking hys seruats specially vniustice proper plucked shall longer god except hee discerne good euill aduance serue soundnesse may iudge world ready heare resort succoure god bereft vertues see certainly glory godhead quite abolished iob could beare blasphemy according also sayd psalme zeale god house ought bite hart consume v reproch men offer vnto ought rebound vpon v behoueth v grieued see honoure god impeached child becommeth v set selues thus see haue note iob rebuked hys wife stoutly say thou hast spoken like foole herewithal let v beare mind answer ought made like temptation partie soeuer come whence soeuer sent v aboue wee bee troubled lewd imagination owne flesh behoueth v folowe example iob learne howe deale owne griefes whereas wee haue bene accustomed angrie sting v v wrong euery one v must begin storme againste himselfe may bethinke selues thus haue vice angry mine enemy one haue practised euill againste haue pacience caried away desire vengeance requite like like yet haue well aduised selfe find worse enemie welfare tha selfe say vngracious nature wicked affection conceiue within many enimies hinder welfare therefore becommeth angry selfe bycause thence greatest enemy come vvherefore temptation come vpon v see happened iob let v learne withstand stoutly without soothing selues end may ouercome see selues trayned lewde fancy striue god nature full rebelliousnesse striuing must flatter selues say nature wee bee able amend let v assure selues excuse shall stand v steade behoueth v fight stoutly resist v saye flatly must saue selues wote must enter combate yea liuely combate must employ witte endeuoure else shall neuer come ende lo whereof aduised streine iob addeth seeing haue receyued good lorde shoulde also receyue euill setteth downe naturall argument induce v beare paciently euil aduersities god sendeth v wee bee muche bounde man wee haue receyued good turne hys hand wil haue consideration saye man hath done great good herevppon indure thing hand whome muche beholden men saye villanouse vnthankfulnesse v according bound mortall men also wyll pacient shall faine suffer inconuenience childe willing beare father forasmuch hee knowes father begate nourished kepeth stil hys house childe notwithstanding father rough towards bound neuerthelesse acknowledge good reason abide say graunt much vnto creature must graunt creator vve see god doth v many good turnes shall endure euill hand pleaseth ought haue superioritie ouer v punish v thinketh good consideration ought make v bowe downe neckes hold v quiet argument iob maketh heere hee sayd heeretofore lord hath gyuen lorde hathe taken away another reason thereby hee ment god gyueth v good appropriate vnto v say let v haue vse time wee bee readye houres sende home agayne hath lent v lo thus see iob alleageth naturall reason bringeth another second reason vve receyue good lord hand receiue wee euill also sithe wee bee greatly bound vnto god vile vnthankfulnesse wee find heart suffer thing sake furthermore marke thys reason well wee must first compare god hys creature secondly must compare benefytes god gyueth v benefites receyue men vvhen god cometh rank pray al honor authoritie giuen creature droppe respect whiche due vnto god hee hath deserued let v marke well hundreth thousande tymes pacient suffer affliction bee aduersitie came vnto v behalfe men whome bounde yet purpose vvhy bicause maiestie god surmounteth creature wise cannot discharge selues towards becommeth v although duetie towards men impossible accomplish whiche owe vnto god aboue must marke gratious gift dealeth v continually hys owne hand let v count well sure whe haue counted vttermost must confesse dauid nother number measure wherefore god goodnesse bottomlesse pit insomuch must needes rauished oft long time wee muse vppon proofe thereof man consider god hath shewed selfe father euen birth yea birthe pray must confounded reach hundreth part seeyng case standeth god grace innumerable meanes comprehended receyue wee aduersities sendeth v although afflicted much yet god benefites farre surmount affliction suffer hys hande let v marke well sayde reason iobs ende euer god shall afflict v may beare thinges paciently assuring selues good reason receyue aduersitie hys hande sith haue receyued many benefytes rest thys sentence shall reserued till morrowe bycause nowe set length let v pray thys good god may please haue alwayes regard infirmity whensoeuer hee shall afflict v forasmuch good reason inured vnto pacience long thys worlde although wee bee forced passe many thornes diuers hartgreeues vexation mind yet neuerthelesse good god arme v strength wee may quayle forasmuche life corruptible ruinous caban holde v vp feeblenesse euen vnto ende vntill suche time hee haue ridde v quite cleane infirmity fleshe therewithall wee also hauing recourse vntoo fatherly goodnesse whych vseth towards v may succoured necessity doubting hee bring v saluation hath promised v assuring selues persist obeysance shall neuer disappoynted wee sticke vntoo promise neuer fayle haue hande stretched ouer v succour v may please graunt thys grace v also al people nation earth c tenth sermon third vpon second chapter sermon conteyneth rest exposition tenth verse afore afterward verse following three iobs friendes hauing heard aduersities happened vnto vvitte eliphas themanite baldad suhite zophar maamathite came place vvhere dvvelt agreed come haue compassio comfort hym vvhen lift vp eye farre knevv lifted vp theyr voyce vvept rent clothes cast dust vpon head tovvarde heauen satedovvneby vpon ground space seuen dayes seuen nightes suche vviseas none spake one vvorde savve greefe vvas greatly encreased yesterday declared effect iob meant thys sentence vve haue receyued good lordes hande receyue wee euill also serueth shewe men toto vnthankfull acknowledge themselues greatly bounde vnto god number benefites whych haue receyued hand ought refuse maner affliction listeth exercise vnderstande otherwise though wordes vvee receyue good lordes hande iob hoped yet time come god would towardes agayne felt heretofore seemeth iob meant comfort wife himselfe saying thys myserie shall continue euer although god punish v meaneth continue vttermost end haue pitie vpon distressed naturall meaning haue set downe already witte iob calling remembrance good hee receyued god hande helde selfe beholden vnto hym thought selfe bounde abide aduersities paciently heerevpon wee may gather good profitable doctrine wit oft long aduersities oppresse v wee must acknowledge god hath shewed hym selfe good father v many sortes becommeth v thinke straunge hee chastize v time prouoked moued grudge heerewithall certayne iob coulde haue bene comforted except hee applyed god former benefites tyme come wee consider onely howe god hath bene good v tyme past wee shall haue purpose could paciente hath bene sayde alreadye vve must bee well assured goodnesse loue god must truste continually hys grace doubting hee wil proceede loue v still notwithstanding deale roughly v iob calleth minde benefites hee receyued heeretofore god hande suche wise hee maketh conclusion namely god changed nother purpose nature ceassed continue good righteous notwithstanding afflicted hym vvhen haue consideration v wee see wherewith assuage sorowes true aduersities go againste nature sharpe harde v beare lyke medicine bitter troublesome therefore must somewhat sweetned may easlyer receyued god also gyueth v wherewith season oure sorrowes intente wee shoulde bee ouer sorrowfull heere wee see principall poynt namely although god seeme bent againste v yet considering haue found good hee hathe made v feele loue many sort wee shoulde doubt continue euen end thys cause sayde thynges iob offended lippes wee muste vnderstande heere iob hypocrite glorifye god hys mouth yet mind heart contrarye vvhere fore sayde hee sinned hys lippes shewe hee wonderfull stay hym selfe true sometymes although wee conceyue euill imagination yet wee holde euill wordes escape v howe man tempted bee offended god many imagination runne head muche hee woulde fayne lifte vp selfe willingly agaynst god yea euen conceyueth blasphemy heerevppon bridleth rebuketh selfe thus wretched creature meanest thou vvee see middest temptatios god gyueth v grace resist wee come extremitie blaspheme hym openlye bee blame worthy meane whyle conceyuing suche thoughtes ought condemne selues god appeareth well holye ghoste hathe wroughte v wee haue consented suche temptation liking man may well take thys sentence thys sense namely iob offended hys lippes say hee came extremitie although hee sore prouoked euill yet hee resisted euill ouercame hee maynteyned hys battell stedfastly notwithstanding wee haue considered thing throughly doubte iob set heere v man rightly perfecte pacience better comprehending heere let v marke sainct iames sayth hee hath sinned tongue perfect aboue men vve see forasmuch men bee ouerswifte speake insomuch thing spoken conceyue hee able holde selfe word slippeth good aduisemente well set sheweth selfe bee indued wyth singular grace thus wee see wee haue note heere concerning iob namely howe hee farre shewing sturdinesse againste god euen hys wordes well ordered whereas men light speech vnable rule tung iob humbleth hym selfe god heereby wee bee taughte call vppon god graunt v grace wee may neuer cast foorthe woordes maye tende dishonoure hys holy name wee knowe tongue ought bee dedicated chiefly honoure god true wee oughte applye member therevntoo like hee hathe created good reason shoulde bee imployed hys glorye hee wyll haue tongue sounde suche wyse mouthes may bee instrumentes glorifye hym wee applye contrarye muche peruerte order nature forasmuch wee bee gyuen vice haue sayde nothing difficulte withholde selues therefore wee haue muche neede call vppon god hee maye gouerne v suche sorte wee maye vtter one woorde shall bee hys honoure furthermore wee nowe conceiue euill imagination possible wee muste needes haue manye wicked thoughtes considering great frayltie howe satan eggeth v let v assure selues already faultie god must aske forgyuenesse yet therewithall fight valiantly still thrust thing vnder foote according sayd yesterday iob rebuked hys wyfe also discouered hir folly therefore becommeth v take good heede enter disputation pleading god rather learne bridle yea rebuke selues iustely thus see must bee sharpe condemne suche vice v heerein wee see beastlynesse hathe reigned reigneth yet still thys daye among papistes say sinagoges man fall doubt whether god whether god rightuous hee conceyue horrible outrageous blasphemy head sinne consente vtterly man tempted strip neighboure clothes murther blaspheme giue selfe whorehunting hee feele affection within carrie away say sinne must suche folke needes worse brute beastes see one resolution whiche common ouer among papistes well worthy resolution forasmuche nothing hypocrisie meanes wherof make light sin nothing al making veniall sinne man hath offended god deadly whych man haue committed horriblest sinne world needeth one sprinkling holywater discharged towards god parte haue sayde let v thinke prouoked wicked doubtingnesse wee bee condemned alreadye god let v preuent iudgement bee owne iudges yeelde selues guiltie yet meane whyle let v doubt god hath mercie v wyll hold v vp infirmity conditionally grace holy spirit shake suche thinges agree put wicked imagination practize shall haue conceyued mindes thus see ought deale thys behalfe consequently sayde three iobs freendes hauing hearde myseries happened vntoo hym tooke aduyce visit ende haue compassion hym comfort good likelyhood firste blush god meant releeue seruant iob sente men vntoo pretended haue pitie vppon misery skilfull wise comforte hym well shall see discourse anon howe exquisite persones man might suppose god would hencefoorth stretch hande vnto iob deliuer misery hee sente see visitation freendes increace miserie plundge euen bottome endlesse waues vvhereby admonished time hope drawen affliction must thinke straunge though matter fall haue conceyued wee see iob disappointed hope whe sawe friendes became diuells torment bene tormented afore yet notwithstanding minde neyther came mocke iob brought malicious purpose wicked intente right hartie good loue towardes sayd meaning haue compassion say take themselues part miserie farre possible beare greefe bene ioyned knit togither persone lo end came yet notwithstanding wee see iob affliction grieuously increased let v take warning example although well minded towards neighbour desirous comfort misery yet god must guyde v el sayd good intent nothyng auayle v therefore wee see neighbor daunger necessitie truely ought beseech god gyue v grace haue compassion succoure yet wherefore bycause haue spirit wisedome much go cleane awke yet beare selues hande best world shall dryue poore man despayre felt much hys miserie vve see manye zelous person whych earnest desirous shewe themselues charitable towards whome able helpe handsomnesse good fashion dealing vvhen come poore creature already afflicted bring hym new torment whereof commeth euen want discretion skill therfore god must fayne worke thys cace haue sayd wee succoure one another necessitie god shall haue giuen v affection let v pray hym gyue v also meane right vse hand may gyue good profitable may haue skill handle folke according shal conuenient agreable nature person plunged excesse anguish comfort bring may bee well applyed hys vse hee may feele reliefe vvee must pray god giue v thys vertue founde v afterward god haue giuen v wisdome hee must also put louing kindnesse v wee bee rigorous towardes whose well may haue cause past hope rather inclined pitifull affection say mildly minded hope well well according sayde charitie hopeth thing thus ye see haue marke furthermore wee compare men selues find certaintie god hath neede gouerne v cace vvhy none common ordinarie sort men haue declared already dullardes bee greate personage well aduised poynts accordingly shewe themselues bee yet neuerthelesse see proceede suche wise let iob myght haue bene dinged downe vnto hell cause god ment shewe v nother wisedome discretion mind man rule measure hym excepte hee hymselfe gyue let v bee sure vnlesse wee haue wee shall bee able comfort suche afflicted iobs friendes whiche excellent men ouershoote themselues much likelyhoode wee shall misse god supply want giue wherewith behaue selues meete v thus wee see haue remember moreouer whereas sayd tooke counsell haue compassion comfort two woordes shewed v dutie see friendes neighbour indure aduersitie two thing requisite comforting also succouring may imploy selues vttermost succour haue need help yet shall great matter wee haue hart bee ioyne selues though wee felt griefes owne persones vvee may giue goodes poore yet haue loue nothing sainct paule speaking sheweth wee maye well doo many fayre thinges whiche notwithstanding shall bee leasings vanitie except wee haue louingnesse guide shall see aduenture themselues valiantly man stande neede helpe yet haue feeling compassion griefe lo sayde iobs friend come comfort drawe miserie haue compassion deede man v whiche first formost desyreth comfort men shoulde haue compassion example man indure aduersitie happeneth others come serue bee opinion doo good haue care bee touched compassion miserie doubling grief true shal receyue good done vnto regardeth comparison compassion much whereas men succour giue ayde yet perceiue poore folk haue feeling miserie member make account succour man giue without minde discharge selues duetie towardes aduersitie let v beginne poynt witte pitie misery feele part neere true tryall loue herewithall true wee muste also shewe compassion doings bee sorie ynough see neighbour aduersitie yet therewithall fare blockes man get succour bee dismayde must followe fashion set downe namely pitifull tender harted sort see man endure aduersitie wee alwayes haue handes libertie succour abilitie god hath giuen v muste wee haue mindes ouerset sorrowe oure heartes shoulde dismayde wittes vtterly amazed rather pitifulnesse muste extende yet quicken v vp seeke howe wee may salue sore see neighbour meant second place sayd iobs friend beeing come mourne purposed haue comforted speede comming onely weepe say feele part thy miserie also comfort bin possible thus see minde came fayled middes theyr iourney vvhen went first hande errand good minde hilde meane requisite needfull whiche come shoulde haue compassion towardes iob still haue sought meanes comfort beene agreeable haue shot alwayes marke yea contrarywise became men amazed howe doubtlesse found thing offended persone iob howbeit forasmuch sawe suche extremenesse affliction seemed god would haue handled sharply except hee bene castaway tooke suche conceyte reason excessiue misery sawe iob lost courage comfort wee see sayde psalme happie man hath consideration trouble dauid passed way well iob hee indured great aduersities suche sorte hee lyke hee bin forsaken god according haue sayde heretofore man might say beholde bee seene fondnesse glorie trusting god warrant himselfe woulde succour wee see plaine contrarie asmuche therefore dauid condemned men vnder colour god persecuted exercised pacience sundriewise hee sayeth right happie man hath consideration afflicted hereby meaneth wee see man anguish hard aduersities god requyreth aboue thing first dashe take suche conceyte say damned god sheweth full well hee purposeth cut hope behold past recouerie vve must bee rigorous wee must haue wit say verie well let v wayt god aduersities common well good men bad light vppon good men without cause vvhen god scourgeth although wee perceyue cause wherefore doth yet becometh v consider god rightuous vvee see affliction common god chosen people hee holdeth child also castawayes go damnation forasmuche v iudge except god hath shewed v ende affliction shall come vnto becommeth v holde verdit suspence man say man afflicted well let v acknowledge hande god begin say ala haue well deserued much wretched creature looke thou haue offended thy god many wayes may punishe thee hundred thousand folde thou seest indure much let v aduise selues conclude thus well see poore man handled roughly true hee lead naughtie life hee suffereth rightfully yet knowe god lo wisedome dauid exhorteth v vnto namely wee shoulde wayte see whether god deliuer whome hee persecuteth owne hande albeit rightfully done also let v learne fenced agaynst stumblingblocks may come way wee bee troubled thing exceede imagination letted duetie continually harte fayle v middes iourney truely lesson hard put vre muche payne ought put selues vnto god giue v grace bring thing spake beginning namely haue desire zeale comfort neighbour wee must desire god furnish v meanes intent whe commeth put vre become vnprofitable like blockes woode yet notwithstanding must thought ouer straunge iobs friend astonied considering plight wherein founde vtterly disfigured coulde know first sight text sayeth vndoubtedly affection rooted hart sawe miserable yet coulde cease shewe loued still howbeit knewe vtterly astonished consequently sayd lyfted vp voyce fell weeping teares came counterfeytnesse good affection howbeeit forasmuch abashed reason great misery iob indured wee see bee troubled dashed countenaunce bee able doo duetie meant haue loue vtter signes requyred loue must well ruled end may well serue one anothers turne god commaundeth touching sayd rent theyr clothes cast dust vppon theyr heades cast themselues vpon grounde seuen dayes seuen nightes without speaking woorde therein see sayde compassion whereof haue spoken afore besides see howe meening humble theselues iob make intercession godward haue pitie vpon men olde time cast dust vpon head token humilitie acknowledgement sinnes first knewe estate say doth god punish v let v bethinke v whiche wee haue forgotten wit wee bee rottennesse thing nothing men prosperitie make themselues drunken flaunt sore ayre touched care assoone god smyteth storme consider neither whence come whither must returne also men olde tyme end bring remembrance vsed sayd ceremonie thereby yeelding themselues faultie god though beene wretched offender thing requyred offender handes acknowledge fault craue pardon yeeld themselues guiltie god returne vnto true repentance iob good occasion friendes also could shew forth friendship done like bee bound take vpon v persone neighbour aske god forgiuenesse behalfe greatest reliefe giue distresse pray god shake altogither wee cannot prayer succour aduersitie without hauing haue recited wit without keeping companie humble selues afore god without coming mourne dauid protesteth euen enimies saw running intoo destruction hee sorie hart shead bitter teares sighes dauid haue done thus enemy persecuted shoulde doo knowe child god certainly ought follow dauid praying enemy without christ auow v disciple ouergreat leudnesse wee haue pitie vpon perceyue signe godlinesse religion instructed al one doctrine v therefore come sue pardon god hande becometh v ioyne case behold say ye haue marke sayd iobs friendes rent garment cast theselues ground sprinkled dust vppon heades herewithall note although ceremony bee signes repentance yet wee must thinke men shal discharged clothing themselues sackcloth much weeping vsing suche maner fashion may make seeme haue nothing lowlynesse aduersitie rather must bethinke oure selues sentence ioels rende hart garmentes whereby ioell meeneth purpose men haue great store ceremony martyr themselues much outwarde sight worlde except harte broken maner rending breaking god requireth hart wee shoulde bee cast downe humbled perceiue signes wrath specially feele blowes hande alreadie paciet assuring selues come sinnes wee many beaten god roddes chawe theyr brydles lyke mule conceyue wote fiercenesse bitternesse serue set rage agaynst god notwithstanding make countenaunce though well tamed contrarywise haue sayd behoueth hart rent according exhortation made vntoo v psalme laying hart open god ende know within let v follow sayd saying prophet ioell rend garment harte rather therein true repentance shewe itselfe impossible hart rightly rent withoute shewing foresayde lowelinesse experience confessing sinnes intent giue glory vntoo god herein man may see mockerie thinke himselues haue done muche haue graunted haue done amisse haue committed great offence agaynst god haue cast stumblingblocke intoo church yet peraduenture man grate vpon little would make vnderstande fault would mkae say totoo much woulde seeme vnto god ouersharpe rigorous agaynst wise must thinke god receyueth v repentant person except bring sacrifize spoken one fiftith psalme maner sacrifize wee haue heartes mindes distressed wee ashamed committing sinnes conscience hath remorse accuseth v knowe become vntill haue found fauour god thus much concerning point repentance consisteth ceremony hath hir seate hart man howbeit must shew hir self signes haue minde well dispozed wee must appeere men may onely haue woorde mouth say haue offended also harte muste speake tung sayde iobs friendes sate seuen dayes seuen nightes ment departed place whyle abode space seuen dayes lamenting casting themselues vppon earth specially yeelded good record loue towards abandoning pleasure commodity bee sorowing meant comfort lo summe therwithall sayd spake one worde wherein wee see whiche haue touched heretofore namely sore troubled saw god hande rigorous vpon iob came sette purpose comfort iob dumb vvhat cause haue forgotten reason might serue comfort withall welsettled remembrance wee shall see hereafter vvherefore hilde peace bycause preuented imagination howe vvee tooke man haue beene seruant god peraduenture god punished wee would haue thought yet bene order comfort see god hath forsaken hath set markes vpon shewe reprobate persone hope therefore see meane comfort thus see cause astonishment ought haue eye god promise whereby hee witnesseth vnto v seemeth vntoo v lost past hope recouerie v hee able sende remedie still howbeit hereby admonished touched afore pray vnto god holde v moued compass aduersities eyther selues neighbor conclude must past al hope recouerie diuell desire nothing cause v make conclusion put intoo heades god hath cast v supposest thou hee say god wil euer receyue thee mercie seeing thou hast offended many wayes giue place temptation beholde howe bee bereft god grace hys promise therefore let v much earnestly pray god strengthen v wise may beate backe assaultes satan whensoeuer wee afflicted owne persones happen see neighbour suffer aduersitie wee may vtterly dismayed rather take courage make conclusion wel true affliction great yet must wee stil trust god hope wil turne aduersitie welfare according maketh thing doth worlde serue welfare faythfull haue consideration v wee shall neuer destitute cofort trouble neuer bee barred god helpe flee vnto succour let v fal downe presence good god acknowledgement sinnes praying make v feele may alwayes ready indure chasticementes hee shall sende v abide without ouertroubled mind therwithall may neuer ashamed condemne sinnes iniquity craue pardon specially yeelding selues guiltie bee deede may ceasse call vpon assure selues mercie shal neuer denied v come true repentance desiring nothing subiect good walke feare obedience time life may please graunt grace onely vnto v also c eleuenth sermon first vpon third chapter iob opened mouth curssed day iob ansvvered sayd let day perishe vvherein vvas borne night vvherein vvoorde vvas brought man childe vvas conceyued let day bee ouercast darkenesse let god require aboue let haue brightnesse giue light let darkenesse thicke shadovvs ouervvhelme let bee ouercouered vvith clovvdes let heate day burne vp possessed bee night vvith darkenesse let bee reckened among dayes yeare come number monethes desolate bee night let haue gladnesse let vvoont curse dayes curse also fall mourning let starres darkened let haue hope light neyther let eye liddes morning tvvilight see bycause shette doores wombe bare mee hyde trouble mine eies wee muste consider intent holy ghost ende wee may applie whole doctrine oure vse hitherto haue seene iobs pacience submitted himselfe wholy vnto god yea hath ceassed blisse notwithstanding deemed miserable among men seemeth turneth topsiteruie angrie god marke thing wel throughly combate wherein see one side man infirmitie sheweth selfe side hath yet still strength resist temptatiions iob mamering meanes whereof whereas heretofore nothing constancie stoutnesse mixture frailtie flesh maketh far ouerseene murmureth agaynst god howbeit intent fall god neuerthelesse woordes scape whiche euill proceede faultie minde cannot iustified thus ye see first point haue consider wit state iob namely sheweth himselfe stedfast afore incountered battell doth well shewe frayle man able beare temptation faine would submit himselfe vnto god peaceable minde requisite bene wont wee haue profitable warning first wee see men able giuen aboue therefore let v learne brag owne strength see part men abuse themselues bearing themselues hand owne free wil able moue mountaines worke wonder must deceyued imagination must assure selues long god vpholdeth v may well stande loozen hande v shall cast downe thing whereof man boast muste altogyther depende aboue resort alwayes thither bee well strengthened herewithall wee see sodaine chaunge happened iob seemeth hath newe occasion bee pacience cursse day byrth considering howe hee dooth seuen dayes hee shewed himselfe pacient hee seemeth bee become quyte another man hee strength vanisheth away turning hande god continue ayding v wee see wherefore man lykened shadowe onely bycause lyfe frayle flightfull also bycause wee vnconstant holde v wee bee fickle mynded looking sometymes stately seeme wee courage lyon becomming faint harted woman neyther reason stomacke v farre wee hauing valiantnesse encounter temptation wee cannot abide muche heare man shoulde rebuke v lette v marke well suddennesse chaunge befalleth vntoo menne wee may looke better aboute v wee haue called vppon god morning lette v doo like day long bee short let v thinke vppon god continually without turning oure selues asyde anye maner wyse thus wee see howe wee muste alwayes bee carefull thus wee see howe wee must alwayes continue prayer supplication nowe let v come whiche sette downe text howe iob cursed day byrth haue bene would excuse iob altogither though beene caried away aduersitie howbeeit without blaspheming god imagine hee hathe forgotten pacientnesse whiche hee heretoofore hee altogither inraged hee hath mynde glorifie god caryed awaye owne passion speaketh man wittes heretofore hee blamed wife folly nowe hee sheweth himselfe double foole curssing day wherein hee borne certayne iob come suche extremitie alwayes purpose obey god wee shall see neuerthelesse mixture wit fighting hee fayleth wounded ceasseth receyue blowes staggereth steppeth awrie let v marke mixture wit iob hath sounde perfection hee afore yet notwithstanding although aduersitie pinched likely hee shoulde haue faynted middes way hee hilde course still still purpose obey god howbeeit meane sayeth paule accomplished good desired paule place treateth himselfe confesseth although whole desire giue himselfe vnto god yet notwithstanding came passe hindered owne nature ouerweake paule acknowledged muche himselfe let v thinke straunge like happen iob desirous frame himselfe good god yet affection perfect poynts must faine halte stoope herein see happened father iacob time god meant cause v vnderstande whensoeuer faithfull incounter temptation shall bee without carying awaye curste blowes shall leaue theyr markes behinde vve see howe iacob wrestled angell god wherefore hee god enemie bycause lorde tryeth mindeth also proue owne child haue seene first chapter therfore sayd patriarke iacob stroue wrestled angell vvhereby appeareth god ment exercise also iacob disposed himselfe beare bruntes hee shoulde put vnto insomuch god inhonored giuing name israell whiche much say mightie towardes god meane went hee away victorie withoute touch brest thigh crusshed suche sort halted lame lyfe vpper hand yet hee faine humbled behold faythful withstand temptation namely poynt may chaunce stoope yea euen wise god shall humble dayes life may haue occasion know infirmity till grone againe yet get vpper hand incountering god suffer vtterly oppressed muste god child comfort themselues god sendeth afflictios may well feele inward heauinesse mindes shall knowe way turne yea farre ouershoote themselues vse wordes excused yet infirmitie strength god shall ceasse dwell still hold vp sort shal feele themselues haue alwayes good affection although legges fayle yet hart shall holde owne still prouerbe sayeth thus ye see haue marke sentence may better vnderstand wherein iob ouershot farre let v consider maner lawfull men wearie lyfe haue bene many heathen men knowing misery earthly lyfe haue sayd day byrth ought time myrth ioy rather sorrow much man commeth beginneth weeping beholde creature full vncleannesse vyle miserable possible bee imagined moreouer wee marke thing well bottomlesse gulfe misery whereunto wee subiect wee haue eye present state condition lyfe wee shall haue cause say wee ought lament child borne oguth rather reioyce men die forasmuche bee deliuered many euilles heathen men spake maner howbeit vnderstanding able reache farre god leadeth v woorde sought present lyfe continue howbeit altogither eate drinke also honour purchase themselues estimation finish euery man owne course herewithall haue holy scripture telleth v god hath put v bylowe hath printed owne image v therefore wee ought consider noblenesse woorthinesse hee hath giuen v aboue creature god hath fashioned v owne image lykenesse whereby hee meeneth haue glorie shine v pray wee whereof reioyce selues wherefore magnifie furthermore besides eating drinking worlde wee haue also recorde god father purpose earth bringeth foorth hir foyzon euen nourish v withall happeneth fortune god hath ordeyned wherefore bycause hee woulde shewe himselfe father towardes v vvee see helpes whiche maynteyne v heere bylowe auouchmentes proufes fatherly loue god ought wee make account benefite yea wee make great account deserueth yet god exercise v bylowe hope heauenly lyfe giueth v taste calleth v bee serued honoured v ende shoulde knowe wee hath interteyned v bee housholde familie thing bee well considered haue good cause magnifie grace bestoweth vpon v sendeth v worlde inioye present life yet neuerthelesse true also wee haue cause sigh sob forasmuche bottomlesse pit misery long wee must marke whence proceedeth paynim knewe state menne miserable wee muste consider wherefore god hath made v subiect many inconueniences namely bycause sinne wee must haue recourse firste creation man consider god niggarde goodes hath poured bountifully fountayne liberalitie hath hee shewed himselfe liberall towardes mankinde persone adam wee bereft blissings requisite god cut benefites giuen v forsomuch father adam owne vnthankfulnesse turned away vntoo wickednesse sithe wee say miseryes present lyfe fruites sinnes wee haue occasion sighe bee miserable state harde troublesome giuen much naughtinesse great rebelliousnesse agaynst god whereas image ought shyne foorth v seemeth wee haue conspyred doo spyte cause sainct paule lamenteth wee see true sorrow christian ought make hauing cold heate induring disease calamity see themselues prison bondage sinne vvretch sayeth sainct paule sayeth hee bycause hee impacient hee lyfteth vp himselfe agaynste god hee instrument holy ghost sheweth v present life wee haue cause sighe grone without ceassing wee bee shutte vp deadly pryson subiecte many wicked lustes wee meanes atteyne dedicate selues vnto god reason great number corruption ceasse prouoke v vnto euill thus wee see howe wee maye lament cace example saynct paule giueth v rule thereof wee see howe iob cursed daye byrthe wherein hee bee excused neyther bee sayde hee ouershotte himselfe behoueth v ioyne bothe togyther witte god created v hee also prynted hys owne image v dyd v honour bee excellentest hys creature whiche respecte wee haue cause blisse name continually althoughe life bee full misery nothing bee yet cace standeth wee sufficientlye value inestimable benefite god hath bestowed vppon v giuing v present lyfe bycause mainteyning v therein hee maketh v feele experience hee hathe care v wyll meanes forsake v howsoeuer worlde go seeing wee haue haue wee whereof reioyce euen middest aduersityes faythfull man whiche speaketh good aduisement neuer cursse daye byrth miserie soeuer indure iob therefore behaueth hym selfe vnthankefully godwarde cursing day byrth cannot bee sayde hee deserued blame passing boundes furthermore let v marke child god maye also blisse byrthday meane considering want bewayle themselues wyth sainct paule simplie hauing eye benefyte whiche god gaue hee sent worlde true heathen men abused solemnized theyr byrthday exceede many folly superfluous pompes original welspring solemnizing byrthdayes holye father knewe good reason yeelde god thankes therefore hilde daye solemne feast ende prouoke themselues prayse god yea verily wee haue passed yeares life althoughe wee ought call god benefites remembraunce incessauntly yet requisite day entraunce worlde bee kepte euerlasting memoriall wee might say see well yeare past god hathe brought mee hitherto haue ended many wayes therefore meete shoulde nowe aske hym forgiuenesse aboue thing hee hathe shewed mee great fauour hee hath maynteyned mee alwayes hope saluation hath giuen hath deliuered many daungers therefore becommeth mee call remembraunce nowe enter intoo another yeare good prepare selfe seruing god euill aduentures haue passed shewe howe great neede haue succour without shall bee vndoone hundred thousande time thus see howe holye father woont solemnize theyr byrthdayes howe good profitable exercise heathen men say haue abused wee see thys day howe call themselues christian doe play flat mockholyday god solemnize theyr byrthdayes make reckening prayer thankesgyuing acknowledging theyr sinnes god benefites pampering themselues beastly manner haue sayde behoueth v alwayes blisse god vpon byrthdayes muche god hath set v heere worlde bee child hee hath put v foorth ox dogges reasonable creature beare image muche wee bee baptyzed name oure lorde iesus chryst besydes oure creation god hathe also moreouer prynted hys marke vppon v aduauntage intent wee shoulde bee deere friendes bee receyued intoo hys churche therein wee haue cause blisse god double cursse day theyr byrthe chafing miseryes affliction endure shewe well bee vnthankefull owne affliction doo muche ouermaster euen stoode cace iob therefore wee haue cause pray vntoo god without ceassing hee vouchsafe holde v backe nowe hee suffer v let slippe wicked wordes bee stedfast requisite yet notwithstanding thoughe wee bee shaken wee may fall recouer selues agayne learne gather oure wittes better aboute v brydle oure selues wee see hathe beene frayltie v wee maye condemne faulte intent returne agayne intoo right waye thus yee see wee haue marke heere sayde cursed bee night wherein worde brought beholde manchilde conceyued shoulde seeme iob meant spyte god dooing thoughe wee haue cause haue earst sayde blisse god creating v hys owne image likenesse yet case suche menne preferred woman mankinde know god hathe ordeyned man heade giuen dignitie preheminence ouer woman heere wee see also sainct paule sayeth man muste goe heade bare bicause hee glorie god woman glorie man true image god printed alyke bothe yet woman inferiour man wee muste goe degree whiche god hathe sette order nature reason god shoulde bee gloryfied bothe male female howebeeit hee muste chiefly bee gloryfied byrthe manchilde yet cleane contrarywise iob sayeth curssed bee night wherein reported manchilde borne hee become haue thoughte well thinges according god disposed dayes yes iob turneth contrarie heere wee see whiche haue touched namely hee wanzeth awaye owne passion hee forgetteth god graciousnesse whereof hee spoken afore sayde well seeing haue receiued benefite god hande shoulde wee also receyue euill wee bee bounde bee subiect vntoo iob shoulde haue borne thinges well minde howbeeit muche excellenter matter haue manchilde borne haue womanchilde hee sayeth cursed bee night wherein hee conceyued haue sayde afore teache v praye god arme v giue v strength power withstande temptation considering hee patterne pacience carried away therefore time wee bee incombred excesse oure fleshe prouoketh v suche wise wee haue quiet mynde obey god bee desyred let cause v bee heart sithe wee see thing hath befalne vntoo iob behoueth v humble oure selues acknowledging owne frayltie meane whyle good courage vntill god haue giuen v full victorie furthermore wee haue marke also suche haue child oughte reioyce hauing menchildren reiect theyr daughter wee see vaineglorious fooles doo thinke god dothe greate wrong hee sende menchildren purpose ende continue theyr house purchase estimation come credite lo manner men woulde prolong theyr owne lyfe euer yet meane whyle god giue daughter profite knowe therefore woulde haue god consent theyr foolishe fancy also god dooth oftentymes punishe presumptuousnesse hee giueth menchildren desirous scratch eye ende seagulfes swallowe vppe substaunce father opinion theyr child shall increase house haue malechildren yet commonly occasion bring house confusion shall bee poynted wyth finger cause thereof men applye themselues god vvhen men desire haue child desire good bee well ruled must come poynt lorde thou giue mee issue let bee ende thy name may bee honoured gone thou doo mee worship bee father let mee bring vppe child thou shalt giue mee maye bee rightly thine maye learne serue thee thou guide according thy good beholde say howe father mother muste content themselues vvhen god sendeth one childe whereas woulde haue three foure god sendeth daughter whereas woulde haue sonne let say euen lord thou knowest meete v wee must frame selues thereafter behold say wherein blissing god sheweth self forasmuch men inordinate desire meete god scorne folly way taught also despise one another whereas god hath honoured men giuing dignitie beeing heade mankinde appoynted woman bee inferiour degree men muste bee proude truely wee heare howe sainct paule sayth mankynde come man wit adam howe dooth hee continue meanes woman men coulde separate themselues woman maynteyne little worlde themselues alone shoulde haue good cause make boast nowe man consider himselfe hee sooner say father hee must say also mother seeing mankinde continued meanes woman becommeth v thinke wee bee bounde one v another furthermore purpose woman created verily shee shoulde bee helpe man behoueth hir also bee subiect yet shee mannes companion scripture termeth hir sayde among thinges god created anye helper coulde bee meete adam bycause hee nature like vntoo beastes excellent creation nowe woman bee mennes companion cause disdeyne men shoulde trample vnder theyr feete shake holde scorne must bee knitte togither sayd mutuall bond saying well god created v fashioned v hee mainteyneth v menne woman done ende wee shoulde liue togither one common accorde knowing bonde copartnershippe whiche god hathe consecrated inuiolable betwixt v thus wee see wee haue remember wee may behaue selues vprightly nowe let v come whiche rehearsed heere sayde iob wyshed daye byrthe ouerwhelmed darkenesse brunt vppe wyth beate daye stormes tempectes stryken oute course yeare mighte haue starres might come intoo kalender bee vnder gouernment moone seemeth heere woulde peruert whole order nature hereby wee see howe oure passion boyle wythin v true men coulde mourne without excesse affliction condemned vvhy lorde iesus christ affectionlesse yea wee see hee endured greefe hee felt hee sighed sadde yet vnspotted lambe god insomuche nothing coulde blamed hee heauinesse saue onely haue sayde alreadie sorrowing moderated conuenient wicked sinfull selfe passion wicked bycause bee wrapped sturdinesse agaynst god dystrust outrage flesh god send v good euill v glad specially wee cannot yeeld thankes must haue hart libertie feele good lucke hee hathe sente v menne alwayes full vanitie neuer make themselues merry without offending god example god sende ryches goeth wote vaynglorye medled cannot tell howe leastwyse call vppon god suche feruentnesse woont doo become verye lazie giue selues ouer whiche haue hande bee short fast men purpose make themselues merrie bee sad euermore bee excesse hardlye holde themselues offending god bicause haue suche staye themselues requisite let themselues runne randon specially aduersitie bee great menne shall verie hardly scape forgette themselues bee caried awaye according befalleth heere vntoo iob hee sayeth hee woulde fayne byrthdaye quite wyped yeare hee himselfe dispose dayes yeare hee shoulde desyre chaunge god ordinaunce lorde sheweth v modestie wee ought keepe making othes sayth yee able make one heares youre heade whyte blacke blacke white howe sweare heade iob passeth somewhat hee woulde plucke starres skie hee would set whole worlde fyre burne vp earth woulde haue clowdes windes thing else mingle themselues togither desire hereby wee see men much pinched wyth aduersitie ouershoote themselues suche wyse remayneth modestie thing else outrage sith wee see iob behoueth v stande vppon garde bee well aduised sorrowing affliction bee sort meane whyle god blissed hee doth wee prouoke displeasnre euen vnaduisednesse certaine iob ment displease god willingly neyther intent dooe agaynst god minde befell vnaduisednesse passion blinde wee haue witte discerne wander without keeping eyther waye pathe muche wee knowe affection bee outrageous haue much neede pray god rule v way wee compare iob wyth blaspheme god open mouth pray howe woorthie suche men bee condemned iob hauing serued god tyme lyfe neuerthelesse set vppon scaffolde spirite god ende men might perceyue theyr owne wretchednesse humble themselues vnderstande grace god fayleth forewardenesse cast themselues hell bee hilde backe seeing god exercyse iob suche sorte set oute gazing stocke make serue example learning vntoo others shall become blaspheme god yea euen without cause heart griefe happen troubled man doo styrre choler yee shall see teare god name peeces thinke ought serue excuse say chafe mee man happen doo little displeasure flie chaunce crosse eye iesus christe death bloud fleshe euer hee hath shall bee torne peeces woulde say lorde iesus christ taken man flesh vppon bee made rayling stocke monster handes woorthie liue vpon earth yet notwithstanding take theyr excuse saye suche man anger mee thou supposest thou bendest thy selfe agaynst man yet notwithstanding thou bendest thee agaynst hym hathe grieued thee cace god offended come aduaunce themselues wise agaynst god seeme monster contrarie nature therefore lette v take heede wee brydle affection god name bee blasphemed v whereas ought bee praysed blissed marke one speciall poynt furthermore wee see blaspheming god men haue certaine naturall rhetorike cunning art lacke god hathe giuen v speache intent wee shoulde confesse bee good righteous full equitie respectes caces ende oure talke indeuer shoulde bee speake hym reuerence commeth poynt god shoulde bee honoured aboue thinges wee speake fayntlye scarcely man wring little woorde v shall bee well set men go blaspheming yee shall see eloquent may bee deuysed man maye seeme haue beene schoole learne fine rhetorike euen iob set purpose haue sayde afore withhilde himselfe muche able hee fought agaynst temptation yet notwithstanding see howe owne nature caried awaye suche wyse hee coulde holde hymselfe kinde rhetorike whiche flowing wheretoo else serueth setting downe manye fashion speache whiche hee heapeth vppe intoo little pyle muche wee see suche vyce rooted menne haue wee doo vvee muste pray god open oure mouth giue v grace woordes may tende honour moreouer restraine v suche sorte wee maye take good heede wee speake vntowardly aduenture occasion giuen talke iudgementes good hee hath done v correction hee hathe sent v suche lyke thing wee maye beare suche reuerence maiestie woordes may bee well framed may bee anye reproche much lesse outrage wee see happened vntoo iob yea wee must bee prouoked therevntoo hee sayth let woont curse dayes curse daye byrth let rayse vppe weeping lamentation ban night wherein conceyued seeing iob speaketh wee see yet better men haue neyther measure stay themselues affection beginne boyle vp like potte first seething ouerpast hath cast first skumme walloppes come man cannot stoppe euen fare affection outrageous man cannot weeld first brunt contrarywise wee see taught v holye scripture namely dauid ment prayse god became contented applie wittes indeuer dooing call men beare companie hee sayeth also yee heauens thou earth ye tree yee hilles thou hayle thou snow thou rayne ye senselesse creature prayse ye lorde vvee see zeal ousnesse ought bee v wee mynde serue god good earnest witte wee must desyre onely menne woman also sencelesse creature shoulde one common consent applie themselues prayse god v may bee nothing worlde neither aboue beneath shall bende selfe wholy glorifie god herewithall also let v pray god giue v grace bee able imploy selues thereaboutes strengthen v temptatios may chaunce onely agaynste assaultes shall made vpon v enemy without also agaynst affection within v let v fall downe presence good god acknowledgment offence beseeching make v vnderstad better open eye behold misery wherewith like drowned vtterly fordone may learne haue recourse soueraine goodnesse may cotinew thing shall haue begone v making v taste loue hee sende v affliction eyther reason sinnes tryall pacience may vngracious grudge rather blisse assuring selues hath iuste cause chastyze v yet neuerthelesse beseeching gouerne v suche wyse holy spirit wee may desire nothing frame selues good ende hee may cause precious bloud sonne shedde redemption bee auaylable v wee may bee settled therein vntill haue gathered v vp immortall glorie wherevnto calleth v may please graunt grace onely vnto v also people nation earth bringing poore ignorant soules knowledge c twelfth sermon second vpon third chapter sermon contayneth yet still exposition tenth verse verse folowing vvherefore died mother wombe wherefore yeelde vp ghoste soone come hir wombe vvherefore knee receyue wherefore haue sucked teates shoulde haue lyen still taken rest shoulde quyet rest mee vvith kinges counsellers earth buylde desert place vvith prince haue golde hoorde vp siluer house shoulde vnty mely byrth hidden infant hath seene lyght wicked rest trouble haue traueled lie rest prisoner rest togither man heareth voyce extortioner greate small equall seruant free maister haue declared heretofore bee heauy sorowfull onely remembrance god benefites muste cheere v leastwise asswage misery griefes aduersitie pinch bethinke great number benefites god hath done mee must asswage sorrow sith cace standeth affliction ought make v forget knowledge whiche wee haue god benefites grace yet notwithstanding commeth passe vvhereof see example iob true mirrour pacience soeuer misery indured yet ought haue acknowledged greate good fortune hee sent reasonable creature world borne image god hee bene cherished mainteyned vnto man age intent myght know god bee father beholde benefites inestimable yet iob farre commending hee wisheth hee neuer tasted vvee see howe sore temptation trouble v steede taking comforte asswagement sorowes god benefites wee turne corzie somuch could finde hart god neuer done v good wee neuer knowne iob vtterly minde bycause woordes escaped mouth without aduisement force miserie hee indured incouragement v consent vnto wicked intentes wee muste brydle selues suche wise fancy come heade wee may driue greate way v certaine greate sinfull infirmitie worthy bee condemned wee see example shewed v two twentyth psalme persone dauid specially persone lorde iesus christe dauid man destitute helpe whome god sheweth himselfe contrarie muche hee seemeth vtterly shaken therefore hee cryeth god god haste thou forsaken mee spoken persone iesus christ heade faithfull yet neuerthelesse hath thus made mone hee addeth lorde thou diddest draw mee mother wombe thou diddest gather mee vp matrice thou haste shewed thy selfe bee god coulde knowe thee call vpon thee dauid set geere purpose render thankes vnto god sing vnto name middes sorowes afterwarde stablysheth himselfe good hope time come doubting god regarded styll copassion considering shewed gracious pitifull towards alreadie see lesson comon men distressed aduersitie vttermoste euen seemeth vayne thing lost labour call vnto god yet behoueth v cosider hath created v put v world imprinting owne image v giuing v many token knowe taketh v child ought make v lyfte vp mindes alofte yeelde worthy prayse moreouer must serue v spurre make v trust doubting shewe himselfe hereafter whome wee haue felte heretofore true better man vnborne vtterly lefte vp vnto miserie muche lorde sayeth vnhappie whome offence come farre better suche man hee neuer bene borne yea cace standeth vpon suffering calamity trouble wee muste take sore harte forgette gracious goodnesse hee shewed v pleased make v inioy lyghte worlde specially condition child bicause hee hath printed image v therefore peece vnthankefulnesse iob let v marke therwithall spake one consented suche meaning hee turmoyled escaped mouthe vnwares yet neuerthelesse fully resolued hart still god done muche good reason hee ought acknowledge hereby wee bee taught although god strengthen v holy spirite haue pacience power withstand aduersities yet notwithstading frailenesse mingled much griefe shall carie v away hideous tempest v wee shall able rule selues poynts requisite hereby warned walke feare stande continually vpon garde beseeching god succour releeue suche weakenesse hee knoweth v furthermore tyme wee assaulted passe bondes make complaintes let vt praye god arme v wee may well atchieue combate howsoeuer worlde go let v practyze lesson haue spoken set eye benefites god whiche wee haue receyued time paste intent may comforte v soro doo ouermate v oppresse v altogither wee may keepe still taste god goodnesse ende wee maye hope styll mercye hande notwithstanding wee haue lykelyhoode seemeth wee bee vtterly shutte thus yee see wee haue marke streyne herewithall wee see menne fallen vnto wickednesse ho alreadie muche haue sayde doore mother wombe shutte vp borne worlde hee addeth knee receyue mee sucke teate herein wee see iob considereth god benefytes owne profite albeit hee haue felte greate number rather reiecteth altogyther make ill beginning therefore wee muste take good heede selues soone lorde maketh v knowe good wee haue receyued hande muste touche v quycke wee may bee churlishe frowarde turne good euyll wee beginne forgette god gyftes turne contrarie wee ought certayne inconuenience vyce wyll followe v vttermoste wee see example iob vvhen god openeth moothers womb let v worlde hee gyueth v certayne woman take v vp according wee see verie needefull considering poore humane creature commeth foorthe greate necessitie thing bee done hee prepareth nourishmente whereby wee bee strengthened hee turneth woman bloude milke wee myght sucke sustenance god doeth prouyde v euen tyme wee haue neyther wytte reason daunger death able helpe selues aske helpe folkes handes god preuenteth ouergoeth v vvee see benefytes diuers kindes wee see iob put bundle angrye therefore lette v heereby take warning bee moued consider god fatherly goodnesse thanke often hee setteth foorthe anie benefytes wee haue receyued wee haue begonne lette v go throughe sayde frenche prouerbe loaues made horned setting amisse ouen menne haue ouershorte themselues wote howe keepe measure nowe happened vnto iob indewed singular constancie shall become v leaues needeth little blaste winde shake v downe lette v vnderstande neede wee haue flee vnto god hee may reache v mightie hande iob hath sayde addeth yet worser whiche hee dead shoulde haue rest reason sayeth hee death endeth thing eyther riche poore seruaunt mayster haue troubled worlde holde themselues quiet haue bene troubled also reste shoulde lye still sleepe haue care feeling miserie seemeth firste blushe iob speaketh heere lyke heathen man hath hope lyfe come resurrection howebeit neuer cleane wyped harte sometymes greate headdie passion v seede god choked lyght religiousnesse whiche wee ought haue dimmed conceytes thereof caste vnder foote beare sway
