well woorth nothing neede bee declared length bee well vnderstoode vvee see howe present affliction blinde v bee sommer wee bee ouerwhote wee muste take theyr familiar example seemeth one paynefullest trouble man indure specially man bee ouerloden hee faynt bee able holde hee woulde haue froste shoulde clyue stone hee thinkes hee shoulde bee well refreshed hee shoulde bee ease bee winter wee thinke heate bee greate v lo howe present passion cary v away befalleth men yet notwithstanding muche tender nyce suffer aduersitie bee therefore according eche man nature complexion thereafter doth hee torment himselfe aduersitie hee indureth thereafter dothe hee martyr himselfe vttermoste asmuche wee see suche experience wee knowe men caryed away affection suche wise thinke vpon nothing thing grieueth tormenteth thing bee seene heere iob hee ouerpressed miserie hee lo eth vntoo whiche shoulde befall death thinketh nothing seconde lyfe saye hee thought nothing spake sorte aduenture true hee knowledge beliefe printed harte lay couered fyre choked ash let v thinke straunge euill sinfull affection shoulde cause v forgette thing knewe sure afore wee see howe good zeale hath propertie moyses sainct paule vvhen moyses desired god bee striken booke lyfe ende people might bee saued wee see good holy minde euen suche one god allowed yet somewhat bee gainesayde doth moyses thinke god roote owne chozen god chaungeable purpose moyses knewe well god chozen accepted bee one child howe dothe hee desyre bee wyped booke lyfe muche saye hee neuer bene reckened number muste obteyne euerlasting lyfe dothe hee demaunde god waye hypocrisie nothing caryeth away owne zealousnesse feruent hee passeth sor nothing welfare people committed vnto matter hee hearde sentence condemnation god woulde destroy child abraham offpriug god hath chozen himselfe bee rooted couenant god muste also needes bee abolyshed lorde rather lette bee razed thy booke say al people heere shall perishe moyses seazed greate anguishe hee forgat himselfe hee regarde himselfe neyther considered whome god hath chozen muste necessitie bee preserued euen ende gone little thus wee see desired wyped booke lyfe much bee sayde sainct paule woulde wishe sayeth hee bee cursed brethren sake howe sainct paule knew himselfe bee member lorde iesus christe sure hee instrument purposely chozen glorifie woulde hee nowe repeale sayde grace woulde hee breake course god determination hee knewe well vnchaungeable hee himselfe declareth anone contrarietie yea inconuenience came sayde zeale whiche good holy draue inflamed suche sorte hee respect owne welfare present tyme desirous god fulfill promise ofspring abraham intent name myght bee blasphemed nowe wee see example good affection doo sometimes steppe asyde way god child make forget knowen certayne vnto sith cace stadeth must thinke straunge though iob hardly distressed hee forced speake like harebrayne maketh men alike equall bee deade seeme saying menne perishe none lyfe dealing thus well coceyued opinion minde ingraued harte hee speaketh man raueth traunce griefe blinded hee owne man become like boyling sea wherein waues iustle one agaynste another see wee fayre lookingglasse whereby wee may perceyue affection blinde bicause folowe reason knowe thing wee ought bee moste certayne fully resolued worlde shall become v wee knowe wee created better lyfe better v wee ass ox brute beastes inioy present lyfe feede take theyr rest trauell without greate feeling men eate one morsell breade without care middes pleasure haue number hartbytings owne besydes wante anoyances men handes euery man himselfe becommeth owne hangman therefore wee haue hope seconde lyfe shall become v truely lordes shoulde abyde printed harte menne according wee see although heathen men become brutishe yet notwithstanding retayned styll knowledge seconde lyfe immortalitie soule knewe god hathe lefte marke whereby make vnexcusable yea euen toombes haue made burie deadefolkes euen recorde resurrection heere wee see iob wiste nothing vvhat shall wee saye wee haue sayde alreadie witte wee gyue heade affection put eye else seele vp close wee see neuerawhit speake without aduysed vnderstanding staye talke beholde wherevpon wee ought muze side lette v marke grace gyuen iob hee vtterly consent raunging talke bene blaspheming god onely lette slippe suche woordes randon man asked sayest thou difference betweene good men badde dothe death make finall ende thinges thou speakest heere lyke infidell neuer knewe god god religion god teacheth v death better lyfe euerlasting heritage hee hath prepared whome hee hath chozen reprobate seeyng haue despyzed theyr lyfe shall knowe bee iudge iob bene posed thus hee woulde haue confessed suche thing yea euen vnfaynedly yet hee ceasseth ouershoote himselfe thing also wee see matter consisteth knowing wee muste perseuer knowledge withstande temptation assayle v haue readde holy scripture wee haue haunted sermon haue bene taught requisite man saluation yet bee negligent bende oure minde bethinke v thing wee haue hearde afore one man beeing well furnished corselet murryon swoorde target shoulde hang vp vpon spirget suffer armour ruste swoorde sticke faste scabberd hee come haue neede hee may well say haue armour weapon ready shall boote looke vpon yee see furniture vnprofitable bycause hee hath suffered ruste moreouer hee shall knowe howe handle eyther swoorde target neede euen standeth case v vvee may well haue knowne thing good conuenient saluation yet wee thinke selues bee handsome well appoynted men wee shall haue skill howe applie thing behoofe knowledge shall bee rustie shall come remembrance wee haue neede might stande v beste steade see wee good lesson v ynough v haue knowen thing god sheweth v profit wee muste also exercise without ceassing remembrance muste bee refreshed intent wee may knowe true vse holy scripture whiche spoken befell vnto iob notwithstanding earnestly minded worde god meene word written woorde god hath giuen aspiracion say missed besotted neede shall become v muche weaker hee therefore lette v beseeche good god time make v humble suffer owne infirmitie ouerrule v wee haue suche power warde satan blowes requisite yet notwithstanding may bee crossed reckening booke bee called account thus wee see wee haue wee bee assoyled god hande muste wee first condemne faultes wee perceyue ourselues furthermore touching state seconde lyfe scripture sheweth v muche expedient bee knowen behalfe true men come ende race god draweth backe hence beneathe life likened course race therfore haue made ende race iourney death yet wee ceasse eyther bee payne else bee blissed ioye soules parted body lo wee haue beare minde touching paynes present lyfe care eating drinking mainteyning oure selues apparell keeping oure selues harme taking well meanes men meanes beastes shall vtterly ceasse yet meane saide childre god gathered vp ioy true yet wee haue crowne promised v whiche prepared v whole body iesus christ muste bee made full perfect togyther heere wee see sayde lyfe lyeth hidde christe vntill tyme c mming yet faythfull resting abraham bosome already farre foorth parttakers sayde ioy knowe god father truste whiche haue vayne specially wee muste marke howe sainct paule sayeth long wee bee shutte vp within mortall body wee walke hope without beholding sight thing promised v thing hid v wee bee parted worlde wee see thing wee hoped thing earst hid v shewed openly vnto v vve see howe faythfull departed worlde ioy god knowe forasmuche bee christes member perishe yea knowe muche better greater power done present lyfe reprobate condemned caytifs wayte houre execution torment sure alreadie co demnation heere wee see sayde diuelles locked vp darke prison bounde chaynes vntill come sayde finall confusion whiche prepared agaynste comming lorde iesus christe thus wee see scripture dothe briefly shewe v concerning state seconde lyfe wayting laste daye spoken soberly vnto v bycause wee bee muche gyuen fonde curious question wee see men loue better bee inquisitiue done paradise knowe whiche waye come thither beholde god selfe telleth v saying come mee hee sheweth v wee may come thither wee passe woulde maruell see howe colde bee standeth vpon poynt going vnto meanes hee hath giuen v yet meane whyle wee bee buzie demaunding done heere doone vvee desirous knowe whiche god hath hidden v hee haue v knowe ought nowe onely parte heere wee see holye scripture vseth sobernesse bycause wee shoulde couet bee ouersuttle fonde question bee contented knowe whiche profite yet neuerthelesse standeth v hande bee well resolued sayde article witte death reste men true men yea euen wicked also haue sayde shall bee discharged necessity present lyfe meane season fayle bee tormented feeling god bee theyr iudge whose hande looke mercy knowe confusion throughly ready shall bee plunged downe hell seeing say caste repriued day feele vnquietnesse whiche passeth paynes tormentes worlde behoueth v knowe intent wee lyue belowe wee may pray god guyde v holy spirite wee may couer vnlawfull thing wayting continually tyll hee accomplishe promise gathering v togyther heauenly kingdome lo wee haue beare minde touching reste although iobs talk square haue said alredy yet notwithstanding wee may gather good profitable lesson howe vvhen hee sayeth kinges prince doo buylde vp desert place hee sheweth foolishe vaynegloriousnesse worldelings suche woulde make themselues renoumed heere vvhen men deuise practyze consulte buylding house palace wee knowe commonly excesse vvhe proceede according order nature say vell god wyll wee shoulde lodge heere belowe therevpon doe buylde themselues house dwell according theyr article good lyne drawe meane magnifie themselues worlde content themselues wil printe euerlastingnesse name palace castelles wyll haue bee seene farre vvho buylded suche place yonder prince thus yee see vayne gloriousnesse passeth beyonde order nature iob mente gyue inkling hee sayde men lyue vpon earth prycked muche care wyse take muche payne fayle heaue one another bee prycked theyr owne lustes wage battell agaynste nature meaneth buylding desertes make buyldinges incredible man commeth place hee maye take vp hys hande blisse saying howe posible haue buylded place situation bee conuenient easie buylde vpon man see fayre buylding vpon well shall thought strange matter bee mockt maner quippe man see place vnapprochable take vpon say wyll make place estimation beholde desert buylded vp beholde made new worlde suche maner men meene stomake agaynste god purpose reforme worlde order god hath set wyll haue seene nothing shall let theyr purpose whereas god hath sette barres say muste go leape quite ouer lo vainegloriousnesse many men thing iob mente betoken heere also sayde woordes farre square howsoeuer case standeth man maye yet gather good lesson moreouer hee addeth seruaunt set free mayster poore riche one shewe v men muste glorie theyr present greatenesse according sainct paule speaketh principality wherein hee speaketh dauid dothe thus hee sayeth psalme haue sayde ye god vvhich muche say prince suche authoritie god li etenants haue preheminence aboue reste worlde thoughe god priuiledged yet yee mortall men shall dye men assure selues thus wee see whiche aduaunced hyghe estate oughte dazle men eye rather acknowledge theyr owne frayle state asmuche worlde shape thereof passeth away theyr rich theyr credite honor shall come nought therefore let besot selues let continually thinke vpon death let haue seruauntes subiectes vnder thinke thus themselues muste come account wee haue one heauen maister v sainct paule sayeth accepting person shall bee bondage mastershippe men alleage god true earthly policie also state magistrate ordeyned god concerneth worlde worldely thing whiche shall take ende therefore muste thing bee transitorie also let v take heede wee holde selues lowlynesse modestie wee attempt thing whiche god hath giuen v libertie doe nowe let v returne matter wee beganne withall wit iobs talke ceassed bee outrageous excessiue without measure hee hadde consented vnto beene horrible blasphemie case standeth forasmuche suche strength selfe bee able master himselfe hee attaynted many euill faultes men muste needes feele encountering haue alwayes infirmity theyr fleshe furthermore wee see heere howe iob speaketh little babe whereas hee sayeth vntimely byrthe muche hee ment tell v god putteth humane creature mother wombe hath soule contrarily wee knowe creature conceyued mother wombe god breatheth soule certayne hathe seede lyfe iob sheweth himselfe bee well ynough settled wittes consider god workes iudge rightly discerne betweene blacke whyte altogyther strayght whereof commeth euen hardinesse passion haue sayde vvee see heere tempeste storme maketh iob bothe deafe blinde sometimes thundreth ayre sore troubled man heare thing oure wittes bee vtterly amazed therewithall bee striken feare see flash lyghtning heare thundercrackes ratling sore vehement hayle wee imagine wee shoulde bee fordoone wee shrinke selues inwarde suche wyse dare put head euen stoode cace iob vvherefore let v consider thing withall let v also beare minde doctrine haue touched already true muste marke two thing wee haue two extremity whereof behoueth v take hede one sorte thinke pacience man bee altogither peaceable sorte opinion although man chafe agaynste god resist yet hee ceasseth bee pacient conditionally ende hee mislyke faulte repent men gyue themselues brydle take leaue committe many sinnes yea suppose themselues bee pacient haue stomaked agaynste god meane bereeue themselues god grace therefore wee must take heede two extremity let v marke pacientnesse submitting selues god good bee without greefe stomake matter time feele waues come rushing v wee shold senseles person behalfe rather wee bee suche battels let v discourage selues matter lette v call vpon god therewithall feeling continually howe greately wee giltie let v pray strengthen v power holie spirite wee may able withstand assaultes whereby myght oppressed firste blowe hee susteyned v beholde say howe behoueth v deale ende god shall haue gyuen v power strength withstand temptation may encrease v vntill come ende battels let v fall presence good god acknowledgement fault beseeching make v feele better haue done may sory craue pardon walke aduisednesse beeing shrowded vnder shadowe wing may fenced good inuincible defence aduersarie euer ca practyze v asmuch inuironed many want world let v pray also bee strengthned power fro aboue may faynt midst iourney hold race hauing alwaies eye vpon glory promised v heauen purchased v death passion lord iesus christ doubting wee shall fully perfectly enioy shall haue earst taken possession beneath hope pacience may please graunt grace onely v also people nation worlde c thirtenth sermon third vpon third chapter vvhy gyueth hee lyght miserie lyfe vnto haue sorrow full harte vvhiche wayte death commeth whiche seeke busily treasure woulde reioyce bee merye woulde bee gladde myght finde graue vvhy giueth light man whose way hidden god hath shet vp sighing commeth take repaste roaring lyke ouerflowing water haue met thing stoode feare thing mistrusted falne vpon mee haue bene prosperitie haue bene quiet rest yet notwithstanding trouble come vpon mee iob complayneth though god men wrong put worlde exercise store misery maketh reckening god haue v liue mainteine v owne ease incomber v many trouble thus see briefly conteyned verily iobs intent pleade agaynst god woulde go lawe yet meane whyle greefe hee susteyned carryed farfoorth complayntes passed mouth nowe vvherefore hath god set v world end know father wee shoulde blisse bycause wee sure hath care v contrariwise bee seene many men afflicted tormented many misery purpose doth god holde poynt seemeth hee would haue name bee blasphemed vvhat whome hee handleth rigorously see death eye rather haue betweene teeth fret chafe thus wee see occasion murmuring agaynst god seemeth himselfe cause haue good profitable lesson assure selues whe god scourgeth v yet hee ceasseth giue v taste goodnesse wise euen middest affliction wee may still prayse reioyce yet notwithstanding true restrayneth ioyes turneth bitternesse meane betwixte blessing god name blaspheming whiche meane call vpon wee bee oppressed aduersitie resorte vnto desiring receyue v vnto mercy men neuer keepe meane except god haue eye himselfe scourgeth v therefore let v marke firste whensoeuer god sendeth v trouble sorowes hee ceasseth make v taste goodnesse therewithall asswage anguishe myghte holde harte distresse vvee haue shewed heretofore men eye god former benefites towardes yea though hee hath susteyned childehoode hee brought mother wombe giuen lyfe ynough comfort euen bee ouerloden dispayre make thinke may god punishe v iustly wee bee bounde beare paciently aduersitie hee sendeth nature teacheth v forasmuch hee bestoweth many benefites vpo v according iob hath shewed heeretofore vvee see howe onely one consideration ought asswage sorrowes according bee seene men put suger hony medicine ouer bitter wyll alay suche sorte pacient may better take wheras otherwise would go neere choke yet matter namely god sheweth v vse chastyzementes whiche hee sendeth v whiche hee meeneth destroy v ofte hee scourgeth v profite welfare hee promiseth v wee bee faythfull hee suffer v racked measure supporte v wee bee afflicted reason wee shoulde take pritche agaynst god though founde nothing rigour hande wee bee comforted affliction vnthankfulnesse letted v myght reioyce say blissed name god although hee sende v owne desire thus muche firste poynte nowe herewithall wee muste marke also seconde article whiche haue touched already although wee haue nothing distresse although bee hilde vpon racke wee haue nothing comforte v yet muste wee bee hasty take pritche agaynst god wee muste rather call vpon according sayde let sorrowfull pray sainct iames sheweth v meane whiche wee oughte holde wee bee merrie sayeth let v sing maner worlde whiche ruffleth royetteth without acknowledging good come god rendring prayse god gladnesse wee bee sorrowe heauinesse let v pray vnto god beseeching pitie v abate rigour thus wee see faythfull theyr wittes ende go yet muste rushe agaynste god finde faulte neither muste outrage whiche full pryde rebelliousnesse rather let v thinke thus lorde see selfe bee wretched creature knowe become woote doo except thou receyue mercy shewe thy selfe pitifull towardes mee releeue miserie longer beare thus wee see child god muste beare aduersities pacietly although god chastize roughly tyme seene although iob co tinually minded lesson yet hee sufficiently armed withstand temptation sayth vvhy god giue light suche troubled mindes remembred god iust cause keepe men middes many misery although state bee wretched belowe yet god righteous still albeit punishe v keepe v occupied many wayes yet becommeth v holde plea vnder colour holdeth v shutte vp prison wee bee lyfe neither must conceyue displeasure iob sufficiently consider nowe suche persone iob happened ouershoote himselfe kicke agaynste god want hauing sayde regarde haue spoken muche muste wee set mindes vpon sayde two poyntes wit beare remembrance god neuer forsaketh v therefore wee may bee ouersorowfull god sendeth v aduersities bycause wee bee sure chastizing v sorte therewithall hee releeueth greefe leastwise long selues owne vnthankfulnesse secondly whe wee bee distressed wee god calleth allureth v friendly vnto yea say hee prouoketh v resorte vnto prayer often wee bee vtterly stripped wee haue lo heere true remedy call vpon good god haue pitie vpon v suffer v bee dismayde say wote purpose go vnto god let v keepe selues suche incombrance perswade selues wee shall alwayes sure fare well wee call vpon god bee alwayes mercifull v euen middest affliction vvhen wee haue two poynts well settled remembrace shall say vvherefore god holdeth heere whiche sorrowe minde wee see wherefore hee doeth greate reason god shoulde chastyze men greate sinnes number infinite agayne wee looke vpon lustes also bottomlesse gulfe whiche hath neede bee mended god therefore muste mortifie v furthermore wee consider howe muche wee bee gyuen worlde wee shall finde affliction neede bee plucked god chastyzementes moreouer howe greate pryde presumptuousnesse therefore muste god needes humble v besides howe colde wee craue helpe therefore hee muste bee fayne inforce v finally ought fayth bee tryed made knowen see wee reason inowe god holdeth v heere haue v bee miserable nothing payne trouble torment anguishe whole lyfe sufficient reason god shoulde marke heere speciall poynte sithe hee continually calleth v vnto maketh v free passage vnto wee haue suche remedie misery may wee holde selues well apayed vvee see howe wee oughte bee armed fenced agaynste sayde temptation whiche reygned ouermuche iob howebeit hee vtterly ouercome iob speaketh heere suche desire graue whiche willingly dyg hidden treasure longing dye cannot hee putteth selfe ranke wee shall see sequele wherin confirmeth owne infirmitie vice lawfull faythfull mislyke owne lyfe wishe death true wee may wishe death one respect whiche consideration wee bee hilde suche bondage sinne wee serue god freely bee wished bycause ouerfraught vice respect certaine may sigh desire god take v quickly worlde sayde afore may bee hate lyfe wee bee weery bee hilde bycause wee bee handled ouer rigorously wee muste beare lot paciently wayting god leysure delyuer v wee see paule holdeth selfe measure hee sayeth romanes ala shall delyuer mee mortall body vnhappie yet therewithall hee sayeth thankes bee god lorde iesus christe lo heere howe sainct paule one syde calleth himselfe vnhappie desireth bee taken worlde syde contented reste bycause god preserueth hee knoweth god wyll neuer forsake howbeit hee bee subiecte many misery vvee see heere contentation wee may better vnderstande whole lette v marke howe iob hath done amysse two poyntes witte hauing regarde hee ought haue desyring death also keeping measure heere wee see two faultes grosse vvhen say iob eye fastned vpon marke hee oughte meane wyshing death bycause hee sawe himselfe bee miserable sinner coulde attayne perfection whiche v oughte labour bycause hee weerie nipping greefes well whiche hee presently indured persone hee susteyned gooddes hee desired death bycause seemed god pressed ouersore thus wee see firste faulte spake wee apply owne vse wyll bee yet better vnderstoode apparaunte man searche trye selfe throughly thinke thus himselfe giuen suche vice fight agaynste come purpose matter one vice alone haue two three torment mee surely yet giue selfe brydle neither wounde selfe feare vengeance god wyll holde selfe suche sorte bee vtterly vanquished see muste bee muche earnest seruing god fighting agaynst worlde mine owne fleshe verye requisite shoulde bee hilde backe hindered myne owne lustes saye man acknowledge himselfe suche one hee hath well examined lyfe hee sayeth therevpon yea god see selfe miserable plyght shall bee deliuered needes muste beare sinne although reigne yet doth dwell mee else sinne diuelles scepter whereby hee reigneth ouer v bondslaue satan death god muste tarie euermore weerysome plight christian man may well haue suche sighes beseech god set free suche bondage wherein hee seeth himselfe bee matter concerne aduersitie must regard nother colde heate pouertie sicknesse must haue eye onely sinnes specially god punisheth v wise soeuer bee wee muste mounte vp higher without resting vpon bodily aduersitie thinke thus selues behold fruites sinnes forasmuche wee haue done agaynst god wyll good reason hee shoulde shewe himselfe iudge towardes v vvhen wee haue thus acknowledged sinnes worketh remorse v prouoketh v conceyue sorow whereof paule speaketh thus muche concerning firste poynte ynough thinke afore sayde wit wishe death suche wise haue earst shewed houeth also keepe measure say wee muste onely wish vpon good cause wee muste also brydle desire bee ruled good pleasure god bring passe outrage whiche shewed heere iob shall bee restreyned brydle haue alreadie touched poynt texte alleaged paule made moane wished deliuered prison death addeth thanke god hee ceasseth bee quyet euen midst complaynts longing hee seeth good reason god shoulde bee master gouerne v pleasure wee shoulde paciently wayte ende hee listeth gyue v paule perceyuing concludeth immediately although hee wretched sinner yet notwithstanding sure god guyde wise saluation miscarie paule eye two thing therefore hee sayeth hee yeeldeth god thankes notwithstanding hee bee miserie euen muste wee doyng shall onely readier indure misery world honour god hee may bee glorified bothe person humilitie also wee shall bee wylling suffer neyghboures sainct paule also sheweth v owne example hee sayeth philippian himselfe shoulde bee farre better bee taken oute worlde youre sake sayeth hee requisite lyue bicause know haue yet neede laboure god imployeth mee aboute edifying fayth vnto submit selfe afterwarde hee sayeth although behoofe goe hence oute hande yet willing abyde still lo howe sainct paule exhorteth men submitte themselues suche wyse vnto god pleasure whyle lyue thys worlde may onely beare theyr affliction pacientlie also bee readie suffer theyr neyghbours theyr labour may profitable comon weale themselues seruice churche god thus wee see wee haue marke lesson yet vnderstode asmuche put vre god leaue v rest yee shall see v blinded vayne fond ioy wee bee ouersotted know neither death owne frailtie neither haue discretion god visite v affliction needes bee asked whether blaspheme whether othes passe mouth store misliking murmuring impaciencie shall bee full sturdinesse wind dore v many thinke vpon sinnes grone vnder burden therewithall looke vnto ayde god giueth hee suffereth vtterly ouercome satan therevppon doo quiet themselues take comfort hee preserueth number small yet written vaine generall haue consider faithfull may wel sigh grone life long till god haue taken world alwayes wishing ende saye death yet notwithstanding must restreyne selues wise maye wholly submitte themselues god good pleasure knowing made themselues firste say faithfull maye well sighe folke wearie long pinning prison theirfleshe namely cause haue touched bicause serue god freedome requisite drawe line amisse woorke awrye oftentimes swarue aside wee muste syghe farrefoorth lawfull v done often enter consyderation owne ouerwearinesse matter standeth vpon seruing god must spurre v desire god take v worlde make v haue eye lyfe prepared v heauen shall fully shewed vpon v comming lorde iesus christ heereby wee see howe onely graunted goddes child wishe deathe also ought wish shewe good proofe fayth except seeke go worlde according deed thing hast labour toward marke mark aloft therfore must neuer leaue running till wee come wayes ende whyche god hathe sette v wee muste desire may quickly neuerthelesse lette v alwayes beare mynde cause haue spoken namely wee must bee prouoked wish death bycause subiect sicknesse pouertie one thing bycause fully reformed image god bycause wee haue many imperfection v marke well say cause muste spurre prouoke v desire death namely ende beeing ridde thys mortall bodye whyche like cabane full stinche noysomnesse maye bee fully reformed image god hee may reigne v corruption nature bee vtterly done away furthermore lette v keepe v within compasse desiring lyue dye goddes pleasure wee maye bee gyuen oure owne wyll wee maye make sacrifyze behalfe liuing maye bee selues god wee may saye lorde knowe myne owne frailtie neuerthelesse thy wyll holde world heere good reason shoulde tarrie heere whensoeuer shall please thee call hence make great accompt lyfe alwayes thy commaundemente dispose thine owne pleasure beholde saye howe wee ought deale thys case heerewithall lette v haue oure affection euermore quieted yea euen suche sorte wee maye continuallye prayse god name assuring selues life deathe hee alwayes shewe hymselfe father sauioure towardes v iob hath spoken addeth distressed heartes would bee full gladde fayne myghte fynde theyr graue vvherein hee bewrayeth himselfe speake brutishe vnaduised affection hee keepeth neyther measure modestie hee confesseth wee come naught wee see howe hee falne howbeit wyth deadly fall halfe fall god rayseth hym vp agayne afterwarde wee shall see yet neuerthelesse case standeth wee must verily condemne thys infirmitie heere iob saye hee dismayed heauinesse could taste goddes goodnesse thereby gather neuer little comforte susteine hymselfe forasmuche wee see thys befell vntoo hym much must bee earnest praying vntoo god sorow maye ouermate v wee shoulde bee vtterly ouerwhelmed therefore lette v alwayes vnderpropped stayed vp wee may fight sorrowfulnesse feele good v liue heere according goddes although wee haue great griefes trouble heere yet must wee stande fully resolued vppon thys poynte good v continue still worlde wherefore ende god may bee glorifyed v ende fayth may bee tryed ende wee call vppon professe always father notwithstanding scourge v end meanes thereof wee may bee prepared heauenly lyfe thys taste said fatherly goodnesse must alwayes make v desyrous go vntoo god suffer v gyue bridle anye one outrageous beastly affection see iob hath done heere waye hee sheweth whence thys heauinesse came vppon wholly swallowed vp whence also proceedeth dismayde admit comforte assuage myseries sayeth man whose waye hidden god hath shut hee made hedge round man enter well worthy bee noted iob sheweth wherein hee fayled namely yelding himselfe inough god prouidence yet notwithstanding heerewithall discouereth disease wherevnto v subiect witte wee desirous knowe muste befall v state shall al would haue declared v muche wee perplexitie wee knowe shall become v inconuenience pincheth v see end wee poynte vtter despaire lo heere mischiefe ouercommon ordinarie must marke well ende wee maye seeke remedie contrary part vvhat inclination men could well find heart leape vp cloudes knowe shall course whole life wee see determine themselues salomon mocking ouerweening n sayeth determine vpon whole life whereas moue tip tung without god guide yet determine vppon mockerie able moue tippe toung yet presume say behold ten yeeres hence according also sainct iames agreeth salomon scorning sayd presumptuousnesse men long god letteth v alone ease euery man beleeueth hee listeth himselfe take selues bee petigoddes assoone god turneth hand beateth v roddes ye shall see v amazed wote become thinke possible v euer scape misery looke one side see end bee shet vp wee cannot take hold goodnesse mightie power god succoure v affection iob sheweth v heere ouercommon disease wee fynd well ynough experience thing troubleth tormenteth v much wee see selues shut vp know ende misery shall become v much assayled side conclude selues neuer get away without vtter oppression ouerthrowe haue sayd disease let v resort remedie disease cured wee must needes fall said excessiue passion whereof mention made heere namely wee shall wish death men despaire shall haue assuagement misery desire god ouerwhelme v hande conueniente remedie disease referre selues god prouidence hee may see brightly v sith bee blynd darknesse god may guyde v knoweth good v leade v foorth enterprise behold also wherevnto holy scripture bringeth v backe ieremie sayth lorde knowe way man owne power neither man walke direct owne steppe much say man taketh muche vppon purposeth dispose owne lyfe let v vnderstand god humble v much shutteth eye wee see must become v know day wee haue tomorow god entertayneth v day lyke iourneymen men terme maner hyreling waged daye woteth shall set worke next morowe behold god haue v liue ende learne depend wholly vpon saying true lord life frayle yet thou knowest shall betide thou hast forseene lorde therefore put selfe thyne hande haue many care tormente trouble discharge mee intoo thy lappe forasmuch sure bee safe vnder thy protection custodie holde selfe contented thus see behoueth v deale haue sayd prouidence god thoroughly imprinted harte depend wholly vpon although bee turmoyled many trouble world yet see good foundation make v stand steadie constant calling serue god according hys dayes life let v learne settle selues vpon sayde prouidence god see thing shuffled togither worlde wee know whych syde turne v may therefore ceasse apeaceable quiet assuring selues god ordereth guydeth thing suche wise nothing hinder welfare faithfull seeing hath take protectio thus see haue marke straine ende iob addeth hee hath rest e beauinesse take repast yet notwithstanding sayeth haue behaued selfe heeretofore men haue settled selfe prosperitie haue continually feared miserie come vppn let v marke complaynt iobs one syde sheweth miserie extreme therewithall sayeth hee cause god handleth god threateneth menne hee sayeth forasmuche thou hast made thy selfe drunken thyne owne pleasure forasmuch thou hast bene blinded forasmuch thou wart altered didde thee good thou hast knowen mee thou maist see wherefore intend punish thee god sheweth precisely canot away fleshly selfeloue men whe weene shall alwayes haue ease shall say peace safe behold sodayn storme shall ouerthrow forsaw afore vve see god punisheth presumption rashnesse men whyle bee prosperitie beleeue shall dwell euer meane season consider hande god thinke vpon owne frailtie god cannot abide ease wee must referre vnto god therewithall prepare ourselues bee afflicted shall please hym maner hee knoweth expedient asmuche god threateneth blynded manner pleasure iob beholding himselfe sore tormented afflicted amazed bycause hee tyme sotted hymselfe abundance alwayes fore mistrusted mischiefe nowe lyghted vppon borne hymselfe hand hee thencefoorth continue ease prosperitie god set lyke thinke mortall lyfe god hathe aduaunced aboue others sayeth continually thought afore hand misery myght happen vnto hapned hee ouertaken although thing cannot discoursed length yet may gather thereby one word asmuch iob alwayes put himselfe readinesse indure aduersitie god send vnto ouertaken anguishe greate standeth v hande looke haue much worse according desert god spare v hold v vp time let v therevppon conceyue vayne fond imagination thinke aduersitie touch v wee thinke god muste wake v vp good earnest shewe power authoritie hathe ouer v vvhat must must vigilant keepe good watch specially god handleth v gently wee susteyne aduersitie yet notwithstanding wee must haue eye may betyde v example iob miserie misdoubted lighted vpon wee maye sure sharper sighted hee foresee farre inconueniences may hit vpon v also falne let v therefore ceasse resort god see god hath ayded seruant end although hee seemed plunged gulfe hell yet notwithstanding god reached hande therefore let v also hope like towards selues lette v pray thys good god may please open eye wee maye better knowe needefull v wee see howe many wantes misery wee bee subiecte worlde wee may learne sigh grone specially forasmuch hild bondage sinne serue god full libertie wee may long kingdome heauen wee shall haue full perfection enioyemente grace whereof haue tast worlde also shall ioyned heade iesus christ reygne euerlasting glory maye please graunt grace v also c fourtenth sermon first vpon fourth chapter sermon conteyneth still exposition two last verse third chapter fourth chapter followeth eliphas manite ansvvered sayd man assay talke shall greeue thee vvho holde himselfe speaking behold thou hast taught many thou hast strengthned vverie handes thy vvordes thou haste stayed vp vvere falling thou hast strengthned vveake trembling knee novv euill come vppon thee thou art quiet novve hathe touched thee thou art astonyed thy feare thy trust thy hope vprightnesse thy vvayes vpon iobs talke whych treated yesterday ther remaineth vnderstand prosperitie hope god continue time come let v rest still iob seemeth meene faithfull must alalways stand doubt must thinke thing hold one hand shall forthwith taken away herevpon wee note wee must imagin god promiseth v vayne fonde presumption men behight selues thing god leaueth dout therefore god punisheth maner ouerwening imagin wee liste write vpon shall god haue v haue leaningstock word whiche assured truthe lye therfore whensoeuer men presume vppon themselues nothing vanitie leasing wonder though disappointed theyr purpose lord hath good reason mocke passe measure fashio must hold generall rule trust must settled wholly vpon god promise lette v consider god promiseth sayeth haue thought vpon v day forget v tomorow shall helped hand al time life behold promise may well assure selues god always keepe v meanes thereof shall daunger falling intoo decay yet herewithal must make account subiect manie inconueniences lord sayeth keepe v shut vp mew shall see aduersitie acquainted trouble continuall ioy felicitie hee promiseth v suche matter onely aide succour v necessity vvherfore behoueth v vnderstand god exercise v manye aduersities subiect comon affliction present life meane season ought suffize v shall ayded shal bee vtterly forsaken seing case stadeth perceiue well must sleepe wee bee prosperitie though state euerlasting nothing could change therfore presuming far step beyond boundes god telleth v may peraduenture suffer many aduersities help v cotinually meane shal fight yea assayled al side therfore passe boundes wise shal punished ouerhardinesse haue said already word faithfull may euer doubt yet neuer ceasse bee quiet consider chaunges turmoylings world must needes afraid carefull euery v must prepare receyue blowes whe shal please god smite yet herewithall know falling wee light otherwise vpon feete bicause wee bee hild vp hande god bee vtterly oppressed bycause releeueth v vve see wee bee vexed ouergreat vnquietnesse yet wee may bee sore greeued oure heauinesse withdrawe selues god make accompt calling vpon haue recourse vnto short great diuersitie betweene carelesnesse wherevnto inclined nature according disposition leshe assurednesse wee haue resting oure selues vpon god promise haue sayd fleshly presumptuousnesse like certaine drunkennesse maketh v blockishe wee haue regarde god hys helpe making oure reckening shall go well v though hee neuer looke v thinke vpon v rest vpon god word call vpon hym looke v side consider oure life thing nothyng state wretched death manaceth v side bee hemmed infinite misery heerevpon wee pray vnto god make moane vnto hym yet neuerthelesse please hym punishe v wee readye receyue stripe meekenesse loe howe wee ought deale yet faithfull man must enter intoo himselfe acknowledge sinnes consider giueth continually newe occasion god shoulde iustly punishe hym although wee bee promised god mainteyne v worlde though wee brooded vnder wing shal bee peace without anye disquietnesse yet doo sinnes cause hym chastize v shewe roughnesse towardes v god abyde suffer v runne decay leaue v sort randon without chastizemente woulde bee oure vtter vndoing earthlye father marre child cocker much certaine shoulde bee much marred god shoulde chastize v shewe signe roughnesse towardes v experience sheweth abuse goodnesse respectes faithfull therefore acknowledging themselues offende god without ceasing must also beare minde hee hath roddes readinesse beate sinnes either day tomorrow chaunge prosperitie presently enioy therevppon deale rigorously let v marke must sleepe sort god mainteineth v quietnesse wee must also haue eye may betide v alwayes ready receyue affliction shall send v let v come reported heere witte eliphas themanite one iobs friendes came comfort entred talke telleth effect seeth well feare god purenesse seemed haue outward appearance hypocrisie bicause hee delte farre square could paciently receyue correction god sent anon entreth yet witte force must needes iob reprobate considering god handleth roughly good men neuer smitten extremitie lo heere first grounde eliphas taketh reason vppon iob must thinke v whiche haue declared heeretofore iob hath good case hee handleth ill countercompanions hauean ill case handle wel according sometimes man may set faire coloure vpon euill matter standeth v hand mark otherwise talke rehearsed v confused iob haue said hath good case acknowledgeth god whiche scourgeth although account himselfe worthie suche correction much sinner yet notwithstanding hee fully perswaded god looketh sending great aduersities vnto respecte sinnes secrete cause whereof priuie meane shutteth mouth sayth win nothing pleading god yet ceasseth vse muche wandring talke cause sayd handled good case amisse visite take vntrue principle god doth alwayes deale men earthly life according desertes thys saying vtterly false see plaine contrary scripture sheweth v experience serueth v another proofe yet case standeth meane season say ceasse alleage good holy reason whereoutof wee also may gather good profitable doctrin howbeit better vnderstanding whole let v call remembrance howe sayde psalme blessed man considereth aright hym smitten saye iudgeth discreetely hym afflicted maner wisedome thinke god deliuer tyme aduersitie thus wee see holy ghost requireth v wee bee rashe iudges turne goddes woorkes vpside downe vvhen wee see poore men beaten beare wee must vnderstande god mercifull succoure sayd hee meeneth destroy vtterly short bee discreete iudgers chastizements correction god sendeth vppon men wee muste wayte ende must bee ouerhastie giue sentence first dash must stay selues marke pleaseth god according sayeth displeasure short mercie lasteth vnto life wee must encline selues wayte hitherside witte hope well wayte good happie issue thus see wee haue marke iobs friendes remembred cause ouershot themselues see iob smitten extremitie therevpon conclude god meant shew hym example reprobate person thinges happened vnto hee beene wicked vngracious person conceyued scripture sheweth v namely howe propertie god succoure distresse scripture telleth v onely god aydeth afflicted also draweth graues seme bee alreadye deade although affliction bee great excessiue yet muste wee still hope god helpe whych doubtlesse bee beyonde opinion man beyonde meanes conceyue thys text onely scripture speaketh doctrine ryfe sayde righteous man shall bee shaken also hee shall fall seuen tymes day may fall many tymes yet shall god hande bee ready hold v vp fallings shall bee deadly leastwyse broose v sore god shall delyuer v beholde howe scripture speaketh true bee dyuerse promise whereby seemeth god maketh difference owne child reprobate despisers hys woorde hee sayeth hardhearted man shall bee tamed force strypes lyke mule restye horse god wyll ceasse beate vppon wyth greate stroke whyche rebellious sturdye contrariwise trust shall hedged mercy say god al side blesse make prosper vvee see heere princely promise whyche seemeth exempt god child aduersities yet behoueth v expound sayd promise haue eye whych sayde howe god knowen preseruer seruaunts drawing graue god hedge v hys mercy make v cockney aduersitie touch v needy feele scarsitie wee neuer haue greefe god mindeth vse suche maner dealing conuenient v haue v passe fire water saye kynde myseries distressed wee wote become herevppon remedie necessitie ende wee may knowe whome wee bee beholding welfare thus see manner lord worketh also let v note iudge well behoueth beare thys point always mind witte onely god punisheth worst sort also exerciseth pacience hys faithfull one scourging handling farre roughly doth wicked short let v alwayes haue eye issue haue sayd let v maruell though wee see god help first day lo heere principle whych wee must lay v wee may know make owne profite whyche recited v touching wordes eliphas vseth bee man attempt talke man rayse talke well one maye bee spoken bycause hebrue wordhath double signification forasmuch hebrue word whych put heere talke speech sometimes taken also thing vnderstande thus god tempt thee meete thou shouldest bee farre pacience meete thou shouldest bee sore moued wee knowe scripture termeth temptation troubled god trieth v manner euer bee meening shoulde bee suche meete thou shouldest repine god thou seest hee tryeth tempteth thee saye thou seest hee mindeth proue thee thing bee throughly considered naturall meening man assay atumpt speake eliphas addeth immediatly bee withheld selfe speaking hee saye thou art farre square agaynst reason men must needes fynde fault thee myldest man worlde hee shoulde constrayned rebuke thee sawe thy outrageousnesse thy behauing thy selfe heere lyke sauge beaste therefore thou muste restrayned thou wouldest inforce meekest man aliue speake lo heere playne meening effect eliphassis minde shewe iob hath walked aright cleere conscience god lo heere first poynt afterward hee entreth thys generall argument whych haue touched witte righteous neuer oppressed wise wyth affliction alwayes token god vengeance therefore hee perceyued iob tormented thys wyse hee deemed hym reprobate person thus yee see two poyntes nowe lette v come vnto first sayth vnto thou bee etofore baste taughte whole world thou baste strengthned quiuering knee thou hast refreshed weerie handes thou baste amonded suche dyd amisse thou hast comforted tormented miserie come vppon thy selfe see thou art quiet therefore conclude feare god whyche thou hast hope thou pretendest namely god alwayes haue bene fauorable vntoo thee bee shorte thou haste serued god vpon vsurie thou diddest gyue ouer thy selfe vntoo good earnest respect thou diddest hope would alwayes haue bene mercifull vntoo thee long thou couldest well finde thine heart serue nowe thou seelest somewhat roughe thou renouncest hys seruice vvhereby bee perceyued nothyng else hypocrisie thee thus wee see effecte whole ground discourse eliphas maketh true wee marke selues wee eyther counsell men comfort rebuke euery man doo yea euen moste ideotes sayde common prouerbe easie health comsort suche diseased wee shewe oure owne dooyngs thing whiche wee speake vnto others selues wee speake heart true proofe wee deale deceitfully vvee shall see diuers eloquent eloquent needeth whych babble well purpose yee woulde wonder neuer want tongue bee prattle happen god doo fillip wyth finger ende wote comforte thing else meeneth vvhat bee done vvhen wee speake neighbour let v shewe vnto thing whych speake vnto mouth throughly grounded hart thus see ought proceede yet meant heereby wee ceasse comforte incourage neighbour reproue one another passe chastize amisse comfort heauinesse reforme go astray shewe themselues haue care neyther god hys seruice loue god right affection certayne muche vslyeth seeke men may doo lyke true christian content himselfe walke aright hee doo best drawe whole worlde accorde therefore behoueth v put thing vre whiche sainct paule also sheweth v teaching reforming one another sayde wee must hart verely shall come triall may shew deede wee haue spoken teeth outwarde worde whiche issued oure mouthe throughly rooted hart see vse god word namely teache shewe good also correct suche haue done amisse rebuke suche deale disorderly strengthen weake feeble small courage therefore prophet esay auoucheth belongeth charge prophet teacher church suche haue charge beare abroade worde god onely vtter whyche commaunded speake wee may see heere god haue declared vnto v also haue cheerefulnesse spurre pricke forwarde lazie giue courage weake lift vp falne bring backe stray right way thus ye see true vse god worde namely way aswell instruct men aright also shewe effectualnesse gospell according also sainct paule telleth v howe wee must applye holy scripture instruction sayeth serueth onely knowe good discerne betweene good euill also exhorte reproue conuince v heereby wee must bee prouoked receyue god worde desirously cheerefull louing affection somuch wee see howe belongeth welfare comprehended therein god onely bringeth v whyche behoofe knowe also forasmuche seeth frailtie intendeth remedie haue hys word serue strengthen v forasmuch seeth wee brittle daunger fall hee setteth v vp agayne anone forasmuch hee seeth v inclined hypocrisie soothe selues owne vice spurreth v ende wee may perceyue owne euills delight seeyng wee perceyue god hathe well prouided thing whiche hee knoweth bee behoosefull hee haue hys worde serue v throughly behalfe ought wee bee inslamed receyue worde seeing wee perceyuc bee suche treasure ought wee saye receyue cheerefull minde considering howe sweeter hony sayde nyneteenth psalme also wee heare worde god standeth v hande knowe wherefore would haue man doo nothing else say beholde wee haue marke vpon text man make colde exposition shoulde bee exhortation rebuking vice liuelynesse yea muche deface doctrine god man shoulde cut sunder sinewes body might haue strength vvhat bee done vvhen wee come sermon man readeth alone selfe wee must vnderstande god intent onely shewe v good say go way also rebuke sinnes v may messenger pricke v forwarde learne humble selues euen let v marke also howe sluggish wee bee wee hye v vnto suche zele requisite insomuch hee fayne gyue v stroke spurre quicken v vp exhortation serue humble v make v submit oure selues frankly hys thus see wee ought deale make worde god serue oure vse wise ought put vre aboue cheefe charge must marke well bee quite discharged haue faithfully informed people good also muste haue foresayd liuelinesse encouraging intent suche dull may somewhat quickned comforting suche distresse intent may finde reliefe god rebukyng delight owne vice spurre suche wise may abashed ashamed selues like minister teacher must applye thing men openly muste euery one v apply himselfe following whiche apostle sayth epistle hebrues alleaging saying prophet esay sayth wee must tarrye till others speake v euery one v must bee scholemaster selfe saye beholde vnto appoynted carrie abroade god worde name prophet esay giueth commaundement comfort trembling knee stay vp handes suche faynt releeue oppressed pull backe intoo right pathe gone astray yet neuerthelesse freends sayth marke howe euery one also bounde succour weake feeble cherishe weery heart comforte oppressed sorrowe short imploy selfe knoweth bee meete expedient welfare neyghbours finallye euery one v must duetie preacher towards selfe lo haue marke texte whereas recorde gyuen vnto iob instructed many heere shewed v first excellent vertue hym must also take instruction doo lyke witte drawe men v much v lyeth serue god one common consent true men indewed great giftes yet must euery man consider hys owne measure imploy selfe according god hathe gyuen hym abilitie towardes hys neyghbors therefore wee must vnderstande whatsoeuer god hath imprinted eche v common buylding vp hys churche wee must discharge selues according giftes euery v hath receyued must profite others v must communicate togythers may go god one accorde euery man shewe openly hath desire serue neighbour turne nowe let v come conclusion eliphas maketh forasmuche sayth hee thou art pacience aduersitie come vppon thee must needes bee sayde thou hast beene hypocrite feare thou hast hope looking god alwayes fauour thee verily iob beene suche one eliphas surmizeth bee hys saying beene true haue touched afore marke knowe hypocrite babble teach others shewe deede doctrine serueth owne turne haue fayre vtterance keepe nothing within serue owne turne neede let v learne bee euery man hys owne scholemaster teacher minde profite neighbour doctrine let euery one v begin hym selfe whereas eliphas dothe iob wrong saying hee founde hym astonished though beene nother witte reason hym wee perceyue thereby humble v therewith god may well suffer v bee delte withall yet wee muste also presuppose whatsoeuer temptation happen god child shall neuer vtterly decay god succoure wise shall haue wherewith stablishe strengthen themselues notwithstanding nature bee feeble weake euen stumble without ablenesse rise agayne god reached hys hande vntoo let v vnderstande wee haue taught men wrought wonder reprouing sturdie wilfull sorte refourmyng went astray strengthning suche faynthearted wee shall bee muche blameable worthie bee condemned shewe owne dooings speake hearte earnestly greater shall damnation bee hauyng medled wyth teachyng others doe themselues take profite doctrine ought well make v walke feare humblenesse therefore commeth cace instructing let v thinke thus true god haue mee serue neyghboures turnes muste bee myne owne iudge carye abroade woorde therfore must teach myne owne selfe otherwyse frame life according whiche speake vtter mouth wil greate horrible confusion aboue men minister gospel must well consider see also sainct paule sayeth blamed condemned himselfe ende might first ranke condemning others shall come question brief haue charge beare woorde god shall bee muche blameworthie though haue faithefully taughte whiche god himselfe hath shed vpon v gift holy spirit haue begonne shewe owne person must amende others lette v firste amend selues must exhort others lette v first exhort selues lette v alwayes bee firste leading daunce specially rebuke haue doone amisse let v practise whiche saincte paule sayeth wit let v vse softenesse reprouing haue doone amisse looke vpon thy selfe sayeth thou find thy selfe frayle must thou beare thy neighbour yet meanewhyle muste hinder liuely admonishment whiche god enioyneth v thus wee see haue gather may profit selues text wit ofte shal please god correct v maner euer wee muste shewe wee desirous comfort men lyke trouble haue bin good faithfull teacher towardes selues concerning sentence sayde thy feare counterfea nesse thy hope simplicitie thy wayes lykewise eliphas meaneth shewe iob bene hypocrite hadde serued god desire seeme seene certain serue god yea though feare wee shall haue agaynst v slauish maner seruice god haue v bee hireling seruing haue v goe free courage wholly giuen vnto may say lorde thyne reason euery one v shoulde dedicate himselfe vnto thee labour glorifie thy name vve see howe ought haue free heart seruing god bee led slauishe constraynt true textes rightly sayde may well serue god considering shall disappoynted labour according sayde nintenth psalme lyke place thys doth easily agree togither wit seruing god must led free mynded affection yet neuerthelesse must assure ourselues god wil suffer laboure bee vnprofitable according also sainct paule speaketh god sayth rightuous promiseth trauailing shall vayne shoulde loste labour bee persecuted holie scripture full doctrine specially sayde effecte suche truste god shall loze rewarde touching first poynt wee may well haue eye promisses god hathe made v namely wee shall loze labour seruing bee disappoynted longing rewarde greate heauen yet notwithstanding meane time seruice doo vnto god must bee free harted witte whe soeuer pleaseth hym plague v wee must therefore ceasse continue obedience towardes walke hys feare wel dealt gently v mainteyned v good plight hereof ye see must loke haue hyrelings rewarde say serue god conditionally hee deale mine owne desire wee come poynte seruing god manner child manner hyred wage day vvhat done wee must haue freeharted affection dedicate selues wholy vnto god giue selues wholly seruing yea euen well wo weale well assured labour shall disappointed wee shall haue proceeded simplicitie asmuche matter layde foorth length nowe keepe rest till tomorrow let v humble selues presence good god acknowledgement sinnes praying make v vnderstande better wee maye dislyke seeke remedy hee offereth v ende maye bee corrected therewithall guyde v wyse worlde wee may desire nothing please pointes respectes follow hys holy commaundements let v say almighty god heauenly father c fiftenth sermon second vpon fourth chapter sermon contayneth yet still exposition sixth verse afterward followeth consider pray thee vvho euer perished beeing innocent vvhere haue vpright bene destroyed haue seene plough vnrightuousnesse sovv incomberance gather perished vvith blast god vvere consumed vvith breath hys mouth roring lyon noyze libarde teeth lyon vvhelpes dispatched lyon perisheth vvant pray lyonesses vvhelpes chaced avvay first formost wee haue beare mind declared yesterday serue god aright wee must bee ledde freeharted affection giue selues vntoo withoute hauing respect well intreated hand afterward send v owne harte desire wyll indent wyth god receyue god hand soeuer themselues desire first shew themselues ouerfleshly much gyuen lustes secondly woulde bynde god straunge fashion behaue themselues child towardes theyr father bee driuen slauishe respecte bee hyrelinges wagismen vvhat muste wee doo referring selues god good pleasure muste haue suche constancie v honour bothe woe weale desire bee hys continue obeying soeuer hee doo v soeuer hee dispose v wee bee mynde seruice wee shall like hym neuer whit notwithstanding bee neuer well liked esteemed worlde therefore lette v referre fearing reuerencing god ende wee would haue doo wee liste although hee rough sharpe towards v may sometymes seeme hee would thunder vpon v yet neuerthelesse lette v abyde still awe say lorde reason thou shouldest raigne ouer thy creature also childe commaunde father binde hym stake say sir gouerne mee according good pleasure protest desire nothing subiect vnto behold haue doo surely wee know well inough scripture sheweth v lost labour serue god hath promised v plentifull reward shall disappointed expectation yet must said freeharted affection go wee make bargayning god say bound v according appetities must necessitie graunt v euer haue imagined owne brayne lo god seruants knowing seruice acceptable shall vnprofitable notwithstanding reste themselues vpon reward promised much lesse must intend bring god bente bowe taske necessitie doo thys must lowlinesse referre themselues wholy thing pleasure whereas speake reward debate whither reward due vnto v stand vpon matter vvhen haue done possible done god shall neuer whit debt promiseth v reward vnderstand freegift haue deserued wee worthy bycause hath receyued v fauour also allowe workes yea whiche hee hymselfe doth holy spirit touching goodnesse none v yet looke god hath giuen v accepteth wee brought hym owne receyueth workes owne mere goodnesse gyue v better courage serue hauing eye hys promise wherein protesteth vntoo v rewarde great heauen yea hee blisse v thys world also wee shall want thing may wee cast eye heerevpon comfort selues heerewithall haue sayde wee muste recken god deale v owne deuice rather determine selues referre matter wholly vnto submit ourselues wholly good thus see doctrine wee haue gather texte profitable v marke whereby discerne hypocrite god child hypocrite may well magnifie god full mouthe time prosperitie worlde goe desire man shall see chaunged cause suche maner men beare reuerence godwarde forth hee applyeth himselfe vnto kinde reuerence minded serue mine owne torne one well bicause drawe profite make good countenaunce perceiue shake like vilaine hee serues well nowe mortall men beare carlishnesse shall become v come vnto god shall loue shall honor farre forth may owne profit mockery see order nature peruerted true friendship betwene v man wil honor vertues know bee ende wee may liue togither one comon accord serue god say god giueth v mark may well serue honor man may well haue regarde creature nothing touching god hee must bee honored owne sake bicause deserueth must rauished honoring may thinke oure selues sauing seconde place inferiour degree vvee maye see howe hypocrite bewray themselues repyning againste god time aduersitie hee handleth owne fansie much men giuen vice wee see cause ought marke lesson better nowe eliphas addeth consider euer anye rightuous man haue perished marke right dealing men haue beene rooted eliphas haue sayde alreadie taketh heere good sentence reason bringeth heere iob good holy notwithstanding case bee euill surely principle set drawne god pure truth reason whereof much holy ghost pronounced saying neuer rightuous man yet perished neuer right dealing man bene destroyed neither could suche thing happen vvhy god hathe promised haue care rightuous saide eye lorde vpon rightuous eares open prayer heare succour neede scripture full matter wit god hande stretched preserue rightuous call vpon put trust needes must diuell haue bene stronger god rightuous might haue perished therefore let v alwayes haue recourse sentence iesus christe father hath put handes stronger meaning welfare shall neuer hazarde muche god taketh v keeping vvherefore spread power v mainteine v therefore let v conclude welfare good suretie god hath taken charge sure doctrine righteous perishe right dealing men rooted great difference perishing afflicting punishment affliction serue alwayes destroy men haue declared partly already yet may affliction grieuous somtimes seeme deadly vvhat done must conclude according haue shewed much god chalendgeth office pull men graues need doubt shall succored wee haue endured time vve see eliphas misapplieth matter thoughe iob perished alreadie god forsaken vtterly without remedy true poore man altogither disfigured irksome beholde spectacle might shew wrath god yet god ceasse loue may see experience sheweth ende eliphas therefore preuented dread maketh misdeeme muche hee leaueth roome god mercy meere goodnesse lo wherein ouershot himselfe also see miserable plight seemeth vtterly fordone hope recouerie let v learne let v learne saye magnifie god goodnesse hope hee yet still remedie mischiefes seeme incurable true mannes expectation may fordone god hath meanes incomprehensible v whereby succoure seruantes hee listeth shewe himselfe pitifull towardes let v tarie leysure till hee shewe v ende meane let v suspende oure iudgements least iudged ouer hastie rashe thus wee see wee haue marke namely wee must acknowledge power god great able succour ouerthrowne able quicken againe although already dead must applye doctrine neighbor must also practise ech one v wherefore god sendeth v many great trouble wee conceiue spoken iob neede eliphas vexe v beare v hand past recouerie ther none v al hath seed harburning selfe trouble martyr affliction yea euen driue v despaire owne nature affordeth v god scourgeth v troubled imagination howe nowe god hath promised succour thou pinest away yea euen extremitie thou callest vpon god hee answereth thee vvhere promise thou seest well inough hee hath shaken thee therefore cause thou shouldest anye thinke accounteth thee thou highe time looke vpon thee pitie thee nowe neuer shetteth eye make though hee sawe thee therefore thou seest hathe vtterly forsaken thee beholde temptation wherevnto subiecte steppe v driue v vtterly dispaire muche haue neede fensed conflict maner haue sayd man mynde casteth temptation hee must answere say true neuer rightuous man yet perished true right dealing men roted perishing bee onely afflicted wherefore holy scripture telleth v god rayseth vp dead hee gyueth courage vtterly dismayed recouereth suche wounded death vvhen scripture sayth shew god vttereth working towardes afflicted yes sayde deade alreadie rotten lift vp selues receiue yee full liuelynesse flourish yee fresh herbes esay speaketh faythfull faithfull must sometimes become lyke rotten carkesses god maye gyue liuelynesse againe wee see hearbes become greene springtime good deade winter euen muste god worke v bee many sentence tend vnto self end wee perceiue god preserueth seruauntes one meaneth make cokneys hee myndeth take graues mainteine wonderful fashyon intent may knowe howe hee belongeth haue dominion ouer death giue life therefore haue warrant issue death god hande beholde heere notable promisse vvhen dauid intendeth shewe v howe god guydeth v hee sayth issue outgoings death belong vnto meaneth bee throwne headlong deathe euery blowe set forth one steppe shal seeme wee vtterly vndone god hath issue death hande sayeth hee let v marke well sentence wee may throughly fenced diuell shall come blowe oure eare art thou seest thou howe thou hast succoure aboue rightuous perish bar sata purpose let v haue answer readie true rightuous perish neither perished thou arte good dead sayth dieul god let v say thathath issue deth hand dauid meaneth texte saying though shadowe death thy sheepehooke lorde shall guyde mee bicause alwayes put trust thee thou protector shall bee exempted euill thus yee see howe wee ought practize lesson ensueth sowe extortion laboure extortion sowe incomberance shall gather vvhiche thing confirmed similitude eliphas sayeth roring lyon stinted teeth broken whelpes destitute praye vvherby hee meaneth haue bene full crueltie extortion shall bee daunted hande god somewhat afore hee sayde wicked perished blaste god breath mouthe touching former sentence sayde suche labour iniquitie sowe trouble incomberance c say similitude taken tiller earth sayde two wordes iniquitie trouble one vnrightuousnesse incomberaunce ioyned togither scripture signifie extortion outrage wicked commit vexe disquiet neighbour also worde incomberance trouble spoken suche doe nothing tosse turmoyle men first sayde plough bycause desirous anoy neyghbours doe harme doe make preparatiues like laborour intendeth sowe grounde hee must first plough earth must first tilled euen wicked consulte aforehande vpon vngraciousnesse trecheries vnlawfull dooings deuysing guyles deceytes afterwarde haue layde whole platforme seeke meanes possible put lewde enterprise execution verie laboring tillage eliphas speaketh sayth heerevpon sowe incomberance saye haue made preparation runne vpon poore men fleece eate vp men sayeth hee doe reape haue sowed saye god maketh mischiefe whiche haue conceyued inuented others lyght vpon owne heades vvee see heere sentence true wee muste take spoken holy ghost euen gather generall lesson thereof put true vse must pray god graunt v spirit wisdome behalf may wrest scripture way way draw contrarie sense wesee eliphas hath done wheras holy scripture sayeth suche plough iniquitie sowe incomberance shall reape threatning god vttereth wicked thinke aduaunce themselues highly playe rauenous beastes fleecing one man eating vp another specially deuour seeming themselues bee iolly conquerours standing owne conceytes lorde telleth beguile themselues verie muche hee maketh enterprise turne owne confusion vvherfore ye see threatning whereby god purposeth represse ouer boldenesse maliciousnesse men minding holde short intent may liue togiether good loue vpright dealing man may labour hinder neighbour like contrarie side heare also promisse giuen v wordes soweth blissednesse shall reape sainct paule speaketh almesdeedes hee sayeth wee sowe vpon oure neighboures god gyueth vnto v shall gatheir againe much wee shall haue abundance gracious giftes blissinges god shall shead rich vpon v shewe himselfe gracious liberall towardes v bee necessitie promisse serueth giue faithfuil good mynde deale frankly neighbour succour nowe see true vse lesson wee must keepe oure selues well practyzing anye anoyance deceyte little shall wee bee able aduaunce selues wicked practyzes vnlawfull meanes god shall put v confusion ende vvee see howe wee ought represse wicked lustes wee maye deale vprightly reasonably neighboures side muche noysomnesse extortion displease god let v bee well ware behaue oure selues vprightly say let v labour well euery one v may onely absteine misdealing also consider god haue giuen v abilitie muste profit one another comunicate mutually altogither heerevnto lette v also gather togyther sentence holy scripture tende ende cursed bee thou robbest thou shalte bee robbed thy turne come afterwarde looke measure men make shall bee giuen againe vvhen wee heare sayinges let v vnderstande god doth euermore turne mischiefe wicked men deuised vpon themselues scripture speaking wicked persone sayeth hee shall fall pit hee hathe digged afterwarde iudgement wythout mercie shall hee haue whiche mercilesse vnpitifull vvhen wee heare suche sentence lette v tremble bee circumspecte walke iustly vprightly neighboures men maye knowe wee bee continually restrained feare god thus wee see wee haue marke effect sentence way man vexed haue doone good persecuted seketh liue peace concorde neighbour must conclude hee companie gather trouble incomberance bycause sowed wee heare howe holy scripture sayeth contrarie namely god dothe somtimes suffer thing trie pacientnesse vvee see example reported v holy scripture dauid protesteth hee sought nothing concorde yet notwithstanding hee troubled lesse hee prouoked enimies hee giuen cause doe displeasure hee sayeth hee hated without cause heerein hee shewed himselfe true member iesus christe therefore wee muste come backe saincte peter sayth yea euen alledging psalme vvho sayeth hee desirous prosper bee blissed god leade quiet life let seeke peace giue himselfe well lo god promiseth v witte ordinarie blissing wee bee giuen well hee guyde v suffer v bee racked oute measure neuerthelesse yee suffer weldoing thanke god sayeth hee whereas hee sayeth yee seeke bee peace euerye man yee shall fynde immediately hee addeth shall alwayes bee much vnthankefulnesse worlde wicked shall deale lewdely haue soughte nothing welfare wee see man afflicted wee muste conclude hee dealt sowing iniquitie sowing trouble incomberance wee knowe cause god visiteth suche wyse true shall haue knowne one haue beene wicked persone god iudgement visible notorious vpon man haue beene despyzer god one hath ledde lawlesse lyfe offence others wee iudge scripture telleth v wee wyll iudge firste dashe withoute knowing partie onely wee see scourged therevpon saye cursed beholde rashe ouerpresumptuous iudgement one god findeth faulte withall therefore wee must haue staye selues proceede suche myldenesse aduisednesse haue shewed heeretofore eliphas hath spoken addeth maner men wit practysed deceit violence oppresse neighbour haue put wicked practizes execution shall bee destroyed blaste god breath mouth vvherby sheweth althoughe men ceasse duty yet god ceasseth doe punishing suche gyuen outrage crueltie anoyance thing verye true well worthye bee throughly marked v wherefore thing hardeneth wicked causeth goe theyr vngraciousnesse bycause beare themselues hande manne dare open lippes againste men stande feare behaue themselues like wilde beastes euery man shoulde stande awe world quake onely looke haue pilled polled euer man speake bycause haue wherewith currie fauour suche may anoy according wee see howe haue vsed suche wycked practyzes haue alwayes brybes hande stop mouthes maye punishe muche therefore wicked gyue selues suche misdealing hope scape punishment man hande sayde shall bee destroyed blaste god saye although men omitte duetie iustice executed whiche haue vsing swoorde holde peace playe dumbe idolles man mainteine right reason wyckednesse borne yet god ydle heauen lette v beare mynde whole worlde sooth v vppe naughtinesse yet shall oure cace bee neuer better neyther shall wee haue gayned anye thing beeyng flattered oure vyces men handes wee must come account heauenly iudge beholde heere speciall poynt wee haue marke therefore l non blyndfolde owne eye giue ouer himselfe naughtinesse hee seeth hee may saye vvell plucke thing selfe man dare speake mee yea wee heare howe sayde heere men giue v libertie doe euill god ydle meane whyle hee bolster euill hath hee tolde v lyke hee neare suche call vpon also hee beholdeth marketh eye wicked doo men violence extorcion seeing case let prouoke v walke feare assuring selues wee must yeelde account iudge wee shall haue gayned nothing fauour men thus see haue marke sentence great weyght sayde wicked perishe blaste god breath mouth herein signifyed vnto v god needeth make great preparation arme himselfe intendeth represse suche stubborne deuour thinges giue themselues guilefulnesse deceiue neighbor specially full crueltie extortion deuoure whole worlde god needeth leuie great power men strengthen withall needeth seeke meanes heere howe ouerthrowe let blowe vpon behold dispatched nowe therefore wee see maner speaking wherein sayde wicked perish blast god breath mouthe importeth verie much like esay also speaking men generally setteth v downe selfe blast shew v brittle state therefore wee haue neede bee mainteined god else shall hazarde perishing euery minute houre furthermore make v vnderstand although wicked haue full scope worlde triumphe bee bothe stoute strong seeme inuincible yet needeth great force destroy blast god bee inough dispatche quite cleane nowe let v come sayde concerning kingdome lorde iesus christ sayde power referred breath mouth worde wit wicked shall bee rooted behold howe esay speaketh paule applieth texte latter comming oure lorde iesus christe howe iesus christe reigneth enimies confounded simple worde blast needeth thuderbolts ouerthrowe sith case standeth let v looke selues ofte gospell preached god thundereth vpon despisers thereof vppon become harde hearted stubborne true tyme wee perceiue force worde punishing wicked yet ende shall fayne fele vaine god hath said prophet confirmed apostle iesus christe shall destroy wicked blaste mouth vertue word therfore feare saide sentence let v submit selues gospell fele force inclosed owne confusion rather see experience welfare thus much concerning text afterwarde similitude lion lioness lioness whelpes shall scattered destroyed dout eliphassis meaning god stretched strong arme outrageous violent men shorte resemble lion wylde beastes see effect true see meeke one afflicted seemeth god woulde breake brooze piece haue example dauid yet sentence ceasseth true specially consider god iudgements proceedeth commonly touching punishmentes god layeth vpon world rule made without exception vvhen sayde suche mercilesse shall haue iudgement without mercie wee must vnderstand point case according present course thing see neither must conclude suche cruelly persecuted haue therefore bene cruell vvee see befell oure lorde iesus christ head mirrour patterne god child vvee see also hathe befalne faithfull haue erst sayde must take ordinarie iudgement wee heare promisse contrarie parte blissed meeke shall inherite earth iesus christ telleth v mylde louing wee liue gently among neighbor wee indeuer euery man good shall enioy earth say shall continue quietnesse wee shall troubled yea haue declared ment hereby shal exempted inconueniences god cause shall possesse earth verely farre forth shall expedient v lo haue beare remembrance let v thinke thing straunge whiche spoken texte witte lion teeth shall bee broken roaring make shall bee stinted say god stretch arme power daunt full pryde fiercenesse seke nothing eate vp deuour god therefore sheweth arme bee strong wee ordinarily see wherevpon shall god shewe iudgementes great notable vppon lion like woode beastes set vpon spoyle yea glutted man bloud vve see howe god sheweth himselfe iudge notably case vpon little one vpon haue exercised violence therefore let v learne afrayde god iudgementes preuent oft executeth thing vpon giuen hurt neighbor let v glorify assuring ourselues wil iudge whole world haue pitie wrongfully vexed ende hee bee safetie shewe verye deede neuer forgate euen seemed vtterly cast vvhat done wee must looke vpon god iudgementes wyse wee may perceiue sheweth world stage whervpon god setteth v forth many example must turne behoues wee maye walke feare absteyning euill good oure neyghbours walking soundly vprightly among respectes wee doubte wee shall feele power oure god maintein v notwithstading must faine walk many misery world bee short although wee among thousande deathes perceyue yet helpe promiseth yet shall wee ceasse mainteined wonderful maner let v fall downe presence good god acknowledgement fault praying make v perceiue better wee haue doone heretofore hauing eye promyses whereby allureth v gently vnto wee maye warrante oure selues wee walke feare hee neuer forget v although wee haue offended manye wayes wee bee well worthie bee shaken sathan also would make v beleeue wee shall bee receiued mercye yet notwithstanding wee must bee fayne walke many misery world bee short although wee among thousande deathes perceiue yet helpe promiseth yet shall ceasse mainteined wonderfull maner let v fall downe presence good god acknowledgement fault praying make v perceyue better wee haue doone heeretofore hauing eye promise whereby allureth v gently vntoo wee maye warrant selues wee walke feare hee neuer forget v although wee haue offended many wayes wee bee well worthie shaken sathan also would make v beleeue shall receiued mercy yet notwithstanding wil cause v know hath pardoned v yea readie receiue v time often come backe may rest vpon promise performance hereof let v pray guyde v may atteine perfectfulnesse benefites hee hathe promised v hee hath prepared v heauen maye please graunt grace onely v also people nation earth c sixteenth sermon third vpon fourth chapter one thing hath bene brought secret vvhereof myne eare hath heard little among thought nightvisions vvhen men sleepe fearefulnesse trembling came vpon made bone afrayde vvynde vvhisked made haire bodie stare stoode one knevve face vvas image myne eye heard voyce silence man rightuous god man pure maker beholde findeth stedfastnesse seruants hath put vanitie angel hovve much dvvell house clay vvhose foundation duste vvhich consumed destroyed mouth eliphas hathe shewed reason iob serued god faithfully pure heart least wise affection doe addeth god authoritie shewe iob neither ought meanes reply condemned god good right men thinke eliphas bosteth hauing reuelation neuerthelesse well considered doubt pretending god reueled matter vnto matter certaintie wee must hold principle general sentence hee alledgeth good yet illapplied must thinke strange god inspire maner noweadayes taught fashion father age god speaketh vnto v wise prophet instrument holie ghost haue gospell wherein god sheweth himselfe familiarly let v looke vpon manner speaking whiche god vseth noweadayes church hee hath disclosed whole vnto v holie scripture time paste god opened himselfe suche pleased shewe speciall fauour howe vision holie scripture witnesseth let v assure selues eliphas excellent man therefore must thinke strange god shoulde appeere vnto vision night shoulde knowe thing whiche scripture teacheth v daye pretending matter false brag eliphas doth dout case misapplye thing euill purpose person iob whiche bin reueled vnto end vse see god sheweth men ought walke lowlynesse behold whervnto vision giue tendeth wit men stande owne conceite bee puffte vp pryde thinke themselues rightuous great woorthinesse vnderstande come shewe themselues god nothing sinne reason whereof must needes confounded therfore must haue eye corruption sorie eliphas receiued maner doctrine good nowe layeth burthen vpon iob thinketh himselfe haue woone spur ouercharging serued god faithfully vvee see generall case eliphas boasteth vaine bin taught god playeth yll scholer point taketh heede himselfe intendeth oppresse iob contrarie truth let v come lay forth whole matter particularly hee sayeth thing brought secrete eare hearde little yea sayth hee vision night heard blast whisked hither thither last voyce whiche spake silence true addeth also image whereas hee sayeth hee knewe sauing hee abashed euen hee shuddered bodie ouer heares fleshe stoode staring vp feare astonishemente traunce tendeth shewe reporteth dreames verye testimonie god whiche muste bee receiued authoritie heereby wee see vision whiche auncient father god dyd certaine token amaze put terrour feare serued authorize woorde ende bee receyued better see howe men well inclyned heare god speake ought bee except hee make feele maiestie man greate estate speake vntoo v wonder see wee bee earnest hearken vnto wee bee heare reade holie scripture vvherof commeth carnall beastly remedie faultinesse hath pleased god giue alwayes token maiestie intent worde might bee receyued men take bee greater credit authoritie also mention made vision holie
