scripture alwayes sayde holie father haue bene stricken feare without cause behoued bee prepared humilitie might obey god simply yet another reason although wee seeme well minded heare god yet capacitie receiue hee telleth v except fleshe tamed inwarde pryde v puffeth v vp sort knowe good conuenient v vntill tyme god hath stricken v downe thus see wherefore god neuer appeared vntoo men hee gaue feeling feare namely end like well themselues stand much vpon owne reputation trust much owne strength nowe wee perceiue wherunto long description eliphas maketh referred sayth secrete matter whereof small intelligence true first blush may seeme trifling calleth secrete god leastwise rightuous men hee concludeth end men haue regarded rightuous euery man confesseth woordes muche verie heathen haue euer gaynsayde vvhat mysterie secrete matter let v assure selues tha necessarie although men agree point none ryghtuous onely god bee full infirmity comparison yet notwithstanding wee acknowledge sufficiently neyther sufficiently imprinted v wee fully throughly persuaded god ryghtuousnesse owne naughtinesse certayne wee doubt wee commonly doo grudgings bee hearde mouthes shoulde bee gaynesaying replying heartes wee bee altogither quiet euer please god put v shame wee could confesse hee good right cace standeth ye shall see men kick god assoone toucheth nay spare sinnes doe warne come true knowledgement man may perceiue hereby men puffed vppe presumptuousnesse knowe god rightuousnesse might humble themselues vnder therefore without cause eliphas termeth heere secrete god sheweth himselfe rightuous men ought bee ashamed want knowledge themselues wretched manner also doth sainct paule take telleth romaine howe vnknowne secrete thing vntoo men god purposed vtter foorth rightuousnesse iesus chryst end worlde acknowledge themselues indetted vntoo god true man say anye difficultie heerein yet haue shewed afore men attribute wote themselues fynde theyr heart vncace selues sayd vayne ouerstatelinesse much owne opinion thinke selues able woorke wonder free heerevpon beare themselues hande shall purchace rewarde god hande contrariwyse god knowne bee onely rightuous nothing wickednesse bee founde men thus much concerning poynte eliphas saying hee hearde little sayde woord sheweth well exalted himselfe farre taketh vpon perfection wisedome saye nothing escaped hee comprehended euery whit vttermoste hee sayth hee taste sayde doctrine god conceyued parte vvee see hee speaketh modestly declaring angell heauen could behold god glorie full sight according man rudenesse bene taught know communicate thing vnto neighbour receiued god lo ment say effect hereby admonished howe familiarly euer god sheweth himselfe vnto v great matter wee admitted knowe thing part must thinke haue perfect vnderstanding may bee lacke thinke themselues beguile themselues thereby shet themselues gate open come afore let marke well much done v haue little taste enterance knowledge god truth meant prophetes teacher god hath chozen ordeyned vnto whome hath gyuen excellent gyftes wee see example eliphas shall sayd v set v one simple comon sort people one whome god himselfe hath appeared yet telleth v heard little behold haue marke firste place truely throughly persuaded suche ouerweening seene talke euery v beares himselfe hande ignorant nothing least exercysed holy scripture needes haue reputation themselues bee suttle sharpwitted speake nothing good reason though holie ghost sleeue whence commeth pryde yet apcee imagine themselues vnderstand thinges furthermore pryde accompanied carelesnesse moste part passe perfit themselues weene bee come perfection knowledge many men haue heard two three word gospell ye shall see full bee passe learning knowledge needes teach men short doctor god laugheth presumption skorne little myght haue receiued must taken shall go away emptie according written song virgin marie full winde esteeming themselues rych standing vpon reputation haue bin starued hunger let v learne praise god wise hath giuen v know haue neede proceede dayly may haue earnest desire profit come modestie familiarly wee bee taught concerning god worde much must bee little scholers wee step pride thinke al brain come according abilitie haue sayd must bee none hath perfection wisedome saue iesus christ intent may deale euery man measure certeine portion furthermore let v marke well circumstance place treateth god rightuousnesse whereof haue spoken knowing full sinnes corruptios end may apply whole studie doctrine assuring selues wel shall neuer bring throughly passe vvherfore behoueth v mynde much apply whole lyfe therevnto bene throughly knowne men falne horrible darkenesse papacie seemeth superfluous thing treate free iustification fayth counte madde doctrine skoffe v standing somuch vpon yea heere shewed v euen haue vsed vision heauen haue muche vnderstande little secrecie let v vnderstande behoueth v diligent article haue imployed wittes yet shall comprehende hundreth part proofe heereof god rightuousnesse infinit thing corruption sea bottomlesse pitte therefore must maruell eliphas telling v heere hee small taste article let v nowe come hee addeth breath winde went fro die quaked shuddered heare stoode vppe stiffe throughout bodie appeered image vnto hee knewe ende heard voyce silence done ende haue touched wit make eliphas readie receiue god purposed saye prepare suche wise might vnderstand howe god spake ende doctrine might bee authoritie furthermore eliphas might bee humbled hee might bee hoissed vp presumption according men commonly chalenge themselues wote behoued eliphas altogither abased end might know owne want giue glorie vnto god true dayes haue vision time past behoueth v knowe whereas god gaue signes auncient father must serue v also day therefore reade holie scripture come sermon wee must bee touched maiestie god yeelde reuerence wee defile holie truth esteeming man tell v merie conceyted tale rather thinke thus seeing maker speaketh vnto v behoueth knee bowe men ought quake sayth lo haue mark sentece moreouer know god publishing lawe shewed token affray ment teach time therevpon people sayd let v come neere mountaine shall al die god speak vnto v thus ye see god authorize lawe wise people vtterly dismaid reason great number miracle shewed done sake onely time god ment giue v also knowledge power whiche permanent vnto world ende gospel hath yet greater proofe maiestie ther nothing either ought hinder v fro receiuing gospel except vnthankfulnesse vngraciousnesse put oure eye although wee see wonder god hath shewed yet must hold ourselues cotented god teacheth v worde wythout longing newe vision many wandring spirites doe whiche woulde angel shoulde come downe heauen bring newe reuelations heerein doe god great wrong content themselues god hath shewed himselfe familiarly vnto v seeing haue holy scripture certaine wee wante thing aboue thinges brightnesse gospell wee haue perfection wisdome sainct paule sheweth syth cace standeth tickled fonde desire haue vision doe well bewraye neuer knewe holy scripture let v contente v whiche hathe pleased god disclose vnto v well prophetes sonne oure lorde iesus christe assuring selues maketh v finall conclusion without passing hereby wee see whereunto come haue desyre raunge abroade leape beyonde boundes heere see whence came horrible confusion popedome heere wee see wherevpon pope groundeth doctrine hee sayth apostle haue declared profyte churche holy ghoste come make men frame newe article make men reste themselues vpon holy councels much pope hanger haue hild themselues purenesse holie scripture god hath vndoubtedly blinded owne folie wee see among bee dull brutishe finally haue beene growne farre kynde worshippe stone stockes timber thing farre square euen little babe might well ashamed commeth diuelish curiositie bee contented taught simply holy scripture beholde also wherevpon religion turkes founded mahomet hath reported himselfe bee partie shoulde bring full reuelation ouer besydes gospell meanes thereof vtterly become brute beastes day wee see poore beastes buzie heades doltishe vnsensible thing bee iuste vengeance god hath gyuen ouer wilfull stubborne mynde much hathe bene doone fantasticall persones specially dayes haue troubled churche would need haue vision one article cursed creature seruet burnt sayde holy ghoste reygned yet hee come wycked creature dishonored god thoughe father olde tyme shadowe holie ghoste though shedde himselfe visibly vpon apostle hee retyred agayne incontinently suche sorte churche hath beene destitute holy ghoste beholde hee sette downe respect himselfe would haue made himselfe mahomet haue holy ghost comaundement man may see diuell caried away requisite god bring men poynt end might abhor part let v followe order haue told alreadie wit let v taught according rule god hath ordeyned let v headie bynde god agree desire fashion let v content v holy scripture seeing god hath inclosed v within boundes thereof futhermore touching eliphas sayeth hearde voyce silence shewe god prepared wise hee bare awaye spoken vnto man rauyshed traunce may well heare thing yet haue remembrance commeth againe himselfe many come sermon doe heare well matter treated settleth much one aske treated cannot tell one worde prouerbe sayth wittes woolgathering one mused thing another houering aire setled giue eare vnto god vaine fancy conceyue come myndes many turmoyles hinder v gyuing eare audience vnto god wee ought giue wander owne imagination comprehende thing say see lesson whiche ought bee common among v wee must bee fully settled faythe cause eliphas sayeth voyce came silence stilnesse god disposed presupposed stoode hande giue eare attentiue spoken vnto haue touched alreadie namely come heare god worde wee must haue wittes rouing manner must holde short giue diligent hearing vnto god fleshely affection vanity carie v vnto wickednesse turne v hither thither way short wee must bee quiet heare god haue sayde ende may rightly vnderstoode v vvee see wee haue gather vpon sentence nowe let v come doctrine eliphas handleth heere shall man rightuouser god shall man rightuous maker beholde hee findeth stedfastnesse truth seruantes hee hath iudged follie vanitie angelles howe shall doe dwell house claye first place heere eliphas setteth downe sentence theme hee groundeth himselfe vpon vnreasonablenesse men desire glorifie themselues comparison maker must men needes destitute wit reason gloryfie selues comparing themselues god lo heere theme grounde much men easily abyde haue owne authoritie condemned behold reason hee addeth confirme doctrine god shoulde examine angel hee finde fault hee finde stedfast perceiue themselues vaine weake creature nowe angel shall become men dwell house claye bodie foundation hath firmenesse euer seemeth bee needes one little shoure raine washe quite away sith case standeth let v assure selues wee stande god presence wee come thither presuming bring rightuousnesse owne considering verye angel able doe thus see effect sayde vnto v heere haue consider meant mention made angel imagining bee agaynst reason god finde angelles throughly rightuous haue concluded ment concerning angelles continued obedience god falne become renegates diuels god angel kept state wherein god created fell horrible fall much fayne mirrours damnation vvee see maner diuers haue expounded texte namely seeing stedfastnesse angel fell looked men whose foundation clay must seke forced exposition magnifie angel place speaketh god seruants tytle honorable eliphas would haue sayde god hath founde stedfastnesse seruants hee would haue sayde beholde diuelles heretofore appoynted seruice god nowe falne suche horrible fashion fall thing brought wauering much eue mankind also come like perdition drawne selfe decay eliphas woulde haue spoken sayth god found truth angelles hee founde follie vanitie hee sayeth founde rebellion backesliding sayth onely vanitie greater maner speeche well considered doubt eliphas speaketh heere angelles serue god giue themselues wholly therevnto meaneth hee saying stedfastnesse rather vanitie vnstedfastnesse vvhen sainct paule sayeth none immortall onely god certayne excludeth creature yet wee know angel immortall spirites god hath created purpose shoulde returne nothing soule man may tyme dye howe shall wee make sentence agree angelles created lyue euerlastingly none immortall onely god solution easie aungels immortall bycause susteyned power aboue bicause god mainteyneth beeing immortall nature selfe verie fountaine lyfe sayde psalme lorde fountayne lyfe dwelleth thee thy light shall wee see light seeing lyfe god onely yet notwithstanding hinderance spredding lyfe creature proceedeth grace wee perceyue howe aungels immortall yet haue stedfastnesse themselues haue nede god strengthen meere goodnesse vvithout thing woulde happen vnto whiche spoken hundred fourth psalme sayeth thou withdrawest thy spirite decayeth vvhat gyueth liuelinesse aungelles heauen spirite god wee see haue thing themselues giuen god neyther could inioy euer god cotinue sayd grace hath put like wee speake lyfe must wee speake righteousnesse also aungels stedfast foorth god holdeth vp rightly called principality power bicause god executeth power guideth bee shorte angel haue nothing theselues whereof make boast power stedfastnesse haue holde god much indetted touching followeth namely god findeth putteth hebrew worde importeth god putteth follie vanitie implyeth vanity angelles commeth god meening hee putteth chargeth iudgement say iudge giueth sentence folly vanitie say faultinesse angelles yea could stande would deale rigorously verily seemeth straunge suche exercised holy scripture wee wiste righteousnesse god wee marueyle angel themselues found faultie copare himselfe must alwayes come back poynt good thing creature small estimation whiche god vtterly infinite therefore must alwaies put difference betweene one vve see angel haue wonderfull power vertues specially respect v notwithstanding angel abide degree creature yet may wee well glorifie come god greatnesse muste swallowe vp reste likewise wee see howe sune darkneth starres skie sunne planet well rest yet neuerthelesse bicause god hath graunted creature haue brightnesse starres must needes ouershadowed starre ca pereeyued sunne hath full power bee done whe god himselfe cometh foorth prophet esay sayth shall neither sunne moone brightnesse god shall suche shall seene knowne ouer vvhen esay speaketh god kingdome sheweth thing muste bee done away nothing glorified onely god seeing let v referre also spoken wit god findeth lacke angelles although bee seruantes yet let seruice angel vnto god perfect according perfection creature likewise respect praying wee desire god may done earth heauen wee witnesse vntowardnesse obedience angel yeeld vnto reigneth peaceable maner wholly conformable must alwaies beare minde haue touched long go degree state creature shall perfection angel verily perfectio may creature come vnto god sayd perfection swallowed vp like starres appeere sunne giues light furthermore behoueth v marke well paule sayeth iesus christ come gather togither thing heauen earth therby sheweth angelles haue stedfastnesse grace lord iesus christ forsomuch hee mediator betwene god creature true iesus christ redemed angel needed raunsomed fro death whervnto yet falne yet mediator intent ioyne vnto god al perfectio afterward mainteyne grace may bee preserued falling nowe seeing god findeth faultinesse angel say haue stedfastnesse tha mainteyned fro aboue thought v vve must bee faine come eliphas addeth glory yea power angel heauen let cace cosidered created dwell corruptible transitorie lodging brag wee much wee list yet nothing vanitie v say body dust poulder muste go corruption seeing wee dwell house clay excellenter dwell glorie god beholde face alreadie angelles beeing subiect chaunges turning world dwell alreadie heauenly immortality find experience lyfe better blast looke dispatched worlde euery minute houre sith cace standeth commes passe presume selues short stedfastnesse men doth slip vanishe away case stade betwene god v let v learne haue good regard one side wit vnto god true vnderstad mighty power apperteineth angel much neerer tha behold face haue perfection fault may found hee list examine rigor vvhat shall become v consider owne weaknesse shal become vertues would copare angel noble excellet creature thus see haue remeber sentece residue canot declared present let v fall face good god acknowledgement faultes praying dispose v receyuing worde wee may come heedlesly thing heare may run one care wee may beare away imprint throughly hart make v chaunge wicked affectios renounce selues quite ridde vaine trust selues wee may desire nothing worship greate god yeeld prayse deserueth specially inestimable grace giueth v lord iesus christ loue hee hath shewed v spared deliuered death v may make v feele frute effectualnesse hath purchased v death passion ende may bee receyued righteous giltlesse god father may please graunt grace onely vnto v also c seuententh sermon fourth vpon fourth chapter firste vpon fift chapter sermon conteyneth still exposition xviij xix verse fourth chapter followeth morning euening bee destroyed bicause man setteth minde vpon perish euer doth excellencie go avvay vvith shall perishe vvisedome nowe followeth fifte chapter call novv aunsvvere thee consider one sainctes doubtlesse anger sleaeth foole enuie killeth vvitlesse person haue seene already wherevnto talketendeth witte humble men bycause farre perfection angel sith case stadeth god listeth iudge angelles rigor hee shoulde finde sault ynough become vnable say thing themselues haue nothing vanity neuertheles might seeme rehersed sufficiet proue intent eliphas albeit feeble albeit life nothing yet doth therfore follow bee either sinner faultie god seueral thing say life trasitory vanisheth away euery minute houre say god may codemne v thing well cosidered reason alleaged fitte purpose case stadeth simply vpo men frailtie respect body vpo theyr dwelling corruptible flesh earthly thinke themselues although haue death cotinually eies also wee must marke comparison maner forme set betweene angel mortall men vve see angel nere vnto god beholde glory wholy giuen seruice yet stedfastnesse vphilde grace god might fade vanish away theselues god meere goodnesse mainteyned let v come men vvhere dwell bee farre inough fro said heauely glory sayd transitory lodging else body speake properly graues body prison darke hinder v beholding god wee alreadie vnder earth vvhat foundation duste yet wee consider selues neuer wee continually go decay death threatneth v incessantly consider whitte therefore wee neede woonder though nothing else infirmitie men seeing angel whiche neere vnto god haue exquisite perfection god maye condemne list enter iudgement see argumet whiche eliphas vseth fit agreing purpose nowe remayneth wey word touched may aduatage selues truely man speaketh v shortnesse life thinke nedelesse talk knowes nought god speaketh oft putteth v remembrance throughly conceyued life certayne firste wee woulde bee worldly wee bee neyther woulde oure thought bee blockishe bee secondly would haue regarde heauenly kingdome rest selues wholly thervpon despise heauenly life intangled heere wee cannot drawne hence foloweth none v knowe thing euery v confesseth say life shadow passeth away like floure greene herbe incontinently cut downe withereth short although prouerbs import ouershortnesse worldly life haue alwayes bene rife ynough yet still yet peerce hart v wee see warned thinke vpon better surely wee could recken yeares moyses speaketh xc psalme certesse taught well thinke vpon death also tend marke god calles v wote count vpon finger behold childhod differ little nothing brute beastes sauing incobrance trouble vnderstanding reason small none little one certesse draw neere ma estate lustes ouerboyling canot bridled come man estate passeth away hand anon old age attacheth v remaineth nothing v weery life put folkes trouble payne wist recken race life vpon finger certeynly wee shoulde dullard wee bee therefore let v thinke wee lose time set mindes vpon lesson witte knowe life nothing hundred thousand deathes manace v cheefe lustinesse haue vvhe kinsfolke friend depart see corse go buriall haue wit say man life greate death towne cou trey wee bee yet mooued forgotten v therefore haue wee neede exercise selues doctrine tyme oure life thus wee see scripture speaketh vnto v concerning present text sayd first men dwell house clay foundation duste say wee consider present life selfe wherein cosisteth beeing inclosed within lodging tende corruption else body behold stedfastnesse witte euery whit goeth incontinently vnto dust consumed either woormes winde say wee bee dispatched soone worme whiche thing nought wee scarce esteeme liuing creature yet consumed sooner thus see sayd vnto v firste place afterward eliphas addeth men perishe c nsumed morning vnto euening expounde though ment men perishe small time verie true herewithall yet wit wee passe minute lyfe approching vnto death cosider well man riseth morning sure shall steppe foorth one pace sure shall take repaste hee sure hee shall turne hande shall still wex elder elder life euer shortneth must consider euen eye sight life fleeteth slideth away v thus see ment beeing cosumed morning euening sayde afterward men perish euer bycause man thinkes vpo vve must treate two poynts wee may profit selues doctrine one poyntis whatsoeuer alwayes haue death eye prouoked thinke vpon haue sayde well knowne among men verie heathen skill say euery man playe doctor teaching men conteyned yet meane neuer good scholler v behalfe man whiche sheweth dooings euer knew consumed morning euening wit lustinesse seeblenesse stedfastnesse v holde selues one cotinuall state alwaies hast toward death death towards v must needes come thither legnth verily single doctrine alone would stand v steade make v storme torment selues like whe paynim knew life flightfull cocluded thervpon best neuer borne sooner wee dyed better v lo paynim reiected grace god bicause knewe honour doth v sendeth v worlde euen shewe himselfe father towards v asmuch wee reasonable creature haue image god printed oure natur wee haue record holdeth v childre despise grace say bene better v neuer haue bene created apparant blasphemie ynough v know long bee world wee bee consumed euery minute houre wee must come seconde poynt wit haue well behild brittle life muste also marke wee bee repayred agayne god grace specially susteyned vphilde according also two poynts matched togither hundreth fourth psalme sayde soone god withdraweth spirite woorking goeth decay yea prophete addeth also god spredde foorth power renewed worlde thing take liuelinesse vvee see haue marke wit wee know selues bee lesse nothing subiect vnto death wee muste runne thither ye would say spite teeth must vnderstad also greate weaknesse god holdeth v hand vphild power strengthned grate behold wherein haue reioyce chiefe poynt haue eye benefit good grace god hath giuen v aboue order nature restoring v worde prophet esay sayth fleshe grasse verily man greene florisheth withereth vvheras word lorde indureth euer yea cotinue heaue also end may haue euerlasting life redeemed vniuersall corruption earthly life god may dwell v make v parttakers euerlastingnesse vve see wherto muste come profit selues lesson shall see yet againe anon furthermore forasmuch see selues wanze away fast fro morning euening go cotinually decay therfore must bee busier bestow time wel god giueth v bicause short god hath put v world keepe v occupied seruice haue long time yet ca diligent earnest dooing dutie discharge selu whe shall come poynt god seruice body soules forasmuchas see needeth turne hand behold last cast ought much earnester runne according also scripture exhorteth v shewing v life heere race therefore may go loyteringly euery must chere vp himselfe pricke spurre forward himselfe thus wee see wee yet note vpon sentence sayde men cosumed away fro morning night let v come eliphas addeth sayth perish euer bicause man thinketh vpon man might demaunde heere whether wee shun death wee thinke vpon nine forty psalme sayd wise men fooles gathered one herde behoueth v vnderstand mankind shet vp vnder necessitie dying wherfore sayde perish euer bicause none thinke firste eliphas ment tea v men wex beastly looke theselues loke speaketh wee must alwayes referre present case hee maketh generall case treate man life trasitorie without going intendeth shew v somuch bee poore silie creature creeping vpon earth wee cannot attayne perfection angel yet come nere whereas sayeth perish euer bicause none thinke hee meeneth men go brute beastes without iudgement without discretion without thinking vpon death long time aforehand therefore taken tardy side hee purposeth declare men owne nature god hath gathered himselfe gouerned holy spirite end take hede doctrine behold two poynts wee haue marke touching first draweth nere text alleaged euen prophet prophet mocketh carelesnesse men make account dwell euer notwithstanding ought well perceyue life wit turning hand ye shall see broken man think seeme men take pleasure beguiling forgetting themselues consider endes beare themselues hande idol wilfull sotting themselues brutishnesse prophet saith folly reproued well knowen experience men deceyue selues throw themselues hedlong destruction frame themselues immortalitie imagine shall dwell euer thus see follie whiche conuinced euen eyesight yet sayth farre posteritie fro wexing whit wizer gathered thither one flocke like sheepe graue swalloweth vp greate small yet none thinkes vpon see howe geere relieth purpose eliphas let v marke holye ghost intendeth v vnderstand forasmuche wee bee flyghtfull ought haue death alwayes eye ende wee shoulde make hast thitherward attached fearefulnesse shall please god take v worlde yet amazed wee see moste part bee striken astonishmet know therfore bethinke v great afore hande end shall vpon condition created shall perish like fooles without thinking vpon yet witte must haue foresight tha matter onely perish euer vvhy mention made men owne kinde certaine haue eie renewment god maketh power spirite wee must v consumed better conceyuing heereof let v take helpe sayd hundred second psalme intent men ouerlike themselues owne state brag lustinesse owne prophet giueth v euen sky example although wee see hygh maiesty wee bee driuen maze yet notwithstanding euen selfe sky must grow olde chaunged go corruption garment doth shall become men must needes bee much frayle meane season saith sonnes god child shall continue wee bee giuen feare god wee shall haue firme well settled state behold prophet separateth god child common order nature haue seede life whereof sainct paule also speaketh eyght romanes see hee comforteth v forasmuche loden burthen corruptible weight body wee haue sayeth hee spirite god seede true life power shall one day bee fully restored therefore let v marke well thinke vpon frailtie ought haue knowen theselues nothing nought else vanity leasing shall perish altogither seeke remedy whiche god hath offered shall bee gathered bondage death renued god hath chosen himselfe make power flowe downe vpon may drawe water fountayne lyfe vvee see suche bethinke themselues present life ende thereof cannot consumed euer bycause god remedieth wretched state wherein wee bee borne nature calleth himselfe haue gather sentence touched long since wit whe haue singly perceyued life nothing greatly boote v vvhy make v dismayde take courage must haue eye poynts wit see necessitie v vntill drawe nere vnto god wee must mourne worldling doo beeing drunken theyr pompes pleasure rich doo wittingly willingly mocke beguile themselues haue sayde wee must cast away kinde blindfoldings open eies whe come vnto god haue acknowledged miserable plight wherin must assure selues god reach hand vnto v bicause seeketh nothing else succour v draw v darkenesse wherin nature thus see wee haue marke effect immediatly sayde exceliencie men shall taken away shall perishe wisedome true behoueth v humbled death witte god bereue v glory wee shoulde brought nothing end might know al stedfastnesse power proceedeth fro else fro free gooduesse god short liue selues bicause pleaseth god haue v come neere vnto draw fulnesse according hath giuen v lord iesus christ foutaine opened vnto v god sheweth v whervnto leadeth v intent may filled therwith behoueth v brought nothing owne nature yet therwithall know god hath stripped v cloth v agayne se wherfore paule whe hath sayd must grone logas liue world addeth desire vnclothed wee desire bee still beholde wherevnto nature driueth v bicause knowe another better dwelling place prepared v whe lodging destroyed god cloth v immortalitie bring v true state thing wherein differ vnbeleuers fro haue tasted whit god grace thus see sayd sentence shall excellency bee taken away ye behold present state men cosider themselues ye must needes conclude brought nothing death haue grace god supernaturall succor v somuche perishing perish whe vnclothed immediatly clothed againe haue sayde already thus see eliphas addeth wisedome hee intendeth alwayes condemne men bycause blockishe neuer thinke vpon themselues let v marke great wisdome prepare selues vnto ath passe cheerfully whe come say shall haue profited greatly reputed wise god sight whe shall haue learned present lesson throughly able put vre receiue fruit yet notwithstading see euery man shunneth melancolike matter somuch man speake death euery greued falles dump neuerthelesse cace stadeth men set mindes vpon muste needes ouershoote theselues deuises cosultations greatest wisedome weene haue must needes turned foolishnesse wherfore greater folly tha man know himselfe purpose serue wisedome discretion loke selues thinke vpon death ne put theseluesin mind ouershoote theselues much possible yea coulde finde harte play wilde colt forgetting themselues vve see al one men ment bury wit reason god hath giuen therfore without cause eliphas codemneth men dying without wisedome much say although god haue told wherevnto must come haue set butte eies say go thither yet run astray life long know whither go cometh poynt must depart hence grunt grudge striuing fighting god although boote yet shew furious sturdinesse thus see effect wee haue marke text remayneth see coclusion eliphas maketh sayeth iob hath turned al side shall finde faythfull man sort copany man vtterly forsaken god hereby see spake men heretofore hee toke owne proper nature wit without hauing respect speciall grace whiche god giueth opening kingdome vnto giuing hope saluatio gouerning holy spirite making go better euerlasting life eliphas ment set downe owne proper state plight suche bee owne selues time separated fro god appeareth sayth iob thou canst find much one faythfull thy sort whome thou mayest call thy companion vvhy sayth anger sleaeth fooles enuie spite fretting choler moodinesse whiche gnaweth man like wilde beaste thing sayth killeth witlesse certesse according haue declared already eliphas doth amisse applying person iob yea doth great wrong yet notwithstanding doctrine ceasseth bee true profitable wit oft wee bee chastized god hand wee muste haue eye haue gone afore v see whether haue suffred like torment anguish wee see god child haue traced path v muste greeue v ioyned howe vve see holy father farre excelleter tha men haue indured aduersitie men god haue spared chalenge priuilege tha oft see god child haue bene beaten diuers rod vexed many misery greeses haue wherwith comfort ourselues chere vp hart must alway haue eye end howe god neuer forsooke pityed come extremityes must also hope doas much v marke speciall poynte furthermore wee haue god bee pitifull mercifull vnto v aduersities let v beware wee frette agaynst kicke againste spurre wee doo shall sentence bee verified vpon v anger sleaeth fooles sayde suche chafe grinde teeth affliction shew selue haue profited euill god schole shall gaine ende shall doubling miserie vvhe shall haue fomed rage god whe shall haue spewed blasphemy thinke haue wonne prize ala may bee deceyue themselues much haue sayde already shall doubling miserie lo howe anger sleaeth foole moreouer whe haue spite others stand pleading agaynst god dealing roughlyer else doth maner fretting make pyne theselues away ende perish come vtterly nought behold haue gather vpon text papistes farre ouersotted made saying eliphas serue turne prooue ought pray sainctes departed ought flee refuge beholde say saide iob haue respect one sainctes seeke peradueture would answere much purpose sayd iob went seeke dead make intercession vntoo god contrarily haue shewed heretofore truth matter finde sainctes bee company sainctes alwayes meeke minde aduersities god chastized asort refrained rigour end good happy although time bene shaken hande suche sort coulde bee perceyued care yet notwithsta ding referred theselues vnto prayed alwaies vnto assuring theselues neuer vtterly forsaken disappointed saluation promised lo intent eliphas see papistes falsifyers haue manifestly corrupted holye scripture verelye nede borne withal one behalfe meene beastlinesse greate neede wreste wring holy scripture prooue theyr dreames would make men beleeue ought pray vnto sainctes deceassed yet holy scripture cyphereth one word neither finde muche one sillable good proofe proue therefore muste needes cofounde white must turned blacke meane behoueth v shunne mennes inuentions whiche haue beene foolishly contriued without god warrant wherefore first men wander right way saluatio whe folow owne deuises secondly causeth holy scripture torne peeces men corrupt turne vpside downe therefore let v learne mislyke whatsoeuer thing men haue forged owne braine let v holde v simplicitie namely muste couet know ought sauing god hath declared v owne mouth conclude let v marke well two poyntes haue glaunced alreadie witte often scourged god hande let v marke well whither faithful haue gone v haue beene like plight finde god hath excercised many tribulation let v cofort selues commeth turne follow let v sure god forsake v neede forsooke furthermore wee see god doth scourge v dayes well generally particularly must fayne indure many torment trouble let v acknowledge selues bee well worthy considering greate thankfulnesse seene v whereas hath pleased god call v vnto knowledge gospell haue v yeelde record child howe take profite grace nay contrarywise seemeth v delight disanull make vnauayleable god serued honoured hand ought bee yee woulde say little angelles cosidering light gospell god hath giuen vnto v yet wee see nothing naughtinesse hypocrisie moste parte men vvee good skill make protestation oure fayth lettea man examine life hee shall finde conformitie gospell rather seemeth haue cospired god withdraw selues vve see haue goodly outwarde shew become brutish therefore let v sure god visiteth v whippes bycause sinnes yet notwithstading let v ceasse trust continually call vpon praying burie former faultes guide v wise henceforth may serue draw v vnto himselfe intent may haue pitie vpon v lette v come vnto lowly minde wee haue peece enuie hartburning v whereof mention made heere assuring selues wee haue styrre vp inflame god vengeance agaynste v vvhen wee bee come suche sturdinesse behooueth god also rushe stoutely vpon v sayde eyghteenth psalme vvith frowarde thou wilt deale frowardely men needes play wilde beastes sayde god strike sidelings ouerthwart therfore let v beware fretting chafing maner repining let v rather acknowledge oure selues woorthy hundred thousande deathes god pityeth v succoureth v infi goodnesse wee doe thus let v doubt god performe hee hath promised v witte hee hath beaten v howbeit men rod keeping measure shall vtterly destroyed withdraw hande againe shall feele mercifull fauourable lorde iesus christ whome hath set foorth rich goodnesse fatherly loue towardes v let v humble selues throne maiestie beseeching make v perceyue fault suche sort wee may become owne iudge preuenting iugemet intent condened owne selues wee may desire nothing please respect vntill haue bereft v mortall body deliuered v fro bodage sin wherein yet shut vp take v heauenly kingdom let say almighty god heauenly father c eightenth sermon seconde vpon fift chapter haue seene foole taking roote immediately haue cursed house child shall bee farre helpe shall bee troden dovvne gate man shall deliuer hungry shall eate vp haruest picke midst thornes thirstie shall drinke vp rich miserie commeth duste neyther dooth trouble grovve earth man borne trauell sparkes flie vpvvarde haue seene heretofore win repine god accuse cruelty passe boundes impaciencie wit make cace worser must bee consumed fretting rage forasmuche oftentimes despyzers god prosper well ease mention made state notwithstanding men esteeme happy worldward eliphas sayth hee sawe foolish man prosperitie iudged comon trade say man happy blissed god knew end euil punished eue ofspring although eliphas doo misapply sentence vnto iobs persone yet doctrine god holye ghost man god dooth oftentymes vtter suche kinde saying turne v false opinion may coceyue see punished runne excesse wickednesse rather seeming fauoured god know comon opinion wee esteeme thing may seene eye minde wadeth god lift vp hand execute iustice may seene scarcely men vouchsafe regarde winke thing tary paciently sinner wee thinke bee asleepe hee gouerneth world letteth thing go randon without minde remedy see howe blockishe wee bee lord sheweth v wicked ceasse bee cursed euen middes prosperitie wee neede spite good fortune terme must double punished farre better miserable bycause shall pay ouer deere pleasure beholde effect eliphas sayeth behold also sayde behoueth v marke well sentence namely bicause coteyneth verie profitable lesson wee may better profit selues conteyned heere firste behoueth v note worde foole put suche regarde god although worlde take bee wise men whiche skill deale well owne profit shift matter cunningly say holy scripture telleth v none wisedome feare god haue eye vpon god wee direct lyfe according put whole trust haue recourse succour beholde true wisedome see paule sayth learned gospell perfitly wise finde order whole lyfe without missing erring although men full suttlety fine conueyance wene themselues bee verie wise yet must hold v taught v euerywhit folly vanity long feare god reygneth let v come sayde haue cursed foole notwithstanding hee taken roote yea haue cursed house immediatly vvhen hee speaketh taking roote expresse seemed well prosperitie haue continued firme stable eliphas sayd haue seene foole aduaunced aloft great dignitie expressed much doth sayeth planted bicause despizers god peruerse froward folke hope haue fortune alwayes sleeue like tree throughly wel sattled deeply rooted ground stadeth fast though shake wind stormes eue seemeth god hath aduauced wicked shal reygne cotinually triumphes shall neuer come end eliphas sayth sawe likelihod hee forbare curse wicked hand hee sayth immediatly meening taried till came change commonly first blushe wee see despizers god bee chiefe ruffe haue winde sterne terme linger time astonied saying wil geere proue perceiue falling decay chaunge minde log see florish wote say wit end contrariwise eliphas telleth v abashed whit matter spake minde according god vttered comming giue iudgemet codemnatio hed owne fancie declareth according god sheweth v wicked shall cofounded end grouded thervpon shaken fro teptation although seene wicked fly high pitch yet hild still one stay saying must needes come naught wee see effect coteyned let v apply lesson owne vse wee may knowe howe agreable vnto v true wee haue doe codening stadeth euery rather looke vnto himselfe thing whervnto euery one v muste apply indeuer meddle hastily iudging theyr neyghbors forget themselues god wil spare though flatter theselues must faine come iudge wil handle rigorously bicause ouerslipt themselues much owne fault let v note minde muste gad heere seeke euill neighbour euery man must enter himselfe examine owne state lyfe wee finde fault selues must condemne furthermore wheras said must also curse wicked despizers god yeelde authoritie preheminence v selues howe firste wicked sorte persecute trouble v v wrong anoyance wee imagine god hath giuen v ouer hee careth v herevpon tempted conceyue greefe though loste time walking singlenesse vprightnesse saying howe nowe looke god shoulde haue succoured mee neede haue serued haue put trust yet hee suffereth mee bee tormented vttermost finde releefe whe pray vnto hee make though deafe vve see verie troublesome temptation god seemeth make none account succoring v time men missintreate v persecute v therefore comforte slues withall wee must practise lesson trouble incomberances thoughe wicked bee theyr tryumphe day set foote vpon throte god hath forgotten v sende v remedie ende let v wayte pacience shall finde issue bee suche god hath promised wit regard v mercie nowe see profite redoundeth vnto v cursing wicked wit wee shall perceyue howe nothing vnhappinesse theyr estate throughout let v proceede yet vvhen wee see wicked haue better tyme good men child god wee see craftie politike wee see triumphe euen seeme bee exempted common misery earthly lyfe say see vexed wee woote say thinke seemeth better gyue ourselues lewdenesse good forsomuche god setteth better order matter worlde intent bee prouoked amisse wee muste take conclusion wit despisers god seeme bee king prince take theyr pleasure glory estate yet ceasse bee cursed true cursednesse appeereth firste daye secrete muste haue leysure shew selfe otherside wee muste behold thing though cannot seene eie yea must beholde fayth bycause god hath spoken alreadie owne mouth muste sticke vnto whiche hee sayeth selfe matter seuen thirtie psalme treateth much wee see thing confounded mortall life wicked froward sort haue ease well good also seemeth god minded cocker shew fauour reason whereof wee may see perking vp flourishing like ceders mount libanus short desire commeth effect seemeth eye stroute heades fatnesse three score thirtenth psalme sayeth vvhat done cace world deemeth folke blissed men clap handes side vvee must curse say must fully resolued selues nothing god hath tolde v hee haue oure eye bleared present thing hee haue v assure selues faith shall turne mischiefe vtter vndooing submit themselues vnto concerning word curse let v marke gyueth v scope wishe mischiefe confusion partie meane desire geance oftentimes wee bee caried away passion rayneth nothing v hartburning bitternesse leastwise foolish vndiscrete zeale whereas sayde eliphas cursed wicked man house importeth nothing else hilde whiche scripture teacheth sheweth v therefore v iudges greate rashnesse wee take much preheminence vpon v say man shall make euill end man shall come shame man muste presume farre belongeth god onely curse blisse part wee haue agree hee sayeth answering lord thou art copetent iudge worlde doth behoue v herken telleth v obey saying without replying contrary without demaunding possible done may gone hand god haue spoken word euery one v muste holde himselfe contented see worde curse importeth remayneth gather whole summe whiche conteyned heere two temptation cast way comon euery v feeleth himselfe haue neede bee armed shal euer dauger miscarying vnlesse take hold coclusion set therfore whensoeuer wee outrageously misintreated wicked haue v aduantage seeme woulde deuoure v wee haue meanes put v let v make muche sentence call remembrance ende god suffer wicked ruffle continually hee well able redresse thing amisse thing may bee sure seeing sheweth v effect experience beholde heere inestimable comfort faythfull oppressed tormented wrongfully whiche knowe whiche persecute cursed god furthermore let v vnderstande contrary part also affliction blissed say although worlde esteeme v wretch gazing stocke haue fleece eaten back yea also troubled tormented yet god ceasseth dispose thing suche wyse euill vswarde turned good theyr dealing shall welfare beholde child god ought cheere vp themselues mids sorrowes wee see sayde psalme god cutte asunder cordes wicked drawe plough vpon backe hys church namely intente good men shoulde stretche handes doo euill commonly thinke thing shall continue always broile shall neuer better ende thervpon tempted giue ouer selues vnto euill man goeth doo v wrong next way set v chafe vvee see desirous walk feare god singlenesse daunger stretche theyr handes vnto euill say giue themselues following wicked god sheweth hee cut asunder coardes torment v shal haue abilitie anoy v hereafter marke speciall poynt furthermore see suche scorne god full gyuen ouer lewdnesse restreyned full scope take benefite tyme ladie fortune terme seemeth laugh vpon let v ceasse cursse say let v paciently wayt ende shall assure seluer prosperitie shall turne confusion intent wee shoulde enuie finally let v learne apply vse haue sayde therefore god suffer v indure muche worlde humble v withall one v smitten sicknesse pouertie euery man beareth owne crosse let v thinke god hath forgotten v state woorse like cursse wicked prosperitie know nothing else dream glydeth awaye also contrarie part shall seeme god hathe shaken v worlde iudgeth v oure flesh owne nature prouoke v temptation let v assure selues god turne welfare afflicting v bycause wee haue neede bee wounde intangling worlde hee doth duetie physition towardes v intending purge v oure naughtie corruption outrageous lustes fleshe make v kicke agaynst master like horse ouerpampered god foreseeth also let v holde certaine sure wee bee blissed worlde seeth nothing curssednesse v euen according fleshe wee perceyue nothing vnhappinesse euen see fayth cannot light otherwise vpon feete bicause god loueth v sheweth himselfe father vvee see effect wee haue beare minde let v well aduised cast forth sentence cursing fooles v cannot iudge fooles except haue god spirite guide v discretion wee may iudge aduenture haue tolde alreadie fooles eliphas speaketh wit men would take wysest glorie finenesse suttlenesse wittes yea much feare liuing god caried away looke euen themselues see reason nothing follye vvill yee iudge men first let v haue eye vntoo god secondly let euery v enter himselfe examine himselfe well true wisedome therein consisteth say wee must first formost haue eye vnto god wit submit selues wholly vnto serue true humilitie frame selues vnto worde put whole trust grace call vpon flee refuge thus see point must begin minde haue true rule wisedome afterwarde let v enter owne selues vnderstande owne vice wantes may mislyke selues sigh see keepe way forth godwarde wee ought vvhen haue done may haue good discretion iudge fooles although worlde clappe handes wicked yet let v ceasse set light yea hate abhorre sayde fiftenth psalme must haue none estimation walke feare god behold ought honourable honoured among v despisers god delight naughtinesse must esteeme dirt myre wee must account doings filth cannot abide stinche liue dishonour god men make reuerence sooth vp must abhorre dogges filthinesse doth infect whole worlde thus see howe wee ought proceede wee may iudge accordingly god therewithall let v also practise thing set downe eliphas sayth hee hande demed accursed whome worlde thought haue attayned full measure felicitie vvherby ment must change opinion according alteration wee see worlde perceyue wicked exalted seemeth v come naught rather god executeth office al one good euill purpose well therefore let v swift hastie iudge according successe thing let v consider worlde neuer troublesome wee must alwayes conclude whatsoeuer god hath declared vnto v shall fulfilled short reason measure god iudgementes owne fansie let v hearken sayth vnto v although first dashe perceyue effect accomplishment conteyned holy scripture yet let fayth worke behalfe holde v backe let wittes roaue let v say seeing thys man despizer god leadeth loose life must come euill ende know alreadie mishap sheweth selfe bicause god hath sayde must suffize v moreouer let v learne say conteyned eliphas meeneth hard men report beholde man shall bee curssed hee shall vnhappie sayth trusted god although saw thing confused worlde yet notwithstanding fully persuaded none blissed child god honoured leaned altogither goodnesse yea although persecuted mocked reiected made laughingstocke shoulde seeme starke doltes bycause iolitie worlde yet ceassed bee accepted allowed god hande notwithstanding worlde deemed contrarie beholde haue remember sentence euer time required practize lesson dayes require world full contempt god verely man shall see wylinesse ynough folkes wittes sharpe suttle inough dayes man shall see fewe none regard god number small nay rather men walke rashly headily ye would say religion world seeth also see iniquitie reigneth extremely euen wise part men become shamelesse ashamed euill vve see thing thus confused yet whiche esteeme god fauour euen woorst furthest square conditionally bee suttle sharpe witted bring matter well full wyles shiftes beholde bee wise discrete men although wicked estimation euery man make muche yet let v holde accursed bycause god oddes cannot shewe fauour herewithall let v curse euill men yea let v hand say let v tarie till god lift vp hande worke manifest meanes doo verie small honour make account iustice see execution wicked men brauerie proude good fortune terme let v take scorne abhorre let v holde accursed whatsoeuer come specially ought mark well eliphas addeth child despyse god shall fall downe gate shall bee sette farre saluation man shall succour hee doth v vnderstande god accomplish iudgements heere well worke vpon ofspring shall seeme haue escaped hande howe may bee shall giue themselues wholly vntoo euill long liue god shall suffer gather goodes increase continually heape vp rich anew euen till dying day yet notwithstanding bee curssed rich reuenues curssed well cursse perceyued person father bicause shall shewe itselfe child hereby admonished god hath diuers maners executing vengeance therefore let v learne walke feare aduisednesse verily first sight maye seeme straunge god shoulde punishe child father sake yet doctrine rife ynough scripture besides meant like father god doth well shew himselfe sauiour borne descended euill auncesters see example holy scripture yet falleth commonly issue wicked sort accursed according also god auoucheth hee pursue vengeance third fourth generation vpo despize lift vp themselues double maner punishing wickednesse father vpon child sometymes god sheweth mercie child yet notwithstanding cesseth chastice vnrightuousnesse father person child example see father hath gotten much goodes bee wicked bargayning subtiltie craft crueltie yet god haue pitie vpon childe man ridde quite cleane euill gotten goodes bicause woulde bring confusion according sayde kinde rich wood ende kindle fire god wrath therefore lorde meeneth saue childe wicked man hath liued amisse hee bereueth hys euill gotten goodes though let bloud saue life might wrapped mischief corruption father drawne vntoo himselfe beholde howe god punisheth wickednesse father vppon child yet ceasseth bee sauiour child shewe mercie sometymes hee passeth bicause father haue bin farre al square haue led stubborne froward life god forsaketh ofspring insomuch grace holy spirite dwelleth nowe wee bee destitute god guiding muste needes runne intoo destruction needes muste mischiefe increase thus see child vngodly doo beare sinnes father onely god forsaketh leaueth vppe state owne nature also hee giueth satan full power ouer letteth haue brydle raigne suche house owne pleasure diuill hath ledde away father caryed naughtinesse child shall also ouershoote themselues intoo excessiue outrage vvee see nowe ment heere witte child wicked men destitute god grace walke owne inordinate lustes must needes come greater confusion theyr father thus yee maye see sayde shall bee destitute helpe shall fall downe gate witte bycause shall fall forrest among theeues open iustice scripture worde cate signifieth iudgement bycause men caces wont bee debated place common assembly made finally seate iustice ment psalme sayde child good men suche blissed god shall bee mainteyned gate put enemy confusion likewise contrarie part sayde text child wicked shall stumble crushed peeces yea euen plaine iustice vvhereby better expressed god persecuteth openly apparant eye layeth hand vpon addeth immediatly man shall succour god myndeth put men destruction hee leaueth destitute meanes helpe succour deede referre vnto men vnderstoode howe god hath bestripped left destitute succour intent shoulde neuer holpen vp againe partes according whiche haue touched already wee haue much cause cast downe eye pray god make v walke aright obedience although wee perceyue curse vpon v vpon childre yet notwithstanding may take conclusion god hath meanes v incomprehensible insomuche shall seeme vnto v thinges go well wee haue prouided aforehande onely whole lyfe also death child also may good surenesse welfare may seeme wee haue set thing good order nothing amisse wee may consider nothing soone god doo blowe vpon determination deuises hee shall turne vpside downe vvhen wee knowe let v abuse pacience hee spare v time let make v ouersleepe selues sooth selues vice let learne v returne vnto due season preuent vengeance wherewith manaceth despisers place herewithall let v marke oftentymes good men child may happen persecuted vniustly neuerthelesse holy ghost presupposeth true also may sticke vnto certaine infallible scourging troubling v god hath respect prouide v ende hath sufficiently tried v humbled v turne euill benefite welfare haue sayde contrarywise whereas sayd race wicked shall stumble set farre helpe expresse whe god intendeth punish wicked hee proceedeth sort men may perceyue hee doth tame might returne vnto mortifie fleshly affection finally cure like phisition confounde bring vtter destruction behold holy ghost presupposeth also let v learne discerne chastizements god vseth towardes child benefite punishment sendeth vpon wicked amende shew himselfe iudge agaynst followeth goodes suche men shall bee deuoured hungrie yea euen picking corne among thornes fieldes shall reaped enemy shall deuour al substance also men shall scrape altogither betweene hedge thing hidden bee two three eares corne among bush shall bee gleaned vp heereby eliphas meeneth god iudgements vpon wicked lyke vnto correction hee sendeth child sheweth howe hath vtterly cast hee pitieth hee haue feele fatherly goodnesse bycause hee acknowledgeth lo effect spoken herevpon wee haue nowe call mynde haue declared afore witte wee bee troubled vexed tormented wicked wee must paciently abide god leysure till hee put hande succour v although wee perceyue god iudgementes first pushe yet notwithstanding let v assure selues hee execute due time place also wee see execution let make v stande awe sithe wee see vengeance horrible let v brydle selues beware wee tempt god sainct paule also exhorteth v lette man abuse sayeth hee vayne woordes reason suche thing vengeance god woont come vppon vnbeleeuers stubburne personnes therefore god doth shewe v iudgementes let v quake let v stande feare awe submitting selues wholly whiche hee sayeth vttereth hee addeth howbeeit cannot expounded present namely becommeth v yeelde selues suche wyse god may answere bee euer sayeth vnto v assuring selues thing fall chaunce worlde long earth ayre heauen men afflicted men beare bane themselues let v acknowledge happen affliction worlde let v sure hande god whiche lighteth vpon v sinnes mischiefe commeth selues haue verie welspring groundworke thereof within v let v say acknowledge ende may mislyke selues vice therevpon pray god drawe v himselfe make grace hath put intoo v auaylable saluation mainteyned power hath openly shewed towards v name lorde iesus christ may able prosper blissing let v cast selues downe presence good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v feele wise may returne true repentance suffer selues gouerned henceforth hande yea maner holy name may bee glorifyed v whole lyfe let v saye almightie god heauenly father c nintenth sermon thirde vpon fift chapter sermon conteyneth yet still exposition sixth seuenth verse followeth vvill reason vvith god turne talke vnto god doth great vvorkes yea euen vnsercheable vvoorkes vvhich doth vvonderfull deedes vvithout ende vvhich giueth raine vpon earth vvhich maketh vvaters gushe dovvne streetes began heertosore tell ment saying trouble commeth earth miserie dust man borne labour wee bee troubled inconuenience wee gaze v search corner wit finde cause selues yet perceiue god scourgeth v sinnes fountaine aduersities mishap indure must sought owne life warned sentence wee heare speaking misery man life eche one v also feeleth part portion therof wit must wander abrode fetch long windlass atoneside atother euery man must enter himselfe searche owne sinnes shal find maruell though beset round many necessity life subiect wretched state vvhy like wood carieth nature propertie receyueth fire kindleth easily also standeth cace v haue sin wood matter affliction wherevpon commeth wrath god must nedes cosumed sparkle therfore flie aloft sayth eliphas yet secrete operation steele striken vpon stith certain spark would passe euen behoueth v vnderstand fire al misery inclosed selues shal haue profited greatly beare away lesson although euery one v confesse god scourgeth v iustly yet enter foresayd consideration rather labor shun much vvhensoeuer man hath aduersitie god knocketh doore prouoketh thinke vpon sinnes man make none accout yea rather worse sleepeth soundly aduersitie fathereth either vpon thing vpon find casuall chaunce goeth seeke great way neuer entreth intoo examination hys owne life therefore whereas subiect many misery wantes let v learne take whole burthen blame vppon oure selues charge eyther heauen earth example wee see weather distempered commeth frost thunder haile let v assure selues aire disposed selfe come drought heauen hardened owne nature earth barrein proceedeth owne kind selues cause therfore sayd borne vnto eliphas presupposeth forasmuch borne euill wholy inclined ouermany vice meete bee handled therafter god answere v according come vnto verily bring al corruption v mother wombe naturally giuen naughtinesse sinne therefore muste state sutable therevnto say forasmuch god findeth v must also send v knoweth bee conuenient iust rightfull v eliphas meeneth god created v purpose deale hardly v taketh man corrupt nature euer since turned away god saith requisit estate shuld bicause able conceiue god spreadeth goodnesse vpon v intreateth v gently wee obedient vnto poynts forasmuch men neuer humble themselues except bee constrained therto force indeuer striue god eliphas addeth another sentence wit turneth himselfe vnto god purposeth reason say men cannot abide receiue doctrine namely shoulde bee tolde well worthie bee scourged therefore must striue agaynst take al good worth blame creaturs misery indure rather acknowledge theselues cause therof men cannot stoupe coceiue true except made stoupe shewing maiestie god therfore vntil haue sinnes layd afore v bee made perceyue howe god whome wee haue deale man whiche holde himselfe aloofe hath answer readie tongs end setteth color vpo misdoings though altogither rebellious yet notwithstading wil carelesnesse v whatsoeuer sayto v al one wee neyther greeued moued vice vvhat must vve shal neuer lerne true humilitie vntil made vnderstand god must answere cited appere throne feele iugde moreouer also cannot escape hande life must knowne examined vvhen brought poynt must faine looke vnto god begin sort rouze vp selues carelesse drousie loftinesse fond ouerweening sooth flatter ourselues withall come haue feeling perceyuing misery aboue god maiestie set oure eye make v feele howe dreadfull greatnesse sette afore v maketh v tremble yet vve see sporting matter heere sleeping v bearing oure selues hande vvherfore roome flattery god consuming fire appeareth maketh v come nere vnto wee perceyue howe hee maketh mountaynes melt able make cleane riddance thing therefore know greatnesse god needes must sinke vnder forget pride thus much concerning intent eliphas nowe must consider doctrine applie selues first al oft feel selues sufficietly wakened condemne selues sinnes let v vse order set downe v haue eye vnto god vvee may see man sufficiently conuinced sinnes notwithstanding goeth still followeth owne swinge reproued else otherwise feele remorse owne conscience passeth ouer taketh great greefe bycause hee hath eye vpon god thus yee see maketh v continue sinnes yee see cause wee bee cast downe true humilitie namely bycause perceyue god iudge hee wyth haue none remedie haue spoken wit first wee bee wakened oute sinnes otherwise wee neuer thinke bee sorie much may fall diuell shall bewitch v bee constrayned perceyue goeth well v shall become amazed wee must come seconde poynt say ala poore creature art thou able scape vengeance thy god vvhen worlde hath magnified thee yet shalt thou misse condemned al creature perceiue thy shame thou must bee brought shame little babe euen vnto beastes thou canst shift thy hand shall become thee thou must bee faine come heauenly iudge thinkest thou hath dreadfull iudgement damnation thee seing thou continuest naughtinesse thus see wee meane waken selues oure sinnes displease v ynough wee feele liuely earnest sorinesse requisite thus see must reason god men imagine selues haue better ende staffe long abide heere belowe trauell alwayes end according flesh nature ouer much giuen way man bee rebuked bestyrres spake sayth hast thou thou looke well vpon thy selfe thou shalt finde bee blamed home thou art hastie vpon mee thou seemest thoughe thou wouldest quarell mee seemeth thou wouldest deface beholde snap men rebuke v yea wee doo muche god specially man accuse v wee sticke seeke still suche startinghole howe vvhen man considereth himselfe hee perceyueth well god punishe hee dealeth rightly start examining neighbour hee saye himselfe one woorse least wyse badde hath suche one deserued greate punishment thus wee see howe wee labour alwayes iustifie oure cace fleeing god therfore behoueth v marke wel lesson must reason men say must stay wee shall gaine nothing must rather call home wit aduisedly say ala see well god scourgeth mee therefore behoueth heedfull consider hande therevpon prepare selfe humilitie hauesayde alreadie furthermore whereas sayde shall bee better touched thinking vpon god meaning must know god bee suche one long men beare themselues hande disguise god false imagination bending reede dalying little babe yea worse greater libertie vsed god little babe proceedeth outrage consider greatnesse therefore must surmyze god presume disguise make suche one fansie lust away must know bee one sheweth himselfe worde must also conceiue suche sort hee vttereth himselfe workes vvhen haue well bethought v certaine prattling well stinted wee bee pert rash come pleade agaynst beare selues hande hee tormenteth v without cause wee haue deserued maner self flatterings must thrust downe hypocrisie must done away must abashed dismayd said greatnesse maiestie shal haue conceyued god thus see seconde poynt well worthie bee noted ought knowe god truly faynedly see saint paule sayeth men vanished away imagination namely bicause transformed god inasmuch robbed god glorie god also put shame hee gaue vp lewd minde reason whereof gaue themselues ouer villanie shameful doings cast themselues dishonestie man might ashamed filthinesse sayth glorified god wrongfully deface maiestie turned truth lie transformed wise seing maladie ouercomon euery man hath experience himselfe therefore standeth v hande marke well doctrine wit thinke god must bee done reuerence knowe falsly surmyze bee true god sheweth himselfe v word yet neuerthelesse vnexcusable co sider workes also inasmuch hath left himselfe without witnesse sayth paule xiiij actes hee speaketh order nature glasse v behold god paule sayth expresly god maketh sunne shine sendeth rayne sendeth diuersitie season hee maketh earth yelde frute herein leaueth himselfe without good recorde one pleade cace say vvhereas men haue knowne glory maiestie perceyued haue thing hand gouerne thing haue created reason alledge ignorance verie order nature might haue perceyued one creator whiche disposeth let v open eye wee shall haue proofes ynowe shewe v greatnesse god end may learne honor deserueth thus see eliphas doth lesson turne greatly profit practise throughly short let v beare minde oft communication concerning god moued vntoo v thinke haue worde let v marke properly belonging vnto god cannot separated ende may magnifie worthie vvere well setled v much giue superstition neither worldly two vice reigne haue alwayes reigned world one contempt god men care trample vnder feete much lieth true able impeach maiestie neuerthelesse diuelish pride seene men steade worshipping god submitting themselues vnto could finde heart throwe vnder foote triumph ouer suffer haue kind authoritie ouer thus see maladie ouer great outrageous yet hath beene tymes saye menne ouerheathenish knowe reuerence whiche owe vntoo god othervice superstition whiche vnder shadowe deuotion menne gad seeke foolishe inuentions whereof commeth thys mischiefe euen bycause god knowne rightly properly belonging vnto wel vnderstoode mightinesse iustice goodnesse certaine men woulde caryed away men forge themselues vndergoddes say forge idolles owne heades assigne office though woulde deale vertues pertayne vntoo god alone though woulde put spoyle euery one haue share bootie nowe ye see sayde must much diligent knowe god aright namely ende hee bee robbed honour man bereue owne resteth onely howe may doo haue alreadie brieflye tolde howe neede onely open theyr eye god vttereth himselfe suche sort order nature wee vtterly vnexcusable wee yeelde whiche eliphas sheweth heere hee beginneth say god woorkes great vnable bee searched hee doth wonderfull decdes without number eliphas taketh generall sentence afterwarde specisyeth thing particular example whiche hee spoken summe therefore preface one worde foreshew hee ment say wise god doth exceeding great incomprehensible thing doings wonderfull without ende vvhen vnderstand god workes exceeding great incomprehensible shall forced lift vp mindes perceyue wee must disguise surmize thing naturall reason must mount vp higher certaine ledde thervnto whether thus wee see eliphassis meaning vvhen men looke vnto godwarde touched suche feare humilitie requisite vvhat reason bycause thinke workes god workes come discourse euery man think himselfe competent iudge speake verdite vpon yea wee bee bolde ynough rather ouerbolde controll god woorke fashion wee bee full grudging wee say wherefore hee went matter vvhat cause suche ouerboldnesse men saucie god holde plea agaynst specially make themselues iudges bycause haue considered great incomprehensible workes workes god incomprehensible haue wee measure great ynough declare vvhat witte vvhen wee haue stretched vttermost length breadth may able comprehende hundreth part god woorkes determination whiche highe hidden v vve must go selues wee minde onely taste wonderfull infinite wisedome appeareth god workes nowe must mount aboue owne wittes get little taste shall become v wee incloze wee knowe vttermost pray wee attaine therevntoo vve see men worse mad presumptuous desyre determine god workes imcomprehensible true cannot gage bottome god workes comprehende reason yet god keepeth good way giue v knowledge knoweth bee behoofe note god workes incomprehensible themselues say wil search euer parcelmeale shall neuer able atteyne depth therefore wee must bee whelmed vnder sayde greatnesse assuring selues take vpon v bee iudges god workes shall find wherwith stoppe eies bycause cannot atteyne secret furthermore wee shall haue proceeded suche humilitie knowing wee bee competent iudges knowe thing high deepe v let v pray god giue v spirite wisedome wee may iudge aright hys woorkes hee graunt v grace perceyue much behoofe wee may discouer decypher nothing shoulde bee vnknowne v shoulde fall oute oure imagination god holde v short shall knowe part meane season sayde knowledge must suffyze v muche nothing shall bee hidden v good conuenient welfare therefore let v contente selues herewith otherwise vnthankefulnesse v bee desirous enter intoo god secretes reade therein wee woulde haue thing escape v fond curious haue desire make subiect fond braine thus see two poyntes wee haue marke heere infinite wisedome workes god smallest basest greatest sort surmount capacitie specially cace concerneth redemption concerneth god sealing vp recorde adoption v hys holy spirite matter surmounteth common order nature chiefly sayd hath chozen v worlde made hee hath chozen v generall many hee thought good hee hath forsaken rest wee see secretes highe v vvhat done let v assure selues tootoo vnexcusable behalfe walk feare warenesse considering thing incomprehensible thinke attaine high desire stye vp maner aboue skyes hauing wing make v breake neckes moreouer haue giuen glory vnto god confessed onely mouth also deede workes incomprehensible bottomlesse pitte swallow vp vnderstanding let v ceasse pray make v perceyuc farre foorth knoweth meete capacitie therewithall let v also searche shewed v holy scripture god haue v negligent v say papistes wee muste bee inquisitiue god secretes holy scripture giuen v god euery man shoulde seeke yet therewithall wyll also men shoulde holde waye hee sheweth wit al humilitie follow conteyned holy scripture nowe wee haue learned god teacheth v schole let v hold v come toy head contrarie hart tickled seeke meete v know let v beware haue wisdome modesty say poore creature meete thou shouldest presume haue larger instruction tha god giues thee holy scripture let v wey well saying end may hold selues sobrietie iudge rashly god workes sayd god doth wonderfull deedes without end vvhereas god wor called wonderful secret worde importeth bring v reuerencing god meening knowing greatnesse work shoulde astonish v driue v contrarywise draw v reuerence shoulde honor saying lorde howe mightie art thou lorde howe great thy power thy goodnesse thy iustice thy wisdome vndoubtedly dauid knew wel infinit greatnesse god workes yet notwithstanding hee ceasseth say lorde thy work full wisdome rightuousnesse knew well haue consider god work yet hee honoured neuerthelesse let v learne conceyue suche greatnesse god workes might make v dull lyke brute beastes knowe become take instruction good learning conceyue may serue represse v wit ouerwandring wee play horse broken loose take libertie haue tolde say know cometh passe let v modest true wisedome ignorant thing god haue hidden fro v thus see must prepare selues lowlinesse modestie furthermore let v vnderstand ther withall must reuerence workes god howe comprehende infinite wisedome rightuousnesse power conteyned according smal capacitie assuring selues god doth thing without reason although knowne vnto v first dash god doth alwayes vtter present reason workes may perceiue againe sayd wisdome deepe named bottomlesse pit therefore let v learne reuerece god work although perceiue euermore cause hee worketh vvee see well wise god workes wonderfull hee sayth expressely haue none ende vvhereby men yet better humbled wee chaunce come full vnderstanding one thing seemeth v nothing go beyonde v cunning question whiche propounded vnto v shall bee assoiled hand put cace able iudge god workes two three hundred vvhat right nought without number haue sayd alreadie least god workes ynough ouerwhelme v shall become v whe come sayd bottomlesse depth whereof none ende lo howe behoueth v wey well spoken heere generally way preface make v enter better consideration god workes wont may yeeld honor vnto maiestie due haue touched heeretofore eliphas hath spoken generall speaketh particularly also saying god giueth raine vpon earth maketh water gush downe streetes seemeth bee nothing purpose matter hand men may perceiue theselues rightly punished god handle wil must stand pleading shall gaine nothing must necessitie ouercome mention made rayne seeme bymatter must marke bee put mynde comon order god kepeth gouerniug creature end apply al wholy owne vse haue run vp downe trauersed fro one side another must enter selues must waken vp wit must apply doctrine vse haue spoken may honour god deserueth thus ye see mention made raine doubt vnder one particular eliphas coprehendeth say vve onely see god hath created thing workmanship sky earth al think vpon must needes astonied also see howe guideth disposeth thing giueth raine winde sendeth cotrarie also listeth thus much co cerning saying eliphas furthermore let v marke ynough yeelde vnto god honor soueraintie dispose creature owne pleasure must also consider ende wherefore vvhich shuld lern therby submit selues vnto acknowlege father master see whereat holy scripture amed fayle therof two poynts first formost regarde god whether raine whether make fayre weather shet eye true wee bee glad rayne come may serue turne meane passe knowe god sending mind tyed earth cannot mount vp thither also wee haue faire weather see sunne glad shining yet notwithstading cosider god hath kindled cresset giue v light thus haue regarde god whiche verye great ouer beastly vice let v put cace god come thought yet many say god bee praysed faire weather meane forget neuer remeber say god giueth v faire weather shewe himselfe father towardes v therfore becometh v like minded vnto behaue selues true child therwithall bethinke ourselues thus behold god creature obey yet obedience hath vndoubtedly beholde order nature must lead v certen fear god present tasting goodnesse end may giue vp vnto wholly dedicated obedience lo maner must practize sayde lesson eliphas sheweth v heere witte god sendeth rayne maketh water runne gushing thorough streetes vve see also maner holy scripture speketh therof haue tolde already good wisdome know end intet holy ghost setteth thing vnto v thereby may lerne feare honor god know maner authoritie wee graunt vnto maner soueraintie hath ouer v therevpon come iustice also humble selues vnder true eliphas misbehaueth himselfe applying thing person iob neuerthelesse haue said heretofore doctrine good holy ghost must receiue doctrine mortal must say spirit god spake therefore remaineth v haue said wisdome discretion knowing profite selues time place shewed v heere let v like eliphas wresteth thing person iob haue receyued generall doctrine confessed true let euery one v arme himselfe accordingly see effect shewed v heere wit inconueniences wherevnto life subiect must fathered vpon sinnes wee muste blame neither heauen earth creature prosper wee woulde wishe euery one v must condemne himselfe consider howe haue wood within v fewell kindleth fire god wrath forsomuche wee bee giuen euill euen byrth must maruell though wee bee subiect many misery necessity troubled dyuers maners let v blame god let v haue eie welspring wit sinnes cause inconueniences wee endure world let v take heede therefore plead agaynst haue bin wont rather let v yeelde selues giltie let v knowe rightuous punishing v intet may learne feare honor humblenesse becommeth v thus ye see haue remember vpo text wayting till residue may layde foorth fully nowe let v cast selues downe presence good god acknowledgement offence beseeching make v knowe better haue done aboue thing holde v awe vnder maiestie wee maye bee touched quicke bee dull wee haue beene heretofore may knowe maner wee ought iudge workes therewithall haue eye according hee sheweth vntoo v worde intent wee humbling oure selues vnder greatnesse maiestie maye desyre nothing glorifie name poynts onely mouth also verye deede shewe hee well worthie reigne ouer v thing great small ought humble themselues vnto honour may please graunt grace onely v also people nation earth c twentith sermon fourth vpon fifth chapter exalt despysed bring safetie vvhich vexed heart hee disappoynteth thoughtes vvicked vvise handes thing enterprise hee ouertaketh vvise ovvne vvilynesse disappoynteth determination craftie noonetyde vvalke darkenesse grope rode day light night plucketh avvay oppressed svvord mouth hand strong hope heereafter oppressed mouthe vvickednesse shall stopped sayde heere god exalteth suche despised sentence well worthy bee borne minde heereby warned repayre vnto wee see selues oppressed proude seemeth shall bee vtterly ouerwhelmed specially forasmuche sayde god plucketh backe safetie vexed hart wee bee tormented aduersities wee extreme anguishe let v learne call vpon god sith chalengeth office saue distresse able indure true god giue seruaunts prosperitie shall neuer disquieted hath rightfull reason moue doe wee see pryde man nature although appeare fully yet seede hidden god therefore must remedie meane thereof tame v affliction surely wee shall see diuers suffer many aduersities yet bee neuer humbled like restie iade suffer himselfe bee beaten bellye bee ripte rather hee obey stubborne vttermost pleaseth god tame men maketh affliction bee force whiche hee sendeth serue medicine purge sayde pryde presumptuousnesse whereout could otherwise drawe themselues vvee see howe without cause god dothe exercise child euen suffer bee despized worldwarde bee scorned bee quite cleane without authoritie credite bee shorte seeme bee vtterly forsaken vvhy doth hee bycause haue neede bee aschole vvherefore sendeth hee many aduersities fayne sighe grone wote whiche side turne make call vpon flee vnto refuge vvee see howe affliction wee bee taught first knowe ourselues presume thing selues bee puffed vp pryde statelynesse secondly take muche pleasure oure owne lustes rather forsake worldly thinges finally call vpon god whiche principallest pointe long men bee ease although dare say goe beyond god yet doings shewe themselues sotted haue minde call vpon god commende selues vnto yee see god suffreth seruauntes bee afflicted suche wise yea euen bee pinched anguishe hearte wote become therefore let v beare doctrine well mynde considering hat muche profite furthermore aboue let v aduise oure selues practize oure neede vvhensoeuer wee shall bee oppressed men shall seeme wee must needes perishe seeing declared heere howe god office lifte vppe oppressed recomforte sorrowe let v doubte hee performe promise hee hath forgotten nature wee shal certeinely finde hee shewe himselfe bee hee beginning heere wee see also wherefore hee abaceth suche aduaunced dignitie honour vvhen man beholdeth suche backtumblings thinkes bee wheele fortune wicked sorte grudge god shoulde play men ball happeneth reason vnthankfulnesse suche hyghe estate forget whence welfare commeth therevpon bee sotted greatnesse wexe stoute againste god dyuers wayes fall outrage therefore god fayne abate suche manner pryde wee see cause maketh god pull downe whome hee exalted afore namely say bycause keepe themselues within boundes modestie giue glorie vnto god know themselues contrariwyse honour god hathe doone vnto forget themselues aduaunce themselues without measure therefore god fayne shewe howe bey bee nothing doe beguyle selues pryde therefore let aduaunced hyghe estate beware walke feare god carefulnesse moreouer suche bace despyzed haue inough wherewith comforte themselues haue sayde haue promise belongeth god giue helpe suche distresse lo wee haue marke although bee done alwayes apparantly eye yet notwithstanding suche sorrowfull heart aright saye whiche caste downe flee vnto god
