seeke reliefe hande shall feele operation doctrine certesse v generall doe finde experience god lifteth vp despyzed wee nature plight dothe god finde v hee adopteth v bee child wee plunged filthynesse infection onely also fayne drawe v gulfe hell reason whereof may well bee sayde doubtlesse nature wee bee cursed caytifes bring nothing v image deathe nothing v sinne specially sayde ezechiell wee bee lyke chylde newely come wombe mother yea euen mother full corruption insomuche besides myseries wherein hee wrapped hath also maner filthinesse gore bloud maner vncleannesse prophete speaketh vvee see state till god haue made v cleane seeing euerie one v alreadie knoweth selfe owne behalfe howe god hath exalted v calling v hope kingdome heauen eternall lyfe yea hath plucked v euen bottomlesse pit death clenzed v stinking filthinesse haue wee cause hope like heereafter therefore aboue thing wee bee suche distresse wee beare let v put vp sute vnto maye please succour v haue pitie v vvee see howe god regardeth suche bee ofcastes worlde ende succour followeth immediatly hee breaketh determination wicked ende handes shoulde accomplyshe anye enterprise vvee see yet one comfort whiche behoueth v marke well wee may bee pacient world notwithstanding enemy assayle v side true god spareth v sometimes hee sheweth open warre againste v wicked haue alwayrs power persecute v otherwise letted else god dothe sorte brydle rage muche wee haue alwayes open warre yet impossible god child liue world bee many peril continually must walke simplicitie true ought bee wise lord hath giuen muche wisedome requisitc howe euer worlde goe must maynteine selues crafte wylinesse wicked practizes althoughe bee among wolues yet must bee lambes sheepe although bee among fox yet must continue doues muste keepe still simplicitie whiche god commaundeth vvee see howe worlde fraught naughtinesse muche yee fynde right honest man saye verie fyne seede rare bee met withall nowe god shoulde worke disappointe purpose wicked shoulde become v wee perishe hundreth time adaye wee see heere texte whereof wee muste make owne profite god watcheth heauen disappointe enterprizes practizes whiche wicked sorte doe contriue againste v firste formoste bee temptation v wee see oure selues watched wayted vpon nothing else sought catche v auauntage winde aboute v saye bee tempting v doe like saye selues haue doe suttle foxe therefore muste bee faine keepe good watche howe wit wylye double wyly say prouerbe beholde howe wee bee giuen decline vnto euill make two diuels one prouerbe sayeth wee bee assayled naughtinesse men waye holde v obedience vnto god make v walke simplicitie soundnesse acknowledging god bee oure buckler hee prouide well inough mischeeues prepared v true wee ought defende oure selues yea verily farre sorth god giueth leaue witte wee steppe aside vprightnesse hee commaundeth howe euer case standeth wee vse guile practize anye thing vnlawfull v doe vvhen wee proceede manner lette v assure oure selues god well inough finde meanes dispatche enterprise suche thinke catche v pitfall craftinesse god prouide suche wise knoweth bee profitable v furthemore nothing spoken heere wee finde daily experience child god bee anye time deceyued knowe god hilde vnder protection saue snare ginnes suche seeke nothing wynde aboute bee ouertaken euery blowe small thing also whole life see well inough seeing wee haue suche proofe doctrine ought better confirmed thereby howe vvhen man hath eye selfe wee haue skill inough say nothing naughtinesse worlde man tell whome may trust whiche side euer man turneth himselfe hee daunger deceiued come confusion faithe trustinesse nother kinsfolke friendes vvell sith euerye man maketh suche complaint wee bee beguiled let v marke well god defendeth v likely wee bee beguiled euerie blowe would become v god remedie therefore let euery man acknowledge preserued hand god without cause god hath auouched office make deuises wicked vanish away ende execute attemptes true although god giueth wicked men strength execute deuices yet hee well able preuent practizes ouerthrowe euerychone hee sayth anone hee ouertaketh wyse owne wylynesse sometimes god blyndeth weene selues bee verye suttle cunning hee maketh bee naked lo heere one waye whiche hee hath saue albeit hee let wicked men runne vpon brydle albeit haue manye deuises albeit seeme impossible wee meanes escape handes yet notwythstanding euen god shall haue gyuen suche libertie manne shall see ende geere shall vanishe awaye bee euen pointe set practizes abroche saye wee see wee haue doe yee see howe wee muste proceede euen deuises shall washe away therefore shall haue set thinges readinesse shall haue concluded vppon matter likelyhoode deuises shall come effecte god mocke man woulde wonder see howe thinges shall fall cleane contrarie whiche imagined true shall perceiue howe doone intent knowe howe god worketh wonderfull fashion therefore gracious goodnesse muste needes appeere better thereby towardes v let v marke well sayde heere effecte namely god suffreth wicked haue store wile suttle deuises maye seeme shall vtterly ouerthrowe whole church else go oppresse one man two three likely meanes bee resisted vvhat bee doone cace vvee must flee god say well lord true see enemy haue store guyles matter come incountering suttle shiftes pollicies wee shall bee farre ouermatched vtterly vndoone commeth thy turne dashe al deuises make flee awaye ayre maye haue power hande put execution beholde howe wee muste haue recourse vnto god sticke promise whiche hee hath made v heere therefore god shall haue suffred wicked sorte debate liste myndes vndertake able holde handes tyed welinough maye bee hee giue leaue raunge farre inoughe yet therewithall commeth poynte accomplishing thing whiche debated shall bee disappoynted handes shall bee tyed beleeue haue thinges commaundemente shall bee destitute counsell aduisement yea force power muche god hath prouided matter incomprehensible maner thus muche concerning strayne eliphas proceedeth yet saying god ouertaketh wyse theyr owne wylynesse determination wycked defeated yea euen suche wyse stumble open lyghte darke grope aboute noone dayes nyghte heere eliphas onely declareth god suffer wicked accomplyshe whiche conceyued heartes also addeth god ouertaketh owne wyles suche wyse ouerthwarteth deuises bee berefte wittes wote doe little babe practizes become altogither laughingstockes wee muste marke well two thinges haue sayde heeretofore wee see god disappoynte oure enemy pollicies oure side wee haue greate aduice lykelyhoode wee shall misse bee oppressed yee shall see v ouertaken dispayre bycause oure seeming god meant ayde v hee woulde put forthe himselfe make long tarying therefore hee make delay astonied afraide meete wee pacient though god resist wicked confederate themselues suche wise againste v rather giueth leaue debate vpon matter wherefore hee come due time deliuer v handes notwithstanding beleeue certeinly bring attemptes aboute oure vtter ouerthrowe yet neuerthelesse sometymes god tarrieth long pittieth ou e feeblenesse hee seeth v daunger bee shaken preuenteth matter maketh hast succour v howe beholde oure enemy ouersuttle polytike moreouer bee practyzed man woulde suppose suttle shiftes whole worlde hadde passed throughe handes good cause haue wee bee afrayde wee see haue made tryall suche manner pollycies god able sotte suche sorte shall become beastes whereas thought haue bene handesome men coulde bee become like little babe muche wonder see consulte thinges wherein neyther ryme reason say howe commeth passe god well skill howe sende spirite drunkennesse shall stagger reele without drinking anye drop wyne according hee declareth prophetes lyke hee gyuer witte discretion suche filie idiotes contrariwyse hee knoweth howe blynde vnderstanding suche thinke selues see farre afore muche euen hyghe noonetide doe nothing grope lyke poore silye blinde soules vve see eliphas ment shewe heere doctrine extendeth selfe verye farre thereby taught see enemy practize possible againste v wee may set light assuring ourselues oure god make attemptes vayne according wee see howe prophete esaye speaketh two sentence goe youre waye sayeth hee take counsell togyther yet shall come nothing lorde disappoynt euerywhit go way sayth make great deliberation gather selues togyther yet muste disappointed god holdeth counsell heauen make naughtinesse suttleties bee turned backe yee shall winne nothing againste beholde also gret force prepared citie hierusalem poore king ezechias come vtter extremitie much made countenaunce withstande enemie sawe himselfe vnable match mynded purchase peace money therevpon spoyled himselfe substance contented temple god fleeced left value one dodkin citie hierusalem palace quite emptie rich behold poore king refuseth paye ransome soeuer man would aske might scape lyon mouth verye likely shoulde haue bene vtterly vndone herevpon god sendeth prophet mocketh enemy go lay head togither deuise yee yee yet shall yee bring none enterprise passe whyso lord setteth himselfe practizes maineteyne people churche thus see haue sayde behoueth v take heede wee put lesson vre therefore wee bee come point wee knowe whither way v yea euen seemeth vtterly vndoone alreadie let v flee goodnesse god easily finde meanes vnknowne v aboue thing soeuer see wicked persecute v quarel gospell let v doubt god vtter power speciall maner behalfe like dayes true god enemy full ynoughe suttle deuises haue mayster wit diuell hath shoppe well furnished stuffe pope adherent haue wyles ynow diuell forge ynow still see mischeeuous practizes side see men thinke greatest skill kept wage blaspheme god slaunder doctrine truthe make v hated worlde finally buy sell v side intent wee come vtter decay vvhen thing aforesayd come eye haue else wayte pacience specially seing sure god well tell hold hande fast tyed haue sought corner wit prolled aboute whole earthe yea mounted aboue cloud god suffer put thing execution furthermore hee well able make men dullardes take themselues politike wise men say make dull euen little child shall laugh beastlinesse according see verye deede wee marke god truth incountred adayes clawebackes pope vpholders shall see besotted likely men could come doltishnesse specially man marke weene themselues cunningest seeme confederate v wee haue giuen wage mocke antichrist mayster would faine pleasure disgrace proofe hereof man reade bookes say speake fauour v part knowe vvhereof commeth doubt god accomplisheth thing spoken heere knowe manifestly seing god sheweth deed thing hath spoken vaine let v learne stay ourselues vpon douting able ouerthrow al practises deuises take themselues cunningest hee make grope hygh noone blindfolded darke hee sayeth expresly god ouertaketh wyse theyr wylynesse vvhen eliphas vseth worde wyse hee doth maner men glorifie themselues behalfe vvisdome singular gift god good comendable thing good sooth whence cometh holy ghost fountaine welspring thereof according also holie scripture sheweth v wee selues also knowe vnthankfull seing wisdome excellent thing condemned certein wittinesse wylynesse whiche wee see wicked enemy god deserueth called wisdome muche boaste taken bee worldwarde eliphas vseth worde according also ouercommon say behold yonder go wyse man ment wyse man effect diuelish creature man bee taken wyse man hee must haue loyaltie faythfulnesse vpright dealing conscience hee must bee able mocke whole world must able aduaunce himselfe hee must haue many fayre colour beguile deceiue men withall man full wisdome yet meane shall haue nothing fraude naughtinesse hee shall haue nothing hypocrysie dissimulation man bee mynded walke simplicitie vprightnesse meneth man wrong tush shall counted dolt idiot yea although hee haue witte ynough euen wicked men themselues inforced confesse much faine say yee see man wise ynough listed put foorth himselfe carelesse passeth nothing welter owne ease without putting himselfe hazard behold howe world iudgeth bycause suche one giueth himselfe craftinesse snatching men forsomuch world hath worde wisdome mouth vnhaloweth holie thing howbeit fasly abused yee see eliphas sayeth verie well let v put cace wyles wisdome deed termed commonly taken bee howbeeit wyll graunt title yet notwythstanding god knoweth well ynough howe disappoint owne naughtinesse shewed sayd wisdome whereof wicked vaunte selues worthye honorable title wherfore al said wylinesse thus yee see haue marke text nowe must receiue warning belowly see god put himselfe heere principall partie practyze euill neybours seeke winde suttletie vvhen wee see god setteth behalfe sheweth himselfe bee aduersarie partie pray ought haue good hold selues notwithstanding wee bee tempted vse crafte suttletie therewithall haue witte inough bring matter example maye oftentimes happen god putteth good men handes whome wee may beguile leade noze prouerb sayth verie well occasion offered wee ought haue good stay considering howe god sayeth yee vse deceyte guyle make warre againste men mee true maye easily beguyle sillie soule verie deede leueling therefore step shewe mine office dash disappoint al vngracious practizes wicked folke take hand brag much list owne wisdome put confusion euerye man shall laugh skorne wherefore bycause enterpryses yee beare selues hande ye bee able compasse thing policy wile shall fynde howe wisedome mee furthermore aboue case standeth vpon walking god let v looke rid clenze ourselues hypocrisie woorst wylinesse whole world men woulde beguyle god say doo vse suche language haue printed hart without cause prophet esaye sayeth vvo dig caues vnder earth say yee could hyde selues whome euen god himselfe ouerryfe adayes vvhat bee seene worlde first al men doo thinke concerning god man thinketh himselfe suttle ynough scape hande verye cause wicked despizers god run royot beare themselues hande beastlinesse v afrayd iudgemet come vvhen see v stande vpon wit see v exhort people feare wrathe vengeance god shew maye bee prepared v make mocke saying see fellowes turmoyle themselues vayne yet let v cease make lustie cheere must needes come god well tyme woorth monie beholde diuelish blasphemy whiche man shall heare although passe theyr mouthes yet hart full fraught short see vngodlinesse vnreasonable outrageous dayes may well sayde men make reckening prouoke god anger let v lerne therfore side walke singlehartednesse god may compelled lift vp hys hand execute dreadfull power wherof mention made heere wit perish ne ouertaken owne wylinesse thus see haue mark sentence consequently sayd god delyuereth sworde hande myghtie hee whiche afflicted shall haue hope hereafter mouth wickednesse shall bee stopped added comfort god child else state worlde tormenting many greefs troubling manye anguisshes anoyances vve continuall battell true god spareth v haue sayd heretofore bycause seeth weake gyue bridle looce satan mate deuoured first chop vvell lord keepeth v brooded vnder hys wing yet doth suffer v vexed troubled haue many hartsores giuen v wherefore intent prouoked desire help also intent learne take heede ourselues surprised satan cause decay negligence whiche flee vnto god wise bee prouoked call vpon lo maner v must world wit must afflicted deede word signifieth poore oppressed thys place signifyeth also well humbled brought low bycause pouertie true scholemistresse bring men meeldnesse may highmynded themselues haue sayd ouerhardinesse spirituall drunkennesse aduenture farre may walke according measure assuring themselues god succour euerie minute houre shoulde bee vtterly vndone thus yee see say god child must bee fayne bee beset rounde many affliction world purpose partaker god kingdome hereafter see little cace rich commonly puffed vp statelinesse dazeled pompes pleasure verye harde matter make humble true whensoeuer pleaseth god hee saue ryche great one well poorest moste despyzed brydling laying affliction vpon may bee poore meane euen midst ryches may know howe state miserable thereby constreined seeke god hang wholly vpon thus yee see plight god setteth v first afterwarde sayde hee plucketh v backe sword deliuereth v throte hand ouermightie woord god faithfull one mainteined ordinarie meanes alwayes haue army redinesse reuenge themselues bee assayled enimies shoulde haue great fortification bee strongly alyed thing shalbe vnprouided geere worldward else haue shall barre enimies beeing strong mightie bee able stande againste meanes vvee see wee must bee mainteined worldly meanes whensoeuer bee hemmed myghtier wee seeke nothyng else ouerwhelme v rescowed end know god defe deth v preserueth v vnder protection wee bee brooded vnder wing sort suffereth wicked worke malice vpon v fayne would readie letted aboue thus yee see haue marke deede wee see sufficient cleere mirrour dayes howe goeth worlde v seemeth god enimies starke mad churche shoulde eate v vp wyth one grayne salte prouerb sayth man make comparison power ala power syde vvee one little flocke sheepe one heard woolues infinite number woolues whole world full could fynd heart eate verie bowel v satisfyed putting v single death suche crueltie among man may well perceiue altogither hellish seing power great meane whiche seeke nothing destroye v make cleane riddance v yet neuerthelesse wee continue styll chaunce liue one day yet wel seene thereby god executeth office whiche spoken wit deliuereth oppressed hand ouermightie vve see howe ought better confirmed trust god hath begonne hee continue ende poore church threatened conspyred shee seemeth alredy good half oppressed yet notwithstanding remedie thing hath sayde hath forgotten cunning knoweth meanes howebeit vnknown vnto v therefore let v tarie leysure paciently conclusion sayth shal hope afflicted heereafter mouth wickednesse shall bee stopped declared vnto v purpose al haue herd hitherto hath bin spoken wit intent learn trust god verie hard matter doe true euerie man protest trusteth god trusting importeth much tell vtter much euen whiche shall haue studied lesson lyfe long shall haue profited wel haue learned half wit bee throughly persuaded god wyll forsake vvhen poynt say well settled heartes bee great forwardnesse lyfe expresly sayde hope heereafter must hope hope say mynde sh wee trust god good earnest must likelihod hope worldward v trust vnto death must hem v side must ouercast darknesse spect may one spark light comforte v bee short wee must haue nothing left v saue promis god hath made v saying sauiour notwithstanding semeth withall turne backe vpon v hath shaken v yea euen fauoreth enemy putteth cudgell hande strike v altogither v say tydeth yet neuerthelesse must trust continually thus yee see saide hope hereafter oppressed eliphas shuld say vvhen god child become last cast wote way turne waye escape yet let cease hope god shewe himselfe father sauiour neuer fayle conditionally rest themselues vpon sayde promis shall hope hereafter oppressed cease haue eye lyfe prepared though see death eye lo howe wee ought practyze doctrine moreouer though enemy confounded first dash yet god work suche wise shame shall light vpon spyght teeth ment saying mouth wickednesse shalbe stopped asmuch say wicked shall know reply god iudgemet part behoueth v haue mouth open glorifye god must resemble wieked confounded cease neuer whit blaspheme god grynde teethe although haue reply saying closeth vp hundreth seuenth psalme god prouidence spoken said god punished inhabiters lande sinnes one sort vexed warre sickenesse another sort suffered much inconuenience bothe sea lande commeth deliuering misery good men haue whereof glorifie therewithall mouth wickednesse stopped say although wicked dooers desyre nothing mocke god cast skoffs yet must shet vp may knowe say vtterly confounded shame report knowe god prouidence gouerning thing heere beneath see iudgements manifest let v learne glorifie holie name therwithall let v flee vnto oure aduersities shall haue succoured v let v render thanks vnto accordingly let v cast downe ourselues presence good god acknowledgement fault praying voutsafe make v perceiue better wee haue done intent knowing vnworthie helped hande may much willinger resorte vnto succour folowing way sheweth v wit wee may come lord iesus christ finde grace meanes heauenly throne may come thither displeased ourselues sinnes beseeching clenze v intente nothing may hinder v resorting vnto obteining request according shal perceiue bee expedient v maye please graunt grace onely vnto v also people nation earth bringing backe poore ignorant soules miserable bondage error darknesse right waye saluation whereof maye please rayse vp true faythfull minister worde seeke owne profite vaineglorie aduauncement holyname welfare flocke contrariwise roote sectes errours heresy seed trouble diuision among people end may liue good brotherly concord c xxj sermon fifth vpon fifth chapter beholde man blissed vvhome god correcteth therefore refuze thou chastizement almightie hethat maketh vvound vvhich ndeth vp vvhich smyteth vvhiche bringeth lyfe heretofore eliphas hath declared power god wee myght better readinesse receiue doctrine hee addeth wee see cause teachable requisite namely bycause wee knowe maiestie god stande awe therefore wee haue neede shewe howe god gouerneth world consider infinite rightuousnesse power wisedome nowe wicked bee confounded bycause god sheweth himselfe haue mouthes stopped muste become v god muste constreine v doe honour inough giueth v occasion hee sheweth howe iust cause v wee must come good accord let v beare mynd hath bene declared heretofore namely god iudgements layde afore v matter laught dalie behoueth creature tremble sayd man blissed whome god chastiseth therfore wee must refuse correction almightie man shoulde tell v god doeth men wrong becommeth iudge vseth great seueritie rigour towardes verely ought touch v neare inough yet wee would bee astonished doctrine man giuen v knocke heade beetle vvhat bee done must sweetenesse bee mingled may take taste shall bee sayde vnto v assuring selues profitable oure saluation eliphas hath set forth god iudgementes generall dispose v feare humilitie nowe hee sheweth god bee louing vnto v euer world goe specially chastizeth v neuer vseth sharpnesse towardes v make v feele goodnesse mercie therewithal intent wee approche vnto bee dismayed like afrayde bee confounded god meaneth maiestie shoulde bee dreadfull v meaning drawe v vnto ende wee loue doth v good also euen chastizeth v sinnes thus wee see effect haue gather vpon sentence shoulde seeme sentence contrarie written else holie scripture misery aduersities wee suffer earthly life proceede sinne consequently god curse howe thing agree wee blissed god chastizeth v yet neuerthelesse al misery come vnto v hand many signes displeasure wee haue ended hee curseth v whence come happinesse ioy god contrarie part god v wee see oure life cursed againe wee feele god angrie v punishing v shoulde seeme small blissednesse wee haue marke heere howe eliphas hath eye intent ende whereat god ameth chastizeth men true god doth v well vnderstand abhorreth sinne verie deede order appointed making worlde troubled hee handleth v like father yee see aduersities life shewe v signe god curse ende thereby wee shoulde vnderstande sinne displeaseth hee hateth abhorreth beare bycause hee fountayne rightuousnesse yet god hath declared hatred hee beareth sin also haue v perceiue hee draweth exhorteth summoneth v repentance doth god scourge v token loth wee perishe hee dothe rather prouoke v returne vnto correction recordes god readie receiue v mercie wee acknowledge oure faultes aske sorgiuenesse vnfeynedly seeing cace standeth wee muste thinke straunge eliphas shoulde saye man happye whome god chastyzeth wee must beare mynde two point haue touched whereof one soone aduersitie befalleth v wrath god must come eye wee may vnderstand cannot awaye sinne therevpon wee must consider rigour iustice wee may bee heartely sorie wee haue offended beholde poynte wee oughte beginne withall also let v moreouer take holde god goodnesse hee suffereth v runne destruction without drawing v home himselfe meaning bring v backe often scourgeth v thus yee see wee haue conceyue affliction remayneth yet one harde poynte meane season wee see howe affliction lyght vpon men without exception god chastizeth whome hee mynded shewe mercie wee see also hee punisheth castawayes yet shall turne greater damnation vvhat auayled roddes pharao felt sauing made vnexcusable bycause hee continued stubborne vnable bee amended agaynste god euen ende muche god scourgeth bothe good bad wee see experience affliction fyre kindle god wrath againste castawayes followeth therevpon god chastizeth many folkes reckened bee happie therefore herevpon behoueth v note eliphas speaketh heere whome god chastizeth child profite hee declareth followeth saying god byndeth vp woundes hee hath made swadling laying playsters making whole yee see howe eliphas restreyneth sentence whome god maketh chastizementes turne true amendment sentence bee somewhat darkest bee layde foorthe somewhat large yee may haue sure cleere resolulion let v marke howe god worketh towarde castawayes true hee exhorteth men repentance chastizeth haue said already one hee wake vppe say knowe faultes continue longer returne vnto mee readie shewe mercie yet well knowne sayde chastisement profit men also hee giueth al men grace return vnto inough god strike v hande excepte hee touch v within also holy spirit god soften hardnesse oure heartes fall v wyth pharao men like vnto stithies anuilds beating vpon able change nature see beate backe blowes againe euen vntill god haue touched v quicke within certeine wee shall nothing kicke gather rankour whensoeuer chastiseth v shall gnash teeth shall doe nothing else storme good soothe wickednesse men mischeuous headstrong desperate god chastiseth spue blasphemy shew themselues vtterly past amendment way bring vnto reason let v learne till god haue touched v holy spirit vnpossible chastisement serue bring v back repentance rather shall make v wex worse worse yet sayde god rightuous therby men conuinced much god hild bay sort punishing sinnes might pleade ignorance neuer wist ouershot themselues bicause god prouoked acknowledge fault haue felt hande god haue beene fayne perceiue iudgementes spyte teethe haue beene summoned yet notwithstanding haue onely gone onwarde euill woorse also bene puffed vp open manifest rebellion god hereby see effecte haue mouth stopped haue say themselues ye see howe god sheweth iustice often hee punisheth men notwithstanding found correction amendment furthermore god chastiseth castawayes one hand begin shew wrath vpon fire already kindled true vtterly consumed present time howbeit token horrible vengeance prepared latter day yee see many men touched god hande whiche notwithstanding accursed begin hell alreadie world according haue example amende wicked life god sendeth affliction vpon man shall see take corner stande barking like dogges though able yet cease shewe continuall woodnesse else like restie iades comparison made xxxij psalme finally altogither ouersotted knowe owne harme meane consider hande striketh prophet sayth crye ala shall feele blowes thinke neuer vpon god hand neyther knowe howe visiteth vvee see oure eye many men vnhappie beeing chastised god hande bycause profite schoole yet take good correction heere mention made precisely whome god chastiseth touching holie spirite therefore let v assure selues god maketh v feele hande humbled vnder hee doth v speciall good turne priuiledge hee giueth none owne chyldren vvhen wee feele correction whiche hee sendeth v moreouer taught mislyke oure selues offence syghe grone flee mercie refuge say wee haue feeling god chastisementes token hee hath wrought heartes spirite hygh poynte wisedome growe mynde man muste proceede free goodnesse god holie ghost must first haue softened sayde curssed hardnesse stubbornesse wherevnto wee inclyned nature let v vnderstande present text spoken precisely god child stubborne agaynste hande ouermaystred tamed holie ghoste intent striue agaynst affliction hee sendeth vnto yet saying seeme straunge opinion fleshe vvhy vvhatsoeuer inconueniences fall otherwise wee would haue terme aduersities vvhen wee indure hunger thirste colde heate wee say euery one aduersitie vvhy wee would fayne haue oure owne appetite desire good soothe maner speaking say mishapes god sendeth vpon v aduersities say thing againste v without reason neuerthelesse must vnderstande ende namely god scourging v bycause sinnes therefore let v bee beguyled flattering selues furthermore haue alreadie tolde onely requisite v consider god scourging v bycause hee hateth sinne summoning v make v feele iudge also need reach armes vnto v shew v redy one v euer wee shall come true repentance wee perceyue whome god chastyzeth happie notwithstanding shunne aduersitie much possibly also shall neuer consent doctrine receyue hart vntill fayth haue made v behold goodnesse god vseth towardes seruantes draweth backe himselfe may better comprehende lette v marke becommeth men god leaueth themselues maketh countenance clenzing sinnes looke vppon man gyuen euill example lette v take despyzer god god lette alone seeme chastyze yee shall see suche one harden himselfe dyuell shall carye still therefore much better bin chastized sooner greatest mishap light vpon v god suffereth v welter owne wickednesse must wee needes rotte away ende verely greatly desired men would come vnto god owne accord without spurring would cleaue vnto without warning giuen fault without rebuking say thing greatly wished yea moreouer fault v angel desyring nothing yeeld obedience maker honour loue father forasmuch froward cease offend god besides play hypocrite seeking coceale faultes forasmuch greate pride v would haue god let v alone vphold v lust fynally would iudges rather considering say howe froward standeth god hand vse violet remedie draw v vnto hee handle v altogither gentlenesse would become vve see thing partly euen yong child theyr father mother chastize sende gallowes true perceyue howbeit experience sheweth haue commo prouerbes father cocker child marre mother yet much fond flattering meane whyle bring naught herein god sheweth v small beames thing much himselfe hee handle v mildely wee vtterly vndone past recouerie therefore must fayne shewe himselfe father towards v rough v seeing sturdie nature deale gently v take good ye see may atteyne truth doctrine happie whome god chastizeth wit considering oure nature namely stubborne hard framed order god shoulde neuer chastize v profit therfore nedefull hold v short gyue v many lasshes whippe constreyned regard whither would shall length come conclude man happie whome god chastizeth yea verely adde second grace vnto wit hee make roddes correction auayle cause holy ghoste worke wise hart man may hardned aduaunce himselfe god maye haue care thinke vpon owne sinnes bee rightly tamed humbled thus ye see sayd greatest benefyte haue corrected god hand much haue cast account full wee shall fynde correction whiche hee sendeth v profite bread eate starue hunger god wyll haue pitie vpon v taking v worlde liue still heere bylowe ceasse prouoke wrath sheweth himselfe good liberall father towardes v see ye shamefull vnthankfulnesse pray bin better bin borne dead shoulde prolong life damnation god preuent v vse chastizements preseruatiue medicine tarrie till disease farre ouergrowen great benefite v one ought wish oft long correction hard bitter v flesh prouoketh v impacience despaire let v learne call lesson remembraunce man happie whome god chastizeth howbeit imagination say contrarily wee surmize nothing better spared borne withall certeinly although know experience without cause holie ghost hath vttered sentence yet notwithstanding meant thereby correction haue indure euermore sowre painefull themselues according apostle sayeth god also haue v feele pricking put v payne feele greefe god correcteth v obedientnesse furthermore shall learne angrie selues sinnes shall bee afrayde god iudgements tamed aright behoueth v greeued aduersitie whiche god sendeth v aud although aduersitie turned benefyte god thereby shew loueth v yet requisite pricking paynefulnesse intent wee may perceyue wrath god displeased selues sinnes yet heere withall wee muste mount vp higher haue found nature inclined euill let v confesse ourselues haue neede god vse sharpe punishment purge v withall see phisicions put kind poyson medicine see malady great deeperooted phisicion seeth well ynough weakening poore man vnstrengethening veynes sinewes specially gentler meanes wyll serue letting bloud euen muche drawe substance mannes bodye yet must e needes vse violent meanes remedie maladie euen god fayne worke v howbeit bee extraordinarie maner wee say wee bee happie bee chastised god hande must leade v vnto lowlinesse seeing god cannot procure oure saluation shewing himselfe bee v sayd iustly maruellous corruptnesse men sith god cannot sauioure father handling roughly nature shewe himselfe gracious gentle creature followeth order would keepe respect himselfe doth nothing else spred goodnesse vpon v wise replenished grace wholly rauishe thereat handle v gently according h owne nature inclination vndone therefore faine alter mind say shew himselfe otherwise towardes v hee would cause thereof vnrecouerable naughtinesse therefore wee haue good cause heere bee confounded shame see hee ayne yee would say disguise himselfe hee intende shoulde perishe thus muche touching thys sentence howbeit forasmuchas cannot well applye doctrine vse without adding followeth let v ioyne togither sayd refuse correction almightie hath made wound bindeth vp layeth conuenient playsters hee hathe sent maladie hee healeth heere exhorted refuze god correction cause thereof added byandby witte bycause god giue good issue lo wherein consisteth sayde happinesse whereof eliphas hathe made mention let v learne heere god purposeth exhort v pacience telleth v wee cannot eschew hand wee lose time rebelling wee must passe way spyte teeth wee cannot withstand necessitie pacience lumbard say whe wee shoulde grynde oure teeth manner therewithall lift vp selues god much v lyeth wee shoulde pacient perforce therefore wee wyll pacient godward muste drawen another manner witte wee must bee soone comforted sainct paule speaketh fiftenth romanes hee putteth two thing togither inseparable witte intent wee may haue pacience aduersities must haue tast god goodnesse must reioyce grace must assure selues scourging v welfare thing shewed v streyne sayd refuze correction almyghtie hee surgion sore hee sende health disease god sheweth v heere howe hys meening mennes submitting themselues vntoo say seeing wee noneotherwise nedes must god haue maystrie v wee cannot exempte ourselues iurisdiction cace standeth vppon comming lorde sayeth bee yee pacient humble selues vnto mee take warning iudgementes yee murmure mee ne stomack matter otherwise ye shall bee fayne bee beaten downe hand yea euen wise yee shall bee vtterly ouerwhelmed ye hubly acknowledge fault come craue pardon ye shall feele assuagement misery suche sorte yee shall haue cause yeeld mee thankes euen middes greatest trouble beholde say haue muze vpon wee may haue true pacience seeing owne nature wee bee stubborne god angrie touche v hys little finger seeing also wee haue suche proudenesse v wee thinke god dothe v wrong chastize v seeyng saye wee haue twoo greate vice harde matter purge v muche therefore must mind lesson shewed v witte god scourging v meeneth bring v backe himselfe yea euen benefite welfare furthermore behoueth v marke well promisse set downe heere witte god beale woundes e hath made true healing pertayneth men onely suche receyue correction meekely way lette v marke god haue menne put minde returne vnto considering gentlenesse whiche sheweth many taste thing conteyned heere also cause see much impacience much murmuring muche blasphemie vsed god correction light repentance none see seemeth men conspired withstand god vttermost vvhy bycause fewe conceiue presente doctrine receyue sayde promisse say lorde thine office bynde vp woundes whiche thou hast made heale sore therefore lette v remember well lesson specially seing often repeted onely sentence holye ghoste speaketh also wee see howe sayde lorde smiteth v healeth v againe third day hee haue gyuen v stripe rodde shoulde therefore imagine hee bee mercifull v wee come vnto vvhen suche exhortacions made vnto v prophetes one god shoulde say vntoo v true haue scourged spredde mercie vpon shall bee euerlasting ye felt anger signe choler father displeased child bycause haue hated bycause haue bene fayne make feele frute sinnes doo vnderstande hate neuerthelesse end ye shall finde purpose nothing el heale woundes cure disease haue sent true first blushe seeming meete god shuld take pleasure wounde men first heale vvhy rather doth hee lette v alone peace prosperitie haue alreadye shewed woundes god maketh good medicine v double grace whiche god graunteth v heere one god scourgeth v procureth welfare drawing v repentance purging v sinnes specially sinnes know god contented remedie inconueniences alreadye present considereth also muche seede sicknesse hidden within v therefore layeth holde v aforehande redresseth thing amisse singular benefyte doth vnto v hee seemeth come agaynste v naked sworde pretendeth angrie wyth v yet notwithstanding sheweth himselfe phisition euer world go marke speciall poynte followeth seconde grace also well shewed vnto v witte god bindeth vp woundes hath made healeth whiche haue alledged alreadye sainct paule hee suffereth v tempted aboue power giueth good issue misery although correction bee profitable yea necessarie v god fayne prouoke v diuers meanes returne vnto hym yet notwithstanding hee spareth v looketh altogither sinnes require wee able beare heere yee see sayeth chastize v man hande saye hee proceede according owne mightie power woulde become v god stretch hys arme v ala creature able stande verely needeth shew one angrie loke behold world perishe though hee doo yet let hym withdrawe spirite muste needes decay sayde hundred fourth psalme handleth v gently therwithall also withdraweth hande seeth v sore oppressed spareth v wee bowe vnder burthen condicionally wee bee lowly meeke mynde wee knowe hee telleth v lawe wee fall sturdinesse hym hee sturdie towardes v sayeth also eightenth psalme stubborne stubborne vvee make fayre hande stout stubborne furnish god let v thinke compasse hym meanes hee bee froward wyth frowarde say bee ouer terrible hee seeth men vse obstinate malice hym therefore needes must bee vtterly oppressed wee bee meeke minde submitte selues mightie hande god certaine shall alwayes fynd thing whiche spoken lette v followe whiche shewed v apostle humble selues sayeth hee vnder mightie hande god soeuer stoupeth downe head soeuer boweth knee god honoure shall feele hande ready releeue hee fall hee lifteth himselfe vp againste god shall sure feele god hand hym desire wee feele god hand vnder v ayde v let v humble selues soeuer aduaunceth himselfe hee muste needes rushe againste hande god feele thunderclap shall vtterly ouerwhelme let v beare wel mynd lesson sayde refuse correction almightie vven shall haue caught hold god goodnesse wee know fatherly loue serue sweeten affliction whyche otherwise seeme harshe sharpe v meane euery one v muste applye thys lesson owne vse bee easie matter v say blissed bee god chastizing men yet meane season wee ourselues chastized prayse hym rather grudge truly must deale soeuer selues scourged let v receyue correction paciently let v selues take thing incoragements skil giue comfort vnto others let v vnderstande man v hath many vice many disease god cannot heale meanes afflictios sendeth v true listed vse absolute power could well doo otherwise speake god almightinesse treate meane keepe towardes v asmuch god wil hold said order remedying vice scourging v behoueth euery v study lesson himselfe end may confesse wyth dauid lord profite thou hast brought low dauid speaketh men say lord thou hast done well chastize haue done amisse beginneth himselfe must doo holy ghost sheweth v heere saying behold man happie god chastizeth men cannot abide gouerned god striue hym continue always vnamendable therefore needefull profitable chastized god asmuch wee see god hand lifted vp dayes generally seuerally ought touched doctrine apparant enormity worlde come wonder god shew rigour yet certaine beareth much v thereof true man may see punisheth wicked doth v notwithstanding rebellious obstinate vttermost wil yeeld themselues vnto god warning man giue summoneth affliction layeth eye person specially maketh feele owne person condemne stubborne wilfulnesse bycause continue rebellious obstinate side let v pray suffer v bee hardened assoone hee shall shewe v signes displeasure worke wise v holy spirite hee may soften sayd hardnesse hart grace may take place whe shal haue receiued v mercie according haue neede therof may perceyue toto ouerblockish let v fall downe face good god aknowlegemet fault beseching make v mislike may desire nothing much returne craue pardon framing selues wholly good wil according hee hath shewed v holy law walke al life long feare let v say almightie god c xxij sermon sixt vpon fifth chapter vvill deliuer thee sixe affliction seuenth euill shall touch thee time death shall preserue thee death svvord time vvarre thou shalt bee hidden scourge tong thou shalt bee afrayd vvhen destruction commeth thou shalt laugh destruction dearth shalt afrayde beastes fielde thou shalt haue league vvith stone vvilde beastes shall bee brought haue peace vvith thee thou shalt perceyue thy tent suretie visiting thy house thou shalte bee greeued thou shalt see thy linage increace thine ofspring grasse ground thou shalt come thy graue full recke corne gathered due season behold vve haue inquired thing therefore herken marke thy selfe yesterday intreated comforte set downe heere faithfull god afflicteth whyche woundes deadlye bicause god wil length deliuer misery much surgion cure stripe truly tempereth measure vtterly oppressed bycause vpholdeth v pitie feeblenesse v therefore shorte god wonderfull prouidence doth continually cause issue affliction happie ministreth matter gladnesse vnto v considering benefit welfare sainct paule also speaketh eyght romanes confirme matter sayde god delyuer chozen sixe trouble daungers seuenth euill shall come heereby signified vnto v god perchaunce suffer v indure many misery wee escaped one wee shall enter intoo another may continuall exercise v time oure life shall respite poore child god shall bee tormented one fashion another yea behoueth expedient handled bycause sinnes yet neuerthelesse god giueth affliction good end notwithstanding number infinite thus ye see effect shewed v heere haue neede promisse considering vntowardnesse v albeit haue felt experience god haue ayded succored v aduersitie yet afterward daunger agayne seemeth v looking succoure hand see yee ouer great vnthankfulnesse frowardnesse yet notwithstanding oft god helpeth assure time come ende mighte alwayes haue recourse vnto reasoning thus themselues seeyng god hath helped pitied neede forget long liue therefore call vpon resort vnto refuge sure ready alwayes remedie inconueniences happen vnto behold god would assure v succoure yet cannot find hart trust vnto contrary parte doeth v good imagin werie bee ouercloyed v hee woulde haue v trouble rather wee forget releeuing v put trust hee would wee vve see haue neede mynde well lesson witte god deliuer v sixe trouble bene sayde must trust god onely day two one push asmuche life full many misery bee sooner cropen one aduersitie commeth another fresh necke wee bee tormented misery number therefore inasmuch haue continuall battell ouerthrowen incontinently god hande help v wee must beleeue certaintie hee fayle v expound text precisely thogh sayd god deliuer v misery time life ende make v passe taking v world like world made sixe dayes also man lyfe willingly co prehended number commeth rest god strippeth v mortall body ye see maketh ende laboures griefes battells lette suffize v haue playne meening texte although wee bee tossed many misery present life god continually make v way bring v good hauen short mention made seuen correction common maner holy scripture sayde number seuen importeth greate infinite quantitie ye see sayde prouerbes rightuous man falleth seuen time day riseth agayne true men vnderstande ment sinning salomon speaketh mischaunces fall wee beaten many roddes one commeth disease time aduersitie man shall trouble v one another shall v wrong ye see falles goddes child fall steade holding vp strong hande seemeth letteth tumble downe like little babe haue strength vvhen wee bee falne god dothe alwayes releeue v specially sayeth another text hee haue hand vnder v suffer v fall ouer hard let v learne streyne warned first maruell though behoue v come many tribulation god hath set v worlde purpose end therefore v promisse selues shall wee gayne bearing ourselues hande shall haue thing power haue also god alwayes suffer v disappointed expectation bee foolish make reckening without submit selues gouernement therefore man must warrant hymselfe continuall rest seeing god haue v fight pleasure exercise v furthermore sith see ceasse prouoke goddes wrath suche store faultes v meete wee shoulde therevpon desire liue oure ease pleasure neuer part inough make v rotte oure owne dung god shoulde skoure v affliction let v learne prepare selues battaile assuring selues whyle wee liue world wee paradise wee bee haue manie myseries trouble bycause god wee knowe aduersities profitable v yea necessarie saluation god faine visite quicken v vp maner thus muche concerning first poynt howe holie ghost declareth faithfull shall bee subiecte many infirmity hee speketh god child euen hee sheweth mercie yet notwithstanding hee sayeth euen shall tormented one affliction alone sixe seuen nowe way wee warned pacient aduersities let v also beare mynde present comforte giuen v heere witte god neuer fayle v neede true hee succour v euerie pinche exempt v vtterly myserie yet succour v due season shall bee inough v althoughe wee bee driuen afterdeale bee ayded soone desire would craue oure desire boyling may bee god delayeth letteth v alone trie pacience meane season haue sayde let suffize v god hath declared vnto v namely wee shall bee disappointed helpe wee tarie leysure quietly till see good deliuer v thus ye see wee haue beare mynde conclusion whensoeuer god shall haue made v wade misery hee suffereth v enter deliuereth v muche saye god continually encrease goodnesse towardes v wee haue felte helpe sixe time say many time often ende hee shewe himselfe yet fauorable towards v meening onely reach v hande time make v way misery wherein wee bee also take v eternall rest make end trouble wherewith incompassed nowe benefites god bestoweth vpon v present life guide v vnto one marke wit ende saluation shall perfecte full god giueth v little tast let v tarie till haue brought thing true perfection shall perceiue sauiour lo howe benefites whiche wee receiue worlde ought giue v large hyghe expectation god goodnesse whiche shewed nowe parte wholly hee hath sayde hee addeth wee shall bee delyuered time dearth opinion eliphas declareth heere seuen affliction whereof hee hath spoken curious exposition hath substantialnesse man reste fullye vpon therefore let v followe naturall sence suche witte according myseries infinite wherewith god scourgeth v worlde muste hope stretch selfe farre wide ende wee maye continually wayte sayde deliuerance whiche hath promised v soeuer kynde misery wee indure yee see heere mention made dearth warre wilde beastes stormes tempestes fyre calamity accordyng wee see poore lyfe besieged many sortes aduersities nothing bee thing declared v effect god draweth v dearth onely deliuereth v warre also trouble soeuer wee bee shall fynde hee hath issue hande according sayde hee hath issue outgoings deathe hys hande thys right necessarie poynte wee see superstition menne witte distribute goddes office vntoo others bycause seeming coulde fynde remedie inconueniences shoulde resorte one place heere yee see papist make one sainct twoo three fower haue charge ague another haue keeping fruites earth thirde haue rule suche disease imagine shoulde resorte vntoo god haue ague shoulde come hym helpe haue dropsie able intende many thing therefore better eche seuerall office committed seuerall sainct el two three consequently lyke shoulde bee done sainct sainct behold men teare god maiestie piece diuelish superstition robbe sorte operation put ouer creature also lette v marke well thys doctrine wherein declared vnto v god keepe v plague also keepe v swoorde men neede go distribute hys office thys man lette v assure ourselues sauiour onely parte also throughout thing therefore lette v boldely haue recourse vnto onely one kynde aduersitie many shall come vpon v assuring selues hys power shall extende euen vntoo deathes threaten v according sayde hath way deliuer v deathe also hath wayes incomprehensible v vvhen wee bee afflicted one side god thother side make v feele wee bee helped vvhen wee bee locked vp seemeth way v scape god finde one v yea owne fashion saye aboue vnderstanding opinion fleshe way wee bee heere new againe warned prepare ourselues pacience onely one kind aduersitie euer betyde v according wee see howe menne borne diuers affliction say bycause suche strong inough indure one aduersitie immediatly bee ouercome temptation example man shall finde indure pouertie yet one sickenesse carie away suche sorte shall frette god shall meane appeace well away sicknesse thys thing man doo wrong iniurie man go deface cace haue lost pacience may nowe bee apparance vertue man respect one kynde temptation hee shall fayle cause behoueth v marke well conteyned thys streyne namely god commende man shewing hymselfe stoute one poynt hee bee cold incontinently quayled reste pacience muste reache witte wee must yeelde selues peaceably euer god shall sende v wee bee exhorted bee pacient god setteth eye one miserie twoo three sayeth euery v must take vp crosse fardell manner fardell muste thys bee wee muste make owne packet say haue measure portion belongeth god gyue v burthen aduertizeth v wee shall haue bene persecuted one fashion wee must bee fayne enter intoo newe farre diuers battell therefore wee must prepare selues therevntoo heere ye see also affliction tearmed cup drinking glasse like phisition gyueth pacient suche quantitie thinketh good pacient must fayne receyue drinke portion phisition shall haue appoynted lyke father cherishing hys child cutteth euery pittance gyueth eate drinke hys owne pleasure euen muste god dispose v haue authoritie ouer v charge v gyue v portion misery shall thinke good seeing case standeth lette v remember doctrine sette downe heere god deliuer v famine tyme dearth hee saue v swoorde time warre hee defende v wilde beastes sayde menne shal onely bee assayled famine warre pestilence othersome anoyances wilde beastes also well one shall feele may haue many anoyances wee see meanes trouble v many enemy neere v god haue hande stretched continually haue pitie vppon v deliuer v wee see hundred thousande deathes whiche threaten v incompasse v side yee see howe standeth euery one v hande thynke well vppon daungers wherein knowe howe miserable state ende may bee earnest calling vpon god herewithall lette v also readie indure paciently one kinde aduersitie also infinite number according shal please god scourge euery v sayde god contenteth himselfe exercysing v one sorte wee muste bee fayne passe fyre water saye wee shall haue one sorte affliction alone assoone wee passed one aduersitie wee must streight wayes enter yee see effect signified vntoo v heere sayde immediatly wee shall bee league stone wilde beastes vvhereby eliphas meeneth thing whiche woonte anoy trouble menne suche stone fielde wilde beastes shall disquiet v howe shall stone fielde trouble v nother walking tilling ground wee knowe tilling grounde painefull bee stonie laboursome poore man plough shall bee oftentimes daunger breaking hee turne away stone lo wherefore lord telleth v stone shall hurte oure walking labouring fieldes walking say haue vnhappie stumblingplot also addeth beastes earthe wee see beast v true beastes ought nature obey v bycause god hath giuen man dominion ouer creature specially bycause hee hath created beastes ende shoulde bee subiect vnto menne acknowledge man prince reigneth heere beneath according god hath ordeyned yet withstanding beastes fayne rise vp v bicause wee haue done homage god respect souerayne lordship hee hath ouer creature whereof hath made v partaker lyke man holding fee prince beeing leege man committed offence treason rebellion goodes whiche hee hath shall excheated euen dealeth lorde vnthankfulnesse sake hee hath bene fayne bereeue v goodes hee put handes much hee hath armed wylde beastes ought yeeld v ful obedience rayseth vp dayly v behold wherof commeth contrarietie enmitie betweene men beastes heere sayde shall league beastes saye god restrayne rage beastes shall haue desire v harme truely wee see god hath yet vtterly bereft v dominion whych gaue v adam although horse bulles also bee beastes full fiercenesse seemeth ouermayster menne yet notwithstanding bee commonly tamed menne bring lure asmuch haue liuing worlde god shoulde still remayne trace goodnesse shoulde inioy creature parte yet haue sayde league suche perfection god promiseth heere neyther conuenient haue behoueth v bee troubled vexed beastes intent wee may feele fruite rebellion god yet notwithstanding speciall gifte whych god gyueth vnder hys defence protection wit wilde beastes peaceable towardes league betweene god treated peace come betwixte say true beastes haue hitherto bene enimies shall bee peace agreement betweene yee see promised heere yea euen singular benefite suche shrowd themselues vnder shadowe god winges meane howe obteyne suche priuiledge shewed v yet better osee hee sayeth seconde chapter god cause league bee betweene v wilde beastes namely lorde iesus christe place expressely handled restitution churche whiche decayed desolate sayd god wil send peace throughout added particular cause v bee league wilde beastes bycause iesus christe vniuersall heire creature thing gyuen intoo handes wee bee hys member shall parttakers benefites whiche father hathe committed perfection yee see howe wee may walke al anoyances world without wounding witte bycause christe keeper ouerseeth lyfe maynteyne welfare yet notwithstanding wee shall ceasse bee troubled according needefull god shoulde chastyze v diuers sortes soeuer worlde go shall finde howe nought sayde heere god make wilde beastes become tame shal rise vp v rage haue bene wonte doo bycause hee holde short heere wee haue profitable lesson witte wee muste measure assistaunce god eyesight promisse succoure behighted v aboue yee see sorte god bee honored v witte haue v beholde daungers neere vnto v wee see howe alwayes hundred perilles v fall wee muste therefore ceasse truste ayde god saye beholde lord true wee looke onely heere bylow wee shall bee totoo much confounded asmuche thou haste promised helpe v neede life muste reste vpon thee wee muste put intoo thy handes lo heere greate honor wee doo vnto god wee shette eye daungers threaten v imbrace promise hee hathe made maynteyne welfare shewe faythfull muste yeeld themselues wholly god protection sayde shall laugh tyme calamitie famine wee shall bee senselesse wee ought bee laughing heere importeth boldnesse afrayd lyke wretched vnbeleeuers know say see themselues hazarde lette v marke bothe good badde shall feele miserie pincheth conceyue daungers bee afrayde yet meane season vnbeleeuer perceyue mischiefe towardes yee shall see caried away fearefulnesse comforting woorse menne doo muze continually vppon tormentes according sayde wicked shal flee man foloweth hym another texte sayd needeth leafe fall atree afright haue trust god yee see men trust god committe themselues wholly vnto shall bee scared wittes haue reste according sayde lawe life shall bee hanging threede morning shall say possible may go foorth vntill night night shall bee perplexitie knowe may see morning yee see regarde god continuall thoughtfulnesse onely also extreme agony wote whither bee alyue dead contrariwise god child haue perceyued inconueniences haue sighed bene attached feare alwayes come saye thus lorde thy handes commende soule thou haste redeemed mee thou arte soothfast thou wilt continue thy goodnesse towardes mee euen end euen lorde therefore prouide thou daungers faithfull hauing called thus vppon god doo truste hee heare therefore call vpon without ceassing although perceyue helpeth yet notwithstanding hold still course warranting themselues theyr welfare assured bycause grounded vppon god truth infallible vnchaungeable yee see laughing whereof mention made ment god child become altogither senselesse conceyue nothing make sport god thretneth aduersitie manlinesse rather beastlinesse child god muste bee afrayde specially perceyue god visiteth sinnes muste thinke thoroughly yea muste haue feeling misery neighbour pitie yet therewithall shall also laugh say shall bee able despise aduersities according wee see howe sainct paule speaketh triumpheth pouertie againste disease hunger thirst sword thing present thing come yea specially cace concerned fighting power aboue wherefore wee know god hath taken v keeping hee bee shielde wee may defie harmes come v menne successiuely sayde faithfull man shall visit tente shall meete wyth mishappe greeue shall see linage increased breede cattell shall bee blissed god heerein shewed vnto v god shew loue whiche beareth v contented remedie mishappes delyuer v also blisseth v diuers sortes maketh v prosper intent wee shoulde feele hys grace vpon v thus yee see summe conteyned heere haue neede consider god goodnesse thoroughly bycause succoreth v affliction side benefites bestoweth vpon v behoueth v bee attentiue knowe fatherly care whiche hee hath v specially soeuer shall take v worlde wee may knowe holie ghost sheweth v heere according shall set foorthe anon finally caces respectes god bee guyder although fayne indure thing thys mortall lyfe subiecte many chaunges ouerturnings yet god wyll preserue blissing bee sufficient defende euen ende yee see holye ghost ment shewe v heere mouth eliphas among grace whiche lorde promiseth vnto men whereby bee knowen bee gentle louing one gyueth v child wee knowe howe linage singular honor whyche god doeth vnto men verily hee haue hys goodnesse knowne euen respecte beastes beastes doo thriue increace god say haue goodnesse fauour caught hold thereby bee done createth child formeth owne image excellent greater dignitie man nature creature maruell though god doo often holy scripture marke sayde blissing precious thing way men afflicted child lette vnderstande proceedeth sinne god order reuersed cace neuerthe lesse wee maye manifestly perceyue god could tell world howe vtter loue beareth v great goodnesse towardes v better giuing v issue finally sayde faithfull man shall gathered graue stacke corne gathered togither due time layde berne also man shall come thither abundance say hee shall haue liued fill heere eliphas meant say god wyll preserue hys seruantes violent death guyde suche sorte worlde soeuer must depart shall man gathered corne haruest time better corne shoulde bee layde intoo berne shoulde perishe fieldes leaue corne standing fielde dead ripe graynes must needes shedde come naught birdes eate reste muste rotte troden intoo dirte bee gathered intoo berne man may applye good vse eliphas promiseth god hath made faithfull bring foorth fruite world shall come full rypenesse gather vp himselfe menne gather corne true hee doth thus alwayes wee see sometimes god suffereth seruantes fall violent death plucketh worlde floure age yea euen infancie vvee see cain came greate yeeres age abell raught away sworde meant god preserue faithfull one euen till bee full rype man shoulde gather corne berne wee must marke first holy scripture speaketh worldly blissinges intendeth falleth commonly falleth continually furthermore wee muste make comparison betweene greater benefyte lesser vvhen god suffereth child bee taken worlde betymes profyte god prouideth better faithfull man hee calleth age twentie thirtie yeeres hee letteth liue till threescore specially wee see worlde flowing intoo suche corruption confounded nowe dayes praye ought wee esteeme happie god hath drawen away himselfe longer time languishe heere miracle menne coulde continue heere come al olde age wee see snare satan layeth v howe right harde walke many outrage therefore god pull away child quickly lette v bee sure dooth greater benefite specially wee haue herevppon vnderstand although bee bereft blissing whyche small respect god wyll gyue yet dothe ceasse loue fauoure suffering fall speedie death lyke persecuted tyrantes haue moste precious deathe offer vp sacrifize whyche moste acceptable god offering sweete sauour hee seeth hys woorde sealed vp bloud martyr wee compare lesse greater wee shall finde promisse feeling continually sayde blissing god sending gra e corne gathered due time vayne towardes faithfull soeuer world go rypeneth continually faythfull man die age thirtie yeeres doth seemeth greatly sorie hee maketh great struggeling wee see vnbeleeuers yea bee euen stale earth prouerbe sayeth beholde despizer god worldling whych neuer thought vppon death commeth poynte god pinche good earnest make grinde teethe frette hymselfe weening withstande death saying prolong lyfe one yeere longer take hymselfe bee peece greene woode crackleth side contrariwise faythfull persone dieth although indure muche yet hee betaketh hymselfe vntoo god comforteth hymselfe hym although bee striuing seene body yet hath hee mynde quiet desireth nothing frame himselfe god good choozing rather dye god calleth liue heere shorte desireth nothing obey good heauenly father vve see howe god dothe alwayes rypen hys seruants call worlde bee fully satisfyed come graues hee bringeth twentie yeeres graue rype another shall bring ye would say million yeeres according see vnbeleeuers fret chafe themselues god calleth bee neuer rype olde ynough let v marke god bereeueth child thing hee promiseth texte witte soeuer worlde go shall come graue lyke corne ripe meete applyed good vse therefore let euery one v bee contented god hath giuen grace liue worlde seeing haue recorde conscience verely hee drawe v himselfe although please keepe v worlde time exercise v many affliction misery yet let v ceasse taste continually goodnesse maketh v feele many wayes whereof shall haue full fruition present lyfe hee shal haue called v eternall rest hath prepared v purchased v death passion lorde iesus christ let v fall downe presence good god acknowledgement oure faultes praying giue v grace walking many daungers wee may knowe howe oure sinnes cause wee haue neede bee beaten chastized hande therewithall let v pray graunt v grace correction hee sendeth v maye bee vnprofitable v may learne feare iustice may bee earnester call vpon necessity also giue v grace walke togither one right brotherhoode thereby shewe howe wee rightly child seeke nothing knitte selues togither goodnesse whereas see vnbeleeuers conspyre despise god right reason may please graunt grace v also al people nation earth c xxiij sermon first vpon sixth chapter iob ansvvered sayde vnto distresse vvere vvell vveyed sorovves vere put balance vvould heauier sand sea vvherefore vvordes svvallovved vp arrovves almightie mee vvhereof poyson drinketh vp spirite terrours god directed agaynst mee vvill vvilde asse bray vvhen hath grasse vvill oxe lovve vvhen hath fodder shall vvhich vnsauerie bee eaten vvithoute salte taste vvhite egge thing vvhich soule hath lothed touch vvere disease flesh thing vvhich desire might happen mee thing vvhich loue vvere graunted mee god vvould crushe breake vvould cut mee abovve wee haue consider state poore man god scourgeth maketh feele suche misery may seeme hee hath god vve see power hold whe cace verye true iob neuer yet vtterly ouerthrowne shoulde haue pacience yet notwithstanding without much difficultie could gather wit haue comfort way haue sayd wee haue behold anguish mortal man whe god sheweth himselfe aduersarie partie greatly behoofe mind lesson bicause ouer negligent yea ouerfewe thinke vpon kinde temptation bee spoken suffering miserie pacient aduersitie bee fleshly mount higher sensualtie able comprehend say may indure disease may bee put trouble may happen vnto v greatest mischiefe whiche able ouerwhelme men vtterly god presseth maketh feele wrath hee bent full say haue ye offended therefore god sheweth sore men behold temptatio passeth euer may indure bodie ye see saide good trie thing throughly conteyned iob sayth would faine distresse well weyed side sorrowes greefes wit miserie indureth suffereth put togither balance sayth seene miserie mine heauier sand sea proof hereof god hath shot arrowes yea eue poysoned arrowes much fired spirit swallowed vp spirite steeped bitternesse reason god sayde arrowes haue pearced mee beholde whereat hee beginneth seemeth heere hee frameth vniust complaynt hee sayeth miserie great sorrowe bee able match bee answerable thys complaynt draweth neere cain made wee knowe without blasphemie soone cain heard condemnation whiche god pronounced agaynst certaine hee could iustifie himselfe sinne manifest hee conuinced accused god crueltie ouergreat rigour punishment sayth ouergreat able beare thou wilt chase ouer earth able stande thy face howe doest thou handle mee wee see heere although wretched caytife coulde denie punished iustly yet notwithstanding startinghole god punished vprightly passed measure rigorousnesse sayd seemeth iob doth like sayth maruell though bee great distresse bicause affliction indureth exceeding great much heauie say could lament ynough seeing god handled roughly haue seene hath come already euen cursing byrthday howe woulde bin borne dead hee also banneth day wherein borne seemeth iob might bee excused deede haue tolde alreadie although haue good cace yet doth handle amisse behoueth men know howe faultinesse respect neuerthelesse ceasseth speake truth hee sayeth miserie whiche hee indureth great extreeme euen woordes swallowed vp muche behalfe hee man ouerwhelmed whiche hath liuelynesse euer able saye nothing comparison affliction wherewith god presseth lette v marke therefore wee haue two thing one wee see poore sillie creature god presseth wyth iudgement haue sayde alreadie wee shoulde knowe fighting agaynst temptation although wee doo best wee withstande submitte selues vnto god yet notwithstanding wee swaye aside eyther one waye infirmitie neuer sufficient strength v except god holde v vp suffer v bow expedient v know bee made steele wee bee rockes stone mortall men full frailtie behoofefull god shoulde make v feele also although assist v affliction ouercome yet doth make v wouded halte say leaueth alwayes feeblenesse v sheweth selfe mightie operation giueth v thus ye see two point haue consider first let v call remembrance haue touched heretofore wee bee tempted whensoeuer bee pinched aduersitie bodie wee muste feare still spirituall temptation god cyteth v iudgement becommeth iudge wee must bee faine answere render accounte true wee shal much perceiue thing toucheth v fleshe wee bee wholly giuen wee see commonly menne feare famine pestilence sicknesse death whiche vttermost man threaten v wee bee afrayde man speake v god wee bee moued whit herein shewe selues bee dull yea euen vttermost differ nothing ox ass wee make small reckening god wrath damnation prepared soules meane continue enemy vnto god man talke v thing concerneth present life wee amazed measure neuerthelesse meane time whyle continue dulnesse god ceasseth exercise maner maketh feele wrath sayde bee tempted muche without comparison indured misery possible bee imagined sometimes wee shall thinke straunge faythfull speake thus god hath shewed himselfe lion towards hath broken bone burning fire wote become soule swallowed vp bodie good rotten nothing stinch vvherefore faythfull speake seemeth bee nice womanishe yet notwithstanding strong stedfast whome haue seene gouerned spirite god haue inuincible courage dauid goodly pacience god exercysed verie much yet see alwayes vpper hande neuer caryed away vnto wickednesse trouble befell ye see man armes hath bene practised maner battayles onely day yeare lyfe long yet experience complayneth hee neuer beene acquainted aduersitie wist afflicted yea verely haue sayde let v marke pressed bodily harmes although sensible men yet greatly grieued beare sicknesse suffer like thing vvhat driueth complaine bycause hee entereth hymselfe touched conscience though god onely forsaken also become deadly foe pursued euen vnto hell say thou shalt haue neyther peace truce drowne thee altogither seeing dauid pressed wyth feeling sinnes perceyued god wrath kindled agaynst yee see nipped euen heart ezechias felte muche god onely afflicted sicknesse may commonly befall vnto v also besides shewed token displeasure therefore seemed vntoo god woulde repeale disanull grace hee graunted deathe shoulde cause god seruice bee quite ouerthrowne beene stablished hande vvhen ezechias conceyued great horrible vengeance god good reason hee shoulde dismayde yee see hee made complaynts ar conteyned song therefore let v marke god afflicteth v body wee well take paciently miseryes hee sendeth v nothing comparison anguishe whiche indure maketh feele wrath vengeance yet notwithstanding profite come therevnto although harde bitter thing vntoo v yet neuerthelesse wee must bee fayne come conceyue theyr bodily tribulation passe seeke helpe disease theyr soules bycause perceyue consequently passe seeke attonement god consider iustice sayde necessarie v wounded god iudgement wee haue taken holde may bee constrayned grone vnder anguishe according wee see haue beene iob true euerye man shall haue like measure god also knoweth wee bee able beare according man shall bee weake god shall haue indued great grace holy spirite verily hee make feele iudgement thereafter howbeeit hee holde vp make taste mercie middes wrath shall vtterly dismay hath receyued singular strength whome god hath fortified holy spirite must faine sustaine greater brunt farre rougher assault feeble like litle child ye perceiue see spirituall battayles dauid ezechias iob neuer one v shall finde himselfe true shall haue portion haue sayde without would become dullard woulde signe forsaken god haue conscience rocked asleepe much god presseth v iudgement small wee compare selues holy person haue incountred agaynst sorrowes death hell god armed yea hee fenced owne strength although bowed yet vtterly beaten downe beaten downe yet god lift vp againe therefore behoueth v marke well sayde vnto v furthermore see iob sore pressed euen iob say mirrour pacience let v learne walke aduisedly happened greene tree shall become drie tree vve see iob hartburned anguish wee see dulled torment wist speake shall become v god list scourge v rigorously must needes quaile vtterly must astonie v neuerthelesse standeth v hande bee afrayde hardie ynough bee farre blowes ordinarie maner insomuch none v make himselfe valiant seemeth nothing shall able daunt v let v rather consider feeblenesse end may puffed vp vaine presumption may vnderstande poore creature cannot well hold one minute houre agaynst assault may giuen v either syde except flee god praying strengthen v ye see haue wee beholde example iob moreouer let v marke well woorde hee sayth arrowes god venim hath drunke vp spirite spirite hath sucked venim eyther wayes may spoken principall poynt haue marke iob doth v vnderstande heere hath deale men cace standeth indure affliction flesh knowe sayth god warreth agaynst onely arrowes also sayth mee haue stryken mee heart runne quite first place iob sheweth faine indure battayles god himselfe warred agaynst matter mortall man thing nothing bee forced farre feele god prepareth bendeth himselfe agaynst yet notwithstanding able outstande howe bee possible neuerthelesse haue sayde alreadie must needes brought poynt owne profite good sooth profite euil vnder god scourge meane wee beate braynes reason men see whence aduersities come vnto v linger still verie yll considered v example one diseased thinke himselfe inconuenience light vpon lo thing cause hee cannot suffer affliction whereby god shall giue occasion feele wrath man farre receyuing frute chastizementes god sendeth say wee ceasse alledge hold selues still creature profite verie yll therefore must mount vp step aduersities come god come vpon v bicause sinnes heerewithall let v vnderstande howe much god shotte arrowes v wounded v let v bethinke v well woorde iob sayeth arrowes almightie let flee agaynst yea hee sayeth expresly sticke fast spirit swallowed vp vvhere hee meeneth distresse commeth sayde fearing god according also hee addeth terrours god bent agaynste better vnderstanding streyne let v marke god dooth oftentimes afflict wylfull hard hearted mynde neuer humbled beate backe god iudgements anuylde beateth backe hammer god woundeth listeth meeneth humble insomuch stryken quite yea euen bottome hart thus yee see iob ment expresse true somtimes like shall happen reprobate also full account made speciall grace god bestoweth vpon child pearceth throughout maketh feele vengeance within hart wise swallowed vp harte consumed hard v flee possible thereby god worketh welfare much better th shoulde blockish beate backe conceytes god sendeth v whe purposeth scourge v sinnes make v feele howe terrible thing haue agaynst v beholde must profite selues wounding knowing god intendeth humble v ende bee scorner doo nothing mocke iudgements hys making v feele quicke ende wee shoulde quake furthermore wee see neede haue medicine sith bee suche dullard follow lustes flesh better god worde wee moued threatnings made v seemeth would hold owne agaynst god spite defiance beholde pride seene commonly men also subiect therevnto god clenzeth v shewing rough towarde v might feele arrowes hart courage might swallowed vp likewise iob sayth terror god directed leuelled wordes swallowed vp consumed vvhereas hee sayth terriblenesse god leueled meeneth haue sayd alreadie hath men enemyes god himselfe warreth true may assaulted men handes yet notwithstanding wee must ceasse acknowledge sayde heere wit god armeth creature agaynst v ende shewe v displeasure worde side soeuer mischiefe threaten iob yea euen wounded must acknowledge howe hande god toucheth presseth cause saith terrours terriblenesse hee knowes well ynough whe god scourgeth int haue returne vnto god seeketh nothing receyue seruants mercie deliuer trouble indure sorowes suffreth able take hold goodnesse god intendeth vse towards thus ye see cause impacience euen touched requisite render god due honour proofe hereof speake calling vpon god desiring haue pitie vpon v ceremonially vntill knowe last cast poore damned soules forlorne creature vntill knowe throughly quicke certaine oure desiring god haue pitie vpon v shall teeth outwarde therefore man neuer honoureth god good earnest vnlesse hee bee confounded himselfe matter consisteth altogither saying god must bee superior ouer v wee subiect creature wee muste yeelde honour specified namely righteous nothing else v maner wickednesse ende wee may haue mouth shette bee distitute excuse wee maye make account selues acknowledge nothing belongeth v shame deserue cast away stin ng cursed creature bee come poynt honouring seruing god according saint paule sheweth thirde romaine speaking god infinite glorie hee sayeth becommeth v come feare lowlinesse wee may bee lyke poore offender halter neckes shoulde go hell hee plucked v backe infinit goodnesse without cause god afflicteth seruants presseth wise hee bringeth poynt ende hee may bee gloryfied touching sayth wordes swallowed vp much sayd speaketh rhetorically wee see men eloquent setting aduersities cokneys indure little aduersitie neede man lawe pleade case seemeth heare speak none men shoulde haue compassion well pleade babble shewe well ynough aduersitie greatly greeue beene touched good earnest certaine woulde shewe sayde heere heere ye see wherfore expresly sayde song ezechias hee chattered like swallowes hee voice man vtter conceyt beene shet vp time sorow wist say howe couch wordes vtter hys mynde let v marke god summoneth seruaunts suche wise hee sheweth himselfe bee iudge pincheth quicke euen destitute wordes confounded know howe expresse meenings although say god woorke hee oftentymes deale roughly v yet notwithstanding let v call mind conuenient remedie least wee bee put vtter confusion sainct paule meeneth hee sayeth god holye spirite gyueth v gronings intollerable vvhen sainct paule speaketh prayer faythfull meene better sort hee sayeth god maketh v pray earnestly wee grone yea wee euen grone wee haue woorde hande man shoulde demaunde v thou sayest vvhat thou desirest god vve wist say vvee muste keepe thing locked vp wee cannot declare woorde mouth wee ment say yee see howe god remedyeth whiche spoken heere although oure speeche swallowed vp yet hee giueth v meane finde get meane hee alloweth although kinde language vnderstoode men yea euen partie himselfe prayeth vntoo god bee intangled hee cannot vtter woordes yet doth god vnderstand maner speech nowe forasmuche wee see god heareth gronings wee bee abashed wee bee vtterly dismayde selues let v beare paciently aduersities hee sendeth v seeing hee giueth successe redoundeth profite welfare lo haue marke vpon straine heere withall iob vseth certaine similitude shewe howe without cause hee complayneth hee sayeth wylde asse bray hee hathe grasse wil oxe hee hath fodder furthermore man eate thing hath sauour white egge without salt similitude iob meeneth menne beastes glad thing fall oute theyr minde desire vvhat thing wilde asse seeketh hee desyreth pasture therefore hath grasse careth bray greeue himselfe vvhy hath thing hee desireth oxe likewise contented hath fodder giuen contrarywise sayth howe possible man made like thing agaynst verely wee eate meates vnsauerie man shoulde make v suppe white egge ynough make v spewe thing woulde go agaynst stomacke seeing worde betokeneth vnsauerie thing sayd bitter thing shoulde serue choke v yet much worse misery wherewith iob afflicted therefore concludeth therevpon woulde fayne haue owne wishe god woulde kill first blow make pine away sort yee see effect ment heere first let v marke sentence good true yea doctrine conteyned therein verie profitable expedient v bee warned passion stande much vpon reputation owne vertues therefore good v knowe haue neede haue fleshly desire repressed vvhy ende thing fall oute according mynde wee may haue skill say beholde god giueth v heartes desire therefore wee haue whereof reioyce thing fall agaynst v wee maye acknowledge say beholde god afflicteth v vvherefore euen bicause haue offended hee cut v oute morselles good therefore thing shoulde bee knowne vnto v wee minde remembrance oftentymes bee renued speciallye great shame men haue discretion seeing brute beastes shew howe according measure haue discretion true reason iudgement oxe asse yet hath god giuen certaine witte whiche leadeth thither nature goeth nowe let v consider god giueth vnto man ought haue iudgement bycause spirite imprinted soule behoueth haue discretion yet let v note behoueth v inespecially fight agaynst oure lustes howe asse leaue hys braying hee hath pasture
