afore man content himselfe verie well good man shoulde thanke god hath prosperitie shoulde know much beholding god must fal asleepe vpon let v learne two thing one god giueth v meate drinke worse brute beastes wee make account libertie blockish harte wee consider howe liberall gracious god towardes v thus much first poynt wee conceyue cleane cotrary many men yea maner al men howe great vnthankefulnesse god giue v meate drinke haue stayednesse brute beastes holde selues quiet contented like vnsatiable seagulles fowle howe excessiue appetite see howe asse eateth although haue trauelled great paine put pasture satisfieth himselfe layes vpon contented man though haue crammed much foure fiue men could swall owe vp contented hee regardeth meete still bee heaping vp gathering vvhen man hath garner full yet hath bellie bigge vvhen hath wine seller well stored thinketh nothing vvhen hath prouision ynough whole doozen person yet contented like neuer filled ye see men away lustes neuer satisfied vnthankfulnesse iudge must maner folk haue euen ass en angelles neede come downe heauen poure god condemnation vpon head order nature man may perceyue much reason modestie dulnesse beast tha men ought haue consideration beholde speciall poynt haue marke side also let v learne wee must bee lyke brute beast seeking nothing else bellie cheere god sendeth v prosperitie must holde v must butte shoote vvhat let v vse sayde prosperitie passing continually still preparing selues affliction god list sende v intent bee taken vnwares bycause wee made reckening haue lyued alwayes ease say let v beware wee fall asleepe suche carelesnesse god sendeth v pasture wee bee handeled well wee woulde wishe let v continually quicken vppe ourselues wee may attayne benefyte wherevntoo hee calleth v marke speciall poynt nowe whereas sayde wee cannot bee made eate whiche without sauour wee cannot suppe white egge without salt heereby wee may knowe haue sayde howe blowe come good forethinke oure selues colde heate vnsauerie vittayles thing aduersities shunne nature verie well needes must wee feele geere wee bee senfelesse howsoeuer worlde go let v make selues readie indure paciently thing vnsauerie let v bee contented god shall profite therewithall let v assure selues sithe hee ordeyneth onely muste bee better taste vnto v thing happen v oure owne good vvhat shall salt make v finde good taste aduersities befall v wee maye beare paciently obedience wee acknowledge say go see heere howe god afflicteth v first bycause worthie secondly bicause aduaunce welfare meane beholde say make v finde good sauour heeretofore ye would say lothsome poynt must come vnto desirous finde fauour aduersities may paciently receyue correction whiche shall please god sende v wee may frame selues good pleasure desiring nothing accomplish hath begonne intent beeing guided gouerned holye spirite may seeke nothing loue serue honour holde good rightfull shall please sende v nowe let v cast selues downe face good god acknowledging fault praying make v perceyue better haue done hitherto shall please make v feele iudgements although pressed measure owne seeming yet notwithstanding may ceasse resort vnto continually hoping deliuer v al aduersities according infinite mercie reach hande v continually although first wee perceyue minded ayde v yet may wayt paciently till time conuenient come shewe v hath alwayes beene freendly fauourable v yea truly meane lorde iesus christ according hath pleased chooze v call v knowledge ende make v member bodie may please graunt grace onely v also people c xxiiij sermon second vpon sixt chapter vvho vvill cause desire come passe god may sende longing vvhich hee shoulde breake mee peeces shoulde stretch hande cut mee yet haue comfort shoulde reioyce griefe let spare vvill denie vvordes holy one vvhat strength shoulde bee able indure vvhat mine ende prolong life strength strength stone flesh steele might fayleth mee hee afflicted ought haue good turne friende men haue forsaken feare almightie god wee haue goe forwarde matter began alreadie iob tormenteth selfe heere miserie hee indureth bodie bycause god hilde poore condemned person bycause hee dealeth iudge altogither ye see wherefore iob greeued rest hee coulde suffer wit bycause feeleth god hande heauie vppon dauid speaketh two thirtie psalme let v marke well alwayes otherwise shall knowe purpose hee sayeth woulde deade would god woulde kill mee would cut world shoulde haue ease shoulde bee sore pressed coulde befall worse thing death specially death god sending wherein knowe god woulde vtterly ouerwhelme extremest misery yet hee sayth god woulde dispatch one blowe could well beare linger pyning hee doth bee pressed long hee sayth impossible keepe measure one hee hilde burning fire let v marke well diuersitie whiche betweene man ouerwhelmed first stroke another god holdeth vpon rack scourgeth long without giuing hym respite releeued miserie must faine abyde continually let v nowe come ripping vp cace iob pleadeth first hee sheweth cheefe desire shoulde die cut true haue touched heeretofore god child may well wishe death howbeit ende respect hee doth heere like v must paule desire let looce bondage sinne wherin hilde prisoner saint paule mooued temptation fleshe rather desire hee hath imploy himselfe god seruice without let driueth wishe might passe prison bodie vvhy long wee bee worlde must alwayes wrapped many misery wee ceasse offende god beeing weake wee bee saint paule sorie hee must liue long offending god kinde desire good holy proceedeth holy ghost verie fewe desire go worlde respect long bee ease care whit vyces imperfection haue forwarde seruing god requisite geere toucheth v whit vvhat betide v trouble fall disease matter fal would haue wee wish selues worlde none talke oure wearinesse despizing oure lyfe yee see iobs wishing chiefly bycause hee knewe state bicause miserie hee felt nippe therefore hee desirous haue request god hande onely desireth hart also addresseth himselfe god make sute yet another mischiefe man wisshing death iob doth heere shall bee ye woulde say shet vp shrunke himselfe shall dare present himselfe vnto god pray though haue comitted great offence must presume hide selues haue backe nookes wherein make wisshes wicked reiected god yet man shall come farre forth make request vnto god doubt sinneth double vvhy ouergreat rashnesse v come vnhallow name god wee must pray vvhat rule must obserue behalfe request nothing agreeable hys wil according iohn speaketh canonical epistle verely lorde iesus christ sheweth full well must keepe sayd modestie setteth downe petition god done ye see iob vnhalloweth name god dareth make excessiue request nowe first poynt whereas lawfull men wishe god woulde deliuer quickly mortall bodie life besieged many wantes misery reason trouble must indure bicause alwayes subiect many vice marke speciall poynt let v marke god afflicteth v happen thing sowre v must wish death therfore rather wee must buckle selues combate sith god thirdly desire bee set free bondage sinne god shoulde breake bondes holde v nowe let men measurably may readie bee humbled muche shall please although greeue v sighe bicause wee cannot giue selues wholly god commaundeth wee must first haue cosideration say vvell lord thy beeing poore sinner hauing vice continually lurking shoulde serue thee graunt mee grace acknowledge faultes may sigh thee craue pardon thy hande beholde say measure behoueth v keepe furthermore let v learne example iob wee come god v bring thither oure owne desire owne lustes speake whatsoeuer commeth tung ende requestes must alwayes bee framed according god promise according giueth v leaue demaunde ye see whereat must begin wee pray vnto god becommeth v must rash threape hande wee must consider well lawfull v according honour yeelde vnto god craue whatsoeuer commeth minde without foreconsideration meening haue head vnder gyrdle beholde say vntollerable presumptuousnesse mortall man beare suche sway god must bee subiect demaundes besides haue shewed alreadie god wil haue v yeeld reuerence seeke know hee giueth v leaue thinketh good haue v modestie seeing iob hath happened ouershoote himselfe farre make request vnto god naughty selues would finde fault let v well aduised bee sober minded fall hand praying vnto god haue wel considered aforehand thing god promiseth permitteth way remedie hereof pray vnto god whe flesh prouoketh v desire mantel peruerting true prayer demaund thing god hath allowed say answere verie wel sir pray god shoulde displease make subiect sort desire may wel ynough wish yet mynded god subiect desire must vse leapes vvhat done vvhen see wish foolish full vanitie onely fonde also wicked bee done seeking lurking hole vvhat let v rather lay open harte god holy scripture speaketh therof haue nothing wrapped vp soone desire come mynde let v thinke thus lawfull wish thing doth god permit let v fall examining oure selues thing entred intoo heart may layde open haue made god priuie let v dispose selues pray vnto according vvhen haue done let v part consider wee must come vnto god heade vpright bee bolde make farre account shoulde whatsoeuer wee haue conceyued oure braine wee must bee subiect poyntes respectes nowe wee holde v measure yee shall see oure euill lustes corrected repressed knowing man muste couet thing might bolde aske god hande bee brydle v wee must presume aske anye thing whiche god hath graunted hys woorde bee wee must needes bee restrayned flesh must ouermayster v carie v away lo wee haue marke concerning iob streyne yet notwithstanding lesson verie slenderly practized worlde wee see howe one sorte make wish without submitting vnto god another sort suche vaine fantasticall myndes desyre contraryes none conceyte coyning framing newe deuises heade neuer pray vntoo god beholde heere intollerable vyce howe men wander awaye whereas god allureth familiarly come vntoo whereas hee telleth may bee vnburthened casting care vpon great wilfull frowardnesse men make themselues suche straungers drawe backe yet notwythstanding ordinarie matter let euerie man searche himselfe pray howe many foolishe desyres haue wee v whiche mooue v sighe oure selues although god priuie another sort swarue aside contrarie extremitie become like blockes god asking without knowing howe without hauing rule choyce hereby bee seene sayde lesson whiche haue earst set afore verie yll knowne onely haue beene instructed god woorde also v therefore much better must wee marke text ende euery v may holde himselfe awe learne frame desire better haue done bring passe must lay open god assuring selues shall win nothing slinking aside thing must come account time therfore oft shall prouoked minded desire thing let v learne poynt god may alwayes made priuie hereof let v examine well al sinnes may condemne whatsoeuer see agreeing ought haue whole dominion ouer v let v come backe againe iob saith wish god slea stretch hande cut haue alreadie briefly shewed whereto wordes tende wit god one stroke quite dispatch man without making linger yea gayneth hee shall man fare better yea seemes know must bee faine endure torment comfort v long iob hath respect god sheweth iudge towards v feele agaynst v intollerable tormet insomuch wee coulde finde heartes mountaynes shoulde fall vppon v iesus christ also sayth could finde harte whole worlde turned vpside downe wee much leuer creature rose vp agaynst v euery bring bane passe infinite daungers might come face god dreadfull agaynst v ye see whereat iob eye true knowne many vvhy bicause part blockish nothing else hardenesse stubbornesse man woman bee pinched sicknesse crie ala bee pinched pouertie hunger thing euerie man complaine hath occasion torment minde wee skill god persecuteth v sheweth v howe dreadfull wrath proofe heereof conscience rockt asleepe hardly one bee founde among thousande euer tasted ment hande god terrible iob setteth foorth yet neuerthelesse haue neede much better feced lesse power affliction god spare v time knowe keepeth v ende vve see many haue beene carelesse haue made good cheere tyme life yea euen men haue laboured make feele god iudgemet haue turned mockage whose iolitie god hath abated drewe towarde death insteade iesting sporting wherevnto bene giuen haue bene faine feele terror hell ye would say locked vp yea vtterly ouerwhelmed bicause god cast lightning vpon say shal see come state god punisheth pride wherewith puffed vp conceyt greeue therfore scripture speaketh v dreadfulnesse conceyue feele god iudge let v learne ende euery v thinke vpon certainly bodily harmes wey much v according wholy giuen flesh present life beholde scripture speaketh v amischiefe farre feared ought astonish v maketh v feele sinnes summoneth v appeare toucheth v much body torne peeces shoulde lay many misery vpon v possible sith cace standeth let v feare god let v thinke selues haue made better market shunne iudgement let v holde v good let euery v come obedience examining life wise lay account sinnes open afore ye see howe wee must deale heare word rehersed v heere iob sayth shoulde haue comfort shoulde warme himselfe rather merrie sorrow greefe hebrew worde hevseth place signifieth burne warmed translate merrie keepe proper naturall meening worde let v take shoulde bee warmed sorrow meening haue ease god woulde stretch hande cut first blowe greeueth pyned god vseth force ouerwhelm miserie might quickly bee ende yet surely dispatched vppon sodaine ceasse afflicted still easeth farre feele great paine iob speaketh like man ouerpassionate knoweth hee therefore seeming better comfort bee vtterly razed oute soone god layeth hand vpon vvhen wee haue present passion wee imagine none miserie whole worlde vvhen man pressed sorrowe great excessiue hee thinketh nothing men greefes nothing heate coulde finde hart bee cooled yea euen yce yet hee bee fornummed colde passion also bee greeuous beare bitter heate shall haue indured afore yea verily man haue eyther heate colde thing troubleth bodie yee shall see ouertaken hee shall thinke contrarie misery woulde bee ease vntoo bycause passion carie v away lo howe iob hath spoken let v marke fancie releefes easments woulde bee thoughe god shoulde sende v desyres wee shoulde finde wee fall one miserie another none ease haue god fauourable vnto v proofe hereof please giue v pacience whe lose finger also well giue v wee lose whole hande yea euen wee shall bee faine lose whole body muste wee thinke miserie thing selfe rather owne frayltie weake left vp selues doubt shall vtterly confounded god haue strengthened v grace although wee haue huge mountaine beare yet shall well beare god power shall bee ynough behalfe needeth one foote water drowne man one drawe sea therefore god reach v hand although plunged ouer heade eares yer might scape please deliuer v wee shall fayle come vtter ruine sith case standeth let v thinke haue case god shall haue chaunged kind miserie let v assure selues wee cannot bee eased except god mercifull fauourable v except haue pitie vpon v shew v hath forgiuen sinnes see true rest otherwise must bee faine liue continuall vnquietnesse like sicke man turneth tumbleth hither thither hee thinketh hee hath releefe hee bee suffered shifte one bedde another beholde owne seeming hee halfe whole hath tossed turmoyled himselfe throughly seeth maladie feercer vpon little nothing hee mended euen v seemeth v wee better cace god would afflict v another maner doth would neuer whit asswage greefe cace behoueth v flee vnto god pray withdrawe hande v hee hath receyued v mercie wee shall see selues rightly eased concerning iob sayeth hee shoulde bee warmed sorowe hee meeneth sorow bee asswaged comfort like greate fyre vnder pot fleshe bee sodden soone pot throughly heated otherwise fleshe wyll lie saping long become vnsauerie seemeth iob wee pine linger suche extremity nothing else make v rotte awaye oure misery yet neuerthelesse haue sayde men doo ceasse shewe themselues vtterly desperate witte euen god forbeareth make languishe behoueth v vnderstande god list prolong misery ynough v hee giueth v pacience seeing hath giuen v day hee continue morrowe god woorke maner well aduersities easie borne plundge v ouer head eares hundred thousande time wee alwayes remit selues vnto hee sustaine v grace hath giuen v heauen making v feele comforte holy scripture harte insomuche god touche v whither fillip v finger strike v hande whether hee gyue v greate blowes beetle whether hee make v pyne awaye peecemeale dispatche v hande surely nothing shall happen without wiil n eth oure welfare seeing wee bee child cause v doubte iob sayeth let spare mee conceale woordes holie one hee maketh drotestation whiche hee able persourme hee speaketh maner caryed away theyr affection behold sayeth hee though god haue ouerpressed first blowe yet condemne specially grudge agaynst rather blisse name confesse righteous neuerthelesse sithe tormented long haue ease lose pacientnesse thereby lo howe men proceede according hath beene declared iob addeth hee strength fayleth hee whiche afflicted ought haue good turne fre ndes handes haue shewed alreadie iob ought haue returned vntoo god haue hilde selfe buckleth himselfe agaynst haue founde faulte temptation whereof wee ought take good heede according cause holye ghoste bringeth storie oure remembrance intent wee maye vnderstande men come heaue v scoffe v driue v dispayre leastwise best driue v wee muste take good heede going wee bee intrapped vvhy beholde man commeth mee sayes thinkest thou god hath care thee thou callest vpo thou beguylest thy selfe dooing surely god abhorre thee thinkest thou would haue exercised thee extremitie thou seest thy selfe heere bee poore damned creature perceyuest thou howe god agaynst thee man come whet sorte see deadly plague must warde specially bycause haue eares beaten suche temptation may see say beholde diuell come set fire intent shoulde frette chafe agaynst god must beate backe wile gather wittes aboute mee consider haue deale men god therefore wee muste put vp oure complaintes vntoo saye lorde thou seest howe man seeketh nothing driue mee despayre hee come hither make mee fall quite cleane away vouchsafe therefore receyue mee mercye let mee vnderstande euer muste indure commeth man thee alone although men bee woorkers vnaduisednesse rather maliciousnesse craft outrage yet doth thing happen without thy thy good righteous welfare lo howe wee ought proceede iob hath missed poynt faulte muste serue oure learning certeynly holy ghost hath ment verye well holy personage mirrour pacience set heere oure eye bee looked vpon intent thing may profite v wee may thereby receyue lesson wee may apply owne behoofe let v vnderstande oft whensoeuer happeneth greate inconuenience vnto v wee muste make excuse yea cannot abyde present misaduenture god woulde handle mee maner shall well come let v set oure trust let v consider howe nothing ought put v pacience turne v aside god make v vtter rebelles agaynst let v condemne selues owne vice whole part let v acknowledge ala god exercise mee sorte woulde thing shew selfe whiche nowe hidden number disease hidde within mee know selfe god knoweth therefore standes hand know selfe pray hee suffer greate number vice mee burst libertie make battell rather purge correct lo howe wee ought doo cace let v take conclusion aduenture iob setteth downe whe sayth grudge though god spare mee wyll denie wordes holy one vvhat ment suppressing concealing wordes holy one ment giuing glorie vnto god poynts respect iobs meening effect god shall haue scourged mee vttermost yet wyll denie bee woorthie prayse acknowledge lorde good ryght thou shouldest scourge thy creature forasmuche thy hande dispose thou mee thy good pleasure iob protesteth assuredly protesteth knowing himselfe haue sayde lette v learne enter selues tie selues vnto men assoone wee shall haue made suche protestation god wyll laugh v scorne nothing else follie fondenesse man say suche thing happen wyll therefore man come poynte needes muste god laugh pride scorne good sooth oure strength whereof wee boast lette v knowe maner euer god handle intreate v wee muste alwayes haue discretion glorifie beseeching guyde v holy spirite hee giue v vertue pacience thereafter shall please afflict v thus yee see haue marke streyne heerewithall hee addeth vvhat strength shoulde bee able indure strength strength stone fleshe steele heere iob entreth intoo complayntes shewe hee hath iuste cause cha e maner althoughe hee passe measure god sayeth hee syde excessiue chastyzing yee see effect hee purposeth saye wee see whiche haue touched heeretofore witte iob ouerpressed present payne hee hath regarde reste vtterly blinde poynte wee muste marke well yee see cace wee bee experience sheweth vvhensoeuer wee haue anye trouble strayghtwayes withoute regarding eye dazeled wee discerne betweene redde greene wee babble purpose muche muste wee marke conteyned heere iob sayeth heere strength true strength nothing hee knoweth stayeth vpon nexte way make impacient hee afore iob thinkes strength fayleth saue present miserie hee indureth contrarywise lette men try themselues throughly searche well shall finde leaste inconuenience troubleth pricketh without greate greefe meane touching bodie nothing respect iob indureth spirituall temptation whereof haue spoken desyreth bee eased miserie hee myghte knowe infirmitie humble himselfe god myght confesse good reason shoulde handled maner vvhat hee intendeth shewe howe god handleth extraordinary fashion men woont bee ouerpressed meening enter field battell god god shoulde likewise take swoorde wote lo howe iob runnes heade must demaund seeke stregth selues stregtheneth v wee shall neuer finde thing vanitie selues thinke selues haue strength carie one fardel shal find selues ouerwhelmed vnder wee faynte selues needeth aduersitie come otherwhere beare v downe strength none godwarde true outwarde shewe maye well seeme bee strength v deede verie shadow forasmuch wee know strength nothing let v conclude generall ala shall become god lay hande vpon mee ought indure farre greeuouser torment yet notwithsta ding lift vp selfe agaynst although god afflict v well body mind yet must wee grudge agaynste condemne hee v wrong forasmuche wee knowe oure strength care respect nothing ye see howe wee muste learne humble selues god beseech strength v assuring oure selues hee whiche hath spirite strength howe belongeth onely gyue v else wee sustayned yet neuerthelesse behoueth v indure long tyme thing let v assure selues wee bee vtterly beaten downe firste blow god neede make miserie indure long destroy v could warrant himselfe cotinue pacient one day one houre onely needeth god prolong misery shew feeblenesse make v conuicted let v assure selues cannot much begin good thing muche lesse performe therefore muche must prouoked pray god mainteyne v lift v vp euen ouerthrowne lo maner wee muste consider owne weakenesse wee muste consider iob say god keepeth measure towardes v rather let v marke wee haue displeased god chastizeth v steed amending vnder rod become worse worse vvhy bycause god toucheth v fall blaspheming name beholde vttermost full heyght euill let v learne god remedie vice hee muste abate deuilishe pride make v knowe otherwise shall neuer profite chastizementes hee sende v wee knowe euill v must mislyke seeke remedie say ala god true feeble weake nothing vanitie mee neuerthelesse please thee strengthen mee thou onely haste strength stone steele also thy strength infinite let stone rockes come rushe agaynst thee let storm tempest may seeme whole worlde shall sunken bottomlesse pitte yet certaine lorde thy strength alwayes inuincible therefore vouchsafe fortifie mee thy holy spirite ende although bee frayle mine owne nature yet may ceasse fight agaynste temptation come assayle v vvhen wee shall haue done thus shall haue profited greatly poynt learning herewithal let v vnderstand side also god passe measure send v temptation haue leysure take breath behoueth v cry ala god send v temptation yea euen hundred become true nature quaile cace god haue pitie vpon v call vpon helpe v trouble way wherby may bee deliuered yea ouercome pacience behoueth men prepare themselues meanes affliction may feele god haue succour may outstand cobats shall put muste haue recourse vnto praying strengthe power holy spirite may costatly passe aduersities world vntill gathered euerlasting rest prepared heauen according hath bin purchased v lord iesus christ let v cast selues downe face good god acknowledgemet fault praying make v better perceyue haue done wise beeing conuinced want may haue oure whole recourse mercie beseeching father lorde iesus christ although wee worthy bee reckened among creature yet accept v child may learne taste loue goodnesse therwithall strengthe v wise al affliction shall make v feele may able withstand euen till haue drawen v away make v inioy victory purchased lord iesus christ triumph tarieth v heauen may please graut grace onely v also people nation c xxv sermon thirde vpon sixt chapter sermon conteyneth rest exposition xiij xiiij verse followeth brother haue beguyled mee dryebrooke vvaters passe throughe valleyes troubled vvith yce full snovve aftervvarde fayle drought taken place heate turne aside diuerse vvayes vanish perish haue seene vvayting quarter thema come seba beeing vvere confounded hauing hoped vvhen vvere come place vvere ashamed behold hovv driebrookes ye haue bene amazed sight mee haue saide bring hither giue goodes deliuer enemie rescue hand tyrans first sentence haue hearde tendeth end pressed ca deserues well excused excessiue passion iob alleadgeth excuse although speake measure sayth men must think much blame misery inforceth true colour may admitted among men godward cannot iustified wee alledge miserie excessiue wote god able asswage wee desire hand furtheremore cannot excuse selues present maner god shall bee accused regard welfare hadled v without anye aduisement verely men thinke yet wee speake god ought open oure mouth reuerence sobrenesse let v consider whether god chastyze v discretion vvhen agreed vpon god knoweth hee afflicteth v hee neuer passeth measure muste go payment come excuse selues rather must yeeld selues giltie seeing iob hath fayled behalfe lette v go rather remedie whiche wee bee combered greate aduersities wee shoulde haue oure recourse vntoo god praying voutsafe succoure v dooing wee shall finde hee ease v muche shall bee needefull also hee suffer v quayle althoughe shall seeme oure calamity gulfes swallowe v vp yet god vpholde v hande preserue v suche wyse wee shall come poynte bee vtterlie ouerthrowen true respect oure selues god intent oure weakenesse shoulde bee knowne shoulde shewe selfe intent wee myght haue whereof boaste oure selues rather foolishe haultinesse v myghte bee beaten downe yet wee shall bee succoured due tyme yee see bee sayde concerning sentence sayde freende ought doo good whiche afflicted iob complayneth men haue feare god sentence oughte bee common among v wee muste go schoole say let v haue compassion vpon distresse ingrauen men man hee skill say specially wee bee aduersitie euery v desyre men haue pitie thinke vpon releefe yee see heere lesson ought bee knowen v yet meane whyle man practyzeth therefore muche lesse wee bee excused oure common prouerbes serue v condemnation veryest idiot ignorantest persones worlde cannot say haue hearde whiche common ordinarie among men man consyder prouerbes runne abrode hee shall finde record ynough reproue woulde take couert god say knewe learned warned wee haue skill ynough say man ought greeue afflicted hee ought pitie yet wee consider whit ye see latter day god shall haue nothing put long inditements v crueltie whiche wee vse towards neyghbours euery man bee owne iudge cace let v marke mention made compassion gentlenesse extendeth farre cace standeth onely vpon geuing meate drink man hee hungred thirst vpon giuing bodily releefe also vpon comforting man hee troubled sorowe anguish mind man hemmed aduersitie comming vex put harte altogither rather meanes muste bee sought comfort curtesye wherevnto wee bee bounde nature lyeth onely dooing pleasure also beeing hardharted shake aduersitie without regarde codemne double end miserie shoulde greater rather bee meeke gentle find hart mourne mourne scripture exhorteth v bee glad neyghboures prosperitie yee see wee haue marke sayde man saketh feare god hee hath compassion afflicted trulye man remember well rule whiche giuen lorde iesus christ hee shall well see howe feare god v wee bee shrunke away yee see howe lorde iesus christ telleth v wee ought followe oure heauenly father wee bee taken child heathen themselues coulde well skill say nothing wherein man dooth resemble god fashion himselfe like vntoo good inasmuche kindely thing man succour necessitie yee see howe god causeth daysunne shyne vpon good bad see brother see mirrour myne owne flesh myne nature pinched aduersitie haue care token proofe thinke god ouerbeastly without cause sayd streyne suche haue pitie vppon poore wretched creature aduersity haue giuen ouer feare god yee see also lorde iesus christ sayeth cheefe poyntes lawe iudgement rightuousnesse mercie truthe vvhen wee shewe wee feare god desyre serue wee muste come present poynt wee walke soundnesse among men wee bee gyuen guy lefulnesse malice furthermore wee render euerye man ryght wee maynteyne good ryghtfull caces neere wee wee pitie suche haue neede helpe succoring vttermost power yee see say wherein wee shall fulfill god lawe wee bee full crueltie euery v thinke onely vpon himselfe make account howe men fare herein wee shewe selues haue regarde god wee god eye would consider hee hath set v liue togither communicate one another wee would consider hee father v wee woulde consider howe hee hath made v one kinde ende wee shoulde one v haue care another none v drawe awaye himselfe alone considering wee haue neede one another therefore bee sayde suche turned away kindhartednesse haue also turned backe vpon god yea knowe thing manhood let v beare well minde sentence proue selues haue feare god behoueth v labour good afflicted true obseruing general rule wee bee bounde good men howbeit forasmuchas wee haue greate hardnesse hart wee must bee softened syght euerye one distresse good meane breake abate enmity euill haue bene afore man bee prosperitie aflote bee hated afterwarde fall haue greate storme lyght vpon head sayd hatred bene afore ceasseth insomuche whiche borne rancour agaynste woulde fayne haue eaten hart guttes say somewhat appeased see chaunge happened vnto seeing affliction ynough kill hatred make enmitie ceasse pray shall wee see neighboures aduersitie ought double moued succoure torment sting poore folke miserie heauinesse onely vnkind bicause haue compassion also exceede forsomuch come increase mischeefe see man mourneth desireth succour turne backe vpon cruell shewe selfe knowe nother god nature another come laugh mock desyreth bee somewhat releeued comming doubleth greef suche one also double cruell true haue dealte churlishly behalfe commeth set foote vpon poore man throte dooth hee shew himselfe bee wild beaste yea beastly iobs freendes whome complaineth therefore proue oure selues god child let v learne shake miserie assuring ourselues thing whervnto god calleth v whereby haue record whither wee take father say vse brotherlinesse towards men wise let v beware wee lift vp selues indure aduersitie wee oppresse moreouer wee see greater despising god wee made reckening thus yee see haue marke herevpon iob vseth similitude comparing freendes dry brooke looke vpon brooke sayeth runneth time sometimes dry come great shot water freze man shall see greate houge heape frost lasteth afterward fall snow behold water come gushing downe brooke swolne hee scarce keepe himselfe within bank ouerfloweth would thinke continue alwayes brooke passeth hee goeth sayth end dryeth vp man go way thema way seba hope find water shall deceyued country wilde respect lande iewrye desertes betwixt dry waye maner vntrauellable therefore place neede water refresh men behold trauellers sayeth shall haue seene brooke bee glad surmise themselues wee haue riuer giue v refreshing wee bee athirst wee may drinke water wee shall haue continuallye hande come drye place think refresh themselues haue water heate greate see themselues deceyued therefore abashed greeued angrie matter lo sayeth hee euen without cause iob alledgeth similitude haue seene heretofore freends whiche come comfort men greate countenaunce doubte honoured renoumed wise men euen oure selues maye perceyue common person excellent giftes grace touching matter iob sayeth wisedome blaste winde cheefe poynte man haue egall stedinesse bee full vaunt fling feeldand make great florishes sheeld afterwarde meene nothing deede onely brauerie according wee shall see make fayre face turning hand become men somuche sometimes man would say behold yonder angel anone shall see wash away like water holde iob applying coparison freends sheweth haue sayd egall stedinesse sayd holde themselues requisite aboue thing men therfore haue profitable lesson gather vpon sentence muche better v bee little spring whiche shall seeme haue greate store water bee greate brooke bee dryed vp tymes maye bee little spring perchaunce well seene hath one little hole man shall haue muche draw vp one pot water yet notwithstanding spring continueth alwayes still serueth one turne keepeth course dryeth vp true one beareth greate shewe much made among men spring selfe shall lye hid man may passe ouer perceyue head innermore yet muche better haue little trickling grope v holdeth continueth still tyme tyme haue houge gushing streames make greate shewe length dry vp howe yee shall see man still man maketh great talk laboring shall handycraftes man greate reputation soeuer hee hee lead blamelesse life hee laboreth faythfully referring himselfe god contenteth himselfe little hath god giue child hee bringeth vp hee good example hee gyueth occasion stumbling moreouer hee sure hee make greate trouble royots hand long hee stretch hither thither haue sayde hee sheweth littlenesse hee able help neyghbour besides cofirming good example god dooth also gyue grace imploy himselfe small matter truely hee hath greate shewe worldward yet cace standeth hee may serue mannes turne euen littlenesse yee see howe suche man holding himselfe sorte lowlinesse continuing race may copared pretie spring neuer dryeth though bee little shall bee woorke wonder woulde seeme mo men firste blushe yee woulde say beholde wee see wonder lette man looke throughly vpon hee shall finde lacke spoken bee practized learned scripture yea talk countenance themselues peraduenture also bee gay shewe theyr lyfe see heere likenesse drybrooke make greate noyse water come downe togither snowes melted seeme whole doozen greate spring fell intoo gushed greate violence yee shall see man beareth greate countenance let bee throughly vewed say let marked hee dooth length hee shall bee founde fayle hold hee haue shewe vertue hee shall haue greate vice matched pity see somuch shall see seeketh nothing make himselfe well esteemed whereas hee hath vnreasonable faultes backebyting one man beguyling another world shall bee ashamed rather laugh skome yee see dry brooke well swolne whyle ende dryed vp cause haue sayd ought well aduised take good heede euery man himselfe pray god make v perceyue owne infirmity end wee cast selues sort bouds purchace great reputation amog men cheef study bee haue liuing water spoken seuenth iohn true water ought flow foorth ought make one another parttakers giftes god hath gyuen v yet meane season headspring must lye couered within wee must bee satisfied god hath giuen v afterward deale therof among oure neyghboures euery man according abilitie behold effect wherevnto muste apply comparison set downe heere extendeth farre wee see howe iob speaketh hys freends made pretence bee redye succoure neede yet fayled wise deceyued hope hee according dauid sayeth tablefreendes shewe head tyme neede vve see dayly experience sayde greate sorte dry brooke worlde say greate sorte howge water rore make mightie noyze certeintie neyther haue euenflowing course holde ende intent wee bee shamed forasmuche god warneth v aforehande lette v consider men drybrookes although seeme bee maruelouse streames tyme yetnotwithstanding vanishe slippe awaye suche wyse man cannot tell water become trusted vpon seing god sheweth v shall bee yea besides woord wee haue experience also shall wee maruell matter come passe lette v beare well minde must gaze men dooing wee shall bee disappoynted expectation let v rather learne hold v fountayne liuing water shewed vnto v prophete ieremie god blameth vnthankefulnesse men whiche dig themselues pittes cranyed cesternes holde water meane tyme forsake welspring lyuing water wherwith ought bee filled continually one shoulde make man greate promise woulde greate fault founde fayle neede howe would sayd hath promised mee mountaynes mynes haue wayted vpon good fayth haue indeuered selfe seruice giueth mee slip make none acconnt mee behold say complaint made ordinary marke god chastizeth v hauenot leaned vnto became v doo long succoured hath promised bicause wee haue shrunke away creature put oure truste creator therefore good reason bee disappoynted hope put shame brought vnder foote whome wee haue trusted vnto foolishlye thus yee see wee haue beare minde yet way wee must abhorre like drybrookes god hath ioyned v one another intent oure continuing heere shoulde bee comfort one another euerye one v shoulde take peece hys neyghboures burthen bee nothing gay countenance meane wee haue care one another see yee thing tendeth peruert order nature wee muste mislyke make fayre protestation ende doe shrinke wetting suche wise water whiche made shewe nothing else bleare folk eye mennes wayting vpon vaine nowe suche maner men deserue bee condemned bee sayde brooke defyle thing minde carye afore much better brooke dry vp still haue suche swelling marre feeldes medowes turning vp afore according wee see brooke ouerflowe bankes leaue nother lande house tree sweepe awaye afore domage thereof shall bee one yeere alone sometymes groundes feele good whyle yea euen maner men shall bee able sowe anyething vpon shall bee turned sande grauell wee see manie dryebrookes yea wee muste bee fayne bee accustomed authoritie beare mace iustice ought bee ryuer refreshe suche readie faynte succour suche distressed trample folke vnder theyr feete oppresse ryght equitie maynteyne naughty packes would put hauocke lift vp themselues openly god needes long examination thing apparant eye riche good world haue landes possession liue rente marchauntes haue good trade traficke ought bee riuers water place passe aboundance god hath gyuen ouerflowe bankes nothing else ouerthrowing one turning vp another thereafter god hath giuen euery ability thinketh haue power anoy greeue neighbour ye see sorte men doo defaulte beguyle haue wayted vpon haue streame water floude yea destroy turne vp thing vvhen see geere let v assure selues men enemyes nature woorke spyte vnto god herewithall let v also marke meanes god wakeneth v draweth v intent wee shoulde learne put trust furthermore haue touched alredie euery v put minde dutie whe haue sayd waterspring v thereafter haue drawne said fountain liuing water say god must keepe said grace inclosed v must spring neuer drieth vp therwithall water must flow neighbor also according measure euery shall haue receyued let studie may comon profite furtherance others according god wil thing haue receiued serue selfe alone suppresse wil deale forth haue want euery man shoulde indeuer like thus yee see wee haue remember effect vpon streyne furthermore wee muste also wey sayd man commeth way thema greate beate water summerbrookes fayle notwithstanding wintertyme moister ground bene greate quantity water seemed maruelous commonly bee seene iolly fellowes stande much vpon reputation make great noyse vvhy hold themselues modesty ouerflow bankes swell suche sorte seeme totoo inuincible strength spred wing whe ease promis cometh push nothing riuer requisite greate heate sommer dry coast shal winter moyst ground also must vertuousnesse shew self whe come true tryall god afflict man thing wherein ought shew himselfe pacient afterward hehoue imploy himselfe vpon neighbour ye see wherein ought shew charitie let v beare mind indeuer make theselues renoumed farre shew themselues drybrookes end wheras walke measure compasse keeping selues modestie making greate shewe greate noyse raunging farre inlarge theyr border shall bee welspring couered hidden haue touched heeretofore ceasse doo well yet howsoeuer bee wee see hath greate abundance man myght saye likely shoulde neuer fayle howbeeit commodious bryngeth profite greate brooke make great noyze ouerflowing bankes make greate shewes muster hande nothing else litle ape toyes parte let v take bee wee may shunne god suffereth foolishe vayngloriousnesse men gyuen vanitie u ne mockerie themseluesto bee put shame certaine suche set suche store themselues woulde make themselues renowmed led vayngloriousnesse suche wyndinesse swelling would still quyet would hunt great reputation forasmuche bee haultye themselues say forasmuche driuen led vaynegloriousnesse good reason god shoulde make reprochefull among men ende wee shoulde knowe howe nothing leasing theyr cace yee see oughte holde v yet still awe wee become drybrookes euery v may reserue himselfe till neede requyre although worlde despise v yet notwithstanding let v like better walke lowlinesse tha make shewes say haue haue nay let v reserue selues good purpose releue necessitye bothe oure selues oure neyghbours let v lauishe time lashe aduenture one pushe afterwarde drye vp ende wee doe wee shall bee lyke drybrookes thus yee see wee haue marke streyne iob addeth hee desyred freendes releeue theyr good yet bee borowe rescowe handes enemyes yet notwithstanding meane season drawne backe vvhen iob sayth hee requested freends giue thing pay ransome meeneth apply similitude whiche wee haue expounded owne purpose hee shoulde say desyre giue good haue done might ye well withdrawe selues mee muche reason water shoulde bee dryed vp yee myght cut way fountayne shoulde sue helpe mee craue nothing yet neuerthelesse man may see yee dazeled onely sight misery therefore dooyng yee shewe selues well bee drybrookes lette v remember well accusation heere wee maye profit oure selues althoughe wee haue shewe seeme wee readie forewarde myghte bee yet wee succoure oure neighbour haue lacke v therein shew selues drybrookes matter standeth vpon succouring good stand neede also vpon hauing compassion without anie abatement oure substance sith costeth v nothing muche shall wee bee vnexcusable wee bee nigardlie haue pitie vppon suche distresse thus yee see wherein iob ment shewe ouergreate hypocrisie haue fayre glosse little whyle yet stedinesse firmenesse therefore serueth condemne suche sute dayes according wee see farre taking anie good succoure haue neede although nothing bee desyred yet greefe peine vnderstand want neyghboures say greefe sygh sorinesse man cannot wrest sygh rather could finde harte poore neyghboures rooted oute woulde wishe deade pity sake sorowe see distresse rather skornfulnesse whiche maketh shunne suche see necessitie greate vnkindenesse yee shall see man wyll bee frende vttermost yea long hee prosperitie god lay hande vpon wee voutsafe regarde creature made image god wee woulde bee newe worlde wee myght haue suche thing meete insomuche wee ashamed onely say suche man spake mee euen nowe spake seeing holie ghoste dooth mouth iob condemne suche extreme hypocrisie lette v looke selues wee see affliction eyther greate small let v assure selues god summoneth v make v vnderstande louing kindnesse wee ought put vre towards ioyned vnto v god prouide well makind good pleasure man payne euery man contented well ease sende suche necessity ende whiche suche want needinesse shoulde haue pitie euery man owne behalfe according abilitie god hath giuen shoulde streyne himselfe helpe haue neede example perchaunce well ease assoone hee seeth poore bodye hee shall bee touched carefulnesse greeueth see necessitie although distribute good yet succour man twayne ceasse haue pitie vpon succoured could finde hart man shall bee much set another shall much richer bycause hath longing gyue meate drink suche lacke god also wyll cause men haue pitye tyme neede according hee promiseth haue bene mercifull pitifull shall finde lyke happen bee pinched aduersitie others shall pay suche measure haue measured vnto others yee see wee haue beare minde namely see neighbour aduersitie must frame selues moued affectioned releeue well yet notwithstanding wee performe dutie discharge selues gyuing good releefe others leastwise lette v shewe howe wee haue sayde pride would cut v whiche necessitie god afflicteth rather let v know meane whereby god try haue kindly affection v deede must alwaies warer disdeyning pouerty trouble louing prosperitie ease soothing vp respect bicause beare goodly port worldeward charitie well grounded loue neighbour respect helped serue owne turnes credit good fauour nay rather let v haue regard follow god comaundeth v wit shewe charitie vpon whome knowe haue neede furthermore let v extend doctrine ourselues say let v thinke ynough blisse god wee bee prosperitie god sende v affliction yet lette v cease glorifie respect put truste although wee bee tossed poste piller misery greeuances world yet neuerthelesse lette v assure selues god strong ynough deliuer v also referre selues wholly prouidence glorifie holie name shall please sende v well prosperity aduersity ye see effect haue mark cocerning text touching iob addeth teache mee haue doone amisse canot bee declared therefore reserue till morow lette v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v perceyue better ende beaten downe oure selues wee maye haue oure recourse souerayne goodnesse reste oure selues vpon vayne trustes false imagination wherewith worlde beguyleth selfe wilfully whensoeuer hee shall suffer v bee afflicted worlde euen meane men creature yet notwithstanding wee maye acknowledge bee hande beateth v ende wee maye indeuer returne vntoo seeke remedye cure oure malady onely mercy therefore giue v grace may neuer bee withdrawne consideration namely may v one labour brought thervnto ende one comon accord may yeeld selues wholly seruice walke feare obedience vntill hee haue taken v mortall body make v parttakers endlesse glorie maye please graunt grace onely v also people nation earth c xxvj sermon fourth vpon sixt chapter teache ye mee vvill holde peace shewe ye vvherein haue doone amisse hovv stedfast rightuouse vvoordes vvhat fault finder among finde faulte vvithall frame reason ouerthrovve matter let vvoordes afflicted go vvinde vvinde fatherlesse ye dig pit freende turne ye againe consider marke reason lye turne ye againe shall none iniquitie turne ye yet againe ryghtusnesse shall appeare behalfe vvickednesse toung dooth mouth feele bitternesse greate vertue man yeelde hymselfe teachable say submit himselfe reason withoute men must needes ouershoote selues despite god proofe heereof cheefe honoure god requyseth hand whatsoeuer know proceede bee receyued without gaynsaying hild good rightfull men frame themselues therevnto certeinly truthe reason proceede god therefore let v conclude god hath soueraintie authoritie ouer v except men yeeld themselues fully whiche knowe true reasonable shall haue profited greatly lyfe wee shall haue learned humble ourselues farfoorth assoone reason thing knowne vnto v wee make gaynesaying shewe selues stubborne hard agree vnto rather doo honoure god say lord wee see make warre agaynst thee stand case thy truth true marke thy diuine glory therefore whosoeuer woorship thee muste obey thy truthe otherwyse must needes troden vnder foote thys matter iob treateth thys streyne protesteth hee bee taught holde tung desyre haue shewed hym wherein hee hath doone amisse doubt iob dooth heere hys owne persone giue common rule child god vvhich rule god shall haue shewed v wherein wee haue doone amisse wee must open mouthes alledge tryfling excuse enter intoo defence dooings wee must gyue eare shall told v without incountering generally wee must receyue good doctrine soone spoken without asking whither wee know bee must go without kicking pricke haue sayd great vertue bee teachable also let v vnderstande rare vertue lyghtly bee found among men nay rather wee see foolish presumptuousnesse euery man weeneth wyse hys owne conceyt heerevppon groweth deuelish wilfulnesse although wee shewe selues bee conuicted yet many v wyll neuer yeelde rather shamelesse brazenfaste maynteyne whiche reason wellynough bee foyled muche ought wee marke well sayde heere although iob treate heere owne vertuousnesse yet notwithstanding goddes holy spirite setteth heere eye lookingglasse example v followe let v wedded owne fancy quietly herken whiche tolde v yea euen commeth poynt wee must bee rebuked oure faulte iob treateth thereof especiall foolish ouerweening men bee conuicted haue done amisse haue ouerseene themselues bee ashamed cast themselues intoo thousand absurdity bee caried away become lyke brute beast facing matter despite god glory opinionholders bee men neuer ouercome first therefore let v marke thing shall propounded vnto v wee muste wilfulminded say looke haue conceyued wil stand vnto let v beware wilfulnesse deadly plague wee shall bee headstrong wilfull matter wee take hande one wee shet gate god say hee shall come although hee visite v although bee desyrous shewe v greatly welfare yet notwithstanding repulse grace haue sayd already namely god child must haue spirit meekenesse say must haue peasable quyet mynd wee must suffer selues handled behold also wherfore lord iesus christ likeneth child lamb sheepe follow voyce shepeherd herken vnto soone calleth therefore let v learne reproued receyue correction whensoeuer brought v generally lette v learne yeeld selues thing knowe good god taught must wee follow haue touched already wedded owne opinion certayne god setteth foorth bee mockerie reproch suffereth haue shamefastnesse modestic letteth bee wylde beastes reuengeth hymselfe suche stiffeneckednesse men cannot find hart yeelde bowe neck agreeing iob meeneth holding peace holding tong man may teache v wee perchaunce shall say true yea wee may perchaunce alwayes say amen sobeeit yet peraduenture may bee wil hold tong yet notwithstanding cotinue still stubborne fancy whatsoeuer befall yee speake man fully determined yeeld mum vtter woord ye shall get open lippes yet notwithstanding holding peace without stubbornesse iob speaketh holding peace meeneth man warned hee incounter man gyue one woord hee shoulde gyue three contrarye wee simply gyue eare sayde thus yee see holy scripture meeneth holding one pe ce holding one tong commaunded hold peace vnto god intent wee shoulde make adoo bycause passion roaring make noyse god haue audience heard v let v lerne speake hold peace taught first lette v learne hold tongs witte hinder grace god offered v wee giue eare keepe mouth shet wee reply furthermore let v also learne speake say confesse god truthe good fault bee found according sayde haue beleeued therefore speake let v yeeld record vnto god goodnesse also indeuer drawe others lo wherevntoo speaking must serue namely end ignorant may bee defyed wee may one common accord bee god true scholers doctrine may receyued whensoeuer listeth play schoolemayster among v thus ye see wee haue marke vpon thys streyne euer doctrine needefull bee practized nowadayes time see ignorance world pray darknesse haue bin needes hold v haue co ceyued shall become v vve haue bin lewdly taught hath bene nothing confusion whole lyfe god graunted v grace gyue hearing mencioned thys place thing bene day wee see manye continue ignoraunce bycause cannot abyde heare paciently tolde god dooth iustly punishe hastinesse lifting vp themselues agaynst hym furthermore wee see thing confuzed throughout wee bee weldispozed settled herken shewed v goddes name apply behoofe certayne wee shall bee lyke straying beastes euery man shall wander heere none v shall keepe right way seeyng wee haue suche neede bee teachable haue meeke mynde receyue sayde vnto v let v learne represse fond affection auaunce themselues wee see vayngloriousnesse selues according desyrous set themselues speake agaynste truthe knowe purpose purchace themselues fame othersome firie wit runne rouers suche sorte man neuer brydle seing wee knowe vice bee v let v learne correct intent may bee thing hinder v holding oure peace keepe selues quiet till wee haue lerned good god teacheth v thus much co cerning first verse touching residue sayeth teache yee mee shewe wherein haue doone amisse meeneth although god child ought meeke receyue correction good doctrine yet notwithstanding ment shoulde bee without wisdome discretion see happened popedome vnder coloure beeing simple say must walk simplicitie true meening men suffer themselues bee led like brute beastes without discerning betweene whyte blacke nought lord promiseth faythfull one spirite discretion intent bee led heere daunce euery mannes pype bee led lyke poareblind men vvhat done vvee must taught wee must haue knowledge certayntie god truthe followe obey man shall haue shewed v faultes wee must take warning aryght thereby followe good eschue euill thus ye see ment thys woorde teach placed heere profitable warning many folke whiche thynke ynough receyue whatsoeuer sayde yea euen without warrant without hauing firmenesse wee haue true fayth god truthe must sealed hart holie ghoste wee may fully resolued according sainct iohn sayeth wee knowe ourselues child god sayeth wee suppose weene haue conceyued confuzed intangled opinion hee speaketh knowledge true wisedome commeth fleshly reason nother oure owne witte vnderstanding bring v god learning surmounteth capacitie man yet neuerthelesse behoueth v consider truth bee throughly resolued receiue whatsoeuer men tell v auenture vnder shadowe simplicitie without knowing wee must diligently inquire thing told v vnderstande doctrine good must determine fully selues hold v thencefoorth replying hygh treason open mouth agaynst god thus yee see wee haue marke heere ryghtly taught concerning god may well bee angrie woulde disguyze god trueth leasings lyke dayes requisite v armed example iob may beate backe wicked slaunders wherewith enemy god woorde labour ouerthrowe turne away fayth ye see papist doo v greate wrong insomuch shoulde seeme wee woorthy grounde shoulde beare v meane talke shewing ynough haue filled eares ignorant sort afore hand bearing hande speake againste holye churche bycause wee subiect traditios haue made yea sayd god woorde must receyued therefore whosoeuer speaketh must aduaunce himselfe bring fancy must speake wyse men may knowe thing whiche hee vttereth godly god must god exalted among v also papistes prye cast vp skum behoueth v bee alwayes readye bee taught yea howbeit doctrine men liuing god whome hee hath appointed onely mayster witte oure lord iesus christ nameth himselfe shepherd intent wee flocke onely voyce bee herd among v shake voyce straungers moreouer agaynste papist wee must bee armed warning day miserable tyme childre god haue great neede inuincible constancie resist many sundry aduersaries dayes booteth find fault euill condene euery man supporteth manifestly day become bottomlesse gulf happen wickednesse euery man couereth yea iustifieth good must needes condemned men feare horrible curse god hath vttered prophet cursed call euill good good euill truely little men thinke haue sayde euill shall borne withall yea borne good shall borne downe vvhen man shall haue doone amisse twice also proceded farre spyte god full one haue shewe ceremoniousnesse man shall come say see thou haste doone amisse yea done lyke seruant house haue confederate hymselfe wyth child guzzle wyne play glutton corner maner naughtiue yet fault espyed child make countenace say thou hast done amisse notwithstanding haue one accord compacted themselues togither commit suche ryots vnthriftinesse men vse like ceremony day mocke god withall euill excessiue contrarily needes must codemned haue walked simplicitie vpryghtnesse whiche haue maynteyned god quarel must passe pike codemned whyle wicked bolstred fauoured al mennes hand v may hardily despise mocke god sort take v cudgell serue beate put confuzio heauenly iudge say whensoeuer man shall teache v aright let v tractable quiet perceyue hym indeuer confound god truthe turne lye let v abhorre maner dealing let v always hold owne race sayd consequently wordes rightnesse strong fault finder finde fault heereby iob meeneth shew man hath good conscience shall continue stedfast neuer bee shaken thing sayd true wicked wil labour throughly ouerwhelme yet shall continue alwayes stedfastnesse hereby warned walke rightly god haue good inward witnesse hath bin hypocrisie v haue done let men assayle v al side shall haue wherewith hold tacke true shall ceasse greeued yet shall wicked neuer haue vpper hand v haue rightnesse wherof iob speaketh heere inestimable priuiledge haue kept way rightnesse soundnesse neuer cofounded true worldward men may oppresse false slaunders men may diffame suche wise shall seeme worst folke whole world according see frowardnesse reigneth nowadayes nother right indifferencie remayning vve come time wherof prophet esay coplayneth namely right openly oppressed vprightnesse truth chaced world besides sayeth although mischeef increased ouerfloweth bound yet hath bene man hath vttered one word cleere thing confuzed rather hath seemed euery man hath desyre augment mischeef behold poynt haue sayd heeretofore yee see inestimable priuiledge wee hold thing good whyche world hateth men poynt v wyth finger spit face trample reason vnder foote although see yet notwithstanding abashed wee shoulde inclyne wickednesse doo alwayes continue fast rooted grounded sayde truthe whych myghtie ynough maynteyne v folowing shewed heere let v learne hold v always word rightuousnesse assuring selues god euermore bee side truth bee myghtie end get vpper true forsomuchas men fugitiue runne headily truth hath alwayes full scope seeme erewhyles vtterly ouerthrowne let v haue pacience vntill day lord appeare sayeth paule wherevnto calleth mocking ouerweening suche iudge awkly ouerthwartly confuzedly charging reproches sayeth wayt day lord til god length discouer false slaunders wherwith haue bin charged whe day sayeth beginneth appeare must ryghtfulnesse come abrode must slaunderers bee conuicted must thing turne confusion god euen whole lyfe graunt v grace get vpper hand maliciouse persones go trample v vnder foote shall haue walked vnfeynedly truthe much shall wee haue preheminence cace concerneth fayth seruice god doctrine saluation wit god giue v stedfast constancie diuell shall haue bent force v shall gayne nothing hads according also haue promis therof vvherof long bee stedfaster adayes seeyng trouble world whereof commeth wee see many men giue themselues naughtinesse euen bicause haue said rightnesse bycause bee fensed manifold assault whiche satan bendeth agaynst verely good minde man warne receyue chastizement quietly man trouble well hurt man neyther gyue cause offence see iniquitie hath full scope man meene liue simplely vprightly hee shall bee pricked one syde punched starteth asyde boweth wyth al wyndes whereof commeth inconstancie bycause haue rightnesse spoken heere well rooted hart behold say cause wee see many wauering men sure truthe gospell insomuch wethercockes turne wyth euery wynd reedes bow euery way euen bycause neuer knew power god woord truthe certayne truth strong diuell may well assayle v woorke v trouble deuise yet howsoeuer world go wee shall holde owne wee shall abide stedfast state vvhat bee done let v pray god make v feele power word whereof mention made wit inuincible fortresse may knowe experience deede wee blame wee doo let v say many ignorant person saye knowe syde turne see contrariety mennes opinion one sayes another sayes true dyuers opinion must fayth tried god suffereth according also sainct paule sayeth must heresy intent god may knowne hauing constancie cleauing continually vnto god truth neuer turned alledged many incounters disputation true muche say oure faith must therefore bee shaken wherein shall stedfastnesse ryghtnesse shewe selfe say shall man knowe truthe strong shall power thereof shewe selfe v like verye deede sayde goddes woord indureth euer ment alwayes heauen also hart faythfull according sainct peter sheweth v although wee bee tossed many stormes tempest world yet shall fayth neuer shaken downe certayne god truthe myghtye ynough withstand assaultes according sayde victory ouercommeth world namely euen faythe sainct iohn sayes canonicall epistle wee desyrous profite well gospell schoole god let v learne take followe whiche good also answer therevnto wise wee maye protest doo thing bycause hope bring passe also bycause god wyll gyue mee strength withstande temptation whych diuell shall prepare mee shall neuer fayle whatsoeuer betyde sayd whiche faultfinder among find fault thing shewe enemy god may well practyze well vse craftie conueyances naughtinesse shall neuer obteyne suppresse truthe shall streyne themselues shall deuise thing may serue strengthen withall yet notwithstanding thys god maynteyne case seruantes length shewe truthe certayne say wicked shall indeuer yea sometimes shal seeme haue vpper hand meanes god punisheth vnthankfulnesse world sainct paule meeneth saying wicked anoy church shal go preuayle increase god giueth satan brydle suffereth diuels champion aduaunce themselues wise seemeth ought lord god suffreth without cause see vnthankfulnesse world many would willingly deceyued greued men teache purenesse coulde fynde hart god word confused yea euen sort man myght knowe discerne aught twoo face one hoode say othersome although abide heare one say truthe yet haue greate care throughly rooted one forasmuch god seeth one sort suche maliciousnesse sort carelesnesse turneth euen open rebelliousnesse many men quenche lyghte god setteth wee maruell slacke brydle wicked turne truthe intoo lying vtterly deface yet meane whyle certayne god strengtheneth mainteyneth end whome hath taught truth yee see wherefore said faultfinder maye well streyne themselues howbeit ende shalbe vanquished god shew himselfe side good right spoken doctrine gospel also al euer concerneth life faithfull true doctrine saluation one preciousest thing god hath therfore ye see also wil shew power thereof wise destroy wicked breath mouth shall feele sayd word haue despised sworde slea driue damnation behoueth god vtter power behalfe aboue al yet doings whensoeuer wrongfully oppressed men whereas ought susteyned shal seeme goeth cleane backward yet let v cease trust still god wee may perhaps bee little set time may abhorred nothing euill v let v contented haue god angells bee good witness soundnesse let v tary till god chace away droopie darknesse make innocencie shine may seene breake day thus ye see haue marke streine iob addeth friend came vnder pretence cofort haue framed talke confound holy purpose say confound right saying haue let word afflicted passe wind heere iob accuseth extreme spitefulnes proceede egerly behoueth v mark wel point doubt holy ghost sheweth v heere wee haue beware loth displease god wold make open war behold say vice hateful god whe cuning ouerthrow good matter specially whe happeneth aduaunce selues afflicted worldward suche presumptuousnesse v prouoke cast themselues despaire yet vice ouer rife bycause man thinketh told heere namely men forge inuentions say deuise thing ouerthrow equitie much make krinks truthe might bee knowne take place one came iustle god tooke hym aduersarie partie men would thynke themselues say thus howe bid battell vnto god certayne wold afraid heare would stand vp vpon head would bridle hold fling themselues randon sith thinke little leastwise let v receiue god sheweth v seeing gyueth v warning streyne ye see effect wee haue beare mind wit man speaketh v delay answere vntill wee know matter vve see communication ministred bee done let v herken marke whither godly true let v pray god giue v spirite discretion may vnderstad truth whe haue founde let v replie haue sayd heretofore men ouershoote themselues vnaduisedly bycause knowe god againste whome set themselues meanes whereof cease proceede euill conscience although directly minded say wil go iustle god yet see well ynough god gyueth leaue auaunce themselues sorte goodnesse suppresse good cace see well ynough therefore certaine yeeld simply good cannot excuse themselues haue certaine maliciousnesse fought god nowe let triall made bee found great small ceasse wage deadly warre continually god worke spite proofe hereof shall euer cace ouerruled iustice wherein shall bee vsed number slight turne good euill yet notwithstanding looke vpon holiest best priuiledged place shamefully defiled none stinking bestlinesse eue bawd brothelhouses wold ashamed men disguise thing yea corrupt sort may seeme haue conspired shet equitie vprightnesse dores yet notwithstanding mean men make countenance though sawe thing would fayne couer leawdnesse apparant notoriouse euen like man cast vp handfull ash darken sunne say day end thing knowne well may yet men stil aske worse said seene euen seate iustice side seene diuell possesseth al temple god ought dedicated seruing worshipping god purely commandeth stuffed ydolles nothing corruption caneldirt wherwith send silly soules destruction effect wee see life man nothing disguising thing tidings hearde sayd soundnesse vprightnesse whereof wee haue spoken heerewithall haue marke thys saying word afflicted person despised person passe away winde ye see howe cause men auaunce selues god set much themselues thinke wisedome owne brayne truly affaire men haue euery man seekes auayles therefore naughtipacke woulde eschue punishment hath deserued wil haue faire flattery gloses hand intent shuld knowne howe cace standeth whither bee money matter thing behold men corrupt truth turne lie owne aduauntage sake case concerne doctrine faith gospell else cause manye countersayings see many sophisters come adayes mocke god flatly sophisticall suttleties pride thinke selues haue witte ynough winne spurres reason pro con terme reason fro side doubt god spirite ment taunt pride presumtuousnesse ende purpose keepe selues enimies god fighting truth shoulde shake ouerweening despise oure neighbour tread vnder feete rather contented taught euen little childe god shall haue opened vnto vntoo v according sainct paule sheweth haue spirit prophecie although god haue giuen grace teach others must notwithstanding disdayne giue place vntoo whome god shall haue giuen knowledge yee see haue marke streyne finally iob concludeth pretended friendes nothing else dig pit man stumble ought bee hilde vp seeke nothing winde fatherlesse hee vseth manner similitude bycause fatherlesse childe hath meane defend left wer spoile iob one god scourgeth vttermost sheweth v shal scape god hand vengeance except laboure succoure miserable say suche worthy pitie compassion sayde yesterday lo haue marke first place conclusion hee exhorteth turne againe saith hee shal none iniquitie turn yee agayne saith ageyne righteousnesse shall appeare behalfe iob exhorting sheweth well mind must find fault euill condemne witte bring men backe againe possible atteyne therfore let v thinke vpon intent take warning may perishe sinnes rather sorie ashamed haue offended god maye retourne vnto greater affection true find haue offended god touched feeling iustice vengeance insomuch man manace shall win nothing hand behoueth bee touched quicke make abashed hee purpose bring repentance howsoeuer cace stand must alwayes shoote marke shewed v heere witte drawe backe according manner iob vseth proceeding touching sayth turne ye againe shall none iniquitie true man may expound streyn sayd shall iniquitie reason saye retourne ye shall bee iniquitie turne ye agayne righteousnesse shall knowen heere iob shoulde saye hath bin cause haue hitherto condemned man whome god cast away seeming shuld worst man worlde cause haue cryed selfe haue bin herd hand haue turned back al reason therefore turne yee agayne righteousnesse apparant wil better vnderstood shall haue applied instruction first formost put mind heere whensoeuer wee condemne good allow euill commeth owne meere default cannot say behold haue bin deceyued wist matter ment let v alledge certaine shall alwayes found blameworthy wee condemne good allowe euill god conuicteth v inasmuch declareth haue voutsaued open eye see hee sheweth v men followe lie sted truth blind know good bycause haue turned back vpon god maliciousnesse hypocrisie carelesnesse god suffer v haue eye seeled vp cannot discerne betwene good euill bycause haue good regard vnto god becommeth v redy teach v familiarly ynough marke speciall poynt whensoeuer bee caried away wee haue spirite wise dome euen allow euill yea cherish remedy v returne wilfully bent continue false opinion wee haue conceyued except wee fall intoo bottomlesse pit whereoutof escaping bleared cannot abide god enlighten manner men must needes come top confusion let v bethinke v turne head assoone wee shall haue knowen fault god sheweth v fauoure giue v warning wee giue care heare sayth suffer v bee led astray euill continually bring v backe agayne good way herewithall houeth v marke well iob addeth returne ye yet agayne righteousnesse appeare betokeneth two thing one inough v come ceremoniously say true fault according see haue fowly offended god haue bin cause suche vnrecouerable inconuenience sore whereof required letting bloud insomuch hath folowed stumbling confusion church euen haue bene giltie trayterousnesse shal come say true haue done amisse nothyng else mockerie well seene zeale affection proceede behalfe namely minded retourne vnto god verely retourne sort may bee knowne repent iob ment shewe hee contented hymselfe haue sayde turne ye agayne sayd turne ye agayne second time seconde poynte haue marke god shall haue discouered iniquitie wee haue conceyued wicked imagination hath turned v away good ende behoueth v acknowledge faulte may returne vnto god sayd applying owne instruction wee shoulde haue easier vnderstanding men found time shall estranged god truth right way haue scrupulousnesse euill opinion according deuill neuer without thys slight trump one thing way end god word may haue sauoure tast specially may weery verely whe maner folke retourne shall iniquitie say god mercifull giueth grace glutted wery word ye see sort iniquitie cesseth men returne neuerthelesse entred good waye behoueth go yet must returne yet witte must bethinke ala bene poore forelorne creature god pitie hath pleased take mee mercy referre selfe wholly vnto beseeching gouerne hencefoorth according good suche men retourne double god maketh see knew first respecte heereof lette euery v beethinke himselfe wee may haue oure recourse vntoo god praying hee hath instructed v hys truth confirme v suche sorte may neuer step right way deuill may neuer thrust v aside let v cast selues downe face good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v feele wise wee may walke according alwayes bee confirmed grace hath gyuen v already called v hys houshold forasmuch greatly inclined go astray let v pray beare infirmity vntill haue quite cleane rid v let v say almightie god heauenly father wee acknowledge selues wee bee worthy lift vp oure eye heauen c xxvij sermon first vpon seuenth chapter time appoynted man vvhiche vppon earth dayes dayes hireling bondman longeth shadovve hireling longeth end hys laboure haue vayne moneths paynefull night appoynted vnto laying dovvne say vvhen shall rise bed cloyed vvith bitternesse euen vntill euening flesh clothed vvith vvormes dust earth skin alto broken corrupted dayes glide avvay like vveauers shettle vvast avvay vvithout hope know well long liue world wee must indure many misery yet wee could find hart god handle v measure wee bee tender nice soone layeth hand vpon v thinke much yea euen pacientest poynt god proceedeth afflicting v still ye shall see faintnesse bewray discouer selfe thing haue handle time iob complayning miserie indureth ouer long sayth man ought haue time set afore hand shoulde say god hath set v vpon earth vnquietnesse time make ende misery plight haue release rest night day seemeth cace worse men god minded afflict beyond state man life able beare lo purpose wee see answereth vnto haue touched witte first sight well confesse bee good reason troubled haue hartsores world yet therewithall wee woulde fayne god spare v soone hee doth touch v tip finger wee would haue streightwayes withdraw hand affliction long continuance standes v hand marke well streyne person iob holy ghoste hath set frailtie oure eye glasse meane frailtie mynde body certayne haue sayd heretofore iob courage constancie wonderfull among men yet man may see taking shall become haue nothyng infirmitie whiche haue scarcely receyued three droppes courageousnesse susteyne themselues withall middes affliction must suche men quayle hand wee see iob beaten downe whome god strengthned mightily wyth grace first let v foreward lesson apply owne vse namely time apointed man vpon earth profitable v comfort v affliction specially commeth seruing god walke feare awfulnesse ought come remembrance according also see holy scripture speaketh true iob misapplieth sentence yet selfe good holy haue sayd alredy ought serue v profitable instruction doubtlesse sainct peter telleth v must walke feare bycause god sercheth bottome men harte iudgeth without accepting person wee must one day render account afore wee haue contented mortall men outwarde apparance nothing worth hee shall discouer oure affection thought good sooth seeme hard cace god child fayne lyue feare vnquietnesse saint peter addeth sayth pilgrimage lyfe vve see saint peter foresetteth time faithfull walke sort verely end giue comfort take courage hauing eye euerlasting rest prepared heauen may well profite ourselues sentence sayd time appointed vnto man vpon earth matter life prolonged without ende wee still continue cace rest men true shunne god drag backe hope well themselues good turne yea long may royst delight pleasure yet meane must bee ame inuironed many misery wee may haue fayre wherewith dispatch selues yet doth god holde v imprisoned vvhat matter bee miserie without hope deliuerance setting free ynough set v rage cast v despaire oft thinke vpon great number greeuances want afflictios world let v marke god comforteth releeueth v saying thus vvell yee passe thys world life short therefore indure ye paciently affliction short end yee shall come rest haue prepared ye see sorte ought mind doctrine intende take profite much said chastizementes god sendeth v whiche haue said hitherto extendeth generally whole life particular whensoeuer shall indure aduersitie verely god send end according see speaketh prophet esay commaundeth coforte people thine apointed time sayth end speaketh captiuitie babylon meaning although hee scourgeth people sinnes yet intedeth cosume vtterly keepeth measure correction anone may haue release knowe god hath pitie punish vttermost therefore ought thakfull towards goodnesse vvee see howe whole course life must fayne suffer aduersities heere howbeit god prolong beyond appoynted time soothly seeme common thing though god spake euen heathen men meene euen moste brutish haue alwayes recourse poynt misery could befall comforted themselues therewith saying well miserie great hath end see pray howe measured passion seemeth superfluous doctrine god comfort v declareth time foreset men theyr dayes dayes hireling howbeit wee haue marke whatsoeuer men conceyue imagination yet god presseth abashed seeming bottomlesse gulfe whereout neuer scape long wee bee reste haue skill say aduersities bee great sharpe long continuance god summon v afore make v feeele oure sinnes iustice dreadfull v behold inclozed round maze whereoutof wee see way scape seemeth make v go euery day deeper yee see howe men astonyed god iustice toucheth good earnest much behoofefull v thys doctrine god telleth v forasmuche wee must passe many misery liue thys world wee ought consider life transitorie shall greeue v vnder state seeing end appoynted aforehand afterward god chastize v send v affliction well presseth v last euer certayne able hold ouerlong therefore keepeth measure knoweth conuenient v let v abide paciently till delyuer v shall disappointed hope verely euery v haue eye himselfe shall finde oure selues haue great neede put mind thys gere although know yet forget wote meeneth wee come putting vre proofe heereof v fayth geare neuer done wee haue affliction one sicke another pinched pouertie thirde tormented hartgriefe troubleth without ceassing aske shall always new begin neuer end seing flesh nature inclined storme repyne let v assure selues without cause god forsetteth determinate time whereof mention made heere heerewithall let v marke whereas sayd time appoynted belongeth god forset v time thys may v much seruice vvherefore god knewe bee good conuenient v wee might well bee sorie heare tyme miserie hand appointment somuch knoweth able beare perceyueth charged ouersore sinke vnder burthen yea vtterly crushed broken somuch saye god knoweth therevpon declareth vnto v hee holdeth v vp according seeth feeblenesse doth require vphild v continually hand shoulde bee daunger broken peeces hee knoweth well moderate weight affliction hee sendeth v seeing wee haue promise haue good cause glad foresetting time let v marke well inasmuche haue time determinate heere bylowe must thereafter make comparison sainct paule betweene misery last twincling eye endlesse glory heauen shortnesse affliction world saith must make v thinke light haue eye euerlasting endlesse kingdome heauen ought outway balance worldly miserie possible deuised seing case standeth ofte tempted ouersorowing impaciecie despair let v haue recourse sayd heere time thereof foreappointed let v vnderstand god hath foreseene good v indure oure affliction befall v without good pleasure furthermore also let v vnderstande hee handleth v onely vprightnesse reason also fartherly louing kindnesse lo haue marke doctrine extedeth farre howbeit consisteth experience talking vpon may reason long ynough purpose chiefe poynt euery v regard profite himselfe neede surely life would seeme short vnto v subiect many wantes long haue owne wish rest euery v confesse life nothing short thing whe thinke vppon infinite misery wherewith full fraughte assoone wee passed one miserie wee muste enter streightways intoo another begin continually new agayne long lingering make v starke weery therefore let v haue recourse whych sayde namely god hath appointed tyme dispose v listeth must contente selues measure hee hath giue v knowing well woteth meete expedient feeblenesse yet notwithstanding euer wee shall fayne languishe end time god shall take v earthly pilgrimage yea euen call v hys euerlasting rest shall none end shall time set furthermore god visiteth v euery v himselfe indureth necessitie chastizements let v acknowledge thus vvell true geere last euer need quaile god knoweth ende whiche mindeth gyue v hee hath promised wee shall continue ouerwhelmed vnder burthen let v tarie till reach v hande aduersities let v assure oure selues hee prouide v due time lo howe wee ought applie lesson owne vse meane wee see iob hath ill profited therefore must wee bee much water wee abuse
