sentence god putteth mynde instruct v applying cleane contrarie yet ordinarie matter v doe vvhen reade holie scripture comfort giuen v ther serue assuage griefe ye see heere comfort god giueth child vtterly bereft seemeth god would chere vp faithfull one ende cast dispaire seeing case standeth thinke vtterly barred hope grace thus ye see howe wee deale commonly behalfe vvheras god allureth v gently bee whereas hee sweeteneth misery sorrowes wee thrust v seeke nothing else nourishe maladie within v barre oure selues quyte god fauour cast great waye vve see befell iob therefore let v thinke straunge subiect like temptation must remedie praye god giue v spirite wysedome may know howe applie vse welfare warning giueth v let v come treate said iob alledgeth howe nowe time appointed man vpon earth true beneath men poore wretched creature yet may sort glad seeing god hath set heere continue euer lo heere thing whiche moste part able assuage greefes indure vpon earth sayth god maketh none ende torment behold howe iob complayneth state worse men say god scourgeth mee measure hee sheweth hee mynded ridde mee misery presse mee haue touched heeretofore namely generally wee confesse well ynoughe howe good reason wee shoulde indure manye aduersities whyle wee world euerie man say yea wee bee borne vnder condition ende wee muste thinke otherwise man euen birth bringeth many misery many want pittie see say well acknowledge generall termes soone god smiteth v thinke hath measure thus yee see point iob also ye see sayde appointing time must referred god discretion lust iob without beeing caried away owne passion considered well said certein spoken amisse vvhy man time foreset iobs misdealing himselfe would iudge meane hee plucketh away authoritie belongeth vnto god wee see wee selues doe case true intent shall bee bereeue god power vsurpe right authoritie hath ouer v say yet meane good patient wee hold affection awe wee afflicted say vvell lorde thy hande v stint thee taske thee present time say thou shalt doe much thou hast tolde v thou canst ende oure misery yea bring happie desirable end lorde wee paciently wayte whiche thou haste promised v haue mindes thus disposed shal god honoured hee deserueth hastie furnish cast forthe complaintes randon saye vvhat shall become seemeth god neuer make end misery say wee doe one would plucke god seate suffer haue authoritie ouer v lo iob dealeth cace true pacient howsoeuer world go yet let faultinesse mingled therewith pacience faithfull sort alwayes perfect requisite seeing iob hath missed behalfe ought wee bethinke selues well fully brittle let v marke well often god shal scourge v although miserie indure prolonged although see intendeth deliuer v hand yet notwithstanding wee must goe manner iob saye vvhat god leaueth continuall torment seeth miserie hathe none ende let v feede oure selues hope sayde let v call mynde determining time must lust god muste order according hee knoweth good perceiue end misery first seeme must indure yet let v cease tast goodnesse hee hath promised v god promise lead v darknesse death giue v light intente put v alwayes hope shall one daye deliuered oure aduersities heere yee see saint paule saith although harried heere yea made skourings thing yet shall wee continue cace god gather v vp himselfe ioyne v liue euer behold ought profite selues promise god maketh vnto v wee may tast middes oure misery let v come iob addeth vseth similitude expresse meant appointing time whereof hee hath made mention sayeth hee looke mee vpon poore bondman slaue hee speaketh seruants hindes seruing dayes slaues afterward addeth couenaunt seruantes hired wage looke vpon slaue howe hee longeth shadow say rest night cause hee neuer ceasseth laboring day long verie well one desireth shadowe againe wage longeth haue dayes worke end haue mooneth lesse serue hath eye ende terme may haue rest mee sayth haue nother rest release laye mee downe say howe shall come morning shall ryse againe vvhen vppe morning day seemeth whole yere long seeing plight well seen god contented plague ordinarie manner men meaneth thunder downe vpon maye know doe say complaint iob maketh saying miserie excessiue common miserie heere cause man saye thou seest long men world haue many misery indure thou hast experience thou knowest maner god wont deale behalf god saith hee vttereth force mee seemeth ouerwhelme altogither compare others whome correcteth see selfe bee bottome hell haue yet hope helpe shall deliuered misery wee haue marke hath bene touched alreadie heretofore wit iob pressed bodily aduersitie chiefe griefe feele god therefore addeth insueth immediatly beholde sayth hee fleshe clinged bone skin alto broken rotten behalf poore forlorne caytife yet notwithstanding life passeth glydeth awaye euen weauers shettle whiche runneth swiftly man perceyueth neyther measure nimblenesse euen life saith hee rise vtterly abashed haue nother ease rest day night although iob smitten bodie yet temptation feeling god iudge holde ye would say vpon racke farre greeuous al martirdomes felt body ye see also tormented himselfe farre thing ought marke well verie fewe folke haue bene exercized spirituall battels therefore wote meaneth vnknowne language god visiteth maner yee shall see vtterly dismayd bicause haue tasted doctrine time place let v bethinke v let v marke aduersities whiche befall v sharpe tedious v yet behoueth v knowe nothing comparison anguish indure pressed god iudgement sheweth boystous towardes giueth token wrath vengeance reason wherof ye shall see astonished comfort cheere vp vnlesse god work extraordinarie operation behalf al misery god giue v leaue returne vnto may call vpon hope hee wil pitie v end certaine cast care trouble vpon scripture saith affliction sweete amiable v go sort vnto god conceiue mistrust shutteth vp gate wee imagin god enemie persecuteth v lost time vaine thing call vpon euen much alreadie bottomlesse gulfe hell pointe iob come parte altogither howbeit hee experience vvhen wee see let v assure selues god well send yet hath done spare v bycause knoweth oure weakenesse trie iob vttermost vse rigorous triall towards v owne infinite goodnesse neuerthelesse meane let euery man prepare himselfe aforehande hee may able withstande temptation euer shall come vnto though tossed waues let v lose courage middes suche tempestes seeing god hathe susteined seruaunt iob yea plucked backe againe euen seemed haue bene vtterly drowned swallowed vppe bottomelesse pit therefore let v vnderstand euer wee shall enter suche gulfes wee shall drawen againe ende hild vp hande god thus ye see howe behoueth v prepared battell heart temptation come vpon v although seeme bee beaten downe euerie stroke yet notwithstanding may hope god ayde v thing conuenient time hee hath done seruaunte iob furthermore although haue bene afflicted good togither yet god suffereth affliction continue still specially wee haue imagined haue end thing shall come passe shall seeme cleane contrarie shall neuer deliuered yet notwithstanding let v resist temptation shall caste oure eye assuring selues god knoweth well howe dispose time season belongeth doe therefore thinges must put hande good beholde sayth iob looked end misery vvell also may well looke god rigorous towardes v hee beareth v far may lawfully say vntill long shall holde according see dauid speaketh good sort time haue looked whyther shall ende misery let v learne also beware wee bee hastie else shall confounded vvhat done let v shet eye present thing let v praye god make v behold end hidden fleshe owne opinion say let v praye make v beholde let v frame selues wholly good remedy nourish hope pacience see misery indure long god sheweth v sort make v way let v shut eye say well lord true thou wilt hold like poore blinde soule darknesse yea comforte meane comfort praye god giue eye beholde present thing also knowe thinges fayth hidden nowe beholde say howe must deale say iob doth see remedy lefte mee man speaketh sort despaire must limit god power though thing seeme impossible selues hee saith lay downe aske shall rise againe morning saye night let v note set downe shewe conscience whiche pressed god iudgement alwayes troubled agonie behold sort moyses speaketh treating god dreadfull vengeance vpon shall continue wilfully disobeying god lawe thy life saith shall hang thee vpon threede morning thou shalt say shall make liue till euening iob speaketh temptation feeleth wit thought night long dayes weerisome according hee said one day longer whole yere yea man whole life nothing pine away onely ordinarie misery also horrible torment faint vnder god hand see temptatio come vpon iob let v haue recourse remedie whiche haue touched wit call mind god peculiar charge dispose v misery therefore doth time seeme long v let v praye god make v thinke well doth otherwise else shall wee prouoke god iob doth hee willing yet meane season ceasseth blameworthy word haue escaped vnaduisedly hath cast foorth agaynste god wise ment spite therefore let v turne backe ageine say thee appointe time hand thy god wilt thou take office intendest thou wretched creature vvhither goest thou whe thou takest vpon thee sort euen breake thy necke thou wilt stie thus aboue sky without wing let v learn walke humblenesse praye god may take good hee disposeth v may yeld therevnto saye lord thou art rightuous wyse thy doings therefore graunt v grace cease prayse thee giue thee glory namely take good worth euer thou sendest frame selues notwithstanding flesh hard bitter indure thus ye see haue marke text furthermore saith dayes passed swiftly weauers shettle heere seemeth bee contrarietie sayth life ouerlong yet neuerthelesse hee addeth dayes slippe away swiftly thing man saye iob caried awaye ouerheadie passion verie well somewhat contrarietie marke well howe according similitude whiche put heere also well placed song king ezechias esay serueth shewe man pressed hande god hee woteth although endure many aduersities yet notwithstanding wee count still vpon life god pursue v ouerhastily wee become itwere dulheaded wee bee manner wee wont liue vtterly dismayde saying nowe could time passed sone yee see similitude importeth iob ment nowe saying life passed swiftly away like weauers shettle felte god hand presse sore hee coulde sighe lament saye end ye see iob ment yet meane season hee ceasseth bee attached feare anguishe plunged ouer head eares cause god hild vpon racke seemed keepe measure chastizing lo ought apply similitude hereby warned pray vnto god affliction howsoeuer keepe v wee may haue rest thinke vpon selues vpon saye thinke vpon ourselues intent may knowe sinnes consider howe much time wee haue lost life end wee may thinke straunge though god scourge v vexe v passe part life pampering ourselues yea euen aduaunce selues god therefore haue great neede pray waken v giue v respite examine well oure faultes ouer let v also thinke vpon cannot done must haue rest somewhat cheered forso long wee bee hartburning chawe vpon bridle vnpossible v come vnto god comforte oure selues goodnesse readie make v fele therfore must praye holde v awe haue myndes abyde quiet peasable midst trouble may befall v also cannot done except iesus christ hande v may haue solace according himselfe sayth come vnto mee yee laboure ouerloden refreshe shall finde rest soules oft god scourgeth v let v determine pray vnto may turne heart minde lorde iesus christe wee maye haue rest whereof hee speaketh wee haue founde wee may bee hild wise wee may receiue god chastizementes correction humble v wee maye leane vnto good may doubt end bee helpfull v shew himselfe fauourable towards v beholde say sort behoueth v bee comforted middes misery affliction whiche wee haue endure worlde wayting enioye blissed comfort god offereth v word shall one day enioy full perfection shall haue taken v hence himselfe nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement sinnes praying make v feele better wee haue earste done yea euen suche sorte wee may bee ashamed presently come vnto touched suche zeale feeling bee oure father sauiour wee maye yeelde selues wholly goodnesse hee strengthen v truste wee haue vntill time haue deliuered v misery worlde also slauerie sinne called v heauenly glorie whiche possesse nowe hope may please graunt grace onely v also people nation c xxviij sermon second vpon seuenth chapter remember life vvinde mine eye shall see good eye seer shall see mee thine eye vpon shall longer like cloude passeth vanisheth avvay also goeth dovvne graue shall comevp againe shall returne house place shall knovve therefore vvill spare mouth shoulde speake mine anguishe talke miserie sea vvhalefish thou keepest vvarde vvhen say bed shall ease couch shal comfort vvhen speake self thou frayest vvith dreames vision behold soule hath chosen halter death rather bone holy scripture telleth v oftentimes god pitieth v respecte frailtie must thinke moued worthinesse v thing god spare v vse mercie towardes v respect needinesse knoweth v otherwise according also saide considereth men grasse whiche fadeth hand withereth away men flesh say corruption breth say winde passeth awaye vanisheth without returning seeing holie scripture witnesseth vnto v also ought set v prayer intent doth holie ghoste speake let v beare mind moue god pitie must alledge haue deserued aught hande excellencie oure person nature gere must laide vnder foote none otherway v deale acknowledge ala lorde rottennesse fleete awaye incontinently strength life shadow vvhen speake maner following warning holie ghost giueth v must aduise selues well sort purpose vse maner speech wit redound god glorie worship humbling ourselues vnto skil say ala worme ther nothing mee vanitie life smoke vanisheth away yet mean haue nother humilitie obedience abace themselues god acknowledge beholding al thing cleane contrariwise shall tende rather make suche complaint seing god hath authoritie ouer creature meete hee shoulde giue v taketh v meete haue let v marke scripture telleth v god pitieth v consideration wee bee frayle life lesse nothing doone giue v occasion murmure fret selues bycause state despizable nothing v whereof wee may vaunt oure selues rather confusion done ende knowe howe wee bring thing god hee shewe v fauoure meane season hee seeke anye thing wote might prouoke loue v shall find aught shall shake v vvhat must muche god seeth wee bee wretched must haue pitie vpon state considering nothing wisedome mere follie nothing vertues onely leasing wickednesse seeing knowe god bereaueth v glorie let v sure haue v presume chalendge thing selues bring worthinesse presence say yea lord shouldest thou shewe fauoure haue done thing mee let v haue mouthes shut respect worthinesse assure selues must drawe licoure onely free mercie god thus yee see intent must call misery rememberaunce witte complaine murmure god humble selues abace oure selues vtterly god alone may honoured may bee knowne hee doth v good bring doe findeth aught v wherefore bounde bycause hath compassion v hee seeth v bee fraile life thing nothing nowe let v come whiche continued heere remember lyfe nothing request good iob saith vnto god lord tormented heere might please thee giue comfort thou knowest nature vvhen iob protesteth good holie request yea verely affection right certaine hee right intent yet therewithall coulde bee saide hee ouershot himselfe going farre wee shall see better sequele therefore let v marke alledging frailtie god ynough humble selues confesse wee haue nothing wherein wee may auaunce selues wee must haue modestie confesse god rightuous making v bee suche state yea though wee perceiue cause although hee haue hid secretes v yet must plead againste haue harteburning v ouersore pressed muste bridle oure selues god hathe iuste cause set v suche state wee might bee hedged manner misery affliction vvhy ende holde v awe subiection vnto might haue sayde presumption puffednesse pryde heerevnto iob addeth lyfe nothing hee shall returne agayne see good saye take pleasure thing god giueth men present life eye sayth seer shal see say shall bee longer heere ende hee likeneth man cloude yee see cloude vanisheth awaye man tell becommeth returneth former state euen hee goeth graue shal come vp iob speketh frailtie man life ende god handle rigour according hee saye anon another streine thou shouldest stretch thyne arme againste mee hee saye lorde wilte thou fight shadowe man maye thinke straunge iob speaking death leaueth hope nother selfe mankinde saye dying wee doe perishe vtterly dispatched doe shall neuer restored agayne hee sayth man layde graue abydeth neuer returneth anye seemeth heere iob speaketh like vnbeleeuer hathe nother knowne tasted aught true religion must consider place hee speaketh deathe men selfe like holy scripture also vseth manner inditing oftentimes elsewhere must thinke straunge iob hath spoken according maner taught holy ghost thing wee haue dayes yet written time iob yet god ingrauen thing heart faithfull one written yea god euen yet still day maketh v feele heart engraneth still finger say holy ghoste let v come backe againe article haue touched scripture speaketh battells wee haue owne nature without taking hold god goodnesse aboue vve haue alredy alledged record sayd man breath wind passeth away returneth seeme man likened brute beastes yea like verie deede god put hande whence commeth immortalitie soules speciall fauour god beareth v saint paule saieth god immortall vve rransitorie doe nothing else fade awaye oure soules euen angel heauen shoulde also bee mortall howbeit muche god hath breathed owne power must need continue whece procedeth immortalitie say eue angel behoueth v also part draw well according said psalme lord thee fountaine life thy light shall enlightned vve see men considered selues haue nothing dedlinesse according sayd another sentence hundred fourth psalm lord drawe thou away thy spirite thing shall decaye come nothing nowe holie scripture speaketh manner take v hope resurrection nother make v thynke wee bee immortall wee muste alwayes beginne thys poynte namelye knowe oure owne weakenesse afterwarde mount vp degree know god hath put v vvhat men wind smoke howebeit much god hath breathed continuing power intoo v therefore wee bee immortall furthermore behoueth god stablishe thing whiche hath put v hee mainteyned grace woulde goe decay specially must come highest poynt witte resurrection promised v shall wee fynde owne nature wee muste stie vppe aboue worlde wee must vnderstande none onely iesus christe whiche true mirrour wherein see thing wee see god rayse v vp againe glorie hee plucke v corruption rottennesse wherein nowe walke wherein wee shoulde abyde euer extraordinarie remedie whereby hee helpeth matter yee see howe wee must bee fayne come iesus christ knowe whereat behoueth v looke hope raysed vp agayne last day verely sainct paule vseth certaine similitude whiche hee taketh common order nature shewe resurrection sayth ye see graines corne seed cast ground rotting growe vp againe nowe saythe hee men sowe bare corne afterwarde groweth vp againe rottennesse whereintoo behoued first turned ye haue figure image resurrection yet muche say wee see oure resurrection serueth onely shewe faythlesse vnthankfull ouerlewde godwarde dispute possible body shoulde ryse againe rotted turned duste suche wise theyr owne conceyte shoote suttle deuises therevpon conclude vnpossible god rayse v vp againe saincte paule sheweth suche folke malicious nothing else owne vnthankfulnesse turneth awaye receyuing power god whereby hee poomiseth set v perfite state agayne gyueth v certayne familiar likelyhodes order nature assure v good purpose sainct paule vseth foresayde maner reasoning meante oure resurrection shall bee naturall thing make v vnderstand infinite power god honour yeelde prayse belongeth vnto therewithall looke vpon promise hath made v although farre surmount vnderstanding bee verie straunge thing god shoulde make v newe agayne wee bee turned intoo duste yet notwithstanding hee restore v euen wee shall haue beene turned nothyng althoughe saye hard beleeued yet must trust god neuerthelesse able doe power wherethrough hee able doe thing according sayde another place philippian nowe therefore let men wittes discourse let raunge euen diuelles hell yet certayne shall bee able diminishe god power neuerthelesse encounter sayd promise made v resurrection thing surmounteth capacitie go diminish yea much lyeth vtterly abolishe god wonderfull power whereby hee able thing nowe let v come againe sayde heere ala lorde shall see good eye seer shall see shall returne graue vvhy speaketh iob thus hee man dispayre casteth awaye taste whiche hee earst felte god goodnesse touching resurrection hee setteth man alone selfe grace whereof god hathe made partaker owne meere goodnesse euen ought wee doe likewyse yea speciall poynte well worthie bee marked moste men abuse selues haue discretion saye beholde oure god hath done v exceeding muche good wee must consider wee bee beholding euer wee haue ryght necessarie lesson v nowe dayes shall men able humble themselues except set one syde god gracious goodnesse say myne haue selfe possessing bycause hee lendeth therefore must homage therewithall consider howe fauourable god mee howe bountifull hee sheweth himselfe towarde thus yee see meaning iobs wordes expresse man god leaue vp himselfe therefore hee concludeth shall see good eye seer shall see mee muste fayne continue graue nowe let v learne consider life howe flightfull frayle likewise examine infirmity oure mynds may conclude worse nothing except god vphold v goodnesse neuerthelesse must hinder v magnifying god gracious goodnesse althoughe wee knowe oure state beevile abiecte howebeit wee must beginne poynt haue spoken alreadie furthermore haue touched wee must alwayes beare mynde although iob alienated god bee hope comfort pacience yet notwithstanding hee ceassed exceede measure hereby wee bee warned looke well oure selues wee swallowed vp sorrowe bee caste dispayre considering muche oure owne frayltie profitable lesson nothing ought desyre muche humble selues onely wicket wee haue receyue god grace long men epossessed pryde weene themselues worth thing yee shall see locked vp grace god neuer enter muste humilitie go cheefe oure study ought bee bethinke oure selues well wee bee ende wee maye haue trust selfeliking selues beholde craftinesse sathan thing moste profitable auayleable men saluation hee taketh maketh rancke poyson hee findeth waye make men brutishe knowledge misery much become woode cast themselues dispayre true diuell hee could would continually sot v follie ouerweening hee woulde make v beleeue wonder selues hee neuer suffer men humble abace themselues hinder much hee hee seeth hee cannot hinder men abashed themselues knowing owne state goeth shift see yee ouermaystred hee set feete vpon men belly say yea vpon throtes holde still poynte euen till hee haue forced dispayre cause wee enter intoo consideration owne wantes let v bee well aduised haue bethought v vtterly ouerwhelmed wee meane alwayes acknowledge good thinges god hath done v put v bestoweth vpon v continually togither remedy whiche hee hathe giuen v releeue wantes wherein wee haue rotted god extraordinarie goodnesse bene let v learne knowe ende may take breath thus yee see wee haue marke streyne insueth seeing sayth iob spare mouthe muste needes speake muste needes make mone must needes talke sorrowe anguishe herein see haue touched alreadie although iobs consideration good although thing alledgeth holie agreeable doctrine holy ghost yet ceasseth haue temptation excesse sayth behold must needes speake seeing haue past moment liue ouerpressed hand god therfore must reuenge selfe speaking sorrowes hold selfe true god giueth v leaue speake making mone howbeit wise choler shoulde encrease sorrowes wheras thinke ease meanes vvhat permitted intent returne vnto vnburthen selues sometimes speake ceasse displease god greeuously impaciencie blaspheme full mouthe doubtlesse verie heynous cryme men dare open theyr mouthes blaspheme god yet many also vtter one word yet full rancour god yea bee much fuller pryde bitternesse speake yee shall see man chafe vpon bridle like mule yet speake one word ye examine hart ye shall finde redie burst spite firy rage possible hee might fyght god would another vnlodeth selfe first dashe many wicked wordes slip yet hath muche bitternesse heart howsoeuer world go naught vvhat done sorrowes oppresse v sore let v settle ourselues pray god may please ayd v midst may conceiue moodinesse againste leastwise whiche hinder honoring herewithal must also labor fight whereas men wont harden selues haue conceyued wilfulnesse stomaking nourish themselues therein behoueth v knowe must withstand let v restraine affection let bee tied vp like wild beastes haue done indeuer represse passion hold awethen let v assure ourselues also discerne say howe shall mortall man haue leaue giue bridle shall stand contention god would pick quarell let v keepe v lycenciousnesse murmuring againste god haue tong vnbridled say god vvherefore handleth hee manner let v let v make mone sort god maye alwaye alwayes honored handes let v confesse rightuous vnpartiall howsoeuer deale v marke speciall point moreouer therewithall letall complaintes bee made vntoo yee see wherein men onershoote themselues oftentimes shrinking awaye god much woulde make complaintes else discoursing neighbour howe haue misfortune say man indureth much seeme god mindeth torment mee without ende ceassing lo howe men alwayes grunt although vtter murmuring mouthe yet sure keepe euer store stuffe behind hart lay open god requireth yee see haue consider iob sayth wil speake bitternesse talke witte measure hee ought keepe taketh much libertie nowe hapned man mirror pacience shall betyde v let v beare mynde warning haue giuen alreadie wit haue bitternesse hart come vnto god praye assuage disease wee come speaking vse tonges babbling may refrayned glorifye god withall make complaintes vnto goe murmuring heere wayling babbling god maye bee witnesse sighes grones resort right forth vnto comforte iob hath sayde addeth sea whale thou shouldest set barres fayne haue great let stop iob protesteth heere god need stopped great violence like sea sayth hee hath need rampyres ietties sea haue broken ouer bankes thousande two thousande men must bee sente must bee bringing timber earth stone make vp great breach also vvhale suffer himselfe bee caught without great adoe great force muste bee vsed holde strong mightie beaste iob sayeth sea vvhale howe god proceedth great violence mee hereby hee meaneth miserie whiche hee endureth ouergreat god hathe neede punishe heerein hee sheweth hee suche staye himselfe hee ought haue true haue sayde afore hee ceassed bee pacient howe bee pacience continually perfecte alwayes storminesse mingled haue wee gather vpon sentence bewayling oure selues wee knowe muche better wee bee true muche wee bee frayle wee maye well saye vvhale lyon beare wylde beaste vvell herewithall wee looke vpon oure lustes wee looke vpon rebelliousnesse v god wee looke vpon number vice wee haue whole bee lyke eendes hell onely bursting boundes vnto euill vpon earth also mounting well neere heauen vvhen wee resiste god oure lustes praye doe wee mount vppe alofte make warre god neyther vvhale lyon wylde beast vpon earth owne nature hath great violence haue wicked affection man therefore god vse violent remedy v hamper v roughly would hee let v say iob sayth vvhale sea wee bee much worse god must fayne hold v chayned force wee lunatike lunatike nowe wee shall haue knowne gainestriuing wicked passion wee confesse god afflicte v vse euen violent remedy v without cause therefore wee accuse hee excessiue must glorify considering howe cace standeth nowe wee see men ought haue double knowledge themselues one side behoueth knowe nothing rottennesse corruption intent may obtaine fauour god moue vse mercie pittie towards v know let v also consider wee bee strong vnto euill cace madde man flingeth tormenteth himselfe yet hath neuer awhit right strength euen standes cace v respecte good vtterly weake touching euill bee like gyants huge force v requisite god stretch arme smyte v great stroke yea thunder vppon v vppon wylde beastes althoughe wylde beastes holde crueltie suffer themselues bee easily maystred yet notwithstanding wee compare selues wee shall fynde men start muche boundes therefore euer god shall presse v neuer sore let v bee sure hee hath good cause doe let v repyne haue pleaded oure best wee shall gayne nothing needeth one woorde put v consusion thus muche concerning streyne hee addeth say bed shall comfort behold couch burneth talke selfe thou frayest vision night thou afrightest dreames true present saying expounded diuersly sayde iob purposed haue refreshment bed hee found burning heate couche hebrew worde put betokeneth sometimes burne according shal see sentence moreouer signifieth withdrawe drawbacke similitude signifieth leaue forsake neuerthelesse signification burning agreeth verie well heere euer man expounde word sentence doctrine remayne one still wit iob complaineth beeing disappointed hope hee looked haue refreshment bed yet founde heate much burning fire talked himselfe heere see hath bene shewed alreadie heretofore namely iob horrible tormentes hee pressed bodily paine also battels mynde feeling god iudge beeing payned sort bene burning lake paine hell must alwayes call teo mynde sayde good v also thinke oftentymes true wee ought put selues good readinesse battell sith god afflicteth v shal feele thing saue indure world warde chiefe sithe wee knowe wee must come reckening god hee make v feele sinnes shewing himselfe rigorous iudge beholde depthe hell gulfes open swallowe v vp vve must haue bethought v thing hande wee may know humble selues conceit also doe vtterly confounde v yee see iob man vertue excellencie notwithstanding pressed wherefore example god meant shewe howe small matter come maiestie iudgement seate answere whole life let v apply selues receiue warning whiche god giueth v sinnes notwithstanding haue verie rough assaultes let v leseech god holde v vp putting trust grace offered v lorde iesus christ may ceasse continue hold end yea euen till haue humbled v knoweth needfull v specially let v marke well circumstance vvhen haue thought bed giue rest founde burning fire talking selfe true may well hope god releeue v v appoint either time place must put ouer wholly good must wee seeke rest neither bed thing let v cast vp sighes vnto god may please refreshe v sorrowes way sayde strange cace iob feele himselfe burned talking haue told howe circumstance well worthy marked whereas men commonly babble muche making mone talking doth set fire vvhat cause wee ouershote selues suche sort passion bycause euerye v flingeth randon deceyueth iob sayth contrariwise say spake himselfe vvhen man shrinketh intoo himselfe striueth keepe himselfe passing boundes wordes feare resisting god represseth affection occasion set fyre yea surely sometimes according sayd two thirtie psalme text yet notwithstading much say contrarie part therefore bee lauishe wordes complaintes euery bodye fynde ease oure griefe quench fire whereof mention made heere tather let v enter oure selues true sometimes passion kindle talking oure selues yet notwithstanding god soone office quenching fire shal kindled example looke vpon poore man whome god scourgeth man oftentimes knoweth yet notwithstanding ende god turne good poore man continue still anguishe shall hee doe let enter himselfe howe let say hath thy god forsaken thee else let say loke well vpon thy selfe poore creature need must thou haue offended god greeuously seeing hee executeth suche rigour vpon thee ende holie ghoste still make take holde taste apply owne vse holie scripture speaking roughest assaultes doth neuerthelesse set forth v infinite goodnesse god intent middes oure greatest affliction wee assured god deliuer v aduersities time conuenient yee see howe iob hath bene exercized yet neuerthelesse hee presently protesteth hee felte himselfe greater heate mourned muzed himselfe ought acknowledge verie well god haue yet inough true miserie great respecte ablenesse beare must yet increase lo iob ought haue considered bene point true wisedome seeing hee euen courage may see much behoueth v stand vpon gard aduise oure selues well pleade againste god afflicteth v seare least put v reproch shall know become hee sayeth god troubleth vision night according wee haue seene alreadie heertofore hee doo men feele paine bodie onely aboue faine abide temptation god herevpon hee concludeth soule chosen halter say wished miserablest death could bee leuer hanged suche case howe wordes man despayre let v marke iob speaking sayth hilde himselfe purpose settled selfe hee protesteth onely making comparison life worst death could happen vnto dismayde time hee loked asore feeling sorrowes pinched herevpon let v consider god haue spared seruat iob may fall shall tormented true god knowing wee bee able beare suffer temptation bee greate haue bene man receyued strength holy ghost yet muste euery v visited hande god sorte sometime lyfe shall miserable death hanged say wee must bee fayne come therevnto therefore standeth v hand throughly redinesse let v learne fence selues whiche shewed v holy scripture namely shall haue matter gladnesse ynough wee shall haue increased profited iesus christ well death lyfe wee ioyned iesus christ although oure lyfe bee miserable yet shall turne oure profite haue trouble world shall many helpes saluation therefore whensoeuer shall seeme vtterly forlorn let v therfore ceasse call vpon god hoping wil ende turne trouble ioy glory also continue goodnesse towardes v vntill make v feele perfectnesse let v caste oure selues downe face good god acknowledgement oure faultes praying humble v suche wise ashamed selues may sory giue glory due vnto yet notwithstanding meane wee may ceasse returne towards seeing hee allureth v familiarly beeing sure hee receyue v time may knowe way whereby leade v thither say lord iesus christ haue knowne howe nothing v bottomlesse gulfe confusion may neuerthelesse continue stedfast trust shall acceptable good god seeing clothed rightuousnesse onely sonne oure sinnes bee blotted merit death passion purenesse obedience whiche hath yeelded vnto may please graunt grace c xxix sermon thirde vpon seuenth chapter sermon conteyneth rest exposition xv verse followeth vvery shall liue alvvayes take thy selfe avvay mee dayes nothing vvhat man thou magnifiest thou hast care thou visitest morning thou hast eye vpon euery minute hovve long bee ere thou lette mee alone thou wilt gyue mee tyme svvallovve spittle haue sinned vvhat shall doe thee thou keeper men vvhy hast thou set mee ouer thee bee burthen selfe vvhy doest thou take avvay sinne vvhy doest thou pardon mine iniquity shall layde dust thou seeke morning shall iob goeth forward still matter touched yesterday say lothing life sayth resteth resolutely vpo poynt though hee tasted god goodnesse awhit cofort himselfe withal considereth lyfe long god holdeth rigour therevpon cocludeth muche better god would kill yea sort euer haue sayde alreadie men looke theyr present state may bee tempted suche misliking shall vtterly dismayde reason theyr exceeding miserie specially seemeth god minded execute singular rigour towardes faithfull handleth suche wise afflicted wicked maye wee bee caryed away hopelesnesse wee shall bee wearie lyfe leuer bee deade nothing comforteth v knowing euen middes sorowes still beloued god end haue pitie v giue v saluation lyfe meanes lord iesus christ vvithout certaine life weerisome bring nothing lothsomnesse yea euen repyning againste god let v marke iob ment expresse affection god hilde vp cause addeth weery hee shall liue euer dayes vanitie therefore hee woulde haue god go away hee say ala lorde wherefore persecutest thou mee thou seest heere poore soule indure except thou haue consideration life nothing vanitie vvherfore doost thou get thee away mee according haue seene alreadie witte god ought vtter full force mortall transitorie men bicause bee rockes yet boysteous beast fayne inforce himselfe muche iob therefore confirmeth still matter man anguishe cannot make ende gronings hauing sayde addeth vvhat man thou magnifyest vvhat hee thou visitest morninges thou settest thy harte vpon hast greate care expound sentence vvhat man thou makest muche thoughe iob ment heere rayle god hee lifteth v vp wee little king hee seemeth haue fatherly care v preferre v aboue creature afterward throweth v men picture wheele fortune thus yee see howe take streyne othersome thinke iob ment make comparison betweene himselfe mankind sayd ala lorde thou art good vnto men thy mercy filleth whole earth man feeleth howe thou art father thou bestowest many benefites vpon none selfe alone whome thou art vnkind vvhat meeneth shall ranke men thing well considered iobs plaine meening say yea lord art thou greeued agaynste men thou settest verye greate store dooth hee speake god benefites rather meeneth conuenient thing god bee greeued men example greate prince shoulde take pritch poore labourer honour men woulde saye matcheth hee himselfe hys equall hee doth himselfe great wrong knoweth hee yea euen proude sorte worlde well ynoughe saye suche one matche woulde shewe yee see sorte men commonly vse shewe token disdeyne men woormes earth well skill alledge comely beare malice farre inferior farre greater reason thinke god seemeth magnifie men ouer muche hee matcheth himselfe agaynst vvhat state god therefore ought set light say tushe well yee woormes yee vermine shall chalendge go fyght greatlye defacing glorie maiestie yee see iobs cheefe meening furthermore wee haue marke present sentence like eyght psalme sayde lorde man thou makest muche yee see heere howe woordes sette theyr proper signification iobs saying bee taken cleane contrarie said text psalme haue alledged dauid recounteth god infinite goodnesse thinketh vpon creature vouchsafeth haue care guyde gouerne ye looke vpon man himselfe ye shall see poore creature may well seeme god ought haue respect caste eye vppon nowe wee see god onely vouchsafeth gouerne men also maketh lordes creature according sayde hee hath made beastes feelde byrdes ayre fish sea serue turnes withall seeing hee hath disposed thing serue v succour neces ities seemeth god beareth v suche loue hee putteth hath vnder hand saying withhold nothing ye see wretchednesse poorenesse men yeeldeth greater beauty god goodnesse mercie wee thing oure owne coulde prouoke v good thus ye see dauids playne meening thing specially fulfilled person lorde iesus christ although hee onely sonne god yet notwithstanding respect manhoode hee sonne abraham fully like v poynts sinne onely excepted see god hath made much gyuing thing intoo hande ende wee shoulde recouer thing whiche wee loste adam therein god hath shewed greate infinite treasure mercie verely iesus christe true looking glasse god grace whiche afterward spred vpon member example dauid wee haue good cause exalte goodnesse god wee see hauing begonne first adam afterwarde iesus christ whome made whole agayne beaten downe defaced adam hee continueth still day v good bee made parttakers rich heerein wee haue good cause maruell saye ala lorde wee thou visitest v thou vsest v familiarly wee bee thy child thou holdest v thy lappe thou shewest thy selfe bountifull towardes v wee ought doo place iob taketh fiat contrarie vvherein wee see mennes mouthes oute taste nothing like cace mannes stomacke squeymishe meanes sicknesse beste finest meates coulde bee brought vntoo shoulde haue sauour lothe prouoke vomiting standeth cace v wee bee yll disposed haue right well ruled iudgement god grace shall haue taste sauer v thing oughte prouoke v loue god wee knowe hee commeth downe sorte vnto v hee dooth ye woulde say put meate mouthes moother dooth hir yong babe hee hath wing spred oute receyue v vnder sayde song moyses vvhen wee see god haue familiar care v ynoughe rauishe v oute wittes ought consideration therof susfize v throughly forweeryed full anguishe come farre shorte tasting theyr profite coulde finde theyr harte god greate way according wee see happened vnto iob leastewise respect fleshly affection doubt hee resisted pacience howbeit secrete hidden within neuerthelesse behooued passion shewe selfe whatsoeuer god ment humble thereby vvee see howe iob turneth god prouidence quite vpside downe steade coforting cheering himselfe therewith woulde fayne god farre vvhat man sayeth thou makest muche yea verely god chastize v whe amisse must therefore say aduaunceth v muche doeth v wrong mortall men man bee offended hold scorne match himselfe vnderling bende himselfe agaynste equall wherefore matter standeth vpon reuenging god chastize v faultes wee haue committed auenge himselfe v hee passeth thing vvhat two reason one wee muste bee fayne take iudge spite oure teeth wee haue despyzed neuer muche would haue v perishe therefore correcteth v end come backe agayne calleth v meanes repentance vvee say vncomely thing god punishe v preace vpon v intent plucke v backe sinnes shew himselfe iudge learne subiect vnto vve see howe thaklesse men sith turne good turnes vpside downe god doth moreouer lette v vnderstand befell vnto iob bee tempted hee wished god awaye like temptation may well happen vnto v shake v also put v plundge shall quite ouerthrown must men bee well aduised fense themselues aforehad accordingly haue declared must acknowledge god bindeth v exceedingly much vnto vouchsafeth visit v keepe watch warde ouer life haue fatherly care v wee neuer magnifie grace muche yea hee punisheth v sinnes let v assure selues chastening v wee bee worthy cause hee shoulde put hande hee let v go suche sending v punishmets god sheweth bothe goodnesse iustice meanes calleth men repentance afterwarde hee maketh feele theyr iudge may humble themselues hee chastizeth profit vnthankfulnesse hinder profiting lo wee haue remember streyne howsoeuer worlde go let v keepe selues saying god man thou magnifiest thou visitest morning lette v greeued god set sure watch vpon v let v woulde haue brydle layd looce necke runne rouers end god chastize gayne let v put cace god shet eye let v runne randon feeldes ouer wee gaue oure selues riot passed become v beholde diuell would ceaze vpon v wee pray woulde carie v euen destruction let v know nothing better welfare god haue eies open continually see specially gage bottome thought wee shoulde remoue one finger bredth step forth one pace note marke assuring selues say profit otherwise thus yee see haue gather vpon text iob addeth howe long bee ere thou let mee alone withdrawe selfe mee tyll haue swallowed spittle heere iob declareth passion wherewith hee bene tempted way wee haue beare minde hath bene sayde heretofore wit iob felt alwayes comfort god forsooke full doo iob sheweth heere sort hee affectioned respect flesh intent freendes might knowe made great complaint without cause better expresse anguish wherein hee hee turneth himselfe god bicause hee see hee shall gaine nothing men hand yet ceasseth regarde men yea euen much bene well gathered himselfe hee made prayer vnto god certayne hee behaued himselfe quietly hee shewed greater token fayth pacience vvhat cause iob martyreth himselfe sort may seeme first blush hee desperate person hee hath eye reproches offered able beare passe ouer haue eye vnto god sayde heretofore namely men come molest sting v must looke vpon wee muste cast countenance thitherwarde forasmuch wee perceyue satan laboureth bring v meanes confusion wee muste come streyght vnto god must mourne muste assure selues hee cause v feele auaylablenesse chastizements better cannot bee thrust way men marke wee ame yet neuerthelesse iobs purpose streyne expresse vehemencie affection better turning talke vntoo god hee sayde vvell ye vnderstand nothing see yee perceyue spirituall battell wherevntoo god hath put therefore must talke iudge bee short one iob sayde speake counterfeyte stuffe god himselfe heere hee sayeth hee touched afore lyfe nothing vanitie muche god ought take himselfe awaye vntill hee bad swallowed spittle according wee may saye take breath heereby iob meeneth god pursueth vppon ouer roughly seemeth hee woulde pleade agaynste god hee hath done heeretofore haue tolde alreadie hee dooth expresse passion fleshe truely whensoeuer god giueth men grace frame themselues vntoo beare crosse affliction paciently suche wise bee altogither without feeling shoulde bee vnmooueable vnprofitable men trouble torment intent shoulde fully settle themselues beare pacience shoulde conclude meete god haue maysterie frame selfe lure therefore yeelde selfe ouer vnto good pleasure howsoeuer worlde go none able without incountering iob expresseth heere owne pa ion suche sorte hee felt meane god grace buried tyme vtterly quenched haue sayde god vphilde come passe firste passion assaulte faythfull shall man woulde say harried away suche maner may seeme god gouerneth play horse broken looce nay man vpon horse well yee see horse flingeth kicketh doth escape runne ouer feelde anone man handsome tell well inough howe tame hee reyne vp brydle bring good pace euen v wee shall oftentimes bee caryed awaye headlong ouerheady passion yet god let v alone rather reyne v vp drawe v according shall see howe hee worketh towardes iob hath bene declared heeretofore true wee may well alledge vnto god frayltie lyfe wee woulde obteyne mercie releefe hande iob speaketh heere excessiuely man wittes knoweth whome hee ought direct woordes euery faithfull bodye lightly say lorde dayes nothing vanitie smoke therefore haue pitie vpon miserable creature request good holy god accepteth good woorth bycause taught holie spirite speake iob steppeth fashion another maner style howe dayes sayeth vanitie commest thou heere set thy selfe agaynste mee vvilt thou giue mee respite swallowe downe spittle vvhy doost thou get thee mee hee opinion god woulde drawe away hande haue ease yea woulde become v god lette v alone shoulde wee haue power swallowe downe spittle howe coulde wee breathe spirite gyueth liuelynesse thing shoulde forsake v doe wee see wee needes decay haue declared alreadie iob amazed man hath consideration miserie serueth v good profitable warning see bee ouerpressed owne passion namely wee forgo wisedome pacience become dull brute beastes verely seeme v wee marke mennes passion farre bee wee shall finde make v altogither blockishe wee haue knowledge agayne wee haue holde selues bee competent iudges bee seene wittes confounded neede lette euerie v marke men bee cumbred vehement passion else let v consider wee selues fare god pinche v aduersitie ouerroughe v wee bee daunted wee haue hart call vpon god wee cannot bethinke v promise conteyned holye writte remedie misery nowe haue sayde suche headinesse oure passion god shoulde ouermayster aboue yea euen woonderfull power holie spirite suche wise wee might know maiestie therein man skill certayne ynough mingle confounde heauen earth togither euerie blowe yet neuerthelesse haue touched alreadie iob farre consideration asmuche god spirite god remedie grace holy spirite question yee shall finde man owne naturall kinde ye shall finde passion according flesh get thee sayeth iob shoulde become v god shoulde let v alone wee shoulde abyde without ayde assistence wee haue beeing liuing oure mouing scripture speaketh wee selues doo see experience wee swallowe downe oure spittle god shoulde gyue v vp much like woulde saye power v angelles heauen god shoulde leaue themselues woulde become beholde immortall creature already glorie heauen behold maiestie god yet neuerthelesse shoulde vanish away brought nothing god shoulde withdraw himselfe full corruptio haue force therfore whyle god gyueth v leysure let v learne thinke vppon oure infirmity whiche excessiue v knowe nothing better god shoulde visit v looke v dispose v else wee shoulde decay euery minute thus yee see wee haue marke vpon streyne certayne person one faythfull pacient man god intended gyue v mirrour inordinate affection ende wee shoulde beware seeke feele succour refreshment shewed v heere howe shall wee feele better way call vpon hath power himselfe may restreyne v suffer v starte aside wee chastyzed sorte hand nowe hee addeth immediately haue sinned shall thee thou keeper men men expound though iob disputed agaynst god saying none sinne wherefore haste thou made mee suche one thou bee preseruer men shouldest thou condemne mee seeyng lyeth thee saue mee man may well see naturall meening take neuer knewe intent holy ghost toucing streyne moreouer haue yll considered witnessed v concerning iob hee pacient soeuer worlde went vvhat iob ment say well confesse fault cannot scape iudgement god vvhy hee keeper men woorde keeper hath bene misconstrued men haue taken preseruer mankinde one sheeldeth vnder protectio certeyne greeke translater also hath well marked whiche thing hee commonly woont doe iob ment say god wayteth vppon v hee watcheth v hee knoweth man shoulde watche one spie marke euer hee dooth sayeth yee see sense iob applyeth title vnto god keeper men true god dooth well preserue v hath v hande oure lyfe continueth yet let hee shoulde bee called oure keeper respect hee seeth beholdeth wee doo wee hyde oure selues according scripture sayth sercheth men examineth theyr thoughtes ciscouereth thing nothing hidden lyfe appeareth iob ment purpose sayth vvhat shall thee bicause must fayne yeelde himselfe giltie lorde sayeth hee gaine nothing thy hand starting aside confesse det haue sinned way shall thee must fayne passe way letst thou alone although thou see heere poore creature cast vnder foote hath neyther strength power yet neuerthelesse thou followest vppon thy rigoure still acknowledge selfe bee indetted thee yet thou holdest mee still vpon racke iudge shoulde holde malefactor vpon racke say tell mee thy fault malefactor shoulde answere haue committed murther yea twoo three suche suche accessary purpose shoulde iudge holde still vpon racke suche confession beholde like cace concerning iob truth lorde sayeth haue sinned thou needest torment mee racke mee make mee confesse faultes sithe haue graunted thee thy det wherefore doost thou persecute mee thou art keeper men thou knowest thou needed make inquisition thing hidden thee well thou mightest say holde thee heere tyll haue gotten knowledge thy faultes thou knowest sayeth iob thou art keeper men admitte men knew themselues yet knowest thou bee seeyng cace doost thou draw thy hande awaye mee withoure pressing mee suche sort thus yee see naturall meaning sentence heere wee see howe men fare measure god iustice theyr owne witte capacitie seeme god passeth measure euerie blow hee vseth ouer greate rigour although oure intent bee accuse god crueltie full mouthe yet wee ceasse frette chafe agaynste like iob hath bene tempted doo vvhat bee done let v consider god keeper men saye wee heere within sight wee maye well finde fare colour lurking hole men hypocrisy cannot keepe god seeyng v discerning euen oure verye thought vvhat got father adam couering himselfe leaues hee summoned god hee shoulde haue appeared sinne shoulde haue beene layde afore spyte teeth lette v consider god register full oure woorkes woordes thought although nowe wee reade inditements bee framed yet shall daniel saying fulfilled whe iudgement settled bookes shall bee opened yee see thing wee haue marke first place god mennes keeper wee may well sette belowe take leaue leape like frogges without order prouerbe sayeth play meece chaffe thing may bee confuzed manwarde yet god marke beare awaye vvhen wee know let v learne walke eae carefulnesse seeing god looketh vpon v lette v walke wee haue lesson well printed harte shall sure haue one care wee vvee shall bee ashamed afore men wee doo oure naughtinesse open daye open streete bicause eye men lette v behold also howe god angel witness life ought make v walke farre awe greate deale knowledge muste hold v awe ende thinke sinnes shall scape vnpunished forasmuch god knoweth also gyue iudgement agaynst gouerneth common order men hath maner eye tha wee haue although wee haue confessed faultes hee knoweth hidden within vnknowne oure selues vvhen offender hath acknowledged crime euill dooings earthly iudge man demaundeth hande god spirituall iudge bring v inward knowledge sinnes ynough v say haue sinned wee muste condemne sinne selues yea euen suche wise euery v may bee owne iudge learne abhorre sinne according also yee see god holdeth v locked vp therein wee pyne away like poore soules despayre yee see wherfore tryeth v namely intent euery v knowe himselfe onely saye yea verely perceyue well sinner also haue liuely feeling oure sinnes wee maye bee vtterly ashamed finally iob sayeth vvherefore baste thou sette mee full ouer againste thee vvherefore doost thou take awaye wickednesse vvherefore doost thou pardon sinne duste thou seeke mee shall bee heere iob returneth matter whiche hee glaunced afore witte hee desyred haue truce release till swalowed hys spittle nowe therefore hee sayeth haste thou set mee full ouer agaynste thee say white man shoote hee coulde well haue founde harte god shoulde haue lette alone hee hee shoulde say whome doost thou bende thy selfe poore woorme earth thou settest mee whyte shoote muste thou needes trie thy strength vpon mee say anone iob returneth oftentymes complaynt renueth ofte true god setteth v full butte agaynste wee bee able abyde suche force yet wee muste shrinke awaye cannot bee wee must needes fayle soone god turneth backe vpon v wee desirous stande oute continue good state meane thereof god shoulde turne backe vpon v marke butte shoote hee shoulde beate vpon v much hee listeth yea verely hee asswage greefe woundes hath made causing v feele goodnesse wee may knowe middest anger hee forgetteth mercie according spoken song habacucke thus yee see persuasion iobs sette vnto v intent wee learne desire god let v alone wee bee shoulde wee bee drowned euen damnation lette v pray god hee chastyzeth v wee maye make outleapes hope scape hande wee may holde backes receyue stroke bee hee gyue v power beare correction pacientlye therevpon also hee make v taste mercie wee destitute comfort middes aduersities true wee muste followe iob heere confessing god looke vppon v euening morning wee shall bee verely hee leaue v destitute grace forsake v looking vppon v wee returne hartie affection wee shall feele alwayes hande v hee wyll fayle v assist v continually yea euen till haue taken v vp heauenly glorie continue euer let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement sinnes praying wheras prouoke wrath many wayes wil suffer v continue stubborne oure vice plunged owne filthinesse hee drawe v make v cleane yea meane moderate roddes may bee vtterly past hope may comfort selues hee hath promised god assist v end therevpon returne vnto knowing office chaunge world better therefore pray vnto increase grace v wee may alwaies fashion selues like vnto oure lorde iesus christ meane time gouerne v holy spirite wee may prouoke wrath v wee haue done hitherto rather making v feele sweete fatherly hand may euer haue much greater occasion magnifie glorifie life may please graut grace onely v also nation earth bringing back poore ignorant soules miserable bondage errour c xxx sermon first vpon eight chapter baldad suite ansvvered sayde hovvelong vvilt thou holde suche talke vvoordes thy mouthe vehement vvinde vvill god peruert iustice vvill almightie deface right thy sonnes haue sinned hath made come place misdeedes thou returne god betimes pray almightie thou bee pure right hee vvill avvake vnto thee make tent thy rightuousnesse peaceable better profite selues whiche conteyned present chapter muste beare mind haue declared afore wit iobs freends vndertaking euill case haue notwithstanding good argument good reason true misapply neuerthelesse doctrine selfe holy profitable take thing generally spoken wee shall finde good sentence deede ye shall see principall matter baldad pretendeth maynteyne god rightuous punishing men cause finde faulte without question doctrine good also one chiefe article fayth none faulte baldad needes apply persone iob wee haue seene heeretofore intent holie man blame god lifte vp himselfe agaynst hee maketh moane miserie whiche hee indured grieuous heauie considering feeblenesse yet ceasseth glorifie god still lette v marke baldad euill cace yet meane setteth downe good rightuous behoueth v receyue bycause fitte edification like sayeth pleade sorte god turmoyle themselues like winde ayre true must leaue persone iob sayde afore take thing generally contayned vve heare wicked vnbeleeuers spew blasphemy rayling god iustice seemeth thunder lighten woordes winde washe away reache high maiesty god sheweth selfe therein sentence wee haue marke firste heare blasphemy god must dismayed therefore alwayes glorifie god cotinueth whole sounde hee men cannot abate maiestie though rayle full mouthe winde vanitie thus much cocerning first poynt touching seconde let euery v learne speake god soberly reuerence humblenesse wee caste foorth suche winde mencioned although wee able preiudice god maner meanes yet hee fayle take vengeance indeuer lifte vp themselues sort agaynst casting proude presumptuous woordes vvhat doone wee haue settled thing harte holy scripture teacheth v hold v true stedfastnesse afterward wee speake measure fayth wee shall onely caste foorth goodly blastes god shall exalted magnified talke lette v come set downe heere principall vvill god peruert iudgement right almightie ouerthrowe iustice wee bee put mind yeeld god honor beeing fountaine equitie right impossible hee shoulde thing good rightfull well finde harte graunt god almighty meane acknowledge bee rightuous ought one must separated vve muste imagine thing god whiche bee deuided one another true behooueth v put difference betweene wisedome goodnesse iustice almightinesse god yet notwithstanding respect hee god thing must need must himselfe beeing let v beware surmyze lawelesse power god gouerned world like tyrant vsed excesse crueltie lette v vnderstande whereas hath thing hande endlesse power doth thing yet notwithstanding hee ceasseth bee rightuous true rightuousnesse god partly hidde v wee comprehende yet neuerthelesse mightinesse also proofe thereof able measure vnderstanding certayne wee cannot therefore heare speaking god rightuousnesse iustice let v marke although bee fully knowne manifest vnto v yet wee must honor reuerence sayde deuices bottomlesse pit dwelleth vnapprochable light cannot reache high know yet neuerthelesse must fully perswaded selues propertie nature god thing perfect vprightnesse faulte bee founde nowe wee see opinion wee ought conceyue god vvhen worldly folke speake god well say hee soueraine creator worlde yet meane season acknowledge thing propre vnto suche wise manifest vnto v wit iustice goodnesse wisedome thing whereby may take taste loue honor serue principall poynt wee must take heede vnto shall haue gayned knowing curiously beeing glorious maiestie god meane tyme wee vnderstande thing whiche wee ought feele experience declareth vnto v sayde dwelleth v liue haue mouing beeing mercie filleth thing wee susteyned goodnesse haue much light giueth v remedie corruption canot haue much one graine one drop rightuousnesse except wee drawe welspring therof know thing shall auayle v know one god contayneth thing haue feeling maiesty vvherefore much behoueth v marke well sayd wit muste take grounded principle god nature rightuous possible turne aside right equitie say hee forgo ceasse god lesse absurditie say god doth thing vnaduisedly say hee say beeing diminished yee see also paule reasoneth thirde romanes hee taketh awaye slaunder might inforced doctrine brought alwaies full venim speake euill god pure truth stand checking replying sainct paule therfore sayeth god vnrightuous possible belo geth iudge whole worlde performe right sheweth word iudge v ought bee fully perswaded god chare right dealing doeth commeth copassed rule vvee see sayde sentence paules agreeth baldads vnder terme god baldad coprehendeth iustice rightdealing doth afterwarde vnder woorde almightie muche hee sayd spoyle god thing whiche knitte beeing cannot meanes put asunder much abace vtterly pull seare bring nothing man woulde pleade agaynst though hee rightuous steade setting downe woorde god alone ioyning title almightie sainct paule alledgeth office wit god iudge world hee iudge maner brybed corrupted wee see mortall well aduauced great estate authoritie doo notwithstanding abuse full oft god iudge worlde good happe election auenture sute purchace incidet nature sooner god immediatly iudge therwithal seing cace stadeth let v coceyue ought rightuousnesse well assured soueraine rule therof furthermore haue sayde rightuousnesse cannot knowen vnto v able decypher soeuer god shall woorke ought wee shall see reason doubtlesse reason shoulde bee subiect v wee shoulde desire haue vnderling capacitie wee finde thing bee good whiche hee doeth whither shall wee go presumptuousnesse shall mortall creature say poore worm earth desirous compell god make knowe workes giue verdit cleane contrarie although god conceale reason dooings v wee thinke workes straunge seemeth oure vnderstanding wee haue cause pleade yet must honour secrete incomprehensible iudgementes gather wittes v humblenesse say beholde true nowe seemeth v bee able preuaile god without replying must hold sure conclusion god righteous asmuch see part yea euen glasse darkely let v wayte day wherein shall see god glory face face shall wee comprehend thing hidden v yee see maner god exercise faith wit hee haue v confesse rightuousnesse bee suche man witte may finde fault carpe say hee haue v confesse although wee perceyue haue full knowledge although euery man haue reason dispute god hee doth albeit see thing eye yet must wee haue humblenesse yeelde vnto god belogeth vnto otherwise one wee would farre v lyeth bring euerlasting beeing vtterly nought haue well printed oure harte bee good beginning aforehande submit selues suche wise vnto god although scourge v hadle v roughlyer would yet notwithstanding shall pacient aduersities vvhy fretteth aduersitie must needes made know lift vp himselfe god cannot take pritch agaynst god must also set right equitie el shall bee ende suche cace confusion decay beholde brydle holde v still pacience namely knowledge wee ought haue god rightuousnesse standing right equitie fight owne danation chafe aduersities wage battell god woulde ouerthrowe iustice bring nothing neere yet notwithstanding behoueth v go wee bee rightly pacient bycause shall bee neuerthelesse tempted despayre though wee haue knowne rightuousnesse iustice god looke vpon poore sinner feeleth himselfe pressed vttermost well hee confesse yea euen vnfaynedly god rightuous punishing yet seemeth shall perishe forgiuenesse bee looked cace yee see visited hande god may fall despayre notwithstanding acknowledge god ryghttuous good fayth wee see happened vnto iob true hee vtterly destitute pacience yet ceassed bee tormented horrible passion wee haue seene heretofore shall see hereafter certainely hee doubted god rightuous hee eye owne infirmitie saying himselfe lorde frayle yet neuerthelesse thou vtterest thy strength seemeth thou arte minded heere thunder agaynste mee sillie creature whiche lesse worme yee see wherewith iob sounde himselfe greeued vexed namely coulde firste brunte taste howe god succoured middes rigour afterwarde would giue happie ende hee taryed leysure verilie iob feeling hereof yet combered heauinesse hee coulde ridde dispatch himselfe firste brunt yee see iob partlye vnpacient notwithstanding set foorth v mirrour pacience yet affliction vehement hee quayleth vvhat reason bicause hee hath suche sauour fatherly care god hath requisite cause haue sayde knowe god rightuousnesse bee fully persuaded meane bring v pacience howbeit wee muste matche another article witte wee muste alwayes thinke god afflicting v doeth ceasse loue v yea hee procure saluation rigour soeuer vse towardes v affliction shall bee assuaged grace giue gladsome end baldad hath spoken addeth thy child haue sinned god hath sent place theyr iniquitie thou returne betymes hee wake towardes thee hee make prosperitie come agayne hereby hee meeneth god hath set fayre lookingglasse iobs eye intent hee shoulde aduaunce himselfe play horse broken looce seeing stubborne agaynste god come confusion must plunged perditio euer secodly promisse god doth still wayte would fayne draw backe repetance therefore ought make haste time serueth thus ye see two poynts touched baldad haue told misapplieth person iob vvhy euill cace well handled therefore let v take generall lesson end euery v may apply himselfe degree according necessitie sayd god punisheth stubborne hereby meening humble v might giue bridle infirmity flesh maner licentious vvhen come taking stomake agaynst god wee make lesse difficultie wee shoulde incounter inferiour equall behold say diuelish boldnesse raigneth world party afraide mortall creature wouldbe loth offend anger god boldely without remorse conscience therefore lette v remember well lesson shewed v heere witte soeuer ofte god punisheth wicked executeth horrible vengeance intent wee shoulde stoupe heades bothe great small shoulde haue mouthes shet wee shoulde presume come pleade agaynste god assure selues shall happen vnto v vnto whome see perishe sort wee follow heere yee see sayde holie scripture god teacheth men rightuousnesse executing iudgementes heereby prophet esay sheweth long sinnes abyde vnpunished men harden themselues make sport thinke scaped iudges hand short neither feare modestie soone god settes himselfe downe iudgement seate sheweth example iustice bee conceyt wee conceyue fearefulnesse wee sinke downe vnder serueth bring v backe againe lo howe iudgements god executeth vpon wicked ought serue instruction intent euerie v yeelde himselfe vnder hys hande sayde likewise text truely wee ought determine whether iobs child reprobate likelyhood god sent onely temporall punishment saue soules euer haue seene heretofore concorde betwixt scripture speaketh doth sonnes elie side wee see iob made solemne sacrifizes course feasting come doubt hath beene declared counselled aske forgiuenesse god hand doutlesse woulde haue ioyned father cannot determinately say iobs child reprobate knowe oftentimes god taketh euen cheefe worlde violent meanes hath chosen ordeyned saluation howbeit handleth fashion chastizement sendeth turneth welfare also men body must perishe tyme soules may saued euer therfore may bee like befell iobs child haue sayde alreadie must haue eie person heere wee muste onely receyue doctrine oft god stretcheth arme punishe sinnes worlde none v ought tremble whensoeuer shall haue missebehaued selues vnto god knowing chastizeth v men harmes beholde sort feele howe terrible wrath vpon aduaunce themselues resist yee see saint paule turning speach faythfull saith yee deceyued vaine wordes reason thing god wrath wont come vppon vnbeleeuers true men flatter themselues discountenancing sinnes according see howe diuelish scoffer iesters doo cloke thys day nowe dayes man speake lecherie shall made tricke youth nature man speake drunkennesse answere shall made god giueth wine hee haue v merrie ye see maner men become brutish spewe blasphemy agaynst god howe seeke nothing else shiftes flatter themselues owne fault euill doings cause saint paule sayth friend let men deceyue heathenish talke hee sayeth wrath god shall come vppon shall ouerwhelmed sayeth learne know god sheweth ye haue verie fayre mirror oft god chastizeth whoremonger vnbeleeuers disobedient stubborne kinde folke hee meeneth shewe euill escapeth vnpunished preuent ye vengeance tarie till fall vpon profite selues instruction giueth farre thus much concerning sentence wherein correction god sendeth set afore v ende might knowe god sendeth rebelles place iniquitie true founde foolishe madbrayned could finde harte maintayne cace wicked agaynst god soone god shal lay hande vpon creature let v learne confesse rightuous notwithstanding knowe wherefore hee doth according wee haue declared large alreadie namely notorious sinnes bee punished eye wee must vnderstand god warneth v setteth v liuely picture according saint paule speaketh tenth chapter first epistle corinthes see man full blasphemy despizer god meanes abyde neyther yoke discipline altogither awlesse see worldling lechour riotter person lewde loce life see drunkarde see naughtie packe seeketh nothing deceyue one spoyle another goodes god performe execute vpon one vengeance hee declareth lawe let v assure selues good warrant wee must dally surmise thing hee hath vttered owne mouth scarebugges little babe seeing effect matched wee see apparant visible cause let v neuerthelesse vnderstande god vse neuer great rigour yet must wee therfore inquisitiue say doth know neither must presume knowe long worlde ye see haue marke beare minde wit see calamity affliction god sendeth worlde must looke euident signes ende may learne yeelde selues conformable vntoo god submit selues vnto yea euery v may examine himselfe wrapped like condemnation nowe let v come second poynt god visite v world make v pine away although bee oppressed mightily life shall bee tedious bitter v thousand deathes yet notwithstanding hee still giueth v time repentance returne vnto hande shall finde throughly readie receyue v make dwelling place rightuousnesse peaseable yea verily wee come vnto prayer bring pure rightmeening heart v beholde verie good profitable lesson thereby men put minde acknowledge gracious goodnesse god doth fauour sheweth suffereth quite cut away first blow letteth alone still life true languishing iob farre harder grieuouser death wee see also iob looketh owne state hee coulde finde heart bee hanged yee see hath spoken meane season cast eye vpon ende god ameth vpon marke setteth v also shall wee finde sorrowes asswaged wee shall feele hath yet still pitie vpon v put cace man feele hell steade comforted haue horrible terrour feeling god agaynst mortall enemie herevppon hee haue fire burning minde well poore man feeleth anguish therwithall person suffer one side slaunder otherside great paynes assault shall intollerable true sayde poore man may first brunt wishe desire death muche would require better passe throughe fire water swoorde according wee see howe lorde iesus christ sayth ouertaken dread god woulde haue mountaynes fall vpon worlde shoulde turned vpside downe ouerwhelme enter consideration say perceyue god doth offer mercie meening shoulde draw nie vnto oft bee scourged hand calleth v sweete amiable voyce incoraging v come assured promise shewe himselfe gracious pitifull towardes v sufficient thing assuage heauinesse seeing cace standeth griefes haue still hope left v ought wise accept good god doth v wee may feele ease burthe misery though neuer excessiue seeme shoulder able beare vvee see nowe howe profitable lesson v haue witte make owne wit end know god doth still leane v remedie serue turne disease shall incurable leastwise haue recourse vnto herevpon must gather generall sentence witte god doth still pitie men chastizeth sinnes hee neuer vseth great rigour mercie continually mingled summoning make v appere intent feeling iudge wee shoulde flee infinite grace mercie doubting shew himselfe father suche shall haue recourse vnto hereby man may see vnthankefulnesse worlde affliction vniuersall man hath portion rate wee passe present life god chastizeth v many wayes say euery v seuerally generall see god visiteth v yet meane hee thinketh vpon returning vnto god number small thin sowen know vnthankfull although god call v loth perish yet stiffenecked shake warning gyueth v doctrine must also profite v make v trust god although persecuted worlde yet notwithstanding hee leaueth v lowe without calling v continually vnto haue v disappoynted shall bee come poynt comming thither haue al recourse vnto let v hardily trust god mercifull v lette v thanke hath taken v present lyfe first blowe hath giuen v leysure bethinke v sinnes may sorie returne vnto nowe let v come comfort set downe heere thou come betymes seeke prayer thou right pure bee awake thee added purposely bicause men cotinue stubborne although god prouoke returne way saluation yet passe lo purposely sayd must kicke agaynst pricke wee shoulde play restie iades become blockishe short wee must haue forwardnesse god commaundeth according sayde must come betymes say wee must make delay dryuing time see vnthriftes mocke god say needes one good sigh say life sleeue warranted certaine time liue worlde ouer though repentance man power coulde turne againe owne pleasure listeth speciall gift god deede holy precious thing behoueth v let go good cheape let v consider worlde go alwayes backe would play euill detters haue gotten long day payment sleepe without care till terme bee come euen say play worldling god lengthneth liues wayting shoulde repent neuer thinke vpon till houre come perishe shame ende may doo sayde wee must returne vnto god betimes short heere three thing wee must marke well one soone god visiteth v must returne hande tarry day day till morow marke one speciall poynt seconde wee muste come wyth prayer condemning selues offence wee maye obteyne forgyuenesse mercie hande thirde oure prayer muste bee made hypocrisie wee must bring pure right meening heart thus yee see three thing propounded v true wee cannot dispatche three nowe bee intent may haue abridgement whole doctrine haue declared behoueth v haue sayde three poynts well imprinted mindes short let v learne humble selues vnder mightie hande god apostle exhorteth v herevpon let v consider rightuous yea euen suche sort hee shall execute roughest iudgements vpon v may ceasse confesse hee dooth thing rightfully vnpartially may haue mouth alledge thing agaynst onelye let v acknowledge rightuousnesse iustice bee god also let v doo may take profite wit punisheth rebelles despysers maiestie vtterly past mendment let v assure selues hee calleth v home vntoo therefore behoueth v tarie till hee smile vpon v let v take learning let teach v rightuousnesse according haue alledged prophete esay specially shall please god stretche hande vppon v smite v let v wearie correction apostle sayeth epistle hebrues aboue sith knowe god calleth v let v come vnto yea euen betymes therewithall let v bring vntoo pure right meening hart beseching forgiue faultes example dauid let v desire clense v spottes according behoueth v washed may present selues face purenesse commaundeth let v fall downe maiestie good god acknowledgement innumerable offence wee ceasse commit dayly agaynst praying make v feele better wee haue done may sorie returning vnto wee may giue glorie belongeth wee may bee confirmed holy grace obedience lawe let v say almightie god c xxxj sermon seconde vpon eight chapter sermon conteyneth rest exposition fifth sixth verse followeth although thy beginning vvere small thy last state shall bee greatly increased inquire pray thee former age dispose thy selfe bee taught thy father vvee yesterday vvee bee ignorant bycause dayes shadovve vppon earth shall teach thee plainly vtter vvordes hart vvilla rushe grovve moyste grounde grasse marishe grovve vvithout vvater althoughe bee freshnesse vncutte dovvne yet shall vvyther hearbe euen vvith forget god hope hypocrite shall perish first haue gather sume hath bin expounded alreadie wee haue done amisse god chastiseth v therfore alwayes ready shew v mercie call vnto expresly said must make hast come least abuse pacience wee see mocker afterward added must sue vnto right meening purenesse suing importeth must cofesse sinnes worde purenesse betokeneth must vnfaynedly see promise god allureth v himselfe desirous draw v say men needes perish wilfully ready receiue mercie notwithstanding high brode way damnation therefore let v marke well sith god openeth gate vnto v double worthy damnation come vnto vve know well inough despayre cause hardning part giue themselues vnthriftinesse make play double quit men say whe god sheweth v mercie shal alwayes readie v ought moue v let v marke well promise conteyned therewithall make hast seeing god driue delay co ming vnto vvhen god prouoketh v thinke vpon sinnes let v delay repentance till morrow aboue al whe voice god come soundeth heauen let v harde hart sayd psalm rather let v said prophet esay seeke lorde may founde call vpon neere let wicked man leaue wayes said againe another text behold fit time dayes sauing god exhorteth v repentance forslow occasion wil slip away shall abash v gate shal shet v ye see behoueth v put hasting vre let v marke wel comming vnto god shal gaine nothing bringing excuse haue one worde lay selues god shall see hereafter shal haue hundred yea thousand article v condemne v let v come god prayer said must sue vnto importeth plain pure confessing sinnes say cofession shall haue sayd haue sinned must also follow repentance shall see many neuer sticke say god hath done rightly punishing fault grieuous grosse men yet fall old byasse againe strayght wayes god hold nozes grindstone sicknesse crosse make fayre promise assone god hand withdrawne shewe playnly nothing dissimulation therefore whereas wee commaunded confesse fault let v marke well wee must haue sayd purenesse vprightnesse co demne euill reconciling selues vnto god heere shewed fruite insueth wee shall haue obteyned grace god wil make dwelling place rightuousnesse prosper baldad say god one men receyueth mercie leaueth maketh feele effectualnesse mercie loue god pardoneth maner protest forgiue fault men haue committed agaynst yet meane able reuenge sticke cracke credite spie occasion saying hath one doo shall finde hath done displeasure ye see euill maner forgiuing god deales telleth v sinnes forgiuen immediately hee addeth effect forgiuing making v feele goodnesse blissing prospering v heere expresse mention made habitation rightuousnesse two cause first god grace may better vttered shall shewe selfe onely towardes persones also towardes house god hauing pitie man cause feele bodie minde verie much alreadie god extende goodnesse yet man blissed child cattell household doo yee perceyue yet larger proofe goodnesse yee see howe sayd god maketh man dwelling prosper returneth speedely vnto dwelling called tent rightu usnesse intent put v continually remembrance come vnto god must said rightmeening purenesse whereof mention hath bene made erewhile contrarie part see god persecuteth v let v know haue wood within v kindle fire withall say haue heaped vp matter within v sinnes rightuousnesse dwelling house say house well ordered certaine god grace would preuent v feele nothing goodnesse rest therfore god scourge v sende v affliction must blame sinnes thus ye see effect wee haue make heere moreouer hee addeth serueth yet confirme present matter wit beginning small god increase added nonce men shoulde measure god grace perceyue ye see cause maketh v faint harted haue slender hope namely bicause haue eie worldly meanes thervpon make coclusion shall become v beholde thing state thing thing shall meane consider easie helpe v opinion thing vnpossible see howe holy ghost ment correct frowarde iudgement v imagin god grace owne capacitie able see contrarywise sayde god hath wonderfull meanes incoprehensible v augment seemeth small notwithstanding wee good deathes doore might seeme neuer plucked misery yet shal god well finde good way cannot bee perceyued
