first intent also bring v lowe ende may learne flee refuge would become v fayth exercized make reckening say god wil worke according conceiue inferiour cause worlde wherein shall god power knowne wherein shoulde sayd grace wonderfull make v amazed deede sayde psalme god guideth sauing dreame matter straunge euerie man astonied hee beholdeth looked let v marke well sinnes shall haue sent v downe bottomlesse pitte wee may thinke selues vtterly shette vp despayre wee must fight oure owne vnderstanding conclude god well skill increase thing small scripture saith office peculiar propertie cal though ende giue v newe beeing wee haue lo wee haue gather streyne nowe giue authoritie talke baldad sayeth aske yeares olde time despose thy selfe inquyre father vvhereby hee dooth v vnderstande thing hee hath spoken knowne bee true experience long time inquyre sayth hee onely liue day departed long ago searche age age thou shalt finde god neuer reiected come vnto expectation neuer superfluous vnauaylable verely sought without dissimulation afterward addeth vve yesterday vnskilfull dayes shadow father answere thee speake strength heart say suche wise thou shalt haue full resolution stedfast ground reason shall come tip tongue well foreconsidered vnderstanding vvhen baldad speaketh father doubt hee meeneth former experience time wee haue touched already speaketh old liued time also suche alreadie dead man perchaunce demaund done possible iob go bee instructed handes answere easie namely ment men thing bene done time accordingly story witnesse vntoo v beholde baldad ment say thus bring thee vncouth doctrine thou shalt haue made long back search euen creation worlde thou shalt finde god hath alwayes wrought maner wit soone men haue returned iniquity god hath reached hande gate saluation hath beene opened vntoo sayth shalt thou vnderstande also instruction verie profitable v namely wee must shette eye agaynst god sheweth v hath shewed v time world rather must consider thing haue beene done former time wee may applie owne vse true men giue themselues vanitie cannot gather wittes vnto applie studie except god compell therevnto heere yee see cause dauid protesteth afflicted hee called remembrance former yeares olde time bethought therefore wee must lay grounde namely wee bethinke v well god workes onely wee haue seene owne time also hath beene reported v olde hath alwayes bin god story ende remembrance thing might preserued meanes notwithstanding men take pleasure reading story yet vaine sporting themselues bicause applie matter former time instruction whiche true schoole teach v rule life beholde god iudgements wee beholde howe hath assisted fled succour specially howe hath confirmed gracious goodnesse insomuch although men faythlesse yet hee reserued men knowledge truth howbeit full time yet come short eies cleare cleane dimmed see god workes deepe sea bottomlesse pit wisdome minde bee well setled good doctrine let v learne looke foot twain nozes men say also stretch wit happened borne aboue thing ought bee moued forasmuch see hath pleased god glasse wherein wee might beholde maner hath time preserued mainteyned church since worlde made strengthning good men fight agaynst assaultes finally hath chastized owne child yea double corrected became hard harted insomuch hath admonished prophet haue continued stubbornnesse haue bene faine feele greater excessiue rigor insomuch see thing god hath prouided prouidence behalfe thing might haue bin buried laid afore v instruction pray ought exercise selues therin earnestly let v beare mind sayd must aske haue liued afore v howbeit person haue accesse dead neither lawfull v seeke counsel god hath ordeyned prophet furtherforth seruice time peter paule rest apostle prophet speake vnto v day theyr writing immortall person god hath withdrawne companie yet must aske time wherein liued must also folow record haue yelded god work thereby learne bee established feare reason must moue v herevnto added baldad sayth bee yesterday ignorant bicause life shadow true present text may bee expounded twoo wayes think baldad ment say know thou wilt esteeme bring mine owne thou wilt say old shuld giue ear wise man vvell put cace saying nought worth bicause person agreeable therevnto yet shalt thou finde olde men tell thee much set downe interpretation bicause may go good howbeeit thing bee neerly looked appeere plaine meening text baldads mouing iob inquire time past bycause looke v shall small purpose true verie god sheweth v day day ynough instruction shall neede processe make v vnexcusable wee shall haue perceyued one yeare twoo yea euen one day god sheweth v many thing remaynes excuse v neither alledge neuer wist god neuer gaue knowledge say see ynough eye instruction slothfulnesse god need chawe morsel v aforehand yet shall haue much ado swallowe downe bee chawed prouerbe sayth lo wherefore hee giueth v knowledge time past example despise come passe birth say shall bee wise ynough considering thing see life god president giueth v time far past purpose vvhe scripture telleth v euer since creating world god hath gouerned men chastized offence pitied goodnesse continually surmounted naughtines amisse aboue thing defended succored affliction seing god fro age age discouereth thing greatly behoofe wil haue eueriwhit despised thrust vnder foot ye see villainous vnthankfulnesse thrust farre v thing tha profitable v let v mark thing whervnto speaketh namely baldad hath pretended bring iob therfore shal grieue v inquire thing welfare let v consider little owne age vvhat wee vvee yesterday vvhen men haue cast vp account throughly snayles vanish away hande true man may liue fiftie threescore yeares yet must come backe sayde song moyses namely god thousande yeares one day therefore man life dreame past alreadie wee considered well shortnesse life howe glydeth away shadow certaine wee woulde much diligent inquire thing past wee ignorant looke sayde shortnes life god wil thing haue bin done borne present v storyes left v yee see howe gracious god hath shewed himselfe towardes v hath gathered tymes together brought passe man liueth fiftie yeares worlde may bee able comprehende fiue thousande yeares dispose put order know yee see howe long time slipped away afore floud verie well went thing howe hath god wrought since floud vvhen liked prepare church manner hee gouerne howe faythfull behaue themselues whiche persecuted witnessing truth afterwarde faultes crept howe god redresse againe howe churche continue hir state set flote say wee may see thing oure eye yet notwithstanding aboue fiue thousande yeares passed true haue sayde grace god whiche cannot bee pryzed sufficiently surely ought spurre v well forward onely looke feete also cast eye knowing god hath set v vppon stage hee haue v discouer time onely hundred yeares also euen since beginning worlde wee see baldads intent also wise wee ought applie sentence owne vse wit seing yesterday life shadowe say abide long tyme worlde thing wee see heere may suffize v good looke accordingly god giueth v meanes inquire time past effect warned consider well euer god sheweth v workes past wey thing belong v thing brought remembrance teach v let v applie story former time instruction may leade v put whole trust god call vpon necessity feare honour requireth lo haue beare away streyne followeth rush growe moyst place also grasse moorishe ground cannot cherish selfe without water insomuch herb florish wither away themselues without cutting vp euen hope hypocrite shall perish likewise hope forget god cleane contrarie sawe afore sentence alledged alreadie beginning chapter baldad added god mercifull returne notwithstanding runne royot tyme nowe returneth sayd afore namely god roote hypocrite wicked doer vseth verie fitte similitude saying weedes marrisgrounds rush suche like hearbes growe moyst grounde many hearbes growe well inough without water vpon mountaines yea euen shall bee whitte earth bare rockes yet neuerthelesse wee shall see hearbes growe haue propertie nature rushe hearbes cannot grow marri nourishment water grounde must bee alwayes moyst else geere wither like rushe moorishe hearbe cannot growe moyst place euen man hathe sap god must needes perishe fayre shewes quite wither away similitude set downe text onely also verie rife rest holye scripture wee know sayde first psalme man setteth himselfe wholy mynding god lawe like tree planted riuers syde bycause roote continually soked tree dooth neuer wither drie away continueth still freshnesse shewe god neuer suffereth good menne perishe grace floweth alwayes vpon mainteyne ende yea mainteyne without ende wee bee watered onely bee mainteyned heere certayne time come euerlasting life yee see suche yeelde themselues wholly vntoo god tree planted ryuers side florish euer yet better expressed seuententh ieremie bycause prophet compryzeth partes cursed sayeth hee man trusteth man setteth flesh bee hope strength shall bee grasse heath shooteth vp little among sande wildernesse vvell true shall bee freshnesse howbeit shall scorched incontinent meanes heate insomuch suche shrubbe shall bee burnt vp sunne euen standeth cace suche freshe greene put trust god eyther trust themselues else haue eies vppon creature happie man trusteth god whatsoeuer heat sunne hee haue though hee seeme bee burnt vppe yet shall hee bee watred god giue suche nourishment hee shall decay although prophete ieremie setting downe two comparison giue light one doo sufficiently expresse whiche sayde heere yet notwithstanding yet text baldad hath chozen kinde hearbe cannot bee nourished without water psalme sayde wicked shall bee like grasse groweth vppon house toppes see weedes growe well vpon house toppes good hearbes shall bee trampled vnder foote men walke vpon medow ground neuerthelesse time yeare commeth yee see hearbes meddowes doo growe florish although medowe bee mowen yet doth grasse spring become freshe againe commeth weedes vppon house toppe stande man steade sayde sayde text man maye well fill armes full hee shall finde foyzon hee shall finde fruite verely man see house toppe ouergrowne weedes hee sayeth god blisseth hearbes contrarywise good turne plucked vppe sunne also burneth vp bee rype come perfection yee see although wicked bee exalted bee estimation blissed god yet neuerthelesse dry away sort bring forth frute howe fayre shewe soeuer make substancialnesse thus ye see ment speaking rush moorish weedes bee short let v note profite well wee must drawe sap god wee must bee neere vnto must ceasse water v must bee continuall water quicken v giue v lustinesse without whiche impossible wee shoulde indure one minute houre yee see effect conteyned nowe wee throughly settled beleefe doctrine certaine wee shoulde seeke god another maner affection wee doo euery man holdes himselfe whiche hee hath yet wee consyder whence good gyuen v meanes whereof euery man feedeth himselfe winde spoken prophet see say men beguile themselues wittinglye willinglye seemeth riche want nothing yet winde say nothing foolish cuerweening outwarde appearance may well bee freshe flourishe men may commende v come starke nothing neuerthelesse dazled owne conceyt euerie v weeneth himselfe bee better god goodly shewe v wee neede none folkes deceyue v reuery v beguyleth himselfe owne fonde folly way let v marke well howe god plucketh v backe himselfe shewing v howe bee much blinded trusting selues let v marke well god procureth oure welfare meanes hee sayth fountaine liuely water true riuer standeth hande watred continually grace else bee nothing drynesse although ye loke grene yet nothing yee must wither away baldad meeneth heere although saith men cut vp herbes yet drie away haue moysture yea shall vtterly amaze men see howe shall bee quite withered euen middes greatest pride euen hope hypocrite heereby done vnderstande although men put hand god consume v secrete vnknowne working must bee faine come naught except bee wee haue trusted haue taken deepe liuely roote true sometimes god rooteth vp wicked punishing man hande yea hee matcheth one agaynst another sort deface destroye themselues oftentimes wee see eye god vndermineth haue presumed muche taken vppon maruellously vve see saye god consumeth man knowes howe melt away snowe agaynst sunne men thinke straunge saying howe possible shoulde come passe howe happeneth man plight wee consider force god curse let v marke well god without seruing turne men make onely men fade away also greate castle whatsoeuer possession lordship rich haue must needes perish god bloweth vpon according precisely expressed namely although weedes bee cut vp yet shall fayle wither bycause haue moysture ripen withall wee must also consider well howe sayd hope hypocrite shall perish bringeth v againe haue touched alreadie wit suche haue nothing else smoke vntruth ceasse bee fresh greene yea owne seeming opinion men yee see heere wl deceyueth v naked goodnesse yet wee bee brutish weene selues bee verie riche therefore god nobodie v lo baldad hath spoken heere precisely hope hypocrite hee sayde true hypocrite make faire shewes onely like well themselues goodly outwarde countenaunce vertue also seemeth god dandleth lappe fauoureth poyntes yet shall wither drie awaye shall bee wonder see howe bee vndermined vtterly ouerthrowne let v wilfully beguile selues say although haue worldly prosperitie time yet let v sleepe vpon neither let v tied rich pleasure worlde hinder v looking vntoo god let v rest selues wholly vpon according welspring welfare prosperitie ye see imported worde hope whereof mention made place finally haue also marke baldad describeth hypocrite saying haue forgotten god yea doubtlesse although hypocrite prate neuer muche god yet haue quite forgotte true remembring god feele welfare lieth must seeke saluation otherwhere alone without goodnesse mercie must needes go destruction yee see meant forgetting god namely men haue selfeliking owne vertues insomuch thinke themselues able aduaunce mainteyne themselues meane come god seeke remedie misery hand whereas ought haue recourse vnto onely one time often shall haue neede helpe wee forget god acknowledge must receyue al goodnesse hande bycause wee bee vtterly voide respect selues trust owne vertues imagine purchace estimation owne policie presume vppon themselues wise soeuer men forget god haue pluckt office vsurped themselues also doo forget god giuen wicked affection fleshly lustes vve see liue owne ease cannot tamed maner meanes talking making walke feare god hath worldes good man tell must humble himselfe hee shall neuer bring rich haue made horne dosse agaynst god whorehunter plunged villanie man go drawe backe counsell correction amendeth rather appareth caried away owne affection wilde beastes cast themselues wilfully destruction man cannot bring backe againe right way haue forgotten god consider walke aright behoueth v haue god continually eye verie deede heere ye see title holy scripture giueth faythfull namely like sayde hypocrite forget god contrarie part god intendeth marke shewe cheefe poynt requyreth hande sayde beholde one god presence walketh god let v learne exercise selues heerein acknowledge god benefites throughly ende wee may thanke call vpon succour v necessity assuring selues come begge hee moysten v grace although feele great heates say although haue sore affliction worlde yet shall wee neuer drie away bycause haue taken sure rooting god suffer v quaile mainteyne v continually vntill haue taken v vp himselfe make v partaker heauenly life yea water v grace present worlde make v feele farre foorth shall needfull v let v fall flat face good god acknowledgement fault praying looke vpon offence punish deserue may learne bee owne iudges condemning selues may come vnto phisition disease hee heale v beeing one wee may walke vprightnesse meanes wee may bee partaker whiche hee hath promised faythfull one worlde wee enioying recorde hee giueth v fatherly loue maye growe affection hee giueth v loue honour vntill time hee haue brought v glorie hee tarieth v heauen wee possesse alreadie hope may please graunt grace vnto v also vnto people nation c xxxij sermon third vpon eight chapter vvayes hypocrite forget god hope cut expectation spider vvebbe hee shall leane vpon house shall holde vvoulde holde shall stande tree planted sunne braunches vvill spread ouer garden shall reach fountaine shall spread selfe house stone plucked vp place man may say knovv thee ioy shall planted againe another place euen god vvill cast avvay sounde man neyther vvill hee reache hande vvicked vntill haue filled thy mouth vvith laughter thy lippes vvith gladnesse thine enemy confounded dvvelling place vvicked shall stande haue declared heeretofore ment forgetting god thing standeth v hande marke well vnder woorde comprysed mennes hypocrisie say theyr vanitie vvill haue holynesse shall bee acceptable allowed afore god let v looke walke euen though hee present v wayes let v assure selues custodie belongeth vnto guide v order v therefore wee haue suche remembrance god wee shall giuen maner vanitie holye ghost termeth heere name hypocrisie expresse better hee sayeth trust like cobweb spider weaue knowe spider weaues web strength euen builde vpon vaine hope beare themselues hande shoulde continue worldes ende god au ngeth himselfe presumption heere wee see clerely forget god wee considered well howe god reserueth himselfe honour mainteyning v blessing v life long certaine shoulde bee foolish farre ouerseene beare selues hande know men abusing themselues vaine hope commeth nothing else bicause yeelde god honoure requireth also due vntoo right let v marke well one onely meane remedie drawe v vanity make v walke good way witte know god office giue mind way sen world full said hypocrisie much behoueth v marke well streyne end wit haue earst bin dulled know god haue bin rouing heere haue gone astray maner wee must leastwise bethinke selues god calleth v agayne sheweth v hee haue v abide foolishe trustes haue v haue certayne resting poynt may builde spider haue stayednesse certaynely heere comparison betweene resting wherewith wee ought rest vpon god promise trust wherewith pretend rest vpon creature ye see heere howe holie ghost condemneth trust wee haue creature find stedfastnesse god certayne shall finde none therefore al giue ouer themselues vnto creature hang vpon meane shutte god dores driue great way thinke suffer suche dealing hee curse vaine hope sentence hath neede well minded well expounded word vvee see whole matter consisteth practize well knowing certaine men beare themselues hand finde worldly inferiour meanes serue turne well ynough men yeelde god due honor rather wrest howe god auenge himselfe haue god enemie ouerthrowe wee laboure build vp must rest wholie vpon goodnesse power grace shall haue spider webbes abiding stedfastnesse contrarie part glorifie god commeth v certain thinges see eye fall vpon hypocrits may well bee fulfilled v much wee profite selues example nowe let v come similitude added heere mention hath bene made heretofore rushe drie place vvee knowe nature growe moorishe grounde rushe like herbes growe drie moysture lesse place must needes bee seared vp time though man put hande plucke vp eyther cut vp mowe yet must go destruction contrariwise sayde tree whiche hath taken deepe liuelie roote planted fountayne shall spread braunches boughes yea euen house else shall bee strong house stone againe yee see tree well planted yet notwithstandnig mayster garden take vp purpose destroy altogither tree good selfe well rooted bycause conuenient place therefore master take vp plant againe elsewhere nowe man set larger place shall haue impeachment maye fynde good batling moysture ought tree complaine state impaired rather cheeridg tree haue vnderstanding glad bicause case heere shewe tree appayred remoued one place another similitude must bee applyed whome god plucketh vp doe hee taketh vp time hee preserueth roote intent newe planted agayne may spring newe bring foorth fruite doone dayly time god chastizeth v yea euen suche roughnesse maye well seeme first hee vtterlie ouerwhelme v hope v anone giueth v grace returne vnto rich man hath greate possession digge vp tree garden set field mighte burnish better sunne cherisheth grounde planted fitter take deeper roote tree waxeth bigge able gather greater strength sorte worketh god therefore wee bee scourged hys hande yea euen hardlie seemeth kynde death yet must quite heart bycause wee knowe god well set v good state agayne wee shall flourish hee set v prosperitie yee see declared heere effecte conclusion baldad addeth god take wicked man bande fauoure forsake good menne rather fyll mouthe wyth laughter true heere speaketh iob person meaneth doe v wit suche returne vnto god shall fynde gracious fauorable towarde fine hee sayth tent wicked shall bee able stande god put good men enemy shame hee onely shewe selfe fauourable person bee troubled greeued hee put himselfe betwixte shewe hee hathe vnder defence protection heere wee see sentence well woorthye bee noted witte wee like tree taken vp one place bee planted agayne another speake child god wicked may well bee taken vppe rootes also shall bee continue without hope bee planted agayne wee heare threatning made oure lorde iesus christ hee sayth euery tree bringeth foorth fruite shall bee hewen downe made firewoode lo heere horrible blowes god giueth wicked hee seeth bee vtterlie reprobate giuen vp damnation therefore hee must stub vp euer also hee sayth likewise euerie tree planted heauenly father shall plucked vp roote wee shall see many time make faire countenance seeme bee euen tree whiche god hath set garden possession hipocrits mingled faithfull would faine sort aduaunced church planted haue good sure roote therefore end god must stub vp much bee sayde vine namely oure lorde iesus christe stocke vine wee braunches graffed therin bring forth good fruite father manureth v feele hee hath hande alwayes vpon v make grace auailable multiplie wee beare euill fruite altogether fruitlesse god may make complaint maketh prophet vine haue done thee thou bearest nothing bitternesse haue looked sweetnesse thy hand seemeth thou wouldest choke thy master vvhat shall doe plucke thee vp ought make haire stand vp vpon head sayd good quyte stubbed vp deede affliction lyght vpon dispysers god vpon past mending many stubbings vp true wither firste blowe god punishe wicked man hee yet giue leysure bethinke himselfe come home agayne neuerthelesse enemy god feele anye one chastizement worlde god beginneth alreadie stub vp tendeth finall destruction wherefore bycause bee farre amending god scourging rather repayre sharpen themselues heerein bee seene theyr naughtinesse vnrecouerable let v marke ofte god lifteth vp hande againste wicked alreadie stubbing vp v adopted bee child yea verely wee haue receyued grace without dissimulation let v marke god scourge v worlde make state worse therefore doth harme rather wee bee renued wee feele care god hath v thus yee see inestimable comfort child god therewithall wee see also neede haue flee therevnto succour vvhy pitie see bowe many calamity oure life subiecte dayly seemeth god would plucke v vp wee perishe generall men yet faithfull afflicted heere yee see saint paule sayth hope bee onely worlde resteth heere beneath wee wretcheddest creature vnbeleeuers haue better time woe state farre happier much seemeth wee bee plucked vp euerie day wee bee much afflicted become v wee comforte set downe heere verie deede speake properly wee bee plucked vp god beateth v roddes humble v semeth vnderstanding specially wee bee pressed misery god sende v anye meane affliction may happen vnto v euery daye sicknesse wrong losse good affliction plucking v vp meane oure affection take bee man shoulde shred diuers boughes tree hee see many well maye man cut one halfe tree yet shall continue still howe euer worlde goe afterwarde sproute newe braunches euen v god vseth meane correction falleth extreme rigoure god list trie v vttermoste may come passe shall bee brought euen graue seeming shall bee lefte one onely sparke life faithfull pecke trouble hande god lifteth vp selfe looke finde way get affliction mischiefe pursueth seemeth god full bente neuer giue release affliction great excessiue yee see meant plucking vp stubbing vp done ofte god chastizeth v maner euer bee let v bee astonied though correction seeme greeuous v respecte owne nature desire continue still oure state bee diminished thus yee see wee couet bnt god cut braunch v must needes gainestriuing gaynesaying yea verely oure naturall vnderstanding yet neuerthelesse let v looke wee take heart affliction greeueth v let v enter account set downe heere yee see true man cut part tree hee abateth beautie one yere yet certayne good labourer owne profite play good husbande shreddeth tree hee meeneth make impaire tree thriue better sith cace standeth let v put ourselues god hand praye dispose v hee knoweth howe hee may make v beare fruite therefore let v suffer cut shred boughes v let v fyght natiue greefe sorrowfulnesse wee conceiue first brunt let v fyght say yea euen suche wise wee bee subdued say verie well seeing pleaseth god shred part v hee knoweth wherefore hee doth wee muste passe yet ynoughe v shewe selues pacient small common aduersitie god bring v deathes doore saye hee vse suche extremitie chastizing v may well seeme hee intendeth destroye v wee shall haue debated matter condemne ourselues vtterlye abashed yet notwithstanding wee must still continue stedfast shall sayde hereafter although god kill v yet must trust still phisition heale wound also death self therfore sayde psalme although walke shadowe death long see sheepehooke god saye long hee sheweth himselfe bee shepherde shall comforte selfe therewith let v learne fight temptation prouoketh v despayre god oure seeming presseth v measure able abide yet let v stand vp say plucked vp god plant v againe husbandman may remoue tree one place shall god haue power let v trust let v doubt pleaseth haue pitie vpon v wee shall restored better state wee afore yea verely mean thereof shall man fancie also becommeth v measure god grace power reason let v wrong let v assure ourselues power hee hathe giuen mortall men whit abated himselfe hath much without comparison letted ayde v greatest aduersities vvhen calamity shall bee vtterly deadlye hee restore v agayne suche wise wee shall haue whereof reioyce nowe remayneth applied owne vse haue touched afore wee see state present life euery man ought looke himselfe man whiche skill complayne whiche maketh moanes least wyse whiche though hee vtter mouth dothe keepe locked vp sorrowe hee sayeth selfe ala suche inconuenience befalne mee worse god hath diminished mee much vvee skill well ynoughe bethinke v thing diuell also misse put oure heades wee myghte bee greeued tormented yea euen fret fume againste god vvhat bee done beholde heere meane beate backe suche temptation witte consider god worke suche manner towardes shall turne theyr welfare shall make theyr profite euen aduauntage seemed tende theyr destruction heere yee see euen kynd temptation set v first blush seemed straunge grislye mention made plucking vp roote ye see tree dead quite cleane dispatched wherein co sisteth life tree roote earth taken awaye lyfe v god take v belongeth present life ye see wee bee plucked vp roote hope v imagine life consisteth hauing goodes hauing wherewith susteyne cherish selues yet wee tree tree contented hauing much roome roote able occupie man hath insatiable lust bee gulfes much thinke whole worlde ynoughe fynde v suche haue fieldes house vineyardes heritage afrayde still shoulde wante earth haue money purse afrayde doubte yea continuallye martyred feare leaste god disappoint pray abate portion seeing oure desyres reached farre onely roote tree also without stint measure proofe heereof sobre hold ourselues holy ghost calleth v greatly oure behoofe lette v marke well althoughe seeme oure life continue without ordinarie mean god hath allotted yet notwithstanding able send v meanes wherethrough wee shall escape hee giue v day morrowe true thing shall seeme easie vnto v neuerthelesse ynough god prouide yea hee set order shall haue cause magnifie infinite power wisedome working suche maner v incomprehensible ye see say standeth v hand practise sentence euery v findeth himselfe perplexity maye say ala must become see goodes minished see shut meanes trade diminished vvell god hath cut yet must needes say whiche hee hath cut superfluous mee behooueth profite selfe thereby sawe behooued mee pray vnto god nowe hee sheweth wee muste alwayes conclude withoute cause cutteth thing knoweth bee superfluous v meane whyle let v prepare selues plucked vp chiefe poynt many awaye meane affliction god diminish shew themselues constante muche manne shall see outrageouse vaine glorie ouervnruly couetousnesse take whiche lefte holde themselues contented thanking god keeping selues quiet bee pinched somewhat neere quicke specially seeme god mynded make cleane riddance shall yee fynde vtterly wittes bycause prepared ought indure battell spoken heere witte bee vtterlie plucked vp ynoughe v suffer god cut boughes shred braunches twigges knoweth bee superfluous v also plucke v vp rootes hath authoritie ouer v wee shall gayne nothing resisting yet neuerthelesse great profite wee hope hee plant v agayne meane giue roome mercie contrarie withstande god grace hee voutsafeth set v vp againe hee see scourging v make v thinke oure selues vtterlie forlorne past recouerie anye freshenesse agayne one wee cut god hande say hee planteth v agayne true power shall bee lessened throughe vnbeleefe worthy feele enioy great benefite ye see whereto must come witte euery v must dispose selfe bee plucked vp roote say god smyte v parte afterward please smite v whole person wiues child honoure euer haue wise become yee would say wretched darknesse wee haue much one sparke life yet neuerthelesse wee must abyde quietly beholde thing surmounteth worldly power confesse doubt menne inforce themselues therevnto owne accorde wee must desire god worke v intent hee maye wise dispose oure life may ready liue dye pleasure therefore must pray giue v manner strength doubt thing written shall bee fulfilled god meant disappoint v hope likened v tree planted afterward taken vp ende planted better place howbeit true wee shall alwayes planted againe respect worlde may well bee wee shall continue plucked vp yea shal seeme god hath euen cast v away iudge state may say farewell good dayes god mynded haue pitie vpon mee hee woulde haue lingered dryuen long time much see hee letteth rotte miserie token neuer set vp agayne lo wee may say neuerthelesse let v call mynd god meaneth trie faythe holding v hope heuenly life hidden v although god blisse seruants giue prosperitie worlde bee sayde last state better planting v churche intente wee shoulde liue kingdome euerlastingly without ende nowe oure true resurrection renewment euen god reserue v set v kingdome hee hath made v wayfare worlde passe fire water affliction wee may ende exempted misery world made partaker life glorie let v beare mynd howe saint paule sayth vnto v life hidde iesus christ shal notsee true perfecte manifestation vntill lord iesus come heauen bee short let v marke one similitude wee ought bee well acquainted truely winter time tree seeme deade see howe raine doth rotte swolne bee readie burst thus yee see well one kynde rottennesse afterwarde commeth frost seare drie vp vvee see thing see much one floure cutting v beholde heere kynd death lasteth daye twayne foure fine moneths neuerthelesse although life tree vnseene yet sap roote hart wood euen v life also hidden howe selues poore kind hiding need great frost sterue vp great wet marre carrie fire frost ynough selues consume life hidden god hee keeper wee knowe iesus christ partie whome wee drawe life let v content selues sayde headdinesse true man take vp tree purpose set againe hee neede make hast tree tarrie anye long time aboue grounde neuer take roote though bee planted newe againe god hathe manner power laborer earth haue neuerthelesse wee see sometimes men cunning well keepe tree aliue time laye shadie place nother wynde sunne shall come drye sappe shall alwayes bee kepte close men fynde meanes although cannot saue liues tree euer yet helpe sorte let v thinke god listeth keepe v vnplanted long time hee preserue v yea euen wise shall hard make v take roote newe againe euer pleaseth yee see wee haue beare mynde thing wherein euery one v must exercise himselfe giue whole mynde may profite selues similitude spoken heere conclude confirme matter behoueth v marke well sayd namely god neuer lend hand wicked contrariwise put enemy good men shame haue pitie th good men continually verely wee put god stint say respect present life hee behaue himselfe sorte towardes v wee alwayes bee blissed hande continue alwayes prosperitie doctrine false also haue recordes ynowe scripture god hold rule whose father sauiour liue ease rest verie deede expedient v example day good men handled gentlie god hande thing wish desire wicked punished roughly hoping latter daye wee fall sound asleepe cace nothing needefull lord iesus christ appeate iudge world god iudgementes bee altogither apparaunt none hope saluation vvee see although god suffer thing bee confused worlde good folke tormented vttermoste wicked folke aduaunced triumphe yet wee bee drouzie dulheaded wee bee moued come vnto god consider sayth v namely life hidden yet wee muste tarrie till bee reuealed comming iesus christ vvee attaine consideration meanes although god prouoke v drawe v force vvhat would god disposed mannes life wise well ordered man indured anye aduersitie men might say behold god aydeth good therewithall shewing himselfe enemie bad beare suffer certayne wee would make heauen heere wee would conclude fondnesse waite comming christ bee looked wee see profite god nowe vphold v ordinarie vnpartiall maner shew himselfe fauourable faithfull punishe naughtipacks rather seeme dissemble time wicked ouershoote themselues working displeasure nothing else mocking vvell seemeth god sleepe rather hee able represse wycked muste ruffle oute haue better hande tyme contrarie good troubled tormented god muste succoure muste syghe crye vpon seemes bee vayne heard effecte would shewe good therefore thing goe none reason haue alledged alreadie inough must also rehearse text scripture sayd faythe muche precious corruptible metalles golde syluer muste passe fyre bee fyned drosse oure fayth muste also bee tryed muche thorrowlye precious god howe shall done affliction marke wee haue note may fare better texte god lendeth hande wicked fauouring shewing selfe bee friende contrarie hee shewe loue towards faithfull first suffereth languishe suche wise bee trampled vnder foote likelyhoode euer bee set vp againe god maye well doe thinges yet meane whyle ceasseth fulfill conteyned heere witte hee reacheth hande vnto wicked goodes whiche haue euer delight glorye must euery whit turne confusion wee perceyue excepte wee gyue eare whiche spoken v holie scripture vvhen shall haue harkened heare god vttereth hee giue v eye behold hidden v behold sauioure iesus christe cryeth wo bee laugh nowe yee shall weepe vvo bee ruffle must likewyse bee tormented shall pay deere ioyes lo scripture auoucheth behoueth v receyue spoken throughly resolued wee haue doone god honour giue credite worde hee make v vnderstande men perceyue namely middes greatest aduersitie heauinesse betide v haue still cause laugh say comfort cheere selues bycause haue eye happie ende god promiseth notwithstanding bee perceyued earthly eye vnderstanding neuerthelesse certayne god fauoureth wicked bycause althoughe haue neuer muche prosperitie although flourish neuer much outward appearance yet turned ruine confusion contrariwise though faithfull scourged tormented many wayes yet notwithstanding muche bee vphild hande god neuer miscarie turneth welfare profit herein see thing accomplished conteyned heere bee short see haue marke vpon texte let v learne put trust worlde inferiour meanes heere belowe let v leane vnto god seeing hee hath giuen v lorde iesus christ end graffed may drayne strength sap although life bee hidden wee bee euen death may ceasse continue still maynteined good sure state wayting till good god haue deliuered v worldly misery oute trouble wee bee fayne suffer heere vntill hee call v bring v kingdome heauen glorie hath purchased precious bloud lord iesus christ nowe let v fall flat presence oure good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v perceiue better wee haue done therewithall wee maye haue oure recourse vnto knowing howe onely amend v euill affection therefore maye please drawe v backe suche wise forsaking selues worlde wee maye laboure heauenly life vntill suche time hauing ouercome aduersitie present life beeing come ende battels wherewyth wee assayled may fully enioy victory whiche giueth v nowe grace holye spirite may please graunt grace v also people nation earth c xxxiij sermon first vpon ninth chapter iob ansvvered sayd truth knovv man shall bee iustified godvvard vvould dispute vvith ansvvere one poynt thousand vvise hart mightie strength vvho shall set selfe haue peace hee remoueth mountaynes feele vvhen hee ouerthrovveth hys vvrath remoueth earth hir place pillers thereof quake although men bee enforced confesse god righteous fault founde yet notwithstanding passion outrageous afflicted man shal heare smitten onely grudge againste god also blaspheme full mouthe yet torment neuer lesse seemeth reuenge selues sorte rayle whome haue doe muche therefore behooueth v bethinke v god righteousnesse great whyle aforehand ende scourgeth v may alwayes abyde lowlinesse knowe witte hee ryghteouse vnblameable neuerthelesse whole matter consisteth onely confessing generally god ryghteouse wee haue seene heeretofore baldad mainteining sayd cace god rightuous wrested euill fashion staying vppon thys poynte namely god punisheth men according desert wee haue seene alreadie rule holdeth continually alike god doth somtimes spare wicked beare sometimes hee chastizeth whome hee loueth handeleth much rigorously vtterly past amendment wee deeme god chastizeth euery man according desertes shall become men couet maynteine rightuousnesse meanes take wrong way yee see fault men take vpon measure god iustice say hee punisheth man sinnes yea looke manner quantitie euerye one hath offended thereafter muste god paye home worlde take god iustice ought doe respecte iob treateth nowe muche better manner god iustice howe knowne baldad hath done wit without hauing respecte one sinne onely taking menne bee moothers wombe yet notwithstanding whole worlde muste needes bee condemned afore god apparant althoughe affliction seeme roughe yet notwithstanding god reproued let v marke well two diuers maners speeche saye god rightuous punisheth men according deserte say god rightuous euer hee handleth men yet must wee alwayes keepe oure mouthes shet grudge bycause wee gaine thing thereby wee see wicked man punished god hand haue touched afore god meaning men knowe particular iudgement hee executeth ende men bee warned holie scripture speaketh manner vvee see god punisheth whoredomes cruelty periuries blasphemy suche like thinges yea verelie eyther vpon men person else vpon country vppon place shall haue bene giuen crime vvhen god layeth hande vpon suche therein hee sheweth mirrour instructe v according paule speaketh hee sayeth god punisheth sinner intent euery man shoulde beware hee punisheth rebellion worde make v walke feare vvhen hee punisheth wicked lustes holde v awe vvhen hee punisheth whoredomes ende wee shoulde walke cleanlinesse bothe bodie soule thus yee see howe god menne behold consider iudgements specially bee manyfest man may well saye sometimes god righteous hee hath punished suche one yea euen bycause hee man wicked dissolute life hee hath executed vengeance vpon countrie full filthynesse vncleannesse vvee may well speake maner ought wee doe howe bee alwayes haue sayde alreadie hee holdeth one rule vvhat bee done vvee must come vp higher saye god alwayes righteous howe euer hee handle men poynte well worthie bee noted dayes wee shall see beastes notwithstanding weene themselues bee clearkly fellowes shall haue maynteined god iustice owne reason phantasticall wit would god bee esteemed righteous handling euerie man according desertes touched afore bring passe fayne graunt free god election must ouerthrowne brought naught saye god choseth whome hee listeth calleth saluation owne free goodnesse hee forsaketh residue thinke verie straunge bee spoken bycause comprehende reason heere yee see rogue counterfaite bee great clearkes ouerturne foundacions fayth proue god rightuousnesse euen owne fansie cause mount hygh knowe god rightuous comparison men whatsoeuer true stadeth v beware another extremitie faultie shal see slaunderous conuersation may perceiue leudnesse discouered fall saying honest man yea worldward confesse euery man sinner godward shroude himselfe vnder common cloake looke vpon whorehunter hathe haunted stewes halfe score yeares looke vpon blasphemer ceasseth rayle god spyte hym looke vpon villaine despiseth god religion looke vpon vnthrifte vnconscionable person seeketh nought else catching withoute faithfulnesse honest dealing dogges say true sinner god manne righteous goe faultes hideous maye bee shrowde themselues vnder cloake naturall infirmitie saying manne bee equall god thinke haue doone verie muche yeelding suche confession haue shewed alreadie behooueth v haue two point one must acknowledge god rightuous respect whole worlde men muste pleade dispute wyth whosoeuer euer able alledge must bee abashed great small lo one speciall poynt ech man haue eye particularly himselfe euery man sorie fault abhorre condemne heerevpon also consider vengeance punishmentes whiche god sendeth vpon sinnes ende learne fare better thereby beaten roddes let euerie v saye good right haue well deserued god teach v men coste hee chastizeth men eye let touch v let v applie example owne instruction intent preuent matter god bee compelled fall vpon v bycause wee haue profyted chastizementes hee hath shewed v person others thus yee see two poyntes wee haue marke put vre let v come laying forth sayd iob know truth saith man shall iustifyed god set downe word importeth much godward doctrin great weight man know wel vvhat cause men iustifye themselues boldly say presume muche themselues set much store themselues bee full pryde vvhat else cause staying belowe euery man compareth himselfe neyghbour yee see wherevnto runne yee see also saint paule sendeth v great iudge saying euerie man shall beare owne burthen sayde friendes men beguile themselues make suche comparison vvhat see men liue better selfe haue faultes haue men ye see cause men condemne themselues ought doe rather sooth themselues iustifying owne cace heere expressely sayde man shall iustifyed god vvhat must wee doe ofte man speaketh v sinnes laieth afore v let v learne know must hold oure eye belowe looke vp iudgement seat lord iesus christ haue accounte make muste knowe incomprehensible maiestie god therefore lette euerie man thinke thereof shall v bee wakened withdrawe oure selues folly wee shall haue moe vaine imaginacions dotage haue bin wont rocke sinner asleepe bin obserued shoulde bee none debate nowe adayes christendome aboute rightuousnesse fayth papistes persuaded say namely wee become rightuous throughe meere fauoure god oure lorde iesus christe shall become merites say good workes wherein saluation menne consisteth papistes stande vpon merites besotted bycause looke vp god dispute theyr schooles whether good workes deserue recompence wage well euill workes deserue punishment thing flat contrarie men sinnes deserue punished must also rewarde vertues otherwise god iustice shoulde bee indifferent yea seeming might men dispute vpon shadowe yee see papistes fall asleepe vpon disputation yet meane whyle god ceasseth behalfe play iudge iudging according lawes behauing himselfe according owne maiestie witte finding thing men wee perceyue vertues godly deede saye suche might goe payment god somewhat shall haue prised vttermost shall smoke come god must layde downe let v remember well sayde heere man shall found rightuous god warde intente wee may take warning heereby ofte man speakes v sinnes must rest bylowe rather euery one v must summon himselfe god wee may knowe maner iudge hee soone take vpon v pleade must needes confounded ouerwhelmed iob addeth immediatly man would dispute god hee answere one point thousande true may well bee verefyed god wee may pleade faire tell long tale whereas ther shall thousand pointes god voutsafe open lip reply vnto verie true coloure shall pretend iustifie selues may wel beare countenaunce afore men bycause see cleerely requisite come vnto god vanisheth away nothing let v thinke god amazed oure long great babbling shal haue cast skum whe shal come point excusing selues giue credit vertues peraduenture seeme god oughte yeelde vnto v yea meane whyle doth nothing laughe mocke vayne bragges menne alledge nothing worth thus yee see good holie sentence whiche wee alledge thousand article god wil answere much one vvhat reason bycause nother heere sighte may well made account men god bee moued awhit neuerthelesse naturall meaof place come vnto god wit way incountering shall co bred shal able answer one article thousand shal alledge v surely wee hastie needes fight god draw sword say see pray wil streine curtesie aduenture vpo mortall man vpon creature nothing vpon liuing god wee intend make defiance man forecast thus able make parte good howe may compasse intent may turne v trouble displeasure vvhen wee shall enter dealing men wee make many discourse wee bee mynded rush god wee step bluntly vvee see heereby rage yea euen diuelishe rage men matche themselues god come push shall fynd experience iustle againste dalying prince thus yee see iob sheweth first hee setteth downe mennes boldnesse may perceyued afterward contrarie part setteth downe comberance wherin god maketh feele rightuous confoundeth lette v marke well men desyrous pleade dispute god wee see yet notwithstanding entred chalendge must need ouerthrown god make feele must bee confounded spyte teethe verie needefull thing haue shewed alreadie foolishe ouerweening wherewith men deceyue themselues proceedeth namely regard god make discourse thus yea verelye woorse men besides haue vice haue vertues also recompence withall cause men ouersleepe themselues knowe god maiestie haue liuely feeling submit themselues therevnto sith case standeth let v marke well said men desyrous stande pleading disputing againste god blind see selues say behold god able ouerwhelme v thust v downe bottomlesse pit hell yet shall go set ourselues wee neuer thinke therefore maruell though blynde howbeit let euerie man bethink himselfe well shall finde reason man speake v pleading god nature selfe teacheth v wee ought abhorre say euen wickeddest v vve see scoffer haue nother conscience feare god yet notwythstanding remayneth kynd feeling ingrauen nature bee abasshed ashamed sayde wilte thou pleade god neuerthelesse euen also seeme bee good discreete men sometimes fall suche manner talke man whiche playeth horse broken loose making protestation god vve see euen prophet haue bene assayled temptation true haue resisted behoued kynde conceite hath somewhat combered haue bene sorie nowe see god iudgemente straunge owne reason hathe good caryed awaye seeing wee bee inclyned pleade againste god much better ought doctrine printed remembrance wee may bee restreined suche time wee bee tempted wise reason againste god assuring oure selues wee gayne nothing ought warned heereof wee shall bee greatly offended though wee see many leape sort boundes stumblingblocke troubleth weake vvee would faine euery man confessed god bee rightuous mercie filleth whole world ought glorifie hapneth wicked men rayle god blaspheme men dare open mouthe reproue rebuke much haue full scope triumph worldward seene weake greeued seemeth mightie power rightuousnesse god defaced therby yeld glory belongeth see naturall thing man pleade maner god although monstrous thing one ought abhor exceedingly yet ordinarie vice sith case standeth let v bee ouer muche disquieted hapneth thus yee see wee haue beare mind behoueth v marke well added second poynt wit god charge v thousande article able scarsly answere one admonished haue serched oure vice vttermoste wee shall come knowledge hundreth parte much one euerie thousand true men examine themselues well without hypocrisie muste needes finde themselues wrapped many euilles may bee ashamed themselues vtterly dismayed specially wee thoughe man picke bee holyest yet muste raunge selues one ranke dauid hathe confessed man attayne true knowledge sinnes nowe holiest suche seeme angells altogither confounded sinnes bycause number infinite pray bee sayde common sort wee must neuer take selues haue profited much wee still farre behynde speake men examine liues throughly shall find bottomlesse gulf sinnes shall vtterly dismayed attayne yet knowledge hundreth part sort requisite ye see dauid entred fault cryed knoweth owne sinnes hee confesseth knew exceeding much afterward addeth lord clenze secrete sinnes sayeth calleth secret sinnes behoueth v knowe sinnes else confesse sinnes answer dauid wist wel god seeth cleerely wee doe seeing conscience vpbraydeth v shall say iudgement god ye see order haue kepe wit euery v enter himselfe search owne vice throughly farre hee come knowledge haue sifted well behold conscience iudge maner iudge true iudge greatly bee feared dothe god see farre cleerer mortall man conscience accuseth mee thousand sinnes god enter reckening mee shall hee find many mo standeth v hand wey well sayde heere witte thousand poyntes hard scarsly answere vnto one wee shall haue espyed one faulte selues god passeth farre seeth sin priuie nowe folowing sayd let v lerne bethink v fault wise wee may fully resolued selues god contenteth commeth owne knowledge iudge according himselfe seeth knoweth according finde leape ouer quicke cole sayde prouerbe god plungeth v ouer head eares whome belongeth search heart scripture attributeth vntoo besides wee discerne well betweene vice vertues ought doe poynt therefore must reserued vnto wherefore descerne iudge well rightly work standeth v hand know perfection without perfectnesse nothing good god say filthynesse wher want perfection deserueth allowed god perfection shewe itselfe nowe howe shall know perfection considering eysight dim see twylight although god inlighten v yet haue wee pure cleane sight vse brightnesse hee sheweth v true worde god entreth intoo bottome oure heartes perceth bone marie true burning cresset true iesus christ called daysunne shineth ouer al yet eysight ceasseth dim stil therefore standeth v greatly hande knowe perfection hereby put mynde soeuer take thing bee good perceyue fault yet therefore without faulte knowe perfection god requireth shorte none god knoweth perfection soundnesse hee knoweth feeble atteyne vnto cause sayde wee may well set fayre face vpon matter shall able answer one poore poynte thousand shall bee alledged layde afore v haue tolde already men warned pleade god shall alwayes find themselues confounded damnation howbeit late warning profitable v reason intent blowe come euery man shoulde holde himselfe within boundes sobernesse modestie say ala thing v go law god thinke get vpper hande nay cleane contrariwise god shall ouerwhelme v behold way acquit hand euery man co demne himselfe fall sturdinesse god wil punish v pride may first push hee wil shew v confusion length shal snarled wee shall winde selues agayne yee see intoo maze god casteth presumptuous sort vndertake stand enterprise combate spoken heere true god gracious hee daunteth length fall aray muste bee taken holde say worketh continually one fashion vve shall see full pride whiche trust owne rightuousnesse would bind god vnto well god ouermastreth tameth casteth vtter confusion afterwarde plucketh againe vvee see god worketh alwaies one rate neuerthelesse behoueth v alwayes vnderstande scripture telleth v namely god stretch hand proude destroy beholde proceedeth therin say hypocrits puffed vp pride presumptuousnesse thynke verely vertues deserue receyued yea haue reward recompence vvell stande owne conceite tyme god letteth alone side satan eggeth inticeth maketh set much themselues gaze owne gay fethers like peacock saying haue done beare themselues hand god ought hold cotented anone haue taken pleasure themselues vertues god cal acount proue face esteemed vertue nothing vice yea starke filthinesse abhominacion comb cut good right insomuch whe haue beguiled worlde also themselues trusting thing haue gay shew cou tenance outwardly thing must alwayes manifested whiche spoken sainct luke namely thyng excellent highly esteemed among men abhominable god let v beware wee presume farre fight god go law iustifie ourselues else oure god confound v rush v shall oppressed ouerwhelmed thousand crime wee shall able answer one bee accused thousand deadly sinnes saye infinite number intend cleere selues one point shall cast owne turne say let v beware come point end may touched better sayde god wise hart mightie strength poynt doctrine hath bin touched already heeretofore neuerthelesse nought spoken heere new againe lesson ought mind day day haue told already men beguile themselues wanze away fond imaginatios bycause thinke vpon god rest vpon themselues beholde heere one inconuenience let v men thought vpon god shuld touched liuely acknowledge according declareth himselfe vnto moued suche feare reuerence would glorify worthy reason bycause conceiue god one vvell skill say god god word runnes roundly vpo tung end yet meane infinite maiestie perceiued awhit al god respect dead thing deede wel seene mennes blasphemy periuries suche like thing men feeling god maiestie heare holy sacred thing rent torne peeces men chafe god must faine abie iacke like master angrie fumish hasty man giue seruant buffet fist testy man wife else hys horse displease euen play god see cast vp choler god vnderling may well sayd totoo dulheaded yea come point without chafed see dogges make bone tearing name god although bee cause prouoke therevnto yet ceasse sweare blasphemously euery word mostrous thing nature therefore good token knowe maiestie god though word flye neuer roundly mouth also store sorswearings horrible cace dayes man cannot wring one worde truth let neuer much solemnitie vsed bring called witnesse yet seene bee sworne insomuch whole number deposed man shall hardly finde one among halfe score say truth indeede common byword among cace go wholly witness much saye one wil speake truth thus ye see spite god also pray talke men hold communication ministred holye scriptur whole religio holy thing wee haue day meete men shoulde hold theselues awe caces according sayd true marke god child tremble hys word see men boldly reason god discoursing prating secret maiestie euen sport substantiall proof wee know god though name ryfe euery mannes mouthe let v marke well thing whiche added heere namelye god wyse hart myghtie strength needeth true woordes seeme pithily spoken might haue bin well weyed found sufficient force make v shrinke horne sayd god wise hart meant worldly wisdome wisdome wit able comprehend sayd strong strong hee gyant mountayne must glorifie wise must assure oure selues might strength power like creature see nothyng see heere beneath wee must seeke strength power god alone lo speech importeth verely thing cannot bee well gone present ought bee yet requisite touch end might see manner iobs proceding rather holye ghost proceding speaketh iobs mouth shewe v maner rightuousnesse god vvill vnderstand well must take generall conclusio whe shall open crymes bee found v liue loocely walke honestly vnblamably worldward nothing vvhy sort soeuer creature god condemne continue rightuous himselfe wee attempt reply true oure opinion may wel find say time god wil winke withstand first brunt end must fayne stoupe receyue sentence damnation men shall haue clapped hand v yea quit v cleere shall faile condemned confounded shall come great iudge hee see cleerely sharply al men world let v assure ourselues none meane obteyne fauour god haue sinnes couered euen haue frankly confessed nothing filth infection v fleeing refuge lord iesus christ shal full perfect ryghtuousnesse bee found vertue whereof shall acceptable god finde hym mercifull v let v cast ourselues face good god acknowledgemet sinnes praying wipe wise may come looking face yea howbeit presuming aught ourselues vpon gracious fauour hath shewed v lorde iesus christe wherof hath bin make v partaker moreouer wil clenze v fro day day purge v corruptios flesh maye bee rightly sanctified apeare blamelesse latter day let v say almightie god c xxxiiij sermon seconde vpon ninth chapter sermon conteyneth rest exposition fourth fifth sixth verse foloweth hee commaundeth sunne hee shyne starres shut vp hym vvith seale spreadeth heauens vvalketh aloft vpon sea made starres arcturus orion pleiades chamber midday hee doeth maruelous incomprehensible vvorks vvonderfull thinges vvithout ende behold goeth mee see hee passeth fro perceyue hee catch snatch vvho hee shall plucke handes vvho hee vvill say vnto vvhat doost thou god vvill vvithdravve vvrath mightiest helpes shall stoupe vnto vvhat enter talk make choyce vvordes vvith although vvere rightuouse yet could ansvver humble self iudge wee wit knowe god accordingly hee vttereth himselfe neede long processe bee vsed euery v bee able discerne thynges set afore eye forasmuchas vntowarde behalfe god neede vpbrayde v vnthankfulnesse telling v work purpose maketh sayd heere namely god listeth skie shall bee couered great thicke cloudes sun shall seene contrarywise pleaseth send lyght cope sky appereth faire pauilio whych heaue maiestie sheweth itselfe walketh aloft vpon sea say power sheweth itselfe throughly also setteth star skye order according certaine number thys say rehersed v ende shoulde knowe duetie better apply mynds cosidering god work wee may honour hee deserueth although god hauing cast v teeth vice v might leaue v yet notwithstanding intent instruct v welfare two poyntes wee haue marke streyne owne profit first vnderstand v thinketh vpon god wisdome power suche sort ought deede confesse ynough mouth entreth hart thing wee shew contemptuousnesse touched yesterday thorowly perswaded wisedome man vanitie strength wee see creature nothing god hold v awe ye woulde say reyned vp hard short brydle none v hardie thinke speake thing according god good pleasure seing negligent euery v beareth himselfe giue bridle wicked thought nourish without remorse conscience insomuch burst euen outwarde deedes thereby shewe wee neuer knewe goddes maiestie aright rather neuer tasted aught purpose else tast thereof vnsauery dyed hand heare sayd god wisdome mightinesse knowen spoken sort vnto v bycause wee vntoward applying mynds profit good sooth greate shame v wheras liue world goodly large list god giueth v sight al creature crosseth afore eye yet wee forget founder euen whose heauen earth mirrours glory according said visible thing wee maye see thing inuisible seeing hath put v world wee make none account al geere must needes sayd haue naughty mind verely wee bee starke blind whensoeuer god delt withal conceyue nothing except hee gyue v must fayne inlighten v else shall bee nothing darknesse wit howsoeuer cace stande cannot excuse selues ignorance shall haue bene wilfulnesse ioyned wee shal conuicted haue regarded god yea hath greeued v thinke bene matter heauinesse yee see first oure lord accuseth v streyne howbeit instruction ioyned wherein perceyue inestimable goodnesse might condemne v leaue v haue sayd alreadye true hee condemneth v howbeeit make v feele sinne may corrected v herevpon dooth office good schoolemaister end lerne thing wee knewe therefore lette v take good heede shall shewed v heere cofesse text speaketh thing whiche euery v knoweth thynges seeme bee common familiar v therefore bee sayd superfluous talke saye peraduenture surmyze forsomuchas referre thynges right marke must god sayne playe schoolemaister repeating lesson v oftentymes ought wee seeke owne profit god dooth lay afore v verye darke matter god maketh sunne shyne pleaseth therewithall whole cope heauen appeare like greate pauilion intent wee might knowe oddes betwixte maiestie god pompe earthly prince vvhen earthly prince indeuer aduaunce themselues doo policy councelles much doo haue set vp one pauilion thirtie foote hyghe yea though two mile long yet comparison yee see skye endlesse god hathe streyned earth footestoole therefore see thing although knowledge yet nothyng woorth go consideretion always must come backe poynt namely see heauen must better bethinke v god maiestie incomprehensible may moued honour submit ourselues vnto hym ought doe nowe perceyue superfluous matter sayde heere lorde commaundeth sunne shall shyne sunne shall hidden cloudes wise may seeme god draweth curtayne afore afterwarde hee vnfoldeth heauen hee listeth muche meant hee sayeth hee walketh vpon water sea surely wee see walke vpon possible sea continue state dooth restreyned woonderfull power wee knowe nature water sheade abrode yet see sea swelleth vp likenesse mountaynes besette wyth bound shall see eyghtandtwentith chapter much earth needes couered ouer hande vvhereas wee haue drye ground dwell vpon let v thinke happeneth cause goddes lodge v heere time holdeth sea within barres bound stone timber owne power although sea haue great violence may seeme nothing able hold backe yet notwithstanding god holdeth backe still euen vntoo day woorde hee spake drye ground men harber ought wee bend wit way wee therefore let v marke superfluous needlesse doctrine sayde god walketh vppon sea afterwarde mention made starres true number infinite according sayde another psalme witte great number starres would requyre long discourse vnder fewe name heere iob meant put v mind whole beautifull hoste heauen besydes planet see starres firmament see serue marke something wee myght better consider woonderfull woorkmanship mouing skyes vve see well sunne keepeth one circuit euery day hee risen goeth downe againe turneth earth well beneathe aboue men see also wee see sunne hath another cleane contrarie course whereof commeth winter whereof commeth sommer sunnes approching v retyring away v keeping hygher lower gate respect v according goeth v draweth neerer v thereafter maketh diuersitie season vve see say euen rudest ignorant v true perceyue sunne walketh cleane contrary course maketh keeping dayly course experience thereof knowen effect wee haue nother winter sommer sunne although wee knowe yet wee sufficiently conceyue sort god ordeyneth thys walke sunne side starres iob nameth v heere informe v thing like see wheeles chariot turne bycause extree ouerthwart wherevpon twoo naues meanes whereof wheeles go euen god hath set twoo starres bee naues wheele charyot sunne seene turne vve see knowledge thing god inestimable wisdome may better perceyued leastwise men shall haue tast whereby shall prouoked magnifie saying lord excellent thy woorkmanshp verely thing iob toucheth cannot bee fully vnderstoode except man haue ben conuersant learning toucheth astrologie hee contented speake whiche rudest ideots doe see hee passeth toucheth cunningly certayne particular intent shoulde knowe workmanship skyes howbeit althoughe men astronomer yet man excuse himselfe god giueth sufficiente knowledge thing wee shet eye sunne shyneth shepherdes countrie well skill speake starres yea giue name howbeeit namyng certain darken glorie god wherof commeth must euill imputed men twoo starres named heere poet haue feyned many fable fond thing vvherof commeth vnreasonablenesse vaynesse naughtinesse men haue said starre crounet garlond woman else woman hirselfe lo heere cow lo ox lo heere lo short lo sort dotage neuerthelesse wee haue marke dotage sprung satan suttlest wylinesse desyre farre possible deface fayre lookingglasse wherein god bee sene knowen sayd moyses god garnished heauen hostes thereof moyses termeth starres well planet residue hoste heauen furniture heauen skyes without beautie fashio garnished starres performed creation worlde moyses declareth see howe diuell beguyleth men make forget record god hath gyuen workes make beleeue starres come place yea men haue intermingled villanies filthinesse ther nothing else whoredomes idolls spake starres heauen lyke pope canonizeth saincts whome listeth idolater canonized lemans idolls woulde fayne haue heauen infected wyth filthinesse well earth yee see satan hath sent illusion worlde abolishe knowledge god possible darken suche wise men might wander theyr owne follyes haue feeling pure truth requisite vvhat bee done lette v marke well iobs intent heere teache v bee astronomer farre capacitie beare may referre glorifying god goodly order heauen see touching first point sayde god intendeth make v astronomer yea farre forth eche man capacitie wil beare decypher particularly many starres therewithall tell skylight men call planet witte distance highnesse lownesse long large respect haue one another good sooth cannot comprehend geere wee see experience sunne hygher moone bycause moone commeth full betweene sight sunne behold made eclipse whereby saye perceyue moone lower may well perceyue suche thing yet notwithstanding meane wee knowe space reason howe commeth passe moone passeth betweene sunne v therefore euery man cannot knowe howbeit wee haue kynd conceyuings ought ynough humble v may consider workes god meane lord would grosser sort meene haue meane follow learning haue sufficient occasion wise ynough glorifie sayd moyses two greate lyghts one rule day rule nyght moone bigger starres planet certayne starres skye bigger moone cannot wee see great bycause farre distance v exceeding hygh respecte v insomuch seeme great bee reason greate distaunce betweene skyes v god speaketh vnto v thing according perceyuing according vvhy say true men atteyne sharp vnderstanding know big planet proportion starres bee diuided euery man say knowes open eye looke vp ye shall see sunne lanterne light yea greate light lighteneth whole world yee shall see shyning moone men ynough make glorifie infinit wisdome god according also sayde god hath cut excuse intent raunge aduenture bycause bee greate clerk sayeth open eye withoute hauing skill ye shall constreyned euill haue profited whome god hath bin gracious lift aboue skyes wise haue measured man might measure plat lande house saye many pace many foote lyke man myght measure place heere bylowe haue philosopher measured space betweene planet also starres themselues short thing hath alwayes bin atteyned vnto yet meane whyle haue knowne god sheweth himselfe openly hys creature little hath knowledge led glorifying haue rather darkened maiestie vvee see standeth v hand take another way whereas speaking sunne planet starres end knowe naturall reason rest ende wee shoulde bee guided vntoo god honoure doo homage wee behold glory hee sheweth vttereth vnto v visible creature thus yee see wee haue marke streine vvee see adayes men wit wander become fond time heeretofore thing shewed v heere although speake starres yet neede go farre perceyue god let v abyde still ourselues saint paule sayeth seuententh act let v looke euery man himselfe shall find haue mouing power v god dwelling v yet comprehend wee say haue eye wee neede grope sayeth sainct paule hee vseth word blind man goeth groping darke though grope eye shut yet god spight teethe make v feele power wisdome goodnesse rightuousnesse continue blockish beastly vtterly witlesse true sharpwitted ynough vayne tryfling thinges cace saluation wee fayle wee bee woorse brute beastes haue one drop good wit much therefore behoueth v marke well sentence wherin lord sheweth v looke vp heauenward ought bethink v thus behold god hath giuen v eye perceyue thys goodly order looke downward ought thinke sheweth euery lette v assure ourselues god whiche sheweth opely intent think vppon thus yee see wee may profit selues text bee short let v bee well aduised occupie selues studie vntill wee haue comprehended power wisdome god wee maye put mynd honoure say honoure hee worthy men acquit themselues lightly haue doone ceremonie vnto god think ought hold contented honour requireth due vnto quake vnder oft heare hym spoken acknowledge hym bee indge abashed assuring ourselues able sinke v one onely loke able make mountaynes melt away wax doeth sunne shall become v frayle first let v abashed maiestie god afterward let v also take hold hir ryghtuousnesse behoueth saying nothing hath hee fountayne benefit wee feele sort god fearing earnestly trembling maiestie profit must make howbeeit forasmuchas wee bee yet farre point let euery one v learne record lesson thus yee see haue beare mynd concerning texte furthermore requisite go seeke story whither mountaynes haue bene sunken deepe sayde heere god remoueth mountaynes feele serueth shewe like hee hathe settled earth builded vpon deepe foundacions please chaunge wise mountaynes shall turned intoo valleyes iob recyteth thing already come passe certayne tyme place sheweth thing god doo according sayde another text pleaseth mountaynes melt away waxe doeth heate sunne serueth v vnderstande doo often hee listeth yee see haue marke cheefly doone must compare owne fraylnesse wee comparison mountayne howe greate firmnesse artillerie world doo nothing v needeth one little finger ouerthrowe v nowe god looke bee terrible dreadfull heauen earth shake scripture sayeth shall mortall man bee able stande vvhen wee shall haue knowne oure owne frailtie throughly digested god myghtie power shall haue doone verye much howbeit forasmuchas thinke seeldome let v hardely learne lyfe long let v study lesson let v alwayes bee scholers iob hath spoken hee addeth god passeth seeth hee goeth fro hee perceyueth wherein doeth v witte although god vtter himselfe vnto v yet shall inuisible god vttereth sheweth vnto v work substance substance shall neuer see neuerthelesse wee knowe suche sorte constreyned see hand hathe passed way thus ye see recorde yeeldeth v presence god passeth v say maketh v perceiue power spreddeth itselfe wise whole worlde hard hand v yet notwithstanding hee inuisible say although sayde vttering shewing himselfe according nature yet haue full knowledge thereof nother aree able comprehende reason small capacitie wit wee stand astonyed example see ground bring foorthe frute behold put mynde goodnesse power god springtime wee see earth open hir bowel vtter hir rich behold god sheweth himselfe passeth v agayne one whyle sunne shyneth another rayneth doeth god passe eyther side v maketh walke fro according varietie hee sheweth much went one place another intent men vew better hee settled one place abide chayre without remouing perceyue well hee walketh vp downe verely intent gathet v better hymselfe vvel god shewed vnto v wit wee conceiue sayd power vertue sheweth itselfe tree corne herbes vynes thing may well haue vnderstanding wee may well perceyue thing howbeeit part god shall neuerthelesse passe fro yet shall see thing bace seeme greate value god walke v perceyue little shall wee wee come higher woorks secret god intendeth worke extraordinarie maner like sometymes executeth iustice yea eue wise astonied cannot perceyue commeth passe bee astonied thing god sheweth dayly may comprehended order nature must need fayle vtterly witts ende shall come woorks farre greater certaine needes must therefore let v marke well sayd god passeth v shall perceyue heereby warned stand contention god say shall bee doone shall come passe hys power infinite yea although shewe itselfe euen smallest thing yet bee comprehended reason although yet perceyue part haue told alreadye must expounded substaunce god onely hys woorke whereby vttereth himselfe vntoo v yet sheweth himselfe come neere v familiarly see shall wee doo comparison purpose come vnto enter talke surmount shall wee bee mightie ynough wee see ouerweening men mind match themselues god weene theselues able stie aboue cloud ala see folly rather madnesse let v marke well purpose sentence placed haue layd foorth iob treateth god power strength saying god catcheth plucke fist hee dare say vntoo doest thou verely seemeth iob graunteth heere absolute power god one hath nother right reason let v marke hee pursueth still poynt declared yesterday witte god iustice consisteth onely punishing transgressor crymes notorious vvherin euen god woorketh straungely hee seemeth vntoo v haue reason dooings doo v wrong euen vnbeleeuers take occasion grudge againste hym euen therein specially wee must acknowledge ryghtuousnesse streyne sayde god snatch doeth hee snatch hereby meante god vse anye terrible power maketh v afrayde lion oftentimes hee likeneth himselfe wild beast wise ouerwhelmeth turneth earth vpside downe say god thundereth sort amazed yet may man say vnto wherefore doest thou much lesse may hee plucke play fist say men pleade god shall lose time true men thinke haue good cause make complaint yea senselesse behalfe haue spewed vp blasphemy thinke haue gotten victorie god end must condemned whensoeuer god listeth reply make feele power might tyrannouse power haue imagined yet infinite power sheweth itselfe vnderstanding saye whither god rightuous according perceiue god rightuous euen would condemne accordingly one siftith psalme thou shalte bee found ryghtuouse euen thou haste condemned men may men well striue againste god yet ende mouthes shall bee stopped god shall founde ryghtuouse doeth prophet dauid vse manner speeche bycause men presumptuouse make god stoupe lure make bone condemning iustifie themselues ye see maner sentence iobs must expounded wee see effect hee hath confirmed matter delt yesterday wit concerning power strength god desyrous knowe power strength god let v settle wit consideration order nature see heauen earth may serue bring v vnto god yea may conceyue may humble selues yeeld honour thys ynough v yet let v go surely ouergreate brutishnesse v heauen earth whole order nature suffizeth v shewe v god ye see booke written letter big ynough withall great store diuers instruction shall haue profited thousand shall hundred thousand others wherat ought learne somewhat wee dull nother heauen earth profit v let v come selues let v bethinke v well doth god come familiarly vnto v well work thing see selues though cannot knowe yet leastwise let v perceyue whe worketh familiarly v certayne fayle behalf therfore must conclude wee haue wit knowe god shall haue inquired god presence power let v lerne humble ourselues according iob addeth heere conclusion behold sayeth whensoeuer shall come answer neuer attempt iustifie selfe wil submit myselfe iudge intreate see wherevnto leaneth iob hath spoken although talke disordered verely may gather good lesson though haue generalitie hath bin declared heeretofore iob sheweth v mark shooteth certayne wil profit v double let v marke well word iob hath spoken god power wisdome giuen mirrours president sayeth done freds ye se god iudge vvhen euery v hath looked put cace euill doer haue led altogither wicked life put cace wee haue bin whoremonger murtherers theeues put cace god bee able charge v haue liued naughtily wantonly yet notwithstanding dare bold ope mouth say rightuouse deserue well thou shouldest receyue mercie dare presume bold bee doone vve must come iudge intreate fayre meanes worde intrcate importeth must pleade gilty say wee must knowe nothing matter death damnation v nothing sin wickednesse v haue none refuge mere mercie thus ye see word intreate importeth oft speaking presenting selues god maiestie let v marke well cannot bee glorified hand ought bee except wee bee brought vtterly vnder foote mouthes stopped whole world confesse themselues indetted vntoo god paule speaketh thirde romanes therfore come make intreatance iudge let mynd iustifie selues shall get good also let v imagin honor god requireth v consisteth ceremony braueries like thing let v stand vpo apish toyes papist vpo wote gewgawes men haue broughte theselues say let v think god serued honored hand geere let v bend wit dedicate selues wholly vntoo hym framing ourselues rule hee hath giuen v word assuring ourselues dayly increace graciouse gift v vntill haue brought v saluation notwithstanding vnworthy let v fal flat face good god aknowledgemet innumerable fault comit dayly beseching make v know better haue done wee may bee ninth chapter sermon contayneth still exposition xiij xiiij xv verse text set downe call vpon ansvver mee yet vvould thinke hath heard mee hath smitten mee dovvne vvith vvhirle vvind hath vvounded vvithout cause giueth mee ley sure take breathe filleth mee vvith bitternesse man go strength beholde hee strong man deale vvith hym iustice vvho may cope vvith iustifie selfe myne ovvne mouth condemneth mee alledge myne vprightnesse shall esteeme frovvard say sound yet knovv soule life misliketh behold one point vvherein resolued vvit god destroyeth ryghtuous vnryghtuouse alike yesterday wee treated thys poynte namely although wee knowe sinnes sufficiently yet notwithstanding behoueth v come vnto god intreatance say euery v must acknowledge himselfe wretched sinner assure ourselues v haue neede mercie condemne v good right according paule sayeth al v runne arrerages bycause sayeth destitute god glory menward may wel glorifie ourselues maye seeme vntoo v wee haue good cause doo come wee greate iudgementseate must al v stand confounded ye see sayd god withdrawe wrath strong helpes shall bee beaten downe hym shall haue gathered togither may ayde v god shall ouerturne euery whit except pacified say except hee goodnesse receyue v mercie hope wee preuayle agaynst therfore behoueth v fall agreement may god set one men making payement themselues shewing themselues rightuouse hee maketh inquisition making intreatance according haue sayd already let v mark vayne seeke meanes heere withstand god wrath stop wee consumed behoueth v keepe way shewed v wit wrath god must pacified thus much concerning poynt nowe iob addeth loste time make choice woordes god vvhereby doeth v wit may like well vse retorik according many besotte themselues owne word like well opinion like bleare eye cleersyghted god shall bee beguyled also iob sayeth heere shall haue chozen word told goodly painted tale might amaze hearer god passe whit must babling retorike ceasse wee come heauenly throne tung heard men thought must come light bookes must bee opened god make none inquisition bringing forth owne cosciences may hide excuse themselues many startingholes must themselues open must knowen apparant let man beguile himselfe alledge afore men geere muste ouerthrowen god summoneth v hym heereby iob meeneth effect wee muste measure god rightuousnesse rightuousnesse men wee pleade manner men doubte cace go ourside yea wee suppose whole worlde shall haue quitte v iustified v yea clapped hand v wee ourside shall haue liued sorte fault may bee found v yet shall wee stop short wee come vnto god chaunce shall bee quite chaunged lette v learne aduauntage wee haue worldwarde shall bee nothing vanitie wee stande god must first marke well wee muste call mynde mightie power whereof mention hathe bene made heeretofore shall bee bereft glorie according sainct paules saying steade imagining selues haue power cleere selues wee shall finde much one silie drop goodnesse v deserueth
