bee made account vvhen men condemned flee refuge mercie god poynte holy ghost intendeth bring v vnto foloweth shal haue called vpon hee haue answered mee yet shall thinke hee hath hearde voice hee hath hearkned beholde heere straunge saying although god heare v outwarde apparance yet doth hee make v feele goodnesse sorte wee bee vtterly destitute help iob sayeth hee shall haue obtayned requestes god hath pitie answered yet hee looke bee condemned hande prayer haue profited nothing howe shall take doubt iob expresseth temptation men long god sheweth himselfe according wee haue seene followeth like phraze speache heeretofore true iob rested yet hee touched suche passion man findeth himselfe plight god commeth call make hym feele iustice sorte vtterly dismayde vve come lowe first brunt true god come fight v suche wise wee see like enimie aduersarypartie v certayne shall bee frighted suche feare nothing may assuage anguish wherewith wee shall bee ouertaken incombered although god haue answered v yet beleeue rather thinke e persecuteth v whatsoeuer hope haue put v yet notwithstanding ceasse increace still stripe ye see discomforte bee whiche haue taken conceyte god asmuch present passion dreadfull haue good cause sence selues aforehand wee may withstand bee first formest lette v vnderstande bee like case iob fewe thinke according owne sensualitie seemeth v none miserie aduersitie whiche wee feele body present lyfe wee come spirituall battels whereby god trieth v holding conscience locked vp wee wote say risen vp agaynst v hee thundereth downe vpon v hath set v ful afore white shoote although god examine v neere quicke first yet must euery v haue eye therevntoo thinke wyth oure selues ala god sende v onely sicknesse smite v maner respect bodie small thing comparison torment hee maketh folkes feele hee setteth nothing afore wrath vengeance maketh though would damne drowne vtterly seeing cace standeth let v pray god shall please hym bring v poynt hee giue v power strength stande howe euen calling promise remembrance true god wrath consuming fire truly soone giueth v incling wee must needes bee vtterly dismayde vndoubtedly men seeke strength themselues withstand incounters must faine borrowe god hand according god dismayeth v sheweth v signe vengeance contrarie part rayseth v graues yea euen bottome hell finally lifteth v vp aboue cloudes ayre maketh v taste goodnesse euen meanes promise lo howe wee borrowe strength god fight agaynst temptation yet neuerthelesse iob sheweth v heere faythfullest pacientest god giueth spirit doth men shall exempted present temptation wit shall know become middes distress god presseth vpon heare think stil shaken god minded pitie temptation last still certaine wee misse blaspheme god vvhen faith quenched needes go astray bee harried away hellish rage howbeit god woundeth faythfull sort abateth smart stripe healeth bee ouerthrowne flung downe hell turning hande god gaue v tast goodnesse distress iob hild fast coclusion god intended heare bene vndone beene remedie let v marke hee possessed oppressed despayre hee vttereth god made feele goodnesse sort vve see yet much better person lord iesus christ sayth vvhy hast thou forsake deed extremitie partie beareth burthen al sinnes world therefore requisite iesus christe feele himselfe forsaken god father yet neuerthelesse cofort cotrarie shewed saying god god long ca call vpon god assuring selues sauiour may preace vnto long doth faith beare sway thereby wee bee perswaded god hath forsaken v yet meane ceasse haue ouerheady passion wherein flesh findeth selfe gulse hath light respect naturall vnderstanding respect aught wee see insomuche wee haue debated matter throughly wee conclude none otherwise god agaynst v god enemie least god hath set v plight pray gyuen vp vnto sathan hope meane recouerie yee see plundge god putteth v howbeit respect fleshly vnderstanding according owne reason aught wee see nature god giueth v sparke brightnesse hee giueth v feeling fayth howbeit wee neither know discerne yee see paule sayeth sighes gronings whiche god stirreth vp v make v pray vnto vnutterable say canot expressed beholde faythfull man prayeth vnto god sigheth groneth maner beholde sayeth paule faithfull person maketh supplication vnto god knoweth doeth thing outreacheth mind al thought wee become like brute beastes praying vntoo god wee bee voyde vnderstanding paule meeneth intent say god worketh straunge fashion wee bee ouercombered owne passion wee wote say see likelyhood bee fauorable mercifull v pecke trouble although insight dimme cannot perceyue god supplie infirmity yet neuerthelesse let v tarie leysure till woorke v yea euen meane vnknowne v high v attaine vnto lo howe iob pretendeth hee beleeued god regarded heard although answered bee short hee doeth v vnderstand present temptation vnruly excessiue forwent whole taste god goodnesse yea fayth good quenched respect owne naturall reason vtterly perished bicause little fire vnder ash good choked iob ouerwhelmed teptation ala shall become v holy gost hath set v mirrour pacience brought lowe falne deepe pit dreadfulnesse pray god touch v quicke must needes swallowed vp whirlpoole muche neede haue pray god strengthen v though light temptation let v bee hart token god hath cast v away destitute holy spirite vseth wonderfull fashion gouerning rescuing notwithstanding respect owne nature haue conceyts imagination dismay plundge ouer head eares yea euen downe hell remaineth nothing say diuell holdeth slaues haue eye troubled time able loke dazeled neuerthelater leaueth feeling maiestie holde alwayes backe vtterly despayre thus ye see effect haue marke middes great temptation diuell shall haue wonne much hand shall seeme vnto v wee must vtterly ouerwhelmed shift get must continue calling vpon god yea euen til time haue giuen v light ouercouered v time quite queched haue sayd haue become v god haue left v vp altogither god suffereth sayd brightnesse fayth holy spirit hath put v stifled maner haue alreadie declared coparison litle fire ouercouered ash cace fire may neuerthelesse bee kindled againe time euen faith smouldred sort sheweth one sparke vntill god kindle v againe chace away darknesse wee possessed ouerwhelmed iob hath vttered sentence addeth beholde hath smitten downe whirlwinde wounded without cause vvhen iob sayeth god stricke downe whirlwind signifie woder though imagin god sore agaynst canot natural reason hope fauour ye thinke straunge sayth say cannot suppose god doth heare shal haue answered haue eye present affliction wherewith wholly possessed nothing may assuage grief haue touched already namely woundes god maketh sheweth enemie whe cyteth v iudgement see nothing angry coutenance sensible therfore whe come poynt certaine bee ouerwhelmed sorrow nothing may cofort v giue v pacientnesse see iobs meening wit present time god wrath feeling therof bereft al mean coforting himselfe harkning declaration could made comfort withall must alwayes beare minde hath bin declared heretofore wit god neuer sheweth himselfe angrie towardes owne maketh feele hys goodnesse wise howbeeit alwayes perceiue thing easie comprehend neuerthelesse behoueth v wayt wil god child yet shall haue much ado perceiue practise poore assaulted teptations shall perchanc say doth god regard beholde pine away cal vpon yet find cofort therfore signe hath shaken afterward sinnes come remembrance diuel stirreth vp store stuffe horrible thus ye see poore creature vtterly ouerwhelmed vvhen past cometh god make al whole conscience tormented afore becometh quiet loke nothing darkenesse doeth nowe shine sheweth swete amiable coutenance maner fayre weather wit though partie temptation time god suffer fayth perish vtterly disfeated impossible fayth vncorruptible seede oure soules howbeeit haue sayd alreadie respect man whole naturall wit reason must needes blind vntill god shew v fauor behoueth v marke wel wordes iob sayth god smyteth whirlewind intent vtter extraordinarie maner dealing though god layd vpon cudgell though giuen mee stripe swoorde hath afrighted sayeth hee cast downe thunderbolte whirlwinde vpon mee blowes wee receyue heere bylowe alwayes deadly thunder light vpon v heauen wee bee deade men iob therfore meeneth wound hath receiued sunken bottolesse deepes sayeth lightning whirlwinde falne vpon fro heauen worth noting one satan policy driue v despayre bearing v hand god hadleth v vnaccustomed rigour satan tell v eare meenest thou true god chastizeth sinner afterwarde pitieth god visiteth owne loueth fatherly maner alwayes moderateth rigour thee doth hadle thee thundreth agaynst thee howe canst thou perswade thy selfe shewe thee mercie impossible diuell beares v hand god vseth accustomed rigour agaynst v maketh v conclude wee shall thenceforth haue recourse vntoo must trust euer receyue v fauour much behoueth v marke text wherein iob sayth smitten whirlewinde nowe haue passed way yet wee see god succour neuerthelesse let v wayte like selues furthermore let v marke well iob speaketh heere according affliction hee senselesse god onely thundred vpon also gaue knowledge feele god thundered beene ynough haue ouerwhelmed meane season hee secrete remedie haue sayde therefore let v hope like concerning addeth god hath giuen many wound without cause seemeth rude geere god tormet men sort without cause onely simple vniustice crueltie bee taken iudge worlde rather tyrant seemeth iob blasphemeth god saying hee smitten wounded withoute cause remember hath bene sayd shall know meening hee speaketh holy ghost hath guyded gouerned tung intent shoulde haue instruction might bee much profite iob first sayeth according naturall vnderstanding god smiteth without cause afterwarde moreouer let v marke wordes without cause haue respect apparant ope knowledge men haue told heretofore god iustice knowne two wayes sometimes god punisheth sinnes notorious worldwarde ye see god chastizeth one men haue knowne shameful whoremaster full silthinesse dishonestie men haue knowne blasphemer swearer men haue knowne drunkard ryotter men haue knowne giuen raking extortion vnfaithfulnesse vvell god executeth iustice vpon one man seeth beholde god iudge suffereth crime scape vnpunished also god iustice knowne secrete iudgements wee see god smite torment folke notable fault rather vertues ye shall see sometimes whole citie whole countrie put hauocke yee see put fire swoorde yea euen little babe nothing bee seene innocencie vvell yee see thing seeming straunge cace must glorifie god yea euen though reason thereof bee open vntoo v god shewe v first day suffereth ordeyneth thing may wee dispute aske doth demaunde reason yee see iob ment wordes without cause meening god respect himselfe punish men without cause haue sayde afore vniuste tyrannie hee taketh woordes without cause respect whiche perceyue herein included wee must reuerence god iustice although hidden ouercast darke thicke cloudes yet must wee beleeue nothing right indifferencie although seeming naturall reason wee finde iustice god rather iustice transformed vnrightuousnesse yet must glorifie neuerthelesse thus yee see iob ment saying hee wounded without cause wit man shoulde haue demaunded knowest thou euident cause thy selfe god punisheth thee see none iob handled straunge fashion vvee haue seene howe hee mirrour castaway howe might seeme god minded vtter anger wrath agaynst iob therefore sawe ende god reason knowledge true hee speaketh hypocrisie deede god respect punished iob shoulde say hee wicked man therefore ought punished men vvherefore bycause diuell accuseth neither vprightnesse soundnesse god ment come trial men knowe one god intent punish iobs sinnes like measure offended meane spared many wicked men dealt roughly see iob blasphemeth sayth god woundeth without cause muche woorde ment simply speaketh wit knew speciall cause god punisheth according truth knew none doubt god vse rigour possible agaynst man like angel heauen walked soundnesse perfection say god vtter rigour agaynst yet shoulde hee iust rightuous still yea verely yet without cause true take counsel braine discusse cace commeth owne fleshly vnderstanding wee shall say without cause without inquisition without running heade behoueth v conclude forasmuch god rightuous knoweth doth vvee see cause yet must glorifie lo plight iob addeth god giueth respite take breath feedeth bitternesse iob sheweth besides miserie great excessiue doth also holde still chiefe piece temptation god feedeth bitternesse say filleth wise anguish cannot finde much one little scrappe goodnesse refresh may take courage ye see yet better howe god doth cast seruants euen bottom graue thing ought marke well man v shall finde himselfe sore combered god turneth backe vpon v perceyue haue terrible countenance shewe himselfe angry v ala euen boldest aduenterous quayled see nothing death eye howe shall wee doo yet weake feeble muche therefore doth stande v hande marke well textes wit god onely hath giuen poore creature signe anger also holdeth locked vp woulde take winde drawe breath hope haue little smack fauour alay grieses withal god commeth still increase miserie seeing iob hath bin extremitie therefore whensoeuer meane aduersitie let v prepare selues receyue grieuouser pleaseth god sende vntill haue remedied misery thus ye see haue mark vpo text iob bewrayeth himselfe openly anon saying ye speake strength like vnto god matter must come iustice summon find matter hold plea stoode vpon euen grounde none conclude sayth god consumeth righteous vnrighteous togither two wayes v recouer right men shal haue taken ought v wee go either force way iustice prince mainteyne theyr quarelles bloudshedde priuate persones woulde much might suffered alwayes woulde begin way deedes hardly withhold selues punnishment euer prepared also ordinarie meanes iustice iob taketh thing shold say true find self tormented extremitie yet notwithstanding howe shall withstand god fall violence shall gaine egall match go waye iustice receyue shall take vpon iudge vmper betwixt v whereat shall beginne plea short see god consumeth righteous wicked talke seemeth yet straunge haue set downe howbeeit wee looke well may sort make one thing verie good fit serue turne vvhereas iob sayeth none match god strength holde plea law bicause much comaundement meeneth hereby impute vnto god lawlesse power listeth deale vniustly true ought aske none reason god hand good yet therwithall must hold certaintie god cannot otherwise iust rightfull though see rather flat eotrarie iob taketh ground vpo haue discoursed afore wit god iustice consisteth knowledge wee haue enter intoo man brayne vvherein consisteth selfe wee muste say hath god done well done hath god willed right rightfull fault bee founde howe may bee examine god doings wee shall finde reason cleane awke bee shall wee therevpon acknowledge bee rightuous howe possible touched afore namely god rightuousnesse iustnesse consisteth selfe needeth borrowe allowance let v thinke straunge god requireth confession handes shoulde v assure selues rightuous howe vnindifferent euer seeme dealing pray wit shall mortall men dare say able comprehende measure god rightuousnesse folly asmuch eyesight dimme haue much discerne one foote length afore v yee woulde say let v acknowledge owne measure able beare true eyesight hild within boundes see worlde imagination fancy v nimble runne euery neuerthelesse wee shall haue stied aboue heauens yet shall neuer atteyne high maiestie god certesse seeing cannot abide brightnesse sunne without dazeling eye ala shall attaine highe reach height god rightuousnesse nothing might bee hidde v shoulde passe examination let v marke well iob hath spoken god strength rightuousnesse maner meening aforesayde vse excessiue forme speache vvho shall go lawe god god giue eare insueth god bee full sufficient credite haue men tied vntoo shall speake owne cace let v come backe againe conclusion fond vnreasonable matter yea euen kind god shoulde bee raunged ranke among men rightuous furtherfoorth maketh v priuie shoulde abace himselfe fellow forget himselfe strip himselfe owne godhead good reason god rightuousnesse haue preeminence whereas hee come account v whereas hee yeelde v reason doings yea euen doeth thing contrarie vnderstanding reason yet withstanding wee muste assure selues rightuousnesse continueth whole sounde bicause haue sayd consisteth selfe herevpon iob concludeth god consumeth rightuous vnrightuous nowe sayth meete forasmuche god rightuousnesse surmounteth capacitie man therefore hee shoulde mingle good bad togither one vessell dooth goodnesse proceede vvhy dooth hee know doth auow fauourable god consume good bad alike seme hath rightuousnesse deede ye see also abraham reasoneth eightenth genesis lorde sayth seemely thou shouldest destroy rightuous vnrightuous impossible howe iob speaketh vvee muste alwayes holde ground iob dooth take rightuous vnrightuous found god rightuous wee come hee taketh rightuous vnrightuous according perceyuing ye see man shall bee rightuous say hee shall leade good honest lyfe hee shall walke feare god purenesse soundnesse neighbour yet hee commeth heauenly throne thing wee see must needes bee discouered thus vnderstanding see rightuous vnrightuous perish god striketh well one plage indifferent sayde salomon shall therefore blaspheme god must alwayes beare minde god iustice bee apparant vnto v say shewe openly punishing wicked deliuering good suche haue serued faithfully well wee haue glorifie behalf god iustice knowne v seemeth hee confoundeth togither according imagination hee punishe rightuous vnrightuous togither yet let v therefore ceasse acknowlege confesse rightuous becommeth v glorifie caces respect vvhen take way although thing seme vtterly cofused vnto v yet god giue v suche wisedome wee shall acknowledge nothing done without reason yea thing seemeth presently agaynst v shall turned welfare lo exercise christian herevntoo must wee applie indeuer vntill god haue called v home warres chiefest assault wherewith exercise v wee may giue glorie notwithstanding seeme hee minded thunder downe vpon v nowe lette v fall flat presence good god acknowledgement fault praying make v enter examination sinnes wee shall haue knowne throughly may doubt hath v great aduauntage therevpon humble oure selues great small v confesse selues indetted great iudge mortall life hee handle v roughly wee woulde sende v affliction ouersore contrarie fleshe let v beseech assuage although abate first dash yet neuerthelesse hee alwayes holde v vp strong hande suffer satan inuegle v blasphemie wee may acknowledge rightuousnesse honour vntill hee make v feele goodnesse giuing v full fruition saluation ende wee may onely sende vp sighes beneath also crie vnto open mouth father may please graunt grace onely v also people nation c xxxvj sermon fourth vpon ninth chapter scourge kill hande shall laugh temptation innocent earth giuen hande vvicked hee couereth face iudges vvhere vvho dayes passed svviftly post insomuch haue seene good slipt avvay sooner svvift ship flying eagle say selfe vvill forgette complaint vvill appease vvrath vvill comfort mee afray de misery knovv thou vvilt iudge innocent wee may fare better thys doctrine must call remembrance hath bene sayd heretofore namely howe iobs intent shewe god iustice appeareth alwayes vnto men knowne sayd men may touch finger rather god woorketh straunge fashion seemeth vnto v neither reason indifferencie maketh hotchpotch al thing haue tolde afore god iustice doth sometimes shewe selfe certaine markes v discerne god punish wicked man none v hee thinketh v haue warning example wee bee compelled glorifie according sayde hundreth seuenth psalme god deliuer one calleth vpon hath walked feare say god rightuous hee keepeth one rate doo continually hath secrete iudge ments incomprehensible v insomuche wee cannot bee abashed amazed god shall doo thing seeme bee quite agaynst reason yee see howe iobs meening findeth himselfe amazed bycause god ruleth owne mynde fancie hath another maner workes vtterly vnknowne vntoo v yee see sayeth whip sinyte kill howe shall god laugh temptation good men bycause sentence darke shorte whiche causeth darkenesse hath bene expounded diuers wayes throughly considered right meening namely god ryse vp agaynst wicked howe dooth hee laugh trouble good spake afore witte baldad pretended god vttereth chastizements openly soeuer men haue deserued whensoeuer haue done amisse god punisheth bee short hee seemed saying men alreadie come latter day iudgement iustice set full perfection howbeeit god reserueth many thing yee see god seemeth goueme thing confuzedly day punish sinnes men woulde thinke ende come alreadie would hope lord iesus christ gather v vp needefull v god shoulde leaue many faultes vnpunished also needful good afflicted seeme haue lost labour seruing god let v come iobs wordes scourge sayth doth slea immediately say god make delay correction lift vp hande smite men soone haue sinned vnto euery man according woorthinesse deseruings shoulde laugh affliction good men knowe iustice vprightnesse consist two partes wherof one punishing euil folke releeuing good folke mainteyning rightuous sounde conuersation therefore god punish wicked hee must also contrarie part mainteyne good keepe vnder tuition suffer troubled tormeted bur may feele succour soone crie vnto howbeit see good punished day two lingering paynes life long stead shewing signe hee minded help seemeth god taketh vengeance purposed plunge bottomlesse pit let v conclude hastie punish wicked hand bringeth first brunt poynt men may say one hath done amisse therefore hee must bee punished conuenient two thing ioyned togither reason iob vseth good paule also setteth seconde epistle thessalonian saying belongeth god rightuousnesse punish trouble good giue reliefe rest shall haue bene oppressed wrongfully time one point say cannot separated wit god rightuous minde shewe perfectly world one side must haue eye vpon amisse suffer scape hand make come reckening side good men disquieted haue wrog violence offered must pitie shew hath hand ye see say two thing ought match togither otherwise shoulde one part iustice god iustice shoulde whole perfect vve see iob hath good reason speake yet said lifted vp himselfe maliciously agaynst god haue declared heretofore intent shew god rightuousnesse alwayes apparant must take generall rule soone men haue sinned god hath hand bent punish contrarie part wil first brunt shew preseruer good ridding misery must come poynt bicause god rightuousnesse alwayes knowne vnto v rather shewe v enter time iudgemets behoueth v humble selues whensoeuer vseth maner dealing shal quite contrarie fancy must presume murmur must reuerence great secretes far aboue capacitie vntill time may comprehend hidde v ye see iobs meening true ceassed tormented excessiue passion therefore let v learne hereby behoueth v huble selues god although deale straunge fashio v perceiue nother equitie vprightnesse yet notwithstanding must cast downe eye haue inclination murmur agaynst god doth thing comprehende owne reason specially shew self scourgeth v wee spurred repine saying meeneth doth god pitie lo men wexe wood god handleth otherwise like yet iob fought agaynst temptation let v marke iob knew god rightuous fully perswaded thereof generall came incounter mischief pressed driuen backe inforced chafe agaynst god furthermore restingpoynt wherof haue spoke cofort themselues afflictios must alwayes haue eye rule iob taketh scourged god hand bicause euill doer god punisheth men according desert becometh v taske ordinarie maner proceeding hath iudgements incoprehensible v ye see iob speaketh confirme matter sayth see good pine away god helpeth suffereth continue anguish yeare two yea time life maketh coutenance coming towards poore forlorne folke god leaue good folke maner necessity said whip striketh hand say god hastie punishing men offence sinnes vve see cleane cotrary herevpon gather must thinke selues scaped god hand hauing done neighbour shrewd turne bee ease time let v beware flatter selues whe god beareth v let v vnderstand meanes meeneth draw v repetance abusest thou god pacience sayth paule speaking wilful naughtinesse true god wil haue pitie vpon returne vnto aske forgiuenesse faultes yet doth therfore follow hee cast away scourgeth thys worlde let v marke god punisheth men sone haue done amisse yet followeth therefore acquit shall neuer called account nay rather bicause god giueth v respite returne mercie beseech receiue v mercie therefore see wicked triumph scoffe god yet pressed hande let v misgreeued therat though god giuen vp office longer iudge worlde let v wayte till time come lorde may well delay correction intendeth sende side time may seeme long vnto v yet must restreyne mindes hold short knowing god punish sinnes worlde presently hee knoweth reason good ynoughe hee haue sayde alreadie meening holde v alwayes suspence wee might worship call vpon vntill thing set order good state thus yee see greate store mingling long worlde indureth bicause god intendeth exercize v fayth hope ende wayte comming lorde iesus christ whiche time shall set vp thing full perfectly intermedled touching iob addeth god laugheth temptation innocent speaketh vnderstanding man must imagine god sporteth himselfe affliction good men vve know loue beareth v cannot expresse sufficiently howe tender saying bee vnto apple hys eye let v thinke god cruel towards v laugh torment howbeit imagine none otherwise f esh yea thinke thus selues lord thou knowst miserie wherin cal vpo thee sigh thee feele fraile yet thou lettest alone stil perceyue thou intendest helpe meanes thing considered conclude selues god doth nothing laugh v heauen behoueth v vnderstad faith whe god doth discountenance matter ceasseth haue pitie vpon v true hee sheweth hand neuerthelesse ought suffize v beeing father v loueth v much wish iesus christ sheweth fleshly father euil nature loue child shall god fountaine goodnesse let v thinke god laugheth v lette v rather consider hys discountenauncing matter nothing else exercise v meane time ceasseth watch ouer v succour v maner wee knowe thus much concerning sentence iob addeth earth deliuered intoo hande wicked eye iudges turned aside say suche ought redresse trouble offence misorders committed guiltie sayeth hee effect iob sheweth present life thing shall mingled togyther men shall say knowe white black earth shall deliuered handes wicked say men shal see wicked haue theirfull scope suche vnruly looce lyfe fighter seditious full vngraciousnesse nother vprightnesse humanitie shall haue thing therefore wee see god giue bridle wicked suche sort bee sayde one onely remedie whiche beare warder iustice represse vexe good men fashion contrarywise bee seene giuen themselues lette go hauocke vvhat sayd magistrate ought yeeld euery man right suffer wicked doo worst man shall find reliefe hand shall haue wayted haue dutie purpose idol cause blame sayeth iob god god gouerner earth ought wicked bee rooted else beare lay raynes brydle neck vexe trouble good men without stopping purpose may sayde god doth geere otherside sayd god office gouerne suche holy spirite walke feare modestie moreouer telleth v hath stablished ciuill state world iudges haue nother wisdome discretion hand seing god leaueth magistrats blind idol lazie haue neither courage inclination maynteyne good punish euill bodie blamed god sayd iob true sentence may expounded otherwyse wee must stand vpon diuersitie exposition wee must haue eye onely naturall meening thus ye see effect iob ment say vpon verse wee haue good lesson gather first wee see thing disordered wicked triumph weltring pleasure inioying abundance goodes man gainsaying working excess age without touche brest must consider howe new thing greatly astonished suche temptation good yea needfull v bee armed agaynst suche imagination vvee see howe owne minde driueth v therevnto thing fall according fancie seemeth v al thing turned fortune god regardeth worlde rather hee forsloweth duetie asleepe else regardeth neither good euill lo fancy runne heades restreyned according scripture telleth v wee ought thinke straunge though earth deliuered sort intoo hande wicked sinnes deserue wicked haue full power ouer v wee obeyed god becommeth v certaine thing ruled fashion shoulde bee contented forasmuch bee stubborne god play horse broken looce good reason also giue wicked scope ende might chastized hand vnthankfulnesse deserueth well god shoulde bring forth roddes make v feele al rigour therefore knowne v thinke straunge sight see thing cofounded may say earth deliuered handes wicked wee shoulde sighe comming thereof passe bycause god giueth v warning sinnes verely haue good cause sigh seeing wicked despyzers god must onely defile earth also haue full scope god hath created men owne image put thing hande intent shoulde bee lieutenant behold wicked seeke nothing offende god deface maiestie glorie displace child hath appointed owne heritage vvhen wee see thing thus turned topsitoruie must needes grone must prouoke v pray god vouchsafe set thing againe right state furthermore sayde god hee shutteth eye iudges let v marke howe much say haue administration iustice committed vnto cannot haue minde except giuen aboue man able gouerne himselfe shall gouerne whole realme furthermore matter great preeminence execute god office worlde therefore god must bee fayne worke hath sette high estate authoritie party themselues must bee much earnester calling vpon god may please guide helpe man thinke sufficient abilitie set siege iustice trust owne wisdome power god laugh scorne make blockheade therefore god choozeth must humble themselues much presume vpo thing selues must craue spirite wisedome spirite stoutnesse spirit vprightnesse god may giue power abilitie discharge duty faythfully thus yee see howe magistrate ought betake themselues vntoo god care feare also vnder muste v parte doo like bee iustice among v beholde curse god vpon v lande muste bee defyled farre tyll god poure hys vttermoste wrath vpon v meane wee oure selues muste bothe suffer see good men suffer none maynteyned ought seeing welfare whole realme god giueth spirite prince magistrate men law v cal vpon suffer blinded vnable discerne aught blockishe though saw euil doings comitted like must sewe grace goodnesse god may please graunt spirite vnto magistrate must wee also pray giue v strength stoutnesse wee may bee heart wee see thing go amisse wee see go much yea euill worse magistrate stead rising vp see neede beeing readie hande mainteine right knowing theselues bee ordeyned god purpose fauour mainteyne euill let v assure selues god hath forsaken thereby sheweth hee hath withdrawne himselfe v bycause wee bee worthie haue sit among v hath promised doo among conformable vnto thus ye see fruite disobedience sinnes god shall suffer ciuill order bee ouerthrowne among v thing may bee confounded wee haue well deserued wee see suche trouble confuzion among v let v assure selues god punisheth v taketh away al discretion vnderstanding iudges sort bicause hee hath striken spirite giddynesse sayde scripture yet must wee murmure agaynst god assuring selues hee dooth thing without cause although wee cannot perceyue iob meeneth saying shewe haue sought reason muche euill done worlde wee must euermore come vnto god scripture sayeth god dooth good euill meeneth thing proceede whether bee prosperitie aduersitie lyfe death light darkenesse sayde prophete esay insomuche whatsoeuer diuell doth haue sayde afore whatsoeuer wicked sorte doo attempt wee muste take hande god vnlesse hee gaue brydle coulde attempt thing whatsoeuer deuised coulde neuer bring passe fayre martyring man self leaue god seke inferiour meanes belongeth god gouern soueraine dominion ouer creature would go wrecke although men seeke nothing rebell yet doth serue turne spite teeth iob ment vtter saying vvhe happeneth mischiefe let men search saying hath done true euill happeneth well skill make discourse seeke ground beneath bee countrey king prince reigneth tyrannically men say beholde king fleeceth deuoureth people moreouer maketh none accout ministring iustice hath officer like himselfe seeke intrappe men ouerturned order seene none shift realme muste come vtter decay blamed complaint shall heard herevpon marked men togither frowarde naughtie haue prouoked god wrath agaynst bee folke giuen lewdnesse despizers god looce life poyntes respect shoulde seeme desirous kindle fire god wrath burne vp men may well alledge lewdnesse gouerners nation misordered maner yet must mount vp higher let v thinke god asleepe heauen hath forgotten worlde rather let v assure selues hee worketh owne hande sinnes people cause officer men law wicked cause god also fayne shake make mirrours wrath vengeance let v cosider inferiour cause meanes may neuerthelesse perceyue reason vnderstanding god abydeth continually soueraine dominion may know thing come yet notwithstanding wee shall alwayes knowe cause god worketh vvhen wee shall haue searched vttermost made great circuites discourse end shall dazled see reason god doth vvhat bee done wee must honour iustice god vnknowne v true sometimes god worketh wise iustice fully apparant men may see eye sometimes also hidden cace haue honour say ala lorde thy iudgements bottomlesse pit wherevnto wee bee able attaine yet wee ceasse confesse thou art righteous although wee perceyue reason howbeit must surmyze men well practized scripture thing done bylowe god sufferance without caring medling much cut power one asleepe heauen left ruling worlde beneath eyther satan men say vtter defacing god maiestie meete shoulde order hee hath made shoulde proceede good disposition true hath beene sayde see alwayes howe god rightuous yet muste wee acknowledge bee wee muste walke sobernesse modestie ende god make v knowe hidden v nowe let v come iob addeth sayeth dayes gone away swiftly poste shippe vnder sayle therefore also flying woorde sette downe expresse better iob speaketh greate ship full fraughted little pinnesse may serue make sporte pastime vpon water turneth nimbly goeth away apace therefore hee likeneth life little pinnesse light glydeth swiftly vpon water withall hee compareth also poste finally aegle soreth ayre seeke hir pray heere iob sheweth howe sore hee caryed away passion pleased holy ghost president bee gyuen v intent euery v shoulde persone iob beholde maye happen himselfe fare wee god scourgeth v lo temptation driue v despayre whiche wee forgette gracious goodnesse god hath done v wee coulde bethinke v benefites wee haue receyued god hande haue seene iob say heretofore certain would make v forget sorrowes vvell god doth nowe smyte mee haue receyued muche good hande hee hath shewed himselfe bountifull towardes mee ende alwayes taste mercie shoulde trust flee therevnto refuge wee cannot eate one bit breade witnesse vnto v god goodnesse alwayes father sauiour beholde heere inestimable remedie sweeten sorrowes whensoeuer wee bee afflicted calling minde benefites gracious giftes wee haue receyued god hand satan seeth well vseth cleane contrarie policie whiche make v forget good god hath doone v bestowed vpon v ende wee might haue nothing v anguish set v fretting might nothing bitternesse nothing might cheere v comfort v trouble iob sheweth v nowe dayes sayeth hee slipt away like little pinnesse go swiftly vppon water else eagle flying ayre lackey goeth poste hereby hee dooth v witte hee remembreth howe god caused borne worlde giuen many token fatherly loue might well haue wherewith comfort himselfe yea regard consideration requisite true iob kept alwayes still taste god goodnesse neuer despayre verely although tormented tossed fro yet alwayes vnderstanding still hilde awe hee knewe god bee rightuous also wayted bee deliuered misery wee see temptation behoueth euery v haue eye behold deede although god shewe v fauour make v taste continually goodnesse yet notwithstanding know sufficiently fully wel loueth v rather hee trouble v wee quite forget good hee hath done v seeming wee neuer receyued benefite hande nowe sith wee see suche temptation befell vntoo iob muche behoueth v bee fenced blowe come let v take warning say oft god shall send v trouble let v thinke thus yea god neuer doo mee good good lost hee bestowed vpon mee beare minde purpose shall serue mee procure double punishmentes mine vnthankfulnesse lo wee haue marke forasmuch life ouerbrickle let euery v inforce himselfe thinke vpon gracious goodnesse benefites god wee fall aduersitie wee must runne remedie pray vnto god strengthen v withholde v murmuring agaynst yea whatsoeuer tribulation wee driuen indure fully assuring selues wee church body lord iesus christ wee must bee made like vnto image glory prepared v aboue heauen ynough recompence tribulation wee indure worlde bethinking thing serue well asswage oure sorrowes finally iob concludeth hee say hee forget complaint refreshe himselfe sayde greefe torment hee cannot vvhy sayeth hee afrayde bycause know thou wilt leaue mee vnpunished thou wilt holde mee giltlesse effect iobs meening sentence forasmuch hath god finde releefe aduersitie heauinesse although purpose yea inforce himselfe bring passe yet dooth god holde shet vp cannot haue reste himselfe notable sentence haue earst seene heretofore haue doo men may still haue startingholes wee may slink aside couert say find meane shift selfe suche man hand although hee lion gape open mouth deuour yet maye still scape haue deale men may still finde scapingplace god shew aduersarie holde v staues ende make v say beholde god punisheth mee behold god troubleth may peraduenture writh selues hither thither make fetch worlde yet wee haue styed aboue cloudes oure skill god still higher higher aboue v go bottome deepes hand well reache thither v passe ouer sea hand shall stretch yet farre therfore let v learne knowe muste seeke startingholes wee haue god muste appeare cyteth v wee shall gayne nothing delaying also let v learne flatter oure selues woont behold vse wherevnto doctrine ought serue v see hypocrisie men come right forth afore god without dissimulation discouer oure harte meete hee shoulde searche v quicke cannnot hide thing ought doo therefore peace god let v beware vse none fonde toyes wherwith woont beguyle selues let v walk feare carefulnesse let v pray please scourge v maye bee suche measure maketh v feele displeasure wee may ceasse taste goodnesse may serue v asswage sorrowes may doubt hand v deliuer v shall perceyue welfare profit yea eue bicause haue called vpon thus ye see sort ought put lesson vre residue god willing shall bee discoursed morrow let v cast selues maiestie good god acknowledgemet fault praying make v feele suche wise wee may instructed lowlinesse yea euen glorifie tribulation beeing well assured wee haue deserued hundred thousand tymes mo misery sendeth v specially may know holdeth v vp spareth v continually euen fatherly goodnesse intent therfore may leade v glorifie magnifie walke feare vntill suche time hauing withdrawen v quyte trouble hinderance hold v backe nowe hee make v attaine knowledge thing deepe v yet let v pray guyde v suche wise holy spirite wee may honour secretes till hee giue v full sight make v feele experience hath bene father sauiour wee shall haue obeyed true child may please graut grace v also people nation earth c xxxvij sermon fift vpon ninth chapter sermon treateth still vpon xxvij xxviij verse vpon followe bee vvicked vvhy labour vaine vvashe selfe cleare vvater make handes pure cleane thou vvilt plundge mee myre mine ovvne clothes shall defile mee hee man might beebolde ansvvere vvee might go lavve togither vvho vmper vvill put hande betvvixt v let take rod avvay mee let fraye mee vvill speake bee afraide holde mee still bicause haue begonne alreadie expound sentence iob sayeth hee hath reste bicause god pursueth reason whereof hee dismayde aduersities wee suffer trouble men handes wee may find meanes resist wee knowe god v ye shall see v incombred may well seeke remedy wee shall finde none till god one v bicause bene layde iobs charge ment iustifie god bene tolde gaine nothing addeth vvell wicked trouble selfe vayne heere iob pleadeth giltie howbeit suche wise freendes tolde spake effect enemy vvhy intended haue hild condemned caytife despizer god castaway howbeit iob grau teth hee sayeth hee offender ment god secrete iudgement shoulde bee entered hee shoulde say haue fayre pleading cace shall haue iustified lyfe afore men yet shall alwaies condemned afore god hee list enter rigour agaynst mee wee must alwayes turne backe againe grounde wee haue spoken heeretofore wit god may well allow v shall haue serued honoured yet notwithstanding hee shall bring v secrete iustice whiche rule rightuousnesse whiche hee standeth accepteth wee shall nothing euer v must needes vtterly defaced requireth larger declaration otherwise bee vnderstoode truely according rule god hath giuen v law mortall wight found rightuous perfect loue required say wee loue god hart neighbour oure selues forsomuch wee fayle loue towards god charitie towards neighbour condemned god lawe heere wee see paule alledging text cursed persourmeth thing conteyned law concludeth thervpon rightuousnesse among men hope saluation rest vpon workes vvhy doth follow bicause transgressor law cursed therfore men yea verely bee found whiche haue walked according god law meane full perfection haue missed one poynt giltie bicause iames sayeth hee hath forbidde murther hath also forbidden steale vvhe wee shall haue offended god maiestie haue wrought agaynst rightuousnesse muste wee needes come shorte rightuousnesse marke speciall poynte god enter intoo account v according rule conteyned lawe hee shall finde muche one rightuous man whole worlde yet notwithstanding meane whyle walke feare god howbeit owne nature howe fayre shewe soeuer wee make certaine till god gouerne v spirite holinesse men perceyue v hypocrisie vntruth god touche harte write lawe within shall obey howbeit throughly perfect soundnesse wee may come boldely god bee acquit neuerthelesse greate diuersitie betweene despizers god faythfull although faythfull man haue manye infirmity cannot walke right fayne would yet notwithstanding hee hath desire serue god laboreth inforceth himselfe wheras faithlesse taketh scorne goodnesse casting god making none account giuen owne sensualitie wee see may called rightuous deserue accepted god finding perfect rightuousnesse men neyther sayde god beholding may go lawe haue deserued well hand cannot find fault life speake another rightuousnesse whiche god accepteth owne free goodnesse wee speake rightuousnesse halfe one whiche maye bee rightly codemned howbeit condemned bicause god imputeth fault imperfection faithfull one iob doth tearme himselfe wicked man maner lawlesse awelesse person ye shall see whoremoger shall giue filthinesse mocke god full ye shall see cruell man giuen extortion yee shall see blasphemer swearer maner men wicked conuersation naughtinesse farre oute square ought good right hold accursed iob graunteth himselfe one lyed wee shall see heereafter hee protesteth himselfe haue bene fosterer fatherlesse succourer widowes eye blinde bearer vp feeble weake bee short hee angelicall soundnesse bee copared men sense doth codemne himselfe wicked man sentece doth hypocrisie sayde afore bicause enter secrete iustice god must needes bee cast shall well alledge lord thy hade haue receyued grace yeelding self thy seruice although haue walked perfectly ought yet notwithstanding marke amed haue applied mine indeuer way minde none haue giuen selfe wholly therevnto true blame worthie many thing howbeit haue shruke away fro thee time iob might well haue protested al sayd rigorous iustice must needes haue mouth shet although men maye well shewe themselues haue desire well yet nothing worth thus yee see iob ment sentence therfore let v marke well whosoeuer wee shall haue fayre shew meane men euen angel heauen although haue labored serue god without dissimulation yet ynough iustifie v vvhy enter accounte god rightuousnesse wee haue must needes wash away come naught sainct paule speaking charge onely whole life sayeth hath ought whereat coscience may repine might bee blamed iustly yet notwithstanding woulde iustifie himselfe place speaketh one thing namely hee preached gospell good zeale yet confesseth shall iustified god finde fault ynowe wist paule speaking office apostleship stoode vpon poynt bicause knewe well god coulde condemne many thing vnknowen himselfe shall wee come examination whole lyfe shall god shall enter action v one matter matter yea euen oure woordes thoughtes alonely oure woorkes neuerthelesse wee muste alwayes come backe poynte namely iob speaketh alonely rigour lawe whiche vnable bee borne serueth ouerwhelme v euery whit v also mounteth yet higher sayde iustice whiche vnknowen vntoo v notwithstanding hee addeth vvhy laboure vaine thereby hee sheweth himselfe haue excessiue passion hee yeeldeth wholly vntoo certayne hee hath resisted hee speaketh affection fleshe saying verie well yeelde selfe giltie confesse sinner confesse wicked take payne purpose god persecutes mee heere thoughe condemne selfe yet neuer eased meete god shoulde ouerwhelme mee firste blowe vvhy wiped oute worlde dooth god take pleasure holde mee long pyning seeyng acknowledge selfe woorthie bee condemned woulde hee haue lo howe iob speaketh heere man rage haue tolde heeretoofore although faithfull doo fight agaynste temptation yet mysse bee shaken feele assault wote bee thing whiche iob confesseth verely hee prouoked herevnto temptation galled though hee gone make part good god addeth immediatly conteyneth certayne declaration hee sayeth washe selfe water make selfe throughly cleane god shall caste mee myre shall bee plunged filthinesse insomuch mine owne apparell shall defile mee say shall haue clensed selfe well cleanenesse mine whiche present beareth goodly shewe shall bee dung filth asore god heere iob continueth still matter shewe wee haue well examined lyfe shall bee founde oure fearing god obeying proceeded wholly grace hee gaue v yet dooyng nothing muste alwayes beare minde god maiestie hydden v maiestie certaine rightfulnesse comprehend true god hath well giuen v paterne image rightfulnesse lawe howbeit according capacitie behoueth v know reason grosse cannot mount high conceyue perfectly god verye rightuousnesse whiche conteyned god lawe rightuousnesse bounded within measure man capacitie vvee doo rightlye call perfect rightuousnesse may name yea scripture tearmeth perfect rightuousnesse ebeit respect v saye respect creature meene respect v wee bee sinner wee cursed adam respect v god creature yea take away difficultie euen respect angelles rightuousnesse rightuousnesse angelles men ought yeelde vntoo god obeying pleasing yea euen much bee creature yet another higher rightuousnesse god saye perfect ryghtuousnesse wherevntoo wee bee able attayne neyther wee bee able come whitte neere vntill wee bee made like vnto haue function glorie hid v yet wee see glasse darkely shall wee bee farre thing wee bee thus yee see iob telleth v though hee washe himselfe yet shall hee bee founde vncleane neuerthelesse although speake vvater snowe yet notwithstanding resemblance hee meeneth cleannesse men according sayde washe handes innocencie vvhen dauid spake hee eye ceremonie lawe forsomuche god men make themselues cleane came temple pray reason bicause wee bee sullyed full filte therfore behoueth v bee made cleane wee present selues god howe may bee done water bee spirituall washing soules muste wee take ceremonie lawe figure thing must selues wit wee muste renounce lewde affection haue pure cleane hart must renounce wicked work dedicate member serue god perfectly washing wherof iob speaketh short saying hee inforce serue god yea euen wise hee shoulde become white snow yet god finde somwhat worthie blame hee plundge mee sayth behold heere straunge maner speaking god shoulde plundge myre howe propertie god put soyle v know hee fountaine holinesse yea wee full filthinesse wee flee helpe bee purged made cleane vvherefore iob sayeth god plundge myre meening god discouer vncleannesse whiche perceyued afore howe hee discouer onelie lawe true onelye lawe god ynoughe condemne men haue sayde afore heere yee see lawe called message death namely bicause haue doctrine conteyned lawe wee shall bee vtterly ouer whelmed afore god wee shall bee caste away without remedie god indite v according forme lawe shall discouer filthinesse ynoughe v iob steppeth yet wit although sayde purenesse according lawe say althoughe wee perfourmed euer god commaundeth impossible men doo yet wee stande let v put cace iob angell hee able go godwarde according rightuousnesse lawe yet shoulde hee alwayes finde himselfe behinde hande respect secrete rightfulnesse god sayde verie angelles able stande afore hee listed enter reckening iob therefore sentence meeneth euen hee shall bee pure pure may bee meene according rightuousnesse lawe shall dung filth commeth afore god behold heere lesson ought make flesh stoupe shall haue weyed well thing conteyned therein true ordinarie doctrine holye scripture men looke vppon themselues see whether haue fulfilled god lawe shall finde themselues condemned beholde say wherevnto holy scripiure bringeth v backe wherefore wee know pride hypocrisie v vvee bee proude stoupe god except compelled oure lorde presse v secrete rightfulnesse whereof mention made heere thing bee wee play horse broken looce wee set vp horne dosse agaynst god wee see vnbeleeuers doo blaspheme full mouthe althoughe bee conuicted theyr owne conscience reprooueth knowe say themselues yet notwithstanding mouthe still open rayle god grudge spite theyr pleasure therefore requisite god shoulde haue way condemne v peculiar nature abate pride hypocrisie v heere yee see god bringeth v lawe telleth v vtterly forlorne hee shoulde saye well see euerye sootheth himselfe standeth muche owne conceyte yee cannot brought reason made submit selues sewe agaynste selfe gyue looking glasse lawe woulde haue euery one beholde himselfe looke whether yee fayre come wee lawe god euery man see owne filthinesse whereas earst seeming nothing life welfare wonderfull stuffe v nowe wee bee starke dead sainct paule speaketh yea verely wee vnderstande god lawe wee ought doo many haue vayle still theyr eye beare themselues hande haue serued god well long lawe layde asyde thinke themselues haue performed full yet neuer came neere suche folke haue scarffe theyr eye wee consider god lawe shall finde nothing filthinesse iniquitie v yee see wherfore god toucheth v suche maner beholde yet higher meening sentence according also iob speaketh perfecter sorte wit neuer righteousnesse lawe shall bee able stande afore god hee liste deale rigorously v heere man might caste doubt saye god condemne men shall haue perfourmed hee commaundeth appoynteth matter god hee may surely hee let suffize v wee haue ruled life well according god lawe shall bee accepted rightuous certaine sayde hee dooth thing shall liue promise deceyue v vntruth howsoeuer cace stand alwayes sure grounde wee shall haue obeyed god lawe full atteyned sayde purenesse greate required whiche impossible thing mortall men doo yet notwithstanding god needeth content himselfe except list say finde perfectnesse himselfe bring shal bee nothing yet doth sayde afore iob mente saying god plundge myre whe shall haue washed himselfe say god finde meanes shake mee wretched vnperfite creature although haue giuen minde purenesse life might bee ruled lawe ordinance woorkes might good holy yet notwithstanding sayde purenesse shall bee filth god rightfulnesse passe vpon haue sayde alreadie present lesson ought well astonishe v though pure angelles yet wee able stande grace god farre forth hee vpholdeth v creature withoute vsing rigour agaynst v hee listed handle v wee deserue howe god may ouerwhelme like angel ala cause shoulde auaunce selues seeing drink sinne fishe sucketh water according sayde selfe booke seeing ceasse go agaynst rule hee hath giuen v seeing wee perceyue one condemnation hundred thousand yea infinite number condemnation v ala shall become man pride hereby wee see rage rather furie hath bin still popedome alledging owne merites wretched folke puffed vp pryde weene themselues able purchase paradise amisse anye poynt haue meanes theyr owne recompence god haue satisfaction haue theyr woorkes ouerplusse supererogation terme payment discharge theselues god deuill muste needes haue witched men could beare themselues hand able binde god thir work let v wey well doctrine way let v represse affection hold shorte wee come poynt iob hee rested vpon poynt bene blasphemie hee confesseth himselfe haue beene tempted haue beene prouoked say go god man might bee bolde answere might go lawe togither body might take vpon bee vmper betwixt v woulde speake freely bee afrayde god woulde gyue leaue holde plea suffer iudge set ouer v coulde talke boldly beholde right daungerous temptation sayde afore iob concluded therevpon himselfe beene cursed blasphemie therefore sheweth tossed temptation howbeit withstood may happen also shall bee trouble time vnto man vnderstanding verie straunge thing wee shall haue kept god lawe say possible bee doone yet wee shall bee discharged men haue alwayes replie cace least lament state make moane saying possible god shoulde deale rygorously v oure fulfilling lawe shoulde bee nothing woorth men haue cace whiche themselues shall thinke bee verie worthie fauour shall seeme bee worldewarde wee bee egged sort wee muste holde selues awe learne know god rightfulnesse wee cannot comprehende nowe hidden v intent shoulde honor wee haue two wayes magnifie god one according maner manifesting himselfe vntoo v yee see howe god dooth lawe shewe himselfe iudge condemne v gospell hee sheweth himselfe father acquit v say commaundeth v thing good rightuous therewithall threatneth v haue fayled thing wee muste accursed god sheweth himselfe maner wee haue wherefore glorifie acknowledge hee rightuous howesoeuer cace stande wee perishe yet haue wee cause grudge agayne god call v himselfe offering v grace oure lorde iesus christ shewing hee desireth nothing one v ye see yet greater cause glorifie rightuousnesse forasmuche hee hath pulled v oute hell reached v hande yee see howe wee muste glorifie god double wise hee vttereth himselfe vntoo v woorde muche sayde woorke vvhen god beareth v hys mercie let v vnderstand coulde thunder downe vpon v speciall fauour hee doth againe chastizeth v offence purpose drawe v repentance see yee howe ministreth many cause sing prayses vnto yes verelye inasmuche god sheweth himselfe bee good rightuous wyse well woorde workes wee haue wherefore glorifie haue wee done wee must mount yet higher wit muste glorifie god though hee hide himselfe v shewe himselfe v neyther rightuousnesse goodnesse anye thing whiche mighte cause v saye sayde glory due vnto example vvhen scripture speaketh v election hee choozeth whome hee lyketh casteth awaye residue hee disposeth mankinde owne pleasure likewise scourgeth good seaueth oppressed wee see thing confounded worlde caces god hydeth himselfe say sheweth himselfe vsafter fashion reason may able take holde rightfulnesse goodnesse power wisedome yet must yeeld due glorie thus yee see haue marke vpon streyne may well correct beate backe temptation wherof iob speaketh hee sayeth let god go law mee giue leaue plead boldely ala shall wee bee able bring oure matter passe haue touched afore iob ment expresse tempted repine god wise hee resisted incounter euen must bicause haue sayde alreadie although god shoulde giue v sayde libertie pleading yet wee confounded iob yll remember bicause mind bewrapped anguish wist hee sayd perfect man set forth v mirrour pacience incumbred become v much behooueth v marke well sayde witte god vtter himselfe v must glorifie hide himselfe wee muste reuerence secretes whiche incomprehensible v muste euery way haue mouth shut say might reason matter preuayle cace wee shall somtimes see scripture god sayth come let v pleade togither according sayde prophet esay beholde contented bee iudge betwixt v see whither caces beste ende sayeth god stoppe mouthes wicked folke full rancour agaynste thought themselues haue gotten gole men allowed yea sayeth lorde ende yee alledge vse tyrannicall power agaynst yee bee oppressed withoute cause reason come wayes contented mustered ranke among men bee taken creature forgo mine owne right souereine dominion maiestie mee contented present cace ye shall haue regard none geere yet yee shall bee condemned neuerthelesse ye see god well contented enter account v speaketh agaynste despizers spite vtterly rebellious agaynste shall finde ynough condemne among sort dooth iob put himselfe among haue bin desirous serue god haue walked vnder obedience lawe yea verely howbeit hee deceyueth himselfe much man perfect whome god findeth muche faultinesse euen selfe rule gyueth v law way haue another poynt marke iob sheweth v howe sinnes hee committed cause god handleth roughly true poynt iob grosse headed hee knewe well ynough hee found faulty god life examined lawe iob might know well ynough true greefe caryed away became good blinde howsoeuer world went yet knew well god shall euermore find giltinesse vvhy doth say speake boldely hee turneth talke accused present discourse rather agaynst men agaynst matter iob spoken without aduersarie would haue sayde ala confesse selfe indetted vnto god although possible might quite clere dette according law say although able discharge duty ful yet bee fayne make recourse meere goodnesse lo iob woulde haue spoken forasmuche layde charge hee punished offence sake hee beene dispyzer god hee sayeth durste bee bolde pleade respect saying durste bee bolde pleade true haue sayde caried away pafsions howbeit forasmuche hath eye aduersarie party hee meeneth none otherwise wee haue declared alreadie thus much meening streyne let v consider howe wee may profite oure selues haue tolde heeretofore wee haue done euer god commandeth v whiche impossible man doo yet cace suche hee still finde meane condemne v yea yet shall hee himselfe continue rightuous vvhat haue wee doo onelye humble oure selues furthermore lette v learne knowe god vseth double goodnesse towardes v hee giueth v lawe also plucketh v damnation wherinto casteth v yee see saye one poynte god goodnesse hee speaketh familiarlie vntoo men say go owe nothing bee indetted bounde vnto mee much woorth deale thinke good yet meane shall say vnto pay v asmuch yee bee mine good reason euer haue bee dedicated mee neuerthelesse beare farre bee contented fulfill lawe giue euerlasting life rewarde notwithstanding mighte requite youre hande oute recompence seeing god speaketh thus lawe yee see greate goodnesse alreadie rightuousnesse whiche hee requireth handes bee required pure creature suche angelles heauen respect bee oure owne nature nowe sinfull corrupted wee muste alwayes beare well minde seeing god hath spoken wee shoulde v bee confounded damned hee goeth setteth mercie v otherewise wee shoulde abyde accursed notwithstanding wee perfourmed thing conteyned lawe howbeeit forasmuche oure good god holdeth v vp notwithstanding haue bothe wayes doone amisse thing whiche draweth v curse lawe let v remember god dooth well giue v cause come vntoo pleade iustifie case mouthes must bee stopped acknowledge selues meanes indetted vnto verely euen owne mother wit e doth v vnderstande must needes bee condemned yea thoughe hee speake one worde yet ynough wee haue sayde iudgement ingrauen within v v cannot leastwise ought bee owne iudge owne hypocrisie letted v know owne conscience must spyte teeth reproue v lo heere speciall poynt furthermore steade vmpers heare matter debated let v seeke iesus christ may vmper take vp matter let v desire haue iudge lay hande vpon v let v beseech may meanes attonemet betwene v maiestie ye see god estraunged separated v cause sinnes sayeth prophete esay god dwelleth v power howe haue wee beeing moouing lyfe howe haue wee continuance reason power spred throughe thing yet wee ceasse bee separated sinnes iniquity vvhat must wee doo vvhat remayneth iesus christ put himselfe betwixte v iesus christe muste bee fayne bee oure daysman passe iudgement vppon maiestie god sette god barre v bee meane reconcile v vnto god draw v heade knit v wife vnto god wee may one scripture speaketh herevpon let v learne humble selues say lord come vnto thee pleade presume vpon thing v owne person bicause thou art fauourable v bicause thou art willing receyue v thy sonne iesus christes sake thing whereof vaunte selues wee must continue confounded respect selues forasmuch pleaseth thee make v feele thine infinite goodnesse thou hast set forth thine onely sonne lorde iesus christ whome thou gauest death sake wee nowe doubt thou wilt receyue v notwithstanding wee bee vnworthie let v fall downe maiestie good god acknowledgemente innumerable sinnes ceasse commit dayly beseeching forasmuche wee bee full filthinesse infection may please purge v rid v spttes specially correct hypocrisie vnto bee much giuen ende misliking fault offence haue committed heeretofore may desire nothing somuch returne vnto true repentance assuring oure selues shall fayle get pardon hande leastwise well come true soundnesse hearte praying moreouer gouerne v suche wise holy spirite although wee bee full many infirmity bee manye wayes defiled yet may please receyue v vse rigour extremity towardes v may please graunt grace onely v also people nation earth c xxxviij sermon first vpon tenth chapter soule cut lyfe vvill leaue complaynte vpon selfe vvill speake bitternesse vvill say god condemne mee shevve mee vvhy thou pleadest agaynst mee good thee doo mee vvrong caste avvay vvorke thine ovvne handes cleere deuice vvicked hast thou eye fleshe lookest thou maner men thy dayes dayes men thy yeares yeares mortall man thou shou dest serche mine iniquitie make inquirie sinne thing spoken iob may well bee spoken euery v farrefoorth bee good holy prayer made vnto god allowe first wee bee pressed anguish wee may well say shall get good aduaucing ourselues god going lawe secondly may desire make v feele oure sinnes cheefe condemnation hee shall pronounce vpon v shall boote whit oure saluation except wee bee touched ouerthrowne selues man muste become owne iudge condemne himselfe bee quit god hande also may well marke shewes added immediatly witte reason god shoulde giue wicked shorte occasion like theyr blasphemy lewde dealing othersyde hee earthlye creature hee shoulde bee desyrous reuenge himselfe finally wee bee woorke handes lastly may well saye hee neede put men racke boulte oute misdeedes knowne vntoo wee may well vse woordes reported heere good sorte wee see howe iob vttereth passion hee caryed away hee resisted haue declared asore yet gathered meane hee cobred first brunt confesseth suche bitternesse although gayne nothing yet could strengthen himselfe complayntes rather giue theyr full scope hebrew woorde put signifieth bothe leaue let looce also fortifie strengthen therefore let v marke well iob speaketh heere man ouerfull passion neuerthelesse hee knoweth nature god restreyneth himselfe neither laboureth make cace good accusing god contrariwise confesseth hee amazed witte men say therfore resorteth praying vnto god hee condemne hee shoulde shewe wherefore hee goeth law bring downe poynt make perceyue reason hee indureth let v go matter woorde woorde sayeth soule cut life hebrew worde signifieth oftentimes mislyke say soule wearie life lothe liue longer truer meening say soule cut life although alyue yet notwithstanding hee confesseth state euen good deade behold sayeth lyfe lyfe lyue death thus yee see meening hereby hee confesseth himselfe past hope yea verely respect god handling hee still hope god howbeeit truste therevnto behoued go owne person poynt whiche wee ought marke throughlye wee looke vppon oure presente state wee doo wee shoulde bee vtterlie ouerthrowen proofe heereof althoughe man bee ease yet hath hee continuance beare oute inconueniences lyfe hee looke vppon owne frayltie hee beseeged hundred deathes hee hath shadowe lyfe speciallie god scourgeth v sheweth himselfe oure aduersarie shoulde seeme hee thunder vpon v one side consider oure sinnes syde haue eye perfect highe rightuousnesse whiche god certayne wee cannot conceyue hope saluation oure selues notwithstanding suffer themselues bee ouercome suche temptation doo well shewe themselues bee ouerdull say haue suche feeling god iudgement ought haue whosoeuer touched rightlye quicke shall feele himselfe hell hee bethinketh sinnes speciallye god summon seate make feele howe gyltie hee nought tolde iob confesseth himselfe bee paste hope yea verely respect himselfe neuerthelater hee tasted god mercie fatherlye loue wherevntoo hee alwayes recourse thing whereby hee susteyned ouercame greate temptation v also like wee haue considered oure sinnes bee sory wee must herken sweete amyable voyce whereby god calleth v himselfe promiseth saluation life angel onely able shew themselues rightuous man worlde bee shet lyfe saluation god declareth fauorable sinner vtterly cast downe themselues know become yee see howe selues selues must seke comfort whe haue sorowed sight sinnes wee feele trouble see nothing hell open v swallow v vp must wee lift vp eye aloft looke vpon inestimable goodnesse god whereby hee willing call v saluation notwithstanding wee bee good damned alreadie thus ye see haue note vpon first place wheras iob sayeth seeing hee take leaue talke himselfe vpon himselfe therin declareth meeneth bewray passion wherwith turmoyled whiche themselues euill damnable neuerthelesse iob intended lay foorth end men might know oppressed heauinesse yea euen heauinesse hee saw remedie fayne make moane frayle man holye ghost yet foresight ment iob bee prophet teacher vnto v giue v warning oure affection behoueth men know themselues warned infirmity may take heede themselues brydle theselues somuche let themselues liberty shall keepe neither meane measure lo howe wee ought applie lesson oure instruction neuerthelesse behoueth v marke well speeche iob sayeth hee take libertie make complayntes agaynste himselfe hee shoulde saye knowe shall gayne nothing standing contention god yee see preface whiche vseth importeth profitable lesson men opinion shall discharge themselues well ynoughe maye frette grudge agaynste god heere yee see wherein wicked comforte themselues beholde wyll seeme well eased theyr burthen haue spewed blasphemy vttered theyr impatience yet booteth nothing make theyr cace muche woorse wee haue thing ouerlodeth v well wee caste grounde wee bee vnburthened true haue greate burthen vpon shoulder betwixt myne armes woulde caste vpon myne heade make greate striuing doo nexte waye breake necke haue gayned euen v wee pleade god one wee woulde hoyse vp burthen vpon heade muste needes fall vpon thing wee doo whiche waye soeuer wee flee shall lyghte vppon v vvee see men doo nought destroye themselues vomite spewe vp theyr murmuring blasphemy fashion agaynst god thus yee perceyue sayde lesson greatly oure profite true god woulde haue v vse homelinesse vnburthening selues intoo lappe manner proceeding therein verye diuerse sayde psalmes many place holy scripture manner wee shoulde consider god prouide forasmuch office gouerne world well remedie needes giue v releefe ouerfore oppressed lo howe wee may lay care greefes god lap take charge whereby shall eased yea wee come prayer supplication haue heauinesse greefe nippeth v let v say well lorde thee succoure thy faithfull seruants pyne payne come hither knowing shall become thou pitie therefore wee shall haue requested god sort shall haue yeelded v recorde hath bene deafe desire sure hath heard good discharge god commeth still v receyueth burthe deliuer vnto harden themselues pryde puffed vp caried away impaciencie bend themselues agaynst god man would shoote arrow heauen must needes fall backe vppon owne heade man shoulde cast vp stone light vpon owne pate also therfore make complayntes let v well aduised done lowlinesse yea rest wholly vppon god prouidence grounding selues vppon goodnesse fatherly loue whych hath shewed v going vntoo prayer supplication shall vnburthened god prouide thinke amende cace grudging casting foorth bitter talke certayne thereby shall bring selues worse plight wee afore yee see haue consider vpon text iob confesseth giue excessiue passion head must needes rebounde backe vppon himselfe hymselfe meane season hee declareth hys intent lift vp himselfe god acknowledge complayntes hee shoulde make came greefe hee indured aduersitie therefore let v acknowledge faultes yet haue acknowledged wee muste also seeke remedie wee perceyue oure fleshe vnable beare affliction god sendeth v let v runne vntoo hath spirit strength yea himselfe deale abrode suche haue neede nowe men knowe infirmity haue doo behold god telleth hee able helpe strengthen seeing wee warned oure disease go wee phisition seemeth moste men sufficient discharge say true haue sinned man fleshe bloude neyther yron steele misfortune happen vnto must needes feele true meane whertoo serue warninges giuen v holy scripture serue shewe god warneth v sinnes hee would haue v bee sorie euerie v hate himselfe seeing himselfe bee one againe wherto serue promise also hee addeth make v come streyte vntoo praying performe v wee may doubt readye succour v whensoeuer hee seeth v dryuen necessitie yee see thing haue doo onely acknowledge faultes also come vnto god may amende goodnesse grace holy spirite iob sayth hee crie vnto god saying condemne mee shew mee wherefore thou pleadest heere iob speaketh still man troubled wittes loth god proceede sayde secrete hidden rightfulnesse whereof treated yesterday woulde haue god examine ordinarie manner sayde afore god hath giuen v sure rule lawe intreated according offence beholde god rightuousnesse set foorth inditement giuen v layd afore v writing insomuch see article proued v yea well proued suffize cast v therfore men scourged god hande sinnes see law onely sentence condemnation also whole inditement matter layde foorth poynt poynt fayne cast heades intoo bosomes howbeit forsomuch god scourgeth iob ordinarie manner graunted satan leaue trouble therefore iob sayth condemne till thou hast first commenced thyne action sayde bycause god secret iustice straunge v knowe wit cannot attaine therevnto alwayes desirous knowe reason god worketh would haue accountable v whe god scourgeth v letteth v know wherfore therevpon amazed angrie god rightuous must doth needes ruled reason vprightnesse yes see rather flat contrary see men puffed vp pleade god make discourse within themselues yea euen discourse hartburning sumishnesse thus yee see iob seeketh sentence yet god able shewe hym playnly yea say make perceyue rightuous euer bene good reason bee chastized sinnes wherfore doth make protestation hee seemeth beare men hand case good god would chastize rule law rather hath respect purpose god confesse vnfaynedly sinner although god good reason punish greeuously yet notwithstanding hee punish sinnes sake proofe thereof saw many wicked folke world spared whylest punished owne part always indeuered serue god vttermost power vvherefore hee scourged bycause god speciall co sideration ye see iob pretendeth heere witte obteyne god handle ordinarie manner ende make perceyue sinnes heerewithall haue apply thys present lesson owne instruction stad v great stead applying pray god shew v wherfore entreth processe v calleth v iudgement without al chastizements endure purpose according see greater part world doo harden selues god vvee see god scourge beate great small deede euery man crieth ala wretched world better adayes meane season repentance auaile al chastizements semeth men haue cospired withstand god beate backe blowes insomuch god giue neuer great stroke hammer see hart stythes farre fro softning rather harden vvherof commeth bycause want wisdome discretion know god pleadeth v profitable petition v desire god simply condemne v rather make v vnderstand wherein guiltie enlighten v holy spirit may enter examining oure owne conscience haue well considered sinnes may mourne haue intent returne vnto yeeld selues confounded may haue pitie vpon v lo heere speciall poynt besides yet another second request god punishing v may bee oppresse v vtterly wil deale v sort wee may haue leysure bethinke v sinnes present request differeth vvhy god shoulde come great headie violece first brunt might vtterly dismaid wold become v vve shuld haue stomacke acknowledge ala god iudge yet neuer ceasseth father still miserable offender condemned dulled drawen gallowes like blocke wood vnable receiue comfort though offered euen ye see taking god doth sayd horrible extremitie begin shew himselfe v hand conceiue eternall death whiche combersome v ouerwhelmeth v suche darknesse wee haue much one little sparke good comfort come vnto vve possessed fearfulnesse haue witte saye ala god yet giue thou space repentance thy silly poore creature presenteth himselfe thee therefore wee haue greate neede returne vnto god example iob praying indite v condemne v say deale mildly v may haue respite bethinke selues heere ye see ieremy likewise sayth lord chastize thou howbeit measure sayth welynough god listed deale rigorously v vtterly ouerwhelmed past recouerie therefore beseecheth god chastize hym measure say chastizement may tempered moderated wise hee may reade quietly examin fault sorie therevpon may also take hart returne vntoo god hope forgiuenesse hand ye see behoueth v necessarie v doo see god scourge continually sent abrode whole world cause mischeefe whiche haue shewed already witte bycause men cosider god scourgeth beateth fashion agayne see men besotted presumptuousnesse yea foolish rage thinke themselues alwayes able iustifie themselues god seeing pride deepely rooted nature ought much prouoked make said petition haue spoken witte god shew v wherefore sueth v say hee make v feele sinnes suche manner might driuen willingly confesse selues guiltie afterward bee taught returne vntoo yet whensoeuer shall please god shew men wherefore hee pleadeth man hath enditement throughly framed already euen rightuousest man vppon earth say euen according rule lawe god needeth bring v high iustice incomprehensible v looke vppon owne life one side otherside considering god law requireth comparing work rule god hath lent v shall bee driuen vtter confusion vvherefore presume much vpon work vpon theyr vertues vpon merites bycause neuer knew god iustice whereof commeth thys hypocrisie popedome men shall preache free merit satisfaction set vp bristle suche wise beare themselues hande may come perking god yea preace thither lyke shamelesse strumpet full filth vncleannesse yet notwithstanding preache theyr owne merites beare themselues hand haue done amisse well quit themselues againe satisfaction whereof commeth pride bycause neuer rightly cited sayd iudgement seate feele guiltie therefore lette v marke well wee desire god shewe v wherefore hee pleadeth v iustifying quitting selues must bee marke wee must shoote rather must yeeld ourselues giltie may receyued mercie behold onely remedie left v desire god pitie v bycause wee part bring nothing owne confusion thus ye see haue marke streine way iob addeth good thee wrong cast away worke thy handes make determination wicked shine pleasure thee priuie cousell wicked heere iob speaketh nature god euen intet obtayn request haue touched heretofore god suffereth v vse suche manner speeche come vnto witte hee giueth v leaue speake familiarly neuerthelesse muste bee done lowlinesse god freendlie abace selfe intent wee alledge set farre giue v boldnesse ouershoote ourselues come scornefully disdayne end sorrow ouerwhelme v suche sort able take breath bee hope god wil regard v thus ye see meane wee haue find easement shall seeme wee vtterly vndone respect selues ceasse lay open oure hart familiarly vntoo god make moane vnto little child get father seeing giueth v leane ye see faith god childre may well stablished pride ouerweening true lowlinesse let v come iob sayeth shalt thou gayne thing mee wrong casting away worke thy hand goddes righteousnesse tried like men led affection vvhereof commeth men wrong harme anoyance guile malice neighboure bycause profiteth selues vvherefore iudge bribed vvherfore hee oppresse good men support wicked men vvill led credite fauoure bycause seemeth profit win good person else auege self none thing fasten vpon god vve see righteousnesse proued one parte god scourgeth men doth hee bend selfe enemy hee addresseth selfe creature worke hand hath created fashioned v vvil destroy hath made therefore behoueth v conclude god cannot vse eyther wrong crueltie towardes v cannot vse wrong verely bycause requireth thing men hand due conuicted thereof although malicious stubborne yet haue alwayes respect vnto true ouerbold naughtinesse giue themselues wholly vnto thinke vpon god notwithstanding haue said euen nature imprinteth alwayes vnderstanding men know commoditie profite extorcion wrong neighbour men euill themselues euill owne profite god fountayne goodnesse rule righte bee moued v harme punishe v wrongfullye without hauing profite wee see heere one proofe god righteousnesse agayne manifest vse crueltie v workemanship inasmuch hath fashioned v certayne therefore forsomuch workmanship destroy v without cause vve see workman hath made peece worke wold haue fame preserued still god hath put v thys world record power righteousnesse goodnesse wisdome vvill hee destroy v without cause doctrine greatly behoofe able applye well instruction yea satan tempt v assayes offended god say vsed ouergreat rigoure towardes v hee vnrighteous must haue stay say wretched creature whome bendest thou thy selfe imaginest thou thy god doth thee wrong possible hym thou art full sinne thou art full malice craftinesse deceit yet notwithstanding thou hast eye thine owne profite whe thou dost man harme thou anoy impeach man thy selfe another man losse hindrance thy god gayne thing thee vvilt thou make copartner thine vnrighteousnesse sinne consider thus farre certayne shall horribly afrayde treate sort god righteousnesse meanes bring question furthermore consider selues say god hath set thee world hath spred graciouse gift great treasure goodnesse vppon thee whiche thou marke thy body thou shalte haue matter ynough rauish thee wondering must thou needes bee vnsensible yea possessed diuell thou shalt charge thy god crueltie hath shewed selfe gentle louing towards thee yee see howe wee must practize lesson may haue skill profite ourselues saying added yet practized nothing rife v pacience wee see wicked despizers god ruffe though world make triumphes skorning god gospell v professe god afflicteth church ye see wicked triumph thinke haue wonne goale seemeth god fauoreth afterward ther commeth trouble thing go cleane backward whereas ought confirmed number faithfull shall increase whereas ought stregthned faith al goodnesse see many whiche made pretence beleeue gospel slip head coller become muche wicked outrageous open enemy vve see thing also whereof hope shall amed better greeueth v say god suffereth geere seemeth minded aduaunce wicked heere hee willing open theyr mouthes may spew blasphemy hym seemeth altogither agaynste v pleasure haue v vexed made laughingstocke men wil god cleere deuises wicked vvill hee take part bee partner corruption filthinesse lo geere may runne oure head much therefore behoueth v fenced temptation according iob setteth downe twayne thys sentence one side
