hee confesseth came thus hys imagination seemeth god taketh wicked mennes part hath made compact giue much boldnesse iob confesseth thys temptation came head howbeit withstoode confesseth impossible god shoulde vtterly euill bycause naturally hateth otherwise fayne denye himselfe forsomuch god iudge worlde hee muste needes hate vnrightuousnesse vvherefore let v assure selues neuer cleere intent wicked say neuer shewe himselfe allow vvhat exercise pacience meane therefore let v armed stumblingblocks vvhen wee see wicked enemy truth take occasion skoffe god v reason thing confounded world let v say well yet god side end must confouded pride behoueth v looke behold tyme darknesse lorde iesus christ termeth ciuell hath libertie mischeefe wicked haue reynes bridle looce theyr necke sayeth kingdome reigne darknesse thing confounded dark god wil chace away darknesse gyue v light length according haue certayne promis let v tary quiet conclude impossible god shoulde fauour deuises wicked howsoeuer hee seeme dissemble matter meane towards v therefore must bee pacient end time conuenient shewe v wee haue bene deceyued wayting leysure lo haue note concerning text touching iob addeth wit whither god haue eye man hath else whither tyme bee tyme mortall man shewe god needeth make long inquest v hee say lord thou knowest thing yea present thee creation worlde therefore thou needest vse ordinarie course earthly iudges make long process whyle hold offender vpon racke bycause ignorance thou haste neede wherefore handlest thou rigorously iob speaketh well god nature hee concludeth ill bewrayeth excessiue passion sayd afore cheefe point consider apply lesson owne vse vvhereas iob desyreth eased bycause god hath eye mortall man let v vnderstand god scourgeth v doeth boult certaintie aught vnknowen concealed make v vnderstad vvhy doth god suffer v pine away processe time seing make cleane riddance v first blowe doth end bethinke selues better heere iob contrary hymselfe vvherein see mennes passion diuers oftentimes speake themselues eue see waues sea breake one another violence euen passion contrary repugnant one another v vve see awhit would shore vp eye shoulde find suche contrariousnesse selues wee speake one one thing another another behold happened vnto iob sayd euen condemne shewe wherefore thou sewest vvell god ment shew side knew howbeit sayeth hee pressed ouerfore hee pacience continually haue sayd perfect requisite whensoeuer oft shal happen smitten god hand soone scaped one wo wee enter another wee continue lingering paine see end misery thinke plucke one foote myre sinketh let v aknowledge god afflicteth v bycause hee taketh pleasure profit aduauntage bycause draw v meane let make v thinke affliction sweete amiable seeing wee perceyue tend saluation welfare wise let v hart scourgeth v diuers way hath giuen v one stripe turne agayne strike v twyce thrice let v say well lord seing pleaseth thee hold v vpon racke suffer v rooted naughtinesse shoulde grind teethe thee though conuicted sinnes make v come right meekenesse sue thy mercie may find thee fauorable pitifull towards v behold say ought bycause haue none accesse god lorde iesus christ let v repayre vnto praying put v redinesse may receyued hande although must fayne indure many trouble misery present life yet beare paciently let v doubt shall turne welfare serue v sted salues mediciues let v present selues maiestie good god aknowledging innumerable fault giltie sight praying hath made v perceiue also withdrawe v gouerne v holy spirit may fight wise temptation flesh world haue ouercome may come triumph glory prepared v heauen let v say almghtie god c xxxix sermon second vpon tenth chapter thou knovvest cannot vvickedly man deliuer thy hande thy handes haue made mee haue fashyoned vvholly round doost thou destroy remember thou haste made clay thou shalt bring mee dust agayne haste thou poured like milke hast thou set mee togither like cheese haste thou clothed mee vvith skin fleshe knit mee togither vvith bone sinevves thou hast giuen life grace thy visitation hath preserued soule thinges haste thou hidden thee yet notvvithstanding knovve vvith thee haue sinned thou vvilt imprison mee thou vvilt suffer scape vnpunished haue done misse vvo mee haue bin righteouse yet shall lift vp head seeing filled vvith shame knovving mine affliction iob going forwarde whyche declared yesterday telleth god heere hee needeth make inquisition manner earthly iudges vvhy thou knowest saith euill man deliuer thy band men haue offender warde afrayd least worse hee done afore escape specially laboure reuenge themselues past cause men fayne kill whome hope amendment afterwarde iob sayeth god vvherefore thou knowest sayeth euill thou knowest although thou deliuer punishmente alwayes subiect thee whensoeuer pleaseth thee thou canst bring agayne wretched plight wherein seeing prouoke thee put mee many torment haue sayd already request may well made vnto god al lowlinesse stand contention though wee wold blame handling v rigorously else alledge reason owne behalfe iustifie oure cace withall vvhen come manner settled purpose mind say ala lord respect thy selfe know thou proceedest maner men leade thee thou knowest thou knowest hearte againe thine owne power bridle though wickeddest caitif world yet coulde escape shall gayne striuing thee dust poore mortall creature lo heere speciall poynt moreouer thou blowe vpon shall right nought al lord know therefore conclude thou art led fleshly affection thou scourgest vvhat remayneth make feele thy goodnesse vvhen bee well assured god rightfulnesse therewithal haue full purpose incline selues stedfast trust let v imagin heareth v shewe v mercie thus ye see wee may vse iobs talke hath sayd addeth thy hand haue made haue fashioned wholly round aboute yet wilt thou destroy heere returneth declared yesterday matter hath bin touched afore nowe confirmeth new againe without cause matter ought comfort v greatly god vse rigoure towards v doth crueltie vvhy hath regard owne worke thing made therefore oft god striketh v wee must alwayes thinke thus vvel made selfe god lifteth selfe vp straunge thing worke owne hand sith becommeth say hee hath good reason deale thus cruell certaine acknowledgeth owne worke god doth man might say loke vpon selfe behold selfe men glasse without cause looked vpon made found good man principall worke excellentest creature hys vtter thing put small portion heauen earth liuing wight somuch man termed little worlde wherein see many wonderfull thing man must needes astonied sith wee must alwayes beleeue god beholding hys owne woorkmanship v moued inclined doo v good mainteyne v know attributed holy scripture namely hee preserueth hath made bringeth thyng perfection hath begonne seeing cace hee hath vsed singular fauoure towards v doubt continue end see matter say considering god made v ought stand v great stead wee applye good vse heere yee see also iob maketh larger discourse verse saith lord wilt thou deuoure signifieth hebrew word translate wilte thou destroy seeing thou hast fashioned wholly round hee meeneth fault bee found one may well make goodly peece worke shall perfectly polished alike throughout part wherein hath vsed like cunning man make peece fayre tapistrie ther shall outside bewtifull eye sight shal altogither il fauored man see hee polished top toe ther one orderly workmanship thoroughout yea according order nature ther exception taken euen tippes nayles iob therfore ment expresse infinite wisdome god vttereth selfe shape man sayde lord wilt thou destroy excellent work wherein man may see thy wisdome thy power inestimable goodnesse thy glory vvilt thou take pleasure defacing thine owne glory appeereth shineth men see meening howbeit hee addeth haue touched witte god hath made clay shall bring dust agayne say lord thy workmanship taken remaine beginning mire earth true none adam god made earth heereby yesee whence haue firste beginning vve must v come backe thither vvhe bethinke v whence men come whereof made wit earth let v assure ourselues verified vpon v al general seing god hath made v earth let take away hath put v say let hym withdraw power wisdome goodnesse whiche hee hath shed vppon v wee must needes retourne whence wee came cace standing doth god destroy v much deface owne glory yes without reason destroyeth wicked vnrighteouse bycause much could haue blotted image printed nature deede moyses declareth god sorie saw men corrupted fashion behold sayth god repented euer made man chaungeablenesse god repent well foreseene al thing world made moyses sheweth god misliketh men bee peruerted turned away soundnesse rightuousnesse whiche hee put heereby see god doeth alwayes acknowledge workmanship men howbeit therewithall hee doeth alwayes vtterly mislike sinne proceedeth cabe fathered vpon iob addeth hast thou powred like milke heere hee speaketh mannes begetting whiche wonderfull thing whereat oure wittes confounded say mannes seede shoulde ingender liuing wight wight polished shoulde appeere suche orderly disposition might rauish men mynds make astonished ought god magnified therein difference betweene originall man making cheeze wee see milke set togither curded folke make cheeze say liuing creature creature beareth image god creature well framed shall proceede groundworke begetting men forsomuch seemeth bee likelyhode man bee formed mannes eede much seene god intent glorified therein therefore let v bee rauished say lord workman art thou men compacted manner dung filthinesse yet notwithstanding become excellent thing wee looke vppon man wee muste needes abasshed whither whereof commeth shamefull thing suche one men loth speake ye see god hath abaced v begetting hee haue power ryghtuousnesse wisdome better knowne thereby lo iob hath vttered heere cause addeth lord thou hast clothed flesh skin thing proceede mannes seede nothyng infection filthinesse yet notwithstanding behold skin behold flesh beholde sinewes come thereof whych thing whereat world may amazed seeyng god hath packed many miracle togither one body sheweth v faire liuely image maiestie haue wee cause say lord heere thing farre passe witte reason iob hath spoken man begetting addeth well thou hast giuen mee life grace thy visitation hath preserued soule heerein sheweth god thought ynough haue fashioned mother womb haue gyuen excellent shape besides sayeth thou hast giuen life grace thys word lyfe meeneth liuelinesse power soule body selfe hath mouing dead thing thou therefore lord hast quickened saye shape body cheefe thing ought magnified thy worke true euen may see thy woonderfull power wisdome soule yet passeth heerewithall soule hath common life suche brute beast whose soule hath power feele mouse eate drinke go come outwards sens man also reason vnderstanding truth see number thing mind man doeth comprehend lo iob matcheth word life worde grace meening thereby brute beast parttakers life men men dignitie farre greater much value successiuely declareth god continuer thereof thy visitation sayeth thy looking hath preserued soule god hath set v good state yet continue vnlesse haue hand alwayes reached ouer v vvhat done wee may continue state wherein stablished god must faine breath power intoo v without ceassing continually hand v thus ye see iob vseth thys woord visitation looking say lord thou lookest vpon mee fatherly eye certayne shoulde vndoone euery minute houre thou lookest mee continually thou knowest needes thou prouidest lo preserued maynteyned end hee addeth although thing hidden thee thou keepest thyne owne minde yet know well thee iob say lord knowe thing hygh cannot reach yet notwithstanding needes must haue ame knowe thee say haue perfect knowledge requisite yet neuerthelesse knowe haue taste part whiche suffizeth make conclude thou haste layde foorthe greate treasure thy wisdome goodnesse power mee impossible mee value esteeme deserue see thou handlest mee vnhappie thou haste shet mee heere prizon shall neuer able get looke vppon trouble wherein thou haste set bycause see end behold abashed although rightuouse yet durst looke vp excuze selfe thee vtterly barred plea like iudge admit allegation barreth partie plea must partie need condemned notwithstanding replication euen mee sayeth iob see although perceyue selfe faultie yet notwithstanding thou hast punished greeuously spoken respect excessiue hartgreefe whereof haue treated yet neuerthelesse acknowledgeth therewithal come sayd rightfulnesse god incomprehensible vnto v woulde thinke straunge handled true hee could conceyue thing owne natural vnderstanding yet neuerthelesse shall haue considered thing well hee must needes resist sayde temptation yee see effect touched wee haue consider beare minde iob declareth heere concerning creation men concerning god grace whereby mainteyned state marke speciall poynt hee sayeth god hath created v clay must e brought dust agayne shall haue withdrawen grace spred vpon v muste teach v lowelinesse wee see men set muche themselues euery one v could find hart aduanced aboue cloudes vvhy knowes selfe well setteth little himselfe men desyre purchace estimation shet eye forget themselues passe consider bee state wonder loue well beguile ourselues yet neuerthelesse muche must wee marke lesson bringeth v backe point wee woulde come good witte knowing god tooke v myre dirt behold let men go vaunt themselues say haue worthinesse vertue yet must faine end knowe dirt myre wil serue make v itoupe must returne state againe god leaue v hope resurrection speake owne nature say euer woorthy bee made account body building mud haue liuelinesse v nowe soothly greennesse grasse prophet esay sayeth vve florish awhyle florishing fadeth hand looke order nature death dispatcheth euer worthinesse men much returneth myre dirt earth sith cace standeth let v learne record lesson oftentymes may shrinke horne puffed vp vayne ouerweening men take selues bee beholden vnto god wee haue hold hym doo homage without lifting ourselues vp wee bewray villanouse vnthankfulnesse v take vpon v honour belongs god vsurp thing wherein haue part let v fully resolued namely know whence came whither wee must returne thing meetly common selfe howbeit forasmuch practize slightly therefore holy scripture speaketh often furthermore parte also let v learne consider god infinite goodnesse towards v better haue done bycause defyled looke vpon metall men made vpon shape giue compare one giue greater glosse whiche god hath put god made v substance sunne starres made heauenly substance take men truly wee might haue cause say beginning honorable thereby grace god also somewhat disgraced bethinke dirt myre regard behold thing importeth reproche men scarse vouchsafe cast eye vpon myre wee haue dirt hanging v yea euen vpon hem garment wee defyled haue hand cannot abide haue face mislikes v worst yet wholly clay vve haue much one rag garment heele hoze peece shoesoles clay wee nothing else dirt myre within without yet notwithstanding come considering wonderfull woorkmanship god hath put intoo v haue sayd already therein haue occasion acknowledge god goodnesse power wisdome much better cleerelyer ye see whe men behold whence came ought cast head vtterly abace themselues againe considering state degree honoure god hath aduaunced ought rauished vntoo wondering magnifying god acknowledging themselues muche bounde hauing taken base despyzed kind matter hath notwithstanding put intoo preciouse hygh noble grace force euen spyte teethe muste needes confesse behold god vttereth himselfe full oft think vpon selues let two thing come remembraunce namely matter made may rid v pride bereeue v loftinesse also woorkmanship god hath put v end may better know much beholden indetted lette euery v crye ala lord wee bee able comprehend hundredth part benefit thou bestowest vpon v thus ye see haue remember first place herevpon behoueth v also consider iob addeth sayeth thou hast poured like milke thou hast fashioned like cheese setting togither thou hast clothed skinne bone truely phraze speeche seemeth somewhat straunge first blush holy ghost fitter thing say better kind speech expresse begetting men thinges seeme answerable agreeable maiestie god nought iob speaketh haue sayde heeretofore men must abased neuer loth else would alwayes puffed vp pryde could neuer come co sideration whiche notwithstanding needefull thinke god hath put intoo v would become v withdraw grace quite separate himselfe v men neuer come farre force therefore behoueth v bee brought myre dirt spoken heere true suttle say weene themselues wise owne brayne wyll take exception heere manner speech seeming would haue wished ye aske philosopher wil speake another fashion god knew could edifie v best matter standeth vppon disputing suttle scholepoynts vpon making v philosopher vppon lerning much bound vnto god vpon exercysing selues two pointes haue touched one side wee bee ashamed selues owne abasshed beholding owne nature side bee rauished knowledge god goodnesse grace making v suche wee bee goodly excellent woorkmanship say thing wherevnto behoueth v apply indeuer curious inquiring peecemeale cause reason meanes begetting men wit attayne verely philosopher disputed thing sayd god working begetting men must needes extraordinarie apparant reason take perfect excellent worke man body thing bace selfe although philosopher say well haue thing nature must begin corruptio yet notwithstanding ye see fayre beginning cleane contrary mannes reason true god shewe euen wisest shal graueled come beholding work neuerthelesse god graunteth philosopher meane vewe consider many thing shal vnderstood common people vnlearned sort god meening call v schoole vvhat ment shewe thing auaylable saluation shuld first know selues mettal made secondly respect workmanship v wee shoulde behold shape god hath giuen v glorifie withall end none v nother great small learned ignorant simple haue excuse god treated thing ouercunningly great clearks would haue surmised atteyned suche knowledge owne study reason greate discretion aboue men god setteth downe thing heere sense needeth descanting vppon afterward great speculation vnlearned myght say neuer went schoole needeth greate learning skill vnderstand sayde heere yee see greate clearks shall blame worthy perceyue thing ignorantest person ought knowe also haue gone schole shal haue excuse cloke themselues withall bycause thing god setteth downe ought knowne v thus ye see ought inure ourselues speech whiche holy ghoste vseth heere mouth iob sayeth god hath clothed man skin flesh knit togither bone sinewes serueth expresse better hath bene sayd afore wit difference betwene seede man see mannes body ye see seede filth corruption ye see flesh liuely ye see skin sinewes bone let v consider little manner workmanship men skinnes heathen forced say suche knew soueraine godhead might conuicted thereof euen one nayle man without going ye see nayles superfluouse body yet notwithstanding wee looke well vppon nayles shall see wonderfull workmanship serue arme finger may put worke hold whatsoeuer necessary bowing finger therefore certayne mannes nayle superfluitie lookingglasse god prouidence v wee may perceyue hath wrought suche wise v vnpossible v knowe hundredth part woorkmanship hee hath put v ye see vttered namelye greate oddes betweene seede whereof men begotten thing seene mannes body yet cheefe thing soule cause hee sayeth thou haste clothed mee hereby iob meeneth cheefe part men consisteth shape seene eye dwelleth within importeth manner speeche ment saying thou haste clothed mee must needes guest lodged bodie guest soule vvee see cheefe part men soule god hath put excellent woorkmanship body wee must need astonied thought surmounteth farre higher muche greater woorthinesse beholde degree whiche wee haue remember although manner speeche whereby god meant teache veriest idiot bee rude grosse yet notwithstanding see thing still able moue v throughly set whole mynd vppon though sharpestwitted finestheaded worlde yet iob expresseth excellencie woorthinesse soule sayeth thou haste giuen mee life grace thy visitation hath preserued soule vvhen hee sayeth thou haste gyuen mee life sheweth body nothing though haue goodly wonderfull woorkmanship liuelinesse shed forsomuch god hath quickened v therin hath vttered great goodnesse ought glorifie therein acknowledge ourselues bound vnto beyond measure true wee haue muche v common life mouing much selfe let v behold brute beastes great matter say beholde beaste shall come seede saye corruption although haue man meane euen touching bodie yet hathe god put mouingnesse vvee see nourishment beastes haue eaten grasse turneth bloud milke fleshe afterward beastes bee killed feede v likewise vvhen behold thing euen verie beastlife man may terme beare witnesse god excellent power wisedome much men life cause iob sayeth expresly god giuen life grace heereby doth v wit life men matched vnderstanding reason therefore saide first chapter saint iohn life lighte men vvhen iohn declareth thinges quickened worde god sayde externall wisedome whiche god welspring life power hee sheweth men haue onely life eate drinke sayeth hee also light shining worde light hee meeneth image god imprinted v bycause wee haue vnderstanding reason bycause wee discerne betweene good euill bycause men borne haue order common societie amog themselues euerie man hath conscience tell euill good yee see howe god hath graunted men prerogatiue whiche onely hee hath giuen life also inlightned myndes wise iudge discerne yea take holde eternall life wee consider well men certeine wee shall wonder nothing whereat shall astonied reason god hath put v ye see man heare thing neuer sawe hee conceiueth mynd vvhen men looke aforehand vnto thinges come compare wyth thing past commit vnto memorie againe anye thing read reported also iudge thus see god hath indued men grace bee valewed sufficiently therefore let v learne consider well god hath giuen v shall haue cause ynough glorifie yea wee shall neede passe selues heere also yee see saint paule goodly sermon hee made citie athens sayth men neede go farre learne knowe god sayth hee haue life mouing wee blinde let v fall groping grope handes poore blinde man doth darke although see nothing yet gropeth thereafter taketh way therefore wee bee blinde sayth saint paule yet may wee grope god workes much hath giuen v wit reason wee bee vtterly vnexcusable wee make grace auailable mention made heere conclusion wee must also marke well howe iob sayeth heere thy visstation lord hath preserued soule hitherto hee hath spoken whiche wee may see creation begetting vvhen v begotten doth myre shewe self say full infection filthinesse therewithall appeereth also sayde workmanship god hath put respecte body soule god preserued v wee needes perishe euerie minute houre sayde psalme lorde thou sendest forth thy spirit thing renewed thou withdrawest thinges goe wrecke decay god must bee sayne mainteine v looke vnto v bee alwayes hande v otherwyse vtterly vndoone beholde heere poynt well worth weying namely visitation god looking soules soules spoken precisely name vvhy sayde lord thy visitation preserueth body bodye shall goe graue first brunt euen bicause thou mainteinest thy power beene sayd bene muche farre without comparison iob speaketh soule seemeth vnto v soule hath self power quicken body giue liuelynesse partly true behoueth v vnderstand moreouer soules immortall power nother life inclosed themselues though roote vvhere life god farre forth god putteth drop sparke life mennes soules farre forth haue liuelynesse otherwise thus yee see wee haue marke vpon streyne specially let v hearken holie ghoste meant expresse worde visitation god mainteineth v continually looketh v preserue v else goe wrecke philosopher well say god hathe created fashyoned v wee haue beeing therewithall opinion god hath set v race euery man guydeth gouerneth himselfe lo howe deface goodnesse power god vntoo loudnesse men inclyned muche standeth v hande marke well word visitation importeth much saye god hath put v worlde hee letteth v alone say walke yee euery one ye abideth v continually hath hande alwayes stretched breathe power v intent miscarie therefore seeing wee continue except haue eye alwayes vpon v visite v loke v wee muste learne rule life wyse euermore presence much assureth v god infinite goodnesse whiche hee sheweth towardes v let make v walke feare magnifie yeelde due praise nowe let v cast selues downe face good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v perceiue better wee may sorie greeued wee alwayes seeke remedie reforming holie spirite like hath created v mortall men make v member lord iesus christ may repayred image loke hee hathe put v nature hee hath put v grace whiche surmounteth specially seeing hath voutsaued make v new creature inherite heauenly kingdome let v beseech onely continue good hath begonne v also increase till bee come full perfection meane time beare infirmity although guiltie yet condemne v rigoure recciue v childre accordingly hath voutsaued adopte v name meane oure lorde iesus christ may please c xl sermon third vpon tenth chapter sermon yet still vpon xiiij xv verse vpon falloweth let increase come thou lyon shevve thy selfe maruelous vpon mee thou renevvest thy plague againste mee thy vvrath increaseth mee svvoorde chaunge multitude vpon mee yesterday sawe god preserueth v state wherin hathe set v ynough haue created v first haue giuen v liuelinesse hee must fayne continue also acknowledged respecte present life much reason god bee praysed renewing v infinite goodnesse repayring image v leading v hande vntill time haue finished course behoueth worke greater power behalfe order nature therefore let v learne magnifie god gracio u giftes wise perceiue let v marke well iob hauing felt god bestowed many benefites vpon ceassed greeued fayne bewraye excessiue passion may muche befall v wee shall haue mynded god goodnesse becommeth v gracious giftes dealeth v dayly haue declared heretofore true remedie assuage misery feele howe bountifull god vnto v rich goodnesse poureth vpon v know throughly ynough remedie temptation sort may able take courage call vpon euen wee shall bee hell well iob knowe thing howe bee affliction great terrible ouermastered therefore let v bethinke ourselues well let v marke god punish v vnthankfulnesse make accout benefit dayly bestoweth vpon v shall neede great tribulation ouerthrow v shall bee dispatched hande soone feele little aduersitie proofe let v come iob addeth haue sinned sayth hee thou wilt imprison thou wilt let goe vnpunished saye lorde thou holdest mee vpon acke hee matcheth imprisonment sodaine punishment god myght lay vpon bee easier abyde leastwise owne seeming vvee knowe present harmes greeuousest beare hee indureth bitter colde could finde heart bee broyled heate hote desireth extreme colde iob pressed suche violence hande god seemed bee hope recouerie would fayne god haue killed hand might haue pyned longer like wretched offender condemned seeth cannot escape yet let alone vnexecuted misery encreased hee feareth bee put torture hee shall charged newe matter day day iob beeing cace complayneth god persecuteth sayth hee ought take oute worlde without anye adoo heereby wee admonished god moderate roddes hee myndeth chastize fault exercise pacience dismayde sted profiting vnder correction shall nothing else storme shall nothing turmoyling rebelliousnesse v iob pacient yet fayled make great broyle though bene minded stand defiance god infirmitie driuen therevnto god preserued grace holie spirite sith cace standeth let v marke well standeth v hande praye vnto god whensoeuer shall minded chastize v trie pacience may pleasehim vse myldenesse towardes v may learne chiefly knowe hande profite selues thereby bee caried away oure ouerheadie affection although god suffer v tossed fro owne flesh carrie v awaye yet neuerthelesse may please succour v may haue wherewith sence oure selues wee giue head affection meane whyle let v hart feele turmoyling selues though see v wee skirmishing againste god vnpossible v returne vnto yeelde selues vnder obeysaunce vvee see heere happened vnto iob therefore let v call vpon able set v vp agayne vtterly ouerthrowne thus ye see haue marke streyne nowe let v come well head bee wicked saith iob wo bee rightuous yet maye lifte vp heade seeing trouble beeing fil reproche iob goeth forth matter haue expounded alreadie heeretofore considereth wicked lawe god shall condemne rightuous yet rightuousnesse aboue whereby shall misse condemned thing well knowne maruell although god haue told v law damned thing manyfest selfe yet shall wee hardly finde one hundred whiche commeth poynt hipocrisie hindreth v blindfoldeth eye yea vtterly blyndeth v wee knowe ought best knowne familiar vnto v beholde sainte paule confesseth although bin trayned vp childhood lawe god one order companie doctor great reputation yet notwithstanding hee vnderstood meening god law flattered himselfe puffed vp pryde supposing himselfe rightuouse liued saith hee saye hee thought himselfe rightuous god ouerliking owne merites bycause hee power enter owne heart saye god hath giuen v lawe euery man view himselfe men might knowe howe nothing vnrighte ousnesse ashamed thereof saint paule come farre forward man bene trained vp god lawe therewithall lyued blamelesse life neuerthelesse dazeled pryde shall come v vvhat shall become suche haue care thinke vppon god vpon worde spred theyr vice leade law lesse life shal become vaunte themselues yet haue cause according day see monkes hypocrite chaplaines papacie see whole rable superstitious cloysterers whiche haue gaye deuotions yet meane whyle shall bee whorehunters drunkard full crueltie othersome full treason enuie ceasse recken themselues rightuous haue merites sell depart vnto folkes therefore wee must thinke straunge seeing saint paule abused behalfe heereby yee may see grosse hypocrisie men wonder howe god pacient beare long doth condemnation god setteth oute vnto v lawe bee vnknowne vnto v howe attaine conceiuing iustice higher straunger sayde vnto v thou shalt loue god thy heart thy mynd thy strength thy neighboure thy selfe man confesseth bee good reason keepe rule verie nature teacheth v wee bee created ende wee mainteine common societie hath ordeyned among mankynde thing ought commonly knowne euen vnto little child let v come comparing oure life whiche god commaundeth lawe shall finde euerie one v guiltie owne part come farre short performing god appoynteth v wee able performe one poynt euen much thinke good saith saint paule able thinke good thought finde ouermuch experience vvhen haue made comparison yet continue dull still vvhich v feeleth himselfe wounded deadly wounde saye ala must bee fayne come god hee must bee iudge haue nothing alledge must bee driuen confesse conuicted vvho thinketh thus man although men haue doone deede bee condemned blamed yet notwithstanding ceasse giltie much sayde vnto v thou shalt lust god hath forbidden v bee murtherers theeues whoremonger blasphemer rebel word hath also forbidden v consent euill vvho euer shall caste aside vnchaste looke lechor god vvhosoeuer shall haue slaundered brother rayled vpon priuily hated behold murtherer vvhosoeuer wisheth men goodes although neuer go take yet theefe alreadie god hathe onely sorbidden desire amisse passeth yet hee hath forbidden lust saye bee tickled stirred vp euill desire lyking forthwith wee bee transgressers god lawe finally doe men consider haue sayde heeretofore seeing wee bee blockishe haue regarde selues lawe cleere large looking glasse v behold ourselues pray boast selfe bee rightuous hee able performe lawe god commaundeth therefore wee must thinke strange men cleere themselues conteined furthermore may take profit doctrine behoueth v call remembrance haue declared afore namely god lawe sufficient perfecte rule whereby liue good holie life wit respecte v let v marke rightuousnesse whiche conteined lawe may well termed perfect rightuousnesse yea respect men say according theyr capacitie measure rightuousnesse answerable rightuousnesse god equall commeth farre short bee better knowen angelles yee see angelles haue lawe written yet frame selues obeying god heere ye see also wee say prayer thy bee done earth heauen gaynsaying god obeyed fully hee reigneth heauen doe wee desire conformable angelles ought bee ynough v shall wee haue suche perfection ought bee creature yea much say angel haue rightuousnesse maye fully match bee compared rightuousnesse god great oddes betwixt distance betweene heauen earth although rightuousnesse angel perfect respecte creature yet nothing smoke commeth infinite maiestie god lette v marke well lawe giuen v full certaine rule wherby liue well whe wee performe inioyned v shall taken reckened rightuous god perfection goodnesse yet shall rightuous say worthynesse v wee might deserue anything hand owne free fauoure sayth doth thing shall liue god might exacte listeth hande yet notwithstanding neuer say wee bee debt wee bee euer wee bring vntoo accepte excepte list although wee take bee rightuous thing bee seeming faulte yet god voutsafe cast eye vpon except list saye except owne meere grace bountifulnesse moue see howe double rightuousnesse god one set forth v law wherewithall god contenteth selfe bycause pleaseth secrete rightuousnesse surmounteth wit capacitie creature respect iob saith wicked wo vnto mee vvhy sayde cursed performeth thing conteyned booke cursed bee hee worshippeth god cursed breaketh sabboth cursed honoreth father mother cursed stealeth men good taketh themawaye force cursed killeth hurteth neighbour people must answere amen say v must confesse haue rightly deserued cursed cast away god hande albeit lawe perchance writtenin iobs time wee knowe nothing thereof yet recorde ingrauen men heart ye see wherfore hee sayth thathe vnhappie hee bee sounde wicked say hee shall haue withstoode god lead loose life secondly hee addeth although rightuous yet lifte vp bead vvhy bycause sayth see mine affliction filled shame vvhereby hee meeneth god increasing affliction muche say hath soueraine authoritie ouer men although ryghtuous yet may hee execute rigoure vpon may thought straunge yet howe euer case standeth men shall gayne nothing checking may well pleade alledge yet must fayne confounded god muste haue maistrie cause iob saith wil lift vp head though found rightuous way man might aske question heere howe iob meeneth hee bee founde rightuous imposible hee skarce knewe himselfe hee meante chalendge perfection true fulfilling god lawe haue sayde heeretofore long men continue owne nature farre wyde discharging duetie godwarde anye parte thereof nothing else bee sounde rebelliousnesse according saint paule sayth affection oure fleshe enemy vntoo god shall wee followe owne nature goe cleane auke god wee haue muche one thought wicked damnable vntill god reach v hand shall neuer come vnto hath hee begonne giue v grace yea partly verely farforth doe laboure towardes hee draweth v vnto hee guideth v yet wee come faste requisite wee may haue good inclination shall bee weake wee shall limpe make many false steppe shall stumble oftentimes start aside right path yee see plyghte men bee let v come highest degree rightuousnesse let v take abraham holie father haue walked perfection bene angel sayde men haue fulfilled lawe none shall finde himselfe blameworthie life examined god howe iob sayeth heere rightuous yet hee lift vp heade true god accepteth rightuous whiche rightuous say hee hath gyuen v grace walke according although faultes v passeth mother rigorous towards v though haue performed dutie poyntes full shake th v beareth weakenesse allowing accepting thing good v whiche good ye see god dealeth faithful one place iob hath spoken impossibilitie hee say true rightuous may come god say let v fal account let life well tried founde haue offended awhit haue fullie discharged selfe tone side tother impossible although fulfilled lawe yet durst lifte vp may heade wherefore see mine affliction filled reproch say god holdeth awe wote reply shal gaine nothing herein iob bewraieth passion haue confessed well god rightuous onely lawe serue bridle also knowe higher rightuousnesse known v recorde good euill giueth v rule life know god hath higher rightuousnesse therefore behoueth mee submit selfe vnder iob ought haue spoken bewrayeth constraint hee acknowledgeth hygher ryghtuousnesse god rightuousnesse lawe sayth see mine affliction filled reproches therefore speake worde befell suche person shall become v let v inure oure selues consider well god true peculiar rightuousnesse whiche incomprehensible v let v honoure secretes let v conceiue thing owne wit wee see owne smalnesse short must wee doe truely condemning selues wee neede climbe high saye god hath rightuousnesse whiche bee comprehended creature vnto man witte reache vvee haue doe condemning oure selues lawe bee ynoughe matter hath berre showed alreadie often man shall proude thinke hee mainteine himselfe god owne workes let thinke himselfe well looke vpon god lawe v say wee rightuous bycause seeme selues bycause men find v allow doings tryallmuste bee made lawe god vvhen world shall haue canonized v saint shall nothing boote v heauenly iudge condemne v god haue v goe anye whither else lawe bowe nother one way therefore ofte wee bee tempted eyther pryde hypocrisie let v bethinke v lawe sayeth v wee shall fynde greate horrible shamefulnesse oure selues shall remayne nothing v euerlasting death thus yee see howe wee ought practize lesson vvo vnto v wee bee wicked shall wee neede come second poynt rightuous yet dare lifte vp hande bee found rightuous furthermore let v marke wel bee rightuous say wee bee vtterly wicked al square al rightuousnesse v shall bee franke free acceptation howe true faithfull called rightuous onely bycause god forgcueth theyr sinnes receyueth mercie also bycause hee lyketh well theyr life sayde simeon good ryghtuous man zacharie elizabeth wife rightuous also bycause walked god lawe commaundements sayde also holie patriarkes yea let v marke bycause god owne free goodnesse receyued layde theyr synnes theyr charge vvhen wee saye menne made righteous sayth much say god forgiueth sinnes cleerely acquiteth lord iefus christes sake like wise behoueth v vnderstand wee rightuous workes bycause god accepteth v fauour workes deserue bee alwayes refuzed hande speake workes men doe owne power nothing villanie rebellion euen man gouerned god spirite grace doth walke good workes yet good workes vnperfecte god might cast yea farre worthynesse deseruing papist imagine nothing filthynesse neuerthelesse yet god receyueth yea euen father receiueth whiche commeth childe though bee nothing worth although wee bee rightuous say althoughe wee haue likelyhoode rightuousnesse let v marke well deserueth accepted god bycause written cursed performeth thing conteyned booke lawe nowe man performeth muche one thing meane performeth pure perfect mynd therefore followeth god may damne v must fayne holde downe oure heades yea euen without going law yet nothing come god rightuousnesse whiche incomprehensible v let v put cace man behaued hym selfe poyntes became might hee doe might hee therefore pleade againste god hee must come shorte god oweth v nothing true hee hath pomised euer dothe thing shall liue yea wee must vnderstande hee hath made promise owne free bountifulnesse vve see howe lord iesus christ saith seruaunt shall haue doone hee maister hee speaketh seruantes dayes witte slaues bondage bought solde slaue doe hee master shal master rise table say nowe serue thee another whyle seruaunts dutie serue maister master abace selfe seruant bee bounde vnto thing eue faith christ ye haue done al commaunded assure yourselues ye still vnprofitable seruantes saying iesus christ meeneth euer man founde founde haue performed god commaundeth putteth cace also must let v put cace man fulfilled lawe yet behoueth reuerence god al humilitie saying ala lorde still submit selfe vnder thy hand knowe well haue done thee muche one drop goodnesse proceede mee althoughe thou accepte mee bycause worthy bycause haue deserued thyne owne free fauour lo howe wee ought deale furthermore let v bee well ware excessiue passion iob behoueth v conceiue souereine rightuousnesse god sort haue sayde must end may induced humilitie say rightuous yet lift vp head seeing mine affliction certaine god performe whatsoeuer hath promised yea euen hath saide doth thing shall liue certainely able performe law full let v assure ourselues god hath rewarde ready reward v must say iob doth seing reproch seeing scourgeth v confounded power know although bee far measure yet dare grudge bicause shall win nought let v caried away far let v thinke god neuer chastizeth seruantes without iust cause yea thoughe hee haue eye sinnes certaine iob punished wicked offender true god iust cause punishe hundred time god respect meaning vvhat intent trie pacience cleare slaunder sathan made saying iob obeyeth god bycause prosperitie therefore god meant shewe contrarie wee speake god soueraine iustice let talke bee thinke presseth v measure auaunce selues force let bee honoure wonderfull secretes yea euen suche wise wee may bee fully resolued say selues ala v alledge though righteous yet bee bolde lift vp head wee haue good cause hang downe oure heades continually although god set selfe downe throne condemne v haue iudge within v euerye man condemne himselfe hathe euery man witte perceiue himselfe bee blameable let v marke need none condemnation v whiche conteyned lawe wherewith bothe great small ought bee well acquainted iob hath spoken hee addeth hee would fayne plague increased yea although increased sayth hee yet wilte thou come vpon lyon wilte shewe thy selfe maruellous heere iob treateth god secrete iudgements man reach vnto reason doe farre passe vnderstanding wit cause hee calleth god maruellous true wee shall alwayes finde god lawe straunge bycause wakeneth v vp beyond imagination wee selues also see wysest men doe speake soundnesse perfection come short rigour god lawe also god teacheth v worde hee doth still aboue ordinarie capacitie haue bin taught know matter goeth fully conuicted god haue layde brydle loose necke wee haue bene schoole learne lawe wee bee well neere good brute beast behalfe knowe man must loue god heart mynde strength neiboure himselfe see god requireth nothing hand wee owe wee haue thing wee haue receyued thus ye see howe wee shall find nothing straunge referre god word contrariewise god doings according reason equitie wee come rightuousnesse vnknowne say although performed whole lawe full yet wee done nothing respect rightuousnesse god yet farre straunger thing muche wee knowe say wittes fayle v amazed whiche iob meante saying thou wilte shewe thy selfe maruellous mee nowe although god maruellous wonderfull iudgementes yet must faithfull sort learne thinke nothing strange howe let v take example god election prouidence thing hee doth aboue eur vnderstanding behold part god secretes bottomlesse pit vnto v ward god chooseth whome listeth bring saluation forsaketh residue hee findeth v alike man vaunt himselfe bee better neighboure wherefore wee sholed asunder say god choseth one sort make inheritor kingdome forsaketh sort make go destruction cause heere firste blushe thinke verie strange saying reason whereas wee bee v god creature difference betwixt v respecte selues one v lightly preferred another yet notwithstanding god hath pitie whome hee listeth forsaketh residue reason lo men shal tempted grudge god good reason bee wonderfull v wonderfull would always haue wittes intangled many question ende would spue blasphemy see priuie repiners doo alwayes arguing making phantasticall discourse coulde finde heart condemne god bycause hee worketh woulde haue man speake v god election must needes maruellous acte yet must astonished ende may prouoke v honour say ala lorde wee cannot reach hygh enter thy secrete purpose know inclosed therin becommeth v reuerence vnknown v must confesse thou arte rightuous good yea euen though appeere reason vnto v vvhen come poynt shall fling rashly aduentures iudge god secretes owne fancie shall doe see faithfull time haue done verely dispute god election soberly modestly crie oute saint paule howe wonderfull thy iudgementes rauished inquire curiously thinke well nowe wee knowe god doings parte daye come shall reuealed vnto v full lo faithfull haue alwayes reasoned god election raunged abroade inquire thing curiously certesse thought verie strange maruellous yeelde god due honoure knowing bee great loftinesse creature presume attaine high continued quiet rauished wondermente doings god maruellous vntoo yet ouerstraunge maruellous bycause knewe secretes whiche surmount capacitie vnderstanding man agayne straunge bycause election knewe god goodnesse mercie hee chosen saluation calling vnto casting rest behold see god election much bee sayde also prouideoce sayde god disposeth thing world vvell possible warres come bee god stirring vp god guide tossed outrageous passion prince full ambition couetous bludsheaders rakers extortioner muche hellish confuzion serue behalfe make conscience sticking slea rob pill yee see men ill wilde astes much werse shuld god vse instrumentes howe possible againe see church selfe turmoyled ye see persecution put vntoo hee rayseth vp furthermore see doctrine gospell troden vnder foote tirannie wicked caitifes lie reigne stead truth maketh trouble rightfull vengeance god vve see reason wee see howe wise worketh wee must perceiue hand fayth straunge v must needes end may humble v shall haue bin instructed god worde although knowe reason workes yet shall wee customably magnifie assuring selues hee dothe aught without iust cause yee see howe standeth v hande practize sentence wherein sayde thou wilt thy selfe maruellous mee iob passed measure certaine hee sheweth heere tempted outrageous passion hee sayth thou wilt shewe thy selfe maruellous whereby declareth confesseth owne parte hee vtterly dismayde thought verie straunge god scourge wee must beware hee maruellous v sort true perceiue god maruellous secret dealing may well abashed say ala lord see weaknesse rudenesse thinke workes thy hand strange thou shalt enlighten v little little vntill wee bee come thy sanctuarie vve haue one foote alreadie truly curtins see thee aloofe time come thou shalt giue v familiar knowledge therfore let greeue v god haue secretes wise surmount capacitie yet doth amaze v man may alledge howe doth welfare happinesse consist knowing god yes verely farre foorth expedient v let v marke god hath giuen v way know conuenient fit v could well giue v full perfect light day seeth profite therefore giueth v certaine portion applyeth himselfe vnto v therefore let greeue v haue knowledge god yet measure giuen v scripture waite till haue bereft v mortall body specially till haue wholly reformed myndes maye bee wrapped worldlinesse earthlinesse specially sinfulnesse procedeth sinne adam finall concluzion iob declareth wherein god shewed himselfe maruellous againste wit renue stripe fall chaunging true hebrew word whiche put stripe woundes plague signifieth muche record witness witnessings without cause plague god sendeth vpon men witness brought forth proofes god maketh bring thing knowledge place iob speaketh stripe woundes plague whereby meeneth chastizements god layd vpon therefore saith renued much newe chastizements layde vpon thing wel worthy noted although find god working straunge vnderstanding yet notwithstanding nothing hindreth v knowledge god rightuousnesse temptation doth say thing wherein men find themselues hindred true oft man alledgeth piece scripture v oure lyking greeueth v fall arguing god specially weshewe stubbornesse smitten beaten hand god brought confesse god rightuous chastizements behold say thing whervnto made agree yee see iob hauing spoken god wonderfull working addeth thou doublest thy plague mee muche matter bee discoursed length daye let v marke nothing else v doe flee vnto god praying giue v tast word may quietly receiue whatsoeuer conteyned yet whensoeuer shall please vse rigour towardes v moderate roddes although make v feele smart yet may cease haue recourse vnto father ende may alwayes receiue v child nowe let v kneele downe face good god acknowledgement sinnes praying make v knowe wise wee may anye bee blinded hypocrisie pryde fonde folly whereof oure heades full vtterly ashamed may always haue recourse remedie giuen v embrace redemption purchased v death passion lorde iesus christ knowing bee onely meane whereby wee may bee reconciled vnto god may come assured trust hee heare v therewithall maye please ayde v holie spirite may make v walke feare obedience vntill shall haue restored v fully remayne sinne corruption v may please graunt grace onely v also people nation earth bringing backe poore ignorant soules miserable bondage error c xlj sermon fourth vpon tenth chapter vvhy haste thou broughte mee vvombe dyed eye seene mee bin neuer bin bene caryed vvombe g raue shal portion dayes come sone end let vvithdravve himselfe quickly may take breath agayne go countrie darknesse shadovve death vvhence returning agayne intoo darke countrie vvhere nothing darknesse euen thicke darknesse vvhere nothing disorder vvhen shoulde shine darkenesse must call mynde spoken yesterdaye concerning god chaunging plague witte god scourgeth men hee hath diuers meanes doe hee hathe vsed one kind correction hee hath another alwayes store therefore let v thinke scaped hand hee hath deliuered v one trouble let v prepare selues till please shew v mercie beholde meane set v rest stand god fauour otherwise hee make v feele contayned song moyses namely hath diuers sort chastizementes cofers storehouse meane whyle wee see iob beeing sore pressed desireth god put death hande vvee haue seene sentence heeretofore heere hee confirmeth matter therewith hee shoulde say without cause wishe seeing god persecuteth mee sharply haue cause respite meanes vtterly confounded whereas iob sayth wherefore haste thou taken mee mother wombe doubt sinned saying poynt vnthankfulnesse men acknowledge selues verie much beholden god hee hathe made fashioned notwithstanding liue neuer miserably world small thing god hath put v worlde reigne therein haue fruition creature beare image heere knowe father yea fynd experience ought hold skorne honoure doth vnto v vve see iob altogither excused hee wisheth haue bin caried mother wombe graue rather haue bin borne true made conclusion rest fully vpon bewrayeth passion wherwith moued although consented popish doctor say sinne say great beastlinesse holde opynion man bee prouoked himselfe vengeance robberie suche thing sinne hee reste vppon ne fully purpose hys heart rather esteeme vertue bycause say bee suche battels man outstandeth verely graunt baptim sinne turke heathen man tempted euill forthwith giltie god say suche sinnes scoured oute v baptim wee rather deserue prayse afore god consenting suche temptation bee esteemed sinner haue done amisse earst sayd brutish bestlinesse whome dothe god speake hee sayth men muste loue hearte theyr strength speaketh iewes churche dothe belong vnto v day rule common v bound loue god strength mynde side bee looke howe many lewde affection wee bee combered many striuings enmity haue loue owe vnto god wee must needes conclude also bee many sinnes else sinne rebell god haue transgressed commaundements ye see thing nature true sinnes layde charge yet enseweth therefore wee bee worthy bee punished god owne meere goodnesse doth take v mercie let v vnderstand euer oure fleshe tempteth v vnto euill although resting determining vppon yet may god iustly punish v neuerthe later owne free goodnesse spareth v commeth account iob therefore amisse oure side let v know god may cal v iudgement account haue temptation doth make v swarue little although bring effect ouercome yet alreadie gone astraye behoueth v confesse faulte yet notwithstanding behooueth v also settle oure selues vppon free mercie god graunteth forgetting buriyng thing nowe let v come iobs talke hee sayth wherefore hast thou taken mee moothers wombe verely wee looke lyfe man wee shall alwayes fayne come prouerb whiche common among heathen leaste wyse among part namely good men neuer bee borne else dye hande haue reckned misery inconueniences whereto subiect whyle liue heere lowe haue thought better men neuer borne else beginning life weeping wayling little babe haue vnderstanding doe shewe seagulfe misery v pitie terrour beholde afterwarde growe yeares doe misery increace number quantitie therefore better men might neuer borne must needes bee borne good dye quickly might haue long iourney make talke hath partly reason howbeit without vnthankefulnesse although misery bee innumerable wherewith men oppressed yet must wee wey balance honoure god doth v making v lord ouer creature haue dominion ouer heere childre whome hee maketh feele father towardes v morouer bycause setting v world aduaunce v aloft witte heauenly life wherof giueth v perceyuerance feeling afore hande throughly knowne surely ouercommeth misery trouble happen men worlde thus yee see sayde sentence namely best men borne might seeme bee grounded vppon reason yet without vnthankfulnesse wee must forget god giueth v recompence withall farre iob coming point hee leuer haue bin borne bicause combered minde amazed harte seazed forepossessed griefe hee could consider god neuerthelesse created owne image hee kepte worlde one child hee made tast euerlasting life whervnto men allured iob could come poynt hart closed vp sorrowe hee none eye miserie therefore lette v marke well affliction bee greate wee alwayes subiect fault whiche iob bewrayeth himselfe whiche wee forget god gracious benefites althoughe wee bee put remembrance yet wee finde taste sauour touch v comfort asswage sorrow wee might take breath say lord although beaten thy hand bee heauie burthen beare yet notwithstanding consider side thou hast bin good vnto perceiue thee mercifull father cheereth vp comforteth ye see thing haue marke firste place knowe vice naturally rooted v god succoure v giue v sayd cofort sweeten sorrowes shoulde misse bee driuen suche afterdeale nothing despaire v wish neuer bene borne nowe iob addeth bene caried mother wombe graue bene though neuer bene seconde part prouerb sayde vsed among infidel namely men bee borne good soone dispatched rid life haue touched alredy smal regarding honour god dooth v giuing v suche dignitie preheminence ouer creature mustreth v ranke child heires inestimable priuiledge ought appease griefes betide v specially let v marke purpose god haue v lyue heere worlde die childhoode wee haue nother vnderstanding reason grow yeares learne vnknowen vnto v namely god hath made v owne image giuen v vnderstanding knowe onely wee muste passe away heere belowe also continuing lyfe heauen thing whereto hee calleth v wee e taken world wee neuer bene disappoynted great benefite knowing god bee eternall sauioure hee giueth v already token fatherlye loue wee earthly wayfaring therefore yee see intolerable vnthankfulnesse men wish haue bene rid way neuer beene borne wee muste thinke vppon lyfe man simply selfe wee must set eye vpon end whervnto tendeth whiche wee shoulde bee led hope yet hidden vp heauen whereof god gyueth v taste alreadye farre foorthe oure rawnesse able comprehende also heere bee noted wyse wee may wishe die sorte wee muste onely bee willing lyue also cheere vp selues though wee lyue lingering payne hath bene shewed heertofore maye desyre deathe respecte wee ceasse offende god asmuche wee bee compassed aboute manye corruption lamentable see wee maye well mourne desyre god delvuer v suche bondage onely lawefull also requisite v doo god spirite gouerne v wee muste hate synne euill neuerthelesse long man worlde hee ceasseth displease god saye take euen vertuousest man shall alwayes bee faulte bee founde therefore hating naughtinesse sinne wee muste needes bee weerie oure lyfe bycause holdeth v thraldome prison manye infirmity contrarie god ye see howe faythfull alwayes weerie lyue linger worlde sithe cannot serue god fullye woulde wishe saye onelye lawfull also needefull v doo vvee see also howe sainct paule sayeth hee coulde haue doone declareth beste god shoulde take quicklie oute worlde hee respect himselfe speciallie hee sayeth wretche shall delyuer mee hee confesseth hee looked owne presente state hee vnhappye hee desyreth bee delyuered hence hee speaketh throughe humaine passion zelousnesse wherewith hee dryuen holye ghost singular regarde hee giue himselfe goodnesse hee sawe coulde bee doone till hee quite cleane rid fleshe cause hee weerie lyfe heere yee see howe wee ought proceede behalfe witte oure misliking lyfe muste bee bycause wee knowe oure selues bee sinfull howebeit muche men cannot atteyne therevnto god fayne pinche make abhorre synne muche wee bee fayne bee driuen force yee see one faulte v agayne although god chastize v suche correction wee bee warned mislike sinnes yet wee hate except hee continue making v feele smart withdraw hande wee fall oure olde byasse wee coulde finde harte sit still owne workes hee woulde let v alone yee see heere second vice oure hating present life bycause wee cannot lyue heere oure fleshely lustes notwithstanding wicked corrupte vvee woulde haue god giue v leaue end yea could make bargaine life shoulde sweete wold desire nothing tarry heere vve see cause men weery theyr liues cannot compasse desire hate euill corruption nature intangleth yet sorie god giueth full scope lyste ne suffereth ake delightes pleasure heere theyr owne inclination agayne yet one thing bee condemned wee keepe measure although haue good reason hate lyfe yet wee fall misliking doone farre square sainct paule place alleadged afore leadeth v cleane contrarie aliboughe hee call himselfe wretched vnhappie desire bee deliuered pryson body yet commeth backe poynt hee contenteth himselfe grace god gyueth beholde sayeth hee thanke god throughe iesus christ hee knewe well god woulde leaue without helpe hee knewe god woulde gyue power withstand euill finally infirmitie whiche buryed god layd charge paule misliketh life man stomaked impacient neyther doth hee caste himselfe suche outrage checke god cleane contrariwise yeldeth himselfe vnto god good contenteth himselfe god layeth euill charge holdeth vp strong hande hee bee vanquished sathan synne euen ought thus ye see may bee lawfull v hate present lyfe bycause say god holdeth v bondage sinne againe houeth v hold measure languishing vnder god hande long shall please holde v worlde knowing ought suffise v neere hand v helpe v nede wheras iob sayeth would bene borne bene caryed mother wombe graue inordinate maner speache although rested vpon poynt doo yet hee offended god ye see good cause marke well sayd shall neuer keepe measure euen hande hating present life except consider gyuen v god ende make v passe making v feele fatherly loue present lyfe witness god shewing himselfe good towardes v doth alreadie warrant v whiche wee see yet namely immortall glorie hath layde vp v wee thinke wee couet liue wee passe seruing god doe shewed v example holy father namely lyue sette foorthe prayse lorde lyue come temple magnifie ny god vvee haue regarde v maruell wee bee vtterly corrupted haue forgotten excellencie oure firste creation vvhat oure desiring lyue brutishe affection bee owne ease eate drinke fulfill owne justes according euerie mannes complexion leadeth lo howe men straitened themselues without hauing eye vnto god poynt vtter wickednesse beeyng weerie lyue bee bycause wee liue owne ease wee bee heere hild sinne bicause god pleaseth v bycause haue euer flesh desireth could finde hart god bee subiect v bicause ourvnderling thing fall cleane contrarie beholde greeueth v stingeth v tormenteth v wee caste foorthe oure choler euery therefore muche must marke lesson whiche wee muste honor present lyfe bycause god hath set v intent recorde v taketh v child bee oure father secondly wee consider selues namely wee bee corrupted adam wee alwayes hilde satan prisoner ceasse euill vpon knowledge whereof must eue midst weerinesse prouoke selues good holy affection returne alwayes vnto god assuring selues remedie al inconueniences hath made v feele satherly loue hee continually increase gracious giftes throughly bring passe hath begonne beit forasmuche wee bee sore inclined repine agaynst god let v well ware haue benefites alwayes throughly printed minde wee fall intoo temptation spoken heere wishe wee neuer life true better castawayes haue bene borne deade haue bene swallowed vp earth neuer bene begotten lorde iesus christ speaketh iudas yet meane whyle wee muste holde rule lyfe man selfe precious noble gifte god deserueth well bee estimation wee muste alwayes come backe poynte god neuer createth man hee imprinteth image true image defaced neuerthelesse respect order nature goodnesse god taketh alwayes vpper hande ought haue suche preferment preheminence among v magnifie acknowledge accordingly nowe lette v come whiche iob addeth hee sayeth bene carryed away sorte mother womb graue eye seene yet one vnthankfulnesse life ought bee well lyked onely bycause euery v knoweth vpon condition ende created also bicause god oughte bee glorified v vvhen wee looke vpon creature whome god hath sente worlde haue wee therein mirroure goodnesse often may beholde man eye must make serue v glorifie god behalfe iob woulde haue beene deade first dashe much darken god glorie whiche thing without smacke vnthankfulnesse wee see howe hee ouershotte himselfe thing hee hilde measure hee oughte haue doone therefore haue cause bee well aduised temptation befell vntoo suche man hee howe muche shall wee bee caryed awaye beeyng frayle wee bee immediately hee sayeth god woulde withdrawe hande mee gette awaye whyle myght haue respite go downe intoo darke countrey intoo shadowe deathe nothing confusion vve see heere howe iob still caryed awaye witte bycause god iudgemente laye sore vppon sayde afore namely onelye felte bodily aduersities euerie v shall seele chiefe greefe god agaynst hee beene deadly fewd thus yee see pinch iob suche distresse tormented suche wise hee pacient requisite bee short god bringeth v spirituall battelles doth hee prooue v trie v quicke thing well woorth noting wee take oure selues stoute men warre haue beene tryed vttermost wee haue indured sicknesse aduersitie wee thinke god ought beginne new agayne v wee bee quite discharged become stoute champion yet notwithstanding bodily affliction indure nothing respect distresse poore sinner hee perceyueth god partie agaynst persecuteth hee finde meanes come attonement agreement therefore oure sinnes come sorte v diuell maketh v feele god wrath agayne syde oure owne conscience reprooueth v god seemeth bee vtterly angrie v say farre greater dreadefuller anguishe misery wee indure fleshe therefore lette v prepare oure selues suche spirituall battelles praying god strengthen v see man strength fayleth behalfe wee shall bee quickly ouerwhelmed wee bee propped vp aboue lifted vp god wee bee fallen sette agayne right way wee bee stepped oute waye iob sayeth lette gette mee whyle vve see yet better howe miserable state poore synners haue conceyte god perse cuteth agaynste wherein lyeth oure welfare oure ioy god neere hande v wee feele howe gracious fauoure neuer separated v cleane contrarie poore sinner scared god iudgement desireth nothing hyde himselfe finde secrete nooke god myght see hee myght make feele hande greatest benefite poore sinner could haue feele themselues tormented god iudgement preace neere craue helpe succour hande vtter vndooing shrinke away vvee see men god sheweth himselfe angry haue none shift heape wickednesse vpon wickednesse enter hell ie hell wee shrunke awaye sorte god yet notwithstanding god holdeth poynt beholde howe poore sinner wishe hee would make perceyue nothing wrath curse heereby wee muste bee prouoked pray god whatsoeuer vengcance wee haue deserued sinnes yet wee may forget grace whiche hee offereth v namely wee shoulde alwayes haue recourse goodnesse although haue good right bee angrie v yet neuerthelesse may assure selues hee ceasseth allure v goodnesse surmounteth rigoure iustice whiche due v sinnes thereby let v comforted vntill hee haue withdrawne hand v let v shrinke backe hee absenteth himselfe v rather let v say lorde withdraw thine anger thou shew v thine angrie coutenance one wee drowned alreadie hell lo wee haue marke streyne therefore let v bethinke v profite oure selues wee quayle god listeth trie v prooue quicke strength constancie temptation yee see howe wee may say sainct paule neyther thing present thing come life death thing else able separate v loue god say nothing disappoynte v wee shoulde alwayes feele fatherly loue whiche hee vseth towardes v asswage sweeten sorrowes withall sainct paule setteth thing come shoulde say true men subiect infinite misery neither number measure misery nature maze yet wee holde selues lorde iesus christ bande betwene god v looke vpon partie knitteth v god father shall bee nothing hinder v shoulde alwayes merie lo wee haue desire god hande wee knowe plyght wee bee nowe ende iob speaketh state suche departed saying go intoo darke countrey intoo lyghtlesse pitte nothing confuzion disorder night day ought shine iob speaketh like man hath beleefe either immortality soule resurrection promised v vvhere become let v marke place expresseth passion wretched sinner seeleth nothing god wrath haue touched heere fore yet haue wee neede bee put oftentymes minde bycause behoofe iob brought suche hell minde hee thinketh god iudge himselfe reprobate hope grace forgiuenesse lo wherfore speaking death hee feeleth nothing confuzion howe death serueth turne god order vpside downe like sinne turned thing vpside downe god created man intent haue bin mortall true haue liued euermore worlde state adam god would haue chaunged v glorious immortalitie yet notwithstanding shuld haue bi ayn haue dyed neither oure mortalitie haue needed haue bin renued state adam haue bin liued full time world haue euerlasting heritage god sinne stepped beholde god added death hande yea euen death wherein nothing confusion thereby man coulde perceyue nothing god curse vppon hym hath sort cut man number creature ye see howe god hath settled v worlde liue heere child taketh v away bereaueth v thys life whiche one hee shoulde driue v hys house shoulde shewe howe hee myndeth recken v number hys creature see ye horrible confuzion cace standeth wee haue knowledge oure sinnes god iustice wee muste bee fayne rest must thinke straunge iob speaking death say men go darke coast nothing darknesse disorder hee matcheth sinne god curse togither death long god holdeth locked vp distresse certayne hartburning seeketh meane grace true remedy shew v light euen death order also darknesse darke soeuer bycause haue bin brought dust wee shall bee rayzed vp agayne iob perceyued bycause behooued god first make hym feele hys sharpe sore rigoure afterwarde comfort hym againe text whiche wee ought marke well wee mynde receyue grace god giueth v offereth v continually oure lorde iesus christe wee must first feele wee oure selues plight wee bee wee desyrous say taste heauenly lyfe firste wee muste knowe ende wee bee borne yea euen according wee bee sinner adam good sooth without cause sainct paule sayeth whiche corruptible goeth formost hee speaketh onely order god holdeth nature also whiche behoueth v consider oure part therefore wee muste vnderstande although wee bee borne worlde noble excellent creature god bee yet notwithstanding meanes sinne death hath abolished razed noblenesse muche god misliketh v disclaymeth v though hys hande fashioned v bycause bee disfigured deuill hath sette markes stampe vppon v furthermore beeing subiect cursse pronounced vppon adam wee good banished oute whole worlde neyther heauen earthe abhorreth v say thing wee haue marke selues wee enter intoo battell certaine wee shall confounded vtterly yee see cause men stande muche owne conceyte cannot bethinke god iustice ought doo yet must wee come poynt howbeeit wee shall haue considered howe wretched oure lyfe death yet wretched bycause greate gulfe serueth shewe v importance cursse god pronounced v owne mouth say shall haue considered must also beware wee vtterly swallowed vp heauinesse remedie remedie turne oure eye lorde iesus christ meane whereby god inlighteneth v middes darkenesse howe oure lorde iesus christ offereth himselfe vnto v whome haue true daysunne rightuousnesse nowe wee haue regarde v death dreadfull vnto v heere ye see dauid sayeth god sheepehooke shall comfort shadow death darknesse vvhen hee speaketh god sheepehooke meaneth hee shall bee afraid nothing long god sheweth himselfe shepeheard towards shew himselfe sheepherd person lord iesus christ let v first consider minde iob speaketh heere hee knoweth men considered themselues verye nature haue nothing else manner confusion life death howbeeit seeyng wee haue sonne god although state seeme neuer wretched insomuch wee bee poore woormes subiect corruption rottennesse yet come wee tasting benefite whiche god gaue v hee made light issue middes darknesse according sayde creation worlde god turned darknesse intoo light seeyng wee knowe wee haue reioyce meanes onely sonne hee hath caused hys goodnesse grace shine foorth death yea euen lyfe seemeth shoulde enter intoo dungeon gulfes hell dooth god open v gate kingdome euen hee maketh v enter intoo dwelling place whereoutof wee bee nowe sort banished christ inlightneth v onely deathe intent darknesse whiche shoulde darken v quite ouerwhelme v also life thys present worlde scripture telleth v full darknesse wee bee poore blind soules yet meane whyle iesus christ cesseth inlighten v hys gospell vvee haue lawe prophetes burning cressettes v wee haue gospell whiche yet farre greater light yea euen light high noone yee see howe oure lorde iesus christe bee sufficient light v lyfe deathe wee looke vnto haue touched heeretofore wee must first feele disorder confuzion enuironeth v round aboute vntill suche time iesus christ haue reached v hys hand furthermore iesus christ hath inlightned v shall haue walked hope euerlasting lyfe world although god take v hence death eye yet let v therefore ceasse call vpon god tarie leysure till comfort soules owne kingdome alwais incombered haue perfect ioy long dwell body till god take vp himselfe doo true thinke vpon death alone selfe without lifting vp selues higher god may bring v point brought iob iob faith hope euerlasting life yet little ouerraught feare conceyued nothing else death confuzion disorder looked graue saw hell open swallow vp hauing suche conceytes greeued iob muche torment coulde indure body like god plucke end gyue victory temptation v likewise neuerthelesse warned heereby wee neede walke warely praying good god shall please call v account iudgement may bee handle v rigorously according haue deserued may please make v feele fauour hee vseth customably towards wee may always come backe thys poynt namely although wee must fayne walke world middes darknesse shadow death yet wee may afraid seeing haue iesus christ eye true daysunne rightuousnesse may cause v labour toward heritage heauen wherevnto god calleth v make v partaker glorious immortalitie nowe therefore let v fall downe maiestie good god acknowledgement oure faultes praying hym make v perceyue suche wyse wee maye thereby bee prouoked sighe grone continually beseeching pardon wee maye bee astonyed iudgementes faynte beeyng condemned wee bee woorthy ryght bee condemned beeyng ashamed selues wee may returne good god hee may make v taste hys inestimable loue vseth towardes v shewing himselfe sauiour persone oure lorde iesus christ sonne may stablished hope giueth v saluation grow vntill time hauing incountred assault haue indure heere bylow may come euerlasting rest prepared v heauen may please c xlij sermon first vpon xj chapter zophar naamathite ansvvered sayd men ansvver man much talke shall babbling person preuayle verely thy vvordes shall make men holde peace vvhen thou hast mocked man shall thee shame thou hast sayd dealing rightfull cleane thy presence vvould god vvould speake thee vvould open lippes agaynst thee hee vvoulde discouer vntoo thee secretes vvisdome iudgement double rightfull god hath forgotten thee thine vnrightuousnesse sake wee may better profite oureselues doctrine wee must call mind hath bin saide heeretofore namely matter set downe heere true themselues notwithstanding misseapplied person iob thus see ye instruction good profitable v bee haue wisedome discretion know howe vse aright effect done heere vnderstande whensoeuer debate maner man may stande god wee must alledge owne prittle prattle thinke preuayle vayne rhetorike must beaten downe dismayde considering maiestie god bring passe let v assure selues possible v serch wisedome wee cannot comprehende worlde must humble selfe vnder thus ye see effect shewed v heere doctrine beene well hilde practized thys day haue suche disputings reigne worlde wise men may iustifyed saued god vvhy stablish deseruings purchace fauour god sight make beleeue may saue themselues owne power know maiestie spoken heere brabble fonde trifle cace stood vpon dealing men would much boldnesse see vsed debating meane whereby wee might stand god shorte men haue bin besotted wist iustice iudgement thing else came debating maner god loueth v mercifull towards v sort might present selues maiestie find fauour hys hande therefore much standeth v hande marke well doctrine sayde shoulde men answere man muche talke shall babbler preuayle heere wee see howe men talkatiuenesse dashed yea though like well themselues haue store vaine fonde rhetorike beholde beguileth namely iustifie themselues men beare countenance angelles whereas nothing want filthinesse true may haue apparant reason men shall like well deede according man reason demaunded rightuousnesse bee answered man must liue vnblameably must discharge duetie hee must euery man right ye see rightuousnesse said man rightuous god though wretched sinner sinnes forgyuen behold strange thing canot sinke man fleshly vnderstanding say accepted rightuous yet rightuousnesse whyle muste bee fayne borrow another although god know wretched damned creature yet notwithstanding saue purpose therefore sophisters hypocrite stablish men merites beare hand able winne paradise oure owne power hath somewhat fayre coloure easily receyued part world ye see causeth harden rankle muche theyr seeming asmuche men take saying woorth accept good god also ought holde himselfe contented wee shall cace thereby although tyme god suffer v tell many fayre tale insomuche seemeth wee haue ouercome yet ende must fayne come downe againe god appeareth seate must disputings bee fayne ceasse wherein men foade vaunte themselues somuche nowe adayes vvhat muste wee doo vvhen wee debate sorte men maye stande god wee muste alledge lykely reason suche worlde receyueth euery v must enter intoo himselfe intoo hys owne conscience poynt whereat wee must beginne bee yet better vnderstoode lay foorth matter familiar order haue tolde alreadye men come debating wise become rightuous according man reason sayd must lyue ryghtuously true speake properly rightuousnesse men lyues well ruled fault bee founde performe god lawe hee commaundeth vttermost yea shall bee fully declared muste proceede haue another rightuousnesse bycause wee come short thys meane menne perceyue behoueth perfourme theyr duetie walke god hys woorde fall imagining thus themselues vvell standes mee hande fulfill god lawe opinion shall bryng notwithstanding vnable stirre one finger yet woonder see beare themselues hande able carie great mountaynes vppon shoulder bee able life muche one strawe neuerthelesse full fonde ouerweening straine themselues perfourme god lawe owne free well ende must fayne perceyue weakenesse owne experience true time puffe blastes yea another vice namely men surmize themselues well able make themselues rightuous without fulfilling god lawe howe foolish deuotions wee see papacie men desyrous become holy rightuous mention framing life commaundementes god vvhat euery man take vp toy good deuotion owne head shall ceremony shall superstition reigne vnder name god seruice heare masse euery day mumble muche fast often doo poore hypocrite beare themselues hand haue well quitte themselues god yea take bound vnto heerein sleepe tyme man tell lost labour fearce vppon spyteth saying goodly thing vnprofitable god vnrightuous must hee needes accept seruice offer vnto paine carefulnesse lo howe idolater pleade god seemeth doth great wrong accept take good woorth pelting trash wherewith beguile themselues lo dyzinesse reigneth men braynes tyme yet sayde earst ende muste bee fayne graunt nothing god presseth putteth tryall shall faine acknowledge ala little purpose haue heaped vp many ceremony sorte haue done yet doth myne owne conscience reproue mee haue serued god well one poynte haue missed many others men beeyng reproued owne conscience doo therevppon seeke remedye saying vvell see god shoulde enter intoo accounte shoulde bee sore indaungered vntoo hym howe shall wee doo vvee fall finding satisfaction like papacie euerye wyll confesse manne lyuing able fulfill god lawe yet meane whyle ceasse sleepe still bycause wretched hypocrite beare themselues hande able make god amendes bringing payment true say thys behalfe haue doone amisse god wyll bee contented mee shall haue made amendes suche sorte sorte heere yee see whereupon grewe inuention woorkes ouerplus supererogation terme say woorkes yeelde vntoo god ouer besydes due vvhen men doo thinke euer must come account iudge maye easily say vvhat vve wee wherefore take wee suche paynes serue god shall wee thynke thys geere shall bee reiected hys hande hee wyll make reckening moreouer althoughe wee bee weake bee faultes imperfection v yet wee labour make amendes sinnes god must needes haue regarde vnto suche sorte men parte supposing themselues throughly well discharged sayde afore conceyue rancour hartburning agaynste warning nowe wee see holy ghost condemneth heere wit men flatter themselues rocke theselues asleepe vayne imagination seemeth haue gotten goale men like well dooings nothing wee come heauenly throne none pedling trifle shall take place vvhat muste bee done vve must know yea wee muste firmely beleeue rightuousnesse world abhomination god may reiect filthinesse verie deede although hee haue graunted v grace labour vntoo goodnesse yet wee yet come vnto although wee trauell thitherwarde yet suche feeblenesse wee bee ouermuche bee condemned wee muste call mynde howe hath beene declared heretoofore wee bring one poynte selues god haue thousande confounde v yee see wee haue marke streyne ye see also sayde matter standeth vpon babbling vppon alledging reason may carie fayre coloure men especially euerye v enter intoo himselfe examine lyfe howe wee bee cyted god babbling ceasse euery man thinke neerely vppon himselfe knowing wee haue none meane bee quit god condemning selues beeing vtterly abashed better vnderstanding matter lette v nowe come whiche hee addeth thou haste sayde dealing iust rightfull sounde thy presence heere zophar sheweth babbling whiche hee condemneth verely haue warned afore hee misapplyeth matter person iob hee doth great wrong accusing vniustlie neuerthelesse doctrine selfe good holie profitable lette v marke suche minde iustifie themselues bee seene without blame haue
