nothing vaine babbling though bee taken wise folke worldewarde poynte wee oughte marke well men come applying bee small purpose say well must babbling men come treato god secretes worde holy thing men deale pleasure must go sobernesse reuerence verely may good warning zophar sayeth precisely suche minde aduaunce power men perswade nothing rightuousnesse god better babbler fayre shewe soeuer make therefore lette v learne doctrine well settled grounded able stand god saue vtterly defaceth sheweth haue thing whereof may make boast short cofoundeth sort haue none refuge meere goodnesse mercy god herewithall haue heere two article marke one thatwhensoeuer talk holy scripture thing perteyneth religion wee muste learne speake soberly lette oure tung runne vpon pattins dispute thereof pleasure say lette v keepe oure selues vnaduisednesse wee see vice hath bene cause god truthe hath bene vtterly peruerted turned lye proofe heereof else popishe diuinitie heathenish fashion vtter scoffing rayling secretes god poperie lawefull men babble tossing tennisball good sooth papistes say true vse bywoorde holy scripture anoze waxe lo blaspheme god ashamed set downe theyr bookes yea meane proue men holde themselues holy scripture wee haue assurance oure beleefe god worde wee ought receyue whiche decreed men see say holy scripture noze waxe true respect theselues haue made noze waxe turning wresting forewarde backwarde make playne mockerie god truth come passe bycause haue knowne god vttering vnto v intent euery v enter himselfe examine well owne conscience apply owne vse instruction conteyned holy scripture assuring oure selues god ment feede oure curiositie tickle eares edifie soules yea might behoofe let v beare mind article wit speake god muste reuerence feare especially let v come spoken heere namely whosoeuer magnifie men acquite iustifie god babbler though alledge neuer fayre reason let v marke puffed vp presumption allow men merites neuer yet throughly wakened know god much indetted iudgement whosoeuer shall haue examined owne conscience well must needes haue mouth stopt canot know mankind order wee haue nothing cursednesse v heerevpon wee may boldely saye teacher papacie vtterly besotted become scorner god despizers rightuousnesse vvee see bolde aduaunce freewill magnifie strength men make v beleeue wee bee able deserue wee haue committed sinnes yet may wee well purchase oure selues forgiuenesse oure owne good woorkes asmuche talke needeth saying set heere shewe bee despizers god bauling curres neuer muche one remorse scruple conscience vtterly blinded diuell anye seeling incling god iudgement certainely woulde babble aduaunce owne merites whiche pelting trashe side lette v learne go better schoole wee intende stande vp god sayde heere ende wee shall haue suche answere shall serue ouerwhelme v vtterlie dayes wee sharpen oure beake vaunte oure selues owne rightuousnesse puffed vp vayne opinion rather outrage wee bee well able stande afore god ende hee muste bee fayne answere v yeahee muste fayne answere v suche sorte shall bee confounded therewith according sayde heere shall babbling persone preuayle vvee may perchaunce weene wee shall bee beguyled haue declared afore hee make himselfe rightuouse god sighte vaine babler say hee bewraieth hee neuer touched quicke conscience still sleepe hee knoweth either doo well liue well hee taketh holde shadow steade bodie finally hee hath considered god must bee iudge thus yee see causeth men recken without host saide prouerbe nowe lette v come whiche zophar addeth yeal woulde fayne sayeth hee god woulde speake agaynste thee hee woulde open mouthe beholde howe men reprooued theyr confusion witte god openeth mouth long wee reason men well euery one v maye thinke owne halfepenie bee good syluer soone god openeth mouth wee haue nothing replie say whiche wee beleeue substantiall stuffe bee muste needes go grounde washe awaye oure reason shall bee froath maye bee greate bubbling boyling yet dooth washe vanishe away therefore lette v wey well sentence god muste bee fayne speake put men silence make men vtterlie rungtyed behalfe namely maye presume alledge aught owne fantasy sort shall god speake hee hath alreadie spoken ynoughe holie scripture humble v withall see howe men condemned cursed adam marke speciall poynte therevpon behooueth euerie one v peculiarly himselfe yeelde himselfe tootoo blameworthie seeing god sheweth v oure sinnes horrible wee cannot mislike ynoughe althoughe man bee greeued himselfe lothe owne lyfe yet knoweth hee hundred parte euill god telleth v wee see sainct paule putteth men vnder shame wee reade texte oure heare oughte stande vp vpon oure heades see howe wee bee condemned naughtinesse although euery one v bee giltie alike fact yet v haue seede thereof within v yee see howe god hath giuen sentence damnation vpon men ought inough make v shrinke downe oure heades make v vtterly tungtied sayde afore men stately cannot stoupe though scripture confounde according wee see notwithstanding men thinke still iustifie themselues god greatest difference betwixt v papistes namely bee demaunded meane oure saluation papistes haue nothing owne freewill merites satisfaction syde wee saye man beeing vtterly voyde rightuousnesse hauing aught himselfe cursednesse muste flee succour onely mercie god seeke thing lord iesus christ whiche oure owne persones vvee see thing conteyned holy scripture concerning oure sinnes humbling v god able ouermayster v take awaye pride presumptuousnesse flesh therfore god must fayne speake another fashion wit hee muste make v feele experience whiche conteyned holy scripture end may knowe howe vntoo v hee telleth tale speciallie hee take v towell hypocrisie whiche keepeth oure eye faste shet clozed vp wee reade holie scripture one whiche speketh god giuen euill filthie infected theyr sinnes corruption therewithall nothing else men vanitie wisdom foolishnesse thoughtes affection wickednesse enmitie god rightuousnesse wee heare wee say selues tush spoken wicked none number euery man exempteth himselfe furthermore wee surmyze wee haue wote goodnesse v bee one poore drop stretch farre wyde beare selues hande bee able content god throughly therefore muste god come take away sayde well witte wee may imagine surmize selues haue abilitie assure oure selues curse whiche conteyned scripture doo agree pertayne vntoo v must needes wound v mortall plague wee may knowe oure confusion thus yee see wee haue marke streyne whensoeuer wee desire knowe rightuousnesse say howe wee become rightuous howe wee maye obteyne fauour god sighte wee muste consider well cace standeth vppon seeking whiche shall seeme good men whiche may bee allowed man reason euer maye bee alledged creature vvhat lette v heare god speake say let v receyue holy scripture let euery v submit himselfe therevnto lette god speake let v holde peace without making oure accustomed replyes furthermore asmuche sayde hypocrisie v behooueth v bee clenzed let v consider also god iudgement muste bee dreadfull v wee muste astonished therefore lette v beseech hee hath spoken terribly vntoo v hee comforte v therevpon wee may take taste goodnesse vvhen know certaine shall make much disputing sayd article bee curious serching sort men may become rightuous firste behooueth v vnderstande nothing euill v heare howe sayde euen hee dareth vaunte himselfe shall finde nothing cursednesse crowne heade soale foote againe though god finde v throughly well disposed walke feare yet purpose vve shallbe alwayes vnperfect neuerthelesse mischiefe whatsoeuer god sayth worde yet continue alwayes still one poynt haue eye still shet seemeth v howsoeuer worlde go alwayes somewhat v wee may warrant ourselues owne workes god therefore must faine set himselfe cace eye shewe v nothing v whereof may proude howe shall men doo confounded certain neuer whit hindered thereby runne vnto lorde iesus christ puffed vp pride wee shall haue lust bee v one stomake full winde whereby weakned cannot receyue thing contrarywise becleare presumptuousnesse hungred wee desire nothing much god remedie disease haue hearkned vntoo god wyth good say whiche haue first sought shewed v holy scripture afterwarde laboured applie owne instruction assuring themselues vntoo holy wrytings speake say easily consent doctrine namely haue rightuousnesse selues sauing giuen v grace lorde iesus christ although god finde v cursed forlorne damned sinner yet redemeth v sayde confuzion whereof raunsome payde iesus christ sheaded bloud redemption saluation nowe hencefoorth forsomuch obedience iesus christ hath yeelded god father set ouer vnto v one wee selues fulfilled whole lawe thus ye see howe wee may doo selues good lesson bee short man shall neuer knowe ment beeing iustified fayth vntill hee haue heard god speake yea hearing hath made humble himselfe bereeue himselfe sayde foolishe haultinesse wherethrough men take much vpon wherewith besotted lo zophar ment saying god would speake open lippes agaynst thee sayth expresly god openeth lip deed hebrew maner speaking reporteth vehemencie speach like man treateth earnestly matter onely speaketh woorde twaine glaunce layeth forth large hee maketh full conclusion haue tolde must throughly well weyed bycause wee see howe men herken vnto god halues true peraduenture shall well heare euery worde matter great weight long wee hold al god sheweth vnto v settle selues throughly hee sayth v therefore ynough v haue yeelded one eare vntoo god haue heard euery worde shall speake vntoo v must heedfull followe sayth throughly poynts shall haue opened lippes condemne v wee bee giuen babling say presumptuous ouerhardie bragge owne rightuousnesse wee shall bee vtterly ashamed selues sayde afterwarde god reacole secretes wisedome verely saying sheweth iob might well haue bene punished double say might haue twice much iustice executed vpon god might haue forgotten miquities sake else might haue serched hebrew worde signifieth exect sometimes also require account like therefore man might expounde god able charge suche thing perceyue himselfe double daunger commeth one ende first whereas sayde god reueale wisedome iob wist shewe v knowledge haue sinnes inestimable goodnesse god passeth capacitie wisedome neuer bee atteyned vnto man reason must come v aboue heauen haue warned alreadie geere misapplyed vntoo iob deed hee knewe well ynough men must measure god rightuousnesse owne wit iob hath well opened poynt himselfe haue shewed good case howbeit hadled amisse line wee must go namely take present doctrine generally may bee profited behold speciall poynt thing whiche scripture telleth v rightuousnesse faith higher secret men attein vnto vvhat bee done god must reueale vnto v cause papist cannot assent herevnto holde themselues continually theyr owne imagination knowe rightuousnesse maner heathen philosopher man aske heathen philosopher rightuousnesse life well ruled vertuousnesse answere euen also popish diuines reason vvee say true selfe must step yet wit another rightuousnesse men whereof one droppe founde must bee faine haue rightuousnesse hauing condemned v person take v mercie lorde iesus christes sake meane may acceptable holy forsomuch obedience whiche iesus christ yeelded vnto set ouer vnto v sayde geere entreth man brayne ye see take themselues bee wittie put trust owne strength bicause purpose comprehende man reason let v thinke straunge seeing sayde belongeth onely vnto god reueale owne wisedome sayd true long men tie themselues imagination owne witte needes iudge owne liking shall neuer vnderstand rightuous god shall doo nothing babble haue set neuer many ayre colour vpon matterial shall smoke bicause know sort become rightuous god inestimable wisedome hidden man reason vntill time god haue spoke vnto v disclozeth v confusion vntill haue made v perceyue wee bee able stand vtterly cast away cursed creature none meane v haue accesse vnto comming vnto name lord iesus christ sonne till time god haue shewed v shall alwayes giuen babbling say wee shall bee giuen fonde presumptuousnesse wherewith wee moued tempted therefore god must bee fayne reueale vnto v wisedome acquainted end passe bound thing ought know ye see effect touched let v learne oft tempted sayde ouerweening owne vertues ought beare sway wee may well satisfie god owne deseruings let v learne say returne spoken heere namely belongeth vnto god disclose owne secretes vnto v teach v wisdome farre wee able atteine knowledge owne power flee much possible blindfold eye intent might put away perceyuerance feeling god iudgement v much therefore behoueth v marke wel rigoure zophar speaketh name god messenger herault sent summon v iudgement seate wee may knowe maner rigour witte intollerable whensoeuer god lysteth vse towardes v vvhat must wee must learne knowe bee humble selues wee may returne god hartie repentance desyreth nothing shoulde come name lorde iesus christ let v go mourning sinnes wounded inwarde conceyte iudgements may desire nothing take v mercie receyue v vnto onely forgiue v sinnes past also amend wise time come may walke obedience howbeeit walking must ende pay merites workes make v returne fauour beseech gouerne v wise holy spirit may continually call vpon sue father nowe let v cast selues downe presence good god father acknowledgement sinnes praying making v feele may amende v wise may desire thing much come nearer nearer vnto vntil come thither full perfection let v say almightie god heauenly father knowledge c xliij sermon seconde vpon xj chapter shalt thou finde god seeking shalt thou finde full perfection almightie surmounteth heigth heauens vvhat vvilt thou doo deeper bottomlesse depthes hovve vvilt thou comprehend vvydenesse broder earth largenesse greater sea vvhen moueth himselfe shet vp leaue vvho shall let seeing hee knovveth men vaine seeth force shall hee perceyue emptie man indued vvith hart man borne like vvilde asse asmuch easie matter v conceyue howe humble selues therefore ye see god standeth vpon doctrine ende may haue much occasion put vre yesterday wee sawe god punish v must replie agaynst ende shal find hath borne v alreadie might right vse greater rigour towards v heare v bicause sinnes haue separated v vnworthie bee heard forgotten hande reason sinnes according sayd wicked shal gain nothing thinke haue recourse vntoo verie deede go vnseynedly good god heare oute hande leastwise hee suffereth perceyue bycause good meekned setting foorth article lawfull men iustifie themselues god generall sayde labour vaine go seeke wisdome vvhy ouerreacheth heauens deeper bottomlesse pittes wydenesse stretcheth let v haue eye owne measure beholde howe man would ouerreach whole earth needeth sixe foote couer man desirous inclose whole sea imagination meane hee himselfe nothing would fayne surmount heauens howe shall hee come thither hee woulde gage bottome depthes meanes hath withall neuerthelesse let v put cace man minde able stye aboue heauen nothing could hidden yet come short god wisdome bicause infinite cannot bee compared eyther deepes heauens farre ouerpasseth therefore let v assure selues oure presumption foolish wee go knowe reason god doings thus ye see effect shewed v heere vvherefore let v marke word wisedome taken heere god purpose determination intent able comprehend true wee may well tast little portion god wisedome like beholde creature sheweth himselfe vnto v howbeit partly let v take braunch herbe wee shall see sorte cunning god hathe wrought lookingglasse hys wisedome much reason wee come greater choycer work perceyue god wisedome woonderfull thing haue tast way perfectnesse thereof spoken heere witte wee needes knowe god doth thing man desyrous see end god setteth afore hymselfe cause moueth therevnto wee muste needes vtterly confounded heere first wee admonished rawnesse wit vndersta ding intent wee passe boundes play horse broken looce wee see ouerweening pride oure nature driueth v therevnto hereby wee haue also consider goodnesse god applyeth himselfe vnto v oure feeblenesse leastwise tast whiche incomprehensible vnto v although conceiue throughly ne tast fully yet sheweth v maketh v feele far foorth profite thus see two article well woorthy marked touching first haue tolde behoueth men cosider rawe weake vnderstanding bee presume thrust themselues farre forwarde make inquisition god woorkes hee willeth giueth leaue say hee willeth gyueth leaue haue touched already god goodnesse doth vtterly barre v hauing perceyuerance wisedome behoueth v keepe measure let v well aduised euery v haue eye hys owne habilitie marke howe suttle sharpe witted wee bee howe greatly gyuen ouerboldenesse wherevnto oure owne nature eggeth v continually vve woulde alwayes bring god account doings vvhen meete straunge thing men say vntoo v god good pleasure bycause hath ordeyned therefore must pleade hym yea say wee dooth hee otherwise suche inconuenience insue heerevpon matter may drawe quite cleane awke might bee profite thus see howe euery push woulde fayne haue god yeeld v reason hee dooth moreouer althoughe wee haue thing alledge yet woulde wee god conceale thing v wee myghte enter intoo greatest secretes hath wee see howe sore harte tickled thys respect true bee sharper set bee yet common vice wherewith v infected greatest least therefore let v marke well tolde v heere god wisedome ouerreacheth heauens deeper tha depthes also vayne v desire comprehend brayne measure farre short insomuche man hundred time vnderstanding hee hath yet could hee atteyne hundred part god wisedome seeyng wee bee nothing god wisedome bottomlesse depth haue wee much cause hold selues short followe owne fancy seeking god giueth v leaue let come remembrante saye whyther goest thou thou poore creature thou entrest bottomlesse pit wherout thou canst neuer escape warning haue follow sentence way let v also beare mind whiche hath bin declared concerning fauour god sheweth v applying himselfe v shewing v workes farre foorth behoofe profite know doth thys god applying himselfe sort vntoo v bycause bounde v bonde chalenge sheweth greatly loueth v seeing co meth neere vnto v familiarly vvee heare oure lorde iesus christ sayeth disciple call seruants ye freends reason secretes haue shewed haue familiarly told commission father seeing god commeth familiarly vnto v haue great singular record loue therefore let v learne inquire god work himselfe leadeth ruleth v wel worth marking see men incline continually extremitie tolde already pride man heart hee would fayne know thing nothing might scape euery one v gyuen vice vvell god sheweth v wee must bee wise must sobernesse content selues know whiche hee disclozeth vnto v hope keepe selues vice therewithall enter contrarie extremitie saying must shet eye inquire nothing nay great difference betwixt meannesse nothing god hath made v hys owne image haue sayd wee shoulde become brute beast consent wee shoulde haue little regarde light sheweth v shoulde quite quenched v lette v learne knowe much pleaseth teach v god scholemaister giue eare speeche able giue v wisedome discretion comprehend learning wee cannot amisse lord shet hys mouth wee also must shet vp wittes holde prison wee take libertie say would know would know god haue v know hee hath shewed v seeyng two vyces reigne worlde standeth v muche hande marke haue sayde wit vse grace priuiledge god giueth v sheweth v profit know vse common prouerbe god secret bee searched true searched sauing farre forth maketh v priuie secretes ye see howe paule calleth gospell wonderfull secrete whiche hath beene hidden god yea somuch angells haue bene rauished amazed highly honored yet neuerthelesse easie doctrine v ther god vttereth wil vnto v yea ye wold say forecheaweth foode nothing v swallow downe boweth vnto rudenesse sheweth himselfe exceeding homely vve see gospell selfe high wisedome wee selues neuer arteyne vnto seeing angells comprehende yet notwithstanding doctrine ought knowne vnto v yea euen rude vnlearned sort according sainct paule sayeth another place wit somuch god hath applied himselfe vnto v secretes hid v add wherevnro god gyueth v leaue atteine yet true last day shall know thing wee muste bethinke v paule saieth wit know part yea darkely god giueth v forecast shall reuealed perfectly vnto v fully transformed image glory long therefore clothed mortall flesh let v acknowledge owne small capacitie content selues soeuer pleaseth god giue discloze vnto v secretes god keepe priuie v mortall life like cannot know hee hath determined man faithfull haue sufficient witnesse god hath chozen adopted child inherite saluation yet cannot see register heauen know whither written ynough god hath giuen good copie election looke vpon lord iesus christ insomuch mebers doubt god auow child howbeit know bee companie chosen wee know bee castawayes yet know wherefore god doth one thing discourse god prouidence thing see whole worlde wee shall confounded streyt secrete ordinance god high v atteyne vnto yee see concerning secretes hid v men must learne vse modestie short wisedome must herken vnto god follow simply sayeth without going say two thing wherein true wisedome men cosisteth say heare god speake without gainesaying follow whatsoeuer conteyned woord may haue authoritie make v feare god humble selues vnder lo heere good meane become wise lyke behoueth v obey god follow sheweth v also must desire know conteined word men wil needes wise god become starke mad vve see befel forefather adam yea eue time pure soud created image god far excellent noble state men adayes image god darkned v light almost aught el darkenesse v adam could content himselfe state desirous haue higher perfection whereinto falne foule sinke ought henceforth ashamed state pray climbe still saide highnesse wherwith adam tempted wretchednesse falne rather tumbled cannot meeken v must bee punished double therefore lette v learne couet know god sheweth v haue sayd alreadye yet notwithstanding let v ceasse searche secretes conteined holy scripture nother let v papist say forbearing know autht bicause doctrine holy scripture cannot throughly comprehended men bicause men great dauger intangled many errours heresy bycause see confusednesse world springeth men caried away fonde desire knowledge terme haue modestie content themselues wyth ouerwrapped faith beleeuing simply whatsoeuer hilde holy church seemeth first blushe hath colour yet crused blasphemie god haue sayde alreadye although doctrine lawe gospell high mindes able reache vnto yet hath god published law vaine neyther naught hath comaunded gospell preched al creature yea euen ignorantest sorte disclozeth himselfe louing gentle fashion man hee may familiarly acquaynted whiche shewed let v vnthankfull god let v accuse haue spoken bottome bottle protesteth hys prophet esay calleth v vayne hath spoken huddermudder voyce soundeth lowd cleere ought heard men v ought receyue sith cace standeth let v hardily study god worde let v apply wittes therevnto labour shall vnprofitable furthermore let v vse sayd sobernesse haue spoken heere ye may see paule meening correct foolishe rashe curiositie men sheweth whereto ought apply themselues wit knowe throughly loue god hath shewed v lord iesus christ wee neede nothing el life long seeke diligently sayde grace shewed v lord iesus christ wee bee rescued satanstyrannie set free bondage sinne death howe whereas wee vtterly damned nature wretched lothely sinner god wee become rightuous receyueth v liketh well v howe gouerned holy spirite ende wee fight lustes owne fleshe howe wee bee reserued vnder hande protection althoughe diuell practyze ouerthrowe v euery minute houre yet wee maye able driue backe bycause sheepefolde keeping good sheepeherd jesus christe hath promised suffer perish whome father hath put hande therefore let v get knowledge thing also ought continually preace vnto god lawfull v call vpon open mouthe bycause hath giuen v mediator maketh v way vnto howe iesus christe beareth worde v god dothe doubt heare v wee praye christes name knowe thing well tyme well bestowed cause paule addeth oure heygth depthe oure bredth short willeth men behold howe maye bee perfectly wyse namely knowing thorowly grace vttered wrought vnto lorde iesus christe heerewithall let v learne knowe must indeuer clymbe high vnderstand wisedome god selfe deepe gulfe hee attayne let v sure strength come shorte therefore men must humble themselues lette v beare mynde paule sayeth v namely shall haue styed vp aloft aboue heauens shall atteyne knowe aught else fatherly loue oure god assuring selues therein wee shall haue perfection wisdome whiche shall stretch selfe high deepe farre wyde side wordes paule taunteth curious heades fisking desirous stye vp aloft sinke low beneath search thing ouer ouer yet meane whyle nothing vanitie nimbler bee lesse surenesse firmenesse paule therefore checketh men making discourse sondly therewithall sheweth giuen holding whiche profite would content themselues shewed simply scripture heere yee see also moyses published lawe sayeth aske mo question saying shall climbe heauen shall go ouer sea shall go downe deepe yee haue worde mouth hearte paule applyeth saying doctrine gospell wyth cause lawe selfe darke could haue contented men giue need full god sent iesus christe haue father olde time part god putteth worde mouth heart giuing v little taste filling v full bee owne lustes insatiable according mennes lustes verie gulfes meane thinges wee come inquyring searching beholde vnmeasurable gulfe v wee coulde finde harte swallowe vp whole maiestie god packe vp glorie one little fardell hee shoulde reserue nothing himselfe seeing bee suche lette v remember well sainct paules saying let v apply studie way long liue lette v profite knowledge lorde iesus christ intent hee hath graffed v bodie hee may increace gift v day day vntill bee throughly filled lo wee haue marke streyne forthwith followeth vvho hee let god hee liste shet vp hee liste let looce hee list remoue hee liste make newe order hee disappoynte purpose vvho shall sette himselfe agaynste good pleasure hath bene tolde v ought bee ouer inquisitiue god wisedome furtherforth giueth v leaue licence knowledge declared v namely lawfull v grudge doings though oure power restreyne reason wee oughte like well euer god dooth although wee knowe hee doth hide v hee loth haue v conceyue reason workes bicause behoueth v haue trie obedience wee may know god shoulde giue v full declaration woorkes heere bee able indure pride woulde wee thinke selues bee although wee see wit bee weake wee feele selues wrapped darkenesse cloudes vnderstanding reach threefoote afore v yet man may see wee ceasse auaunce selues aloft therefore woulde become v god reyne v shorte moreouer honour yeelde wee god wee comprehende dooings shoulde seeme woulde bee hayle fellow well met wee see pryde v alreadie therefore good god shoulde trie obedientnesse ende wee may learne glorifie dooings yea euen though bee thing v vnknowne though find straunge first pushe make v say likelyhood ought go otherwise lette v say seeing god good pleasure behoueth mee yeeld thereto vvhen men come suche discretion haue greatly profited yee see cause god sheweth v hee doth furthermore whereas mention made remouing shetting vp letting muche bene sayde god chaunge transpose euer wee see yet ought wee gaynesay presume stryue alleadge thing agaynste true wee beholde order nature god hath set alreadie wee ought right glorifie certainely god hath set v worlde greate stage beholde woorkes confesse hee wise rightuous mightie yea euen wonderfull manner behoueth men onely bee taught giue glorie reuerence also bee throughly rapted aboue sens vnderstading acknowledge crie dauid impossible atteyne wisdome god appeareth workes although god chaunge orderlinesse wherein wee shoulde beholde wherein keepe v occupied day yet neuerthelesse behoue v submit selues therevnto say hee doth without cause thinke straunge sayde afore let v learne say yea art thou wretched creature pray man haue gotten great vnderstanding skill yet knoweth himselfe men say hee wise say man haue applyed minde learning yea haue practized himselfe affayres insomuch hee able giue another man good counsell yet meane starke soole vtterlye witlesse thing concerne himselfe touche owne persone men say suche one hath witte true hath witte remembrance men hee hath discretion himselfe euen would restreyn god mighty power fancie thinke themselues able coprehend fayle cheefe poynt wit know theselues entreth looketh vpon throughly shall find vtterly vnskilfull weake therfore hath great need walke modestly humbly god ye see men caried away haue neither reason discretion go sort coprehend god mightie power conceyts much therfore behoueth v marke well lesson whether god shet vp let chaunge must therfore ceasse honour mightie power maner sheweth vnto v although wee knowe reason worketh wise yet notwithstanding wee muste learne glorifie poynts saying lord good reason thing shuld lawful thee thou shouldst vse thy creature pleaseth thee thou mightest pul heauens raise vp earth aloft short whensoeuer thou dealest thou listest thy creature thou passest beyond thine owne right neither vsurpest thou man right al thine due behold say sort men ought glorifie goodnesse mightie power god yet al must father lawlesse power vpon god popish teacher terme cursed diuelish thing cofesse schooles god might absolute power thunder vpo angel damne call absolute power god wrongfull tyrannous power let v take good heede surmize god tyran doth al thing indiffere e vprightnesse neuerthelesse hath purpose hidden fro v therfore becometh v honor rightuousnesse though vnknowne v wit vnderstanding vnable arte ne therevnto haue remember streyne seeing cace standeth mortall men lift vp themselues agaynst god withstande mightie power finde fault rightuousnesse though shoulde please alter order nature remoue shift thing pray must wee needes bee vnthankfull forwarde murmur agaynst god present orderlinesse see beautifull wherein nothing foud fault let v put cace god turned light darkenesse sunne tumbled downe deepe earth mounted vp high al thing confounded togither yet ought glorifie god say lord astonished thing right strange v vouchsafe thou hold v awe vntill thou haue shewed v good thus yee see haue doo nowe orderly disposition world spite teeth forced say workemanship creature able atteyne vnto must mindes bee ouermalicious wee cannot glorifie god lowlinesse true wee see confuzion present order nature whereof commeth god disposeth thing bee wished seemeth turned vpside downe wherof cometh sinnes cause god continueth thing order set beginning wee make many confuzed midlies yet neuerthelesse wee must cace deeme god vpright iudge herewithall let v beare mind cofoundeth order nature wise maketh v feele hys fatherly goodnesse mercie continually therefore much ought induced humilitie weesee greatnesse goodnesse mercie passeth hougenesse enormitic sinnes thus much concerning sentence addeth also god knoweth men vanitie men nothing worth shoulde vnderstande man borne sillie wilde asse knoweth himselfe yet thinketh himselfe able match mightie power conclusion doctrine wee haue heard discourse hath beene made concerning god mightie power reacheth aboue heauens deeper deepes therfore men take vpon inquisitiue must vnderstand bee swallowed vp needes giue curiousnesse bridle search bottome god power must fayne shew lawfull creature lift vp theselues whatsoeuer thus ye see declaration serueth applie general doctrine present purpose whiche god side knoweth men side men thing haue cause aduaunce themselues call god reckening let v little consider birth men like wilde ass say haue none vnderstanding except god giue touching first poynt without cause sayth god knoweth men vanitie bee nothing worth ende wee learne value selues reason ordinarie maner vvhen men value themselues owne fancie beleeue themselues thereafter giue verdit nothing worth wee must esteeme selues according god hath spoken none alone may copetent iudge know bee hath authori e say thing wee ought marke well men haue valued themselues owne imagination opinion shall haue gayned like whe foole calleth himselfe king countrie meane euery man laughes scorne labor vve double fooles wee weene selues bee thing withall god sheweth v howe nothing vanitie v let v mind men desirous know state estimation effect bee must turne god saying lorde thou knowest v thou hast made v shall haue short resolute answere vve see scripture sayth wisdome men suppose themselues haue starke follie wyser wene themselues dullardes god laugheth fondnesse scorne thinke climbe vp high withdraweth himselfe must faine wanze away owne imagination lo scripture pronounceth let v assure selues none god knoweth v truly tell cause sayd god knoweth seemeth first blush common thing euerye man easily easily confesse god knoweth men vanitie yet wee consider substance wordes import bicause men haue eye stopped know themselues full vanitie therefore god fayne make feele may learne humble themselues thus muche first poynt second emptie man shall indued hart shall like wild ass colt brought backe birth v vnderstand al wit haue god gift besides nature let v looke vpon power men vvhen little babe commeth mother wombe wisedome bringeth verely philosopher haue well supposed al vnderstanding haue selues onely memorie requisite v haue one sence inclozed v afore hand yet seene childe hath lesse wit silliest beast let man looke throughout shall finde beast brutishe vnpurueyed reason vnderstanding men comming world ye see man foale wilde asse let ake great account himselfe hee listeth yet wee see hee neuerthelesse howe wee haue spirit vnderstanding wee come full age god must fayne giue v see sayde emptie man shall indued hart scripture woorde harte importeth vnderstanding let v marke shewed haue wit reason commeth owne nature neyther wee possesse though grew vp v behoueth v know excellent benefite god bestoweth vpon v seeing haue hande vnthankfulnesse v abuse therefore let v acknowledge benefite giuing v wisedome discretion come age knowe selues honour let v learne hold selues humilitie according pleaseth god giue v vnderstanding let v acknowledge come let v pray make v applie wittes vse may alwayes walke holde selues vnder awe vntill beeing set free bondage sinne conueyed heauenly glorie beholde perfectly let v cast selues downe face good god acknowledgement sinnes praying make v perceyue graunt v grace applie wittes indeuer consider wit wretched vaine vnprofitable creature vnable thing selues must sayne furnish strengthen v else wee must needes vtterly quayle knowledge owne weakenesse feeblenesse may prouoke v returne greater desire grace good god offereth v seeking nothing bee filled ende wee may honour magnifie respect vntill hee haue brought v perfection wherevnto bee called without swaruing one way feare turning right way saluation may please graunt grace onely v also people c xliiij sermon thirde vpon xj chapter thou prepare thine hart stretch thy handes vnto thou put iniquitie thee vvhich thy hande vnrightuousnesse abide thy tent mayst thou lift vp thy face vvithout spot thou shalt sure shalt afrayde thou shalt forget thy miserie shalt haue remembrance vvaters passed time shall spring vp bright noone day shalt thou shine bee morning thou shalt safe bicause hope thou shalt dig pit lay thee dovvne safely thou shalt rest thee shall bee noman make thee afrayed many shall sue thee eye vvicked shall sayle forgo refuge hope shall turned anguish minde wee haue seene heretofore lowlinesse ought bee men thinke vppon god work wit must presume iudge owne fancie must vnderstande forasmuch god wisdome infinite therefore cannot comprehend reason doings forasmuch able thing man ought presume let giue leaue doo hee thinketh good al men ought stoupe vnto behold second point zophar addeth desirous god fauourable merciful v must seeke pure right meening minde without hypocrisie thus ye see effect declared afterward conclusion addeth smitten god hand cannot excuse themselues howe soeuer cace standeth owne sinne cause miserie indure verely thing misapplied iobs person yet notwithstanding ceasseth good v therefore let v bethinke v profite selues first whereas told v god gracious seeke vnfaynedly often ynough warranted v holy scripture god allureth vnto deceyue sayth turne vnto wil turne vnto hereby declareth hee alwayes willing readie v good let side let v marke whensoeuer seeke god bee hande v yea euen grace blissing wee must also marke meane seeking god see men beare themselues hand haue desired nothing god mercifull haue bene desirous yeeld themselues vnto cheef desire honour yet draw quite cleane backwarde text declared wise god serued requireth alloweth therefore sayth first wee must settle heart stretch handes vnto afterwarde put wickednesse hand none may dwel house behold say men may obey god turne aside namely beginning soundnesse heart bycause god abhorreth dissimulation contrarywise see hypocrisie reigneth wise nature hart shrinketh alwayes backeward make many countenance many apish toyes mowes shoulde seeme altogither fire zeale godward outwardly shall full ceremony apparant pretence whereas notwithstanding shal truth right meening inwardly hart ye see haue much neede marke sayd namely go seeke god thing aughtworth insteade going forwarde draw backwarde except hart disposed way say except haue pure single affection double heart better confirmation lesson wee must bethinke v textes scripture god auoucheth like mortall creature rest vpon outward shewes thing bycause wee bee fleshly wee make much seemeth gay god one therefore wee must measure metyard forasmuch peculiar office searche bottome mennes pr thoughtes must needes layd open therefore eye looke vnto faithfulnesse truth sayde ieremie bee short seruice god ought bee grounded vpon singlehartednesse wherof scripture speaketh oft saying thou shalt bee sounde mee without cause god giue rule abraham gaue ende bee generall faythfull often repeating shew god mindeth shoale owne child certaine marke hypocrite alwayes setteth downe sayde soundhartednesse therefore let v marke well forasmuche god truth hee bee serued spirite truth seeing god seruice spirituall eyning vntruth must bee farre v otherwise althoughe workes please men neuer much commended worlde bee better dung vanitie god reiect wee haue wee haue first indeuered put harte order true papistes take holde text proue freewill seemeth haue fayre colour say sith men exhorted order harte aright therefore abilitie power fonde tryfling reason measure men power abilitie thing commaunded god sheweth v wee haue doo respecteth wee able v respecteth bee bound vnto dutie vvhen willeth v loue hart strength power bicause findeth man liuing able yeelde whole hart sayde loue vve see flat contrarie nature fully bent agaynst god god ment require nothing handes able performe hee shoulde let v go streight destruction let v thinke god lozeth right bicause wee haue wherewith pay put cace man dette reason creditours shoulde loze right bicause falne pouertie wasting goodes riot excesse true shall able recouer hande yet doth dette remayne alwayes vpon head seeing cace doo wee thinke god disfeated duetie bicause men bee altogither lewde frowarde bicause diuell holdeth bondage giuen ouer mischeef wickednesse must conclude men able dispose owne hart themselues pleasure owne motio bycause god commaundeth hee doth onely shewe bounde euer able attempt shall esteemed receyued god hande vntill tyme wee haue sayd purenesse hart whereof mention made thys place nowe let euery man examine hymselfe shall fynd selues haue hart stone nothyng hardnesse nother reigneth thyng naughtinesse suche continuall stubbornesse meanes bowed obey god sith cace standeth god muste fayne put hys hande hath also promised doo sayeth hee giue v fleshly harte shall soft plyable wee may serue sayeth ingraue law sorte harte bowel wee shall giue selues alloweth shall one conformitie agreement beweene desire affection betweene rightuousnesse conteyned lawe say peculiar worke god therfore behoueth dispose v seruing bycause vnfit one oure behalfe drawing altogither backe hauing aught lustes contrarietie goodnesse lo belongeth god apply v vnto himselfe make v fitte able serue seeing haue abilitie meane selues hath thus spoken purenesse rightfull meening hart hee sayeth wee muste stretch handes vntoo god thys importeth muche vnder one particular zophar ment comprehende effecte cheefe poynt god seruice first table lawe el prayer recorde faith wee haue godward calling vppon god without hypocrisie witnesse openly welfare lyeth hym onely partie whome ought flee succoure shorte calling vpon god wee yeelde hym glory belongeth vnto hym whych reserueth hymselfe let v marke vnder thys one particular point calling vpon god zophar ment comprehende whole content fyrste table whych god telleth v must worshipped v ca abide haue copartener must abuse name vnhalowe wee must render hym honour worthy followe order hath appointed hys church thyngs bee throughly considered certayn calling vpon god protest haue none god alone renounce idolatrie superstition shewing trust settled vppon hym alone declaring ryghtuousnesse power life wholly god fountain behoueth v drawe wee bee greatly bounde indetted vnto impossible v discharge selues towardes hym beholde sort hys name shall honored agayne yeelding selues ouer prouidence prayer meane obserue spirituall sabboth rest besides thys prayer importeth confession fayth also desire god vouchsafe succour v also yeeld thankes benefites haue receyued hys hand wee see vnder calling vpo god coprehended whatsoeuer perteyneth honour heereby see poperie seruice god hath onely bene peruerted marred also good vtterly abolished true men easily say ought pray vnto god maner come thyther say papistes must runne trotte sainct sainct virgin marie must mother mercie treasurie saluation euery sainct muste haue office thither must men haue recourse must repose trust god muste haue little sprinkling somuch shall hardly knowne great number wee must wise begin beare themselues hand go first heesaincts sheesaincts god shaketh iesus christ speaking seeking vnto mediator hee shoulde make way god father thys geere haue skill meeneth seeing principall poynt perteineth god honor obserued let v assure selues eue rest inferiour therefore let v thanke good god drawing v horrible dungeon shewing v whome must hold selues must call vpo father take heede keepe way wherby sheweth v come vnto namely assuring selues hys seate terrible vnto v make v shunne rather amiable v come vnto asmuch lord iesus christ reacheth v hand office make intercession v god also hath opened v gate desiring nothing v day day come vnto lette v say acknowledge inestimable benefite vnto v therwithall let v haue pitie vpon blynde wretch whyche go astray manner somuch come poynt calling vpon god wote end begin verely hereby appereth state miserable wherein lieth al welfare men wherein al happinesse haue sayde haue theyr recourse vnto god according sayd whosoeuer calleth vpo name lord shal safe cace standeth wretched papistes wote calling vpo god therefore must concluded muste needes bereft al hope saluation banished god kingdome seing know call vpon god appeereth come doubting trembling therewithall haue thousand windlass come god bycause haue iesus christ guide foreleader let v marke wel streyne wherein mention made stretching handes vnto god vvhy asmuch cannot stye vp heaue reason infirmity behoueth v haue signe may serue make outward protestatio inwarde secrete ye see harte cannot seene pray vnfainedly hart lifteth selfe vp aloft much came god lay foorth euer haue within v say inuisible neuerthelesse holding vp hand vnto god declare haue refuge thus see prayer betokened signe holy scripture signe whole principall poynt prayer hypocrite skil wel ynough stretch hand armes seemeth euer burning fire yet al nothing falshod mocke god therefore behoueth signe true scripture also presupposeth ye see also sayde heart must disposed zophar sayde stretch thy handes vnto god men myght haue alledged god contented come ceremony sayth afore thing heart must sound wrything crokeduesse much say must layd foudacion whervpon build hereby see lifting vp hand vnto heaue nothing vnles hart go hads may true recorde man god himselfe knoweth concerning residue life peraduenture men regard v may haue regard verely must desire prayse desire allowed creature receiue wage sayth lord iesus christ yet notwithstanding let men see v rest life pray vnto god euery man must retire shrinke himselfe may acknowledge behold god behold throne maiestie doings life prayer must remoued furthest hypocrisie vntruth mean ill put vre let man marke howe hypocrite papacie play mockeholiday god shalbe store liplabour thing wherein bewraye themselues though hypocrisie thing yet al praiers papist side would god like consideratio haue spoke say euery v retired cometh praying vnto god locked vp behalf respect world another maner perfectnesse prayer haue feare god durst bold call vpon god name full mouth doe call vpon men seeming ynough world thinke haue good returne vnto god meane god seeth sparke good furthermore although behoue v withdrawn selues pray vnto god ment comon prayer stirre vp one another example sufficient euery man prayed chamber lodging god haue v pray togither comon one mouth end may one solemne confession faith euery man may edified neighbor neuerthelesse open praying must sort may withdrawne selues euery man haue eye vpon god aboue thus muche concerning wordes lifting vp oure handes zophar commeth downe second table lawe sayth must put away iniquitie handes must well house manner speaking rife ynough say vve haue cleane handes hand meddle deale matter betwene v neighbor therefore robbeth neyghbor doth violence anoyance hathe foule hand like contrarie part said childre god wash hand kepe equitie vprightnesse giue theselues misdealing rather haue regard serue euery man turne zophars meening place man wil blissed god prosper must withhold hand vnrightfulnesse driue away al vnrightfulnesse hand haue called vpon god haue protested whose handes looke saluation welfare haue glorified beco meth v remaineth communicate neyghbors also without man wrong may complaine haue put losse hinderace cleere fro al violence guile liue neighbour maner behold god also draw neere vnto v thus ye see howe shall perceiue readie bestow good thing vpon v desire meete saluation forasmuch men willingly beare theselues yea excuse ourselues euill seeke many shift starting hole horrible behold sayd misdealing must chazed banished tent say men must none euill directly might cast teeth shame also muste beware none euill bee done vnder shadow exaple master household let hold wife child seruants awe let take good heede wrong done man ouerthwart meanes wycked dealing thus yee see precisely added misdealing must dwell tentes haue wee effect sayde remayneth euery one v thinke better haue done doctrine consisteth wordes must put vre euery euery v must thinke vpon throughly nothing heere ought comon familiar v farre euen bycause parte v contented heare speake yet notwithstanding leaue chief point entent therefore may touched better quick let v marke first must go bush god keepe right way shewed v saying drawe v superstition fond ape toyes wherewith men beguile themselues wilfully general principle men finde hart confesse welynough namely good reason god honored serued without curse v cast v away ought wonder though punish v consume v aduersities world seing worke spite god must needes ouerwhelme v euery man say well confesse agayne seconde poynt bee denyed god haue pitie vpon v wee turne vnto wee serue ought hee deale hardely v shall finde experience father sauiour v men well ynough say commeth deede bee well perceyued nothing hypocrisie goodly protestation men farre god long thought content fonde fancy let v learne true turning whyche god alloweth tormenting ma selfe vayne superfluous thing comming vnto rightmeening soundnesse let v looke vppon lurkingholes harte say let euery man examine himselfe let v flatter selues make selues beleeue blacke white shall winne nothing seeyng haue many startingholes selues wee haue good cause fight easie matter haue cleere hart suche soundnesse god requireth vvhen men haue indeuered themselues thervnto tyme much come middes iourney die yet neuerthelesse must trauell still desire god strengthen v wee may compasse intent power holy spirite marke speciall poynt bringing heereof passe let v take heede bee angrie selues oft feele hypocrisie feynednesse selues euery man looked neerely certayne sigh hundred time day whereas falne asleepe yea mightely stoutly iustifie selues many would fayne haue men thinke seeke god pure freeharted affection apply indeuer therevnto yet meane searched themselues throughly see men see would manifestly perceyued ful hypocrisie one drop good zele seeing worlde findeth ought rather finde themselues beguyle themselues wilfully euery v sayd examine himselfe ought certaine wee shoulde fall sleepe rather wee shoulde pricked prouoked proceede right way let v make speede god calleth v giueth v leaue boldnesse stretch handes vnto let v abuse suche benefite inestimable god preuented infinite goodnesse gaue v way vnto v durst preace vnto deede wee bee shaken diuelish malapertnesse man owne selfe owne head preace vntoo god hauing leaue god man durst come neere mortall prince dead carkesse shall preace maiestie oure maker yea verely considering wee mortall enemy wee cannot come thyther wee shall bring much sinne bee hee muste needes abhorre v reason thereof spiteth hym see v according also hee renounceth disclaymeth v creature respect bee sinner therefore must fayne giue v leaue call v tell v wee shalbe welcome open v gate behoueth v know needefull v bee dealt haue sayde afore witte flee god refuge assuring selues wee destitute goodnesse needie wretched may bee furthermore wee may well seeke heere wee lacke shall finde nothing emptinesse oure selues shalbe famished weene supply theyr want seeking remedie handes creature doo feede themselues winde let v go god seeke meane come lord iesus christ make intercession v cause v finde fauour owne person god must needes hate v yea good right also holde v accursed please fauorable v come name lord iesus thing sayde vnder lawe shadowes yet darke ought wee bee muche affectioned adayes seeing veyle temple rente asunder thys present doctrine serued time lawe people abode porch temple stoode aloofe veyle also hide thing sight earnestly ought practize day true high priest bare name child israell vpon shoulder vpon brest behold iesus christ hath rent asunder veyle temple opened way wise wee may shewe oure selues god looke face way continually open hys bloud apostle sayeth busshes bramble let v nother way rough shrubbie wee shoulde bee faine leape ouer many lettes way altogither playn leuell go bloud lord iesus christ thus muche concerning poynt furthermore let v marke well also call vpon god purely shewing wee make true confession faith yeelde due honour muste also communicate neighbour maner vpright dealing neighbour made like vnto image god yet notwithstanding fleece one eate vp another euery man giuen himselfe pray spitte god far possible v worke anoyance shapen image neybours bee member iesus christe wee offer wrong violence haue eye owne profit renting iesus christes body peeces sorte leade v god father make v find fauour lette v marke haue accesse vnto god wee must liue neighbour vpright dealing heere expresse mention made hand end shoulde knowe meane whereby god proueth maner christianitie v euery man wil inable himselfe tung none v al good seruant god wee may beleeued vpon woorde commeth deede man shall see cleane contrary hee hath preached charitie spoken maruellous well shew wholly giuen himselfe co meth point must ioyne neighbor good sooth none shamelesse alwayes speaking charitie haue bene accustomed haue much charitie vsed towardes preach none thing man aske owe shal get none reason charitie charitie make remorse pil poll men goodes list blameworthy god man yet ashamed preach charitie yea shall pilfer men goodes therefore expresse mention made hand behold true trial whither loue god honour becometh v making knowne vprightnesse equitie v short kindnesse v wee liue sort neighbour euery one v according state abilitie imploy himselfe succour haue neede intent meanes league aliance god hath set cosecrated among v may obserued thus ye see haue marke saide must cast al iniquitie far hand one handycrafts man well let businesse faithfully content himselfe honest gaine worke hand let buyeth thinke thus must haue another man labour seeing brother trauels take payne reason lose tyme otherwise one shoulde go plucke bread mouth god hath set hys sustenance labour hand wrong much sucked bloud whome god hath comended vnto whome bound releeue yee see euery man ought haue eye estate haue alleaged example end euery one v lay forth peecemeale according v haue deale neybours behaue selues wise wee might giue man occasion complayne v furthermore also euery man haue eye hys owne household god ynough faithful man forbeare euildoing directly himselfe also haue al croked wayes farre v specially haue care gouerne house god may honored childre husband wife master meseruants mayd seruants would god thought vpon better head house go astray haue feare god religio seene al goeth wrecke child also honour father mother become better haue discretion ye shall see rooted naughtinesse men maydens shalbe full corruptio true maysters mistress tel wel ynough finde fault seruants commit lewd prankes filche thing serue would haue meane god offended thousand wayes make matter shal let slip much therfore behoueth v marke well haue saide namely must thinke content god carefull serue onely owne persones wee must also haue eye whome haue charge keepe away euill wise assuring selues consent vntoo wee must bee wrapped damnation wicked diligent take heede let v doubt god regard v mercie neere hande v wyth blissing grace according promised heere verily haue yet one poynt marke god fauour shewe selfe alwayes firste brunt promise conteyned heere taken lawe leastwise effect haue tolde wee knowe tyme booke written howsoeuer cace stande see spirite god spake ye see heere doctrine conformable whiche conteyned lawe moyses lorde promiseth blisse serue dwell among make perceyue howe auayleable hys presence witte life shall happie lette v beare minde haue touched wit god maketh v feele hys fauour first push therefore whereas sayd walke feare god shal blissed hee make prosper ment god visiteth seruants wise seemeth bee alienated quite although call vpo must faine linger paine wote seeming god hath vtterly forsaken must bee fayne walke world many affliction notwithstanding wee serue god heerewithall haue double comfort one side certayne although hart tende vnto god yet notwithstanding forasmuch zele ought nother serue affection bound therefore must bee faine suffer punishment correction sinnes yet meanes god maketh v consider owne want wee mighte humble selues fall amendment returne vnto haue bin exercised sort trouble hee sendeth lo heere one great comforte bee made like vnto lord iesus christe like hee entred kingdome heauen tribulation death euen hys member beare markes troubled worlde end may cause v come glory resurrection vve see oure aduersities turned welfare heerewithall ought also comfore selues oure god put v triall knoweth meete behofefull v although wee must faine endure many want misery state seeme bee wretcheddest worlde yet god ceasse make v feele continuallye hee neere v hathe forsaken v watcheth alwayes ouer v defende v ende wee seeke hande indeuoure serue honoure hym pure right meening mynde vtterly voyde hypocrisie haue declared alreadie let v cast selues downe good god father acknowledgement oure faultes sinnes praying bring v backe vnto himselfe much seeth vntowardnesse nature oure thoughtes affection bent euill nothing oure intentes vanitie leasing may please reforme v wise wee may become newe ceatures wee knowing selues bee destitute goodnesse maye seeke fauoure belongeth oure saluation yea bodyly life say wee maye seeke according office giue bountifully vnto v specially name oure lorde iesus christ gouerned spirite wee maye call vppon oure father therewithall bee ioyned knitte togither one true brotherly affection wee maye declare thereby wee bee child wee growe true vnion charitie vntill beeing receyued heauenly heritage wee maye enioy true vnion whiche begonne alreadie v maye please graunt grace onely v also people nation earth c xlv sermon first vpon twelfth chapter iob ansvvered saide yea people vvisedome shall die vvith haue vvit vvell vvhit inferiour vvho knovveth thing alledge aiesting stocke friendes calleth vpon god vvhome heareth rightuous perfect skorned torch despised rich man vvhose foote point slip tent robber prosper hold god hand boldly prouoke seemeth first blushe two saying namely suche feare god shall blissed wicked shall prosperitie cleane contrary deed iob answering wee haue heard witte despizers god lyue oftentymes ease gaynesayth propounded heeretofore zophar iobs answering contrarie hath bin said shew doctrine although bee taken lawe neuerthelesse misapplyed therefore behoueth v consider well howe vnderstoode vvhereas god declareth auoucheth lawe hee keepe good vnder protection hee giue heart desire shall want nothing themselues cattell goodes shall bee blissed meeneth good shall neuer bee troubled pacience knowne riddeth hys seruants trouble thing fall mynde wee know call vppon god desire pitie v nother wee feele goodnesse reaching v hande let v marke well god hathe promised faythfull suche prosperitie world bee vtterly exempted ordinarie trouble wherevnto behoueth v bee subiecte promise god serue v vnderstande commonly god make prosper whiche walke feare wee see howbeit waye wee haue two poyntes marke witte oure synnes make v vnworthy god shoulde blisse v sortes time man hee prouoketh god euen perfectest whome seeming fault founde euen rightuousest doe finde themselues blameworthy god therefore chastize hee doth iustly againe sayd god doth alwayes measure affliction hee sendeth sinnes wee haue committed hee hathe reason visite v namely hee mortifie euill v oftentimes god faine preuent vice lurke v although wee haue yet offended yet god see well wee fall euill therefore steppeth afore remedie besides hee intendeth humble v wee may put trust world tied earth moreouer meeneth knowe whither wee obedient aduersitie well prosperitie also purposeth know fayth whither wee flee refuge shorte make v haue eye kingdome heauen ende wee know oure welfare two point well considered bee easie v conclude god blisseth suche keepe commaundementes sendeth whatsoeuer hee knoweth bee behoofe yea appetite knowledge hee alwayes iudge furthermore scourge doth cause let feele hys fauoure goodnesse continually haue whereof reioyce thus ye see howe promise present life taken god bindeth himselfe handle v one indifferent rate effecte meening shewe wee shall perceyue bee fauourable neere hand seeing saide lawe wee shall liue peace rest wee followe god lawe cause men vexe v trouble v haue made warre god vvhen mortall man aduaunceth himselfe hys creator meete hee also haue enemy vexe anoy persecuted men let v looke haue kept peace god let v consider wee haue prouoked displeasure therefore let v maruell thoughe hee giue men leaue vexe v sort side heere ye see sayd lawe god send warre vpon haue wise incountered furthermore although man pursue harme yet ceasse carrie hangman within among cur lawe sayd also forest curse ought abash v thou shalt bee alwayes agast thou shalte haue thine eye sunken thy heade thy lyfe shall hang vpon thread morning thou shalt say howe shall continue vntill night night thou shalte say warrant passe ouer night thou shalt continuall fearefulnesse sayth lorde behold rightfull punishment vpon suche framed meekenesse seruing god purely namely driuen bee owne tormenter let v marke well howe without cause lawe blissing giuen v shall liue peace man shall vexe v cleaue vnto god without gaynesaying god holde wicked shorte shall bee able hurt v thoughe practize whatsoeuer v let v marke also way although assayled outwardly pray yet neuerthelesse must assure selues god defende v sayd promise deceitfull howe nowe god sticke suffer wicked spurre v gall v euen trie constancie also sticke suffer v bee tempted mind shall doubt distrust ende call vpon praye strengthen v shall come passe yet meane tyme faythfull shall feele god cast vppe middes trouble hand faythlesse shall vtterly dismayde ende shall feele god hathe forsaken deserue much bee sayde residue blissings lawe short oft troubled let v haue eye faultes humble selues god assuring selues chastizementes sendeth rightfull desirous hee shoulde assuage sorrowes let v runne vnto let v ceasse misdoing notwithstanding haue sayd alreadie must therfore imagin god holdeth one ordinarie measure punishing offender rate deserte vve see chastizeth men worlde lesse yea hee reserueth many punishmentes laste daye therefore wee muste pronounce suche definitiue sentence generall zophar hathe doone cause iob speaketh yea saythe hee people haue expounded sentence though iob meante spoken brought nothing suche stuffe knowne men yea euen verie idiot cleane contrarie meening say seemeth whole world seemeth wisdome shall dye thinke ye haue witte esteeme yee vnderling thing yee alledge well knowne therefore must bee fayne bee despised call vpon god heard say god seemeth fauoure therefore agreeth wishe muste bee fayne bee mockingstocke folke must bee fayne bee torch wasteth despized rych short hold god hand sayth hee doe boldly spite prouoke whyle tentes wicked vnthriftes prosper heereby iob sheweth howe great follie affyrme generally without exception god dothe thys present life punishe suche haue offended soone man hath doone amisse god redresseth hath hande vp take suche vengeance partie hathe deserued vvee see cleane contrarie sayd afore seemeth repugnant doctrine lawe sayd god curse transgressers commaundementes hee shewe fauoure goodnesse towardes keepe men see hauockmakers fauoured hande men see good despised disquieted vvhat meante godiest promiseth blisse faithfull pronounced suche curse vpon despisers word haue alreadie loozened knot shewing god executeth iudgementes one rate world vvee must alwayes beare mynde hath bene sayd heretofore witte god punishe haue doone amisse like like saye faulte great punishment bee answerable fault light chastizement suddeine vpon good dealt heart desire whereto comming oure lorde iesus christ serue resurrection wee waite hope would conclude beholde god sheweth himselfe bee iudge world let doe well listeth hee receiue well god hande would anye heauenly life haue heauen heere wee see god prouide yll oure welfare make punishmentes like offence amisse therefore requisite diuerse yea part punishmentes reserued vvhen god punisheth wicked well make v walke feare warinesse also sheweth v escape hande iudgeth without respect person must conclude faultes committed day abyde vnpunished respecte thys presente lyfe shall come accounte ende witte great assyses hild lo iob speaketh doctrine lawe againste false exposition giuen zophar woulde god shoulde presently make suche execution iudgementes hee shoulde leaue faulte vnfounde oute wee neede wayte anye dooyng falleth oute hathe bene shewed afore heereby wee bee taught praye god giue v spirite wisedome may apply well oure owne vse doctrine true good may haue skill take profite heere see doctrine verie profitable edifying god sheweth v serue shall loose laboure hee mainteine v continually make v perceyue life throughout thing thinke god regardeth v seruice slippeth away without regarde part therefore wee must come whiche esay sayth bee yee contented rightuous shall receiue hyre otherwise would betyde v dauid confesseth happened vnto namely hee good slidden awaye foote slipped poynt fall bene vpon yee suche time hee thought washing hys handes innocencie seruing god bene vaine must wee vnderstande god watcheth ouer worlde hee knoweth bee seeke serue honoure also hee hath eye vpon wicked sayd psalme ende must needes shewe beare great contempt grace meane season let v tarrie god leysure till hee sende iudgementes due time v hasten great doltishnesse would haue god punish faultes prouoke wrath presently sone toy taketh v head yea verely delay till another time v abridge libertie behold sayd haue neede praye god giue v spirite wisedome ende may take sayde texte lawe owne imagination wee maye bee good expounder wee doe zophar doth heere concludeth suche serue god muste rewarded hand prensent lyfe must paradise god must bee fauourable world may see shewe verie deede doth saith iob vvhy ye see wicked prosperitie prouoke god much boldly sith cace standeth experience sheweth v god execute iudgementes hande holdeth couert suspence vntill houre hee thinketh good meane whyle good chyldren god euen haue walked single meaning heart may scourged extremely yet must bee imputed sinnes though furthest square men sayde suche man punished rigorously therefore must concluded hee heynous offender god abhorreth god knowes wherfore scourgeth good hee hath diuerse reason v giue sentence v saye man hathe sinned greeuously others seeing god vseth suche roughnesse towards thus yee see howe must restrayne promise threatnings lawe god prouidence cursse thereof suche wee see bee daily threatnings god true hee sayth cursse transgressers yea hee executeth first day god must workes pleaseth selfe proportion measure hee knowes conuenient god promiseth blisse serue walke according yea yet hee haue authoritie afflicte euen welfare saluation hee ceasseth bee alwayes neere hande heare neede make perceyue profitable affliction yet time plunged ouer head eares bee tossed fro wote become good bee meekened welfare lo howe god soothfast promise threatnings yet gouerneth worlde suche wise prouidence seemeth godly haue lost laboure seruing wicked haue bridle layd loose necke skoffe god scaped hande seeme v iudge wee see presently according wee measure thinges oure owne witte let v humble selues say vvell god iudge world howbeit appeereth first blow therefore howe close soeuer keepe yet neuerthelesse wee muste haue fayth hope v conclude thing whiche vnknowne v shalbe shewed v end let v come iobs word set downe heere bee people wisedome shall dye heereby hee meant represse foolish haughtinesse presumption haue spoken otherwise dealing puffed vp vayne truste theyr owne skill men must needes shew follie true oftentimes men shall nothing auayle dooing hee throughly sotted owne fonde ouerweening euer man tell neuerthelesse bee wedded owne opinion take himselfe yet notwithstanding wee incounter suche miswrest god truth wee must sticke shewe follie ignorance verely may bee done though men would shewe whither sharpwitted better skill beholde doe haue nothing ambition vaineglorie euery would faine make great shew hee beginneth would faine amaze men talke answereth would also aduaunce himselfe well yee see battell fooles wee must deale sort therefore wee incounter corrupte god truth wrest vnto vntruth come shewe ignoraunce vvee must doe seeme better learned skilfuller purchaze selues estimation wee muste content ourselues haue made waye truth may receyued men longer wedded suche bee reputation ouerthrowe well builded day man shall see many poore sillie folke hilde still superstition bycause say many great learned men haue hild doctrine followed nowe adays stand still houre beguiled beholde poynt many poore weakiings bycause possessed imagination possible prelate church learned men great personage ouerseene nowe teach folke make come knowledge god requisite learne knowe beastlinesse ignorance whome haue esteemed highly lift vp selues againste god superstitious hipocrites doe whiche mainteyne abhominations papacie day conuicted beastlinesse malapart euer yet doltish euen little babe may perceiue gewgawes told rage men true haue skill ynough loth god truth meanes come neere simple sort alreadie snarled saide false opinion spake yee see wise iob rebuketh heere euill expounder god lawe wrested straunge meening telleth great clearkes would faine seeme alledged thing purpose thing ought bee knowne men finally hee mocketh saying bee whole people wisedome shall dye wyth vvhen iob sayth inferioure haue hearte witte well meeneth magnifie hymselfe thereby maner haue tolde fonde vaingloriousnesse euery man shoulde owne side bee desirous shewe selfe cunning sharpwitted others hee saye vvhat pray verely much bickering among men yet god truth shall continue still iob meeneth heere shewe god hath giuen grace know discerne truthe better full ouerweening yee see wise may bee lawefull v boaste ourselues ende men clap handes v great learned men men great witte knowledge awaye fonde toyes vnpossible v settle mind seruing god excepte wee forget euer concerneth selues long haue eye selues couet estimation certaine oure lorde suffer v fall many ouersightes become laughingstocke oure vtter shame heere ye see also hire suche couet bee estimation good reason bee seeing god truth thereby layde flat vpon ground meane whyle men haue regard owne honoure vvhat done vve must forget selues yet therewithall aduaunce god gracious giftes namely ende haue good cace may mainteined thing shall alledge may receyued authoritie man bee taken idiot haue nother skill witte become nothing speaketh receiued disdayne man intende fare better aughte spoken must thinke thus himselfe well god hathe giuen grace man grace despised wrong vnto god bycause proceedeth holie ghost sith let v beware wee lifte vp selues againste god thus ye see howe cause humbly receiue good doctrine know man teacheth v hath bene taught god lo intent iob declareth hee witte whit inferioure set great price estimation selues bee shorte let v learne aduaunce gracious giftes god hathe put v yea verelie exalt ourselues intent thing haue receiued may profite bring forth fruite thus much concerning person iob heerewithall also faithfull warned see man hath receyued excellent gift holie ghost able aduaunce god honoure edifye church must giue eare must bee receyued reuerence hee shall saye vvhyso otherwise dispising god let v come iob saith saith despiser frundes true word lie saith despized frinds forsaken deed speaketh third person afterward likeneth himselfe torch linke wasteth shunned vvhat man looke torch commeth ende waxe droppeth men drawe backe ray light vpon ynough marre garment therefore linke torch hath lighted men time serued men long cast away euery man shunnes nothing stinch iob meaneth saying cace stoode euen himselfe yee see readie fall sayth hee therfore yee despize hee sheweth reason similitude saying bycause yee see brim graue cause forsaken hee sayth also rich men doe mocke afflicted call vpon god saith hee heareth iob meaneth heereby wicked wayte welfare god hand seeke meaneth haue world seemeth haue god hand carie sleeue men say according wee shall see hee addeth afterwarde true expounde sentence bee meant idolater make god come handes foolish vnreasonable exposition iob loked prosperitie wicked haue al welfare cometh god wicked haue abundance doth seem god league sotheth yeldeth lust man might properly say god flattereth liue reste prosper suche wise haue shortely whatsoeuer desire iob sayth prouoke god much boldly yet mean house happie vvhereby hee ment betoken haue told afore witte zophar wrong saying great sinner vvherefore sayth hee contrary bee seene let v come sayth concerning contempt despised sayth linke teach wasted heere person iob wee taughte lord giueth world leaue skorne v suffereth state miserable seemeth vtterly forlorne therefore behoueth v pacient vvhy vve see befell vnto iob would deere seeing excellent seruant god giuen vp men mocked tooke castaway let v astonished murmure god hee suffer v come poynt nother let v thinke ouercruell handling v let v consider howe good v meekened sort let waken v let v learne hope must rooted beneath fastned sure ankerhold heaue apostle saith great lesson whe mockages world ordeyned saluation true laughter shall end long face wicked dofling v meane season profitable v sayde make v regard god know hope lieth consisteth wholly thus ye see haue remember sayde laughed skorne haue bin friend verely greeuousest temptation haue loued v heretofore wer abhorre v hard digest seeing besell vnto iob let v follow step stoupe god listeth abace v sorte hee sayth expressely foote slid meening long able stand bin torch link man ease haue burning torche light seruice yea long whole able last bee wasted man wyll cast away intoo canell beareth must needes burne handes remayneth nothing little glimcing darke smoke iobs intent shewe time god hild hym vp hee honored esteemed nowe hee falne hee cast away heereby warned sometimes may forespent men shall see light v shall nothiug lefte little smoke seeme shall fall peeces shall whole peece left v shall come last cast let v take paciently forasmuch iob came point v seeing hath shewed v path let v follow hym pray god strengthen v wise wee may vtterly decay touching saying despisers god call vpon heareth haue told already referred common perceuerance men seemeth wicked couenant god obteyne whatsoeuer list hand true veriest hipocrits loocest liuers deede cal vpon god howbeit way mockerie say god would giue thing vvhen wicked man desirous rob another goodes prayes hart god would giue man goodes praying vnto god disguising stayning maiestie short men starke mad whe ashamed mocke god sort wrapping sinnes cursed kayti e yet farre square desire wold fayne haue god intermedle selfe right calling vpon god name among wicked nother true prayer thus ye see bee taken iob sayth heere forasmuch wicked desire list receiue god hand seemeth god hearkneth say seemeth willing graunt theyr lust way let v marke wicked desire god whatsoeuer hearte wisheth yea euen without reuerece faith lawfull forme prayer casting foorth auenture inordinate desire greater damnation vvherfore nature teacheth v ought resort vnto god want verely wicked neuer bethink themselues aforehand saye god must honored hande hee holdeth welfare welth hand fountayne thereof thence must draw therefore reason craue lowlinesse wicked skill yet doth god thrust forward blind motion costreyned know god whose hand wee must demaund wee want according see say wold god wold giue thing haue knowledge ingrauen hart maketh much guiltie god dishonoring holye name sort mingling outrageouse desire horrible wish heereby wee bee warned wee pray vnto god wee must doo reuerence calling vpon full beleefe rooted hart wretched nothing remedie misery calamity except wee flee refuge meere goodnesse gracious god please giue v goodes hath iob sayth tent wicked shall peace verely sayth bycause hold god make come handes yet euen prouoke boldly behold whereof commeth contemptuousnesse vnbeleeuers cause wicked contented vaunt themselues though god fauored also proudely cruelly trample vnder feete walke singly vprightly saying seemeth god exalting end despise others shake heere ye see temptation troublesom hard ouercome much standeth v hand marke well texte let v vnderstande newe cace wicked adayes aduaunced raunge abrode triumph time hath always bin god suffereth greater decay suffereth also meeken v wicked happen haue theyr full scope let v lose courage let v serue god stedfastly let v glory hope hath giuen v lasting life notwithstanding suffer v combered wee bee miscaried wee see god aduaunce naughtipacks set aboue cloudes bee ouerthrowne thereby continue alwayes sure stedfast oure vocation beholde good warrant faith also sayd afore namely good profitable god trie v sort happeneth wee ought thinke straunge considering hath bin iobs time make god come intoo hand euen prouoke malapartly maner speech betokeneth god fauoreth loueth wicked certesse iudge according flesh cause say god loueth al haue prosperitie neuerthelesse prosperitie wicked haue world destruction ruine bicause god side although seeme fauoured hand bee deere derlings yet end shall perceiue euer haue shal turned destruction side although god seeme shrinke v make countenance help v seemeth bee separated v yet let v learne say let v learne humble ourselues vnder mightie hand submit selues good follow word waiting till shew effect always neere hand v meane let faith continue alwayes true stedfastnesse although god plague v let v weerie seruing let v hold race continually till haue made v passe incounters temptation haue indure world let v fall downe face good god acknowledgment fault praying make v feele wise may come submit selues vnto stand vppon defence oure owne righteousnesse sound dealing yeeld selues giltie desire vse infinite mercie towards v forasmuch hee hath alreadye shewed v way whereby must come vnto witte bringing vnto obedientnesse oure lord iesus christ meane thereof fault may buried forgotte may please receiue v said name forgiue sinnes also gouerne v wise holy spirite may always get vpper hand euen till oure liues ende yea euen ouer death selfe ouer temptation diuell able raise may please hym graunt grace c xlvj sermon second vpon twelfth chapter aske cattell vvill teach thee aske foules aire vvill tell thee speake earth vvill informe thee fish sea vvill report thee vvho knovveth thing hand god hath done vvhose hand soule breath liuing thing doth eare discerne vvords roofe mouth sauoure vittells vvisdome old men age bringeth skilfulnesse vvisdome strength counsell skilfulnesse vvill throvv dovvne man shall able build vp vvill shut vp man shall able let vvill restrayne vvaters shall drie vp hee vvill sende foorth shall ouerflovv earth hath strength might commeth deceyued deceyuer shewe nothyng meere ambition vaynglory zophar sayde hym iob telleth hee knowth well god prouidence importeth gouerning whole worlde manifest doctrine man needed haue made great protestation thing ment propounde saith knowe thing yea great follie zophar thinke haue great witte magnifying god prouidece sorte iob therefore sheweth geere common ordinarie ynough afterward seconde poynte hee declareth hee wondered friend better vnderstand matter hee discoursed afore vvhereto serueth sayth haue eares eate drinke palat well ynough discerne foode whither bee sauery therefore like palat giue man tast thing eateth eares serue heare word seemeth ye deafe haue heard nothing thus much second poynt thirdly said seeke true wisdome must stay vpon men vpon creature sayth whome al wisdome bycause bin vpbraided afore voutsafed inquire auncients regarded time past yea saith beleeue must hold selfe altogither vnto men wisdome vanisheth away vve must rather go vnto god must seeke sure stay haue rest vpon shall always mamering vntill wise taught schole wee must vnderstande euer shall haue shewed v shal nothing comparison infunite wisdome referred behird proofe hereof hee cast downe man shall build vp list shut vp man keepe hym prison man may deliuer let v vnderstand wisdome god ouerhigh secret v verely saith vnto belong bee beguileth beguiled hee saye god sende spirit erroure straunge thing one thinke hard blind ought keepe themselues beguiling shall vtterly blockish cometh passe without maketh v oure wit end therfore must conclude high wisdome v atteyne great secretes god iudgemets meening saith ende debate heere vain vve see effect iobs word howbeit wee may receiue good instruction sentece let v marke first iob meneth god glory doth wise shine whole world euery creature wee discretio wee ought haue ynough make v learned vvhat cause become brutish know belongeth god much say
