marke altogither visible open sight man excuse hymselfe say clerk neuer went schoole yea verely ye neede learne brute beast earth speechlesse fish dumb teach v god giue v vnderstanding become starke dolt therefore must conclude ther none let owne vnthankfulnesse vousaf ope eye see thing god sheweth v behold text well worth marking place holy ghost telleth v god glory shews itselfe euery said heauens tell foorth goodly order see betwene day night starres wee behold sky al residew vnto v liuely picture god maiestie good faith although starres speake yet eue holding peace crie loude ther shall nede none witnesse v latter day bicause haue taken heede hath bin shewed v ther ye see haue beare mind according also paul saith first chapter romanes wheras god inuisible hath vttered opely ynough cretures intet shuld left without excuse said act apostle hath left without witnesse crieth lowde shril creature al goodnes cometh god haue created world al vnder subiectio pray reason homage whe wee hold life wholly needeth hee make anye long proces condemne v oure naughtinesse common haue denied obedience due maker labored plucke selues away fro sted honoring spited vice corruptios seing al notoriously knowe vtterly confounded therefore let v remeber well said namely ther excuse ignorance left men go alledge knew god high thing attein vnto vvhy go schole beast wold sufficiet teacher ther nother asse oxe could teach v god best create theselues doth see welynough said god made al thing cosider end namely hath applied vse doth shew boud vnto excedingly vvhat thing hath giue v aboue al creaturs seing hath shewed bountifull towards v meete powring rich cast mire reason shuld set store goodnes hath made v feele coparison make betweene ourselues beast ought right bring v far worship serue god according discerning good euil hath ingraued heart retchlesnesse dulnesse vnthakfulnesse burie thing oftentimes seene best haue witte reason haue true said best teach v example bicause haue behold glory god furthermore haue touched alredy beast shew v duety duetie better thereby codemned double also thing whervnto prophet esay sendeth v asse saith knoweth master stable oxe knoweth owner crib people knoweth vve say wee bee god church house could find hart aduanced higher saith church make himselfe bee herd voice soundeth high cleere yet al know wherof cometh wit reason oxe asse tha mortal men vvherfore hath giue v reason yea haue bin taught word wil vtter peruerting god goodnesse vve see fort men may rebuked exaple beast whe slouth ful dscharging duetie godward saide turneth double cofusio text iob ment creature sufficietly teach v ought honour god let v ope eye saith vve neede learned haue great capacitie canot cast eye vpward downward god preseteth al side sort haue told glory visible throughout thing wherin consisteth god glory power goodnesse wisdome iustice vve see god hath set world good order ye see wonderfull wisdome whereat ought rauished infinite power god mainteineth preserueth thing hath made whole vphild hys full state may well seeme impossible thing ye see ought reuerece god mighty power also goodnesse wherfore hath made world vvherefore hath stuffed rich vvherefore hath decked vtter loue specially mercie towards men according said psalmes extendeth hys mercie euen vnto beastes shall betide v much neerer whome hath put much noblenesse without comparison ye see god goodnesse sheweth declareh selfe vve see hys righteousnesse watcheth ouer creature careth therewithall side see also iustice see gouerneth world wonderful fashion although wicked seeke nothing else bite yet must bee fayne confounded therefore let v learne applie indeuoure better beholding god work vvhen sunne shineth let v cosider god kindleth light end led guided vnto beholding heauen earth thing conteyned homage benefites hee bestoweth vppon v nothing myght hinder v marking considering throughly lo god would haue v comprehend wee atteine vttermost depth wisdome deepe gulfe yet behoueth v diligente indeuoure may prooue good scholers god schoole according abilitie doutlesse shall latter day bee cast oure teeth wee haue conceyued verie beastes dumb witlesse creature haue shewed v angel heauen ready declare god wil hath bin witnessed v prophet apostle specially lord iesus christ fare better excuse shall make although bereft holy scripture doctrine yet notwithstanding euen thynges beast shew v ynough condemne v bereeue v excuse intent cast teeth last day wee haue wilfully shut eye god would haue drawen v vnto offered himselfe familiarly vnto v end haue knowen let v bethinke v better matter haue done heeretofore let v follow warning iobs aske beast wil answer thee talke earth shew thee bird aire informe thee fish sea haue skill tell thee yea though bee neuer dumb thus much concerning sentence let v come second point iob alledgeth heere palat saith rieth tast vittels eare discerneth word hereby findeth fault friend letting thing passe spoken afore voutsafed consider wherevnto tended bin deafe iob blameth suche retchlesnesse matter pointeth v proofe heere let v marke quicke tast haue discern foode euery v hath skill say good haue good appetite oure palat also rest sens suttle mough wee spie thing delighteth v eye neuer wee haue mind go runne whither spare nother hand leg short man wil sharp witted ynough yea ouersharp witted al thing like flesh contentation foolish lust hee commeth iudging doctrine might soule helth whereby receiue edifying dullard seemeth blockes wood whereof commeth doltish bycause bestowe whole witte wise requisite wee moreouer eares shew keepe egall measure man tell v foolish tale vtter lewde talke poyson infect v sainct paule saythe wee haue eares attentiue man needeth tell v one thyng twice wee vnderstand incontinent wee come hungrie appetite thing wee cannot bee satisfied fond thing trifling toyes thing hurtfull wicked ye see wherevnto man casteth selfe altogither meane season god tell v thing good edifye v wee fare prophet esay sayeth man tell v thing two three time yet let slip away perceiue prophet esay likeneth vnlustie dulheaded bycause god bereueth witte reason naughtinesse sake vntoo little babe whome folke say rightly man hath told fower fiue time well harped vpon perchance say man aske letter know awhit afterward one come b b long man pronouncing letter say b man aske anone letter forget prophet esay saith man must faine repeate thing sorte haue profited god schoole hee must chaw euery worde euery sillable yet neuer wiser nother thing euer sinke intoo head euen fare also vvherefore let v marke well holy ghost mouth iob heere doth blame three men also condemne v al attentiue heare thing belong bodily life behalfe man needeth tarrie till haue bin schoole become clerk euery man master doctor owne pleasure profite say come well purpose mine owne tooth incontinently wee haue concluded vppon matter neede long perswasions much lesse long talke matter wee preuent altogither vpon spurre nothing nimble witte applyed fond thing wee come god doctrine wee bee worse beast whereof commeth mouth iudge foode god doctrine shall haue sauoure v vvee tast insomuch wee cannot discerne betweene truth vntruth let v marke last day shall neede none thing confound mankynde article haue bin much giuen worldly thing leysure giue eare thing wer euerlasting welfare soules wee haue heere degenerated brute beastes reason wittes haue bin tangled either rich pleasure vanity wicked affection looke vpon man coueteth goodes world vvhat man shall beguile one penie hee always reckenings counting vppon nothing scapeth hym without looking may gayne sayth hee hys mind wandreth abrode aduentureth trudgeth vp downe whence cometh wittnesse bycause man affection leades carry away wise knoweth vve see much labour come estimation set themselues credite dignitie also gather meanes possible aduaunce haue reason alledge selues side yea euen whoremonger caried away beastly lust drunkardes swine haue skilfulnesse kinde tast manner may compasse wickednesse shall become v wee haue wit come home vnto god doth happen bycause hold skorne vse thing god hath giuen v sayd afore heere yet one accusation men see many adayes think themselues haue faire starting hole knowe nothing god cast doctrine vnder foote say see pray ye notable iudge man may beguile vnder coloure god religion therefore better know nothing yea vnthankfulnesse god hath giuen v eares heare obediently say make seeking matter one man shoulde say eate euill meates man might giue naughtie weede woulde poyson mee therefore better eate meate man make foolish determination himselfe woorthy starue lo deale say know holy scripture may deceiued vvretched creature thou art foode thy soule lord nourisheth men body meate drinke nurrisheth soules word yet wee would refuze foode feare corruption manifest tempting god sayd wherefore eares giuen v heare herken receiue whatsoeuer god sayth vnto v true selues shall bee able except god enlighten v yet wee come meekely heare tolde v name god wee desire gouerne v holy spirit may abused vntruth hee shewe hath made eares nought heare receyue told v feare reuerence thus yee see wee haue marke thys streyne effect holy ghost exhorteth v herken vnto god speaketh v diligent receiuing doctrine saluation doubting make preuaile v wee haue oure eares ready well disposed heare sayth let v come iob addeth vvisdome olde men age bringeth skilfulnesse wisdome skilfulnesse counsell altogither heere iob maketh comparison betweene god men poynt whereof hee bin accused hee regarded tyme past considered thing antiquitie bare mind bin taught suche liued long time world heerevpon saith yea verely wisdome old men truly may taken way mockerie thus alledge mee auncient time old men end shoulde hold shall become god must god bereft honoure men may take roome iob graunteth may wisdome men beit exalted aboue measure hee say true man haue liued long time heere seene muche hee may haue gotten skill must derogation god wisdome men vanitie although deserue esteemed selfe comparison made betwixt men god euer haue must needes dashed downe god must reputed wise men must knowe wisedome thus ye see iobs meening haue good profitable lesson gather sentence first certayne ought despise wisdome men whome god sendeth v helpes folke haue seene much god intendeth teach v wee holde skorne profite selues shew v whome wee offer wrong euen liuing god also god haue giuen man good wit able giue counsell aduice giue abilitie grace teach others folke make account refuse certayne holy ghost trampled vnder foote man able instruct v hath himselfe owne growing giuen aboue giuen helpe v withall god dealeth foorth gift ende euerye man keepe himselfe make men partner common edifying v stately cannot abide bee taught haue good doctrine guided giue good counsel quech light god refuse benefite would bestow vpon v therefore wee haue men able teach v must willingly heare yeeld selues teachable meeke mind bee stubborne see part yet must wee hold selues poynt altogither without exception vve see wretched world blinded day sayd credit giuing much men wil say vvhat manner liuing men vse adayes time mind vvhat long time haue men kept themselues hath bin vsed thus long time heerevppon wretched folke cast themselues intoo destruction god ready bring right way according wee see word preached v intent haue full authoritie ouer v might led snare deceitfull word sainte paule sayth fourth ephesian leade v lure god mighte gouerne v become wise obeying ye see way haue hold wee haue receyued men hand thing bring god minister instrument holy spirite vve must neuerthelesse vnderstand god must haue whole preheminence ouer v whome wisdome proceedeth end caried away trusting much vnto men bee tossed suddainly hither thither may bee fully settled certaintie hold doctrine better perceyuing heereof must note two extremity shall see brainlesse person despise gift god giueth men vnskilfullest presumptuousest cace common thing muche brag theyr beastlinesse looke vpon man neuer knowledge thinke hath much cause stand vpon reputation wee see diuers adayes wrest text scripture aduaunce themselues greater pride ye see sayd god hydeth secret wise men greate men world openeth little one yet beastes yet glory though diuinitie god men vaunt themselues theyr slendernesse despise gift deserue esteemed vvhece come science vvhece commeth discretion one man another riuers flowing one fountaine witte spirit god yes vndoutedly let v learne despise god gift appeere men profit selues applye owne vse wee refuse men without discretion surely great folly men say fooles bolt soone shot double fooles wee iudge without anye knowledge discretion yet see many diuerse say thing hilde obserued yea ther reason howbeit forasmuch commeth men refuze nay canst thou tell whither thing came first god meanes men therefore man layeth doctrine v must swift hastie refuze wee muste sift thus ye see modesty must vse eschue extremitie spake also extremitie touched witte see papist behold say holde whiche hath bin taught childhod follow father auncesters antiquitie shall god forgo authoritie meane must men aduanced high god thrust vnder feete vvere better sunne plucked skie throwne bottome sea behold heere greater outrage ouse confusion therefore let v keepe selues well offering suche outrage vntoo god leaue behind v hold selues wholly vnto men receiuing whiche commeth men god giueth v meanes must bee sort god may always haue whole due hee may exalted great small may taught may protest teachablnesse towards men serueth abate whit god duetie hys soueraintie hath ouer v guide v vntoo stop mouthes speaketh wee may hold peace bee hindred leade v whither listeth may without gainsaying receyue whatsoeuer proceedeth mouth ye see modestie ought v heereby man may perceiue doltishnesse papist say see humilitie great vertue neuer condemned god hand yea verely manner humilitie humilitie papist crouching vnto men shaking god yoke yea spiting meanes possible diuelish humilitie creature aduaunced obeyed creator thing nothing let humbling selues sort maintenance sayd meekenesse towards men may bee mild mind receyue behoofe profite yet neuerthelesse god may reygne ouer v master teacher authoritie lendeth men may derogation himselfe let v forepossessed fond imagination say man sayd therefore must beleeued suche man mortall man hee frayle creature wherin ther nothing vanitie let v beware sticking much vnto men wee returne alwayes vnto god grounded vpon certaintie oure fayth bee ioyned knit word thus ye see wee haue marke therefore whome wisdome skifulnesse wit counsell vvhen sayd exclude al men sunne shineth darkneth light starres men doo god commeth among cause sayd prophet esay creature must ceasse god shyneth iob ment repeate expresly heere many word perfection wisdom god intent wee shoulde surmise needed bee supplyed wee see men foolish haue receyued anie blissing god hande must adding somewhat must make mingling must patching piecing matter vvhen god putteth wisdome v must bee vsed pure simply men must adde thing whatsoeuer iob ment step yet farther haue touched afore namely god secret wisdome surmounteth capacitie man wherevnto wee cannot attayne yet true god wisdome diuers sundrie sort respecte selfe wisdome thing inseparable cannot diuided parted respecte v seeming god wise two sortes wit wee may say two particular kind god wisdome howbeit respect selues howe wisdome conteyned word hee imparteth wise vnto v become wise receyuing instruction hee giueth v wisdome whiche hee communicateth creature moreouer wisdome keepeth still hymselfe manner one woonderful prouidence whereby gouerneth world beyond wee conceyue beholde god dispozeth thing take confuzed vnderstanding vvhen tyrant beare sway shal sayd hereafter wicked seduce sillie folke carie soules destruction sort saued done wonderfull prouidence god seeke reason wee gulfe wit must needes swallowed vp thus ye see wisdome god keepeth himselfe whereof maketh men partaker according also vnpossible atteyne vnto wee shall haue bene taught god schoole become wise comprehending thing according measure oure capacitie shall haue pleased teache v hys worde let v knowe yet secret behoueth v honour forasmuchas cannot atteyne knowledge bycause vnpossible v mount high ye see wee ought consider god wisdome twoo wayes ye see also iob ment speake thyng whereof make larger discourse heereafter howbeit forasmuch time beare keepe residue till morowe nowe lette v kneele downe face oure good god father acknowledgement oure faultes sinnes praying voutsafe make v know better feeling seeblenesse v may learne humble selues vnder presume vpon owne strength wisdome seeke want walke vnder hande vnder guidance also let v pray gouerne v suche wise wittes sens may hyld prisoner vnto hee may haue suche soueraintie ouer v may raigne peasibly consent angells obey willingly meane season take thing vpon v aboue oure abilitie abuse giftes hee dealeth vntoo v may alwayes acknowledge come end may seeke yeeld hym due prayse may please graunt grace c xlvij sermon third vpon twelfth chapter sermon yet stil vpon verse haue bene touched former sermon see thing come passe reherced seemeth v god gouerneth worlde goeth adueture rather ther reason purpose god could find harte lay v set foorth new lesson point hee correct though amisse ye see men wit order rash could find harte controll god contrariwise heere iob meeneth auow mighty power prouidence wisdome god whereof mention hath bin made therefore telleth v wee see thing order world must father thing vppon fortune assure ourselues god sitteth aboue guideth besides thys although thinke straunge worke yet let v presumptuouse reply againste hym let v honour secrete incomprehensible wisdome thus ye see two point fathered vpon god heretosore wit al power al counsel wisdome skil hath set three word purposely represse men folish presumptuousnes taking vpo haue discretio reason tha god misliking doings thogh find good therfore behoueth v marke well iobs drift whiche make v know god prouidence thing done world neuerthelesse know god gouerneth haue doo wee must also graunt wisdome hath bene spoken true oftentimes may perceiue reason god work also haue men knowe hee doeth one thing alwayes nother muste wee make generall rule sometimes god blindeth haue forsaken truthe verie well vengeance euident knowe men haue well deserued god shuld vtterly bereue knowledge bycause mind taught hand sometimes knowe wherefore god taketh away word daunteth v cace behoueth v reuerence secret determinatio although knowe yet nother reason end worke yet must acknowledge confesse cannot bee righteous yet meane whyle let v bethinke v weakenesse wit intent presume shut vp ne bee desirouse measure thing infinite owne capacitie let v lay foorth thing particularly set downe sayd god breake downe manshall buyld vp vvhereby meant god hand v although wee help creature shall boote v wee must needes perishe behold effect conteined sentence first blush wee may well say yet touched ard proofe heereof god scourge v wee bethinke v whome wee haue wee go seeke meanes succour selues seemeth v may well shifte mischeefe owne cunning men bee willing helpe v true god forbiddeth v thinke vppon selues shift selues haue regard remedie thing yea hee maketh dealing auayle howbeit suche maner wee haue bin inured god afflicteth v first remedie humble ourselues vnder hande seeke atonement done may well desire giue v meanes prouide necessity arme ourselues way warde blowes hande thus yee see dutie cleane contrary kind dealing see nothing rebelliousnesse thys worlde god intendeth humble wee mynded thys doctrine throughly vse suche maner dealing would come thus oure remembrance god cast v downe hee build v vp againe therfore must hymselfe faine put hand haue offended let v craue pardon hum end may haue pitie v though iudgements hidden v yet must humble selues vnto hym ende may receyue v cast downe deede wee ought gyue good eare threatenings whiche god vttereth purpose reprobate sayeth cast downe edom aud man labour set vp shall lost labour heerein see god hand v succour commeth v men creature must needes vaine vnauaylable vvee may well haue seeming maynteyne v wee shall finde profit shall go cleane contrarie expectation moreouer sayde babylon whosoeuer build vp againe must lay foundation vppon firste borne say resist goddes iudgement shall followe haue beene punished afore keepe company themselues therfore let v bethink v well let v desire strengthened hand god mainteyned state without must needes perish yea though world side haue sayde already heere yee see also tolde v psalme men may well take vppon buylde haue thinges commaundement yet go forward god make go backwarde hee blisse doubte word buyld iob comprehendeth concerneth man state said belongeth god build v vp whensoeuer hath set v trade must stablished power listeth throwe v quite downe bring v vtterly nought may well euer man v shall vtterly vnauaylable contrariwise god bee side wee may despize thing v againe god enimie lette v haue commodity bee shall turne confusion thus much concerning point sayd immediatly god locke vp man body let iob shoulde saye belongeth onely god giue v libertie hee list although seeme haue handes feete libertie shall bee forclozed oure limmes wee shall bee able stirre one finger although men labour drawe v yet shall auayle long god holdeth v inclozed shet vp fynally betokeneth haue touched already wit god must bee fayne fauour v else go wrong v shall waxe worse worse insomuch tumble right downe first blow yet shall digged downe little little till god haue vtterly consumed v hath spoken addeth foorthwith god hold backe water stop drought god list le water looce shall fluddes beare al afore rake vp earth shall bee nother tree house left vnouerthrowen iob speaketh purposely holding water letting go bycause wee knowe god hand sufficiently worketh one rate wherewith wee acquainted doeth sunne ryse morning ordinarie thing v thinke nother doeth waken v sufficiently come vnto god doth hee sende rayne commeth mind vvhen see rayne man aske v sent confesse well ynough god yet consideration pierceth v quicke therefore moueth v humble selues vnder god prouidence acknowledge hand directeth life thinke iob hath made choice work rarest least accustomed g men see drought lasteth euery man touched make faire wether rayne meane earth doeth vtterly drye vp men thinke come great drought men perceiue corne cannot growe thriueth behold seede dryed vp ground commeth nothing frute come come extraordinarie drought ye shall see v touched eueso also great rage water send shower anoy tush ouerpasse haue regard god continuall rayne riuers ouerflowe bank seemeth new generall flud marke beare mind iobs meening thing happen wise may seeme order nature shal change excessiue drought may seeme shall burnt vp wee must know god hath layd bridle looce fortune necke himselfe worketh fashion also whe falleth great rayne likely shall go hauocke let v assure selues god whyche worketh certesse drought may well come sometimes notorious sinnes men may perceiue wherfore god vengeance lighteth according hee threateneth v law shet vp heauen wise shall brasse drop moysture gotten thence earth shall become hard yron seedes shall dwin ground shall yeelde nurrishment hart also ayre shall deafe earth openeth cranyed mouth thirst ayre shall answer lord doeth rightly manace v lawe execute punishmentes vppon v verily oure sinnes sake neuerthelater sometimes fall wee cannot discerne god worketh wee shall haue knowldge may leade v iudge god sheweth v reason therof neuerthelesse becommeth v honour power wisdome althogh end thereof vnknowen v must humble selues sort whether wee see earth drowned water whether bee seared vp drought let god bee alwayes glorified maner euen confessing doth first behoueth v acknowledge power afterward must match power wisdome grudge agaynst blame tyrannie outrage one say true god gouerneth worlde therwithal imagin tirannicall power haue touched alreadie glorifie god aright must acknowledge almightie therwithall must also honor infinite wisdome whervnto cannot attayne consideration wherof ought made subiect vnderstanding neither ought god yeeld v account doings iob repeateth againe power skill rightnesse second word set commeth hebrue beeing signifieth beeing therefore man may take thing haue seeming yet firme substantiall like creature may well make shewe seeme flourish howbeeit shadow perisheth hand theselues vanishe away vnlesse god maintaine god euerlasting firmnesse euer hath beene euer shall bee also giueth power creature continue state sayde worde therfore well deriued beeing neuerthelesse oftentymes taken god lawe instruction also taken prince commissio proclamation wee haue seene heretofore iob speaketh onely god mightie power shoulde say hath thing hand also sayd perfectly wise prouidence woderfull let v mark well streyne meeneth speake god beeing rather vprightnesse gouernment vseth wee knowe asmuch iudge worlde must needes gouerne thing vprightly nothing repetition matter bene delt howbeeit without cause doeth iob repeate although god workes eies yet hard come consideration wee com wee forget remembrance thereof refreshed v let v marke well sentence meeneth wit god power also gouernment worlde belongeth order thing indifferencie vprightnesse vvhe wee shall haue recorded lesson throughly wee shall haue profited greatly onely day time life also one speciall cause whiche iob repeateth lesson intent enter god iudgements straunger v hath spoken specially hee sayeth hee deceyueth bee deceyued god hande yee see heere thing seemeth agaynst reason namely god hath deceyuers hand driueth thervnto semeth point vtterly repugnant nature iob hath purposely vsed preface brydle v r sh headlong agaynst god although wee bee troubled wyth temptation first brunt yet notwithstanding might restreyned become like many wilde beast lift vp themselues agaynst god rayling blaspheming hee spoyle himselfe owne mightie power insomuch wee see howe ashamed f sh villanous cursed speeche beleeue god rightuous bee doer thing specially farre foorth driue forwarde euill meanes say shoulde author sin hath shewed vnto euen much would frame god theyr owne fancie bycause comprehende hys wonderfull wisedome honour though bee hidden v yee see howe arrogant beast cannot agree god almightie except might make subiect owne fashion fancie common prouerbe sayeth none bold blind bayard say behold conceyue art thou haue seene sillie fooles although play doctor one science yet notwithstanding bee ouerignorant pitie see man may perceiue nothing beastlynesse yet neuerthelesse bolde say vnderstand therfore canot agree thereto although wisest wilyest man worlde yet ought men spitte face abhorre hee dare set vp bristle maner agaynst god see iob hath giuen v good profitable lesson namely whereas ment say god hath deceyuers deceyued hand put preface afore power skil let v come make comparison betwene wit god mightie power able inclose brayne go inclose heauen earth narrowe roome yet man aduaunce himselfe thither pray monstrousnesse man knoweth whether creator ne passeth apperteyneth vntoo let v remember wel said namely although think hard god shoulde haue hande deceyue deceyued yet neuerthelesse vvhy god almightie thing might bee done worlde without medling almightie yes truly man say reason thou must seeke reason otherwhere bycause thou canst attayne vnto thou must lowlinesse honour surmounteth thy capacitie thou canst stye aboue cloudes god must acknowledged bee wise almightie thou perceyue reason well tarie thou leysure silence quietnesse vntill hee discouer thing vntoo thee yet vnknowne ment saying shall behold thing face face cannot see glasse dimly would make scripture false vai glorious beast deface darken prouidence god vnder colour conceyue reason cannot brooke coteyned holy scripture would haue god reserue nothing last day finde fault making greater clerkes seing men perceiue ignorant dulheaded although make greate shewe haue neyther iudgement discretion deed although men haue estimation whether way scorn otherwise yet seene dull beastes vvhy blame god giuing fyner wit giuing meane profite better schoole seeme themselues bee worthiest men world yet hath god giue ouer vvhy blame handling owne lust owne opinion bee wise men worlde ought make ryde triuphing chariot yet meane seene haue store reply find fault god take hande bring account part let v kepe sayd namely wee must bee simple honor god prouidence wisdome notwithstading hidden v furthermore let v come whiche iob sayeth heere concerning deceyued deceyueth vvhereas sayth twaine well deceyuer deceiued god hand meeneth respect creature haue life colde saying shoulde import nothing vvee knowe treateth god iudgementes whiche incomprehensible whervnto wit able reach nowe straunge verdite say god hath made men beholdeth well wicked deceytfull also deceyued whit al without common order nature wee see iob ment wade wit man erreth deceiued cometh passe without god wil ordinance also whe deceiuer bringeth craft suttleties god gouerneth aboue woulde accuse god vnrightuousnesse vnder colour suffereth thing done men doth himselfe beseech resolue question iob hath sayde power vprightnesse god hee addeth deceyued deceyuers hand lo iob auoweth god mightie power hee hath gouernment world saying deceyuers deceiued hand single sufferance iob spoken ill must concluded god guideth thing suche wise nothing done otherwise hath ordeined way must beare minde haue touched alreadie namely god wil sometimes haue men deceiued reaso wil haue apparant sometimes also know al wherof cometh whereto tendeth cace behoueth v hold wit brydle acknowledging selues ignorant feeblewitted atteyne high god wil deceit reigne men beguiled holy scripture sheweth tolde v god doeth giue leaue shuld say passe medle comaundeth insomuch sayth shall go deceyue beholde god seeketh deceiuers haue deceites haue full scope speakes holy scripture vvhat glose ca alledged darke euidet text diuell offereth saying go lying spirit mouth al prophet begu le achab thervpo god sendeth satan forth willeth deceyue blind king people see wel god shrinketh corner say wil suffer done ordeineth disposeth otherwise sayd almighty vvhe scripture giueth title vnto god meeneth list rest heauen doth nothing meaneth god mighty power matched effect wit present thing thing done otherwise hee disposeth yee see manner god almightie babble disfeate restreme god prouidence denie first article fayth lyke witlesse folke possessed diuelishrage therefore vnlesse make scripture false settled point must hold v god haue men deceyued sayd text also throughout whole holy scripture aboue others notable place paule ought bee much familiar v bycause haue experience proofe paule treating state christian church come sayeth shall falling away shal become renegats gospel hath bin preached vnto shall renouce god shall horrible scattering whole church thing see yet notwithstanding papist forbeare say hath god suffered churche erre long time behold paule telles v come god single sufferace paule sayeth expresly god send effectuall errour sayeth onely god let sata looce deceiue men saith deceit leazings must take effect shall able kepe theselues beguiled see god horrible vengeance eye men haue bin blynded haue perceyued lye deceit satan haue bin caryed away like brute beast vvhose god paule auoucheth expresly beit true behalfe manifest reason paule sayth sayd scattering shall happen men vnthakfulnesse bycause haue refused honor god therfore must faine beare yoke men subiect tiranny mind obey truth therfore god fed lye according also shewed firste chapter roman somuch world coueteth deceiued yea shetteth eye whe god goeth inlighten word need must sata beguile misleade somtimes shall come passe know man demaund reason hath made long discourse shall wit end let v marke wel although perceyue reason god doth thing yet must stoupe downe necke say reuerence mightie powe rassuring selues ruled al vprightnes indifferencie notwithstanding priuy yea eue suche time god blindeth men raiseth vp deceiuers beguile false doctrine abuse heresy haue full scope god giueth sataful power punish sinnes furthermore man might moue yet many questios possible god shoulde serue owne turne sata nothing malice naughtinesse besides looke vpon wicked hath none intent ouerthrowe goodnesse destroy yet doth bringeth passe seemeth hee acquit bycause seruice hath bene accomplishing god men moue question serue grauell oure wit cause iob sayde hath vsed preface power dominion god say forsomuch hath al thing hande reason dispose creature owne pleasure forsomuchas iudge whole worlde therefore cannot amisse nother impossible swarue one waye right dealing although vnknowne v fountayne rightuousnesse vvhen man hath doone thing examined vvhy wee haue rule aboue v verely wittes changeable good euill yea worse naturally altogither euill crooked vntoward rightnesse subiect caried heere owne fancie reason whereof dooings neede examined bee hygher rule ouer haue rule theselues certaine would nothing cofusion state yee see heathe theselues sayd lawe ought god ouer v god ought bee lawe cace standeth god therefore come rule right rightuousnesse wherby muste ruled wherto muste subiect aboue v god aboue according haue shewed alredie god rightuousnesse two sort one hath shewed v lawe haue world ruled incomprehensible insomuch must faine winck whe god worketh content knowe nother doth whe reason god doings reueled vnto v let v vnderstand poynt rightuousnesse secrete wyll whiche surmounteth ule manifest knowne v verely doctrine wil hard many let v content selues auouched v seing scripture speaketh v muste answer amen acknowledge thing told v wit see folke erre deceyuers haue full scope happeneth without god prouidence besides hath bene sayd let v also bethink v warning paule also prophet esay giue men looke well vpon themselues shall hardie lifte vp selues god checke agaynst truthe vvee bee earth dung authoritie hath god men looked well vpo owne state surely would presume lift vp selues suche wise god also dogges forbeare barke though cannot byte would bold let v leaue point stil cotent theselues holy scripture speaketh let go seeke answer otherwheres take greate paynes answere questios purpose tempt god manifestly desire passe boundes behold god telleth v doth many thing whereof reason concealed fro v desirous know forcible breaking wall god hath set agaynst v hath barred v fro say ye shall passe beyond wee passe plaine despising god let v ouer labour selues content fond curiositie auaunce themselues maner god rather let v lerne con ute fashion maner paules speeche saying art thou man one word man man ynough stop mouthes lift vp themselues wise agaynst god vnder word man compreheded much wretchednesse ought cast downe head also earth could open swallowed bottomlesse pit haue diuelishe pride v lifting vp selues god moreouer lette v marke doctrine bringeth v great comfort applie vse vvhen said deceiuers deceyued belong vnto god thereby vnderstande god bridleth satan deceyuers cannot without bee troubled false doctrine heresy darnell serueth turne v aside fro purenesse gospel god holdeth deceyuers hand yea euen satan head vnto serue turne seeing god holdeth hande certaine attempt nothing farther giueth bridle although attempt yet haue aduauntage ouer v bycause deceyued likewise hande god seing hand let v referre selues vnto suffer v number satan ouerthroweth shall alwayes get vpper hand lie shal trump wayes lo ought practize doctrine murmuring god desiring make fond foolish brauerie say tush dispute agaynst man cannot yeeld reason neuer bowe let v beware making brag haue sayde let v rather humble selues honor thing reuerence know although see thing confuzed world remayneth nothing v fal destruction let v afrayd forasmuch god gouerneth thing hath soueraine dominion ouer creature let v warrant selues god well ynough disappoint policie deadly enemie satan craft deceit men shal haue vpper hand otherside although god list afflict v suffer heresy run abrode many trouble insue wee see thing cofounded world yet full well preserue v shall miscarie must giue satan error effect senced wel inough lord iesus christ faith impossible euer chosen shoulde turned way saluation seing cace stadeth let v put selues god protection forsomuch pleaseth co mit charge welfare lord iesus christ let v cotent selues therwith let v rest let v tossed vnquietnesse say shal scape dauger vndoing true ought stand vpon gard carefull call vpo god whe haue called vpo walking purenes life let v dout maintemeth v wise al trouble worlde doo v harm always abide stedfast truth truth inuincible fortresse v according also paul speaketh let v cast selues downe face good god acknowledgement fault praying make v perceyue maner one rudenesse brutishnesse end may lerne humble selues vnder glorifie caces walke sort feare may thinke good rightfull whatsoeuer disposeth v creature let v say almightie god heauenly father c xlviij sermon fourth vpon xij chapter putteth counsellers spoile maketh iudges dull vvitted loozeneth band king girdeth reines vvith girdle putteth prince spoile distresseth mightie taketh avvay speech faithfull taketh avvay courage prince poureth contempt vpon noble hetaketh avvay strength mightie bringeth hidden thing light shadovv death vnto open light increaseth people destroyeth enlargeth nation streitneth taketh avvay heartes gouernours earth maketh vvander vvildernesse maketh grope darke vvithout light maketh reele like drunken men like yesterday saw god hath hand deceyuers deceiued iob proceedeth declare change turning sene world com passe haphazard god disposition stadeth v hand knowe worlde turmoyled secrete brydle aboue thing neuer confounded god disposeth thinketh good hee taketh notablest thing wee might thereby perceyue god prouidence better shoulde seeme prince priuiledged aboue rest worlde ye would say sholed common ranke men iob sheweth god doth cheefly vtter power haue bee cheefly knowne poore man afflicted light aduersitie vpon regarde commonly inured matter prince seemed hoyssed vp aloft cast downe bee touched wee must needes espye god prouidence blockish also haue gouernment people become dull witted neyther vnderstanding reason also well worthie marked loke neerlier priuate person specially men haue good wit haue learning experience haue bene wholy fashioned deale publike gouernment afterward sodenly become dullard men afore maner chaunge notable constreyneth v looke vp vnto god cause iob speaketh comon people gouerners speketh simple ydiots men haue knowne greate wisdome insomuch seemed haue bene able ynough haue gouerned whole worlde yet notwithstanding destitute wit reason lo effect shewed v heere howbeit forasmuch talke cocerneth notable thing import much matter iob thinketh inough vtter minde word twaine repeteth saying god putteth prince strong men men might spoyle vntieth band ther subiectio alliance nothing worth whe haue sword side shall fall groud short meanes whiche prince earth haue shall serue purpose whe god listeth pul downe iob therfore stadeth vpon poynt bicause one side lazinesse v otherside seeth blind thing ought consider although partly know god doings chaunges happen yet cannot sink mind maner iob speakes although haue well bethought v yet make profit neuerthelesse behoueth v know god gouerne cheef state world arme also stretched lesser thing nothing escapeth lo haue marke effect haue sayd whe cheef state changed euery moued anon think indeed see story full conteined yet world fareth much better therby persuaded ought god prouidence hee hath soueraine dominion ouer thing thing neuer yet throughly well knowne hath bin let owne blockishnesse let v mark wel god delighteth chaunge men imagine wheele fortune heathenishe folke say god playeth men tosseth balles tenisplay chaunges happen bycause cannot suffer god cotinue grace towards vvhen thing setled good plight behold men wearie ease friske kicke lyke horse well fed authoritie forget themselues despise god imagine ther brydle vpo lo lord sendeth chaunges world bicause cannot abide hold one euen cotinuall rate ouer v behoofe make v knowe one perceyue soueraine creature although prince honour abused state auauncing themselues al vngraciousnesse yet puffed vp pride thinke themselues worthie come high degree haue purchased owne policie god nobodie otherside would opinio nothing el reigneth fortune god therefore must bee faine discouer thing good buried ende wee may knowe hath ordering thing cause great alteration happen worlde vvhen man readeth chronicle would wonder possible whereas bin great monarchie thing haue bin ouerthrowne smal time straunge fashion men would neuer haue thought let v loke vpo first monarchy assyrian chaldies let v take great state might well haue seemed euerlasting neuer haue bin ouerthrowne shall find thing spake loke vpo persian medes reigned ouer asia insomuch man hundred league countrie nothing armyes fiuehundred thousand men readines thing sufficiently warrated fable thing inuented sayde certentie euident ynough yet al one prince thirtie thousande men discomfited one hoste three hundred thousand another seuenhundred thousand man would wonder reading thing yea god blinded erst thought themselues bee come toppe strength owne seeming man durst open lip bin able haue ouerwhelmed enemy blast mouth god ment mocke pride meanes great monarchie ouerthrowne god break man girdle asunder sword fall away euen say befall persian medes vvell hath great alexander gotten victory side like thunderclap ouercommeth man doth heare noise seene god tooke worlde floure age remayned hee heires male wife mother brother short great kinred might seeme hys race neuer haue fayled gotten empire leastwise child worthie haue succeeded taken mortall man honored god men warre yelded reuerence would haue sticked haue died in linage yet al one taile whole ofspring left al fayne go slaughter blud bee shed like filled earth bloud crueltie god rooted house vvhen see see wonderfull iudgements neuer read holy scripture may espie diuine power must spite teeth cofesse god reigning heauen executeth iustice neuer looked haue alledged one example sayd story full thing yet little men fare better man come empire rome state settled wise likelyhood euer remoued bare authoritie common wealth rome neuer suffered bodie impeache state yet neuerthelesse faine come passe came passe empire fell vnto obteyned verely euen sorce warre libertie oppressed neither heire successor could sayde prince emperour insomuch hoped thing haue bin set againe former state notwithstanding thing turmoyled child became emperor augustus caesar began reigne neither wisedome wit thing else empire cast lap asleepe deed haue fought field bed much doo rize therefore seemed emperourship fell dreame yet done haphazard god abate pryde citie rome afterwarde neatcherd became emperor sonne brothell could brag nothing owne brother sonne mother vnkindly incest came aunceters man tell whence came whether bredde ou earth water ye see shamefull thing would make mannes heare stande vp vpon head heare storyes read god ordeyned wise ende might better knowne chaunges happen men instruction sayde fullye hundreth seuenth psalme let v marke well without cause iob standeth much vpon poynt hee sayeth god blindeth prince neyther wisdome discretion aught else seemeth bereft wit yea thing shal light vpo minute houre afterwarde cut asunder girdle theyr sword shall fal wise shall force besides men haue estimation god maketh despised insomuch sayde poureth reproch vppon heere three thing wherof two visible mainteyning prince third secret two visible thing force wisdom ye see king reigneth whece hath authoritie wise haue skilfull counsellers thing well guided aduise hys affayres lay aforehand beholde one meane king hath men greate furniture warre well alyed hath strong hold countrie thus ye see two thing perceiue standard kingdomes principality state world wit force wisdome god ouerthroweth force becommeth nothing worth take away wisdome great forecast ye shal see daunted haue lesse wit little child third thing secret world god imprinteth certain maiestie prince honored knowne according sayde daniel god minded stablish great empire chaldie put feare terror al creature looke vpon balsasar looke vpon nabuchadnesar king god magnified wise bird ayre stoode feare awe wherof came conceyt euen god printed image considering pride men let v think kingdomes could stand stedfast except god mainteyned meanes aforesayd euery man would lord would beare yoke statelinesse nature men euery man esteemes himselfe worthie king commeth passe men suffer smal number one alone reigne ouer bycause god wil order among sayde god poure contempt reproch vpon haue bin noble men haue reuerenced god make laughing stocke insomuch men shall flout make none account vvhy bicause belongeth set vp pull downe therfore let v marke well three thing spoken prince world trust munition fortress people reuenewes mainteyne sayd god cut bandes asunder abate force vnbuckle girdle vaine prince think shall continue euer bicause bee well stored fenced furnished thing harte desire soone god shall blowe vpon nothing shall auaile prince trust wisedome shall happen likewise see also prophet mocke vaine ouerweening vnbeleeuers enemy god vvhere sage counsellers pharao hath egypt renoume vntill sort greate policie worlde behold dulled bereft discretion howe vanished away wise would haue thought god hath done sayeth prophet esay let great one worlde learne humble theselues let bee caried away fonde ouer weening though able mainteyne theselues wisdome strength wee see geere smoke god great men world ca yeelde themselues therevnto herken doctrine leastwise let example serue instruction let v thinke vpon knowne vnto v god hath shewed v small fauour hee setteth king prince vpo scaffold teach v end euery v humble himselfe walke aduisedly knowing god gouerneth thing disposeth creature owne pleasure shall prince blinded persones god giueth v profitable instructio fault selues little one therfore must vnderstad singular fauour god sheweth teacheth schoole meane leaueth far highliest aduaunced world herewithal also let v marke well god chaunge state prince abate force seeme puissant strong al thing quake vnder shal become nothing coparison let v go boast owne greatnesse strength looke vpon great king monarkes haue lorded ouer al men god hath cofouded twinkling eye pray shall become glorious fellowes haue nothing comparison vnder colour wote thinke themselues maruelous men beare theselues hand ought flie aboue clowds bicause haue one peece finger vpon men yet idol theselues god needeth cace vtter great iudgemet worthie remebrance foolishnes laughingstocke euen little child thinke god leaueth ouerweening pryde vnpunished seeing stinketh sight world cannot bee abidden moreouer hath ground colour v priuate persones let v well ware set vp bristle god peculiar office daunt proude resist labour striue aduaunce themselues much rougher must god hande cofound therefore let v bee afrayde lift vp selues agaynst god hande ouerheauie wee come furthermore haue touched alreadie wee muste vnderstand men must glorie owne skil wisdome see sayd iudges cousellers king god mainteyne common weales holy thing world bestoweth spirit vpon worthie king cousellers haue charge gouerne people may haue wisedome howbeeit themselues much god setteth state requisite haue peculiar thing whiche owne nature god doth although men bee worthie reason whereof intendeth maynteyne order hath set neuerthelesse fayleth afterwarde bereeue king prince cousellers wit reason deale thus towards bestoweth spirite extraordinarily shall betyde priuate persones lette v learne walke modestly thinke selues well appoynted thing owne witte reason god able bereeue v true god leaue men witte reason yet meane shall take none effect wee see example achitophell god suffereth bee alwayes man great aduice deed great policie counsell gaue absalom vvell yee see achitophell politike wit owne god abated whit yet brought enterprise passe god blinded well absalom also counsell achitophell beleeued vvee see god abridgeth effect force craftie wylie sight worlde sometimes also maketh dull doltish iob speaketh euen likewise befalleth priuate person man looke vpon howe yee shall see man good skill lay aforehand owne matter fault found yet prospereth god hath cut effect man wisedome made purpose therefore befalleth perceyue prouidence god howbeit may also come passe man whiche polityke great forecast shall fond act shall irke men see possible shall men say forecasting man hath giuen counsell men fall grosse follie cause god hath wrought done god giue v wit wisdome first let v vse wee ought say let v apply wit vnto euill beguile men deale deceytfully doo harme hinderance let serue mainteyne goodnesse represse euill therewithall let v still pray god stablish wit hee hath gyuen v assuring selues continuall heritage god neede continue grace hath begoone wee may bee vtterly bereft day ere morrowe therefore wee must thinke thus selues god thou haste assisted much indetted thee yet take thy spirite mee man owne wit haue serued turne well day yeare whole tyme life let yeelde honour vnto god saying lord beholding thee haue stoode selfe therefore thou must bee fayne vpholde still nothing selfe yee see wee haue doo whereas sayde god taketh away witte whiche well aduised making grope darke wise bee blinde drunken power fore vanished away become nothing god listed must needes come vtter decay vvhen heare let v take example haue sayde must leaue first article namely god poureth reproche also vpon noble whiche reuerence honour vppon god spreade contempt shall full shame men shall scoffe shall haue reputation hereby bee taught although wee haue possible wished nothing shall serue v contempt commeth shall nother shape fauour aught el men see v contempt bee demaunded whereof commeth man tell say yee shall see men aduaunced great estate dignitie yea euen mightiest king world yet shall runne contempt want good iudgement aduisednesse want meanes force policie men know therefore bee imbased runne contempt may men perceyue hand god vpon let men search shall find prince haue sometimes beene shamefull looce liuers worthie haue bene bottom alehouse borthelhouse yet al mainteyned authoritie othersome hauing erst bene men age great wisedome authoritie god made despysed shifte themselues fall downe herein let v beholde god iudgements learne thing happen vnto aduaunced aboue common aray men god may well abace v wil fill v full shame although bene great dignitie reputation furthermore iob hauing spoken prince chaunges happen state addeth must also behold god iudgements bodie people hee hath spoken head cometh body behold people sayeth growne great mightie see howe god bringeth nothing another people inlargeth spreadeth boundes far god hemmeth certesse men comonly father thing vpon fortune bycause men blinde themselues owne vnthankefulnesse wee would open eye certaine god iudgements manifest cace men could gainsay also cause sayd ende psalme god prouidence treated mouth vnrightuousnesse shall stopped wicked may well deface god maiestie vttermost power yet must needes conuinced haue wel considered doings thing whole worlde must needes haue theyr mouthes stopped lyke sayd god smiteth vpon thigh proude head smal one must need take occasion tremble humble themselues god visiteth whole bodye togyther say people shal become euery seueral ber euery seuerall persone god spareth whole countrie shal become thus ye see howe ought applie great thing vnto small ende euery man seuerally may learne walk hubly vnder mightie hande god frame selfe thereafter acknowledge god bee whole soueraine hee handle v another fashion spoken wit shall perceyue protection wonderfull towards v men offer themselues god suffer gouerne wil stretch hand mainteyne state alwayes vphold power wil shielde defence agaynst euill aduentures men needes flye highe god must needes stoppe must euery v needes crouch see god smyteth whole nation sort first standeth v hand throughly persuaded conteyned shall else take instruction haue layde forth let v assure selues lord shal haue multiplyed people well diminish lesse nothing happen great alteration realme let v assure selues co meth passe hap hazard god worker therefore wee must bee throughly resolued two thing true may wel talke shall neuer good earnest till wee haue well studied lesson euery v bee well practized wyse may neuer bee blotted remebrance let v assure selues howe soeuer world goeth god ruleth thing wise ought bee witlesse father thing vpon fortune say poynt whereat ought begin namely hauing full assurednesse god prouidence apply owne vse sayde must make owne profite bycause see fantasticall head talke god prouidence none ende intangle theselues speculatios grosse pity see bring edification wel ynough say god chaungeth god remoueth edified feare verye truth holy scripture speaketh v god prouidence intent therby know mightie power wyse knowe end honour holdeth v hys hand hath ful soueraintie ouer life death say bee subiect vnto seeing hath authoritie ouer v side scripture sheweth v god wise gouerning worlde according haue said already v say god doth listeth wote whither good bad contrarywise must cofesse euer doth wel done although knowe reason yet must wee honour secrete wisdome conclusion wee must tarie leysure tyll hee shewe v wherefore chaugeth shifteth state world sort therwithall must haue eye open thing manifest behold god blesseth people wherefore euen owne mere goodnesse sake wee must seeke desertes men god sheweth fauour see god spred goodnesse vpon people hee magnified people outrageously gyuen euill god visit must wee also thinke cause behalfe lyke dayes see great confusion worlde would greeue man hart wee see also wickednesse become like flowing floud yee see countrie farre square great outragious vyces god scourge follow say within muste wee needes cace acknowledge god bee rightuous iudge wee may iustly condemne perishe haue condemned must wee streytwayes come selues principall poynt v profite oure selues men cost god doth v pleasure warne v aforehande ende euery v shoulde come home againe yee see sorte wee may fare better god prouidence according shewed v streyn sayd immediatly god bringeth darknesse light yea euen darknesse hat darke death say darkenesse hell bring light hee lysteth iob expresserh meening namely rehearce vntoo v workes god famous shoulde speake comon ordinarie workes would slepe would touche v whit haue declared alreadie therefore must warned sort wittes may astonished yea wee may quickned vp lazie dullminded euer bee thus ye see iob ment saying god bring darkenesse death vnto lighte might well haue sayd god maketh sunne shine euery day see night hath course day succeedeth lo heere great wonderfull chaunge iob might haue spoken forasmuche ordinarie thing among v passe therefore intended touch extraordinarie thing sayd god maketh alteration hell aduaunced vp aloft death set vp high men behold darknesse chaungeth light straunge fashion one neuer looked thereby god wakeneth v vp giueth v cause thinke better vpon power haue erst done let v remember lesson well wee neuer better instruction god giueth v day day yea although worke miracle ought moue v throughly think vpon yet wee whit touched vvherefore must bee fayne worke another fashion crie aloude vve bee like man layde bed falne fast asleepe thousande thing may spoken hee heareth folke may talke discourse many matter asleepe shall knowe neuer whit one make great noyse ye shall see wake man cannot speake softly heare sayd standeth cace v god sheweth v many thing ought serue instruction haue eyesshet hee speaketh v heare nothing bicause bee asleepe therefore must faine make great noise waken v end may think much better vpon prouidence acknowledge god wakeneth v therefore v sluggishe shoulde haue regarde profit selues iudgementes hee sheweth v vvherfore let v aduisedly shroud v vnder protectio doubting inasmuch hath creature hand yea euen vnto little sparrowes small value estimation neuer forget v somuch creature sashioned owne image also bicause child according hath adopted v lord iesus christ let v fall downe presence good god acknowledgem fault praying make v feele better may abhorre condemne flouthfulnesse v sens inlighten v holy spirite bicause blinde euen lighsommest manifestest thing therfore let v pray open eye sort may behold great secretes heauely kingdome yea may beholde maiesty farre forth expedient welfare according also weth himselfe v meanes lord iesus christ vntill may come full perfect sight shalbe last day wee shall see face face wise shall fully fashioned like vnto glory may please graut grace v also people nation c xlix sermon first vpon thirtenth chapter behold mine eye hath seene thing mine eare hath heard vnderstoode knovve much inferiour vvill speake vnto god reason vvith yee bee forger lye phisitions value vvould hold tung counted vvisedome heare discourse vnderstand vvhat debate neede alledge iniquitie god defence speake vntruth sake vvill yee pleasure vvill yee pleade cace good allovve vsurpe vpon vpon man vvill reproue fauour secrete euell thing euerye v set himselfe bee inferiour companion haue sonde desire seeme couted wise possible shall ingender much strife among v paule also speaketh vayngloriousnesle sea welspring debate men shal neuer agree quietly among theselues except euery man yeelde meekely whiche good reasonable bee voyde desire aduance himselfe aboue others euery v fond steppe esteemed fire muste needes kindled hande furthermore wee see howe scripture telleth v wee must esteeme gyfts god haue receyued vvherefore let euery man thinke vpon owne infirmity sinnes make v stoupe esteeme whome haue presumptuously shaken let v afraid god wrog despising vtterly destitute gracious gyftes seemeth heere iob mente preferre hymselfe spoken vnderstand much sayeth inferior mine eare hath hearde thing mine eye hath seene seemeth iob would haue reputation wisedome skilfulnesse three whome spake ledde desire prayse bycause men woulde beare downe theyr presumptuousnesse yea peruerte god truthe theyr owne fancye iob therefore constreyned say vnderstoode thing better doth end men able profit selues humbling vntill tyme men bee made stoupe lowe may bee puffed vp sayde presumptuousnesse impossible wynne thing theyr hande euer man shewe sette muche man mynde make himselfe fit heare god truthe receyue muste humbled afore thing whereat iob ameth muche whome hee talked bene hardened settled blinde ouerweening theyr owne wisedome iob wyll haue truthe hearde ceasse haue authoritye styll notwithstanding men reiect thus ye see iobs meening effecte according heerevntoo wee see sainct paule forced sometimes make comparison betweene himselfe estimation among men certayne sainct paule prouoked thereto vaynegloriousnesse nother hee ledde minde desire couet esteemed among men vvhy copareth hee himselfe suche bone wont magnifie themselues hebrewes sayth auncient linage also may well account pedegree bee earnest follower lawe well haue liued without blame boast selues haue knowledge also haue beene well taught fro childhood haue good mayster seemeth paule gathereth togyther thing wont esteemed end men clap hand take greate man set muche store hee ment suche thing hee himselfe auoucheth bee starke folly vvell sayeth compell mee play foole spred wing bee medling euery thing magnified among men fayne sayeth deale mine owne saw corinthian like sorepossessed fonde reputation men nothing worth loued none manner teacher bycause ytching eares meanes wherof god gospell despised troubler theyr full scope nother wisedome discretion consider profit suffered themselues led nothing fayre glozings without holinesse paule perceyuing telleth maner men purchace themselues estimation meanes may wel wil thing wherin must esteemed according concludeth end couted god church must become new creature ye see sayeth hee estimation god hand braueries wherwith men head buzied neuerthelesse paul see ment shew inferiour pretended greate style bee preheminence dignitie worldward maner iob doth hee sawe men met treade god truth vnder foote bicause reputation iob part telleth hee vnderstoode thing well therevpon purposed warne lowly yeeld themselues teachable although beene vtterly vnamendable stubborne folly yet neuerthelesse iobs mind god truth bene maner preuerted haue full authoritie deserueth thus much cocerning first poynt way must warned seeke prayse reputation afore men intende certayne stead mainteyning truth shall marre god also suffer v sotted folly bee made laughing stocke let v bee well ware seeke owne prayse lord giueth v grace teach others let tende marke namely honour cause thing well accepted cometh men may submit themselues vnto wee selues shewe example others according also oure lorde iesus christe setteth thing downe marke discerne good true doctrine man seeketh glory god men know thereby minister truth desire exalted esteemed must needes disguise marre pure doctrine must needes defaced vayngloriousnesse marke speciall poynt nowe let v come whiche iob sayeth yee sayeth hee forger lye aud pelting phisitions woulde fayne ye shoul hold tung moste wisedome vvhen iob calleth forger lye spoken afore wee see strayte wayes purpose sayeth nowe lette v take saying added namely thei pelting phisitios vvhy bicause misapplye medicine wee haue seene hath beene tolde already doctrine whiche hath bene set downe men good holy howbeit ill applied person iob phisition shoulde choze good drug yet without knowing party disease complexion nature say lo good medicine well tryed therefore shall doo man good hee deale whereas saueth one hee shall kyll another therefore behooueth phisition bee wise hee knowe pacients complexion disease men heere suche regarde thus yee see iob called pelting phisitions value beholde heere text well woorthie bee marked vve knowe god woorde ordinarie foode oure soules yet must serue v also phisicke wee diseased breade hath alwayes accustomed vse god woorde muste onely feede v muste furthermore heale disease clenze v therfore must discretion vsed applying without shall confounde howe poore man bee desolate haue troubled conscience see poynt despayre one set god threatnings vengeance afore el send headlong forward see wall shaketh alreadie beate greate stroke attocke next way throw downe must wee marke bee disposed whome wee haue doo poore man bee already dismayed god wrath know become need bee comforted cheered vp promise god giueth wretched sinner calling sweetely medicine must applyed peculiarly suche haue neede others shamelesse despise god scoffe euer sayd man come cocker offering mercy god setting afore pitie god hathe v foolishe proceeding suche folke haue neede bee touched quicke bee threatned yea wounded euen bottome hart bee possible may knowe stomake wise agaynst god wee see holy scripture beyng spirituall phisicke soules must applyed according euery man dispositio let v marke state iob hee extremely pressed affliction god sente wee haue seene reason namely behoued pacience bee exercised god gyueth pacience howbeit hee shoulde haue muche infirmitie therewith like wretched man hee starteth square casteth forth bubble froth agaynste god leapeth quite boundes holdeth suche euennesse measure hee oughte haue done soeuer case stoode infirmity iob knew wel ynough god afflicted howbeit forasmuch sawe cause thought god pressed sore hee oughte haue spared doe come comforte tell god rightuous true herevpo coclude god punisheth men without good cause handling roughly reason sinnes true misapply particularly cocluding god handleth euery man according desert see flat cotrary general principle good true draw euill cosequence although god iust men sinner haue deserued yet doth follow god punisheth therafter ful kepeth one continuall rate presently punishe haue offended reserue nothing tyll latter daye also followeth iob wicked man hypocrite god shewed euidently shaken nothing else hypocrisie thing false notwithstanding men take deriue true grounde yee see wherefore iob calleth pelting physitions streyne warneth v pray god gyue v wisedome may take holy scripture end perteyneth wee may haue discretion applie suche wise wee may good bee pulled fro toppe say according manie men abuse furthermore wee take hand teache neyghbours let v consider well fit holye scripture sayeth paule fit teache incourage warne reproue redresse yea muste bee considered maner one partie muste applyed vnto sayde afore wee see poore sinner caste downe mourneth sinnes desireth nothing returne vnto god let shewed god ready accept receyue yee see howe wee ought deale behalfe contrarywise wee see one proude statelye wee knocke vppon harde parte beetle make meeken himselfe god wee see slouthfull persone hee muste bee pricked forewarde like asse thus yee see howe holy scipture maye bee profitable v meane season wee muste also keepe maner proceeding owne behalfe wee muste bee neyghbors wee selues vvee see theyr conscience combered themselues disquieted mynde feede theyr owne humour take god threatenings rygorously thinke shoulde neuer come soone ynough despayre lette v keepe v suche dealing wee spie satan wylinesse making v beleeue vtterly paste recouery helpe comforte v lette v resist applye remedie therevnto satan woorketh therefore wee contrarye parte muste seeke asswagemente bring v backe vnto god wee muste enter intoo promise wee muste gyue heedefull eare vnto wee muste set wittes vpon moreouer wee see much slouthfulnesse selues wee haue neede bee prycked spurred lette v take v exhortation holy scripture thus yee see howe may bee good phisitions bothe towardes selues towardes oure neyghboures considering meete conuenient v touching iob sayeth would fayne freendes woulde holde theyr peace myght bee counted wise men agreeth common prouerbe salomon vseth whiche foole may bee counted wise hee holdeth peace true man neuer better hiding owne shame long folly abides still within nurishe priuilie neuerthelesse beginning doo well man hathe holde himselfe rule hys tung token delighteth altogither owne follie true couer folly tyme ende bee fayne bewraye themselues make menne knowe bee witte fooles neuerthelesse man haue skill keepe silence although weake wit haue discretion requisite yet greate poynt wisedome knoweth fodeth himselfe vice rather laboureth amende say although suche follie remayne man yet greate poynt wisedome auaunceth himselfe knoweth himselfe sort misliketh humbleth himselfe man bewray himselfe bee foole owne tung token starke foole according often see haue leaste skill babbling without reason man cannot meanes hold hath talked whole houre togyther hee shall finde bee men still therefore men perceyued bee poynte signe extreme foly therefore let prouerbe put v minde iames telleth also wit greate vertue man skill holde tung vse soberly wee bee hastie speake hindreth v fro hearing whiche oure pofit vvhat cause many men profit woorde god bycause hastie whereas ought bee quiet whereas onely god ought haue hearing step forth bubble caste foorth talke yea euen randon therefore shet gate suche wise themselues cannot bee instructed though doctrine offered cause let v marke well iames counseleth v brydle oure tung meening quiet discrete heare wee purpose profit sayd vnto v among men must talkatiue wearie vnprofitable babbling must euery one v put vre needefull make long sermon suche thing shoulde rather continually minded set forth large manye woordes perceyue bee harde frame oure selues vnto vertue muche ought wee esteeme man skill speake muche hee ought nowe lette v come cheefe poynt touched heere iob sayeth hee neuerthelesse talke god hee reason blameth gone aboute ouercome theyr disputation shoulde say woulde speake defence god thinke yee sayeth hee god hath neede leazings shoulde come bee proctours aduocates hath neede men defende suche fashion thinke shall auayle commeth try ye muste bee ouerwhelmed pretence desirousnesse iustifie hee shewe hee abhorreth dealing mainteyned owne rightuousnesse withoute borrowing anye meanes acquitted men hand without borrowing theyr leazings excuse shall haue forged vvhereas iob sayeth hee talke god dispute verely excuse saying lette v also marke good wee maye discerne euill beholde good saying iobs wyll turne awaye men whome doo perceyued spirituall battell himselfe could haue found harte haue indured hundred time god sweetened stripe comfort hee might haue knowen god fauourable neuer faile iob bene throughly perswaded god hylde mighty hande doubt hee bene ready haue iudured hundred tymes forasmuche perceyued perceyued nothing god rigour seemed god vtterly agaynst persecuted extremitie woteth behold wittes suche spirituall battels easie bee knowen men therefore iob sayeth bee talke god saye hee shrinke himselfe gathered close secrete hee holde himselfe men take word randon wrest list themselues god knoweth well ynough ende speaking tendeth marke speciall poynte let v also marke cace standeth vpon framing selues vnto pacience indure aduersitie must comfort selues god wee bee tryed diuell tempteth thrusteth v forewarde despayre nothing good gather oure wittes home long wee gaze men wee shall nothing auayle whiche wee shall selues harme bee troubled well coforte selfe fayre shewes onely make greate protestation men god laugh fondnesse scorne much come selfe agayne alone conscience pinche mee shall feele euer pretended smoke bicause haue regarde men god man intendeth frame himselfe vnto pacience good withdraw himselfe separated fro whole worlde referre himselfe wholly vnto god suffer himselfe bee gouerned truly seing necessity haue good cause call vpon god shall call vpon bee cut men long fastened long turned asyde god vvee see must cut cordes hold v backe present selues maiestie god partie whome wee haue regard true muste regarde neyghbours also bothe edifie receyue comfort handes meane whyle wee muste beginne poynt wit laying open hart god disburden matter sorowes care vnto yee see howe talking god muste bee ende men drawe v hither thither like god seeth v wee haue eye settled fastened vpon alone hidden harte maye bee clenzed voyded away wee bee come poynte appeered fore thus yee see good wee haue gather woordes iob howe bee profitable oure instruction also euill hee enter disputation god true sometimes god giueth v leaue reason yea oure disputings muste bee long besides conclusion muste alwayes bee glorifie howe vvee see prophet finde fault calamity desolation sawe say lorde howe bee thou shouldest destroye thy people wilt thou suffer thing confounded sorte wilt thou neuer set order thus yee see one kinde disputing reasoning god yea prophet holy men rested poynte bewrayed infirmity maner alwayes concluded thou therwith dispose thou thereof according thy wonderfull wisedome v replie thee therefore wee paciently wayte shall become thy worke true wee bee sore amazed nowe wee see thing go suche confusion yet notwithstanding lorde thou wilt prouide well ynough suche wise thy name maye bee praysed vntill suche time bee set order agayne shrinke head groud according sayde lay mouth duste sainctes muste bee humbled wise leremie horrible extremitie hee saide saw vtter desolation god churche muche couenant seemed bee abolished whole seruice turned vpside downe hope whole worlde buryed therefore ieremie made moane hee sayeth hee lay mouth grounde rather eate duste dung lifte vp beake lette tung large agaynst god yee see howe lawfull v sometime reason god howbeit bee mildly winding vp bee haue sayde witte glorifie god referring oure selues wholly vnto lo effect wee haue marke lette v come backe agayne iobs persone intendeth dispute god maner suche sorte althoughe knowe double rightuousnesse god witte manifested v law keepeth hidden yet hee coulde conceyue cause god tormented sorte seemed god ought haue borne therefore disputing iob vexeth himselfe passion farre square disputation ioyned dependeth vppon ye see iob doth amisse condemned reasoning sort god let v marke well whensoeuer god handleth v roughly wee tempted grudge fret muste bridle selues true haue sayd god beareth v vtter griefes vnto say ala lord thou eest ca loger hold shal thus mee euer must yet linger still longer time vve may say make moanes god hath giue v libertie yet haue v neuerthelesse conclude thus lord thine thou shalt v pleaseth thee v glorifie thee respect lo wee haue marke matter concerneth oure person also generally shall seeme v god woorkes haue reason example wee see greate stumblings wicked haue full scope god prouide good suffereth afflicted without giuing ease wee say god hath declared ayde call vpon see cleane contrarie vve ceasse haue recourse vnto yet hee deafe prayer wee offer vntoo agayne hath promised defend church behold left vp spoyle vve see horrible tirannie beareth sway god succour doth hee shew himselfe willing maynteyne owne cace men see church openly oppressed enemy religion reigne adayes outrage pitifull see yet god represseth temptation come minde let v learne get v awaye fal reasoning god thus ye see haue marke vpon streyne let v come second poynt iob sayeth whiche spoken mente currye fauour god wee woulde support mortall man hebrew word set signifieth like accept one face persone vvhat cause accept person matter iudgemet world though man haue euill cace yet hee kinsman freende commended vnto v may looke profit hande authoritie well moued fleshly regard towardes wee bee caryed away cace partie nothing v fauoure blindeth v also worde face persone referred outwarde thing may serue incline mindes eyther louing hating man thus doth iob speake seemeth god hath neede helpe supporte mortall man hath euill cace truely one bee minded shewe fauour say kinsman hee freende commended mee hee hath pleasured wil pleasure herevpon disguiseth thing suche sorte hee proceedeth ryght equitie indirectly beseeche sayth iob hath god neede hilde vp wise supported maner men behooueth v marke well poynt god haue cace hadled abhorreth accepting person vve know telleth v wee iudge rightly wee must turned quite cleane away worldly respect consideration vtterly bereeue v vprightnesse discretion wee ought haue howe happeneth man maketh lawe hee make reasonable hee sitteth iudge cace oftentimes giue forked sentece hee maketh lawe hee hath eye vpon matter looketh vnto vprightnesse hee cannot turne aside hee shoulde followe whiche good true menne haue consideration yet wee haue respecte vnto men man propounde cace vnto v suche wyse persones bee medled wee iudge vprightlye cace layde naked afore v twoo party come v one bee riche kinne bee like respect poore man well recommended vnto v iudge caryed awaye yea reuerseth matter euen cace hath beene layde open hee hath gyuen ryght iudgement vpon persones bereeue vprightnesse whiche hee also yee see lorde iesus christ sayeth iudge yee truely accepting person hee sheweth bee fore possessed humane affection whyther bee hatred sauoure pronounce good vnpartiall sentence thing cannot matche togither passion doo caste v suche darknesse wee see right wee yee see god condemneth accepting person say respect regard haue men cace god haue accepting person among men vtterly abhorreth take good woorth towardes himselfe seeing hee hath neede vndoubtedly hee wee see iobs meening nowe remayneth wee knowe profite doctrine profitable man woulde thinke hath put practize let v take example whiche wee see dayes oure eye doo halfe stablishe freewill may better pleade cace againste god lette menne followe thing purely whiche holye scripture sheweth v sayde men naught frowarde cannot much thinke good thought muche stirre one finger doo good bee bondeslaues sinne thought nothing else conspiracie agaynste god theyr affection enemy goodnesse lo holye scripture telleth v inferre heerevppon yea wherefore hath god giuen v lawe wherein requireth wee shoulde loue harte minde oure strength power wee bee giuen vp euill dooth god commaunde v doo well playne mockerie othersome say seeing wee good wee excused sinne ought bee imputed vnto v excepte wee bee able absteyne seeing power v followeth sinne worlde heerevpon steppe stickler whiche woulde fayne play philosopher defende god cleere slaunders say true wee bee weake wee doo nothing vnlesse god helpe v grace readie v take wee may make auaylable faulte bee oure selues beholde howe men desirous curry fauoure god defacing doctrine holye scripture thoughe god stoode neede vntruthes also god election vvhen men saye god chooseth whome thinketh good leaueth residue vnknowne hee doth sauing pleaseth wil ought suffise v finall conclusion whome god hath chozen haue consider goodnesse mercie touching forsaken mirrours vengeance men speake manner according scripture nowe beholde howe malicious sorte ranckle spewe blasphemy god yea say chooze whome listeth accepter persones vvhy doth chooze one rather verely shoulde say god regarded fayre eye choozing v cause sprang himselfe say owne meere goodnesse yee see howe men alwayes desyrous checke agaynst god herevpon come stickler spake qualifie matter say must say god doth sort chooze thinketh good shoulde giue wicked men occasion runne oute square wee muste rowe betweene bothe streames content one well vvell say true god choozeth whome hee foresawe bee disposed receyue grace side looke whome foreknewe bee wicked woulde bee better choozyng dooth hee leaue suche bee knowing well ynough would vndone owne freewill thus yee see howe wicked sorte doo speake god election euen peruerting truth yet beare themselues hande god liketh well let v rather assure selues god abhorreth text sheweth v yee see vse muste apply doctrine minde fare better surely deserueth layde forth length shalbe god willing nowe tyme suffer man say let v caste selues downe presence oure good god acknowledgemente oure sinnes praying humble v wise conuicted offending diuers wayes may seeke nothing fauour afflict v time vse suche rigour may seeme excessiue vnto v yet wee maye still keepe mouth shet wayting pacientlie till hee deliuer v trouble meane season wee may giue due glory acknowledging authoritie hath ouer v creature may please graunt grace v also people nation c l sermon second vpon thirtenth chapter sermon yet still vpon vij viij ix x verse followeth doth maiestie amaze doth feare fall vpon remembrance like vnto asshes body body clay holde tung pesence lette mee speake let happen mee vvhat vvherefore take flesh teeth put soule handes although kill mee yet vvill trust neuerthelesse vvill reproue vvayes hys sight haue go forward matter wee began yesterday scripture sheweth v many thing vnderstading canot brooke man speaketh v maner cocerning god suche scornfulnesse v seeming wee bound receyue thing finde good herevpon haue bene would fayne play wyze men disguising thing end might wel liked according alledged two example yesterday one cocerneth freewill beholde scripture telleth v namely men ca good hilde prizoners altogither vnto euill many opinio sinner excused quit asmuchas haue power good forger lye whiche rowe betweene two streames say better graunt men freewill intent maye bee blameworthie haue doone amisse yea scripture speaketh otherwise vvherefore flee startingholes forge leasings curry fauour god hath hee neede theyr lie muste trueth bee mainteyned meane much bee sayde darken god grace hath chozen thought good creation world reiected rest howe sore poynte wee see many men haue stumbled yee see sage alledge yet meane whyle steppe like stickler saying say god hath chozen ought saued bycause hee foresawe would well dispozed therevnto therefore asmuch hee foreknewe woulde bee ready receyue grace hee marked hee might say myne dooth scripture speake speaketh cleane contrarie sayeth god fyndeth v alike hee putteth
