difference betwixt v nother barrell better herring v sauing god owne infinite goodnesse draweth v oute death thus yee see pure simple doctrine holy scripture vvherefore doo men come brabble heere tolde thinke excuse god yea muste god bee fayne borrowe oure lye must bee spokesman oure wrangling trickes lyke wee see euill case neede well coloured altogyther turkined maye bleare eye iudges may bee able knowe nothing needefull woorke fashion god behalfe let v marke well howe sayde wee shall haue sought corner witte colour men would else reiect condemne intent might bee article holye scripture might misliked god codemne v sophisticall inuentions extendeth yet wee see howe many daye would fayne medling make meane betwixt v papistes verely say true many abuse churche cofesse thing ouergrosse vnable borne withall therfore needefull haue reformation wil confesse meane season bee demaunded preache finde fault peece fault doctrine follow pure simplicitie gospell withoute adding diminishing notwithstanding see reiected many men cannot agree hard matter reforme thing hande smooth men gentle bee dealt withall herevpon finde forge deuise say beste holde meane betweene bothe wee sawe interim vvhat hath bene cause bring v diuelishnesse onely deuisers desirous play alchimistes multiplier find new quintessence wote haue bene sufficiently couicted poperie nothing horrible confuzion thing ouerfarre order idolatrie grosse may bee seruing god vtterly defaced wee see men put truste owne deseruings haue imagined iesus christe buryed trotted sainct sainct haue theyr patrones god sacramentes set oute gaze vpon make chaffer marchandize men soules impute pelting trifle ceremony meete muche make idol yee see neuter know well ynough neede bee remedied wise saye thing lutheran haue desired hithertoo manner impossible worlde cannot abyde suche alteration therefore neede bee meane yea mary true men haue corrupted god seruice leaning hath beene commaunded men therefore requisite obedience sake men shoulde bee bounde doo still howbeeit bee bounde greate penaltie strayghtly agayne men haue trusted muche merites woorkes therefore muste bee sayde nowe ought beginne god grace cheefe piller wherevpon reste vvhereas iesus christ hath beene good bodie men haue resorted grace hee muste bee declared bee aduocate yea cheefe aduocate oure onely aduocate men may mingle theyr owne merites grace god men commaundementes muste alwayes bee obserued manner also men muste ceasse haue deceassed sainctes bee theyr aduocates maye fellowe commissioner iesus christ worshipping image men bee sotted may well sayde image stirre vp deuotion ignorant simple sort verely ouer grosse folly gadde pilgrimage yet meane men may keepe still deuotion weake ignorant touching sacrament men may well shewe ought greate estimation men ought knowe ought make account remembrance christe yet men may conceyue wote masse well shal much aduaunced men shall haue particular mass deade honour suche sainct thing shall bee common masse men shall saye still sacrifice iesus christ true priest offereth himselfe god father masse shall represent death passion iesus christe lo howe leazing forger haue surmized themselues worke politikely making suche medlye ende gospel might rough worlde co trary part sayde god ayded serued leazings vvhat bee done lette v walke soundly plainely let v haue mouthes shet ende hath spoken may hold selues proceedeth mouthe without replying thervnto behold say howe wee may allowed hand codemne v shift thinke purchase fauour owne fancie step neuer little aside purenesse worde misfashion iudgementes though neuer straunge man imagination let v come added dooth maiestie amaze doth feare fall vpon sayeth iob afterward addeth memoriall like asshes body bodie clay hereby meneth lie god behalfe muche saye conceyue maiestie would make like selues pull downe hither wee hayle fellowe well met beholde pray driueth men vvhy shamelesse falsifying god truth bicause would measure owne spanne oddes betwixte god v let v learne conceyue manner one maiestie god thervpon let v foolishe desire incroch thing either vpon worde vpon iudgementes let v looke downe heades lette god say pleaseth wee haue hearde worde let also doo hee thinketh good let v honour woorkes specially wee enter consideration oure owne feeblenesse frayltie saye wee thus yee see two thing iob compareth togyther heere first sayeth doth maiestie god amaze vvhen hee speaketh maiestie dignitie hee sheweth men ought bee somewhat better aduised talke god vvee steppe bluntly seemeth v god suffer men play addeth immediatelye therefore wee speake god let v learne conceiue infinite glory haue conceyued cannot wee muste bee humbled saye ala speaking god manner men making comparison shoulde made woulde wee set degree woulde place vvoulde haue matched creature asmuche make thing nothing shall become maiesty men haue abaced sort wit conceyue tast god infinite glory certaine shoulde learne humble selues vnderneath ouerweening make selues beleeue furthermore let v bethinke selues feeblenesse wretchednesse man nature giue far greater glosse god maiestie insomuch muste needes bee magnified wee knowe throughly wee selues v glory angelles shoulde approche neerer vnto god yet shoulde faine angel according sayd vnder shape cherubins fayne hyde face able looke vpon god throughly true scripture sayeth see god face howe seeing able abyde withoute casting downe theyr eye withoute couering theyr face theyr wing say able doo without bashfulnesse reuerencing god soueraine vnto whome able atteyne withoute acknowledging highnesse humble theselues therevnto lo angelles heauen fare wee rottennesse touching soules bee little sparkes whiche shoulde bee quenched passe away intoo shadow god preserueth state hee owne meere goodnesse haue wee selues power stande one minute hower god must fayne preserue v bycause nothing v smoke vanitie vvhen knowe certaine presumptuousnesse well beaten downe v shall haue foolish desire disputing owne maner paynt god colour according wee see disfigured rent peeces men vve shall bee presumptious malaparte wee knowe glorie haue well bethought v weakenesse oure selues thus yee see sorte wee shall bee astonished feare iob speaketh heere impossible knowledge god bee ydle men shoulde cast downe suche wise durst bee bolde babble god haue spoken randon token neuer knewe felte maiestie sayde afore liuelye feeling wee vnderstande god hath created v wee whether looke vpwarde downward thing hand wonderfull rightuousuesse wisedome hid v incomparable goodnesse wee knowe thing cannot bee muste needes bee astonied abashed selues shall vtterly abace selues honour highnesse infinite let v learne know better god ende may trayned modestie sobernesse therewithall also let v examine selues vvhen see owne fleshe doth tickle v like well selues wee inclined flatter selues seeke stande owne conceyte let v stirre vp selues say whence commeth vice bycause thou haste yet knowne thy selfe consider thou art enter thy selfe iudge thine owne state shall finde haue bottomlesse gulfe sinfulnesse v bee wrapped ignorance horrible behold thicke darknesse vtterly choketh strangleth v far hauing eye open knowe god wee see thing oure noze therefore whe men shall haue thought themselues wise certaine shall touched maiestie god whereas seene full pryde harebraynd fearing god reuerence modesty feare god shall fall vpon steade greate straunge fastnesse bee seene world men shall find reuerent awe god sayde wee haue conceyued god wee shall stoope vnder agayne otherside wee see oure selues wee shall haue cause stande oure owne conceyte aduaunce selues manner wise thus yee see iob mente token twoo sentence greater confirmation hee sayeth yea thinke hee wyll beare yee dally man hee sheweth v heerein men beguiled knowing maiestie god honour ought doo doo dally vvhereas ought honour wee play bee wont play dealing one another hee deceyue sticketh deceyue well ynough bee perceyued like conuey wyles among men also woulde make couin passe good payment godwarde greate abuse therfore let v thinke dallie craftesmayster scape vnpunished althoughe god suffer men runne yote tyme yet ende hee misse shewe hee partie tooke another manner man hee partie tooke bee bycause hee lyke creature ought obedient common rule suche wise may bee brought accounte measured lawe hee hath gyuen vnto v vnto v say hath squared law bee meetyard bee subiect himselfe heerewithall also men must vnderstand hee another manner one haue imagined bee haue eye infinite glorie therefore let v beware dallying god sheweth v whensoeuer treate eyther worde woorkes wee muste go good earnest nowe iob sayth holde tongue afore mee speake let befall mee heere iob sheweth hee like babbler skirmishe god worde iudgementes howe bee aloofe handestrokes according yee shall see haue tung well fyled talke shall onely debate trifling question farre pracize iob sheweth himselfe none see sayth hee howe carie fleshe betweene teeth torne peeces fayne take vp fleshe skinne teeth carie haue soule saythe hee betweene handes sith see mee plight thinke prate like popiniay cage forced speake heart god examineth mee holding mee vpon racke muste needes vtter affection playnely mee speake one hath experience god tryeth mee maner well seene haue leysure colour matter speake one thing another therefore let speake ye shall beare burthen god whome haue deale hee also whome haue answere youre discourse leaue much bee worth saye vtterly vnprofitable tryfling toyes mee speake according god sheweth mee hee sheweth mee effecte thus yee see breefely iob meant say let v marke heere manner speeche hee vseth namely hee holdeth fleshe betweene teethe carie hee rente peeces mannes skinne torne hee wist doe take vp betwixte teeth yee see iob telleth plyght hee thereby hee sheweth himselfe haue bene pitifull cace hee like liuing creature vvhereas hee sayth hee holdeth soule life betweene handes muche saye vtter hazarde abandoned lefte vp spoyle heerein man may see doltishnesse papistes haue surmyzed holde one soule betweene handes signified haue power doe good euill let men deuize list saye haue soule myne owne handes say doe thinke good haue free state bee shorte meant builde free vpon sentence haue ray soule betweene handes know god threatneth men hee tell hee leaue owne hande sorest scourge light vpon beholde god thundereth v sayth hee leaue v vp owne hand god hold v backe remedie wee must needes runne headlong intoo destruction therefore wee see howe papistes besotted wrested scripture fashion meaning verie cleere streine iob sayth hee beareth soule hande alreadie breathed oure soule clozed within oure body chest meane keepe wee hande one left randon iob declareth rather deade aliue god handleth wise like wretched rotten carkasse liuelynesse become lothly men lo sayeth hee knowe well taken bee companie menne esteemed deade bodye heereby sayde iob sheweth speculatiue teacher true practicioner thing speaketh say god iudgements vndoubtedly without experience wee neyther knowe god hande power iustice thyng else true men shall bee tryed iob wit suche rigoure yet must come touchstone discouer v haue nothing vaine speculation god doe sometymes summon v wee maye feele sinnes endlesse death vnderstande bee destitute saluation shet hope respect selues wee shall neuer know treate god aright say shall neuer knowe one iote heartie affection trifling pratlers maye well haue store fayre shewes may make bragges men shall bee steadinesse wee desirous speake god earnestly becommeth v requisite v haue bene exercysed aforehande haue come tryall say god haue nipped v ende may knowe selues thus yee see effect iob hath meent streine rest let v marke well oure lorde putteth v tryals wee neede greater strength man ende may stand vpon hearing iobs wordes wee woulde condemne good cause waye must consider well extremitie hee intent may thinke straunge though hee temptation ouermaystred hym albeeit ende withstoode combates yet feeblenesse meane hee maner quyte quayled althoughe fayth fell quyte downe yet shaken hee hadde defaultes well felte behoued hym ouergoe temptation notwithstanding ryght greeuous beare therefore lette v thinke straunge speeche man daye saye iob sayde namely hee poore desperate soule hee holdeth hys fleshe hys skinne betweene teeth hee hath soule hand true dauid speaketh manner hundred nyneteenth psalme yet comparison iob euen pittes bottome wee see wee looke vppon hee indured bodye seeing hee broken man woulde disdeyne looke vpon hym yea verye sight ynough make mannes haire stande vppe vpon head hee become hydeous thing would shame man yea loth heart beholde nowe iob indured paynes bodie bene verie much cheefe poynt sayde feeling god iudgement god persecuted much hee found fauour hand seemed god meant adde continually plague vpon plague till hee sent bottome death damnation seeing iob layde roughly let v thinke straunge temptation square meete god poynte vtter perfectnesse owne strength infirmitie man let v oure side apply instruction firste god sende v great excessiue affliction wee bee maner swallowrd vp let make v despayre shall bee declared yet full heereafter let v resiste knowing god doth still reserue mercie readie v time conuenient wee bee payned wee woulde wishe let v assure selues god let maladie rypen heale better man haue plague sore well seene sore stinketh ynough impayre health whole man yet hisition surgion launce byle first dash hee make firie bycause matter yet rype hee lay drawing playster fyrste make sore rypen afterwarde hee bee bolde launce euen dealeth god v hee seeth wee haue verye noysome plague sore let v thinke straunge hee healeth first dashe disease must first bee made rype afterwarde god maye put hande fynde conuenient remedy let v assure selues god knoweth good conuenient v therefore let v tarie leysure pacience wee bee egre making haste wee endure anye affliction excuse bee v specially sythe wee see iob come gulfe hell yet neuerthelesse humble himselfe god although hee endured greeuous tormentes excessiue sorrowe yet hee restrayned selfe say man punished dyd still brydle selfe praye shall wee bee vnexcusable wee chafe fret oure selues aduersities let v consider thinges let euery v haue eye selfe vvhen wee see seruant god hath bene tryed sort vttermost wee must much mylde aduersities stomacke god wee haue beene wonte doe thus yee see wee haue beare mynde concerning streyne iob sayeth although god kill hym yet trust neuerthelesse hee reprooue owne wa e god presence true hebrewe worde lo translate maye bee taken doth signifye properly nothwithstanding tymes taken relatiuely tearme one letter chaunged intoo another whiche common vse among hebrewes neuerthelesse meening one eyther wayes yee reade muste bee waye demannding question thus thoughe hee kill mee shall trust hym yes still trust else yee read thoughe hee kill mee vvhen hee shall haue killed mee yet put truste wee see substance matter chaunged bee short iobs meening although hee bee ouerthrowne inraged passion yet muche say hath forgone pacience intendeth stad contention god alienate himselfe quite cleane fro minded stomack matter wise haue vvherefore protesteth hopeth whatsoeuer come although hee kill saith confound yet cease trust neuertherlesse reproue wayes sight thus fayne intermeddle vehemencie see whiche perceiue say faine intermeddle hope haue god haue faire excellent mirrour god working suffereth faithful fal end faith may better tryed thing seeme vnable matched togither themselues god himselfe maketh agree first blush man would say lo heere fire water last god bringeth al thing end disagreement haue bene whiche disputation would fayne alwayes conclude manner philosopher al thing put order disagreement certaine league couenant throughout thing men neuer knewe haue bene sifted god haue passed iudgementes haue sayd god handleth v straunge fashion thing confounded cace good sooth thing v also neuer made agree time desirous liue sometimes wee woulde fayne dye thing contrarie yea respectes diuers sayth saint paule naturally couet bee consequently wee shunne death death horrible v bicause contrarie oure nature thing dismayeth man part wee see wee bee hild heere prison long bodye oures compasseth v wee bondage sinne therefore inforced syghe sorie therewithall long euerlastingnesse whiche promised v time god shall haue taken v worlde wee drawe towarde death come wee death verie gate life assuring selues much iesus christe hath passed away wee neede bee afrayde death shall haue power ouer v rebated blunted swoord whereof point broken cannot hurt v although draw bloud v yet notwithstanding shall rid v disease shoulde seeme affection contrarie bee deede god agreeth verie well suche wyse thing wee haue conceyued naturall wit put vnder foote bycause fayth getteth vpper hande muche sayde iob handleth streine ye see faythfull fully resolued vpon pointe namely put trust god hope saluation hande howe euer hee would goe thing doe excepte hild father resorted refuge say behold god hath bene father vttermost therewithall hath giuen leaue come vnto therefore muste call vpon put selfe intoo keeping doubt alwayes mercifull vnto mee yea scourgeth mee mind come neere shall perceiue hath heard verely conceite hard combersome beare yet must tary leasure god pacience honor rest selfe vpon promise lo howe faithfull fully resolued point otherside behoueth knowe themselues vnpossible knowe owne infirmity must also make moane say thing contrarie ought tarie god leysure silence meete v make disputing enter co plaint contrarie faith true contrarie firste sight god setteth one well ynough haue bene tossed turmoyled hartburning behold faith draweth v wise vnto stilnesse finally wee conclude thus doubt goodnesse god neuer forsake v howsoeuer world go shall always find fauorable althoughe hee shewe himselfe first brunt thus ye see haue gather effect vpon streine nowe wee see whereat iob amed hee sayde although god kill yet put trust yet neuerthelesse reason god reproue mine way hebrew word vseth signifieth reproue also debate pleade saying protestation hee man party spoken toke toke one would haue played double quit woulde haue trusted god hee spoken thing dispite god telleth none holdeth still trust god nowe seeing trusteth god must necessitie submit himselfe trust god shrinke awaye holde one selfe aloofe contrariwise trust god come vnto seemeth farre v euen streine selues get therwithal moreouer holy scripture telleth v namely shroud ourselues vnder shadowe wing returne vnto may receyue v lap child receyued father ye see conteined iob saith trust god continually sheweth hee one straggler make outleaps bicause desirous play horse broken looce cleane contrarie saith desire nothing neere haue hand vpon mee heereby hee cleared false slaunder charged withall yet neuerthelesse saith afterward beholde yet muste reason god concerning wayes say hope haue vtterly vnmingled complaintes lift vp selfe murmure god true proceedeth infirmitie yea euen sinfull infirmitie worthy condemned howe euer cace stande god letteth goe altogither sayde afore faith ouerruleth affection vvhen wee truste god call vpon much say wee neuer haue bickering selues fayth must get vpper hande peace whereof paule speaketh must winne victorie say must get maistrie heart hee speaketh peace god attributeth victory vnto sheweth wel shall haue turmoylings v shall tossed fro remedie ther peace god must power may get maistrie end passion brought awe let v marke well protesting trust god iob doth also cofesse owne infirmitie shew perfect alwayes fault found yet neuerthelesse hee fleeth alwayes god refuge sith cace standeth let v also side vnderstad whe shake prouocations flesh owne affection somewhat carie v away muste therefore despayre imagine god helpe v let v plucke vp oure heartes trust although wee doe perfectly requisite yet let v sure hee make v feele wayting vpon vayne hee strengthen v continually faythe make get vpper hand al temptation world present life let v fall downe presence good god acknowledgement oure faultes praying make v feele suche wise beeing ashamed selues may labour haue oure recourse mercie may please onely forgiue v fault past also rid v misery wherein receyued protection custodie wee may neuer slip howsoeuer satan practize againste v hee neuerthelesse bee alwayes hande wee maye euer haue wherewith beate backe assaultes mortall enemie maketh vpon v may please graunt grace onely v also people nation earth bringing backe poore ignorant soules c lj sermon third vpon thirtenth chapter vvill yet still helpe hypocrite shall come face herken vvords marke vvhat shall tell vvhen shall haue set dovvne cace knovve shall iustified vvho vvill plead hold peace vndone graunt tvvo thing vvill hyde selfe thy sight vvithdravv thy hand let thy vvrath make afrayde thou speake vvill ansvvere else vvill speake ansvvere thou haue seene alreadie protestation iob made witte hee woulde still trust god euen hee ouerwhelmed hande sayde shewe howe hee deeper conceyte feeling god iudgement men commonly haue according wherevnto hee knewe double ryghtuousnesse god nowe confirmeth ratifieth matter anewe saying god bee helpe yea hypocrite sayeth hee shall come hee saye knowe present selfe god therefore sure hath handled mee hardly afflicted extremitie still shew himselfe sauiour vvherevpon doth iob ground hope welfare vpon hee dareth approch vnto god true hypocrite also approche vnto god according sayde eyght fiftith esay people seeketh daye daye preace would knowe wayes vvee see hypocrite haue affection zeale neuerthelesse make many windelasses martyr themselues seeme nothing fire flame get neere vnto god yea doe nothing else turne potte bee desirous come streyght way vnto god would fayne bee quit without comming howe wee see howe hypocrite verie full deuotion buzy pretend therby vvhen papist heare three mass day make muche bibblebabble take holy water trot altar altar certayne pretende serue god pretending sorte god beholdeth neere hande withdrawe themselues stray farre away cause prophete ieremie likeneth braueries masking ceremony among men vnto theeues caue like theefe retyreth couert ende might seene faulte come light euen doe hypocrite make sundrie colour lurkingholes euerie thing call seruice god ende god demaunde nothing let alone bee maye couer themselues vnder mummerie thus see hypocrite make countenance approching vnto god howbeeit bee truth therefore although bee puffed vp fonde misweening yet neuer neerer vnto god although perke vp nebbes bolde make many protestation muche seemeth would euen runne vpon god haste yet come neuer neerer vnto bycause besotted thinke vpon god thought vpon god would bee bolde vvee see hypocrite haue playde fooles owne fonde trifle dallied god little babie thinke themselues rightuous angel faulte bee founde god demaunde thing hand doth presse much farre beeing indetted vnto seeming beholden vnto ye see howe hypocrite flash fire flame sort shoulde seeme would runne vpon god bycause thinke haue liuely feeling conscience bee short man shall neuer come god good hart pure free affection excepte hee honour honouring feare fearing truste thing say must man heart euer come vnto god haue acquaintance first poynt say honour god saye knowe maiestie becommeth v yeelde selues wholly therevnto homage vntill wee haue conceyued maiestie god aboue v shall neuer desirous come vnto feare must also bee matched therewithall say haue graunted soueraintie dominion wee muste bee desirous serue walke commaundeth feare alone ynough therefore must learne knowe god goodnesse wee may put oure trust also meane come vntoo cause iob sayth hypocrite neuer appeare god presence say shunne god muche possible according also see spoken death torment themselues yet notwithstanding way come vnto god howebeeit vtterly eschewe iob hee hath sayde hypocrite come neere god protesteth hee selfe none number proofe whereof hee commeth god yea seeth reasoning mortall men therefore resteth vpo leuer god herken might haue leaue speake hee face hereby hee presupposeth god bee helpe still way wordes vseth somwhat straunge haue seene like heretofore shall see like hereafter howbeit end may haue true exposition let v follow order hild heere hearken ye sayth receyue woordes shall haue set downe cace knowe shall bee iustified iob presupposeth hath good reason defende himselfe withall shall quitte god may haue leaue plead cace pleadeth men deale deafe eares would haue speaketh holde peace heare hee shall debate wayte ende issue shall vttered god vvee see summe intent wit ment say bee quit myght haue leaue libertie debate cace wherevpon dependeth vvee must call mynde hath beene declared afore witte two sortes god rightuousnesse god sometimes iudge men lawe hath giuen v ryghtuousnesse whiche throughlye knowne apparant vnto v god doth enter couenaunt v giueth v rule marke howe haue men liue hee doth thing cursed hee euer performeth law shall liue seing lord hath certifyed v hee hath shewed v rightuousnesse altogither apparant iudge v therafter fayne enter account examine life euery commaundement thinke selues go wherein hast thou doone amisse behold thy god requireth thing hast thou performed thou seest wherin thou art faultie marke say shall condemned law likewise contrarie part knowe ourselues haue fulfilled god law vnpossible admit say man trieth work throughly finde life hath bin conformable god law hee iustified rightuousnesse apparant knowne v yet iob hath protested heretofore higher rightuousnesse god whereby hee could condemne euen angelles vvherefore although god allowe man life throughly framed according lawe yet bound thereby neyther much saye owe seruice hold v acquit compare perfection god perfection creature wil come sunne may darkned though giue light al world say ther nothing suffize satisfie matter let v marke well whe euer god listeth iudge v lawe although wee know euill vice selues yet wee bee rightuous let v come iob sayth vvhen euer shall haue leaue plead cace sayth lay forth matter order alledge reason knowe shall iustified say god would iudge according lawe might answere shewe life hath bene iustifyed haue told impossible needes none proofe shew al men cursed damned god sayth whosoeuer performeth thing shall bee accursed vvhen paule goeth proue man shall iustified deedes lawe giltie god mouthes must bee stopped hee alledgeth sentence yea doth follow therevpon damned vvee must looke whether god lawe paule presuppeseth wee say none whiche dischargeth dutie v farre meeneth iob say hee shall iustified god would admit stand defence god wherof accuse faultie thing knowe much hee mortall man hee clothed many infirmity sinnes doth hee meene hee could quit first wee must call mynde hath bene touched heretofore namely iob looketh simply deseruing himselfe god intent scourging howe vvee haue seene god findeth sinnes v worthy bee punished go hee beareth forgiueth yet meane afflict v cause befell vnto iob true wretched sinner god according lawe might haue punished extremely yet notwithstanding suche respect vve haue seene afore god punished iobs sinnes set purpose punishe say punish man bicause hee hath deserued bycause hath liued naughtily god respect vvhat intended iob mirrour men end beholde may haue occasion humble ourselues knowing god hande heauie v beare also considering frailtie according secret incomprehensible iustice hee might handle v hundred thousand time roughlier doth therwithall also haue eye pacientnesse man god ment vse iob matter see intent punish cause iob saith leaue speake open cace large found rightuous according god intent say respect present affliction endured god find iniquitie behalfe contrariwise allow one seruants iob saying reiecteth forgiuenesse sinnes wherevpon rightuousnesse founded vve say men made rightuous faith bycause wee damned workes true bring damnation cursednesse god therefore must v abyde shame confuzion cause standeth v hande borrowe rightuousnesse god maye like allowe thing done lord iesus christ clotheth v owne rightuousnesse allowed v god ye see become rightuous fayth bycause bee clenzed scoured sinnes death passion oure lorde iesus christe meane time god guideth v holy spirit guiding v accepteth seruice yeelde say accepteth goodnesse hee hath put v much one drop goodnesse v giuen v aboue therfore like god giueth v gracious giftes doth also take good worth howe workes please god hee hath eye imperfection thing v hath blemishe god hee regardeth hee beareth v fatherly loue ye see may bee rightuous god yea verely insomuch pleaseth like well v hee bounde wee haue deserued maner iob sayth hee shall bee found rightuous whereby excludeth god grace mercie hee extendeth bearing handling rigourously calling life account poynt poynt heerewithall let v marke also iob speaketh excessiuely hee hath doone afore vvhat reason hee man raueth one astraught hee woteth cause hee disputeth god secret rightfulnesse ouerrough therefore sayth maruell though troubled swallowed vp dispayre seeing god persecuteth fashion without shewing iob astonied sort hee hath eye hee knoweth bee true namely god well make feele sinnes examineth onely according lawe hee considereth muche god pardoneth seruantes walke soundnesse straunge thing hee hauing done yea euen hart neuerthelesse handied roughly feeleth heauinesse ofhys hande better vnderstanding heereof let v looke vpon whiche hee addeth hee desireth god graunthym two article sayth hide selfe thy sight saye readie receiue punishment thou listest complayne thy hande rough pleade wyth thee thou pressest condicionally haue two poyntes one whereof sayth hee thy hande bee withdrawne terriblenesse shoulde dismaye mee hee meeneth saye prayeth execute hys iudgement haue indited iob thinketh verie straunge god scourge sore without making priuie wherefore one therefore prisoner desire bee set libertie hee knoweth himselfe quite cleane shaken men giue hearing vvhat shall prisoner tormented without examination without question put vnto without proofe information layde yet neuerthelesse hee thrust deepe dungeon set stock iob complayneth heere specially hee bee streyned vpon racke seeme hee like dismembred saye poore prisoner handled fashion woulde hee say iob complayneth god doth nowe execute suche rigour yet action commenced againste thus ye see first poynt whereof speaketh theseconde god call say cace might bee layde forth orderly rigour ceasseth men deale order lawe vvell sayeth hee let action commenced hide thy sight say refuse thing whatsoeuer dispose shall please thee pacient obey thee poyntes vvee see iob excessiue man oute wittes vvhy hee looked well himselfe certayne haue knowne aught hee might haue shewed himselfe god must haue beene fayne haue come wyth head hanging downe like men come poynt must fayne acknowledge wretchednesse stand confouded iob therfore would haue vsed manner talke bene forepossessed maruellous great amazednesse moderate discretion humble himselfe god became way haue good profitable lessonto gather present text first let v remember haue sayd alreadie wit god list handle v rigorous manner whiche conteyned lawe yet hath authoritie iudge world vve may well reply contrarie shall gaine nothing murmuring therfore haue good cause humble ourselues furthermore let v consider little cace god handle v according measure conuement v haue told god hath giuen v lawe respecting owe vnto also vtter perfectnesse rightuousnesse hauing regarde meete conuenient creature stead approuing life commeth iudged lawe faine stand ashamed yea one sort thousand sinnes misdoings bottomlesse gulfe seeing cace remaineth nothing v humble ourselues sighe ashamed shamefulnesse said may well check god alwayes bee cause prouoke god wrath v furthermore let v beare mynde god visitation verie hard bee borne seeing iob caried awaye hee wist hee man wittes vvhy god pressed terriblenesse heereby wee bee warned god punishe v rygorously wee muste needes bee ouerwhelmed dispayre bee vtterly confounded true long wee bee good way blowes stout ynough god commeth iustle v good earnest feele force whiche wee set light whatsoeuer wee imagined bee selues shall bee lesse naught nothing else smoke fonde surmizing requisite knowe wee knowe nothing saluation sayd presumptuousnesse wherewith wee bee besotted maketh v rash runne randon wee contented passe oure boundes also wee woulde fayne stye aboue cloudes ye see cause decay namely foolishe ouerweening wherewith dazeled moreouer doth hinder v calling vpon god whereas wee ought resorte refuge broode selues vnder wing euerie v runneth ryot seeming wee moue mountaines worke wonder thus ye see wherein cheef point saluation halteth wit whereas wee ought flee vnto god prayer supplication specially wee pinched aduersitie last cast wee goe seeke worldly helpes else wee yeelde oure owne fonde fancy haue deceyued v vvoulde wee bee exempted suche illuzions vayne thought let v loke vpon selues example iob cosider seing hath abidde spiritual battels say seing god pressed suche wise hee felte enemie god doo nowe adayes shewe himseife iudge wee shun hand escape rigour true wee haue conceyte wee shall dismayde wee shall see nothing gulfe hell gaping vpon v shall bee impossible v haue eyther reason modestie stay measure well ought wee consider may quake yea quaking must terrour may continue v may come remedie wit wee must pray vnto god graunt v grace fynde rest middes trouble wee maye bee sure notwithstanding tyme hee make countenance set himselfe agaynst v destroy v vtterly lo howe wee haue neede pray vnto god handle v rigorously moreouer whe sayth graunt two thing wilcome head bolt vpright hide self thee let v marke v summon god desiring punishe v hee haue made v vnderstand sinnes great intruding vpon iurisdiction shall wretched offender appoint iudge true earthly iudge may ouerrigorous man may pressed cruelly cannot god v whesoeuer punisheth v beareth v excesse neuer none true perceiue doth thing neither wee see ballance weight vseth nay rather seemeth v turneth al thing topsie turuie yet al behoueth v honor secret iudgemets let v assure ourselues thing think full strange neuerthelesse ruled vprightnesse equitie much proceede shall manifested v ende neede haue pride desiring range god vnto fancie require let v content ourselues good praying giue v pacience full obedience till haue made v perceiue doings good verely may well desire god indite v hee punishe v vvherefore intent may iudges shall auaile v though god punish v euen extremitie meane season continue stubburne naughtinesse wee slouthfull dul headed thinke vpon al would alwaies greater damnation god beate vpon v would bow backes hart would neuerawhit supple muche would become like styth beateth backe blowes god chastizementes shall neuer welfare except owne iudges condemne ourselues first may know fault say know wretched sinner haue well deserued punishmet suffer meane enter therewithall hart feele sinnes suche hypocrite saying haue well deserued chastizement without knowing wherfore true ought condemne sinnes know yet must wee begin poynt namely examining conscience seeking thing whiche ynough conuict v otherwise vnpossible euer man humble god condemne truly vnfaynedly ye see end may require god enter processe v punishe v say shew v fauor lay sin v ende may see owne condemnation first al beaten downe selues lo wise may make request reason astonishment iob affliction carieth v away neuerthelesse although lawfull v yea behooffull also make petition vnto god wit would admitte v receiue v debate cace yet must require withdraw hand god well thing wit make v proces therin shewe v hath iust cause punish v see sinnes therewithall also continue make v feele stroke hand god well thing togither forsomuch may match togither receiuing togither muste bee thought strage told behalf must altogither like iob requireth maner admitted defence al one haue tolde already would pleade god according sayd iustified acquit addeth nowe speake first god giue leaue speake else answere whe god hath begon speake iob maketh request end aforesayd wit pray god moderate rigour yet notwithstanding make v perceyue fault hath brought v lowlinesse become owne iudges euery one v may willingly passe vnder condemnation iobs intent enter cleane contrarie cace vvee see wherein hee fayleth shewed v entente wee followe measure haue spoken alreadie nowe wee see profite redoundeth v doctrine wee applye well oure vse witte wee desire bee heard god hande must bee bring excuse thoughe wee faultie wee could lessen offence rather make none must bee enter intoo knowledge yea enter wise wee may bee vtterly throwne downe may bee none shift v flee vnto god goodnesse wee shall haue condemned whole life may notwithstanding ceasse truste mercie hee hath promised wretched sinner mislike sinnes condemne desyring nothing god receyue mercie yee see wise wee ought practize sayde request harde v attayne reason therefore must streyne selues hardnesse muste put v hearte rather prouoke v runne vntoo god praying hys grace touch v suche wyse doctrine meanes hys worde wee maye offer vp suche requestes vnto wee may feele fruite faultes tolde v dayly yet thinke vpon god therefore perceyuing v slow yea euen sort able moue v worde lifteth vp hand sendeth v chastizements bicause affliction small nothing v wee shake oure eare prouerbe sayth god doubleth stripe scourgeth v holding nozes gryndstone say withdrawing himselfe v hys spirite quenched v feele gouerneth v muche become poore desperate soules crie ala afterwarde become inraged wee would fayne haue god giue v release hee giue v yee shall see v vtterly past selues remedie state may well desire god withdrawe hande giue v leaue say ala lorde thou seest sillie creature feele heere thy chastizementes ouergreat considering myne infirmitie true chastyzement due mee yea ought feele yet muche strength feeble weake seeming already shet vp dungeon hell ala god voutsafe thou therefore alay thy rygour little may haue leysure take breath bethinke selfe better haue done vvhen haue releef come thee woundes shall assuaged see meane take good thy scourging abide vnreformable vnder thy hand behold goodnesse god dothe vnto v suffereth v come vnto neuerthelesse make request vnto must bee done condition vvell lord true petition make necessity thou seest able beare thou preuent mischeefe must needes fall gulfe confuzion shall neuer get againe neuerthelesse lord referre self wholly vnto thee thou knowest meet conuenient thou arte able remedie extremity wherein according thou haste infinite meanes plucke thy seruant euen death adde condition god dothe well suffer v make suche request yea like well lo wee haue marke sentence waye wee muste thinke iob farre ouerseene beare himselfe hand hee faultlesse hee ready enter lawe god pleade agaynst weening shuld get better let v think iob sotted follye vvhat vvee must hinke spake without aduisement bee wont doe affection ouermaster v haue eye bleared discerne nothing example man bee besides himselfe greese anguish knoweth light wordes escape hee bee told answere yet true shall haue spoken yea shall seeme owne vnderstanding bycause wit troubled confounded haue sayde passion carie v away wyse bee maner beside selues cace yet meane whyle god ceasseth maynteyne alwayes knowledge v shall notwithstanding bee good choked vvhen man couereth fire wyth asshes earth great cole lye hyd vnderneath man shall see thing perceyue heate euen doth god sometymes suffer discretion choked v cace wee see nothing asshes saye passion vppermoste wee see steame fire sheweth selfe euen standeth cace wyth v iob made protestation hee felte extremitie hee sought meanes come god saying hee would first speake let v bee sure hee spake man vtterly rauing fittes seeing cace suche let v learne walke alwayes humilitie let v well ware affection doe carye v awaye sorte wee knowe wee doe say lo heere sentence verye profitable full good learning first wee see affection like wylde beastes dashe v god let v come rushe shall winne wee hard r hee wee able make bowe else breake ala wee muste needes bee crusshed broken peeces rushe furiously onely also hee ouerthrow v blast nedeth breth scripture sayeth destroye v vndoo v bring v nought therefore let v vnderstand passion must bee repressed wee must hold awe yea must fetter say must vttermost abate heady frant knesse else become see hath happened iob holy man mirrour pacience persisted mynd obey god yet notwithstanding seene violence intermedled fell rushing wyse wist much ought wee praye hartely vnto god rule passion see vnruly bee able weeld represse wise may come lift vp themselues furthermore haue hapned ouershoot ourselues haue passed bound hearkned vnto god let v bee discouraged therefore remedy pray vnto god bring v vnto reason agayne moreouer let v kindle againe fyre going say whe see good consciece falne sleepe v manner choked haue muche one sparke lyght people confounded saye wee perceyue let v labour come reason againe wee may say art thou thou wretched creature thou seest thou flingest thy selfe auenture yea euen thy god witte thy wordes therefore standeth thee hand restrein thy self measuring passion whiche ouer vehement excessiue thee lo howe behooueth v come backe vnto reason find ourselues dismayde wee knowe wee say let v assure selues thing whereby wee must bethinke selues neerely may absteyne excessiue speech wee see iob hath vttered heere yea euen without aduisement let v learne moderate passion wise wee may desire nothing god giue v grace take taste goodnesse mercie although seeme confounded yet may ceasse reioyce rest ourselues vppon goodnesse wee may glory euen middes affliction lette v cast selues downe sight good god acknowledgment sinnes praying make v perceyue better make men foreward willing come yeeld themselues vnto shall appeere iudgement seate may come condicion first owne iudges quit hys hand receyued vnto fauour infinite mercie hath shewed v lord iesus christ whensoeuer scourgeth v hee assuage smart roddes may know chastizing v profit meanes thereof may stirred vp turne agayne vnto strengthen ourselues goodnes euen til come place rest shal fully inioy fauour graciouse giftes possesse hope may please grant grace v also people c lij sermon fourth vpon xiij chapter hovv many si ne iniquity haue shevv misdeede transgression vvhy doest thou hide thy face take thine enimie doest thou follovv broken leafe doest thou persecute drie stubble thou vvritest bitternesse makest possesse sinnes youth thou lockest feete stock cannot scape thou printest sol feeete shall rotte old tree garment motheaten heeretofore iob declared thing true touched yesterday whiche god scourgeth v see reason wee go law euery poynte could lay selues could lay infinite number v shuld put confusion meane euen rightuousest men true also although seeme bee faultie law common rule yet must god acknowledged declared righteouse wee shall reape nothing shame wee haue pleaded neuer wel ourselues dependeth still vpon hadled yesterday wit god hath secrete righteousnesse aboue whych knowen vnto v declared v law angel wer examined righteousnes shuld condemned ther creature neuer pure able satisfie iob pursueth new sayth shew misdeedes mine iniquity much haue sinned transgressed true heere confesseth forsomuch scourged god hande behoueth humble himselfe howbeit hee cannot paciently indure god shoulde scourge without shewing reason thing wherein faulted god make v perceiue sinnes wee see oure eye god punishing v bicause haue offended manner much therein doth v great grace leastwise haue wit discretion condemne selues wee may aske forgiuenesse hardened better knowing sinnes notwithstanding god holde v imprisoned wee bee beaten roddes stripe hard v beare know hee intendeth cause scourgeth v manner yet must murmure cast downe countenance say lorde tarrie thy leysure till thou shew ende affliction true may wel wish would please god make v perceiue meening know might profit lawfull ynough v make request yet therewithall must haue myldnesse hold tung vntill please shew v large vnknowne v vvell may fare better sentence let v marke iob perceyued god scourged marke one special point secondly fully perswaded hee amend cace pleading god furthermore also knew god scourged ordinarie manner wont punishmen handled iob fashion therefore knew indured common chastizement suche one man might bring vnder ordinarie rule secret hidden determination god iob knew ought haue bin pacient thing haue spoken failed awhit great matter perceiue god hande striketh v feele stroke also know wherof proceede ye see thing good right profitable seeing know god shall always found righteouse wee may well grudge againste shall neuer cace must needes euermore condemned see yee good lesson learne beare mind also serue humble v wee shall haue mouth shut end may restreyne bridle affection stomacke matter god let v vnderstand secrete iudgements hym wee cannot perceiue thing serueth also hold v much awe may pro uoked presumption malapertnesse dispute god thus ye see good thing yet therwithall men must haue stay themselues perceyue god punisheth know wherefore say must quietminded tarrie till god discouer thing vnto whiche yet concealed poynt iob failed let v consider forepossessed grief indured greatly wondered though astonished desired god handle leastwise according sinnes persecute god bendeth himselfe poore creature stretcheth arme seemeth thunder vpon man hath respite tormented hee seeth ende miserie good ouerwhelmed behalfe ala maruell though wandring wordes scape euen iob vvherefore lette v learne pray god shall please put v incounters suffer v quayle specially infirmitie sheweth selfe point enter wicked imagination plucke v backe himselfe bring v againe state may glorifie incomprehensible iudgement thus ye see wee haue marke first place vpon streyne man myght demaund heere iob vseth singly worde sin alone say shew many sinnes haue addeth iniquity transgression misdeedes purpose doeth one hee saye god hath examined throughly poyntes shall finde cause handle roughly iob esteemed himselfe rightuouse haue sayd already speaketh troubled mind hath regard thing resteth vpon considering hee suche persone freendes reported witte god punished hym bycause greater sinner men thys hath good cace meane hee considereth ought doo finally iob declareth god shall haue serched throughly euill shall find punishmentes indureth bicause misdoings place haue made distinction betweene wilfull sinne sinne ignorance betweene committed god whiche committed ouersight terme distinction hath substance iob haue touched already ment rather set downe cace particular full better perceyuing heereof lette v marke god speaketh lawe hys commaundementes hee vseth diuersitie termes ordinance statute decree iudgementes suche lyke seuen eyght wordes import one thing first formost hys meening shewe wee walke rightly wee cannot alledge ignorance vvhy gyueth v full instruction howe wee ought lyue therefore goe astray make reckening obeying god vvhat reason wee would studie hys word well could neuer doo amisse would guyde v poyntes caces yee see first place wherevntoo diuersitie wordes serueth sayde statute ordinance obseruances proclamation decree testimony vvitnessings iudgements c serue shewe god guideth v carefully wee cannot make one false step wee follow whych hee teacheth v therefore wee vnexcusable amisse god hath set many barres wayes hold v backe hee hath made v certaine path hee hath set v boundes side hee hymselfe guideth v cannot swarue right hand left doctrine giueth v admonishmentes confirming whole vse take contrary way men may see purposed malice yea euen wit thus ye se men made vnexcusable seeing god hath commaunded thing good word twayne hath ratified stablished making ordinance statute obseruances euen purpose men shoulde bee conuicted ouerheynous rebellion go thing contrary part manner vsed speaking sinne end men shoulde bee better touched vnderstande haue committed small light fault haue deserued bee punished rigour transgression horrible example vvhen dauid twoandthirtith psalme sayeth man blissed whose sinnes god forgiueth whose iniquity couered whose transgression buried whose misdoings god rememembereth see wherein mannes happinesse consisteth wherefore doeth dauid speake sinnes iniquity transgression bene ynough haue sayd one word blissed man whose sinnes god hath forgiuen hee ment expresse infinite graciouse goodnesse god sheweth v forgiueth v sinnes call v reckening ala woulde bee none ende found e age vnto hym one parcell assoone hee shall haue cast v one poynt shall new begin agayne another dauid knewe men plunged damnation deepely horribly myght bee sauing god pulleth backe owne infinite goodnesse hee doeth men ought ouerpasse slightly hee released det fiue shilling must bethinke well misdeedes iniquity theyr transgression must mynd throughly beare remembrance wee see vsed suche diuersitie woords iob flat contrarye hee say true men may amisse many wayes true bee exceedingly blame woorthie god yet life throughly examined bee nother misdooings transgression iniquity deserue god shoulde handle mee fashyon wee must bee heedfull beare mynde hath bene sayd namely iob ment iustifie himselfe though performed thing full onely eye god intent punished hym certayne wee haue seene already god respect vntoo hys sinnes greate ment proue hys pacience lo scourged wee may take profit thys doctrine let v marke first god list vse rigoure towards v certayne one sinne may punish v wise wee shall knowe become yet hee shall v wrong much likelyhod listed punish v sinnes bee ende thirdly although punish v directly respecte faultes wee haue committed yet shall rightuouse still becommeth v sinke downe vnder true lowelinesse euen behalfe three poyntes whych haue marke firste god listed condemne v one fault alone haue cause replye hym say punishment ouergreat vve see booted cain replye god wise surely hee could denye deede conuicted afore hande alreadye sayde keeper brother life sawe iniquitie knowen spited gnasshed teeth grunting sayd punishment greater able beare behold forlorne man thou chacest shall become vvhosoeuer meeteth mee shall kill mee thus ye see cain murmureth god hys punishment greate sayde sped euer better wickednesse increased much therefore let v keepe oure selues repinyng although wee wist mo one fault v v shewe sinnes haue deserued god competent iudge thereof therefore must punish v fancie seemeth good v according hys owne iudgement marke one poynt moreouer seconde poynt wee haue marke faultes innumerable also wee must thinke straunge god punish v diuers sortes double stripe wee bee plunged deeper deeper intoo many misery languish folke vtterly forlorne let v thinke thys geere straunge faultes withoute number second poynt haue beare mind third let v marke god may well vtter hand v yea euen execute secrete iudgementes wee haue labored serue good conscience imployed ourselues faithfully vpon neighbour yea liued among men without fraude without malice without violence vvhe wee haue worshipped serued god purely sort haue walked vprightly neighbour yet god scourge v must still confesse hym rightuouse vve see yet must wee pleade wee must come short say vvell lord thou wilt shewe reason miserie whiche indure neuerthelesse thinke time long howbeit lord wisdome ynough humble selfe vnder thy mightie hande furthermore thou thys pleasure time come may knowe thy purpose may profit howfoeuer worlde go let ceasse glorifye thee lo manner ought proceede iob hath desired god enter sorte intoo ordinarie pleading hee addeth wherefore hidest thou thy face esteemest thyne enemie following leafe already broken perfecuting stubble already withered heere iob alledgeth owne frailtie get ease hys affliction asswagement sore hath vsed heeretofore againe heereafter thys manner praying good holy proceedeth cause wee see faythfull haue done indeede heere ye see haue bring vnto god would obteyne fauoure hand deliuer v misery succoure v whiche lay feeblenesse vvhereas fooles alledge owne woorthinesse go binde god vnto say nothing wee bee wretched shall obteyne mercie euen saying ala lorde consider thou must bee faine haue pitie v bycause thy creature vvhen man alledgeth ala nothing filthinesse body lorde thou take away thy strength beholde brought naught soule hath little breath thou also withdrawe thy breath say power thou hast gyuen thencefoorth nothing furthermore muche ignorance store vice many wantes woonder see ala god thou seest full misery perceyuest thou matter thy mercie woorke vppon vvee see wee bee desirous obteyne fauoure god hande wee must take way iob dooth heere howbeit another mynde iob driuen strong vehemencie bycause hee weerie bee pressed hande god therevpon hee fretted hymselfe vve must oure laying foorth oure myseries god must bee ende hee may bee inclined pitie v holy scripture full suche text faithfull say ala lorde man behold dauid sayth seeing life breath passeth away without returning lorde wilte thou haue pitie vpon v succoure v seeing thou perceyuest v fraile god heareth suche request appeereth text remembered flesh breath passeth returneth agayne yee see ho god witnesseth hee shewed mercie child israell dealt according theyr desert bycause sawe flesh nothing corruption therefore hee bare seeing god spare v consideration wretchednesse v certayne may ought alledge poynt vnto hym intend obteyne mercie hand therefore let v marke well word iob vseth lawfull v good forme praying vnto god go humilitie say lord consider leafe yea euen leafe already withered yet goest thou wipe ouerwhelme vtterly stubble already dry grasse already cut downe life substance ala god thou persecute moreouer shall become wee speake maner god accept suche complaint come suche pride bound vnto v wee lay oure misery end succoure v remedie maner prayer heard hande therewithall let v beware questioning iob doeth vvhy esteemest thou thine enimie iob alledgeth vnseemely thing god said see lorde thou art almightie lesse nothing yet commest thou holde plea againste whereas wretched rotten tree nother life sap vvilt thou trie thy strength sayeth heeretofore repeteth wordes cause sayde wee must keepe selues caried away oure affection although god almightie wee frayle may yet notwithstanding nought entereth battell v wee thinke straunge must shut eye say must ouerwise owne vnderstanding saye would fayne knowe reason god handleth mee sort let v keepe selues suche presumptuousnesse yea marie meant god hath thing hande onely looke maketh mountaynes melt waxe agaynste fire snow sunne word ca destroy whole world doth neuerthelesse aduaunce himselfe fight hand hand say wyth wretched creature vvhat meeneth vvell may argue sort god make conclusion confound v let v ouerwise sayd let v take god scourging v good great strong euer dreadfull euer maiestie bee towards v let v ceasse yeeld glory assuring ourselues hee righteouse hee doth allthings according reason though hee bend himselfe againste v make countenance though hee would ouerwhelme v deede good cause god shew himselfe enimie yea euen though vnable withstande despise v inasmuch proude wee stoupe vnder always seeme rightuouse must needes shew v lesson yea must shew v force good yeeld selues giltie therefore god compelleth v scourging v according desert thys iust cause god shewe himselfe enimie againe put cace god mind scourge v sinnes yet shew himselfe bee enimie v end wee fight againste temptation desirousnesse know condemned great combersome temptation god meening therefore see whither wee wyll abide firme stedfast seruice notwithstanding seeme enimie seeing drift beare paciently ye see ought restreyned pleading notwithstanding god shewe himselfe enimie power abilitie v resist hee hath iust reason though bee priuie againe sheweth v partly wherefore wee oughte bee contented smallest tast hee giueth v heerewithall must take warning two similitude namely end wee may learne walke warely also know great neede haue hild vp mainteyned god hand stregthened goodnesse vvhat man god leaueth naturall state doubt hee thynkes himselfe iolly fellow see men sotted ouerweening beare themselues hand theyr owne wisdome strength haue besides able moue mountaynes woorke wonder sayeth scripture beholde broken leafe behold withered herb behold drye stubble say without freshnesse without substantialnesse worsse nothing whatsoeuer glory weene haue blast seeing god setteth mirrours afore v let v looke vppon oure owne feeblenesse learne humble selues rid strip ourselues naked ouerweening men whe challenge thing themselues deceiue themselues wittingly willingly lo howe god commeth foorth telleth v haue v beguiled fond foolish opinion therfore telleth v better grasse cut downe withereth hand without lyfe destitute strength grace thus much concerning poynt iob addeth god holdeth locked vp payre stockes therewithall sayeth also god wryteth bitternesse hym maketh hym possesse sinnes youth thou lockest mee stockes sayeth sayeth god sheweth nothing signes wrath forasmuch sentence oftentymes giuen writing iob hauing eye common phrase country sayeth god writeth bitternesse say chargeth greeuousest crymes could deuised like iudge abhorreth wretched offe der inhaunceth offence goeth shew outrageouse ca punished rigorously according heerevnto iob complayneth god writeth ouerrigorous sentence ynough make man heare stand vp stiffe vpon head addeth reneweth remembrance sinnes youth purpose make possesse doeth making possesse import much say cold stripped clothes must also bee bound like man hys house abrode feeldes hee sort stripped possession euen doest thou lord make keepe possession sinnes say cannot rid cursed vnhappie possession sinnes wrapped cannot get heere iob acknowledgeth god hath iust cause scourge hym yet ceasseth pacience chafe therefore much ought wee stande vpon gard seeing hee singular mirroure pacience neuerthelesse prouoked temptation let v come knowe speaketh sinnes youth two reason one bycause age lustes seene whotest cause also sayd psalme shall yong man order wayes euen keeping thy word vvhy speaking yong folke rather others bycause mannes nature alwayes sinfull wicked doeth cast vp greatest froath hath boyling affection therefore hath neede strongest bridle forsomuch men committe faultes youth iob speaketh precisely ye see also dauid saith lord remember fault youth speaketh expresly age bycause hee knewe hee passed without offending god many wayes greate vnaduisednesse vnruly lust wherewith yong man blinded insomuch thinketh nothing vnpossible stayednesse rule hym withall excesse ouerweening like thing ye see one reason sinnes youth spoken heere second reason iob ment declare god brought sinnes rememberance frame inditement faultes done euer since child complayneth ouergreat rigoure saye lorde though haue erewhyles doone amisse well thou hast bene gracious bryng mee backe reforme thy seruice wherefore doost thou gather beadroll faultes whyche ought haue bene forgotten vvherefore commest thou lay agayne seeing thou hast pardoned meete intangled new agayne yee see whereat iob amed heereby taught god writeth bitterly v say sheweth v signes rigour lothsome sight wee must thinke wee haue gayned aught finding fault wyth wee haue well deserued much poynt must alwayes come backe vntoo furthermore whome long god writeth bitterly v hee vseth accustomed sweetenesse wont vse towards hys whome long say sheweth hymselfe sweete selues god pressing v iudgemente bycause hee seeth well wee haue neede vehement remedie proofe therof easie matter meeken man giuen pride god writeth bitterly v end wee bee vtterly abashed yet meane ceasseth receyue v mercie true hyde himselfe time hee hid hymselfe iob according say heereafter wherefore hydest thou thy face let v marke god hath hid face away season shewe hymselfe graciouse pitifull towardes v yea verely perceyueth meete v true maketh delay letteth v linger payne wil helpe v conuenient season let v marke whensoeuer god wryteth bitterly v assuage miserie within according office put v graue pull v againe abide condemnation haue come god mercie redemption whyche hath purchaced v cause shet meane time haue whereof thanke god hartily somuch wee see beeyng woorthy bee condemned hys hande wee neuerthelesse acquit see howe god allureth v dayly vvhen wee come sermon sheweth v oure sinnes vice hee condemneth v dayly pronounceth many sentence v insomuch cannot open holy scripture shall find condemnation euery leafe side cannot couer vice god shewe v beholde thou hast doone suche saulte beholde thou haste committed sinne see pray lord dealeth hath made v ashamed sinnes hee sheweth v bee mercifull v lord iesus christ sake thus yee see ought make v magnifie hys goodnesse furthermore although hee bryng oure olde sinnes remembraunce agayne lette v assure selues hee doeth v wrong therein nother haue wee cause replye agaynst hym wee haue muche cause blisse hym wee see hee hath forgyuen oure olde sinnes receyueth v still mercie euer state doeth god finde v come moothers womb true naughtinesse v yet perceyued yet haue seede thereof inclosed v cursed already bycause wee come cursed crabbed stocke god pardoneth v originall sinne say sin drayne roote mankynde hathe hee pardoned v sinne forgiueth v sinnes childhoode youth many mo sinnes doeth continually pardon v afterwarde bee come fortie fiftie threescore yeeres age god contented forgiue v sinne haue committed twentie yeeres ago also come hym sinne committed day hee receyueth v mercifull v forasmuch wee see slowe wrath foreward shewe mercie ala ought rauished desire glorifie mercie lo reading thys sentence muste warning v grunt god though nowe hee bee somewhat bitterest roughest towardes v pray hym assuage hys rigoure assuaging may allure v come vnto hym finallye iob addeth whych haue spoken namely god holdeth hym stockes sol feete hee tearmeth rootes hys feete printed hym yee see hym sayeth hee speaketh hymselfe third person rotten tree motheaten garment shall betide thou list pursue rotten tree motheaten garmente vve see yet better spake afore concerning troublednesse iob pacience yet notwithstanding shaken yea shaken fretted chafed god thing see hee complayneth hee set stockes locked vp let v marke much least may fall v haue profited well god schoole holy man therefore may tormented sort affliction oure impacience bewray itselfe although wee haue true desire hold ourselues awe vnder hand god vvherefore let v alwayes haue poynt oure eye namely giue selues bridle aduance ourselues god seemeth passe measure scourging v knoweth wee bee able beare ouerlay v knoweth v able beare therefore let v droope beseech god strengthen v wise infirmity holy spirit may ouercome temptation wherewith possible v bee shaken time let v kneele downe face good god acknowledgement fault praying hym make v perceyue better wee haue doone may sorie therewithall runne vntoo hym hee may receyue v lord iesus christ sake although wee deserue hee shew himselfe dreadfull iudge v yet neuerthelesse wyll shyne vpon v fatherly countenance drawe v vnto yea euen suche wise may haue accesse goodnesse assured trust hee pitie v meane whyle hee suffer v quayle affliction present lyfe wee may fight stoutly vnto end euen till hee haue taken v vp euerlasting rest whych hee hath prepared v heauen may please graunt grace v also people nation c liij sermon first vpon fourtenth chapter man borne vvoman short time filled vvith many trouble commeth vp floure cut fleeth shadovve hath stay thou commest set thine eye vpon one call lavv vvho bring foorth cleane thing vncleannesse much one saw yesterday lawfull v alledge owne frayltie namely way petition may please god haue pitie vpon v deede perceiueth v miserable moueth mercie sayd wee must also beware murmure wee come vntoo god vve must make complaintes allegation oure owne right keepe onward still end hee may haue pitie vpon v iob proceeded way heere ye see purpose holy ghoste setteth downe complayntes iob made namely followe condemned hym text goodly saying tend good end maner altogyther good allowable heere iob speaketh mannes state selfe man sayeth hath shorte transitorie lyfe marke one poynt confirmeth similitude commeth vp floure sayeth cut vp withereth dried vp vanisheth away shadowe hath stay vvee see shortnesse mannes lyfe one floure whiche incontinently withereth shadowe whiche passeth glydeth away yet sayeth life also full trouble vnquietnes small time liue world wee ceasse vexed stinged store hartgreefs haue rest miserable state itselfe good sooth see considering shortnesse lyfe full trouble vnquietnesse haue good cause pray vnto god vse great rigour towards v rather hee beare v wee oppressed measure lo lawfull v iob passeth wherein see excesse condemned behold sayth oughtest thou cast thy looke thy cou tenance vpon poore creature transitorie hath nothing miserie wherefore doest thou bende thy selfe way catch trip fit match thee vvee see iob vnder pretence hys infirmitie would haue shifted god haue plaged fully resolued concluded vpon poynt sheweth v affection torment v ought resist also resisted well howbeit meane whyle ceasseth bewray tossed many euill thought euery one v findeth experience himselfe consequently hee addeth yet one sentence therevpon man myght reply god afflicteth men without cause forsomuchas bee sinner sayeth wee come corrupt euill lump wee pure cleane maruell wee bee full soyle spring issue heere iob speake seeme men ought excused bicause sin nature little ought ease euill much faultie assoone enter worlde wee already enimies god nothing rebellion naughtinesse v nothyng seede sin come wee age mischeefe increaced augmented much one drop goodnesse v let v conclude whereas men say excuse borne full filthinesse ought muche rather cursed reiected god thus see heere yet one faultie affection iob whiche reported v holy ghost end may learne profit selues wee haue considered oure nature forasmuch effect wee haue iobs meening let v marke instruction conteyned sentence sayth man short lyfe yet meane whyle filled many trouble heereby instructed first set mind much vppon world seeing nothing passe away thys common thing yet conceyue well requisite proofe heereof although wee haue three dayes liue heere yet vntangled affection care present life tickle transitorie man neuer thinke hymselfe haue goodes ynough hee desirous come honour deuiseth practizeth side bee short man bottomlesse pit vnsatiable gulfe insomuch cannot bee satisfied goodes earth nother end measure hym cause thereof surely considered shortnesse life lust woulde alayed desire wold headstrong could consider lyfe nothing howbeit meane sharp set vpon gathering rich thinke vppon nothing else cause thereof mind always beneath see confession euery v maketh wit life shadow passeth away hand hypocrisie leasing truth haue printed hart fully resolued superfluouse thing scripture telleth vsso often life nothing vanisheth away hande let v assure ourselues good cause put v minde rememberance forasmuch wee forget neuer tarieth awhit hart thus yee see wee haue consider first place ynough know shortnesse life must go yet greefe v knowe nothing else fade away worlde oure tyme glideth away hope endlesse lyfe otherwise bee myserable vnhappie brute beastes therefore wee must make comparison wyth heauenly lyfe wherevnto god calleth v euery day shuld despize base corruptible thing worlde much tyed agayne wee would aduaunce selues aloft take contentation rest secondly might well alledge god oft desire haue pitie vppon v misery thing perswade succour v prouide necessity thus much concerning infirmitie shortnesse mannes lyfe trouble also set downe vnder woorde iob hathe comprehended passion wherewith turmoyled inordinate lust liking tormenter man cannot haue worse tormenter hymself punishing himselfe owne inordinate passion man bee gyuen vayneglory beholde suche fire kindled hym hee shall thinke wyth hymselfe hee neuer come soone ynough credite estimation insomuch man happen honoure hym ye shall see hym nettled hinder hys aduauncement streitwayes enuieth hym bee short needeth one lust ingender v thousande others wee shall haue matched two thinges togither shall wee haue much cause mislike presente life true haue sayde afore saying straunge world v conuicted experience yet euery one v ought set minde throughly vpon without cause scripture speaketh thereof saying although man come fourscore yeeres vpward wee must esteeme bee long time let v consider childhoode vve lyue good worlde wee bee entered life indeede chilhood wee nother witte reason verely although yong folke haue discretion discerne good euill yet doo ouerflow theyr bankes runne royot settled constancie thus yee fee one part age passeth slippeth away wee haue begonne liue bycause wee knowe good footh man knoweth wherefore god created hath skill perceyue end set world pray speake properly ought sayd lyueth hath confuzed knowledge wee come middle age vvee see care increace man haue regarde hee thinketh haue hithertoo beene rouer haue beene wanton fond anye man may nowe recouer time haue lost bee verye harde afterwarde man haue charge child hee thinketh go shift mee take order state yet shall neuer soone come time shall bee taken away incontinent thus yee see vnquietnesse beginneth martir men man come fiftie yeeres old may sayde deathe seene summon dayly although disease assayle v yet well seene draw neere ende man come fourescore yeeres seene graue hande manner hee alyue wyll greeue man see himselfe vnmeete world hee seeth hee burthen brings many trouble combersome others hee combersome hymselfe therefore nought told v haue earst sayde wee set one yeere worlde wee ought doo hundred agayne wee consider howe oure lyfe misguided put true vse muche standeth v hande bethinke v well suche saying warning witte man borne woman shorte flightfull lyfe better conceyuing shortnesse must also match trouble put cace life farre longer cause haue like well seeing vexed vvhy rather come seeking rest prepared v heauen heerewithall haue marke whence trouble come vpon v witte owne naughtie affection wee troubled folk meane rest ourselues yea verely true rest might well complayne disquietnesse present life free course went owne pace forasmuch euery man hangman himselfe haue sayd already owne lust passion desire cause vnquietnesse incomberance whome whome shall make oure complaint let v learne haue considered well must blame god commence action find fault ourselues finall poynt whervnto must come know shortnesse life bee abashed wee thinke thereof yet better expressed foloweth sayth pure thing cleane commeth vncleannesse filthinesse saying bee admonished misery indure proceede coruption man nature better comprehending doctrine let v note speaking whiche question concerneth god worke creation adam created another manner one day vve falne state wherein god set adam mankinde adam persone adam created image god endewed excellent giftes grace yea vnsubiect death importeth image god perfectnesse rightuousnesse soundnesse wherethrough god vttered great rich effect mirrour excellent glory shyneth fully god sin bereft gift grace banished kingdome god bycause hath forsaken v also destitute life whereof fountayne welspring wherein lyeth fulnesse al good thing god must needes conclude cut wee bee left miserie yea euen death say proceedeth creation wee destitute benefite god giuen v hencefoorth haue bereft sin man mighte moue question seemeth iobs meening cause vnbeleefe sinnes vice v bycause wee come descend adam race come adam concerning body vvhere doth sinne dwell hath proper seate soule shew reason mean soules also come race line adam therefore seemeth iob reasoneth aright haue marke like god created mankind owne image person adam eue also adam sin adam himselfe consequently also ofspring depriued shet grace bin bestowed vpon whereof commeth bycause wee inclosed within persone according god vvee must heere dispute naturall reason knowe whether behoueth v know god giue first father would haue v tooke also ruine confuzion let v haue eye ordinance god let v settle ourselues therevpon let v beleeue wit imagination thus yee see shortly haue beare away true matter might bee dilated large ynough v vnderstande cheefe poynt two three word mind thing conteyned namely maruell though men full vncleannesse nothing filthinesse taken corrupt lump therefore much one otherwise true although iesus christ man yet exempted vncleannesse bycause conceuyed holy ghost god ordeyned peculiarly oure lord iesus christe bee conceyued power aboue end adam vncleannesse might light hym hee bee defiled therewith wee conceiued forasmuch common order man nature subiect said corruption possible find one mortall wight full vnrighteousnesse sauing lord iesus christ let v marke whence come wee haue call rememberance hath bin touched witte wise wee ought alledge vntoo god shortnesse life misery wherevnto subiecte end shuld haue pitie vpon v murmure howbeit therewithall must also mislike owne life haue touched already namely wist well life flightfull bethought v misery wherewyth fraughted pestered wold farre loue wee bee heere ye see good cause ought much waker neuerthelesse behoueth v keepe measure thys behalfe haue bin many heathen whyche haue knowen thing rightly spoken heere haue bin fully perswaded haue bin weery loth liue world yea see haue fordone themselues sawe well misery heere wee must come extremitie vvhat vvhen wee consider life vanisheth away moment let v consider also whence swiftnesse proceedeth witte sinne created end death haue dominion ouer v come vppon v father adam somuch v giltie sinne therefore talke shortnesse life wee must enter acknowledgement originall sinne againe whence come misery hedge v round bycause wee banished god kingdome welfare lieth wee miserable long separated god separated reason sinnes therefore standeth v hande returne always thither vvhen haue learned blame selues sort shal deale murmure god howe say seene men cheefe woorke god among creature shewe muche excellencie dignitie al rest yet vexed troubled beyod measure meaneth verely many heathenish folke haue herevpo taken occasion murmure god say set man vpon scaffold make mockerie gazingstocke notwithstanding hee seeme noblest creature shal haue cosidered misery wherto subiect proceede owne faultinesse bicause wee sinfull shall haue mouthes stopped shall presume murmure god marke one poynte yet ynough vnlesse wee haue eye remedie god hath giuen v doubt shall caried away desperation cannot blaspheme god deede certaine fordoo theselues despite god although knowen theselues blameworthy owne misery yet booted asswagement theyr sorrow heauinesse therfore fall despaire let v haue eye able asswage anguish example first although life miserable yet neuerthelesse god maketh v taste goodnesse many wayes wee may well conclude rightly happy bicause maketh v parttakers benefites life short howbeit short god gyueth v respite ynough knowe bee father sauioure taste power v calleth v vnto shold haue benefite paste quarter houre inioy longer time pray ought make account suche benefite agayne although wee suffer heate colde hunger thirst bee diuerse wayes persecuted besydes inconueniences happen men handes wee haue gulfe within v deede wee haue store temptation come vpon v whiche verely manye incomberances yet notwithstanding god giueth v tast mercie see hee holdeth v vp pleaseth chastise v either giueth v pacience else measureth rigoure alwaies feele goodnesse seing euen trouble vnquietnesse worlde wee haue occasion comforte cheere vp selues god recompence ought suffize v nowe complayne god hath set v worlde haue wee cause rather blisse glorifie lette v marke well standeth v hande beware fall extremitie say vvo worth man better neuer bin borne turmoyled worlde haue foresayde consideration may sure shall come confusion vvhat bee done vve muste ioyne poynts togither say ala present life bee sooner entred wee giue vp ghoste wee tarry heere see nothing eye miserie graue hemmeth v side also better v die one kinde death hande bee assaulted thousande thousand afterward wee haue ouerpassed many incomberances effect wee doo pine away peecemeale therefore wee bethinke v well oure state shall haue good cause mislike worlde bycause inconueniences whiche wee indure proceede owne sinnes though yet doth god meane make v feele goodnesse haue v dismaide ouersorrowed haue whereof reioyce furthermore forasmuche sheweth v wee wayfarer worlde misery shall continue euer shortnesse lyfe ought greeue v rather comfort v howe fantasticall say tushe man life gone turning hande rest vpon poynte fall hartburning say muste wee liue small doth god play mockholyday v say returne agayne mee hand coulde giue v longer lyfe leastwise make v knowe remedie oure life haue one day good tyme life hangeth threed death alwayes betweene teeth behold say poynt whiche altogither settle reste themselues vpon shortnesse ma life let v thinke thus selues vvell god meeneth wee shoulde linger heere foreuer true wee bee subiect many misery much knoweth owne state oughte sigh grone continually long world god hath appointed ende calleth v himselfe good sure reste cace standeth therevpon hauing lyfe equall life length tyme god maketh v partaker owne life endlesse therefore let v good cheere seeing wee haue whereof reioyce shortnesse oure life cause bee pacient cause bee muche quiet hope heauenly life perceiue world nothing wee disquieted vvell may wee sigh matter shall comforted bicause wee bee sure god bring v good end receyuing v intoo euerlasting reste thus yee see wise wee ought marke doctrine purpose fare better furthermore sorasmuch wee see men turmoyled vnquietnesse tormenting themselues owne affection lust haue muche cause bridle fleshly affection v coueteth liue peace vvee well confesse although haue world wil yet notwithstanding wee bee vnquieted oure selues behold greate corzie reste nothing woorth ca confesse wherin lyeth peace hauing eye vpon god resting suche wi e vpon loue hee beareth v namely vpon free loue acknowledge selues alwayes vnhappie till hee receyue v himselfe moreouer traueling towardes kingdome withoute setting hart vpon corruptible thing lo peace men cosisteth steade hereof seemeth make warre god ende rise vp againste v make v feele enemie wee haue faine set vpon v therefore let euery v beware bridle passion affectios come like wilde beastes lift vp selues god muste worse starke mad let v beare well mind sayde cocerning troublesomnesse ma life let v thinke vpo may serue rule correct oure wicked lustes stirre v thrust v forward vnto euill ye see wise wee ought practize lesson receiue good auailable instruction saluation specal vpon poynt sayd man make thing pure cleane commeth vncleannesse filthinesse let v marke well lord ment send v confusion intent haue aught wherof boast onely meere goodnesse requisite men shamed sort bicause blindfold owne eye beare themselues hand much worthinesse vvee see diuell neuer ceassed yet deface coteined holy scripture cocerning corruption haue bin heretiks inough haue borne world hand originall sinne nothing except follow adam owne yet god shoulde altogither preuaile neuerthelesse papacie ther forging free buylding morall vertues reason whereof set downe afore ende tendeth men like well themselues thinke themselues haue goodnesse body dareth saye man able saue himselfe euen papacie confessed wee haue neede god grace onely forgyuing oure sinnes also aiding v holy spirite yet saye commeth papistes confesse say haue certayne portion goodnesse oure selues god neede helpe v reste lo howe god made cohelper say must help infirmitie yet muste wee side companion deuill hath bewitched men hee maketh beleeue bee wote yet wee see also worldwarde men stande greatly owne conceit commeth passe suche haue witte knowledge aduance themselues credite authoritie idol honoure themselues short needeth nothing perswade men greate worthinesse althoughe man tell yet dooth euery man forge frame store
