leazings beguyle himselfe withall flatterings put v besides wee receyue easily may suger v god therfore fayne knocke v harde vpon head greate beetels beate v downe shoulde let v alone wee bee pryde woulde dwell continually v would bow downe necke nother wold bee acknowne dette say cause holy ghost speaketh v vncleannesse whiche v nature dauid one fifteth psalme sayeth hee begotten sinne mother conceyued sinne hee accuseth nother father mother pleadeth gyltie himselfe sayd vncleane god euen byrth howbeit see iob carryed awaye former passion hee applyed thing cleane cotrarie vvherfore sayeth thing commeth vncleannesse cannot pure cleane intent seeke startinghole abate damnation lyeth vpon men cleane cotrariwise see text alledged dauid dauid acknowledged horrible sinne whereby offended god hilde himselfe cotented passed saying ala lorde onely life time haue done amisse haue also brought suche possession sinne byrth euer since borne world haue still increased euil wherof haue seede within thus ye see dauid set originall sinne hys eye hunt pretence cleere god passe codemnation wherin must deale speake originall sinne may bee exempt selues god iudgemente wee see skoffers doo whiche say seeing man ordeyned sinne seeyng hee misframed nature seeyng nothing ignorance seeing hee altogither rebellious agaynste god poore creature doo meete god shoulde vpon condemne v certesse although wee bee wretched yet shifte v rather serueth inhaunce oure euill vvhen sainct paule sayeth naturally child wrath oneth hee cleere men myghte haue good cace godward sinnes might bee layde charge bicause wee haue roote oure owne nature sainct paule meeneth thing sayth end fleshe shoulde bee confounded mouthes stopped god yee see poynte muste come oft speake originall sinne namely muste day day enter examination selues knowe wee haue offended god many wayes wee haue deserued dye therevpon say ala wee haue gathered togither saultes know yet infinite sort beside impossible men shoulde call minde hundreth parte offence haue committed againste god yet besides borne sinne yea soked behold sinner god haue discretion vvhe think v shall haue cause huble selues yeelde glory vnto god vvhe iob saith hee make pure cleane thing come vncleannesse thereby sheweth starke mad whe beare themselues pure cleane let v beare mind respect oure selues remaineth nothing v cofusion decay bicause bee ouerloden sinne vice god might rightly cast v away yet neuerthelesse forsomuch hee chalengeth himselfe office washing clensing v spottes must resort refuge specially bycause hath giuen v lord iesus christ hath al cleannesse god seeing v de filed stayned way ouerlog high v come hath voutsafed giue v suche holines iesus christ wash selues bloud wee shall become pure cleane oure filthinesse vvhen know lump come nothing vncleannesse bothe oure bodyes oure mind let v pray lorde iesus christ voutsafe rince v bloud sheade cleere water vpon v wherof ezechiel speaketh wit holy ghost giuen vnto fulnesse may washed fro day day ende may come purenesse hee hath promised v haue need double clesing one god forgiue fault washing away spottes renew v holy spirite clenze v fro wicked affection lust hath done one day muste faine cotinue life long vntill haue brought v perfection long shew v hoping hath bin nought shall bee disappoynted oure longing conditionally haue wayted requireth let v fall downe presence good god acknowledgeme sinnes praying make v feele may know great neede haue flee mercy whe shal haue made v feele goodnesse middes affliction may desire liue world saue glorify name let v say almighty god oure heauenly father wee acknowledge confesse according truth worthy lift vp eye heauen present selues thee presume farre prayer c liiij sermon second vpon xiiij chapter dayes limited number moneths thee hast thou made ordinance vvhich hee shall passe turne thee avvaye lette bee reste tyll desired day come daye hireling hope tree cut dovvne shall spring agayne impes vvill grovve vp agayne although roote bee vvaxed olde body bee seared deade yet vvill hee spring agayne force vvater vvill hee spred foorth plant man fayle hee dye commeth like vvaters shoulde shrinke sea riuer passe avvay euen men rise agayne till heauen thinke nother doe rise agayne sleepe yesterday wee sawe request iob made reason ficklenesse man life sum whereof asmuch man fraile flightfull creature seemeth reasonable god pursue rigour vtter force haue seene afore declareth life short much miserable men cotinual torment addeth god hath life man hande hath limited tearme whiche cannot bee passed man lyued fewe dayes god hath ordeined yet might say well god displeased therfore cannot abyde little tyme shoulde passe withoute punishing haue doone amisse seeyng hee hath foreordeyned wee shoulde liue pleasure determination seeing hath poynted laste instante life haue v come seeyng saith iob cannot indure man finishe course come dayes ende dooth hireling doth hee handle gently seeyng wee bee troubled vnquietnesse presente lyfe may well sayde like labourer hyred daye looke vppon labouring man see hee toyles himselfe earne peece money dayes woorke ende hee taketh reste hee hath wage euen v oure lyfe long bycause subiecte manye misery wee hope paste wee shall bee quyte discharged deathe bee come wee made ende oure taske haue cause gladde bycause wee come reste thus yee see iobs meaning heerewithall wee muste also beare continually minde hath bene sayde namely heere hee declareth owne passion muste allowe muche god condemneth wherefore wrytten firste ende myght see eue perfectest sort although bee neuer pacient fayle haue greate hardinesse fyghting agaynste passion theyr fleshe god layeth hande vpon vve must thinke iob suche lyke made steele senslesse folke althoughe singular stoutenesse indeuored themselues obey god yet withoute touche breste fayne feeele maruaylous sting theyr fleshe althoughe outstoode temptation gat vpper hande yet stormes tossed fro meane season tolde v end stand vpon garde pray god strengthen v assuring selues although wee neuer good desire honoure yet wee vanquished holdeth v vp hand giueth v strength aboue fight valiantly stedfastnesse besides admonished also hart though wee seeme poynt quayle bee discouraged excellentest men euer haue alwayes bin effeebled tyme howbeit god hath stood wise haue gotten vpper hande battelles god giue suche victorie also call vpon bee foolishe sooth selues owne vice finally let v cosider vse wee ought applie whiche sayde heere namely god hath bounded tyme man lyfe well ende wee might say hee ought leaue v found v get away v iob sayde yesterday seemed vnreasonable god shoulde open eye vpon wretched creature hee ought let men alone bycause bee worthy bee matched strength lette v marke fayre hande shoulde make god shoulde get away v meane shoulde guyde v redresse v wee amisse wee liue one daye without god visitation fall asleepe sinnes much hee spare v long time according wee see men prosperitie know god iudge ouer cannot find hart hild vnder yoke bridled man cannot meanes bring reason seeing rebellious wold god let v alone time life woulde play horse broken looce wold way make v knowe selues wee might returne vnto god therefore behoueth v pray pitie v tame lustes flesh may bee teachable obedient towardes let v marke well excessiue passion iob alledge meete conuenient god let men alone bicause life shorte brittle bicause hee himselfe hathe assigned determinate terme agayne verie requisite god watch ouer v looke narrowly v bycause lyeth v guyde oure owne steppe wee protection pray wold become v pitifull see many deathes wee beseeged god neede haue fatherly care oure life whereas iob desireth god withdrawe himselfe let v pray draw neerer v two sortes first inasmuch behoofe custodie mainteyned bicause liue susteyned power may please make v feele presence know newre hande v aide v succoure v furthermore whiche second point may also please bee neere hande v chastize v hee seeth v farre square true wee ought pray vse gentlenesse towardes v may pressed bee able beare yet therewithall haue also desire lifte vp hande hee seeth wee haue neede correction hee shoulde let v alone ynough rocke v asleepe make v block thus much concerning poynt aboue ought wey well sayde heere namely life man determined god bee hath account oure monethes handes hath sette ordinance whiche cannot bee passed heerevpon wee haue cause take greate comforte life god hande beholde heere cause men fearefull dare stirre one finger trembling seemeth thing thing may befall namely knowe god hath keeping belongeth well take world hath created wee throughly perswaded certaine go pace tormented much ought wee make accounte doctrine conteyned heere witte god hath limited dayes howbeit true must keepe meane behalfe although wee ought warrant oure selues seeing life god hande yet must wee rash cast selues geerishly daunger wee muste walke aduisedly according god commaundeth v fantasticall persones hearing dayes man numbered wee nother lengthen shorten lyfe bycause god hand good pleasure say well come heade one borne hanged shall neuer drowned prouerb sayes among papist yea vnthrifts among v disposed dally god vse woulde god common deede common men know well ynough whome speake ye see despisers god take occasion say wee may shut oure eye passe throughe fire water bycause god hath limited dayes yea intent scripture speaketh saieth god hauing put v world knoweth long ought holde v bee hande behooueth v departe hence whensoeuer shall please according also sayde nintenth psalme wherfore told v intent shold learne put selues god hand say vvell lord seeing thou disposest v thy good pleasure giue v grace lyue dye according thy good may couet liue longer shall please thee also oure lyfe may seeme ouerlong v thou listest hold v heere meane time may serue thee spending time well whiche thou hast giuen v rather short agayne heerevpon lorde seeing thou holdest life thy hande yet haue v knowe terme haste reserued thyne owne knowledge graut v grace walke feare warely thou haste giuen v meanes mainteyne present life thou hast gyuen v meate drinke gyue v grace vse soberly temperance moreouer thou haste gyuen v remedyes wee bee diseased thou wylte haue v wante thing therefore gyue v grace wee maye desire tarrie flightfull lyfe onely serue honoure thee lorde let v walke poyntes thou commaundest v according whiche sayde one nintyeth psalme god wyll sende angelles garde v wee may stumble make false steppe wee walke wayes say wee may playe stray coltes skurrie heere vnthriftes wyll meanes submitte themselues vnto god therefore whensoeuer wee abyde waye hee sheweth v wee garded angel doone wee muste also conceyue good holie hardynesse god wyll haue v enter intoo anye daunger howe vvee see daye state poore christian witte bee sheepe wolues mouthes nowe go aboute excuse oure selues seruing god forbeare confesse oure fayth bycause cannot bee doone withoute ieopardie oure lyfe suppose yee god accept fonde excuse hath life hande let v trust hee keepe v hee good faithfull please wee shall continue shall bee withoute hee giue v strength power thus yee see must applye vse spoken heere otherwise betide v wee see hath done many others shrinke away gyue ouer seruice god bycause shunne crosse vnbeleefe grounde thereof bycause knowe leastwise throughlye perswaded god hath appoynted tearme cannot prolong wee fully resolued poynt certayne wee shoulde bee bolder spende selues standeth vppon honouring god performance oure dutie according becommeth euerye man degree say haue another manner constancie stoutnesse wee haue true must make v rash wise go seeke daungers owne heades withoute aduice whensoeuer neede shall require wee shall sticke go vnto death forsomuch know men whatsoeuer attept practize v able nothing seeing doctrine greatly profite lette v determine beare well minde therevpon conclude according also oure lorde iesus christ telleth v heares head numbered god holdeth v suche wise custodie wee neede feare thing happen vnto v without good pleasure true satan assayeth meanes hee side wee see men make full reckning turne vpside downe seeme woulde confounde heauen earth togither yea haue done theyr vttermost able take away lyfe except god gyue leaue bee willing therewith howe withstand let v looke god commaundeth v let v looke calling dutie beareth doo let euery man imploy himselfe faythfully assuring selues shall finish course yea euen bycause hande god thus ye see haue marke vpon sentence iob hath sayde hee addeth hope tree tree cut may spring agayne specially hee haue nourishmet water hee may forishe freshe like hope man dead past recouery saieth therefore god ought haue pitie po creature heere firste blushe may seeme straunge iob cutteth hope man hee deade seemeth heere remembrance euerlasting life thoughe men soules dyed body let v note firste iob speaketh men hee speaketh passion torment haue seene already therfore hath respect present life according bee pressed miserie minde runnes vpon nothing bee summertime ouerwhot thinke hard frost pleasantest holsomest thing could bee bycause forepossessed passion greeueth tormenteth v forasmuch god hand sore vpon iob none regard get presente peynes hope lyfe come hee minded heere seene men troubled sort aduersitie god doe releeue strengthen true iob canot charged haue cocluded god doth vtterly roote men whe taketh world iob say made finall co clusion yet muste note dazeled passion remembred man continueth still god death hath secret life life hath good seede shall fully restored perfectio farre nowe witte heauenly glory glorious immortalitie iob rememberance settle himselfe therevpon dazeled passion time therefore wee muste looke selues warer saide afore euen rest wordes certainly iob knew well god doth men singular good turne visiteth man asked great honor god doth v wheras stinking carkasses yet voutsafeth caste eye vpon v chastize v haue done amisse father doth child wolde haue answered yes yet able conceyue first brunt hee might haue resisted owne passion fayne bee tormented indure greate distresse muche ought wee receyue aduertyzemente ala lord lyfe short brittle nothing filthinesse corruption v yet thou forgettest v deserue wee thou shouldest regarde v wee worthy thou shouldest visit v ala lorde angelles heauen woorthie shoulde bee worthie rottennesse stinche thou thyne infinite goodnesse arte willing friendly familiar v thou beholdest v pitie wee haue doone amisse steade tying v therevnto thou still pullest v backe thee aiest meanes bring v repentance lorde goodnesse lo howe wee ought speake also bee sayde presente sentence wee maye fare better sithe men haue strength themselues spring shoote forth braunches newe agayne tree doo whiche haue roote earth doo rotte away quite cleane let v acknowledge good god doeth v pleaseth preserue oure life common order nature also keepeth hydden alofte bee manifested agayne tyme conuenient therefore lette v acknowledge bee inestimable priuiledge better vnderstanding lesson lette v marke firste although men bee immortall yet haue theyr owne strength withoute cause sainct paule yeeldeth title immortalitie euerlastingnesse peculiarlie vnto god shall wee saye angelles vvhat shall wee saye men mortall brute beastes certaine feele well god breatheth power oure soules yee see wee haue spirituall life else borrowe although soules come nought ne rotte away body yet notwithstading alienated god farre horrible death vtterly returned nothing state better vtterly foredone beeseparated god feele bee v muste god faine giue v another life hee knit v himselfe grace holy spirite hee may lyue reigne v haue chiefe benefite wherein wee ioy meane god worketh straunge fashion vnknowen mannes reason let v consider state faithfull life world set like state vnbeleuers made muche poore miserable man looke vpon child god shall finde bee afflicted seemeth ought bee cut mankind though worthy lyue vppon earthe thus ye see sort god suffreth dealte withall vvhat done let v come backe sainct paule saith colossian witte deade life lyeth hid lorde iesus christe god shewe due time see goodly similitude iob setteth downe saieth tree fade co ming winter appeereth greenenesse seemeth dead leaues falne tree themselues frostebitten yet life ceasseth lye hid rootes heart vvee see spring time come shootes foorth againe liuelines vnseene time sheweth selfe anewe nowe god shew v tree vtter greater operation towards v excellent creature soothly sainct paule speaketh resurrection reproueth men beastlinesse bicause co sider god doth shewe v naturall figure resurrection growing corne vpon earth looke vpon corne barn drye cast grounde rotteth vve see springeth vp againe one graine commeth vp twentie thirtie ten seeing god reneweth graines bothe wheate corne yea euen rotting hee men vvill vtter farre greater woorke senslesse brutish perceyue manner god worketh confirme v hope life hee hathe promised v much thought sayeth wee see tree whiche winter time deade leastwise seemed deade become freshe greene againe spring time must cofirmed god declareth vnto v namely although life hidden heere shadow death yet hinder v lifte vp heades continuallye looke resurrection hee hath promised v yea euen nowe although wee seeme deade yet haue wee god spirite dwelling v sufficient warrant oure life whensoeuer shall please god take v worlde although body rotte away yet notwithstanding seeyng hee hath printed seale holy spirite oure soules thinke shall perish protector frayltie man lyfe ought stirre v vp magnifie god goodnesse towardes v god wrought order witte hee bringeth v lacke himselfe fayth hee shoulde place v heere little paradise shoulde like angelles power shew selfe v voyde infirmity wee see lyfe might bee like shadowe vanisheth away wee bee walled many misery god shoulde dwel middes v reigne peasably v verely gracious gistes well worthy bee highly esteemed yet shoulde wee meane mistake know whence come wee caryed away vaingloriousnesse nowe god humbleth v manie wayes wee looke vpon present state wee see nothing death yet neuerthelesse parte hee sheweth v maketh v perceyue bothe experience faith aliue yea verely whose lyfe parttakers hee maketh v see glasse sayde immortalitie whiche wayte seeing god hee hath humbled v bringeth v hope spake haue wee cause make much goodnesse vswarde say ala lord thy spirite dwell heere body wormes soules nothing wickednesse yet notwithstanding thou lorde hast chosen body oure soules bee temple thy maiestie thou haste dedicated vse lorde howe greatly wee thy dette much boud vnto thee againe although body heere doo go decay yet wee sure shall bee restored againe sted transitory lodging wee haue dwelling place prepared v heauen therefore ought greeue v droope away little little tyll wee bee quite cleane dispatched seeing wee haue ought stirred praise god wee see howe wee may applie thing oure instruction iob turneth euill vse going expresse pang felt whereagainst fought furthermore wee speake owne state let v marke well one side must cosider wee selues side god able doo power haue saide already requisite men know theselues looke themselues haue told also alredy wit bycause neede pricking forwarde vainegloriousnesse frayle euer bee yet seene parte v ruffile runne riot forget misery ought brydle vvee see eye euery one v shoulde bee infected vice god prouided therefore wee cannot forbeare considering miserie feeblenes oure lyfe wretched thing vvhe know shall haue good cause mislike oure selues call vpon god praye haue pitie vpon v also therewithall muste consider power measure wee hope whiche wee see become vvhat shall become resurrection vvhat shall become euerlasting saluation promised v vvhat shal become heauenly glory likely bodyes rotten shall bee parttakers god glory see oure selues bee frayle muste companion angel paradise specially wee shall bee matched sonne god vvee knowe maiestie soueraintie bothe heauen earth gyuen vnto likely resemble wee shoulde member body partaker al whiche gyuen vntoo enter intoo man reason vvhat bee done lette v acknowledge whiche sainct paule sayeth philippian god rayse v vp power whereby made al thing see whether sainct paule sendeth v hee intendeth strengthen v hope resurrection say friend let v looke whiche possible oure imagination god wyll haue men rest let v enter higher consideration whiche god disposeth thing yea euen aboue vnderstanding insomuch whe wee thinke vpon work astonished without cause worketh woderously insomuch power sayeth whereby made thing transformed glory lorde iesus christ although bodyes nowe weake subiect many necessity yet shall taken heauenly glory thus yee see two thing wee haue consider namely humble oure selues one side haue certayne infallible hope whiche surmounteth capacitie cannot conceyued v case bee heerewithall let v gather whiche iob meeneth heere inasmuch man cannot receyue himselfe renued tree riuer shoulde drye vp water shrinke sea therfore woulde hee plaged god hand long world yea cleane contrarie men destitute bee cannot holde themselues pride excesse starting bound would correction saide afore much god neede abate men pride presumption whiche cannot easily correct selfe forasmuche men lifte vp themselues againste god euery man forget himselfe yea puffed vp hee hath rest case neede chastized haue newe correction day day yea verely god let v rune race life withoute making v feele roddes quicken v vp haue done amisse ala shoulde neuer come time vvhereto tende correction god sendeth v nowadayes call v repentance god tarry till wee deade gate would shut would tyme returning vnto behold sayeth sainct paule acceptable dayes dayes saluation wee bee way god see men go astray rune letthe go till falne downe tubled headlong pit coulde neuer get thing therefore behoueth v reason contrary whiche iob wit seeing life short good cace tree let v put cace bicause whe departed world seemeth perished therfore good god chastize v long liue end call v repentance deathe shall bee time reste lette v doubt haue touched afore iob opinion good men bee visited god although shunne skoffers whiche alledge iobs example shrowding sheete saying beholde holy men haue forgotten hope resurruction chafed god coplayned god pressed ouersore somuche leysure subdue imperfection shall lyke bee lawfull v haue declared already although wee bee pacient bearing god chastyzementes induring quietlye wee ought yet fayle moued haue oure fleshe shewe selfe somewhat rebellious v therefore wee cannot come vntoo god serue wee shall bee assayled pricked side vvee muste styll fighte according apostle sayeth wee shall get victorye fyghting cheefe battell wee haue fighte agaynste oure selues agaynste oure owne vice thing wherein wee muste imploye oure whole force lette v marke whereas iob speaketh heere lyfe man persone withoute regarde resurrection come hee rested wholly vpon poynte hee well foreseene meant expresse passion felt end euery v bethinke himselfe caryed away temptation befall v moreouer iob weakened sort let v assure selues shall weakened much howbeit god whiche assisted like v also power inuincible maynteyne v daye hee calleth v daye euen owne goodnesse abated shoulde make v feele well made seruants old time fele therfore see thing co founded nowadayes world wote say become let v runne good god casting eye vpon oure lorde iesus christ deliuer v misery trouble day world vvell feele selues feeble weake let v looke vpon lord iesus christ power god father see selues good already dead fountaine lyfe come vnto v forsomuch god hath sent v sonne end euen draw v dungeon death assure v beeing vnited vnto ca neuer set beside saluatio prepared v ye see haue eye settled vpon lord iesus christ shall fayle thinke selues safe wel midds death trouble worlde bicause meanes sure shall come heauenly glory wherinto entered v haue finished course whiche wee haue runne subiect many misery let v fall downe presence good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v perceyue better haue done yet notwithstanding sort may become folke forlorne returne remedie desiring bee pitifull v shewe himselfe towardes v hath bin towardes time furthermore seeing hath pleased bee one v persone lorde iesus christ lorde iesus christ hath giuen owne selfe v good gage loue speciallye death passion whiche indured sake hee suffer v forget despize greate benefite rather wee may put oure whole truste meanes stirred vp call vppon oure good god oure necessity misery may please graunte grace onely v also people c lv sermon third vpon xiiij chapter thou vvoldest hide graue thou hadst shut vp till thine anger vvere abated thou vvoldest set time vvherein thinke vpon shall man dead liue agayne dayes battell vvill vvayte till chaunge come thou vvoldest ansvvere vvhen call thee thou vvoldest fauour vvorke thy handes prophet esay shewing howe horrible god wrath howe heauy beare sayeth feele wold faine mountaines shoulde hide wishe myghte fall downe vpon head lord iesus christ also hath vsed selfe word done shewe v must bee dulheaded know thing haue god v true wee shall well ynough feele mischeefe whe persecuteth v cheefe thing wee haue doo standeth v hande wey throughly god wrath vnderstand god hande bethinke selues sinnes therevpon wee bee abashed perceyue full well muste needes perishe except god haue pitie vpon v howbeeit forasmuche shunne feeling lorde exerciseth v make v thoughly awake intendeth shewe v mercie thus yee see gathered iobs woordes sayth thou woldest hide graue hee preferred death life cace bicause wold haue escaped god hand bin possible knew well far terribler matter haue god iudge die hundred time ought touch v neerer make v thinke better vpon sinnes wee haue done end may knowe wee shall haue indured misery worlde nothing comparison appeering god iudgemet seate commeth yeelding vp account sicke little wee cry ala happen v mischance men shall heare v make complaint yet sinnes shall buryed neuer come thought remembrance heereby wee shewe howe vntoward iudging thing therefore oft wee heare whiche haue bin scourged god hand haue desired death hidden graue let v assure selues thing whiche ought feare aboue witte god sheweth himselfe aduersarie agaynste v perswaded greatest daunger befall vnto man wee wyll laboure meanes retourne vnto vvhen oure sinnes come minde ala wee say cace god shew himselfe enemie shall wee doe cace shall wee bee let v preuent matter behold wee shall prouoked seeke vnto god grace shall neuer rest till hee bee one v thus ye see vse wherevnto ought applie lesson wee must marke well howe hee saith would fayue thou baddest hidden graue shut vp vntill sucke tyme cut heere hee sheweth wherefore hee desireth deathe namely bycause hee felt himselfe shutte vp vnder god iudgement could find way scape hereby bee warned startingholes shall serue v purpose ende haue fisked hither thither neuer much must fayne shut vp vve shall haue profited well one day beare lesson mind vvhy although god threaten v neuer much yet seene needeth thing make v beleue able shift according euerie v imagineth one shift insomuch hypocrisie cause god threatnings pierce hart requisite nothing prouoketh god extreeme vengeance hee see wee make none account wrath lo prouoketh extreemely let v learne sayd whensoeuer god listeth pinch v good earnest scaping v neither one meanes must fayne fast shut vp side god giue v respite specially hee shewe v howe wee may obteyne fauour hande let v vse oportunitie sayde immediately woulde thou haddest hidden graue might bee demaunded death token god wrath curse comming thither reliefe vvhat doth boote v verely seemeth bee vttermost extremitie god cannot shewe greater rigour vpon v put v death iob hath conceyued death amisse haue shewed heretofore must beare well minde hee ouerpressed anguish bycause god made feele miserie therevpon bethinketh himselfe might bee rid leastwise sayth wander darke long beare flesh sayth conclusion ende long soule payne tormented haue nothing distresse god taken worlde shoulde haue case woulde ende hee hath sayde afore haue end hireling ye see rest terme ende couenant come thus ye see desireth bee shet vp graue furthermore let v marke hee knewe well ynoughe men ceasse bee vnder god hande dying must fayne iudged feele still iob knewe well ynough meane eye miserie pressed fast tyed therevnto hee thought rest yee see god persecuteth poore sinner hee hath respect say ala must bee enclosed without remedie must miserie encrease perish end bicause god neuer leaue pursuing sinner hath respect thing harde beare cause thought death nothing shoulde serue salue sore maner spake iob desiring couered graue locked vp sayth vntill thou bethinke thee vntill thou set day thereby hee sheweth howe feeling still euen death howbeeit seeming caryed away rauished shall respite take breath inso much shail gone worlde shall confusion harde heauie cace felt haue sayde iob coulde knowe euen death wee haue account make sayth wayte graue vntill thou appoynt time bethinke thy selfe bethinking nothing else god calling creature iudgement iob troubled wit sayde passion turmoyle iudged setled minde ought doo first formost long liue worlde shoulde wee desire god shoulde haue v remembrance forget v shall become v peter sayde get thee away mee lorde wretched sinner yea must go contrarie way worke say lorde come neerer v without thy grace nothing needfull god remember v mainteine preserue v vpholde v haue pitie vpon feeblenesse releeue guide v prouidence ye see god must fayne remember v else state verie miserable nothing ought much afrayd forgotten god lo one poynt although god take v oute worlde yet forgetteth hee v though seeme forget v hee keepeth alwayes hand custodie damned reserued chaynes vntill day executing sentence ye see god doth alwayes beare v minde scripture sayth hath forgotten v bicause perceyue present succor like poore man lingreth paine desire god helpe feele helpe see likelyhod god heareth thus ye see sort sayde hath forgotten v wit ought perceyue yet hee remembreth v continually iob amisse surmize dead forgotten til god cal vp al creature latter day summon iudgement seate iob therefore consider remembrance god towards v well requisite may well see perswaded haue sayde namely god ceasseth think vpon v though leaue v little body rot earth soules abide suspence wayting day wherein world shall repayred moreouer long wee liue let v fully resolued nothing better v haue god thinke vpon v yea euen though punish v god thinke vpon v make v feele fauor therein consisteth ioy glorie according sayde eight psalme ala man god vouchsafe looke vpon watch ouer vve little shadow nothing yet pleaseth god haue fatherly ca e ou life ought wee acknowledge wonderfull goodnesse behalfe wee must highly esteeme sayde mercie god sheweth v minde full v euen make v feele goodnesse sayde although chostice v sinnes yet gracious v thereby sheweth loth perish hee calleth v backe againe seeth v high way destruction chastizings many warning giueth v come repentance ye see ought set store god grace hee mindefull v desire forget v effect wee haue remember concerning sentence ensueth shall n dead liue agayne looke chaunge dayes battell trauell heerein iob sheweth howe sore troubled minde better hee afore hee suche distresse hee wist ende men whether shoulde rayzed againe bee deade truely seemeth straunge first blushe wee muste marke haue sayde afore namelye iob speaketh former temptation whiche hee withstoode great difference betweene beeing vtterly beaten downe temptation betweene feeling beeing shaken yet meane withstande vvhat number euill opinion fancy come heade according wee knowe men receyue many mockeryes satan hande beholde one wicked fancie commeth heade wee greatly distrust god wee shoulde say canst thou tell whither god think vppon thee howe knowest thou whether hee hath giuen thee ouer vvhat wotest thou whither vouchsafe looke towardes mortall men beholde thoughtes men haue euer among make v humble selues forasmuch see selues full vanitie haue much need walke feare god say ala thing ought imploy wit glorifying god beholde part wit occupied suche maner thoughtes yea come outrageous blasphemy heade greatly ought men bee greeued themselues conceyue fancy faithfull doo repulse incontinently assoone diuell go trouble v fashion bee armed god worde fence selues buckler fayth scripture speaketh although diuell cast firie dart v paul sayth yet enter soules woud v poyso perceth deepe v true satan assault v mightily yet sting shall neither deadly infectiue vve shal repulse wicked conceyts assayled sort wholy possessed farre square doubt god prouidence othersome thinke god hath vtterly reiected meanes whereof vtterly vnder foote great difference betwixt fleeting fancie commeth head withstand sure perswasion settleth selfe taketh root v true wee shall haue fought al temptation satan ouercome yet shall come full ende wee must mourne still god bicause wee haue glorified perfitly requisite neuerthelater hee accepteth sted fastnesse resist euil maner see iob hath delt behalf reherseth temptation wherwith assayled yet ouercome verely three degree noted somtimes come fancy minde driue away hande sometymes shall payne distresse wee shall almost tyred say howe shall outweare temptation yet ende satan presseth v therewith god dooth still strengthen v thirde degree wee bee vtterly borne downe ouercome iob onely came first degree haue fleeting fancie aske whether men shall rise againe also hee came seconde step temptation sawe himselfe pressed miserie hee thought himselfe intendeth god mee seemeth hee minded wipe quite away seeing haue hym mine enemie shall become mee iob tormented temptation euill bicause marked howe god agaynst yet ouercome although battell verie sore hard endure yet gat vpper hande thus yee see sort wee must take sentence iob settled opinion beene cursed blasphemie aske whether man shall rise againe surely hee assayled wise yet neuerthelesse hee abode styll beleefe hee conceyued spirite god gaue vpper hande vvee muste therefore charge blasphemie dooing neyther muste wee condemne misbeleefe fayth withoute fighting behoueth hir bee throughly exercized howe done diuels casting many occasion vnbeleefe misbeleefe way thus yee see true tryall fayth iob must bee cast number companie faythfull beeing assaulted also bee noted hee alonely doubt also caryed away bycause pressed god hande iob bene demaunded whether men perish vtterly dying hee woulde haue answered although bodie rot away god rayse againe soule reserued till last day whiche time shall wholy restored iob woulde surely haue answered bin examined death generall forasmuch cace nowe become peculiar bicause god pincheth sore hee woteth become insomuch seemeth god fully determined confounde ouerwhelme euer sore dismayd therat cause doubting therfore let v mark iob eie owne person wit god rigor great likelihood euer get miserie wherin cause sayth shall man dead rise verely hee meeneth death cace god vttereth force bring manne naught hee shoulde say ala lorde seemeth thou art mynded barre mee hope whiche thou haste gyuen v oure rysing agayne seeing thou handlest mee rygorously dooth thys straunge dealing thou vsest towardes mee tende vtter fordooing thou hast fordone make mee vp againe surmising god put ouer time vtterly root number creature cause demau deth whither possible man come life dead bicause god dealeth straugely may seeme hee minded bring vtterly naught hereby warned pray god handle v measurably may alwayes haue hope assure selues miserie shal endure euer god remedie office rayze graues belecue wee must needes fall horrible dispayre dismay v wee see happened vnto iob god hilde vp strong hand ye see also sayd lord chastice howbeeit reason god time vnreasonable worde reason iudgement ieremiement moderate fashion agreeable oure infirmitie bee tempted strongly wee may alwayes perceyue god pitie v ende remedie misery thus ye see wherof bee admonished text demaunded whether man deade shall liue againe touching insueth namely wayte till day chaunging come men expound iob wist god woulde rayze deade hope resurrection renewment hee woulde wayte day must bee taken plainly wit lorde comfort nowe wittes ende see thou vsest nothing force see thou executest thing violence agaynst mee must still fight streyne selfe vttermost haue none comfort waite day change see effect sort iob vnderstoode saying hee rather reasoneth himselfe wyth god whether man shall returne lyfe againe deade hee shoulde say see selfe heere wretched state mine owne seeming must bee vtterly terly confounded meanes recouerie sith god agaynst mee minded bring naught bee sayde yet heerevpon hee inforceth himselfe calleth courage concluding thus yet wayte day chaunge heereby therefore wee perceyue iob gat vpper hande wanne prize battell notwithstanding entered debate whether shoulde rize agayne yet ende sayth beholde wayte day chaunge yea euen time trauell sayd true long time lasteth wishe god shoulde keepe mee shette vp graue hee shoulde caste mee intoo dungeon shoulde cause hilles fall vpon mee yet must tarie leysure still yea euen middes affictions wherein although harde vnable indured yet notwithstanding forasmuche chaunge must suffice giue comfort nourish obedience god see meening iobs word haue good profitable lesson picke saying first whensoeuer wee assayled satan tormented naughtie ymaginations specially commeth distrust leade v dispayre wee must make disputation quickly shortly conclude resolue selues vpon god truth howe haue pleasure intangle themselues lewde imagination come opinion theyr heade yea euen opinion lewde tendeth euen dashing themselues agaynst god heerevpon fall debating imagining whether possible howe fareth therefore heades runne vpon wheeles sort fall chawing vpon bitte hatching lewde opinion cleane contrarie fayth one men fall deuifing state wyth enemy come besiege theyr citie giue eare allowe counsell destruction whole towne set ope gate one euen snarle themselues owne lewde opinion satan putteth theyr heades abyde ende leading destruction vvhat bee done let v followe experience shewed v heere iob verely hee assaulted daungerously doubted whether euer rize seing god brought low hee continued minde ende thing beene hee beene assayled cutteth matter hande sayth tarie day chaunge howe euer speede lo haue namely conclude according god truth also conceyue lewd imagination may turne v fayth way saluation wee must come backe take holde sentence scripture see selues fenced god truth conclusion must wee dispute seeing god hath spoken thus ye see souerein remedie wee haue beate backe satan behalfe wit goeth turne v aside fayth obeying god worde furthermore iob fayth tarie chaunge worde deserueth weyed throughly verely speaketh resurrection therefore meeneth must wholly renued corruption whiche v reason adam sin vtterly done away god receyue v immortalitie kingdom lo chaunge whereof iob speaketh also thing must haue eie vnto without resurrection wee cannot comfort selues neyther wil al euer man alledge sufficient cheere v vvee see also holy scripture directeth faythfull thither purposeth content giue assured settled rest ye sure say seruants god wee bee called bee partaker heauenly glorie god hath promised therefore ye glad howbeeit better assurance last chaunge wee must consider chaunges god maketh day euen course life howe god maketh many alteration v whereby giueth v alreadie taste last chaunge example vve trouble well shet vp vvhen wee looke ende wee see none remedie past recouerie forlorne sodenly god hath pitie vpon v deliuered hand see ye chaunge ought lead v forth vnderstande muche perfecter deliuerance wee perceyue day particularly let v learne acquaint selues well chaunges god maketh dayly wee may bee lifted vp high meanes quiet till time renued kingdome heauen also heere yee see maner dauid hath spoken speaketh chaunges god hand whether rescuing men trouble casting saying great weight though seeme men haue alwayes fonde opinion concerning fortune say see ill fortune befalne mee see good fortune happened mee bee chaunges god hande poynt must wee alwayes bee brought howbeeit among chaunges made worlde liuelyest image last renewment god quickning v holye spirite inlightning v fayth making v newe creature oure lorde iesus christ scripture speaketh let v consider birth men true wee come intoo worlde wee bring remnant god image wherein adam created howbeeit image disfygured bee full vnrightuousnesse nothing blindnesse ignorance minde yee see state men byrth god inlightneth v holy spirite yea euen suche wise wee able beholde farrefoorth expedient transforming v intoo glorie reforming v holy spirite therefore god shall haue chaunged v wee feele dwelling v meanes thereof wee fight agaynst wicked lustes whereas men doo ordinarily delight vice bathe themselues seeke cleane contrarie euill soeuer v mislikes v mourne therewithall follow good altogither desirous giue selues ouer seruing god woonderfull chaunge maner dooings neuer spring selues vvhen wee taste god goodnesse sure fatherly loue towardes v specially haue certentie saluation call vpon father see yee chaunge able shewe howe mightifull god hand men owne nature neuer open mouthes call vppon god truth true may well haue ceremony heathen folke pray vntoo god papistes also doo babble make prayer long ynough nothing bicause bee assured theyr prayer fully perswaded god bee father wee see god willing heare v wee desirous serue honour euen much chaunged v caste v newe agayne mowlde though put v newe againe making doubtlesse naught scripture calleth v new creature oure lorde iesus christ place wee sayde workemanship bicause hee hath created v good woorkes saint paule meeneth god hath created v onely bee mortall men also entent wee good workes therfore god dooth chaunge faythfull one yee see speciall woorke wherein vttereth power aboue nature heere ye see sayde must take holde chaunges haue assured hope resurrection doubt whether god renue v last day must come hath god chaunged v alreadie purpose doth hee put grace v purpose shall haue giuen v courage serue honour purpose also shall haue giuen v spirit adoption assure v hope haue euerlasting glorie purpose chaunge perceyue selues nowe infallible witnesse heauenly glorie see yet hid v god giueth v good ernest pennie according sayde holye ghost ernest pennie pledge bicause effectes holy ghost ydle v rather sheweth openly dwelleth v make v child god soner god child must enforce selues good workes followe ye see wyze faythfull ought practize lesson iob sayeth precizely hee wyll wayte chaunge dayes hys trauell vvhich saying woorthie well marked tossed neuer many trouble ynough vppon good motion affection say nowe must wee trust god nothing vnlesse holde yea euen middes incounters first therefore let v marke hope dayes byrde monethes byrde must continue ende doubtlesse bee fully settled vpon god promise hee holdeth v still ende wee may quayle euerie day haue ouerpassed time wee maye alwayes stablished vntill god haue perfourmed thing whiche yet delayed another time ye see booteth haue good affection haue trusted god except continue throughout iob hath expressed thing plainlyer vnder woorde trauell attell meeneth wee go god ease see well ynough long suffer nothing finde harte liue still worlde prolong life double possible desire god shoulde handle v without greeuing v please v respect obey v desire see howe easily would passe time wee might go owne pace might haue temptation might heauinesse feare suche thing else sayde must giue attendance life long yea euen fighting wordes dayes shewed v time linger seeme long v must take excuse doo euill bee greeued giue ouer mids iourney must continue end vnder woorde battell fighting expressed vnto v state present life wayfarer world must faine fight beseeged side continuall perill bee tempted sometimes care sometimes aduersities sometime daunger therefore let v thinke vpon herewithall let v vnderstande also must fight agaynst lustes owne flesh notwithstanding distress yet must still wayt chaunge thus ye see haue beare away streyne conclusion iob sayeth thou wouldest answere calleth thee thou wouldest accept worke thine owne hande serueth larger declaration matter come treate intent shewe chaunge hath wayted god shoulde gracious worke owne handes surely expounde present streyn god would beare worke hand constreyned therfore meening nothing else wil quietly abide god leysure til shew effect accept creature cause sayeth answere whensoeuer thou callest iob protesteth shun god shrinke backe hee calleth readie come yea euen cheerfull courage knoweth god shewe pitifull towardes thus ye see thing haue marke streyne effect euen mids trouble seemeth god sore displeased v shall come attonement yea recken v number creature come passe yet neuerthelesse must fight agaynst dispayre vntill haue gotten much hope chaunge wayt see text ought prouoke v bee good comfort aduersities pray god strengthen v power although tossed fro many stormes yet may ceasse kepe way still towards make doubt comming thither howsoeuer worlde go although seeme haue cast v angrie v yet returne vnto cal vpon answere v stablish hope welfare making v feele loue beareth v wee may bee throughly persuaded doubt let v fall downe presence good god acknowledgement fault praying make v feele maye bee meane prouoke v returne vntoo true repentance may prosper therein till hee haue taken v misery worlde gather v kingdome shall inioy euerlasting rest full whereof nowe giueth v taste holy ghost may please graunt grace onely vnto v also c lvj sermon fourth vpon xiiij chapter sermon conteyneth rest exposition xv verse text followeth novv thou recknest steppe makest delay vpon sinne misdeede sealed bundell thou hast added mine iniquitie mountayne perisheth infalling dovvne rocke vvasteth vvaters consume stone thou destroyest earth vvith floudes vvaters thou takest avvay hope man miserie thou vtterest thy force ouercome thou couerest face sendest avvay knovveth vvhither sonnes exalted vvhither oppressed distressed flesh mourneth long vpon soule sorrovv wee sawe yesterday wise wee may answere god say wyse wee maye come freely vntoo namely knowing hee loueth v hee accepteth v woorke hande long wee knowe whither god misliketh v must needes afrayd shun presence much possible ye see cace wretched creature haue tast god goodnesse trust might comfort themselues therefore let v marke well behoueth v persuaded god loue towardes v thereby may conceyue trust may present selues vnto well assured soueraigne welfare answere say hyde selues sight bee alwayes willing guided hand desire nothing vnder hande direction way haue consider wordes woorke thine handes thing wherein wee may settle oure trust acceptable god hee hath created v must wee pretende bee loued god hande desertes owne bycause hee see wee workemanship true wee woorkemanship alreadie wee bee men yet wit hath fashioned v new owne image grace lorde iesus christ vvhen holy ghost teacheth v pray vnto god setteth wordes afore v lorde thy workemanship maner said esay likewise fourescoure fiftenth psalme vve thy flocke work thy handes textes lorde thou wilt despise woorke thine handes thou wilt forsake thou hast begunne without finishing yee see whereof ought take occasion trust god agreeable vntoo come vntoo sure readie receyue v euen bicause creature hath formed v cast away thing commeth himselfe marke one poynt howbeeit sayde wee must looke onely first creation hope shall haue thereby verie slender bicause god image blotted oute v adam sinne forasmuch god owne infinite mercie hath renued v adopted v bee child lorde iesus christ imprinted image agayne v therein wee bee woorekmanshippe maye come heades vpright call vpon assure selues hee shake v wee shall bee welcome therefore let v marke well streyne according profitablenesse thereof men wretched cace know whether god doo loue muste needes bee afrayde fearefulnesse must needes cause ingender rebelliousnesse shun god eschue hand much striue agaynst ye see men wilde beastes cannot submit themselues vntoo god vntill time know loueth contrarie side wee knowe god fauoreth v wee bold approch vnto yea euen answere say yeeld ourselues simply take good worth whatsoeuer hee doth dispozeth v yea although hee scourge v torment v put v distresse yet must wee still flee vnto hath care saluation bring v therevnto shall done desertes bicause god woont poure grace vpon v bicause beholden good thing haue thus ye see wee acknowledge selues alreadie bounde exceedingly vnto god yet notwithstanding still increase grace v vntill haue brought v full perfection may doubt wil performe al hath begon v lo effect haue beare minde concerning streyne therevpon iob entereth againe intoo complaintes maruell though although god child comfort themselues middes sorowes set eies thing may giue good hope yet cannot tossed trouble haue indured one battell must bee faine enter second third see minde iob tooke sentence haue seene resolue himselfe might come freely vnto god reason bicause god accepteth worke owne handes beholde assayled new againe thou numbrest steppe sayth delayest sinne text thou keepest sinne worde keepe signifieth watch wayte vpon effect iobs meening god iudgement presseth excessiuely howbeit speaketh man wel ease mind certaine god alwayes slow wrath himselfe telleth v wee selues see vvhich v perceyueth god vseth great long sufferance towards v haue offended hee hastie punish v become v see god doth well ynough keepe sinnes say put vp punishe rigorously haue deserued vvherefore iob complayneth bicause felt himselfe shet vp suche anguish able indure looketh rightly vnto god neither able iudge aright trouble hee complayneth according hys greefe hereby see bee heddie affection cannot iudge god work setled minde therefore maruell though moste tymes glorifie god requisite ought doo passion doo carrie v away god doo v good yet hee content v like vnsatiable gulfes wee thinke doth v little hee ought doo euery thing wee woulde haue againe hee chastize v tender pitie see fall murmuring thinke rigorous although hee handle v gentle fashion yet cannot deeme cause owne outrageous affection ye see howe god glorified handes ought bicause blinded affection flesh trouble v wise cannot haue moderate sure iudgement much ought wee fight agaynst temptation beat backe ende may acknowledge god handleth v iustice equitie doings faultlesse according reason ende wee may conceyue thing affection must bee thrust downe kept prisoner fell iob deeme amisse god iudgements see hath done betide v haue profited hundred parte hee notwithstanding iob somewhat borne withal bicause god haue sayde heeretofore handled extraordinarie fashion bee well considered greater condemnation discontented god though haue wayted long pacience howe beholde man hath committed many offence whome god hath long spared forced ende feele correction otherwise hee woulde still keepe owne race therefore god punisheth nowe soone bee touched hande wee fall cry ala lamenting thoughe ouerrigorous towardes v yet notwithstanding wee cannot denie hee hath delt gently louingly v deferring punishment due v hee punish one sinne haue committed hundred send v correction surely shall light comparison haue deserued wee iobs cace god pressed v yea knew wherefore made v feele sinnes haue sene minded set v vpon scaffolde example others afflicted v without shewing v howe sore woulde euery v bee greeued disquieted oft god visiteth v wyth roddes let v looke homewarde thinke well vpon sinnes consider wee haue long time afore deserued god shew v rigor whereas haue bin borne withall touched first day let v acknowledge selues beholding therfore proceeded infinit mercie present afflicting v bicause wee haue copelled prouoking much sin short wee haue abused goodnesse grace wherethrough bore forbore v long time togither thus ye see haue note furthermore let v quarell god though put vp sin thing man haue euill lurking purged euill become vncureable whereas might well remedied delayed long vve see commeth shun phisicke vvhen inconuenience comming vpon v foreseene refuze take purgation preuent mischief forslow prouide till growne full past time deale disease haue gotten vpper hande strong feuer come vpon man disease bee taken let alone ye see swelleth rankleth ynough make partie lose lymme yea whole bodie kindle burning feuer shall meanes heale euen v god put vp sinnes silence euen ranckling increase payne hee come purge v would late god sheweth v great fauor clenseth v sinnes according knoweth bee meete welfare therefore wee haue cause complaine rather glorifie hath care v specially taryeth till aske thing profite preuenteth v correcting couert disease within v thus much concerning streyne nowe iob addeth sinne sealed vp god hath added misdoings worde adde taken sense many men expound wit god make iobs iniquity greater like cruell man woont light pardonable fault committed maketh heynous vnpardonable crime thys saying god added iobs misdeedes shoulde bee ment god make greater heynous deede text sheweth tendeth another ende new thing specially iob psalmes see repetition verie ordinarie matter hebrew tung let v looke content verse iob borroweth similitude namely god hath bound vp sinnes bundle locked vp togither chest set seale shoulde say nothing shoulde escape therevnto addeth god hath layd good weyght vpon like zacharie ment god shetteth vp men sinnes sayde god layeth masse leade vpon vessell wherein hee hath shet vp vessell hee layeth masse leade vppon shoulde get iob continueth heere similitude hee set downe saying god hath sealed vp sinnes entent nothing shoulde escape shoulde bee much one poynt left expresse hee sayth god hath added good counterpeyse weight nothing bee drawne away misdeedes must abyde god come account bee iudged condemned nowe wee see plaine meening sentence verely iob occasion speake bicause haue sayde hee pressed extraordinarie fashion god custome handle men roughly iob therefore occasion make complaint yet must alwayes come backe haue touched namely hee forced excessiue passion therefore hilde measure certaine god listed haue punished rigour could haue founde exceeding great sinnes haue made feele farre greater chastizement considereth god woont men thervpon maketh complaint side haue first consider wee bee farre perfection iob therefore whensoeuer lorde punisheth oure sinnes let v assure selues chastize v one two three foure yea great number mo let euery v call account haue well examined life shall find gulf sin v shall euery man bee faine confesse ashamed let men summon themselues let search little life godward vve hipocrites dullard ashamed selues good ouerwhelmed confusion cace sith god condemneth v say suffer sinnes doth v wrong ala ought know letteth slip great sort sinnes yea euen part desirous punish v rigorously giueth v occasion bethink v sinnes leysure sory aske forgiuenesse thus ye see haue marke sentence herewithall let v marke also iob acknowledged owne sinnes entet think ment iustifie himselfe heretofore doth shamelesse person thinke themselues without spot yea god det iob went way worke iustified haue tolde alreadie sort namely acknowledging god yet iob dooth put himselfe intoo aray sinner hee knoweth well god finde faultes ynough neuerthelater greeueth god shoulde handle excessiue vnaccustomed rigor hereby must wee take warning looke god doth vnto men thing oftentimes driueth v impacience murmuring vvee see god punisheth seeming haue offended greatly wee yea beholde say wee god beareth one see hee compared togither woulde bee founde hath offended therevpon conclude god keepeth euen hand vprightnesse hee ought ashamed blasph eme yet ceasse repyne say dealing vvherfore dooth god punishe mee sinnes meane see letteth others alone better looke vppon neighbour shall finde faultie selfe yet see god handleth rigorously doth thus ye see howe men greeued heart looke heere fonde fashion passe selues euery man ought shet eye looke god doth vnto folkes let content v rightuous hee handle mee rigorously take bee offender selfe well hee knoweth good expedient mee hee hath reason hidde mee behoueth mee bee contented wyth hys therevpon submit selfe simply vnto furthermore wee bee greatly blame also wee take vppon v iudge oure neighbour wee inhaunce faultes lessen owne although wee knowe tenth part faultes haue committed yet wee ouer sharpe sighted marke beare awaye men doo yea whiche worse although thing bee good yet malicious wee ceasse condemne therefore let v forbeare maner condemnings whensoeuer shall please god handle v rigorously let v assure selues hee hath iust cause doo although vnknowne v nowe thus ye see wee haue remember sentence immediately iob addeth mountayne goeth decay rockes melt water bolloweth stone man miserie destroyed god specially god vtter force agaynst men opinion iob dooth heere compare death mountaynes rockes stone say mountaynes consume doo rockes death endureth euer death keepeth still strength liuelinesse vvhat ment construction ouerforced men may perceyue othersome thinke iob weary lingring long therevpon hee sayeth howe nowe cannot see mine ende desire death death commeth mountayne might vndermyned whyle rocke might droppe downe wee see rockes fall intoo deepe sea stone needed water eate hollowe see sea ouerflowe bankes marreth whole countrey come great rage water maketh suche hauocke neyther feeld lande cattell house thing else remayneth vnturned vp poore frayle creature sturdie mountaynes yet al cannot die verely exposition meetely conuenient draweth nie true naturall meening howbeeit iob ment simplie mountaynes consume god vseth violence towardes according must needes great force shall consume mountaynes rockes beholde iob ment vvho lorde sayth thou seest nothing weakenesse mee yet howe doest thou chastice thou neededst touch thy little finger yea thou neededst come neere mee giue puffe beholde vndone god looke vpon v angrie countenance looke nothing death destruction god needeth arme himselfe gard himselfe great power ouercome silie creature lesse tha nothing therfore vse great violence though hee woulde thunder vpon mountaynes though hee ment ouerturne rock cliue asunder scatter stone reason dooing thus ye see iob ment say must always remember iob speaketh man right wit man considereth thing ought doo might mind reason flingeth bound agaynst god sheweth maner hee bin tossed shaken resisted temptation haue sayd afore bicause felt vehemet temptation reason vexation torment howbeeit withstood grace god perceiue god plague v cannot shall troubled looke vpon others augmenting owne miserie much must bridle affection therwithal resort vnto god may please restreyne lustes suffer v time ouershoote selues moreouer intendeth humble v therevpon giueth v bridle wise cannot refraine chafing afflicteth v may please graunt v grace resist fight still suffer v ide murmuring chafe still vpon bit may maister selues apparat working holy spirit may subdue flesh hold selues true subiection may dispose v glorifie doings thus ye see haue beare away first place sentence rest sayeth man miserable hath store misery cannot well expressed meeneth conclude thereby god ought pursue men sore way let v looke little vpon hardnesse v god afflicteth v though beaten neuer much seene euer whit softer bowe neckes winneth v become teachable obedient ala see god may make complaynt dayes made prophet esays time shall sayth soale foote crowne heade whole part people god wearie bicause chastized people muche assayde bring amendment vvell yee see heere people beaten double beaten forwo e wyth plague warres famine generally particularly finally become like wretched lepres rotte owne affliction yet styll stubburne stubburne euer afore yee see lorde dealeth behalfe father seeth amendmente hys child greeued hart notwithstandyng al correction vseth yet child altogither stubborne vnreformable therefore hee maketh moane saying ala thing haue lost labour euen doth god complayne people see much selues day let v marke although miserable haue many default v yet ceasse wee therefore still hard harted stubborne yea respect blind pride feerce presumptuousnesse v respect rebellion wilfull stubbornnesse thing exceede mountaines rockes notwithstading little shadow smoke therefore let v thinke strage god vtter force correcting v respecteth infirmitie v wilfull hardhartednesse wherethrough wee would withstand mountaynes high let v looke little vpon hart man ther trayterousnesse v could find hart mount aboue cloudes yea atteyne god throne plucke although wee bee wretched carions yet notwithstanding suche malapertnesse v wee would controll god work cannot finde harte submit selues vntoo say well lorde hold thou soueraigntie ouer thy creature let none grudge thee put god stint euery turne thing fashion liking fall checking hym agayne hee giue v leaue list holde v short say must strayte bondage seemeth god mynded set purpose trouble men heere without hauing regard state sith appoynteth v liue heere bilow suffreth v haue leastwise nature desireth else gaue v another inclination see diuelish pryde men moreouer v malicious wilfulnesse god labour bring v backe hee able compasse teachable side euer turne v booteth wee haue alwayes sayde ouerstatelinesse pride hart although haue played hypocrite little whyle lette man turne hand shall finde poyson hidden vnderneath returne afore vve see hardhartednesse hath neede bee corrected straunge fashion thys lorde speaketh ieremie complayneth people vnreformable howbeeit vnder another similitude prophete esay dooth haue alledged afore comparison god maketh fitte matter hande god sayeth people like cake baked one side vnbaked example let v put cace man make hote fire harth burning sparckling well one take cake layes vpon cake baketh scorcheth one side soft paste still euen v one part nothing frailtie according seene men say well ynough ala men nothing wretchednesse miserie vve speake truely saying howbeit god visiteth v chastizeth v doo wee shewe bake vnder correction nay wee rather burne bake say god shall win one good amendment chastizings sendeth rather fall chafing stomaking withall kindle fire wrath vengeance yee see whereas god would haue v well baked rather burne lo hee vseth violence chastizing v let v go complayne god thunder vpon mountaynes reason see shall mend cace vvhat shall win pleading shall bee next way increace damnation let v assure selues seeing god findeth suche wilfull hardhartednesse v hee muste needes set strong hande v vse fauourable meanes good thus ye see haue marke thys streyne lette v bee sure god chastizeth v strike boystously vpon v would vpon mountayne rocke commeth mercie wee see greatly requisite god vse roughnesse say regardeth welfare howsoeuer worlde go say euen sendeth v seemeth haue brought v euen vnto hell yet doth hee gyue v wherewith comfort cheere vp selues wee must thanke fatherly mercie acknowledge wonderfull gracious goodnesse god vseth towardes v steade iust thundering downe vpon v hee sheweth himselfe gentle freendly seeketh nothing make v feele goodnesse thus yee see effect wee haue marke streyne immediately iob addeth god vttereth force farre hee euen chaungeth countenance frowneth vpon hym hee knoweth heyres shall ee whither poore riche noble v oble iob goeth hys complaynte sheweth god shall haue punished men life long theyr ende also shall bee sutable therevntoo bee departed worlde shall haue intelligence done heere afterwarde addeth conclusion long fleshe vpon must needes payned hys soule muste bee sorowfull hee hymselfe must mourne surely thys complaynte voyde vnthankfulnesse iob ought knowe god doth alwayes mingle fauor affliction hee sendeth v haue cause blisse hym considered vvhy bycause ouerpassionate sorowfull also wee must beare mynd haue sayd afore witte oft god scourgeth v must bethynke v benefites wee haue receyued hym help asswage greefe wee muze vpon nothing miserie wee indure wee ouerraught sorrowe wee blisse god call vpon settle trust hym looke way thinke selues god hathe done v thus many good turnes hold still sorrowes asswaged therewithall also recouer boldnesse ro call vppon god herevpon conclude behooueth v pacient ynough hath shewed himselfe good father correcting v owne hande bycause hee tendereth oure welfare yee see thing haue marke first place iobs rushing suche rage bycause hee looked misery therfore behooueth v bethinke v god benefites afflicteth v ende sorrow may assuaged sweetned thereby wee doo wee shall finde god sendeth v suche griefe neither bodie mynd alwayes matter gladnesse howe although wee bee subiecte manye disease colde heate suche suffering yet haue shifte approching vnto god power vtter oure infirmity vnto recompence oughte well assuage sorrowes haue coceyued vve see wise may resist suche maner complayntes whiche full vnthankfulnesse namely thinking vppon benefites haue receyued god hand former time thervpon trusting cotinue time come verily muste warned long lyfe lasteth wee must bee faine grone fleshe greeued must fayne lamente ende desire liue ease would wish god hath told v wil haue v troubled presente lyfe bothe bodie mynde therefore behoueth v make full rcckening let v marke euen middes sorrowes wee shall haue wherfore praise god paule doth calleth miserable vvretched man sayth deliuer mee prison bodie yeldeth thankes god lorde iesus christe concerning iob sayeth man departed knoweth done lowe whether ofspryng poore riche grounde article oure faith vpon suche gone world know state iob spake man ouercombered therefore wee must take certayntie doctrine neither greately v inquire suche matter let suffize v god hath sette v worlde communicate one euery man ought imploy vpon neyghbors god hath giuen suche gifte abilitie therefore must applie selfe waye agayne one v may pray another hath taken v world said comunicating taken awaye v communicating neither must doe papist wont run deceassed saincts thoughe yet finished course nowe forasmuche scripture teacheth v wee ought behalfe let v leaue thing doubt suspence whereof wee haue certaine resolution woorde god singlenesse mynde also thing wherin behooueth v walke touching text wee see effecte iobs meening nothing else man myserable long lyfe indureth sayth full payne anguishe death extremest misery bycause seemeth bee vtterly rooted iob spake maner bycause haue sayd caryed away passion part let v contented languish haue fleshe payned mynde distressed lyfe yet haue wee whereof reioyce god bycause promiseth alwayes father sauiour doe wee die vvee knowe aduauntage paule sayeth bicause mean god taketh v misery world make v partaker rich glorious immortalitie let v knele downe presence good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v feele wee maye craue forgiuenesse hand may stirred vp pray may make v feele goodnesse mercie wee profit thereby also tyme f ur life may giue ouer selues glorifying holy name praysing hym deserueth hath broughte v right waye neuer suffer v swarue aside may continue inuincible strength stedfastnesse euen ende may please grant grace v c lvij sermon fyrst vpon xv chapter eliphas themanite ansvvered sayd vvill vvise man bring foorth knovvledge vvinde fill mennes belly vvith east vvynde vvill reason vnmeete matter vnlavvfull vvordes thou pullest avvay feare turnest prayer avvay god thine ovvne mouth shall reproue thee vnrightuousnesse thou haste taken toung craftynesse thine ovvne mouth shall condemne thee thine ovvne lippes beare witnesse thee art thou first man borne vvart thou created mountaynes haste thou heard secretes god vvisedome restrained vnto thee vvhat knovvest thou vve knovve vvhat vnderstandest thou v vve baldheaded auncient older man among v thy father wee knowe wee haue spoken truth god behalfe yet men reiect wee haue sayd harde greeuous temptation cace onely blamed person also wee see men refuse thing god neuerthelesse behoued iob vndertake battell see streyne mainteyned hys cace suttletie wilfulnesse ignorance yet notwithstanding layd dish hee taken tung craftinesse despizers god saying bin winde wherein bin firmnesse reason iob therefore greeuously charged heere maynteyning doctrine knew god must serue example day many greeued see men receyue god word rather moste part worlde condemneth seeing men haue time bin stubborne god hee could neuer yet make receyue theyr behoofe let v thinke straunge wee also muste passe way authoritie god hys woord imbaced stubbornesse malice men considering iudgemet awke cannot giue themselues goodnesse haue charge beare god word preach though see men reiect yet let stand stoutly let doings thrust way iob condemned saying sonne god also vvee see men farre accepting doctrine rise vp furiously accused blasphemie like done day noueltie meane whyle let v determine god commaundeth v let men aduaunce themselues much list lette resist god truth yet must ouerpassed must ceasse duetie marke one poynt way behoueth v marke although wordes whiche rehearsed heere eliphas haue bin misapplyed persone iob yet neuerthelesse generalitie wee may gather good profitable lesson first sayd wyse wil bring foorth windie word fill bearer belly easterne wind thing see commonly scripture wit word ought vnprofitable rather well seasoned salte according sainct paule vseth similitude afterwarde expresse meening sayeth word ought bee substantiall meete edifie profit heare may bee instructed feare god guyded aright way incouraged yee see vpon saying eliphassis haue marke word ought tend edification shall lyke wynde say shall bee puffed vp vayne swelling shal bee substantialnesse wherewith feede men soules truely eere ye see sayd good holy doctrine foode taking conuenient foode wee bee satisfied gather strength stomacke accloyed insueth good naturall nurrishment euen wyth word god vvhen well applyed vse filled wee bee nurrished yet meane windinesse breakes vp vpon stomacke brings substantiall nurrishmet see two point haue note first men find fauour word wee haue told thing good profitable god must therefore pacience considering hath happened iob also seruants god doctrine fauour worldward mocked taken winde trifling thing contrariwise side let v well aduised speake may edifying neighbour carie substantiall profite euen oure ordinarie common talke must obserue rule although wee haue libertie yet notwithstanding god condemneth vanitie v bee giuen prattle vnprofitable matter neuerthelesse wee see men haue hold themselues nother make mirth except raunge intoo windye word men greatly giuen vntoo warrant say therfore lawful god findeth fault see therefore let v hold v doctrine alledged paule talke muste vnprofitable seasoned salt may edifie profite hearer aboue cace standeth vpon handling god woord must neerely looked without comparison cace let v haue regard vse sobrietie wee defile thing god hath ordeyned oure saluation certayne speake god woorde dally rayse vnprofitable question vayne disputation high treason god wherfore lorde hath shewed v word ought profit v fall handling suche sorte apply right lauf ende play tennisbal passe good instruction haue oure eares filled wynde serueth satisfie mennes vayne curiositie defiling holye thing greate wrong dishonour godward thing serueth saluation despized thruste vnder foote lette v looke neerely oure selues deale holy thing let suche reuerence good substantiall instruction may alwayes insue say maye settle v soules may nourished behooueth v marke well similitude wynde eliphas vseth heere haue sayd alreadie doctrine bee good suche substantialnesse wee shall bee fedde wee shall fynde good reste vppon contrarywyse purpose curiosity true good store winde gay shewes great likeyhodes yet ende disappoynte v heere ye see sainct paule sayeth knowledge selfe dooth puffe men vp matched loue loue edifieth heare god word owne instruction talke instruction others wee couet counted skilfull foolish vaingloriousnesse desire euery v esteemed sharpwitted thought well seene scripture else wind puffednesse sainct paule sayeth lo diuinitie men haue forged framed themselues owne vaynegloriousnesse like wee see papacie men call diuinitie nothing else blast easterne wynde seareth thing hath substance feede nourish poore soules withall man mighte make generall distinction two poynts one parte popish diuinitie consisteth question quarels bring frute first trouble themselues dayes life cannot finde resolution mynde seeke god neuer discloze yea haue hidden still v nowe wee knowe hath spoken hee haue oure mouthes kept shet eares itch listen wee bee ignorant teacheth v thus ye see true wisedome desire know god sheweth v schoole ye see also popish diuines moue question thing whych god would haue vnknowne vnto v well debate neuer conclude reason guess put cace possible haue certayne resolution say thus yet shall man neuer edified profited beeyng resolued whiche debate theyr schooles disputing whither bee saued god mercie shew forasmuch sure forgiuenesse sinnes wee ought haue muche greater cause prayse magnifye hys goodnesse towardes v telling comforte ought take oure aduersities talke flittering ayre men least good counted greatest skill fellowes alone bee contemplatiue say sore aire haue steddinesse thus ye see shamefull defiling god worde although papacie doctrine wicked fully false selfe yet neuerthelesse manner veine haue found bee abhorred meanes haue peruerted true aud naturall vse god word sayd afore let v beare well mynde thing serue puffe men vp eare vp soules steade feeding gyuing good nourishment substance ought vtterly cast away seconde part popish diuinitie stablish freedome men make beleeue haue power atteyne vntoo good atteyne fully yet bee helper companion god grace hath preuented lift vp themselues suche wise owne strength good deseruings may proceede thereof haue done grace god shall fayle shoulde saye able bind side bee able purchace fauour god hande owne workes bee anye default may supplye satisfaction papist doo thus teach men able themselues puffing vp presumption ouerweening mighte aduaunce themselues god sooth themselues owne strength though able worke wonder marke poynt much hurtfull vnprofitable questioning touched afore verely bee greatly misliked yet muche greater harme latter men trust themselues flatter themselues owne strength nexte way ouerthrow quite deadly poyson simple puffing vp also diuelish pride serueth send wretched soules destruction meane wee see popishe diuinitie winde serueth puffe vp wretched soules giue nourishment vvhat bee done let v learne vse edifying talke suche may feede seelie soules may taught feare god withall know nothing selues must fayne drawe fountayne vprightnesse iustice god must faine make v partaker grace without shall voyde goodnesse vvhen doctrine set foorth serue edifie shall nourished battled moreouer let v indeuer also draw neighbour like nourishment wee may fed god truth substantiall foode must edifie v full thus yee see haue remember effect concerning thys sentence streyght another declaration wee ought marke well eliphas sheweth wherefore hee likeneth fond doctrine blasting wind thou takest away feare withdrawest prayer god true second word vseth signifieth sometimes muzing minding bethinking yet commonly taken prayer supplication doubt eliphas ment heere note two principall part edifying wee haue receyue good doctrine marke god ameth setteth word afore v hold v awe make v walke feare obedience also make v put whole trust hym call vppon seeing wee bee destitute spirite wisedome rightuousnesse power life marke twoo poyntes wee haue obserue wee intende shoote right marke come point whyche god calleth v vntoo true wee shall heare many thing god woorde handled afore v haue sayde commeth two poyntes eliphas therefore intending conclude iobs learning winde puffeth vp swelleth stomacke sayeth taketh away feare withdraweth prayer god say turned aside feare god minded call vpon flee vnto goodnesse winde make v burst nourish v may better see edification speaketh oftentimes sayd paul al must done edifying edifying taught feare god stablished secondly bee taught call vppon warned seeke welfare alone according also place shall find touching feare importeth much life must bee ruled according wil god becommeth men whe knowe themselues bee subiect theyr maker rush naughtinesse vve know lustes feare god reigne v must acknowledge hath put v worlde liue libertie list selues reserueth hys whole right ouer v must obey hym behold say word teare importeth say learne direct whole life god vve haue law whereby guideth v sheweth v discerne betweene good euill excepte wee bee vtterly confounded wee must begin poynt yet v feare god saue gouernance holy spirit voyde goodnesse giuen nothing euil lay god law lyues men shall find deadly battell betwixt betweene fire water yea euen whole nature thyng contrarye god rightuousnesse affection flesh sainct paule sayeth eyght romanes enimyes vntoo god seeyng cace must come praying forsomuch wee drawe wholly vntoo euill yea wholly carried awaye rapted vntoo furie wee muste beseeche god lay hande vppon v guide v make hys holye spirite rule ouer v suche wyse wee may freely single hart sticke vntoo hys rightuousnesse vntoo euer hee calleth v vnto also hee suffer temptation satan vvorlde turne v dooing good may please hym forgyue v oure faultes bee alwayes mercifull louing towardes v thus ye see prayer ought bee ioyned feare god ynough v shewed ought god requireth hand duetie must also bee incouraged go haue whole recourse vnto hym seeke thing wanteth selues ende may releeue neede remedie cheefe phisition haue well borne away text wee shall haue profited greatly one day vve come oftentimes sermon vve wander bring two point gyue diligent hearing wherfore come thither know god requireth oure hads ought walke beast world god alloweth none rule men obey frame themselues according hys deuotions men deuise starke folie according wee see howe wretched papist torment themselues sore end one thing gaine doings theyr owne deuices lawe god good buried among let v beware beguile selues let comming vnto sermon atteine certeintie wherein may fayle vvhiche thing come passe admit nothing el god wil rule gouerne whole life howbeit haue purpose men beate eares preaching say behold thus muste yee behold thus doth god commaund vntill time haue learned printeth lawe hart ingraueth bowel giueth v power sticke hys commaundements holy spirite giueth force effectualnesse doctrine goodnesse accepteth v forgiueth v sinnes say purpose till haue learned thing bene taught resort vnto demaund hande whatsoeuer wee haue neede ynough v haue told v thus thus must ye sayd god must fayne giue v strength performe shall craue hand furthermore wee bee admonished faith edified aduersitie always ingendreth v desire prayse god resort vnto vvhen tolde v lorde iesus christe hath reconciled v god father shed bloud wash v wee might pure cleane hath payde price raunsome wee might quit rightuousnesse become acceptable god vse mercie towardes v knowing thing say end throughly cleaue vnto say well may bee saued meere grace god asmuch lord iesus christ hath made satisfaction v end faith shoulde rest therevpon must therfore lie still asleepe must awake may repaire vnto god say welfare death passion lorde iesus christe therefore must seeke shall finde among men must wee seeke prayer supplication let v come vnto god say lord sith thou seest v voyde goodnesse fill thou v thy grace true wretched sinner howbeit asmuch wee bee member thy sonnes body wee shall bee made rightuous hym true full spottes hee hath wherewith clenze v hee hath good washing v true wee bee giltie euerlasting death bound therevntoo lorde iesus christ hath set v free vvherefore lorde bee good v make v partaker thing purchaced v thine infinite goodnesse beholde manner ought haue recourse vnto god lette v say yea lorde fill thou v thy holy spirite hee may leade v strength suffer v faynt temptation befall v thus yee see effect wee haue marke thys streyne
