eliphas doth afterwarde vpbrayd iob hath chozen tung craftinesse present saying importeth hee doth mocke god whiche bereft feare reuerence haue reason sometimes men shall sinne simplicitie yet stande feare god howbeit shall dulled time according wee shall see many touched liuely sorte little better brute beastes yet notwithstanding shall feare god lie hidden whych good choked wel manner folke haue simplicitie craftinesse malice othersome thinke themselues sharpwitted scoffe religion dally god maiestie take vnmeasurable libertie follow euill set purpose ye see craftie suttle folke whome eliphas maketh mention thys streyne amisse ignorance ouersight suche wilfully set purpose make none account god handling hys woord contemptuously make sport stage play behold toppe iniquitie lette v marke well god let men runne farre vpon brydle shew themselues suttlewitted hym hath satan taken suche possession right harde bring backe againe right way yea manner impossible wee see also wise prophet esay thundereth suche kinde folke saying cursed make lurkingholes vseth similitude inspeaking suttleheaded folke beare themselues hand beguile god vvhen haue sharpened wittes inuented fine slightes beholde strayning themselues abolish feare god mark wherat begin bridled say one word scripture thing must yeeld vnto without gaynesaying thing many thing vnderstoode againe man may doubt thing v compelled yeeld suche authoritie god word may lawfull v aske cace standeth politike head therefore desirous worke wyles god begin poynte namely taking leaue keepe men seeing thing men call god word end mouthes tungtied might raze quite cleane whe entred doubt afterwarde harden themselues good reason god shoulde leaue satan cary headlong bee come poynt nothing else bleare tung al doctrine greefe remorse conscience short bee bereft humanitie become brutish thus yee see sayde impossible whome god hath left poynt euer returne way saluation therefore let v beware hold oure selues streytly subiection vnto god beare suche reuerence worde wee may shunne vtterly abhorre detest slightes suttleties wherein wicked sort delight welter themselues think themselues sharpwitted ynough till haue despized god also fantastical fleeing heades seene thinke themselues dullard estimation till haue learned mocke god rid themselues quite religion hearken say behold god speaketh obeyed vve see many dayes thinke ouergreat simplenesse submit man selfe willingly vnto god meane shake feare god confuzion come therefore behoueth v ware set muche store simplicitie god requireth v verely minde haue v dulheaded fayth papistes imagine namely men shoulde go lyke go ings vvhen papistes say men must lyue simply simplicitie meane men shoulde discerne betweene white blacke know ought holde follow god sayd wil haue v ignorant must bee child lewdnesse vnderstanding sainct peter sayth wee must learne god fetch light brightnesse holy spirite worde liue lewdly desire fed foode simplicitie vprightnesse milke like god handled child manner olde time haue foode set v day also way haue note god seruants must bee ready armed agaynst suche stumbling blockes men cast teeth despize god theyr whole drift bring confuzion adayes papistes shamelesse vpbrayde v wee seeke nothing bring men fleshly libertie might honestie among men anye man passe serue god exercise himselfe brotherly charitie vvell layd charge charge alone vve see iob assayled wyth lyke temptation therefore let v beare pacience may shew god worlde men v wrong charging v wyth euill well may wee answer haue eye frame selues god sheweth giue attentiue eare sayth v furthermore wee chalenge knowledge thing haue learned schoole may continue onely worde ynough beate backe slaunders enimies truth lay vpon v herewithal let v turne men away trust themselues whereas commaunded serue god purely end put whole trust vnderstande howe wee ought whatsoeuer seemeth good selues turne aside eyther right hande left simply respect folow whatsoeuer god commaundeth v ye see ought pure afore god also haue good report among men walke aright wicked folke slaunder v must beare paciently yet knowe bee impudent shamelesse eliphas hauing spoken addeth iob ought trust much wit art thou first man sayth wart thou borne mountaynes heere auncient gray healed men yea euen elder thy father art thou counsell god vvhen eliphas vpbraydeth iob fashion old ynough ought take vpon libertie iudging verely hath colour saying haue sene afore god gracious vnto man let liue long time heere may well haue learned many thing againe knowe men wit better settled age yong men cast foorthe manye bubble age represseth bee presumed old man forasmuch hath profited liuing long world ought perfecter haue certayne skill men yet thys see stead profiting long life part go backward men might oftentimes theyr age atteine good knowledge vnderstanding yea vnto wisedome howbeit forasmuch naturally go euill worse god vphold v therefore seene part men become fooles age youth marke one poynt againe also trusting owne agednesse respect god wisedome hee dealeth foorth pleaseth yong old according sayeth prophet ioell beholde dayes shall come poure spirit vpon flesh olde men sayeth hee shall dreame dreames say shall bee prophet teach sonnes daughter shall see vision place see god calleth well yong olde well woman men receyuing wisedome sendeth worlde must glory age throwne downe old folke haue liued neuer long haue neuer much experience behoueth know yet foloweth must needes know secretes kingdome heauen hand god men must presume know reason long time true god call v childhood ought confirmed age thing bringeth working god grace euery whit proceedeth therefore haue cause stande owne conceyte brag thing hand heerein see dotage papist ground al foundation faith vpon antiquitie saying see sir doctrine new start vp yesterday yeare twain ago world hath liued long time wee bee possessio purpose afore god cace standeth vpon hauing euerlasting truth whiche hath bene making world must go god lord iesus christ haue sure resting stocke faith leane vnto matter concerneth score yeeres foure hundred thousand wee muste haue euerlasting truth hath bin disclozed v making world wee haue oure fayth shall well settled want vanitie wee shall alwayes bee mammering needeth one little blast wind behold faith quite blowne downe let v beare mind antiquitie muste beare suche sway v yong folke may vtterly refuse ruled elder specially go turne whyche haue learned concerning one god truth lo wee haue marke heere withall haue liued long time world let glory age say ought take folkes trip rather knowe muche bound vnto god giuing meanes occasios settled stayed furthermore let father wisedome vpon god pride cast downe imagine themselues haue gotten knowledge eyther length tyme finenesse witte owne forecast great experience thing el bycause hath pleased god poure spirit vpon v might know greatly wee beholden vntoo let yong men also side knowe god haue giuen gift grace bycause leaue destitute spirite old folke haue liued long time inte deth shew making v partaker selfesame grace spirite also make v heyres heauenly kingdome come euerlasting glory hath reuealed vnto v already part let v kneele downe presence good god acknowledgement faultes praying hym make v feele may flee alone partie able remedie harmes seeke wise wee may bee hilde prisoner vnder obedience desire thing sticke purely simply word renouncing soeuer owne nature bycause nothing corruption frowardnesse also praying renew v wise holy spirite likeshapen image may haue much better certentie proofe taketh v child also may yeelde thanks agayne father may please graunt grace v also people c lviij sermon second vpon xv chapter sermon yet still vpon viij ix x verse vpon followeth seeme god comfortes small thing vnto thee straunge vntoo thee vvhy thy hart rauished vvhy thyne eye make signe thou bucklest thy selfe god vtterest vvordes thy mouth hym vvhat man hee bee cleane borne vvoman shoulde rightuouse behold findeth stedfastnesse saincts nother heauens cleane sight hovv much man abhominable filthie vvho drinketh iniquitie vvater sawe yesterday reproche offered vnto iob respect age therevpon saide good reason yong folke ruled counsell elder giue eare suche haue experience reason log vse also forasmuch god hath giuen old men grace liue long ought consider bound teach others shew way yet yong old ought knowe true wisdome god giueth aboue god dealeth foorth wise thinketh good men must imagine bounde vnto hath promised poure spirit vpon greate small listeth end may knowen bee free gift praise ought giuen alone heere agayne eliphas vpbraydeth iob hath heard god secretes poynteth men generall behoueth v vnderstande rudenesse weakenesse owne witte true meane reuerence god secret knowing incomprehensible high v attaine vnto long men presume vpon owne wit thinke atteyne heighth god secret certayne cannot humbled brought anye modestie ye see poynt whereto must come must reuerence honour god secret seeing haue capacitie coprehend much haue acknowledge infirmitie crie euery one dauid lorde high thy determination ought reuerence yee see effect eliphas ment saying vnto iob heard secret god doctrine often repeted common holy scripture bycause hard abate pride naturally rooted men onely euery one v take vpon bee wiser hys fellowe also cannot finde hart acknowledge oure owne slendernesse humble selues euen come god therefore haue neede brought low warned scripture doth must go comprehend purpose god high profound thing v vvhat remayneth honour acknowledging owne rawnesse weakenesse sayd afore way wee muste come whiche sainct paule sayeth first corinthian wit sauiour hath giuen v owne spirit whereby know comprehend aboue capacitie although counsell god yet hath shewed v fauour honour disclose vnto v vnknowne hidden v none knoweth man spirit whiche dwelleth sayeth paule spirit dwelleth god giuen vnto v thus ye see made partaker thing vtterly separated v wherevnto wee cannot anye meanes approch marke heere singular grace whych ought make great account namely lorde hath inlightened v euen v wretched blynde soules although comprehend thing heere bylow yet wee lifted vp aboue heauens thing reueled knowne v whiche angells wonder see ye inestimable honoure howbeit sainct paule sayeth done god giuing spirite v hee excludeth hys word god intendeth disclose secretes sendeth v inspiration also speaketh vntoo v neuerthelesse without cause paule imputeth thing spirit may well reade heare shall profit awhit except god open minde wee may vnderstande hee telleth v word mouth therefore wee must match spirit word togither say must beleeue lord hath layd foorth treasure infinite wisedome vnto v giuing v law teaching v hys prophetes specially gospell side let v also consider opening oure eye intent thing conteyned holy scripture strange language v intent wee shoulde acquaynt ourselues therewith owne wit neuer atteine wee see men must humble themselues knowing well god counsell therfore ought honour secretes furthermore forasmuch hath pleased god make v priuie hys let v conceyue hys meening according hee sheweth vnto v yet must ouerwise god giueth v spirite shewe v thing hidden v passe reach ma reason ende know must hold ourselues contented knowe part yet sayeth sainct paule therefore let v beware passe boundes let v discreetly seeke god would haue v know shall finde holy scripture let v go furthermore although vnderstand tenth part thing holy scripture let v pray god discouer dayly thing whiche hidden v yet therewithall let v walke vnder subiection rash runne farre behoueth euen forwardest perfectest men vnderstand yet know secretes god reserued til latter day surely without cause dauid though excellent prophet crieth god determination wonderfull thing heereby sheweth v impossible v atteyne perfection vnderstanding vntill god haue bereft v mortall flesh let v assure ourselues long wee worlde wee way thus yee see wee haue remember streyne nowe eliphas addeth weenest thou god comfortings small thing secrete thee strange thee woorde secrete betokeneth straunge eliphas meeneth heere reproue iob pride vnthankefulnesse hee sayth howe nowe seemeth thou despisest consolation god thou thinkest straunge comfort thee man point surely ouer great pryde yea despyzing god grace whych bee borne withall ought esteeme god comfortings aboue thing troubled shifte remedie v except god bring v backe againe right way let v marke well combered perplexitie bee oure wit ende matter wee dispatch selues nother shifte v god pacifie v content v meane must make great account aboue thing whe bee greatest trouble whole worlde god well inlighten wittes bring v quietnesse neede god shew selfe rid trouble heauen earth ye would say confouded togither ther nothing confusion ouer yet please god appeare vnto v hee set thing order againe sort thing greatly intangled could shall become cleere wee shall see nothing trouble vexe v lo cause haue commend god comfortings consisteth deede worde flee god refuge maye well perceiue howe great force comfortes bee strength haue appeaze v wee haue leaste comberance world behold vexation distresse according knowe men giuen vnquietnesse soone haue neuer light occasion greefe seemeth selues kindle fire torment selues withall vttermost see pray state men long god leaueth sleepe trouble perceiue dayly howe god bringeth v backe verely seemeth oure selues shall neuer scape perplexitie therefore astonished say ala shall become vvee bee drowned deepe wee thinke shall neuer able get confusion yet notwithstanding god setteth suche order wee bee vtterly abasshed mynds quiet appeazed vvhereof commeth alteration bycause god worketh mightily heartes ende magnifie comfortes exceedingly although wee bee conuinced experience none onely god comfort v perplexity anguish pleaseth doe wee haue well wherewith content selues yet notwithstanding forget turning hande greefe befall v none v hee feedeth humour chafing vpon brydle talke repayring vnto god say howe nowe beholde thy god hath shewed thee heretofore thou must repaire yet notwithstanding thou thinkest much must marke well sentence wit men make account god comforte bee deliuered thereby anguishe perplexitie trouble mynde bee vnthankfull besides vnthankfulnesse haue also shamefull pryde perceyue owne necessitie might seeke remedie pryde expressed yet better worde secrete eliphas sayth secrete thee say wretched creature feelest thou thyne owne frayltie surely men knewe themselues bee deede needes fall agreement god bee inflamed suche desire thereof would neuer bee rest vntill god made feele grace wee bee blockishe weene oure selues bee wise whereas nothing foolishnesse vanitie v vve thinke selues haue remedie miserie sleeues wee happen combred trouble fall sharpning wit must need deuising shift would say al matter could forged owne shop yet men ouerweening therefore sayde heere secrete thee perceyued grosse ignorant doltishe surely would suche fooles surmise wee haue wherewith deliuer selues anguish trouble would goe streyght wayes vnto god beeing well assured onely set thing stay according perceiue verie deede himselfe sheweth well ynough thus much therefore concerning sentence according haue sayde alreadie let v put vre much life subiect many misery impossible man haue one minute rest himselfe without carrying away without forgetting himselfe let v go god may comfort v let v make account warning giueth v deserue god comforteth v diuers wayes haue sayde alreadie declareth trouble whereout seemed neuer get dispatcheth wise perceiue hee hathe deliuered v nowe let v come eliphas addeth hee sayth iobs heart caried away hee maketh signe eye lifte vp himselfe god eliphas reproueth iobs pride wrongfully without cause according haue sayde alreadie although matter misapplyed iob himselfe yet may wee gather profitable lesson one serueth turnes therfore sayth howe thy hart rauished hath surprised thee worde worde thus howe bathe thy heart seazed thee howe thou makest countenance thine eye pleade god make signe countenance eye bee scornefull nothing else leere men say turne away eares men tell v thing wee knowe men doe regarde thing spoken take superfluous matter nothing could alledged knowen afore short see eliphas ment condemne suche pryde iob though hee humbled himselfe vnto god hearken sayde vnto heerewithall sheweth pride yll grounded sayth iobs heart rauished certeine pryde alwayes one vice men therefore much lord seeth men stand owne conceit wexe hard pryde hee fayne shewe fooles vtterly witlesse presuming muche themselues beating themselues hande haue whereof vaunt haue apparance likelyhoode abilitie yee shall see v lifted vp high hold v wee stye farre till wee ready breake necke lord perceyuing v wholy giuen puffed vp presumption asketh v yee vvhat haue yee open shop let men see men come suche tryall would soone perceiued nothing folish weening euer imagined thus ye see haue gather vpon text sayde men open mouth god pretend vaunt themselues humble themselues becometh proceedeth frentikenesse well setled wittes neuer little knowledge discretion certayne would humbled goe withstand god sorte presume vpon thing themselues considering haue thing condemnation must fayne abide confounded owne shame behold heere excellent sentence haue skill apply well oure owne instruction vvhat bee done let v learne knowe oure selues according olde prouerbe shall humbed shall vaunt ourselues men refreyne start boundes cause runne head wee doe yea euen casting selues suche ouerweening god fayne fall vpon v enemie proud hard v rauished caried away stand vpon selues causeth blind haue vertue vprightnesse wisedome bycause prysoners themselues say bycause bleare yees blinde themselues wilfully guide himselfe marke god commaundeth shall fynd ynough humble himselfe withall stop owne eye wilfully wee needes bee deceyued wittingly men carie themselues away sorte must needes giue god slip regarde thing sheweth rather make mocke tolde end must fall confusion let v come principall poynt hitherto eliphas hath vsed preface shewe nothing hindered iob make owne profite warning hee heard puffed vp pryde vnthankefull vnto god nowe hee addeth man hee bee able iustifye himselfe god bee found pure cleane god findeth stedfastnesse saint say angel nother heauens cleane sight shall become stinking abbominable corrupt man drinketh inquitie water like fishe fed water n soked sinne wickednesse shall take hande iustifie themselues god first formost neede cleaner purer angelles neede surmoung brightnesse sunne starres seeing heauens themselues infected god comparison made betwene hath bene treated part already heeretofore howbeit repeated without cause haue wee neede call mynde thing haue bene fayde afore notable lesson one minded often first behoueth v knowe sorte angel haue stedfastnesse god haue expounded diuels reason thing say diuels rightuous therefore must men take vpon vve knowe diuell prince iniquitie naughtinesse expresse mention made angel ye see howe place termed saint holy one god according also holie scripture yeeldeth title oftentimes calleth elect chozen angel let v consider sort god findeth stedfastnesse onely bycause haue constancie cotinue goodnesse vnlesse god preserued power bycause verie truth haue sound exquisite rightuousnesse might rest themselues vpon commeth poynt presenting themselues afore god render account point say shall found angel howe see haue none desire obey god nother subiect euill lustes wee bee temptation thrust way desire god bee doone earth heauen wee meene thereby obedience angel yelde vnto god without impeachment vnperfecte feeble thing desire doe good go limpingly tenth parte giuen seruing god requisite howe doe vnderstande god findeth stedfastnesse angel say able answere haue tolde afore iudging v god vseth measure hath set law wit loue heart mynd strength thus yee see meane rightuousnesse wherewith god contenteth cace concerneth iudging angel men eue according rightuousnesse faultie boast yelding vp whole affection vnto god haue bene drawne away wicked lust ala farre atteyning poynt much bee way thitherward yee see men condemned god euen respect mean rightuousnesse yee see also sainte paule alledgeth sentence cursed hee fulfilleth thinges conteyned law saith sentence condemneth v angelles acceptable god respect rightuousnesse bycause blemishe spotte desire set wholly seruing honoring god giue themselues nothing else according rightuousnesse law god accepteth said afore another higher rightuousnesse god surmounteth creature muche angell able satisfie wonder comparison betweene infinite thing thing hath boundes behold although angel haue great glory yet creature god infinit thing much thinke vpon wee ought rauished astonishment let v thinke strange god rightuousnesse high creature come poynt bee found shall nothing shall deserue vtterly wiped therefore saide god findeth stedfastnesse angel say hee listed vse sayd extreme examination towarde angelles must needes vanishe away must needes bee cast downe sunken howbeit much god contented bee honored serued according rule hee hath giuen v lawe stand face hee auoweth ryghtuouse deede tryed bee two diuers thinges namely god hath ryghtuousnesse hath measured capacitie yet commeth rigour say hee hath atteyned see come god shall condemned accursed farre vnable stande vpright angel heauen confounded bycause verie heauens selues cleane whereas god hath created sunne giue light worlde giuen brightnesse starres also followeth therefore haue diuine perfection vve must remember hath bene sayd afore namely creature god made keepe still markes grace man woulde compare creature god hee shall fynde one nothing thus yee see howe heauens cleane saye alwayes imperfection creature haue power stand god respect infinite glorie sayde seeing cace shall become men haue touched alreadie namely although god would examine v mean rightuousnesse hath set forth lawe yet v found giltie vniuersall damnation lie vpon mankind vnder lie ouerthrowne short behold howe men confuted two wayes come god head vpright goe iustifie selues confusion must needes appeere muche shall rightuouser angel heauen see creature able holde commeth creator creator must need swallow vp glorie make thing vanish seemed aught worth yea seemeth wonderfull according sayd sunne shall giue light moone shall bee darkned bycause glorie god shall shine farre brighter prophet esayes intent doe v witte whensoeuer god speaketh forth glorie euer creature must vanish away though hath bene neuer highly esteemed afore sunne senslesse creature doe darken light starres day long although abyde still skie yet seene whyle sunne shineth shall maiestie god doe creature able approch neere vnto one creature excell another shall god himselfe doe thus ye see confuted one wise presume vpo rightuousnesse come god foolish ouerweening thinking god ought bee bounde vnto v wee able bring worthinesse vnto though rightuouser angelles heauen purer cleaner verye heauens yet nothing surmise selues haue marke one poynt howe bee let v goe perfect rightuousnesse let v come onely meane rightuousnesse god hath set vnto v let v looke may creature requireth nothing wee loue heart al mynd al strength man say reasonable yet vvhervnto giue mynds set wholly vpo god loozened earthly bandes may lift themselues vp heauen doe wee lead heere sprituall life forsaking thing may turne v away god meete matter stande onely vpon praying vnto god let v take example scripture sheweth v man commeth praye vnto god hee must retire himselfe discharge mynd caces passion like thing may hinder wee must vtterly ouerthrowne feeling owne wretchednesse wee may seeke helpe god hande lo howe prayer thing greater prerogatiue rest life yet come praying see ourselues fleshly wee haue eye many wicked fancy wee quite cleane leaue although haue good mind praying yet misse drawn stil diuers way seing fugitiue holy thing prayer wil rest whole life deed euery one v ought perceiue well ynough foule shame must told thing men know throughly theselues sith cace standeth ala able stand god shall stand nowe vpon iustifying rightuousnesse true iob went suche thing eliphas wrong iniurie accusing pride way must profit ourselues lesson consider aduisedly sayd men charged frailtie papistes selues easily confesse weake therefore sufficiente ryghtuousnesse v satisfye god wee bee led heere witte men altogither saped sinne demaunded sentence howe men iustifye themselues sith able fulfill lawe bewrapped many imperfection loden many infirmity inconstant fleeting suche termes whiche might spoken men without comming poynt sayd men cannot iustify themselues bycause abhominable filthy drinke iniquitie water say proper nurrishment sinne muche one droppe goodnesse founde short lyke body draweth sustenance meate drinke also men haue none stuffe sinne corrupted verie substance men terme oure bodyes soules euill thing wee bee god workmanship cace speake grossely expresse euer v attaynted euill verely bodyes good creature god likewise soules peruerted whereas god created soules good notwithstanding infected euill one droppe goodnesse stained vtterly imbaced thus yee see effect shewed v first wee haue note great difference betwixt weaknesse corruption sayd men weake papist prattle heathen men haue sayd full much hee sayth paynim haue sayde men inconstant hard thing followe vertue inclined vice paynim say knewe well inough papistes themselues confesse daye yet knowe truth much one droppe goodnesse men abhominable god vntill hee haue reclaymed grace howe ende men presume vpon thing themselues holie ghost calleth abhominable stinking fylthy noughtworth behold also howe sayde psalme god looked downe heauen see one rightuous man hee founde one gone way become abhominable stinking true stead stinking haue translated vnprofitable meaning wee bee withered away nothing left v thing vtterly corrupted sayd expresly psalme god knewe men bycause men would alwayes bee owne iudges purpose forsooth wee wold haue god tied fancy bicause think selues men sufficient abilitie would god content himselfe oure opinion contrarie part sayde let men iustifie themselues liste let euerye man cratch fellowes itch let sooth one another naughtinesse lette playe drunken sottes yet shall god leaue hys looking downe heauen shall fynde stinch lothlinesse vve lothsome god yet meane thinke ourselues haue maruellous stuffe v gayne oft tempted pride statelinesse thinke wee haue apparance vertue v let come oure mynde summon selues god let v bethinke v dreadfull saying god hath looked downe hee hath examined men throughly one euen one hut hee infected stinking lothely sight thus ye see sentence vnderstood whereas sayde wee drinke iniquitie water serueth yet better expresse whole life giuen euill fish feedeth vpon water men doe nothing else feede vpon sinne verely wee ought blame god euill v adam created corruption spoken purchaced god found thing good made man therefore excellentest creature marred fashion till withdrawne selfe god separated fountaine rightuousnesse could remain vnto naughtinesse corruption thus see whence naughtinesse proceedeth ought blame god vice wherevnto subiect vnder hild prisoner according scripture sayth wee sold vnder sinne become bondslaues satan vve must blame god wee must learne knowe heritage haue father adam therefore must take whole blame ourselues god lo wise must vnderstand corruption bondage sinne spoken make serue excuse say ala withall wee see doe blaspheme god say seeing men giuen euill haue power withstande temptation ought acquit god condemne therevpon hee cruell yee shall see men blaspheme sort therefore let v keepe oure mouthes shut assuring oure selues euill resteth selues wee vtterly soked wickednesse wee bee iustifyed god houeth v yeeld ourselues giltie owne accorde otherwise sayd one fyfteth psalme muste euermore bee accomplyshed namely god shall alwayes bee founde ryghtuous iudging thoughe wee fall checking yet shall continue alwayes rightuous yea euen confusion desirous iustified god one onely meane doe come confesse nothing horrible confusion v haue much one drop goodnesse therefore let v desire god receiue v mercie make v rightuous lord iesus christes sake say wash away filthynesse bloude sonne impute rightuousnesse vnto v truth wee clothed garmentes wee shall acceptable good god bycause shall haue perfect angelicall rightuousnesse v let v fall presence good god acknowledgement oure saultes praying reach v hande wee may continue trouble shame although haue walke many temptation yet wee may bee destitute hys ayde succor comforting strengthening v wee maye get victorie incounters may haue cause yeld thankes according working v wee may stablished time come euen till wee haue obteyned full victorie come glorie heauen shall triumphe lord iesus christ may please graunt grace c lix sermon third vpon fiftenth chapter vvill tell thee heare haue seene vvill declare vnto thee vvhat vvise men haue told receiued father haue concealed vvhom alone land vvas giuen stranger passed vvicked alvvayes vvere trauell childe number yeres hid outrageous noise feare eares vvhen peace behold destroyer shal come vpon beleeueth get darknesse shall see svvorde yesterday sawe plight man hee god fauour wit ther nothing confusion filthinesse farre hee beeing able haue anye rightuousnesse maye stande god nowe meane haue consider god great goodnesse towardes v clothing v rightuousnesse surmounteth ryghtuousnesse aungels vvee bee wretched miserable sinner yet notwithstanding god maketh v ryghtuouse excellent precious maner angel respect nature onely otherwise partaker glory iesus christ bycause common head christes rightuousnesse giuen vnto v farre excelleth rightuousnesse angel heerein wee haue cause magnifie goodnesse god meane season let v come matter eliphas pursueth heere treateth thing true selfe rightly applyed witte wicked neuer haue rest suche vnquiethesse neede none hangman torment themselues heerevpon concludeth amisse iob wicked man although hee astonished greefes yet notwithstanding hath bene sayde already hee ceassed trust still god doctrine therefore said good holy must bee applyed accordingly cause tolde reading holy scripture wee must alwayes pray god giue v skill discretion perceiue end tendeth drift wee may fare better shall bee shewed v wee shall goe continually backward god driue v forward ende may take profit conteyned let v followe processe eliphassis wordes heere mee saith rell thee haue seene hee speaketh owne experience afterward hee addeth doctrine receiued hilde manner among wise men whome god hath giuen grace able rule well selues also haue gouernment realmes country addeth hild peaceably passing stranger say without man vsurping whiche god put handes verely whensoeuer god indueth men excellent gift must dispise consider sprite god dwelleth skornefull refuse tell v iniurie thereof redoundeth mortall wight liuing god thereafter god vttereth gracious giftes haue v also receiue oure common profite eliphas therefore hath good colour pretence alledge authoritie ruled realmes country yet inough except knowe god speaketh performance thereof ought trust authoritie men true god commaundeth v bee teachable bee stubborneharted harde yeeld obedience knowe thing told v true ye see howe authoritie men ought bee receiued fall turning truth vpside downe conuerting falshood reason men bee wended vnto therefore must beare point wel remembrance wee see two vngracious extremity one men reiect knowledge wisdome men among v whome god hath aduanced aboue others vnto whome hath dealt greater abundance holie spirite certaine sayde afore despising wrong offered vnto god neuerthlesse wee see many stubborne folke meanes submit themselues counsell aduise man also another extremitie possessed forecoceiued opinion man skilful great wit wel experienced sotted therewith wee looke whit wee must suffer selues led god doth alwayes reserue owne right himselfe verely subiect alone specially cacos saluation true ordinance ciuill pollicies men whereto wee must obedient yet referred vnto dependeth vpon meane season ye see resolute poynt god haue v taught hande yeld authoritie vnto else rob god authoritie preheminence extremitie therefore condemned well meane betwixt two vice wee see god hath bestowed gracious giftes vpon man must haue estimation take counsell willingly hand vnderstand despising doe wrong vnto god bycause honor yet notwithstanding let v ceasse discerne least beguiled vnder shadowe opinion shall haue conceiued mortall man therby turned right waye god also disfeated preheminence thus muche concerning poynt eliphas addeth men haue concealed thinges learned forefather vvherein sheweth behaued themselues faithfully whensoeuer god giueth v grace well taught doth ourselues intent others also drawn knowledge v bee partaker togither thing hath bin giuen v heere ye see god instructing v first end see neighbor ignorant indeuer leade v way wherevnto wee selues entred already hee knoweth god truth must keepe close himselfe though alone vvhat bound neighbour therefore see go astray let reach hande let call hym let shewe hee knoweth wee neede bee afrayde shall bee preiudice hinderance v thoughe men bee made patakers god hath gyuen first vnto v man haue smal store worldly goodes surely deale forth vnto others shall soone see ende god hath inlightned v worde also giuen v spirite wee laboure giue vnto others shall wee bee inriched selues thus yee see sentence wee ought marke well eliphas sayth whome god giuen singular giftes aboue others concealed thing learned aunceters heere also yee see marke god gaue vnto seruaunt abraham shewe hee would vse well faithfully couenant receyued abraham sayth hee indeuer teache housholde come hee shewe ordinaunces statute lorde lette v marke well god openeth oure eye gracious v teach v truth end euery man shoulde keepe himselfe men haue parte portion must much v lyeth draw world nowe seeing bound men general yea euen vnto whome god hathe giuen v charge ought housholder towards seruauntes child vvhat ought minister god worde doe specially appoynted office vvhat ought magistrate seing sword giuen vnto sitteth god seat let v marke well although haue nothet wife child seruantes yet notwithstanding god haue bestowed gifte vpon v bound distribute abroade make common men edification marke one poynt much reason man haue housholde ought much watchfuller carefuller instructe teache whome god hath committed whome shall render account ordeyned shepherd feede god people muste imploye strength power therevpon nother muste openly particularly conceale haue receyued according wherevnto sainte paule sheweth hee cleare blud say faultie god hee taught god truthe faythfullye without ceassing well home theyr house openly abroade also let magistrate parte looke himselfe let negligence quenche lyghte god hath put vttermoste power let indeuer iustice maye reigne haue hir full course god maye honoured truth receyued leasings thinges contrarie true religion may done away lo wee haue remember streyne nowe whereas eliphas sayth god giuen land stranger passed expresse receyued excellent prerogatiue aboue certaine man able mainteine gouernement put hande token god fauoreth becommeth acknowledge benefite pollicie manable throughly also wheras eliphas sayth speaketh reigned peasably god blissed wise troubled guided subiectes dominion conteined quietnesse thereby done vnderstand god maynteineth state countrie peace wee must father vpon mortall men acknowledge speciall benefite god acknowledging must honoring men whome god serued turne also yeelding god due prayse nowe let v come chiefe article haue touched eliphas saith wicked man alway trauelling childe neuer hath rest hee continuall tormente hee looketh euer sworde knoweth number dayes lorde vseth threat transgressers lawe namely sende fearefulnesse life shall hang afore thread eye shall bee sunken heade shall bee anguishe mynde morning shall say warrant mee life vntill night night come howe maye indure till tomorrowe lo howe god punisheth walke purely according law good faith purenesse life desire rest tossed care behoueth v knowe god protection must fully resolued certayne wee may passe fire water say hap hap wee shall bee sure good stedfast leaningstocke wee knowe god watcheth ouer v leastwise wee thinke hee v wee must needes afrayde knowe become therefore without cause god vseth said manace againste transgressers law eliphassis saying true wicked alwayes fearefull according also prophet esay likeneth thought wicked folkes waues beate one againste another vvhen tempest yee see water stirreth waues come rushing one againste another breake asunder euen man ayded god one passion shall carrie away torment shall bee many contrary hee shall bee pecke trouble hee shall bee vtterly wittes ende tolde v wicked man vnquietnesse let v assure oure selues god rightfull vengeance vpon haue sought bee peace howe maye wee haue peace god walking good pure conscience specially knowing wee haue none foundation stande vppon saue onely mercy wee bee fauoure lorde iesus christes sake wee call vpon assuring oure selues bee happie life death bycause pleaseth present v receyue v gather v vp himselfe marke say howe way men haue peace god assure selues sinnes forgiuen praye vnto therewithall walke obedience indeuer haue good pure conscience towards neighbour peace ioyned ioye sainte paule termeth ioy holy ghost bee strengthened fayth saint paule sayth ioy ghostly vseth terme purposely bycause wicked sometimes reioyce say friske laugh merrie thing goe well forget themselues sort feele owne miserie become dull yea peace god filleth shall bee nothing profite manner peace drawe neere vnto god rather turne tayle vpon true peace happie blissed god wee haue eye vntoo come thervpon quiet assuring selues hee receyueth reckeneth auoweth v bee giue v vp guide v always life death thus ye see wee haue remember sentence howbeit true eueramong faythfull suche trouble man hardly discerne betweene dispisers god yet end god setteth rest handling manner hee maketh knowe owne weakenesse maye humble themselues learne call vpon put themselues wholly hande trust altogither hys goodnesse moreouer somtimes pricketh spurreth v come earnestly beseech reach v hande shew hath care v whensoeuer bee tossed sorte neede vnlode care lappe rest selues caces take contentation comforte yee see faythfull may well stricken feare troubling yet god make feele peace hee wont giue although appeere first brunt yet end shall alwayes bee comforted according sayd psalme lorde thou hast comforted mee sorrowes mynde god may well holde v short sometimes set v libertie end heere ye see howe eliphas addeth ought expounded namely extorcioneres euer person full violence shall knowe number yeeres faithfull poynt well furthermore heare request dauid maketh shewe leastwise sayth hee time maye take affliction good woorth perceyue shall last euer vve haue seene lyke request made iob himselfe saying hee knewe length time long god mynded hold heere vvhy doth eliphas referre specially bee despisers god suche full pryde outrage cause full care thought life yet mean wote account part knowe wee haue certaine terme heere howbeit wee shall continue heere long pleaseth god mainteine v seeing wee bee come worlde god hath set v heere wee must giue leaue holde v heere take v away pleasure meane season wee heere howe telleth v worde hee guideth v altogether haires heades numbered wee neede bee afrayde thing though wee beset neuer many daungers wee ought surmise thinges mingled togither worlde fortune beareth sway although wee bee sillie wormes earth yet doth god thinke vpon v hath life hand keepe well safely ought suffise v know protection god seeing say assured god keepeth reckening yeares dayes yea numbereth verie haires head perceiue sufficient certaintie without cause eliphas sayth extorcioners knowe number dayes seeke great anguish may saying may liue yet still sure haue made long disputation great discourse always turne backe continuall vnquietnesse bycause rest themselues vpon god prouidence part must must pray vnto haue put liue hande may quier whatsoeuer trouble befal v knowing forsomuch hath made v fashioned v able deliuer v daungers whensoeuer listeth shew himselfe deliuerer thervpon must conclude watch ouer v asleepe much bee thought eliphas addeth namely outrageous man doth alwayes beliolde sworde say hee doth see infinite daungers hem rounde reason hee qu keth agast agreeth properly vnto tyrantes true state may well seeme bee happye howbeit troubled myndes perceyue bee better haue bene small bace degree bee honored feared yet meane themselues afrayde onely men also euerie leafe shaketh vpon tree verely tiran confessed much one flattered sayde prince maiestie might seeme god worlde euerie man might desire state thou sayth hee wart like cace knewest much thou wouldest wishe chaunge thy state myne herevpon caused goodly banquet bee made ready setting familiar friend place caused naked sworde bee hanged ouer head poynt downeward vvhen sawe daunger could nother eate drinke braueries esteemed highly afore made account eliphat meeneth namely tyrant cruell folke shal alwayes liue feare notwithstanding seeme bee well ease haue great power gardes haue sworde continually eye man demaund whither faithfull shall feele daungers threaten yes certainly yea good v feele wist warranted wee would care runne ynder wing god would play colt broken looce god therfore faine warne v put v mynd besieged thousand deathes wee bee able step forth one pace without tumbling graue vvhen wee consider withall see plague warres famine store misery suche store disease many inconueniences beastes thinges looke howe many creature see heauen earth wee see many deathes leastwise many thinges v bethinke v ala wee bee wretched creature god pitie v moreouer prouoked runne vnto saye lorde thou seest thou sheeld thy hand haue one minute houre liue therefore good lorde voutsafe preserue see howe faythfull beholde sword howbeit beholding behold also grace god made priuie danger wherein flee sayd suretie shewed v often scripture put whole trust god hee onely wall dubble rampire v sayde prophet esay also wall brasse steele worde inuincible fortresse v lo howe faithful hauing behild sworde neuerthelesse behold god protection well assured although death seeme manace side yet shall sword come doe come yet shall fall headlong men say wicked shall share haue fearefulnesse beholding sworde shall sinke stomackes make say beholde daunger mischaunce light vpon meanes shift side shall see god pursuing dart ready rush vpon bowe bent witte thunderbolt strike downe maruell though greatly quiet great distresse wee see difference betwixt feeling daungers child god trouble fearesulnesse vnbeleeuers true sometimes faythfull shall see sworde afrayde feare bringeth touched afore witte god putteth mynde humble themselues afterwarde draweth home himselfe giueth rest whereof destitute tyme profite thus ye see haue remember sentence eliphassis haue knowledge thing wee may well apply doctrine oure instruction soulehealth first see state man ye see liuely picture wherein lord sheweth v wee bee world must bee put feare alwayes haue rest sometimes disquieted verie well yet euerie man go th astray euerie man shrinkes away god mischiefe increseth groweth dubble therefore behooueth terrours increase also become much terrible may daunt v vvhy vvee haue made warre god good reason much v yea al creature armed v done much see disease wee must come remedie acknowledge god wil forsake v tarrieth till come seeke preuenteth v goodnesse sheweth v call vpon may well put life handes good faythfull keeper vvhen knowe shall wee see god doth v much good maynteining v taking vpon charge office preseruing v exempted v daungers put cace men worlde earthly paradise nothing might trouble bee happie middes many affliction trouble finde god commeth downe say abaseth low thinke vpon watch preuenting inconueniences beating backe daungers might befall putteth himselfe betweene harmes intent ouermated troubled measure furthermore let v vnderstand god doe nowe leaue v withdrawe himselfe v hide himselfe wise perceiue succoure assured protection must dismayde pray voutsafe shew v countenance may see assurance according see howe dauid speaketh lorde sayth make thy countenance shine vpon v much better v abundance kynde good vvhen dauid sawe himselfe suche afterdeale seemed god giuen sathan wicked men brydle yea troubled also mynde came help aboue lorde sayth hee desire thou make thy countenance shine vpon v say thou giue little tast thy goodnesse knowe thou hast receyued thus yee see howe behoueth v desire god put away grosse thicke cloudes hinder v perceyue loue beareth towardes v furthermore wee see wicked trouble vnquietnesse let bee brydle vnto v must profite selues god vengeance wee see farre vpon wicked vve must tarie till god bende himselfe v til rap v hard vpon pate hee spare v meane see punisheth haue despised shaken yoke let serue holde v awe warinesse wee may say ala see heere wretched caytifes haue aduaunced themselues pride presumptuousnesse god paiment haue see need hangman torment vvhy tormenteth god persecuteth sort let wake v holde v back cast selues boundes besides let v also much giuen seeking peace inestimable benefit treasure let v hunt much busily calling remembrance paul saith peace god saith hee passeth vnderstading kepe hart mind say sure protection god wee resort vntoo doubting hee receyueth v owne child saith maner peace surmouteth vnderstading man vvherby doth v witte wee comprehende except god giue v holy spirit verie deede must bee faine worke v make v come poynt way haue marke howe conclusion sayd noise feare shall alwayes sounde eares wicked despisers god quiet extorcioner shall fall vpon heere eliphas speaketh twoo thing one wicked prosperitie sodain destruction shal fal vpo like storme perceyued insomuch said say peace sure oueruaunt theselues agaynst god laughing threatnings scorne euen come passe god shall ouerthrow mistrust least true scripture must needes bee fulfilled wicked shall feele thing afrayde contrariwise also god sende feared roote suddainly lande ye see howe eliphassis meening euen middes peace pilling polling shall light vpon despisers god cheefest thing said sound fearefulnesse whiche shall alwayes afright holde vpon racke kinde thing sound whiche god sendeth euen al thing rest noise al trouble yet neuerthelesse must pursue insomuch shall start tremble according see example caine beholde caine rest yet pursued god appointed iudge arreigne neither bodie stande agaynst verely bloud abell cried vengeance men hee sure ynough hee triumphed hee built citie name eldest sonne euery man stoode awe yet meane quaked like leafe tree wherof came euen secrete voyce voyce herd eare yet dreadful noise insomuch although wicked knowe god sheweth yet notwithstanding cease continually agast nowe heare let v pray god make v heere also sweete amiable voyce whereby hee sendeth v tidings fatherly goodnesse loue thus ye see remedie whereby may bee deliuered sayde fearefulnesse astonishment wicked dismayde v beseeche god make v heare voyce gospell hee telleth v receyueth v louingly father hee accepteth v rightuous lorde iesus christ sake life death hee alwayes holde v hande vvhen voice soundeth eares wee vnderstand throughly shall dismaide deafe blinde scarings vnbeleeuers wee shall bee surely fenced dismayings betide v therefore haue recourse vnto god holy spirite giue v grace rest vpon promise let v doubt stablish v good thing hee shall haue giuen v strengthen v power terrours worlde shall euermore stand stedfast vntill haue taken v eternall rest nowe let v cast selues downe presence good god acknowledgement oure faultes praying make v feele dislyking meane time wee may ceasse trust lyke hee receyueth wretched sinner vnto mercie thing wherein hee vttereth richnesse gracious goodnesse also may please make v partaker thereof therewithall may please also continue hee hathe begonne v vntill haue brought v full whole perfection let v say almightie god oure heauenly father wee acknowledge confesse according truth wee bee woorthie lyft vppe eye heauen present oure selues thee presume farre c lx sermon fourth vpon xv chapter hee vvill trotte vppe dovvne breade knovving time darkenesse hys hand anguish amazeth ouercommeth king prepared battell bycause hee hath lift vp hande agaynst god strengthned himselfe agaynste almightie vvill leape vpon necke crush strongest part shield hath couered face vvith fat fatted bovvels hath inhabited desert city ruinous house vvere falne dovvne shall aduaunce himselfe rich shall continue neither shall bee remainder yesterday shewed howe many misery daungers life subiect insomuch wee must alwayes needes tremble feare seke rest god knowing hath care v mainteine v neuer quiet moreouer whe vouchsafe heare voyce peace whiche god prepareth sendeth v must scared men iust punishment vnthankfulnesse receyue great benefite impossible god beare beholde god sheweth v first hee willing forgiue v sinnes although deserue bee ouerwhelmed hand yet desireth nothing one v mercie addeth taketh v intoo protection keeper life wee worthie bee deliuered vnto satan refuse honour priuiledge onely vexed men also quake afrayd though man pursue v let v learne rest selues vpon god sticke promise hath giuen v end may walke safely quietly heere beneath middes daungers nowe eliphas addeth wicked man shall trot vp downe bread knowing day darkenesse hande lay forth sentence sayde god impouerish wicked howe great rich euer haue must bee faine beg true cursse conteyned law heare also howe sayde psalme rightuous neuer forsaken seede begge breade god nurrisheth tyme dearth god prouide wise faythfull one succour neede wee must thinke straunge contrarie part hee plucketh benefites wicked men handes bycause sotted make idol certenly see riche folke worlde become hungerstaruen notwithstanding despise bothe god men beare themselues hande causeth god nowe spoyle strip wise seene go begging notwithstanding abundance erewhile readie burst place eliphas ment say onely speaketh need wherevnto bee brought despise god meeneth also euen middes rich shall still full care whitte better poore folke shall thinke themselues go may shall want wee see experience although god giue vnbeleeuers euer wishe haue garner cellers full money wherewith buy corne wine yea although haue prouision made yet afrayde earth shoulde faile true sometime men like sterue hunger seemeth themselues haue great store according see lorde iesus christ sheweth example rich man sayth go heart merrie take thine ease thou mayst sport thee thy pleasure haue store goodes layde vp thee heere riche men therefore may well trust goodes yet al may stil doubt ceasse thinke may hap fall inconuenience thing may light vpo short haue touched alreadie vnsatiable gulfes although whole worlde yet woulde suffice thus yee perceyue eliphas ment saying wicked runne vp downe bread wee see looke vpon verie rich man happen little losse hee make fisking hee rest till haue compassed hath taken hand must pine martir himselfe measure bring matter passe hee must rayse yet new stock money get withall dare eate one bitte without carke care least wise eate halfe fill repineth eate neuer well ease till haue pinched much serue compasse thing goeth trotting vp bread man hath wherewith finde halfe shyre thinkes himselfe haue nothing bycause hee able staunch owne desire god punisheth manner contrarie vengeance therefore see ought vnderstand right well bee worse blinde god executeth notable vengeance vpon men vengeance worthie remembred man haue pleasure neuer beeing rest man shoulde grudge v meate drinke woulde seeme vnto v hee went starue v wee woulde blame crueltie whiche man owne friend doo good himselfe thinkes hee hath halfe ynough although haue hundred time hath need apparant god hath blinded yet notwithstanding vice hath reigned tymes therefore without cause eliphas doth heere set v downe iudgement god saying wicked shall trot vp downe bread hee addeth knowe day darknesse handes expounde ment day darknesse hande else trouble elbow say god pay suche wage haue deserued whereof commeth fo gred middes abundance god hath giuen hee hath fraughted benefites yet notwithstanding dare neither eate drinke vvhereof commeth punished crueltie reuenousnesse deceytes haue vsed towards neighbour yee neede seeke farre cause wherefore punished maner looke howe haue troubled poore folkes raked mennes goodes raught themselues whatsoeuer coulde finger must god fayne recompence agayne thus yee see darkenesse handes say misery indure proceede theyr executing tirannie poore folkes spared plaine meening wordes namely knowe day darkenesse handes whatsoeuer paynes euer take although rich mightie yet winde themselues affliction god sendeth vpon certaine euer couetous sort prouide may neuer want well aduised woulde bee contented haue cannot away haue sayd alreadie god blindeth become dul cannot perceyue goodes haue ought suffize heerevpon practize euer may trie meanes bring matter one way serue seeke another way wood couetous sort therfore haue handes idle take vpon remoue whole world rather disappoynted purpose dayly making newe shiftes terme yet meane see darkenesse handes say haue done prouide themselues haue vsed meanes possible yet shift handes beeing continuall miserie god hath bereft benefyte according sayde psalme god giue rest welbeloued whereas meane wretched vnbeleeuers shall ryze early go late bed dare eate bread sorrow yet notwithstanding shall themselues whit thereby may easily perceyue god hath blissed increased workes handes vvee see contrarywise whiche set downe heere namely wicked shall haue much adoo labour hand agaynst god say labour mislyked spite teeth must fayne knowe affliction laid vpon therein rid handes haue notable sentence wit abundance good able suffice v cannot make account bee ease bycause haue store corne wine money matter bee founde perfection happynesse god giuing rest faythfull one let v lear giue oure selues outrageous couetousnesse wherewith wee see moste part world caught caried away haue betaken selues vntoo god let v pray make v feele fosterfather let v receiue whatsoeuer giueth v crauing ordinarie food hand without attempting vnlawfull meanes absteyning robberie violence deceyte like thing desiring nourished shall please shewe v fauour thus ye see wee haue marke first place furthermore let v pray blisse labour handes wee may perceyue thing inclosed therein rather make countenance shine vpon v say make v find fauour goodnesse giuing v good successe men labour doo get liuing honestly haue wherof thank god therby perceiue god hath inlightened fauour cresset guide therefore haue cause pray god furthermore wee nowe recoyle backe steade going forwarde let v learne counsell god resort vnto pray suffer v companie see much darknesse handes rather hath giuen v meane make prosper wise may knowe hee neere hande v thus see effect haue remember sentence eliphas addeth asmuch lifted vp hand agaynst god strengthned himselfe almightie god take necke catche holde strongest thickest armour reason rendred lord sendeth fearefulnesse vpon wicked tormenteth also disappoynteth attemptes turneth thing cleane contrarie intent namely bycause lifted vp themselues true mortall man bee ashamed thinke making warre agaynst god wicked themselues farre beeing acknowne minded lift vp themselues almightie abhorre verie worde yet cease proofe hereof need send trumpetter god defie mynd make warre trouble neighbour wrongfully vse deceyt extortion behold god setteth v thought made warre mortall creature would mad ouershoote selues sort wee considered selues god sheweth selfe enemie outrageous woulde lift vp selues fashion fall outrage pray full incountering god vve take yet neuerthelesse vvhat neede sophistrie behalfe sayd afore speake making warre god ment chalendge herault trumpet proude presume vpon strength power take vpon v god giueth v leaue doo certayne come rush agaynst god much disquiet poore folk go set foot vpon throte therfore fall aduauncing selues wise aboue boundes one wee defied god face sentence woorthie rememberance fliphas sayeth god leape neck aduance themselues sort agaynst hee sayeth expressely lifted vp handes agaynst god verely similitude taken fight battell neuerthelesse meening extendeth yet eliphassis meening men take vpon lawfull vsing outrage iniurie god take part neighbour agaynst true cannot compasse matter meanes go deceyt priuie packing although world perceiue yet doth god ceasse enimie nourishing wicked affection secretly within howbeeit shall bee much vnexcusable iniquitie sheweth selfe abrode therefore polleth man goodes shall hild murtherer god yea euen though wrong hee doeth may excused men eliphas ment shewe men ought thinke straunge though god take vengeance wicked haue cloked wrongfull dooings haue made knowne whole worlde good fayth shal haue runne sort shall haue eaten vp one fleeced another shall haue executed many extortion cruelty high time god shoulde step afore neuer nought hee reporteth selfe bee defender poore vexed wrongfully apparant yea oftentymes crie vnto god vengeance wherefore doo poore folk indure thing seemeth god leaueth brier willing doo right temptation behoueth v resort holy scripture sayth namely yet conuenient time knoweth maketh delay nothing else giue tyme repentance euill make vnexcusable also stirre vp poore folke oppressed call vpon flee vnto betake themselues wholly prouidence assuring themselues ayd succour seeth meete expedient welfare howbeeit see god worke deede hath taried long time ought open eies behold iudgements still dazeled afterwarde addeth strengthned themselues agaynst almightie vvhen sayeth strengthened themselues hee meeneth hardened selues howe possible men shoulde gather strength lift vp themselues agaynst god may going sea land assembling helpe possible found strengthen themselues false imagination haue ouerweening themselues thinke themselues able withstand god directly mynde bycause forget god able harme would stubborne euill neither would bee wilfull men shewe fault labour reclayme therfore pride stubbornesse seene men sure record take themselues bee strong mightie ynough beate backe hand god commeth lo saying strengthned themselues bee vnderstoode deede impossible diuelish ouerwening bicause shake feare beare themselues hand indure iudge short ought owe god much dutie come account therwithal become bolder giue themselues ouer naughtinesse though lawfull doo list eliphas giueth title almightie vnto god purposely according circumstance place god time ouercome eliphas inteded scorne pridefulnesse wicked strengthning themselues maner god meene almightie yea shal become strength ye incouter creature wouldstand ye hand knowe strongest sith make warre god must ye needes ouerthrowne ere ye come hand stroke strength yea whereas yee haue borowed ye come turne thinke ye hee suffer strength whiche hath giuen diminish whitte maiestie must needes serue confounde withall yee see cause eliphas hath expressely sette downe worde almightie reproching men strengthning theselues agaynst god haue yet one good profitable lesson gather hereof wee haue warre god must bee well ware absteyne euill wrong must liue among neighbour without working anoyance iniurie assoone wee doo stirre one finger poll men goodes trouble one deuour another beholde god chalenged v make warre v bycause wee haue gone aboute euill towardes hee hath taken vntoo tuicion vvee see earthly prince haue giuen protection house man doo wrong simple felonie high treason whereof bee auenged doo wee imagine god bee lesse priuileged prince hee hathe set badge vpon poore folke taking owne charge protection nowe man come torment afflict suffer sayde let v learne brydle selues ende wee vse outrage neighbour also let v keepe selues frenzie spoken heere bee well wittes take selues mightie strong god therefore let v aduisedly walke modestie acknowledging frailtie nature let v humble selues let serue holde v within boundes knowing thing whiche god permitteth v knowe let v bee contented walke plainly oure waye wythout running ouer feeldes like stray cattell else strengthen selues agaynst god wee presume doo god hath forbidden v shall wee esteeme bee single disobedience diuelish furiousnesse let v vncace selues pride presumption simplie followe god sheweth v wee tempted nowe sayde vaine fancie let v marke well woorde almightie brydle v withall saying howe nowe wretched creature wilt thou doo wherevpon muzest thou thou strengthenest thy selfe thine euill beholde god telleth thee hee lift vp himselfe agaynst thee thou must faine feele thy foe mortall enimie therefore restreyne thy selfe except thou intende feele mightie hand able destroy thee quite make cleane riddance thee marke say wee haue note sentence furthermore let v hearken howe eliphas addeth god aze wicked folkes neckes bee neuer well armed haue helmet sheelde god seaze vpon thickest furn ture vvhereas hee sayeth god seaze wicked necke shew shall bee caught suche wise cannot meanes escape sayde man hilde necke hee shet vp extremitie distresse god therfore sheweth hee deale fashion wicked folke handle stroke cudgel onely giue blow twaine seaze vpon neckes choke good reason shoulde see howe cruell haue beene neighbour haue hilde foote vpon throtes muche coulde god therefore must vse gentle correction towardes assayling must bee extremitie confuzion forasmuch wicked trust armour artillerie bicause bee well furnished forasmuch needes barre god comming sayd purposely nippe thickest armour resistance fortifying themselues god shall boote whit force shall haue cors et sheeld yet god compasse intent vvherby warned walk continually feare ought afraid god punishings according holy scripture sayeth dreadfull thing fall handes liuing god let v surmize wee haue doo mortall man assoone god threatneth let v fall flatte hardharted swell agaynst god wrath king sayeth salomon messenger death wrath god himselfe god sendeth v woorde displeasure see wee howe death present backes therefore let v misbehaue selues helpe wee haue handes men creature let v thinke selues bee euer neerer purpose imagin cace well prouided wee fight agaynst creature might auayle v forasmuch oure warre god wee serue turnes agaynst hee hath hys hande hee disposeth pleasure vvhen shall purpose march one side make v turne head another way thinke good yee see howe haue consider wee arme selues agaynst god owne sword must cut throte god sende armie agaynst v neither needeth make prouision wherwith destroy v wee selues shall woorke owne decay therefore sayde let v trust owne fence meanes heere bylowe assuring selues thing shall nothing profit v haue doo god againe see wicked adtraunced neckes swell threescore thirteenth psalme speaketh insomuch seemeth shoulde burst puffed neckes let v neuerthelesse wayte alwayes paciently till god laye hande vpon knoweth well howe daunt swelling shall vanish away intoo ayre wee see wicked haue great furniture seeming bee sure euill befall let v thinke let vntoo god hee shoulde ouerthrowe destroy time commeth must afrayde see wicked florish cheefe ruffe rather well vphild vnderpropped seemeth bee delt withall god god say must fayne strike stroke hee putteth foorth hande may well seeke helpe succour handes creature yet shall bee cast downe vtterly destroyed lo howe faythfull haue wherewith comfort themselues see wicked men rage despizing god infected al rebelliousnes rather otherwise hardned sort impossible make bow might knowe ende god performe hath sayde spoken hath bene spoken eliphas sentence vttered holy ghost euen two consideration haue spoken wit faithfull might holde themselues modestie lowlinesse attempt thing god see wicked haue full scope world theselues borne many wrong cast vp sighes vntoo god desyring performe hath spoken according also good call vpon haue onely refuge vnto consequently sayd distresse shall light vpon wicked come vpon king prepared battell rather wind word eliphas vseth signifieth ball bowle round thing knowe commeth giuing battell somtymes men cast themselues ring according cace requyreth done olde time therefore sentence may bee expounded distresse shall king readinesse giue battell whensoeuer god shall sende affliction vpon wicked shall bee like enimie hath power strength lyke king hath souldiers ynowe giue enimie ouerthrow else man may referre sayde roundnesse wicked whiche shall bee inuironed sydes say shall haue way scape god seaze vpon shall bee beseege one syde behynde right hande left shall bee inclosed side shall bee startinghole conuenient interpretation let v marke well eliphassis meening god minded punish man long tariance long sparing shewing himselfe bee angrie pacified come side hee may neuer scape handes thus ye see effect sentence herevpon haue yet one good lesson gether bee put mynde v dally god forsomuch bee ouerpressed hande wee may well woorke wyles wee wee shall neuer bee able scape distresse wherewith shall pleasure pinch v aduersitie wherevnto shall subiect must bee faine tarie spite teeth god hath woonderfull furniture like mortall men spitte choller mouth handes bee short meane euen king prince themselues storme well ynough strength fayleth neede god hath alwayes furniture ynough compasse enimies withall vvhat remayneth let v beware wee make warre agaynst performance thereof let v forbeare iniurie euill wee play looce coltes wee shall finde length god hath meanes ynow reyne v backe force wee list submit selues vntoo owne good immediately sayde forsomuch hath fatted eye forasmuch face strouteth greace much hath stuffed bellie forasmuch hee hath ouer larded guttes inhabited desoate townes forsaken house shall come decay prosper verely intent sentence may bee better vnderstoode wee must lay foorth maner although wicked man dwell desert townes yet crammeth bellie bodie bearing himselfe hande hee shall make worlde newe againe hys dooings woonderfull yet shall go decay althoughe hee make fayre shewe tyme yet shall hee continue god shall turne vp syde downe howbeeit yet comprehende eliphassis meening except wee knowe first fill mannes face greace fatte god dooth heere condemne fatnesse mennes body vseth similitude hee intendeth expresse men puffed vp pride prosperitie bicause thing maketh v forget owne infirmitie lo lorde sayeth fatnesse blindeth v deede common prouerb among v say prouander pricketh men also hebrewes intend speak lowly man vse say cast downe lord tameth v wise affliction learne humble selues rid selues quite cleane pride pertnesse like rest holy scripture also sentence sayde wicked fatted ment simply fatte body take pryde good rich puffed vp agaynst god full poyson presumptuousnesse although bee leane bodie yet readie burst another cursed fatnesse forasmuch puffed vp agaynst god yea see fatnesse wit diuelish malapertnesse maketh eye strout heades sayde threescore thirteenth psalme eye good halfe bursten reason bleare selues delightes pleasure consider may bee bereft one minute houre marke say howe fatnesse blindeth wicked howe good bursten owne shame destruction nowe let v come sentence eliphas sayeth wicked shall prosper reason bicause hee puffed vp famesse vvill wee blissed god bee mainteyned good state true happinesse let v kepe v well pampering selues fatnesse say let v keepe v pampered wyth pryde wee presume make selues let v walke mildenesse knowing depende vpon hande god hee hath lyfted v vp hee also soone cast v downe agayne therefore let v bee moued muche serue honour let v bee vngracious giue occasion ouerthrowe hee hath buylded destroy quite bicause wee woulde make towre babilon prefume lift vppe selues agaynst euen happeneth sayeth eliphas although wicked haue inhabited desert city say although haue suche scope might seeme woulde make world new inhabite desert townes much bee contented possession thing good plyght fyght agaynst god might bee newe maker worlde setter vp thing destroyed wicked may well haue outwarde shew shall continuance bicause aduaunce themselues god contraripart vndone stripped starke naked god shew v fauour build vp againe thing forsaken condicionally go vaine pryde presume thing vpon selues desire reach v strong hand guide gouerne v alwayes holy spirite hee hath begon shew gracious fauour towards v hee continue bring perfection nowe let v fall downe presence good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v feele wise may learne mislike selues forasmuch much giuen pryde vaine presumption may please open eies perceiue owne feeblenesse infirmitie wee may run wholly vnto calling vpon acknowledge haue power strengthen selues furtherfoorth pleaseth quicken v death rayse v vp againe life moreouer hee mainteyne v fauour make v feele bodie soule may desire nothing yeeld selues wholly seruice example wee may allure others lyke humilitie may bee honoured glorified great small dooing hereof may please rayse vp true faythfull c lxj sermon fifth vpon xv chapter shall depart darknesse flame shall sindge braunches shall go avvay vvith breath mouth shall deceyued vvith vanitie shall stand vanitie chaunge shall consumed time braunches shall florish shall bereft sourenesse vine god shall cast olife tree dooth floures congregation hypocrite shall desolate fire shall deuoure house brybes conceyueth mischeefe bringeth forth vanitie belly prepareth deceyt yesterday saw howe despysers god aduaunced themselues suche wise may seeme none god gyueth great aduauntage fauouring suche wise mainteyne themselues state make new worlde yet notwithstanding ende cannot bee cursed shamefull eliphas addeth newe saying wicked shall depart darkenesse herein discerneth child god affliction indure whome god hath vtterly reiected may come passe shall bee darknesse wee see holy prophet complaine god hath withdrawne light grope knowe way turne neuerthelesse god giueth end haue languished time reacheth hand draweth sayde wicked shall neuer set darknesse shall abide ouerthrowne without ende hereby sayd discerned god afflicteth tyme hee meeneth succour sayde god deuoure braunches say howe greatly soeuer bee aduaunced god cosume place take braunches child ofspring whole state surely vnder terme comprehended euer springeth tree v vnderstande god shall haue punished wicked may well conceyue many hope beare themselues hand shall spring againe theyr hope slope sayeth eliphas vvhy fire shall consume say god wrath shall fire burne vp likely releeue againe shall finally addeth wicked shall go away breath mouth true may wel verified god scripture sayeth oftentymes god consume wicked onely breath hys mouth shewe power hee hath punish wicked enemy god needeth arme self neither needeth make preparation punish hee listeth let onely open mouth breath vpon enimies behold ouerthrowne destroyed like god word quickeneth v pleaseth inlighten v grace wherein consisteth welfare lyke though good dead yet bee releeued soone god sheweth v fauour contrarywise vttereth wrath wicked hee needeth opening mouth drown destruction also cause saint paule sayth antichrist hath reigned church last shall consumed wyth breth god mouth according haue alledged prophet esay termeth mace wherwith god woont breake daunt al enemy listeth haue sonne reigne sentence therfore vnderstood wicked neuer get affliction neuer shall delyuered darknesse wherinto entred bycause god pursueth hath mouth open consume worde power shall make perish vnhappily howbeit true fit meening wicked man shall go away breath owne mouth say puffe verely also vnderstand thus namely wicked may well gnashe teeth chafe themselues yet god touch lay hand vpon play bulles mouth like wilde bore vve see haue greate breathe chafing fretting win sturdinesse resistance god able saue shall true conuenient lesson howsoeuer wicked doo striue agaynst god full pride bitternesse soeuer yet shall therfore escape god hand saue themselues shift notwithstanding must come sense spake bycause agreeable namely wicked shall go away breth neede open mouth byand vanish away short eliphas ment say wicked make greatest shewe themselues afore men seemeth shall continue without ende shall chaunge insomuch shall sooner breathe shall fordone shall bee breath commeth oute mannes mouth know man puffeth breath vanisheth away sodenly becometh nothing therefore let v marke well although despysers god seeme haue lasting life yet shall soone vanishe away without cause likened breath true thing verefied men wee firmnesse nature wherin consisteth life true soules created image god yet man life blast breath vndone yeelding vp gaspe dead frailtie whereof eliphas speaketh despizers god men furthermore haue wherwith comfort v god preserueth v although life fleeting shadow smoke yet notwithstanding sure ynough seeing hand god thus ye see wherein whole comforte lyeth therfore let v assure selues twaine witte nature wee nothing may perishe euery minute yet notwithstanding god infinite goodnesse putteth difference betwene v enemy haue cast must perish blast although languish like liue past giuing one gaspe yet neuerthelesse god wyll strengthen v power yea euen secrete power shall beare shew worldward yet shall mainteyned shall still aliue wicked go wasted away lo haue beare away sentence consequently sayd wicked beeing deceyued vanitie shall stande bycause vanitie shall bee chaunge true sentence vnderstoode dyuersly woorde translate stand taken also beleeue expounde wicked man beeing vanitie beleeue vanitie shall chaunge againe double vnderstanding worde whereas wee reade vanitie worde rightnesse certentie sayde wicked man beleeueth bee true vvhyso bycause vanitie chaunge neuerthelesse moste receyued commonest construction namely hee deceyued vanitie shall stande continue beleeue vanitie chaunge touching worde beleeue followe construction wee may picke good lesson god bereeueth men witte discretion neuer receyue good warning profitable counsell vvhy stubborne doo yee see punishment god wee must marke well bee afrayde except god make v conformable wee shall neuer discerne good profitable besides although wee haue men v giue v good counsell seeke profite v shew v good v yet notwithstanding shall frowarde euer sayde v shall take place see dayly god bereeueth men vnderstanding shewe vengeance vppon make vnexcusable hee giue men leaue speake still counsell incourage still goodnesse shal continue still sleepe man aske whether willingly perish answere man put minde saluation man shewe poynt way leuer breake necke tumble ditche readie walke way called vnto vve see therefore much must wee marke well iudgements god wee may walke warely small thing tempt oure god wise must bee fayne picke oute eies may knowe syde turne v although hee reache v hande shewe v waye good v go yet wee go quite contrarie beholde horrible vengeance yet wee see dayly wilfull haue often tempted god reiecting grace ende forced fall blindnesse discerne ne beleeue doctrine fayth also heere ye see common gift vnto men beleeue gospell vve see woorde god preached shoulde gainsaying men wilfull frowarde vvhereas god declared himselfe father sauiour aboue thing whereas seeing v full sinnes giueth v warrant oure saluation person sonne assuring v although bee full iniquitie yet notwithstanding lord iesus christ hath satisfied v meanes death passion set cleere may appeare god iudgementseate bee hilde rightuous giltlesse pray vtterly brutish v woulde giue eare earnest desire see gospell despized yea many conceyue rancour agaynst would rather pluck god oute seate submit themselues hys doctrine whereof commeth man power beleeue benefite vntill bee giuen god men left themselues giuen vp lewde minde must needes reiect goodnesse chooze euill altogither owne destruction forasmuch wee see let v humble selues aduaunce himselfe owne conceyte must ende bereft vnderstanding behoueth v keepe allegeance vnto god hath giuen v right minde cleere vnderstanding good reason leastwise wee must confesse commeth pray continue v suffer v abuse singular gift rather cause v applie right vse namely yeelding selues obeysance sticking throughly doctrine ye see haue see many poore blinde soules wandring ouer fieldes able discerne thing euen though man would guide shew right way woulde neuerthelesse draw still contrary way say must acknowledge selues shoulde doo like god strong hand hold v drawe v himselfe ynough call v shew v way go must bee faine draw v also holy scripture sayeth say must giue operation knowledge hee offereth v may touched oure harte tyed therefore god hath taught v doo hee muste also immedatly therewithall giue v minde followe good sayde wee may gather good profitable lesson saying wicked wyll beleeue bicause hee deceyued vanitie reason added expressely bycause man forepossessed naughtie affection snarled many errours corruption yee see like desperate person comming shewe errour howbeit wee bee deceyued vanitie hande nature bring wee oure moothers wombe sayde nothing foolishnesse vntruthe vnderstanding beholde generall sentence shewe soone wee bee borne worlde bee quyte cleane voyde truthe afore hande vntill suche tyme god haue reformed v wee go forewarde altogither vntoo euill therefore wee shoulde bee shet vp condemnation sorte v god drawe v oute hys mercie wee v deceyued vanitie none fit receiue good true profitable welfare wee bee intyced manye deceites satan beguyle v hande howe marke mee yoong man hath liued simplicitie lyfe hath liued long tyme example admitte bee yoong man twenty yeares age hath bene well brought vp beginning hath tasted false doctrine wicked thing although suche one seeme bee sufficiently well disposed receyue goodnesse yeelde himselfe teachable yet muste god bee fayne woorke else neuer come good oure nature forwarde vnto euill altogither gyuen vntoo sayde afore bee one wylye full naughtinesse hath bene nuzled wicked doctrine superstition wee see papistes muche clawebackes hypocrite armed long time afore hand god carryed headlong away theyr errours haue wyse applyed theyr whole indeuor intangle themselues snare satan possible get agayne certaine sorte men muche lesse beleeue wee see experience god dooth still shewe fauour haue simplicitie sotted erroure wholly giuen iustice god must needes bee shewed vpon except bee pleasure woorke woonderfull fashion according hee well drawe whome hee listeth bottome hell hee doeth miracle well worthie bee knowne magnified neuerthelesse wee perceyue whiche sayde namelye wicked man shall beleeue hee sotted vanitie say wee perceyue god executeth vengeance vpon suche hardened euill long continuance nowe heare wee haue cause thanke god drawing v knowledge gospell giuing v minde cleaue vntoo commeth selues speciall gifte holy ghost moreouer also wee bee warned keepe eye open satan dazell v setting erroures deceyts sight wee suffer selues bee misseled deceyued willinglye mischeefe must needes increased euen till come proofe wherof eliphas speaketh wit till wee bee disfurnished reason bee able beleeue whiche welfare sette selues quite cleane fall horrible vengeance god let v preuent let euery v bee heedefull stande vpon garde sith god hath taken vppon charge keepe v carefully hee telleth v nother satan force practizes shall able thing v let v stick promis doubt wil fulfill make v feele frute due time place let v come whiche spake say wicked shall stand woorde importeth muche beleeue like also word truth may also signifie stedinesse true wicked shall stand sotted vanitie vanitie chaunge reason serueth fitly confirme principle wicked shall haue settling finally prosper god maketh turne alwayes vanitie worde vanitie taken two sens sayde wicked man shall stand bicause sotted vanitie much say cannot stande hee full vntruthes blinded deceyuablenesse vanitie see worde altereth
