signification chaunge saye nothing deceyuablenesse hee thinketh haue thing harte lust vanisheth away turning hande findeth nother help releefe aduersitie anye remedie misery thus yee see woorde vanitie importeth seconde place woorde chaunge fitteth well sense god shall haue led wicked sorte throughe manye turmoyles shall haue buskled themselues throughly fro whiche side euer turne shall alwayes fall vanitie say shall vtterly disappointed theyr expectation true may sette manye fayre hope eye beare themselues hande haue wonne goale beholde turning hand bee deceyued see follie gape one thing nowe lette v come gathering togither thing spoken heere one summe namely wicked shall stande say shall haue anye setling continuance althoughe despyzers god bee exalted triumphe tyme yet haue settlednesse god leadeth continually thorough backewayes suche sorte fynde themselues beguyled disappoynted theyr hope profitable lesson v cause wee grudge wicked woulde fayne bee parttakers state bycause wee haue pacience tarrye ende sayde psalme oure mindes quiet certayne wee shoulde shudder ende prepared despizers god bycause laste theyr ioy muste turned weeping wayling gnashing teethe god curseth theyr mirth ende must needes vnhappy wee raught onely present thing runne lustes whot wee haue forecare may happen tomorrow morning much ought marke well lesson whe sayde wicked man shall haue settling saying taught bridle selues see despizers god haue theyr full skope liue theyr ease yea euen whyle wee weepe lament wee ouershoote oure selues giue god leysure finish worke againe let v take heede wee like well prosperitie let v grounde selues vpon god man prosper let dole vpon good fortune terme nother let v bee miscarried forget god lette v seeke settle selues without shall bee stedfastnesse reason eliphas addeth heere immediatly muste bee throughly weyed witte chaunge wicked shall vanitie wherfore see many turning worlde seemeth v alwaies worlde prooue better better v bycause men feede themselues wind god afflict hope vpon maruelous thing substance stedinesse enterprise thus yee see effect wee haue marke right sense sayde afterward wicked man shall bee consumed tyme braunches shall neuer florish shall bee lyke vine hath vnripe grape stript like olife tree casteth floures yea floures shead away cometh froste perishe vtterly doubte two similitude eliphas ment confirme former sentence say wicked man perisheth hee bee full ripe serueth still bring v backe matter whiche wee haue discoursed already see setting eye stablenesse wicked lorde calleth v continuing stablenesse shal deceyuable serue alonly tickle v vayne fonde desire god intent shoulde deceyued vayne imaginacion weening selues happie would haue v bee happie good earnest howe may bee settling oure selues loue lo wherevnto hee calleth v contrarywise hee sheweth v wee muste bee gyuen worldly thing reste vpon reste bee wee bee starke fooles wee beate oure braynes aboute yet cannot turne v notwithstanding god tell v prosperitie happinesse men weene themselues haue world bee separated deceytfulnesse muche standeth v hande marke well lesson sayde wicked shall perishe tyme whereas hee addeth comparison hee shall bee vyne hath sowre grape plucked oliue casteth flower tyme bring foorthe frute heereby lorde intended expresse outwarde shewe wicked shall haue whereat shall wonder yea also stumble wee see wicked prosper immediatly wee bee amazed suche fyre kindled v wee coulde finde hart bee saying suche one beholde yonder naughtypacke ease meane put behind doore see settes foote vpon throte haue meanes reuenged see howe oure affliction chafe v withoute measure soone see wicked prosper contrariwise oure lorde sayeth v vvell sir true yee may sorte bee tempted beholding goodly shewe men lustes suddeyne headie yee see howe vine stripped vnripe grape new burieoned needeth one froste kill grape bee growne bee full fashioned beholde falleth storme sweepes awaye remayneth nother grape leafe vine left bare also looke vpon oliue tree wherein beautie floures yet notwithstanding floures frostbitten tempeste light vpon caste euen felicitie wicked truly seeming poore ignorant folke prosperitie shall bee suche nothing may seeme desirable theyr cace anone floure frute fade away bee rype god plucke away come perfection according tolde shall come much perfectio shoote floures frute shall taken away come seasonable thus yee see effect shewed v heere sayde afore serueth confirme matter hathe beene discoursed already let v learne hereby desire felicitie lasteth past day avery little time lette v learne bee throughly happy lorde would haue v bee well settled assure selues bee blissed god shall make v prosper onely daye twayne also bothe life deathe true muche aduersitie may befall v meane whyle priuiledge haue whe may betake selues vnto god know lay vpo v able beare specially turne aduersities oure welfare saluation seeyng haue prerogatiue haue wee wherewith bee contented although wicked theyr ease present time certeintie haue time come although aduaunce theselues thinke god able shake sayde psalme yet haue sting within god woundeth pricketh else tosseth syde side suche stormes able auoyde let v marke desire god fauour haue continuing prosperitie must grounded neuer quayle vvee knowe sayde another sentence psalme wicked spoken namely bee like greate tree whiche men stub vp remayneth printe plucked vp roote contrary parte must dauid sayeth bee like olife house lorde whiche florisheth alwaies also similitude take sort firste psalme ieremie mente trust god runne vnto hang vpo shall bee like tree planted water riuers side wee shall alwaies haue good sappe florish bring foorth frute seeing god hauing drawen v corruption vayne alluremets world offereth v also euerlasting happinesse must need wit go let v bethinke v well learne bereeue selues lust flesh serue nothing deceiue v yea leade v destruction learne know welfare lyeth thus yee see wee haue beare minde ala hard thing sayde afore vve straitewayes drawen hath fayre shew therefore standeth v hande marke well similitude eliphas bringeth heere vve see olife tree looketh faire continuaunce lette v also haue eye storme hande vpon wicked god holdeth poynte beate downe althoughe wee perceyue firste dashe yet wee looke god iustice eyesight faith wee shall see rooted god cannot come full ripenesse neuer bring foorth good frute shall soone come plucking vp god hath sayde vvee shall see drowned owne pride god word cannot lye ofte bee moued sensualitie foolishe imagination let v retyre god woorde looke whiche wee sawe afore specially thing hydden may know thervpon turne away vayne conceites deceyue v lo wee haue beare away streyne ende sayde householde wicked shall desolate fyre shall consume house brybes vnder terme hypocrite according sense textes also eliphas comprehendeth suche haue frowarde disloyall harte godwarde sayeth hee muste perishe yea euen house retinue afterwarde addeth house brybes shall consumed vvhereas speaketh companie hypocrite expresse better althoughe wicked haue greate traynes greate long tayles yet shall misse bee consumed shall yee see farre wickedder men common simple sort shall carrye greate company bandes whiche make greate shewe shall haue alliance assembly drawe long traynes eliphas sayeth expresly suche assembly shall come nought meening shewe howe true wicked mainteyne themselues time alliance fortifie themselues purpose mainteine state somuche euery one thinketh himselfe strong ynough beare bruntes wrath god kindled burne vp yea wee see howe prophete speaketh hee likeneth faggot thornes man haue gathered bryers thornes made faggot wyll bee snarled hee wyll bee loth put hande hee shall knowe side take holde specially woulde draw abough hee cannot hee put fyre immediatly kindle crackle cast farre greater blaze faste substantiall woodde euen wicked like thornes bryers bee plasshed one within another man cannot tell howe vndoo nother hee well come soone god putteth fire must needes cracke peeces vtterly consume hande ye see eliphas ment saying assembly hypocrite shall perishe meening wicked man maye drawe greate trayne bande men shall stand sted mainteyne god wrath ought assure v wee see wicked men furnished allyed garded yet shall therfore misse bee suddeynly cast downe consumed wee shall see spoken nought hereby wee admonished knit selues togither right feare god haue none bande hold v linked togither seruing good conscience putting whole truste helping one another finally haue agreement among selues euery v may sette minde walke faithfully god man wee deale sort god blisse concord otherwise must needes go wrecke hauock purposely sayd house brybes bryberie shall come nought buyldings haue bin set vp pilling polling must needes perish decay themselues meene onely house buylded stone timber meene man enricheth himselfe bryberie rewardes hee draweth one side snatcheth side giuen scraping deceyuing extortion hath doone hee gathereth woodde commeth little sparke god wrath consumeth euery whit woodde fire take holde wicked pyle vp stacke al side wood serueth wood burne vp theyr traine text ought well borne minde wee may walke soundly purely thus much firste poynt seeing warned wicked sorte haue inriched themselues receyuing gift brybes shall end go destruction let v repine lette euery v looke himselfe walke owne calling let called state iustices ware mainteine themselues without bryberie remember howe sayde giftes blinde eye wise peruert vnderstanding rightuouse therefore let absteyne corruption intent may continue cleere sounde marke speciall poynte agayne let bee priuate state walke vprightly also let euery man bethinke himselfe go maye aduance selfe world vsing wicked trade howbeeit muche bee thing condemned god shall onely kindle wrath lo faithfull ought hold themselues awe moreouer whe see wicked lay baites euery side beare themselues hande haue greatly gayned haue gotten muche rich taking bribe gift let v say yet god legth shew hath vayne sayd heare place whiche holy ghost hath vttered mouth eliphas god wil suffer threatnings vayne match execution anone ye see must quiet see rap rend pill poll side verely must assure selues thing shall continue god take suche order bene farre better haue eaten bare breade haue bene contented little tha haue glutted themselues fashion men cost haue drawen themselues make themselues rich euery whit must go nought house muste fall vpon heades say good haue gathered shall bee ruine destruction true time shall haue scope may well seeme state shall last euer let v pacient tarry god leysure sayde afore till finish woorke meane lette v desire nothing stande grace fauour truely onely meane mainteyne v state time life also giue v better life death hath promised v kingdome heauen nowe let v caste selues downe presence oure good god acknowledgement oure faultes praying gyue v suche repentaunce wee maye chaunge naughty life day daye desire thing renounce al naughty affection thing may turne v seruice greate number wicked lustes wherevnto subiect giuen forsomuch wee full infection may please vpholde v mercie dayly pardon v faultes vntill hee haue fully clothed v agayne rightuousnesse time shall haue taken v worlde make v part taker heauenly glorye may please graunt grace v also c lxij sermon first vpon xvj chapter little remnant laste verse fifteenth chapter iob ansvvered saide haue often hearde suche thing yrksome comforter vvhen vvill bean ende vvindy vvoordes vvherevvith imboldenest thou thy selfe ansvvere coulde speake soulevvere soules steade coulde holde company talke coulde nod heade could strengthen vvith vvoordes talke receiuegriefe speake sorrovve vvill abate hold peace vvhat releefe haue hath loden vvith anguish hath made congregation desolate hath parched vvith vvrinckles vvitnesse leannesse come vpon mee vvhiche vvitnesseth face hath torne mee vvrath hee hath handled furiously grindeth teeth mee mi emie sharpeneth mee stareth vvith eye agaynst eliphas hath told v wicked despizers god cursed matter go againste conclusion hee addeth conceyue sorrowe bring foorth peyne aud belly breedeth craft deceyte vvhereby hee doeth v witte outwarde shewes whiche wicked folkes haue boote awhit god turneth cleane contratie theyr thinking meanes whereof bee disappoynted expectation true sentence expounded thoughe reason eliphas rendreth witte god afflicting cursing wicked hypocrite without cause nothing practize mischiefe whole worlde therfore trouble neyghbours payed like measure truely holy scripture doth oftentimes vse manner speaking seuenth psalme esay also sayeth nine fyftieth chapter therefore holy ghost meeneth declare men giuen naughtineffe sinne intentes thought affection vseth similitude woman child vvhen haue conceiued peine saieth say whereas haue conceiued deuised mischiefe agaynst neyghboures trouble oppresse bryng foorthe iniquitie say execute mischiefe deuised sense agreeth texte haue sayde already eliphas hath already heretofore rendred sufficient reason god much wicked meeneth say although behight themselues good hope beare themselues hande shall compasse theyr matter meanes yet ende shall bee confounded bicause nothing god blissing maketh v prosper therefore shall winne nothing foding themselues hope theyr harte god shall turne topsiteruie heere scripture speaketh maner sixe twentith chapter prophet esay sayde lorde haue traueled thy face woman childe yet haue conceyued brought foorth nothing winde verely faithfull speake complaine wise god howbeeit acknowledge confesse theyr sinnes time sayde traueled woman childe god persecute iustly offence say coceiued brought foorth wind say assoone looked ease theyr misery vanished altogither intoo ayre smoke long lingering peyne miserie neuer awhit amended eliphas passeth sayth wicked breede childe bring foorth mischiefe themselues bellie nurrisheth deceyte say vayne guilefull hope shall deceyue ende threatning god vttereth three thirtieth esay againste skornfull whiche haue made none account worde specially whiche haue bin hardened behold saith ye coceiue chaffe bring foorth dung say bee stubborne againste word bicause ye cannot perceiue euill haue committed howe sore haue prouoked wrath agaynst flattering selues shall stande steade notwithstanding youre flattery shall perceiue haue conceiued nothing chaffe stubble shall vanishe away ayre shall know flattery haue profited nothing wee see effecte eliphassis meening wicked may time well ease god presse hard shall fode themselues hope yet shall god beste worst presse shall haue worme gnaw within theyr owne conscience shall alwayes prick shall haue remorse sting torment secretly yea ende god shall sende strong excessiue anguishe shall bee dryuen force bring foorth whiche haue bred inwardly bellie conceyued nothing guyle saye although perceyued theyr owne harmes firste yet nothing worke owne decay seeyng fauoure god warranted themselues yet came cace nothing playne deceyte nowe lette v come iobs answere hee telleth firste hee often hearde like thing therefeore bee yrksome comforter specially setting vpon troublesome woords saying often heard like thing hee meeneth shoulde haue brought ordinarie common remedy seeing miserie greate extreme shoulde rather haue brought louing comforte suche mighte haue serued turne haue hilde suche talke men woont doo slight fashion measurably afflicted thus yee see iob meente saying hee oftentimes hearde suche matter afore surelye whensoeuer man bringeth v comfort wee acquainted withall afore wee muste holde skorne though instructed cocerning god goodnesse exhorted pacience day may escape oure remembraunce wee shall neuer thinke vppon true matter bee darke vnto v neuerthelesse bee afflicted man put v remembrance hath bin tolde v afore lette v thinke needelesse talke cace standeth vpon practizing haue heard e vnderstood howbeit yet touched quicke bicause occasio serued god nip v distresse heauinesse doth make v taste comfort men haue drawen worde brought vnto v good faith iob none nicelings alwaies longing wote nouelties cannot abide man tell one tale twice say haue hearde afore haue hadde mine eares cloyed tale yea yet haue neede haue beaten still man telleth v one thing often greate profit furtherance iob poynt greeued make account good lesson bicause common nother curious desire saide afore hee sheweth simply miserie excessiue hee neede comforted extraordinarie manner like man sicke common disease folke also vse lighte remedie disease bee sharpe phisition muste fayne proceede applie one medicine disease thing like cace aduersities vvee see man sorrowfull deathe father wife child else losse happened vnto vvell one bringeth meane comfort god hath set foorth bee tormented one manner onely whiche feeleth hande god persecuting side soone one inconuenience befalne followe two three mo necke hee onely afflicted body person goodes frends also haue seene iob pressed spirituall temptation thoughe god meent drowne vtterly must go work exquisite fashion ye vexe poore man already hartbroken purpose shall bring serue muche better man hilde peace god myght worke supply default men thus ye see iob meent beholde eliphas telleth iob god punisheth wicked men shew himselfe iudge world may well fence theselues cannot scape handes hee vtterly destroye howe greate traynes bandes men soeuer haue man apply matter vnto iob muche beare downe god hys enimie bycause hee wicked man also bene nothing hypocrisie beholde matter misapplyed therefore withoute cause hee sayeth gotoo knowe thing euen nowe coulde serue myne owne turne neede cace iob conceyued minde hee punished sinnes sake god suche intente hee felte himselfe faultie woorthy indure yet god listed examine rigoure bicause hee knewe god handled sinnes sake another intent iob knowing reiecteth talke hild bycause vnreasonable yrksome comforter mee sayeth hee reason bycause brought conuenient remedy heereby wee bee warned wee minde comforte neyghboures heauinesse trouble wee muste go randon many men doo haue song one haue regarde whome sing man muste bee handled one fashion man another example bee one stubborne god cace man muste speake another manner style tearmes poore creature hath walked alwayes simplicitie according maladie needefull man bee warned proceede thereafter example men bee dullardes muste bee cryed vnto negligence muste bee rebuked intente maye feele hande god humble themselues vnder therefore wee haue neede greate wisedome wee comforte whome god afflicteth wee ought doo thus yee see wee haue beare minde concerning sentence sayde suche pretended comforte iob yrkesome comforter bycause broughte thing whereby hee might fare better nowe iob addeth vvhen bee ende youre wyndy woordes hee tearmeth woordes wyndy wherein substance saye whiche able edifye man according holye scripture vseth similitude requyred man shoulde bee taughte howe obtayne saluation sayde hee edifyed howe euen bycause hee firste founded afterwarde buylded vppon hee confirmed feare god hee confirmed lawe hee confirmed pacience beare affliction stedfastly afterwarde hee fully resolued praye vnto god prayse flee vnto contrariwise word trouble one brayne man trifle babble hearer receyueth good instruction apply welfare wyndy wordes lette v marke meddle exhortation doctrine aboue thing behooueth v tende sayde substantialnesse witte suche heare v may receyue good instruction maye bee inured walke according godlynesse bee grounded truste mercye frame themselues call vppon doubtinglye waueringly assuring themselues shall bee hearde yee see howe wee oughte study instructe oure neyghboures substantially thing whiche wee haue learned may slippe away like winde furthermore euery v muste also bende suche teaching wee couet bee filled wynde wee see manye curiouse folke woulde fayne haue men listen vntoo myghte feede eares satisfye theyr fonde fancy imagine woulde fayne haue men lysten theyr complayntes dispute matter edifying minde man ouermuche inclined vice yea wholly gyuen vnto euerie v shoulde followe owne appetite certaine woulde bee none question among v howe wee myghte holde vnprofitable talke whiche shoulde spredde ayre haue substance aught winde therefore learne seeke whiche good conuenient edifye v feare god fayth pacience good profitable thing thus yee see wee haue remember sentence iob maketh mention windye woordes neuerthelesse wee muste also take heede oure selues wee refuse talke shall bee ministred vnto v thoughe wyndy wee muste learne taste whither bee vanitie good instruction may knowe apply oure owne vse therewithall lette v pray god bee graciouse v man ministreth good doctrine vnto v may slippe away v vanish ayre owne heedlesnesse man commeth informe v god worde behooueth v knowe isalwayes good instruction towardes many take profit applie whole witte minde fleeting fro god worde doth vanishe winde bycause haue sure groundednesse neuerthelesse better applying lesson vse euery one v sayde afore muste looke narrowly himselfe followeth iob freendes cace hee coulde speake doo holde company talke pleade nod heade truly expound sentence iob woulde render like vnto hee sawe like trouble woulde rather indeuer asswage misery giue releefe increase sorrowe towardes according wee haue seene vnmercifulnesse none talke among dryue holye persone despayre god hadde hilde vp take sentence sense mooued thereto reason namely vnseemelye matter iob woulde bee desyrous reuengemente god withdrawen hande hee woulde mocke poore menne like calamitie hee ease although none cause affliction hee himselfe indured yet shoulde teache haue pittie compassion vppon suche neede well considered iob meeneth shewe heere hee woulde doo man myghte doo hee lyke plyghte therefore hee meeneth hee woulde bee euen wyth hadde troubled wilfullye onely hee coulde bee merrie hee effecte hee meeneth thus talke well youre ease yee shake head yee passe condemning mee plunge mee bottomlesse pittes thus yee doo folke knowe indure miserie youre cace coulde doo muche woulde take come shake head youre calamity sawe hand god nippe extremitie shoulde say well bestowed god muste bee fayne chastize make feele howe hee punisheth sinner ouerwhelmed miserie speake sorte might yee saye skorner cruell persone bethinke youre selues well lo effect iobs meening nowe see sharpened vnto reuengement haue feare god bee anye man disquieteth woulde fayne laye power render twice muche displeasure hath bene done iob minde truely standeth god child hande brydle themselues although men trouble vexe v yet v runne vpon haue persecuted v wrongfully god sendeth vnto v meeken v behooueth v knowe bee roddes come hande neuerthelesse men come trouble v without cause wee maye well example iob tell wee coulde doo like man shall neuer knowe faulte well vntill hee bee tolde face man perceyueth mischeefe may retourne vppon owne heade hee restreyneth himselfe falleth saying howenowe vvhat doe beholde god bring v vpright indifferencie sayeth thou shalt none otherwise thy neyghboure thou wouldest done vnto thy selfe truely hee coulde haue sayde vvhen yee haue doo youre neyghboures see yee deale indifferentlye vprightlye yee bee giuen wicked couetousnesse spoyle men goodes looke yee desire enriche youre selues losse man verely sayeth hee scripture conclusion hee setteth downe saying doo yee woulde bee done vnto man great clerke matter concerne owne profite wee lyke well dispute say vvhat suche man hath one wrong christian parte doo vprightnesse poynte lewde cruell man euerye man therefore skill dispute well reason equitie righte cace concerneth owne profite poynte whervnto iob sendeth freendes bycause bee blynde saying suche extremitie hee woulde bee gladde men shoulde handle gentlye therefore hee coulde doo lesse bryng backe naturall equitie making comparison betweene himselfe hee sayeth come yee like plighte yee see mee reason shoulde minister talke vnto mee man shoulde handle fashion go woorke mee howe woulde take oughte bee mooued haue sayde already long wee bee oure selues saye long matter toucheth v ne lyghteth vppon v wee runne crossing cace touche selues learne better aduised thus yee see effect iob meant say nowe may wee gather good lesson hereof according lord iesus christes forealleadege sentence wee shoulde doo another man whiche wee woulde haue done oure selues wee haue god lawe printed harte haue generall principle abide v cause iudgement peruerted corrupted drawe alwayes backwarde god hath sooner giuen v good rule straightwayes moued ambition hatred pride couetousnesse lo peruerted bee ambitiouse vaunte selues wee fall despizing oure neyghboures wee bee rashheaded oure tung runne rouers wee well vnderstande grounde cace led pryde woulde aduaunce selues plucking backe whome wee see go afore v wee bee prouoked hatred malice blinded loue parcialitie vvhat bee done let v enter ourselues pray god guyde v open harte wee may discerne arighte saying go matter concerned thy selfe wouldest thou saye lo howe wee myght become wise discreete stayed witte applying thing selues whiche cast againste others wee bee much giuen selfeloue selfeprofite sayde nature holdeth v harde euerye man loue yea ouerfarre loue himselfe therefore wee shall bee lesse excused vice founde v seeing bee often exhorted followe vprightnesse indifferencie lette v pray god woorke suche wise v vice may bee turned vertue holy spirite lette v consider imported saying thou shalte loue thy neyghboure thy selfe vvhat cause euery man steppeth oute boundes wee loue oure selues muche despise oure neyghbours bicause wee bee diligent inough practizing whiche sayde vnto v namely muste bee muche giuen loue oure selues wee muste loue neyghboures oure selues wee ought consider god hath created v owne image therewithall wee bee one nature heerewithall also hee telleth v wee oughte agree true brotherhoode linked vnto v thus yee see wee haue remember sentence iob telleth accused vniustly woulde bee loth others like therefore meete abuse pacience fashion lo wee haue gather effecte sayde nowe bolde peace shall profite mee speake ease shall haue heere iob intendeth preuente obiection myghte haue bene layd freendes myght haue sayde comforte thy selfe seeyng thou arte well able doo seeyng thou couldest woorke woonders wee cace thou arte go nowe shewe thy cunning vppon thy selfe hee sayeth see selfe miserable cace maye bee knowe may hope god pincheth straunge fashion speake increase sorrowe holde peace neuer eased beholde man swallowed vp aduersitie thus yee see iob meante say effect namely whether spake whither hilde peace hee way eased marke also dauid two thirtith psalme complayneth aduersitie pinch streyne wist become shifte make vvhen lament sayeth thinke haue asswagement sorrow meanes fire kindled keepe mouth shut bee minded caste selfe downe god harte vexed still torne peeces greefe nippeth quick neuer awhitte restrayned therby another place hee sayeth hee determined himselfe speake one worde haue bin dumbe long wicked full scope able sayth keepe touch minded bridle selfe maner end boylings fayne burst like greate fire vnder potte althoughe potte bee couered yet must skumme needes leape one side well worthy noted god sendeth v sicknesse pouertie seemeth v neuer man handled roughly wee bee cause either driueth v despaire else prouoketh v vtter impaciece fall lifting vp selues god else beare oure selues hand although god afflicteth faithfull haue bene v yet weake wee bee yea vtterly voide passion also cause increasing oure greefe vvherefore let v remember howe sayde god hath pinched seruants say euen whome hee loued whose welfare deere precious sight hath oftentimes brought extremitie able looke vp nother wist speake hold peace dauid made suche consession without cause instruction god child wee see man indued vertue hauing co stacy holy ghost neuerthelesse throwen downe hee woteth doo man wittes let v make profit god send v hard temptation driuen last cast wee let v thinke straunge bee firste haue bene serued dauid sheweth v way hee waded like myre god reached hande hee humbled vttermost holpe vp agayne vvherefore lette v doubt hee still shewe v mercie haue bene hilde downe time see good needefull v haue example eye surely make v oure infirmitie shall ouermaister v temptation fierce vpon v wee knowe become wee wyll bethinke v well see seruantes god haue bene v although greate giftes grace fayne notwithstanding grone vnder hande god wiste become meanes god mente ridde pride teache experience ought stoupe vnder please strike v downe day meane condicionally ende also bee lyke notwithstanding wee smarte meane lette mindes bee troubled sith thing shall turne oure profite welfare lo wee haue note cocerning doctrine conteyned iob addeth god pincheth suche wise shoulde seeme intended rend peeces saying betokeneth haue seene heeretofore namely afflicted bodie also touched greatest forest temptation could yea bitter one wit hee tormented inwardly bicause god mortall enemie certesse sayth leannesse body withering witnesse god wrath full wrinckles flesh good halfe rotten alreadie heerein man may see token dreadfull affliction god handleth comonly wont handle whome hee chastizeth roddes payne excessiue therfore effect matter iob intended expresse heere wee haue note god ment giue v lookingglasses suche haue excellent vertues ende theyr persones might learne knowe according hee dealeth foorth giftes holy spirite thereafter also doth hee sende greate affliction themselues trying chastyzing vttermoste intente make esteemed bring foorthe fruite example looke vpon abraham gouerned god spirite common persone angell full excellencie perfection mighte bee yet howe god deale wee indure tenth part combattes abraham susteyned ouercame thing vvee woulde quyte quayle god spareth v bycause hee hath gyuen v excellent giftes hee gaue muche bee sayde dauid beholde dauid onely god prophet also king gouerned holy chozen people vertues well woorthie renowme prayse yea euen woonderment yet howe god turmoyle vve see complayntes maketh onely despyzed shaken persone also saying god hilde heere earth vpon racke hee forced shewe extremitie hee come vnto without cause hee often sayeth passed fire water hee bene plunged deepe gulfes hee felte god dartes hee god arrowes shotte hand god hath lyen heauy vpon verie bone bene broken remayned nother marye substance vvhen wee heare kinde speech seeme v bee mockerie god purposed set v foorth liuely picture according whiche haue sayde wee might knowe god giueth greate vertues vnto men dothe hee exercise liuely intent vertues idle bee knowne due time place besides let v marke way chiefest temptation euer faythfull endured spirituall battels wee terme witte god summoned conscience made feele wrath smyting suche wise wist cace stood pludged deeper distresse bodily aduersities could befall heere yee see also iob vseth similitude god grated teeth also see ezechias speaketh bycause passed temptation god sayth hath played lyon likewise vsed similitude afore hee vseth heere namely hee wist whither might speake hold peace sayth like swallowe chatter chirpe want wordes vtter griefe miserie haue toung deliuer herevpon hee commeth afterwarde shewe god hathe crasshed broken bone lyon holdeth pawes teeth howe god bee likened lyon cruell beast ezechias mente accuse god crueltie speaketh owne feeling terrible payne hee endured god wrath vpon lette v marke poore creature entereth doubting cace hee god perceyueth god make feele goodnesse must needes bee greate distresse afflighted betweene wolues pawes vvee must imagine bee small thing man feele god wrath especially conceiue hee vtterly v therefore let v praye god hold v vp spare v knowing wee bee able beare burthen except giue v shoulder withall besides lette v praye vse rigour v might feele like lyon rather shewe selfe continuall father punish v desertes make v alwayes feele mercie meanes lord iesus christ end hath guyded v life holie spirite may lift v vp euerlasting glorie angel hath purchased deerely v nowe let v cast selues flat face good god father acknowledgement sinnes praying make v feele wise beeing touched true repentance wee maye returne vnto knowing fauourable v wee haue desired forgiue v sinnes let v also beseech ridde v fleshly vice correcting sinfulnesse nature bring v perfection life guyded world holie spirite wee may glorifie name serue earnest zeale dedicating selues wholly vnto according hee hath prouoked v goodnesse may please c lxiij sermon second vpon xvj chapter open mouthe giue mee buffet vvaye reproch gather themselues gither god hath put handes malicious hath dismayde vvicked prospered threvve dovvne hee hath caught mee necke set butte himselfe archer hem side slitteth reines spareth poureth gall vpon ground hath broken vvith breaking vpon breaking hath runne ouer gyant haue sovved sackcloth vpon skin loden glorie vvith dust face vvexed blevve vvith vveeping mine eyeliddes couered vvith shadovve death yet guile handes praier pure verie greeuous hard thing mortall man god setteth himselfe againste maketh feele aduersarie man conceiue howe greate miserie onely experience cause iob vsed similitude lyon saw afore said rent piece deuoured god lion maner king ezechias also speaketh haue sayd alredy accuse god crueltie bicause anguishe wretched sinner suffer god pursueth cannot expressed sufficiently requisite put mynd thing end god touch v quicke may dismaied feare may consider faithful haue liued v haue passed way god hathe deliuered intente wee ceasse call vpon alwayes feared least plunged dispayre wee could call vpon god finde helpe let v marke poore creature maner drowned god maketh feele wrath yet neuerthelesse wee must still flee vnto distresse propertie draw men graues heale woundes hee hath made yea euen rayse v vp death iob complayneth heere another temptation wicked haue opened mouth mocke haue buffeted waye reproche haue assembled togither vvhen men set selues sorte v renueth miserie indure vvhy diuell serueth owne turne suche scoffe v spite v ouerthrowe roote vp fayth vtterly possible iob speaketh heere expressely wicked two consideration irkesomer thing god doth manner giue bridle wicked persecute child trample vnder feete true good men oughte thinke yet seemeth vnreasonable thing god giue libertie despisers maiestie folke wholly giuen vnto euill faythfull oppressed thus yee see one reason iob speaketh heere expressely malicious sayth selfesame people labour always bring passe may haue trust god giue selues wickednesse turne away quite goodnesse see doone lorde iesus christe true mirroure patterne faythfull verely dauid indured like wee see hapned sonne god sure rule v belongeth v see wherevnto saying iobs referred ouer besides terrible feare wherin haue seene men also lifting themselues vp haue labored driue despayre reprochfully buffeted though god cast vp spoyle made reckening lo haue marke effecte written sake euer god shall suffer wicked mocke affliction aduaunce themselues rage may seeme shall vtterly ouerwhelmed may greatly dismayd iob hath indured like battels yet see ende happie god hath shewed v person haue passed many temptation wel able help v still therfore let v trust rest vpon grace goodnesse lo haue marke streine iob saith expresly god hath also deliuered hand wicked saying wel worthy noted imagin wicked list consider god gyueth bridle farre forth himselfe listeth passe giueth leaue aboue sayde deserueth well noted forepossessed opinion wicked god hande may take much scope list god redresse come must needes bee vtterly ouerthrowne whither shall flee succour knowe god holdeth satan whelpes lyam onely stirre one finger v also intend thinke thing without god ordinance wee flee boldly oft persecuted assuring selues remedie hande good disposition also wee haue humble ourselues face wicked might bestirre themselues god meddle woulde neuer come mynde acknowledge correction chastizementes god thinke v sinnes mourne might haue pitie v wee knowe wickeddest roddes hee holdeth hande beate v correcte v withall short practize well prophet sayth wee haue eye hande stryketh v stone dartes stroke cudgelles hitte v bee verie profitable consideration v beholde still wee haue marke iob sayth simply wicked ranne vpon god hathe besieged euen hee himselfe hathe deliuered addeth oppressed extremitie manner speech hee vseth tende ende vttered sayth hee beene beaten downe astonished god caught neck rent piece set butte shoote archer hemmed side hee slitte asunder yea hee broken broken againe hereby iob sheweth hee come extremitie affliction impossible fynde creature pressed miserable hee wee haue seene god afflicted well bodie goodes also owne wife yee see iob might well liken himselfe marke men shoote god sent one kynd aduersitie alone digge pitte downe hell caste deeper afterwarde hee loded suche weight impossible creature beare greater strength man soothly maruel haue constancie notwithstanding infirmity wee see god strengtheneth owne making vtterly insensible yet taking feeblenesse quite away muste bee fayne acknowledge themselues bee witte frayle creature yet meane season god releeueth infirmitie setteth vp againe bee caste downe thus yee see happened vnto iob nowe way hee sayth hee clothed himselfe sackcloth couered heade duste hee hypocrisie besides hee sayth none thinges besell misdeedes robberie say hee founde handes prayer pure vvherby hee meeneth hee thinketh affliction strange sith hee offended god suche sort might deserue bee handled temptation wee haue seene often iob calleth still rememberance nowe let v lay foorth matter particularly apply oure vse similitude iob vseth importeth good lesson similitude god hath set white butte hath sette archer againste besette round haue sort torn piece gall tumbled vpon ground say hee wounded verie heart speaking iob mente expresse god afflicted common manner nowe let v looke selues wee suffer neuer little aduersitie wee thinke ouer great god keepeth measure pitie see howe nyce wee bee needeth hold v skirmish vttermost long making moane might thought part feblenesse make stir lift vp themselues god common aduersitie haue abide ouergreat impaciencie signe wee neuer god schoole learne suffer yeeld obedience end may learne strong indure chastizementes god sendeth v let v beare mynde shewed v heere namely iob excellent holinesse whome god loued well neuerthelesse set vp white shoote told must strong affliction harden selues againste god chawe vpon brydle wee see many men doe maketh men hardharted suffereth brought repentance therefore must tender harted behalfe wit soone god ticketh v must streitways awake thinke vpon tarie till drawe sword v wound v till lette arrowes flee v thunder vpon v vvhat soone giueth v one stripe rodde although softly wee must bee quiet verely wee wise well aduised wee would tarrie till strike much one stroke would warned threatnings hie v apace come home touched v yee see expedient profitable faythfull shuld feele god hand hard stroke horse dull vpon spurre men like better menne thinke good propertie vice euen v though god strike v sword onely shewe v shadowe rodde yet must moued yet neuerthelesse wee must therwithal bee strong wise haue told must heart ouersorowfull griefe might assuaged haue feeling god gracious goodnesse pressed canot mean reclaime selues bycause take conceit god aduersarie haue trust al goodnesse impossible shuld come neere rather flee fro whe gone away stil labor draw therfore must plucke vp good hart aduersities may call vpon god afrayde returne vnto trusting readie shewe v mercie wee seeke good pure rightmeening mynde ye see wherevnto word haue touched tende namely wee must bee nyce affliction rather feele time may returne vnto god also god hauing sent v aduersitie double may griped exceedingly within without yet lette v assure selues yet come iob therfore continued call vpon god flee still vnto refuge v turne away fro thus yee see wee haue marke sentence nowe whereas heere mention made god archer notable similitude wee se howe men alwayes troubled come affliction present life wee father vpon god wee ought doe wee imagine alwayes come misfortune else meanes men bee short wee iudge disorderly shape selues vnto god cause holie scripture besides telleth v life death light darkenesse good euill god hande vseth also familiar co parisons ende matter may expressed v better according sayde heere god set archer aray iob speakes hee heere men misery iob indure misery termed god archer ende shoulde learne god afflicteth v hee commeth well furnished iudge haue officer come strong companie apprehende malefactor yee see god vseth aduersities feele present life therfore let v thinke misfortune indure sickenesse pouertie lyke aduersities worlde numberlesse lette v assure oure selues god hathe innumerable meanes correct v listeth howe listeth moyses meeneth hee sayth thing locked vppe god cofers hee hath spoken misery happen man hee addeth cofers say haue treasurer good thinges pleaseth mee shewe fauoure loue towardes men yea haue wherewith good manner world meanes incomprehensible contrarie part also list punishe men shall feele howe doe wist euer knewe thus yee see howe god haue incomprehensible ryches knowne vntoo v well voutsauing poure benefites vpon v also contrarie vvherefore let v sure euer pleaseth plague v hee doe straunge manner vvell wee scaped one miserie second followe yea innumerable come one another lo haue remember verse furthermore whereas iob addeth newe gall poured vpon grounde kidneyes open shredde piece lette v beare mynde haue touched afore witte god punisheth pursueth v extremitie hand becommeth grieuous ouerheauie beare wee muste therefore bee muche discouraged dulled lette v beethinke v whiche iob knewe muche wee haue doe god lette v sighe grone humilitie according also hee himselfe addeth saying eye face blubbered weeping hee hadde sowed sackclothe vppon skinne hee couered heade duste vvhat ledde iob doe verely bycause knewe god hande vpon misery light vpon none came fortune god visitation iob bene persuaded booted hym haue put sackcloth vpon backe next skinne haue cast dust vpon heade true whiche thinke vpon god fayle make great complaynts weepe howle weare sackcloth aright shall neuer except haue eye vnto god way although hypocrite knowe god aright yet haue conceit whe shewe signes repentance true saw within finde nothing fainednesse neuerthelesse ceremonie whereof iob speaketh sure signe men informed confesse god iudge muche iob vnfaynedly say hee benummed vnbeleeuers god handle thing roughly thinke themselues see misfortune hapned looke iob knewe fully resolued behoued impute thing vnto god learned lesson profited wel one day meene learned practize throughly ought men well inough confesse disease deathes misery warres plague famine suche thing come god come proofe bee amazed able make conclusion say ourselues vvell seeing god visiteth v co meth home vnto v behoueth v nowe returne vnto heretofore haue played looce coltes haue wilfully run astray nowe rayneth v rough bit hee shaketh rodde v yea maketh v feele therefore wee must learne stoupe vnder hande contrariwise howe deale wee behalfe man bee afflicted poynte wil else chafe grind teeth grudging god surely man tell hath offended god easily graunt true hath true remorse restreine himselfe sayd haue confused conceit hereby man maye see fewe haue lesson well printed hearte affliction god archer garded shew iudge much sayd ordinarie aduersities happen commonly people whole countrie touched warre according pollings extorcions outrage doone howe many men thinke vpon god vve see rore yet wee consider god guydeth sterne vvhen see turmoyling wee admonished marke note muche textes holie scripture wherein god sheweth v looking glasse rather liuely picture side soeuer men afflicted becommeth acknowledge bee hande god specially whole coutrie plagued must acknowledged god visitation vvherfore thing hapneth let v follow example iob wee haue wepte yea euen till oure face bee formeygred teares wee muste come confesse faultes desire god pitie v sayde afore vnbeleeuers also weepe behoueth v set selues vnto god doubt make account teares according also heare dauid saith god putteth bottle vvhen bee scourged wee lette v flee succour god weepe true lowlinesse surely ther shall one teare droppe eye shall come bee accounted presence sacrifice euerychone according also saide one fyftith psalme sorrowfull hearte hearte cast downe pleasant sacrifice vnto god teares tende ende witness fleeing vnto god lowlynesse acknowledging much hand v none remedie beseech mercifull v certayne sayde make account teares specially wee troubled wicked men insteade making two diuels one say wit steade rendering euill euill come beseech god assuage hande set order thing confuzed let v assure oureselues lyke hee put vp dauids teares intoo bottle hee shall lost though fall grounde god meene neuer forget yee see howe must applie doctrine owne instruction wit wee weepe god afflicteth v oure teares must bee teares sillie witlesse folke knowe themselues meene wherevnto ought directe themselues wee must directe selues vnto god mourne confyrmed iob sayth hee clothed himselfe sackcloth couered heade dust surely thing signes repentance like wretched offender sue grace hee cloth himselfe wedding apparell hee come combed frisled brauerie iudge hee rather come hee maye moue compassion saye hee come sorrowfull heauie countenance hee come coursly apparelled mourner faithful haue outward signes repentance god afflicted haue confessed sinnes might obteine forgiuenesse wont cloth selues hayre sackcloth cast dust vpon heades dooing allowed god vvhy firste men neede quicken vp themselues bycause slowe colde therefore take conuenient helpe spurre selues forwarde superfluous syth wee knowe commeth humbling selues god go lazily fashion sake vvee well say wee bee faultie wee well cast foorth sighes meane season wee consider offence number infinite excessiuely great wee ought right dismayd feare death wee come oure iudge neuerthelesse seeming ynough cast foorth sigh twaine away seeing coldnesse v lette v assure selues wee haue neede spurred lyke ass lo wherevnto sackcloth dust auncient father serued vsed sayde ceremonie nought also behooueth v come vnto god wee cast dust vpon oure heades bodie created like must haue heart settled vpon god must oure body also bee answerable therevnto whole man must dedicated vnto god homage nowe wee see thing fond trifle auncient father ware haire sackcloth backes therewithall also cast dust vpon heades iob ment speaking neuerthelesse prophete ioell sayth rende heartes garmentes meaning reiecte outward signes directeth talke hypocrite thought themselues well discharged playde fewe ape toyes men made goodly shew might seeme well seasoned repentance yea sayth hee garmentes beare good recorde yee make many bragges shewe selues good penitent hart continue still stubborne naughtinesse harde stithies thing ought haue begonne furthermore notwithstanding hee sayth people take sackcloth ash cast themselues vpon ground weepe god gouernours haue publike charge begin rest people follow see auncient father vsed sackcloth duste came open witnessing repentance god true nowe adayes wee bee tyed bound suche manner doings neuerthelesse repentance ought wee would bee frozenharted necessity haue alledged found v also men olde time willing spurre vp themselues knowledge owne sinnes putting sackcloth backes praye shall become v haue feruent zeale craue pardon god wee pulled downe mislike offence sorie requisite ala much behoof wee bee dull behalfe auncient father needed humble selues acknowledging sinnes much neede doe vve thinke whit thereby seene skil neither god iudgement owne sinnes true sinnes may perchaunce well ynough knowne v perceyue owne filthinesse bee ashamed bee grieued selues part care hearken yet notwithstanding written vaine let v learne v afflicted although ware sackcloth ne cast dust vpon heade yet ought much stirre vp selues meanes see meete v vvhen man selfe alone let bethinke himselfe thus well pray god hartily doe let aduise himselfe suche meane good mee cast selfe vpon earth lay mouth dust beeing abashed ashamed god shoulde touch mee neerely quicke prouoked flee god succour beholde say howe euerie man ought prouoke himselfe particularly specially neede constreyneth v wee see wee haue great neede presently also let v stirre vp selues togither soone god sendeth plague famine thinke wee bee pleasant sacrifize men made solemne protestation great small confessed sinnes euerie man stirred vp neighbour doe contrariwise come bolt vpright seemeth wee perceiue god chastizements giue slip doe wee wonder hee double blowes yea punishe v seuen folde sayde lawe vvee haue skill inough chafe demaund wherefore presseth v sore yea wee consider hee went meeken v beate backe blowes pryde sturdinesse fayne necessitie double let v bethinke v practize better lesson shewed v iob furthermore let v marke well sayth conclusion witte extorcion robberie hand prayer bene pure iob addeth sayde signifie suche manner affliction straunge hath spoken heeretofore surely euer god afflicteth v beholde wee must wee must enter selues examine owne liues therevpon according wee haue offended must lament god say ala lorde thou afflictest sore deed compare fault wey ballance aduersitie indure ala lorde knowe haue offended thee many wayes thou shouldest plunge euen hell well worthie lo haue doe perceiue god afflicteth v sinnes verie sore temptation v fall reasoning oure selues howe nowe vvhat haue trespassed vvherefore doth god handle rigorously see spareth wicked haue indeuered serue good vpright conscience deede come farre short discharging dutie throughly yet haue euer kept forwarde yet notwithstanding vsed vnhappiest curse dst creature earth beareth ment geere ye see great temptation one able dismaye v according befell iob bee done behalfe first let v well aduised wee may like iob wee may say extortion oure handes easie matter man vaunte bragge soundnesse wee see wickedd est sort ashamed nowe adayes man admonisheth misdoings nothing perfection diuelishest would esteemed halfe angel sayd let v part serch throughly v without flatterie let v protest wee haue cleane handes except wee bee throughly like vnto iob performance must owne iudges iudge owne fancy manner men ought examine oure liues fourme shoulde frame inditement must saying weene suppose take weene stuffe must layde away vvhat let v come god lawe praye inlighten v holie spirite may throughly serch owne darknesse sinnes v terrible lurkingholes god therefore muste bee fayne light v vp cresset giue v wisedome discretion knowe vnderstande faultes suche wise wee may confesse thus yee see wee haue doe let v put cace god handling v oure sinnes good sooth hee mente suche thing towardes iob punishe desertes vvherefore hee hee intended trie pacience god may afflicte good men euill according wee see ezechiell indured much wickeddest ierusalem vvherein god speciall eye sinnes howbeeit although god punishe v according sinnes yet much say hee may doe list bee scourged hundred tymes iob god would send v sorer aduersities hee sent yet v wrog thus yee see wee haue marke therewithall behooueth v knowe god executeth iudgementes concealed kept v time beholde sometimes hee chastizeth v seemeth hee minded destroye v yet hee doth welfare true wee knowe presently wee shall knowe discoureth hidden againe iob handled roughly notwithstanding pure cleane handes appeere protestation wee shall heare make heereafter praye ought wee wonder nowe adayes god afflict v say v haue rebelled many wayes let euery v little bethinke himselfe shall finde wee haue committed many iniquity offence horrible god afflicteth v manner hee iob hee beareth v great deale giueth v stripe twaine rodde put cace strake v great blowes sword yet stroke deadly seeing sayde iob handled rigorously notwithstanding hys handes cleare prayer right god let v learne worlde plagued sorte cause wonder vvhy wee sure iniquitie water floud euery man feeleth particularly himselfe wee v infected vice common say hath walked vprightly hee may truely protest handes bee cleare god ala commeth farre short seeing let v sure whensoeuer indure affliction god punishment sinnes therefore wee may beare paciently let v assure selues haue deserued much neuerthelesse let v bee bolde flee vnto god praying voutsafe clenze v vnrightuousnesse cause misery wee endure present life maye please beare infirmity make v feele goodnesse ende wee may alwayes haue occasion glorifie euen vntill haue dispatched v flightfull life make v partaker euerlasting glorie nowe let v fall downe presence oure good god acknowledgement fault praying make v knowe wise farre foorth expedient v therewithall hee comforte v goodnesse reforme v holie spirit wee may neede bee persecuted roughly hand assoone giueth inckling may bee throughly moued humble oure selues vnder maye please accepte prayer selues also al haue need dayes according wee see howe sore whole wretched worlde plagued vvherefore let v beseech good god looke vpon eye pitie reason spreading mercie vpon v vpon nation earth wee may haue occasion sound forth prayses euery let v say almightie god heauenly father wee acknowledge confesse c lxiiij sermon third vpon xvj chapter sermon yet still vpon xvij verse vpon text followeth earth hide thou bloud neither let place cry euen novve vvitnesse heauen vvarrant eth highest place friendes rhetorician myne eye poure teares vnto god vvere lavvfull man reason vvith god vvith sonne man neighbor beholde short yeares shall slide avvaye enter vvaye vvhich shall come backe againe iob intending make protestation hys owne vpryghtnesse setteth downe heere twoo thinges witte hee hath delte amisse towards men hee hathe called vpon god purely referring life lawe bicause lorde sheweth howe wee muste serue howe wee muste bee conuersant among men insomuch often spoken without cause small matter bee able guide life suche wise maye please god vve see iobs intent namely shew indeuered serue god walk neighbour without hurting annoying bodie true heere hee setteth downe two particular howbeit meening comprehende whole hee sayth outrage excesse handes importeth muche liued withoute giuing man cause complayne shoulde say hee procured harme losse true wee may doe wrong iniurie without shew violence much men giue themselues harmefulnesse starte boundes streyne themselues racke one pill another deuour third therefore iob purposely sayeth beene rauening handes much ment seconde saying seruing god consisteth exercise prayer much chief point vnder particular iob hath comprehended whole nowe wee see sorte life may bee allowable afore god witte duely referred lawe god haue men liue owne swinge delight thinke best themselues owne iudges hee himselfe haue whole authoritie ouer v wee gouerned according word ende wee labour vaine let v learne walke according god commaundement marke one poynte verely oftentimes shewed v yet wee see howe worlde doth alwayes runne astraye men delight much owne fancy therefore without cause holie scripture doth often sende v poynt wee liue owne liking according god hath commaunded againe whereas vnder worde prayer heere mention made whole seruice god wee ought weye throughly part men thinke al praying vnto god wee see howe world dischargeth selfe verie lightly neuerthelesse scripture speaketh honouring god chiefest poynte setteth downe v prayer bene obserued ought bee manner praying bene much esteemed among men would haue swarued one waye haue followed holie scripture sheweth nowe cleane contrariwise come passe men haue taken scope praying vntoo god reckening made knowing good profytable bee prayed maner euerie man steppe like blinde bayarde commes duetifully vntoo god whence proceedeth ouerweenyng bycause wee take prayer bee thing great estimation wee tooke cheefe poynte god seruice certayne wee woulde go farre greater heartinesse againe wee see steade praying vnto god menne giuen praying sainctes deceased worlde yeeldeth thing creature peculiar vnto god thinketh bee otherwyse good man aske papistes terme virgin marie hope saluation flee hir euery one hath seuerall saincte patrone man tell blasphemie god verie hard make beleue bicause neuer knewe tasted holie scripture vttereth diligently wit serue god aright behooueth v praye vnto surely greatest honorablest seruice requireth v greatest souerainest worship alloweth v haue oure recourse vntoo papist considered would haue yrked haue gone deade creature say worship god rather yeelde due prayer principall seruice requireth oure handes yet conuey ouer creature peruerting order nature much better therefore ought wee marke throughly conteyned wit word prayer iob ment shewe serued god purely men nowe giue proofe vprightnesse let alledge gewgawes hypocrite wont doe saying haue wee fasted haue wee done wee muste vnderstande lorde haue v ruled lawe hee haue whole authoritie ouer v marke one poynt furthermore wee haue also note prayer shall neuer bee pure god acceptable vnto vnlesse handes bee cleere violence wee bee cruell wrangling neighbor god putteth v backe haue accesse vnto true many giue aduenture pray vnto god although full rauening haue troubled one tormented yet ceasse bee hardie ynough call vpon god surely prayer abhominable bycause handes stayned bloude say wicked doings heere yee see also god complayneth prophet esay iewes came weare pauement temple hee mocketh meening hee liketh comming temple making resemblance though ment worshippe sayth handes full bloud say ye haue ceassed anoy hurt neighbor nowe thinke giue accesse haue acquaintance thus yee see effecte haue consider sentence nowe iob addeth earth byde bloude neither let teares take place haue misinterpreted sentence earth bideth bloud vnderstood iob wish haue misery knowne much hee afflicted excessiue fashion hee desired bloude might hidden earth might crie vengeance purpose plagued men ment earth aske vengeance god againe otherside texte declareth selfe anon needes must man shet owne eye ouerseene easie matter iob heere toucheth two point one word earth hide blud neither let cry take place vvhat meeneth hee wishing cryes take place muche say hee hathe ouerlaboured himselfe cry turmoyling shall bee laboure lost bycause god refuseth hee come men shall gayne nothing syth cace standeth wee maye easily conclude saying earth hide bloude graunteth haue done amisse matter shall come account iudgement whole life shall bee layde afore inditement shall bee framed extremitie god handle according desert doubtlesse holy scripture worde bloude oftentimes taken horrible crime example lorde deliuer bloude saye lorde deliuer mee deadly sinnes haue commited vvherfore wee see iob place termeth trasgressions crime hee might haue committed name bloud according matter sayde handes cleere rauin confirmation thereof hee addeth god finde guiltie thing whatsoeuer hee contented shall come light account sinnes bee longer concealed god shoulde bring abroade throughly examined hee bee found faultie hee contented god shewe fauoure mercie afterward hee sayth although hee sighe shreeke yet notwithstanding let boote let al outcry lost may seeme god eares stopped see iobs meening heere haue call mynde thing hath beene treated afore iobs raging bycause hee looketh god soueraine iustice whiche perfecte exquisite creature able stande euen angelles hath beene sayde heeretofore iob looked well vpon would haue hilde awe neuer haue made suche protestation moreouer wee must call remembrance iobs intent iustifie himselfe though hee vtterly innocent loketh respect god punish deserued men commonly punished misdeed also god another respect wit ment set forth mirrour men trie pacience iob meeneth declare heere life wholly pure neuer done amisse meening god punisheth rigorously wicked caytife led licencious life men lo heere effect haue beare away v let v assure selues god plague v sinnes although conscience witnessed wee desire serue honour yea euen without hypocrisie yet notwithstanding shall come farre short beeing cleare ought bee wee bee found indaungered hundred thousand wayes therefore let euery man looke neerely whe know fault best let v sure god knoweth hundred time v selues knowe one fault god sharpe sighted sayth sainte iohn canonicall epistle let v learne humble oure selues beseech god hide faultes behoueth v come backe sayde two thirtie psalme namely blessed man whose sinnes lorde couereth whose iniquity hee calleth remembrance god discouer oure faultes must v perishe yea euen perfectest onely refuge welfare praye vnto god hide transgression maye come account intende iudge shift hell must prepared v furthermore let v desire god hearken cry vnworthy though bee god delay graunting requestes till wee haue serued perfection ala shall become v shall one gate shall bee shet hee shall haue entrance vnto god cry therfore must receiued notwithstanding haue deserued shaken neuerthelesse behoueth v doe indeuer liue quietly neighbor may haue god fauour finde one towards v desire vvhy written iudgement without mercie shall haue hath bene mercilesse ye see saint iames telleth v god deale rigorously v haue pittie compassion vpon neighbor heere vvhat thing betide v dreadfull god handleth v rigorously contrariwise hope v conceyue god vsing infinite goodnesse sheweth imputing sinnes v againe salomon sayth hee stoppeth eare cry poore shall cry himselfe heard neighbour aduersitie desire ayde yetnotwithstanding deafe shake yea worse also torment needes must feele vengeance god shall make v crie yea bring v deale wote become yet shall hearken v therefore haue sayd alreadie wee haue god mercifull v let v beware haue compassion aduersitie succor let v kepe selues crueltie outrage least thing written performed vpo v measure shall moten v wee mote neighbour thus ye see effect haue marke sentence followeth immediately also see witness heauen hee warranteth mee highest place friend play orator mine eye gush teares vnto god heere iob appealeth vnto god onely competent iudge bicause hee bene wrongfully condemned men doubteth appeale vnto god much hee knowes cace good true haue said already missehandleth cace howe hee iust cause mainteine soundnesse ye see cause afrayde appeale vnto god seeth men persecute wrongfully let v consider one iob intent vse rash boldnesse men vvhen matter commeth calling god witnesse pray maketh cursie conscience world adays full forswearing ther faithfulnesse vvhereof come bicause haue feeling god iustice come rushing seate like wilde beastes periurie forswearing spiting god though hee neither might authoritie punishe v vve denie wee call god bee oure witnesse iudge hee therefore sweareth falsely doth mocke god maiestie face yet see men make much account apparant hereby wee beare small reuerence maiestie god vvherefore muche oughte wee marke whiche sayde namely wee muste bee bolde protesting god calling recorde wee muste goe wee poynt yeelde accounte maner iob summoned haue seene heretofore shall see yet fully hereafter nowadays man bee accused crime althoughe taken tardie yea vtterly conuinced yet hee make conscience saye god witnesse wronged falsely accused howe happeneth god name ryfe mennes mouthes also hypocrite magnifye selues alwayes saye god priuie hearte knoweth referre cace hym happeneth doe wee thinke bycause god wynketh menne call recorde false standarde larum punisheth firste dashe whiche doe dallie therefore hee lengthe shewe whiche hee hath vttered lawe witte hee suffer name taken vaine reuendge wrong doone offering great reproch scorne maiestie sorte lette v marke well ofte muste come god behoueth v haue examined oure lyfe example iob wee bee rashe steppe foorth saye god witnesse wee haue thoroughly serched oure conscience god answere within v hee alloweth marke one poynte heerewithall wee haue marke worlde beare v recorde nothyng till god haue allowed hereby wee bee warned dispose lyfe fayre outewarde shewe wee see howe nothing vayngloriousnesse alwayes worlde men clappe handes v wee bee good estimation among ynough v wee woulde fayne god content himselfe yea hee lyke mortall men holye scripture sheweth vvee see outwarde appearance god searcheth hidden within hath eye truth vprightnesse speaketh prophete hieremie accordingly texte samuell seeing let v learne knowe behoueth v haue oure handes oure eye feete cleane neyther must wee thinke selues haue doone muche oure sinnes manifeste chief poynt haue recorde heauen saye god allowe doings haue declared alreadie vvhat manner allowaunce must wee haue god verely wee haue walked purenesse heart hath bin hypocrisie v wee haue onely outwarde shewe wee might saye worlde charge wee haue right meening mynde wee haue continued good dooing wee haue indeuered behaue oure selues god marked onely woorkes also thoughtes marke yet haue beare awaye sentence beholde sayth iob euen nowe recorde heauen vnder woorde euen also hee comprehendeth may wel take men witnesse hee passeth yet commeth euen vntoo god ought bee weyed whereas hypocrite call god witnesse dare put themselues triall menne bee wicked persone notoriously knowne bee suche one caste prison hee bee drawing gallowes hee brag honestie vttermoste yet meane whyle euerie man wil condemne yea steade three foure iudges shall haue hundred thousande euerie man saye marke mee yonder naughtypacke marke mee yonder theefe marke yonder murtherer marke yonder extortioner yonder swearer yonder extortioner yonder swearer yonder despizer god yet suche manner menne shamelesse make bone take god recorde honestie proteste knoweth bee readie answere matter come tryall menne shoulde haue thousande voyces condemne haue touched alreadye howe dare present themselues god bicause conceyue maiestie lo wee oughte weye well thys woorde euen sayeth iob hee presupposeth hee maye call men recorde euerie man beare witnesse hee hadde behaued himselfe hee bene eye blynde gardian fatherlesse defender widdowes hee serued stead legges cripple hande neuer bene shet poore wee see maketh protestation afterwarde iob walked suche wyse afore men hee sayeth hee myghte come euen god also whyche greate thing also wee see howe magnifyeth heere witnesse heauen well bee coniectured hee flung aduenture iustifye himselfe vnbrideled libertie mocker doe proteste mouth god knoweth yet life villanous verie ayre stinketh verye babe canne skyll speake thus yee see wee haue marke texte afterwarde hee addeth freendes playde oratours meane whyle eye poured oute teares afore god iob sheweth hee fayne referre himselfe god iudgement namely bycause fyndeth reason vprightnesse among men surely verie greate temptation wee bee plagued worlde taketh v bee forsaken god pollicie diuels driue v despaire vvhen poore man smitten god roddes miserie indureth heauie inoughe selfe nowe one come laye double loade vppon backe casting teeth howe appeareth plainly hee vtterly forsaken god ynough ouerwhelme speake wicked stubborne sorte whome god plagueth sinnes speake suche haue walked vprightly yet notwithstanding god hathe missed afflict true haue wel deserued hee hath alwayes eye vnto nowe hee intendeth mortifye tyme come bicause yet sufficiently tamed fayne cut away leude affection furthermore haue learne needfull pray vnto put theyr whole trust finally wil haue pacience shewed thus ye see good man tendeth godward walketh playnely shall notwithstandyng haue greate plague nowe proofe god taketh greater sinner men surely yet man threape vpon inough caste intoo despaire iob delte let v marke well sayde temptation hard burthensome therfore let v resort remedie must vse wit presente selues god without tying selues ouermuche vnto men according iob hathe discoursed heere afore frendes sayth play oratours againste mee meeneth oughte haue comforted partly haue assuaged grief haue taken plesure mocke rhetorike wherof speaketh nothing else filed toungs mock vexe put besides himselfe hapned vnto iob ende bee example vnto v therfore whensoeuer shal please god afflict v world iudge amisse v diuers take occasion condemne v though mynd neuer bene rightly disposed let v take paciently assuring selues oure lorde stirreth vp men sort agaynst v satan practiseth cast v quite downe parte crosse wee muste seeke remedie mischiefe suche wyse iob sheweth v oure eye must poure teares vnto god vvhy vve see men come vexe v sort therfore would encounter driue backe howe doo mee great wrong greate crueltie handle maner true maye well make suche protestation wee must stande muche vpon point must glaunce yea muste done ende namely sorie men ake occasion stumbling v intente wee example euill let v saye thus beholde although men iudge euill mee yet haue endeuered serue god neuerthelesse conceite muste glyde away lightly neuer bethink v god iudgementes neyther doe enter intoo owne conscience long pleade sort men vve see vice bee ouer common therfore let v remember lesson shewed v heere wit eye must shed teares god lifting vp eye aloft see men malicious towards v draw reason though easie iudge oure life haue doone thing worthie blame lette v learne resort vnto god content haue warrant thus yee see wherevntoo iob leadeth v wee follow example duely heereby also shewed v plainly wherefore made protestation haue heard long since complayning sentence bycause men condemned wrongfully let v nowe proceede wisheth lawfull hym pleade god mortall man doth equall sayeth short dayes slide away enter way whiche shall come backe ageyn vvhen iob wisheth lawfull plead god according whiche wee haue seene alreadie hereby sheweth chafing bicause miserie endured greuous could beare hee amisse v accuse iob point let v haue eye whiche haue sayde namely good matter yet caried away ouershot handling knowne owne transgression fault comitted submitted himselfe quietly god entred intoo pleading faultfinding sayd afore knew angel clere god perfect rightuousnesse god euer creature bring must necessitie bee nought worth insomuch brightnesse sunne dimme starres much rather muste god rightuousnesse swallowe vp rightuousnesse suppose selues haue iob therefore spake maner well remembred said consideration god rightuousnesse would haue ouershot himselfe say would lawfull mee goe lawe god haue touched already albeit knew doctrine yet passion vehement forgate hereby warned beare away thing whiche reade holie scripture wee may learne bridle passion wee bee tempted impaciencie anye vice thing wee haue learned god worde may bee sufficient drawe v trouble riseth vp v saint paule sayeth gospell power subdue thing lifte vp themselues againste god beholde oure wittes beholde oure fleshly affection see howe lifte vp themselues agaynst god bid battell vvhat doone must hilde captiuitie saye soeuer finde v oure nature bee agaynst god doctrine wee must subdue force thus yee see perfect constancie wherein behoueth v continue therefore fall disputing specially come encountering let v shrinke downe meekely lyke sillie sheepe let v alwayes conclude god iudge nothing bee found fault withall hym though libertie pleade yet cace quayle coulde alledge one poynt myselfe hee woulde alledge thousande againste mee yee see wee muste glorifye god without standing contention hym yea euen althoughe lawfull v pleade selues heere ye see also lord purpose conuince doth say go let v go law togither doth cheefly prophet esay content sayth go law let v haue iudge vmper let bee tryed hath wrong hath right vvhereof ye accuse vvhat harme haue done contrariwise accuse suche poynts suche doubt iudge betweene god v vvhy vseth suche maner speach letteth himselfe downe maiestie highnesse sheweth hee creature vmper dayesman appointed hee bee fayne abyde another bodyes iudgement yet could men cleare themselues hee alledge agaynst vve see god vsing thys manner speech thoughe mortall man clad person shew v plagueth v lyke tyrant ne dealeth v absolute authoritie popish diuines haue surmized diuelish doctrine god vseth suche absolute power say lawlesse power terme whiche bee separated rightfulnesse hee vseth vprightnesse insomuche mouthes must stopped hath condemned v bee founde righteous iudging sayd one fiftie psalme true wee haue false wrongfull verdites make many allegation ende god shall bee founde rightuous yea euen confuzion vvhat remayneth vve must humble meeken selues acknowledge god iudgements rightfull notwithstanding vnto v seeme contrarie furthermore let v go diminish maiestie neither let v say would god mortall man deale match let god maiestie bee continued still full state lyeth v imbace cursed blasphemie attempt surely iobs intent blaspheme hee bin mind satan caried quite cleane away sayde hee bewrayeth owne passion wherevnto consented first moouing cut cometh mynde lift vp ourselues god bycause hand seemeth lye heauie vpon v let v turne backe restreyne vnruly affection assuring selues god hath iust cause punishe v hundred tymes roughly hee dooth listed yee see wise behoueth men humble themselues acknowledge god bee soueraine iudge therewithall fayle take holde mercie assuring themselues inasmuch welspring goodnesse hys maiestie terrible v looke vpon v pitie knowing oure infirmity beare deede know hath gyuen v good pawne good assurance lord iesus christ whome hath made iudge intent might find mercie partie sheweth himselfe redeemer aduocate let v cast selues downe presence good god wyth acknowledgement oure sinnes praying hym make v feele wise ashamed may flee whither else succor mercie may know needeful v therevpon imbrace therwithall also let v learne bee displeased selues sinnes flatter selues haue bin wont wee may bee clenzed oure owne filthinesse clothed ouer wyth hys rightuousnesse whiche yet little begonne v may please graunt grace onely v also people nation earth c lxv sermon first vpon xvij chapter sermon yet still vpon last verse xvj chapter vpon text followeth breath vnsauerie dayes ende graues vpon dallyers vvith myne eye abideth bitternesse pray thee lay dovvne guage giue pledge thee vvho vvill touch hande bycause thou hast couered theyr hart haue vnderstanding thou vvilt exalt verely speake flattery freends eye child shall fayle iob made protestation innocencie haue seene hee addeth booteth hee seeth hymselfe manner forlorne go sayth hee intoo path whereby shall neuer returne agayne anon addeth complaynt shortnesse life meening thereby god ought handle men lesse rigorously seeing passe away ouer earth afterwarde confirmeth matter new agayne saying breath vnsauerie breath quite spent hee hath lustinesse remayneth nothyng graue side euer turne seeth present death hee hemmed round canot scape graue prepared ye see effect iob meeneth surely respect motherwit could perceiue god minded dispatch quite cleane might haue loked higher acording know euen extremitie death faithful must still hope life co fort theselues tribulation may doubt god giue good end moreouer god onely giueth v wherewith comfort ourselues oure tribulation also whereof glorie triumph assuring ourselues shal turne saluatio iob speaketh throughly like faithful haue sayd already vttereth passion euery one v findeth experiece although rest vpon god promise comfort yet notwithstanding ceasseth disquieted troubled himselfe vve shall ouercome temptation first pushe must fayn fight great force difficultie vvhen wee haue battell may well saye iob see nothing graue breath forespente liuelynesse cut away ther recouerie vve may say ought see howbeit soone haue espied oure misery felte wee must lift vp oure selues higher vnto godwarde doubte hee deliuer v yea make thing turne profite whiche wee thinke bee oure harme yee see effecte sort wee muste practize sentence wit first v suche distresse woteth say ne seeth ende cace well must therfore bee astonyed thoughe accordyng fleshe dread present death god seeme haue forsaken v helpe v vvee see iob came lyke distresse yet notwithstandyng hee ceassed beleeue god would haue pitie ende hee foughte good whyle neyther doubted hee victorie yee see owne feeblenesse ought bee discomfort vntoo v soone feele suche impedimentes let v cast eye vpon god say well must bee fayne passe heere thorough pathe whereby neuer man returneth agayne according course kind yea hath god promised seruauntes holde hande middes death yes let v marche boldly againe haue wee iesus christe guyde let v goe death doe wee know howe entrie wherby come glorie heauen seeing resurrection ioyned deathe god sonne also assure v god suffer v continue rottennesse knowe whiche written sixteenth psalme fulfilled namely god preserued hym rotting ende wee shoulde bee made free drawne quite length seeyng wee haue suche promise goddes hande suche assuraunce persone oure lorde iesus chryste wee ought fyghte manfully agaynst dreadfulnesse death loe effect wee haue remember streyn herewithall wee bee also put mynde brittlenesse lyfe breath forespent sayeth iob good sooth lustinesse men blaste agayne lyfe long wee woulde wishe yet little start yeares number respecte mannes lyfe lystynesse wee haue thyng withered fadeth awaye seeing let v learne ouersleepe selues heere knowing god shewing v howe frayle worlde giueth v occasion thinke vppon seeke heauenly life torment oure selues measure sith wee see oure lyfe goeth decay little little fadeth vtterly therefore let v bee greeued assoone god settleth v worlde hee telleth v entent wee shoulde passe swiftely awaye make turne heere though seemed life verie strong wise misliked thing whiche wee haue yet remember sentence also bee noted vpon worde graues bee besieged one kind death many vve haue one life yea verie flightfull consisting one blast nothing wee looke nerely v whole hundred death beset v round ye see iob vseth plurall number graues bene ynough haue sayde graue prepared mee cannot escape hee sayeth graues prepared mee needeth one man anye one pitte iob meeneth sone neuer little passed oute one death another shoulde wayte hym yea another bee shorte hee shoulde bee fayne perishe thoughe hee passed neuer many daungers true wee come intoo suche extremity iob yet none v findeth himselfe cace saye hath one lyfe among number deathes readie v vvhat bee doone vve must learne praye vntoo oure god betake oure lyfe intoo handes ende wee may bee sure seeing pleaseth god keeper oure lyfe lette v walke course withoute ouermuche carefulnesse agayne though thousande deathes readie swallowe v vp god strong ynough plucke v sayde psalme hee hath issue outegoings death hande saye hee hathe meanes whereby deliuer v yea euen althoughe bee incomprehensible v neuerthelesse lette v heereby take warning bee alwayes readie departe worlde much wedded beeing heere low shoulde wee gayne lette v alwayes haue one foote lyfted vp wee shoulde enter intoo graue lette v goe lustily making conclusion selues wee goe thither tarie euer oure lorde hath shewed v persone lord iesus christe hee haue v perishe death abyde rottennesse euer let v proceede sayde truthe dallyers mee myne eye continueth bitternesse heere iob findeth faulte came comforte nothing else put trouble hee termeth dallyers scoffe folke aduersitie bicause came iudge affliction compassion humanitie ought haue doone hee addeth could bring nothing vexation greeue fayne beholde still miserie bitternesse procured hereby bee aduertised wee comforte sorrowfull afflicted aright muste come vnkyndely heart steele yron wee must bee pitiful must man thinke himselfe meete comforte suche trouble incomberance except cloth selfe passion say except hee put himselfe cace true owne seeming stoutest comfort poore folke distresse shall doo small good come tongue breuerie gay word may well discourse matter shal purpose impossible v vse doctrine shall fitte asswage greefes neighbour vnlesse feele touched ourselues therefore let v marke well word dallyers suche churlishe vnkynde meane comforte incombered tribulation marke one poynt agayne seeing know behoueth v bee pitifull toward suffer miserie let v bethynke v sayd psalme blissed man hath consideration poore god delyuer hym day aduersitie v wit behoueth v haue singular discretion iudge aright
