aduersities neighbour wee muste follow discrete dealing god sheweth v giueth vnto v without wee shall go cleane contrary worke man plagued shall hold talke ouerthwartly without discretion must god giue v vnderstanding deeme aright folkes affliction heerevpon come comfort indure aduersitie specially shew faultes let v go sharpely set oure foote vppon throte bee downe rather let v haue mind desire releeue help vp aboue thing must beseech god giue v spirit vnderstanding sayd moreouer thing must also practized wit v trouble must haue care apply holy scripture vse may comforted vvhy bee offended man commeth sting v heape vp yet trouble vpon v aduersitie already wee soone say greate crueltie honestie good dealing men handle v sort yet euery one v lyke hymselfe auinesse take holy scripture comfort mee bethinke take text rather meete threatening steade scripture make mee feele taste god goodnesse comforte hym assuage sorrowes set selfe fire increace greefe see ouershoote ouerselues bycause haue skill co fort selues ought god would wee therefore let v haue pitie compassio neyghbours aduersitie also let euery v looke hymselfe comfort assuage hys owne sorrowes aright lighteth extremitie followeth iob desireth god lay downe gage giue pledge put suretie vvho sayeth iob touch hand returneth matter declared yesterday hee woulde fayne go law god yea fellowe hys equall demaundeth hee gage demaundeth hee suretie warrantize bycause would haue god abace himselfe maiestie say surely long thou continuest thy greatnesse dare come dispute thee thou art ouermightie confound mee giue mee leaue talke thee lay downe gage bynd thy selfe abyde tryall submit thy selfe authoritie iudge cace man dweller place shoulde hyre house put suretyes vvhat iob meeneth saying vvho hee touch mee hand muche say vndertake bee suretie mee men vsed ceremonie like adayes men signe paper hand iudge notarie dayes party touched one another hand gyue theyr fayth bind selues yee see iobs meening yee would knowe whither demaund bee excused desired god hee myght pleade certayne bee excused touched glauncingly yesterday ought desire nothing come god haue hym iudge yea handle v hee listeth himselfe true vtter rigour v shift confounded vvo bee wretched creature come iudged rigorously without mercie forasmuch god loueth v receyue v forgiuenesse sinnes whiche hee offereth v sheweth hymselfe bee one v lorde iesus christe pronounceth blissed whose sinnes forgiuen heare thing wee wish better cace come face taketh away oure sinnes casteth behynde hys backe bottome sea sayde specially let v looke vppon oure lorde iesus christ whome power iudgemente gyuen whiche serueth maynteyne cace aduocate thynke wee hee make bitter death auaylable indured v men well aduyzed ought nothing bee wished iudged god hand leastwise recourse mercie yeelded themselues intoo handes lord iesus christ iudge v condemnation rather acquit v behalfe wee may say sainct paule god acquitteth v shall condemne v vvho shall accuse v seeyng iesus christ aduocate defendeth oure cace partie answereth v god hys father shall wee feare bee accused condemned iob hath vttered hymselfe heere wise hee founde himselfe turmoyled hys owne passion torment heereby wee bee taught represse oure owne naughtinesse vvhy wee see inordinatenesse nature wee giue oure affection head whereto must come iob desyreth go law wyth god ala preuayle sute hee desireth bee vtterly ouerwhelmed much would doo god restreyneth v gyuing v grace subdue passion let v marke well first men suffer themselues bee caried away fleshly affection ouershoote themselues far become hardharted make bone rush god horrible thing v abhorreth aduace sort god yet al ordinarie vyce among v vvhat done heerevpon vve must learne brydle oure affection seeyng furiouse arme v manner god example set afore v end euery v indeuer represse much v lyeth marke one poynt agayne lette v desire diminish maiestie god easing selues hand ouerstrong ouerheauie vpon v afflicteth v let v assure selues hee vpholdeth v farre stronger mightier puissance vvhen lord visiteth v sendeth v affliction well wee may say heere burthen heauie beare indure feeble let v consider little meanes wee hold one minute houre able resist manfulnesse wee oure selues warde god blowes hee striketh v wee able outstand force bycause hee striketh v one hand hee holdeth v vp else certayne vndone euery blowe god neede giue v one fillup say make countenance strike v dispatched hande seeyng v cannot holde god afflicteth v power greate follye v desyre therevpon mightinesse bee abated vvherefore haue sayde erewhyle let v learne desire glory bee diminished easing v cleane wrong way wee bee vtterly disappoynted desire thought bee eased weakening effeebling god hande next way send v packing bycause none meane preserue v onely god vttering strength v haue sayde afore another poynt whyche wee haue consider texte therewithall let v marke also horrible blasphemie require god lay v downe gage put v pledge suretie likelyhod wee trust faithfulnesse true iob vseth word declare ouerhygh power god mortall man durst incounter except god would release owne right yet neuerthelesse god gyueth v assurance come vntoo hym vvhich haue men content themselues single word good reason vvill wee bee assured let v giue eare god promise let v imbrace let v beleeue hee ment feede v leasing soade v vayne frutelesse hope hee faythfull performe hath promised thus yee see poynt behoueth v come besides haue good gage lord iesus christ see euer god promised warranted time gaue onely sonne death rayzed vp agayne wee see gage ought assure v sufficiently besides god sealeth promise hart holy ghost marke goodly record namely haue lorde speake end might doubt truthe might boast selues whatsoeuer conteyned word altogither sure deceytlesse vnto v marke say marke assurance whiche god gyueth v goodes hee putteth handes warrant v pledge assurance hee haue v demaund therefore let v learne content selues effect haue consider vpon verse yet behoueth v turne backe haue touched wit seeing lord voutsafeth handle v sweetly telleth v must afraid come face much vnthakfulnesse v desire go law must man totoo froward refuzeth bee iudged god yes sith god promiseth euen vseth greatest rigour yet hee forget goodnesse releeue mainteyne v continually shal see needfull giue good desirable end oure affliction must needes toto vnkynd refuze suche benefite priuiledge way v humble present selues iudgement seate god wee may vphild grace iob addeth bycause thou hast couered hart haue vnderstandyng thou wilt exalte heere iob strengtheneth himselfe vexed vnder colour comforting haue remember hath bene sayd namely iob bewrayeth affection woonder though continue one tale shift eft one matter eft another shewe himselfe variable wherfore bycause speaketh combate vve knowe man fighting combate keepeth alwayes one countenance fayne trauerse ground fet compasse shift handes retire auaunce forewarde enimie preaceth vppon himselfe espyeth owne aduauntage euen v wee fall resisting temptation sometimes stoupe saue selues sometymes wee giue backe auoyd blowe god giueth v respit take wee hart agayne releeued lykely shuld haue bene ouerthrowen thing therefore see iob taketh courage sayth lord true corzie mee see freendes become dalyers doo nothing else vexe mee yet must discomfort selfe see well haue none vnderstanding therefore must take hold seeing reason beast came running vppon mee dogge hild mee bay myght well vse fayre woordes appeaze could preuayle vnderstand lord must take hart heare wandering talke men vvhy bycause thou hast couered hart haue vnderstanding thys haue touched already namely comfort wretched folke affliction wee must desire god giue v spirit wisdome withall talk shall vaine vnprofitable sauing farre foorth reacheth v hand like contrarie part wee shall speake edifying guyde v sayd couereth hart might haue none vnderstanding man say hee blyndfoldeth eye scripture word hart sometimes taken mynd deede taken continually sometimes taken truenesse pure conscience whereas sayde moyses god hath giuen hart vnderstand eue vnto day wee see word hart taken mynde euen also sentence iob therefore meeneth god hath blyndfolded eye men heere thought themselues wise thereby became good beast let v marke manner men freendes iob euident talke excellent men fooles see men experience men great wit yea sayd god sent shall scarsly haue one iote wisedome shall become pleaseth god blynd agayne god blind wise let thinke themselues skilfull trust owne sharp wit presume much vpon owne policie learne humble themselues knowing god blynde eye shall see whit high nooneday thus see yea profitable lesson take pride owne wisedome thinke nothing ought passe aduice vvhat shall become god shall haue blynded thus blynde wretch haue eye seeled vp discerne nothing shall end god exalt say hee put shame ende bee verified worldly thing sayd secretes heauenlye kingdome farre surmount al wit behold god blindeth eye wise euen worldly affayres thing concerne present life insomuch euen craftie greatest wit become like little babe fond deedes readye fall downe euery blowe men see cause god hath couered eyesight shall wee doo wee must fayne mount vp hygher wonderfull secretes cannot knowne vnlesse god haue inlightened v holy spirit heereby wee bee warned take offence wee see wyse men worlde haue tast gospell poynt doctrine saluation dishe whereof euery man may hys owne caruer god must bee fayne worke holy spirite thing well worthy bee noted wee see many wretched weakling day rest themselues vpon thys wise men world cannot frame themselues gospell say man man great reputation sauoreth gospell yea needeth alledging one man whole nation men say suche nation many wyse head see gospell receyned say receyuing gospell came owne towardnesse motherwit able comprehend soeuer god sheweth v holy scripture cleane contrariwise sayd blinded behalfe wisdome god foolishnesse man reason seeing cace standeth let v thinke straunge though suche presume know themselues blynded sort god forsaketh reason pride hee schoolemaister humble little one men great one able take profite god schoole seeing wee perceyue god blyndeth men sort let v part learne trust ourselues desire guyde v holy ghost gouerne v may see cleerely middes darknesse world yea hys word cresset must serue purpose peter discourseth although nothyng darknesse world yet shall well guyded wee followe doctrine holye scripture yet aboue thing god must bee fayne inlighten v hys holy spirite hee must take away kerchief satan hath blindfolded v hee must open oure eye seeyng lyeth let v craue grace wyth lowlinesse vtterly distrusting selues moreouer let v marke saying added lorde seeyng thou hast couered theyr eye thou wilt exalte iob sayeth blind folke whome speaketh shall exalted hee meeneth haue told shall bee confounded god shall laugh skorne make iestingstocke therefore let v bee afrayd least wee bee destitute god spirit lyght wee receyue thereby confounded end lord cause v driuen foorth headlong like wretched beastes wee fall intoo manye irksome thinges euery man bee ashamed v yet meane whyle ourselues perceyue owne shame behold world goeth whome god hath giuen vp lewde mynd sainct paule sayeth first chapter romanes god hathe bereft men witte reason shall discerne aught good fayth wee see howe wretched idolater cast themselues downe pecce wood worship beastly thyng yes verely howbeeit god hath blinded men sort must need become starke beast fall euill euill finally giue themselues ouer shamefull deedes forgo countenance honestie fall working nature dooing thing men would abhorre would looke vppon drunkard swine wee would looke vppon whorehunters whiche chafed fire owne lust haue modestie honestie ought tremble sight thereof knowtng frutes god vengeance blindeth men sieleth vp eye suche sorte bee able see discerne aught yet last parte cofuzion vve must come prophet esay sayeth vvhen god hath spoken punishing blynding men vntill sayeth prophet vntill city beaten downe theyr people destroyed nothing left vnconfounded see frute blinding men therfore must walke aduisedly feare pray god wyll neuer suffer v haue eye blyndfolded thus much concerning sentence iob addeth hee telleth freend flattering tale shall haue eye child fayle heere iob speaketh according circumstance place wee haue seene heeretofore opinion freendes namely might perceyued iudged worlde whiche god chozen reprobate much say last iudgement wherevntoo thing reserued wee wyll esteeme men according god present handling heere thing ye see vntoward doctrine iudge iob vseth worde flalterie set purpose say preacheth prosperitie freend say shall say man gotoo thou art happie thou art beloued god thou prosperest thou liuest thine ease thou art rich fauour world say talketh thys sort cursed eye child shall fall say hee shall accursed onely owne persone also ofspring heereby warned first rest selues vpon prosperitie transitorie life bring nothing flatterie marke one poynt lesson greatly auauntage v practyse throughly sayd flatterie men rest wholly vpon prosperitie transitorie worldly life beare themselues hande bee beloued god cause ruine destruction sodomite liued pleasure ease whyle arreignement making heauen verely sentence giuen pronounced againste persone abraham sixscore yeeres flud world exceede delight pleasure seemed god shoulde haue charge men sore abashed suddayne surprizing doubted playne falshood esteeme god fauour present prosperitie therefore let v take occasion flatter selues say god loueth fauoreth v prospereth v say let v beware wee beguyle ourselues sort bee confuzion thus yee see word flatterie importeth therewithall wee haue note wretched dealing selues neybours vse sayd flattering euery man dazeleth owne eye seeketh lift vp himselfe god prosperitie deceyue freendes also wee make ease beleeue bee good god lap yet al gulfe hell neere therefore without cause iob doth pronounce greeuous punishment preach prosperitie sort neighbour vvhat done effect vvhen prosperitie let v cheere vp one another serue god busie ourselues yeelding thaks goodnesse sheweth v aduersitie let v take promise giue v cofort v withall make serue purpose therewithal let v alwayes ready receyue aduersitie notwithstanding god shew getle louing towards v say let v ceasse prepare ourselues chastizement let v bee willing receyue stripe hys hand please handle v rigorously furthermore let mind troubled say god doth hadle men heere according desert whensoeuer afflicteth v let v vnderstand chastizeth v sinnes hee spare v let v vnderstand hys meening draw v getlenesse whatsoeuer betide v let nothing hinder v lift vp heds cotinually seke life cotentatio heaue happie rest tarieth v let greeue v aflicted seing god calleth v triuph purchaced v death lord iesus christ let v cast ourselues flat face good god acknowledgement faultes praying hym make v feele wrath suche wise oure aduersities wee may ceasse tast alwayes fatherly mercie haue recourse grounding setling ourselues therevpon wee may neuer swarue doubting deliuer v affliction conuenient time ease v al misery although bee pinched vttermost nowe yet wee shall bee fully dispatched hath bereft v flesh make v parttakers benefites whych hee hathe prepared v aloft hys heauenly glorye wee shall triumphe oure lorde iesus christ according hee hath gone afore v glorye resurrection maye please graunt grace v also people nation earth c lxvj sermon second vpon xvij chapter hath made common byvvord set open gazingstocke myne eye dimmed vvith sorovve limbes shadovve rightuouse vvill bee astonished innocent shall lift vp himselfe hypocrite rightuouse vvill hold vvay hath cleane hand shall strengthened returne turne ye agayne one vvise man among dayes glyded avvay mine enterprizes past thought hart haue turned day night haue offered mee darknesse light approched tarrie graue house shall make bed dark vvill say dust thou art father corruption thou art mother sister vvhere myne expectation vvhat hope must looke shall go dovvne bottom graue vvee shall bee layed earth bed shall dust iob following matter entered afore intedeth shew briefly respect present state vtterly forlorne remedie misery seing cace must faine conclude talk spake afore true wit delt within world according desert must esteme god grace loue hatred according state present lyfe shall boote flee vnto god ye see effect haue marke first al sayd god hath made mockingstocke set gazingstock men make tale second woord vseth haue translated gazingstocke signifieth timbrell marke men haue thought iob ment compare heere prosperitie aduersitie great extreme time sayd heretofore haue bene great triumph nowe god hath handled wise see self byword gazingstocke true steade gazingstocke traslate hel whereas haue translated open sight opinion iob ment say men damned wretched creature tyme well considered playne meening haue touched repeting one matter twyce greater confirmation according common custome holie scripture therefore thing intedeth set downe asmuch god hath made mirrour aduersitie wee esteeme men god fauour displeasure state present life wee hold forlorne persone yet take himselfe none howbeit vtterly without feeling infirmity soeuer yet fight agaynst sure fully resolued god would length pitie therefore hild mouth shet vntill sawe end misery respect addeth rightuouse shall astonished yet neuerthelesse innocent shall lift vp himselfe hypocrite rightuouse shall hold wayes haue cleane handes shall gather new strength stedfast saying ryghtuouse shall bee astonished iob meeneth wee see aduersities god sendeth haue serued walked feare pure conscience thinke straunge abashed good sooth see runnes minde god gouerne world good reason spare good men haue indeuered walk purely handle father doeth child see afflicted extremely god hand imagin eyther hath turned backe wil think vpo earthly thing else passeth liue behaue theselues cause oftetymes astonished aduersitie rightuouse god seemeth shewe enemie see nothing signes crueltie cause iob speaketh astonishment howbeit sayeth yet neuerthelesse innocentes shall auaunce themselues aboue hypocrite say shal sore astonished shal make good winding vp sentence ought marke better tha vvhy know experiece hard men iudge aright god dooings respect see presently hath bene declared fully already god executes iudgemets sort world thing well ruled nothing square contrariwyse thing confounded see wicked man punished rightuouse man punished much wee see good man prosper wicked man shall prosper double vvhere see thing vvee astonished wee wit end say know way turne v wee iudge present thing naturall reason wee must needes rauished holie scripture telleth v wee shall although god suffer v haue experiece yet hath also voutchsafed warn v woord wit shall troubled dazeled looke vpon thing seeme go therefore let v marke well sentence sayd ryghtuouse shall astonished see god afflicteth child sorte verie deede point also crosse misliketh v according also terme thing aduersities mislike v harde combersome asmuchas wee shunne affliction sorte needes must wee caryed away astonishment reason gaynstryuing nature see god afflicteth child maner layeth vpon great stroke whe see lord spareth hath chozen hath giuen grace walke purely feare seruice doubt selues say see wee forced astonished thing learned lesson vve might ouertaken feare wee neuer returne right way againe vvherfore let v take warning blow come wee see good men handled roughly god hand let v therefore offended set al randon let v keepe selues tarying myre let v vnderstand behoueth v passe come iob sayeth follow wit soeuer come must ceasse lift vp selues despizers god hereby ye see wherein faythfull differ faithlesse may seeme bee bothe like cace worldwarde vtterly plundged ouer head eares imagination god gouerneth worlde sheweth iudge winketh thing specially child oppressed without releef wheras meane wicked haue full scope bridle layd looce vppon necke without redresse thing rest vpon point cannot rid hand trouble temptation vvhat behoueth v man myre muste fayne wade force till come firme grounde sayde fortith psalme euen wee feele diuell goeth make v sinke deepest bottomlesse pit meanes would driue v despayre let v streyne selues say let v inforce selues till come point wee haue wonne much able say yet god neuer forsake seruants though seeme oppressed seeme deede sheweth himselfe strong ynough susteyne continually hand make feele length deliuered woonderfull fashion marke say exercizes marke battels god intendeth imploy v say see thing confuzed world greued time must labour releeue selues vntill wee haue gotten victorie temptation iob expresseth full whiche touched breefly saying rightuouse shall hold way whiche hath cleane handes shall strengthened behold verie profitable lesson causeth many men step square bicause would recopenced first day god cotent appetite thinke labour lost serue ought take much peynes seing wage good bad impacience causeth many men greeued turne backe yea lose corage though haue begon well folowe god vvherefore let v marke sayd rightuouse may take conceyt disquiet selues seing good men ceasse bee persecuted somuch god seemeth either haue forgotten else become aduersarie seing persecuteth sort although good men feele theselues greeued time yet must strengthen themselues vntill haue cocluded hold way say continue throughout although see way wherthrough must passe full thornes bryers must fayne leape ouer hedge rock diches yet must ceasse continue god seruice triall examinatio faith vvere faire medow might runne along riuers side shadow might nothing pleasure ioy whole life could vaunt serued god good affection god sendeth v thing cleane contrarie desire must fayne one enter quamire another marche vppon rugged stone anotherwyle bee combered bryers thornes whe must fayne meete hedge diches leape ouer shall haue traueled greate shall still seeme haue gone verie little nothing foreward yet see ende iourney behold troublesome teptation v couet walk according god wil bicause haue vtterly renounced selues hath yet learned tame affectios subdue seruing god notwithstanding hard doo knoweth yet good earnest liue well faithfully let v practize spoken holding wayes say knowing wee desirouse rule life according god lawe way verie difficult done without many let hinderance yet must firme constant hold way still sith god sendeth child triall wit hee suffereth much vexation yet neuerthelesse must hold still tackling shall become forsake right way without vexing troubling see many men behold lord graciouse vnto beare respect weaknesse well handleth owne nature sendeth ouerstrong temptation yet fayle go awrie though tooke pleasure forsaking god wilfully pray would doo assayled like temptation iob speaketh would vnthankfulnesse moste men appeere howe many repine god without maner distresse man aske doo temptation hath moued none matter bycause bee maliciouse froward nature wil needes vtterly accursed let v part well aduized although way wherby god haue v passe full greate hardnesse shall haue much doo steppe foorthe one pace wee shall meete hard incounter yet notwithstanding wee must keepe way still according shewed howbeit forasmuch canot done without gathering new strength therfore iob addeth hath cleane hand shall gather new strength hereby let v note first v feeblenesse wee flatter selues become werie soone know selues weake would serue god quite vndone constancie stedfastnes v let v consider little frayle wee meene euen god hath giuen good zele iob speaketh sticke naturall reason treateth haue spirite god dwelling haue already receyued suche vertue aboue dispozed weldoing yet neuerthelesse euen maner men frayle still find themselues voyd strength god presse knowe shoulde withstand temptation therefore haue neede gather new strength wee must shrink though wee feele weakenesse selues sayde god child shall strengthened therby see although weake god beareth v shake v verely wee flatter selues hypocrisie number fode themselues owne vice saying man able notwithstading know haue many fleshly infirmity beare themselues hande well discharged alledging commo ordinarie vice men cotrarywise sayd oft god maketh v feele owne weaknesse warning make v learne seeke remedie vvherefore let v beware nurrishing owne vice selfflatterie let v beware seeke fond excuse many folke beguile themselues weening god forgiue fault though labour amend cotrarywise let v looke gather strength wher shall get certainly found elswhere god men find themselues weake let go seeke strength holie scripture telleth sayd god hath spirite strength stedfastnesse wee feare borne downe temptation afrayd swaruing let v desire god strengthen v lo faythfull strengthen themselues vayne ouerweening doo trust owne free chalendging woonderfull thing themselues bearing themselues hand come compassing intent whereas ende step aside well seene nothing vanitie vvill well strengthened let v presume vpon owne ryghtuousnesse let v returne vnto god beseeching strengthen v wise holie ghoste diuell may able fell v downe though assayle v neuer many battells lo lyfe faythfull effect wit shall neuer bee without many temptation specially wee bee subiect many misery tyme earthly wayfaring indeuer serue god best ceasse often ouerpressed many inconueniences many affliction vvhen astonished cannot must thinke strange firste brunt let v fight suche temptation let v holde right way without starting although find much hardnesse ourselues let v pray god giue v inuincible strength may continue seruice euen end notwithstanding satan labour thrust v iob speaketh purposely heere haue cleane handes surely true purenesse consisteth hart least wise harte place taketh roote nothing woorth though life perfect angellike man could wishe except pure rightmeening minde serue god man may well withhold working euil may forbeare bodie wrong harme may refreyne giuing folke cause complayne cast thing teeth hart bee inflamed vaynglorie atteynted hypocrisie selfwilled bee infected vice secretly whole state filthinesse yea though neuer highly commended men thus ye see sayd wee muste begin minde hath bene shewed heretofore chapter also diuers place nowe iob hauing spoken rightuouse innocent soundmeening man matched hypocrite addeth partie hath cleane handes standeth v hande haue inward soundnesse god yet moreouer must also shewe deedes bee seeme wee see full naughtinesse vtter despyzers god bold brag themselues best christian man finde fault bee short adayes man haue faire protestation must seeke wickeddest sort puffed vp selfe estimacion insomuch come foorth like shamelesse harlotts stewes ca find fault yet verie babe descerne life abhominable verie ayre stink reason hereof purposely sayd intend shewe sound afore god hand must also pure cleane say wee muste liue sort among men doings may shewe feare god within v short yee see wise behoueth v yeeld record goodnesse roote man say vnto v good tree yet appered frute beareth good goodnesse verely frute co me shall neuer good except roote nature tree good yet must yeeld frute sayd wee intend shewe truly haue sayd right sound meening hart studie serue god thus ye see effect haue reme ber sentence iob addeth turne ye turne ye sayeth wise man among speaking disproue talke bene ministred three discoursed haue herd heretofore shewe man forsaken god nothing cursednesse bicause sawe persecuted iob hath shewed iudgement must giuen aduersities seene present life say man forsaken god marke well point afterward sayth againe god doeth alwaies punish men sinnes good men sometimes afflicted noman knowes reason therof appereth inquire man neuer much trauel neuer much yet shal neuer neerer bicause god iudgments secret incomprehensible forasmuch iobs freends conceiued thing sayth wisedome certesse haue sayde afore small point wisdome discerne aright affliction god sendeth vpon men say man owne cace visited hand god great wisedome haue skil know sinnes enter himselfe humble himselfe acknowledge behold right profitable medicine mee god knew suche vice hath done grace knowe therefore must apply wholly mine owne vse meanes shal know profit greatly god correction besides although know precisely afflicted able lay finger vpon yet shal wisdome conclude vvell lord thou knowest priuie disease though haue done amisse perceiue self thou lord knowest thou art true phisicion giue grace smitten thy hand may alwayes take good thy correction discipline yea albeit perceiue god doeth wise punish sinnes yet must neuerthelesse humble farre say ala lord knowe wherefore thou doest sure thou art rightuouse ynough though thou doo make mee forget world draw thy self make mee taste heauenly life restreyne giuen worldly delight man skilfull know apply god chastizings instruction surely point great wisdome wee shall haue profited greatly time life come point much sayd correction god sendeth neighbour vvhen see man smitte may suppose chastized sinnes yea truly haue knowne despyzer god disordered persone good thinke god punisheth cause wee must iudge neighbour least come home v againe immediatly sorte god thou punish one shalt thou much punish wheras thou hast giuen grace haue desire serue thee lorde much bound vnto thee thou list chastize muste indure yet woorse geere must come remembrance againe see punish one man whoredome another mannes drunkennesse third man blasphemie men robbery guilefulnes periurie well must alwayes profit selues thing according also paule sayeth peynted table wherein god sheweth v howe sore hateth abhorreth vnrightuousnesse behoueth v make owne gayne mennes loss sayd prouerbe furthermore let v ouer rigorous see god smite folke haue bene detected suche great vnmeasurable misdoing might say behold yonder naughtipacks behold yonder despyzers god man hath infirmity yet shall haue shewed signes vprightnesse wee see great aduersitie wee muste say well god knoweth afflicteth poore creature yet must haue pitie copassion ye see dauid sayeth blissed man iudge aright aduersitie wit ca beare god seruants child see oppressed aduersitie pitie gende condemne hooke crooke assuring selues men may condemne v double like rigour vsed v without cause iob doth reproue freends finding wisdome bicause iudged randon aduersities hereby warned well taught god schoole get true wisdome may welfare behoueth v apply mindes considering god iudgements world well vpon ourselues vpon neighbour beate vpon point earely late man indeuereth himselfe put vre surely time well imployed cheef point doctrine god bringeth v apply iudgements owne vse edified feare therfore proceede maner surely perfect wisedome v without may haue shewe wisdome deuised may discourse curiously vpon holy scripture may bring many faire allegacions yet shal vanitie till come point iudge aright lord requireth v sendeth v chastizements afflictios herevpon conclude matter iob sayeth dayes passed thought vanished enterprizes broken disappointed bad darknesse stead light thought day sprang night short sheweth v end misery hope euer continue touching present life cause addeth sayd rottennesse thou art father vnto dust thou art moother sister say regard eyther kinsfolk freendes bylowe god hath hidden cut rank companie liuing like wretched carion must looke returne say creature ease matter question vtterly dispatched remedie cace vvhat mine expectation haue sayeth haue looked vp downe must go downe pit bedde must bylowe say death whatsoeuer hope soeuer build hebrew woord iob vseth may come building verie fit similitude speaketh hope expectation yet neuerthelesse hath eye building doubtfulnesse woord respect signification therefore one sayd although bee patient prolong miserie continually yet remayneth nothing mee graue likeneth expectation building may well builde sayeth hee thinking still hope left shal speede euer better sayes vvhen haue builded best shall haue none house graue seemeth iob speaks man taste heauenly life wist god mercie ment behoueth v consider telleth tale true heretofore fittes disputed god shewed wel terrible conceit notwithstanding resisted hath treated fitts felt sheweth follie would haue god fauor vtter self vnchaungeably present life vpo good faithful god shewe merciful open face world towards ought concluded hath forsaken vtterly past hope recouerie iob mocketh geere telleth tale would see mennes full payment transitorie decaying life ouerfroward doctrine iudge haue declared alredy vvherfore let v mark iob despayre reproueth follie sayd freendes yet would make beleue euen worlde wee shall surely perceiue whither wee god fauour grace whither forsaken better coprehending hereof let v looke vpon argument paule maketh intendeth assure v last resurrection vve sayeth wretcheddest men earth let man compare christias despyzers god heathen folke hypocrits tha spyte god ful see best intreated certaine take one another man shall see prosperitie giuen euill shall doo walke feare god lord neere vnto v watcheth ouer v amisse amendeth man haue care correct child tha neyghbours god therefore shew loue beareth v chastizeth v whe seeth v amisse againe intendeth proue obedience good reason intendeth ratifie faith faith preciouse thing deserueth tried gold siluer rather peter telleth v moreouer know diuell ceasseth practize possible v seeth v heedfull seruice god much rage set fire also looke many wicked folk manie enimies haue satan serueth turne trouble v therfore must maruell though god child bee miserable world paule vseth selfsame argument shewe looke better state sith shake v sayeth sith treade v vnder feete sith reproch laughingstocke whole world cace hoped resurrectio promised v lord iesus christ must come shall perceiue haue serued god vayne god heauen iustice prouidence ye see paules argument muste serue v key open text yee see mee sayth iob man past hope vvhen haue made windlass must fayne come graue lodging see nothing rottennesse round aboute mee sith yee make mee beleeue god doeth handle men beneathe thereafter doeth loue hate mee knowe haue indeuered serue god disappointed myne expectation yet see selfhandled roughly may euery man lookes skew mee gazingstocke comon word vvhat remaineth eyther muste burie benefit priuiledge god hath giuen mee cast quite away else must conclude god mocketh abuseth seruants vaine trust vnto promise would ye haue fall wickednesse sith cace standeth let v vnderstad must iudge god loue hatred thing see let v procede consider god loueth scourgeth keepeth taste goodnesse store though bee hidden time whe sheweth nothing vtter rigour therfore let v cofort ourselues say yet hold still hope continually god length pitie mee shall perceyue father although haue happened lift vp self time yet wil still returne sayd conclusion vve see maner doctrine haue gather sentece better edifying wit must take al misery present life specially wee ourselues feele see al god child ope declaratio god reserueth much better thing v must cause confirme v hope heauenly life see paule speaketh second thessalonian rehersing one suffered many thing bene vexed wicked sayeth euident token god iust iudgement reasonable thing agreeable nature giue releef ye haue ben oppressed therfore assure yourselues seing haue rest vpon earthe god prepareth heaue otherside thing standeth vpo god iustice wicked shuld punished according desert yet notwithstading see done worlde assure yourselues aduersities trouble misery god doth glasse shewe shall oneday come vnto also verie thing wherevnto hope must bee referred long wee world god send v neuer much pouertie tribulation let v learne drawen hope heauenly life vvhen see good folk god sillie child roughly handled laughed scorne pacience abused themselues left succorlesse say whe see al let v vnderstad god declareth although thing confuzed earthly life yet must wee therfore runne square looke afore v wee muste nestle ourselues world corruptible thing onely passe right swiftly full gallop furthermore god spare v let v acknowledge pitieth v interteyning v rest giue v tast goodnesse specially haue serue time come intent lerne bolder trust doubting deliuer v battels assault world make v partaker benefit whiche hath prepared come willingly shroude themselues vnder shadow lord iesu christ let v cast ourselues downe face good god acknowledgmet sinnes praying make v feele may returne vnfeinedly returning come true fayth repentance desirouse rid vice corruption flesh douting lord alwayes behold v pitie receiue v mercie sake hath giuen v mediator let v say almightie god c lxvij sermon first vpon xviij chapter bildad suite ansvvered saying vvhen vvill yee make ende vvoordes herken let v speake vvherefore vvee counted beast opinion dullardes value man teareth ovvne soule rage shall earth forsaken thy sake shall rockes bee remoued place verely light vvicked shall bee quenched sparke fire shall shine light shall bee dimmed tent lampe shyneth vpon shall put steppe shall restreyned ovvne deuice shall cast dovvne net spred vnder feete shall vvalke vpon snare grinnes shall catch heele theeues shall come vpon pitfall hidden earth trappe vvay fearfulnesse shall make afrayd euery side driue feete vvhich vvay soeuer go shall make fall haue tolde heretofore true profitable doctrine god punisheth men fault shewe iudge vnderstood handled skilfully see ugh take point holy scripture generall must apply vse may fare better also experience sheweth number abuse holy scripture tossing thing fro taking aduenture whiche speake true well applied turne cleane cotrarie meening holy ghost truth vtterly corrupted self thing doth bildad newe vndertaketh spoken afore namely although wicked prosper time yet shal cofounded end god suffer prosperitie last euer true therewithall passeth measure vpholding punishment god sendeth vpo wicked alwayes full apparant men may finally discerne eyesight god iudgeth present life whereas contrarywise alwayes seene nother must make general rule lo wherin bildad ouerseene yea notwithstanding doctrine self good holie although first blush seeme harme yet throughly perswaded wit god punisheth wicked seene eye great daunger insue proofe therof thing fall contrarie expectation seeme vntoo v god iudge worlde hath giuen vp office thing ruled fortune cursed blasphemie herevpon shall tempted impatiencie shall stomacke wee see god setteth stay thing disordered finally wee shall prouoked giue selues naughtinesse shall thinke lost time spent doyng good seing god hath regard guide leaueth randon short little shall able call vpon shal vtterly estraunged fro vnder shadow good doctrine bildad turneth religion feare god vpside downe setteth men state despayre thus ye see sayde standeth v greatly hand desire god giue v skill apply owne profite edifying thing reade holie scripture soeuer el shewed v al time concerning iugemets first al bildad greeued herkened saying receyued verely taught faithfully purpose iust cause displeased wee appointed beare abrode god woorde doctrine saluation see men heare v hardned else hold scorne thing tell surely wee haue zele godward reuerence woorde must needes grieued sorie hart despite toucheth v liuing god whose messenger therefore serueth god faithfully carying abrode woorde must sorie labour profite sith men doo wrong vnto god receyuing woord side must much v lieth procure health mennes soules see men go destructio bicause giue eare vnto god headstrog agaynst good counsell beholde vtterly vndone ought say vexe v hart bildad taught ought haue done iust cause complayne men hearing histale asmuch corrupted truthe turned lie reason grieued notwithstanding whensoeuer man offereth v doctrine bee warned hereby discerne reiect thing wee knowe wee see make great matter reiect man go shewe health soule therefore lette v haue pryde v wee shall onely greeue men seeke welfare willing v seruice shal also grieue spirite god dwelleth giueth loue edifie v offer v good conuenient v ye see haue neede beware despising offered v till wee know furthermore bildad doth vpbrayde iob teareth soule rage thereby warned haue touched afore whe men martyr themselues passion gayne nothing plundge themselues still miserie shall also returne vpon owne head true man aduersitie thinkes himselfe well eased murmuring storming stomacking specially belke blasphemie god lo say men woulde fayne wreake themselues god holdeth aduersitie cace ende cleane contrariwize nothing else rende owne soules yea euen furiously sayd streyne heathen skill ynough say man choler burning headie furiousnesse man cannot submit himselfe god aduersitie sharpeneth himselfe still pray one starke madde al one would stande god say wee vtterly without passion god sendeth v aduersities affection vnbrydled vnruly serue kindle v spurre v foreward god wee bee full bitternesse muste needes followe possessed furie haue sayde alreadie seing wee come iustle sort god durst creature bereft right wittes reason surely durst see ye text ought marke well although bildad misapply persone iob yet sentence true selfe ought serue turne asmuch see impaciencie kinde madnesse man ment impaciencie simply greef conceyued mislyking aduersities wee werie excessiue hartburning stomaking wee cannot submit selues simply vnto god dispose v pleasure therfore passios vnruly keepe measure aduersities dothe impaciencie ouermaster v wee haue hold stay selues wee must needes conclude wee better frentike folke god yea vtterly wittes true confesse much holie ghost hath auouched would haue competent iudge looke well selues nothing texte experience sheweth true let v assure selues hath power bridle affection hold short hath gotten great wisedome vndoubtedly self purpose also iames sayeth man want wisdome let aske god spoken afore patience friend sayeth whensoeuer god afflicteth light teptations assure selues profit welfare yet foloweth may seeme straunge fewe men shall agree therevnto man haue neede wisdome let resort vnto god say true man minde neuer thinke al teptations aduersities benefit god procuremet towards v fault bicause misaduised knowe expedient v vvhat done asmuch want wisdome specially passion ouermaister v trouble mindes let v repayre vnto god well skill supplie want thus ye see haue gather vpo sentece namely must applie indeuer bridle affectios great choler god afflicteth v assuring selues take paciently god wil turne al profit welfare contrary wise stomacke matter asswage misery cofort god giueth v end euen bildad sheweth wit wee shall teare owne soules see wretched madman fling himselfe fire leapes windowes hurteth one whyle whyle otherme fit frenzie taketh euen shal caried away choler wil make bone rush square god remembring whit shall turne owne confusion therfore haue neede wey wel doctrine wit teare owne soules learne referre ourselues wholly god good may v pleaseth thus ye see effect wee haue beare minde sayde shall world chaunged thy sake shall rockes remoued place expound sentence curiously thus shall world say shall order god hath set stablished chaunged shall rocke say shall god whiche strength worlde hee remoued place thing much racked bildad ment speake simplie namely iob talke peruerted order nature effect thing hee ment bildad set downe assoone god made heauen earth settled naturall order wee see behoued also iustice haue course true howbeit mistaketh would haue god iustice altogither apparant men might know behold eye touche finger wherein beguyleth himselfe neuerthelesse good vnderstand meening wee may gather instruction conteyned saying shall worlde bee chaunged thy sake say vnderstadest thou thou reasonest god doth execute iustice bylow may knowne would god haue iudgemets knowne forthwith frothe time stablished order heauen ayre earth wee behold god workes aboue beneath end goodnesse wisedome rightfulnesse vertues knowne yes question end hath god set fayre lookingglasse creature ende glorified hand sith like god vttereth vertues rest also wil haue v priuie iudgemets true respect wit vnderstood ought bildad stretcheth generally vvhat done oft man speaketh v god let workes sheweth v neerest vnto v leade v cotinually higher vnto example scripture speakes oftentimes v see dayly wit god sendeth rayne fayre wether maketh earth yeeld fruite causeth nurrish v ynough v know rayne fayre wether come god earth yeeldeth v foode grace true fundacions yet must go mount vp higher wit god giue power earth muste much rather needes follow receyue stregth much nobler creature life v far greater excellenter thing power earth hath yeeld fruite yes certenly behoueth v acknowledge one god workes proceedeth againe yf god haue care feede men world thinke father behalf vouchsaueth haue regarde body wretched carkases doth make much account soules also casting seede earth rotting cause spyre againe beare fruyte anew restore v better lyfe though wee go corruption seing sheweth power order nature besides god keepeth stedie hand making sunne ryze go downe euery day moreouer moone finisheth hir circuite euery moneth sunne euery yeere see orderlinesse starres planet oft wee beholde thing must coclude god stedfast truth giueth v instruction signes thereof vvhen see constancie settled order nature shal thinke promise belong saluatio corruptible thing subiect alteracions chaunges world lo holy scripture trayneth v higher higher workes god neerest familiar v neuerthelesse behoueth v also haue skill discerne betwene god workes neede requireth yee see bildad vtterly cofounded owne matter sayeth bicause god hath created world settled order maynteyneth therfore foloweth iudgements al certeyne men may see know ill cosequece vvhy god wil sunne rize go downe thereby assertayned wil giue v al thing necessary preseruatio life euen worldes ende vvhen see vine tree earth yeeld fruite well god sheweth v hath care present life notwithstanding flightful drooping take v hand lift v vp heaue vnto god wil haue v know certenly comaundeth v touching iudgemets cace minde wee haue tast life wayte pacience till shew full latter day shall thing set order nowe order vntil god wil execute iudgements part coclusio bildad maketh good conuenient mingleth twoo thing togither betweene great diuersitie vvherfore behoueth v vse discretio behalfe vnderstand sentece true yet misapplied sentece true inasmuch order nature teacheth couseleth v seeke thing higher wit knowe wisedome rightuousnesse goodnesse truenesse god thing cocerne transitorie life also thing pertayne euerlasting kingdome heaue vnthankfulnesse heynous shall excused ought vynes put eies ought riuers field al like thing wherin god sheweth representeth self vnto v coceyue must blindnesse say perishing owne ignorace needes wilfull let v come spoken verely light wicked shall quenched lampe shyneth vpon head shalbe dimmed shall remayne one sparke fire similitude bildad ment signifie effect god suffer wicked prosper euer howbeit must marke well true god giue wicked leaue liue ease time triuph ruffle though fortune hande bildad bene ware poynt would haue locked vp streytly doth afterward graunteth wicked may sometimes prosper vvherein ouershooteth himselfe foresetteth time maner day prosperitie take end god turne laughter weeping v appoynt god may sometimes leade forth wicked prosperitie eue graue world shall see haue partly touched wit shall go downe graue without trouble turning hand according also sayd psalme beholde sayeth dauld god child drag lynes cordes doo put pyne away bylowe seemeth death pursueth yet notwithstanding take away fare wicked lustie strong die ere aware sith let v marke well v set god terme say quenche light wicked world thrust darknesse say confusion vve cannot without controlling god besides aduertized pleasure intendeth reserue iudgement latter day vvhat done first let v marke sayde despisers god hypocrite shall haue lampe burning house surely hee expresseth matter diuers termes libg lampe shining bildads speaking ordinarie maner holy scripture neuerthelesse light betokeneth nothing else wicked liue ease pleasure god seemeth sauuor like contrarie parte common thing haue tribulation anguish likened night darkenesse nowe let v come backe agayne matter despysers god folke looce life el haue nothing hypocrisie may wel prosper time see yea standeth v hand well acquaynted inured find noueltie v shalbe troubled vexed shalbe forced giue ouer god seruice therfore behoueth v bee poynt god suffer wicked liue merily reioyce take pleasure bylow must astonied marke one poynt exercise needefull v doubt wilt seeme harde v howbeit behoueth v accustome selues sayd afore moreouer lette v marke secondly lorde quench sayd light wicked haue sported themselues whyle pleasure pastymes haue taken vp must deerely payd cannot misse light shalbe queched also dauid standeth vpon psalme exhorteth hee v repine vngodly wee see triumph maner seemeth world life may bee esteemed happie themselues also glory though beloued god vvhat reason doth dauid alledge assure v sayeth al shal passe away let v tarie sayeth shal see happinesse wicked surmise selues haue cursednesse true shal sure ynough good fortune terme shall like tootoo well end god throw downe wil misprouoked companie wicked must learn passe beyod world vnderstad god wil shew howe nothing worthe haue ease world ioy continuance true god doth sometimes beare vp seruants infirmitie long till cut edge wicked men prosperitie according also sayd psalme alwaies aduersitie without release wee might reache hande euill say wee bee frayle although wee called vpon god desirous serue yet might bee tempted breake square god moderate affliction also represse wicked giuing blowes beate downe grounde god may well execute iudgements euen transitorie life intent support v sort alwayes nother must wee make general rule baldad say god wil quenche light wicked demaunded answere day morrowe say set god terme sorte giue v leaue bee disapoynted hope therefore lette v put hande hee knowes tyme season wherein wicked bee rooted sometimes satteth men ox swyne according sayd prophet nowif f oxe swine trauell full fedde put colde heate set labour beast snetch oxe cut swynes throte euen doth god fat wicked till come brimme graue therefore let v marke well haue sayd afore namely rest selues vpon god iudgements wee must mount aboue worlde wee muste looke vnto thing yet hidden eye thus yee see haue marke wee see wicked aduaunced thing fall would wish well must thinke straunge hath bene beginning world haue father old time bene assaulted temptation resisted let v leaue god onely let v know al pleasure wicked doo take worlde shal turne confuzion much better god dealt niggardly haue giuen liberally benefites according haue abused goodnesse must also fayne punished much grieuously vnthankefulnesse also lette v tarie till god worke office say til quench light wicked herewithal haue mark well maner speech set downe heere bildad sayeth nettes layde vnder feete wicked cannot passe strait rise vp shall caught pitfall snare pitched vnder feete howbeit snare bee couered ar perceyued according herevnto dauid also sayeth wicked shall walke alwayes vpon yee true way glistereth fayre eye sure footing god make treade step awrie breake necke thought similitude agree one wit shewe although wicked prosper happinesse wondered estimation yea coueted whole worlde yet notwithstanding go destruction euery man say would man cace wee see snare couered earth seeme god beareth vp wicked haue wing flie stie high tumble downe vnhandsomely feete bee vpon earth snare vnder true see wee bee warned god woorde muste looke vpon fayth notwithstanding bildad vnderstood well sayd bene hampered snare contrarietie vvhy saying snare couered vnder wicked men feete hee haue remembred v espie vntill god shewe shall surely v appoynt time must men submit themselues god prouidence sette downe generall rule lawe say god let v side looke applie sayde doctrine right vse seing sayd snare vnder wicked men feete well let v pray god leade v hand assuring selues snare layde world men sata onely assayleth v open warre also layeth ambush v practizeth destruction priuily muche possible vvee therefore know howe step one pace present life wee daunger caught snare vvhen satan hath layde snare grinnes v euen ready catch v lorde preserueth v way made afore v yea wee hilde vp guyded angel sayde psalme wicked haue snare alwaies pitched true sooth themselues men also doo thinke bee exceeding happie bycause know prepared ynough knowe snare layde catch wicked wee must note also couered therfore see fayre pleasant way wicked frisking scoterloping seemeth god hold backe yet let v ceasse therfore coclude horrible destructio prepared wee must iudge owne conceyt seeming falsifie holy scripture wee desirous see snare sayd hidde earth therefore let v contented bee ignorat till god discouer iudgements vnto v meane secrete iudgements cannot coceyued fayth wee would haue experience owne fancie naught ye see faythfull ought brydle themselues oft god shall seeme fauour wicked minded punish bring account vvherefore let good men stand alwayes vpon conclusion vvell know men ende yet god iudge worlde wayt paciently till see falling matter shall haue perceyued wicked caught doubt god accomplisheth sayeth though meane doth knowne therfore mount aboue boundes suffiseth mee giue glorie vnto god thing doth therewithall pray may profite selfe thereby put stint mention made heele purposely although bildad eye spoken snare vnder grounde wicked caught yet notwithstanding vnder woorde heele hee sheweth must maruel though god make wicked stumble first blowe suffer runne long race seemeth bee come vttermost triumph euer beareth downe giueth counterbuffe maketh breake necke therefore wee must wonder let v suffer god wayte vpon wicked ende take heele throw downe hadlong thus yee see purpose woorde heele ought serue v nowe bildad addeth immediatly fearefulnesse shal dismay side make fall euery sayd marche narrowe place whither socuer went escape ambush true wicked shall haue roume long large ynough sporte according see leape fro therefore seemeth walke alwayes streyts indeede wee see themselues feele much better wee imagine againe albeit see continually yet doth god length performe sayd euen according bildad vttereth namely feare shall dismay hee mistaketh woorde feare though god enemy shoulde needes knowe conceyue sinnes bee afrayde repent twoo thing namely wicked amazed feare yet merry triumphe cannot stande togither despyzers god would merrie ouershoote themselues forget themselues become beast beleeue able worke wonder think themselues happiest men worlde anger god lo ioy wicked sorte witte furious ioy ioy bereeues wittes reason leaues modestie yet meane whyle god doth call account summoneth within constreyned perceyue must bee fayne come yet burie knowledge muche contented abyde deafe blind nother see yet heare god sheweth telleth wee see wee ought set foorth lesson wee may practise profite effect although wicked haue worlde much say lyfe therefore happy vvhat cheife welfare man bee sure conscience quiet reste hee may goe true constancie life death yea euen merrie doth befall wicked although streyne themselues set light god bee voyde sadnesse yet faine sorie quiet spite teeth hereby wee see life vnhappie good haue vnderstad god mercifull v although vexed side yet comfort v middes al sorrowes sure god wil end profit welfare confusion enimies thus ye see wee must practyze lesson verely deserueth bee discoursed length shall bee god leaue next lecture nowe present time suffer v goe let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement faultes praying hath made v perceyue selues well worthie bereft light cast horrible darknesse reiecting grace holy spirite offered v may neuerthelesse please pity v like hee hath inlightened v woorde holie ghoste increase light v specially make v prosper knoweth fit v yet meane suffer v tied corruptible goodes world rest selues much vpon wee may alwaies go forward euerlasting heritage prepared v heauen wee may vanquished temptation may befall v get vpper hand battelles wherwith assayled wayting till god haue deliuered v misery world taken v vp blissednesse prepared v heauen wee shall haue full contentation may please graunt grace onely v also c lxviij sermon second vpon xviij chapter strength shalbe famine breaking anguish shalbe side firstborne death shall eate vp braunches member skinne yea shall eate vp member hope shall rooted tent king feare shall make come none shall dvvell tent brimstone shall bee povvred vpon dvvelling place rootes shall vvither bylovve boughes shall bee cut aloft name shall perish earth shall haue renoume vvhere shall cast light darknesse driuen quite vvorld shall haue nother sonnes graundchildren among people ouerliuer dvvellings liue shall astonied day go afore shal caught vvith feare surely tent vvicked place knovveth god wee haue go forwarde matter begunne yesterday bildad sheweth god suffereth wicked scape vnpunished howsoeuer worlde go saying true said afore bee rightly vnderstood wit prouided minde binde god wise wee haue bene wont punish wicked maner maner giue leaue execute owne iudgements let v looke vpon followeth bildad sayeth first al famine shall strength wicked breaking shallbe readie iust side vvhen speaketh stregth doubt meeneth abilitie say wicked man nurrishmet shal turned hunger herevnto agreeth secod part streyne addeth side ribbes shall nothing else burst asunder ribbes betoken strength according wee know flesh alone able beare vp vnlesse ribbes harder substance wherin consisteth al force effect vnderstad god curse wicked although seeme strog wel furnished al belongs yet shal keepe broozing breaking may fare better sentece haue mark first according scripture man nurrished bread euery woorde proceedeth mouth god vvherein moyses doth v wit abundance haue able susteine v vvhat nothing el grace god please lorde wee shall bee fedde though want bread drink meate according sayeth wil feede euen time famine cotrariwise man may haue garner full well stored may full till burst yet shall sustenanced euer whit shorte god shewed manna onely susteyneth v power foode eate blissed god serue turne manna scarcitie god well supply againe god blissing bee vpon v nothing v good wee must needes wexe leane wee muste needes starue pine away abundance sentence bildads true see many textes scripture agree vvherefore let v learne profite selues let v vnderstad wee haue nother strength sustenance spreading god goodnesse vpon v whiche thing whence drawe lyfe meane wherby wee bee preserued maynteyned state therefore let v settle whole trust vpon furthermore wee see wicked strong lette v assure selues shall last euer true wee muste imagine bildad namely god sheweth eyesight thing spoken wee muste tarie paciently giue god leaue execute judgement shall thinke good thus ye see haue marke streyne addeth immediatly first borne death shall eate braunches member skinne yea shall eate member parcell repeted vvhereas mention made firstborne death behoueth v vnderstad exquisite kind death die see passe away easily god spareth othersome tormented suche wise pine away peecemeale worne away harde bone othersome go away without feeling let v marke woord firstborne death carieth great force man hilde vpon racke god dismayeth frayeth wrappes anguish side somuch seeth nothing bottomlesse pitte horrible feare bildad therefore sayeth shall happen maner wicked true v mortall god hathe put v worlde condition take v hence againe surely canot come heauely life except corruptible v first put away paule speaketh vvhat must done let euery man dispose himselfe die assuring selues god doth v inestimable grace voutchsafing deliuer v fro corruptio meanes death although trasitory lodging body destroyed yet reare vp new buyldingin v shall much excellet asmuch shall clothed glorie immortality cotrarie part let v assure selues lord sende firstborne death vpo wicked death must full terrour without cofort vnasswaged misery ye see thing wherein differ vnbeleeuers although v must fayn passe death togither common men without exception yet notwithstandinge god reacheth v hande wee come poynt death wee go quiet minde able comende soules vnto true rightordered trust hee may receyue good faythfull keeper wicked muste bee fayne go hence great violence bee troubled dismayed striue god storme haue nothing may comfort neuerthelesse let v bethinke v hath bene sayde namely thing shall alwayes apparant sometime god sendeth violent death child although body bee payned yet soule therefore worse cace wherein baldad deceyued according wee haue alwayes beare minde wee muste iudge eyesight asmuche god iudgements hidden v wee know god executeth must vse owne wit imagination behalfe howebeit god execute iudgements visible maner let v marke wee may take good wee see well let v vnderstand hee hath reserued vtterance till last day triall fayth yet meane whyle wee must bee fully resolued although death common men yet faythfull comforted strengthened god goodnesse come willingly vnto knowing hee receyue according also bee sure keepe soules well safely vnto latter day much cannot perish bicause hee hath comitted lord iesus christ hath taken protectio faythfull therfore wil go willingly vnto death contrarywise lighteth exquisite dreadfull death vpon wicked bycause first knowe whither goe secondly god iustice pursueth wise co ceyue nothing feare dismayednesse vvhen heare sayde priuiledge giuen v wee haue good cause thanke good god prepare selues liue die pleasure lette v bee stubborne hee goeth take v worlde sith suche comfort prepared v insueth immediatly hope shall bee rooted tent hee shall bee brought king death vvhen sayeth hope vngodly shall bee rooted tent thereby done v vnderstad god time lodge vnworthie shall haue ease yea dwell palace whyle meane season poore faythfull one shall scarsely haue little cotage retyre vnto thus despyzers god whiche giuen naughtinesse shall dwell worlde though lordship thereof belonged none shall haue wide large house shal haue goodly long walk therewithall trust shall bee pleasure say shall thinke themselues well settled may neuer shaken according also sayde psalme shal repine order nature man looke vpon buyldings make bylowe seemeth bee highly aduaunced hand god cannot touche thus yee see twoo thing shewed v sentence therefore wee see despyzers god brauerie iollitie let v abashed vvhy late dayes suche trade began lorde haue v behold thinges end may know yet come heritage saluatio yet hidden thus must troubled offended see wicked prosper haue ful scope haue fayre dwelling place yea trust good fortune puffed vp pride haue suregrounded hope owne seeming may vvhe see well newe thing let v marke sayd hope rooted dwelling place say although world see p pe adayes fenced furnished seeme bee rapirde al side harme may come neere incober although worlde see well ease like cotinue euer yet wil god performe hath sayde naught hath spoken dwelling place hope therein shewed v god wil letted execute vengeance vpo notwithstanding highly aduaunced time exempted misery worlde ende sayd shall come king feare like mencion made firstborne death betoken violent death death terrible common death likewise bildad speaketh king feare betokeneth royall exquisite feare say greatest feare found true similitude wee may take diuell king feare natural meening haue touched afore surely firstborne death king feare one maner speeche let v marke briefly wicked threatened driuen terrible excessiue feare feares worlde godly conceiue nothing muste marke sentence well god sende v occasion care feare wee grieued truly chiefe benefite wish lyfe peace wee set free exempted misdoubting carefulnesse yet notwithstanding god haue v care wee muste therefore quiet ouertake feare although greate yet meane whereby god prouoketh v resort vnto would neuer come hyde selues vnder shadowe winges wee safe sure side v little child long afrayd sport play runne euerywhere bee scared feare man shall get mother lap little chicken would neuer gather themselues hastily vnder dammes wing scared put feare vvee bee witlesse wee knowe daunger v wee play stray beast therefore lorde drawe v home sendeth v feare wee bee fayne spite teeth acknowledge life vnsure garded god thus ye see whereto care feares god sendeth child tende againe meane make distrust owne strength wee neuer trust throughly god except discouraged selues wee knowe become therefore good v bee put feare howbeit wee see wicked sure state lette v bee good cheere reste inioy must ende deerely payde shall go king feare say shall haue suche flightings nothing may deliuer shall liue extreeme torment anguish somuch man would bring backe againe god preuayle tell ought humble themselues vntoo god might rest vpo goodnesse vnderstand whit ment able taste thereof behold say astonishment wicked dally nowadayes god thus yee see effect wee haue remember streyne consequently sayde one whiche none shall dwell tent brimstone shall bee powred vpon house men set downe shall dwell tent howbeit bicause none brimstone shal cast downe vpon harde streyned let v marke bildad ment rather dwellingplaces wicked shall perish else conueyed ouer vnto straungers effect meening like textes like sayd vineyardes landes curse moyses pronou ceth suche obey god haue serued haue bene vnthankfull rebellious towardes thou shalt plant vine sayeth another man shall gather grape thou shalt sowe another shal reape thy haruest thou shalt builde house stranger shall dwell curse performed wee must acknowledge hand god bildad sayeth possesse great house time shal cast length others shall come yea euen theselues dwell god wil ouerthrow shal neede extortioner thrust enimie inuade spoyle possessios brimstone shal fall vpo fro aboue say god finde meanes vnknowne extraordinarie wherby make wicked perish notwithstanding set vp aloft shrynes noman put ye see effect conteined true notable sentence hold v prouiso hath bene set downe say must beare mind god iudgements go one rate world executed one visible maner sens may perceyue sometimes god causeth child tossed fro post piller see nother present time paule sayd without reste meeneth curse layd vpon god child bee alwayes wandering world therby taught seeke heritage rest prepared aboue therefore whereas faithfull birdes vpon bough men say wote abide remoued fro executed vpon curse rather turned wholly welfare saluatio howbeit oft see lord leaue wicked despyzers woord behoueth v vnderstand giueth taste curse cace againe dwell quietly house noman troubleth god hath thunder brimstone hand soone destroy although men fauour worlde maynteyne holde vp throughly fenced side yet al shet gate god may reuendge side listeth immediatly followeth roote shall wither beneath boughes bee cut aboue nowe againe bildad dothe v vnderstand wicked shall cofounded notwithstanding state seeme happie may bee therevnto dothe similitude leade v certesse likeneth tree rooted ground marke tree well planted afterward spreadeth aboue wel truke boughes bear leaues floures frute euen outwarde shew wicked despyzers god similitude well woorthie noted haue declared alreadie must greeued al see god doth first dashe punish steppe vnto euill rather seemeth beare good heare petition troubleth v desire boyle within v would faine god take vengeance hande much behoueth v marke well sayde wicked may wel like vnto fayre tree according sayde psalme haue seene vngodly aduaunced high seemed like cedre libanus like ceders higher tree euen wicked among men somuch seemeth men el stoupe vnder went sayeth dauid kept way came backe againe sawe print remayning vvhereas sayeth went meeneth taried paciently til god accoplished worke full time come euen must wee see wicked prosperitie must hinder v following course till come thither god calleth v thus yee see wee haue marke text first poynt secondly behoueth v marke threatening wicked shal haue taken deepe roote come prosperitie likelihood euer winde storme shall shake shall roote wither beneath say god worke sorte shal throwne downe consumed theyr braunches shal cut aboue say god persecute meanes wee see let v resorte promise giuen god child according sayd man feareth god shal like tree planted riuers side alwayes draweth moysture nurrishment perfect beleefe god like thervnto sayd leremie therefore let v pray god may draw moisture thing spoken another place psalmes may fulfilled v namely rightuous shall florishe palme tree prosper euen house lord also let v pray lorde nurrish roote beneath although wee carie outwarde shewe men yet may cease haue life hidden christe please giue v countenance may magnifying blissing wee may example record goodnesse please time cut boughes wil also make turne profite man cutteth shreddeth vine make beare good fruite afterwarde whereas lette alone would growe wilde let v sure please god cut boughes make v yeelde fruite taking away superfluous v thing may turne benefite besides serue also restreyne v fro tempted pray god make v like wicked wit make v prosper doo thus much concerning similitude also sayd memoriall shall perish earth shall haue renowme true must put trust worlde seeke renowme glorie holy scripture mocketh kinde vanitie saying doo settle name earth know god kingdome meene therefore wee must desirous make selues renowmed worlde yet vaine also god hath promised blissing child name shall continue euer shall blissed bicause lorde spite churlishnesse worlde notwithstanding make seruants honorable good estimatio may despized time yea subiect many slaunders reproches god deliuer length bring passe rightuousnesse shal knowne ye see memoriall good men god child shall blissed true alwayes accomplished world yet falleth oftentimes againe whereas god speaketh renowme memoriall meeneth respect haue discretion iudge vnbeleuers blinde ignorat discerning god child aright yet doth diminish thing promisse god maketh v let v come bildads saying memoriall wicked shall perish let v marke saying curse peculiarly belongyng despizers god according haue touched alreadie bee drunken foolish ambitio beare themselues hand name shall neuer fade worlde men shall haue remembrance euer see goeth cleane contrarie cause turmoyle themselues sorte haue men talke vvell despyzers god desirous make themselues renowmed mouth men god turne quite cleane contrarie remembrance continue shall reproche men shall speake skorne mockage haue bene caried away sayd vaine desire see god hath buried menne coulde tell become vvhereas seemed talked worlde indured whereas themselues surmized euery become greatest although sawe many go yet euery thinke himselfe shall chiefest yet hath god buried sayde afore men speake maner euery man made priuie naughtinesse shame doth come sayd curse god therfore lette v marke bildad hath expressed chiefe thing kinde men seeke whiche giuen worlde ought bee well marked god make name perish worldward loze wee harme haue wee wee knowe name written booke lyfe glad sayeth lorde iesus christ disciple name written god register euerlasting saluation ynough content v vvee like fooles haue none immortalitie make themselues spoken ouergreat fondnesse wee know god hath written name booke ingroced recorde owne hande say owne euerlasting determination god hande vnchaungeable ordinance hee hath appoynted afterward ratified whole bloud lord iesus christ finally sealed working holy spirite seing wee haue memoriall among angel heauen among patriarkes prophet apostle haue wee cause concontented albeit remembrance razed worlde yet shall wee looze nothing wee see god maketh memoriall seruants blissed sayd afore notwithstanding despyzed time counted world dirt dung saint paule speaketh likeneth guttes full filthinesse cast away thus faythfull exercized time yea vnder curse men though bare al sinnes worlde end god maketh rightuousnesse shine foorth breake day blessed remembrace vve see abraham time despized shaken vvhat may man thinke iacob yet see memoriall blissed euerie man ranne vpon dauid cursed spited became worme ground made skorne mockingstocke veriest rascalles euery man lothe yet notwithstanding see remembrance blissed yea euen god churche vnbeleeuers man must seeke haue renowme remembrance among bicause bee wretched blinde soules cannot iudge able discerne betweene white blacke thus ye see haue marke sentence consequently heere added shall bee cast light darkenesse shall bee driuen worlde shall haue neyther child graundchildrenamong people shall haue ouerliuer heyre lande dwell heere bildad confirmeth matter hee treated god make wicked prosper alwayes verie true happinesse state seing laughter muste turned sorow let v assure selues present light wicked serues leade way darknesse vvhen heare wee darknesse say aduersitie according also worde importeth wote side turne v bycause besette many misery round aboute wee see way well let v parte assure selues darknesse neuer great shall pathe leade v god light hee hath wonderfull meanes leade child saluation yea euen seemeth fully minded destroy vndone let v assure selues meanes god draweth v saluation wee thicke darknesse let v assure selues well bring v light thus yee see wee haue gather vpon text contrariwise wee see wicked puffed vp nobilitie make great braueries spread wing vvell true greate brightnesse lette v tarie till god performe whiche sayde heere witte till hee bring darkenesse vppon thus wee see heere verie profitable thing v knowe whiche although god make wicked prosper tyme cace neuer better alwayes ende muste bee looked vnto contrarywise thoughe poore faythfull one bee distressed heere wote become state neuer worse let v looke vpon ende whiche darkenesse god meeneth bring light againe whereas sayde wicked shall haue neyther child ofspring leaue heires dwelling according curse lawe sayde issue blissing god although lorde would benefites life dedicated vnto men acknowledge bee authour yeelde prayse yet notwithstanding auoucheth speciall benefite giueth men issue although law written bildads time yet hee doctrine printed hart god witte lorde roote wicked hee leaue one race al shall brought naught man alledge lord doth often suffer euen owne child barraine answere herevnto maner cursings oftentimes turned blissings vnto god child neyther must make generall indifferent rule say god doth caces woorke saying visibly eye wee muste leaue choyce himselfe dispoze thereof time place shall thinke good vvee may see sometimes faithfull man one feareth god shall haue issue worlde yet bee sayde therefore hee cuised god beholde first rightuous man issue left behinde yea promise made abraham ofspring shoulde bee sande sea starres skie hee great number child many child left death true hee diuerse child besides isaac god cutte according also woorthie bee abraham child true also sonne isaac two child one murtherer hart meanes whereof faine put away banish house vvee see although godly leaue child deceasse yet therefore lesse blissed god haue euerlasting fatherhood heauen pleaseth god ioyne saincts faithfull one angelles also wicked bee knowne want issue curse god vnto seeming forlorne might haue heyre succeede god disappointeth rightfull vengeance punishment meete bicause altogither liking wee haue marke streyne furthermore bildad concludeth end come shall amazed suche go afore shall afrayde dwelling wicked feare god serueth cofirme matter witte god punish wicked wise worlde shall astonished sight state shall vnhappie saying verie true ought aduautage selues greatly beare well minde prouided follow bildad inclosing iob suche afflicted within sayde cursednesse haue sayd aduersities light vpon god child well vpo wicked vvee must alwayes beware let god alone guyding thing vnto whome belongeth poore afflicted world esteemeth v wretch let v therfore ceasse rest vpon goodnesse god wayte leysure till deliuer v full adoo oure necessity affliction thing referre vnto let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v feele suche wise wee may humble selues sorie learne take profite misery aduersities sent v worlde wee haue done hithertoo vpon knowledge faultes sinnes wee may enter examination lyfe mislike vice ende receyued mercie meane lord iesus christ may haue matter occasion trust goodnesse time come whereas wee haue walke many misery aduersities worlde may therfore ceasse obey alwayes end may please graunt grace onely v also c lxix sermon first vpon xix chapter iob ansvvered sayde hovv long vvill ye greeue hart vndermine vvith vvordes yee haue alreadie ten time put confusion ashamed yee hardened agaynst mee haue done amisse sinne shall abide vvith mee magnifie selues vaunt selues miserie knovv ye god hath beseeged vvith povver beset roud vvith net crie reason violence heansvvereth shreeke yet haue right hath shet vp vvay passage hee hath put darknesse path hath bereft glorie hath taken crovvne avvay head hath destroyed mee side vanished avvay hath taken avvay hope hope tree anger kindled counteth enimie army come haue inclosed haue pitched camp tent haue seene bildads intent rebuking iob tooke general groud god leaueth wicked vnpunished thervpo concluded iob muste needes number sith god afflicted greuously iob disproueth bicause men deeme life aduersities endured forsomuch god punisheth offence executeth determination secrete vnknowne men howbeit come poynt coplayneth freendes hardharted towardes yee ashamed sayth put confusion often time alreadie haue hardened selues agaynst mee haue made selues straungers mee hebrew worde may import one wel fittest hardned themselues hauing pitie compassion vpon misery wee see whereto plaint tendeth howbeeit whereas sayth bee haue done amisse sinne shall abyde therein sheweth haue bene ouerpassionate done amisse receyue correction peaceably say let alone shall beare mine owne punishment man shall take harme sin selfe maner speaking agreeth vnreclaymable desperate person rather childe god neuerthelesse iob tempted therevnto sawe coulde haue reason freendes handes yet returneth principall standeth vppon poynt bicause euill cace sayth thinke ye preuayle vaunting selues bicause ye see mee plight thinke cace past recouerie shall bee damned bycause ye see miserable creature may know yee sayth god hath ouerthrowne mee iudgement say ye must dispute heere reason god ruleth himselfe according man capacitie haue right hand may well contende yet must stande harmes muste bee oppressed yet crie make moane miserie neuer assuaged booteth hath shewed himselfe bee mine enimie hath sent innumerable misery like armie beseege mee tormented worse see issue way seemeth hath inclosed mee locked vp maner meane scape misery presse torment mee verie straunge talke first sight alreadie vnderstoode partly wherevpon iob groundeth newly againe brought remembrance shall shewed anon god leaue let v go forwarde iobs talke complaint maketh freendes iust witte pleasure put confusion haue sayde heretofore man smitten god roddes although bee iust cause finde fault yet muste done milde spirite medicine bee sharpe considering hand god hath rigour ynough selfe without adding man beare stoutly god seeme feele miserie playeth madman meanes reformable haue vse greater sharpnesse men abuse god pacience goodnesse statelinesse must tamed god handle firste deserue become hardeharted wilfull bycause hee beareth ye see wherein ought vse greater rigor borne men shoulde outface god sort turne goodnesse gentlenesse poison therby inuenim themselues let man handle mildly runne ryot delight become bewitched man cannot wring reason oute drawe repentance man hartbroken seene god hath wrought wise alredie ought moued compassion matter set vpon rigor vvee shoulde shew selues haue mahood v true man afflicted much possible yet wee see still hardharted god correction hee hath receyued haue amended behoueth vse rigor yet neuerthelesse wee must still haue pitie miserie see wee kindharted bee mitigation gentlenesse vse quiet fashion nowe iobs freendes suche dealing taken thing ought founde humbled vnder hand god surely although seemed straunge hadled yet notwithstanding hee ceassed confesse god iudge power ouer therevpon fall rayling beare hande
