cleane contrary truth hee wicked man nothing hypocrisie hee neuer serued god hartily whiche afflicted much better rightuouser hee iob would haue agreed hee must haue renounced god spoken owne conscience yee see wherevpon hee standeth heereby wee bee taught god afflicteth neyghboures wee muste conclude worst men aliue wee muste haue regard iudge vprightly wee woulde haue men v say maye bee god meening trye pacience althoughe haue walked vprightly good zeale yet notwithstanding hee intendeth wee shoulde haue mirroures please conceale cause v haue doone amisse god doo punishe yet muste wee measure theyr sinnes punishmente wee see hee behaueth himselfe hardly towarde rightuous towarde woorser sorte bicause hee reserueth wickeddest till ende make vnexcusable doo nothing else heape vp store wrath horrible vengeance vppon theyr owne heades yee see howe becommeth v bee wyse modeste wee see poore men aduersitie ende wee go wrong way woorke agayne although god shewe v finger iust cause sendeth suche misery vpon man let v learne make oure owne profite wee may doo lette v haue eye selues god maketh v perceyue iudgementes sorte intent instruct v another man coste therfore purpose v condemne suche aduersitie without hauing regarde oure selues behooueth euerie v enter intoo himselfe bethinke ala god hath preserued mee bounde vntoo yea also may bee chastyzed one waye vvherefore muste acknowldge god spareth mee whereas scourged extremitie specially mine ease reste commeth meere mercie saye lette v acknowledge thing may haue occasion bee owne iudges condemne folkes without looking oure selues way wee see temptation men gyue outwarde wrongfull iudgement v harde keepe measure cace sith iob suche pacientnesse haue seene scripture reporteth hath notwithstanding ouer leaped boundes able brydle himselfe euill woorde myght scape true hath good right complayne yet saying vnreclaymable persone say haue doone amysse faulte shall abyde mee althoughe men bee vnkinde v wee haue doone amisse wee see haue firye zeale leastwise mylde harte requisite yet muste god child alwayes humble themselues knowe wee whither god bee priuye mo faultes v wee oure selues wote surelye wee perceyue tenth parte oure sinnes god therefore doth sende v harder chastizemente thinke conuenient bycause wee knowe oure owne disease vvee see dauid hath selfe consideration towardes semei hee knew well semei lewde fellowe hee ledde agaynste cankerde bitter minde yet notwithstanding hee sayeth tell whyther god hath commaunded rayle vppon mee yee see howe dauid considereth god hilde handes haue dealt withall rudely nowe wicked men persecuting v bee bee fathered vppon god bycause hee serueth turne whippes stryke v iustlye withall shall wee thinke wee see men doo good zeale laboure refourme v desirous oure welfare come v suche gentlenesse requisite shall therfore play looce coltes reiect spoken vvhat discretion vvee shewe well thereby bee gouerned god spirite wise wee see iob tempted maner therfore wee muste bee wa er befell man angell heauen praye become v wee keepe good watche satan vvill soone put v soyle surely hee get entrie intoo v wee knowe well whiche syde turne v come agayne oure right waye wee bee lette sentence serue v suche instruction haue spoken witte men lifte vp themselues wise v feerce vpon v bee modest requisite yet notwithstanding behoueth v vnderstande alwaies welfare receyue correction layde vpon v humbling selues lette v learne enter oure selues let v neyther fret repine men rebuke v somewhat sharpely discouer lewdnesse vvherefore men wee see doo oftentymes storme without rule modesty bicause haue eye vnto god partie appeached woulde consider verely haue done amisse finde selfe blame worthy may well excuse selfe afore let mee iustifie selfe let mee bleare eye selfe neyghbours let mee imagine haue greate wrong done mee ala yet scape hand god vvhat shall gayne seeking many krinkes excusing selfe worldwarde lo god condemne mee moreouer matter standeth simply vpon beeing cyted heauenly iudge beholde mine owne conscience doth cry vpon mee carie iudge hangman mee sith better mee yeeld selfe guiltie caste downe head consider god seeth thing asmuch handleth shoulde acknowledge fit medicine although seme bitter mee could find hart refuze possible yet behoofe yeeld yee see wee haue marke sentence furthermore let v learne quicksighted espying owne faultes god visiteth v assuring oure selues dooing sheweth v singular fauour wee see howe inclined nature hypocrisie thervpon euery v doth flatter foade himselfe owne sinnes wee preuented side none v hee woulde welter owne filthinesse woulde become ende vve shall runne euill worse till satan get full possession v shall wee bee caryed awaye shall remayne nothing blockishnesse v according sayde prouerbes sainct paule speaketh also behold extremest misery men haue remorse carryed away gyuen vp handes satan wounded feele sinnes bewayle god surely v come poynte god withhild v stirring vp men nowe inforce v feele oure sinnes discouering wee haue forgotten thinke well hidden putting v minde whereas wee haue turned oure backes vpon iudge behooueth v come therefore sayde yee see heere benefite bee despized wee refused correction put v one wee laboured quench light god spirite vvee bee darkenesse long sinnes hidden god commeth lyght v vp cresset giue v lyght see owne wantes yet wee leuer haue kercheefes blindefolde selues withall cannot finde oure harte haue taken away wee refuze light lyke better darkenesse praye vnthankefulnesse pray detestable sacriledge wee resiste god spirite sorte reacheth v hande willing bring v backe waye saluation yee see speciall poynt wee haue marke sentence wee muste say haue doone amisse shall beare mine owne burthen men shall suffer punishment mee say lette v stryue fashion lette v consider god gyueth giftes others communicate vntoo v hee sendeth v man shewe v oure faultes recorde goodnesse hee hath styll care v desirous reserue v himselfe verie deede wee bee restie kicke agaynste spurre reiecting correction offered v men manner vnthankefulnesse shooteth god himselfe whome wrong done hee also shall reuenge therefore let v keepe oure selues falling suche pryde let v bethinke v whensoeuer haue done amisse high time v come home oure selues consider oure owne euill may bee remedyed nowe lette v come seconde poynte whiche chiefe hath bene declared heeretofore iob vtterly refuze correction cast foorth wordes blaste winde hath beene noted heeretofore booke iob speaketh onely hee fully resolued also vttereth fittes affection mooued inwardely howbeeit withstode restreyned hee sorie afterwarde nowe therefore hee giueth ouer hee sayde passing commeth principall poynte hee knewe wandering talke grounded eyther vppon reason truthe returneth hee defence cace whiche freendes vnder coloure comforting doo vaunte themselues agaynste yea theyr vaunting themselues withoute alleadging thing reproofe put confuzion came thither suche harde shamelesse harte neyther manhoode modesty thus ye see iobs meening hee concludeth alwaies god dooth punishe sinnes hee handleth straunge fashion suche men acquaynted surely heere hee complayneth hee crye reason bycause god enimie heereby wee taught firste wee doo oure neyghboures good rebuking faultes behooueth v bee well sure haue done amisse finde faulte iustly vpon single coniectures euill manner proceeding iobs freendes condemne bicause god scourged vve muste another minde haue sayde alreadie god keepeth alwayes one rate punishe none suche haue doone amisse nay rather oftentymes rightuousest troubled muche others wee see according god hath dealte power vnto doth hee also trie vttermoste behooueth v beare well minde ende wee bee greeued wee see wee muste walke selfe waye doo ought mislike v god spareth v whome hee loued men vvoulde wee bee priuiledged holy father haue excellent wytnesse holie ghost wee shoulde condemne acquitte euerie man according god handling poore folke worlde sicke folke despyzed folke folke oute credite estimation shoulde bee wicked men dealing god chooseth bee whome acknowledgeth auoucheth bee child contrariwise placed honour dignitie god aduaunceth fashion intente theyr fall shoulde bee deadlyer specially abuse gifte suche haue rich swallowed vp bee entring hell become drunken theyr prosperitie vaunte themselues agaynste god goodes whiche possesse crie vengeance vve see suche strongest like stubborne horse cannot bee broken brought handsomnesse short seemeth nothing else rage agaynst god thus yee see ouerspitefull frowarde iudgement therefore let v learne holde suche euen hande wee condemne men god lawe time bee sure faultes wee may discerne person let v alwayes reserue god hande vntill appeare certaine marke god hath reiected let v parte hastie take vpon v thing lawefull thus yee see haue sticke sentence neuerthelesse haue sayde alreadye iobs meening true witte hee punished sinnes yet followeth therfore hee ouershot himselfe passion oughte alwayes humble v wee see suche man indued great grace able holde himselfe swaruing aside shall become nowe according heerevntoo hee sayeth god ouerthrowen say hee commeth agaynste suche disordered manner altoogither oute square hath indifferencie may spoken sense shall bee euill haue declared heeretoofore god double rightuousnesse one whiche hee hath sette foorth lawe rightuousnesse well knowen apparant v oure rule lyue yet another higher rightuousnesse god whiche secrete hydden v wee shall haue fulfilled whole lawe whiche impossible doo wee wyll put cace doone yet haue wee satisfied god according perfect rightuousnesse wee shall haue contented according seruice hee requireth v according abilitie oure humayne nature meene abilitie wee haue since adam synned suche wee oure creation god put cace wee aungelles go wee myghte fulfill lawe god answerable souerayne rightfulnesse farre hygher oure vnderstanding able reache vntoo proportionablenesse betwixte oure lorde dooth nowe punishe men theyr sinnes euen according curse hee hath set foorth lawe otherwhiles hee hath suche respecte punishing reserueth intente owne secrete purpose wee see afflicting iob bee demaunded wee haue soughte vttermoste wee shall finde bee sinnes therefore muste needes bee cause vvee see trouble iacob indured yet hee serued god purely say yee father abraham isaac shoulde seeme god conspired agaynst make passe aduersities misery coulde bee deuized muche bee sayde dauid vvas disordered men deserued rigorous punishment yee see god hath secrete iudgementes whiche hydden v tyme therefore iobs meening heere affliction whiche hee endureth muste bee taken one common punishment implyed thretnings god hath published lawe hygher cause whiche bee knowen men surely iob simply respecte hee good reason dooing hee sayeth god ouerthrowen order hee sheweth himselfe bee ouermaystred affection true hee alwayes knewe god rightuous according wee see although hee shaken suche woordes escaped yet hee returneth home againe acknowledgeth ought holde mouthe shette neuerthelesse hee cea eth haue skumme boyling pot seetheth vp greate walloppes muste needes spirt ouer one side euen doth iob behooueth v knowe hee stormeth muche agaynst god whiche thing greatly oure profite apply instruction touching firste place wee shall haue profited greatly wee beare away lesson god dooth sometymes punishe men respecte theyr sinnes humble bycause intente shewe hee hathe full authoritie ouer creature hathe ordeyned mirroures pacience bycause hee wyll make feele theyr owne infirmity maye knowe themselues better perceyue bee couert vice discouered affliction haue suche constancie requisite haue swarued asyde shall haue seene themselues stumbled maye bee prouoked call vpon god knowing reached hand bin vtterly vndone surely whensoeuer indure affliction best remedy v enter knowing sinnes euery man accuse himselfe saying ala haue offended god many wayes punish mee hundred folde haue deserued much agayne wee see alwayes wherefore god scourgeth v let v say vvell lorde thou art rightuous although bee able atteyne reason thine intent ought suffize mee knowe thou doest thing rightly indifferently lette v assure selues wee haue true wisedome wee glorifie god notwithstanding hee holde oure eye closed vp leade v poore blinde soules let v bee contented walke whithersoeuer leadeth directeth v assuring selues onely wyll muste bee v infallible rule right whereas wee see iob ouermaystred affection let v vnderstande right harde thing v submitte selues single god without asking reason woorkes speciallie woorkes surmounte witte capacitie sayde afore namely perfect angelicall wisedome haue skill yeelde muche honour vntoo god rest meerely simply vpon pleasure although wee finde matter straunge seeming vtterlye contrarie ryght reason yet wee bowe downe heades saye lorde although thy iudgementes bee deepe gulfe yet wee presume encounter truely iob fully dispozed doo yea althoughe hee rough assault temptation yet ende got victorie neuerthelesse wee see hee swarued saying god hath ouerthrowen iudgement say handleth mee lyke iudge steppeth mee extraordinarie rigoure thoughe hee compassion mee seeyng iob tempted farre shall becomme v therefore lette v applye oure wytte oure indeuoure lesson namelye reste simply meerely vpon good god tarrye vpon temptation althoughe cary v sometimes away holde selues shorte reyne selues bridle wee see god playeth iudge v mortall men auaunce themselues agaynst maker cannot find theyr hate submitte themselues hee sendeth although protest cleane cotrary yet doings shewe blame god crueltie woulde fayne go lawe thus yee see haue beare mynde iob must serue v suche example sith wee see excesse pang howbeeit wee compare rushe intoo diuelishe boldenesse wee ought yet better warned humble oure selues howe vve shall see manie like vntoo iob onely haue pang twayne chafing also continue euill woorse matter falleth theyr minde firste fall murmuring agaynst god afterwarde take libertie chafe meete vneasie saying theyr headinesse suche make bone auaunte themselues agaynste god yea bee wilfull vttermoste wee see selfewize folke doo insomuche thing holye scripture agreeth theyr witte foolishe brayne muste bee condemned first dashe without scanning whence proceedeth afterwarde although bee conuinced yet ceasse shamelesse lifte vp themselues agaynst god agaynste secrete incomprehensible iudgementes say tushe impossible enter heade vvell freende bee blinde sunne therefore darke shineth blinde man say see lyght muche say sunne doth darke men well matter therefore sith wee see diuell caryeth away men suche rage conclude theyr reason agaynste god muche standeth v hand indeuer bridle selues short impaciency erewhiles prouoke v pricke v forward bee angry god fret selues leastwise yet wee haue well stormed lette v come home againe better turne late neuer let v say lorde would become mee thou hilde mee backe euen god behooueth gouerned thy spirite thou giue mee wisedome bee wholly subiect thy good whatsoeuer may betyde mee lo haue marke moreouer let v also compare misery iobs wee consider well affliction indured bee straunge hee myght well say know may take god oppresseth mee ouersore proofe hereof god touche v little finger wee bee tender angrie fall saying howe go geere god sende v common disease beare selues hande hee ought rather haue spared v hee afflict v wise wyll make v storme bee shorte lette giue v one lashe rodde wee saye hee hath thundred vpon v seeing impacient let v consider iob indured woulde become v shoulde come poynt vvoulde cast vp skumme asswage againe nexte way sette v quite ouer oure shoe sith wee bee inclined therevnto vppon euery small occasion muche therefore behooueth v knowe wee haue profited god schoole tyll wee haue learned take paciently correction sendeth v seeing tend welfare thus yee see wee note vpon sentence howbeeit among thing lette v marke harde verye daungerous temptation god heareth cryes complayntes sayde god name strong sure hold suche flee vnto vvhosoeuer calleth vpon name lorde shall saued yea although heauen earth medled togither whole order nature confounded yet shoulde still preserued calling vppon name god oel sayeth god hath promised heare v ope mouth reach hande helpe v speake ye see god sheweth himselfe bountifull yea would maruell assuring v succour necessitie yet shall haue called vpon twice wee shall haue persisted praying haue pitie vpon v wee shall continue still one state whiche woorse shall seeme v god sharpeneth himselfe agaynste v torment v haue called vpon temptation sayde mee name god refuge god neere vnto call vppon faithfully haue assayed promise meane feele comoditie rather miserie increased thing yet notwithstanding iob came poynte iob onely also dauid reste faythfull specially behoueth thing bee fulfilled oure lorde iesus christe according also whome sentence veryfied namely crye vntoo thee daye nyght yet thou easest mee misery thou seemest haue forsaken mee oure father resorted thee alwayes perceyued vayne thou puttest mee heere confusion hereby wee note although god haue promised bee neere vntoo call vppon succoure open theyr mouthes desire yet dooth importe hee sheweth alwayes eye hys owne manner certaine wee call vppon god hee willing readie helpe v proofe heereof whence commeth affection praying commeth holie ghoste man woulde neuer owne minde resort vnto god bycause god looketh vnto v pity thinke hath turned back vpon v agayne haue stoode vp tyme muste needes bee power whiche hee gaue v succouring v hande made v bee pacient lowly aduersities true may haue suche conceyte maye seeme v tyme god hath gyuen eare v vvee see howe iob dauid yea iesus christe also fayne come poynte hee tempted maner say impacience yet notwithstanding bicause hee fight agaynste owne humaine nature hee fayne suffer anguishe minde forasmuche god lefte destitute helpe hee inforced crie god god haste thou forsaken mee therefore wee haue suche temptation greeued reason infirmity greate store vice v according wee full distruste stubbornnesse pryde like thing let v haue recourse vnto poynte bee firste whome god hath minded succoure haue ende felte profyte theyr prayer notwithstanding languyshed vnder hande tyme let v hold oute suffer god keepe v languyshing long pleaseth euen tyll hee haue delyuered v shewed himselfe oure sauioure full according hee hath gyuen v taste already worlde nowe lette v fall downe face good god acknowledgemet sine praying clenze v may nothing v hinder v comming right foorth vnto comming wee may finde ready receyue v lorde iesus christes sake let v saye almighty god heauenly father c lxx sermon second vpon xix chapter sermon conteyneth exposition verse haue bene touched alreadie vpon texte followeth heere hee hath made brother shrinke avvaye mee myne acquayntance become straungers mee neighbour haue forsaken mee father mother haue forgotten mee mine ovvne housholde may deseruantes haue disdeyned mee haue beene straunger theyr sight call seruant hee ansvvereth mee though pray vvith mine ovvne mouth behoueth v go matter beganne last sermon whiche harde burdensome temptation whe prayer heard firste verely onely thing remayneth v aduersitie god receiue v desire hee haue pitie vpon v wee maye feele resorting h succour hath beene vayne thus say welfare comforte faithfull seeme wee haue loste time running god bee ayded hande become shall wee bee good despayre yet god pleasure exercize child manner hyding himselfe making countenaunce hearing regarding misery indure true hath promised bee readie helpe v soone wee desire yea hee tarie bee sued vntoo preuente oure requestes maketh temptation muche greeuouser namely god seemeth haue dallyed v haue gyuen v vayne frutelesse hope let v vnderstande seeing hath exercised child heretofore must maruell though like v nowadayes vvherfore let v wait paciently shall see ende hath forgotten v ne ceasseth heare v althoughe hee shewe oute hande open syght worlde hee hath hande stretched ouer v doubte wee bee pacient able continue prayer token god hath heard v alreadie hee preserued v manner possible v haue continued one minute houre hath beene declared behoueth v come euill v cause god delayeth helpe dryueth time pray hartily requisite euery man saye hee passeth praying deede men bee asked whyther haue doone indeuer pray god haue mercie vpon euerie one answere haue prayed muche possible speake manner knowe prayer meeneth vvee go coldly thing wee thinke god ought receyue suche requestes made fashion sake ceremoniously onely let v marke god seeyng coldenesse negligence aydeth v soone wee desire intente quycken v inflame v greater desire meanes oure fayth may bee better tryed else wee pray god sorte bee negligence oure prayer yet wyll bee rebelliousnesse hydden v wee see heere iob true iob prayed suche mildenesse meete hee rather impacient sorte muste wee go vntoo god sainct paule gyueth v rule saying wee muste pray incessantly gyuing thankes although wee tormented ouerpressed aduersities yet muste wee ceasse sighe grone yea therewithall also continuallye blisse name god oure prayer submit oure selues vntoo bee wanting praying rather defying god man shoulde go summon enimie defye yee see oure prayer sometymes like vntoo summoning according wee make vntoo god howe greatest honour god requireth handes wee shoulde call vppon aduersities nowe steede dooing homage come spyte therefore wee must thinke straunge hee shoulde stoppe eares agaynste oure prayer make countenaunce helpe v wee crye vppon lette v haue two thing witte lette v pray god earnest minde may bee onely liplabour casting foorth sighes aduenture beseeching bottome harte secondly lette bee pryde v bee desirous make god subiect v hee shoulde whatsoeuer commeth heade fancie let v pray vnto lowlinesse magnifiyng praysing although hee afflict v vvhen haue two thing certayne wee shall bee hearde muche rather contrarie vice cause god doth muche delay helping v let v put cace god succoure v wee haue prayed duetifully suche hartinesse hee himselfe requireth yet muste wee still bee pacient till conuenient tyme bee come whiche hande onely iudge wee knowe day prayer haue auayled v god make v perceyue morrowe vvherefore lette v stande dumbe behalfe wayte suche opportunitie ende god shall liste sende v shall bee good luckie welfare thus yee see wee haue marke sentence iob sayeth hee cryed yet wasnot bearde adding complaine affliction extreeme woonder though hee bee exceedinglye sore greeued freendes ought stande checking agaynste follie sayeth hee deeme ordinarie custome ought doo man bee afflicted tolde hee ought pray vnto god mee sayeth hee pray vntoo hearde man reply agayne frende muste storme sore peraduenture aduersitie hee indureth common thing sayeth hee feele suche excessiue payne hande god presseth mee straunge rigorous manner maruell thoughe bee neyther witte reason mee lo iobs meening haue tolde heeretoofore howe behooueth v knowe god dooth sometimes execute rigoure vppon men vnknowen manner respect oure mother witte therefore muste wee suche tymes pray vnto god say lorde make mee perceyue continuallye thou art hande mee although finde experience rather forsaken thee outward seeming yet giue mee power alwayes settle hope vppon thy goodnesse succour iob shoulde haue spoken howbeeit forasmuche hee doth therefore hee roueth ouer feelde say making complaint wee heare texte intent doo oure selues good whiche conteyned heere lette v marke iobs person holie ghost mente sette v oute glasse men affection bee brydled vnder god obeysance marke one poynte another poynte god mente heere shewe v iudgementes howe terrible hee listeth hyde louing countenaunce v shewe himselfe enimie men dreadfull thing ynough ouerwhelme whole worlde seconde poynte thirde althoughe iob suche pangues yet notwithstanding hee resisted temptation howbeeit came sooner brunte many euill woordes scaped infirmitie mingled strength thus yee see three thing wee haue marke heere firste wee note god haue men beholde themselues person iob wee knowe wee god inforced v perceyue oure owne weakenesse euerye man thinkes himselfe bee mightie strong wee imagine oure owne power woonderfull shall neuer swarue yea long wee bee farre blowes assoone god presseth wee bee cast downe wee may well see dull vayne foolishe ouerweening v wee thought wee strength oure selues wheras wee haue none asmuche therefore men blynded sotted foolishe perswasion holy ghost presenteth heere vntoo v persone iob make v perceyue howe men shrinke vnder god hande bee afflicted cannot stande muste needes bee vtterlye ouerthrowne nowe happened iob constant aboue others ala shall become v wee muste come second poynt chiefest whereof commeth wee bee teachable humble selues god walke awe withoute trusting oure selues thing wee doo bicause wee feele howe heauie vntollerable god hande matter god declareth vnto v terrible cace hee lysteth vtter power vpon mortall men punishing must needes melte snowe agaynste sunne bee vtterly confounded yea verely scripture sayth god needeth vtter rigoure vpon v let onely withdrawe spirite saye liuelynesse wherewith hee quickeneth v beholde wee bee gone hee sayeth onely hee wyll bereeue v power also become contrary v fall vpon v thunder tempest ouerwhelme v ala wee true wee confesse impossible mortall men holde tacke god assayleth yet wee conceyue requisite howe dreadfull god hande ought bee v thus yee see example shewed v heere iobs persone way haue touched afore wee muste suppose iob delighted foaded himselfe suche passion euill damnable howe hee stryued withstande yet fayle good shaken downe god intended shewe men neuer vertuous somewhat bee mislyked euer shew themselues weake sorte greatly oure profite ende wee shoulde bee discouraged wee bee tempted thoughe seeme wee shall bee vtterly ouerwhelmed wee finde oure selues cace lette v passe pray god holde v vp lette v doubte hee sithe wee see althoughe iob infirmity flesh yet notwithstanding hee fayled victorie saye let v doubt god wyll woorke hee wyll make v ouercome oure temptation yea shall bee withoute making v lympe without gyuing v blowes without making oure woundes bleede lette suffize v stroke whiche wee receyue deadlye god wyll steppe v buckler nowe lette v come complayntes iob maketh heere sayeth god bath beseeged wayes hee knoweth howe get hee hath put darkenesse pathe though wee bee afflicted yet greate asswagemente oure greefe wee see mishappe muste passe awaye apace continue styll finde meanes scape shifte mennes counsell bee taken v remayneth nothing despayre iob meeneth heere hee sayeth god hathe clozed vp wayes whiche one hee sayde ala shall become wretched man tormented many misery looke whiche way get one way yet another hee seeke meanes aske counsell cace standeth mee god hath shet mee vp heere see waye may well reason obteyning releefe mee nothing darkenesse say see neyther waye pathe god hath inclozed mee word remedy summe spoken heere behoueth v marke wel ende like happen vnto v wee may leaue call vpon god vvhat cause men shet dore blow come able pray vtterly amazed bicause beare themselues hande like neuer happened man afore truely wee haue seene alredy iob assaulted temptation looke vpon faithful haue bin thee euer god handled fashion plaine concluding iob forlorne vtterly cast away ye see texte well worthy marked time seeme vnto v misery wee indure endlesse neuer rid wee haue sought wayes woode seemeth impossible euer shoulde set free agayne let v say well god knoweth drawe v perplexitie therefore let v stande vpon poynt yea likely god pitie v vvee see like hath happened iob let v looke vnto ende iames sayeth seeyng god deliuered man misery indured shoulde hee succoure v also daye nother might abated goodnesse yee see vse behooueth v applie sentence iobs hee sayeth god shut vp wayes furthermore let v marke god doth erewhiles time bereeue faithfull benefytes hath promised intent shoulde bee prouoked pray also hee intendeth humble hee chastizeth sinnes iob certayne hee suffered offence hee committed god founde ynough wherefore punish haue declared heeretofore bycause hee respect onely rather meent trye pacience v hee depriue v blissings hath promised v haue offended woorthy enioy else dashe spurre whiche hee gyueth v make v praye vnto earnestly thus dothe god promise faithfull guide way yea lend angel bee guide shall step one pace awry incoutered euill goodly promise yet notwithstading seeme vnto v way shut vp nothing brables bush afore v nothing mountaines rockes round v thus inclosed likelihode possibilitie get vvhat haue cace say ala worthy god shold performe goodnesse hath promised child haue way plaine leuel know side step therfore behoueth acknowledge fault truly god hath promised send angelles guide faithfull one seemeth cleane otherwise therfore behoueth pray voutsafe shew performance promise towardes thus suche meanes stirred vp call vpon god heerewithall let v vnderstand hee berceue v skill discretion vnto ende make v finde waye none woorking shall bee muche better knowen vnto v whereby wee shall haue greater occasion glorifie whe shall haue wrought manner looked god hath gone beyonde oure witte hope haue much cause glorifie thus yee see effect wee haue marke sentence iob addeth god bereft glory plucked crowne heade hee consumed destroyed berefte hope tree cut vp heere iob betokeneth two thing one god scourgeth roughly hee compared men shoulde founde indure much secondly saieth aduersitie though suffer greate miserie yet notwithstanding tree plucked vp yet hath little roote string left behinde yet still hope saith plucked vp suche sorte remaineth piece mee god seemeth haue stubbed mee vp quite cleane although yet rooted world yet life like deathe yea god giuen many woundes lighted misery calamity vpon child bene cursed deathe goodes bene taken awaye destroyed bodie become rotten carkesse therefore causelesse hee sayeth god cut vp berefte hope like tree plucked vp quite cleane grounde remained nothing strength thereof fadeth awaye bee hoped spring vppon earth bring foorth frute bicause hath lost freshnesse iob sayeth hee dealt like wise heare thing muste maruell sore greeued seemed nothing myghte comforte whiche v would impacient indured hundreth part indured yet perceiue god stood must hope hee much towardes v vvhat cause impaciencie oftentimes v like wee desire bee pacient aduersities behooueth v take comforte fauoure god also contrarie part cannot abide god smite v testie seeming nother order reason dooyng go oure hope wrecke euen happened iob displeased god ouershooting himselfe suche wyse wee haue seene also long himselfe hee caste downe headlong despaire deserued well god shoulde haue rooted berefte hope made tree plucked vp roote rind speaking suche sort wee see iob bereft god grace hee bin vtterly vndoone plunged hell god reached hand farre let v assure selues god singular goodnesse suffered seruaunte fall euen bottomlesse pitte thereby admonished god neede mainteine v yea lift v vp againe falne god woorketh two sortes towards v ende call vpon sometimes hee preserueth v suche wise power wee fall sometimes suffereth v fall end lift v vp againe afterward yet notwithstanding true muste tempt god giue v bridle like frantike folke vnder coloure hath well holpen vp suche haue falne shoulde wee abuse grace agayne becommeth v magnifie gracious goodnesse towards iob assuring selues wee bee good quyte quayled hee commeth v seekes v needefull shoulde worke sort otherwise vndone euery blowe wee see heere fayre lookingglesse thus much concerning saying furthermore wee may withstand suche temptation let v marke oure life must hidden paule also speaketh true like tree pulled vp yet doth god ceasse giue v secret strength wee shall haue continuall freshnesse notwithstanding wee seeme perished let v esteeme life welfare behold may discerned eye sight motherwitte let v vnderstande god intendeth preserue v meane whiche wee able coprehend life sayth paule hidden lord iesus christ therfore let v waite vpo good god pray giue v grace looke alwaies vnto till time come discouer nowe vnknowen behoueth v bee like dead men vntill time god quicken v vve may well feele beneath tast grace hee may well giue v experience yet feele time wee muste pray waken v make v know loue beareth v although haue paste one drop god grace yet muste wee call minde paule sayth romanes god spirite liue v although little portion yet sufficient put away euer v oure owne wicked nature vvell true shall alwaies feele nother shall perceyue working god spirite v let v pray god suffer dulnesse blockishnesse dwell alwayes v shoulde feele grace apply vse would haue v profite selues lo haue marke secod place vpon streyne iob sayth afterward god hath inflamed wrath become enimie true oft god scourgeth v holy scripture sayth angry v subiect passion nother hee casteth v away hee hateth v deede vvhat bicause make v feele displeasure affliction vvhy afflictios god chastizemets sendeth vnto sinnes true haue sayd alredy somtimes chastizeth seruantes purpose yet must alwayes firste call minde bee sinner detters vnto god therefore hee punisheth sinnes wee haue committed howbeeit iobs saying particular consideration beyonde ordinarie woont complayneth god anger kindled agaynst ought noueltie throughout holy scripture god declareth auoweth himselfe bee angrie whome hee chaziseth yea iob intended expresse wrath god common accustomed wrath though god counted vtter castaway like generally god haue v feele anger hee punisheth v enter knowledge owne sinnes also haue v knowe wrath lasteth passeth fadeth away said prophete esay turning hande make thee feele displeasure mercie wil make thee feele generation generation shall indure towardes thee euerlastingly ye see euen middes affliction behoueth v one side know god angrie bycause wee haue offended sinnes side doubt loueth v desirous one v iob declareth god hilde enimie say anger god ordinarie anger sheweth himselfe angry sinner giueth token vengeance hee excessiue sense saying nowe woulde become v cace hee without comfort haue declared afore impossible v pacient coulde needes rebell agaynst god knew goodnesse ende thou mayest feared sayth dauid thou lord art louing men cannot find hart beleeue god pitifull towards much lesse humble themselues nay rather grinde teethe againste nowe may seeme iob comforted beleeued god would destroy hee vtterly throwne alreadie plight might haue shewed heeretofore declareth former pang wherein passed measure howbeeit hee withstood ende see shift haue pray god hee wise ingraue harte promise hee hath made whole church may neuer escape v sayde promise whensoeuer shall haue sinned whensoeuer shall haue swarued commaundements chastize v shall rod man say chastize v gently mylde fashion mercy shal neuer withdrawne v according also sayth another text prophete abacucke sith let v sayth pray affliction suffer v surmise hee taketh v enimies may vnderstad deserue well haue warre hand find mortall enimie bicause wee haue prouoked yet notwithstanding ceasseth father go forward goodnesse towards v howe much soeuer haue deserued contrarie herewithall although wee bee tempted maner thinke god taketh v enimies yet let v ceasse fight still agaynst saying beholde sure looke vpon mine owne state may well seeme god holdeth mee enimy hee hath razed number seruants thinke vpon succour mee yet much honour rest vppon haue none recourse hym thus ye see howe haue withstande temptation wherewith iob sore layd albeeit vtterly ouercome nowe addeth immediately annie god come handes incamped round house hee termeth aduersities indured name god armie souldiers similitude namely aduersities whereto bee subiect god scourge dart errowes sword bee short men warre haue v chace hathe bin seene heeretofore another sentence right necessarie knowne although wee confesse generall speech yet fully persuaded requisite surely men suffer aduersitie cannot withholde themselues thinking happened misfortune fall hayle come frost feare vine marre corne straightwayes euill fortune maner speech proceedeth wee looke euer neerest hand mount higher knowe thinges god disposing say cause men runne continually intoo grosse blockishnesse scripture speaketh affliction telling v god holdeth hande bee men warre bee souldyers bee serue turne hee sendeth hee disposeth good pleasure let v marke well euery whit end whensoeuer turne commeth bee afflicted maner wise may alwayes looke vp god hand assure selues striketh v thereby let v learne humble ourselues saying well lorde see men trouble see lower cause see wherefore thing befalne meane lord thou art aboue therefore behoueth looke vp vnto thee acknowledge stroke come thine hand furthermore let v marke also god hath onely one armie one sworde one cudgell smite v hath bandes hath whole hostes readie besiege v side iob speaketh heere therefore whensoeuer bee scaped one miserie god well plucke v backe againe poynt verie profitable although men bee conuinced god hande persecuteth yet conceyue alwayes vaine hope get thinke thus vvell dispatch well ynough yet shift beholde pray whereas men ought humble themselues vnder hande god become stubborne agaynst beare themselues hand dashe horne shall driue great way specially see stubbornnesse v god smiteth v rodde bee puffed vp pryde presumption thinke hee doth v great wrong considering hee might pinche v hundred folde thus ye see haue marke finally iob complayneth freends euen poynt hee declareth hee knew god hande sentence dooth yet better confirme haue sayde alreadie ende might knowe farre lesson extendeth disease god men warre yea also scourge swordes scripture vseth similitude intent according rudenesse wee mighte better conceyue thinges otherwyse could well enter head yet notwithstanding somewhat agree capacitie men chaunge vpon sodaine become aduersaries ought bee freendes acquaintance increase miserie seemeth commeth god verie deede whereof come conceyts men owne corruption neuerthelesse god smiteth v still prouidence guideth also long wee looke vpon thing wee would neuer haue thought men shoulde haue chaunged sort haue vsed spyte therefore conclude suche chaunges come god true deede faultie done amisse tolde v god seemeth v euill faultinesse god behoueth v consider howe doctrine bee vnderstood certaine men bee malicious cruell towardes v naughtinesse themselues yet therefore said god leadeth therevntoo bereeuing good kindly affection willing haue v persecuted yet notwithstanding god doth euill hee hath good iust cause doth thing vprightly men cannot say euill hath bin intent obey owne conscience commaundementes doo sufficiently conuince contrarie vvee see iob hath caces respectes graunted suche power vnto god hee may doo hee creature serue owne turne punish v thinkes good send v sicknesse well come hee sende v calamity wee bee destitute good thing god doth iob hath saide afore although theeues taken away goodes yet sayth lorde hath giuen lorde hath taken away blissed name lorde let v wey well iob sheweth heere witte freends came sting yea imbattailed agaynst minding fully tread vnder foote knewe howe god hardned hart willing vse courtesie towards iob therefore imputed vnto god shoulde say lorde thou persecutest mee excessiue rate wote say thou hast set butte shoote al thy vengeance vvhere seemeth thou hast sent hell lo wherevnto iobs tale tendeth true good discretio knowing howe god withdrawne freendes yet infirmitie sheweth selfe quieted himselfe hee sawe temptation ought haue sayd vvell lorde true thou hast armed men thou hast sent bid battell yet wayt succour thy hand seeing pleaseth thee serue thy turne men scourging retire vnto thee assuring selfe thou canst well chaunge heart shall please thee lo poynt iob ought haue come came first blow yet went forward vnto therefore let v looke selues whensoeuer men practize destruction persecute v may stay sticke wee must know haue god therefore let v runne vnto may trust goodnesse chastized creature let v fal downe face good god acknowledgement faultes praying hym graunt v grace profite wise affliction chasticements sendeth v wee may bee humbled meekned come aduance selues check strengthened power may stand stedfastly obeying yet notwithstanding ceasse sigh grone seeing daunger wherein vntill reache hande v aboue thing wee may looke vp lorde iesus christ assuring selues made like affliction wee shall haue wherewith reioyce sorrowes wayting day fulnesse ioy hee shall gather v glorie resurrection whereinto gone afore may please graunt grace onely v lxxj sermon third vpon xix chapter breath lothsome vvife though intreate hir childrens sake mine ovvne bodie euen little one shunne vvhen rise vp cast scoffes agaynst freends haue abhorred vvhom loued turned agaynst bone cleaueth skinne flesh scaped vvith skinne teeth haue pitie vpon haue pitie vpon freends hand god hath smitten mee vvhy persecute god doth satisfied vvith flesh vvordes vvere vvritten vvere registred booke vvith penne ofyron leade stone euer sure redeemer liueth shall last rise vp vpon earth forasmuche god hath knitte men togyther ende one shoulde beare vppe another eche manne indeuoure helpe neighboure wee doo wee shoulde haue pitie compassion one another wee happen bee destitute helpe wee bee troubled sydes man sheweth v anye kindnesse euerie man cruell v temptation verie sore cause iob complayneth sentence neyther wyfe freend householde pitied worlde forsaken nowe wee heare thing wee muste applie selues declared yesterday god suffereth men fayle v euery bodie shrinke v ende might better resort vnto indeede long wee haue stay worlde wee trust god wee ought doo rather wee hilde heere bylowe nature inclyneth much much giuen thitherwarde therefore god intending nowe plucke v backe himselfe maketh v vtterly destitute worldly helpe else hee doth humble v seemeth v hee ought reason haue regarde v wee bee woorthie euerie v blyndeth himselfe presumption lord therefore mindeth teach v lowlinesse meane euerie man despiseth v become outcaste great small wee haue consider wee haue taken selues whatsoeuer come passe let v sure god hath therefore forsaken v see iob hath recourse still vntoo disappoynted hope god reached hande notwithstanding men shaken imagined bee past hope recouerie god eye shewe mercie therefore let v trust besides let v learne duetie towardes suche afflicted according haue tolde god hath knitte vnited v togither ende haue communitie one another men must separate themselues vtterly asunder true lorde hath ordeyned common pollicie euerie man shoulde haue house meynie wyfe child euery man knowne degree yet muste man exempt himselfe communitie say liue alone liue worse brute beast vvhat let v assure selues god hath bound v one another ende helpe one another see man necessitie although wee cannot doo much good wee would yet leastwise wee must pitifull towards bee v let v marke person iob holy ghost asketh vngeance v dout although iob tossed hideous excessiue passion yet alwayes gouerned god spirit specially respect generall ground say respect sentence hee setteth downe according haue tolde import right profitable doctrine vvherefore let v mark lord telleth v ouergreat crueltie v see poore man afflicted indeuour succour rather shrinke away also let v marke sometimes sayde euen thing holy scripture occasion whereby may gather good lesson sayde iob owne wife saith able abide breath though prayed hir childrens sake hir owne wombe hee sheweth child ought bee increasement loue betweene man wife god blisseth mariage issue ought increase mutuall affection liue greater concorde verie paynim knewe well ynough ill perfourmed ought see much cleerer codemnation shall bee beleeuers boast themselues haue bin instructed woorde god knowe nature sheweth sillie ignorant sort good blinde looke vpon painims haue acknowledged child gage confirme better loue man wife holde peace vnitie according herevnto iob sayth hee intreated wife childrens sake begot hir moued hir al sheweth thing nature behalfe wife shewed hirselfe bee worse wilde beast let v marke cannot follow order heere rebuked way holye ghost pronounced condemnation expresse termes yet notwithstanding see many men haue discretion god gracious giue child looke vpon maried man true mariage alreadie selfe holy thing onely saying ought suffise saide shall bee two one flesh man shall make account vnitie hee ought haue wife vnitie whiche hee hathe father mother god yet confirmation sayde grace addeth increase child mariage men woman beastly prouoked led thereby loue one another better certainly vnkindnesse tooto grosse howbeit haue sayde alreadie thing euill practised among christian neuerthelesse behoueth v take profite saying though touched heere occasion increase euill iob sayth freends also men counsell say whome hee woont communicate hys secretes turned themselues else scorned made none account credite authoritie also euen meanest sort verie rascal despised effect meening hee founde himselfe destitute help seeing friend fayled secodly bin scorningstocke insomuche euen basest sort world vouchsafed looke vpon take one retinew must needes bee sayde affliction great seeing none would acknowledge companie men tooke alreadie outcast lo effect iob ment say haue touched alreadie god wil exercising make myrrour vnto v happen neerest v become deadly enimies persecute v let v learne flee vnto god beare paciently seeing happened vntoo iob v specially forasmuch perteyneth member church let v beare minde saying lord iesus christ eateth bread table hathe lyfted vp heele agaynst mee must needes fulfilled faithfull therfore hath lord iesus shewed v way intent wee bee loth become comformable image vve see continually faythfull shall bee betrayed persecuted trust priuiest wyth dooings verie well right hard cace cannot bee denyed wee feele mischeefe ynough discourage v howbeeit forasmuch lorde hath tolde v must hath giuen v record sonne let v passe way submit selues condition thus yee see againe wee haue marke text let v come iob addeth haue pitie vpon haue pitie vppon mee freendes hande lorde hath touched mee alreadie true wee see god punish men ought dutie glorifie saying lorde thou art rightuous howbeeit speciall consideration iob howe punishment faulte hee committed ende againe put cace bin chastized desert yet notwithstanding wee see poore offender whome god hath put execution must bee touched selues two cause one euerie v looke himselfe wee shall finde god ought punishe v roughly roughlyer pleased visite v according desertes therefore whosoeuer bethinks himselfe well shall finde himselfe woorthie bee punished greeuously hee seeth sore distressed therefore wee ought looke vpon pitie compassion muste oure vyces sinnes cause v humble selues beholde poore wretch see god persecuteth terrible thing good cause god shoulde punish likewise behoueth mee humble myselfe behold myselfe glasse person man one poynt againe see man scourged god hande sore may bee let v consider created image god also hee neighbour manner one v vve bee one nature one flesh one mankinde may sayde bee issued one selfe spring sith ought wee haue consideration one another see moreouer poore soule going destruction ought pitie helpe lie power although able yet ought sorie say two reason ought moue v pitie wee see god afflicteth woorthie wee bethinke selues surely either must needes bee hardharted dulwitted else shall pitie like selues wee consider beholde man formed image god hee selfe nature againe beholde soule purchased bloud sonne god perish ought bee greeued cause iob sayth haue pitie vpon mee freendes bycause bande god hath smitten mee better vnderstanding heereof must take grounde dreadfull thing fall intoo handes liuing god therefore see god sende punishment behoueth v bee moued feare yea euen although spare v self rest god maketh countenance touche see smiteth one punisheth another matter bee astonished must tarie till god fall vpon heades many blowes ouer grosse dealing see minded teach v another man cost behoueth v haue eye cause hee punisheth men according saint paule telleth v hee sayth afrayd wrath god shall come vppon hee sayeth freendes yee see howe god punisheth vnbeleeuers spareth yet must vnderstande instruction hee weth token hys wrath vpon men let v marke well sentence apostle dreadfull thing fall handes liuing god therefore oft punishment let v moued thereby wee shall hand taught pitie distresse say ala poore creature mortall wight afflicted man might giue releefe god agaynst ought wee sorie wee see man alledge resisting god wee sorie punished fault much striue god iustice may well haue affection v allow god iustice yeelding prayse glorie doth yet neuerthelesse bee sorie punished bycause selues maye haue deserued muche ought seeke welfare men speecially neerest v god hath put bande betwixt v according wee may allowe ciuill iustice whiche nothing else little glasse god iustice yet ceasse haue pitie vpon offender vvhen transgresser punished men say hee hath wrong done vnto crueltie iudge say set place iustice discharge duetie offer acceptable sacrifice vnto god put offender death yet meane wee ceasse pitie poore creature shall suffer euill doings moued thereat manhood v graunt worldly iustice little sparke god iustice pray wee come soueraine seate iustice high ought wee first glorifie god doth assuring selues hee iust vpright poynts respect yet notwithstanding sayd afore shall hinder v pitie suffer punishment comfort succoure wee good wish saluation praying god make correction profitable drawing home suffer become hardharted striue hand behold say wherevnto iob groundeth self desireth beseecheth frinds haue pitie vpon speaketh purposely next although god haue generally set vnitie among men say although hee hath knitte altogither haue sayde afore ought separate selues one another yet notwithstanding hee byndeth v dubble eyther kinred aliance betwixt v know neighbour ought moued yeeld priuate freendship one another behalfe god hath ye would say put v vnder one yoke men might put beast brute beast ought teach v haue vvhen two ox yoked togither bee stubborne trouble one another agree laboure willingly togither also drinke togither sleepe togither must needes tormentor cace euen men vvhen god matcheth togither manner soeuer woulde cupple vnder one yoke ayde support nowe sturdie worse brute beast condemnation bring vpon owne head let v marke well god linketh v togither giueth v meane communicate togither doth bind v one another friend bound freend man although behoue oure charitie bee generall v loue whome god commendeth vnto v yea though mortall enimies yet shall husband bounde wife father child child father kinsfolke also one another behoueth v knowe generally degree frendship god hath set world iob addeth vvhy doo persecute god doth seeme saying hath great reason haue touched alreadie sayd rightuous man shall wash handes bloud vngodly ought bee glad see god punish wicked iob alledgeth heere men ought persecute whome god afflicteth question hath bin dissolued already sayde wee may well agree god iustice yet notwithstanding ceasse pitie comfort suffer lie v leastwise wee must haue affection wishe saluation cruell matter shoulde persecute men well god doth god punisheth sinner meane rightuous sort suche iob haue liued amisse led wicked life ende looke bigge vpon vexe first euerie v learne condemne himselfe another man person say see man smitten god roddes sinnes god iudge whole world yes doth matter concerne also giltlesse nothing god may finde fault ala nothing sinfulnesse mee yea grosse sinfulnesse ye see ought condemne themselues folkes persones oft wee see god sendeth punishmentes vpon therewithall also god myndeth inure v pitifulnesse compassion follow order wee amisse wee fall greeuing haue much greefe alreadie without hauing respect fault crueltie would vsurpe god office iudges whereas ought rather bethinke v howe sayde v must appeere iudgement seate god true haue sayde god ought right bee glorified punishment sendeth vpon men much say bicause know god must iudge men therefore man ought condemne selfe holde himselfe within compasse humanitie thus ye see iob hath iust cause reproue frends persecuting god let v marke wel god vtter vengeance vpo haue offeded meening arme v vnnaturalnesse set v rage pore paciets vtterly cast downe rather wold rue againe iob blameth crueltie friend saying cannot satisfied flesh vvherefore sayth hee ye satisfie selues fleshe certaine thing whiche hee taketh similitude ye would say flesht vpon neighbour one would eate aliue wee also often vse suche manner speech common talke like man taketh pleasure repast eating drinking seemeth cruell neighbour could find hart feede vpon eate vp swallow quicke ye see iob sayth vvhy ye satisfie selues flesh wee see oure neighbour haue aduersitie ynoughe ynough yet satisfied increase misery great crueltie one would eate vp therefore circumstance bee noted well iob sayth leastwise freendes ought haue beene satisfied see ouerthrowne vvhat would ye sayth last cast holde longer wee haue hated man wished harme sought meanes bee reuenged yet hee happen fall extreme miserie beholde naturall thing anger bee appeased yet say affection ought counted vertue although heathen men wicked thought lawfull reuenge yet notwithstanding mynde would appeased saw enimies sore afflicted needed put theyr hand admit man haue done man harme vvel offended would reuenge himselfe possible nowe meane god preuenteth sendeth great misfortune vppon offender man ere full rancor desired nothing destroy whome hee hated say yea shall hee oppressed pitie see hee hath ynough already thus fyre dooth naturally quenche selfe see man aduersitie though wee neuer much moued said vertue neither deserueth counted god seruice charitie yet naturall inclination euen among painims shal become whiche adayes satisfied see enimies persecuted extremitie vnsatiable could find hart euen eate vp damnable done man enimies contented misery god sendeth vpon thing done man friend therefore let cruell assure themselues worthie counted number men whosoeuer mindeth discharge himselfe duetie muste onely appease miserie affliction enimies must also moued pitie stead seking reuenge must rather bee readie succour much hee doubt god sendeth aduersitie enimies vntoo haue offended v intent assuage malice rancour v shift away cause made v bee yll minded towardes oure neighbour nowe god call v gentlenesse wee go cleane manifest fighting agaynst let v marke well god scourge haue done v anye wrong iniurie assuage bitternesse oure stomackes haue beene angrie displeased haue coueted reuengement god intendeth meeken lewde affection v lead v compassion kindnesse lo haue marke streyne nowe iob addeth newe complaint misery saying bone cleaued skinne hee escaped skinne betwixt teeth serueth expresse matter better come touch witte friend ought right haue bin satisfied though beene verie beast sought deuour sayth ye see state vvhat desire ye man wish miserie one person god hath sent vpon sayth skinne claue bone much hee sayde hee vtterly withered away hee become right image deade man moysture substance hee sayeth scaped skinne teeth v vnderstand whole part gummes hys skinne become lyke gummes woorme breede man bodie skinne bee drie wil like skinne gummes say rottennesse hath gotten vpper hande woormeaten man shall see fleshe bloudie ooze halfe bloud half water wound like see howe wound resemble skinne man gummes thus iob declareth disfigured phisnomie man coulde discerned seeing come extremitie beene reason freends haue bin contented warned looke better vpon neighbour aduersities haue done god sendeth misery pray giue v grace haue eye better open consider marke well may moue v pitie euerie v indeuer remedie much finally hope god hath layde hand vpon wil shewe himselfe mercifull towardes forsomuch iobs friendes accused blasphemie agaynst god iustifying himselfe withoute cause blinding himselfe owne vice want acknowledging sayth wordes written ingraued penne yron ingraued lead stone euer endlesse memoriall saying iob declareth mainteyned innocencie vaine neither feared bee blamed god knewe hee iust cause thus ye see effect whereat ameth neuerthelesse certaine respect iobs wordes excesse much bytalke hee kept measure howe good reasonable ground soeuer hee cace allowable god yet misconuey haue declared heeretofore many woordes escaped blamewoorthie vvhy sayth hee still woulde faine hys wordes written ynough bring double condemnation vpon owne heade let v marke iob hathe eye principall poynt tyeth himselfe euerie worde vttered taketh saying heere defence cace nowe defence iust although missehandled often lept nowe one side yet notwithstanding hee still mainteyned rightly hee punished sinnes bee counted wickeddest man worlde bycause god shewed himselfe rigorous iob hath set downe thing vpon good reason yet hath done amisse hee acknowledged sinnes suche wise hee might feele himselfe alwayes faultie god heereby wee bee warned bee verie well aduised wee say sayde psalme determined selfe holde peace brydle selfe long wicked bare sway full scope ende coulde refrayne dauid knewe well god child tempted seeing themselues oppressed affliction wicked sorte tryumph haue winde weather sore cace hardly refraine selues murmuring agaynst god cause sayde determined brydle selfe put snaffle coped vp lippes intent might speake worde end let broken determination purposed vpon could holde mee vttering desire conceyued wythin finally fyre kindled brake hereby dauid sheweth verie great rare vertue bee pacient silence holde tongue misery oppresse v specially wee see wicked men mouthes open boast themselues scoffe v ioyning saying dauids example iob wee must learne keepe mouth shut god afflicteth v affection headie although haue learned speake simply prayse blisse god wee ought yet well aduised well stayed something escape v bubble burst wee shall alwayes bee faultie talke although wee haue intent blaspheme god speake thing may bee honour yet auoyded wee shall bee ouerhardie talke like iob desyred haue saying registred ingraued euerlasting rememberance printed stone leade intent might neuer blotted let v rather aduise selues pray god forgiue v faultes wee make euen wordes thinke bee purest sayth sant iames refraine tongue hath singular vertue swift speake euill wee thinke wee haue spoken verie soundly god still find somewhat amisse thus ye see wee haue marke streyne ende iob addeth knoweth redeemer liueth verely cannot wholly expounded nowe yet must touch intent whiche iob sayd meening delt maner hypocrite smoothing cace men iustifie himselfe knewe hee doo god thing wee ought knowe sentence heere shoulde bee taken broken matter woulde haue great edifying neyther shoulde wee knowe iob ment vvherefore let v remember haue touched afore vvhat iob pretendeth vvee knowe men labour excuse themselues bycause thinke vppon god ynoughe worlde lykes well bee taken honest men thus dooth hypocrisie ingender vnshamefastnesse knowe god bee iudge suffice mee menne clappe handes mee haue mee good reputation gayne nothing exceeding great shamelesnesse although mine owne conscience accuse mee bee conuicted haue done amisse yet perke vp nebbe say whereof man accuse vvhat haue done haue good cace take fayre colour couer skinne bleare men eye tushe cace shall speede well ynough spake namely hipocrisie ingendreth shamelesnesse men become bolde mainteyne cace good bycause haue regard god iob contrariwise saith know god aliue ende ee rise vp vpon dust hee shoulde say taken wicked man desperate persone though blasphemed god labouring iustifie selfe agaynst desire nothing humble selfe vnto repose selfe wholly grace yet must faine mainteyne mine vprightnesse agaynst see go woorke nothing slaunders defence suche sort meane looke vntoo god haue mine eye fastned vppon heereof wee may ought gather good lesson must bee popeholie couer faultes afore men make countenance mainteyning good cace beare face honest men yet bee reproued owne conscience rather let v learne enter selues examine owne sinnes cite selues god let v say beginne poynt say howe intend true may well excuse selfe afore men meane time shall boote god vvill accept therefore according let v come heauenly iudge great small let euerie one v present himselfe craue pardon offence let v doubt come vnfeynedly acquit v worthinesse owne owne grace mercie nowe let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement sinnes praying make v feele right cast downe ought bee may repayre soueraine refuge infinite goodnesse whiche hee hath promised v lorde iesus christ take sure foundation may doubt fauour towardes v yea although wee doo alwayes feele sort worlde outwarde woorking rather hee sheweth v token rigoure yet may ceasse call vpon aduersities doubting ende shewe selfe louing mercifull father towardes v make v feele proofe also tyme conuenient may please graunt grace onely v also al people c lxxij sermon fourth vpon xix chapter sermon conteyneth still exposition fiue twentith verse text following although skinne vvoormes destroy bodie yet shall see god flesh shall beholde mine eye shall see none kidneyes vvasted bosome haue sayde vvherein persecuted roote matter found ye afrayde presence svvorde vvrath affliction vvith svvorde intent ye knovv iudgement yesterday saw protestation iob made hee eye vpon god tyed men bycause whiche rest themselues low willing enter owne conscience condemne themselues ought feele owne sinnes might confesse themselues haue done amisse craue forgiuenesse god hand see assoone bee flesht among men desire ouercome bee truth vntruth lo heere cause thinke rightly vpon god consequently indeuer mend misdoings ought short nothing hypocrisie therefore iob sayeth hee knoweth redeemer aliue shoulde say pleading hitherto bin iustifie himselfe wise afore men though marke shot knewe shoulde bee faine come god iudged render account hys life afterwarde addeth god shall stande vp fast vpon dust sayde vvhen men faile worlde must needes perish yet doth god continue euer therefore great follie mee desire excuse selfe afore men meane god shoulde condemne iudges nowe whether willing bee whether cast honour vpon must perish mee god must continue euer suffizeth mee yeeld selfe vntoo heare shall please determine whereas sayth god shall stande vp vpon dust meeneth like men seeing must v fade away euen till wee come nothing wee knowe wee must returne whence came euen intoo corruption rottennesse god sayth hee neuer decay men hee continue state euerlastingly againe let v marke iob meant doo v vnderstande god wyll spred power vppon dust say vpon men nothing ne haue power strength title hee yeeldeth vnto god importeth yet namely maker partie mainteyned god listed coulde continue full state meane perish intendeth make v partaker strength cause v feele hee standeth vp sort vpon dust hee maketh dust awake hand setteth vp againe vaine named redeemer maker therefore let v marke well iob intended declare god holdeth sayde power inclosed onely owne beeing also spreadeth vpon men good lesson v first warned fondnesse desirous please men allowed men vvhat gain euery whit must fall ground therefore let v learne haue eye fastened vpon god may like v allow v marke whervnto must applie indeuer heerewithall intent hilde backe world wrapped hypocrisie ouer surely rooted v nature lette v assure selues god warrant belongeth mainteyne men soundnesse shal haue walked pure conscience shall one day iudge stand vp vpon dust albeeit thing whiche wee see aboute v bee frayle transitorie yet god like hath higher state onely himselfe also set creature state bee disordered inestimable comforte godly see themselues borne downe slaunders worlde although haue indeuered walke aright yet men ceasse heaue backebite falsely still referre themselues god call witnesse rest vpon assurance stande men shall brought nothing vvell presume condemne v rayle vpon v must tumble downe chaunce must bee quite turned god length bee oure redeemer nowe rashnesse men vsurpe god power vndertake lawfull ende god must shewe himselfe hee must bee exalted may knowe howe belongeth mainteyne v beholde wee ought call minde oft men doo falsely misrepor v wee haue good recorde god namely ynough v vphilde alloweth v though worlde beside reiect v nowe let v come iob sayeth hee sayeth vvoormes although woorde woormes bee set downe hebrewe text yet well seene hee meeneth vermine corruption hauing eaten skinne also gnawe fret away rest yet sayeth hee trusteth see god yea see fleshe say beeing restored againe yea sayth shall see none notwithstanding kidneyes bee consumed say strength bee weakened taken away protestation woorthie bee noted iob sayeth hee haue looke fastened vpon god none yea euen though vtterly consumed shoulde say would measure hope god might see euen nothing appeereth yet therefore ceasse looke vntoo god howe man finde himselfe forsaken god perceyue nothing matter despayre death manace sydes yea readie swallow vp yet neuerthelesse holdes still stedfast fayth say yet call vpon god shall yet feele helpe mightinesse ynough selfe giue v courage yea shall bee euen shall seeme bee forlorne man ouerpasseth worldly thing shewing fayth hope whiche hee hath god thing may bee seene comprehended naturall reason passeth worlde according sayde wee must hope beyonde hope hope thing hidden nowe wee see iobs meening true hee speaketh expressely resurrection yet woordes cannot bee expounded must bee peceyued iob ment attribute power vnto god seene common order nature therefore one sayd god wil haue v know onely doth v good preserueth nurrisheth v also although faile v seeming see nothing death v yet muste fully resolued lorde leaue bee keeper shall bee maynteyned protection howbeit better profite ourselues sentence lette v wey throughly iob sayeth although remnant sayeth bee eaten away vnder skin yet shall see god beleeue god bycause maketh earth bring foorth corne wine see number brutish folke haue none tast feeling god heauen hee feedeth filleth belly man aske whiche god answere nurrisheth v true ought conceyue goodnesse power god benefites hee bestoweth vpon v yet must stay sayde wee muste mount fayth aboue thing bee seene world therfore lette v say beleeue god bycause maynteyneth bicause gyueth health bicause nurrisheth beleue god bicause hath giuen heeretofore tast goodnesse power hauing care body whiche rottennesse see hee sheweth himselfe father haue power spirite beleeue alone bicause calleth heauen hath created oxe asse liue heere little whyle hath formed owne image intent shoulde hope inheritance kingdome bee parttaker glory sonne beleeue hee allureth dayly thither intente doubt body layde graue consumed nothing yet notwithstanding shal restored agayne lastday meane soule shall safe sure keeping bycause dead god haue protection shall behold much better life lorde iesus christe hath purchaced v bloud thus ye see beleefe must well ruled well disposed wee may say iob well verely see body must go decay looke freshnesse soeuer diminisheth day day neede go farre seeke death see small infirmitie fleshe messenger death yet al shall see god wee could speake wee see strength droupeth vanisheth away little little although pleased god smite v wise wee maner rotte aboue grounde iob sayeth skinne wormeaten consumed good dead yet protesteth hee wyll ceasse looking vntoo god yet wee ceasse trust god still example iob thus ye see greatnesse affliction god sendeth v shall astonish v wee haue learned know bee one towardes v indeede say consider well end hee hathe created v still maynteyneth v world furthermore iob sayeth hee shall see redeemer flesh meening sayd afore hee shall restored new state though skinne eaten sayeth expresly bone shall bee consumed nothing shall remayne whole afterwarde hee addeth shall set god flesh shall see flesh say shall bee set former state see god yet agayne confesseth god able ynough set vp agayne although hee vtterly consumed plunged bottomlesse pit thus yee see condicion wherevpon wee must trust god hee shall haue layde v graues wee assure selues reach v hand lift v agayne therfore let v say trust god bycause see assisteth fayleth thing god fayleth v estraunged v let v euen say iob shall see fleshe nothing seeme bee shadowe life vanisheth away hand yet god shewe himselfe mightie behalfe shall see iob spake thus time yet greate learning perchaunce law yet written admit nother yet prophetes leastwise mo moyses prophet make mention iob man old time say iob hauing little sparke light strengthened affliction saw one kind death also god seemed haue set hym spectacle among men dreadfull terrible thing able say yet shall see god excuse v dayes god sheweth v resurrection neerely expresly giueth v many goodly promise specially considering see mirrour substance thereof lorde iesus christ whome hath rayzed againe intent put v doubt shall one day parttakers immortall glorie muche assurance cannot brought beliefe iob must needes charged vnthankfulnesse could imbrace god promise true fayth would sufficient power make v mount ouer temptation reigne ouer v let v marke well text wee may say paule cotage body gone termeth cotage thing made leaues shed nothing woorth wee haue much better excellenter buylding prepared v heauen outward man say pertayneth present life seene done away yet would god renew v againe yea maketh v alreadie beholde resurrection sort see body waste away manner according also another texte paule sendeth v seede cast earth saying cannot grow haue liuely roote yeeld good fruite except first rotte wee see death hath dominion ouer v lette v marke god minded giue v true life say heauenly life purchaced v precious bloud sonne least temptation worlde woulde ouercome v haue sayd already misery haue suffer many message death wee sawe death thought shuld make cleane riddance v must needes vtterly quayle none meane comfort v oure affliction onely doctrine euer v consumed yet shall wee ceasse see god yea see flesh afterward sayd mine eye shall beholde none iob addeth continuing matter maynteyned wit seing god hath assured make mee strong agayne hold wholly vnto neede stray bee haled one way behoueth holde selfe alone myne eye shall behold none behold heere one goodly lesson hee spake erewhyle wit hee shoulde see god flesh hath relation experience god set vp agayne vpon feete speaketh nowe spoken another respect witte respect hope god seene v two maners vve see hym sheweth himselfe father sauiour effect giuing v open proofe experience behold god hath delyuered sicknesse raysing death recorde hath layde hand vpon succoure thus see yea see effectually howbeit eue sicke likelyhood recouerie ceasse see god still put trust agayne wayte paciently ende hee shall giue doubt still althoughe hee take world thus ye see yet another maner beholding god iob meeneth shal see god effect set againe former state secondly addeth hee ceasse beholde hym although ouerwhelmed misery hee mine eye sayeth shall fastned vpon looke aside heere see nature fayth namely gather selfe wyse vnto god wander abrode bee drawne away wee commonly bee pray cause wee cannot repose selues vpon god meete wee bycause wee parte god office power intoo many peeces gobbettes wee leaue little nothing vvee well ynough say god whome belongeth mainteyne v yet wee ceasse trudge vp downe forewarde backwarde seeke meanes lyue gyuen god proceeding hym wee attribute power god meanes themselues whereby make idolles thus ye see cannot looke vpon god pure eye settle trust contentation therefore let v marke well woordes iob vseth heere eye shall behold god none hee sayde holde fleeting men put selfe wholly god say thou lord yea thou whome holde lyfe gone hence thou shalte restore mee agayne thou haste promised lette v make comparison betweene iob selues iob hauing assurance god goodnesse familiar teaching hundreth parte wee haue doo notwithstanding say hee shall beholde god wee bee excused wee fleete fro specially seeing lorde iesus christe offereth himselfe vnto v whome dwelleth whole fulnesse glorie godhead ful power holy ghoste shewed suche time hee rayzed dead surely wee neede streyne eyesight looke farre gospell cleere looking glasse wherein see hym face face sith haue touched let v beware wee guiltie suche vnthankfulnesse disdeyne looke vnto hym offereth hymselfe familiarly vnto v effect whiche wee haue marke streyne iob addeth although kidneyes bee wasted bosome say although strength courage bee short following matter hee entred intoo alreadye sheweth hys looking vnto god bycause liued hys ease bycause god sente hys harte desire bycause bene preserued affliction cleane contrariwise although distresse sayeth god seemeth thunder vpon strength courage yet looke vnto god mine eye holde mee wholly vnto hym knowe shall see agayne redeemer keeper euen shall haue consumed conclusion sayeth frendes haue sayd wherefore persecuted wherefore persecute hym roote cace matter founde sentece somewhat darke bycause word may taken two wayes vvherefore hee persecuted wherefore persecute take wherefore persecuted meening iobs freendes marueled god handled roughly therefore co cluded bee sayd hee man vtterly forsaken god ye translate persecute meening come prepensed malice take trip byte although diuersitie touching wordes yet dothe meening come one end lette v consider doctrine haue gather principall yea whole matter iob chargeth hys friend iudged amisse affliction euen first dashe fell saying needes must man sayd wicked doer walked good conscience hee bee punished cotrariwise iob sayeth roote matter found true hebrewe word signifieth sometime thing matter somtime word speach saying heere iob meeneth good sure foundation men haue wel sifted shall find cace men haue falsely surmised lette v see purpose geere tendeth profite wee may reape vvhen iob telleth friendes sayde wherefore persecuted sheweth great crueltie men seeke men sinnes see one beaten god roddes say needes must wicked man therefore let v sift life point must begin true hathe bin sayde large heeretofore correction chastizements god sendeth wee muste alwayes behold iustice vppon men sinnes must condemne selues vvee must iudge men let selues slip let v begin say lette v begin selues thus wee see vse doctrine man pressed aduersitie must hastie condemne specially wee must wrinch aside spie faultes rather must looke vnto god sheweth himselfe bee iudge v copelleth v knowe behoueth v haue pitie compassion vppon suffereth must go aduenture although know faultie rather aduise ourselues bring medicine heale let v beware set cart horse say wee iudge know cace commonly wont hath bin already oftentimes sayd god afflicting men alwayes one self end sometimes punisheth sinnes sometimes triall paciece else respect therefore let v ouerhastie rashe iudge wee knowe cace throughly wee see happened iobs friend bicause see afflicted therefore first dash must needes wicked man say happie iudgeth discretely afflicted sayd psalme vvas dauid pinched smartly god hand euer man yet notwithstanding god sayeth haue found dauid seruant mine owne hart haue anoynted oyle gladnesse thus doth god holde dauid lappe yet see handled bee rash iudging shall condemne dauid abraham holy patriarkes doth maner iudging redounde dishonoring god yes surely let v sober modest see neighbour afflicted let v acknowledge hand god least happen vnto v vnto iobs friend sayeth precisely roote cace roote matte effect substance heereby hee meeneth men must trie iudge good soothe euery man graunt step aduenture foolishe presumption ouerweening v common prouerbe among v say fooles bolte soone shot yet ceasse hazard selues still without searching examining cace standeth vvherfore let v marke well must first go roote sitte downe giue iudgement let v iudge swiftly feare least might seeme ignorant certesse thing inforceth men swift ashamed least seeme sharpwitted ynough iudge first sight blab prittleprattle men wil make none account god laugheth vayne gloriousnesse therfore let v keepe selues sobernesse modestie vntill god haue shewed v wherefore hee punisheth one man another let v runne true shall haue searched matter throughly shall haue come roote wee may iudge freely iudgement shal come selues shal fetched god bycause grou ded vpon word gouerned holy spirit howbeit thing behoueth v go roote whereof mention made heere afterward iob sayeth ye afrayd presence sword wrath iniquitie affliction sword hande ende yee know iudgement present saying somwhat darke ynough bicause word cut effect iobs intent saying yee afrayde sword one sayd ye speake heere shadowe yee discourse pleasure haue nothing owne leysure folkes may dispute like none make better battelles furthest blowes giue onset besiege townes flea forray sacke city woonder see haue well discoursed come marching forewarde indeede doo sooner heare sounde drum courage quite quayled iob therefore blameth friend reasoning cace leysure telleth must take holde god iustice bee afrayde swoorde hee shewed already agayne sayeth wrath iniquitie saying poynteth crueltie whiche hee vpbrayded wrath muche say chase agaynst mee greeue hebrew worde may signifie iniquitie affliction iob declareth frieds come vnto compassion miserie rather chafe yea grieue vexe imported swoorde sayeth say god suffer outrage vnpunished although offended yet ought curteous towards nowe condemning without cause ye shewe nothing rigorousnesse therefore must god sworde bee drawen verely end ye may knowe iudgement behold notable profitable sentence rebuking friendes sorte iob prophet god speaketh generally men common thing telleth v malicious iudge euill thing good churlish tormenting vexing miserable ynough already haue sword god afrayd sayd cursed call good euil euill good yet notwithstanding wee see vice hath reigned time reygneth stil day caried affection conscience make spite god openly haue skill ynough say see cace good ynough selfe yet notwithstanding go quite cleane suche man desirous serue god stop thing myght bee buylding vp churche serue maynteyning felowship among men furtherance common weale ouerthrow euery whit yee shall see euen sitte seate iustice good diuels incarnate spiting god ouerthrowing al equitie right ful corruption outrage sith wee see sayd come top wickednesse much sayd men bee seene ther nother great small worke spite god sayd diuell possesseth men sith giue themselues ouerthrow goodnesse mainteyne euil specially seeing horrible curse pronounced mouthe prophete suche shall say euill good good euill iob ment heere saying ye afrayde sword whome speaketh puffed vp god againste right whome wee make warre agaynst god wee go aboute turne lyght intoo darkenesse woulde oppresse good cace beholde god whome wee assayle wee haue good cause bee afrayde yea though wee trouble one poore man heaping newe vexacion vppon hym god setteth himselfe agaynst v hee sayeth hee cannot away suche violence extorcion vvhen menne go aboute outrage wrong poore folkes god steppeth sheweth hymselfe bee theyr defender therefore whensoeuer wee bee tempted greeue trouble poore folkes aduersitie alreadye ought woordes make v tremble shall come minde god sworde drawne agaynst suche increace miserie muche miserie already beholde howe god defieth gyuen wrong violence extortion lyke thyngs see howe summoneth fire bloud also wee see poore man vnderfoote body supporteth hym let v afrayde treade vpon hym wrong reproch god auoucheth hee hath swoord drawen suche shall vexe good innocent folke sorte iob speaketh conclusion saying wrath iniquitie shall bring swoord hee shoulde say true nowe menne ouerleape boundes trouble good folkes seemeth themselues shall scape vnpunished nother feare god iudgement sayeth swoorde readie therefore lette v stande much owne conceyt beare selues hande god cannot come v haue tormented poore folk seeke nothing liue quiet haue offended v thing wee fall stinging shewing selues bitter towards god bee hundred thousandfold bitterer vnto v shal feele wee come oure iudge vvere well weyed surely thing would go far otherwise world tha vve see prince ambition sake fall wasting country burning house
