destroying townes robbing rauishing spoyling thing horrible seene wherefore lawfull vnder name warre first formost consider whither compelled stirre broiles make warre maner whole world howbeit forasmuch none thyng ambition inflameth therevnto al mischieues must spring rage wherwith moued thinke swoorde readie againe touching serue theyr lustes feede humour thinke god ought drawe sword vpon let v looke vpon onely see nother king prince abilitie make hauock country enter vpon force withstanding ceasse full malice rather fuller play little scorpion whiche cannot hurt otherwise cast poyson tayles see euery man seeketh anoy trouble therefore must men needes feele said heere wit sword drawne manner folke yee see iob doth purposely say intet ye know true men doltes knew god heauen iudge worlde men skill experience wee haue seene talke shall see heereafter god leaue vvhy doth iob say vnto intent yee know bycause men beyng blinded theyr naughty affection know god beleeue whe haue drawne curtayne betweene god themselues god see able punish deserue lette v looke vppon sworde althoughe wee see yet wyth eye say although god yet shewe v signes mynded punishe v make v knowe hee iudge worlde lette v thinke hee desirous drawe v hym shewe hee vse excessiue rigoure towardes v specially wee bee rigorous towardes neighbour furthermore lette v vnderstande ynough v absteyne euill behoueth also helpe suche aduersitie though man coulde protest hath absteyned iniurie wrong yet shall therfore discharged god hee oughte help succour haue neede succoure haue absteyned euill quit god hilde offender pray shall say nothyng else practise mischeefe day night alwayes deuising howe may trouble vexe man man vvhen wicked men sharpen wit set purpose hurt neighbour reason god sworde sharpened againste let v bethinke selues bee ready releeue suche necessititie also asmuch muche miserie wretchednesse whole world let v haue pitie compassion farre let oure sight extende euen thither accordingly charitie ought inflame mankind let v pray god vouchsafe pittie distressed hath chastized roddes bring home himselfe make turne saluation somuch whereas wee haue occasion sigh may reioyce togither prayse name one common accord let v cast selues downe presence good god acknowledgemente oure faultes praying make v feele wise may haue regard amend therewithall euery one v may haue mynde humble himselfe vnder god mightie hand steade condemning others learne feele euilles selues may seeke purge clense v till haue clothed v fully owne rightuousnesse let v say almighty god heauenly father c lxxiij sermon first vpon xx chapter sophar naamathite ansvvered sayd thought inforce ansvvere hastinesse mee haue heard correction reproche spirite myne vnderstanding enforceth ansvvere hast thou knovvne time old since god placed man vpon earth aduauncement vvicked short time ioy hypocrite shall indure though lifted vp heauen haue raysed head aboue cloudes yet shall perish ovvne dung haue seene shall say vvhere wee may better profite thys doctrine wee haue beare mynde hath bene declared suche incountered iob saying god leaueth wicked vnpunished haue taken grounde true selfe applyed amisse persone iob cause ought pray alwayes vnto god giue v skill discretion know howe apply thing rightly shall haue learned god word wee may turne thing euill might profite according see number abuse holy scripture crossely ouerthwartly therefore standeth v hand marke poynt shall see heere good profitable instruction effect whiche sophar sayeth heere althoughe wicked despizers god bee seene prosper heere whyle yet must perish end must miserable according hath alwayes bene seene put vre god execute iudgements world end hath done afore ere come poynt hee vseth preface wit inforced answer compelled well spirit vnderstanding also bycause ashamed checked iobs hand specially sith knew himselfe sayeth owne saying true iob reasoneth contrary sophar good reason first god giueth v grace intent serue selues alone ought make neyghbours partaker god giue vnderstanding one man another ought keepe himselfe alone looke gift god bestoweth vpon v wee muste labour communicate oure neyghbours may bee edified well selues god bee honoured one common consent paule also sheweth namely man haue receyued gifte god hath receiued himselfe must apply wholly common vse behold also howe god haue charitie exercysed euery man like well himselfe despyze neyghbours poynt wee bee bodie churche meete member bee knit togither meete bee referred head lette v marke well whereas sophar sayeth spirite vnderstanding inforced answere god gouerned thys saying rightly placed hee reason say sayd god shall haue disclosed good thing vntoo v must bee drowned v rather wee must bring light heere yee see sayde wee haue beleeued must speake fayth muste bee dead thing must vtter hir selfe paule dothe well verefie sayd sentence psalme hee sheweth lawfull doo bycause god giuen vnderstanding whiche ought serue whole world therefore vttereth treasure committed knowing well particular thing one man profite instruction whole church verely euery one v must applye lesson himselfe shall see many say ynough euerye man beleeue owne hart would say thing god hath ioyned togither might separated men wee haue seene alreadie recorde dauid beleeue ought speake except doo shew malice doo burie thyng whiche god woulde haue published abroade according sayde men light candle put vnder busshell hide set vpon candelsticke may shine al furthermore nowe man hath receyued gift thinketh win himselfe credite estimation aboue man contrariwise disgrace god gift making serue vainglory purpose god dealeth gift one another end wee shoulde men good therefore let euery v haue care aduaunce spread abrode whiche god hath committed vnto haue receyued much let neuerthelesse brought meanes saluation wherevnto god calleth v ende hee might bee glorified among v marke one poynt yet muste poynt presse v sophar sayeth hee heard correction reproch speaketh respect owne persone onely according matter hee dealt hee angrie see god truth troden meanes vnder foote iob intent haue declared alreadye therefore sophar dyd hym great wrong neuerthelesse thys doctrine continueth selfe alwayes good true wee must holde holy ghost also ment teach v man blinded owne imagination notwithstanding ceassed haue good groundes thys doctrine taken may stand v steade notwithstanding see reproue good fight agaynst god truth resisting cauils thing misapplyed therefore like befalleth v must withstand much say whensoeuer see man striue god truth wee must set ourselues aduersarie party vvhy god giue v wherewith make ourselues proctor witness haue cace maynteyned v honour great done v behalfe god seeth wee bee full vanitie nothing vntruth v yet neuerthelesse calleth v proctor ought boud mind honour v far foorth vvhat remayneth euery v streyne himselfe vttermost dutie vvhen wee see men malicious wicked lift vp themselues god seeke meanes possible peruert corrupt truth meete v bee slouthfull vve see day pope hath many seducer whiche seeke nothing slaunder good doctrine falsifie euer alledge name god yea wee neede go farre see malicious head euery vnderlings satan whiche turkin thing desire nothing turne vpside downe see diuell working sort ouerthrowe thing good edifie church impoysoned ought holde oure peace resist stoutly much v lyeth yes certenly else cowardes yea imputed v high treason shoulde suffer god truth bee defaced wee maynteyne opinion better hold peace speake agaynste papist superstition yea meane see howe diuell would abuse silence vtter foorth lye tirannies continually poore soules perish meane hold tung shall become shepeheard duetie wil suffer woolues theeues enter flocke scare byte deuoure yet say neuer word god hath appoynted v sheepeheards church like wee muste haue sweete amiable voyce guide oure flocke withall leade saluation teachable obedient also contrary part wee see theeues vvoolues must crie aloude scare away ye see perceyue men peruert god truth ought dissemble rather earnest zelous resisting vttermost power agayne ought haue courage constancie maynteyning good caces trumpery suttleties wicked pray ought wee speake still like behalfe wee see god name blasphemed deede good doctrine scorned rayled vpon ewde lyfe malapertnesse euer wicked folke take hand vvould god necessitie constreyned v muche doth vvhen man hath preached woorde god let go abroade streates marke seeth ech man openly sene euery man hath conspired god fyre water contrarie common lyfe leade doctrine preached say reachlesse men heare although set face vpon matter ceremoniously pretende god shall honored word receyued yet appeereth playing little child men throughly mocke god common lyfe doo nothing else despyze word vve neede decyfer thing peecemeale men see well ynough wee dulheaded grieued v see god ill obeyed among v smally reuerenced men handes specially seeing thing come shamefulnesse sophar speaketh namely onely god dishonored whoredome loocenesse lyfe blasphemie robbery thing reigne punished ought bee also euen punishment extended men finde theyr hart mocke god iustice speake whyche sawe yesterday myne eye strumpet bee put prison shee must haue tartes caried hir feast hir withall must locked vp countenauce meane whyle shee must presented great tartes pray dealing onely bene tolde bene oulted yet could haue hild peace saw selfe myne owne eye somuch may seeme god brought diuell ment make triuphes side maruell though haue charge lordes flocke preache hys woorde speake roughly sith see thing farre square nother modestie honestie ho yet blameable god speake hundreth part ought considering disorder outrageous see vvherefore let v marke well sentence sophars sayde could holde pe inforced speake bicause hee chafed wyth reproch wee must suffer euill haue scope without setting selues without shewing selues haue zele god maynteyning glory truth let v come generall matter layd foorth heere hast thou knowne time old sayeth sophar eue since god set man vppon earth highnesse wicked shorte time ioy hypocrite transgressor shall indure hee taketh heere principle good true whiche wee take life despyzers god happie wee deceyued happinesse dreame adde similitude true men wyll say wicked vnhappie wee ouershoote ourselues wee see man liue easily honour although life bee ruled according god word yet notwithstanding rauished thinke state good wished euery man spite yea meane whyle knowe aduaunced snayles sayd psalme comparison well worthy noted dauid sayeth bee aduaunced world haue liuely roote settled god snayles come creeping vp one night vanishe away hand behold heere snayles porredge haue consideration wee leaue principall poynt looke vnto end haue pacience say well god aduaunceth whome wil breake neckes greater owler fall vve good skill wheele fortune wee cannot referre thyngs god prouidence beholde hys workes yeelde hym praise muche therefore haue wee neede marke well sentence euer since god set man vpon earth hath bin found continuall experience highnesse hypocrite late tyme ioy shall indure euer vvhen sophar sayeth thing bee knowne long experience hath bene euer since god created worlde saying great weyght wee see two three example god iustice ought wee bee touched ynough heere much three foure persones onely god sheweth hee leaue wicked vnpunished hee sheweth euery day hath shewed borne wee pursue age age since creation world wee shall see god hath alwayes kepte rate seeyng wee haue suche example greate long continuance god hathe alwayes shewed himselfe iudger wicked mennes prosperitie made thing turne confuzion decay reason wee shoulde yet still doubt vvherefore lette v marke well saying howe importeth much truthe say time since men dwelt vppon earth hath bin god wyll ther alwayes recordes iudgements therefore wee must bee dull blockish consider thing god hath done instruction heerevppon wee ought gather ynough v haue eye open marke vewe well thing god dothe oure owne life tyme must also profite auncient hystories verely heere see lordes wee haue notable iudgementes lefte v wryting namely ende remembrance remayne euer yea wee muste onely profite ourselues thing conteyned holy scripture also heare story rehearced written heathen men wee must haue skill apply god doings selues wee see hath executed vengeance vpon gyuen crueltie robberie extorcions therewithall hath punished whoredome filthinesse whe reigned ouersore finally wee see hath punished periuries outrage men pryde hath exceeded farre coulde longer borne looke vpo thing ought serue turne day also let v remember well lesson giuen v heere namely somuch god hath euer since creation worlde tyme tyme giuen v warning shewe v hee iudge world must learne stande awe hym walke warely punishment hee hath executed vpon wicked may lookingglasses v brydles restrayne v nowe lette v returne hee sayeth highnesse wicked short tyme although lifted vp heauen reached vp clowdes head yet shuld continue god would throw downe hand heere iob continueth matter sawe wit god wil suffer wicked aduaunced florish shall indure long sophar considered thys well would haue stoode contention wyth iob forasmuch taketh generall sentence applyeth amisse goeth ouerthwartly worke yet notwithstanding haue sayd doctrine deserueth bee receyued comming holy ghost v doo looke aduisedly vpon apply conueniently therefore let v go foreward matter troublous temptation v see wicked prosperitie would fayne god shew himselfe wit cannot away wicked throweth downe bycause hateth abhorreth selues amisse would haue god spare v none v thinketh god ouerhastie punishing v vvhen haue committed one sin two three god chastize v thinke soone wee cannot away another man haue done neuer little faulte would haue god thunder vpo hande lo wherevnto hypocrisie leadeth v done contrary part vve must bee contented see wicked triumph tyme worlde haue full scope liue ease pleasure bee greeued although wee selues bee meane whyle aduersitie trouble meane god intendeth trie fayth wee sawe thing bee suche shall bee ende god sheweth v word would put trust vve would beleeue nothing til saw perceyue thing god speaketh soone wee would yet neuerthelesse continue still stedfast hys word resting vpon hath proceeded hys mouth thing wherein wee shew selues beleeue let v marke well god doth lay brydle vpon wicked vngodly folkes neckes trie whither haue serued purely whither haue paciently giuen leaue doo without lifting vp selues also yet god haue v learne paradise world would faine liue pleasure god dandle v lyke little cockneyes behoofe cleane co trary vnlesse god drew v affliction wee would neuer good willes fleete world much intangled may therefore wee haue neede bee drawen heauenly kingdome many tribulation god shoulde inforce v come yet therewithall also shewe v hee roote wicked though runne ryot neuer much vvhen see wee shall haue cause beare grudge haue sayd already let v learne ouercome sayd temptation trumped way wicked happen bee aduaunced yea euen reaching clowdes wyth theyr head let v vnderstand must bee grieued though god asleepe though regarded world ne care contrariwise let v assure selues god lifting vp strike quite downe one blow yea euen deadly fall falling stand vppon feete might well scape breaking bone god suffereth hoysed vp high sendeth downe vtter destruction thus ye see intent sophar sayeth loftinesse wicked short tyme nowe hee addeth ioy shall bee long continuance vvhereby meeneth despyzers god al tyed world ouer ioy themselues present prosperitie vtterly drunken wyth true child god may well bee merie haue prosperitie like whe god sendeth v wherewith fed maynteyned hee dealeth v want nothing giueth v health quietnesse like thing may well mery yea ought bee according sayde law thou shalt eate drinke thy god bee mery yet must faythfull settle ioy vpon present benefites hold themselues tyed vnto yea rather want meate drinke bee troubled sicknesse must therefore ceasse trust god must learne paules lesson whiche haue skill poore rich indure hunger scarcitie also haue abundance thus ye see mirth god child differeth greatly mirth vnbeleeuers worldling reioyce thing hold hande without looking god heauenly life haue care besotte themselues sort find ease run ryot extreeme loocenesse lyfe contrary wise faythfull prosperitie always led wit acknowledging god goodnesse hee hath made feele father towards know also may seeme haue forsaken neerest succour thys sentence sophar ment shew despizers god giuen euill aduaunced fortune terme hir laugheth vpon prosper liue ease bee dulled mirth drunkennesse runne ryot without order measure lo sophar ment speake purpose let v marke well lord iesus christ sayeth wo laugh shall weepe mirth shalbe turned gnashing teeth lawfull v merrie sayd afore lawfull v reioyce god giueth v occasion merrie let v iames willeth v let merrie sing say let giue god thanks calling vpon let alwayes still go foreward towards stablished loue feare trust towards ye see mirth ought way sayd mirth wee must also bee sadde considering wee ceasse offend god paule also sheweth v example considering vice v let v alwayes go onward still full perfect ioy hidden v yet thus muche concerning saying ioy wicked shall indure long furthermore let v mark sophar beguyled mistaking word short time small continuance scripture sayeth wicked vanish away god consume turning hand ment keepeth one ordinarie stint haue declared already god reserued till latter day would wedded world wayte comming lord iesus christ accomplish resurrection redemption lord therefore fayne reserue many yea parte thing till hys last iudgement yet meane alwayes office destroy wicked shew short continuance good sooth let v consider well oure life wee shall se thyng lasteth longest time worlde doth passe slip away turning hand vvee bee suche fooles god lift vp hand first day destroy haue offended wee opinion time neuer come seemeth v life lasteth long yet graunt shadow euery man must away hence spite teeth therefore sayd vnto v wicked continue long tyme lette v learne meant oure lorde riddes hand although come yeeres fiftie threescore yet ceasse bee trayned still god hand decay confuzion bee shorte wee muste bee pacient wayte silence god without boyling hastinesse sophar wont vse heere behold say howe behoueth v apply doctrine wee intend fare better truly right necessarie poynt v wee shall see many offended reading promise holy scripture god blisse leade wayes bring deuices good ende shall liue prosperitie shall bee blissed hande themselues ofspring cattle home abroade possession shall bee preserued grace god contrarie part see child god indure great scarcitie many misery rufull sometime haue much one morsell bread put mouth smirten disease al calamity meane time wicked whome god threatned doe prosper vve astonished wee seeme lose time trusting vnto god threatenings promise deceytfull vvhat cause suche trouble want pacience bridle ourselues say wil see god vve need stride ouer wee haue passe diche bee fayne leape stryde wee maye get ouer much leape ouer thing worlde lift vp selues beholde god iudgements therefore cannot see though neere hand certesse diuers say go thing stoppeth stop strawe lyeth way let yet needed lift vp foote treade vpon ouercome matter make great adoe great lazinesse v howbeit destitute god spirit yee see plight yet thing conteyned holie scripture spoken vaine without cause furthermore behoueth v marke also howe zophar sayeth heere wicked shall haue lifted vp heade skie reached cloud god find meanes well inough throw downe yea sinke euen hell lo end wicked shall seeke nothing aduaunce themselues true god doth erewhiles exalt seruantes honour dignitie yet ceasse lowely still vvhen man gouerned god spirit although great prince honoured whole worlde god hath reached hande exalt highly yet hee always modestly mynded acknowledge infirmity walke feare warenesse saying ala would become god brydled mee giueth grace haue nothing myne haue cause glorifie selfe neerer commeth doth bynde honored among men behoueth mirrour saue destroyed ouerthrowne god hath sette cace ende serue turnes haue neede helpe thus child god indued grace meene keepe themselues serue owne peculiar turne withall acquaint themselues neighbor yea eue meanest according saint paule speaketh humble themselues lowest god hath commaunded cleane contrarie whe wicked happen bee aduaunced doe nothing lift vp heades cloudes perke vp vnto heauen whereof commeth bycause haue forgotten themselues thinke themselues bee mortall men take themselues ye would say god vve see blinde wretch sotted pryde namely knowe themselues one spake men thinke forgotten zophar meeneth saying wicked lift vp head vnto sky perke aboue cloudes true behoueth v reach heades aboue skyes aboue cloud another manner wit although bee wayfarer worlde see nothing corruption selues yet wee must fayle possesse hope euerlasting benefites god hath promised v must bee able protest paule wee citizen heauen heritage prepared v alreadie alreadie set heauenly place namely person head iesus christe hath knit vnited v self neuer separated thus ye see howe faythfull child god must lift vp head heauen also aboue heauen yet notwithstanding mente heereby humble themselues according sayde shall alwayes stoupe vnto god prophet amos speaketh meneth saying god haue v stoupe vnder intent wee know burthen vpon shoulder wee able beare mainteined power surely necessarie v end may glorified v deliuering v sorte misery aduersities wherewith wee bee ouerloden borne downe therefore let v marke wel thing ende may learne frame ourselues myldnesse wee may bee number whome god lift vp heauen hee hath cast downe vnto hell vphild hand god let v humble selues apostle sayth yea let v humble selues sort may first yelde god glorie belongeth vnto whome goodnesse proceedeth make true confession vnto secondly haue euery one v eye calling knowing god hathe knit v wise togither greatest ought apply themselues least euery v ought put god giftes suche vse may take good common assuring oure selues condition wherevpon bee giuen v others bee partaker well vvhen wee goe worke sort certaine wee shall bee alwayes vphilde hande god although diuell make neuer great assaultes vpon v yet shall holde againe though wee bee sayne stagger nowe yet god alwayes readie hande shall euermore get victorie howesoeuer world go therefore hilde modestie becommeth v let v assure selues god cause v feele power making v continue goodnesse euen ende although must fayne walke many hazardes daungers worlde yet hee suffer v rush euill incounters break necke meete surely giue v grace leape ouer sayde afore thus muche haue wee gather wordes zophar present time nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement ou faultes praying make v feele thereby may taught mislike selues sith wee wretched creature ceasse offend therewithall may true lowlynesse receyue chastizementes shall send v may dayly stoup vnder mightie hand stricken may notwithstanding ceasse walke hee commaundeth heart myndes lifted vp faith hope vnto kingdome heauen continuing neuerthelesse little one world howe babe witte babe malice intent bereft vaine presumption selfeliking wee may serue one another god may honored v one accorde may please graunt grace v also people c lxxiiij sermon second vpon xx chapter sermon goeth exposition vij verse text added heere hee shall vanishe avvay dreame found againe shall passe avvay vision night eye hath seene shall see place shall knovv child shall faune vpon poore hand shall restore rich bone shall full youth shall lie dovvne vvith dust euill svveete mouth vvill hide vnder toung vvill spare let go keepe mids palate meate bovvels shall turned gall adder vvithin hath svvallovved vp rich hee shall spue vp againe god shall plucke bellie heere sophar go forward doctrine glaunced yesterday witte wheras wicked despyzers god seeme bee happie shall laste long bycause god must put hande confound end vseth phrase whiche may doe v vnderstande shall perishe owne turning else owne dung doe hebrew terme turning sayd shall go dung speake way disdeine reproch ye see meening say although despyzers god braue make selues terrible yet must perish shame ynough cast men remoue dung lo sense afterward addeth shal perish neuer recouer made whole againe herevpon likeneth dream vision night passeth away incontinent short saith haue seen great estate authoritie shall knowe nother shall bee hope recouer place againe haue declared verie true happinesse appeereth wicked shall end turne greater confuzion much bee cursed god bee must needes come euill ende vvhat cause men happinesse bycause god receyueth fauour blisseth wee haue contrarie hee shake v although whole world seeme side thing fall contentation tootoo well needes muste benefites possible v haue turned vndoing therefore fountaine welfare onely goodnesse loue god haue although seeme neuer wretched yet shall thing turne welfare cleane contrariwise god loue v impossible meanes prosper vvee may well haue outward shewe shall cotinuance shewed v therfore let v mark wel spech sophar vseth although betoken two thing haue sayde yet notwithstanding importeth god ouerthroweth wicked turning hande deserueth noted bycause seeme fastned yron nayles say may neuer remoued god finde meanes throwe downe yea euen vpon suddeine men aware thing shall seeme impossible v god able work beyond imagination conceit againe let v learne bleared gloriousnesse dignitie wicked seeing lorde casteth teeth see doth world highly comend inriched robberie aduaunced wicked practizes suche despyze god equitie right behold holie ghost likeneth dung filth haue touched let v bee tempted see greatnesse excellencie despyzers god rather let v hearken saying holie ghoste vttereth put estimation without cause bicause wee repine state drawne line lust would euerie blow finally bee disquieted though god executed iustice world asleep heauen listed represse wickednesse ouerfloweth bank therfore ende suche temptation haue dominion ouer v let v learn esteeme thing dung filth world hath great reputation lo wee haue see men clap handes wicked maner honour god therfore meane let v pacient wayting ende assuring selues dung afore god also poynt bee noted namely place shall knowe eye hathe seene shall see vvhereby sophar meeneth wicked shall afflicted small time like god doeth oftentimes afflicte faythfull also wise may seeme bee vtterly ouerwhelmed may seeme god minded confound owne seruants without anye hope setting vp againe yet haue promis although bottom hell hande god stretch selfe thither drawe vvherefore though wee must bee faine walke middes shadowe death yet let v dismayed seing god giueth v token redeemer wit sith heare voyce god warranting v hath forgotten v lo haue side although god giue wicked somuch little fillup wound deadly neuer recouer god speaketh destroy yea eue wise man may bee able set estate build vp againe vvell may men attempt shall preuayle thinke plucke backe thus see sophar sholeth despizers god wicked sort fro faythfull affliction may well light vpon alike oddes end say affliction light vpon one wel insomuch faythfull shall seeme verie point perish vtterly without recouerie howbeit muche god hath promised reach hande although come euen deathe yet bee rayzed vp againe wicked must perish vtterly curse god vpon therefore let v learne comfort selues god shall sende v affliction although great hard heauie yet cause gladnesse sith end shall happie side see wicked florishe triumph let v ceasse keepe pace notwithstanding miserable worldward god striketh vpon suddein set vp againe must lie still place shal neuer acquainted saide full seuen thirtith psalme inasmuch hard thing beleeued god destroy wicked euen bee well settled life maye seeme continue ate euer holie ghost fayne drawe v backe oftentimes lesson ende may bee throughly settled heart fully persuaded wee perceiue te god raze wicked without euer suffering recouer vp againe let v herken scripture sayth wee shall perceiue god rooteth suche sorte menne shall wote become thus muche concerning sophars wordes hee sayeth place wicked shall knowe also comparison dreame night phancies menne conceyue true life man selfe may well called dreame doe men heere vntill oure lord haue inlightened made knowe ordeyned better life vvhat say onely dreame suche weene get wealth heape vp rich heere bylowe ceasse runne seeking heere make large circuites yet notwithstanding come always one point thinke vpon nothing else gathering dreame vvhat vice euer men infected pray haue certeine mark resting place long bee intangled world haue cleere mind vnderstand god calleth haue thought well settled haue affection well ordered dreame short thing well serched peecemeale men purpose deuise take hande doe would bee founde whole state like dreame fancie man conceyueth haue sayde may mannes life generally sayd specially may verefied hold aloofe god turne back vpon much leaue light wilfully seeke darkenesse meete haue wage deserue wit haue wit confounded may able iudge thing discerne betweene white blacke rather ouerspred continuall night doe nothing else dreame deede wee see also howe transforme thinges turne cleane contrarie marke despizer god hee beare himselfe hand able worke wonder yet meane knoweth god enimie must need perish may wel fortifie shal able scape god hand fall vpon hideous storme said forsomuch wicked shun light asmuch deserue god shuld cast vnlightsome place continual night wrapped round darkenesse haue mind dazeled conceiue dreames fancy make themselues beleue without cause holy ghost doth mouth sophar liken wicked vnto dreame onely disguise themselues sorte see men also haue false opinion wicked man aduanced euery man reuerenceth yea enuie state would ne lyke come doe oftentimes make idole thus yee see cace menne see wycked prosper wee consider within haue woorme gnaweth without ende ceassing bycause god iustice followeth harde heeles alwayes troubled conscience knowe wee perplexitie vnquietnesse wicked bycause god hath cursed wee bee bleared certeine vayno shewe prouerbe sayth glistereth eyther golde siluer eye let v learne remember shewed v heere wit wee must dreame bee led owne misweening fancie god skorne vanitie shewe end haue bene darknesse day come wherein wee shall bee brought light daye commeth men shall see howe haue bene beguiled dreames nowe night god inlighteneth v leastwise let selues vvhat maketh v dreame cause deceyued owne fonde imagination euery one v forgeth fancie self loth stay selues consider god doth dally eye specially hee warneth v worde beholde howe god sheweth v true happinesse true welfare blissed man sayth hee feareth lorde blissed man applieth minding god truth blissed man putteth whole truste god shall bee like tree planted ryuers side alwayes full good sappe nother heate drought maye cause forgoe freshnesse lustinesse thus doth lorde shewe v true happinesse may knowe selues blame fugitiue cannot rest vpon firme ground needes haue happinesse slipperie flyghtfull therefore well worthy perishe tumble bottomlesse pit sith goe wilfully seeke darkenesse night thus ye see sayde muche god gracious inlighten v worde behoueth v come away dreames fancy end tossed afterwarde sayde bone full youth hebrewe word sophar vseth heere doth sometimes signifie hid secrete sinnes surelye hebrewe worde signifieth youth deriued thence also sense may wicked man bone full sinnes hath committed specially hee began commit youth else youth bone full filled glutted pleasure heart desire euer mynde vnto came hande wee haue note wee take worde youth owne signification meening first sophar warranteth wicked giuen vnto euill neuer returne backe agayne according sayde salomon prouerbs yong man hath taken wrong way shall go still commeth olde age shal continue al one vve see men haue take way awry giue themselues naughtinesse verie hard plucke backe againe lo good profitable lesson although common ynough talke verie heathen men haue made prouerbes yet haue wee neede bee warned considering howe much giuen continue euill rufull thinke nothing perceiue howe satan taketh possession v continue filthynesse vvhen man beginneth first euill thinketh followe still day moneth yeare shall returne well ynough againe end verely though repentance sleeue sayde beholde satan creepeth v taketh possession v ere aware therfore let v keepe v hardening euill soone wee perceyue flesh naughtie nature egge v prouoke v step asyde let v restreyned feare god falne let v doe endeuer get vp againe incontinently wee bee way let v returne say v delay till morrow specially yong man standeth vpon ordering life let well aduised gyue himselfe ouer vice filthinesse weene returne hee listeth himselfe hee deceyued yee see fyrst thing wee haue marke wee must bee saped sinnes nowe verie fitte manner speaking say bone wicked full youth wit wicked onely haue fleeting lustes man shall see folke haue anye malicious wilfulnesse vtterly despyzers god haue still seede godnesse would fayne giue themselues weldoing howbeit muche haue holde themselues constant assoone meete prouocation streit ouershoote themselues shall see say sophar meeneth much heere wit haue bone full naughtinesse within soked steeped delight themselues see also diuell poisoneth men stinging lightly sheading venim bottome heart witte vnderstanding may conceyue nothing euill lo howe god punisheth haue despyzed gyuen themselues ouer euill dayly appayre wex euer woorse woorse hereby see mannes choyce repent listeth scoffer say mocking god tush need one good sigh end shal giue sigh vvherefore let v beware welter sinnes get bone intoo maree oure naughtinesse goe v graue well may wee stryue yet must fayne dwell still olde skin therfore let v beware vengeance god light vpon v furthermore haue sayde another lesson v gather saying bone wicked full youth shall lie graue naughtinesse shall lie sayth sophar hereby meeneth wicked yee would say redie burst fulnesse goodes pleasure god make leane ynough shall wither away fayne go starke naked graue serueth confirme matter discoursed long afore witte wicked haue owne wish cheefe iollitie seeme bee happyest men whole world one bone bene full youth say god first giuen could wish afterward made lay themselues downe sleepe euen euery man himselfe alone say bare carkesse god vncaseth stripped starke naked sendeth graue hereby bee admonished wee see wicked men haue meate drinke fill yea euen till burst rich flowe vnto desire honored haue pleasure say warned quiet wee see thing seing lord hath told v must good reason passe ouer stumblingblockes shaken let v marke wel ende sophar sheweth howe euerie one must goe lie downe alone himselfe graue seeing let v tarie till lord vncase wicked shal haue cause enuie ouershoote ourselues sayd common thing v goe dust rot true howbeit haue good companie inasmuch wee haue walked feare god life know yelde soules handes hee keepe well faithfully vve shall well accompanied much knowe angel god scripture telleth v shall receiue soules put saide good safe keeping vntill wee rise againe heauenly glorie albeit outward apparance euerie one v cut world companie men layd graues yet shall well accompanied godward wee haue walked feare contrarie part wicked must lie still dust although haue great traines band e haue ye would say trayled long tayle yet must god bring ende declared afterward sayd euill sweete mouth holde vnder tong wil spare without swallowing downe keepe still palate mouth shall turned gall adder bowel assoone haue swallowed shall spue vp againe among thing hee spake also child wicked thing forgotten sophar therfore among thing sayth wicked folkes child shall flatter poore handes shall restore rich bad possessed hereby hee doth v vnderstande god vtter vengeance make felte onely person whome speaketh also child according also scripture sayeth god make iniquitie father come home bosomes child maye seeme first blushe agreeth god rightuousnesse soule hath sinned shall beare punishment sinnes said ezechiel god punisheth child sinnes father hee doth deede howbeit must presuppose god doeth oftentimes owne gracious goodnesse exempte child wicked ceasse blisse notwithstanding deserued bee cursed againe god intendeth performe iudgement whereof mention made heere hee letteth child wicked holde owne race steppe father reason whereof continually increase mischeef much vtterly voyde god spirite doe prouoke wrath continue heaping vp vengeance vpon themselues according god executed vppon theyr father true verie cause god draweth backe holie spirit might follow father bound tyed man let v thinke maner punishing straunge whereof sophar speaketh heere wit god impouerish wicked mennes child bring lowe ebbe must fayne fawne euen vpon veriest rascal theyr father passingly proude muche greatest honorablest sorte durst matche stoode awe according see haue heart puffed vp pryde must need disdeyne men seeing haue alreadie begonne despyze god vve see intollerable pryde voutsafe giue good looke come sue make supplication vvell child must bee fayne sue veriest rascal say vengeance performed god suffereth child followe father thing right necessarie v knowe ende may consider sorte vengeance god vpon wicked seeing must also extend child like side perceyue infinite goodnesse oure god pleaseth blisse child make fele mercie sake excellent recorde loue beareth v contrarie part wee see fire wrath kindled onely pursueth selues also spreadeth catcheth hold child also inough make haires stand vpright vpon head let v learne walk much carefully feare god least drawe sayd horrible punishment vpon oure selues ofspring herewithall let v vnderstand also lord blisse ofspring haue feared honored wee maye better courage giue ourselues seruice whe see liberall thinkes ynough make promisse v haue extend child also behold say haue marke sentence nowe consequently sayde handes shall restore rich agreeth sophar addeth namely hath hee deuowred hee must spewe vp againe god make restore thing hath swallowed vp mente heere wicked may well rake muche toogither short tyme inriche themselues shall neuer sooner inioy goodes haue gotten eyther child must bee brought pouertie else themselues must spue vp againe god tarie long time making yeelde vp account seeme bee come full point purpose god must bee fayne doe cure vpon make cast vp stomackes rid quite cleane great store good raked togither vvee see verie many example hereof yet verie fewe thinke vpon say wee see men pilling scraping side vvell god giueth bridle haue meanes occasion inrich themselues buy house landes turne pennie deale marchandize ye see full well stuffed may haue swallowed vp come storme worth hundred thousand crounes shall find distressed hee would bee glad scape safe bodie like poore man midds sea would giue goodes hee hathe hee might saue life euen saye doeth god suffer rich choke men haue raked togither hangman else shal bereft impouerished assoone commeth sodeine storme also see othersome waste away peecemeale truely men say see euill lucke beholde one verie rich sped well owne pollicie come ye see nowe misfortune befalne suche man hath delte amisse hath made foolish bargaine else ieoparded much thus wee looke vpon meane cause ought go principall thing wee therein bewraye howe blind wee consider manner men inriched crueltie extorcio craft deceit guile haue raked men goodes vnto without pitying widowes fatherlesse verie cause turned good want knowing god hande althoughe shewe selfe wee turne vpside downe vvherefore let v learne take better heede doe god giueth v example wit haue bene verie rich abated also delte withall god hee maketh cast gorge see impouerished oure face let v acknowledge god layeth hande vpon whereas sayde owne bandes shall restore rich howe commeth passe haue swallowed vp thing doe stoupe lowe restore haue raked togither owne handes meening owne accord wicked would neuer come poynt good will excepte god graunt speciall grace acknowledge ala haue doone men great wrong whome haue polled beguiled therefore must bethinke restore againe suche haue defrauded neygbours come poynt blissing god heere sophar speaketh god curseth howe shall hand restore thinges haue taken men knowe meanes whereby god maketh cast gorge seeme vtterly destitute wit vnderstanding whereas heretofore bene skilfull dooing theyr businesse coulde discourse vppon matter howe lay afore hande say thing must bee done first haue thing doone waye must go worke haue bene politike gather themselues side shall yee see become starke dolt much shall seeme giue backe againe rich scraped togither though cost nothing bee shorte man would say play little babe vndo thing true maner men ceasse bee couetous euer haue furnace still burning could find hart haue deuoured hundred world yet blinded themselues passe lashe hilde streitly whereof commeth bycause god disfurnisheth wit reason impouerish sorte thus yee see wee haue marke first part sentence although wicked swallowe vp thing maner deuouring one fleecing another seeming themselues neuer haue ynough though good increase still yet let v ceasse behold thing fayth see yet eye looke mee vpon wicked man inricheth himselfe hee scrapeth vnto side vvell shall thinke wee must haue eye sayde heere true wee shall foorthwith perceiue howe oure lorde doth cure spake making restore thing haue swallowed vp deuoured let v behold thing word wee conceiue selues see euidently make v wee shall tempted doe euill maketh v couetous take away mennes goodes bycause wee beare selues hande thing shall continue v euer contrarie side see howe god threatneth v intente serue brydle restreyne v might tempted stretch handes men good inrich selues losse neyghbours nowe immediatly sayde euill bee sweete mouth hold see heere trim fit similitude sophar vseth expresseth poynt despyzers god wit looke take pleasure looke finde sweetenesse holde themselues feede humour example couetous man gather good suger honnie surely man hunger staruen although piece maet nother tastable sauerie yet wil chop vp commeth passe salomon saith prouerbes throughly hungred thinkes meate hee eateth bee sweete although bee bitter deede wicked cace say misdooings finde sweetenesse howe come passe bycause diuell sauceth looke vpon whoremaister chafed owne lust diuell blindeth make finde sinne sweete delight man giuen drunkennesse gluttonie hee serues sauce thus yee see howe wicked despyzers god doe finde sweetenesse misdooings playe liquerous folke licke lippes holde suger yea somtimes keepe vp roofe mouth hold sweetnesse longer loth swallowe downe soone vve shall see liquerous sort another bodie saith could finde hart haue crane neck intent fauour meate might tarie longer meete cup good wine thinke haue neuer emptied glasse ynough would faine haue sweetnesse tarrie longer spring runne continually sophar sayth wicked doe find fauor iniquitie like liquerous folk whe haue delicate morsell mouth holde vpon tong rub palate licke lip well ease lo point wicked end find bitternede hidden vnder commeth man giue one poyson must season honny suger bitternesse felt first tast assoone poyson swallowed worketh verie sharply bitternesse becommeth much feercer deadlyer hee felte first receiuing morsell yet mouth also wicked haue swallowed downe saide sweetnesse sophar sayth shall turned gall adder nowe must wee indeuer beare mynde surely although declaration similitude euery man see meetly common doctrin one may vnderstood eue rudest vnlearneddest sort yet notwithstanding colde practizing doth always shew haue take heed inough neuerthelesse suche grace similitude man may well see holye ghost set downe end stirre v remember conteyned wee perceiue diuell commeth tempt v layes baytes v let v beware allured vice wil first sight haue alwayes sweetnesse wee shall bee deceiued bee full hooke hungrie fisshes sooner byte bayte immediately bee stricken hang faste hooke euen v suffer selues bee seduced beguiled oure owne vice yea euen heathen men haue often vsed similitude according plato sayth looke howe many lustes affection men many baytes allurement satan offereth throw headlong afterwarde destruction true beginning bee likelyhoode sweetnesse seeme bee sweetest thing world ende conteyned must needes shewe selfe wit sweetenesse wicked shall haue felte misdoings shall turned gall adder much heere mention made despyzers god wit assoone shall haue chawed poyson swallowed downe although feele bitternesse first yet must shew selfe end let v pray god suffer v finde sauor vice giue v spirit wisdom wee may discerne aright deceiued vaine sweetenesse wee feele finnes fyrst taste let v allured rather let v seeke true liuely sweetenesse grace whiche communicated vnto v sauiour iesus christe ende may fill v sweetenesse hope euerlasting life wherevnto calleth v furthermore let greeue v though bee kept hungrie life haue wherewith fill selues rather bee pyned god hande many affliction misery let greeue v say beare assuring selues shall bee partaker heauenly inheritaunce wher shal haue full frition inestimable sweetnesse god hath promised yet hidden v nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledging sinnes praying suffer v yeld selues satan deceit although owne nature ready turne asidevnto enticementes offereth v yet may hilde backe restreyned holie spirite none lustes affection fleshe may carrie v away tosse turmoyle v wont may stedfastly withstand vntill power holie spirit wee haue gotten full victorie bee come marke good god hath set afore v beeing conformed glorie vnited sonne heauenly kingdome wee may haue wherefore glorifie magnifie reioyce fully may please graunt grace onely v c lxxv sermon third vpon xx chapter sermon goeth still exposition xv verse text following shall sucke venim adder toung viper shall slea shall see riuers streames flovve vvith honnye butter shall restore vvhich hee hath gotten shall tarie vvith according surenesse chaunge nother shall inioy hee hath gathered togither hee shall bee made poore hee hath spoyled house builded shall feele contentation belly nother shall able keepe desire among corruption intice v drawe god giue selues euill dooing one men simplie persuaded desirable thing bee rich without regarding wherein rich consist ende possessing enioy world blind knoweth rich end purpose men rich wee see wretched vnbeleeuers wedded affection namely man must riche meanes soeuer herevpon fall snatching polling extorcion passing come thing haue meane knowe god curseth haue gathered greate abundance goodes may seeme haue swallowed vp whole earth shall reape fruition goodes possesse god plucke goodes handes else make melte away shall feele profyte much doth stande v hande marke well sentence conteyned heere first shewed v men guyle selues beare selues hande haue gathered great good shall inioy yet notwithstanding thing couetous folke doe ground vpon may get land possession say shall take reuenewes shall neede goe seeke corne wine myne owne cellar garner shall haue make money besides againe shall haue diuers thing men shall bee fayne seeke mee shall haue neede none shall bee honored shall credited man hang groyne mee shall haue money pouch wring nowe men make account may soone come short reckening common prouerb sayth recken without hoste god may well suffer men gather gain heape vp great store bee fullie fraughted charged muste lay vp stomaks againe thus ye see ment first place saying hath deuoured greate goodes hee must spue vp againe god plucke bellie come passe vnbeleuers beare themselues hand good haue gotten shall continue alwayes shall neuer bereft bycause perceyue god heauen must cal account shewed v streine rightly sayde couetous folke make iust reckening sure goodes possesse holy ghost bringeth v backe iudgement god vvhen man sayth hee shall haue swallowed vp good owner hath coffer garner cellar also belly god able plucke againe let v assure selues purpose haue deuoured getting good behoueth v aboue al thing able protest truly hold god say haue gotten mean lawfull allowed god hath put hand lo principal point must ame meane eue whe cace stadeth vpo gathering good world let v folish imagin al happinesse consisteth rich rather let v bethink ourselues true richnesse hauing great abundance worldly good gotte right wrong blissing god co tented hath therwithal also able inioy vse good handes speciall gift god furthermore let v afraide threate god make v spue vp wee haue deuoured notwithstanding stomacke bellie haue consumed let v learne say take god giueth v grace bee contented play cormorant drunkard cram much faine lay vp byandby rather sober aduised man taketh repast measurably let euery v take heed increace himselfe meanes god giueth caried away excessiue couetousnes deceyue one side deuoure rake deceyte one way pill poll another way therfore sayde let v content ourselues receyue whatsoeuer god shall giue v added yet greater cursednesse wit lyke inriche themselues suttleties crueltie vnlawfull meanes doe sucke poyson adder viper toung shall kill according afore wit wicked mennes meate shall bee turned intoo gall adder within bowelles notwithstanding find somwhat sweete mouth yea licke lippes delight themselues rolling toung vve see neuer thinke themselues haue inough well ease merrie may deceyue man againe haue practize hande say fall well purpose take hande get thing neuer bee reste till haue brought thus sweetenesse tong god turneth bitternesse vvherefore let v marke well sayde heere wicked shall sucke poyson adder viper shal kil shewe v god well chaunge sweetnesse wicked doe beguile themselues intrap folke thinke themselues happiest men worlde bee short paradyse intrap men side must goe ende sayd god chaunge turne thing adder poyson thought bee sweete honnie suger let v simply followe petition wherein lorde iesus christe hath taught v aske dayly breade god vnder saying comprehended god shall haue giuen v eate drinke must also voutsafe turne good nurrishment ynough v haue wherevpon feede lorde must also fayne blisse throughly make auayle nurrishment shall see againe anon hee crammeth glutteth selfe much eating farre suffized shall bee turned bane true may well filled shall maner wretched bodie hath dropsie dropsiman purged humor bodie shuld bee better ease one half cup wine one bit bread would good meate world forasmuchas full naughtie humor within might drinke vp sea fisshes men say yet neuer better euen haue deuoured al thing cruelly like wild beastes god must fayne turne bane folowing admonition moyses let v learne pray god fosterfather euen therfore god feede people wildernesse space fortie yeeres without bread vitayles giuing manna heauen god sayeth hath mainteyned thee sort intent thou shouldest know time come man liueth owne labour thou mightest say diligence mine owne hand haue gotte thing like thou seest god fed father wildernesse mana heauen giueth thee bread receyue thou owne hand nowe let v go couetriches rake selues therewithall let v marke sayd wit shall farre turning welfare god conuerteth adder poyson maketh like byting scorpion yea might know experience although written let v open eye shall perceyue god executeth iudgements worlde maner specified blind say vtterly ignorant shet eye bicause would see true somtime cannot discerned euen good men troubled much feare yet god setteth markes vpon iudgements end might receyue instruction therefore long v wilfulnesse bee seene bycause wee turne away sight god sheweth v let v learne bee somewhat wizer whereas told v heere shall come farre short nurrished good get rauening shall become bane shall sooner burst v satisfie v let v learne content selues little god shall giue v may v good sayd immediatly wicked shall see riuers streames flow butter honnie heere wee done vnderstand wicked shall bee depriued blissing god hath promised specially faithfull whiche giue abundance riuers flowed wine honnie butter true see yet wee bee susteined god grace know rest vpo goodnesse fatherly loue assuring selues careth v nurrish v child riuers flowed full honnie butter well contented wee thing world may perish fade away sauing fountaine wit hand god neuer drieth without cause sayd heere precysely feele sayd nurrishment god play wilde beastes may well burst themselues haue pit welsprings worlde yea great riuers yet must thirst middes abundance shal able suffize cause destitute god blissing said wherein consisteth rest contentation men meane fill satisfie say make say ho may prayse god alwaies go forewarde race haue blissing god good world cannot suffize v saying common ynough seeme yet fully perswaded true surely see equitie vprightnesse reigne among neede many lawes many iusticers represse extortion committed yea neede much teaching exhorting euery man would bee owne schoolemaister teacher euery man would carie iustice inclozed hart needefull come iudge neede seriants aduocats process would preuent mischeef assure selues god hath put good world hand could susteine v thought good hath promised v although one graine corne one drop water good sooth wee conuinced hereof experience crauing ordinarie foode fed like little babe goodnesse haue much yet let v content selues sheweth v grace nurrish v manna fell vpon v heauen wee haue much haue v put right vse whiche wee must bee cormorant keepe euery v wee haue receiued must communicate haue want neede seing lord auoucheth himselfe fosterfather let v feare shall left destitute knoweth needefull v let v hold selues contented faire promise certainly discretion v euery one v would refrayned neede threatnings lawes say abstaine ye euildoing hurt neighbour man wrog others ye would haue done selues euery man would brideled himselfe induced vprightnesse would go violence wee seene men lust outrageous cannot meanes bee tamed cord cheines able tie say shoulde neede constreints handes would owne accord bee tied vp euill yea would desirous serue euery man turne good cause wee ought minde lesson well ynough draw v backe vanitie loocenesse excessiue lust wrong extortion haue bin wont enriching selues moreouer stirre v vp regard god resting vpon onely blissing therewithall vse well goodes hee hath put v trust knowing wee bee steward giuing v vpon condition wee yeeld good faithfull account shewing none v hath deuoured alone himselfe made neighbour partaker according abilitie wee haue receiued thus yee see effect conteined saide wicked shall restore whiche haue gotten shall abide verely according measure change nother shall inioy wee haue herd heretofore expressed heere full wicked neuer satisfied although haue gathered much goodes seeme ready burst vvherfore alwaies want bicause lord prospereth thing haue hand like man might cast much goodes gulfe yet seene insatiable man may snatch catch side yet ceasse hungrie stil commeth twoo cause singular grace god wee content selues little call vpon name waite fed hande according haue found selues haue bin nurrished heretofore contrarie part suffereth couetousnesse vnbeleeuers bee kindled bee alwaies gathering euermore coueting neuer contented punishment let v marke well first cause wicked cannot inioy great goodes haue gathered bicause lorde set lust fire suffereth haue racke within neuer ceasseth torment deuill still kindleth fire god iuste permission harte regard thus muche concerning firste point second cause like god increaceth one graine corne nurrishing maketh multiplie hundred little shall suffise make fat likewise contrarie part curseth withereth euer wicked cram shall eate dubble say shall gather ynough much howbeit god consume euery whit sayd prophete shall go naught greate heape goodes shall vanish away minute houre yee see god rooteth vp whiche men made greate account cause wicked cannot enioy whiche possesse true bee proude ynough according also lord iesus christ sheweth parable riche man inlarged barnes soule saith merrie haste thou well wherewith feede thee beholde thou haste suche abundance thou canst neuer wante therefore wedded worldly goodes haue gotten muche wicked dealing haue great cause boast rich withoute cause sayd vnto rich flow vnto set hart vppon thereby prophete meeneth hardly shall men bee riche shall find themselues wrapped worldly vanity also cause saint paule exhorteth timothie warne rich men worlde bee exalted pride vvhereby doth v wit riche men make ydoll goodes thinke themselues bee aboue state men vtterly forget themselues wicked may well reioyce getting manner reioycing cursed one euen one god muste end turne gnashing teeth anguish therfore let v marke must stand vpon day yeere wee see wicked triumph take pleasure state beare themselues hand felicitie let v looke end wee shall find thing conteined heere shall accomplished say ioy euerlasting howsoeuer world goe wicked alwaies torment vnquietnesse surely could see theyr hart would appeere euen middes ioyes alwaies full care perplexitie afraide least earth faile looke vpon man hath gathered great goodes surely man shall able beare pride hee could find harte set foote vpon men throtes vnder colour credite traples one vnder feete oppresseth another make third honour god home owne house stand tooting vpon himselfe peacocke owne tayle seene say yet hath secrete pricking within god abide suche glory manner goodes haue certaine rest putteth woorme gnaweth wise continuall anguish perplexitie howsoeuer worlde go saide expressely heere wicked shall make restitution according lengthening chaunge saying may first blush seeme somwhat darke conteineth good lesson effect sheweth v wicked must faine restore thing haue gotten greate labour first point hee say men blinde witlesse take greate peines get goodes must yeeld vp though haue neuer much hard nippe wee knowe couetouse sorte wedded goodes man shoulde breake bone plucke maree goodes possesse deere owne liues farre led away co sider goodes created men vse income present life yet notwithstanding wee see wicked torment themselues haue neuer little harme losse goeth harte man cut throte hundred time yet neuerthelesse must faine restore good bicause god plucketh hath bene saide heeretofore yea euen according prolonging chaunges rechaunges haue made god haue turne change also howe vvhen man gripple gathering goodes god giueth head doo transpose thing may seeme hee make newe world hee impouerisheth rich abateth much pulleth downe aloft lo couetouse much lieth doo make new worlde god said giues leaue time plow vp thing men seeming yea venim poyson stuffe themselues full vomit vp agayne anone yea feele horrible bitternesse whiche haue swallowed downe haue changed thing say haue made turning haue land possession none cofers filled wheras three shilling purse estimation credite whereas despized afore haue changed whole world god also hath turne mortall man presume displace thing hee practize determine would say shall god chaunge length vvill sit idle heauen thinke chaunges made heere without permission suffereth done thinke wee hath resigned office meddles gouernement world bicause winketh thing time blinde wicked sorte suffereth compasse enterprise intent cast downe deadlier fall otherside exerciseth faith pacience faithfull might troubled sight suche change haue discretion wait quietly end ouershoote theselues hastily whereby god trieth faith meanes prouoked returne god greater earnestnesse sayd wee see heere conteyned good lesson mention made pride wicked sort making chaunges seemeth woulde spite god displace bound god hath set like haue realm dominion bee bounded also haue bound settled amog priuate person euery one may peasably possesse owne raueners gulfes wilde beast seeme said loth leaue either bound border thing else would fayne make newe world haue changed pace hath god suffered must afterward chaunge copie set thing againe former state thus much concerning sentence anon saide bicause wicked haue impouerished good spoyled house whiche builded heere see behoueth v consider god iustice punishment sendeth worlde truely already good instruction wee knewe chaunges world casuall men terme say happen alteration proceedeth hande god though simply graunt god power say ruleth world doth thing nothing done guideth determination yet go glorifying god ought like god knowen almightie also knowne bee righteouse true hath bin declared heretofore wee shall alwayes perceiue sayde righteousnesse thing seene yet must haue two thing witte first must know thing turned fortune aduenture god disposeth thing god gouerneth holdeth bridle marke one point knowe almightinesse god wherevnto worlde subiect vve must come secondly righteousnesse say wee must fully resolued perswaded god turning thing world though dalied played v tennisball wicked sorte say god maketh sport men taking pleasure either exalt men cast downe v let v assure ourselues god almightinesse tirannical inordinate power ioyned vnseparable bad righteousnesse doth thing vpright maner true haue sayde wee shall alwaies perceiue righteousnesse god sometimes hideth co ceiue reason doth thing howbeit let good reason thing wherein iobs friend deceiued therein wee must resemble condemned iob wicked man imagined common manner god iudgements must esteemed al one rate vvhy sayd afore sometimes god doth thing v incomprehensible vvhat shall cace let v conclude neuerthelesse god righteouse yea let v confesse therewithall iudgements bottomlesse pitte cannot sounded god two wayes commended holy scripture righteousnesse sometime god punisheth men iniquity sight world ende might bee feared honored sayde prophet esay god keepe court shew iudge world inhabitant earth learne walke vprightly whereas euery man tooke leaue afore euill thinke ala ala iudge whome wee ought feare thus yee see howe god righteousenesse sometimes shewed openly sometimes also god woorketh fashion straunge v wee haue inquired thing come passe taken wee must bee fayne come short purpose yet neuerthelesse behoueth v acknowledge god righteouse honour secrete iudgements whiche bottomlesse pitte howsoeuer worlde go sayde god muste bee hilde alwayes righteouse heere speaketh god righteousnesse apparant vnto v wee may behold eye sayd bicause wicked haue beggered good men themselues must bee payde like measure bicause haue raked spoyled men house god must driue turne quite dores make reckening dwell ease wee haue good discretion change come amisse wee may profite selues sort god doo time impouerish haue liued wel let v assure ourselues bee done greene tree shall become seare tree let v tremble vnder hand god praying graunt v grace inioy goodes hath put handes intent please bereeue v let v pray giue v strength beare paciently pouertie shall send vnto v thus yee see haue marke side wee see lord compelleth cormorant vomit swallowed downe making yelde account constreyning restore whiche snatched away driuing house builded violence deceit bereeuing goodes gathered lewde fetch let v acknowledge god dothe hold assyses shew v although suffer wicked grow riche intent cotinue euer thing haue swooped vp turne bane whereas goodes faithfull turne welfare become good riuers flowing butter honnie say let v acknowledge ende wee may behold god iudgementes humble selues vnder also let v learne enuie wicked seeme liue rest ease abundance credite honour god turne miserie put open reproche shame men thus yee see becommeth v marke chastizings punishmets god sendeth vpon worlde wee may applie instruction saint paule counseleth v brother sayth lette man beguile vaine woordes truly man may heare wicked woordes cast foorth god iudgements scoft deceiued saithe paule wrath god commeth vpon vnbeleeuer suche thing say tarrie till god smite vpo head punisheth wicked eies knowe cannot away vngodlinesse must bee faine shew himselfe iudge abuse pacience long therefore profite selues chastizements learne know intendeth make wise men harmes lo heere marke sentence afterward inseweth saying taking away bouses builded true god promised people dwell house builded speciall promise god set people lande canaan againe wee knowe howe holy scripture saith generally man happie whiche eateth labour owne hand nurrished therewith therefore intend haue goodes v good let v learne haue cace wee may say god hath giuen v god meddleth craft extortion confesse deede wicked inriched without yet therefore sayd alloweth doings nother ment wicked acknowledge god say thanke god thinke selfe beholding hath giuen hold diuell god blissing therefore let v side learne said afore make account promise happie eate labour hand say eate thing haue gotten good lawfull meanes allowed god furthermore let v assure selues purpose builde world thing heere fleeting transitorie let v like fooles make nest worlde would say looked neuer go therefore let v bee tied whiche chiefe house bodie though man haue great palace sumptuouse house world certaine cannot continue euer cannot keepe himselfe prison peculiarest lodging euery man hath owne body yet wee see brittlenesse vvhat firmenesse hath nothing corruption rottennesse vvhat done let v hie v heauenly building say let v desire repaired god spirite may dwell v wee bee made temple whatsoeuer corruptible transitorie v may renewed may set state promised v yee see must world seeke draw men goodes v take pleasure whiche none liue cotented whatsoeuer god giueth v therewithall pray god builde v may temple end may dwell v holy spirite suffer satan carrie v away enter v nurrish vice sinnes v meanes would make body foule stinking stable know god cannot dwell filthy place therefore wee haue settle v wee must first pray clenze v vncleannesse end may build v grace bee true temple holy spirite lo wee may well builded wee muste vnderstand proceedeth meere grace according scripture auoucheth bee charge build vp sion like generally lord iesus christ buildeth whole body churche also let v assure ourselues must fayne builde one v thing must ame vve must wedded flightfull corruptible thing worlde must hie v euerlasting thing labour till become fullie lette v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement fault praying make v feele may learne mislike take suche hartie remorse wee ouercome temptation hie v alwayes heauenly glory true heritage may giuen vnto may seeke nothing please god frame selues wholly wee may shewe deedes calling v vnto vaine wee willing glorifie whole life acknowledging benefites whiche hee giueth v meere grace end wee yeeld praise due honour may please graunt grace onely v also people nation earth c lxxvj sermon fourth vpon xx chapter shall feele suffizance bellie nother shall keepe desire none meate left therefore shall goodes multiplied vvhen abundance full shal anguish hand labouring men shal come vnto vvhen hath vvherevvith fil bellie god shall sende dread vvrath make raine vpon meate vvhen fleeth yron vveapons bovve steele shall meete vvith svvord shall bee dravven shall cut shall passe gall fearefulnesse shall vpon zophar going forward matter delt yesterday addeth wicked man neuer hath contentation rest shall fare thing better aught leaueth behinde nother shall goodes thriue heire successour sentence hath bin declared alredy howbeit larger confirmation thereof repeted againe may beare better mind also better perswaded see man haue abundance goodes opinion wanteth nothing hath contentation felicitie needeth nothing else take pleasure seeing thing answer hart desire maner marke pray perceyue wretchednesse hid whome god curseth giue iudgement according see eye god iudgement inclozed bone maree therefore yee see behoofe heare sentece often may surer haue remeberance printed hart side looke vpon rich man thinke heauen earth mingle themselues togither confound therefore god declareth although man haue neuer great welth yet shall perish euery whit vanish away wise shal nothing heire successor hope vvherefore let v marke well two point may learne set store god blissing welth world tempted couet cursed rich cannot come good end bicause god scatter abrode lo whervnto lesson ought serue v let v vnderstand first chiefe marke must well prouided great abundance worldly goodes god must singularly graciouse vnto v may feele fauour wee may sure father take nurrishment hand giue v contentatio rest see couetousnesse men desire neuer quenched worldly goodes sure shall bleared sometimes euen blast yet doth god ope eye giue gathering rich perceyue howe nothing passe away swiftly smoke impossible man cotented satisfied looketh vpon goodes hath hads meane haue rest see haue ynough god shew father beleeue hath hande continually stretched giue v al euer haue neede vvhen haue regard v shall haue good rest although one bit bread ye would say yet notwithstading asmuch sure god rich ynough maintaine v waite vpon whiche promiseth saith lion wild beast notwithstanding bee giuen rauening seeme though would swallow vp thing ceasse suffer hunger scarsitie wheras god nurrisheth time derth true shall bee alwayes exempted distresse yet god succour come extremitie say thing wherin faithful reioyce benefyte spoken heere like wicked men haue true discerning benefite childre god esteeme morsell bread declaration god father thereby bee also confirmed hath susteyned day duetie morrow likewise hath alwaies wherewith grace goodnesse neuer abated cause sayd goodnesse god laid vp store feare true thinking vpon bodily nurrishment principall point wherby god haue v feele loue fauour beareth v wee muste mount higher namely although wee veriest wretch whole worlde yet hath god prepared rich v aloft heauen wherevnto wee muste hie v therevpon wholly set oure mind neuerthelesse looke whatsoeuer good god doth v bylow foretast giueth v souereine goodnesse let v come backe againe texte wee alledged psalme lord great abundance thy goodnesse thou hast laid vp store feare thee vvherefore doth prophet speake bycause although god doo sheade bountifulnesse euery according sayd mercie vppon creature yea euen vnto brute beast yet wicked vngodly notwithstanding cram themselues god benefit till burst perceyue goodnesse vtterly voyde knowledge thereof god hath layde vp store feare thus muche concerning firste poynte shewed v heere namely wee must deeme men happie great abundance goodes possesse according contentation vnpossible suche know god grace ne haue care shoulde haue contentation bycause knowe benefite haue whiche one afterwarde sayde shall bee remaynder meate straunge thing man shall haue heaped vp great goodes shall likely leaue child little king god vndermine shall bee remaynder lefte surely falleth continually nother haue said god haue one vnchangeable rate kept alwayes execution iudgements worlde thing nothing reserued till latter day yet shall perceyue token god consumeth man goodes sorte shall apparant men eye yet knowe become meanes hath bin impouerished vvhen see thing ought wee thinke god executeth office giueth v occasion thinke vpon acknowledge iudge intent inticed inordinate lustes wee wont bee surmise oure happinesse consisteth raking much goodes ourselues imagine rich euerlasting rather come alwayes backe poynt seeking ordinarie foode hande day morrow life long thus yee see ought practise lesson sophar hath spoken manner addeth wicked man chiefe welth shall ceasse bee anguish handes labourer shall come vnto else hand men able doo great acte shall come vppon sense may dubble word placed betokeneth man foreward executing thing may bee taken man laboreth traueleth worketh may also taken man disposed harme wrong violence howbeit playne meening euery labouring hand shall come wicked doo seruice yet shall boote lo summe sophars meening ought beguile ourselues wee see wicked throughly stuffed lord heapeth vp goodes house seeme hee minded giue hundred time giueth men whole world ready seruice somuch haue men fee euery man offereth himselfe vnto saying sir please imploy haue hand labour seruice profite yet shall ceasse bee anguish behold wonderfull iudgement god therfore much ought bee sensible v say ought touched much thing nature man hath wherewith himselfe good wanteth nothing yea list haue great trayne may haue great number take paine might liue ease pleasure able inioy owne goodes liue continuall griefe afrayd least earth faile surely thing reason neuerthelesse see welynough god dothe persecute sorte bicause haue gotten rich lewde practises thereby shewing right well geere serue purpose bicause curseth euery whit behold say iudgement god right straunge wee seeke commeth passe shall finde meane therefore conclude god whiche worketh againe seemeth v wee haue good willes loue men euery man seeke v seruice goeth well v wee neuer want saide heere wicked haue men sorte commaundement haue whole host men ready labour profite nothing worth continuall anguish heere therefore zophar intended inlarge sayd afore say hee intended giue v greater certeintie god iustice vppon wicked thereof setteth v wealth good men beare thus yee see riche men ruffle seeme v owner god hath yee would say power anoy see men sotte themselues owne imagination shall abundance boote nothing wee see wicked continuall anguish although haue wherewith make themselues merrie neede say word table ready furnished haue seruants commaundement haue retayners fee short seemeth world created none yet cannot eate one morsell bread ease poore man doth worth past valew fiue shilling betaketh himselfe god laboring man liueth dayly vpon dayes worke hath dined knoweth wherwith shall suppe referreth god assuring himselfe leastwise hee good cace bird lift vp billes heauen god feedeth say poore folke cace yong rauens according sayd psalme god nurrisheth blissing vve see vvherefore let v learne turne againe vnto god assuring selues wee shall want thing take charge v though giue v great abundance goodes blissing shall suffise v say let v aduise selues sorrowfull though god beneficiall v wee would haue although hee deale sparingly v yet lette v ceasse haue franke hart short let v martyr selues measure vpon trust neuer faile v token vnthankfulnesse men god shall haue shewed himselfe liberall towards giuing great abundance goodes yet notwithstanding still doubtful neuer ceasse thoughtfull muzing vppon one thing say token neuer acquainted god grace else knewe haue esteemed ought god giue v wherewith let v learne content selues knowing setteth goodnesse eies intent learne settle selues vpon rest also one point namely although wee haue wante worldly goodes likely many euils misery shall come vpon v yet must withstand thoughtfull conceit true wee cannot vtterly carelesse nother must wee yet must moderate passion specially must consider fed god hand wee may seeke foode also hang vppon goodnesse without greeuing selues much vvhen men fauourable v lette v acknowledge god dothe comforte yet must wee reste still vppon men god curse labour wise shall rise early go late bedde yet speede neuer better neede wee god blissing though wee bee destitute helpe onely grace bee ynough v contrariwise wee may haue whole worlde side yet god reach v hande certaine shall go backward thus yee see shewed v sentence wee could practize wee profited oure lyfe long piteouse cace euery v shall haue confessed thing wee sufficiently conuinced wee cannot settle selues vppon wee well shew effect beleeue none thing god blissing dothe men good giueth contentation cannot haue eye vnto exercise v withdraw hand giue v abundance would wish acknowledge almightie succour v yet notwithstanding meening call v thither afflicting v giue v stroke spurre prouoke v seeke desire pitie v seeming neuer haue sustenance ynough except haue abundance hand nother consider please god deale sparely v blissing suffice v better welth worlde lette v passe sayde wicked shall haue filled bellie god sende terroure wrath shall rayne vpon meate confirmation haue seene erewhiles true zophar passeth sayde wicked shall liue anguish although bee throughly furnished stored thing yet shall ceasse bee incombered bycause god giueth contentation rather sting secret pricking somuch fayne martyr themselues continually yea although men indeuer themselues serue yet shall sophar hath sayde hee addeth may well bee wicked shall feele god curse first stroke shall welter yea boast themselues good fortune tearme bee short yee shall see wicked men liue ease outwarde appeerance shoulde seeme feele god wrath beholde saith sophar turning hand god make rayne vpon meate shall rayne rage wrathe vvee see haue touched already whiche heere higher step whiche haue expounded already anguish whereof mention hath bene made vnquietnesse comberance wicked haue springeth continuall distrust haue regard god world nothing trust vnto therefore greate vexation mind neuerthelesse sayd shall ease time shall dazled owne seeming shall bee happie respect vvell doth therefore follow god blissing vpon god suffereth wicked runne riot put trust sort rich doo prouoke god know wealth commeth therevpon take occasion ouershoote themselues much thus ye see brutishe wicked become haue sayd vnquietnesse pricke rest contente themselues weening goeth well muche must god vengeaunce increace vvhy bycause haue gotten goodes amisse bycause haue craft extortion bycause bestow naughtily bicause succour suche haue neede rather gulfes moreouer bee vnthankefull proude god shoulde seeme would worke spite bee greatly bound though beholding thing presume vpon rich make paradise world thinke theselues peerelesse make horne dosse god beholde pray top iniquitie whiche causeth god vengeance bee horrible vppon head sophars intent say friend although yee see wicked vtterly besotted welth bee opinion harme light vppon yet let v thinke cace better euen shall thinke vpon nothing making good cheere worlde loue god send fire wrath whiche shall fall vppon tempest raine commeth suddainely sommertime little blast woulde serue man turne beholde commeth suddaine storme vnthought euen likewise god wrathe shall bee suddayne hee listeth punishe men yee see none shifte v shroude selues vnder shadow god goodnesse safetie whither giue v abundance whither deale sparingly v vvhen wee bee vnder hande protection one bit bread good v nurrishment manna heauen wee haue abundance wee shall perceiue therein god sheweth himselfe father v handdleth v child faythfull therefore euery way fare better thing god sendeth wicked may well haue wherewith burst yet muste god throwe downe turne goodes harme vvee see fell people israell contented heauenly manna vnsauerie thing longing meates bin accustomed egypt vvell god sent meate quantitie cast vp agayne meate yet throtes sayde psalme wrath god came vpon thus yee see god stealeth vpon men vnwares euen twinckling eye vpon thinke themselues subiect lorde giue v goodes let v learne intangle selues nother lette v make graue thing ought ladder v climbe higher vnbeleeuers hie god whe haue goodes snarle selues therfore make graue fasten themselues earth withall contrariwise must make ladder goodes god giueth v world climbe vp aloft wee may led vnto knowing goodnesse fatherly loue apply benefit vse meeneth v vvhat done though wee haue meate drinke yet neuerthelesse let v lifte vp eye aloft desire god feede v wee must throughly perswaded meate take sustenaunce onely power god maynteyneth v agayne meate may perishe although mouthes else shall turned gall poyson belly full fed let v thanke god hauing care v continuing fauour towarde v meane lette v bee prouoked serue thus yee see wee haue marke sentence zophar addeth wicked man fleeth yron weapon shall meete bow steele vvhereby signifyeth god hath many wayes persecute punishe wicked shall bee able scape hande shiftes attemptes soeuer make truly wicked alwayes seeking shunne inconueniences bring bold ynough despize thing zophar also meant bewray presumption sayde wicked shall shunne yron weapon hee sayd true wicked ware wise ynough seeming eschue inconueniences assoone foresee inconuenience streightwayes must remedied order must taken wicked therefore shall fast asleepe shall alwayes haue eye ordering theyr affaire turne vnto
