god intend take order make recourse receyue counsell holy spirite hee may bring enterprise good ende nothing pride statelinesse somuche thinke shall welynough finde good conuenient shiftes owne braynes agayne know howe belongeth god guide thing leade doings end marke wicked yeld honour vnto god consult beate braynes prophet esay saith make discourse conclude beare themselues hande go thing bring passe themselues haue deuised god sheweth shall fall cleane contrarie attempt bycause haue bene caried away owne fond fancy let v marke well wicked neuer suttle seeme also easie find startingholes reason haue laid well affayres aforehand yet notwithstanding god find ende shall able scape nettes effect thing shewed v god hath diuers meanes persecute enimies earthly prince hath made great preparation preuailes disappoynted hope new begin againe without remouing without deuising thing hee needes speake word bring pafse army worlde vve see hath incountered enimies diuerse time rayse great hoste men punished pharao egiptians sent woormes filthynesse beholde god woorketh pleaseth agayne suffer wicked scape harme foloweth policie haue ouercome god hande lord suffereth end condemnation shoulde growe greater waxe wilfull opinion according also wee see come passe wicked escape aduersitie vnouerwhelmed shake eares quite dispatched surmize therevpon take greater libertie afterwarde god doth send small aduersitie wicked pursueth greate rigoure let go escaped scotfree dubble anone much scoffe god pacience prouoke anger also must fayne vtter roughnesse thunder vpon whereas scarce giuen ticke rod must bee faine draw sword take bow shoote therefore let v learne minde saying well aforehand ende lorde visit v may thinke shunne mischiefe owne byleapes rather commit ourselues vnto sted persocuting v deadly enimies deserue may voutsafe take v mercie cause threatnings repeted often holy scripture heere onely sayd wicked man shall flee weapon yron meete bow steele see lord himselfe speaketh prophet saying shall small purpose thee hide thy selfe thine house thou go feelds thou shalt meete wilde beast thou art escaped mouth lion shall bee beare shall find thee welynough heereby lord sheweth hath creature hande serue owne turne persecute men wee cannot make account discharged till wee haue found fauoure sight haue pitie v onely meane sure safe god haue receiued v flee aloofe fro hath long hand hee hath drawne sworde hath bow also say hath many sortes chastizings punishmens ende wee must needes fall vnhappily except reconciled vnto haue shewed alredy nowe like god threatneth sword bowes wild beast scorpion lift vp themselues stoutly harden themselues hand also contrarie parte hee sheweth hee hath wayes without number saue flee refuge goodnesse put theyr trust therein true wee shall inuironed many misery many deathes shall lie wayte v god also hath diuerse wayes succoure v yea v incomprehensible therefore wee vnprouided meanes shall seeme v vndone let v bethinke selues thus god hath issue death knowne himselfe hidden v bycause intendeth exercise fayth let v tarrie till discouer goodnesse shall please make countenance shine vpon v shall perceiue life euen midds death ye see threatnings god maketh wicked ought make v resort vnto shall wee haue full matter gladnesse rest notwithstanding wee many daungers assoone wee bee passed one another hand seemeth v neuer deliuered like god hath sword punish wicked hath infinite deliuerances succoure faithfull one lo effect wee haue remember verse conclusion said sword shall drawen pearce gall fearefulnesse shalbe vpon vvhen hee saith sworde shall bee drawne pearce wicked quite cleane gall muche say shall bee deadly stroke shall wounde harte serueth v vnderstande god punishementes shall sometimes bee suddayne true alwayes therefore must made generall rule also haue tolde question whither god perfourme iudgements swiftly yet doth hee giue v shewe euen life ende wee earnestlier herken last day whereas thing shall bee set agayne full state perfection neuerthelesse saide god iudgementes shall sometime bee suddaine zophar ment expresse saying sword drawen shall strike quite gall hee shoulde say wicked man shall perceiue farre god mindeth punish hee shall keepe trace still danger beit sword shall sooner bee drawen scabbard shall strike body wee see meening sentence heereby bee warned foresee daungers good aforehand end wee may flee vnto god pray keepe v heere god iudgementes shewed v bee suddaine also saide wicked shall say peace safe god wrath shall fall like thunder vpon head heereby said warned looke great way v inconueniences may happen whereunto life subiect vvere corzie life say miserable much better v god put v world wold teach v fall asleepe world runne vnto god assure ourselues vphild power oure god wee may outeface satan world yea death selfe bycause wee shall haue god protector defender let v marke well whereas wicked perceiue owne miserie throw downe rather forasmuch mind call vpon god contrariwise beare themselues hande haue neede destruction must needes fall vpon thinke furthermore hee saith immediatly fearefulnesse terroure shall go inch thus wicked haue dubble mischiefe whiche sworde shall runne soone drawen scabbard besides god shall neuer suffer bee rest although daunger past yet shal tremble feare still whereat euen shaking leafe tree saide shall thinke death hath already caught man pursueth see wherat holy ghostamed first intended shewe v wee must enuie wicked bee well garded may seeme harme come neere god shal strike turning hand yea euen deadly stroke whereof may neuer healed marke one point another see wicked feare wee must vnderstand one meane rest know vnder god protection therefore let suffice v although behoue v walke feare yet shall wee alwayes bee sure goodnesse whereas wicked despisers maiestie shall alwayes afraid shall neuer haue rest therefore let v learne retire god lowlinesse liue neighbour withoute man wrong least measure bee moten v againe wee go worke surely god make v feele goodnesse deliuer v danger terrours dismayings happe v nowe let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement fault praying make v feele bee sorie consider better iudgements hee sheweth v wee may dayly bee instructed withdrawe selues transitorie thinges thys world whiche wont blind men though felicitie consisted rather wee may atteine wisedome skill knowe god draweth v trouble wee see heere bylow please exercise v affliction wee may thinke prouoke v seeke side handle v getly end feeling fatherly loue shuld sticke faster loue honor muche earnester minde still passing heere bylow inioying benefit bestoweth vpon v vntill bring v true happinesse whiche tarrieth v heauen may please graunt grace c lxxvij sermon fifth vpon twentith chapter darknesse shall laid vp secret place fire blowen shall consume cursed shall residue house heauens shall bewray iniquitie earth shall rise vp blud shall go house flowing water day wrath portion wicked man god heritage hee shall haue god word saw yesterday howe despisers god afraide without comfort true godly may bee abashed afraide god comforteth runne vnto sure succoure wicked inasmuche despised al men full pride thought themselues subiect mischance god scare sorte shall bee remedie feare therefore let v learne stand awe may walke godlily let v learne well aduised carelesse murtherers shall finde god make v safe eue middes terrours thus remedie afraid measure walke warely know infirmity v dau gers compasse v side wee may pray god voutsafe reach v hade distrusting ourselues learning settle ourselues wholly vpon alone vvhen haue kinde feare god glad v neede shall sure helpe play hardie stout fellowes must god needes bring v confusion shall conceiue feare shal good hel already world expresse better wicked shall find meanes safetie sophar addeth theyr priuie secrete place shall bee darknesse hidden layde vp firste sight semeth great matter saying throughly vnderstoode appeere bee good confirmation whiche saide long since heere priuye place meant backenookes whiche wicked haue god persecuteth according haue alwayes lurkingholes hide themselues vvee see howe wicked man alwayes haue blinde byway play foxe digge himselfe denne many startingholes may bee taken vnwares although know wellynough god entereth place yet beare himselfe hand little hole hee may hyde himselfe god hande may come sophar saith euen shall finde darknesse say although wicked indeuer shrinke themselues shrowdes yet notwithstanding god pursueth shall haue terrour within shall quake although man follow short meeneth whyle despizers god farre blowes set light threatnings beare themselues hande none euill may come neere commeth verie pinche bestirre themselues get couert though god lay hande shewe euident signe hee agaynst yet shall haue darkenesse say shall haue vnquietnesse teacheth v seeke blinde bywayes shunne god hand let v vnderstand oft god citeth v wee muste come foorth account therefore let v deuise shiftes escape yea although worlde seeme promise v neuer many lurkingholes let v assure selues nothing vvherefore let v come willingly vnto god offer vp selues maiestie praying receyue v mercie face shine vpon v shall wee bee deliuered set free darkenesse yea althoughe whole worlde confounded put order yet shoulde wee alwayes bee safe sure custodie god otherwise wee couerts worlde little auayle v shoulde finde dismayednesse wee discouered sydes coulde see miserie vpon v afore hande yet notwithstanding men cannot refrayne themselues seeking lurkingholes bee seene contrarie part intendeth god hee sendeth v worde hee would haue bee cresset yea rather sunne v euery v might serche himselfe sinnes vnknowne v may bee layde open v euerie v bee sorie furthermore espie punishment wee haue deserued wee may bee taken vnwares like vnbeleeuers whiche behight themselues peace safetie maye discouer god iudgements wee high watchtower sayde prophete abacucke preuent inconuenience towardes v say preuent euen prayer supplication repentance yee see wherat god ameth hee inlightneth v gospell wee drawe quite backe asmuch v lyeth wee quench sayde light bycause wee bee naught loth thing whiche hidden v shoulde come light bee short wee couet alwayes bee flattered doth v pleasure abuse selues flattery god doo worde hath borne sway v vvill hee sit still accomplisheth whiche hee speaketh prophete sophonie wit hee entreth lanterne euen deepest caues beholde hee sayth citie ierusalem visite thee lanterne sayth thou hast hidden thy treasure priuie place thou shalt win nothing thou must needes winnowed let v suffer god inlighten v worde let v seeke lurkingholes wee bee come willingly sort surely hyde v tent scripture speaketh hee onely giue v house chamber drawe intoo also himselfe wil inuincible fortresse v short shadowe wing wilbe good safetie v contrarie part shall feele sayd wit hide themselues specially dig deepe dennes sayde place prophete esay shall bee found god spyte teeth though owne conscience pursue yet shall perceyue haue gayned nothing imagining escape god hande thus ye see haue marke sentence consequently sayd fyre whiche blowne shall consume heere zophar threatneth despizers god wicked although happe harme vnto creature yet shal misse cosumed god wrath needeth sayth artificiall fire wrath god ynough destroy willingly submit themselues similitude common ynough al holy scripture namely god consuming fire men stubble wil soone consumed else snow melteth expressely sayd god wrath fire onely melt snow burne stubble also cliue rockes mountaynes make whole worlde fall downe neyther heauen earth shall stand vnshaken assoone god giueth signe wrath shall poore creature frayle nothing v stubble shall becom v god shall haue kindled fire consumeth thing nowe wee see sophars meening holy ghost speaketh mouth telleth v wee must trust fauour worlde thing fall would haue yet therfore scaped god hand addeth afterwarde shall neither heauen earth shall rise vp execute vengeance true shewe mightie incomprehensible power hee may well nowe suffer creature bee fauourable towards v desire bee fulfilled nothing shall fall agaynst v bee ease god needes shewe enimie fire wrath ynough consume v without seruice men without imploying creature allthough holy scripture make v perceyue better terrible god wrath ought v doo sometimes say brimstone thunder mingled yet notwithstanding addeth likewise commeth man hande made inferiour art meane wrought god according sayd esay hell fire prepared long ago wicked enimies god mention made fire brimstone sayd verie breath god bloweth vvhich al one zophar saith heere namely needeth bellowes elsewhere forraine helpe kindle present fire bycause force proceedeth god mouth ynough consume wicked vtterly vttereth self agaynst let v learne frame selues suche wise vnto god wee may feele execution sentence vpon selues late crie ala god shall haue kindled inquenchable fire sayd god word ought bee vnto v burning fire howbeit consume v clenze away drosse superfluity v like golde siluer fined passing fornace ere seruice applyed vse euen lorde intendeth ridde v wicked lustes worde whiche thing onely superfluous also hurtfull wee may dedicate selues afterward seruice must bee doone thing therefore god purposeth enflame v loue end may wholy rauished therewith must bee done meane worde wee cannot abide must needes become chaffe stubble according sayde prophete shall woorde bee consuming fire hammer breaketh stone shall people bee chaffe thus yee see howe wee cannot disfeate god worde office giueth vnto consuming fire must alwayes side diligent offring oure selues vnto god purge v filth wee shall reformed rightuousnesse inflamed loue contrariwise play wilde coltes maliciously stubburnely reiect god woorde let v bee sure spyte teeth doo best woorst wee shall burne v vp euen bycause wee shall bee strawe chaffe stubble whiche consumed hande yea god hathe made v perceyne oure damnation woorde hee doubtlesse also put hande make v vnderstande experience hee hath sayde vayne fire shall consume wicked yea euen without blowing without kindling without putting man hande without ayde creature meane short let v learne stande awe god wrath fall sleepe wee see thing fall wee would wishe worlde serue v purpose iniquitie shall come account god hee shewe himselfe bee oure iudge thus ye see wee haue beare away sentence sayde immediately residue house shall go hauocke shalt nothing misfortune vpon rest house like oure lorde vttereth goodnesse towardes blissing household child belongeth contrarie part hee sheweth howe dreadfull wrath spreading selfe vpon aboute vngodly according wee see howe worlde generally defyled v cause neyther heaue earth corner worlde god wrath cursse seene vpon creature sinfulnesse vve know sayd one man vpo earth dooth good v comprised generall condemnation sinne vniuersally v forasmuch god owne nature hateth sinne must needes odious vnto seeing creature accursed reason filthinesse vncleannesse highe lowe must bee fayne feele defiling euen standeth cace peculiarly wicked man bee giuen vngraciousnesse hee despizer god rushing forth euill euer toucheth defyled filth onely bycause naughtie man marreth peruerteth co uersant companie bringeth vp child lewdly disordereth wife also bycause secrete cursse god vpon head spread vpon child householde cattell euer hath thus see effect mention made remnant wicked men house shewe v lorde agaynst men haue good cause abashed sunken destroyed owne person vengeance god must stretche yet ad nthis sayd end wee shoulde enuie prosperitie wicked see farewell considering ende wee see heere therefore faythfull haue conceyued terrible god wrath must touched must thinke wicked happy flightfull prosperitie doe drawe line till come vtter destruction conclude better v seeme miserable sobeeit stande god fauour haue man wishe meane time god agaynst v lo wee haue marke sentence nowe zophar hath spoken hee addeth heauens shall bewray iniquitie earth rize vp agaynst hee sayde heeretofore fire consume wicked without blowing say god without vsing seruice creature able destroy th lift vp themselues agaynst telleth v another kinde punishment whiche god arme creature execute vengeance agaynst wicked ye see god worketh diuerse sortes hee mindeth punishe despyzers maiestie sometimes haue sayd suffereth thing goe well outward appearance shall doubt mistrust thing whiche shall sport wallow good fortune bee drunken sorte prosperitie beholde god ouerwhelme sodenly naturall fire secrete incomprehensible power yet notwithstanding meane whyle bee sayde oure lorde hath creature owne hande arme suche wise agaynst v euerie shall bee swordes bowes arrowes weapon whiche god stirre vp destroy v withall made purposely bycause wicked bee puffed vp pride thinke get maystrie hardhartednesse bee seene shamelesse folkes bee rebuked sinnes yea euen notorious sinnes whiche little child bee iudges yet keepe still brazen face man shall neuer outface till bee conuinced thrice tentymes tolde vvell maner doth god bring reason ende euen arming heauens agaynst saye discouering shamefulnesse meanes shall haue vsed suche vnshamefastnesse scoffed warning giuen yea made scorne god threatnings muste bee persecuted yea euen without putting mannes hande god alone pursueth shall knowe become chafe vpon brydle spyte god withall furie ouerpast muste bee rooted shamelesse stubburnnesse haue abused god pacience ouerlong thus ye see effect zophar mente say haue wee doo true sometymes wee shall bee wrongfully diffamed oppressed false slaunders wee maye commend cace vntoo god hee make oure rightuousnesse shine bright morning scripture sayth insomuche night passed wee haue darke storme hath suppressed knowledge oure innocencie god ende shewe himselfe bee warrant maynteyne cace spyte wicked lye contrarie part wee go woorke wyles thinke scape oure shiftes hypocrisy let v looke whiche spoken heere namely heauens shall bewraye iniquitie spite teeth wee must come open light discouered midday vvee bee oure lurkingholes verie well god suffer v bee little hee skill well ynough hale v oute oure deepest dungeon bewray oure shamefulnesse vvhether wee wee muste bee ashamed shrowding sinnes whiche shall steppe vp agaynst v yea creature notwithstanding tyme haue seemed neyther heauen earth whiche fauoured v god become oure enimie creature must needes shewe themselues bee subiect vntoo true happeneth alwayes oute hande according haue declared heeretofore god iudgements executed diuersly yet muste wee alwayes haue saying oure eye witte heauens shall bewraye iniquitie suche despize god earth shall ryse vp agaynst ende wee may learne discouer owne iniquity vntoo god scripture counselleth v doo let v oure owne free accorde acknowledge dettes confesse selues blameworthy god haue wee disclosed oure owne iniquitie dooth god couer dooth hee burie dooth cast intoo bottom sea shall neuer come remembrance agayne haue wee shewed bothe heauen earth oure onely desire god pitie v bycause hee might good right condemne v beholde heauens shall bee mantle v earth shall likewise couer v oure iniquity shall buried say wee muste confesse oure iniquity vntoo heauen say god wee must also confesse earth wee shall haue cast stumblingblockes churche haue liued amisse must bee ashamed yelde selues guiltie men haue sorrowed god wee minde shift thing lying god must fayne shew hathe spoken sentence vayne zophar hath spoken bee addeth bud house shall go away like flowing water day god wrath mention made heere budde house wicked men expresse hope haue time come shall beguile wicked cropped god hande hope still bud agayne renue recouer former state sayd god disappoynt budding make slide away water day wrath true faythfull smitten god hande alwayes releeue themselues hope miserie shall indure euer according promised god wrath indureth turning hand mercie shall last towardes euer faythfull may ought well comfort themselues bycause know god make spring agayne holy scripture vseth often similitude although cropped yettheir roote left still grounde nowe take hope presume vpon owne power intent spite god haue acknowledged worthie forsaken god truste hee haue mercie vpon infirmity contrariwise wicked hope afflictios shall continue euer maner defying god kinde iustling agaynst knowe hardest beholde god agaynst side sticke tackling say wilfully bent vntoo sturdinesse determine neuer bow neckes continue alwayes stiffe agaynst god therevpon flatter themselues beleeue miserie whiche endure shall passe away bee gone shall go well wherevpon commeth take hart grace sayde afore haue trust god mercie proceedeth diuelishe pride beare themselues hande god hande strong ynough daunt reason whereof wil wise submit themselues vntoo therefore behoueth v marke well conteyned sentence god make budding fade away like water say shall purpose wicked take highly vpon beare themselues hande shall bee sette vp againe god plucke vp roote rinde although haue bud left say although god haue left little shewe might seeme vtterly dispatched yet shall fade away specially day wrath must wey saying dothe v vnderstande wee must notimagin god ydle ouerpasseth thing putteth hand punishing wicked hee hathe conuenient season hathe god wrath certaine determinate day whiche wee know therefore wee see wicked prosperitie triumphes seemeth misfortune shall euer befall let come oure remembrance wrath god hath day god knoweth time punishe say let v tarie paciently meane learne heereby fall asleepe god spare v lorde make v feele vengeance time let v alone handle v gently although wee haue offended say let v flatter oure selues therefore daungerous deceyte men sleepe saping sinnes thinke vpon god wrath vnder colour beareth gather great heape wrath themselues saint paule sayeth second chapter romanes let v learne flatter selues suche time wee bee rest let v dayly thinke vpon daye god wrathe preuent namely trembling continually oure iudge praying receyue v mercie bycause greatly indetted vnto let v keepe mouthes shet commeth mainteyning cace zophar applyed matter rightly hee condemned iob hee acknowledged iob whiche hee speaketh generally wit whereas wicked doo prosper yet notwithstanding iob hauing led blamelesse life punished rigorously sayd god disalloweth alloweth wicked hee hathe day wrath true zophar prophet god yet dothe hee peruert thing balaam bycause hee discerneth fitte time goddes wrath whereof hee spake cause ought wee giue better heede saying ende wee haue sayde skill spake namely consider god hath couuenient tymes punishe wicked conclude doctrine wee haue heard hee sayth ende portion wicked yea god hand god hand also heritage like bycause wordes touching conclusion sealing haue heard heere intent might authoritie harte might fully assured receyue without doubting marke portion wicked whose hande god sayde true wicked rufsle worlde play looce colt beleeue iudge heauen neyther thinke vpon yet cannot pluck preheminence maiestie hee prepareth indytement serueth expressely daunt wicked put god minde much also good lesson faythfull teache say go wee may muche euill shall bee pardoned men handes yea shall neuer say muche blacke eye end wee must come iudge come thither forbearing men hand turne double condemnation counsell haue gather text name god expressed heere two time men oftentimes discharge dutie specially meene office vve neuer passe admonishing amisse correcting winke yea magistrate whiche ought put hande represse offence doth verie often let alone men bothe generally particularly dissemble make countenance see whitte god negligent office well haue beene borne haue borne must come accout name god togither circumstance text ought wey greatly v sith know without cause said suche portion wicked yea euen godsbade serueth wipe away vaine hope whiche woont conceyue men giue v hande eyther winke sinnes else pardon let v trust vpon bee double confusion v afore god let v assure selues although scaped worlde yet must god shew himselfe iudge whereas mention made portion heritage also serueth v vnderstande must fully resolued poynt god leaue wicked vnpunished like euerie man calleth thing portion ordeyned alotted vnto hathe lorde alreadie assigned wicked whiche belongeth vnto heritage say theyr patrimonie nothing peculiarly man owne punishment god lay vpon wicked hee speaketh purposely woordes howe true men restreyne blasphemy wicked belke agaynst god worde sette downe heere soundeth none euill must taken simply witte wicked men may well alledge many excuse list shall gaine nothing shall bee condemned wordes surely zophar eye iob therein sayde afore applied amisse vnto yet ceasseth true good selfe holy ghoste pronounceth heere generall wicked gay woordes shall rooted hande god therfore worde couched heere without cause see continually wicked desirous pleade agaynst god thinking worke wonder vntoward allegatios truly god suffereth hold plea time length hee sheweth whiche written genesis namely spirite shall striue longer man god borne outrageous wickednesse could bee sawe men abused pacience maner sayde longer pleade must fayne put hande thus ye see sayde heere wicked may well file tongue iustify themselues good skill chop logicke god shall cace rather sharpe sword god must bee fayne execute sorer iustice terribler vengeance vpon heades men may armed tongue pleade agaynst god god hath hande armed stretch heauen confounde suche shall pleade agaynst saying ought touche wicked doth heereby seene brutishe blockishnesse greater parte worlde noweadayes bowing vnder woorde god vnder correction done vnto v name authoritie men encounter sturdinesse well bee perceyued religion among among turkes paynim onely warning vayne giuen men secret also open fault spoken pulpit whereas men ought aske god mercie sue humblenesse bee seene men fully bent stande stoutly agaynste god example spake last sunday shamefull outrage beene doone heereby cologny fell iustifying themselues conspyring agaynst god deuising themselues howe hide thing altogither apparant matter sermon broken church yet coulde obteyned roysters handes leaue warned matter complayned howe thing bee suffered men seeke meanes coloure yea picke quarell great wrong doone vnto yee wretched men yee shoulde haue prepared youre selues lordes supper tolde shamefull disorder intent ye shoulde bee sorie leastwise ye beene become deuils ye haue beene somewhat touched conforme selues come cleane contrariwise rage woorke mischeefe apparant heereby seeke nothing fight openly agaynst god wee speake secreter matter yet whole worlde knoweth wee see open whoredomes wee see blasphemy wee see drunkennesse gluttonie excess wee see despysing god woorde ecclesiasticall order wee see bribery cruelty muche gentlenesse among men among woolues none meening doo violence one poll another finally shame gone thing apparant outrageous thing man shoulde speake pulpit man might well bee wearie conscience come receyue lordes supper hande thou commest euen iudas thou shalt bee sure feele god vengeance trembling cain thou art manifest apparant reprobate haue alledged example ende wee might learne stande checking agaynst god hee list pleade v ala defence shall wee haue get vpper hande cace yet let v thinke god needeth studie howe tell long tale hee conclude execute sentence without pronouncing newe agayne haue ynough holy scripture wherein hee sheweth himselfe iudge whole worlde thus ye see haue marke text wit wee confesse faultes afore god wee shall forgiuen hande wee stande pleading wee seeke lurkingholes hyde oure iniquity wee shall conuinced worde also hee lay rough hand vpon v shall ouerwhelmed vnder yea euen without remedie bee time aske forgiuenesse therefore let v take conuenient time god assigneth v offereth v meane obteyne mercie gospell nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement fault praying make v feele may leade v true repentance steede hardning oure selues may bee hartbroken yea euen hee make v feele sorenesse wrath euery one v maybe owne iudge ende wee shall appeare iudgement seate lorde iesus christ oure sinnes maye bee couered buryed rightuousnesse let v say almightie god oure heauenly father c lxxvij sermon first vpon xxj chapter iob ansvvered sayde heare vvordes let comfortes beare vvith vvill speake vvhen haue spoken mocke talking vnto man vvere hovv spirit faint marke abashed lay hande vpon mouth verely vvhen bethinke afrayde feare taketh holde flesh seemeth sort woordes whiche iob setteth downe heere contrarie worde god inasmuche hee auoucheth god punisheth notthe wicked letteth alone prosper wee haue seene heretofore wee must consider iudgements god executeth worlde according recorde holy scripture first sight talke iobs seemeth vtterly repugnant truth must remember hath sayde heeretofore namely holy scripture speaketh god iudgements sayeth hee accomplisheth peremptorily somtimes taketh hande shew himselfe iudge worlde poynts caces yet one rate therfore ought suffize v god giueth v token wicked cannot scape hande must come account neuerthelesse god doth sometimes dissemble see experience behoueth v acknowledge god dothe prouidence gouerne worlde maynteyne preserue good punishe wicked wee make generall rule suche bee wicked punished hande god delayeth punishment till afterward vseth sufferance reserueth thing life come enter great disorder vvherfore sith knowing god iudgements ought wise wayt accomplishment fulfilling latter day thereby wee maye well dispatche contrarietie seemeth first blush betweene iobs saying heere holy scripture vvhat iob meeneth wee see wicked prosper god farre punishing bee caried still pleasure delightes euen till dying day pine away long lingring rather seeme bee exempted priuiledge god hande aduersitie nowe seemeth sort iob intended beare men hande thing gouerned fortune god hathe regarde worldly matter ne careth meening nothing according also himselfe protesteth ende intent men take offence woordes vvhat purpose shew god visiteth man wee must first dashe giue sentence condemnation vppon say one wicked man suche one hated forsaken god behoueth v examine well life wee must thinke god doothe alwayes handle men worlde wholly according desert vvherefore see wee many wicked men spared shoulde seeme iniquity knowne god seing layeth punishment vpon let v vnderstand lorde reserueth many punishment latter day whiche seene yet agayne hee handleth rigorously loueth haue offended greeuously men thing doth sinnes sake wee knowe doth let v humble selues god must bee glorifyed workes although wee knowe reason yet nowe wee see iob pretended bee wee may better profite selues conteyned heere let v lay foorth serche thing order hee setteth downe hearken mee sayth hee take beede woordes let bee comfort say let bee steede comforte come giue mee truely wee knowe iobs freendes came ende howebeit sore combered sawe plight according man reason concluded iob castaway see howe dazeled generall sentence god punisheth wicked set iob rancke wickeddest sort thing ought doo therefore hee telleth whereas come comfort hee desireth nothing pacience quiet hearing afterwarde protesteth agayne hee shapeth talke vnto men hypocrite seeke bee iustified worlde alwayes shunning presence god neuer come acknowledge bee force till men haue throughly tried iob sayth talking vnto men say led vayne ambition make fayre countenaunces flourishings men hee shapeth himselfe god proofe sayth might spirit holde respect vntoo men yee see suche necessitie creature able indure miserable state likelihoode could haue beene dispatched hundred tymes ere sith see neuerthelater spirite fayleth mee signe knowe hande god submit selfe rest vpon seeing heere wauering reede yee perceyue haue better surer foundation forsomuche see speake god heare mee afterwarde hee addeth thinke without feeling beholde selfe cannot sore abashed greatly dismayde thing whiche see surely iob spectacle terriblenesse wee reade happened vnto heares ought stande vp vpon oure heade saying hee cannot thinke vpon himselfe remember great misery befalne terrible feare must catche holde therefore ye knowe state throughly sayth bee astonished lay hande vpon mouth say blame mee yee haue done hithertoo yee imagine mee pleasure signe yee haue pitie compassion great miserie persone heere haue marke first wee comfort miserable aduersitie behoueth v consider well howe required singular discretion behalfe wee haue seene heeretofore affliction disease phisition vse one medicine disease thing bee disease whote colde disease requireth man shoulde bee kept drie hee shoulde bee refreshed moysture one disease haue man kepte close another haue go abrode yee see phisition shall kill patientes hee haue regarde disease yea behooueth also acquainted complexion patient euen ought wee consider whome god visiteth affliction first must marke persones howe wee see dispozed say wee muste marke personnes man haue liued without stayne walking feare god shewing token sounde meening thing condemne wee see aduersity agayne though man committed foule offence time beene rage agaynste god hee bee daunted aduersities hee indureth wee perceyue nothing true repentance beastly wicked crueltie steppe neuerthelesse vse great roughnesse agaynst nay wee must rather reache hande suche beaten downe helpe vp according sayde duetie teache faythfully name god strengthen weake knee feeble hand herten comfort destresse anguishe minde yee see wee ought vse great discretion comforting suche afflicted therefore without cause iob telleth freendes muche better holde peace increase trouble speaking hee woulde take theyr silence comfort yea hee addeth haue heard hee giue leaue mocke hee meeneth might haue reason doo rebuketh rashnesse according sayde prouerbially hastie iudge giueth swift sentence ouer hastie condemning iob hearde sayth may mocke haue heard speake meeneth nothing disorder rashnesse descant vpon vnknowne matter whereof yet throughly informed therefore wee haue common doctrine marke sentence whiche brydle selues come iudging bee heddie till wee knowe verie truthe indeede muche ought wee minde bycause wee see men nature ouermuche inclyned rashnesse ouerhastinesse although wee woulde fayne esteemed bee ripe settled iudgement yet verie fewe bee found giue themselues bee yea worse shall see great number make haste shewe fine witte feare least men shoulde take dullardes causeth v oftentimes throwe oure selues headlong intoo ouerhardinesse iudge crookedly vntowardly oure neighbour without reason without indifferencie seeing maladie naturall v let v learne examine thing wee speake sayde wize man alwayes heare foole haue mouth open neuer leaue babbling naught salomon sayeth wee well skill say meane wee doo yll put vre therefore oure cheefe wisedome saint iames sheweth v sayeth ought bee slowe speake willing suffer selues bee taught wee haue modestie refrayne hastie speaking god giue v grace knowe matter wee knowe wee shall tell howe stande woord wee shall haue profited greatly haue learned refrayne hastie iudgement wee cannot iudge oure neighbour sort aduenture without double despising god goodnesse vvhy wee must appeare iudgement seate saint paule telleth v iudge neighbour knowe howe cace standeth take vpon authoritie god chalenge selfe belongeth angell heauen ouerboldenesse true knowe euill say knowe owne imagination verie truth may bee bolde condemne shall rash vvhy iudge onely ratifie iudgement god hath giuen worde wee bee hastie spoken afore high treason god bycause rob right peculiar himselfe pull owne person againe besides offende god taking vpon v iudge secret matter behoueth v knowe owne measure haue neede inquire thing knowe say vntill wee bee throughly informed matter twoo reason ought holde v well awe ouerhardie iudging neighbour furthermore behoue v keepe modestie towarde men persones must wee god doctrine pray euerie man stootes foorth bolt vpon doctrine haue throughly examined rashnesse woorthie bee double condemned haue shewed alreadie bee traytours god robbing honour wee iudge persones brother knowe throughly certaine god doctrine muche precious mennes persones go aboute infrindge doctrine aduenture yea euen doctrine holye scripture article fayth vnhallowing holy thing neuerthelesse wee see men bolde ouerbolde cace nowadayes shall bee sooner beleeued matter doctrine drunkardes looce liuers heathenish men whiche muche skill god secretes brute beastes yea verie swine muste snuffe vp theyr groyne agaynst god doctrine dispute might maine agaynst truth hath beene well stablished holy scripture maketh bolde euen bycause vouchsafe heere god punisheth presumption shewing bee ranke fooles alwayes haue tongue walking neuer haue eares open heare pacience much behoueth v practize thys sentence admonition giuen v heere euerie one v must learne bee slowe iudge wee wee shall bee teachable hee neuer proue good maister hath bene good scholler man worke maystries first day hee haue euer beene bounde prentice occupation hee shall make fayre woorke aduauntage himselfe greatly nowe cace stande handie craftes thought god doctrine surmounteth man vnderstanding reuerenced euen angel wee must onely haue beene scholers may bee maysters wee must also perseuer life long profiting vnderstanding wee mynde teache others vvhen god hath giuen man grace teache others hee must thinke hee himselfe bounde learne let v assure selues man shal euer good faithfull teacher except hee indeuer learne still well men bee short behoueth v well teache learne god scholers proceede learning yea euen till die thus much concerning sentence nowe let v come protestation iob maketh talking sayth vnto men howe shoulde spirite fayle heere iob sheweth child god ought speake protested like alreadie heretofore beit without cause repeateth againe forasmuch certain wee wander bylowe talke alwayes trayle long trayne superfluity wee shall go matter roundly substancially wee ought vvhat cause wee woont snarle wordes wise man cannot wring pure truth v bicause haue eye vpon men besides men bleare themselues discerne thing ought side alreadie enclyned followe diuell also thrusteth himselfe make hotchopotche thing oure woordes shall neuer bee well conueyed cleare except wee haue god eye speake prefence side wee neuer throughly touched wee talke men iudge see wee passe hide vice thinke ynough euill apparant lo howe men fall asleepe theyr sinnes neuer speake freely ought doo vnlesse knowe god summoneth frameth inditements must preuet tarie till god condemne rather yeeld themselues giltie owne accorde cause iob protesteth talking vnto men true ought haue regard neighbor wee talke wordes may edifie cast forth light wandring speech shall lay stumbling blockes way may hurt diuerse wayes therefore speake men must bethinke selues afore hand say must haue regarde might bee profite yet must wee haue thing spoken heere iob put god iob meeneth singly despyzeth men hee see rude ignorant wise applie himselfe vnto led vanitie please men onely forget god put behind rather speaketh hee maketh reckening aforehande presence god thought knowne heauenly iudge therefore must disguise himselfe thinke cace concealing truth lo whereat iob looked haue touched alredie let v haue wit pray god cal v throughly home himselfe say oft hee viseteth v handes touch mindes harte quicke wee may knowe hee whiche punisheth v oure faultes oure thought bare dazeled sotted owne talke full babling onely please men beholde say whereof wee bee instructed sentence behoueth v remember well reason iob addeth sayeth wherefore doth spirite faynt seemeth hee leaueth talke heere cut sense doo direct talke men without regarde god shall quayle ende haue made fayre countenaunces first sight hypocrisie bewray selfe last good footh wee see experience ledde vainglorie alwayes desirous reputation among men onely respect haue surely tell many fayre tale roll trimly rhetoricke woordes vtterly bleare men eye bee woonder heare speake heerevpon streake themselues men sooth ende god pincheth suche sort hee sheweth hypocrisie god taketh away starche woman starcheth hir face commeth intoo sunne heate lighteth vppon hir starche falleth hir wrinckles appeare meanes whereof hir shame manifest shee faine get hir away hide euen hypocrite reason goodly shewes shall bee commended exceedingly worlde men thinke none euill vvell god leaueth time shyne bright men ende hee mocketh theyr hypocrisite vtterly defaced bee pynched double treble till babling woont make layde water beholde theyr goodly rhetoricke fayleth therefore let v marke well reason ende may learne come vnto god owne accorde haue care speake presence constreyne v force violence thus reason set downe heere ought serue v threate make v shunne hypocrisie follow sayde vnfeynednesse setling selues presence god hauing eye alwayes vntoo talke wee haue eye vntoo surely hee giue v grace stande specially wee followe example iob cain iudas like faine end feele god presence moued returne repentance god brought therevntoo force let v followe iob say let v seeke holde selues face iudge let v go humblenesse acknowledging iustice may giue glorie belongeth deserueth vvhen wee go woorke desire bee succoured goodnesse surely wittes shall fayle v though pressed neuer extreemely yea seemed bee vtterly ouerwhelmed vve say neuerthelesse hilde vp ende restored god shew seeke come hym willingly receyued hys hande yea euen bee hilde lappe hee giue resting stay shall neuer miscarie infirmitie neuer greate nowe iob without cause addeth freendes looke vppon shall amazed compelled shet mouth lay hande vppon holde peace knew god iudgementes good earnest surely wee woulde haue holde selues wee haue cause wee bee hardie iudge randon wee examine throughly thing god sheweth v howe wee see manne afflicted surely perceyue well ynough commeth god foorth wee fall raunging saye god punisheth suche one sinnes wherevpon fall thundering sayde wee consider god iudgements aright haue better stay oure selues consyder god iudgements aright behoueth v first formost thinke vppon sinnes persone one man god intendeth alwayes instruct thousande many looke howe manye chastizements aduersities shewed many teaching instruction dooth god sende v anye man bee scourged wee must onely looke must also thinke vpon selues surely shall wee lift vp oure horne wee come god maiestie wee shall haue reuerentnesse wee iudge oure neighbour shall bee feare greefe shall behoue euerie one v haue iudged condemned oure selues aforehande haue acknowledged wee deserue receyue muche greeuouser condemnation handes oure god wretched mortall creature syllie woorme earth take vpon mee iudge neighbour shall god doo agaynst mee hee holdeth assyzes wee thought pray woulde stryke terrour intoo v syde wee see god iustice vppon manne ought wee perceyue wee selues haue deserued much hee might handle v muche rygorously true wee coulde blame god crueltie rightuous hee punishe one roughly shall hee doo mee say wee haue consideration serue humble v make v walke awe god onely also strike v feare know condemnation hangeth ouer v god pitie mercie vppon v hee maketh v perceyue aboue see iudgements god whiche notable saye whiche worthie remembrance vnaccustomed ought touche v quicke wee ought conceyue great feare abashe v wee dare open mouth example vvhen wee see common aduersities wherevntoo wee bee inured custome yet muste wee bee grosse headed acknowledge hande god knowledge thereof bee stricken downe humbled feare wee see god sometymes stretch arme sort see thing wee neuer knewe thought dreadfull punishment howe straunge neuer suche thing hearde suche thing say shall wee see behoueth v thinke yet better vpon god seeth v asleepe ouerslouthfull weakeneth v like man falne intoo sounde sleepe hee coulde answere hee called yet notwithstanding must needes wake hee iogged pulled harde arme euen dealeth lorde v inasmuch moued common correction sendeth v dull retchelesse sheweth v great excessiue punishment wee haue heard hee ment waken v perforce vvherefore let v bethinke v profite oure selues god iudgements simplie bee striken feare bee afflighted wee shoulde shunne stirred vp runne vntoo walke feare also let v desire holde v strong hande suffer v stumble seeing cannot bee otherwise v except hee holde v vp preserue v thus ye see ende behoueth v bee astonished god iudgements contrariwise wee see men seeke nothing forget seeming bee melancholike matter god smyte man v must profite oure selues haue declared alreadie contrarie part verie suppresse doctrine although god bende himselfe v beate v roddes yet doo wee labour intangle myndes seeke vaine shiftes hyde god hande withall although feele strypes well ynough yet wee bee acknowne howe god visiteth v see howe woulde burie remembrance god straunge iudgementes whiche ought fray men yea moue euen verie stone yet wee say wicked wishe burie wee haue seene example vvhen lorde hath executed terrible iudgementes mennes eares ought glowe man needes speake good defender honour geneua make complaint say man speaketh man whome god woulde haue bee horrible spectacle feare terrour men manne bring thing rememberance shewe blaspemer spyted god religion ye woulde say straught wittes insomuch mother bare hir wombe deposed diuell brought say men dishonour citie behold good men zealous honour geneua coulde finde harte towne sunken well knowne bee man needes poynt finger call name knowne well ynough yet pretende desirousnesse honour citie well seene heart dooings proceede yee see howe wicked woulde fayne burie iudgementes god bycause bee desirous plucke seate possible might subiect iurisdiction yet hee woorketh terrible fashion needes must wee bee woorse brute beastes moued yet gallant would fain buried furthermore let v mark shewed heere wit god liftes vp mightie hande woorkes vnaccustomed maner waken fast asleepe bring v awe feare abasshed wee may resort vnto learne hide selues vnder shadow pray guide v suffer v fall bottomlesse pit wee haue marke text iob speaketh stopping mouthes maner speeche verie ryfe among hebrewes sayd prophet wise man lay hande vpon mouth v wit thing shall bee confuzed skilfullest best practized men shall knowe say shall bee vtterly past wittes sayeth iob nowe abasshed must lay hande vpon mouth keepe silence iudgement god executed vppon persone iob terrible dreadfull mannes vnderstanding manne shoulde iudge fleshe hee coulde bee amazed sight iobs persone nowe let v gather common doctrine god worketh maner wee acquainted wee haue glorifie sheweth v reason woorkes haue knowne v putteth word mouth wee may bee able speake againe see god workes outpasse vnderstanding wee knowe hee disposeth thing see done vvee must lay hande vpon mouth say must bolde prattle vvherefore let v lerne knowe owne abilitie wee fling selues astray ouer feeldes rather follow alwayes right way heereof need knowe giuen v according also saint paule bringeth v rule namely knowe god leadeth v vnto long reacheth v hande let v go boldely leadeth v must stoppe dumbe true must always haue mouth open one sort glorifie god wee presume bring vnder compasse vnderstanding would haue reserue nothing himselfe whither go wee open despyting god hee intendeth hyde thing v intent wee shoulde knowe owne ignorance yet ceasse acknowledge bee rightuous honour woonderfull incomprehensible ordinance haue touched alreadie whensoeuer god sheweth v reason work let v thank goodnesse say lorde thou commest downe verie lowe v wretched creature thou vouchsauest shewe v thou doost thy goodnesse deserueth well bee magnified v thou communicatest familiarly suche woorth god hyde reason woorkes v bee highe v reach vnto let v shet mouth say let v talkatiue babble owne fancie let v glorifie god bee ashamed ignorant verie wisedome faythfull knowe hath pleased god shewe therefore let v make silence vnto god sort soeuer worke till last day discouerie bee come wee shall see face face glorie maiestie let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement sin praying make v feele better cast downe selues may seeke set vp may taught pitie neighbour reache hand cruell iudges see men aduersitie euery one v may bethinke ende selues perplexitie god afflicteth v may assure selues pitie v doubt hee shewe himselfe pitifull father towardes v wee returne vnto true humilitie obedience grauntvs grace holde selues contented hee maketh v priuie vnto nowe till hee haue gathered v himselfe bee made like vnto glorie may please graunt grace c lxxix sermon second vpon xxj chapter vvhy vvicked liue grovv olde vvelter rich seede mainteyned theyr eye vvith generation theyr presence house quiet vvithout feare scourge god vpon bull commeth gendering seede misseth covve calueth barrein sende forth little one like sheepe child daunce play vpon taber harpe make merrie vvith sounde organ saw yesterday intent iob set saying first sight might haue seemed euill god leaueth wicked vnpunished seemeth bee agreeable office rather muche hee iudge worlde dutie redresse mischeeues done beneath ought restreyn men see square seeth himselfe despized ought mainteyn owne glory pul mounted vp pride rebelliousnesse wee see wicked rage god abide seemeth god sleepe therfore doth iob blaspheme god making complaint meening shew simply although god iudge world yet foloweth chastizings punishment executeth vpon sinnes always apparant men might see eies point finger god delay iudgements behoueth v stay owne wisdome suffer rauge abrode imagination man brayne least hastie though see punishment executed wished yet let v troubled offended let v quietly wayt till couenient time come god knoweth see effect iob intended howbeit intermedleth also teptations faithfull may haue inasmuch god maketh delay seemeth ouer w cannot must need conceiue greefe weerynesse yet must resistit nowe let v see maner iob speaketh vvheefore saith wicked liue wherefore become old wherfore increase rich shuld say among al desire men think cheef happiest helth secondly haue long life thirdly haue abundance goodes thing wherein men willingly place felicitie found wicked cattell prospereth offprings continueth thing fall would haue whe haue led ioyfull life go graue turning hande say linger pain godly droope life long full disease pulled many misery wicked liue ease ende god taketh world without great greefe reason whereof seemeth worst sort fauored god cace shoulde thin god intendeth execute none punishment vpon wicked see execute first sight although haue effect iob sayth yet shall bee good better inlightning whole vnderstande zophars errour true sentence wee haue heard former chapter good true haue sayd misapplied bicause zophar ment conclude wee see man sore afflicted ought say hee enimie god see man liue ease wee may knowe thereby god fauour god loueth must go work verie deede errour sadduceis although sadduceis thought soule man bee immortall men liued worlde brute beast neyther heauenly life resurrection although say brutish yet thinke god men ought yeeld themselues seruing walke vprightnesse good conscience god regardeth lead holy life ayde succour shewe goodnesse also hee punisheth wicked geere hang togither seeing commonly feare god haue verie euill life world sadduceis say god recompenceth seruants worlde likewise punish despise imagination men shoulde haue hope time come good euill euerie man shoulde receiue bee god well ill dealing life resist imagination represse pernicious errour lorde set purpose doth alwayes punish wicked intent shoulde knowe another principall iudgement yet seene againe god doth alwayes shew signes loue beareth child hee leaueth vp spoyle wide worlde bee martired assayled yet haue succoure hande end might know better excellent welfare laid vp v heauen see lord summoneth v latter day looke howe oft wicked punished haue deserued spared good afflicted much beare seeme bee hearde though call vpon god cannot bee perceyued god hath pitie vpon rather seemeth turne backe haue shaken bee minded deliuer miserie vnder faint often doth trumpet sounde eares nowe wee see beastlinesse sadduceis thinke men wholly mortall heauenly life good hope euill wee feare onely world yet hardned grosse beastly opinion zophar companion sort wrapped like conceyt beholde say god iudge worlde therefore men bee beaten roddes followeth hateth vtter castawayes conclusion fond naught vvhy proceedes diuelishe errour mennes soules mortall neither resurrection kingdome god contrarywise twoo thing may verie well agree wit god iudge world yet neuerthelesse may cursed heere life subiect many misery whereas wicked shall liue merily prosper tryumph haue whatsoeuer wish two thing say repugnant god iudging world appoyntment hee shoulde faine execute iudgementes toy taketh v head god iudge world yet notwithstanding may well dissemble whe men become froward offende measure shall neede make countenance punishing haue sayd afore hee reserueth iudgement till another time bounde shewe himselfe iudge day morrow neither like men lose occasion dooing business vvhen haue thing hande matter easie mee compasse take oportunitie slippeth away mee woulde afterwarde shall come tyme thereby god purposeth stirre v vp diligent enter hee openeth v gate go hee sheweth v way himselfe must subiect state say worke hande oportunitie scape alwayes recouer tyme houre meane owne pleasure let v marke wee must conclude god must punish wicked life although hee bee iudge worlde may conclude doth part god iudge world therefore followeth seeth misdeedes done noteth olleth hath care good walke feare seruice trust call vpon succour verie deede faythfull perceyue god neere watcheth safegarde know experience bicause addeth meanes wicked also doo spyte theyr teeth feele hand persecuteth therefore sayd god iudgements alwayes apparant punisheth euerie man heere measure desert god giueth signes whereby knowne thing must come account men must passe hande also giueth token shewe neuer forgetteth hee hath vnder protection safe keeping behold pray wee haue conclude holy scripture telleth v world gouerned god prouidence al thing must ordered haue declared alreadie woulde haue lorde shewe v fully perfectly nowe iudge men shoulde bee reserued last day whole hope vvhen holy scripture incorageth exhorteth faythfull liue well holily sayeth freends lift vp hart latter day impossible v sticke vnto god firmly stedfastly without swaruing anye time except wee ouerleape thing heere beneath mount vp mind anker hold fastened wholly must thus wee see iob incountered heere agaynst false cursed opinion sadduceis thought god executed iudgements transitorie life ment shewe wicked maye well prosper haue thing woulde wishe yet wee muste bee quiet though thing gouerned fortune nothing disorder heere lowe behoueth v gather wittes togyther vntill lorde shewe hidden long thing confouded good order wee would desire ye see god doeth alwayes shewe countenance yet meane behoueth v see cleerelier naturall sens example fowle weather see sunne yet vnwise wee knowe well ynough sunne shyneth still abone cloudsif man aske little child sunne quite gone would say hee farre learned knowe light wee haue commeth sunne whatsoeuer let betwixt v wee knowe experience sunne keepeth ordinarie course hee vp notwithstanding cloudes take away sight v ceasse say sunne shyneth weather faire calme see hidden also lorde sendeth trouble intoo worlde wee see iniquitie runne abrode vnbrideled ouerflowing thing waterflud perceyue god minded withstand rather seemeth let thing go hauocke good men borne downe god maketh countenance succour although sigh grone say see behoueth v haue higher reach owne motherwit fully resolued god yet still assist v also forasmuch see suffereth world vtterly ouerwhelmed holdeth still secret brydle restreyneth wicked thing passe bloudshed murther let v assure selues god reigneth still although darke maner againe see good ayded deliuered hand yet doth mainteyn preserue without perish first brunt although bee tormented aff ctions yet sayde god hath quite turned backe vpon regardeth contrarywise euen mids darke thicke cloudes alwayes maketh feele neere hand rescue neede therefore behoueth v bee alwayes persuaded god guideth ste yea euen secrete maner thus nowe onely haue iobs meening also see vse ende ought applie wordes gather good lesson cannot greeue v see thing farre square worlde bee tender weake hearted may againe alwayes incline euil side diuell prouoketh v distrust see lord represse wicked correct haue done amisse contrarywise giue releefe good surely may well greeue v may shall conceyue sorrowe hartburning demaunde god hee dissembleth seeme asleepe yet must hastie boyle sort lord knoweth well ynough execute iudgements v set schoole nowe time neuer v set appointment againe say haue wayted long let v assure selues looke feete yet another life passage wherein bee nowe nothing vvhen men haue liued neuer long length come end way small race comparison time endlesse life euerlasting shall haue considered men onely created certaine time circuite make also god calleth thinke god slow although first dashe execute punishment vpon wicked desired haue shewed alredie wil sone recouer occasion thought haue beene lost lo howe wee ought warre agaynst lewde fancy come way thing bee brought order would well wish therefore let v learne knowe although seeming god worke yet tymes finishe worke listeth let v tary quiet end falling shewe sleepe though wee perceyued hee regarded thing heere bylow thus ye see ought practize lesson iobs whereas say one side god gouerne world redresseth number euils committed deliuereth hee seeth tormented extremitie vve haue answere exercise fayth pacientnesse child assureth wicked vnbeleeuers vnto gentlenesse howbeit make vnexcusable turning goodnesse occasion hardening inhaunceth damnation much againe bee tyme tempted wishe god make haste must beware set taske true may well mourne say lord long yet must desire request ruled pacience must subiect god caces suffer dispoze whole according owne vve may wishe yet wish wee must thinke make god subiect lustes rather thereby giue tryall obedience howsoeuer woorke thing otherwise wee woulde imagin beholde true practizing lesson iobs howbeeit aboue thing let v alwayes indeuer stablished hope last iudgement lo ought proceed acknowlegg god rightuous according office gouerne worlde vvhen haue lerned two point good foundation build vpon god office gouerne world must imagin ydoll acknowledge god incomprehensible say god hath maiestie yet meane rob peculiar canot separated make idoll dead thing good sooth gouern creature thing vnder dominion thing ordered power wisedome pray rending peeces defacing maiestie yes surely must bee alwayes fully resolued point god gouerneth al thing directed guiding prouidence must adde yet rightuous hee gouerneth disordered fashion vnaduysedly neither reigning shew absolute power tirants get themselues estimatio take libertie wrongfully crookedly whatsoeuer themselues list god power rightly ruled rightuousnesse haue twoo poynts must thence forth stablished hope resurrection trouble worlde vve see wicked liue growe olde wee see leade dayes mirth make greate good cheere see thing happen would wish child cattell household seeme god dandleth armes therfore must conclude another iudgement let v cheere vp selues hope comming lorde iesus christ vve see good men vexed troubled yet heires worlde inheriting sometymes haue bit bread eate lurched cal vpon god deliuered therefore wee must thinke god holdeth backe shewing loue hee beareth towardes wil yet poynts performe grace hath promised end meanes thereof might bee moued seeke heauenly inheritance promised alwayes laboring traueling thitherward wheras owne nature inclined stumbling starting way wee see thing misordered let serue stablishe v let bee stroke spurre pricke v forward wee may drawe still sayd heauenly life say well lord see wicked haue full scope heere yet must wee enuie theri prosperitie thy curse wayteth fall horribly vpon therefore much better v bee miserable thou keepe v mercifully meane time bee wrapped confusion readie triumph yea go lord thou hast promised bee father v wee call vpon thee yet see thy helpe first push wherby see well lorde place wee must rest heauen heauen place thou callest v vnto let v regard present life nother let greeue v bee tossed many waues whirle wind sith meane lord forceth v come vp vnto though spurred v ye see principall vse wee ought put text vnto iob farre heere ouershooting hath handled cheefe article fayth shewing v wee must fight agaynst god prouidence sheweth selfe first dashe follow fashion sadducies appointing full perfectnesse god woorkes bylow contrarywise alwayes haue eye last resurrection bicause time wherin al thing shall bee set state whatsoeuer confuzed shal put due order furthermore bee preuented temptation let v lose courage let v returne conclusion iob maketh heere haue sayde alreadie wee feele much experience weake bee faynt hand haue temptation pincheth v therfore thing go crookedly ouerthwartly bee oppressed wicked haue full scope verely greeue v shall conceyue bitternesse hart make v enter intoo disputation iob doeth heere shall wee surely fall intoo disputing cannot bee wee shall bee troubled first sight saye meeneth geere intendeth god doo wee must abyde therefore wee haue disputed asked geere meeneth let v come holy scripture sheweth v god kept vnchaungeable order nothing might bee square paradise bee fayth hope shoulde haue howbeit forsomuch lord mindeth traine v hee leaueth thing doutfull balance may say intent shoulde haue eye resurrection vvherfore let v discoraged although nature greatly inclined many euil temptation let v lerne resist let conclusion bee iob maketh heere say although haue bin shaken first brunt yet neuerthelesse may conclude god rightuous doings although delay iudgements yet hee forgoeth occasion executing listeth forbearing wicked tarying till turne fully come thus ye see haue mark sentence iob hauing alreadie spoken prosperitie wicked sayth expressely run sound taber flute daunce sounde organ leade dayes mirth glad sse go downe graue twinckling eye iob meeneth expresse somewhat hee done afore saying wicked liue grow old thing fall woulde wish namely also part take benefite tyme besotte themselues good thing god sendeth two diuers thing haue health sping cattell great possession rich honour take pleasure set one whole felicitie vvhy abraham rich healthie strong bodie iacob reporteth well sayth owne dayes vnhappie comparison dayes father ye see abraham strong good lyking also promised die good lustie old age satisfied liuing bylow riche although inheritance possession yet great housholde much cattell scripture sheweth meane besotted bleared rich wayfarer world knew god called thing grou ded himselfe vpon owne strength like royst play looce colt god giueth lustinesse health bodie alwayes man well tamed god ceassing humble example may v verie good seruice worldling looke earth haue rich bodily health become drunken forget themselues regard god like see one table stayed man well soberly take repaste without misbehauing another glut til burst specially store wine wee see labour nothing much play verie beast seemeth themselues throte wide ynough gulze wine streyne themselues vpon racke fill paunch better euen men may haue great prosperitie yet burst excesse alwayes hold themselues feare awe wicked iob sayth abuse god benefit gift hee doth lay brydle neckes fling ouer feeld think subiection insomuch friske sound taber flute none talk dauncing making good cheere wherat play brute beast altogither iob met vtter setece wheras hee maketh v description despyzers god shewing v picture end learne retyre brutishnesse therefore god giueth v abundance welth let v lerne sotte selues walke continually feare holding selues awe beeing watchfull paule sayeth wee bee child darknesse god hath inlightnened v worde haue v walk high none day thus ye see haue marke streyne againe god sendeth v case pleasure let v vnderstande cutteth v morselles bicause hee seeth bee able diet selues man giue childe eate hee knowes meete hee shall cough mee foole euen doeth god deale v hath hand alwayes reached doo v good niggard expense though afrayde want himselfe hee seeth lust disordered rule measure handleth v hee himselfe see best v giuing v conuenient portion let v knowe haue wherewith make great cheere wherewith feede pleasure god dooing cut v pittace knoweth stomack brooke abundance would marre v thus ye see haue marke seconde part sentence said wicked run sounde taber flute neuerthelesse wee see noueltie child world exceede measure vanity god condemneth dauncing like loocenesse hath bin time diuell whose drift tend blind men draw regarding god spirituall life hath knackes time time men haue willingly folowed haue liked pleased flesh therfore whereas dayes see many men seeke nothing royst insomuch haue none countenance seeking hop daunce like stray beastes doo like thing let v vnderstande late beginning diuell hath reigned time howbeeit let v knowe also euill neuer bee excuzed auncientnesse men haue alwayes done yea bycause diuell hath alwayes reigned must god therfore quite dispossessed furthermore shall bee declared fully morrow god leaue true flute taber like thing condemned simply owne nature onely respect men abusing commonly peruert good vse certainly taber doth sooner sounde make men merrie alwayes lightly vanitie say superfluous beastly behold men caried away cannot sport themselues moderate mirth sling themselues ayre though would leape themselues thus iob ment note heere cursed mirth mirth god condemneth vvhereby ought take warning restreyne selues whereas see many whose whole delight seeke pastime let v say mischeefe haue curse light vpon selues let v learne absent selues looce wanton pastime let v rather aduisedly restreyn selues set god alwayes eye end hee may blisse mirth vse benefit may neuer cease trauel vp heauenward thus ye see behoueth v apply mirth ende namely may melodie sounding v whereby name god may blissed glorified lorde iesus christ nowe let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement fault praying make v feele wee may hartily sorie returning vnto desyre mortifie whole nature ruling thought affection rightuousnesse making v newe creature ende may passe world may hindered stumbling block bylettes cumbered thrust way misery wee haue indure heere aduersities god sendeth tempted prosperitie wicked wee may fight stoutly agaynst temptation euen till hee gather v intoo heauenly rest make v inioy inheritance hee hath promised v whereof yet destitute time fayth hope might exercised may please graunt grace onely v also people c lxxx sermon third vpon xxj chapter sermon conteyneth rest declaration xij verse forth text followeth spende dayes vvelth sodenly go dovvne graue yet say vnto god depart v vve desire knovv thy vvayes vvho almightie vve shoulde serue vvhat shall profit v pray vnto yesterday declared iob speaketh abuse benefit god bestoweth vpon mortall life caried away pleasure drunken therwith hereby ought take warning reioyce bee alwayes measure v bridle selues thing ought moste put v rememberance god receyuing benefites hee bestoweth vpon v thing ought drawe v vnto make v loue contrarywise see reioyce without measure order forget god glad thinke neyther subiect vnto let v follow modestie meane haue spoken learne moderate pleasure wee bee caryed away worlde also bicause heere mention made flute taboret harpe instrumentes musike let v note thing owne nature good ought v bee put euill vse musike selfe cannot bee condemned forasmuch worlde doth almost alway abuse ought much circumspect place warneth v thereof vvee see day whiche vse musike doo swell poyson agaynste god become hardharted wil haue song yea manner song full villanie ribauldrie afterward fall dauncing whiche cheefest mischeefe alway vnchaste behauiour dauncing selfe abuse speake truth one worde nothing else enticement whoredome without cause iob inteding declare child worlde despizers god doo passe measure reioycings speaketh sounde taboret flute instrumentes musike haue already touched hee dooth condemne thing though euill owne nature considereth abuse therin committed men doo neuer well keepe measure vse musike modestly vice heere noted end may thinke may take profit thereby breefe let v long liste excuse vanity committed musike yet doo see spirit god condemneth bicause men delight much sette delight pleasure base earthly thing thinke whit vpon god nother ascribe whole vnto summe haue note place legth sayd god wil suffer despizers maiestie go theyr graue minute houre haue spet whole lyfe greate ioye pleasure thing also well noted threescore thirteenth psalme although vseth another similitude wicked go death without impeachement hinderance haue nother band cord thereby prophet ment shew child god world doo nothing pine away hang wing sicknesse disease suche like thing bandes draw v vnto death pull v backe agayne one side wee sicke see death threatneth v therby taught howe frayle thing life yea messenger whiche god sendeth say vnto v prepare selues haue nothing certayne sure worlde bandes death draw v vnto againe go pyning cannot dye yea man woulde thinke sometyme wee liue halfe yeare ende moste yet wee go foorth meane season disease continueth still v wee see child god wicked spende theyr tyme myrth ioye yea lustie full courage come death seemeth euen woulde wishe laye downe sleepe seeme strange let v keepe reme brance hath bin alredy declared wit howe iob ment shewe although god punishe trespass heere world yet must thinke sleepe hee hath giuen ouer office bicause deferreth giue iudgement vntill present life paste yee see muste lifte vp mindes aboue frayle life knowing man hath worlde gotten would desire yet ceasseth miserable nother must therfore attribute felicitic vnto bycause muste come iudge therefore let v tempted become like vnto despise god giue themselues sport play become dru ken pleasure let v rather desire miserable taste god goodnesse bee contented therewith knowing cheefest felicitie hee loue v merciful vnto v learne looke vnto heauenly heritage whereof faithfull admonished place noweheerevppon iob sheweth wicked vtterly reiect god say vnto departe v wee desire knowe thy wayes truth wicked spew suche blasphemie renounce god effect doo well declare howe passe little desire nothing else rid subiection although cannot bring passe yet labour go farre see proofe thereof men liue without remorse conscience willingly wittingly become brute beastes make difference betweene good euyll thinke thing lawfull muche say vnto god depart v god bee neere v muste haue eye iudge nother muste wee thinke say thing presence nother must accept thing though would iudged would haue libertie liue liste one woulde driue god farre haue none acquaintance verely nexte woordes namely wee none thy wayes declare thing haue vnderstand neere vnto god go farre referred maiestie god diuine beeyng sheweth selfe visible vnto creature true may wel haue vnderstanding wee may knowe beeing infinite spreadeth euery yet notwithstanding cheefe knowledge wee haue god vertues communicateth himselfe vnto v cheefely telleth v teacheth v maner one sheweth v ought walke howe life ought bee ruled behold neere vnto whe suffer selues taught word acknowledging hee whiche speaketh sheweth himselfe familiarly vnto v ende come vnto reste selues furthermore men yeelde themselues teachable refuze instruction desire stark doltes man bring good doctrine make accounte steade drawing neere vntoo god men withdrawe themselues therefore sayde iob declareth heere thing whiche intended afore witte muche wicked despyzers god loth submit themselues god wayes withdrawe themselues much therefore wee none wayes say say get thee away v text wherof may gather good profitable lesson firste shewed v roote foundation good life namely haue god eye true wee cannot eschewe behooueth v parte come neere vnto cause holye scripture intendeth signifie man hath led holy life sayeth hath god eye contrariwise sayeth man hath turned backe god sheweth regarded god mind one sayde man runne astray gyuen ouer euill finally paste recouerye manner speaking therefore notable thing vvhy wee bee inclined alreadie nature vnto vncleannesse howe wee get hard thing men alter themselues offer force violence theyr pleasure delightes man might knowe bee renewed say men say harde thing man wyll alwayes runne farre astray euill bee woonderfull power force make turne heade gyue ouer owne witte reson haue sayde afore men wyll continually go forewarde vntoo euill vntill bee reformed hee shall reforme cannot doo themselues nother creature bring passe therefore god muste fayne woorke way helpe god presence man may bee broughte say himselfe go behooueth mee walke god iudge meanes escape hande man haue consideration may hee fighte agaynste wicked lustes whereas bene gyuen euyll hee shall bee ready followe good agayne besides wicked affection cary v away wee bee blinded euerye v maketh himselfe beleeue euill good wee discerne vntill god inlighten v long walke one another like mouse chasse prouerbe sayeth say order amongs v euery man abuse neighbour like wretched beast goeth guideth way ill like pore blinde man like deceiue go wont go make custome law meanes shew v right way looke vnto god haue neere vnto v see two reasos wei declare vnto v thing necessary v let euery man present himselfe god lette v drawe neere vnto let v take heede wee estraunge selues onely bridle tame v subdue v good whereas otherwise shoulde take beastly libertie woulde draw v euill againe god giueth v wisedome discretion knoweth verye well good v necessarie staye v ende none v shoulde wander owne foolish fantasy follow god plaine whiche rule rightuousnesse equitie wee walke becommeth v let v beginne end say let v draw neere vnto god shall draw neere vnto first let v knowe nothing hid thing muste come accompt hee muste iudge euen thoughtes also thus much concerning first furthermore let v know god iudge v worde without cause named sharpe swoorde two edge muste examine moste secrete thoughtes maree within bone thing secrete shall examined worde therfore wee knowe bee meanes make v draw nere vnto god may alwayes haue eye attempte nothing vnder obedience following whiche heere conteyned whereas whiche like bee ignorant wayes god shut eye light thrust god much possibly let v seeke knowe hereby taught howe ought esteeme worde god cheefest felicitie god draw neere vnto v vnto shall done meanes done hee parte commeth downe v deliuereth worde vnto v doeth testifie vnto v hee dwell amongst v receiue worde much receiued god homage ende hee might raigne ouer v forasmuch god present v meanes worde see greater misfortune happe vnto v tha god suffreth v wader fatasies without guiding whe haue doctrine saluatio draweth v vnto contrariwise greatest inestimable treasure haue god gouer neth v taught wil haue certaine testimony receiue v vnto people world knoweth therfore much place wel noted v furthermore let v knowe stubborne cannot bow neck vnder god yoake much thrust farre truth thinke themselues greatly iniured men call mortall enimies god say seeke nothing else thrust authoritie myghte easilye treade vnder foote oh say meane thing yea make holy ghostea lyar hath playnely taught whiche submit themselues doctrine saluation fight god vttermost power would banish world cannot abide raigne enioy authoritie see holy ghost sayeth forasmuch cace standeth guiltie suche sacrilege let v learne humble selues whensoeuer god sendeth woorde amongst v let v tremble thereby declare seeke nothing else preset god alwayes beholde walke know wel must make accompt whole life escape hand moreouer let v long presence god ynoughe haue eye vpon god must desire alwaies sight vnder guiding sometime wicked haue eye vnto god shalbe galey slaues doo fall rowing see themselues faste chayned surelye beaten must needes force constraint wicked god speaketh knowe present lay would destroy godheade would also thrust god kingdome el would flee holie scripture reporteth shall say vnto mountaines couer v see wicked doo alwayes flee presence god bycause terrible vnto nowe behalf haue sayde must onely knowe neere vnto v muste desire alwayes presence knowing state condition miserable god doth behold v vvhether go destruction whe god safegarde wee thinke saue oure selues assurace guide let v learne pray vnto god neuer depart v whatsoeuer happen may let v pray make v feele taste infinite goodnesse inlightening v worde wee may knowe hee iudge whole world wee muste render accompt doings haue saide also thoughtes truth cannot drawen vnto good willes vvhat must muste acknowledge bee father dede sheweth himselse vvhe know good pitifull certaine seeke boldely come neere vnto become thither wil desire nothing el cotinue eue end meanes world swarue thus much haue note place namely haue god eye also shoulde desire looke vpon v guide v iob hath shewed forth blasphemie wicked despizers god hee addeth moreouer say almightie serue profit shall wee get praying vnto iob setteth pride faithlesse wicked men place worthy noted holy scripture sheweth principal vice wicked pride contrariwise humilitie chiefest vertue faithful haue humilitie besides thereby wee learne displeased selues yea wholly codemne selues spoile selues opinio vertue come vnto god seeke whole felicitie besides say shall knowe behoueth v subiects vnto hath rule ouer v see humilitie mother roote vertues contrarie parte pride beareth rule men must need whole life frowad wicked nowe pryde heere attributed faythlesse first conceiue maruelously themselues truste owne wisedome wee see neuer come end bicause puffed vp presumptio wise yea despite god thinke shoulde abace themselues much shoulde forsake owne iudgement harken set forth vnto name god farther haue confidence wisedom giue themselues bridle theyr delight pleasure reproued therfore thinke greatly iniured ye see faythlesse alwaies drowned prefumptio cause prophet habacuk fetteth hautinesse faith signifiying therby faith alwaies leadeth men true humilitie obedience contrariwise faythlesse man must needes alwaies exalt lift vp himselfe god impossible otherwise therfore without cause iob heere speaking wicked armeth pride think submit theselues god say almightie wee shoulde serue truth vtter word mouthe except god discouer sometimes happeneth hypocrite spew horrible thing cause therof god constraineth would gladly hide themselues end filthinesse might knowen worlde god suffer according said knowe god glorifie god deliuered vnto reprobate minde gyuen wickednesse get themselues euill name owne follie god sometime suffer wicked speake sayde although holde theyr peace make goodly protestation serue god yet heart beare spite god wish hee none authoritie ouer saying themselues almightie wee shoulde serue example worste men bee chosen say firste one god meere honored v yea generall termes deede confesse much whe come clozing say man goeth rule sayeth vnto hath god declared wil vnto v sorte haue v walke shall see heare side man woulde pull couetous person couetousnesse reprooue ambitious man vice whoremonger drunkard blasphemer theyr faultes kycke agaynst god woulde fayne haue full libertie doo euill although doe vtter wordes mouth almightie yet swell like toades yeelde themselues subiect vnto god see iob accuseth onely open mouth haue vttered blasphemie whereof hee speaketh also swollen theselues say filled arrogancie humbly submit themselues god acknowledge meete hee shoulde haue soueraintie ouer short condemned men wee muste compare god selues forasmuche creatour wee must acknowledge hee ought haue whole dominion thing ought subiect vnto thus much item seeing hath redeemed v deathe passion onely begotten sonne hee hath well deserued haue souerayntie ouer v nowe hee hath purchased v dearly must addicted selues wholly dedicated seruice furthermore muche father wee muste bee child cause also hee sayeth prophete
