malachie bee lorde feare father loue honor owe vnto mee god declareth truely subiects vntill wee acknowledge right hee hath ouer v gyue title dignity hee mayster lord must giue reuerence seeing acknowledge bee father meete shoulde honour yea true loue childe wicked monster euery man abhorreth detesteth wyll honour father whiche certaine vnlesse hee loue see muste looke vnto god wee bee come selues ala poore creature wee bee man whereof hee may glorie nothing cursednesse yet hath god honored v hee hath created v owne image likenesse although image blotted v sinne adam wee bring nothing mother wombe curse yet god created v owne image one great excellent honor beside hee hath vouchsafed redeeme v bloude onely begotten sonne iesus christ whome hee woulde spare moreouer hath called v housholde seruice owne child heyres vvhen wee shall haue made comparison hart yron steele pray softened yf swell arrogancie burst withall ought poyson purged true humilitie come obedience god cause hee intendeth make v willing obey commaundementes acknowledge auctoritie hath ouer v hee vseth preface lawe eternall thy god vvhen sayeth eternall bringeth v backe creation shewe v haue fashioned sayeth nothing haue created worlde parte thereof muste holde beeing mee homage know mee creator tremble vnder mee nowe hath thus spoken hee sayeth farther thy god shew father people instruct worde fatherhoode ought haue sayde bring v louing reuerence thirdly hee rehearseth benefites made people bounden vnto vvell nowe greater excellent benefites bestowed vpon v hath drawen v earthly bondage depth hell moyses lorde iesus christ seeing see wee meanes bounden vnto therefore meete henceforth shoulde addicted selues euery bee readie wholly dedicate himselfe seruice god concerning iob addeth moreouer certaine wee knowe taught v holye scripture say profite praying vnto lorde might well say vnto v serue mee commaunde without setting forth vnto v hyre reward bounden vnto taught haue done shall bee commaunded yet vnprofitable seruants say god shall neuer bee dette bounden giue selues wholly vnto god mighte simplie comaunde without adding promisse yet doth apply himselfe vnto v seing wee coulde bee brought serue vnlesse hee made v promisse sayeth serue addeth bee father bee defender life ayde necessity beside content promise deede auayle v vnlesse went farther thing hee doth hee sayeth forgiue sinnes receyue mercie wil blot iniquity afterward vphold although frayle serue mee altogither ought doo yet wyll take well woorth halfe seruice doo mee youre father straightly examine doings thus many promise doth god make v bind v vnto hereby seene wee haue none excuse say profite serue god though wee flee yet wee bee without mayster walke randon say bridle let loose spite teethe shall serue shall bee owne lustes diuell heathen men coulde say moste miserable seruice straightest bondage amongst men bee subiecte owne vice lothus haue heathen men themselues spoken diuelishe mistress lustes shame v beeing taught woorde god halfe king haue suche vnbrideled libertie nothing vnruly euen list certaine haue sayde wee coulde miserable cursed bondage beside diuel hath whole rule ouer v wee escape subiection wee bee exempted rightuousnesse paule meaneth hee sayeth romanes freed onely rightuousnesse hee vseth similitude bondman time paste franchysed might bee subiect maisters bee franke free state condition sayeth men iesus christ freed libertie doo euill subiecte rightuousnesse god therefore true libertie nay cleane contrary sayth serued sinne while tooke hold vppon rightuousnesse god cace directeth talke faithfull sayeth ashamed thinke vpon life passed know diuell rule ouer youre ruine destruction ashamed selues call remembrance forsaken god wandred lyke brute beastes state condition exempt themselues seruice god contrarie part serue god certaine seruice honorable tha enioy kingdome heere hath bene declared god doth call v ende bee state condition seruants take v owne child seeing wee see well loste labour gyue selues seruice god neyther must wee alledge say profit shall get thereby seeing lorde maister doth tell v al oure blissednesse walke feare contrariwise greater misfortune happe vnto v exempt oure selues seruice thus much haue note furthermore lette v extende farther iob also doth meaneth wicked prosperitie gyue themselues sporte play thinke one liue well ill making mocke god thinke fauoreth firste stroke hee throwe downe howe vvhen god spareth wicked passe theyr bound wicked doings therevpon become harde harted thinke goeth well doo perceyue god plague beginne despise rebell sayth salomon see wicked thinke profit seruing god much better gyue themselues euill god first doth execute iudgements contrary part must thus conclude selues prophet esay speaketh say yee surely shall go well rightuous therefore wee see confusion thing worlde seemeth vnto v mockerie serue god yet muste still continue sure perswasion lorde mayster disappoynte wayte vppon haue bene led vayne hope looking reward hand may say dauid lorde reward also sayeth vnto abraham abraham walke mee thine exceeding greate rewarde thus must fight temptation comon namely men beginne mistrust promisse god see wicked prosper poore faithful afflicted tormeted euery side vvell yet worde note iob hath spoken seruice god seconde place setteth prayer say reuerence men vnto god humbling themselues vnder making request vnto without cause iob vse worde truth god honored serued v charitie brotherly loue temperace humilitie like thing hee haue v loue one seeke releeue neighbour euery man submit himselfe commaunded calling requireth liue togither euery man apply labour without deceyuing seruice god acceptable sacrifizes vnto yet serue god well must begin end namely honor giuing prayse due vnto done supplication prayer example man walke without euill cannot bee accused hath deceyued man hee hath bene cruell hee hath troubled neyghbour bee conuinced either whoredome drunkenesse short hath absteined notable vice sight men yet haue nother religion fayth harte hath quite forsaken god shall life accepted god nothing vanitie nothing filthinesse god haue giuen vnto men apperteyneth vnto deceyue god robbe preheminence authoritie shoulde god haue greater priuiledge without comparison al creature without cause iob minding shew true seruice god putteth downe speciall kinde seruice weete prayer come present oure selues prayer according holy scripture sheweth cheefe sacrifize god requireth v sayd fiftith psalme hath refused al ceremony wherwith hypocrite make shew seruing whe haue doone many goodly outwarde thing thinke god greately bounde heare vvhat god requireth v call vpon mee day thy neede heare thee shalt thou glorifie mee cheefe seruice therfore god requireth v wee call vpon knowing wee come vnto truth make v parttakers benefites gouerne v spirite shal neuer bereft grace cause iob minding shewe seruice god sayeth pray vnto thing excellet short wee learne hereby intende leade well disposed lyfe suche one god alloweth accepteth wee muste firste put trust knowing wee bee wretched creature wee haue recourse vnto goodnesse contrarywise wee stay selues vpon wee shall want nothing knoweth bee expedient saluation furthermore lette v take heede giue good example men wee bee cruell neyghbours rather indeuer helpe tymes caces bearing weake communicating thing wee haue vnto needie vvhen lyfe thus ruled true seruing god wee robbe god honour make pretence serue yet liue like cattes dogges among selues true mouthe wee shall make protestation wee serue god appeare deede mortall enimies nothing v rebelliousnesse wee nothing make warre agaynst lyfe long nowe lette v fall downe face good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v feele better wee haue heeretofore done ende wee may bee sorie therewithall seeke remedie beeing purged clenzed sinnes wee may seeke nothing else cleaue vnto rightuousnesse wee may let v alwaies looke vnto knowing well hee hath placed v world end alwaies go forward vnto yea sorte doubt hee hath fatherly care ouer v meane season let v desire instructed worde would alwaies lighten v outward workes also thought affection hart minde may wholly giuen ende holy name may bee glorified oure whole life may please graut grace v also people nation c lxxxj sermon fourth vpon xxj chapter prosperitie ovvne hande let intent vvicked farre mee hovv candle vvicked put destruction commeth vpon god deuideth line vvrath chaffe vvinde stubble vvhirlevvinde lorde hideth strength sonnes payeth shall see eye shall see destruction drinketh furie almightie vvhat pleasure leaueth house seeth dayes shortened haue shewed minde iob wit iudgements god worlde apparant eye man may thervpon certainely conclude according euery man liueth well ill punished receyueth god hande due wage rather transitorie life cofusion thing wicked liueth ease godly tormeted dayes life yet iob doth acknowledge god ceasseth rightuous iudge men stay vpo present estate thing true felicitie wicked enioy while god winketh faultes sparing vvee see briefe summe discourse iob maketh thing profitable first consider matter worlde harde thing perswade v god doth guyde thinketh best men vnder hande gouernance muste needes come accompt say enter head el tyme wee perceyue yet fully perswaded therein see howe hypocrite thinke deceyue god contrarie parte also suffer harme wee see thing well ordered god suffereth wicked passe theyr boundes seemeth mindeth punish begin doubt enter terrible thought saying vvhat god care worlde thing guyded see manner gouernment thus much one poynt agayne much wee carnall god worke according minde thinke shal neuer come time see iudgemets day thinke morowe late cannot haue suche pacience quietnesse selues say god knoweth conuenient time wil execute iudgements shall see good perteyneth vnto v appoynt day houre lyeth handes fleshly much muste wee remember lesson conteyned wit wee passe aboue worlde oure faith surmount thing heere beneath wee see wicked bee prosperitie good bee maruelously afflicted stay v hinder v make v faynte let v lifte vp selues fayth may know wel true god letteth loose bridle wicked man would thinke life happie contrariwise wee see good godly tormented payne anguish man would thinke god forsaken thought let v tarie leysure go forwarde thus must practise doctrine taught v iob haue seene wherefore hee thus reasoneth bycause freendes would make beleeue hee wicked man hee afflicted hande god grieuous temptation offensiue vvee muste arme selues heere set v ende god visite v handled roughly may oppressed confusion despayre get vpper hande v let v know god ceasseth loue v pitie v although shew himselfe rough time thus see second place must apply doctrine selues let v note thing particularly iob heere protesteth although wicked punished firste fault yet ought man therfore thinke happie hee knoweth theyr felicitie shall continue god shall make ende prosperitie sayeth hee owne hande hee shoulde say reason god dealeth euery man according desertes wee see cleane cotrary thinke wicked shal escape one whit better cheape bee lordes owne state say god holdeth bridle depriue pleasure thing whiche thinke make full perfect felicitie yea blinded themselues puffed vp pride thinke themselues halfe angel briefe recken themselues daunger vvell theyr prosperitie theyr owne hande say deceyue themselues vayne imagination dreame say lyfe happie therefore intent farre mee say bee blinded present felicitie see wicked made drunken vvee see iob ment declare woordes therfore may better profite doctrine lette v note see wicked preuayle god holdeth secrete bridle mouthes haue day shall taken morrow haue nothing theyr owne power well printed hart troubled thing whiche beholde eye bycause wee thinke whatsoeuer wee see day shoulde continue euer true wee graunt world goeth rounde thing chaunged euery minute houre nothing certaine nothing sure constant wee doo affirme playnely ynough mouth wee thinke harte day prosperitie heade incombred wee thinke wee make reckoning withoute hoste wee haue affliction wee say alwayes bee thus wee thinke wee shall neuer see ende tyme wee grieued prosperitie wicked wee imagine shall neuer come decaye stande feare taken feare thinke remedie man say vnto v let v abide paciently god shall prouide stay selues vpon god prouidence thus see howe present thing carie v away wee encombred wee haue stay oure mindes neyther call vppon god committe selues know prouide thing due tyme place muche diligentlye muste learne doctrine sayde prosperitie wicked theyr owne hande say men may bee prosperitie life hangeth threede wee haue seene whiche thinke haue haue way borowing moment shall taken let v know wee knowe god bestowe benefites vppon v concerning presente life let v acknowledge come yea bee ready bee spoyled clothed beholde lorde thou haste giuen mee wherewith lyue certayne sure thereof muste make mine account enioy euer long shall bee thy good wyll pleasure thus shall come passe faithfull possessing thing shall possessed paule sayeth perswade themselues thing euer know may become poore shall please god nothing shall bee straunge vnto shall happen also contrary parte god sende v pouertie let v thinke thus well lorde thou haste rich thy hande thou couldeste bestowe vpon v thou diddest see good meane season lette bee thy pleasure feede v thou seest neede vouchsafe helpe v suffer v afflicted beyonde measure also wee see wicked glorie welth nothing lette v knowe whiche thinke haue hande haue bicause lorde aboue wee muste keepe remembrance furthermore sayde let intent wicked farre v let v learne must darke fall sleepe thing present stande muche owne conceyte wealth aboundance angry god hee handle v owne minde vve muste become intent wicked god sendeth thing desire puffed vp pride man longer beare wyll acknowledge themselues bee mortall men exalte themselues aboue degree ascende highe ende muste needes fall breake necke man shall finde nothing arrogancie spiritual drunkennesse become beastly tyme man speake vnto deathe sicknesse pouertie thinke come neere man dooth greate iniurie say vnto man go aboute humble say vnto let v knowe howe weake frayle state condition wyll aunswere yea men bee counted number dealt withall thus wicked become proude prosperitie dealing shorte forget men creature perswade themselues subiecte correction god layeth vpon v world furthermore bee afflicted rage gnashe teethe bite nayle agaynste god man shall see fome mouth theyr rage cause haue yet learned submit themselues vnder hande god offer themselues vnto sacrifice ende may dedicated vnto bee dealte withall shall please knowe nothing meaneth god dealeth v fauourably wee muste bridle selues knowing declareth vnto v fatherly loue ende might draw v vnto come vnto true humilitie beco meth v saying well lorde seeing thou shewest thy selfe fauourable meete shoulde cleaue vnto thee placing felicitie co trariwise thou shalte afflicte mee shall saye well lorde thou doest waken mee least stay selfe become carelesse beneath putting trust confidence world earthly thing thou wilt humble mee tame mee ende much couragiously looke vnto thee myght atteyne vnto thy heauenly kingdome thus muste haue intentes seuered wicked say oure mindes may entagled worldly thing make v become brute beastes drunken shoulde thinke vpon god contrarywise wee muste contemne despize thing wherein wicked woont delight knowing although wee bee poore miserable yet oure state worse bicause haue good hope god wyll haue pitie compassion v sume haue note place iob addeth howe lampe wicked quenchea destruction come vpon howe hath god settled liues sorrowes confirmation hath bene already hearde woorde lampe iob setteth theyr prosperitie according holy scripture vseth maner speach namely co paring good worlde bryghtnesse affliction darkenesse hee sayeth lampe wicked shall quenched speaketh admiration bycause doone passeth man witte otherwise wee conceyue haue sayde haue eye bleared wee see farre god mindeth neither hath playnly spoken vvhen wee see wicked prosper wee thinke prosperitie shall neuer quenched wee cannot comprehende althoughe scripture speaketh although wee haue experience dayly wee see god throweth downe wicked exalted euen vp clowdes vvhen haue seene thinke neyther thinke thing euer come passe yet god hath shewed v poynted oute finger much man witte doth ascende high faste tyed thing present wee cannot conceyue god mindeth doo iob speaketh heere straunge thing sayeth hee lampe wicked quenched theyr destruction come vpon hee sayeth theyr destruction commeth vpon hee sheweth god entreateth wycked gentlye time wee muste fasten eye vpon earth reason whether god iudge whether wicked shall punished end must co sider may happen behalfe whereas drunken wealth wheras lifted vp pryde whereas thinke harme ca happen vnto creature appoynted serue nothing god shall sende theyr destruction aboue nowe whereas looke vp high ment looke according outwarde sense shall attayne vnto god greate distance faint way vvhat must let v behold god fayth let v lift vp inwarde sens aboue selues thus must wee iudge fall wicked say must consider much may happe vnto according world god able power god infinite power passeth capacitie serueth teach v thing seeme impossible must sticke coclude thus god worketh fashion hidde vnknowen vnto v euen sort shalbe costrayned woder heare done yea god shewe v subiect worldly meanes thing doth muste maruelous eye summe whiche wee muste remember sayde god theyr cordes wrath true cordes expounded sorrowes also may take naturall sense god wrath sette portion worde cordes sriptures taken portio bicause old time men woulde lay grounde aker say measure ground vsed line holy scripture applieth similitude order god prouidence euen lande measured set meeres boundes diuide possession ende euery man may haue hys right thing may cofused god prouidence doth bring order whiche confused much stretch line nowe sayd god stretch yea shall wrath teach v muche amazed thing come well passe first example thing shall seeme vnto v turned vpside downe worlde ther bridle cord wicked take pleasure cast themselues ouerthwart field good men trode vnder foote assaulted great crueltie extortion remedie appeareth euill waxeth worse worse god maketh thoughe hee turned backe iustice worlde mightiest carieth bell away short midst great stormes thing world turned vpside downe yet muste swallowed vp desperation let v tarie till god spreade cordes wrath although day hide cord doth set bouds insomuch thing brought good order yet hath alwaies cordes hand well declare knoweth howe spreade make partition doth firste bicause yet due time true neuer ceasseth iudge wicked firste shewe vengeance vpon soone put execution hee hath decreed himselfe also expedient v furthermore behoueth wicked made vnexcusable whiche thing brought passe god calleth repentance sayeth paule bearing muche bee blamed haue abused goodnesse pacience besides good men tormented haue wherwith hu ble themselues meete meanes faith exercised ende might pacientlie wayte helpe god knowing saluation hid much lyeth hope hereby god stirreth vp come vnto ende seeke inheritance without worlde see lord without cause deferreth iudgementes time alwayes conuenient execute wrath knoweth better summe haue learne verse sayde moreouer shal stubble winde vvhereby iob meeneth roote felicitie wherein wicked glory proude similitude muche vsed needeth bee expounded thing well knowne vnto v also stubble caried away wynde tempest iob protesteth heere felicitie wicked rooted whirlewinde god wrath commeth vpon shall vanish melt away quite cleane shall nothing left therewithall let v note sheweth howe wrath god shall come minute houre shal think said wicked shall bee taken suddenly shall say peace safetie behold sodaine destruction shal ouerwhelme shall throwes woman childe take hir sodeinly thinketh iob would expresse ende grieue v pine away god send thing wold wish deed cause wee bee impacient god suffereth thing go hauocke bicause think needeth long preparation would haue god shewe token working wee woulde haue sight long short haue god like mortall man though maruellously troubled taketh worke hande need seeke helpe ayde bring purpose passe thus wee would make god whole maiestie subiect state condition vvhat must wee doe let v knowe minute houre hee finish worke yea shall bee meanes thinges whit disposed thereto let v learne felicitie menne dreame specially thinke themselues happie become proude prosperitie fonde imagination sone vanisheth away bicause ther roote much better v bee miserable sight men meane season haue liuely roote god knowe wee shall neuer bee destitute strength ayde let v knowe cheefest felicitie sufficient v haue reste nothing respecte meane season althoughe seeme vntoo v wicked shall alwayes remayne state condition god hath established shall neuer bee moued also puffed vp pryde said psalme shall neuer harme come neare let v ceasse comprehend iudgement god declared say sodaine hee shall neede order thing long god aboue al common order nature worke fashion new strange v nowe iob addeth herewithall god punisheth wicked owne person also extendeth chastizements punishmentes euen vnto child wicked shall life time know nothing vanitie state yea nill perceyue stande vppon vnsure grounde god haue cast downe true cease pryde howe euer bee god vrgeth farre perceyue alwayes continue summe iob meant intreate heere haue note first speaketh child according common doctrine holie scripture say god blisseth onley faythfull themselues also continueth fauour vpon child thus see god beareth v loue content thinketh ynough haue care saluation giue v knoweth bee meete profitable v also hee embraceth child sheweth himselfe father likewise vve see howe goodnesse god described vntoo v holie scripture hath receyued v vnto testified vnto v vnder hand protection sheweth also fauoure vnto child sake seeing wee haue good cause repose selues wee must conclude sake hee continueth fauoure towardes succeede v strong reason wee shall alwayes finde mercyfull father ought mistrust goodnesse seeing fauorable haue care ouer also come v nowe contrarie part sayde god curseth race wicked howe destitute guyding holie ghost must go naught heerein haue none occasion murmure grudge againste god wil thinke strange vvhat say possible god punishe child father sake sayde hee sinneth shall beare owne iniquitie sonne shall punished father sake yes truely sorte sonne hathe cause complayne though rightuous god notwithstanding punishment due vnto father causeth fall vpon innocent guiltlesse happen sayde god requite iniquitie father bosome sonnes doth wrong leaueth wicked nowe wee forsaken god wee doe mischiefe thus see god sheweth suche fauour wicked giue holie spirite diuell must needes raigne ouer stirre vp prouoke wrathe god hasten destruction childre wrapped vp togither father house cursed god possession thraldom satan spirit god ruleth therfore child punished father iust iudgement vpon themselues also say giltlesse found faultie god well father contrarie parte child faythfull continue folowing step father blissing god appeereth menne haue wherefore glorie themselues child say heritage appertayneth vnto v god causeth v prosper bycause father worthie haue suche succession whole must bee attributed onely free goodnesse god worketh beeing bounden vntoo men neyther owing anye thing bycause pleaseth hym haue learne sayd although god punishe wicked first yet addresse himselfe child say hee reserue punishment prosecute matter wee must giue iudgement vpon prouidence god maye bee seene world must quiet mynds stay iudgement vntill god shewe time come becommeth v appoynt time men froward make suche haste see god hath peculiar fashion dooings whiche sometimes straunge vnto v yet must humble mind say lorde like well euer thou shalt although bee agreeing fantasie haue note vpon worde hide reserue sayd god reserueth child wicked punishment hath executed vpon father true enter intoo men head neyther common doctrine cause wherefore sayde must herevnto apply whole studie menne owne nature hastie impacient woulde haue god set eye mindeth neither giue place prouidence excepte hee make hande verie manifest contrarie part vpon condition wee placed worlde wee shoulde bee continuall combates knowing worlde wee must bee tossed turmoyled way waye let v exercise selues reseruations heere mencioned vvhen wee see wicked triumphe seemeth god hath giuen priuiledge aboue men well let v waite still heere mention made reseruing hyding vvee see yet meant therfore let v take heed iudge thing vnknowne might reproued rashnesse shall see shall please god open eye execute hee hath determined himselfe meane season also let v put doctrine vre taught v cocerning reseruation benefites god hath prepared faythfull sayd hidden repose trust god cofort selues hath promised v wee must ascende aboue worlde behold thing inuisible whosoeuer shal stay vpon manifest vnto renounceth fayth hope short shetteth vp gate saluaton himselfe furthermore haue alreadie touched iob shewed wicked shall well perceyue case nothing vanitie follie meaneth feele deede nother bee touched ambicion blinde men altogither dulheads certaine assone perceyued theselues miserable exalting selues would yeeld themselues obedient vnto god haue confidence world hapneth vnfaythfull exalt themselues day mad arrogancie presumption submit themselues equitie reason doe thinges despite god despising grace whence commeth rage bicause know prepared seeing see nothing al say although god shew many token wrath yet knowe nothing true deede punished haue within pricking torment much euer yet touched quicke might knowe destruction hande touched harme might happen vnto according iudgemet world deede great perplexitie say muste prouide danger whereinto might fall see howe case standeth wicked thing ought note well ynough v bee touched lightly puffe make v feele frayltie small matter god doth deede constrayne wicked farre yet neuer better wee see still obstinate euer befall vvhat must wee doe heare mention made vanitie world thing presente life let v knowe although men take great paynes aduance themselues yea bring enterprise passe yet al nothing bycause onely shall enioy rich haue heaped togither thought haue doone successours also shall bee cursed shall haue ioy vvee maye fret prosperitie wicked frail changeable cannot turn curse destruction thus must doctrin put vre againe god shall send v prosperitie plentie let v knowe also shall continue euer wee must still come poynte namely god draw v beyond world therefore let v consider vanity heere beneath may greeue v see ourselues certaine sure nothing heere desire rooted beneath wee shall renouce kingdome heauen whosoeuer knoweth life god shalbe reueled vnto v comming lord iesus christ shall greeue tossed world see nothing chopping chaunging thing certain sure therfore must long heauenly life god calleth biddeth v dayly worde yet meane season midst worldly trouble thing disordered se let v ignorant god guydeth gouerneth world prouidence nothing doone beneath without although reason thereof manifest vnto v first yet al dutie quiet tarie paciently vntill god shewe v experience end wicked shall cursed affliction good men shal turned saluatio howbeit whilest waite till god shewe v effect let v walk still vnder quietly let v behaue selues frowardly thing happeneth vnto v let v redy suffer affliction shal please lay vpon v send v prosperitie let meanes make v tast fatherly goodnesse draw v vnto let v fal face good god acknowledgement faultes desiring lighten v world giuing v knoweth bee good v also worde midst darknesse al affliction haue suffer may ceasse still feele goodnesse fauor follow way sheweth v may neuer turned therefrom thing happeneth vnto v meane season also eye blinded neyther prosperitie aduersitie thing soeuer bee wee may behold glasse hath giuen v say holie worde wee may bee always guided vnto transformed image vntill time haue clensed v sinnes haue vtterly abolished v commeth corrupt sinfull fleshe gather v fully himselfe may partaker glorie hath prepared v heauen may please c lxxxij sermon fift vpon xxj chapter vvho vvil take vpo teach god knovvledge vvho iudgeth highest thing man dieth full strength ease quietly breast teates full milke bone flovv vvith maree another dieth vvith great paine neuer eateth vvith pleasure laide dust vvormes shall couer ignorant thing hovv go vvrong say vvhere house prince vvhere also tent vvicked aske go vvay ye denie signes vvicked kept vnto day destruction shall brought forth day vvrath vvho shall shevve vvay face vvho shall tell againe vvhich hee hath doone shall brought graue shall layde tombe grauelly earth shall svveete vnto euerie man shall go number vvent infinite comfort vaine ansvveres nothing lye iob prosecuteth matter treated yesterday wit although seeme straunge oure fantasie god intreat men confusedly yet becommeth v reproue wage law iustice murmure though euill must humble ourselues maiestie knowing prouidence gouernment wisdome high profound comprehended v content therof shew saith one shal die distresse shal die ase say shall see day life shall nothing pine away great miserie length die beeing wery liue longer bicause life time nothing trouble torment fat perfect health yea riche wealthy iob meeneth similitude breast full milke bone full maree say beholde fat euerie way see diuersitie cause thereof vnknown vnto v would say howe happeneth prosper spende whole life pleasure ease liue continuall payne meeneth see manifest reason thereof truth god iudgements hath beene touched heere well knowne vnto v would open eye wee might well marke see cause god dealeth men alwayes god intendetd trie obedience holding eye closed know reason worke blinde behalfe giue glorie confesse iuste true although bee manifest vnto v good try fayth seruice wee yeelde vnto contrarie part wee bee sharpe witted suttle curious searching thing allowe god rightuous vnlesse shew v cause diuelishe pryde therein wee declare selues subiecte vnto god force shall please v let v note iob heere speaketh iudgements god yet hid v moste parte bee vvell must wee say case hee teache god knowledge say hee shewe god office hee teach lesson say must worke fashion shall bee ascende high come infinit heigth wherein god ala great distance lifte vp selues high god bring v downe well ynough shame confusion appertaineth vnto discusse high matter shall walke aboue angel heauen vvee must humilitie reuerence secret god incomprehensible iudgements shall mortall man dust ash take vpon searche knowe reason thereof must humble selues beholde iudgementes god shall seeme vnto v bee reasonable yet let v learne content brydeling imprisoning myndes least god bee disguysed v maiestie glory trafformed vve must acquaint selues say beholde thing conclude god doth according reason although seeme owne eye haue already sayde life god see whither confesse bee iust wise good although wee haue knowledge rightuousnesse goodnesse wisedome true hee sheweth v signes inough glorified v meane whyle leaue v ignoranthowe wherefore hee ministreth vnto v matter sufficient glorisie ye doth many thing wherein wee blinde men must vsurpe appertayneth vnto wit say well may iudge according see yea prayse thou owest vnto thy god thy maker wilte thou measure thyne owne capacitie thou arte nothing vvhat thy mynde vnderstanding costancie force whole glorie god enclosed coprised doest thou heerein take much vpon thee therfore see thing world turned vpside downe must let v knowe god disposeth thing meete knoweth reason whiche hid v last day buried shall made manifest must suspend iudgement till time truth may pray god make v perceiue wherefore hee doth afflicte v afflicted vvhen man payne findeth himselfe great anguish miserie may runne god say ala lorde thing seeme straunge vnto therefore might leese paciece assisted thy goodnesse euen wealth profite turne hurte confusion although perceyue cause wherefore thou punishest yet must know wealth neuerth elesse voutsafe let vnderstande ende thou doest afflict man ease must also bridle himselfe pray vnto god would suffer abuse benefite hee hath receyued say worthie men bee loued god dealeth sort see great number men verie miserable yet haue desire token god verie well pleased let pryde arrogancie enter head least tempted must pray vnto god make v vnderstande wherefore spareth v vvee may desire god hee would shewe v cause workes yea farre forth expedient v wee must also come humilitie taking vpon v make god subiecte iudgement say must disclose vnto v euerie poynt wherefore doth let v tarie paciently vntill declare vnto v knowe partly much atteine full knowledge god workes cause vntill transsormed image wee haue life gotten small taste goodnesse rightuousnesse wisedome suche pleaseth communicate vnto v holy word teacheth v hee knoweth bee expedient v time let v cotent ourselues vvhich thing done vntill haue renounced curiositie v deceiueable boldnesse whervnto much inclined gyuen let v kepe sensence well remembrance said teach god dutis wee great doctours teach god lesson controll men murmure prouidence god finde faulte muche would take hande teache god arrogancie creature whome nothing beastlynesse ignorance shoulde take vpon teache creator cursed monstruousnesse nature men doe highly exalte themselues gaynesay reply workes god true wee thinke firste yet murmuring replyes wee make misly king wee haue whiche god doth contrarie iudgement appetite many blasphemy tayle euil thought bee short euer content god prouidence yea humilitie confessing generally euer proceedeth good rightuous much lieth would pull god heauenly seate spoyle maiestie set himselfe roume place vvee make faire protestation meane thing thing selfe declareth otherwise short oft tickled curiositie ouer inquisitiue heauenly matter meane season haue boldnesse mixt withal rage god let v note must come coparison art thou god thy creator dost thou set thy selfe dispute workes thou fellow presumest thou hast thou thing thee wherfore thou shouldest enter deepe matter make thing subiecte thy iudgement vvhere art thou become wretched creature vvhen come comparison mustneedes worse mad pride wherewith puffed vp bee quite throwne downe iob ment heere teach saying hee teach ment heere teach saying hee teach god knowledge furthermore bicause men bold hardly brideled vnlesse holden violence would say bound chaines saith yet shall god iudge high matter hee say well men vsurpe doth appertain vnto pleade god shall get ende truely may alledge yet god shall bee diminished let men exalte selues muche possibly yet shall god alwayes remayne place spite teeth hee shall onely remayne safe sounde hee shall also sit aboue iudge hygh matter shall leape like frogges shall flye aboue cloudes although wee wing flye hygh yet angel farre glorious excellent yet angelles god fellowes equall contrariwise sayde hide face wing wee haue seene ezechiell vnder figure cherubins angelles although bee great maiestie nature neuerthelesse beholde brightnesse god constrayned hide selues glorie creator seing noble excellent creature astonished come neere vnto maiestie god shal comparison seeing god iudgeth high matter shall presume exalt selues vvell come farre whatsoeuer shall throw shall doe harme must returne owne confusion much cast stone ouer owne head must needes fall ageine vpon v yet shall able reach vnto god vvee might peraduenture strike blowe hee onside v seing aboue v yea highe able reach vnto lift vp selues much wee cast stone highe haue sayde must need fall againe vpon owne head ouerwhelme v happeneth make argumentes owne fantasie dispute god workes replie deede throwe stone must needes fall againe vpon themselues ment sayde shall dashe stone must needes bee brused broken yea ende stone shall fall vpon crouse quite ouerwhelme let v note also god iudgeth high matter soueraine aboue creature doth set specially highly esteeme themselues becommeth aboue degree sayth hee mortall enemie proud let v learne ther exalt theselues must need turne ruine written humble himselfe shall exalted contrariwise hee exalt himselfe must brought nothing peculiar office god doe thing sort let v note nothing better wise onely farre foorth pleaseth god instructe v let v knowe obey submit selues vntoo thing true wisdome thing come passe would wishe casily stirred vp enter disputation let v stay selues say yea god hath perfection nothing proceede good rightuous ought suffice v rule well fountaine thereof let v drawe boldly sheweth v reason workes let v giue thankes humilitie receyue whatsoeuer hee teacheth v hee hide v let v bee content bee ignorant farre foorth shall please knowing well hee reuealeth vnto v soeuer knoweth profitable v howsoeuer kepe v within certeine measure ende learne obey confesse hee iust although hee shewe v reason dooing summe haue learne place nowe shewe greatnesse temptation sayde afterwarde conered dust wormes eate deede see like ende happeneth although wee haue beene diuersly delte withall worlde might seeme god playeth iudge oure sayth muste surmount graues euer wee beholde eye oftentymes taught v fayth sight beholding thinges inuisible vve shall see good man shall haue serued god dayes life shall haue walked verie vprightly sincerely neuerthelesse hee shall bee continuall greefe paynes god shall ceasse sende hym may tormentes euen death whiche also hee must goe pyning long tyme others shall runne headlong euill shall dye ease haue sayde consusion thing ende come graue dust consume away woormes eate semeth toke paine serue god hath lost labor behold gathered one heape good bad well haue liued heere great mirth pleasure haue sound nothing sorrow trauell world vvhat shall say certaine shall amazed stay ourselues vpon may seen eye vvhat done vve mustascend higher knowe god reserueth vntoo himselfe iudgement appeereth presently yea truely faith beholdeth thing inuisible thing hid let v knowe although death like yet far diuers condition shal god shal declare time conuenient meane season dutie walke alwayes feare conclude seeing hee iudge worlde iniquitie shall remaine vnpunished haue taken paynes obey walke according rightuousnesse shal haue labored vaine disappoynted expectation thus must conclude go stil forward see also god ment declare vnto v mouth deceiuer although balaam endeuered ouerthrow truth turne lie yet god hilde racke forced say death rightuous wished let death saith hee like vnto death rightuous saith head hee would much lay haue brought naught atd vtterly abolished maiestie god yet seeing god maketh speake thus sent angel heauen god say authorize doctrine peculiar marke constrein inforce wicked man enemie truth speake wise wee haue learne wit must fasten eies vpon graue wee see brought vnto one heape difference betweene good bad betweene rich poore betweene haue liued ease haue alwayes bin sorrow paine true death thing turned vpsidedown god knoweth bring thing order perfect state said coming lord iesus christ shall appeere iudge world shall restoring thing iesus christ shall come restore world followeth world day frame thing therin order meane season let oure faith surmount thing let v paciently abide till god finish work finde remedie nowe iob addeth furthermore thought went confounde vnknown vnto way vsed wrong hee say see whereto yetend yee suborned satan bring men dispaire hold fast hope haue god although much oppressed possible man yet still continue calling vpon hath promised sauiour shal ouercome temptation thus doth iob arme defend al obiected friendes hee sawe well ynough tended end purpose bring dispaire nowe place conteineth profitable doctrine wee alwayes learne knowe subtilties satan goeth bring v dispaire bee armed haue wisdome take heed malice men see go hurt v seeke vtter ruine destruction must wee much sharpen wit spirites resist satan prince iniquitie thing ought knowe men goe v harme must stand vpon garde consider force strength enemy ca ouercome force must fall pollicie see man go beguile v wicked slight beware well inough sayth saint paule fighting flesh bloud say haue deale men nothing haue deale spirituall enemy principality behold satan vttereth force wee haue fight diuels ayre winde v inuiron v side haue firie dartes wherewith wee bee stricken downe incontinently wee well furnished armed poynts therefore standeth v hand watchfull cace aboue thing bee acquainted satan wyles according also sainte paule speaketh another place wee haue marke streine namely forasmuch iob fenced temptation put diuell stirred vp see men go leade v destruction must haue eye open espie slightes may prouide disappoynt haue aduisednesse respecte men let v much haue respect satan cheefe enemie whome haue cheefely resist may repulse practizes deuises whiche attempt v herevpon let v mark excuse taken v bee surprised temptation whereof euerie man ought take heed wee steppe awrye euerye v alledge meanes hee seduced man finally wee put thing vre shewed v father adam hee sayde woman thou gauestme hath deceyued yea lorde hath giuen v discretion ynough sobeit wee finde heartes watchefull bee wittingly rocked asleepe muste sathan needes snarle snare make wander well worthy yes seeme willing breake owne neckes haue sought pittes fall well ease find meanes start way many seeke stumbling blockes afterward say oh beholde one hath beguiled kepte watch god warneth v wee alwayes preserued daungers wherewith snared thus ye see wee haue marke vpon place immediatly iob sayth inquire go way denie signes streyne expounded diuers wayes take iourneyers wayfaring men allegoricall sense faythfull bycause bee pilgrimes worlde haue resting place muche streyned vnderstande iob ment saye heere freendes tooke wayfarer saye vnknowne man hee shoulde saye yee handle mee worse would doe wayfarer vnknowne man othersome take fashion let v holde v playne meening whiche iob meeneth saye heere friendes leastwyze bare name come vnto vnder pretence sounde vncorrupted iudgement would haue vsed slaunders saying yea aske wayfaring menne thing whereof yee haue hithertoo reasoned euerie one tell bycause yll mynded much theyr heades bee forepossessed cruell iudgemente speake truth thing behooueth v bee likewise moderated summe whiche hee ment saye nowe wee taught nothing contrarie reason truthe euill affection man shall haue nourished conceyued within hymselfe hee shall bee blynded therewyth hee shall bee able discerne anye lyght shall bee vntoo alwayes darkenesse maye helpe v muche wee applye oure vse behoueth v vvherefore vvee see howe euerie man letteth looce bridle affection vvhen iudge thing haue wee respect vnto reason bee guided surely affection rule v see nothing bycause wee occupied fantasie one caried away pryde hee turne whatsoeuer happen man aduertise hearken reason euer man shal vse vnto shal preuail nothing vvhe man hardned god equitie thinketh could get better estimation remayne stubborne ende againe poysoned hatred dispite wherevpon hee iudge rashly hauing power inquire whither thing bee forasmuch vice reigneth v doth preuail much ought note place sayd euen wayfaring men shall teach v say iudge thing first sight passing way shal better vpright iudges shall bee forepossessed euill affection hinder iudging aright according truth iob ment say place nowe addeth end coclude matter hath hand wicked reserued day destruction suche men shall bee trayned day wrath meane run headlong rash iudgement god punisheth sinnes men sone thinke good afflicteth good men holdeth vnder many tormentes trouble let v say yet wicked reserued day wee worde reserued yesterdaye handled well printed mynds would meane kepe v feare much caried away seeing trouble disorder life wee finde heart reserue thing vnto god think bring matter passe day morrow shall come time cause thing peruerted haue mind encumbered againe speake hastily vnaduisedly meane season giue place vnto faith knowe god rightuousnesse experience teacheth v mean exclude whole worde god say helpeth v beleue nothing therin conteined beleeue owne eye much separate selues god estrange v schoole scholers maruelled men become madde man good diuel possesseth carieth cleane away see many nowe adayes must maruell iust iudgement muche must wee marke doctrine sayde wicked reserued day destruction breef see wicked ease prosperitie triumph true chosen must tempted haue griefe inwardly thinke thus selues howe meeneth god ydle heauen seemeth asleepe careth thing beneath might indeede fantasy come oure heades wee must beate backe say well lorde thou teachest looke vpon worlde first sight would seeme vnto v thou asleepe yet clean contrarie much see another iudgement vpon wicked vnknowne vnto v must also know euerlasting rest godly god giueth v alreadie declaration rightuousnesse iudgement reserued thing shall bee reduced good order thus must wee take profite example eye therefore thing come passe wee woulde haue wicked triumphe god maketh countenance punishe contrariwise good tormented wee perceyue succoured holpen many iniuries violence committed meane season god putteth hand prouide let v run said vnto v wel another iudgement wicked reserued destruction asmuch wicked day spared let v note vengeance shal much horrible market nothing ameded condemnation augmented euery day time dearely bought haue mocked goodnesse god haue abused wisedome continued still euill yea hardened therein exercised malice good men child god faithfull ought reioyce midst sadnesse see wicked reserued day destruction true time wicked shal world paradise shall always life short frayle must needes come account shall bee cast teeth haue mocked god dispised maiestie shall become horrible vengeance shall bee prepared let v conceiue horror finall state condition wicked wee may stayed companying least spotted vice infection wrapped togither wrath god furthermore oppressed see godly men trouble anguish vvell let v knowe true life miserable sight make v go forwarde pricking spurre encourage v stirre v vp beholding heauenly life whylest wee labour come vnto wee might contemne despise thing wherin wicked wont delight place whole felicitie heere world nowe end iob sayth iudge face shall pay hath done seemeth first sight hee speaketh heere god spoken rather wicked neuerthelesse tendeth approue iustice god shewe wicked although haue escaped handes men shall fayle come heuenly iudge sum iob ment say although wicked haue passed life man durst set himselfe againste whylest liued seemed exalted vp cloudes yet shall fayle come graue true according man iudgement might alwayes bee alledged proofe temptation howe vve see equall iob heere concludeth enemy although sight men ende like yet iudgement god aboue men muste become brutishe stay themselues onely vpon graue vpon thing seene heere must know god shal restore thing gotes shall separated lambes god shall declare bee iudge whole worlde time yet come comparison iob maketh heere nowe againe hee repeateth sayde say man discerne betweene outwarde appeerance man glad grauelly ground bodie maye bee buryed therein one death laid togither graue beholde state condition mankynde said psalme bring graue body great little old yong go like flockes sheepe graue outward sight discerne iudgementes god wherefore saith iob thus bycause mindeth make confusion good profitable child god haue alredy declared armed long time teptations might happen vnto see ende godly wicked concerning outward appeerance like end themselues afflicted might call vpon god knowing state condition poore miserable world ioy prepared hope whereof may well diminishe mitigate heauinesse trouble might happen vnto world good know temptation may happen vnto true must herein hastie whe heare mention made deliuerance god send v aduersities wee begin replie yea shall must stay vpon fantasy must generally learne pacient thing least fall head long fleeing fantasy conceyue mindes thing god haue yet remaine vnknowne v let v leaue iudgement vntill reueale vnto v let v know perfectly doth thing cannot presently comprehende cause iob sheweth go graue brought thither ende gather thus well true death like wee put difference betweene godly wicked salomon sayeth booke preacher liuing dogge better dead lion death man like death dog inasmuch bodie man shall rot well carkasse beast vve see thing yet must stay let v beholde shewed v mirrour god worde wit greater iudgement god reserueth execute shall shewe himselfe bee iudge whole world thus behoueth v knowe temptation haue known must resist go forward let v folish say oh whosoeuer shall find prosperitie world let enioy deth hope contrariwise must say haue aduersitie world let v know better hope layd vp v whervnto god calleth v haue prosperitie world let v thanke let v put confidence prosperitie may taken v betwene morrow specially abuse thus say must wey thing present thinke selues iudge according man iudgement al shall done order ende fayth might preuaile v woorde god might guide v may candle shew v way midst darkenesse world vntill come heauenly brightnesse wher ther shal knowledge part perfection time shal behold god face face let v fall face god acknowledgement fault desiring make v haue better feeling wee may touched may displeased ende wee may inioy grace promised v name lorde iesus christe oure sinnes passed bee forgiuen v would please guide v holie spirit may alwayes aspire perfection heauenly rich calleth v rid imperfection infirmity man may clothed heauenly glorie hath bene purchased v bloud sauiour iesus christ may please c lxxxiij sermon first vpon xxij chapter eliphas themanite ansvvered sayde shall man profitable vnto god vvise man profiteth himselfe vvhat careth almightie thou bee rightuous vvhat shall hee gaine thou vvalke vprightly god afeard reproue thee come vvith thee iudgement thy vvickednesse great thine iniquity infinite thou hast take pledge thy brother vvithout cause thou hast spoiled vvas naked thou hast giuen vvater drinke vvas thirst hast denied breade vvas hungrie mightie man earth possession vvas authoritie dvvelt wee haue doe men wee charge aduersarie anye thing fynde anye thing reproue wee thinke wee haue halfe obteyned matter yea say selues faulte needeth iudge condemne v owne conscience man accuse mee finde selfe culpable seeke finde thing mee snatch alledge myne owne discharge mee thinketh muche diuert turne away myndes bee iudges cause ende wholy stay vpon euill haue committed might darkned wrapped vp common practise therefore wee vse one another seeke starting hole must serue v shift matter say haue done pleasure man haue afterward offended ought layd ballance thus wee would diminish fault wee haue committed else alledge thus though haue offended behalfe man altogither innocent come god thing fal groud true wee would vse talke god mortall men deceyued charge withall finde blame worthy seruice wee alledge wee haue done say beholding bounden vnto v mouth must needes stopped doo confesse debt humilitie acknowledge condemnation bee iust without making replie without attempting law shall get nothyng thereby argument handled eliphas see talke hee hathe may gathered good lesson hee spoken verye well applyed dyd well applying vnto iob wherein deceiued yet doctrine selfe generally profitable v wit god doth summon v stirreth v vp acknowledge ou e fault booteth seke reply say haue offended behalf god ought pardon behold haue serued thing ought acknowledge deserueth well good turn let v remoue al toyes take place appeare god wee bring gayne made neyther hote cold say v good also wee doo hym harme concluded agreed wee see presumption must bee throwne downe v remedie humilitie acknowledge condemnation iust end may better vnderstanded let v debate thing order heere conteyned vverein sayth eliphas shall man profit god wise man profiteth himselfe true first sight think deserue much god hand wee indeuor oure selues serue honor much blynded heerein imagin god might receiue commoditie v though neede v contrariwise neither increase diminishe hee sort fountayne goodnesse borow nothing another man whiche men bryng vnto releeue necessitie augmente wi e neede sayeth woulde come vnto thee creature hand furthermore wee knowe god seeketh nothing without hys owne maiestie let v put away foolish fantasie bring commoditie profit vnto god rather let v confesse dauid xvj psalme goodnesse shall reach vnto let men enforce themselues much yet god receyue nothing hand whereby might bee sayde fareth better yea god bestow many benefites vpon v would desire yet could make recompence sayde cxvj psal vvhat shall giue vnto lord many thing haue receyued nothing call vpon hys name farre able make god bounden vnto v shall haue bestowed vpon v benefites may wee able gyue like againe neyther seruice thus much concerning firste thing wee haue heere note man would aske question wherefore dothe god require v wee diligent serue seemeth hee hathe respect himselfe consideration v saluation god hath respect hys owne profite giueth v rule good liuing commaundeth v abstayne euill requireth v god whole lawe hath consideration owne profite considereth good v expedient saluation let v well shall returne vnto selues let v euill shall returne oure owne losse hinderance god hee remayneth alwayes safe sound true much lieth v offend maiestie abolish iustice guiltie thereof yet bee sayd wee diminish anyething god robbe whiche hath reach vnto iniurie truly therefore man shall hurt none hymselfe likewise profite commeth returneth owne persone heerein wee see inestimable goodnesse god hee commaundeth v diligently declareth vnto v liue doth bycause would play good husband say shall take profite thereby surely bycause procureth oure welth saluation serue without respect mine owne profite carefull man benefite go sollicite saying must euening morning pricke stirre hym foreward set order hys affayres profite shoulde redound vnto selfe token rare singular loue euen doth oure god deale v yet vvhen perceiue infinite maiestie consider vouch safeth thinke vpon saluation carefull must needes touched quicke yea rauished astonished bountifulnesse vnthankfulnesse men seeing whereas god win nothing become hardharted dull hee sheweth way saluation exhorteth come vnto vouchsafe go one foote forward rather go backeward excuse wee bee vnthankfull bountifulnesse oure god yet another thing namely although god receiue nothing v yet pretendeth bound vnto v haue neede sayeth thing ye bring mee receyue nothing v true neuerthelesse god accepteth doings maketh accounte though value according see likeneth husband man hath vineyard hath caused dressed gathereth wine hath feelde reapeth corne god vsing similitude declareth hee account work vnto pleasant sweete sacrifice also sayeth good poore euen hym accepteth done vnto himselfe euen oure sauiour iesus christ himselfe speaketh saying whatsoeuer ye shall one least mebers accept bin done mine owne persone seing god abaseth himselfe farre make hymselfe subiect state condition mortall corruptible man sayeth receiueth whatsoeuer vnto brother although bring nothing willingly bindeth himselfe vnto v dept part see must needes rauished admiration great gentlenesse god vseth towards v let v note well sayd place man shal haue taken paynes leade godly vpright life according commaundements god bee sayd life hath profited god thing hath done himselfe good yet god encourage v well accept thing whereby taketh profite requireth though hee better declareth shall leese oure labour thereby neither shal thing vnprofitable v say intent god incourageth v leade good life furthermore let v knowe end spoken vntoo v place wee must keepe remembrance circumstance haue spoken wit come make account god must forget al foolish imagination conceiue bring suche gayne deserue ought hand let al thys say throwne downe hee creature needeth ayde help hee standeth neede nothing content hymselfe forasmuch god manner meanes bounden vnto v let v learne humble selues let v sorie sinnes yea euen may bee vtterly ashamed desire god forgiue v forgiue v saye hee knoweth haue indeuered selfe leade good life haue done thing alledge surely nothing therefore let v forget delayes acknowledge selues guiltie wee haue vsed replyes yet reache vntoo god vvhen wee haue doo mortall men vse flourish couer fault withal yet maruelously ashamed happen oure lie doo appeare vvhat shall become v wee come god heerein see papist deceyued although denye daunger god curse would vse extremitie towards yet alledge satisfaction therein play marchants god haue made default one poynt make amends another away yea haue workes call work sepererogation god neuer commanded serue fill vp hole haue committed euill wherewith god doth vrge vvell say haue sinned heere shall make amends yea matter tried ballance yet would ouerplus poynt papist come thinke great absurditie forgiuenesse sinnes shuld franke free god pardon v meere goodnesse easily graunt true concerning trespas concerning punishmet perteyneth vnto v redeeme vvhe men caried away pride must say haue quite transformed god know maner one much must note wel conteined heere wit shall easily persuade selues god something profited v meere folly vayne fancie shall haue conceyued high let v learne acknowledge fault al humilitie make replye lay nothing charge neither alledge vnto hath receyued thing hand nother thing bounde vnto v thus much one poynt sayd moreuer god careth whither well ill whither walke vprightly vvhen eliphas speaketh thus meneth god shetteth eye difference good ill hee meeneth himselfe forceth true god fountayne al iustice right loueth equitie lead vpright life become wee image god certeyne haue goodnes selues see sun shineth heere beneath casteth foorth beames brightnesse see heere beneath commeth earthe see brightnesse vpo house vpon earth yet proceedeth thence brightnesse reflected call returneth agayne earth receyueth resteth vpon earth behold selues glasse glasse hathe face face man presenteth itselfe glasse representeth backe agayne wee well ourselues nothing drawen v al filthinesse beggerie corrupted nature lord poureth goodnesse rightuousnesse vpon v hee shew v fauor regenerating v holy spirit liue holily wee glass whiche image represented brightnesse whiche commeth aboue sheweth heere beneth much god acknowledgeth al good come cause loueth good impossible otherwise seing welspring fountaine thereof otherwise forceth respect himselfe say profit aduantage receyueth therby careth liue vvhen men worst shal therby take away rightuousnesse god diminish maiesty abolish glory honor shorten bound kingdom sense sayd god careth men concerning v let v cosider felicitie submit ourselues vnto yeeld selues obedient subiects seing hauing need v neither life work yet carefull lead godly life let v hereby know loue beareth v hath alredy bin said doth voutsafe ioyne v vnto vnite v liue wel sayth kingdom established liue yll sayth raigneth wee hinder god soueraine dominio shuld remaine vnto euer doth vse maner speach haue already sayd declare vnto v loueth v said eightenth chapter prouerbes wisedome god brought saying pleasure delight dwell among god speaketh thus declare vnto v wil keepe goodnesse shet vp concealed wil poure amogst v may partaker taketh pleasure lighten v end brue beast know coceyue teacheth v sort might lifted vp high kingdome maner dealeth al thing delighteth bestow hys benefites vpo v giue v fruition ioyneth vnto v v vnto god carefull ouer v wee leade good life hath profite harme therby sume haue note said moreouer feare thee bee reproue thee go lawe thee heere shewed v yet playnely shall get nothing seekingdelayes god wont fellowes mate cause men vse much cauilling controuersies debate haue men defende theselues appaise partie else make afeard hee prosecute matter rigour example vvhen man assaulted wil consider man pursueth liuely shall hee vse way scape else set one hys aduersaries tayle put flea eare saye thinkest thou thine aduersarie strong thee else stirre vp hym something vnder ground man draweth backe waxeth cold dareth prosecute matter hee begon feareth least mischeefe fall vpon head bicause wont make mortall men afeard end might escape handes shew teeth giue signes wee haue wayes meanes auenged think able like god folly must needes voyd sense iudgemet bicause men arrogant think practise thing god neighbor therefore sayde thinkest thou god holdeth hys peace feare thee cause moueth men put aduersaries feare bycause consider man would iniurie must stay hym although set vpon giue repulse else wil find meanes law represse thing stayeth v troubling one another purpose defend selues wicked seeke anoy v wee haue law setteth itselfe betwene party make refuge stayeth executing purposed thus proceede wee haue wyth mortal men let v thinke god ledde affection wee vnto hym make hote cold haue sayd god doth pursue v feare least preuent set foote vpo throte would blow vpon v must needes bee ouerthrowne rise vp againste god doo breake theyr neckes muche man shoulde breake hys sinewes veynes while laboureth go vp high hee must needes misse purpose force himselfe beyond measure shall breake bruse whole body deadly fall happeneth men come diuelish pride lift vp themselues god vve must thinke god afeard v hee mocke ouerweening sayde second psalme vvel true men make much ado conspire togyther specially king prince confederate ioyne togither agaynst liuing god people also agree make muche adoo beneath grashoppers prophet esay speaketh grashoppers haue log legges leap must needes fall agayne keepe great sturre heere leape aboue clowdes meane season dwelleth high place wyll laugh skorne serueth shew god seat wit aboue heauens men neuer reache vntoo hee shall aboue rest laugh skorne while shal make heere much ado let v learne god doth cite v appeare layeth matter charge able hurt respect hath himselfe stay v least preuent giue onset vpon first surely vvherfore make v feele euill v myght therby stirred vp seeke remedie true repentance come vnto gouerned according god therefore hee punisheth men seeketh health condemning mindeth acquite else chastised hee mindeth ratifie confirme iustice shewe euill shall remayne vnpunished withall also hee intendeth abate men pride delight sinnes glorye therin god wil bring al thing bringeth iudgement let v learne flatter ourselues wee haue remorse inwardlye condemned word god men shewe v oure faultes rubbe v galled backe lette v learne say vse startingholes shall nothing else marre market wee may bee sure god afeard v though could harme hee stirreth v vp feeling oure sinnes wee might bee displeased thys meanes hee reacheth hys hande vntoo v leade v saluation else hee mindeth double condemnation wee may bee much vnexcusable resist beside naughtinesse v also become wilfull stubborn bow goeth bring v back vnto summe haue co sider eliphas addeth moreouer thy malice gret thine iniquity infinite truly yll applyed person iob hath bin already noted meane season must holde v generall doctrine ende wee may apply selues needefull v let v note mouthe rude man wisedome ought haue apt applying truth vse holy ghost doth shew v haue wee come recken god namely know euery point guiltie meanes bounde vnto hym nothing bound vnto v furthermore also harme bringeth v law condemneth v owne profite saluation wealth yea let v assure selues euen condemned end might afterward acquit hym least fall condemnation whereintoo wicked shall constreyned come end side let v knowe god bringeth v thus iudgement examine oure sinnes search whole life end displeased sinnes meane season shal haue ripped vp v thinke knowe let v vnderstand haue yet perceyued hundred part speake euen haue cleare sight flatter themselues foster euill howsoeuer much men dul haue short dimme sight certayne shall perceyue hundreth part sinnes god hath farre cleare sight wee haue knoweth fall sinne day manifestly conuicted thereof committe another morrow morning yea day shall passe without great number offence transgression euer new begin agayne wee shall conuinced one fault two three hundred shal become v vvhe man hath well examined coscience findeth himselfe many wayes guiltie cocludeth god knoweth yet hundred time wher become therevpon must need astonied must heares stand vpright vpon head plu ged bottome death thus much haue note vpon place wit oft hearing word god preached vyces wherewith spotted condemned euery man must enter himselfe make owne processe tarie till god prosecute law say within himselfe ala haue offended wise twice many time haue offended wise ther diuers way god would turne vp filthinesse thing would vtterly vndone say would bring v humilitie repentance wee bee slacke wee haue bin approch vnto god least wee stubborne striue hys correction yea let v much carefull thus bycause see part men delight glory sinnes sigh grone vtterly ashamed counted good christian yea perfectest may found deede say generally man men must confesse themselues sinner yet none dothe better know none hath better lyue well say thus filthy naughtypackes yea filthy ayre stinketh theyr wickednesse yet cace make playne mocke god haue sayd wee examine oureselues well shall remayne vnto v nothing vtter confusion insomuche wee must needes acknowledge selues guiltie one sinne two throughly wholy knowing wee accursed god miserable hath pitie compassion v breefe heere taught men muste confesse themselues sinner god lightly fashion sake doo thinke ynough say oh denie faultes must must make burthen heauie beare indeede shall god truly glorified whych men say haue small infirmity imperfection whe dauid speake greatnesse sinnes multitude iniquity daniell speaketh confession angel comparison men yet sayeth haue confessed sinnes sinnes people hee speaketh small fault sayeth sinnes lord great outrageous let v learne acknowledge wee yea sort god may truly glorified throughly whole thus muche one point hope may haue god receiue v fauourable mercifull vnto v ouerwhelmed oure sinnes wee haue committed lord iesus sayth come vnto ye say sinner infirmity sayeth ye loden wearie whose shoulder bend vnder weight sinnes called iesus christe ende may find mercie grace mocke god making light confession beyng touched hart haue note vppon worde furthermore come suche knowledge must particularly examine sinnes wee haue committed man shall neuer truly say throwne bottome hell vnlesse hee bee well searched haue considered sinnes marked well one another vnlesse wee thus particularly examine selues shall neuer perceyue iniquity infinite innumerable cause matter heere couched order eliphas hath pronounced generall termes sinne iob great iniquity infinite sayeth hast thou spoyled naked hast thou taken pledge without cause hast thou withdrawne bread hungred hast thou denyed hym water drinke thirst meane season wast thou confederate men full violence cause god dothe nowe persecute thee true haue already sayde eliphas doth iob great iniurie wrong meane season spirite god intendeth heere teach v order whiche wee muste keepe truly humbled god least wee become hard harted meanes prouoke vengeance striuing breefe let v note men shall neuer feele theselues sinner ought except doo particularly consider themselues afterwarde enter account parcelmeale true wee neuer make ende wee must alwayes conclude dauid vvho vnderstande hys faultes yet wee maye therefore say thyngs muste bee passed ouer lightly bee searched ground earthly iudge bee sharpe witted attentiue heare processe life one man must praye wee haue offended oure god haue therein greater care yea processe criminall onely small summe money yet must iudge looke neerely see whether bee witness whether processe haue proceeded aright thing verified yet controuersie shall bee ten twentie florens hundred crownes tryfle iudge doo duetie hee muste needes bee counted guiltie god theefe worse theefe seeyng stealeth man goodes substance apperteyneth one gyueth vnto another god dooth farre honour v make v iudges owne liues yea doth saluation shall pray excused negligent close vp eye good profitable v certayne wee shall let v wey well whiche haue touched wit men shall neuer truly knowe themselues sinner ought requisite vntill haue examined liues particularly indeede see dauid vseth matter one fault onely bringeth middes sea seeth hee hath committed heynous offence god cause cruell murther onely one man many whyles went kill vrias therefore saw wickednesse hys sinne enormitie thereof constrayneth onely thinke vpon fault alone also consider hymselfe neerely yea behold himselfe mids sea condemne himselfe vtterly thus also must therefore popish shrift diuelish thing would haue men shriue theselues priest eare spew sinnes drunkard go spew wine hee hathe taken somuch hys stomacke able beare god haue v make confession cleane contrarie repugnant hys word side also hee wyll haue v saye one word haue offended passe ouer coales lightly prouerb heere countrey cosider ourselues neere hand euery man enter hys owne conscience acknowledge thus well onely giltie god one fault alone fault fault onely one tyme still fall agayne vvhen examine ourselues thus suche speciall sorte wee may well conclude lorde iniquity infinite oure transgression innumerable thys wherein god bee glorifyed thus muste poore sinner bee touched quicke wounded conscience maye bee displeased sinnes deede confesse themselues generall termes saye sinner men well declare bee touched inwardly bottome hart cannot tell know sinnes displeased v let v learne searche sinnes euen bottome wee haue gathered number let v knowe hundred time let v ashamed ourselues acknowledge condenation sighing god saying ala lorde true sinnes many number iniquity infinite lette multitude thy mercy poured vppon v dauid speaketh way obteyne forgiuenesse sinnes pleaseth god couer goodnesse away clense v power holy spirit let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement faultes desiring make v haue better feeling wee haue side make v beholde holy maiestie end beeing quite throwen downe may raised vp againe none meanes mercie grace hee hath shewed v lord iesus christ meane season lette v come yeeld ourselues great sauiour calleth v vnto reward v crowne glorye hauing respect many misery v shal al say god mighty heauely father c lxxxiiij sermon second vpon xxij chapter sermon doth prosecute exposition sixth seuen eyght verse afterward texte beere adioyned thou hast let vvidovves go emptie arme fatherlesse hath bin broken therefore snare compasse thee day ne feare doth trouble thee darknesse maketh thou canst see great vvaters couer thee man mighte maruell cause eliphas accuseth iob crime neuer found shall see heereafter iob bin courteouse liberall man dayes life hee protesteth hath bin defender fatherlesse protectour widowes eye blind legges lame hand neuer closed needie vvherefore doth eliphas accuse haue taken away goodes substance neighbour violence pitifull bin cruell hee deuoured goodes himselfe alone seemeth thing reason wee must note eliphas iudgeth person iob affliction cause hee mistaketh thing wee haue shewed must beware god punisheth man wee conclude therevpon hee wicked man handled according desert setting cart horse prouerb sayeth euen dealeth eliphas therefore iudgement corrupted furthermore hee heere propoundeth muste simply vnderstanded much exhorte iob well consider whole life seeyng hee afflicted straunge fashion hee conclude bin wicked man offence outrageouse god powred horrible vengeance vppon hee say see time thy prosperitie thou hast beene cruell looke thou haue constreyned poore men euill thing consider thou haue denyed ayde required thee vvay thy selfe whyther thou haue bin contemner god seeyng nowe thou remaynest yet wilte iustify thy selfe token thou makest playne mocke god time thee humble thy selfe neuer seing thou art thus throwen downe must thou needes acknowledge thy iudge condemne thy selfe thou still continuest minde fight agaynste god must needes therefore conclude thou arte mocker scorner thus doth eliphas heere proceede heereby see thing iudge rashly consider neyther whych good men vertues god hath placed wee vse trifling light coniectures coloure shew eliphas euer seene iob thyng whych heere layeth charge surely iob doth afterwarde declare vvhy doth eliphas thus reproue hym bycause soreincombered foolish fantasie seeing iob greeuously punished god muste needes hath committed crime yea god hath vtterly reiected euill conclusion eliphas maketh god sometimes punish seruants according faultes haue committed trie pacience beside shew deale greene tree shall become whiche drie furthermore intendeth mortify concerning world teach misery wee suffer thys world shall hinderance blessednesse promised v though bee hidden shewed world vve see god hath many cause afflict conclude therevppon afflicting led cursed wicked life next way peruertal yet thing behind worse enter foolish coniectures man hath bin men sight man good conuersation shall find cause wherefore hath deserued delt withall giueth v occasion dreame dote elphas doth heere vvherefore must bee sober refrayne selues go giue iudgement vpon neighbour therefore let v go aduentures let v examine well theyr life know man wicked person despiser god fault notoriouse wee may well say god punisheth end taught example might profitable lesson v besides whe perceyue man cause god shoulde punish seuerely calamitie happen vnto let v stay iudgemente practise whiche heere alledged psalme let v rather pitifull inclined good part thinke al lord would deale v according desert shuld become v better man yea may say worse yet wee see plaged let v learne god leade v farther sheweth v life nothing moreouer hee intendeth exercise diuers battels shall haue shewed themselues pacient mids affliction wil haue comfort themselues know better rest prepared another place thus must thys cace procede let v particularly examine touched heere eliphas sayth thou hast taken gage thy neighboure without cause thou hast spoyled naked heere see sinnes ceasse bee odious sight god although men condemne v man cruell take pledge poore man hee lendeth neede hee take either couerlet bed coate wherwith clothed man sue law sued hee acquited hath lent money lawfull take pledge assurance men hee meanes constreyned must therfore thinke acquited god therefore wee thynke perswade selues iust innocent god bycause wee haue bene reproued men wee deceyued worldly policie serueth bring v perfection god requireth v hys child sufficient maynteyned euery may inioy right strongest carrie away deceit extorcion iniuries outrage bee punished purpose worldly policie serue wee come god ynough v alledge haue bin theefe led galowes bee whipped haue murthered shuld condened death haue committed crime bringeth eyther bodily punishment infamie vvhen wee shall haue alledged purpose haue borne neighboure secret grudge alreadye accounted murtherer god haue attempted corrupt abuse another man wife haue looked hir vnchastly lo condemned whoremo ger couet man goodes seeke drawe vnto although men cast teethe yet taken theefe god vve may place gather profitable doctrine may flatter ourselues men cannot charge v whole life haue bin sued lawe anye misdeedes short though men may iudge v righteouse may yet must thinke scaped cause hee shall haue taken pledge assurance money counted god sometime murtherer heere sayd expressely take pledge without cause simply thing euill itselfe neither doth god vtterly reiect wit man shuld take pledge lawfull bie another man goodes lawfull take pledge beholde feeld medow layde pledge whiche thing god doth condemne likewise bring parte mouables itselfe ought vtterly bee reiected sayd euill take pledge without cause eliphas addeth mind neede seeke glose saith iob hathe taken pledge neighboure hee hath spoyled naked according lord declareth law namely pledge whych wee take serueth man ordinarie neede man spoyled bee colde cruell take coate kinde murther man forgoe bed releefe hys hunger lay couerlet pledge corne thing necessary sustenance taketh vnkind farfoorth lieth killeth changeth kind death asmuch man danger hanged owne handes vntie rope stead wil cut throte whe poore man shal haue nothing eate shall constrayned giue away bed get meate villanouse crueltie meanes excused therefore lord saith lawe take heede pledge poore man remayne thee night vvhen thou seest serueth necessary vse cannot without must sustayne harme restore agayne thou let poore man haue hys bed agayne releeue necessitie side shall blisse thee thou haue restored vnto garment cold body shal blisse thee contrariwise poore man put bed diseased thy wickednesse thou hast bin vngentle thou wouldest led nothing without pledge although poore man doo cry vengeance hee dumb yet shalt thou accursed necessitie shal sufficient call thee accompt iudgemente seate god mind eliphas yea saythe thou hast spoyled naked saye poore man came vnto thee required borrow money thee thou diddest consider thou tookest pledge whether gaue thee cote bed pot panne whe bread knew eate thou hast take hym thing whereof stoode great neede vve see walke sincerely god liue togyther brethre ynough v keepe earthly lawes nothing worldly policie must ascend higher must keepe equitie nature nothing man whiche would men v therefore let euery man consider well woulde men shuld say wold iudge stand equitie like neede nowe none say well wee oure lord commaundeth v cherish one another hungrie danger also cold pulleth coate backe doth declare seeketh nothing else cut throte alledge reason well ourselues wee like another shall neede iudge ourselues condemne v breefe summe must learne place nowe foloweth afterward thou hast giuen water drinke athirst thou hast withdrawne thy breade hungrie heere eliphas sheweth mighte iob punished god bin pitifull towardes men releeue neede may gather frute doctrine must leaue person iob wee haue touched therefore let euery man consider himselfe god visiteth v dealeth v rigorously compelled feele sinnes say let v examine matter well whether bycause wee haue shewed courtesie towardes oure neighbour commaunded v ought shewe heere said stoppeth eares poore crieth vnto hym requireth aide hand shall crie hymselfe shall bee hearde beholde god threatneth v wee wyll voutsafe helpe require ayde oure handes wee haue power meanes suffer v fall intoo mischeefe yea richest lyue ease god hathe hys hande manye roddes chastize v withall first conceiue truth whyche riche hope shall neuer fall intoo perplexitie thinke although trouble confusion shoulde happen whole worlde yet shoulde remayne peace oure lorde declareth whiche helpe theyr neyghbours neede make accounte shall come intoo theyr place shall bee holpen neyther shall releeue shall bee hearde aboue fle vnto god gate shall bee shut vntoo sayde shall bee iudgemente withoute mercye woulde shewe mercie moste horrible threatning bee vsed v god declareth vnto v hee deale v without mercie wee looke god haue mercie pitie vppon v wee must needes bee swallowed vp vndoutedly god depriueth v barreth v hope hys goodnesse bee cruell towardes oure neighboures therefore god visite v oure affliction bee greate let v learne searche diligently cause wherefore examine matter thus goto haue meanes helpe stoode neede worldly goodes haue holpen haue discharged duetie heerein neede helpe haue indeuered selfe helpe came vntoo ready communicate goodes vnto hym know haue done duetie thys behalfe let v sigh god know sheweth v great fauoure put v remembrance fault furthermore let v note fonde foolish startingholes say vvhat leaue selfe bare mine owne goodes whiche god hathe giuen mine owne dispose thereof muche shall seeme good vnto haue goodes haue stolne man wrong heerein shuld lawfull inioy hold god giue thankes acknowledging gyuen hym say wee wyll thinke wel done alledge al althogh lord giue vnto riche whiche possesse though haue lawfull meane suche sorte protest haue yet followeth may vse suche sorte shoulde haue regarde vnto necessitie another man lightly god bestoweth rich vpon v abundantly doth v honoure make v stewardes
