receyuers see receiuer hathe onely charge receyue heape vp goodes also distribute maister commandeth seeing lorde appointeth v steward goodes whiche hee putteth handes hee also haue v distribute vve know hath neede v disburse would haue v help neighbour stand neede therefore haue abundance welth must alledge mine owne yea indeede howbeit wyth condition thou shouldest help stande neede thereof thou shouldest deuoure thy selfe alone god hathe giuen thee ende truth lawe bee made thys behalfe sainct paule declareth prince shoulde leuie subsidie require quantitie goodes euery man possesseth therevppon must cessement made god doth vse suche proceeding hee loueth offer vntoo theyr meere liberalitie saint paule sayth cheerefull hart rich must giue vntoo poore necessitie constraint free franke hart therefore neighbour bee hungrie thirstie wee knowing necessitie releeue excused haue deuoured abused benefites god hathe put handes vvhen thus say certaine god count v giltie murtherers thus muche concerning verse sayde hee punished god hathe denied gyue poore hungrie man bread hath gyuen water drinke thirsty added furthermore mightie man meane season possessed earthe authoritie dwelt therein serueth shewe rich men haue compassion bycause lyue ease know stand neede knowe necessitie meeneth therefore touched therewith bee shorte full thinke world well summe eliphas mynd thys place applyeth person iob vpbraydeth earth made small number men rich men thinke whiche haue neuer ynough dayly purchasing saying thus themselues thys would serue well purpose must needes get peece ground neede sixe foote haue theyr full measure say shall bee buried hee hathe goodes ynough find hundred person yet aferd starue hunger lyke vnsatiable whirlpooles woulde content themselues hadde whole earthe possession would coulde pull sunne skye greeueth poore shoulde haue muche common wyth inioy brightnesse sunne thus whirlpooles would deuoure thynke world made none eliphas reproueth heere suche vanitie according also worthy condemned howbeit hee dothe well applye persone iob yet doctrine profitable v let v vnderstande man abuse credite ceasse gather deceitfully bycause hee hath alwayes compasse hys matter bring passe vnstaunched vnsatiable couetousnesse saythe haue thyng yet wind suche thing therefore nippeth pincheth euery side one hee would haue earth bee made hym alone thys meant heereby saying whyche haue authoritie earthe dwell therein true oure lord woulde gouernemente amisse bee riche men poore created god sayth salomon saying hee meeneth two thing witte rich despise pore much creature god poore condemne rich muche god would rich pouertie lawfull man haue rich possession inioy whiche hee hath yet must hee know wee liue worlde condition vse mutuall participation one another god doth giue habitation dwelling lyue owne also saith hee hath giuen earth inheritance men spoken generally therefore although world haue one foote lad yet must haue dwelling place worlde leastwise money haue yea euen strange countrey bee natiue countrie god wil trie rich dwell go driue far spreading wing abrode much angry god despite would take whole world haue note place profitable lesson teach aduanced credite blinded pride abuse authoritie wont rich let cosider must therfore occupie whole earth authoritie must therfore despise poore estimation must support one another behaue themselues rich may offer meanes poore liue may get liuing honestly trauell aduatage let poore although haue nothing owne content seeing pleaseth god make able get liuing without iniurie let deale one another comon societie may mainteined euery man nurrished susteyned thus riche men warned despise poore proudly wont poore also walke according degree small habilitie men liue though lodged worlde hand god nurrished grace summe whiche taught place sayd moreouer iob sent away widdowes without succour aid broken arme fatherlesse say throwen downe whereas poore fatherlesse shoulde haue bin succoured rather oppressed special mention made widowes fatherlesse child bicause lord doth specially comend haue least succour wife vnder shadow hir husband vnder protection long hath aliue also come man state alredy able mainteine poore widdow hath neither counsell meanes poore fatherlesse child knoweth thing meane therfore ready spoyled therfore lord would haue much commended wont pleasure looke recopence contrariwise god intendeth proue charitie whither wee good able requite v besides looke men oppressed must applie meanes god hath giuen v seene widdowes fatherlesse child therefore god hath comended vnto v ioyneth also straungers bicause haue many kinsfolk alied lincked long traine frieds might mainteined much becometh child god haue pitie vpo person brief see god law throughout whole holy scripture declareth greuously offended widdowes fatherlesse child straungers afflicted men hurt harmed bicause destitute succour therfore much must haue pitie bicause haue meanes requite v shew selues child god wee extend charitie also god doth acknowledge putteth account therefore let v doubt much profitable entreat straungers widdowes fatherlesse child men alredy recompenced v contrariwise vexe lie open many iniuries adde euill vpon euil come accoplishment mischief token voyde humaine iudgement become like vnto brute beast therfore eliphas reproue sinne saith heere thou hast reiected widdow succoured hir thou hast holpen fatherlesse troden vnder foote short let v assure ourselues lord would haue weake supported haue best meanes able wee shew ourselues child god wherevnto doth god looke wherin doth chiefly exercise mercie pitie vpon oppressed beare said must resemble heauenly father triall whereby shew called vaine child wee become like vnto know although god pitifull al creature although goodnesse poured vpon men yet neuerthelesse telleth v specially regardeth troden vnder foote oppressed iniuries violence help defender fatherlesse mainteine widdowes stranger seing god declareth thus much behoueth v like vnto behalf contrarie token wee forsake god fauour hath shewed v choozing v child thus much wee haue note place let v come eliphas saith cause snare copasse thee euery side sodaine feare maketh thee astonished vve must alwayes remember hath bin declared afore namely misapplied person iob therwithall let v beare mind generally also thing laid eye end wee know misery calamity chastizements god layth vpon v sinnes truth hath bin already saide god punish sinnes men alike neuerthelesse wee suffer thing wee thereby admonished examine liues sigh grone god acknowledging selues giltie maiestie thus much one point furthermore although god purpose end punishing sinnes yet behoueth euery v consider visited god shut eies whe god doth shew v light time afflicted let v vnderstand god hath laid snare v wild beast wee walked sheepe fold would haue layd snare take v lay snare eawes weather beastes easily handled man needes whistle come wee would willingly come onely voice god shuld neede hunt v lay snare v men wont wilde beast let v know god deale rigorously v haue rebelled thervpon let v examine liues enquire whether wee haue offended moreouer whe feare cometh vpo v astonied therwith bicause haue walked quietly obediece god vnto peace promiseth keep although beseeged enimies although midds many dagers yet shal alwaies safetie sleepe quietly rest vnder shadow therfore astonied feare let v vnderstad god punisheth v bicause haue simply walked vnder obedience short euen peace singular gift god trouble come vpon v curse sent fro said peace singular gift god whe shal haue called vpon god true assurace heare v requireth nothing else wee come vnto inestimable benefite treasure neuer sufficiently valued neither obtain meanes faith know god father sauiour iesus christ vnderstanded onely eternall saluation soules also world haue priuiledge run vnto god comend liues hand seeke needes necessity vvhen shall haue gotten peace wee stay selues vpon prouidence god cast carcks care vpon singular benefite god hath bestowed vpon v contrariwise troubled said extreme curse state condition man miserable feare astonishmet seeth nothing dau gers euery side yet canot come vnto god find rest assurance man feare already hell yes surely therefore let v assure ourselues although thing come passe would wish yet haue peace nothing howbeit let v note also wee must seeke peace world wicked log troubled molested perswade maruellous thing themselues triumph therevpon thing spite god withall vvee must haue peace proceedeth retchlesnesse blockishnesse triuph worlde haue neuer peace forget god cursed peace better v trouble might come vnto god seeke meanes reconciled vnto past feeling let v note peace may liue ease must bee grounded god haue respect vnto meane season let v knowe wee trouble god visiteth v sinnes yea also meanes calleth v vnto end seeke peace hath promised v fro deede eliphas sheweth trouble whereof hee speaketh feare wherwith iob thought seized could trust goodnesse fauour god profitable thing worthy noted may happen euen faithful shal great trouble anguish altogither without feeling yet god ceasseth giue light vvhen see theselues cace deepe dungeos yet haue alwaies light god feele goodnesse haue receiued comfort leadeth stil forth staied vpon promise infallible briefe assault soeuer haue alwaies lift vp head looking saluation fro man ready drowned god reache hand behold though restored life againe looketh vp heauen wee haue light darknesse copasseth v euery side perceiue goodnesse god minded shew v fauour wofull cace therefore wee assured spirituall battels must abide world many feares trouble god sendeth trie costancie stedfastnesse let v determine selues set eye vpon light sheweth v say vpon promise maketh v conteyned word herken diligently vnto stay repose selues wholly vpon let v doubt giue v quiet rest wee may say lord afeard euill although walke shadow death bee vnder shadow thy wing thy protection nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement faultes desiring giue v suche knowledge may onely cause v confesse also hate bee displeased oure selues seeke meanes bee absolued god beseeching also guide v holy spirite wholly subiection obedience may seeke nothing else yeeld ourselues obediet vnto much commaundeth v liue togither world brother let v continue brotherly vnitie hath consecrated among v let euery man imploy himselfe help neighbour end wee may vnfeynedly call vpon oure father hee may acknowledge auouche v child hath giuen v testimonie adoption hart holy spirite grace hath shewed v sauiour iesus christ may please graunt grace onely v also people nation earth c lxxxv sermon third vpon xxij chapter god high heauen behold heigth starres hovv high yet thou aist hovv god knovv iudge cloudes cloud hide ca see nothing vvalketh circle heauen hast thou marked old vvay vvherein vvicked men haue vvalked vvhich vvere throvvne dovvne time foundatio vvas riuer dried vp sayd vnto god depart v vvhat almightie vnto v saw eliphas wrogfully accuse iob though hee liued wickedly among men perceiuing iob acknowledge condemnation true addeth despizer god deede men fall extremitie giuen euil corrected hand god doo returne rather much hardned therfore scourge god canot tame v token vtterly past hope recouerie true medicine bring v againe way saluation god shew v fault make v feele kicke god declare therby past amedmet disease incurable true ill attributed iob yet must follow order haue hitherto kept wit seeing doctrine good holy euery one v muste take profite let v first note huble themselues vnder god chastized aduersitie declare haue religion faith aught else contempt god although haue bin foolish stray way continue wicked life god wink v yet time amend neuer god doth visite v constreyne v force god speake vnto v ought ynough v whe striketh v doth adde help word bicause dull vpon spurre amend v man say child past grace haue first note concerning person iob seeing haue alredy declared shal see hereafter large suche perfection blamed susteined reproche accused haue bin cruell man vniust dealer finally counted contemner despiser god time men condemne v wrongfully let v learne bee pacient god wil suffer v blamed end may learne walke led away ambition hunt glory prayse men content ourselues conscience quieted god vve know nature wee inclined foolish pride woulde praised goodnesse v would world know man refuse v nowe see heere ambition mixed insomuch ynough v men esteeme v pertnesse may bee raysed heere world meane season god quite forgotten therefore profite lord suffereth men v wrong go well turne euill wee blamed slandered tendeth profite end wee learne haue god iudge content selues alowed although whole worlde reiect v let v set light thinke hard let v set eies example iob farre passed v holynesse yet see wrongfully misused done without god ende might learne lesson haue spoken namely must seeke honoured men ought suffise v allowed god conscience doo testifie vnto v hee dothe accept v let v come reason eliphas vseth heere vvhat knowest thou god aboue behold heigth starres high asmuch eliphas accused iob vngodlinesse cotempt god vseth exhortation lestwise saith behold god deede meanes awake v whe falne asleepe thinke sinnes pride rebellion v onely thinke vpon god sufficient bring v againe reason while wee remayne heere world conceiue fleshly assurance care nothing maruell see nothing neere v trouble v considering already selues full pride vvell must come god behold maiestie spite teeth wee muste learne cast downe head reuerence infinite highnesse therefore order eliphas keepeth good ought obserue rule oft touched sinnes thinke vppon vengeance god drunken pleasure bee briefe delight mischiefe cannot bee brought repentaunce remedy thinke thus ourselues vvell iudge whome must render account mortall creature ala come conceiue incomprehensible maiestie inestimable highnesse god wee muste needes bee abashed humble selues puffed vp minde eliphas god saieth high heauen vvhy doth thus speake seate god discerne creature thing worlde truth god infinite essence inclosed heauens maiestie spred whole worlde doth also fill earth declared heauens comprehend thee saide salomon dedicated temple god himselfe prophet esay saith heauen royall throne earth footestoole god enclosed heauen yet without cause scripture speaketh heauen suche marke maiestie glory lift vp eye thither wee must needes bee moued therewith lette v behold earth heere beneath true workes god seene stirre v vp magnifie howbeit asmuch touched reuerence whe haue walked beneath looke vp heauen bycause marke print maiestie glory god let v think strange holy scripture whe intedeth moue v honor god saith vnto v aboue heauen deede said vnto v god world asmuchas carnall wit alway way bending downwards would faste piller house moutain else would set ouer head eares riuer fansies end wee thinke vpon god wee might learn imagine earthly thing passe beyod world stay owne sens fantasy said god dwelleth heauens end know lieth power inclose world conceiue wee neuer coprehend sens haue small measure rather learne reuerence al humilitie cause saide god aboue heauen well knowne vnto v certain al superstition would easily redressed deed sprong men would coprehend god according capacitie whereas able hold alwaies sens would faine occupied searching curiously god thervpon forge conceiue one seemeth best though god carnal cause draweth v carefully thence sheweth v must imagine nothing think good blasphemy sacrilege transforme turne truth lie paul speaketh al forge idol transform god according brain falsaries falsifying publike writing matter record abolishing maiestie god suche heinous treason god passeth therefore build folish fantasy according appetite giltie treson much ought remeber wel lesson taught v wit god aboue end oft speake may know s shal faile v vanish away hundred time come highnes must worship hu bly conceiuing nothing el hath taught v word al wisdome haue saide doctrine well printed hart world shuld purged al superstitios haue alwaies reigned hapneth men haue forged idol thought god nigh except remebrace say figure men toke leaue coprehend god thinke nothing fou tain al superstitio men thus make visible shape bicause knew highnesse god incoprehesible maiestie taught whe people israel requiring haue visible signe represent god saith wee haue go v say haue subiect vnto v howbeit wee muste preace vnto god haue saide wee must reuerence humilitie furthermore men thought serue god owne fashion framed lawes themselues saying good thing acceptable vnto god bicause would make like vnto theselues though delited smal toy inueted wit outward thing trasformed god though would pull heauely seat draw hither though creature fleshly thing wee see fonde deuotions vsed papacie termed diuine seruice sprag namely knew highnesse god wold haue cocluded thus god delited thing seeme good eies another nature spirit therfore must serue clean contrary fashio vnto pleaseth nature nother must wee cace presume attempt thing head haue law hath declared vnto v hath prescribed v rule let v hold v vnto sobrietie god requireth worde whervnto would haue v submit ourselues without swaruing thing al therefro herevpon eliphas saith behold height starres high according haue already sayd wit forasmuch creature beneath doo moue v sufficiently feare reuerence god behold skie liuely touched true villanouse vnthankfulnes yea wat sens moued honour god though opened eye co sider thing lie feete doth earth bring forth many fruit strength foode receiue thece cometh nature disposition therfore although loke farther foot certain open eye shal conuinced god ought worship asmuch dull grosse headed doth greatly moue v vvhat must helpe rudenesse infirmitie let v looke vpon high must need brute beast moued sighte skie order seene starres goodly exquisite disposition doth sufficiently testifie vnto v woderful maiestie god men must needes astonied behold skie furthermore sith wee know sunne starres noble excellet creature thervpon let v ad taught v heere wit god aboue canot reach vnto vvhe know must needes rauished much greater admiratio see heathen men whiche taught moued idolatry beholding sun moone starres saw glory dignity thought shuld haue done great wrong iniurie sun haue worshipped god certain men cace otherwise haue better direction yet say heathen therfore excused haue conceiued sun moone creature yea eue liuelesse creature haue feling yet hauing scripture law bee taught could touched glory highnes appered sun moone reason wherof moued worship make idol error shal serue condenatio another maner seing god speaketh vnto v declareth fully giue v record maiestie sheweth v way come vnto therewithall doth offer v autetick seales sun moone ratifie thing vnto v spoken mouth ther see proofe effect pray shal dubble gilty consideratio moue v make v worship great god incomprehensible maiesty humble selues vnder summe haue learne place let v come eliphas casteth iobs teeth namely thinke god marketh thing beneath chargeth vngodlinesse say god walketh circkle heauen cloud stop vnto seeth state gouerne thing eliphas doth lay fasly vnto iobs charge seene wicked men worlde asmuch perceyue god heere neere vnto conclude farre may sport themselues though sawe nomore like blinde wretch haue visible shape god thinke themselues vtterly vndone god among papist see crucifixe may mow vppon see marmoset say vvhere god become skill religio know christianitie meeneth pray vnto god vnlesse haue marmoset may kneele downe blocke stone heathen alwayes wont see heathen rayled law moyses said iewes worshipped cloudes vncertaine secrete godhead bycause looked vp heauenward image forge themselues god owne desire wretched papist proceede manner day altogither like heathen impossible otherwise vntill time god declare vnto another meane neere vntoo nowe meane doo wicked men haue deuotion thinke oh god aboue glory careth thing beneath busie himselfe meddle neither thing perteining vnto comely maiestie thus wicked take occasion estraunge themselues god giue themselues libertie mischiefe saying god seeth wee must note thing well wee bee stayde hande god worde doth stande v stead bridle vvee fall like confusion lord doth declare vnto v dwelleth high hee beholdeth thing heere beneath nothing hid vvell wee thereby admonished walke face hath declared much vnto v yea worketh also v holy spirite openeth eye end wee thinke vpon maiestie oure deedes thought greater confirmation hee addeth woord preached vnto v two edged sword examineth thought affection proceedeth euen vntoo maree bone sayd epistle hebrues short god declareth vnto v hath giuen property word stayth v bridle become v let v note well sentence said wicked vnder shadow perceiue god naturall witte thinke scaped hand triumph willingly perswade themselues god careth anything done heere beneath nothing cofusion thing commeth vntoo knowledge concerning heere sayd cloud cloudes couert vnto god true howbeit farre sense scripture speaketh vnto v maiestie god saith deede hid cloud purpose saith end curiously gad astray wont see men ticklish nothing speake god dispute purpose reason without modestie saying yea reason god seemeth speake companion one inferiour vnto vvee see diuelish boldnesse men enter deepest secretes god turne vp thing leaue nothing vnremoued short god must subiect vnto see whereto come cause holy scripture saith vnto v god hath darke cloudes place hide himselfe wherto saith mocke phantasticalnesse v purchace vnto god vvill wee comprehend secret let v come cloudes yet come starres great way behold one cloude doth lette v wee cannot see sunne although brightnesse come vnto v yet know place vvhe sunne shineth noone dayes bee close raynie weather cannot marke place sunne say place cloude let v wee cannot see creature whiche sheweth himselfe dayly pray shall comprehend god holy scripture mocketh suche pride men enquire beyond measure apperteineth vnto dispute god pleasure discouer leaue nothing hid cloude saith scripture yea seeth respect v cannot comprehend cloude letteth v sens weake cause saint paule saith place haue alledged men vanish away owne imagination vvhat ment saying vanish men haue wandred way way fade away smoke euen point god behalfe hath cleere sighte hee passe cloudes world shall nothing darke vnto cause sayd dwelleth vnapprochable light saying notable god cannot knowne v seeing nothing brightnesse woord vnapprochable importeth wee cannot come neere man lift vp himselfe shall go meane lift vp pride presumption say tell god comprehend list deede diuelish ouerweening haue said attaine brightnesse god againe nothing v pouertie weakenesse vnabilitie men selues cannot approch vnto god must approche vnto v must conceiue doth offer word contenting selues coteined sayd although way wee cannot come vnto god yet dwelleth brightnesse say eye blinded seeth knoweth thing vnderstand cloude couert god hide yea men cannot come vnto yet couert respect himselfe might say gouerneth thing prouidence seeth plainly onely done beneath also whatsoeuer men co ceiue mind meane season must note certaine men thinking honour god thereby haue imagined heere saide horrible blasphemie thus while men honour god fantasie marre al foolish men therefore haue thought meete god troubled v shoulde great derogation maiestie thus gouerne thing vvhat say shall god carefull flie worme birde ayre proper thing deede thus while attribute vnto god honour seemeth good vnto themselues spoyle power maiestie vvhat must let v learne honor god requireth v let v hath bene already declared seruice wee haue forged owne brayne let v simply herken whiche god hath spoken declared himselfe hath spoken owne holy mouth let v hold v resolution let v know shall haue knowne god sheweth holy scripture may glorifie becometh v also due honor requireth alloweth sayd scripture prouidence god mercie stretched euen vnto brute beast nothing susteined hand power herein first declared vnto v power besides see infinite goodnesse carefull eue wormes earth birde ayre falleth ground without wil forsight ordinance behold goodnesse god vouchsafeth haue care vile despized thing wee also set litle store furthermore thereby wee may also conclude loue beareth v according reason proufes sauiour iesus christ much worth litle sparrowes nourished heaue ly father thinke hath regard mainteine thinke alwaies vnder wing turneth al thing saluation thing hapneth vnto without good thus must honor god bringing subiectio sens fantasie accepting declareth vnto v holy scripture say god walketh circle heaue therfore medleth matter vnseemely thing troubled humane earthly affaire wee speake sorte god needeth take pleasure idlenesse beastly opinion conceiue god would shut world thinke al thing gouerned prouidece power saying tush god suche glorie must bee aboue happie life muste haue care thing much change god shape god haue already said like vnto mortall place great part felicitie liuing ease rest idlenesse god troubled needeth breake braines thing trauayle hads feete thing el gouerneth thing meanes doth remouing going coming framing thing making great discourse truly gouerneth mainteyneth al thing word alone stregth creature must needes obey know god doth walke aboue galeries filleth whole world must behold alwaies neere vnto v bicause behalf neare vnto wee must walke face knowing cannot go one foote beholdeth v al thing marked brief summe wee haue note vpon place eliphas asketh iob whither haue marked way elder become wicked sayeth rooted broken ouerthrowne foundation say al stabilitie riuer rune dried vp againe eliphas cofirmeth said afore wit fro beginning men haue knowne wicked bee punished true god haue declared hath alwayes giuen exa ples iudgemets end men might kept feare according saying prophet esay lord shal execute iudgemets inhabitats earth shall learne rightuousnesse therefore see lord stretcheth arme chastise wicked weth himselfe iudge ought moue v feare loue god hath al time giuen token men must needes come accompt iniquitie shall remaine vnpunished yet doth punish offend alike therefore may make generall rule wicked punished worlde needed reserue iudgement latter day vvhat become immortalitie men soules become hope haue resurrectio come nothing eliphas marreth al maketh generall rule particular example god hath shewed thing wee haue note god hath punished wicked lifted theselues vp although haue bene done yet must conclude although many wicked spared euen end haue lined al voluptuousnes die minute houre without languishing yet must needes come accompt shall let v paciently tarie till hid fro v reueled brief summe wee haue note vpon place meane season let v waigh word spoken heere wicked time may vaunt themselues yea euen farre raile god thing despite eliphas reporteth say get thee v ahnigbtie vnto v vve shall see rage furious wicked meanes knowe god thing spite withall though power authoritie ouer end god pull downe wel ynough meane season eliphas vpbraydeth iob heere sayde menne missed haue house furnished good seemed vntoo iob ment denie prouidence god cleane contrarie confession whiche iob made altogither ought hold say god spareth wicked seeme happie nothing mocke religio remaineth vnpunished neuerthelesse must surmount temptation afrayd coclude god iudge worlde shewe himselfe one although presently wee see lo right sound confession iob hath made mistaken eliphas haue already declared wordes wit wicked say vnto god get thee v speake flee knowledge much lieth willingly wittingly become brute beast seeme man speake scoffer whiche seeke nothing el take pleasure man speake vnto say iudgement god threaten therewith matter stirre vp choler yea lay power would haue whole holy scripture bret men might neuer speake wherfore euen male factour neuer would see neither gallows gibet iustice thing el short would gouernment world wicked coulde finde heart destroy maiestie god lay power meane season refuse doctrine stop eares blindfold eye might neyther see heare shorte withdraw themselues much obedience god would meanes subiect therevnto also euen among selues see counterfait great christian contented say one word well must obey god woorde muste preached yet would haue man tell tale wote neere rubbe galled backe men protestation euer make doo well declare seeke nothing else bee estranged god say vnto get thee v although vtter blasphemie mouth yet men see well ynough minde vvell part let v learne walke god feare carefulnesse much come neere vnto v let v pray continue v wee may neuer estranged seyng worde familiar among v doth dayly communicate vnto v preaching holy gospell let v beholde desire lift v vp aboue clowdes yea euen vnto heauen faith hee hath giuen v wee may increase vntill haue fully ioyned v vnto himselfe beholde perfitely hidde v fully fashioned according image name lord iesus christ let v fal afore face good god acknowledgement faultes desiring make v feele wee may learne displeased sigh grone calamity affliction wee suffer especially offence wee haue committed knowing good god layeth roddes vpon v drawe v suche knowledge sinnes might make v sory driue v aske forgiuenesse seeke remedie whiche hath promised running seeking ridde sinnes coue nothing please thing dedicate selues honor glorie praying augment v grace holy spirite wee may constantly perseuer obedience middest al stumblingblockes affliction may happen vnto v vntil haue gathered v heauenly rest may please graunt grace v also people nation earth c lxxxvj sermon fourth vpon xxij chapter sermon doth still prosecute verse part texte therevnto annexed yet hathe hee filled house vvith treasure lette intente vvicked bee farre mee righteous shall see laugh innocent shall mocke oure substaunce surely hathe bene hidden fyre hathe deuoured remnant acquainte thy selfe vvith deale vvith peace thereby thou shalte haue prosperitie receyue lavve mouth lay vp vvoordes thy heart wee beganne yesterday declare end saying eliphas tendeth hee reproueth iob saying god suffereth wicked prosper punisheth truth deed according iudgement worlde eliphas fellowes sayd god doth neuer delay iudgemets appeare amongst v experience saying iob true wee must paciently abide till god set thing order againe shall bee done world vve must walke hope hope importeth much wee haue sight stayed vpon thing present although al thing order yet wee must quietly abide god pleasure eliphas groundeth vpon point consider course world shal see god hath al time punished wicked true wee haue oftentimes sayde god hath alwaies giuen token iudgements keepe men awe far hereof make generall rule contrarie reason truth let v come againe hath bin alreadie begon handled eliphas speaking wicked attributed vnto pride vtterly refuse god wil haue come neere vtter woordes mouth bicause abyde god bring vnder subiection seene till time god hath tamed men holie spirite beare yoake euery man woulde haue libertie hee listeth heere mencion made whiche haue bene hardened long time wearie good doctrine hate would wishe might neuer heare wordes number men hath alwayes ben great day furthermore gone far astray refuse doctrine god al thing spite withal though could nothing say almightie doo vnto v truth spue blasphemie yet walke boldly like murderer care threatning make mocke thing vntill hand god vrge constraine go still wickednesse much shoulde affirme cared thing god vnto bee short see eliphas ment declare farre men passe bound haue continued mischief become diuelish ca abide bee admonished brought right way namely defie god though hee authoritie ouer onely place see would god exaple therof eye let v note hath ben touched namely holy ghost ment shew v glasse whether men fall headlong long time noozeled sin say suche brutish beastlinesse runne head god remorse conscience paule saith conscieces rocked fast sleepe make doubt thing serueth end walke feare pray vnto god suffer v come extremitie let v go foreward saying eliphas asketh iob whither haue marked way men whither hath taken good heede expound sentence though eliphas reproched iob folowing fashioning like vnto deceiued rather intendeth say iob man altogither without iudgement doubteth whither god punisheth wicked seing hath alwaies perceiued doth herein deceiued hee saieth alwaies might haue well bene yet god hath ceassed reserue many punishment vnto time come ouerthrew citie sodome others neere vnto hath done like al townes giue ouer euill truly send flud ouer al world yea yet see haue ceassed prouoke vengeance vpon yea must appoint law punish sinnes alwaies alike deale pleaseth must cotent selues order taketh yea truly haue shewed reserued punishment would seeme iudgemet come accouts al thing wer perfectly restored worlde wished thing mislike would resurrectio therfore behoueth god vse meanes onely giue v exaples whereby may know sinnes shall remayne vnpunished whereas delayeth v holdeth v suspence till latter day end wee fixe mindes beneth though thing alredy accoplished wished brief summe eliphas mindeth say verse hast thou marked wayes worlde worde world signifieth sometimes antiquitie shuld say god beginneth punish wicked history old time shew v hath alwaies done long ago since sodome gomorrha perished long ago since fludde know thou god hath brought world vnder rule deale men according desert furthermore eliphas hauing spoke punishmet despisers god gone far order mocked power doth yet aggrauate malice sayeth neuerthelesse god hath filled house treasure men bound vnto god might wel excuse theselues yeeld theselues subiect vnto excuse taken away men guiltie vnthankfulnesse must need remaine amazed hauing perceiued god faire meanes draweth vnto yet haue set theselues would meanes abide winne see eliphas ment saying god filled house treasure true men generally bouden vnto god asmuch created placed worlde mainteyned god declareth himselfe vnto man peculiarly done make much inexcusable howe thus man prosperitie god sendeth thing would wishe man hath lesse cause murmure agaynst god afflicted tormented many wayes riche menne liue ease turne head againe play restie iades certaine compted haynous offence without cause gentle handeling god hath thus shewed vnto ought soften heart although stubburne nature fearcenesse yet god intreated gentily hee meant winne gentlenesse seing wilde offence doubled eliphas ment place therefore let v parte learne way aright grace god bestoweth vpon v benefites whiche receyue hande vnto v many warning yeelde selues obedient farre forth honour commit gouernement maystership ouer v handes bounde vnto mortall man although hee vsurpe authoritie ouer v handes wee bee bounde vnto mortall man although vsurpe authoritie ouer v yet wee take handes bound wil say nature teacheth v much shall acknowledge selues bouden vnto god benefites hath bestowed vpon v hath created fashioned v maintayneth v many wayes sheweth himselfe father vnto v yelde vnto owe therefore haue already touched let euery v looke well selfe consider benefites god hathe bestowed vpon ende may helpes vn v bring v obedience may peaceably raigne ouer v guyde v meanes rebell agaynste specially god shall haue dealt fauourablie v poured liberalitie vpon v let serue make v tractable vnto let v desire god estraunge v shoulde become v think benefites haue receyue proceede nothing else god neere vnto v god v good thing coulde haue seing commeth state condition men miserable assay flee fro presence god seeing seeke nothing mischiefe vvherefore let v learne humble selues god shall haue filled v treasure let v horse fatte kick agaynst mayster god vpbraydeth iewes moyses song let v like vnto horse whiche well fed let v submit selues vnder subiection god knowing although wee haue receyued great number good thing hande minute houre bring v pouertie haue made v fatte wee may short space become leane needeth blow vpon v behold wealth shal vanish away seeing let v walke alwayes feare acknowledging good thing wee inioy come god homage knowing wee could inioye pleased continue grace fauour towardes v thus rich shall happie blissed honour pleasure suche like thing shall meanes make men droke bring asleepe rather make watchfull put thing god hand say lorde truthe hitherto thou hast vsed suche goodnesse towardes v wee haue liued ease thou shouldest turne away thy face behold vtterly vndon lord thou hast maintayned v preserued v vnto time let please thee continue euen ende eliphas sayth destroyed time foundation riuer runne vvee shall see sometime happen despisers god whe haue hoped attayne vnto maruelous thing god shall throw downe shall bee disapointed vayne hope shall haue conceyued vvee see yea although god suffer wicked liue die prosperitie purpose consider present life pray continuance vve liue deede yet man shal alwayes holy scripture describeth say hearbe greene assoone winde bloweth vpon withereth away assoone sythe passeth ouer grasse becommeth haye sappe dried vp perisheth nedeth one broyling heate sunne burnt vp knowing frailtie life ought thinke strange bee compared riuer runne dried vp riuer whiche runneth suche wise water shortly suche wee haue seene bee naturall thing eliphas speaketh riuer broken bankes afterward drieth vp hath course euen fare wicked whiche become bold thinke shall neuer fayle shall wasted shall remayne one droppe strength wee take sentence according minde eliphas wee may gather good profitable doctrine place say although god punish wicked first euen life spareth yet ceasse like vnto riuer runneth soundnesse yea shall perish theyr time time bycause persuade themselues shal liue heere euer thinke thier felicitie shall continue alwayes god cutteth life laugheth scorne say soule fill thy selfe thinke swallow vp whole worlde shall strawe breadth liues ende god throweth downe without cause sayth perish tyme disapoynted hope promise themselues long life god cutteth shorte sayde man shoulde cutte threede weauers webbe seemeth threede shoulde go still wee see weauers worke apace threde breaketh webbe ceaseth happeneth lyfe man thinke go forward seemeth vnto v shall neuer haue ende wee become dronken selues beholde meane season god cutteth threede let v minde doctrine wee knowe shortnesse lyfe wee may consider heauenly enheritance promised v expectation may bee settled knowing lay foundation worlde haue great surenesse bicause builde vpon water ayre muste vanishe away wee see god punisheth presumption buyld world put trust thing present sheweth nothing else buyld water ayre wee haue sayd nothing kingdome heaue certaine vnchageable vve must grounded true stay scripture speaketh brief note wee haue marke place wee may yet profit doctrine lette v way saying time wicked shall bee destroyed time bycause god taketh hence pul vp rootes force fasten themselues vpo earth though neuer taken away take roote onely imagination wicked despisers god shall take roote pryde shall thinke haue foundation hundreth foote deepe earth impossible shake yea god wil giue little fillup shal ouerthrowne roote imagined without cause sayeth wicked perish tyme neuerthelesse let v hold fast hath bene shewed say time continue long perceyue god represse wicked despisers maiestie let v therfore discouraged let v walke still suffer god vse libertie witte seeme good vnto let chastise wicked worlde let iudgement hidden v vntill wee come latter day thing shall disclosed eliphas sayeth moreouer rightuous shall see laugh innocent shall make mocke seemeth first sight couenient seing child god ought folow heauely father vve know god inclined mercie pitie men mocke afflicted without crueltie holy ghost attributeth affection childre god mocke wicked see throwne let v note first al behold iudgements god aright take profite thereby must purged carnall affection must led desire vengcace moued excessiue passion wee wont muste bee ameded v must haue pure cleere sight behold doings god thus disposed may without crueltie mocke wicked whe god destroyeth deede wee muste like well iudgements god finding good wee muste also reioyce bycause saluatio thereby aduaced god thereby declareth loue hee beareth v let v learne god punisheth sinnes wicked wee haue matter reioyce yea wee muste knowe wherefore two cause haue cause reioyce god thereby declareth himselfe iudge glorie maiesty therby appeare lo matter reioysing oft god sheweth himselfe giueth v triall strength power glorifie behoueth v reioyce greater ioy require presence god thus draw neare vnto v second cause god thereby declareth hath care ouer v ouer child whe punisheth enemy troubled v delt outrageously v god chastising wicked doth ratify cofirme loue beareth good faithfull againe secod cause ioy yet wee must haue sayd cleane purged desire vengeance malice short haue put al flesh spirit god guydeth v shall haue right pure zeale reioyce fall wicked take profite iudgements god yet one thing noted sayd righteous shal mocke god ouerthroweth destroyeth ment afflicted many whome god chastiseth wealth whiche men altogither past amendment punisheth body ende soules might perish heere mention made reprobate vve know god hath vtterly reiected except shew vnto v sodome gomorrha destroyed floud wee haue certaine testimonie extreme vengeance god place repentance left wretched person bycause made themselues vnworthie mercie like may reioyce god shal chastise neighbour wee knowe yet whether wil haue pitie must haue copassion misery moued iudgements god may conceyue hope send release afflicted bee shorte thus muste wee put texte practise true doctrine thus briefly touched might bee darke euery man note well whiche haue touched may afterwarde large thinke thing thus briefly touched may neuerthelesse content v first haue sayd wee must vse gentlenesse towards neighbour wish health sorie euils paule teacheth v rule charity requireth lamet sayth suffer see child god haue alwayes affectio zeale yet see god punisheth sinnes may also reioyce yea much god therein declareth sheweth himselfe vnto v sayth must bee ratified confirmed see hath care ouer mankind thing guyded followeth substance consumed true worde worde substance bee consumed bidden hebrue worde signifieth two thing properly signifieth hide bycause thing hid seene semeth quite gone likenesse betweene signifieth somtimes cut bring nothing furthermore seemeth ought haue sayde substance destroyed referring wicked deede place translated greekes wee beholde narrowly seemeth natiue sense yet substance bidden let v note maner speach muche vsed among hebrues whiche importeth greater affirmation sayd yea certaine substance hid also worde substance importeth state wee haue hande way preserue v restore v ouerpasse exposition giue vpon place whiche doo agree let v simply hold eliphas meneth say maketh comparison rightuous wicked faythfull despisers god concerning faythfull sayeth truth substance hidden hee vseth worde de hee meaneth substance perished lost contrariwise layd vp safetie treasure commeth passe midst many danger wee yet remayne vpright vpholden wee vnder wing god short secrete layd vp treasure certain life euery minute houre take fro v one way haue good doctrine whe shal thus vnderstaded according sense texte thus shall righteous say substace state say power mayntaine v preserue v hidden left vnto wicked deuoured fyre say god leaueth nothing al somuch must needes destroyed wealth true mortal life may seeme fwallowed vp quite ouerwhelmed great distresse short haue nother stregth substace much must practise doctrine apply right vse following paule teacheth v namely dead life hidden paule shewing state codition faithfull whyles world sayeth life hidde hidde good storehouse sayeth hidde god sauiour iesus christ life iesus christ heaue glorious bodie raysed vp made manifest vnto v loke wher iesus christ kingdome shall perceiue naturall wit become neuerthelesse seing life hidde heaue iesus christ may bee well assured wee note first place god minding proue faith hope suffer v bee copassed many danger life hang vpo threede windes carie away substance euery way shorte steade hauing one drop life hee wil suffer v haue thousand death eye shall thinke perish thousand wayes let v feare seing god kepeth v vnder shadow long haue place retire vnto shal good safetie thus must wee practise doctrine afterward cast eye vpo wicked behold destruction let v muche assured god goodnesse take occasio much magnifie saying lorde priuilege thou hast giuen v seing life thy hand thou art become keeper therof yet wherein differ see co sumed see come destructio see left vnto cleane wasted lord wherin differ nothing truly sauing thy meere mercie hath pleased thee choose v vnto thy self thine inheritance thou mainteynest v giuest v grace walke thy obedience thou doest continue benefit v thou hast begone guydest v way saluation fro whence lorde cometh wealth yet see priuiledge thou giuest v though wee exempted fro misery frayle life asthough wee counted amongst men lord seing thou doest honour bestowest benefite vpon v must needes magnifie goodnesse thine towardes v thus say wee haue knowen fauour god sheweth faythfull seruants ought much confirmed therein also stirred vp giue thankes bycause done vnlesse wee beholde destruction wicked reioyce thereat therefore also good v knowe god punisheth wicked poureth token vengeance vpon done assure v fatherly fauour loue hee beareth v warde nowe eliphas hath thus spoken exhorteth iob acquaint himselfe god bee peace saying shall turne prosperitie addeth receyue lawe god place wordes harte saying iob acquaint himselfe god meaning hee earst withdrawne saying hee peace signifieth wicked life hee declared himselfe enimie god euill applied person haue already seene yet doctrine selfe true profitable howe first heere declared vnto v menne runne astry muche estranged themselues god therfore giuen ouer vice wee spyte god let vnto doth drawe neere vnto v much take leaue el runne away without taking leaue deede without cause scripture sayeth men haue feare god eye knowe god take libertie vnto themselues vvee see men growe wilde become brute beast nomore houshold god yet thinke good case departed long thinke vpo vice sinnes thus much first secodly shewed v make warre god needeth herault trumpette make solemne defiance men shewe themselues mortall enimies god wage warre agaynst oft runne astray pepart obedience subiects rise vp king pray warre much wicked bene colour reason solemnity obserued wont bee nowe men giue ouer theselues wickednesse put themselues armes god certayne looke many wicked affection lustes v many men armes haue ready fight god iustice much behoueth v note well thys place wit take vnto selues libertie euill take away al familiaritie wee haue god become wylde beastes stray vnder hande obedience yet greater mischiefe square willingly wittingly raunge selues battell agaynste god behold horrible thyng creature lift vp himselfe hath fashioned shall get shal haue victorie see well worse madde seing wee ceasse yet run thus ragingly haue note vpon place contrary part let v follow exhortation giuen v heere whiche time haue gone way lustes haue caused v stray scatter abrode become wilde beast god lay hande v wee haue kept selfe vnder gouernement behoueth v let v seke acquaint selues say lette v indeuer winde selues familiaritie shall done know god calleth v vnto woorde seeth bee gone astray way sayeth come agayne come agayne god causing worde preached vnto v tedeth end make v ame whereas wee haue bene wilde say taught layd hande first vvhen haue learned lesson wee shall haue profited well whole life wherto tendeth whole holy scripture make v famililiar god true oure god part doth shew himselfe familiar nothing nurse mother doth onely compare himselfe father louing gentle childre sayth also mother nurse seing god vseth familiaritie v let v lyke wylde beastes wee haue bene let v cotinue still see haue bene froward madde moue warre agaynst sinnes lette v seeke meanes bee peace shall lyeth v hee muste preuent v infinite goodnesse vvhich thing hee doth gospell preached whiche named doctrine peace paule speaketh message reconciliation seeyng god calleth v owne good preueteth v tarying til come seeke peace cometh v seeketh nothing else reconciled v let v vngracious reiect vnkindnesse make acc pt benefit offereth vntoo v let v wyth true humilitie yeeld ourselues subiect vnto knowing ready receyue v name sauiour iesus christ cause v feele wil gentle pitifull father vnto v true childre nowe let v fall downe face good god acknowledgemet fault knowing would deale rigorously v wee hundreth time swallowed vp also worthy maynteyned mortal life therefore muche lesse worthy heauenly inheritance infinite glory hee hath prepared v heauen acknowledging sinnes vnbeleefe wherevnto wee much inclyned let v pray mercie please beare v vntill attonement made betweene v wee may take profit chastisement hee sendeth world may alwayes acknowledge iudge worlde leaue iniquity vnpunished long euer tarie ende meanes wee child may bee moued feare honour father knowing hee prepareth v eternall inheritance heauen notwithstanding poore miserable state worlde may please graut grace v also people c lxxxvij sermon fifth vpon xxij chapter sermon still vpon xxij verse afterward vpon text hereunto annexed thou returne almightie thou shalt buy vp dryue avvay iniquitie far thy tent thou shalt lay golde vpon dust pebble stone riuer golde ophir almightie shall driue away thine enimies thou shalt haue strong fortresse thou shalt take pleasure almightie lift thy handes god thou shalt make thy prayer vnto hee shall heare thee thou shalt pay thy vovves thou shalt determine thing shall established vnto thee light shall shine vpo thy vvayes vvicked bee throvvne dovvne lifted vp god shall saue looke lovvly innocent shall deliuer countrie shall bee preserued purenesse thy handes according haue already declared wee must take exhortation made vnto v shew v true repentance surely eliphas hath misapplied person iob yet holy ghoste meant deliuer v generall doctrine one might greatly profite v heere haue seene bee acquaynted god man hath gone astray men giue ouer themselues euill quite forget god turne backe become wilde men like runne astray sorte doo alienate themselues god must wee acquaynt selues suffering gouerne v shewing selues easie bee guyded wee may become like lammes play wilde beastes hee giueth v signe come vntoo eliphas hath spoken thus hee addeth hee whiche hathe gone astray ought take lawe mouth god place woordes hearte notable poinct rule good life heare god speake vnto v knowe way whiche hee sheweth v whiche ought holde seeing men go astray way saluation soone swarue lawe god therefore sayde expressely place wee muste receyue lawe mouth howebeeit asmuche allowing whiche spoken vnto v wee haue eliphas addeth wee must settle heartes although man yeelde himselfe obedience god concerning outwarde appearance chiefe poinct wee knowe shall greatly aduauntage v abstayne doyng euill onely touching eye handes feete harte muste go guyde reste vvill wee profite well schoole god worde must take deepe roote heartes according sayde hee regardeth truth contrariwise abhorreth hypocrisie nowe wee see wise wee muste turne god wee haue bene bannished say wee must become scholers mayster thereby wee may gather whiche walke according pure worde god gone astray although men allow well wee see oftentimes men thinke nothing holinesse whiche followe owne foolish deuotions hath beene ordinarie abuse euen fro beginning worlde raigneth yet day muche men needes gouerned pleasure yet thinke doings ought well allowed god contrariwise auouched heere sayde whiche walke according woorde god gone astray doubt perswade themselues life good holy may bee men clappe handes token like well one onely competent iudge giue sentence cafe authoritie whiche god wee heare hee pronounceth therefore wee must replie iustifie foolishe deuotion say wee thinke suche thing good owne fancy must bee layde downe wee muste harken god sayeth suffer haue mastership ouer v shewe v way hee haue v followe wee muste first learne true doctrine oftentimes tolde v yet without cause holy ghost speaketh much wee see howe men wedded owne alwayes wise owne conceytes wee finde heart giue god honour haue mastership ouer v wee subiects thus prouerbe sayeth commaunded v become diuels seruants let v examine thing termed name god seruice papistrie vvhat shall man finde meere inuentions menne one syllable holy scripture warrant thing wherein papist trauayle much acceptable vntoo god cleane contrarie yet wee see howe wedded wherefore reason sayd diuelish pryde men abyde bee subiect god receyue lawe mouthe true firste say good reason god shoulde haue dominion ouer v yet wee see rebellion vse vvherefore striuing adayes bycause require nothing bee added diminished pure law deliuered v fro heaue papist could cotented gouerned pure doctrine god soone agree togither disputation wil haue lawes statute obserued meane season none accompt bee made whiche god ordeyneth matter whereaboutes striue although know abuse superstition men walke owne yet notwithstanding men bee stayed go still beyond measure see hard thing stay bridle bowing neckes downe caces receyue yoake god lay vpon yea haue cast tirannie pope cannot quietly yeeld selues obedient vnto god without gainsaying thing seeme bee hard troublesome wee kicke agaynst maketh v bolde bycause suche wilfull loftinesse presumption mindes men cannot content themselues simple lawe god see needfull v oftentimes put remembrance point wete must hearke god speaketh vnto v hereby put mind wee like wretched beast neither wisedom discretion v neuer knowe right way till god reache hand vnto v shew v way walke thus muche one poynt furthermore also declared vnto v shall still bee caried away euil affection till wee haue learned inured selues obey god without gainsaying replie long wee reserue libertie selues cannot bee chosen wee muste striue swel rankle doctrine god presse v muche witte beyond capacitie vvhat must let v lay v striuing fayre reason inuent defence fancy wicked lustes let v become meeke lambes suffer god handle v list sone shal giue v token come vntoo finally shewed v must like shaking reedes suffer selues led way way according papist deede confesse must follow whiche god comaundeth mixte therewithall owne foolishe toyes yea worse thing esteeme men inuentions holy scripture despised thereby make cofused mixture al thing man canot tell preuayle god haue touched holy ghost maketh distinction betweene god creature signifiyng wee shall neuer well gouerned haue right reformation liues vnlesse god aboue reigne ouer v become teacher master know whole perfectio life cosisteth simple obeying thus much cocerning saying must also beare wel remebrance eliphas addeth cocerning settling god lawe heart haue already touched seruice god make fayr shews men may well iustifie v whe see nothing v reproue bicause canot behold secrete affectios peculiar vnto god search men hart although men deeme v angel yet hart bee right pure settled vprightnesse soundnesse whereof scripture speaketh much rest shall vanish away like smoake leade holy life wee muste begin feete yet hads say refrayne self euill sort found blame worthy euery v must enter know euill appetite rebellious god canot raigne ouer v vntil suche time quite put away let v see purge heart end may walke soudly god inted bring forth good fruit al life log let v looke first good roote ment whe sayd liue spirit walke also according spirite set downe life afterward workes vve must first liue spirit god say spirite god must dwell v beate downe contrarie worde god rightuousnesse afterward must appeare whole conuersatio life men may know tree bringing forth fruit cause also sayd worde god hath propertie sharpe two edged sword examine trie euen maree may nother thought affection men bee wholly discouered also place sayd profite woorde god ought reproued themselues say must appeare god present themselues heauenly seate discouer offence hidde cause haue specially declared profite well schoole god wee must take woorde heart followeth thou returne vnto almighty thou shalt buylt shalt driue away iniquitie far thy tent afterward thou shalt lay golde vpon dust thou shalt haue store gold ophir pebble stone riuer eliphas better stirre vp iob sheweth profit shal come vnto shall conuerted vnto god wee must alwaies leaue person iob bicause thing euill applied vntoo yet doctrine ceaseth good v meete saluation accordingly see god vseth like stile whe exhorteth v repetance wit doth simply commaunde v addeth promisse intent incourage v better vnto deede heare onely dutie certified god good toward v would meane stay v hinder v wee haue zeale affectio draw neere vnto god vvhen man doubte knoweth whether shall doo himselfe good coming vnto god hee becometh carelesse therfore may willing returne right way wee must assured god doth wayte vpon v ready receyue v yea doth already reach hand vnto v haue assurance selues wee moue one finger breadth much lesse ca come vnto wee ought nay rather worse men alwayes assay runne backe doubt good god yea maiestie shal fearful vnto conceiue mindes god deale rigorously v iudge vve must need afraid runne much possible v thus short see vnles haue tasted fatherly goodnesse god assured hee ready receyue v mercie man shall neuer cause v much ome repentance cause specially sayd place iob returne god wil blisse euery way whereas hath bene spoyled substance shal enriched agayne euer shall haue plenty golde siluer shall haue thing god prosper shall nothing cause ioy thankesgiuing vve see briefly minde eliphas namely iob shold stirred vp returne vnto god coceyuing sayd good hope shall come vaine disapointed seeking god bycause alwayes ready forgiue v offence whe runne vnto infinite goodnesse blot sinnes true eliphas doothe alwayes passe measure thinketh god maketh loueth prosper alike world great ouersight wee see god afflicteth proueth pacience making subiect ny misery yet al ceaseth loue therfore must deceiue themselues imagining god sende heart desire e mercyfull vnto must come againe sayde law wit like aduersities scourge punish sinnes contrariwise receyueth v vnto come repentance shall handled louingly hee cause v prosper farre forth shall expedient saluatio howsoeuer doctrine true profitable returne vnto god iniquitie shall driuen v meanes shall prosper cause thus afflicted one pouertie disease many torment layd bycause god father taketh pleasure dealing roughly v surely therfore bicause wee meete enioy benefit whiche hee hath prepared v ready bestow vpon v seeth wee abyde deale v according naturall inclination say send v wee would desire wealth health ease would become drunken pleasure kick god horse well fedde pampered god perceyuing vse wel benefit bestoweth vpon v cutteth bycause niggard haue sayd bicause knoweth beare costrayned bestow benefit vpon v small portion end may hunger thirst bicause inclined spend riotously also followeth wicked tayle spiritual drunkennesse make accompt become wanton ca enjoy v cause afflicted many wayes furthermore let v consider offence euery one v committeth god let v alone vncorrected one man would fal asleepe sinnes become hardened boldenesse would increase god pe ceyuing bare much v hee suffer v runne destruction findeth remedie mischiefe therefore wee muche beholding bounde vntoo short constraine god deale rigorously v doth wee would giue place goodnes certain would make v prosper euery way world vnto v earthlie paradise nothing rest ioy wee haue cause always lift vp ourheads according mentio made heere cause sayd retourne vnto god wil chaunge aduersities misery welth life shal happy wee shall haue cause reioyce fully giue thanks hath bin good father vnto v haue found suche one brief summe place haue good profitable lesson gather whiche huble selues oft afflicted wee wont snappe god chafing fretting done v great wrog feele want thing necessary maynteynace familie matter come passe according minde displeased murmureth heart god bee stricken disease yet oppressed pouertie man shal heare murmuring euery side thus fleshe prouoketh v alwayes pricketh v forward kicke agaynst god wherefore bycause wee consider chastizing v purpose bring v knowledge sinnes end wee sigh selues ashamed euils haue committed dayly doo committe retourne vntoo desiring pardon furthermore wee must apply vse whiche hath bene touched say god seing v slowe nature returne vnto gone calleth v louingly vnto putteth v good comfort shal receiued seke vaine vvhat wil haue haue offended god deserue cast yea although aske forgiuenesse hundred thousande time yet might hee refuse v sith contrariwise cometh v assuring v requireth nothing else one v wil seke attonemet already wholly disposed thervnto must needes followe verie hardharted stifnecked wee come vnto yeeld selues wholly hart mind furthermore let v note wel remedy v retourne vnto god call remembrance promise maketh v otherwise always flee haue sayd although made shewe though wee displeased sinnes hartebiting remorse conscience wicked life yet could neuer haue minde change life zeale giue selues vnto god vnlesse know wil mercifull vntoo v thing profitable v neuerthelesse ill practised day exa ple amongst papist talking repentace knowe diuell hathe bewitched repentace nothing else fast certain dayes mumble vp certain pater nosters play hypocrite true repetance forsake self put old skin bee wholly renued outwarde apperance inwarde affection vtterly vnknowne amongst papist howbeeit let v graunt know repentance must retourne vntoo god yet want principall poynt doo assure wretched sinner god wil merciful vnto nother know grace mercie talke much dooing penance aduentures seing knowe whether bee loste time whether shall winne thing indeuering retourne vntoo god shall come euen haue shewed scripture declareth vntoo v sufficiently namely men may well tourne cote shall neuer drawe neere vnto god good pure sound affectio vnlesse perswaded fatherly loue towards according sayd psalme lorde thou shalt neuer bee feared neyther euer obey thee til know thy goodnesse vve see profitable present lesson v better expresse hesayth expressely man shal reioyce god afterward shall call vpon hee shall heard shall pay vowes saying ought wel weighed said retourne right way shall reioyce god putteth difference betwene felicitie child world vnfaithfull imagin felicitie god giueth v vnto child vnfaithful haue aboundance welth bee rest god giue health therwithall thinke selues happie therfore mindes ascende higher carnal earthly men beholde thing present thus caught satan nettes thing come passe according mind cocerning worlde ynough v wee desire life happie think yea felicitie surmise beholde cotrariwise god affirmeth happy know become mercifull vntoo v receiue welth hande giue thankes acknowledging recordes goodnesse loue toward v worldling reioyce glorie earthly good looke farther one god haue al hart desire heere contrariwise although faythfull thing heere possible bee imagined yet would stay thervpo vvherfore haue respect vnto principall witte whither god loue become father indeede good worlde haue tast sauour bee seasoned goodnes god vndoubtedly true sauce men terme make v feele good taste benefites god sendeth v v acknowledge goodnes loue take many recordes saluatio vvho vnfaythfull haue table wel furnished eate drink play glutton take farther care pleasure cramming themselues whe haue spet time must eyther returne feasting againe else go sleepe bee shorte worldling merrie forget god conclude one worde cannot bee merry playing brute beastes must cast sleepe may haue regard god whe intend refresh ease themselues cotrariwise although faithfull man haue meate drinke yet hath delight therein acknowledge therby god fosterfather saying seing hee hath care fraile weake body foloweth wil much rather haue care soule much deerer vnto world wee bee stranger vouchsafe reache hand vnto v v gathered vnto kingdom faithful man haue consideration care anguish minde nother eate drink happy sayeth salomon hath cheerful hart poureth god possible man reioyce merrie god wholly repose self vpon able conclude god loueth surely reioycing wordlings rather brutish beastlynes true ioy deed fee euident experience whe part eate drinke go euen like brute beast hog sty whe swil brought hee filleth belly long meat lasteth muche doeth oxe asse euen part world adayes deuour benefit god without prayer without thanks giuing without acknowledging faithfull cotrariwise thinke god knowing well meates turne condemnatio sure haue meere fauour god otherwise inioying good robbing god prayer supplication acknowledge come fro truth theceremony ynough many day pray giue thankes god mouth heart meane season one whit touched therwith speake looke rightly vnto god beholding meates acknowledge theselues saying god maketh v partaker benefit vpon codicion child well wee inioy part enheritance earnest peny hee giueth v assure v hath created thing sake child must imputed vnto v theft yea high treason faithful enter teptation thervpo must need stricken great sadnesse anguish mind cannot swalow downe one crume bread mirth contentation wee haue note vpon place sayd truely conuerted shal reioyce god according also sayde lawe thou shalt eate drink presence thy god shale merry also god doth well seperate child faythful one vnfaithfull shewing although wicked haue meate drink abundantly yet cease accursed deynties pleasure shall bee turned confusio let v tempted become like vnto leade happy life rightly inioy benefit god bestoweth vpon v wee must haue eye homage know sheweth self fosterfather causeth v feele goodnes end might drawen vp higher alwayes assured fatherlie loue hee beareth v bee short corruptible benefites whiche bestoweth vpon v world might help lifte v vp heauen lay holde vpon eternall life whereunto oure good god hath called v farthermore meanes howe reioyce aright god also immediatly expressed namely calling vpon paying vowes vnto hee hath hearde v good profitable declaration ioye inasmuch nothing else curse god benefites receyue hande vnlesse taste goodnesse wee may reioyce wholly repose content selues standeth v hand consider well howe may atteyne vnto true meanes expressed must first call vpon afterwarde paye vowes hee hath hearde v two thing perteyning dutie thirde promise god maketh v shal call vpon vaine prayer voyde vnprofitable end therfore whereat must beginne pray vntoo god yea euen wee reache handes one way eate drinke begin ende thats say calling vpon god certaynly order peruerted let v learne cheefe exercise studie whiche faythfull ought haue worlde runne vnto god acknowledging bee fountaine goodnesse seeke protesting looke much one drop welfare eyther bodie soules giuen free mercie goodnesse vvhen haue learned well lesson wee shall inflamed pray vnto god otherwayes see howe necessitie vrgeth v sorte maner wittes endes euery man confesse pouerties affliction wherewith wee inuironed infinite yet howe slacke slowe wee praye vnto god whereas hundred thousande cause one daye vrge v pray vnto god scarcely doo thinke three foure tymes yet coldly nothing bee therefore wee shall haue profited greatly wee haue learned lesson practise behoueth v protesting benefites receyue hande longeth vnto giue v ende wee shoulde go vnto doubting wont promisse added therevntoo hee immediatly heare v without promise al prayer nothing else meere hypocrisie pray vnto god witnessing fayth vvell doubt wauer stand mammering know whither god heare v certaine wee haue fayth wee take name god vayne forasmuche prayer whiche ought bee testimonie saythe declareth nought else vncertaintie v nother muste thinke hee heare v wee go suche sorte deede one cheefe article christian beleefe assure selues god promise hee readie receyue oure prayer time often come vnto beeing perswaded taryeth v requireth nothing else shoulde seeke gate open vnto v wee come vntoo name oure lorde iesus christe heereby seene christen leefe hath bene abolished vnder pope yet still present speake muche theyr praying vntoo god certayntie haue shall bee hearde none contrariwise ashamed say wee muste go doubtingly say opinion euen greate doctours onely ideotes say presum tuousnesse pray vnto god stedfast beleefe hee heare v shall obteine request surely horrible trayterousnesse men wauer gaze praye vntoo god heereof commeth superstitiousnesse wee muste haue patrones make intercession v vntoo god besides euerye man priuate patrone must also haue speciall warrant haue neuer doone vvhen haue patched peeced toogither knowe whiche side turne wherevnto hold greate clerkes ende beginning knowe whither haue gotten thing theyr praying vnto god furthermore neuer praye vntoo god serue laste patrones aduocates muste haue firste wordes first frutes prayer cheefe seruice god requireth v thing wee conuey ouer vntoo creature god hath refuse mennes leauings co mon dealing popedome onely ideots haue sayde greatest clerkes follower diuelish doctrine mainteyned see christian beleefe hath bin destroyed abolished therefore muche ought magnifie goodnesse god plucking v bottomlesse pittes much better ought wee sticke doctrine declared heere beleeue stedfastlye wee shall seeke oure god vaine wee call vpon truth bycause forasmuchas hee telleth v hee heare v yea hee tary vntill open mouth holdeth hand already stretched helpe v neede speaketh prophet esay cause promise oftentymes repeated holye scripture withoute reason soeuer god promised men cannot bee perswaded hee wyll heare bee shorte wee cannot gyue credit vnto god oure owne lye wee beleeue muche cause god ratifieth promise hath made hee heare v wee muste note ende god gracious vnto v readye helpe v necessity ende wee shoulde paye vowes say wee shoulde oure thankesgiuing proteste thing thing wee bounde vntoo woorde vowe importeth solemne recorde men yeelde declaring haue thing god gifte aboue cannot require god agayne presente thing saue onely prayse thanks sayd psalme vvhat shall giue vnto lorde benefites haue receyued receyue cuppe saluation call vppon name vvee see god requireth nothing v wee shoulde doo homage benefites acknowledge liberalitie muche extoll mercye whiche hee hath vsed towards v thus way v reioyce oure god knowing muche wee beholding vnto giue thankes benefites thereby stirred vp acknowledge heereafter father honour homage due vnto assuring oure selues hee neuer faile v seeing haue felt good mercifull continue still onely hee make v knowe worlde wee haue put truste vayne trulie perfitly inioye goodnesse shall haue gathered v heauenly kingdome hath purchased vnto v lorde iesus christ nowe lette v fall downe face good god acknowledgement faultes praying touche v holy spirite offence paste may bee abolished meere goodnesse also beare v dayes oure lyfe vntill suche time hauing whollye clothed v rightuousnesse transformed v intoo image hee make glory shine v wee may feele frute inheritance nowe promised v lette v say almightie god heauenly father thou haste promised heare oure requestes whiche wee make vnto thee name thy sonne c lxxxviij sermon first vpon xxiij chapter sermon conteyneth yet thing concerneth three last verse afterward text followeth iob ansvvering sayde although talke day bitternesse plague passeth groning knevve finde hovveto come vnto seate vvould pleade cace fill mouth vvith argument knovve vvhat vvould ansvvere vnderstand vvhat vvould say vnto mee vvould debate matter vvith force vvould put strength mee rightuous shall debate vvith acquitted euer haue conferre last saying eliphas answere iob whiche wee haue hearde eliphas behalf maintaineth god alwayes knowe rightuous onely shewe fauor whole cuntry sake iob answereth although extremely delt god bicause hee hath deserued proofe therof sayth leaue libertie pleade cace would well declare sinnes god doth punish two contrary saying treated nowe touching firste saying eliphas true god hath promised shew himselfe mercifull towarde serue pure hart shal extend owne person also family yea whole cuntries yet notwithstading followeth god bind himselfe one certaine rule see trieth pacience seruantes indeuer obey euery point dealeth hee one rate haue declared heere deed although sayd cuntry shall deliuered cleannesse one man band heare prophet ezechiell say contrariwise iob daniel noe towne shall deliuer theyr owne soules yet child perish seemeth deede prophet hath respect vnto place heere shewe god bounde saue cuntrie one man sake may happen wil owne libertie appoint law thing vnreasonable truth sayd abraham could haue bene founde fiue rightuouse men sodome god would haue spared whole citie sake although filled horrible sinnes yet god woulde haue vsed vengeance whiche written moyses therevpon eliphas intendeth conclude alwaies ofte one righteous cuntrie sake cuntry shal saued ought racked far haue declared bee shorte let v learne teporall promise coteined holie scripture say whiche concerne state lyfe present general shold alwaies stay vpo god reserueth fulnesse grace faithfull lyfe come ynoughe haue taste nother shoulde theyr profite bee altogither filled benefites worlde felicitie woulde wish hath bin declared large heretofore woulde become v euerye man woulde fall asleepe hope wee haue heauenly life woulde bee layd water yea quite abolished therefore needefull god shoulde waken v affliction ende might thinke vpon euerlasting heritage promised v lifte vp mindes therevnto end behoueth v exercised many aduersities cause sayde muste rest peremptorily vpo certaintie promise presente life god distributeth vntoo v according knoweth expedient v hauing alwaies eye infirmitie neuerthelesse god also prosper minded serue make feele grace shall haue aforehand pledge inestimable benefites prepared heauen yet muste set mind vpon pledge againe please god afflict suche haue walked vprightly must therfore shrinke away hart coclude god hath shaken rather must consider meanes god intendeth drawe kill fleshly affection cut superfluity worldward end shoulde better dispozed passe settle themselues thing present thus must alwayes cheere vp ourselues mids affliction make gayne god causeth v feele fauour considering ynough v haue promise fulnesse therof must shewed welfare heereby see iob iust cause rebuke eliphas maner neuerthelesse excedeth measure done heeretofore better perceiued word vseth hee sayeth although wordes bitter yet doeth plage indureth farre passe groning complaynt vvhereby meeneth maketh right greeuous complaint yet men looke vpon aduersitie wey wel shall find farre greeuouser complaint short iob intended excuse co plained sore could refraine himselfe assuage owne sorrow sheweth hath good cause bee excessiue bicause miserie whiche hee indureth dooth yet farre exceede complaintes might well borne withall immediately entreth old byasse wherin haue seene heretofore would fayne go lawe god shewe hee might atteyne haue leaue mayneteyne owne cace well ynough co clusion quit cleered sayeth god woulde vse force againste mee deale mee order lawe might haue hearing shoulde immediatly gayne vpper hande matter would hard vnderstande wee called remembrance hath bene sayde heretofore wit although god alwayes rightuous yet two sortes one whiche hath declared v lawe rightuousnesse whereby hee dealeth men whereby hee iudgeth god summon v iudgement seate deale v order lawe one kinde rightuousnesse iustice man able say wee iustly condemned wee bee codemned lawe god doeth god require handes ought make default say punish v according desert thus ye see one kind god iustice wil grauted rightfull without gaynesaying true wicked ceasse alwayes grunting neuerthelesse grudging yet mouthes stopped forsomuchas owne conscience condemne needeth none man giue euidece make long triall matter haue searingyron burneth within also another kind rightuousnesse wee lesse acquaynted whe god hadleth v according law according may right forasmuchas lord giueth v lesson law commaundeth v whatsoeuer coteined although farre passe power able performe thing hath comaunded v yet notwithstanding wee owe yet bound vnto lawe perfect peerelesse thing sayde infinite rightfulnesse god according haue seene heretofore could find vnrightuousnesse angel daysunne shoulde bee cleere thus yee see perfecter rightuousnesse rightuousnesse law god listed vse although man performed conteyned lawe yet fayle condemned surely lord vseth applieth himselfe farre forth vnto v receyueth accepteth sayde rightuousnesse hee comaundeth though throughly perfect notwithstanding bee somewhat qualified state man meene man hee corrupted sin matter neede layd forth yet large specially cocerning first rightuousnesse true shall neuer found hath fulfilled lawe euen faythfull long abyde owne kind farre fulfilling cannot much think one good thought vvhat man himselfe mortall enimie god goodnesse haue shifte discharge selues agaynst god leaue v ourselues contrariwise shall nothing else prouoke wrath againe whe grauteth v grace holy spirite loue thing good therwithall putteth woorkfulnesse v life becommeth mirrour example holinesse yet fayle many wayes able answer god one point giltie thousand point yea wee neuer good wherein blemish insomuch faulty al respect god listed handle v rigorously howbeeit god graciouse v gouerne v holy spirite accepteth goodnesse hath put v notwithstanding bee vnperfecte true forsomuchas amisse haue much requisite neuerthelesse god layth infirmity sinnes charge shetteth eye like father inquisitiue owne child although see well ynough faultes yet hee beareth euen manner doeth god woorke towardes v hee vseth pitifulnesse forgiuing al infirmity wherthrough amisse let v come sayde iob knew well ynough wretched sinner hee blinded pryde beare himselfe hand throughly rightuous god byte without cause meening god woulde handle ordinarie maner setteth foorth lawe whiche blisse suche serue deale gently may well foole good father manner according rule could well answer mening god vseth owne prerogatiue rightuousnesse secrete hidden men dealeth order lawe another consideration men cannot take holde reach vnto reason witte lo meening better vnderstoode applying forme example persone iob person man set side looke vvpon man god hath chozen himselfe well indeuereth walke holily good conscience god blisseth appereth token god forgetteth rather gouerneth hath care bicause man hath deserued seeke deserte worthinesse creature bring nothing whiche god owne afore goodnesse procedeth first holy ghost man bringeth aught owne vnto god goodnesse v shoulde neuer worthy well liked god reiected bicause alwaies blemishe therefore lorde maketh faithfull prosper hath giuen desire walke according hee vseth ordinarie rightuousnesse wit rightuousnesse setteth foorth vnto v lawe looke mee vpon iob faithfull man hath serued god pure right meening minde yet notwithstanding tormented extremitie seemeth god hath sette vpon scaffolde shewe dreadfull vengeance shorte aught man coniecture hee handled roughlier tha cain iudas meeneth suche straunge manner dealing heerevpon iob saieth lord vseth secret iustice say hee vseth ordinarie rule conteyned lawe intedeth trie iobs pacience make example whole world short intendeth shew authoritie hath ouer creature notwithstanding ceasseth rightuous meene euen although deale altogither maner haue declared already god vseth sayde extraordinarie iustice towards men howbeeit iob thought ye see god shall rightuous still although proceed according rule law let v trie whither iob spake rightly saying surely ouershot proofe thereof let v take sentence set downe hee debate mee force sayth shal haue reason howe meeneth god deale force go law would giue hearing iob presupposeth god vseth absolute lawlesse power terme towardes say god wil list although order iustice plaine lordly ouerruling heerein iob blasphemeth god although god power infinite yet notwithstading imagine absolute lawlesse much make tirat vtterly cotrary maiestie lord vse might without right nother lesse rightfull
