mightfull rightfulnesse mightfulnesse thing inseparable therefore iobs saying euill purposed haue sayd afore blaspheme god yet wandering wordes escape came bicause could bridle affection nowe let v come handeling matter truth hitherto haue layde foorth matter vvhereas sayde two sortes rightuousnesse iustice god true howbeeit applying according iobs imagination misapplying nowe let v come pure truthe may knowe matter goeth behooueth v beare minde hath bin declared heretofore wit god law applieth himselfe vnto v requireth muche owe according mannes abilitie performe meene abilitie corrupted abilitie perfect soundnesse adam fell angel heauen haue yet still yee see god lawe hath respect vnto abilitie yea let v consider well manner worde abilitie vnderstood according want wretchednesse v nowe nowe wee nothing euill according state wherin wee haue continued safe sound corruption entered oure nature better vnderstanding hereof let v take angel mirrour beholde angelles indeuer serue god tempted euill affection rebelliousnesse sinne yet notwithstanding although obedience yeelde vnto god pure respect v ceasseth bee imperfecte bee compared infinite maiestie god nowe god listed coulde vse v extraordinarie manner say although law rule v yea although perfourmed conteyned lawe yet mighte hee iustly condemne v hee contented rule hath giuen shewing hee pytyeth poore creature cause angel pure accepted rightuouse let v passe god hath promised blisse walke purenesse hart hand yea howbeeit condition reserue alwayes himselfe preheminence iudge meete expedient oure welfare god perceyue wee haue neede chastized hee although wee haue minde serue haue put indeuoure thereto yet wyll hee therefore misse handle v roughlye sometimes shal seeme haue offended greeuously wickeddest worlde punishing v sorte iob thought seemed god ought haue hild himselfe contented obedience yelded god punishing proceeded simplie absolute power shoulde say god delt wilfully set purpose shew stregth arme ouerwhelming poore creature wiste doo say reason dooings wordes woorthy blamed yea accursed howe vvhereas god hath afflicted iob wee see true hee ment punish ordinarie manner deserte yet might haue punished euen law surely god beareth v accepteth oure workes good woorth wee grace holy spirit although faulty bound hath giuen v law intent subiect v bound vnto v doth owne free goodnesse man would compell shoulde wrong yes therefore iob misbehaueth behalfe man shall haue walked vprightly possible yet shal found faulty god may iustly sende affliction world man must faine condemne humble himselfe acknowledge hath deserued yet thus ye see wherein iob beguiled himselfe asmuche god owne meere goodnesse beareth child taketh theyr woorkes woorth thoughe deserue seemeth iob god vseth crueltie towardes leastwise absolute lawlesse prerogatiue dooth true god intent punishe iobs sinnes hee another respect went another way woorke according haue shewed minde trie iobs pacience wheras meane many wicked men worlde made merrie triumphed tyme god made ill countenaunce towardes see minde handle iob according desertes howbeeit wee muste alwayes conclude god euen according lawe coulde haue sente iob hundred time aduersitie hee shoulde haue bene able beare leaste offence wee committe trespasseth agaynste maiestie god pray punishment greate ynough huge offence impeaching god maiestie casting downe iustice ouerwhelmed hundred thousande time yet comparable hideousnesse cryme wee haue committed iob reasoneth awry saying god hadleth rule law surely hee sayde according ordinarie manner mening god intended punish sinnes cause sayde well truly hee sayeth see well god vseth excessiue power thundreth agaynste mee though hee woulde dispatch mee therefore must fayne holde peace vvhen hee speaketh doubtlesse hee playeth horse broken looce hee time pacience howbeeit pacience boyled great wallop caste froth skum thus ye see opening matter iob handleth heere forasmuch thing high laying foorth processe matter may giue yet greater light therefore let v come iob sayeth hath declared bitternesse soeuer hee hath vttered stomacke yet greefe surmounteth complaint sayeth lawfull mee finde god meeneth meeneth go lawe manner men doubte god shoulde abace himselfe farre go lawe v yet could neuer winne cace cause hee sayeth prophete esay let v set iudge vmper betwixte v see shall go better vvhen god speaketh maner hee meeneth resigne office stoupe lowe submitte himselfe man tyrall body shoulde presume gyue sentence vppon meening effecte althoughe hee shoulde forbeare hys authoritye man appoynted bee iudge betweene v yet shoulde wee fayle condemned vvee might well pleade selues might well alledge reason yet confounded bicause god woulde alwayes bee able find fault v marke one poynt therfore iob ouershooteth himselfe muche wisshing find god might go lawe say wisshing god stoupe lowe might take aduersarie pleade cace iudge although priuiledge god graunt desire yet alwayes put shame maketh beguile himselfe bicause tormentes troubled wise hee maister wittes sawe vexation darkenesse else eye blinfolded considered god coulde finde blame himselfe priuy listed examine rigorously heereby wee bee warned stand vpon gard god sendeth v afflictios therfore let v take heede hold ourselues short bicause shall hand dazeled passion mischefe pinche v sore wee shall knowe become muche euerie v neede looke narrowlye himselfe god send v aduersities let v assure selues shoulde vanquished beaten downe hand vphild v grace furthermore let v beleeue owne liking fleshly reason alledgeth thing v let v say ala imaginest thou wretched creature besides thou art competente iudge thine owne cace thy miserie hath blinded thee thou turnest asyde ryght way thou quiet thou mightest iudge much better thou canst thine owne conceyt caryeth thee away seeing thou must take vpon thee stad defence thy cace thou must willingly yeeld thy self giltie assuring thy selfe thou shalt able clere thyselfe afore god thou must vtterly cofounded lo haue mark text let v proceede iob sayeth would god dispute force would giue mee strength hereby betokeneth god presently dispute reason mayne force charging god thing meanes lighte vndoubtedly wheras doctor sorbon say god hath absolute lawlesse power diuelish blasphemie forged hell ought enter faithfull mannes head therefore muste say god hath infinite endelesse power whiche notwithstanding rule rightuousnesse rending god peeces make almightie without al rightuous true rightuousnesse shall alwaies apparant vnto v yet ceasseth continue euermore sounde vnappayred vvee muste measure god rightuousnesse owne conceyte greate streytening wee muste alwayes bee fully resolued god myghtfulnesse bee separated rightfulnesse bicause god cannot bee dismembred iob suppozeth heere god disputeth mayne force saye hee sheweth himselfe terrible reason bee hande bycause none thing thy god may dispose thee liste selfe true howbeeit god ordereth creature suche wyse muste imagine rightuousnesse separated power sayde afore point wherin iob ouerseen saide would god dispute mee force certaine although god disputed agaynste iob force might yet shold haue bin lawlesse might sholde haue born right rightfull might notwithstading men could co prehend rightfulnesse thereof heere warned talk god mightinesse ministred vnto v muste reuerence confessing alwaies rightful haue touched alreadie muste measure mightinesse vnderstanding thing euen groud cause grudgings heard god men conceyue reason god doth thing fall gnash teeth chafe sure diuelish pryde presumption whe wil haue god gouern v liking fall cotrolling al doings cannot coceiue good opinio except shew v reason cotrariwise behoueth v honour said secret mightinesse acknowledging ther rightfulnesse inclosed canot espye yet proue god rightuous wold abolish mighty power nuber day canot abide preach god hath chosen v owne free goodnesse disposeth al thing according owne good pleasure nothing hapneth ordinance guiding bicause canot brook geere fall ouerth warting sort god haue chosen forsaken residue foloweth hath created men damnation agreable righruousnesse againe thing done god wil shall man say seing ther many wicked thing done nowe wretched fooles rather madde men cannot finde harte stoupe low say deede strange case god hauing created wil also saue theal neuerthelater let v assure oure selues god rightuousnesse high deepe v atteine vnto day come lorde make v able vnderstand thing hidde v sayde wee know partly darkly whe become like shall onely see also shall perfectly vnderstand thing yet disclosed vnto v drunken sot sotted ouerweening cannot abide yelde god much glory submit theselues wholly vnto man speake god prouidence answer come passe shold codened euill hath comitted yet shold done wil god cannot discerne man beeyng conuicted naughtinesse iustly codemned yet god purposeth another end vnknowen v lob hath well shewed fathering affliction vpo god whe theeues robbed good sayd god done howbeit another respect theeues done albeeit thing strange v yet must fall slaundering god rightuousnesse rayling thus thing sayd noted strayne muste put god vnder suche rule able coceiue vnderstading rightuousnesse far passeth reache witte vvhat done vve must humble ourselues soeuer god worketh fashion strange vnknowen v must therfore ceasse conclude alwayes rightuous way whereby god trie whither wee honour namely thing fall contrarie reason liking neuerthelesse still magnifie name god hadled v owne wish world gouerned deuized head easie v say god rightuous god good bycause wee shall haue concluded already selues must shold become god rightuousnesse shoulde bee certaine subiection vnto v would say god woulde haue wise el greate reason contrariwise haue sayd tryeth humilitie woorketh suche fashion wee cannot find good naturall witte yet neuerthelesse confesse bee rightuouse rest prisoner vnder bridle humilitie thus ye see maner yeeld god glory beloging therfore although god vse greate rigour towards v knowe whiche side turne v seeme bee pressed ouer sore yet let v beware wee say iob god debateth v mightinesse power let v take hede father absolute power vpon god lette v consider alwayes incomprehesible rightfulnesse behooueth v honour though wee perceyue shew selfe let v alwaies make conclusion lorde thou art rightuous thy iudgemets bottomlesse pit cause expresly sayde psalme lorde thou art rightuous thy iudgements deepe sea therefore man must stoupe behalfe presume enter surely shall neuer wade againe plunged drowned although see great darke dungeon yet muste confesse god rightuouse furthermore whereas iob sayeth heere god would giue strength debate prerogatiue power let v acknowledge god giueth v strength euen greatest rigour hee vseth gaue v strength thing god nedeth vtter extreme force confound v let blowe vpon v wee dispatched little rush withered byandby else flowre bud herbe whatsoeuer else lesse short shadowe therefore god shewe power maynteyning v wee bee vndoone yea euen leaste aduersitie sende v become v vphild v listed chastize v somewhat roughlier hee beareth v vp wise whe smiteth vpon v one hand strike v downe hath hande vnder v lift v vp againe suffereth v quaile therefore let v conclude god afflict v hee wyll giue v strength shall alwaies stand stedfast vnouercome yea verely neere v say v insomuch feele assistance hand ought suffize v assuring selues alwayes haue respect infirmity make v feele grace vtter aboundance wee shall bee well fenced continue holie calling vnto ende lette v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgemet fault praying make v profit true repentance open eye may learne search want v condemne selues therwithall resort vnto doubting hee ready heare v whensoeuer seeke remedy disease alwaies shewe good phisition purging v wicked affection may please open eye ende wee may behold fauour sheweth v adopting v oure lorde iesus christes sake giuing v pledge saluation therby may take occasion comfort reioycing yea eue mids affliction temptation world may ouercome battels wherewith hee listeth exercise v may plese graut grace v also people nation c lxxxix sermon second vpon xxiij chapter sermon yet still vpon vij verse vpon text added come afore hee appeareth mee come behinde shall atteyne come left side vvhere doth vvorke shall perceiue turne mee right hand vvill hide himselfe shall see according knovveth vvay doth trie mee shall go golde foote hath hild path haue kept vvay turned aside haue forsaken commaundement lippes haue layde vp haue sette store vvordes mouth liuing custome iob pursewing matter treated yesterday protesteth heere god woulde handle desert shoulde bee sore afflicted hee alwayes meening god woulde proceede according rule law hereby betokeneth punished offeder god hath respect vnknowen vnto certesse true god dealeth ordinarie manner towards whe vttereth rigor iob none haue transgressed god law wise punishment ought exa ple vnto others iob none nuber indeuered lead holy life behaued towards also towards god might haue bin counted half angell coparison therfore hath good reason say punishment indured sinnes acknowledged god might iustly hee thought good lorde beare men bee sayde therfore bound may bee free chastize roughly list iob therfore doth amisse poynte acknowledgeth god meere grace hee punished sinnes agayne hee doth euill entring god secrete iudgements surmizing god vseth absolute lawlesse power acknowledging secrete rightuousnesse although creature perceiue cause sayeth rightcouse might go lawe god woulde voutsafe deale order lawe yet certaine shoulde go way woorke must v needes bee condemned mortall man boast hath fulfilled law god written cursed perfourmeth thing conteyned lawe thus ye see mankinde shut vp vnder curse god listed extend rigour law towards v according sainct paule treateth specially therof thirde chapter galathians iob farre ouerseene saying ryghtuouse man maye pleade hys cace god giue audience according rule law haue said must needes yeeld ourselues giltie onely offending one poynte transgressing poynts insomuch neuer serue god wee ought suche perfection hee deserueth dutie requireth vvherefore followeth men transgressers lawe one parte euery poynte moreouer true rightuouse maye shewe themselues god howbeit come account wherein consisteth oure blissednesse hauing sinnes pardoned buried god hand written two thirtith psalme draweth open mouth pleade heauenly iudge standeth v hande haue iesus christe aduocate pleading cace alleadgeth desert ne setteth himselfe defence say god dooth v wrong punishing v alledgeth amendes himselfe hath made forsomuche hee hath released v dettes quit god thus wee see iob offended saying rightuouse iuste dealing man may pleade cace god concerning poynt sayd seeke god shall perceiue hee come behind shall ouertake hee go left hande bee hidden hee turne right hande hee shall see thereby hee meeneth god iudgements incomprehensible true saying expound foure partes worlde commeth one poynt according sayd psalme shall giue mee wing flie away go ouer sea hande god long ouertake mee go downe deepes find mee flye aboue cloudes yet hand ouerreach mee plucke mee backe thence therefore one text wee vnderstande bee spoken east vvest south north iob meeneth purpose men make long discourse haue trotted vp downe world ouer yet shall neuer attayne great secretes god surmount capacitie reache sense continueth alwaies haue spoken namelye iob meeneth heere manner dealing whiche god vseth towardes high profounde man reason neuer reache vnto true saying bee well applyed iobs fault forasmuch hee perceiueth reason god dooings hee imagineth vse absolute lawlesse power terme say god woorketh owne pleasure withoute keeping anie order rule hee doth listeth like prince bee ruled reason followeth owne liking saying iob blasphemeth god howbeeit bycause suddaine pang passion wherethrough woordes escaped h without aduisednesse neuerthelesse hee fayleth conclude alwaies god rightuous blamelesse sticketh euer vnto himselfe yet notwithstanding hee able brydle tung casting foorth woordes square reason passion wee haue marke effecte nowe may applie doctrine vse let v vnderstande wee muste preache god pleade cace muste needes bee condemned without long procesmaking behalfe mo defence excuse thinke haue much muste sinfulnesse needes increace none remedie acknowledge ourselues giltie craue forgiuenesse mercie thus co ming vnto god muste pretende iustifying selues make satisfactio acknowledge sinnes beseeche admit v owne meere goodnesse mercie open mouth pleade cace manner debating belongeth v office giuen oure lorde iesus christ therefore let v parte holde peace suffer iesus christ bee spokesman make intercession v meanes fault may buryed quit sted condemned thus much haue wee beare away firste place meane deliuer v iudge euer according paule sayeth shall lay thing charge god child seeyng hee iustifyeth vvho shall stande seieng iesus christe hath taken theyr cace hande pleade say refuge without vndone muste thinke come vnto god without shoulde ouerwhelmed wrath worthy touching second point behoueth v marke god iudgementes oftentimes hidden v yet muste therfore thinke straunge check say reason lette v rather acknowledge god rightuousnesse highe thing suche rudenesse v greate presumptuousnesse v desire atteyne therevnto say muste wee fully resolued sayde god iudgementes secrete wee haue sought serched ransacked vttermost wee shall bee confounded doth followe therefore god hath rule let v make comparison betwixte v difference wayes sayeth heauen earth truely vseth manner speach shew must esteeme mercy according owne nature neuerthelesse god doth generally shew reason measure span prouerb sayth vvhat remayneth vve muste honour god secretes hidden v therwithall confesse doings disposed infinite wisedome vprightnesse goodnesse man attempt doubt muste needes come shame according said psalm lord howsoeuer world goeth thou shalt found rightuous dauid saw wel diuelish pryde men needes bee alwayes replying god controlling winne nothing god muste maynteyne owne right bee ouerwhelmed theyr malapertnesse thus ye see poynt well woorthy borne minde sayde wee go sunne rising sunne going downe drawe north south wee haue hunted ouer worlde yet shall attayne vnto god heereby wee informed god determination suche bottomlesse sea wee neuer atteyne rightfulnesse whiche infinite thing lette v consider owne abilitie marke infirmitie v man shoulde bestowe whole life traueling yet could know whole world shoulde know god atteyned centre say bottome earth little nothing surely coulde stye vp aboue cloudes yet shoulde wee come farre shorte knowing god lette v learne two thing breefly one god woorketh manner wee muste thinke selues creature able men haue bin wont doo ordinarie manner woorking thus thus order nature god mighty power muste shut vp within order nature within bound vvhat let v confesse iudgements depe sea cannot found therewithal let v hold sure principle god continueth euermore rightuous notwithstanding hee seeme deale crookedly ouerthwartly although finde fault wyth doings haue apparant surmise colour yet say let v alwayes conclude thus selues lorde thou art rightuous according also ieremy sayth true greeued see wicked haue full scope godly men bee vtterly troden vnder foote thing order might ouercame right conscience vpright dealing among men ieremie lamented sorie againe hee sawe wicked liue vnpunished though god bin asleepe thought vpon charge thus ye see hard combersome temptation prophete indured forasmuch knew fleshly wit cannot conceiue god wonderfull iudgements hee maketh preface hee enter complaint moane saying lorde thou art rightuons thy iudgements rightfull speaking manner shewe intendeth enter intoo disputation god pleade fellowe matche call question whether god woorketh reason ieremie abridged himselfe libertie cut occasion might haue conceyued minde therfore enter matter maketh conclusion lord howsoeuer world go although men may surmize thou dost thing without reason yet art thou rightuous vnblamable poyntes respect euen must wee say iob impossible v knowe reason god woorkes verie true howbeit faintly spoken cannot mount high neuerthelesse god woorke maner cannot comprehende must therfore ceasse acknowledge bee rightuous honour humble selues effect thing haue remeber furthermore let v take warning may wel make large discourse shall gaine nothing thereby true men may haue great quicknesse wit yet must giue v occasion ouerweening see many bicause haue wit wel sharpned thinke themselues able finde reason thing causeth run astray end bee doted owne vnderstanding say god punisheth pryde taking toomuch vpon therefore let v consider well wee haue trudged vp downe shall neuer whit nerer finding end thing lorde shew v wit weake rude attaine heighth knowing therefore must bee part must suffise v tast certaine measure thing welfare wayting latter day wee shall haue fully discouered vnto v thus ye see haue marke streyne iob addeth immediatly according hee knoweth way trie shall go gold hereby iob betokeneth god hath great aduauntage ouer cannot know sayth iob knoweth vnderstande workes iudgeth mine bee short trieth golde furnace insomuch little peece froth infirmitie mee seeth discerneth therefore purpose go law conclusion maketh saying verie true god knoweth wayes trieth proueth v gold furnace yet notwithstanding haue wee cause coplaine match creature checke sort take part agaynst maker though god make v haile fellow himselfe ought wee say doth v wrong iniurie therefore whensoeuer commeth minde god knoweth wayes hee tryeth v purgeth sifteth sinfull affection superfluous thoughtes v let v vnderstand must teach v lowlinesse feare prouoke v make complaint iob dooth text herewithall see god intendeth bridle v al meanes owne welfare trieth v sort commeth profite vnto knoweth bee expedient v according also hee commeth neere vnto v afrayde hee seeketh profite v nothing knoweth wee haue neede bee kept obedience awe cheefe thing requireth v sea vertue bringeth v saluation therfore behoueth v rightly subiect vnto god hild maiestie ouer v shewed v wee bee state hilde v vnder feete would become v considering pride malapertnesse v god shewing v reason work doth end lerne obey againe see doth shall comprehend sure sayd trie v welfare good sooth v trieth nay contrarywise steede lighting candle serch owne want sinnes quench cresset god hath lighted hande vvhat else discretion hee hath giuen v discerne betwene good euill candle hath lighted end might perceyue naughtinesse selues see men labor quench sayd knowledge would faine suppresse owne conscience might liue like swine bee ashamed abashed euill commit men go become brute beastes see indeuer quench lamp candle god lighted draw triall seeing good reason god shoulde search trie v bycause wee selues dutie good willes woulde become like brute beast dispatch selues al discretion reason thus ye see thing haue marke text forsomuch god knoweth wayes woorkes aforehand behoueth v conclude hee make v passe gold furnace profite welfare although perceyue reason ought contented lorde rightuous hee ende shew v whersore hath tryed v maner making v passe many affliction gold passeth fire although greeuous beare yet god doth without cause vve perceyue yet bycause wit weake howbeit lord time make v perceyue wrought aduenture knew meete welfare effect thing whiche haue beare away heere nowe iob hath sayde addeth protestation foote bad walked god path hee bad left way turned asyde commaundement god owne mouth bad set store owne liuing manner dealing true iob might well protest hee walked vprightly number dispisers god number looce liuers giuen naughtinesse iob might well say true according also wee see dauid might well say lorde haue kept thy commaundementes whole hart lorde haue set store thy lawe gold siluer delight hath bin haue weltred wicked affection pleasure hath bin hearing thy lawe vvhen dauid speaketh maner boast himselfe god another place sayth lorde able stand thee thou enter account men creature bee iustified therefore enter iudgement thy seruant lorde lord shall stand vp thou marke faultes vve see dauid dooth willingly yeeld himselfe guiltie whereas protesteth himselfe haue followed god commaundements al one acknowledged gracious giftes hee receyued hand homage saying thus lord thou hast done exceeding great good thou haste gouerned thy holy spirite following thy commaundements came selfe thy guiding caused giue selfe therevnto dauid yeelding honour vntoo god confirmed himselfe good hope assuring himselfe hee felt god good gracious heeretofore hee would neuer sayle heereafter iob proceeded maner protestation bin good holy meening heere go lawe god vphold god handled ordinarie rule lawe hee shoulde haue cause vse rigour towardes iob grossely ouerseene behalfe god iisted haue punished sinnes hee committed might iustly haue done doth meere free goodnesse iob therefore dooth discerne aright betweene god person haue sayd lord true thou chastizest know thou migh test euen thy law true also haue indeuered walke thee great soundnesse possible mee neuerthelesse hath alwayes bin somewhat amisse therefore thou shalt find workes sinsull iob might haue spoken sayd well lorde knowe well thou bearest proceedeth thy fatherly goodnesse although thou chastize yet thou makest mee perceyue thou doest sinnes bycause pleaseth thee exercise pacience neuerthelater meane whyle feele selfe combered extreemely therefore muste conclude thou doest vpon secrete wonderfull purpose iob spoken bin well caried away pang hys passion thereby warned say de afore mistrust selues afflicted ye would say dazeled wee cannot discerne good thing befell vnto iob setheere eye myrrour pacience become v therefore wee bee afflicted lette v pray god hold v awe may glorifie toyes come heades grudge agaynst may beaten downe knowing cannot speake one word selues shall prouoke god wrath thus ye see haue beare remembrance furthermore going sentence let v learne knowe true seruing god iob sheweth v howe vvhereat must begin wee intende giue dedicate selues wholly obeying god keeping way whiche hee sheweth v men must frame themselues newe deuotions owne pleasure manner worlde whiche much giuen therevnto vvhen men bee deuout would faine worke wonder make enterance following seemeth good owne liking yea would say god soueraintie ouer v though cheefe poynt seruice obedience man serue god aright let shut owne imagination doores behaue himselfe owne liking wit let submit himselfe god worde followe set downe heere namely haue set foote walked god path haue turned aside haue wise stepped wayes rule bin well hilde kept wee shoulde haue great controuersies nowe adayes papist aboute seruing god aright called god seruice papacie inuentions theyr owne braynes whereof god neuer spake one woorde vvhat call deuotion euery man owne liking assoone man hath mind thing beares himselfe hand god asmuch delighted man hee vndertaketh thing behold ouerboldnesse hath alwayes reigned world men need maisters make lawes pleasure god must bee saine accept whatsoeuer haue forged maner contrary wise holy ghost telleth v must lift vp one foote go foreward onely way god sheweth v behoueth v refrayne selues cace needes raunge abrode make friskes outleapes stray may well breake leggs necke hee shall neuer himselse good say wee shall neuer go forewarde rather euer backwarde wee bee desirous gad owne fancie let v learne fashion liue well rightly god alloweth set feete way whiche wee selues haue made whiche hee hath shewed v woorde without cause dooth iob adde hee retyred turned backe heereby sheweth men tempted continually tickling lust start right way according verie deede see god cannot holde v vnder obeysance force euen desirous walke singlenesse would neither put take away fro god word shall notwithstanding misse feele pricking himselfe tickeled steppe way specially wee see man take libertie wee say beholde man doth thing wee bee moued sight example maketh v desyrous turne way bee short wee bee easily caried away obeying god maner meanes bycause wittes curious fantasticall also bycause wee see thing euerye drawe v vnto euill therefore let v take heede may able protest truely iob wee haue swarued waye god hath shewed v wee may behoueth v herken well thing god telleth v lawe men woulde still beare themselues hand god alloweth doings still good way declaration iob addeth bee gaue himselfe wholly heare commaundement god owne lippes vvherefore speaketh hee commaundement god lippes shoulde seeme needeth shew man life shall alwayes vnruly disordered bee framed law god thoughtes deedes directed hee presume swarue whit neuer little serueth shew v vse god woorde profite wee reape thereof vse god worde hold v right way bycause looke newe inspiration heauen satan transformed hee might put many illusion heades god hath cut occasion guilefulnesse giuing v holy scripture therevnto haue v holde selues therefore let v beware wee vse benefite god offereth v nowe therewithall matched profitablenesse thing bee desired man sure shall misse walke doubtfulnesse poore papist led owne imagination say bee doubt whether god accept doings thing throughly assured way hee sheweth v infallible may well walke go forwarde neerer wee come poynt saluation certaintie inestimable treasure let v bereeue oure selues grace god offereth v see world malicious froward much leuer giue selfe owne fantasticall deuises followe vnfallible truth cannot lie vntoo v lo wee haue marke text iob speaketh commaundement god lip shewe v god ordeyning word preached mouthes men intended haue v rest therevpon ende wee shoulde seeke vaine gazings heere addeth hee setmore store god worde owne liuing maner dealing hebrue worde vseth heere signifieth properly ordinance decree truely three verse hee saye god hath decreed eye hee vseth woorde set downe heere yee see proper signification worde decree determination ordinance common maner agayne sometymes similitude taken man ordinarie liuing prouision bycause parcell lawe man lay liuing must eate much brust himselfe one day hee must take portion nourishment sustenance content himselfe thus yee see worde also taken euery man ordinarie liuing prouision either wayes may stand well vvhat iob ment heere hee ment god worde treasure estimation vntoo goodes worlde vvhat thing dearer vnto men nourishment loue liues doo also indeuer prouide necessary want bread thing v dismayd forasmuch men haue great care mainteyne liuing iob preferring god worde sustenaunce meate drinke sheweth thereby hee made great account present life earnestnesse obeying god hee muche leuer taught word tha fed best meate worlde heerof wee may gather good admonition see howe men desirous liue onely desirous also mad nother measure staye yet meane whyle wote end liue desire life haue regard god much therefore doth stande v hand marke sayde wit desiring liue world must alwayes serue god dedicate selues glorie bee consirmed hope heauenly life wherevnto calleth v poynt wherevnto wee must applie wit indeuers follow immediately shall preferre god doctrine spirituall foode soules foodes wee wish body fed bread water yea wine dilicatest meates deinties deuised vvhat purpose soules starued meane oxe ass horse shold better excellet state let v lerne preferre god word wherwith oure soules nourished thing concerne teporall flightfull life let preferring bee onely say learned also giue selues wholly seruing god obspeaketh let v come haue declared concerning worde taken signifie common maner wee take sense truly meening wil chaged al effect howbeit wil one point profitable worthie borne away meanes iob declareth wise maner wise men world alwayes needes followe fleshly reason quite giue ouer al self liking end might submit vnto god verie needfull thing according haue touched alreadie wee bee vagabundes straggler wee holde way god hath shewed v howe may done let v cut say let v cut owne customes ordinance maners lyuing let euerie whit fall ground done quite cleane away long men delight inuentions long bee wedded owne customes long sticke wilfully owne trade lyuing impossible giue themselues god one man woulde put french hoode vpon heade calfe cowe theyr nature kynde therefore cannot away yet wood commeth point wee obey god brute beastes thing aforesayd vvherefore may fashioned obey god law wee must learne first formost rid selues gay inuentions come head think selues good vvee haue bin wont euerie man doth hath continued thus tymes vvee muste alledge thing god speake word behoueth v yeeld vnto wee see without cause iob hath sayde sought god worde doctrine conteyned esteemed thing touching word lay vp cannot discoursed day therefore wil let alone till morrow meane let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement oure fault praying make v feele wee may learne humble selues onely acknowledging mightie power hath aboue v also glorifie rightuousnesse knowe selues alwayes wretched sinner specially knowe fault v wee may continually mourne assuring oure selues god knoweth many mo v tha selues perceiue forasmuch bee full vanitie inclyned deceyte leasings let v desire refourme v wise whole seeking may profite schole may harken diligently sound doctrine spoken v name bodily eares sort may take good roote hart may desire nothing else filled haue ordinarie foode may please graunt grace onely v c xc sermon thirde vpon xxiij chaper sermon yet still vpon twelfth verse vpon text ensueth hee still one poynt vvho turne looke vvhat heart desyreth hee doth vvill performe vvhatsoeuer hath decreed many thing cause afrayd vvhen thinke stand feare god hath softned hart almightie hath troubled cut darkenesse hath hidden darknesse face vve sawe yesterday obey god rightly wee muste giue ouer owne customes maner dealing alledge one thing make go good seeing lord hath spoken must hold v simply word hath giuen v nowe remayneth marke worde set downe place namely wee must lay vp god doctrine treasure harte vnlesse laide vp maner neuer take liuely root according shall see many bee moued heare god spoken somwhat well disposed howbeit disposition throughly planted therefore see fayth appeared time vanisheth away let v marke well wee haue neuer profited well god schoole till worde deepely rooted hart say till wee haue receyued mind flightfull motion allowe like well thing told v hartie affection settled vppon good earnest cause oftentymes tolde v seruice god inward spirituall although wee satisfied whole worlde men thought v vtterly faultlesse yet might god iustly refuse goodly outward shewe wherein men sooth v hart go afore let v beare saying minde behoueth v lay vp god worde howe burie beleeue hart vnto rightuousnesse wee must also confesse mouth wee may safe must god worde shewe selfe wee men may thinke v yet good woorkes faythfull must first proceede sayde hartie affection flightfull inconstant motion furthermore worde lay vp well ynough vnderstood wee take similitude treasure applie also lorde iesus christ dooth sayeth man bee well stored thinges hee may fetche foorth whatsoeuer hee hath neede owne householde also men vse man bee niggardly hath chestes full money garner cellers throughly stored starue himselfe releeue bodie menne say one knoweth purpose serueth riche starke beast therefore let v vnderstande hoording must end may vse discretely according cace shall require wee haue treasure doctrine saluation layd vp hart must onely profite selues also edifie neighbour yea let v beare minde saint paule sayth mysterie fayth must bee kept good conscience thus ye see effect haue note vpon sayd text wee learned god worde wee must conceyue opinion brayne must lay vp diligently harte inestimable treasure let v come iob addeth sayth god minded thing man shal turn still continuing matter hande namely god vsed absolute power agaynst going law obteyne right haue tolde ouermuch although iob knewe god punished sinnes yet ought hee haue bin fully resolued god rightuous vnpartiall dooings surmiseth lawlesse power hath nother rule measure wherein hee doth god wrong neuerthelesse sentence true bee applied ought namely god alwayes one poynt one mind say constant vnuariable cannot turned one way according see eue balaam lier inforced acknowledge god like men chaunge mind variable inconstant hath hee sayd thing saith balaam performeth doctrine selfe good holy scripture full matter nowe must applie instruction serueth two purpose one god hath spoken thing promiseth mercifull fauourable v succour v needes must stedfastly beleeue rest vpon without douting whither performe promise vvhy truth infallible likewise contrary part hee threaten v wee must tremble assuring selues v dallie master thus yee see end thing tend spoken holy scripture concerning god constancie stedfastnesse executing determination vve knowe god vttereth minde vnto v auoucheth himselfe pitifull receyueth v mercie seeing lorde doth call v vnto beguile v foade v vayne hope therefore inasmuch haue assurance good let v boldely stay rest therevppon hee chaungeth though world make sute yet cause alter mind meanes may glorie diuell deuise practise yea although see whole worlde bent god promise yet shall neuerthelesse alwayes rest according also wee see howe holy ghost armeth faythfull trust teacheth defie theyr enimies goto sayth lay heades togither worst yet shall thing god hath promised hold end againe sayth neere hande v diuell men haue practized vttermost agaynst v hee beate downe defence seeing may despyse enimies practise deuise ende cannot withstande god let perfourine thing hee hath spoken thus ye see wise ought put doctrine vre concerning stedfastnesse god also let v beare minde hath bin sayd concerning threatnings rebuke vice bee good v warne v let v stand vnamendable misdoings let euerie v humble himselfe looke well aboute carefulnesse indeuer preuente curse god hath tolde v ende doth make v feele wrath say ende hee woulde bee constreyned execute wrath agaynst v lo true vse doctrine god always one mind man turne cause also sayde god hath spoken prophete heard two thing namely power iudgement god say lorde thou needest repeate thy wordes thou hast spoken woorde ought suffise v much wee hundred thousande witness thou haddest neuer ceassed repeating rehearsing thing wee heard afore neede haue eares beaten much vvhy god truth certaine one sillable al one hee great volume yet notwithstanding wee see howe lorde calleth v ratifying hys promise contented haue spoken away putteth v often remembrance thing wee haue heard haue v taughte goodnesse life long seeing hee vseth ouerabundantnesse behoueth v acknowledge hys infinite goodnesse applying himselfe maner rudenesse yet must wee take boldenesse call question thing hee hath spoken dispute whether thing bee true god hath witnessed vnto v wee must rather marke howe sayd vnto v psalme god saying siluer seuen tymes fined fornace wherein neyther drosse superfluitie like wordes mortall men dubble eyther colour wordes haue spoken vnsay againe finde suttle shifte turne another way thing god vvhy wordes siluer throughly fined wherein superfluitie say seale faythfull ought set vnto thing heare god mouth soone god hath spoken thing let v according whiche hath bin touched alreadie set seale vnto nothing truth certeintie nothing vntruth man minde yet god doth v honour make v witness according saint iohn speaketh whosoeuer beleeueth iesus christ hath sette seale god soothfast seeing god doth v honour make v witness althoughe bee nothing vanitie v much ought bee inflamed receyue obediently thing whiche wee heare warrant selues bee true followeth immediately doth soeuer hart desireth heere one sentence whiche verie true bee rightly vnderstoode true wee haue seene iob nisse imagining god vsed lawlesse power could imagin otherwise god minded vtter strength violence bee quite voyde reason surely haue erst declared iob purposed suche blasphemie himselfe heere cace concerneth former pang ouerheadie nowe let v consyder profite redoundeth v doctrine god doth whatsoeuer hee liketh behoueth v firste formost knowe thing god desyreth lyketh vve knowe cannot away vnrightuousnesse therefore desire lyking must needes bee rightuous full equitie seeing let v learne glorisie respect first see thing order worlde seemeth go otherwise ought let v marke howe sayd vnto v god holdeth reynes brydle nothing done whiche hee hath foredetermined purpose oftentymes wee maye thinke thing bee verie straunge whiche done eye weake sighted comprehende infinite power god vvhat done let v conclude muche god rightuous becommeth v allowe dooings although fall oure lyking although seeme v god ought woorke otherwyse yet let v subdue owne reason holde suche bondage wee maye alwayes confesse god anye thing whiche wroughte wyth iustice vprightnesse also let v heere marke particularly seeing god hath called v hee doth also dispose oure welfare faluation speake nowe men generall comfort faythfull may gather god hath shewed himselfe calleth purposely child vttereth heart vnto haue sayd afore faythfull must hang doubt imagine theyr saluation mammering vvhy layde vp gage hande god plucke awaye therefore let faythfull hardily bragge saluation god almightie according sayde tenth saint iohn father hath giuen vnto stronger purpose doth christ speake shew saluation dependeth vpon selues vpon creature let looce hazardes god keepeth bosome forsomuch man ouercome wee bee sure wee shall neuer perishe bycause god hath ordering thing loueth welfare suche wyse hee surely procure thereof wee haue good warrant gospell wee haue sure pledge lorde iesus christ giuen v ende shoulde partaker lyfe goodes doctrine bee put vre ought bee see true holy also exceeding profitable v hee addeth god bring passe whatsoeuer bee bathe determined mee many like thing iob vseth worde expounded yesterday said worde signifieth two thing wit lawes statute ordinance decree determinatiens destiny fashion maners dealing order trade custome guize woont ordinarie also mannes prouision liuing sustenance foode nourishment iob faith god go wyth ordinaunce determination hys saying hee go mine ordinarie else go determination nowe although signification wordes bee double yet notwithstanding circumstaunce place sheweth v sense namely iob meeneth god bring passe thing hee hath purposed vvhereby doth v vnderstande wee bee gouerned fortune haphazard god hath determined shal befal v vvhen put v worlde let v looce rouers let v walke aduenture hee determyned shoulde become lyfe death therfore let v vnderstand walke wise vnder guyding oure god lorde iesus christ sayeth cannot one heare fall oure heade good prouidence extend euen sparrowes woormes earth doth vnto v hee esteemeth muche whome hee hath created shaped owne image likenesse therefore article wee ought marke well euerie v hath destinie say suche tyme god sendeth v intoo worlde hath alreadie ordeyned haue done v guideth v wise life hande death insomuch purpose v vndertake one thing bycause stead going forwarde shall go backe except god guide v thus ye see howe faythfull may comforte themselues wyth god prouidence true iob misapplie faying first pang fit man may terme hee hath spoken heere man despayre beholde sayth know vtterly lorne god hath determined mee thinketh good shal accomplished shall boote mee striue surely must beginne ende wee speake god ordinaunce let v first consider rightuousnesse wee may yeeld due glorie let v imagine sayd lawlesse power god wherof haue spoken heeretofore make lyke tyrant cursed blasphemie let v assure selues god disposing ordering thing vseth soueraine rule iustice rightuousnesse muste bee squared neuerthelesse wee must vaynglorious folke whiche argue agaynst god prouidence beginninglesse election see reason god doth thing imagin tirannicall blasphemousnesse men worse diuels ignorant yet notwithstanding busie seeking god secret true perchance beare countenance great clerk verie deed starke beastes yet need haue god shew reason doings else neuer graunt hee gouerneth thing heere bylowe hee hath chozen hee listed eternall life making worlde let v keepe selues outrage acknowledging god doings rightful good let v marke woorkes shall oftentymes passe vnderstanding yet wee must therefore incounter god thing let v conclude good yea say see reason thereof surely whosoeuer woulde make god subiect reason dooth hee rob glory god wil rule reason fountaine rightuousnesse therefore let v hold selues contented milde say god willeth thing whiche rightfull indifferent know generally said iustice rightuousnesse let v know also god gracious vnto v ioyne knit iustice saluation lyke hee hath matched mightinesse also vvhen say god almightie honour also rest vpon wee may bee inuincible agaynst temptation inasmuch god mightie power infinite hee well mainteyne preserue v like cace rightuousnesse seeing inseparable knot betwene god iustice saluation let v begin poynt ende wee say god bringeth passe soeuer listeth hee perfourme whatsoeuer hath determined v wee may also assure selues thing amisse thing ruled wonderfull iustice wisedome furthermore haue breefe familiar exposition saying let v marke god hath foredetermined haue done respect euerlasting saluatio soules also respect present life concerning first god chose v child creation world wherevnto eye choozing v onely owne infinite mercie bee adam corrupted lumpe vvherefore preferre v rest creature sayth sainct paule sholing v make v excellent fellowes vvee deserued cast away damned god hath vouchsafed drawe v destruction yee see ought glorifie god determination somuch pleased choose v call v saluation make v heyres kingdome determination hath beene vttered v lorde iesus christ wee bee member lorde iesus christ bee sure adoption neede seeke register loft heauen let v content selues assurance hath giuen v man hath copie autentike register content himselfe ought wee god hath declared purpose concerning saluation ought say rest vpon yee see wise behoueth v settle selues forasmuch wee bee sure oure saluation vnalterable bycause god hath made decree cannot chaunged concerning determination present lyfe let v vnderstande god guideth steppe nothing happeneth v casualtie hee fore setteth thing neyther go come thing else otherwise hee hath ordeyned therefore let v assure selues seeing wee bee god protection wee shall well ease seeing hee watcheth ouer v hath care v let v mystrust diuell winde v enimies beside god prouide v well skill keepe v attemptes shall bee made agaynst v ought onely comfort v also giue v courage goe wyth duetie walke euerie man calling mistrusting god disappoynt practizes attemptes shall bee made agaynst v breake snare men shall haue layde catche v goodnesse ought rauish v amaze v wee see god hath care v hath determined thing aboue shall done heere beneath vve froggs grassehoppers prophet esay sayth v short wee like mouse straw prouerbe sayth god set order aforehande shoulde become v nowe see wee may well say knowe god sauiour father hee hathe saluation hande suffer mee perish ought assure selfe seeing hee hathe promised iob addeth many lyke thing hee say agaynst whome bend selfe though world set selfe agaynst shoulde win nothing mee poore woorme therefore behoueth shrinke away surely hee doth well saying bee yeelded god honour prayse rightuousnesse yea euen respecte affliction hee indured hee combered hys minde acknowledgeth god bee rightuous full equitie hee ought vvhat bee done part wee haue acknowledged selues bee cuerie one vnder hande guiding god let v beleeue also whole worlde likewise diuell subiect god thing vvee see rage hee commeth agaynst v see also howe furious wicked sort insomuch may seeme swallow v vp great hideous stormes come ouer whelme v let v marke therefore god onely keepeth child vnder protection maintaine also hee gouerneth whole worlde diuel hee able bring practizes god prouidence alwayes betwene home thus ye see howe ought put doctrine vre nowe finally iob sayth hee afrayde god hee thinketh vpon standeth doubt hath softned hart sayth almightie hath amazed reason bycause hath cut darknesse hath hidden darknesse presence set downe latter part text thus hath hidden cleane contrarie effect iob ment say first affirmeth hee afrayde god afterward addeth reason namely bicause god made feele terrible maiestie wise verely sayth bycause know haue mine aduersarie partie indure mine affliction one knoweth whence come know hande god persecuteth cause afrayde text greatly profite applie ought first formost without cause iob sayth afrayd god presence maketh feel maiestie good reason oft thinke vpon god wee shoulde bee touched striken feare stande awe maiestie yea although god shewe himselfe louing towardes v allure v maner cocker v little babe yet must wee come vnto sort must alwayes feare lowlinesse let v marke hath right knowledge god wil willing come yea come deede reioycing hee knoweth father yet notwithstanding hee alwayes behaue himselfe lawfully obediently towardes honour cause sayde fifth psalme lorde enter thy temple vpon multitude thy mercy worship feare effect wee haue note heere concerning fearing god maiestie herewithall let v knowe feare must bee iob speakes witte wee must bee afrayde god shunne mightie power terrible thing v go hide selues haue conceyued sayde feare wee must also receyue comfort assuring selues god minde scare v drawe v wee neede bee beaten downe considering presumptuousnesse oure nature suche pryde v wee neuer yeelde god due honour till oure fleshe bee vtterly subdued tamed howe must done euen plaine force owne good wee woulde neuer bee humble meeke god therefore fayne vse violence behalfe mortifie flesh may bee broken broozed stoupe vntoo thys done hee setteth v vp agayne contented shewe himselfe bee father ende wee shoulde honour ment wee shoulde bee stricken suche fearefulnesse wee shoulde knowe become wee haue honoured god wyth reuerent awe wee shoulde also preace vntoo vpon trust manifolde goodnesse yet notwithstanding iob speaketh heere verie notable witte conceyuing fearefulnesse bycause god softned heart amazed persecuting heereby iob doth v vnderstand although alwayes feared god yet notwithstanding forasmuch assaulted temptation conceyueth terrour wist manner god nowe importeth two poyntes one oure owne nature wee bee deafe dull wee knowe feare god hath beene sayde alreadie tyll driue v force yee see men become stoute lyke murtherers vntill god haue well tamed heereby wee see necessarye v afflicted otherwise would play looce coltes woulde know obey god yeelde subiection therefore hee fayne make v afrayde affliction hee sendeth v marke one poynt faythfull erewhyles astonished god iustice bee ouerraught yea ouertaken bee vtterly dismayde little iob howbeeit ende god releeueth well woorthie bee noted diuell vseth two extremity v one carelesnesse insomuch god drawe v violent maner fall asleepe sinnes diuell may winne handes well apayd god wakeneth v doth diuell labour driue v dispayre behoueth v preuent policy therefore let v learne iob striken great feare like may well betyde v much except lorde mortifie v heerewithall behoueth v marke maner men brought sayde feare terrour experience sheweth falleth alwayes proofe therof shall see many naughtipackes ceasse gnash teeth god euen hee smyteth vppon many blowes dooth god execute vengeance vppon enimies yet notwithstanding doo amende haue harte whit softned become spytefull wicked afore insomuch thervpon fall kicking spurning agaynst god like restie iades seeing affliction cannot alwayes tame subdue men take bitte teeth runne heade agaynst way god would haue go let v lerne thereby without cause iob sayeth heere hee afrayde bycause god cut darkenesse setteth downe darkenesse presence darknesse yea worde worde face darknesse men haue misexpounded wise god cut miserie happened mee iob meeneth rather thus god hath cut couert affliction indure vnknowne men oftentymes haue greefe trouble know whence commeth afterward addeth hath hidden darkenesse presence bodie hath corrupted text setting downe hee hath hidden whereas contrarywise sayde hee hath hidden darkenesse c say constreyneth come like offender led violence iudge woulde fayne scape hee wist shift himselfe away hee corner alone woulde cut owne throte become hys owne hangman dispatching himselfe yet notwythstanding must spite hart appeare iudge heare sentence condemnation euen doth iob shewe hee himselfe delt saye hucker mucker sayth afflicted cannot say see mischaunce god sheweth himselfe mine aduersarie maketh feele whome must yeeld mine account hath shewed hande notable poynt see oftentimes men smally touched feare god sheweth himselfe affliction report hereof pharao aegyptians dyd god euer vse sharper scourge yet notwithstanding seene hardened themselues agaynst truely knew time hande god knowledge soone vanish away dazeled themselues rather diuel bewitched thought none enemy moises aaron god shewed full well shetteth men vp must needes feele hande yea must fayne spite theyr teeth knowe iudge strong ynough tame yea ouerthrow breake peeces therefore let v pray god smite v hand hee suffer v fall sturdinesse according also moyses speaketh may open eye see chastiseth v may blockish stubborne knowe hande whereas sayde prophet looked hande smote shewe v stubborne people woonne god scourge let v beware happen vnto v let v pray god hee hathe made v feele mightie hande humble v withall suffer v bee vnamendable graunt v grace bee swallowed vp heauinesse wee shoulde bee scared away shunne rather drawe v vntoo vppon trust power bring graue also plucke v thence againe may say prophete lorde wyll quicken v third daye though wee bee deade tyme yet shall bee made alyue agayne hys goodnesse therefore let v alwayes repayre vntoo hym hathe wounded v assuring oure selues hee soueraine surgion wyll helpe v lorde iesus christes sake nowe let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement fault praying hym make v feele wee may alwayes returne right vnto hym yea euen suche affection minde may bee applyed therevntoo wee beeing assured bee fauourable v may call vppon desiring hee hath forgiuen v sinnes past guide v life whole labour may serue glory let v al say almighty god heauenly father c xcj sermon first vpon xxiiij chapter hovv tymes hidden almightie hovve suche knovv see dayes remoue land markes rob fleece flockes feede themselues vvith othersome take asse fatherlesse take vviddovves oxe gage turne poore vvay hyde themselues meeke pestered togither vpon earth go foorth morning like vvilde ass desert pray vvildernesse giueth bread himselfe child gather haruest feeldes gather vintage vynes euen vvicked spoyle naked man vvalketh vvithout garment colde vvet vvith shoures nighte mountaines imbrace stone theyr bed fleece fatherlesse take guage poore matter handled heere hathe beene layd foorth heeretofore another maner howbeit ther nothing may fare better wee consider well god propoundeth lesson often v matter god executeth iudgementes vewe eye might seene hee hath care good maynteyne enemie wicked punish haue deserued vvee see thing order world true iob hath hilde long talke afore know great stumbling blocke troubled continually yea euen perfectest v mischeefe indure god remedye euery v greeued wee fall disputing howe shoulde possible god shoulde pacient dissemble muche seeme asleepe letteth thing alone sort therefore neede stablished lesson conteyned heere often put minde ende wee see thing turmoyled worlde wee may alwayes haue light faith may serue v see god iudgementes although hidden v nowe poynte iob intendeth shewe heere god hideth iudgementes time neither executeth vengeance vpon wicked deliuereth godly first brunt suffereth endure many wrong proofe heereof sayth howe time hidden almightie suche knowe see dayes vvee haue seene heeretofore eliphas bare v hande god iudge worlde wise euery man might perceyue thinketh vpon serue hym hathe eye vppon reacheth hande continuallye side wicked punished hande cleane contrary sayeth iob proofe heereof seene full robberie might ouercommeth right haue taken paynes eate labor handes goodes plucked force seeing good troubled vexed bad hardned yet scape vnpunished god ouerslips though passed worldly matter man say dissembleth shew himselfe iudge till hee perceiue time serue would aske reason shoulde bee confounded therefore wee must conclude god iudgements secret wonderfull passe man capacitie wit shall fayle v behalfe therefore must reuerence secret god vnknowen v acknowledging bee righteous though find doings strange many haue troubled themselues greatly firste parte sentence sayde time hidden god seemeth iob blasphemeth going exclude god gouernment worlde sayde tymes ment thinges subiect chaunge alteration iob ment say god gouerneth well worlde generall medleth particular ordering aud guiding thing seueralitie farre naturall meening neede seeke elsewhere exposition gloze text selfe sayde time hidden vvhat meeneth iob hee sheweth himselfe saying howe whyche knowe god perceyue dayes vve knowe termed dayes god wherein hee vttereth sheweth hymselfe god punisheth wicked ne deliuereth good heareth request firste wee bee darke god seemeth bee hidden withdrawne worlde separate himselfe let go hauocke bee shorte excepte god make v feele prouidence prooue vnto v openly hee gouerneth aboue beneath bee night tyme becommeth darke light countenance god hee sheweth himselfe father good men preseruing grace side punisheth wicked worthye say whiche inlighteneth v day lorde speaketh holy scripture sayeth wicked doo reioyce day lorde shall bee turned vntoo intoo darkenesse light shall full feare terrour vvhy vvhen god appeareth wicked muste needes bee afrayde bycause hys presence ynough ouerwhelme causeth wicked bee stubborne mocke threatnings go forwarde wicked affection bycause seemeth bee scaped god hande god sheweth himselfe muste needes bee abasshed spite teeth let v returne text sayd god dayes seene know say good trust god wayting help saluation hath promised cannot first brunt perceyue hee helpe seeke yet dwell still suspence though calling vpon booted thus ye see godly cannot see god presence say cannot perceyue hand experience god neere sort selfe declareth saying hee alwayes ready heere call vpon truth wee haue true meening sentence witte god hyding time hee executeth hys iudgements euery minute houre bycause delayeth prolongeth meane perceyue hys dayes adayes may seeme god hath care v hee hath separated withdrawne himselfe v bycause hys prouidence knowne v true god seeth marketh thing dayly hath eye blindfolded yet seemeth oure vnderstanding according scripture woont applye selfe rudenesse infirmitie men god therefore hathe hys tyme wyll shewe seeth thing hee perceyueth presently bycause wee side able discerne hee hathe care men nowe hee hath eye open note marke euill committed redresse vve see respect perceyuerance certaine time hidden men howbeit well knowne vntoo god say god delayeth iudgements executeth first dashe thus much concerning sense letter nowe let v aduise selues gather suche instruction gyuen v thys sentence haue sayd already sore temptation faythfull thing confuzed world may seeme god medleth fortune ruleth gouerneth thing hath beene cause diuelishe prouerbes thing tossed casuall fortune thing blindly guided god playeth men tennisball ther neither reason measur doings rather thing gouerned certaine secret necessitie god vouchsafeth thinke vpon v behold blasphemy haue raigned time haue sayd already man wit dazeled goeth iudge thing order passe iudgement reason vvhat bee done let v armed stumblingblocks god sheweth himselfe iudge seemeth rather bee shutte vp heauen take hys pastime bee vnwilling deale affayres heere yet let v holde thys certayntie hee ceasseth doo office howbeeit secret fashion vnknowen vnto v althoughe hys iudgements bee wonderfull yet let v ceasse honour humilitie acknowledging bee rightuous wayting hys leysure paciently till hee shewe v cause hee maketh suche delay seeme straunge v lette v bethinke v whyche hathe beene handled heeretofore oure mindes frowarde wilfull wee turne god workes quite vpside downe neuer take profite god hilde suche order assoone man hath offended hee bee punished according offence good liue heere peace rest hope euerlasting life would neuer brought passe bee plucked bylow god gaue v peasable perfect state wherein nothing misliked would bee fayth wee woulde hope endlesse life wee would imagine resurrection thus ye see men might perceyue god iudgements according owne desire would fall asleepe heere low fast tied world much better thing order end wake v might liue ease wee woulde fall asleepe wee shoulde haue neyther vnderstanding thyng else thing go amisse bee compelled thynke vppon god lift vp oure wittes highe consider iudgement prepared shewed yet meane whereby oure lorde leadeth v longing latter day resurrection hee hathe promised v yet notwithstanding men ceasse intangle themselues many false wicked imagination haue sayd already bycause thing fall wee woulde haue tempted surmyze god thinketh vpon v ne regardeth v tyme lost serue hym one lyue well yll good men gayne nothing walking feare vnder hym lo howe men rushe intoo vngodlinesse bycause lorde ruleth iudgementes appetite might brooke according reason fansie vvherefore let v learne onely distrust owne fleshly wisdome also knowe enemie god wisedome wee must gyue libertie whiche deuise selues must minde well doctrine conteyned heere god iudgements hidden men surmount wee conceyue owne brayne small measure conteyne infinite thing also cause holy scripture termeth god iudgementes vnsearchable deepe cannot bee sounded therefore behoueth v call thys minde may holde v awe wee may bee discreete sober ende aduaunce selues muche waite god leysure till vtter vntoo v thing yet hidden beholde marke whereat must shoote wee mind gather good profitable instructio sentence let v mark also iniquitie raigne ther redresse must seeme straunge v hath beene time certayne wee compare state iobs time state much soundnesse wee know world growes worse worse men harden euill corruption increaseth yet complaynts made iobs time made heere namely rich men seagulfs swallow vp thing ate vp fatherlesse robbed widdowes nothing crueltie againe poore taken paynes yea pressed theyr oyle house yet men ceasse spoyle theyr goodes gathered grape yet fayne go awaye athirst wine drawne awaye hand yea crueltie extended farre poore folke stripped clothes faine go away starke naked steade beddes pyllowes fayne lye vpon harde stone sleepe rayne deaw night winde colde suche cruelty time iob shall wee maruell many outrage committed strongest go awaye thyngs force bee reason equitie vprightnesse among men wilde beastes nowe adayes world ouerfloweth naughtinesse wee come full toppe iniquitie saye wee muste thynke straunge see muche rightuousnesse dayes yet suche extortion intermedled true thing harde v comprehende neuerthelesse written vayne ende wee shoulde receyue instruction whe iniquity raigne sort euery v dispose himselfe pacience beare thing quietly seeing pleaseth god exercise v lyke liued aforetimes haue shewed way come lette v learne say prepare ourselues suche thing yea take paciently must resemble wicked growing hardharted crueltie neyther must practise cursed prouerbe playing naughtypacks among naughtypackes wee must armed pacience thing cannot done vnlesse first conclude selues seing god hath permitted much extortion outrage naughtinesse crueltie raigne age must shrinke like bee nowadayes paciently tarie till god redresse harmes assuring selues shall done god dissembleth time thing seeme hidden sight hee call ought account therefore behoueth v keepe silence meane whyle grudge accusing god though gouerned world righteously else vsurp superioritie ouer cursed blasphemie let v come another point haue marke whiche consider particularly iniquity iob marketh heere thing seeme excusable firste sight sayth riche men take pledge fatherlesse take away ass force take ox poore widdowes well hath beene sayde heeretofore lawfull matter take gage pledge permitted common weales yea let v marke god gaue people leaue take gage lending money condition poore shoulde bee greeued measure robbed goodes taking poore man bed sort fayne lye strawe haue declared alreadye behold heere crueltie punished mennes hand yet shall fayle come account god bee registred vp tyll residue haue pitie theyr neyghbours shall knowe also iustice shall executed vpon without mercie yea though poore folke desire vengeance god hand yet fayle according affirmeth moyses side colde shal crye though partie hold peace beare thing certainly god beholdeth poore man pitie condemnation hath beene cruel naught among cruelty committed iobs time hee rehearseth expressely riche men tooke gage fatherlesse widdowes yea euen suche gage necessary sustenance example fatherlesse childe hathe asse laboure withall taken muche man shoulde snatch bread mouth againe widdowe hathe cowe yeeldes hir milke buie bread withall thys bee taken hir shee robbed left naked though thys bee counted robberie afore men punishable among yet must come reckning god moreouer althoughe wee alledge neuer many excuse yet conuicted wee selues shall bee oure owne iudges howe dooth god execute office comparison vvhen wee see poore fatherlesse childe readye beg bread another man spoyling goodes wee see poore widow oppressed must bee greeued moued say crueltie vvee mortall creature wretched earthly wormes perceyue euill condemne pray god blynd haue eye shet although men laboure hide themselues many startingholes yet shall alwayes haue suche insight harte must needes discerne betweene good euill euen theyr owne iudgementes vnderstand muste fayne come heauely iudge seeth much clearely doo way wee muste marke also howe sayde heere boundes meeres buttelles remoued whiche greate disorder boundes meeres buttelles serue seuer landes heritage like money common fine serueth traffike among men money occupie one another thing true money coyned men might well haue trade occupying togyther exchaunge suche playne dealing nowadayes neyther coulde put vre vntowarde time men see money coyned goeth abroade hand hande suretie warrant men terme men may occupie one another besides also boundes meeres buttelles whiche serue feeldes landes certaine continuall bee good neighbourhod among v oure life shall disordered tha life brutishe wild beast yet notwithstanding see long ago hath beene suche craftinesse maliciousnesse chaunging boundes falsifying thing ought holy among men therefore according haue sayde already boundes meeres buttelles bee kept inuiolable surely go spoyle hauocke wyll bee nothing worlde catch catch may vve see hath beene aforetymes ende wee might bee better strengthned againste suche stumbling blockes yet notwithstanding time cannot iustifye suche doo amisse behoueth v marke poynt many thinke sheeld themselues alledging thing haue beene woonted bee haue beene long continuance pray doo knowe nowadayes suche plucke vp buttelles woorse theeues vve may well iudgement although wee god lawe scripture yet written harte mislike vtterly suche falsehood man alledge hath beene vsed afore hath beene practised three thousand yeares sufficient iustifie suche deface boundes thys day maye saye haue beene possession long time therefore let v learne harden ourselues example whiche see men beginne doo euill greeue god others followe shoulde seeme might doo list custome become lawe let v fall asleepe vpon god rule al right altreth loke hath ordeyned must continue euer men workes must layde squire squared man sooner swarue aside shall bee condemned vvherefore let v marke well men faultes misdoings growne custome must say may follow bycause woonted thing among men let v alwayes haue eye vnto god sayde hath stablished rule shall chaunged althoughe men turne fro thing seeme vtterly oute order yet shall god rightuousnesse continue euermore inuiolable full force therefore let v learne gather selues home paciently walke feare god haue eye sayde vprightnesse hee commaundeth v sayde afterwarde poore shette vp made turne way wicked scope steade hyding themselues oysted streetes hilde pauement owne possession seene nowadayes euer yet notwithstanding wee bee warned see iustice party haue charge represse lewde dealing sit god seate hold sword mace iustice theyr hand dutie must ouermuch offended true wee ought first right sorie seate whiche ought consecrated god seruice defiled men secondly know also god doth punish v iustly suffering iustice beare sway ought token vnworthy gouerned therfore becommeth v sigh see offence committed lord iustice magistrate set hads redresse haue courage stoutnesse ought haue let v learne say god punisheth v meanes forasmuch god name blasphemed thereby let greeue v let v sorie howbeit withall wee must conclude end sith god causeth thing bee set perfection presently must needes looke hee shall shewe himselfe iudge latter day also wee must arme oure selues suche stumblingblockes wee see wicked take suche libertie beate one bounce another doo many wrong outrage yet remedie wee bee newe top beginne agayne good men fayne keepe mouthes shette go house folke mocke bee fayne keepe themselues close prisoner vvhen see well let v pray god vouchsafe haue pitie v vtter power see men bee colde howbeeit hee delay thing fall wee woulde haue let v honour hys secrete iudgementes yee see cause written rightuouse shall bee shette vp shall dare shewe heades abroade muste bee fayne hide themselues bee hylde prisoner therewithall let v marke becommeth wicked howe men winke theyr lewdnesse punishe conuenient tyme gather boldenesse dare shewe themselues open streete make theyr tryumphes vvoulde god wee sawe example hereof nowe adayes scarcely shall honest man go abroade streetes shall flowted scoft vexed troubled assayled dare scarcely mainteyne owne good quarell meane done gallowclappers ought haue beene hanged halfe dozen yeares afore must go perking vp neb yea stoutly offer shame euery priuate persone also whole state iustice good man hath cause go either alone wyth company one russian shall come face hym shamelesse countenance hee must suffered indured spite god man openly wee haue marke wicked punished firste ought bee become stately ouermayster poore simple sorte rushe intoo vngraciousnesse becomming bolde good men fayne hide themselues prison dare speake worde vvhen wee see say let v tarie paciently till god redresse neuerthelesse ought warne suche publike authoritie duetie carefully woorke stoutnesse may bee guiltie extreeme disorder confusion spoken heere else dealing muste returne vpon theyr heades shall onely beare peece burthen also must bee vtterly ouerwhelmed thus yee see effect wee haue marke sayde wicked ryse betymes go theyr businesse namely go stealing robbing sayeth hee lyke wylde ss whiche light verie nimble beast heere hee doth v wit feete malictous cankerdharted sort swift running shed bloud doo manner mischeefe diligence one greatest vertues god gyueth vntoo men neuerthelesse behoueth men knowe ende bee created may applie themselues therevntoo bestowe theyr cunning abilitie vve knowe sayde psalme concerning god order rysing sunne hee sounded trumpette shyneth vntoo v ende euerie man shoulde go worke businesse therby shewe v hee hath made v bee ydle vnprofitable applye oureselues somewhat wherein god neighbour may bee serued ye see sunne rayser v vp vnto god may diligent duetie men oftentimes diligent bee buzie wyll ryse earely ynough doo quaf e fill paunche runne intoo manner disorder sayde prophete esay day long ynough make ende riotting finally wearie play brute beastes throughout sleepe daye watche night order nature turned vtterly vpside downe sort ryse earely purpose woorke treacherie lewdnesse neighbor deceyue one intangle another another sorte go whorehuntings another sort theyr wicked buying selling thus ye see wherein moste men bestowe theyr diligence thys shewed v expresly ende wee might knowe wherevntoo wee shoulde applye therefore soone sunne riseth let v learne thanke god lightning v sort wee may bestirre handes say imploy selues thing soeuer calleth vstoo wherein euer haue v serue hym agayne let onely marke shoote alwayes know wherevnto calleth v thing alloweth let v ware wee abuse light sunne diligentnesse god hathe gyuen v applying hurt oure neighbour man wrong displeasure nay rather sith see theeues vvhoremongers drunkard foreward euill let v learne finde fault owne slouth goodnesse one stirringest man world doo go murther man giue drunkennesse gluttonie layes himselfe graue dead see drunkard stinking carions halfe rotten aboue ground good cause wage receyue theyr double diligence glutting theselues abusing good creature god another sort go whorehuntings othersome theeuing robbing although kind men thinke aduauntage themselues yet diligence destruction haue toyled themselues throughly shall nothing else gather stacke wood end fire god wrath shall put cosume quite cleane therefore see despizers god wicked sorte diligent euill pray great shame v wee bee lazie though armes broken shall euen bee witness v vnprofitable thus ye see thing haue marke sentence warneth v diligent howbeeit take heede apply diligence god haue v bestow thereof let v haue eye good wee communicate one another help neighbour euery man consider abilitie meane hath wherewith succour haue neede lo diligence ought furthemore let v walke child light sith god doth inlighten v bothe day night let v call vpon sigh vnto night day time sendeth v sunnelight see haue duetie let v apply selues faithfully therevntoo leastwise let v forward giue selues euill least become witness slouthfulnesse although see god punish hand yet let v fully perswade selues horrible vengeance prepared sheweth selfe yet let v therefore ceasse looke farre behoueth fayth mount aboue thing seene beholde thing seene beholde thing hidden thus ye see may profite selues euen misorders seene world vntill oure lorde bring thing againe state perfection shall till last day nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement sinnes praying hym make v feele wise hee punishe v time wicked wee may yet perceiue hee spareth v beareth v wee bee vtterly ouerthrowne although haue deserued delt yet may ceasse haue recourse vnto seeing calleth v gently freendly may indeuer amende vice fleshe sory may wholly frame selues good call selues fully home vnto thereby may proue selues childre reuerence father much greater affection may please graunt grace c xcij sermon second vpon xxiiij chapter make naked man go vvithout clothing take gleanings hungrie presse oyle vvithin vvalles tread vvinepresse suffer thirst men crie citie soule vvounded shevveth selfe god putteth stop among hate light knovving vvayes thereof neyther continue path murtherer ryzeth early murthereth poore needie night lyke theefe eye adulterer longeth euening saying eye shall see mee hee hideth face entereth house night vvhich marked day agreeth vvith light light morning shadovve death man knovv terrour shadovv death light vpon vvaters portion cursed vpon earth see frute vineyardes iob goeth forwarde wing state seene world withoute redresse prouiding god serueth proue god iudgernentes alwayes visible apparant first brunt menne ought holde themselues quiet till lord stretch hande bycause hee knoweth fit time doo v appoint nowe iob alledgeth worlde full rakehelles poore go naked suche haue gleaned haue bit bread eate men snatch away euen litle gleaned rich men leaning vvhereby signifieth haue wherewith abuse credite rich consume poore vtterly outrageous thing yet god prouideth notwithstanding hee iudge world thys might trouble v first sight according see many surmize god asleepe worketh lyking behoueth v fully perswaded haue foreseene long afore ende bee troubled offended come passe hath euer beene yet god hath ceassed bee iudge worlde howbeeit time seeme bee hidden bycause see hys day hande true knoweth thing yet hydeth himselfe say hee sheweth hymselfe willing haue care succour suche afflicted tryeth theyr pacience time iob hath sayd addeth suche haue taken paynes yea haue gotten wherewith releeue themselues cannot inioy owne goodes man sayeth hee bath pressed oyle within walles man bathe troden wine shall ceasse bee athirst true oftentymes happeneth god iust punishment according also see howe threatned lawe thou shalt plant tree eate theyr frute thou shalt till earth sowe corne reape haruest thou shalte dresse vine drinke wine vvhen lorde speaketh manner bycause meeneth leaue thing order worlde contrariwise hee threatneth punish haue vsed benefites well yet wee side cannot alwayes see wyth eye god dissembleth matter vvhen pill poll othersome spoyled theyr substance wee cannot see reason god also intendeth humble v wee might honour confesse bee rightuous verely dazeled cannot discerne intendeth ye see whereat iob amed hee shoulde say vvee see dye hunger thirst whiche haue laboured sore meane whyle men robbe theyr goodes easie god redresse hee dooth therefore wee must conclude god woorketh suche manner knowne vntoo v within compasse oure vnderstanding hathe woonderfull purpose whych passeth man reache wee bee blynded wee must go measure god dooings reason shoulde enter bottomlesse deepe wee muste pray graunt v grace content selues sheweth v wee must haue sobernesse modestie walke ignorance till hee discouer thing fully v behoueth v keepe selues within owne tedder play loo e coltes bee neyther way path v thus iobs intent shewe v god iudgements ruled man discretion secret hidden v cause hee addeth men crye citie soule wounded namely dying lament aud god putteth stoppe god doth vnreasonable thyng later part may taken two wayes truely expounde god receyueth prayer two hebrewe wordes namely signifieth stop let hinderance impeachment whyche signifieth prayer haue likenesse neuer latter cannot taken heere prayer haue beene thephi whereas nowe thiphla surely confesse poynts would suffer exposition would bee conuenient agreeable bycause hee speaketh heere cry sayde men crie wherefore bycause bee wrongfully vexed yet god hath regarde theyr complayntes howbeeit translation also god putteth stoppe fitte notwithstanding moste men take another sense namely god doth vnreasonable thing surely sayde woorde commonly holy scripture put signification witte thing well ruled hath foundation whyche hathe truth selfe rather vnhonest condemned true signification common scripture eye muste bee circumstance sentence iob meeneth proue heere god doings grounded vpon reason vprightnesse howbe eit hee doo verely acknowledge discourse hee maketh tendeth another diuerse ende whiche bee amazed beholde state worlde vvhy v none v would dispose thing cleane otherwise therefore thys ordinance gouernement whiche wee see wee haue remember god behaueth himselfe fancie ne executeth hys iudgements suche wise man might beholde say see heere howe god woorketh rather oftentimes hee go couert say iobs meening thys sente ice must bee vnderstoode men crye citie soules suche vexed oppressed doo mourne yet god stoppeth doings thing say letteth thing runne still order yea tyme although hee winke yet hee asleepe hath binsayde afore therefore behoueth v suspende oure iudgementes make generall rule god punisheth men soone haue done amisse iustice apparant visible v vvee see heere contrarye iob sayeth expressely men crye citie hee shoulde saye speake vnknowne faultes maye bee manye deceytes wrong wroughte hudder mudder iniuries notorious whiche knowne ouer citie euery streete ring euery man speakes misused make outcry many men may witness wrong done beholde necessitie extreme appeereth playnly high time helpe neuer readye runne theyr wittes yet god maketh countenance minded helpe seeme cry vayne lost time men resort vnto god vvhen men see shall say god worketh maner wittes must needes dazeled therefore let v learne honor wisdome wee cannot comprehende say lorde true flesh nature prouoke v grudge thee yet must wee rule
