thee appetite vvherefore wee waite paciently till thine houre come wilt thou worke thou knowest profitable expediet lesson wel worthy noted see hastie besides man touch v finger wee bee wayward calling vpon god v hee help v soone haue cast foorth sigh thinke doth v great wrong seeing hartburning v passion excessiue wee haue much neede marke well lesson sayd men crie citie yea euen already poynt deathe yet god dispatcheth theyr sighing sorte suffereth men tormente still seeme straunge v first must vnderstande howe oure lorde hathe threatned suche haue pitied neyghbours shall crie heard themselues sayth poore haue desired shew mercy came find fauor hand became cruell eares deafe request therfore time wil come shall cry man shall heare vvhen heare threatnings god behoueth v looke whether crie lament haue vsed crueltie towards men reason god punish might sob sigh yet succoured whereas sayd cry went vp heaue party cried put extreme paine let v consider little whither worthie hadled therwithall let v acknowledge god iust iudge furthermore cannot bee sayde god suffering v bee oppressed punishe v may come passe suche greeued oppressed haue alwayes beene gentle louing doone anye wrong iniurie neighbour maye bee worthy punishment say knowne lette v reuerence woonderfull secretes god sith wyll wee knowe reason hee dooth beholde saye howe wee ought practize sentence therefore wee bee afflicted crie vntoo god yet perceyue willingnesse hym helhe v let v thynke hath forgotten v nother let v hart vvhy hys prouidence passeth oure vnderstanding therefore must learne holde selues quiet euen wee see graue afore v haue cried besought god haue pitie vpon v yea also seeme shet vp heauen wee perceyue hande gyue v ease let v ceasse sue continually shall disappointed oure hope yet notwithstanding behoueth v mount aboue man vnderstanding also paule sayth according example abraham ought hope aboue hope vvee haue like marke text long men selfewise impossible trust god rest vpon goodnesse vppon saluation promised god exercise fayth make v bee beseeged hundred deathes shall bee good swallowed vp gulfe vvhat done let v learne iudge oure saluation looke god hande owne mother wit reason small measure let v practize lesson paules hoping againste hope see whit god seeth v meane v escape god finde meane deathe seeming readie catch v god able remedie although know manner yet v scan let v god much honor beleeue hee saue v beyonde man conceyue yea euen wise wee shall compelled rauished woonderment behold also sayd welfare church faythfull bethinke sort god hath deliuered shal take dreame insomuch thyng cannot bee comprehended man reason bycause according order nature beholde say howe ought keepe ourselues quiet may rest vpon god goodnesse feede selues hope promise hee hath gyuen v yea wee crie vnto hee maketh likelyhoode hearing v let v ceasse continue sute still hope beyond hope wit beyond see discerne thus muche concerning text nowe followeth suche doo euill shunne light bide themselues theefe alwayes seeketh darknesse night whe day commeth thinketh shadow death aduouterer whorehunter watcheth till euening shette hee may shrinke intoo brothelhouse lo men hate light euill purpose doth iob speake heere shewe v god iudgeth worlde maner eliphas speaketh wee haue sayde eliphassis meening thing ruled suche wise bylow men may perceiue god guideth gouerneth thing true wee may well perceyue howbeit mother wit faith muste bee fayne reigne behalfe wee must looke present visible thing sayth iob heere beholde sayth hee howe menne condemne themselues sinne yet condemned god sight worlde say god executeth vengeance vpon first dash letteth alone quiet men therefore compelled accuse themselues make owne indytement condemne themselues god spareth ment god reserueth greater iudgement himselfe meane hee suffereth thing bee partly order intent wee shoulde drawe aloft vnderstand tyme wherin must exercised many battels temptation thys tyme trouble thing lift v vp withall reposing trust god worde wee walke owne fancie rest vpon thing bee seene nowe next way make v swarue aside ryght reason effect whereat iob ameth therefore let v marke well howe sayd seeke darknesse night work naughtinesse sorie see day appeere shadowe death true somtimes men become shamelesse sticke doe euill high noone dayes saide prophet resemble harlottes vncouer legges haue neyther shame discretion discerne good euill sorie sayth sainct paule salomon speaketh whe come bottome despize god honestie become brute beast discerne betweene good euill yet doth god leaue track whereby bee forced condemne owne sinnes spite teeth wee neyther scripture lawe pollicie anye thing else let v looke vpon sayd heere namely menne purpose vpon euill finde meanes hide themselues conclude euill euill condemned vvhat maketh man shunne sight worlde hee would take pleasure whoredome robberie drunkennesse wantonnesse like thing could find heart glorie wickednesse make vertne yet neuerthelesse hee hydeth himselfe vvhat constreyneth sayd one man doth man else consent euill behold whole worlde full vngraciousnesse seene verie ofte men make compactes togither suche giuen vice desire nothing much haue men doe themselues doe yet notwithstanding well one hyde themselues go naughtinesse would faine lewdnesse might neuer knowne hereby wicked shewe certaine lawe euen nature abolished yea discerning good euill much see must force conclude god iudge hee hath printed feeling men hart ashamed sorie sinnes commes owne good yet shunne light sunne whereas ought rather shunne light god iudgement vve see men besotte themselues wilfully would faine rock conscience asleepe might haue feeling think vpon god haue doone muste spite teeth enter themselues bee hilde fast brydle say conscience haue sinned wote excuse fault sith see must conclude god iudgeth worlde commeth men neuer haue consideration selues bee wounded sinnes bee sorie excepte god constrayned force nowe god inforce men conscience sort seare searing yron making haue burning fire within thinke wee hee must one day call men take reckening thing lay open register sayd daniell discouer thing lie buried darknesse paule sayth corinthian shame wicked haue alone sufficient infallible proof god iudgement much must faine come iohn sayth namely god greater conscience vvhen iohn hath sayde euery man enter owne conscience hee needeth none witnesse aduersarie accuse himselfe shall finde owne misdeed bee sufficiently conuinced freendes sayth perceyue owne sinnes yea euen whether wee shall god thinke hee blinde wee selues cleeresighted hath much power conscience haue man condemne one sinne must conclude damnable god hundred finde himselfe astonished afrayde euill howe shall hee bee able beare god horrible vengeance prepared v wee continue wilfully sinnes behold heere lesson necessarie least put vre haue sayde alreadie men one sparke reason though remorse shame haue sinnes yet bee conuicted could scape hande god surely ofte wee see man wilfully giuen doe euill feele sinnes one god summoned v iudgement constreyned v think vpon done yere haue infinit examination euerie day insomuch haue soner offeded thing said mo se sayd sting pricketh v much god sende pursiuant v say yee must appeare lord iudge vvee see number suche haue doone amisse labour couer sinnes verie cunning bycause know sinne damnable behold god warneth v yet regardeth men wilfully harden heart againste god warning may well sayde satan hath bewitched v yes yet beside suche warning god sheweth v worde faultes maketh v feele draweth v himselfe yet wee ceasse welter still owne filth growe senslesse hereby therefore appeereth lesson verie yll put vre yet written vaine haue sayde well worthie bee marked respecte selfe say much men labour excuse iustifie selues euill dooings yet bring passe standeth euerie one v hand awake consider shall gaine nothing colouring thing serue eschue reproch worlde man haue spent night secretly whoredome haue gone theeuing haue beguiled neighbour haue shet doores practize treason truly menne condemne till lewdnesse bee knowne abroade eschue presence god furthermore let v marke well howe apostle telleth v worde god two edged sworde entereth bone maree nothing hidden god examineth v thoughtes affection appoynteth worde preached vnto v also let v adde lesson paule giueth v sith wee haue gospell enlighten v child darknesse light suche haue god worde thinke haue made fayre hand sinne buried come remembrance god doth inlighten v doctrin haue daylight night according sayde sunne shall shine vpon church daye moone night lorde shall continuall light truly order nature continueth always state yet therewithall let man lay himselfe bed shet himselfe chamber hide himselfe close man may knowe hee sayth doth yet doctrine gospell doth alwayes shine vpon quench knowledge god hath giuen doubt although scornefull heathenish sort labour see howe mad beastes dayes seeke mothing abolishe religion yet god haue sayde lampe worde burne alwayes maye perceyue owne damnation seeing god hathe giuen v doctrine gospell brightnesse whereof wee dimme let v bethinke ourselues vnderstand theeues whoremaster euill dooers seeke couert teache v howe ought walke seeing god v present hee sheweth himselfe open face eyther father iudge vvherefore let v learne dedicate whole life vnto whereas wee see would couer euill dooing shunne light shadowe death glad night commeth let v vse light giuen v keepe v straying waye swaruing aside specially seeing lord calleth v reacheth hande drawe v thus ye see howe wee ought profite ourselues grace god giueth v making v know sinnes wretchednesse meanes gospell furthermore let v marke like wicked doe hate light day could find heart sunne plucked skie ende myght alwayes haue freedome euill much shunne light gospell heere ye see also cause doctrine gospell yll receiued world lord iesus christ sayth wonder howe men bee stubborne againste god specially seeing sendeth sonne redeemer offereth v forgiuenesse sinnes desiring v great gentlenesse freendlinesse howe many say men bee stubborne forsake goodnesse god outrageous churlishnesse yes certainly behold reason world hateth gospell bycause sauiour christe sayth euer doth euill hateth light cace standeth men giue themselues euill yea ouen conuicted wilfulnesse ceasse harden themselues would faine shet eye spite god heart seeing wonder men bee loth tast gospell byte rather play mad bedlems ought thought strange see theeues murtherers whoremonger euill doer could wel find heart haue sunne darkened shine world haue sayde brightnesse gospell yet farre greater serueth gyude eye shew v way outwardly entreth euen oure secrete thoughtes must examine hidden verie bottome heart yee see wicked loth come doctrin frame theselues mean vnto yet must side deale cleane contrariwise haue sayde alreadie therefore touching order nature god maketh daisunne shine let v vnderstand ende euerie man giue himselfe goodnesse dutie marke one point againe wee shall haue walked according calling state euery seruing god neighbor day long let v assure selues wee must abuse darkenesse night libertie dooing euill lampe god worde neuer goeth haue declared alreadie therefore day night let v bee child light let v awake inlightned saint paule sayth say let v fall asleepe soothing selues sinnes neyther let v thinke selues innocent god rather let euerie one v quicken vp himselfe drowned owne conceit bee past shame euill let v bee sober onely eating drinking also al desire lustes let v bridle may cut al superfluous concupiscence drawe v vnto euill thus ye see effect haue marke sentence herevnto iob addeth ende wicked lightfooted vpon water glyde away yet go graue like earth drieth saith hee heate sunne sucketh vp snowe moysture doth graue swallowe vp wicked seemeth iob sheweth god punisheth euill deed done worlde agreed eliphas meening farre otherwise intent shewe effecte wicked perishe wise man perceiue god hand apparantly vpon say behold god punisheth man cause hath liued amisse contrariwise wicked soke away like water leaue remembrance themselues behinde goe graue yea doe good men see howe iob concludeth god doth execute iustice punishing sin men may alwayes seene heerewithall let v call mynde howe hath bene sayde afore iob blasphemeth god make beleue prouidence thing ruled fortune god meane setteth asleepe heauen intent shewe god iudgementes alwayes visible behooueth v beare well mynde saying set alwayes eye verie profitable doctrine haue shewed heretofore yet hath need repeated newe againe good greatly troden vnder foote long pining die time yet owne opinion haue liued long life nothing else cotinull consumptio vve see eye meane becommeth wicked haue despized god bin full outrage crueltie naughtinesse assoone good dayes past die yea euen water soketh away man shall perceiue god vttereth certaine marke vengeance vpon death gentle easie vvhen man see say great stumbling blocke suche iudge naturall reason see lorde doth alwayes punish wicked letteth goe common traine afterwarde die seene common generall men yet must therefore surmize scaped shall abyde vnpunished must haue eye iudgement wee looke according promise holie scripture assuring selues lorde calleth v thither executeth iustice full onely part giue v inckling may serue shewe v thing yet brought right order end hope comming lord iesus christ much heartely long redeemer thus ye see doone vvhen see tyrant beare sway innocent bloud shed whoredome loocenesse reigne wrong outrage violence committed poore folke troden men feete set vpon throat thing shuffled togither hotchpotche wee wote say let v confesse saying vvell lorde thing ordered would wish hope comming lord iesus christ resurrection promised v heauenly kingdome bee alreadie paradise nowe tossed raging sea midst stormes whirlewindes serueth well teach v long rest prepared v heauen thou hast promised v end may haue sight alwayes fastned vpon comming lord lesus christ thy sonne shall gather v himselfe according thou hast committed v charge protection guyding furthermore see wicked nowadayes hide selues euill let v assure selues yet wee hide selues presence oure god although shunne sunnelight yet wee shunne sight searcheth heart vvhat done forasmuch gain nothing seking lurking hole shun presence god would good come sight whereas wicked eschue mocke threatnings made iustice let v seke nothing come god seeing gracious v make v owne indges let v tarie condemned hand ende may quit let v yeelde selues giltie owne accorde ye see may put sentence vre learne condemne ourselues wee come shewe ourselues god come vpon trust promise receyue suche mercie sorie sinnes seeke nothing else grace offered v dayly persone lorde lesus christ let v fall face good god acknowledgement sin praying touch v quicke repentance may perceiue euill v seeke remedie therof sticking rightuousnesse conuert v wise stead feeding ourselues vice lewde lustes may seeke frame selues wholly holie lawe commaundements knowing neede haue healed spirituall disease may seeke medicine wher foud wit lord iesus christ renued holie spirit may hold way right foorth place calleth v vnto euen till haue fully clothed v owne rightuousnesse wee haue continued waye saluation sheweth v nowe worde may please c xciij sermon third vpon xxiiij chapter earth drieth vp heate drinketh vp snovve vvaters sinner graue louing man shall forget vvormes shall take svveetenesse hee shall remembred vvicked shall broken tree misintreateth barrein vvomen beareth child doth good widow dravveth strong vnto distrusteth ovvne life men giue assurance rest eye vvatch vvayes vvhen bee exalted little caughtavvay die bee made poore bee barred vp like tovvers cut top eares corne vvho hee vvill make meea lyer hee bee vvho hee vvill disproue vvordes may fare better doctrine must call mynd hath bin declared heretofore cause thing repeated vnto v wee bee greeued troubled much wee see thing diuersely disordred world wee would haue perfecte state heere hope therefore behoueth v beare paciently disorder whereby pleaseth god exercise v humble v therwithall seeke true remedie sith thing troubled among men suche ought put hand amendment forslow dutie let v learne resort vnto god trust let v doubt end wil pitie v although bee fayne suffer many wrong reproches time like iob shewed heeretofore outrage extortion done also say god seene punishe tormented poore hee addeth similitude may bee vnderstand two wayes reason sentence verie short broken similitude earth soketh heate drinketh vp water snowe graue sinneth standeth worde worde men take though sayde graue swalloweth vp wicked men drie earth drinketh vp snowe water snowe melteth awaye heate sunne hereby iob ment say god punisheth men apparantly according desertes die men execution done vpon person whereby men may perceyue god iustice rather go common trace god permitteth die natural deth therefore see god punish wicked haue done many mischiefes cruelty seemeth asleepe heauen weake ignorant offended though hee regard world though hee dispozed gouerne v mainteine good suppresse vnruly haue shewed alreadie iobs intent shewe v suche case behoueth v reuerence god secrete iudgementes assuring selues althoughe wee conceiue reason workes yet must therefore blaspheme swallowed vp sorrowe quietly wayte till god shew couenient time v set day behoueth v tary leisure assuring ourselues executeth iudgements poynts life intent wee learne reach fayth hope world sense agree verie well also similitude applyed ende thus like earth soketh heate drinketh vp snowe water wicked men sinne euen graue iob sayde bee nuzzled euill whole nature giuen according also commonly sayde menne throughly nuzzled eyther good euil custom haue taken vp maketh become natural vnto beareth sway followe without paine iob ment declare heere hee speaketh sinne start fittes seene man ouershooteth reason sodeine occasion prouoketh although haue liued honestly time without blame yet hee caried time tempest thus see men commit euill outrage continue iob declareth speakes haue done amisse sodeine pang brayd ouercome forcible temptation hardened naughtinesse haue made piece nature therfore like nature sunne melt snowe afterwarde drie earth sucketh euen wicked continue euill euen graue say vnto death sith see example yea warned sentence thinke vpon thing tootoo ordinarie world let v learne resort vnto god pray giue v grace bowe vnder hande bee giuen serue honour may bee naturall v true good shall alwayes haue striuing themselues neuer walke vprightly incomberance gainstriuing according continuall battayle betweene mynd flesh neuerthelesse vertue god hath put v must fo farre forth preuayle make v loue good free hart cleaue throughly therevnto must pray vnto god strengthen v therein otherside must beseech also suffer diuell get possession v trayne v hither thither harden v sore euill dooing might become nature furthermore see men stubborne wickednesse let v thinke straunge hath euer bene see example end iob sayth quiet man forget folke wormes shall take sweetnesse shall bee remembred heereby sheweth well wicked shall reigne euer must haue ende neuerthelesse god letteth alone peace vntill death state seemeth worse men haue liued equitie vprightnesse without wrong neighbour man copare pollers theeues haue eaten vp men goodes delt merueylous cruelly say man compare haue liued simplicitie shall finde state alike thing shuffled togither cannot sayde order world yea truly looke witte wee consider god reserueth punishing wicked till life come intent nestle bylowe alwaies haue eye comming lord iesus christ muste redresse thing nowe order nowe wee behold shortnesse life see giuen spoyling poore folke go graue become wormes meat sayd let v vnderstand verie miserable wee labour immortalitie promised v heere iob setteth v downe liuely picture image man life death end might know wee wee haue better hope seene eye purpose haue liued holily haue endeuered serue god please haue liued among neighbour without deceiuing hurting man yet notwithstanding must gathered graue wicked must bee shuffled togither must wee rot lo menne bee considered owne kynde wretchednesse wee better hope considering alteration world let v warned prouoked lift vp heades looke heauenly life promised v although wretched carions subiecte rottennesse yet let v liue hope lord send v partie whome hath redeemed v wil suffer deare inestimable price hath giuen saluation perish disappointed lo wherein ought reioyce also wherin glorie consisteth iob proceedeth declare wicked fully bent giuen ouer vnto euill without awe feare god yea without shame worldward setteth one kinde namely beguile oppresse barreine woman haue borne child good widowes doubtlesse vnder one kinde iob ment comprehende poore folke able reuenge themselues haue maintenance ayde man hand saying wicked fall hande suche kinde folke bycause seeme fit pray readie prepared speaketh expresly barreine woman woman haue child although widowe yet hir chiidren dutie shee hath succour hath say staffe hir olde age leane vnto woman husbandlesse chyldlesse vtterly succourlesse therefore prayes wicked men hunt bycause thinke bodie withstande may doe list without regarde god nameth himselfe defender widowes likewise deale fatherlesse child straungers hath bin sayd heretofore iob contenteth giuing one example hee say suche men vphild feare god thinke themselues haue libertie doe euill see man let therefore haue raked men good none hath withstood bestirre themselues much take leaue doe list vvhy haue regard god secondly addeth drawe strong say haue long time exercised sayde trade eating vp misintreating poore suche haue meanes defend themselues gather greater boldnesse afterward set vpon rich also whereby make themselues feared doubted men men fain raunsome selues oute handes among outlawes muche euery man afrayde life yea fain compound yet speed neuer better whe haue done become traitor vnfaithfull become also like wilde beastes haue deuoured fleeced poore men may see humanitie yet must men faine giue rausome neuer suretie haue done lie wayte life suche haue giuen thinke man hath presented bribe ought receiue euer rent nowe see effect howe iobs meening wicked haue misintreated poore cannot helpe themselues haue rescue man hand therevpon become hardie play wood beast spare man set vpon rich strong vpon credite authoritie wherby extorcion groweth extreeme nothing robbing beastly outrage short ther neither hood shame left tolde v ende bee troubled wee see example hath bene said afore rather forefenced stumbling blockes might vnderstand lorde suffereth thing intangled end go inheritance wherevnto calleth v nestle selues though sure resting place heere rather learne pilgrymes wayfarer worlde much settling v life according saint paule sayth estate christian remoued fro may haue skill profit selues thing except god pluck v world maine force wee neuer giue ourselues seeke heauenly life cause hee suffereth many alteration remouings thing fro thing goe confuzion great disorder wee bee amazed haires head stande vpright must serue drawe v worlde intent wee bee much wedded thus ye see wherevnto ought apply thing againe whereas haue defence indure many wrong let sure god leaueth destitute worldly help end looke vnto wee must impute misfortune man succoreth v oure neede let v assure selues god hath bereft v man helpe intent wee humbled selues looke vp vnto seeke flee onely vnto refuge lo howe haue practize doctrin furthermore let v vnderstand therewithall lorde myndeth exercise oure charitie wicked sort worke wrong outrage suche haue succour among men say end euerie v endeuer help suche folke according abilitie beholde thing wherein god tryeth whether wee feare trying whether wee haue charitie v wee see owne freendes kinsfolke necessitie trouble verie nature moueth v helpe wee see poore man abused hath man beare vp wee indeuer ayde succoure neede shall vndoubtedly bee inrolled god token one droppe christianitie v haue declared alreadie lorde recommendeth vnto v suche destitute man helpe suffereth bee afflicted openly oure eye intent wee streine ourselues succour bee v bicause bee excuse v oppressed wee must thinke commeth mischaunce rather god sendeth v therefore whensoeuer god maketh v witness wrong done poore man step helpe shielde much v lieth surely god noteth marketh watcheth behalfe bicause haue sayde mindeth take tryall louingnesse nowe let v come second point declared heere iob sayd wicked speaketh draw strong one rage water roteth vp tree beareth downe suche haue long time bene hardned euill dooing like great stormes tempestes rend vp thing yea euen tree house appeareth eye would god got much experience sharp set would faine catching dare first dash set vpon stronger sort vpon haue talon pawes reuenge themselues withall begin little one giue scope euil haue strongest howbeit hapneth without wonderfull ordinance god iust wage rich men authoritie credite vexed wicked vvherefore man rush leudnesse striketh one strippeth another commit outrage well ease haue mainteine themselues laugh true mislike men misliking seke meanes redresse bycause matter seemeth touche themselues say hee playd wold make feele haue teeth lo howe talke haue credite wealth well fenced touched themselues meane poore extremely misused vvhethese roisters suffred list see scape vnpunished fall buckling great cobbes giueth leaue suppose god doeth order eueriwhit manhoode v would pitie rue hart see poore folke troden vnder foote make v resist vttermost power nothing vvhen poore man outrageously molested make none account repressing mischeefe rather let looce giuing wicked occasion misbehauiour must god therefore touch v within suffer appoint mischiefe returne vpon owne head lo heere sentence well worthy bee noted therein myrrour holie ghoste sheweth v wickednesse increaseth groweth full heigth men giue scope indeuer redresse conuenient time lesson directed specially rich men authoritie true see example seene courtes great prince three foure minion great credit make whole realme quake much euen haue twentie thirtie thousand pound rent must faine passe pawes couche like lyamhoundes giue good piece substace purchase fauour raunsome themselues withall vve see example heere howbeit quantitie quantitie man may throughout al place see declared good reason god prouidence extend world vpon great small apparant haue libertie pill poll many annoyance little one must also ende make great one afrayd touching haue meane abilitie ayde mainteine poore men god meaneth vnderstand set themselues wrong iniurie theselues also must looke pinched say themselues shall length answere owne person men shall fleece pick eye worthie shall god glorified sending punishment vpon true disorder increaseth dayly neuerthelesse faithfull maye therein beholde god secrete iudgementes yea euen beyond reach man reason bicause god inlightneth word ye see howe ought acknowledge selues cause disorder worlde vvee skill complaine thing go petite crie ala wo yea bee readie blame god himselfe meane wee consider fault procedeth ourselues ourselues ought beare blame euill euery man would put hande suppressing vice misdealings euerie man labor stop euil surely god woulde blisse suche meenings wee haue delightfull order among v cause reioyce steade seeking remedie thing amisse men bring wood kindling fire rather become firebronds themselues behold maner dealing ought thinke straunge thing bee intermedled neyther brinke brimme al shuffled togither like hotchpotch haue sayd fire kindled wee neuer leaue throwing woode vvherefore lette riche suche authoritie haue regarde poore see outrage wrong done poore oppressed let reach hand indeuer succour perteine rich men able help poore much perteineth haue sword iustice hand negligent bee well worthy euill winked light vpon owne head god set vpon scaffolde men beholde iust vengeance person therefore much ought marke sayde thus yee see ende ought referre doctrine conteyned verse therewithall ought marke well wordes iob vseth without cause sayeth men shall bee faine buie raunsome themselues hand wicked haue scope shal haue giuen boldnesse alreadie eate vppe pill poll crouching greazing hand shall boote nothing mad dogges nothing content therefore euer man doth sharpening appetite bribe doe harten harden take due rente man hath gyuen one present would haue hold still neuer leaue suche vnsatiablenesse followeth poore folke distrust owne life yea say euen rich credit must faine tremble see shall say wicked men haue worlde bee long ere seeth broath wote howe shall bee able shift therefore must bee faine fawne vpon afore hande must gayne somwhat leastwise must prouoke displeasure see erewhile danger faine quake distrust owne life giuing bridle wicked wote bee till haue pacified wicked yet fynde meanes howe therefore must fayne liue continuall perplexitie anguish heerein haue fayre looking glasse shewe v remedie euill doings due time place suffer shrewde weedes growe long till get vpper hand man plucke vp would bycause tooke due season vvee see inconuenience insueth yea euen god maketh heart faynt might easily haue remedied mischeefe first much fare armes broke haue neither courage stoutnesse become weak water sayd iust punishment negligence vsed forslowing duetie represse mischeef first rising men see poore folke harried misused crueltie outrage yet redresse mischeef must needes growe strong nowe faine would heretofore also could haue disfeated afterward preuaile bycause lorde graunteth honour grace let v bethinke v say let v bethinke v well let v consider wretchednesse men rest themselues vpon god haue regarde discharge care vnto whereby might leane vnto protection thing iob describeth v namely men put trust god ordinarie matter world see wicked haue full scope must deuise creepe fauor meane consider feeding cuill wit make much bolder would bee one mad man desired nothing kill men one put sworde hande another bring store stone giue poyson folkes beside much doe fawne vpon wicked men see credite one commes present bribe set iustice sale another commes wind himselfe acquaintance fine deuice inflaming sharpening rage make egerer whereas misdoubt hild backe conclude al list lawfull neede afrayd bicause worlde standes awe say man come lure length residue shall faine come vnder myne arme make play apish tricke see howe wicked become bolder men come fawne vpon fashion yet worldwarde men deale alwayes sorte wee haue respecte vnto god wee must needes bee euermore feare perplexitie say neede beware suche man see muste bee fayne passe handes howe shall doe come reason plaine proofes vaine hath eares full alreadie therefore must goe another waye worke fill wooluishe throte present muste carie hym somewhat else see full vaineglorie desirous aduaunced howe euer bee standeth vpon reputation gazeth owne peacockes feather winne gole skill couche lowe like spaniell see none remedie muste goe waye woorke see say ordinarie manner bee doone contrarie parte vvhen wee see wicked full couetousnesse vaineglorie lyke wilde beastes destroying thinges let v saye vntoo god yet doest thou lorde holde reynes mennes brydle thou canst restreyne god woorke soone wee woulde haue hym lette v vnderstande mynde buffet v tyme yet let v assure oure selues hee watcheth oure welfare suffer v vtterly cast vp pleasure ouershoote themselues sort oure lorde hathe v hande hee neere hande v althoughe wee perceyue immediately yet doeth hee garde v maynteyne v warrant wee may boldely despyze wicked stoutnesse muche wee knowe god watcheth oure welfare preserue v handes pawes aud throtes lo whervnto behoueth v come respecte men knowe none shift yeeld ourselues euill confent vnto behoueth v behold protection god hidden v respect perceyuing wee haue good certaine recorde holie scripture wee ought doubt howe euer world goe let v keepe selues purchasing vnawfull meanes bewray owne distrust vnbeleefe besides wee bee guiltie also euill farre forth v bycause weefeede therefore man falles flattering wicked helpeth set lustinesse redeemeth himselfe handes raunsome doeth hee fyrst sayde hee bewrayeth hath trust god wee could rest vpon god promise surely wee would neuer seeke crooked wayes wee woulde alwayes bethinke v whether god permitted thing hath forbidden would say must wade certaine suche labour winne wicked men fauour briberie suche like dealing verie infidel bewray themselues well ynough must end payd home honoring god ought allying themselues wicked nourishing naughtinesse one conspired breake ouerthrowe order surely haue done muche lay doe therefore haue saide alreadie let v learne looke vnto god trust shall bee subiecte wretchednesse whereof iob maketh mention knowe life defende wicked fashion rest vpon god prouidence must alwayes tremble neuer bee sure safetie rest yea behooueth v marke well howe iob addeth wee bee desirous purchace wicked men fauour presentes inconuenient meane lie much wayte v seene faithlesse folke sith feare god pray bee faythfull vnto men nay rather howe possible god suffer vse treason mischeuousnesse seeing man hee warned hand man cast net wilfully excuse apparant eye men see wicked make conspiracy togither yet notwithstanding none trusteth howe possible two wicked men enter intoo league man would thinke bee ioyned togither like two finger one hande looke one willeth willeth proof eche trusteth certain eyther could finde heart hanged himselfe harme leastwise could find hearte hee hundred foote within ground end fauoured become enemy vvee see heereby god gouerneth euen midst disorder abashed confuzion mangling thing let v lifte vp eye aloft shall see god gouerneth thing surely suffereth wicked trust one another inforceth stand alwayes feare yea euen vphilde naughtinesse soothing ful hypocrisie intent faune vpon please say euen also shall alwayes quake feare contrariwise put trust god surely although suffer many extortion wicked men handes lord permit vexe trouble v yet shall wee bee put expedient v indure god haue consideration bring al thing happie profitable ende say remedie wherevnto wee must bee prouoked resorte wee see thing order worlde nowe iob hath spoken hee addeth bee lifted vp little afterwardes fall downe cut top eare corne bee shet vp others sheweth breefly hee sayde alreadie looke present life wee shall see orderlesse masse wee shall discerne one thing another wicked haue large scope time yee shall see vpon top wheele say come tumbling downe good men may also bee well aduanced yet end faile footing vvhat see experience according iob co cludeth saying make lyer considering experience let v learne retyre vnto god looke vpon present thing doubtlesse wee shall onely wauering reede strawe emptie chaffe cast tossed fro wind ther shal stedfastnesse v therefore must haue discretion looke vpon thing disordered world howbeit wise god prouidence always printed mind true reach vnto owne wit yet must loke toward eye faith god word may loking glasse holie scripture serue light loke world although god iudgements hidden v nowe let v therefore ceasse say lord rightuous humble selues vnder alwayes haue suche eye promise wee fayle call vpon midst distresse assuring selues succour v make v feele goodnesse wee may reioyce midst temptation world let v fal face good god acknowledgement sinnes praying blot oute remembrance bring v backe himselfe wise wee may bee tangled earthly thing cleaue wholly rightuousnesse liue world wee may passe forwarde straungers till wee come rest shall continue v wee haue passed trouble temptation mortall life let v say almightie god heauenly father wee acknowledge confes e c xciiij sermon first vpon xxv chapter bildad suite ansvvered sayde soueraintie terrour vvith maketh peace high place number army vpon vvhome doth light shine vvhat rightuousnesse shall attributed vnto man compared vvith god nothing hovve may cleane borne vvoman behold vvill giue light vnto moone starres cleane sight hovv much lesse man vvind vvho rottennesse son man vvhich vvorme forasmuch wee greatly giuen stande owne conceyto ground follie thinke vpon god maiestie wee haue verie good profitable counsell oft wee tempted take glorie oure selues wee must cast vp eie vpon god consider throughly power might rightuousnesse glorie brauerie soone layed water steade beyng puffed vp pride sotted ouerweening onely regarde god ynough quayle v sort shall ashamed selues ye see cause holy ghost dooth nowe person bildad giue v warning god ought right haue cheefe soueraintie afrayde thinke vppon considering order hath set heauen worlde wee ought know selues farre hauing thing may bee value starres shine bright vnto v darke vntoo seeing cace standeth remayneth men notwithstanding brauerie bee wormes rottennesse would glorifie themselues aboue starres vvere follie ouergreat see end wherevnto thing tende conteyned heere forsomuche men canot humble themselues long looke downeward god set eye maiestie ende knowe cause set store themselues whosoeuer exalteth himselfe god must needes bee brought lowe bilded make v perceyue howe greatly ought feare reuerence god alledgeth heere maketh peace high place say disposeth order heauen suche wise men see peasable well ruled gouernment may referred angelles according wee say prayer thy wil done earth heaue vvhich doth v wit god yll obeyed heere beneath reason rebelliousnesse men bicause fully fraughted many wicked lustes canot submit themselues rightuousnesse desire angelles wholy conformable god seeke nothing please respect may please reforme v make raigne dominion peasable beneathe correcting vnruly affection v therefore man might referre sentence said parcell prayer spoken angel howbeit doubt bildad looked wit whole gouernance wee perceyue order heauen although sunne infinite bodie sight moue swiftly might seme confound thing yet could man rule clocke like compasse say could make kepe course iust possible vve see like moone starres although number bee infinit yet disorder thing well disposed vvherefore without cause doth bildad alledge god maketh peace high place onley heauenly creature see raigning also disposeth whole order worlde suche wise aboue although thing disordered moueable many chaunges trouble yet notwithstanding god fayleth lead al ende hath ordeined appoynted true looke downwarde wee cannot see gouernment peasable set forth loke vp god prouidence certain euen middes al turmoyles alteration world shal perceyue god gouerneth al seemeth good himselfe see imported saying god maketh peace high place say hee brideleth creature wise al chaungings men see yet fayleth gouerne still thing fall haue according guydeth ordinance seeing cace standeth let v conclude good reason power soueraintie feare yelded vnto say honour feare worship partie hath dominion ouer v reuerence acknowledge mayster souerain lord heauen earth first blush talk might seeme superfluous haue well considered hath bene touched shal wel see without cause bildad reporteth heere gouernment dominion god hath ouer world saying runneth roundly mouth talke god wel ynough mean coceyue maiestie make ydoll true acknowne would euen abhorrre yet yelde god power due whiche ought conceyue talke maiestie name run roundly mouth way cotempte oftentimes wee talke way scorne mockage bee seene men measure heathenish wheras al knee ought bow al creature tremble mention made name god bolde yeeld reuerence lowlinesse short men acknowledge maiestie god neither conceiue power humble submit themselues vnto ought doo therfore whe speaking god neede qualified vnto v say vttered wise may conceyne cause holy scripture doth oftentimes adde tytles contented single name termeth almightie alwise alrightuous immortall himselfe maker thing gouetno thing purpose sayde waken men ouersluggish honour god worthie short loke often scripture giueth god name honor vpbrayding v vnthankfulnesse dulnesse wee yelde due much rob power glory leastwise take honor humble ourselues exalt magnify deserueth therefore sayd god maketh peace high place gouerneth world wise see thinges must stoupe vnto notwithstanding rebelliousnesse stubbornnesse men yet ceasseth performe execution ordinance let v learne sit loger asleepe dally god haue bene wont tremble maiestie aboue thing let v remember conclusion made heere namely hee hathe soueraine dominion awe ouer v say must subiect also tremble al feare stande awe foolehardie rather mad striue agaynst dispute doings murmure though fault foud work thus ye see men mouthes stopped ende bereft foolish presumption may learn tremble presence god knowe whome must yeld obedience cause bildad addeth number army vpon doth light shine vvhen sayde army without number shewe men woorse mad matche themselues sort againste god bid battell true doo expresly yet impossible murmure god repine iudgements bee displeased thing hee dothe wee must make warre wherein consisteth souerayntie dominion hathe ouer v acknowledging power also infinite goodnesse wisedom righteousnesse mercie iustice vvhen haue glorify vvell men thinke god doings vnreasonable blame cruelty chafe agaynst impaciencie bee offended thing dothe doubt go bereeue diuine glory cannot done without making war whensoeuer wee glorify god infinite righteousnesse goodnesse power wisedome much wee made defyance rise vp agaynste mortall man taketh hand said heere god host without number beholde angel heauen warned defend honoure formed created likewise creature fully disposed auenge maiesty assayled v wormes rottennesse therefore let v marke well purpose mention made heere god host army ende know oft men presume murmure god blaspheme iustice must haue many deadly enimies bee angel heauen number whome wee knowe bee infinite also behoueth knowe creature armed runne vpon end hath god created thing glory shoulde shine foorth men submit themselues god willingly yeld honoure belongeth vnto spoken heere army host shall serue fray rather glad surely scripture telleth v god hathe many thousandes angel redy commaudements intendeth else make v vnderstande god hath receiued v fauoure strong ynough kepe v safe notwithstanding bee assayled side therfore men vtter force haue practizing destroy v yea diuell himselfe riseth vp v wee must bee afraid vvhy bycause god hath heauenly army defed v according said angel incamp themselues round v hee hathe appointed angel guide v faythfull person shal stumble vvee see infinite number angel serueth comfort v end wee might bee sure god succoure v neede hath wherwith like faythfull leane vnto god submit themselues al humility preserued multitude angel euen al striue agaynst proude sturdy must inforced feare vnderstande set themselues fashion god haue many enimies beside insomuche power angel shall fall vpon ouerwhelme creature shall serue maynteine glory whose power haue therfore let v remember well sentence sayde army god without number therevppon let v assure selues purpose men conspire v shall haue assembled force togither yet shall strong v god shal alwayes get vpper hande vvherefore let v deceiue selues wee see ourselues well accompanied greate number people gathered v may confounded one moment hand power god againe although alone ynough eyther saue v destroy v yet moreouer hath army redy furnished incomprehensible maner shall set vpon v whensoeuer thinketh good therfore let v stande feare let v learne sayd bee proude wee see world hold side great power mainteyne v geere shall stand v sted considering great power god declared heere hereby man maye see howe sore vnbeleefe men blinded put choyce whether wee haue angel heauen watch v gard v seruants welfare whether haue v deadly enimies behold god vseth suche goodnesse grace towardes v appointeth angel v seruice scripture auoucheth haue v garded therewithal affirmeth power say stretcheth hande ouer v ende hee might maynteine v whome long wee bee guyded angel garde v al harme euen long ourselues cannot take benefite offered v vve neded receiue vve farre fro receiuing good turne god offereth v derogation maiestie fall prouoking angel arme themselues oure ruine confusion needes must bereft right mind bewitched deuill wee leuer haue angel enimies minister welfare redy helpe v guide v bee member lord iesus christe yelde obedience vnto head oft speaking god let v learne conceyue dead thing thinke wise glory set foorth v heere forasmuch dul let v beare mind god hath army infinite number angel redy execute hys commandements ouer besides al creature obey good reason vvhereas consequently said light god shineth vpon al men expounded god doth shedde foorth benefytes vpon men may perceiue spark goodnesse wisedome throughout thinges howbeit specially restreyned vnto men point wherin light god appereth according said first chapter saint iohn god gaue creature beeing firste beginning also quickened mayntayne state euen power woorde touching men togither life hee gaue also light ye see creature haue life lorde iesus christ euerlasting word god haue noble exquisite life haue eyther beastes tree frutes earthe vvhy wee haue vnderstanding reason light god shyneth vppon men seeing bee greatly beholden bound vntoo wee much blame woorthy wee deface light yes surely must come back saint paule saith act went groping like blinde folke yet god glory bee perceyued vvhy dwelleth v wee neede seeke farre haue life mouing power thus yee see exposition sentence hathe bene taken god hath bound v vnto making v partaker light wee bee toto vnthankfull go deface glory yeld due wherefore man cannot much stirre himselfe feeleth god dwelleth hold life whome wee may thanke making v reasonable creature rather beastes wee value ox ass bycause hathe pleased god preferre v saide brightnesse wherewith god inlightneth v occasion v exalt glory submit ourselues vnder hande thus see one exposition men make text coteyneth good doctrine whe al throughly cosidered bildads meening simply shew god hath spred light vpon v end gyue v vnderstanding reason shew cannot eschue presence must faine walke wer seeth thinges hathe ye would say eye vpon v ye see god spreading light vpon v much say cannot hide selues presence according matter hath talked al like saieth god hath angel howge host redy seruice addeth doo wee wee cannot eschew god presence true wee leape like grassehoppers hope play horse broken looce yet ende wee must bee fayne yelde vnto god brightnesse doth shine vpo v wee cannot eschue mortall man therfore whensoeuer tempted ouersight imagin may eschue god hande let v learne conclude thus yea whither shall wee goe wee know power spred ouer bycause sighte endlesse wee gone intoo bottome earth yet ceasse see v marke doings let v foolish lifte vp selues god assuring ourselues purpose v tosse turmoyle make many enterprise conspiracy shall auayle v hee still beholde v marke v common lesson holy scripture wee beare ill away leastwise ill put vre proofe whereof wee remembred god beholdeth v marketh euer say pray would walke another manner feare warinesse tush wee feare none men bee safe ynough wee haue witness heere beneath thus yee see cause men giue head wicked lust god spirite beareth sway passe conceiue cursed thing purpose vppon theyr hart prouided alwayes body accuse set god shining vpon eye bare shining rememberance surely would ynough suppresse wicked affection ridde fancy wherwith puffed vp truly ashamed men much ought moue v iudge men men iudge v theyr owne authoritie owne name doe perfourme iudgement god whome alone iudgement perteineth behold god seeth v yet yeld reuerence wee passe prouoking wrath v howe may borne wee remember well lesson god sheadeth light vppon men surely good bridle make v walke purenesse conscience amending faultes wee commit outwardly towards men also amending euill hypocrisie hidden within v thus yee see effect wee haue marke thys streyne bildad hath sayde hee addeth vvhat righteousnesse shall attributed man comparison god word word god borne woman cleere himselfe authenticall summoning v shew v starke fooles set store ourselues beare ourselues hand haue righteousnesse vertue thing else v worthy prayse theefe abrode wood stads awe iustice thing else true alwayes carieth fearefulnesse according hath bin seene heeretofore god ingraueth feeling men sinnes hart must needes bee owne iudges condemne themselues yet theeues runne royot stil passe cut many poore wayfarer throtes meete catche auauntage yet notwithstanding afterward whe bee laid vp see payment hande hardnesse laid awater rage quite gone made beastly euen v long know must yeld account afore god ne conceiue infinite power souereyntie hath himselfe suche ouerweening v sticke magnify ourselues aboue cloud man speake v righteousnesse easly find ourselues vice vertues v lo men besotted loftinesse cannot know themselues till god summon draw force knew themselues would self estimation cause bildad sayeth expressely mortall iustify himselfe god saying great weight saide goto long men among themselues may haue good opinion owne vertues euery maye say honest man yea shall come putting themselues balance esteeme muche themselues men saying man hath fault hath vice vvee maruellously well skill controll men abase meane time wee acknowen owne infirmity wee couer much v lieth ther neuer little drop vertue v leastwise seeme bee smoke shal say anon would haue god set store estimation v vncloth himselfe cloth v ye see pryde men long looke among themselues come god knowe enter examination owne life feare maiestie suffereth v wrap vp ourselues hipocrisie vntruth forget foolish bragg wherwith wee abused time according whiche declared heere whensoeuer bee tempted pride imagine selues haue vertue v worthy estimation let v learne cite ourselues god let v tarrie till draw v let euery man duetie towards himselfe ye see howe lord sheweth v manner proceeding whiche ought holde v man doe time beare himselfe hand hath wote vaunt correct follie statelinesse let onely consider himselfe know let v go vnto god man neuer knoweth himselfe long looketh vpon himselfe dothe co pare neighbour learne know ourselues lift vp eye highe make account come iudgemet seate knoweth al thing like mortall men content themselues pety trifle whome wee cannot make cockleshels go payment deede thing much estimation heere nothing worth therefore perceiue thing vanish away god learne submit ourselues vnto god bee puffed vp pride cause sayd howe man namely borne woman iustify respect god howebeit forasmuche nothing harder bring men reason rid saide vaine selftrust wherwith abused bildad addeth shine vnto moone star pure god therfore man worme sonne man rottennesse true saying may expounded diuers wayes wit god wil shine farre moone else streine tent farre say hee voutsafe come neere starr pure say al creature neuerthelesse see great noblenes must bee estraunged god great space betwixt sayde expressely bycause creature aboue excellenter creature heere beneath soeuer bee god farre bothe moone starres endlesse distance betwixt shal come neere exposition fit ynough good sooth whether man conster shining streyning tent commeth one end short bildads meening lord listed call creature finde brightnesse moone starres shoulde bee darkned neuerthelesse bee thinges enlighten worlde yet notwithstanding must needes bee vtterly drowned maiestie god commeth place nowe let men stande owne conceyte boast themselues vvhere bee wing carrie v high wee may take moone teeth say wee may stye aboue starres vvhen wee thinke haue thing selues assoone wee come god swallowed vp brought nothing reason incomprehensible glorie wee see case men glorifie themselues needes say must satan haue bewitched one would flye aboue star able manne woulde caste himselfe foure pace downewarde ynough breake sinewes yea necke ofte wee haue thing boast wee make suche leapes ynough breake neckes menne yea angel ye woulde saye muste wee needes bee woorse madde sayde afore lo bildads meenings furthermore expounde concerning eclipse moone meanes agree sense simple namely noblest creature whiche seeme haue euen godhead nothing bee compared god must bee abased god alone continue state behoueth v knowe nother righteousnesse power wisedome onely reste vanitie yea experience sheweth sunne darkned starres neyther yes surely sight againe behoueth v marke brightnesse whiche haue borowed another little sparkes wherin god sheweth glorie neyther sunne moone starres glorye aught owne besides god set himselfe agaynste light light rest must nedes darkened sunne take away v light starres praye would god infinite brightnesse doo nowe haue wee bildads meening euen moone sayeth shall bee brightnesse neyther shall starres pure god presence hee sayde true wee see light shead whole worlde oure eye receyue wee glad yet farre thing god come euen body moone starres skie light sayth hee shall darkned vanish away comparison god glory let v come vnto men vvhat vvhat able doo vvhat power vvhereof boaste wormes rottennesse yet needes iustify selues remayneth put lesson vre apply vse heere shewed v wee come god wee bring nothing woorthy prayse men vttered bee voyde goodnesse haue muche one drop righteousnesse whereby purchase selues estimation must bee fayne yeelde selues giltie acknowledging nothing else wretchednesse miserie nowe men wel acquaynted doctrine wee nowe adayes haue many iarres braules wee haue papistes side esteeme highly man owne free though men power dispose themselues godwarde true welynough confesse bee weake bee able doo thing themselues without god helpe without direction grace holy spirit therewithall attribute certayne preparation men afterward workfellowes god furthering grace working common companion haue laide foundation fall attributing men none talke among magnifying men vertues merites although graunt alwayes wee haue neede god mercie yet blow bladder full winde stuffe withall saye imbrewe diuelishe dogtricks beare men hande merit god accepteth bee worthy grace hathe always respect vertues lo howe men puffed vp wind diuelish fancy reigne poperie furthermore say wee amisse wee haue work supererogation ouerplus wherwith make amends vnto god sinnes although haue offended know hee forgiue v sinnes yet wee bring recompence satisfaction meane make one v thing shewed v heere bildad haue seene heretofore well knowen disputation would laid downe easy matter papist iudge randon men righteousnesse merites satisfaction free looke vnto god falne asleepe vayne imagination haue conceiued iustifying owne good deed therefore behoueth v marke well verse conclusion let v note wee cite owne conscience god humble v suche sorte bee seeking presume shall acknowledge selues woormes rottennesse nothing v filthinesse stinch vvhat done oft speake v meane saluation lette v learne consider ought repose trust whiche god receyuing v owne meere goodnesse holy spirite purge clenze v fro spot wash v bloud oure lorde iesus christ whiche hath shed clenze v withall thereby make v pure cleane may able stand face nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement faultes praying whereas hath shewed vnto v heretofore may please increace knowledge make v profyte day day drawing towards wee may touched suche reuerence may desire nothing subiect vnto seruice specially sith hath pleased call v seruice may determine imploy ourselues wholly therein presuming vppon owne vertues vpon thing bee v acknowledging owne meere grace hath chozen v church people receiuing benefyte wee may drawe fountayne whiche hee hath giuen v witte lorde iesus christe acknowledge belongeth giue v full perfection thing still hope may please c xcv sermon first vpon xxvj chapter iob ansvvered said vvhome hast thou succoured hath povver hast thou saued arme strength hast thou giuen counsell vvas destitute vvisedome thou sayst vvhome tellest thou vvords vvhose spirite gone thee dead thing formed vnder vvaters neere place gulfe naked destruction hath couering stretcheth northern coast vppon vvast place earthe founded vppon nothing declared beginning booke propertie whiche required good teacher wanting came comfort iob whiche propertie deuide god word rightly apply right vse suche skilfulnesse hee weake may bee strengthened sorowfull may comforted hee colde may bee warmed gone stray may bee brought home agayne nowe verely hathe bene sayd iobs frendes handled doctrine generalitie good holy howebeeit fayled misapplying person iob let v marke well ynough v speake god co mon vnlesse euery v ca referre saying good vse better vnderstoode laying forthe text point poynt iob demaundeth bildad man hath fared better word first saith whome hast thou succoured hast thou succoured feeble hast thou helped arme strength say good doctrine ought cast forth ayre bring fit instruction partie spoken vvhen wee see man vtterly ouerthrowen dismayed hathe neede comfort rough storme pray next way cast despayre contrariwise see hardned sinnes despiser god yea suche one holdeth scorne good warning wee shoulde speake fayre handle gentle woordes better v holde peace set god word scorningstocke suche man yes neede strike harde man shoulde smite hammer vpon stith seeing partie become sturdy iob sheweth heere bildads talking god prouidence hath bin purpose say marke plight seing thou tellest thy tale meete thou shuldst haue eye might profit therefore thou oughtest deale discreetely cast foorth thy word aduentures wee vnderstande better iob meant say streine behoueth v marke howe auaylable god word wee skill applie profyte sayd ought strengthe suche weake releue suche feeble vtterly cast downe saide vse well noted apostle epistle hebrues wher alledgeth text esay man ought stay trembling knee strengthen weake armes prophete esay appointeth office haue charge preache god word go wayes saith hee holde vp poore weakelings strengthen quaking knee leggs cannot go vve know god hath appointed teacher church haue nothing worde whiche put mouthe surely yet worde hath suche power able redresse feeblenesse men much quaked wise could stand vppon feete yet lord speaketh v gyueth v lustinesse wee manner made new whereas could stirre one toe afore walke abrode whereas armes earst good broken able put thing thus ye see howe ought serue turne god word bee strengthened weake take remedie feeblenesse certaine knowe value god worde vtterly vnprofitable v owne fault hath charge office teach ought haue good respect hearer whome hee speaketh hee see negliget cold behoueth quicken vp harte must cheere according deedewe see many sore shaken distrust themselues though man speake god prouidence ende might leane vntoo yet ceasse starkle somuche heare falling leafe start afrayd vnlesse man strengthen day day hee shal neuer able holde vp falling downe staggering therefore hee ordeyned teacher god church ought haue suche consideration skill hearer bee fayntharted slow must exhort incourage telling god neuer fayleth end may call vppon haue called vppo inioy help walk boldly furthermore like must teache others ought shoote said marke also behoueth euery man like owne behalfe according apostle sayeth applyeth aforesaid text euery priuate person saying frends prophet esay telleth v al whome god hath chozen preache worde ought giue corage strength weake make go good pace looke yourselues whe seeth weake colde plucked backe distrust ouerfearfulnesse fro seruing god neighbor let streine himselfe let gather stregth let come seeke corage word god flatter yourselues sin vvhen ye feele selues weake doo say weake ye know ye seeke remedy god word go reade giue eare promise coteyned mark god telleth mainteyne fainte spirit strong ynough recouer wayt succour hand waiting walke stil trust see may profit ourselues iobs vpbraiding bildad talke vttered ayre bin vnprofitable soud saith stregthe weake saue preserue arme good broken let v mark wel haue greatly profited god word nimble weldisposed doe good haue broken armes trembling knee lusty cheerefulnesse apply selues seruice god oure neighbor lo may become good scholers holy ghost long faynt cold cannot goe one step without stumbling reeling let v mark haue smally profited heauely schole commeth owne faulte certaine god word hath nature propertie strengthen v shal feeble except fault ourselues let haue charge teaching tend always mark let euery v haue discretion consider owne behalfe reade holy scripture come sermon weake haue neede gather strength behoueth bee heedful may receiue remedy god word giueth bee short according disease euery man knoweth let learne whatsoeuer god hath ordeined let imbrace promise remedy therof iob hath sayd addeth whome hast thou giuen counsell one want wisdome expresly said god law serueth instruct ignorant little one property extended whole scripture whiche nothing else exposition law purpose therfore whervnto lord wil haue whole word serue forasmuch blind ignorant wretch bee taught faythfully might stray knowe path wee ought take two three men boast skilful wise ynough gouerne himselfe true men bee foolish ynough presume farre vpon naturall wit god laugheth ouerweening scorne sheweth plainly nothing vanity gay brauerie hee ouertaketh wise owne wilinesse shewing beguile theselues intende walke owne imagination let v assure selues v great small poore blind buzzard nothing ignorance vntil haue profited god schole therwithal let v know guide word al perfectio wisedome title teaching ignorant giuen vaine lo cause iob vpbraided bildad hee giuen counsel destitute wisedome say blemished doctrine want knowing applie wisely ought haue done vvherefore end reproch light vpo v let v learne vse god worde suche sorte may serue v good instruction receyuing doctrine wee may ceasse bee wretched beastes go astray also let whome god hathe committed office teaching others consider well whatsoeuer come men must gouerned hand mouth god true vntill time god hath co uinced ignorace glory themselues therfore fayne pull downe pride according also saint paule speaketh sayth gospell ought serue pull downe loftinesse aduaunceth selfe agaynst lorde iesus christe according saying first chapter first epistle corinthian behoueth v become fooles wee become wise god schoole truly seemeth straunge v ap e lesson wherein wee muste continue time life minister god worde must tell men nother discretion wisedome ende may truste owne strength reason bee selfeweening say knowe welynough ought liue let esteeme themselues fooles say let acknowledge nothing theselues vanitie one drop wisedome v god woulde trouble v let v alone state nowe intendeth pull downe pride owne profite may humbled become little lowly exalt alone submit ourselues wholly shall say vve see minister god woorde neuer edify people except begin poynt shewing men bee vtterly destitute wisedome behoueth euery one v receiue admonishment ourselues acknowledging selues vtterly destitute voyde wisedome assuring ourselues shall find wisedome god worde vvherefore let v bee afraid wee shall bee sufficiently taught perfection suffer god declare vnto v desire hande redy receiue whatsoeuer shall say vnto v wee haue wit suffer selues bee gouerned god mouth wee haue perfection wisedome wherein fault bee founde holy ghost lyed saying proper naturall office good doctrine teache men wisedome reason want nowe ende iob rebuketh bildad speaking rouers saying thou hast said hee meeneth bildads word ruled directed deale withall saying well worthy noted flitter ayre sort theire talke knowe right deuiding god woorde go bushe turning pot according wee see many discourse generality wote howe apply doctrine profitably ought doo purpose stad heere whole halfe day togither expoud vnto one half booke soaring ayre intreating many thinges disorderly without regarde youre profite edifying euery would go home house wise hee came church defacing god word stande v stead vvhat bee doone let v remember well sayde heere namely must referre doings certaine ende wee take matter hande wee must speake purpose skilfull set thing right order may bee confusion according haue saied minde comfort suche sad sorrowfull find themselues distressed coscience haue great trouble behoueth v seeke meanes co fort setting god mercie know disease wee may applie fit remedy vnto mind abate pride rebelliousnesse men behoueth v shew god vengeance make feele spite teeth sporting matter able drowne thing blast lightening consume nothing man exhorte pacience tormented cannot paciently suffer affliction god sendeth wanhope despaire behoueth seeke reason fit purpose speake much order one man came phisitio desired medicine disease phisition go discourse debate art generall termes poore sicke man yeeld vp ghost meane whereas might easily haue bin cured bin helped hand purpose hath al talke serued man come mason put building mason fall discourse building castels tell rearing building aire disputing howe may bee brought passe meane regard present work toy man come lawier aske counsell vpon cace lawyer fal disputing vpo lawes generall applie thing present cace purpose let v marke deale god word behoueth v set certaine marke v wee wander deuide aright know end speake talke rouing gadding fro else wee may speake many good woordes none shall serue purpose thing iob ment shew rebuking bildads vnaduisednesse hauing discretion applie good doctrine right vse nowe vttereth saying weyeth yet saith tellest thou thy tale whose spirit come thee saying thou tellest tale sheweth v ought haue regard person whome direct doctrine haue declared already selfe alone surely v ought profite common go vp pulpit teach men withdraw selfe away rest selfe must scholer word proceedeth mouth must serue mee well else ill meane content selfe estimation haue respect make doctrine bring serue youre capacitie fondnesse behoueth v haue skill applie doctrine god putteth v trust hee putteth v office bee messenger bindeth v people linketh v church behoueth v haue eies alwayes fastned vpon vvherefore wee cast foorth word aire shut eye without hauing consideration whome speake sore abusing god word let v mark well haue charge teaching must consider doctrine may good profitable whe speake whole congregation may deale forth faithfully good discretion may comon profite wee haue consideration wee shall make suche minglemangle hotchpotch god word shal nother tast sauour chiefe point know demaundeth commeth taught meane demaund according fleshly lust demaunde thing fit may doo good let v come lay forth iob setteth downe heere vvhose spirit commeth thee true sentence hath bin expounded though bene saide spirit speakest thou god interpretation vtterly misliked surely man taketh vpon beare abroade doctrine saluation behoueth take good heede vaunt himselfe naturall wit assuring matter men purchase estimation ought gouerned spirit god haue vertue whereof paule speaketh end may know god hath sent thing therefore requisite man marke well processe text iob following touched afore intendeth rather shew bildads word well disposed quicken soule whiche principall poynt haue marke god word said afore god worde serueth teach ignoraunt strengthen weake bicause incourageth faint colde slouthfull weakeneth asleepe sinnes spurneth foreward lag behind raizeth falne downe yet one thing namely quickeneth suche dead iob meant shew said whome spirite gone thee say power thy wordes therefore lette v marke worde god well handled giueth v courage go forewarde strengtheneth feeblenes making v nimble whereas leggs broken making v stoute lusty whereas destitute valiantnesse afore yet muste also giue v life good dead verified specially gospell behold lord iesus christ speaketh fifth saint iohn time come saithe hee voice sonne man shall heard liuing also dead dead surely exempted whereat beginneth god make doctrine auaylable v euen drawing v spiritual death wherin hild till time god inlightneth v word wee blind till open eares deafe till giue v faith wee haue nother soule hart true may well seeme haue outward shew life vnbeleeuers eate drinke well faithfull againe go businesse yea oftentimes feeme bee greate vertues nothing bycause asmuch bee straungers god death vtter confusion god must fayne drawe v death vnto himselfe poynt whereat hee muste begin make worde auaylable v good sooth let v see stregth men till god haue strengthened woord trust themselues say leane vnto reede shall make breake neck yea one man woulde gore himselfe vpon pike asmuch hath sharp point armed yron man leane vppon ye see pricketh trust haue oure owne strength must needes death therfore let v marke well one drop life v till god draw v death yea euen power word therin wee see howe wretched state vnbeleuers true sotted outrage perceiue owne harmes yet holy scripture always shewe selfe true auouching v bee dead vtterly forlorne nothing cursednesse v long wee bee straungers god yet see thaklesse world many found wil suffer themselues bee rayzed quickened god offereth v benefite willeth word preached published men thus ye see life offered v forsake say great multitude shrinketh away thrusteth away benefite might inioy see ye shamefull thanklesnesse must men needes right wit yet notwithstanding wee see fewe whiche submit themselues gospell giue care vvee see rayle agaynst mocke slaunder lift vp themselues agaynst god rage lesse gotten hand wild beast sithe wee see number small whiche receyue doctrine saluation greatest parte withdrawe themselues sayd making none account mocking outrageously setting themselues shew full well nothing wickednesse agaynst god therby seene mightily satan hathe bewitched howsoeuer world go ought marke well sentence sayd spirit ought passe v say whereas dead afore assoone wee heare worde god must giue v liuelinesse spirit may shew itselfe whiche onely bene swound also vtterly quenched true worde god cannot doo thing vttered mouth mortall man must first bee quickened selfe may quicke v vvhen speake mee touche folkes hart make doctrine preach enter euery man may bee moued come vntoo god howe lord neede make word auaylable working holy spirit quicken enter v may take roote vnto v incorruptible seede life ye see god must fayne worke secrete power ere doctrine auaile preached v men true commeth fault euen selues god muste bee fayne boare eares else wee neuer heare hee must fayne soften heart make fleshly themselues hard flint full rebellion yet notwithstanding worde god ought conteine saide power propertie mortifying soules let v maruell ende hath god ordeyned woorde appoynted bee preached intent bring v himselfe come neere vnto v also dwell v welspring life nothing v death seeing hee maketh v partaker himselfe grace worde seeing myndeth dwell v yea liue v ende may lyue doo ye see sayde rising agayne life whereof spake afore therefore let v vnderstand woorde long wee stranger fro god howe goodly shewes euer make bee toto wretched nothing cursednes v wretched soules dead although appeere liuelinesse imagination vvhat done euen quickned god gathering v thing hee doth mean word seeing treasure inestimable let v set much store let v value deserueth let v vnthankfulnesse stay god making v feele power workfulnesse offereth vnto v thus yee see effect wee haue marke saying iobs nowe hee addeth consequently hee may say many thing god prouidence behoueth consider ende hee referreth wordes wauer ayre better holde peace behooueth men bethinke well ende dispute god worde party may bee edifyed doctrine iob therefore sheweth heere bildad came pith matter wandered aloofe woords vvherefore hee ought saith iob haue come poynt shall bee declared heereafter meane hee sheweth hee ignorant vertue bildad speaketh hee sayth god gouerneth thing great power maiestie ought terrible v wee ought come submit oureselues reuerence doe seruice true doctrine selfe profytable may despise preached generall yet notwithstanding needefull looke well handling bee applyed particularly assuring selues purpose tell long tale thing belong matter hand men ought come poynt say thus thing wherein iob founde fault bildad disputing god prouidence hee respect whereto word might serue cause iob sayth nowe ignoraunt god hath created world gouerneth thing holdeth thing hand maiestie ought honoured thing knowe better vnderstanding matter let v marke person whome behoueth v shew god mightie power bring feare maiestie may stande awe ought vvhy wee see many sauadge folke whiche haue muche ado conceiue god heauen gouerneth thing bee little better brute beast verely man speake god make trifle say yea marrie god yet neuer wist glory nother euer feeling wonderfull power also behooueth v shewe god seruice spirituall wee must come soundly roundly bee cleane purged hypocrisie know god tush neuer enquired haue bene letted muche worldly thing yee see moste men heathenish snarled delight present life thinke al vpon god manner men neede haue former matter told legth make feele god maiestie doubt v haue neede euery one according measure say matter must laide forth length haue neede bee called knowing god may forced tremble vnder maiestie whome scoffed afore one point haue marke also men neede brought consideration meane euen haue right feare god euen say must taught put minde god maiestie ende may always quake vnder meekened becommeth yet haue doo must generally reste heere haue learned haue laide foundation muste afterwarde build vpon yea suche wise buylding may skilfully applyed ground worke made already vnder earthe man speake suche haue feare god abace humble themselues vnder god mighty hand hee must rest vpon generall matter particularly consider eache man behoofe hee may buyld well vpon foundation layd already iob meant declare heere nowe lette v come word vseth saith dead thing formed vnder water place neere said goto thou hast talked mee god mightinesse tolde army without number creature hand confesse yea looke yet looke euen intoo bottomlesse deepes euen nauill earth see god bringeth foorth thing quickeneth thing dead vvhence commeth life creature thing hidden deepest gulfes demaunded meanes wee bee serued state place god hath sought life hee giueth vnto men much would go fetch bottomlesse deepes commeth passe earth bringeth foorth frutes howe commeth passe come whiche beareth suche blade afterwarde yeld graine secret god hidden thing iob commeth vp aloft sayeth know well god hath spred heauen yea euen waste place settling much body would hang ayre tapistrie impossible men therein god meante shewe hi wonderfull power true iob dooth set downe north co st precisely yet speaketh whole heauen bycause skie turneth vpon pole like wheeles chariot extree runneth midds wheeles turne round extree reason hole naues eue sky manifestly seene say wel acquainted course firmament doo see skie turneth north side starre apparant eye extree runeth naue wheele whiche sky seene turne another pole hidden vnder v whiche cannot perceiue called antartik bycause skie turneth also though one extree put bothe wheeles hath beene sayde afore vvhen speake course heauen meane daily course sunne see sunne hathe peculiar moouing selfe vniuersal mouing whole cope heauen sayd two starres fastned place remoue stirre thus ye see iob sayth god hath spred heauen vpon northside speaketh hee bycause suche miracle ought amaze v true men haue experience whiche causeth speake yet doth wel disposed order shewe suche wisedome god wee must force cofesse surmounteth reason man ought nothing else honour god greatnesse vttered creation world cause sayth hath founded earth vpon nothing wherevppon doeth earth rest vppon ayre like wee see ayre aboue v likewise side earth earth doeth hang midd true philosopher make muche disputing earth continueth seing bottome world say maruell sinketh considering nothing vpholdeth neuerthelesse able yelde none reason seene order nature whiche woonderfull thing men forced abashed mount aboue themselues glorifie god acknowledging infinite wisdome see whervnto iobs woords tend namely shew hee beastly deny god maiestie acknowledged glorie howebeeit meaning say whole cace standeth treating generally applying right vse according wee speake fully morrow god giue vsleaue nowe let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement sinnes praying make v feele wee may come humilitie seeke help mere mercie wander fro bee cast downe selues wee may seeke altogither bee releeued grace lord iesus christ dayly profit till fully restored assuring selues hath already begonne good v also continue correct fault imperfection flesh euen til haue brought v perfection wherevnto calleth v hee hath rid v cleane letts hinder v drawe v backe comming vnto may please graunt grace v also people nacions earth bringing backe poore ignorant soules miserable bondage errour darknesse c xcvj sermon second vpon xxvj chapter bindeth vvaters vpon cloudes cloud sinketh vnder holdeth backe face throne spreadeth cloud vpon hath set bound vvaters vntill lyght darknesse consumed maketh pillers heauen shake maketh afrayd threatening hee clyueth sea povver appeaseth pryde vnderstanding hath garnished heauens spirite hande hathe formed slipperie serpent outleets wayes hovve little heare vvee vvho hee vnderstand terriblenesse povver yesterday began shew sort wee ought profit ourselues whiche conteyned workes god consider reuerently yeelde honour deserueth thinke neuer muche vpon miracle god doeth yet meane whyle honour shall wee bee better let v learne oft god work set afore v end know maiestie yeeld worthy prayse iob hath tolde v earth founded settled vnto day wonderfull meanes vve go vppon dayly yet fewe v thinke vppon hath bene spoken might fare better againe sayde vntoo v god bindeth water cloudes yet cloudes sinke behold miracle wee see dayly oure eye yet man thinketh vpon slenderly slippeth away sayd power god honored handes cause iob minding protest none number passed brutishly world without knowing maker saith know god byndeth vp water cloudes forasmuch wonted thyng v make greate reokening howbeeit meane whyle god ceasseth shewe v maruellous power doyng miracle water hang sort ayre abyde fast vve see water flow yea ayre fyne thin gyueth place continually water owne nature heauier ayre therefore water ought reason fall downe neuerthelesse wee see hilde tubbes according sayde psalmes prophet meening expresse miracle whiche misknowen men vseth similitude see verse importeth sayde god byndeth vp water cloudes yea euen without nking cloudes thys shewe v oft cloud gather ayre see water inclozed yet earth drowned commeth passe bycause god stretcheth hys hand thereby let v knowe hee eweth hymselfe v would make v perceyue power hath namely infinite power meeneth wake v bycause wether fayre cleere wee regarde nother perceyue glory sheweth selfe maner therfore myndeth teach v another new fashion shetting vp water wyse lodging ayre hang hild bottle tub barrell sight heereof god vpbraydeth v oure vnthankfulnesse calleth v home shewing v caces hath wonderfull power see see man aske thing iob speaketh possible vvee bee conuinced reason thing appeereth euidently god aboue order nature yet al none v touched nother acknowledge compulsion herein therfore seene men much darken god glory thrust vnder foote much oughte warned marke thing tolde v see alteration heauen earthe god could well make ayre alwayes close alwayes fayre neuer clowde hys wyll haue chaunges thinges continued one stay would fall asleepe wee woulde imagine fortune gouerned varietie bee constreyned whither thinke god worketh ydle heauen hath created world afterward let alone also disposeth al thing guideth creature sort wil haue v know neere hand v lo whervpon ought muse see skye troubled cloud thickned ayre rayne alteration season namely meane lord sheweth v draweth v vnto bycause wee consider ynough selues thus ye see haue mark streyne sayd hee withholdeth face sight throne putteth clowd pleaseth hebrew worde iob vseth signifieth sometimes shet vp sometimes also ioyne c ose together whe man maketh barres yron building ioyne timber woork stone togither shetting one within another may holde fast morter sayde god maketh barre foresyde throne heauen termed seate hee inclosed wee knowe hee filleth thing beeing infinite spredde earthe well heauen teache v looke vpward whe intend thinke vpon god infirmitie
