rudenesse insteade exalting god wee dayly abace oft speaking behoueth v lift vp mynds worship reuerence must thinke vpon earthly thing surmise aught owne deuyce fansie loe god throne heauen according scripture sayeth saye hee shet vp shew v highnesse maiestie ende wee surmyze owne fashion owne rude grosse beetleheaded wit men terme short behoueth v mout aboue creature wee intende thinke vppon god rightly let v come sentence sayde god hathe made barre throne truly wee marke well order heauen thing ought rauish wittes philosopher haue bene inquisitiue curiouse searching heauen nature coniectures beste conclusion wee make acknowledge god hathe made principall peece woorke behoueth v wonder confessing selues vnable comprehed hygh profounde secrete thing without case iob intending magnifie maiestie god speaketh heere sayde barre whiche hath made foreside throne afterwarde addeth agayne god spreadeth cloude vppon listeth vvhen wee see sayd alteration end knowe god hath stablished order thing hee created world ment ydle euer dayly guydeth gouerneth thing hathe created holding hand continually bothe vppon heauen earth vppon thing else shewing himselfe father making v feele let v blinde loking vpon skyes perceyue liuely image god maiestie wonderfull power sheweth better v eye picked haue fruition sight goodly work god except proceede turne behoofe mounting vp authour brute beastes shall beare blame hauing lyght bycause haue reason know workemayster parte certayne shall neede none thing condemne v god take excuse v besides eye hee hath also giuen v reason vnderstanding comprehende woonderfull thing sheweth v bothe aboue beneathe ye see whereof haue neede warned purpose ho ghost setteth v varietie heauen wherof wil speake yet hereafter short chiefe poynt life beyng partaker thing god hath created vse shoulde learne magnifie hath giuen v grace possesse creature without dooing homage lo effecte shewed v heere iob addeth immediatly hath set boundes water euen vntill light darknesse come end beholde yet another woorke god well worthie bee remembred namely water bylowe bounded god holdeth fast canot passe bound indureth shall continually indure vntoo worldes end spoken asore water aboue water god draweth vp cloudes hild ayre til make poure downe rayne certayne god bound sea water earth couered man aske philosopher serche whole order nature confesse elementes theire full scope throughout according vntoo theire nature earthe shoulde bee hidden vnder water good sooth experience shewes earth middle world bycause firme substantiall reason weyght water lighter withall shedde firme consequently ayre aboue water fyre also aboue ayre vve see element distinguished according property seeyng ayre inuironeth whole earth wee see water also ought goe round betweene bothe say betweene earthe ayre theire propre place situation lyke fyre ouerspreadeth also would water leaue one foote dry ground mountaynes yea euen hyghest couered vnder wee see lowe hollowe place abyde drie yet sea mounteth aboue man may perceyue reason shewed wee consider thing sea specially riseth aloft woonder earth ouerwhelmed vve see heere notable miracle yea men shet eye owne vnthankfulnesse heathen men reason driueth therevnto acknowledge whereas pleased god haue place voyde plant mankinde hee respect vnto men ordeyned part earth abide drye verye infidelles speake truthe strong inforced confesse meane whyle glorifieth god acknowledge good hath done v wee dumb praysing whiche worse wee defyle earth hath giuen v dwel vppon hath made water withdraw themselues hath fettered vp cheynes although giue v roome dwell vpo yet said defile earth filthinesse sinnes verely acknoweledgement god receyueth hand man openeth mouth glorifie without cause thing tolde v considering witts dull think vpon specially must marke shall sayd new againe according also spoken cheefly prophet ieremie sea violet thing seemeth meanes hold yet barred within listes sea seemeth threaten drowne earth seemeth earth swallowed vp rushing forthe enery waue considering wee see great violece sea terrible thing maketh heares stand vp vpon head must nedes behold mightie inuincible hand god confesse power spoken heere manifest much ought wee bee touched quicke god maketh sea remoue sorte wee haue wit know god infinite goodnesse towards v like power yelde thankes confesse selues beholding diuerse wayes lyfe creating v putting v worlde nurrishing v specially earthe drouned vnder water dry ground left v dwell vpon beholde say purpose heere speciall mention made sea god withholding water sorte shet vp whiche thing cheynes cordes could bring passe wilde beast worlde might easlyer tamed sea yet god ruleth yea ouerruleth woderfull incomprehensible maner behoueth v marke saying iob addeth heere shall continue till light darknesse come end bee medled togither v vnderstand god doeth miracle one day short tyme alwaies hathe shall continue euer although often surge rush forward backward yet notwithstanding god doeth alwayes restreyne sea winning pleaseth threaten men withall end lerne humble themselues walk greater warinesse thus ye see howe iob ment augment commendation power declared god sayd water bounded bordered till worlde come end till lyght darknesse bee mingled togither say till order nature ceasse imported maner speeche man alledge sea also yuers time get vpper hande passe boundes teare vp thing bothe howses vineiards ouerwhelmed exceeding greate excessiue breach made violence sea answer therevnto yet notwithstading god ceasseth preserue worlde generall suffring sea passe bound wise make v thinke vpon power shewed v wee well aduised yea little reason v certain would daylye honor god life preserueth v euen graue vppon earth surely euen graue beholde sea water ouer v whome long swallowe v god holdeth hand betwixt v wee bee farre marking wee become like swyne filling belly pampering selues god benefites thinking one whitte vppon thing sheweth v eye witte wee cannot lyue one minute houre myracle brydleth sea suche wise god therfore stirre v vp knowe power doeth well suffer sea passe boundes reporte hereof thinke ought thinke wee bee blockishe letteth lyke happeneth whole worlde bycause god maynteyneth order nature whiche hathe set safetye woulde becoome one gulfe lake god hande ruleth aboue lo howe wee ought profit selues souereyntie whiche god hath ouer sea water ende wee may knowe fatherly care hee hathe lyfe feeling muche wee bounde vntoo indeuer oo serue honour walke obedience warinesse furthermore manne reply common thing needelesse bee preached nowe bycause euen yong child doo knowe muche woorse neede haue gone schoole haue learned deepe cunning knowing thing common ordinary men yet shewe effect wee beare remembrance wee muche vnexcusable thus see cause lorde telleth v thing euery man seeth deholdeth bycause muche say wee doo wickedly abuse sight hee hathe giuen v forasmuche wee profite beholding creature magnifie power hee sheweth therefore although bee greate matter seeming knowe sea water restreyned earthe perisheth yet notwithstanding greate wisdome conceyue well thereby god therein declareth selfe bee father protector giuing v suche experience goodnesse power becommeth v bee asleepe vvhen wee haue thinges well printed myndes wee haue profyted well onely day twoo also tyme lyfe scripture sayeth perfect wisdome marke well god workes referre right end nowe followeth immediatly pillers hcauen shake bee maketh afrayde voy e iob hathe spoken order dayly seene worlde hee addeth immediatly men see suche mouings thuders tempest god maketh heauen ayre shake seemeth shoulde sinke thing done diuers maner make v perceyue mighty power strength leastwise wit reason consider surely heuen vpheld pillers similitude iob vseth heere bycause great place huge building canot stay vp themselues borne vp vpon pillers like man build great temple nede haue pillers beare vp great weight eue heauens seeme bee building requireth haue pillers yet hath none power god suffiseth building whervnto canot attayn good sooth power haue men build following god hath shewed yet small spark infinite power wisdome men canot make hall hudreth foot length bredth without pillers behold heauen infinite space coparison yet see borne vp power god therfore iob speaketh pillers meening please god send tempest thuder ayre roreth sort foundation pillers heauen shaken end might know god high aboue dwelleth gouerne althings shet vp sayd intent thereby might take warning lift vp hart mind think vpon honour reuerence humilitie imagin fleshly earthly thing vve see iobs meening like god one side sheweth v power holding sea cheynes limiting within bound cannot ouerpasse part pleaseth god make thunder rattle moue tempest ayre semeth al go wrecke nothing shoulde bee able stand longer thus yee see another particular wherin god maketh v perceyue mighty power truely heathen men good skill confesse finenesse witte common experience saying men heare thunder tempest must maugre hart fayne feele inkling godhead lo heathen men haue spoken yea euen despizers god filthie beastly folk seeke nothing mocke religion blearing toung god ca sayd concerning gouernment order nature euen say abashed hearing thunderclappes experience sheweth v vvhy bycause lord giueth token excellent power reaso iob besides discourse continuall order nature addeth nowe tempest thuders lightning shew although men despize god wilfully hardharted wil perceiue god sheweth yet god maketh pillers heaue quake shoting forth thunderclappes seemeth shall go wrecke men inforced conceyue feeling godhead soueraine power aboue ouerruleth al thing passe aduenture therfore must nedes wil wisdome gouerneth lo purpose sentence alledged v therby warned first brutish nature pitie nay rather ougly thing whereas bee reasonable creature yea seeme haue wisdome able coprehend thing thervntoo god giueth v great signes maiestie bothe aboue beneath manifesting vnto v beyng alwayes hand v yea vttering familiar maner vnto v wish yet notwithstanding wee ouerpasse thing entereth v although wee warned neuer much see yee greate outrageouse frowardnesse let v vnderstad vntoward nature seeking deface god glorie manifested vnto v wee shet eye agaynst perceyue vvherefore let v assure selues oft god lightneth thundreth heauen playne vpbrayding v say yee cursed creature haue planted world haue giue earth dwell vppon haue furnished good thing yet notwithstanding wheras haue bin liberall towards shew self louing mercifull father know haue quenched beneficialnesse certaine spitefulnesse wilful stubbornnesse owne seeking darken light eye seeing case standeth must fayne come terrible maner summon make feele spyte teeth ye cannot eschew imcomprehensible maiestie thus yee see thing whiche wee haue marke thuderings rise yre tempest much god cast v teeth frowardnesse vnthankfulnesse wee take profit common continuall order seene heauen earth dede cannot open eye god sheweth v thing ye see also intent thing rehersed vnto v wheras scripture hath spoken v generall order world seene ordinarily men setteth downe also extraordinarie according heere mention made thunder sayd clyueth sea mighty power appeaseth pryde vnderstanding iob repeteth sayde afore true another spyce god power hee sayeth hee cliueth sea waues heaue vppe themselues seemeth sea shoulde rush vppon v swallowe vp man middes hee seeth dreadfuller sight waues seeme mountaynes space betwixt gulf yet bottome bee seene iob ment saying god clyueth sea afterward appeareth pride suddeyne chaunge serueth shewe god myghtie power better man bee midds sea greate tempest see houge hygh mountaynes water hee thinketh sea may bee caulmed onely within space twoo three houres also within whole yeare seemeth impossibilitie greate contrarie chaunge shoulde insue shortly yet man shall see sea hath bene turmoyled becommeth caulme quiet within whyle seing thing chaunge suddenly cannot men see wonderfull power god iob met vtter thervpon may gather intent expresse cleerly aduaunce highly thing sayd afore generally sayde god bouded sea sayth cliueth mightie power thervpo sayth god hath garnished heauen spirit shaped slipperie serpent vvhen speaketh serpent meneth serpets earth purpose haue matched heauen hee speaketh number starres whiche commonly called serpent bycause starres stand writhen row maner serpent wrytheth taile reason wrything figure shape hath beene termed name snake ende men might better discerne god woorkes asunder one another true folk haue intermedled fable yea euen wicked fable diuell hathe alwayes knacke turne men aside creation worlde haue singular auouchment god maiestie neuerthelesse firste vsing terme serpent snake teache looke better vpo order starres againe whe iob sayeth god garnished heauens spirit vnder one kind hee comprehendeth whole ornament beautifyings sayth starres giue fashion heauen without wast thing sight confounded forasmuch haue sunne day starres night therby know better god thought ynough haue made welkin respecte necessary v haue ayre wherby breath also brightnesse giue giue v light aboue also met moreouer adde ornament thervnto therfore setting starres skye decking beautie end prouoked magnify goodnesse wisedome mighty power finally glorifie meanes see iobs setting god work v witnesse hee parte liued worlde heathenish skornfull sort doe whiche yelde god reuerence ne acknowledge power might honour printed euery whit hart mynd herewithall also bee warned shet eye god sheweth fashion vnto v least vnthankfulnesse cast teeth namely worse brute beastes inioying god inestimable benefites without yelding honour seruice conclusion iob sayeth outleetes wayes yet peece conceyue comprehend dreadfull power loe conclusion worthy wel marked according great weyght therof purpose v behold god work except conclude determinatly passe vnderstanding eathe great high thing must necessitie dazeled man applyeth whole study know god heauen earthe would fayne glorifie workes thinke possible know surely dishonoreth god god greater dishonour go incloze mighty power within capacitie witte man would take vpon shet vp sea land owne fist hold betwene cupple finger surely greater madnesse heauen earth great thing iustice power wisdome goodnesse god little mark although men bee neuer diligent searching god work yet think themselues sharpwitted attayne self wise say know much bee knowne see perfectly good wise god beholde shamefull wrong offered vvherfore let v marke well chief poynt whiche wee ought beare mind considering god work bethink v owne weaknesse know wit feeble mount high must fayne confesse dauid wonderfull thy woorkes lorde recken vppe vntoo thee true dauid reckeneth well instructing others thinke well vpon howbeit hath sayd hee addeth end lord ca atteyn euen sayd streyne behold owtleets sayeth iob sayth hee suburbes enter hart god work shall neuer atteyne vvee bee slow lumpish mount vp high vvee bee lythe retch ourselues farre wide nother haue liuelinesse v wit must bee fayne bee ouerwhelmed haue applyed indeuer throughly know god work howe excellent atteyn perfection knowledge let v remember ourselues haue found owtleets impossible v come depth capacitie serue v therto vvee bee grosse weake small peece v insomuche angel heauen came preached vntoo v yet could shew v small part god woorks shall mortal creature bylow sith let v lerne magnify god suche wise nothing may let v yeeld due prayse although wee time life imploy whole wit glorifying magnifying yet impossible discharge selues hundreth parte dutie owe vnto nowe let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement sinnes praying make v feele har ie repentance desire forgiuenesse wee may beseeche amend misdooings ridde v vyces ende whyle wee liue worlde wee may inioy great good doeth v applying right vse namely seruing honoring wise wee may haue eye shet sheweth maiestie euident fashion forasmuch dazeled owne vnderstanding let v beseeche inlighten v holie spirit waken v drouzinesse wherein wee bee wee maye seeke thing else spende selues seruice incorage others thereto example hee may bee exalted magnified men one common consent deserueth performance thereof let v pray rayse vp true faythfull minister woord c xcvij sermon first vpon xxvij chapter iob tooke vp parable agayne sayd god liueth hath taken away right almightie vvho hath set soule bitternes long breath shall continue spirit god nozethrills lippes shall speake vvickednesse toung shall vtter deceyte heere haue still matter hathe bene treated heretofore iob vpholdeth afflicted fault committed secrete reason listed debate pleade matter could iustifie cace agaynst god agaynst woulde beare downe hee wicked man conclude affliction whiche indured bycause greatnesse sinnes iob vpholdeth cause moued god punish wickedder men secret vnknowne reason men therfore behoucth mount higher ordinarie iustice god shewed law wee see ground woorke chapter therfore sayd iob tooke vp parable newe agayne intent thing whiche sayeth may authoritie beginneth protestation importeth othe god sayeth liueth hath taken away right euen almighty hathe set soule anguish yet al wil neuer swarue whereas haue maynteyned selfe bee rightuouse pryde hypocrisie sturdinesse knewe god myght afflict mee sorte bycause suche one make mee bee nother euer graunt god punishing mee desertes leastwyse bee compared men pretende false wicked thing god handleth men worlde present lyfe according woorthinesse deseruinges god doeth oftentymes deferre punishment intendeth lay vppon men bee perceyued till death contrarie part diuers tymes hee pretendeth signes greate rigour agaynst whome loueth whiche haue serued faythfully therfore must make much haste god iudgements think executed firste brunt shoulde god bee vniuste vvee see thinges disordered present thing wee looked hoped redresse hereafter tyme come god woorse blind haue skill ynough say thing go ought doe doeth followe eyther god knoweth doeth else muste hope hee one day iudge worlde hang suspence mind hild doubt reason thing confused therein god exercise v shewe v nowe tyme warrefare therefore like battel man knowes hathe wonne loste long blowes giuen bothe side men yet afrayd victorie sheweth getteth vpper hande euen must al thing need confuzed hurliburlie world insomuche man iudgement cannot perceyued hoped god wil set thing right state agayne verely yet must wee wayt neuerthelesse howbeeit nother day morrowe doeth iob hold opinion whiche seemeth straunge whiche god hath taken plucked right hee seemeth pleade god defence owne rightuousnesse secondly accuse god crueltie outrage thus see two thing might bee verye strange iobs intent knowne let v mark sayeth god hathe bereft right hee meeneth god vseth tyrannicall maner dealing nother meeneth hee himselfe rightuouse god cause punishe yet rigorously rather hath eye ordinanarie rightuousnesse written lawe purpose condemned haue sayd iobs frendes went thus namely god punisheth suche haue doone amisse father sauiour good men therefore foloweth iob wicked man despizer god life order men see punished extremitie ye marke al aduersities happen commonly worlde bee greate therfore must needes concluded god hathe founde man bee outrageous sinner aboue reste loe conclusion iobs freendes made delte yet woorse rested vppon curse god lawe imagining must accomplished present life reward good seruers god death thought wicked shall bee punished else heere ouerth wart expounding god lawe although lord threaten punish offender meeneth restreyne certain time true ordinarly seene present lyfe howebeeit continually wee muste make generall rule without exception bringing god much vnder coram wee see iob better end staffe agaynst freends therfore let v beare mind hath bin tolde afore standeth v hand haue great discretion iudging affliction god sendeth well vpon selues vpon neighbour wee conster god loue towards v according present handling v inough make v despaire euery blowe true punish v alwayes well worthie howsoeuer world go wee shoulde imagine god hateth v bicause handleth v roughly ala thing could call vpo could haue comfort assuage sorrow ye see vtterly vndone vvherefore behoueth v bee wise knowe god afflicting men alwayes sinnes bycause hee minded exercise pacience tame fleshly lust bring wholy vnder awe teach preset life must iourney worlde told rest heritage deale otherwise ynough cast many v despayre suffer aduersitie like log iobs freends vtterly ouerwhelmed standing vpon poynt god punished great sinnes iob hearing wordes might haue bin caught feare haue knowne el haue take damned cursed man ye see also shuld vvere pride condemning innocent thing let v remember well sayd psalme blissed man iudgeth discretly aduersitie see god chastizements may profit selues looking vpon suffer hardnesse also vpon selues moreouer let v always measure men sinnes affliction oftentymes good handled roughlyer bad therfore behoueth v examine men liues throughly fall concluding say man punished god great sin know wicked see god punisheth let v stande awe knowing god setteth v looking glasse liuely image shewe v shall befall v wee haue feare wee returne vntoo man haue liued well wee perceyue punished let v hold selues short tary god leysure till shew v iudgement let v ouerhastie meane whosoeuer holdeth himselfe still certaine may peruert god iudgements euery turne misiudging consequently shall vsurpe authoritie belongeth god alone let v come againe iob sayeth god hath bereft iudgement vvhat meening wordes haue sayd afore iob meeneth god vseth tyrannicall fashion marke one poynt againe meeneth hath good right side shall able get vpper hande cleere himselfe haue done amisse matter shall come debating declareth affliction indureth thicke dark clowd bereeueth knowledge vprightnesse therefore aduersities punishment wherewith god manaceth transgressers law well vnderstanding hereof behoueth v call remembrance hath bin declared alreadie threatnings conteyned law god punish men persones goodes householde cattell continuall say although god punishe disease warres dearth famin drought like thing although hee punish offender despyzers hys worde yet doeth happen alwayes one ate vvhy oftentymes affliction common good bad doth god threaten sort shewe hath iudgement come nowe giueth signes token shoulde performe iudgements perfectly heere beneath would become would hope purpose comming lord iesus christ serue would become confession fayth say beleeue resurrection flesh life euerlasting nowe knowe present life transitorie corruptible also subiect many miseryes haue wee felicitie god promiseth v hidden v therfore behoueth wicked also punished part nowe god giue respite reserue damnation haue deserued vnto last day wherin iesus christ shall iudge worlde fully shall saying esay bee fulfilled knee shall bowe maiestie god thing doone nowe howbeeit partly sufficient nowe gyueth v inckling hee iudge worlde let v returne iobs woordes howe doeth god bereeue men right punishing wise may seeme bee vtterly reiected bending himselfe agaynst mortall enimies outwarde appearance cannot bee sayde men wicked accursed wee must holde maximee generall rule god good must needes bee sayde enimies euill nowe wee see manne afflicted suche extremitie may seeme god vtterly inflamed agaynst wrath precysely bent agaynst according naturall reason wee conceyue none suche one enimie god iob therefore meeneth right bereft bycause god hath set soule anguishe himselfe addeth almightie sayeth hath set soule anguish long wee perceyue cause god hath punished long right buryed insomuche hee may seeme worlde bee wicked detestable persone let v marke well hee speaketh heere common opinion meeneth god hath ryghtfull reason doo specially hys owne secrete purpose behoueth v mounte vp higher stye aboue thicke darke cloudes darken lighte else wee shall neuer knowe iobs rightuousnesse see double rightuousnesse god one manifest vntoo v bycause conteyned lawe also hathe agreement reason god hath giuen v whiche passeth oure vnderstanding therefore comprehende fayth must rather honour thing hidden v wayting comming latter day wherein shall see thing face face nowe darke hidden v ordinarie rightuousnesse god conteyned lawe vouchsafing succour v neede shewing hee hath care welfare wee feare serue wee walke obedience accounting father doeth also shewe hee auoweth v bee benefites faythfull receyue god hand worlde walking feare ratifyings sayde ordinarie rightuousnesse conteyned lawe true neuer deserue god shoulde pitie v whatsoeuer wee yea euen wee bee gouerned holy spirite certaine woorkes still soyled god may good right reiect selues able thinke one good thought although god gouerne v although hee woorke v yet alwayes faultinesse v wee mingle owne infirmity sort grace holy spirite euer proceedeth v defyled deserue aught god hande bee forasmuche hauing called v hee spareth v forgiueth v vyces mingled good desire wee haue serue hee doeth still rewarde faythfull haue indeuered followe say hee rewardeth worlde sheweth hee shet eye good zeale submit themselues alloweth lifteth well ye see god manifesteth ordinarie rightuousnesse fauouring haue fully submitted themselues vnto leastwise farforth weaknesse flesh wil beare say fully meene perfectly poynts vnfeynedly according also holy scripture speaketh contrariwise god punisheth whoremonger theeues drunkard euen also ordinarie rightuousnesse see wicked man shal haue fleeced neighbor played cruell beast eating vp deuouring mennes goodes god bloweth vpon hys substance nothing remayneth true shew god iustice assured warrant euyll gotte good wast away maketh v acknowledge god iudge againe murtherers punished likewise consider written cruel man shall liue halfe dayes also wyth misdooers vve see howe scorner scoffe god repine aduaunce themselues excessiue rage god ouerthroweth sith wee see wicked punished alreadie thys worlde ought thinke god sheweth himselfe iudge ought heare stande vp vpon head perceyue stretch arme mightely execute iustice thus ye see god ordinarie iustice wit iustice perceyue executed according conteyned law herewithall see also good men afflicted god impouerisheth suche haue indeuered walke soundly man giuen wickednesse dooth neuerthelesse iinger paine life long hath much ado go vpon legges commeth passe cause vve cannot tell neither able determine god reserueth reason himselfe therefore poynt ordinarie iustice neither must measured one rate againe see wicked prosperitie onely day two hath bin sayd afore time life yea eue die laughter go away sleepe taken worlde turning hande without long pyning suffering much paine meeneth truly must blame god vnrightuousnesse wee must sharpen tongue agaynst behoueth v knowe hee hath higher kinde iustice rightuousnesse wit reache vntoo wee neuer atteyne vntoo reason must still hidden v neuerthelesse wee must cesse honour secrete iudgements submit selues vnto wayting till disclose thing vntoo v hee reserueth yet himselfe hys owne secrete determination lo howe god hideth men right according whiche wee haue sayde man bee punished sort bee sayde hee wicked persone yet hee true men sinner god might iustly destroy v damne v hee listed doo reknowledgeth owne rightuous layeth sinnes theyr charge true also bee acquitte behoueth condemne themselues god yet hee acquit soeuer worlde go notwithstanding chastizeth meane purpose destroy vndoo hee hydeth right say hee sheweth openly hee accounteth child hath forgiuen offence yet hath done notwithstanding wit able comprehende furthermore let v marke also iob hath eye vntoward misweening false opinion conceyue beeing ouerhastie tarie paciently till god shew wherefore afflicteth discrete modest giue sentence condemnation vpon afflicted find god proceeding strange neyther wee say god withholdeth right assoone see poore man greatly afflicted euery one v rush condemne perplexity therefore cause mannes right buryed seeming god ought first dashe maynteyne cace suche one ryghtmynded neuerthelesse hee doth maketh countenance otherwise hee reserueth iudgement himselfe suffering men iudge amisse v speake amisse v abhorre v letting v alone plight good ouerwhelmed marke cause sayde make rightuousnesse seruants shine foorth breake day giuing promise much say shall alwayes bee perfourmed eyesight behoueth v oftentymes abyde shame reproche yea sainct paule himselfe sheweth say euen hee liued angelicall perfectnesse sheweth hee subiect therevnto onely cast vp many slaunderous reproches touching owne priuate life also misreported touching office insomuch whereas handled doctrine faythfully purely yet notwithstanding men vnthankefull ceassed report euill vvell sayth appeale day lorde come hee sheweth oftentymes worlde shall bee trouble mencioned heere man shall bee able discerne betweene whyte blacke best seruers god shall bee slaundered wronged bycause men see afflicted alwayes conster euill part according mannes inclination giuen misdeeming let v marke well god doeth bereeue men iudgement appeareth first brunt eyther defende v shewe holdeth v rightuous hee taketh cace hande suffereth v bee condemned men finally increaseth affliction therevppon men harden themselues agaynst v say become peruerse iudge thing contrarie grounde gather much boldenesse saying may well say may men see still howe handled thus yee see good men ouersore oppressed god shrinketh aside maketh countenaunce accounting rightuous rather seemeth warre agaynst intende condemne aboue others see iob blasphemed god saying bereft right see sort behoueth v make profit excellent doctrine let v vnderstande god may oftentymes bereeue v right yet shall haue whereof accuse complaine neyther shall wee amende cace pleading hath secrete rightuousnesse behoueth v honour till make v knowe minde exercise v yet lowlinesse worketh straunge fashion towards v cannot vnderstande hee doth keepe v awe make v glorifie saying true lord heere poore blinde soule darke see whit behalfe yet art thou rightuous although thy iudgements bottomlesse pit cace canot enter yea although good buried death yet confesse thee rightuous lorde vvhen go worke haue wee profited affliction god sendeth v whereof reason apparant vntoo v furthermore let v practise iob sayeth god bereeue v iudgement must therefore forbeare holde alwayes god humble selues vnder maiestie according sayde lorde liueth hath bereft iudgement euen almightie hath set soule anguish iob playeth restie horse although haue double anguishe yet knoweth hee well god hath dominion superioritie ouer woulde say god liueth except honour hee shoulde say lorde thy sillie creature thou hast power ouer mee sayd double affliction thing ought marke well wee haue seene howe hee persecuted goodes persone indured much possible mortal wight indure yet another affliction hee tormented came moue despayre passed misery haue sayde god hateth thee thou seest well ynough thou hast accesse vain thee looke ease hand hee agaynst thee giueth thee sure token afflicting thee maner vvhat shouldest thou condemne thy whole life afore passed thou wilt haue mercie god hande thou must chaunge altogither acknowledge hitherto thou hast beene starke naught mocker god man full hypocrisie lewdnesse thus ye see two affliction iob indured yet notwithstanding honored god still sweareth name howbeeit men nowe adayes whiche blaspheme god swearing doubtlesse else othes sworne adayes part reproches vnto god despizing name like man sweare aduenture sheweth well hee regardeth name god ought holy sight whensoeuer wee heare speaking wee ought cast downe oure heades acknowledge infinite glorie contrarywise name god runneth roundly mouthes way mockage therefore looke many light othes man maketh many reproches iniuries wherewith hee disgraceth name god againe also forswearing yet heynous muche man hath invred himselfe sweare foolishly goeth foreward falsifie truth turne lie name god shall run wise shall bee pleasure men think vpon iob swearing eye principall poynt whiche wee sweare name god must acknowledge bee iudge yeelding due authoritie setting selues throne codemned haue done amisse vve see iob acknowledgeth affliction come god hande dealeth stubbornly hee kicketh agaynst mayster like restie iade humbleth himselfe sayeth god liueth howsoeuer world goeth true see selfe forlorne man indure much impossible mee pacient ought bee yet desperate play mad bedlem say knowe god would would let alone power ouer contrarywise know iudge haue authoritie imbrace mightie power hath ouer hold alwayes vnder hand acknowledging affliction bee sending therfore without cause haue sayd haue excellent doctrine taught first acquaint selues chastizement correction god hand vvherefore happen tempted despayre feele fearfulnesse selues think selues alreadie hell let v acknowledge owne frailtie leane vnto namely god hydeth iudgement bereeueth v wise right seeme selues forlorne past al recouery vvell god hideth away right done must cast downe heades tarie till god lift v vp chin redresse state set v vp againe mainteyne cace oppressed turmoyled men folke bleare tung v make ieastingstock v yet must lose courage see example set v behold faythful ought come practize profite themselues although cannot conceyue reason thing god doth yet neuerthelesse must always become lowly say lord deale thou v shall please thee therewithall giue v power prayse thee alwayes thy workes say lord liueth although confounded thus ye see wee haue marke streyne easie v knowe thing conteyned sith haue comprized whole summe need ioyne cloze sentence followe vnto iob sayth long liueth shall passe deceyte wicked worde mouth hereby sheweth speaketh presence god thing well worthie noted haue tolde oftentimes expounding booke ouercommon vice among men marreth wedded world neuer come presence god examine themselues men blame v falsly rest much vpon enter selues examine selues god done cleane contrarie answere men well let v first accuse selues let v fully resolued vpon conscience god without hauing eie one man cause hypocrite al doings take much paine couer colour fault woulde fayne keepe still good reputation credite haue among men contrariwise iob sheweth hee setteth himselfe presence god although speake men yet hee forepossessed foolish ambition pretend vtterly blame lesse iudgeth himselfe god according hee findeth conscience layeth forth matter openly let v mark euill thing bee deuized rest vpon men begin poynt say iudge selues presence god ne haue eye shet world ward respect opinion men conceyue v thing layde vpon v therefore without hauing respect thing behoueth v consider selues cace god shall bee rightly meekened speake feynedly disguyze thing knowing well gaine nothing marke one poynt let v marke well maner speach iob vseth long sayeth shall winde breath long spirite god nozethrilles speaketh life though hilde without grace god true may say thing common ynough man denie bee beholden god breath liuelinesse haue yet howe many acknowledge good earnest men liue brutish fashion might sayde take themselues susteyned themselues owne power bee short know rightly paule meaneth saying haue life mouing beeing god verie fewe say know therefore let v marke well iob sheweth v hee caryed away many men dazeled passion haue skill neyther know say true vndiscrete woordes escaped wee haue seene shall see hereafter yet neuerthelesse hee alwayes hilde himselfe vpon good foundation although buylding sutable yet say hilde himselfe feare awe god lette v marke well circumstance iob speaketh owne leysure ease yee see hee affliction god seemeth bee fully determined destroy vtterly yet honoreth still life acknowledging bee partie hee hath lyfe pray excuse shall wee haue bee fully resolued thereof sith god giueth v releace make v mindefull grace wee acknowledge confesse life euer dependeth therevpon proceede grace power shall wee bee vnexcusable oft wee thinke vpon life let v remember behoueth v make confession iob maketh namely neyther blast breath mee myne owne power god hath giuen euerywhit true iob speaketh god spirite must imagin phantasticall sort thinke substance god spirite abhominable heresie behoueth v alwayes marke suche manner speaches holy scripture ende fall heresie say god spirite v touching verie substance thing insue god spirite subiect ignorance chaunge mutabilitie yea defiled steyned sinnes vyces yet neuerthelesse haue sayde poynt hath sore troubled christen church like vnhappie heretike punished conceyte say men soules parttakers substance godhead thing horrible agaynst nature man must needes vtterly growne kinde ere come let v marke speaking god spirite importeth substance v ment breathing say inspireth v power according see sunne abydeth skie yet brightnesse beames doth wise come v inioy light heate much say therefore holde sunne beneath good sooth see sunne power hee sheadeth downe hither cheereth earth wise beareth frute yeeldeth sustenance nourishment men shall incomprehensible power god himselfe spirit cannot spread selfe euen vnto v yet notwithstanding haue substance let v marke well verie substance god spirite v power shed forth wise liue confirmed meanes thereof knowing behoueth v holde life god according onely holde thing grace holy spirite vvherefore let v consider wee ought acknowledge god grace thing concerne present life much ought wee seeke thing belong endlesse life thing whervnto calleth v shewing v must alwayes labour thitherward till haue deliuered v bandes let present life nowe let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement sinnes praying bring v lure know sinnes may alwayes giue glorie prayse doubting hee scourge v welfare soulehealth yet notwithstanding let v learne submit selues farre vnto wee may suffer selues brought nothing selues may strengthened hande yea strongly mightily may bee able withstand temptation power meane lorde iesus christ life death may alwayes find v obedient child according hee sheweth himselfe mercifull father towardes v may please giue grace onely v c xcviij sermon second vpon xxvij chapter god forbid iustifie vvill neuer giue ouer mine innocencie till till die vvill keepe rightuousnesse forsake heart shall vpbrayde mee vvith dayes cursed gainsayeth mee vvicked rizeth vp agaynst mee vvhat hope hypocrite vvhen hath heaped vp god plucketh avvay soule iob declared minde concerning hee sayde shewed hee blasphemed god onely ment affliction befell reason sinnes extraordinarie purpose god hidden men hee protesteth hee stande stedfastly minde behoueth v marke well dealing settle selues determinately vpon thing whereof well assured aforehand poynt wherein wilfull sort doo differ good allowable constant sort vndiscrete person one weyeth thing good reason aduisement conceyue toy head neuer bee remoued yet shall one bee named constant therfore neither deserueth commended worse poynt mainteyne thing without knowing commonly sayd fooles bolt soone shot hastie iudging also wilfull mainteyning must needes vnrecouerable foole therefore let v mark well iobs proceeding first declared intent shewed himselfe imbrewed false opinion haue errour sayde spoken pure truth declaring hee addeth protestation neuer remoued purpose knoweth rightfull iust whensoeuer wee come iudging thing let v looke neerely sift throughly haue skill ynough behoueth v always acknowledge rawnesse infirmitie let v pray god giue v spirite skilfulnesse discretion thing wel knowne v fully resolued let v wauer great shame wilfull person shoulde stick fast fond imagination cannot bee drawne soone remoued truth know neede none witness iudges condemne rashnesse vnconstancie wilfull sort haue bin wedded owne wit haue allowed thing sticke stoutely cannot meanes wonne pray done god hath giuen knowledge truth ought leastwise imbrace sticke stedfastly yea stande fully resolued vpon much soeuer men labour draw lo two poynts haue marke streyne one hastie mainteyne thing haue skil whereof well assured shoulde first looke discrete iudge wel rightly say know matter perfectly wee sure truth let v take courage sticke whatsoeuer come let v shaken declareth v true nature fayth beleeue vpon fickle opinion leastwise well grounded god truth say beleeue meanewhile haue certaintie god truth onelye imagination certaine bee bewitched satan leastwise wedded men say behold turkes sufficiently hardened errours ought fastnesse rather steelinesse counted sayth certaintie behoueth v vnderstand hold doctrine wit holde god must fully perswaded hath called v schole vvell haue sayde certaintie vvee must immediatly match purpose perseuer many howe euery blast forget haue learned afore assoone heare newe thing wote whereby shewe neuer much tast god truth vvhat bee done haue sayde thing knowe good must neuer escape v nother must wee meanes bee turned wee must print heartes may stande ende thus ye see alreadie haue remember text furthermore whereas iob sayeth god forbid euer shoulde instifie let v marke also small fault god make countenaunce consenting suche mainteyne euill cace go agaynst truth although man doo heart bee otherwyse mynded himselfe yet god blasphemed therein knowe great store hee setteth truth maynteyne euill cace set themselues agaynst truth deface go wicked practize wee doo onely make countenance cleaue vnto partaker certayne wee bee guiltie wickednesse god much better ought wee minde lesson forasmuch nowe adayes wee see men make bone agree wicked leastwyse beare good countenaunce although mislike euill doings although woulde faine amended yet notwithstanding auoyding displeasure shift battelles seene make countenance bow yeelde vntoo oft see wicked aflote haue full scope fayne vale bonnet although vphold euill ful mouth yet farre speaking agaynst man woulde thinke adherent consenters vvee see ordinarie worlde nowe adayes verie rufull man steppe vp maynteyne good quarelles rather common excuse say meddle ouerhastily see shall bring selfe brier euery manne bee toppe make mine owne cace wee woorthie bee shaken god hande wee bee loth mainteyne truth wilfull renouncing god separating oure selues sette purpose wee giue token wee iustifie wicked like euill cace thinke wee doo become without cause iob speaketh heere suche vehemencie say god forbidde abhorreth iustifying vnrightuousnesse thing exceeding heynous muche ouerturne whole order god hath sette heere yee see also prophete esay pronounceth terrible curse agaynst cal good euill euill good hee sayth turning light intoo darknesse another poynt wee haue marke streyne god forbid sayeth iob euer iustifie confirmeth matter yet better adding anon cursed mought aduersarie true betweene twoo verse thirde neuerthelesse bee good matche two sentence togither cursed sayeth hee mought mine aduersarie bee wicked bee hee ryzeth vp agaynst mee first hee sheweth himselfe bee full sure hold hee spiteth shall intende striue defieth warre true harebraynde person peraduenture vse lyke stoutnesse aduaunce agaynst whole world without shrinking awhitte haue tolde afore iob buylded without laying sure steadie foundation fully resolued god truth whereas nowe defyeth would fight agaynst sheweth caces playing handes beeing neuter rowe betwene two streames wee must bee either one side without fleeting fro march true soundnesse saying god cace must v aduocates mainteyne haue conceyued wicked quarell token matter truth let v labour thrust downe let suffered dissemble wee cannot denie traytours god see zeale ought bee v onely confesse truth knowe shewe hold good also withstande errours false wicked opinion becometh v inflamed stoutnesse shewed v persone iob let v marke well doctrine saluation thing belong god seruice religion come question must onely admitte know good true yea euen teachable obedient minde also wee must shunne false opinion contrarie truth lyable vnto say wee must resist fiercely declare gainsay v agree v wicked cursed say bee hilde hand enimies rightuousnesse truth bycause refuze ioyne v obeying god become rebelles reiect truth seeing separate themselues wise god breake true bande vnitie behoueth v haue open warre wise agree desirous pleasure wicked would faine holde therefore prouerbe sayeth holde hare hunte hounde shewe themselues beare two face one hood play two partes enterlude without chaunging apparell god abyde counterfeyting therefore let v remember well sayde heere namely matter standeth onely saying contented suche thing shall passe striue agaynst truth shewe selues like well god truth wee must maynteyne hande set themselues v must enimies must detest assuring selues agreement betweene truth vntruth betweene fire water marke wee haue yet note iob addeth hart shall vpbrayde dayes step aside hee go backe touching hebrewe worde may taken offer reproch may also bee taken wexe yong againe therevpon commeth bee taken recoyle returne backe signification agreeth verie well hee sayeth heart shall retyre backe though wexed yong againe howe dayes say time lyfe haue passed bee short iob ment betoken would neuer swarue like continued vnto day serue god yea euen soundnesse would thenceforth steppe aside runne backe become another man would alwayes founde beene knowne according haue declared alreadie namely forasmuch god hath beene gracious v inlighten v wise discerne betwene good euill knowe ought followe behoueth v take heede wee bee fleeting lyke wauering reedes wee hold owne stedfastly let v looke well selues whensoeuer god shall haue set v good way let v turne sayle backe againe let v go forward still yea looke howe much man hath gone forewarde let knowe god hath bounde much stedfast shame heynouser vnthankefulnesse hee turne backe forsake good way verely soone god sheweth v behoueth v bee taken loue indeuer profite neuer step aside therfore euen first day wee ought bee inflamed follow god truth soone shewed v god hath bene gracious man leade forth moneth onely yeare three ten hee hath liued long knowledge god owne saluation afterwarde become rebell renegate holde last steppe farre greater fault man hath yet taken good sufficient deepe roote shoulde turne away ouershoote himselfe throughe lightnesse man haue tasted good anon turne away verely shall excused god yet men haue pitie vpon turned away hee haue receyued full instruction man hath followed right way long time hath seemed bee constanter sort yet withdrawne excuse thus ye see iob ment expresse streyne shewing seeing god giuen grace walke aright long time knowne good heart shoulde turne backe againe let euery v learne example consider well free fauour god sheweth v hee vouchsafeth draw v pure fayth gospell behoueth v thinke hath bound v vnto solemnest couenants worlde passed betwixt v vvherfore let v settle selues hold ende haue begonne well let v followe way god hath set v assuring selues hath reached hand vnto v let euerie v recken well time long ago since knew god truth howe yeare three ten twentie since god disclosed himselfe vnto mee haue profited since time although haue gone farre forewarde requisite yet much god hath taken intoo house suffered mee runne quite away hath graunted grace holde hitherto thing shoulde nowe renounce giue ouer ouerdamnable vnthankefulnesse lo howe euery man ought call himselfe account may confirme himselfe stedfastnesse iob sheweth v owne persone poynt wee haue marke short wee see streyne lawfull christian wyse dissemble making countenance beleeue thing whiche notwithstanding condemne reason whereof assured euill neither must vse startingholes colour soeuer pretende shall alwayes bee condemned hypocrisie god loueth truth setteth great store haue v sticke soeuer come euen common matter although thing seeme import preiudice harme wrong yet man say hee beleeues bee meane findeth cleane contrarie heart excused whensoeuer doctrine saluation seruing honoring god highest thing bee come question wee must take leaue libertie swarue behalfe euen worldly matter behoueth v acknowledge selues faultie wee make countenance consenting vnto mislike vse suche shiftes god truth impugned facing false wicked thing besides betray god wee also indeuer much v lyeth robbe thing hath knit vnto himselfe separated except renounce himselfe say truth let v marke well shewed v heere example iob namely lorde hath bene gracious v giue v fayth harte behoueth v haue mouth open make confession wee beleeue sure preach due time place wee see men set themselues agaynst doctrine wee knowe bee true let v resist vttermost power maynteyne god quarell except wee intend bee false although doctrine deserue bee set length yet notwithstanding whiche haue comprysed alreadie small roume sufficient let euery man thinke howe hee may fare better whole matter consisteth practizing let v come nowe iob addeth vvhat hope hypocrite sayth seeing heaping vp goodes god plucketh away soule iob protesteth hee opinion god punisheth men sinnes worlde asleepe openeth eies letteth thing slippe wize heere bylowe thing vniuersally turmoyled thing sayeth hee must come account ende howbeit men perceyue god iudgements eyesight first dash effect matter iob declareth behoueth v alwayes beare minde haue seene afore party stroue agaynst iob vphilde men handled according desert god doth euermore shew good louing mercifull towardes suche seeke loue contrarywise forthwith vttereth rygor vengeance despise specially bend themselues stray good way see contrarie namely good afflicted seeme haue god enimie bicause hee dealeth exceeding roughly meane see wicked liue delight pleasure triumphing though god hilde nicely lap vvhat meeneth ende meane perceyue god doth execute iustice fully reserueth well reward good men punishment wicked men vnto last day life iob therefore declareth although sayd afore god punisheth wicked afflicteth godly seemeth vse excessiue crueltie haue deserued contrarywise flatter vngodly yet notwithstanding intendeth rob god office shoulde alwayes bee iudge worlde watche gouerne state earth howe must certaine day set neither must hee bee summoned dutie houre behoueth v tarie leysure paciently make v see example iustice one way summe iob ment declare although haue seene doctrine heretofore yet must irke v haue oftentymes repeated considering one chiefe poynts wee ought sticke vntoo namely euen middes trouble thys worlde ought neuerthelesse assure selues god suffereth thing runne hauocke holdeth wicked although hee spare forbeare punish time yet neuer better taking alwayes vnhappie secret vengeance prepared farre better god punish first push deferre punishment whiche appeareth presently vvherefore let v learne thing needefull may bee throughly perswaded although godly afflicted yet ceasse happie inasmuch haue recourse god bow downe neckes bearing yoke laid vpon sure though god trie obedientnesse yet ceasseth loue vvhen wee perswaded wee haue profited greatly whole time life good sooth let v looke vpon infirmitie v soone haue temptation abashed dismayd comforting v wee see wicked prosper god beareth wee woulde hee nothing v grating teeth seemeth v hope v bee vtterly deceyued calling vpon god seruing againe state fleshe woulde wish courage quayleth yea fall fretting chafing agaynst god finally wee bee combered wee cannot assure selues behoofe resort vntoo god middes misery asswage sorrowes knowe alwayes sauiour father vvherefore let v fight infirmitie may fully resolued thereof also contrary see prosperitie wicked let v faint let v alwayes plucke vp good hart assuring selues god doth fat oxe hog man intendeth kill oxe fat hee bestowe cost vpon prepareth bee drawne slaughterhouse purposeth labour plough like hog lorde handleth wicked men worlde ox swine fatteth pampereth till burst againe destruction forasmuch abuse goodnesse pacience heape vp store wrath whereof paule speaketh defiling benefites receyue god hande time bountifull seeing doctrine profitable vntoo v side hard comprehended let v thinke straunge often repeating wee haue neede record lesson oft bycause wee vnderstand first sight yea haue profited well life long haue begon well conceyue forget againe though bee dayly rehearsed vnto v nowe let v come iobs wordes vvhat hope hypocrite shal haue heaped vp god shall take away soule wordes iob signifieth wee must inclose man happinesse within present life howe may wee say men happie vnhappie must haue eye fastened vpon world verie narrow bound must go death poynt lord sheweth v purpose v haue liued heere ease haue ho orded vp much goodes haue beene honour credite haue crammed selues quietnesse bee short haue wish heere god say sheweth death al geere flightfull vanishing shadowe therefore iudge rightly men state whether happie vnhappie let v looke onely liuing dealt withall twentie thirtie fiftie yeares let v consider men passe hence god calleth according sayde ninetith psalme god causeth make one turne though ranne ring come home yee sonnes menne sayeth hee marke haue conceyue first place end bee ouertaken false opinion bee whiche thinke vpon present lyfe rauished incontinentlie soone see one riche say hath much good hath much fayre landes nothing triumphing hee well housed hee hath mony purse agayne one greate credite well freended greatly allyed another counted wise euery man stoupeth lo eye shall dazeled rather seeled vp shall discerne wee thinke vpon worlde therefore let v beare minde sayde namely god sheweth death purpose haue liued ease world state men bee esteemed thereby fonde iudgement iob sayeth expresly although wicked man haue heaped vp neuer muche say put cace life man euer possible wished yet must thinke better cace therfore shall become sayeth iob god shall plucke away soule woorde plucke sheweth deathe wicked alwayes forcible yea truely although good rotten worlde god suffer liue till age cosume droupe halfe score yeeres die although die exceeding old full yeeres yet plucked awaye vvhat reason firste bycause yeeld themselues god secodly bicause neuer knew ende put world wit ende called away againe vntoo god muche lesse sure heauenly life euerlasting heritage prepared v thus doo wicked men want three thing whiche haue skill obey god suffer themselues bee gouerned knowe end creation wit put wold vpon condition shoulde onely passe finally wote heauenly life place muste haue reste forasmuche wicked haue comprehended three thing maruell thoughe plucked worlde god fayne hale hece force go willing minde contrariwise faythfull beeing contented haue lyued knowledge depart world willingly receiue full fruition thing promised whiche hope wicked therefore plucked away yet wee wey matter well thing nature plucked away although sayde sturdinesse spake bee vnbeleeuers yet notwithstanding god hath diuerse time inforced paynim vtter suche wordes declare v bee vnexcusable wee shunne death wise much wedded present life like iudge wyll inforce offender consesse haue holding vpon racke euen sayde afore god hath force wrested confusion paynim shewe suche die willingly quyet harte monster turne nature quyte vpsyde downe heathenman neuer hearde one woorde good doctrine tolde death sonne answered knowe begate mortall lo heere confession made heathen man whiche ynough condemne whole worlde muche hee sayde sith god hath set v heere behoueth v wayte sorte pleaseth dispoze v list take v hence ought acknowledge life muste bee subiecte another heathen man sayeth beholde worlde sette bee watchman castle sayde souldier come hither go thither hath god set v worlde condition call v hence listeth heathen men haue spoken sorte sufficient witness condemne al reply sette colour vpon lewde affection cace excuse furthermore haue sayde alreadie lette v marke heathenmen spake constraynte god thing done ende shoulde haue oure condemnation written pronounced wee agree wyll nowe done wee dispose selues dye willingly go rest selues god lette v learne knowe vice hinder v remedy redresse firste lette v learne submit selues vnto god let v frowarde madde wishe exempt selues subiection created shaped v behold first thing whervnto behoueth faithfull sort apply theselues acknowledge ende wee created shaped beholde god hath soueraine dominion ouer v therefore behoueth v submit ourselues vnto dedicate ourselues wholly seruice wee may alwayes life death vvhen man submit himselfe god reuerence low linesse renounce say mete creator shold haue vpper hand thee thy maister good beginning truely lesson might holde v tacke three dayes yea three moneths ynough v wee knowe effecte whiche haue touched euery man may thinke vppon leysure ye see firste lesson whiche standeth v hande muze vppon wee minde liue die quietly bee plucked worlde force violence submit selues god good seconde wee know ende intent wee bee put worlde without wee brute beastes oxe knoweth wherefore god created nother doo beastes also man cannot bee excused hath witte reason god calleth worlde intent shoulde knowe lyfe wayfaring brute beastes knowe deathe tyll menne haue brought cut throtes till die mischaunce doo discerne betweene life death men haue vnderstanding thereof yea lorde doth dayly set mirrours frayltie eye nowe wee thinke vpon pray wee tooto brutishe nay whiche woorse brute beastes muste condemne v although oxe know wherefore created yet doth still folowe order nature vvhy holdeth horne boweth necke yoke bicause lorde hath giuen lesson withoute wyll withoute vnderstanding poore beaste hath inclination doo whiche duetie shamefull thing men meane stubborne ox horse ass lette v learne wherefore god hath sette v worlde purpose liue heere wit ende wee shoulde knowe wee bee set iourney wee bee lodged susteyned heere earth god coste therefore muste hang wholly vpon grace feeling bee oure sauiour father according hee sheweth himselfe towardes v dooings wee bee gyuen serue thus ye see seconde poynte wee haue beare minde wee purpose die willingly bee plucked hence violente force god hande thirde cheefest heauenly lyfe death alwayes terrible v selfe wee cannot afrayde man doth speake v wee stryken astonishment wee doo thinke therefore sainct paule sayeth wee desire death impossible man brought desire die shunne much possible god hath imprinted feeling v deathe curse diffeating nature changing god order whiche man sinned wee cannot shunne death euen bycause contrarie fleshe terror thereof dismayeth v reason knowledge god hath giuen v therefore sainct paule forealleadged chapter sayeth desire death respect selfe bicause know yet wee transitorie dwellingplaces vvhat bodie corruptible thing leaues tree soone rotten wee knowe house prepared v wee bee restored heauenly glorie wee shall lodged little shedde vnder leaues soone rotten euerlasting house full glorie seeing knowe god calleth v happie lyfe gyueth v assurance oure lorde iesus christe wee neede shunne death sith therby enter full possession saluation shorte wee come death vnbeleuers vnbeleeuers say know whither go haue opinion immortalitie soules eyther muste needes bee dismayed know god shall theyr iudge else shall sotted wise shall thinke better lyfe parte behoueth v know god hath created v owne image likenesse intente gather v vp himselfe wee shoulde bee sure wee referre selues wholly vnto following example oure lorde iesus christe sheweth v father sayeth ee vnto thee commende spirite lette v learne saye freely vnto god lorde yeelde soule thy handes thus yee see howe wee shall bee safe wee knowe god keeper soules thus ye see shall go gladly good vnto death bycause soules god keeping till knit theyr body agayne comming laste daye vvhen wee bee poynt confirme sayde prayer withall thou mayst adde thou hast redeemed lorde god truth lo howe dauid speaketh iesus christ hath vsed shew requeste whiche oughte bee common member church ende doubt god receyuing soules keeping betake vnfaynedly let v know god truth muche hee suffer v perishe whatsoeuer befall v wee haue heart minde put ourselues handes nowe lette v fall downe face good god acknowledgemente sinnes praying haue pitie vppon v wretched creature bycause wee loth followe sheweth v may please stablish v zeale holy spirite wee may neuer swarue turned right way wherein shall haue set v asmuch long liue worlde inclined yea giuen vp many vice imperfection lette v pray graunt v grace resiste wise hee may bee glorified oure confessing name whyther bee lyfe deathe meane whyle wee may bee knitte fayth hope wee may persiste therein ende vntill hee haue gathered v euerlasting heritage whiche purchased v oure lorde iesus christe may please graunte grace onely v also people nation earth bringing backe poore ignorante soules miserable bondage errour darkenesse right way saluation whereof may please rayse c xcix sermon third vpon xxvij chapter vvhat hope hypocrite vvhen shall haue heaped vp god shall haue plucked avvay soule vvill god heare crye vvhen trouble commeth vpon vvill set delyght almightie vvill hee call vpon god time vvill teach vvhat hande god vvill conceale vvhat vvith almightie beholde yee haue seene thing vvhy yee vanishe avvay vanitie sawe yesterday iudge state men wee must rest vpon present life must go loke tha life man shall see shadow although grauted hart desire god wold giue whatsoeuer wold wish al smoke passeth away hand therfore behoueth v come hope iob speaketh heere may haue skill discerne whither man life happie vnhappie hee bringeth v purposely vnto death declaring sith vnbeleeuers despisers god plucked world violence behoueth v coclude vnhappy pleasure rich honour like thing haue deceitfull vanitie must busie head therfore liueth sort world knoweth himselfe god hand resteth disposeth himselfe vpon goodnesse therewithall readie remoue hence oft whensoeuer god shall call assuring euerlasting abiding place heaue cace may deemed happy regardeth god ne trusteth goodnesse ne knoweth himselfe keeping woulde fayne dwell euer worlde cannot bee gotten hence force constraynt although man haue wish time yet wretched creature better confirmation matter iob addeth god wyll beare wicked pray euen middes distress deserueth bee well marked iob sheweth wherein cheefe weale wee haue wishe haue consisteth namely hauing recourse vnto god mercifull v succour v neede let v put cace man thing else coulde imagined yet wanted surely rest nothing woorthe shoulde bee turned bane vvhat man laugh liue ioy pleasure hee haue good ynough muche men honour shorte hee seeme petigod lowe paradise yet haue priuiledge resorting vntoo god full beleefe resorting shall bee vayne requestes shall bee graunted euer haue besides shall bee curse increace decay lette v marke well nought iob bringeth v heere principall poynt whole life respecte weale wee wishe god shoulde hand v resort vnto heare v shoulde obteyne requestes ayded hand according neede knoweth conuenient welfare done onely wee looke vppon whole doctrine holy scripture wee shall see men alwayes vnhappie god looke vpon bee readie heare true conceyue much reason greate dulnesse surely one spark good vnderstanding none v perceyue doctrine totoo true let v open oure eye learne inioy happinesse know wherevpon chiefly grounded wee may vnderstande haue god fauourable vnto v may resort vnto assured trust certaintie ready help v neede totoo wretched furthermore bee good cace haue recourse vnto god nother affliction miserie hinder v beeing happie beholde remedie ought suffize oure misery god promiseth strengthen v vp good beaten downe deliuer v time conuenient yea turne misery welfare saluation shall become many furtherance helpe v forward euerlasting life wil make v perceiue sent v thing conuenient behouefull v promise serue asswage sorowes morouer euery one v may glorie according also paule speaketh fifth romanes vnder peace hee maketh mention coprehended iob speaketh vve haue peace god except sure loue gate ope v haue accesse vnto vvhen wee haue sayeth paule sure fully perswaded childre god may glory euerlasting heritage hath promised v effecte iob ment saying god heare prayer wicked man yea though hee call vppon trouble heere may demaunded howe happeneth god refuseth man calleth vpon seeing hath promised alwayes bee inclined succour v yea tarry till intreated preuent sute leastwise sure soone open mouth god ready succour v sayeth prophet esay howbeeit sentence touched afore saide heare crie see threate cleane contrarie whiche although wicked haue theyr recourse vnto god desire haue pitie vpon yet hee heare solution verie easie wey well sayd psalme namely god neere vnto call vpon truth prophete sheweth many seeke god howbeeit faynedly reason whereof bee conuinced none meane rid v misery god take v mercy pitiful v vnbeleeuers calvpo god without regard notwithstanding haue mocked religion thing spoken v scripture co cerning god prouidence mercie grace must looke hand therefore bee pinched aduersitie cry ala god driueth therevnto euen mother wit hypocrite despizers god maye well haue forme praying pray teethe outwarde theyr minde otherwise occupied oftentimes men may perceyue euen harty affection bee forced yet truthe haue knowledge say god calleth allureth shal disappoynted coming seing pleasure recken nuber child go vpon foolish rashnesse presumption obedience voyce god trusting promisse hypocrite cannot speake language therefore haue truth standeth hand haue fayth faith depedeth vpon god promise vngodly neuer tasted againe ought haue feeling misery whe approcheth vnto god must abashed himselfe must sorie sinnes must hate himselfe muste acknowledge exceeding wretched wicked hypocrite haue none although haue mouth open call vpon god yet vnhalowe holy name bicause right meening therfore fulfill prophet esay sayth nine twentith chapter whiche preace vnto god theyr mouth tung hart alwaies great way let v marke well lord sayeth auoucheth heare call vpon meeneth prayer must proceede faith men muste haue bethought well promise aforehad therby take boldnesse come vnto yet therewithall must acknowledge themselues wit forlorne damned destitute goodnesse must throughly perswaded ende may resort fountaine goodnesse grace thinke strange though god put backe hypocrite wicked men whe come vntoo come willing mind pure affectio would fayne shun god possible beit forasmuch cannot shift theselues come compulsion comming therfore pray vnto god let v learne offer fre eharted sacrifizes let v come willing minde assuring ourselues without wee destitute wee haue neede perteyneth welfare furthermore lette v doubte fauoure mercie towards v seeing hath promised v let v alwaies beleeue euer ready receiue v deafe desire come craue hand lo shall hearde god hande iob setteth downe purposely vvben trouble commeth vpon hypocrite bicause knowe feele howe auaylable prayer frute yeeld v true god sheweth goodnesse towardes v euery minute houre although perceyue yet doth preserue v fro misery hang ouer heade putteth hande betwixt v cannot acquainted god grace time prosperitie knowe mainteyned yet haue certaine euident experience fauour help prosperitie aduersitie forwhesoeuer miserie pincheth v death threatneth v haue wit discerne forlorne fordone god step v reskue v good sooth howe troubled wee consideration ye see euident demonstration god hath pitie vpon v affliction thing wherein god sheweth himselfe cheefly sauiour heere ye see sayd psalme thou shalt call vpon day thy trouble heare thee thou shalt glorifie therfore said must seeke vnto god necessitie last caste retchlesse wee tarry till constraint came behooueth v call vpo god time shall shewed anone yet doth lord prouoke v scourging v correcteth slouthfulnesse quickeneth v vp come vnto expresly sayd time wherein muste call vpon due conuenient season according sayd two thirtith psalme rightuous shal seeke god due time say whe aduersitie presseth haue occasion continually bycause haue occasion time hereby warned whensoeuer pinched vttermost abide wee muste faynte rather take courage come vnto god knowing allureth v worde mouth also doings hee onely reacheth v hand willeth v take also dooth drawe v force reason great sluggishnesse v lo haue mark streine herewithall let v vnderstand frute faith aduersities wee right happy curse god sendeth vppon men sinnes turned welfare meanes faith whe pray vnto god haue recourse vnto mids trouble sheweth himselfe sauiour maketh v feele hee neere hande v iob hath sayde addeth vngodly delighte almightie seeke alwaies vnto vvhen sayth wicked man seeke alwaies vnto god confirmation hath bene touched already witte must onely pray none otherwise also muste ordinarily deede cannot passe one minute houre without god helpe surely fauoure looke hande consisteth onely deliuering death wee good pit brim also preseruing v turning awaye euill v see life bee continually beseeged hundred deathes misery wheretoo subiect without number god therefore muste fayne garde v wall bulwarke according also sayeth prophet esay hee fortresse shielde hee also named oftentimes psalmes yee see ought call vpon god onely hee toucheth v smiteth hard stroke vpon v euen wee ease rest perceyue daunger towarde euen say behoueth v neuerthelesse consider many misery life subiect beeing perswaded wee escape excepte god preserue v may runne vnto say ala lorde keepe v thou vnder thy protection thy prouidence make v able passe manye deathes hem v rounde muste bee done euening morning moreouer know without going temptation assayle v dayly therefore pray vnto god must shoulde preserue v daungers wherin concerning present life cheefe poynt shoulde reach hande deliuer v satan temptation suffer v fall euill according deadly downefalles whereinto may tumble euery minute houre wee hild vp power lette v marke neede faythfull haue bee defended shielded god hande satan cannot ouercome v one side hee vndermineth v anewe behind hee assaulteth well one side well aboue beneath hath many fyrie burning dartes hee woulde wounde v death god dooth defende preserue v ynough v pray onely day neede selfe constrayneth v standeth v hand continually make ordinarie exercise thus ye see sayde wicked prayeth tymes vnto god yet one poynte ought marke well iobs intent v wit whereas wicked man doth nowe make countenaunce pray yet doeth continue minde proceedeth constantly one continuall rate heere ye see wherein prayer hypocrite differ prayer god child hypocrite withoute examining owne hearte welynough doo thing god child outwarde sight hee pray vnto god yea acknowledge hath neede least temptation world light vpon fretteth himselfe meddleth calling vpon god grunteth agaynst fometh vp rage sheweth well nother depended vppon god trusted soughte rightmeening minde counterfetnesse thus ye see hypocrisie faythlesse discouered lorde handleth owne liking holdeth shut vp distresse fret fume cotrariwise god scourge faithfull man hath prayed prosperitie time rest ceasseth holde still beseeching playe surgion healing woundes hath made short god child continue prayer haue sayde perseuerance holding muche although god afflict seeme turne backe deafe requestes yet neuerthelesse hold still neuer giue ouer cleane contrariwise god graut faithlesse request soone pray vnto pleasure hee perfourme theyr desire withoute delay thinke haue loste tyme see fashion praying right first tarry till extremitie copell v rather aforehand neede shoulde praying god preuent v gracious goodnesse take one point againe trouble distresse let v ceasse pray well prosperitie although god seeme fauour v rather aduersarie enimie vnto v estimation oure fleshly vnderstanding yet behooueth v exercise faith calling vpon whereas may seeme v haue auayled awhit praying rather god deaf request yet notwithstading let v hold stil leaue haue sighed sobbed day feele asswagemet let v returne remedie againe tomorrow good faith yee see although sicke person perceiue phisition hath done good firste yet ceasse beleeue counsell still meete put trust mortall men god let v wey well saying set downe praying continually vnto god let v thinke purpose v go god startes desire haue mercie vppon v wee muste doo diligently euery man stirre vp taske himselfe euening morning saying vvhat wretched creature sleepest thou heere knowest thou neede thou hast thy god shoulde ayde thee againe bee afflicted suffer aduersitie let v ceasse call vpon god nother let hart fayle v assuring selues affliction shall turne oure welfare soulehealth let v hold dayes lyfe yea let holding may importunate according lord iesus christ weth v parable exhorteth v pray without ceassing although god shew effect first hee heareth v yet wicked man set delight god notable saying conteineth good lesson heere iob putteth difference betwixte pleasure ioy god child faithfull sort haue pleasure faithlesse take hereby vnderstand skorners god malicious person looce liuers although seme happiest folke whole worlde vnhappie nothing wretchednesse contrarie parte although child god bee taken forlorne wretched damned creature yet right happy bycause set delight god thus see wee sentence right worthy well marked called ten tymes rememberance none v hee desireth haue ioye yet meane wee knowe true ioy wherein wee ought take wherevntoo wee ought referre cause ioy worlde cursed mouthe god owne sonne sayeth wo laughe vvill god haue v bee alwayes sad god greeued offended shoulde make myrth purpose serue text sayde god would fayne haue men merrie giueth wherwith merrie hee onely voutsafeth giue nurrishmente sustenance also giueth abundance wherwith merrie howe commes passe lorde iesus christ curseth laughter worlde bicause men besotte themselues mirth ioy cleane forgetting themselues turning awaye god according wee see moste men cannot bee merrie vnlesse thruste god good way runne ryot gyue themselues suche superfluitie remayneth wit reason somuche men passe bound needes must mirth cursed bring example heereof needelesse woulde god thing much knowen practized man v findeth vice himselfe bee talking god wee woulde fayne quickly end say ill v lord made v feele sweetenesse finde hath tasted neuer haue fill talking god preferre minding muzing vpon god pleasure worlde giuen vanity stand vpon thornes till bee gone speaking god melancholike matter truely wee see bothe feasting talking like thing trouble whole companie haue mention made god therefore let v thinke straunge god pronouceth horrible curse agaynste mirth worlde seeing frowarde runneth quite oute square right waye keepeth selfe within boundes bee merrie wantonnesse disorder let v come backe whiche sayde lawe thou shalt bee merrie presence thy god lesson beeing merrie presence god greate importance cannot bee doone without acknowledging good thing haue come hee giueth v intente wee shoulde take father yeelde thankes acknowledging bee fountayne goodnesse wee ought sticke vnto short reioyce presence god sticke creature corruptible thing knowe behoueth impute thing god fatherly goodnesse receyue benefites whiche hee bestoweth vppon confirmation loue fauoure thus yee see bee merrie reioyce presence god contrariwise howe fare vnbeleeuers haue shewed alreadie cannot muche laughe bee merrie muste separate themselues god turne theyr backe vppon yea quite cleane forget suche manner mirth cursed wee see nowe iobs meening iudgeth men happinesse ought resteth vpon thing seene hath falne heathe men could skill say imaginatiue happinesse like fayre picture looke vpo antike timber well guilded ouer glistereth maruelously within shalbe eaten mothes wormes eueso al braue lad world laugh god sport theselues withal may wel haue bothe credite rich pleasure may thought haue happiest life worlde meane wormeaten within wicked conscience playeth hangman ceasseth torment wote bee forasmuch cannot call vpon god muste needes bee without hope mercie withoute certaintie stay vpon alwayes feare bicause knowe howe long shall abyde plight bee shorte must needes blockes brute beastes contrarie parte yee shall see faithfull one merry euen inaduersitie wee haue caste eye vpon god behilde fatherly countenance towardes v onely saying comfort v wherein hee assureth v lay trouble vpon v shall bee able beare giue v good ende oure aduersities wee shall haue indured paciently wee shall feele haue profited v oure saluation bycause expedient profitable v bee chastized hande father ende hee might drawe v away vanity world nowe see glaunced afore witte although saythlesse haue thing men wont wishe yet vanitie leazing contrariwise although faithfull bee oppressed manie aduersities yet ceasse bee right happie bicause call vppon god able reioyce forsomuche knowe themselues bee fauoure hee chastizeth sort turneth thing welfare heerewithall let v beare minde manner men ought merrie hath bin sayde afore true lorde giueth v cause occasion mirth haue breade eate wine drinke benefites necessarie life diuers sortes liberalitie god bestoweth vpon v hee gyueth man issue hee sendeth good maketh prosper like thing beholde alwayes matter gladde sort muste wee bee glad euen presence god haue alledged afore vvoulde bee merrie suche wise god shoulde blisse mirth like well might sight lette v haue eye vnto god acknowledge ourselues bee beholding good honoure furthermore lette v haue suche longing wee may learne beate oure braynes present thing set heartes vpon assure ourselues worlde passeth away wee ourselues muste passe away yea ryght swiftly therefore tye ourselues go still forwarde vnto god ende race iob addeth immediatly teach bande god almightie yea addeth freendes verie vnwittie sith seene thing yet neuerthelesse speake aukly according haue seene iob hath alreadye put sufficient difference betwyxte god child vnbeleeuers shewing wee oughte deeme man life vnhappy outwarde shew appeereth day twayne little time muste enter innermore search harte yea must come hope death looke whither may lyue heere bee ioyned vnto god call vpon flee refuge yeelde themselues wholly reioyce goodnesse whither death able commit themselues keeping betake soules beleeuing safe whe bee hande happie contrariwise esteemed honorable suche authoritie suche lyue delight pleasure suche alwayes vnhappie bycause separate themselues god welspring welfare come death truste haled awaye force whereas ought put themselues quietlye handes iob hathe sufficiently distinguished thing already yet intent confirme matter better therefore vseth preface shew hade god almightie hee continueth still matter whiche hee dealt intende iudge rightly must rest must passe beyond world fayth looke vpon god iudgementes another fashion beholde thing wherein iobs counterparties deceyued iudged presente state would needes reste vpon inferiour thing iob therefore sheweth behooueth v go hande god yea marke iudgements secrete shoulde say suche rest onely vpon worlde cast howe thing disposed presently shall alwaies haue vntoward misordered iudgement lord calleth v telleth v althoughe hee execute iudgementes part disclose v suche sort may perceiue incling yet doth reserue many thing owne hand still like prince disclose minde publishe muche proclamation hee knoweth bee expedient gouerning people also man owne priuate house say muche shall good ordering housholde keepe rest himselfe necessarie declared nowe mortall men take libertie shal god meete lord shoulde shewe v iustice wisedome heere make ordinance knowen apparant v keepe nothing himselfe vvhither goe nowe see iobs meening hee rebuketh froward pryde men needes inclose god mightie power rightfulnesse wisedome within state present worlde might bee discerned contrary part sayth iob hand god must looke vnto know shall know fayth motherwit shall neuer reach high fayth wee may espye god reserueth manye thing yea reserueth wise behoueth v pacient whe see thing troubled turmoyled tarry till god make v beholde thing concealed v yet thus wee see doctrine haue gather streine effect must profite selues god woorkes worlde may able apply vse example see god shew himselfe mercifull one cace rigorouse another let v learne trust goodnesse walke feare beeit suche regarde apparant workes wee may meane assure ourselues reserueth thing himselfe whiche seene yet good men afflicted although haue theyr recourse vnto yet hee seemeth minded help seene plaine meening sort haue liued without man wrong troubled extremitie layde open spoyle god maketh countenance deliuering contrariwise wicked sorte triumph harden themselues theyr naughtinesse
