bearing themselues hande may misuse god without feare god winketh thing neuerthelesse let v greeued offended see thing disorder god redresseth first push behoueth v call minde saide god hath many thing hand reserueth himselfe vvhy dooth though know cause yet must humble selues wisedome consisteth submitting ourselues good pleasure god beit muche intendeth exercise fayth shoulde learne pacience experience let v refuze submit whole vnderstanding therevnto agayne seeyng god sheweth v woorkes part let v blinde see apparant neede make far search get tast thing list looke vpon ynough teach v let v shut eye wilfully nother let v plonder away vanitie doo whome iob speaketh vvhe god weakeneth v let v sure minde shoulde knowe work might yeeld due honour rest vpon present thing fall concluding iudgemente whiche behooueth v hope thing shall bee brought righte course therefore let v vanish away vanitie say lette v turned drawne away worldely thing let v recouer ourselues hope god setteth afore v whiche iesus christe come gather v himselfe wee shall see trusting god father vayne let v fall downe face good god acknowledgemente sinnes praying humble v wise wee may haue recourse vnto onely forasmuche pleaseth handle v gently make v feele goodnesse many wayes ende wee might bee moued come vnto suffer v gad owne delightes lustes hath brought v right way may neuer bee turned may alwayes go forwarde till wee come heauenly heritage wherevnto hee calleth v let v say almightie god heauenly father wee acknowledge confesse according truthe worthy lifte vp eye heauen present selues thee presume farre prayer c c sermon fourth vpon xxvij chapter behold vvhat portion vvicked vvith god heritage extortioner receyue almightie child multiplied shall put svvorde offpring shall bee satisfied vvith breade remnant shall buried destruction vvidovves shall vveepe though heape vp siluer duste gold clay righteouse shall cloth himselfe vvith innocent shall deuide siluer shall builde house moth vvatchman maketh lodge vvhen rich man sleepeth shall gather aught shall open eye nothing shal appeere shoulde seeme firste blushe iob speaketh another language done afore sayes vnsaies agreeth counterparties neuerthelesse haue seene already meening shall take thing hee speaketh heere yee see cause hath striued came cofort god doth alwaies punish wise world may throughly discerned seene eyesight holdeth selfesame opinion others haue hilde lette v marke iob place speaketh owne meening putteth cace haue saide leastwise part surely shall see next chapter ouerthroweth thing sheweth breefly god iudgementes hidden v sayde heretofore wee cannot comprehende compare gold siluer wisedome although golde siluer likewise bee metall full drosse hardly bee discerned value bee fyned although hard also find veines bicause hidde earth yet mine gold siluer found wisedome dwelleth men cannot find hir digging deepe downward climb high vpward come hir vnlesse god giue hir hereby iob meeneth hard poynt wisedome v coprehend god iudgements must make grounded rule though wee perfecte full knowledge world see effect iob contrary himselfe ne condescendeth talke doctrine haue hitherto resisted rather declareth haue spoken partly true howbeeit altogither bicause god iudgementes executed ordinarily present life althoughe wee haue nowe signes see iobs intent remaineth wee make oure profite doctrine vve haue two thing marke sentence one contentes heereof declaration punishmentes god executeth vpon wicked witte listeth punishe transitorie life wee haue marke god thinketh good deferreth punishmentes reserueth suche wise bee seene present life yet must quiet though god asleepe executed office knoweth wherefore hee delayeth reason vnknowen v yet pleaseth rule equitie righte thus yee see two poynts whervnto behoueth v bring backe conteined heere nowe touching firste poynt let v marke haue say de already withoute cause god hathe threatned punishe wicked transgressor lawe suche fashion shall euen haue theyr portion heritage heereby wee vnderstande men scape vnpunished heere belowe man taketh vengeance theyr misdeedes outrage extortion haue committed god aboue misse therefore length shall come theyr account shall portion heritage although bee punished firste day yet god worke ende according haue declared already say wee muste make generall rule yet shall fall oftentymes lette v learne haue eye vnto god oure life let v thinke selues discharged bee escaped handes men nother let v flatter ourselues therevpon though wee made fayre hande let v haue eye heritage god telleth v hee hath prepared suche haue liued amisse like sonne heyre man shall possesse father good landes firste day shall bee owner mayster tyme contrarie parte god punisheth wicked sorte incontinently haue offended yet theyr possession kepte end shall reserued certaynly heritage whereof cannot bee disfeated marke one point said child bee multiplied shall go sworde spring shall bee ouerthrowen shall bee buryed destruction without remedy saying wee vnderstand god punisheth wicked despisers maiestie theyr owne persones also extendeth vengeance euen vntoo theyr child truely thinke strange owne vnderstanding hath bene declared already heretofore god may punishe child wicked without dooing wrong wee cursed adam bring nothing damnation v oure mother wombe god leaue v oure owne state v great small alreadie appoynted destruction god rend vp whole world plunge bottomelesse pit might accused crueltie gentle handling v commeth owne meere goodnesse deserte oures hee withdrawe grace ofspring wicked punish father wrap child like destruction somuch father hath run wickednesse child must faine fill vp iniquitie auneester haue punishmente cast bosome scripture sayth let v thinke straunge god knoweth wherefore doth truely wee stande reasoning owne imagination wee would thinke reason diuelishe malapertnes measure god workes oure owne reason vnderstanding herewithall let v beare mynde also hath beene declared witte mankynde fordoone damned selfe god may deale rigorously without blame saluation commeth selues god assureth v hee doth deserte worthynesse owne meere mercie haue shewed afore wee see god ought bee glorified rygour hee executeth vpon wicked punisheth person child serueth caste greater terroure vpon despisers god bee threatned shall bee punished euen ofspring like contrarie part lorde sayth hee gracious pitifull shewe mercie thousande generation loue obey hee meeneth thereby assure v better infinite loue hee beareth v knowe god thinkes ynough loue v take v child voutsafeth also call child sake fauoure substantiall proofe singular goodnesse haue wee much cause reioyce god seeing hee onely receyueth v himselfe also maketh oure child partaker grace furthermore muche menne dull vpon spurre bowe easily god threatneth causeth say hath punished owne person rigoure must bee faine extend euen vnto posteritie yea euen deceasse ceasse shewe sore hated abhorred punishing ofspring sith sayd needes ought wicked terribly afraid yea thoughe harder stone howe nowe may say howe great god vengeance bee vpon v seeing euen child shall bee wrapped fragmentes thereof shall flye posteritie euen death oure issue muste perishe fault howe great terrible shall destruction thus yee see lorde doth expresly threaten wicked punish euen child ende touched neerer quicke feare seeing men dull hardharted owne nature let v come touched beginning witte god iustice may bee seene howe alwayes vve see child wicked doe soone melte away haue goodes wanze away seeme haue wherewith feede yea fat themselues throughly men abashed see howe sodainly wasteth away man tell howe seene wee looke wisely vpon god iudgementes wee may well see experience nought scripture sayth god punishe wicked ofspring looke vpon man shall haue endured great vnquietnesse paynes lyfe long gather goodes deede hee heapeth vp greate hoorde shall seeme rich shall neuer fayle successoures yet consumed lesse nothing whome cause may suche chaunge bee imputed let v conclude god putteth hande vvherefore let v bee blynded oure lorde worketh fashion let v learne take warning example caried away couetousnesse ne imagine mannes welfare consisteth much gathering rather let v make account onely god blissing thing nourisheth v continue nourishe child also god reach hand feede v ynough v let v praye continue still wise wee may perceiue louing father assure selues fayle child deceasse much wicked doe take great payne enriche themselues rich heape vp shall occasion cast chlidren deeper destruction father thinke selues haue done maruellously well gathering much doe twine halter shall draw child destruction made learne simple handicrafte might haue walked conscionably would haue beene good heritage leaue possession become blinde giue themselues al naughtinesse rich muste needes bee occasion make abhorred god man god beare pryde men also prouoked bycause vpon trust rich take vpon doe euerie man wrong anoyance god therefore forced bende himselfe againe bee accustomed deyntie fare drunkennesse get oute cause make giue selues ouer euill ende nowe looke wickednesse increaseth augmenteth also must god vengeance growe hoter riper let v marke well wee see chaunges goodes whiche wickedly gotten father scattered wasted awaye handes child thereby god sheweth v denouncing suche threates vayne marke one poynte yet therewithall let v marke also began say alreadie co tinuall diuers time god taketh awaye goodes godly child bee quyte stripped doth euen reason secrete himselfe vnknowne v neuerthelesse knowe welfare meane hee intendeth inure pacience take awaye occasion falling asleepe heere bylowe else bee shorte hee mindeth minister purgation let bloud bicause hee seeth well abundance possesse would bee noy superfluitie vvhen surgion letteth man bloud seemeth bee hurt verie deed selfesame way whereby theefe murthereth man yet letting bloude phisition curing disease good cause euen happeneth oftentimes god bereeueth rightuous men goodes substaunce hee hath giuen else hee impouerisheth child ende wee shoulde take punishment cleane contrariwise haue sayde purgation hee vseth towardes child thereby also draweth backe intangled worldly good least might occasion bring ofspring destruction ye see execution god iudgements haue spoken heretofore continuall therefore make general rule without exception let v come backe whiche wee haue spoken often alreadie shall bee declared nexte chapter following god iudgementes alwayes visible wee might poynte say god dealeth alwayes manner euer god punisheth man person ofspring let v looke well vpon example may profit selues winke others punish first let v tarie paciently till day lorde appeere long world bee night reason thinges darke comming lorde iesus christe bookes register shall layd open nothing shall hidden therefore let v tarie paciently daye furthermore god scourage v yea euen suche wise wee may suppose hee hateth v persecuteth v mortall enemie yet let v therefore ceasse humble oure selues vnder acknowledge bee meane whereby hee would drawe v vnto let v suffer handle v thinketh good determining selues bee wedded muche owne fansie thing euerie man life owne hande hee might say haue thing bee thus thing vvhere obedience againe let v consider wisdome v couet thing good v nay rather cleane contrariwise tempted wishe thing serueth vtter vndoing thus ye see cause haue bridle selues put selues wholly good pleasure good god nowe followeth wicked man shall haue heaped vp golde dust treasure apparell houshold stuffe suche thing also lande rightuouse shall cloth himselfe maye come passe manye time often happeneth wee must bee blinde wee discerne hande god fare better sayde man may well turmoyle selfe hee maye rise earely goe late bed yet shall neuer forward rather backward except god blisse contrariwise giueth faythfull one euer meete euen lye sleepe lo threate lo heere promisse vve see nought sayde hee make faithfull prosper sometimes hee aduaunce wise good shal grow betweene handes againe wee see number whiche neuer leaue gathering life long yet god ouerthroweth vpon sodein muche haue taken great paine slippeth awaye vvee see bee doe wee see alwayes let v learne looke vpon god temporall iudgementes suche sorte wee constreyne doe tymes alike great difference betwixte thinges concerne present life secrete iudgementes god manner muste wee iudge promise promise belong present life see promise performed alwayes one rate god knoweth bee expedient v touching spirituall promise belong welfare soules certeine behoueth v conclude god neuer disappoynte v let v put difference betweene thinges concerne transitorie life thing concern heauenly life euerlasting kingdome god presente life wee maye generally well looke god shoulde guide v hope long myndeth keepe v heere wee shall nourished goodnesse continue alwayes vnder shadowe sheelding wee particularly determine hee giue v aboundance goodes hee graunt v health hee deliuer v oure enemy help v meanes vve precizely point vpon thing behoueth v haue oure eye seeled vp god haue v heere battell done fall vpon feete say trouble worlde shall let god leading v saluation hee hath promised v wherevnto calleth v like said punishment curse god euermore vpon wicked certaine although bee riche although triumphe althoughe bee credite estimation yet able call vpon god therefore haue rest conscience continually disquieted nother assuage greefe knowledge god goodnesse haue droppe knowledge declared yesterday although god execute vengeance vpon wicked open sight world yet ceasse cursed middes prosperitie laste punishment daye doome misse muste needes come though tarrie neuer long yea haue liued long time suche wise god may seeme haue bene fauorable willing followe lure thing farre woorse bene chastized world must bee fayne pay deere shot goodes haue crammed vp world sotting selues ryottousnesse abusing gentlenesse pacience mocking doctrine religion last punishment whiche god denounceth againste wicked misse yet world may welynough fall shall punished first dashe leastwise perceyue nowe let v come iob sayeth wicked sayth hee shall heape vp money dust god shewe vengeance better suffereth wicked enrich themselues suche sort seeme seagulfes swallow vp good world certesse wicked man neuer prosper men perceiue punishmente spoken heere namely growne rich hath gathered much yet afterwarde enioy man aske take suche paine heape vp ryches intent say tell may befall shall growe olde shall haue neede succour many ouerthwartes befall men haue wherewith help self need besides haue child leaue poore lo aunswere take much paine enrich selues yea meane season whither reason restreine themselues diuers nigardly greeueth themselues good dare helpe selues owne want whither fal god snatcheth good hand nowe happeneth hath suffered haue full scope strippeth quite end cleane one moment seene ofsping become poore man tell howe wee see inioy thing haue heaped togither see threatning executed vpo many namely wicked shall heape vp golde siluer moueables yet ende good men shall come bee clothed true bycause god child walke simply playnly may want many thyngs may seeme pouertie threatneth attache within daye twaine yet god prouideth wise alwayes kepe way still vvee see godly shall sometymes bee clothed spoyle wicked yet thing make certaine rule bynde god continually vvherefore behoueth v beare alwayes mynd god iudgements euer apparant visible bee seene men eye vvhen see wicked man rich stumble saying meeneth wee see wicked despyzers god honoured seemeth v god gouerneth worlde thinges guided fortune behold faith vtterly defaced go measure god iudgementes thinges wee presently see oure eye therefore let v learne suspende oure iudgementes verely god plucke wicked mennes goodes hand let v vnderstand fulfilleth threat whiche wee heare spoken place hee doe let v marke hee reserueth execution iustice vntill last day bring thing perfection nowe bycause nourishe hope still haue v wedded world seeke felicitie heere bylowe paradise pleasure lift vp eye aloft passe lightly worlde iourney knowing oure selues bee wayfarer wanderer worlde therefore behoueth v trauell continually heauenly euerlasting heritage muche mente followeth wicked man shall buylde house moth shall hee watchman caban euen suche watchman caban watcheth vyneyardes vvhen vnbeleeuers despizers god doe buyld beare themselues hand shall dwel thousand yeares death doth statelinesse seene building made despizers god shewe imagine immortalitie world beare themselues hand shall prolong life palace vvhen man hath builded house continue thousande yeares beleeues house tyed shall meanes renoumed god scorneth ouerwening cause iob compareth house wicked men house mothes howe moth marreth wasteth thing make himselfe lodging eateth cloth eateth furre eateth findeth shorte euer moth lodgeth alwayes another body cost hinderance yet notwithstanding nothing corcuption vermine lodging vvhen vinekeeper maketh caban watch vineyardes three monthes sone vinetage done go caban although man set hande yet falleth downe selfe euen sayd wicked men make stately house beare selues hand whe haue buylded maner shall dwell euer vvhat themselues euen moth say haue nothing corruption must sayne carrie continually seing surely house continue long true shall make great shewe time ende god beate downe house shall abyde long thus see yee notable iudgement god executeth vpo make estimation selues world much see example thereof wee ought marke well thereby learne nestle selues world build guile wrong extortion let building according good god hath giuen v let well housed besot selues owne lustes nestle themselues let men nestle themselues vpon earth much list yet shall barre god plucking away let v kepe selues well making nest bylowe according bee sayde nine twentith chapter iob made reckning state neuer change men beguile selues behighting selues suche euerlastingnesse god also laugheth fonde presumption scorne therefore godly lodged owne minde yet let count selues straungers worlde let alwayes readie part hence whensoeuer shall please god haue commodity bee wished yet let goe warde still learne knowe god aduertizeth eyesight place must abyde behoueth passe thus ye see haue remember perceiue lorde haue men set mindes vpon thinges bylow therfore let v trauell right way hee calleth v shall wee bee blissed shall euerie v dwell rest time hath liue bycause shall bee troubled vnquietnesse wicked despizers god haue thus much concerning poynt furthermore although selues also house bee nothing corruption yet haue promise comfort v wee bee restored fully heauenly glorie shall haue need materiall building bylowe yea bodie itselfe shall bee another manner thing nowe yet therwithall let v learn also build snatching catching leude dealing cause oure lorde doth destory great palace builded throwe quite downe according also wee see prophet threaten shalbe dwelling place shreeke oules wylde beast bird pray yea nightcrowes wylde woodwardes lorde doth auenge selfe robbery extortion committed buylding great place according sayde prophete abacucke suche haue bereft men good doe build quire betweene walles one wall shall crie oute builded vpon bloud another murther therefore let faythfull aduise selues well builde bee vppon goodes wrongfully gotten mynde haue ioy dwelling therewithall euer worlde goe let rest make nest let readie remoue euer shall please god nowe furthermore sayde wicked man shall die bee buried honourably hee shall open eye see nothing serueth conclude matter hath bene treated iob meeneth maye well come passe doeth indeede wicked shall stumble yea euen hee hath bene aduaunced thing whereat looketh lorde exalteth wicked afterwarde letteth fall yea euen deadly fall touching death buried honorably agayne looke finde succoure disappoynted longing heere haue faire looking glasse god iudgementes howebeit play held argument iob wit wee goe inforce god set thing perfecte state shall bee done till last day yet meane season behoueth v bee warned looke vpon god hande ofte lord ouerthroweth wicked beateth vvee must poynte seeke chaunce child world whiche imagin wheele fortune menne hoysed vp alofte afterwarde let fall agayne chaunges returnings see world thing happen aduenture behoueth vp father vppon hand god howe sometimes hee punisheth haue abused grace sometimes hee beareth perceyued hee myndeth punishe yet shall haue much terrible account make haue touched alreadie notwithstanding wee see wicked fall behoueth v knowe god aduaunce without cause ende fall shoulde greeuouser euen breake necke beene hoysed vp aloft god must make fall fashion furthermore nought buriall spoken heere although bee neyther heere respecte saluation yet two thing considered one wicked doe death defye god nature thinke prolong greatenesse pompousnesse still spyte nature oure lorde conueyeth rottennesse yea euen say wordly fleshely men make muche brauerie life afore sumptuouse buriall saue memoriall perishing men might speake euer see foolish curiositie worldling vnbeleeuers vse beeing buried great pompe continue pride despite god god laugheth presumption scorne hee disappoynteth expectation much whereas purposed buried honorably diuers time hath giuen cleane contrarie buriall marke one point yet also considered buriall brought god inuention man without good grounde god ordinance end witnesse vnto v resurrection euerlasting life vvhen men buried layde vp earth store house vntill maye bee raysed vp agayne last day buriall vnto v looking glasse resurrection therefore wicked disappoynted buriall much oure lorde vttered cursse vpon visible manner yea euen well deathe life according sayde heere yet notwithstanding lette v marke wicked bee buried honourably wee muste bee troubled thinke god hathe forgotten hym selfe hee executeth iudgementes conuenient time wee see scripture sayeth riche man namely buried sayeth lazarus mention made buriall much known whether eaten dogges whether cast abroade feeldes scripture speaketh speaketh buriall riche man contrariwise god child happen sometimes lye vnburied concluded therfore accursed like wicked buryed bee sayd blessed death shewe v god executeth temporall punishmentes one egall rate worlde reserueth chiefe himselfe till latter day much sayd wee see good men burned put open shame god child perishe wicked yea touching bodie bee caried gallowes although bee martyr iesus christ slaunder bee honour god preserments world yet withstanding god gyueth buriall howe commeth passe howe falleth threatnings wicked spoken behoueth v come backe haue sayde namely suche iudgementes hidden incomprehensible yet behoueth v tarie till lorde bring v daye wherein thing shall bee discouered meane season let v knowe heauen shall serue tumbe suche martyred meane innocent put reproche wicked persecuters honorablest buriall worlde nothing comparison benefite priuiledge god giueth man finde honourable tumbe heauen oure lorde maketh serue tumbe child bereaueth common ordinarie buriall please god haue v buried let v know record goodnesse hee bereeue wicked buriall let v also behold vengeance life death yet notwithstanding let v learne refraine selues haue eye closed vp respect secrete iudgemenres vntill become vnto last day hee shewe v thing perfectly order nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement sinnes praying make v feele wee may bee sorie wise may desire nothing bee gouerned holie spirite therewithall let v beseech humblie vouchsafe vse infinite mercie towards v releasing offence whereby bound iudgement may passe world may wedded worldly thing stablished fayth hope vntill lorde haue called v kingdome shall fully see thing know small portion meane wee may bee strengthened stumbling blockes worlde neuer ceasse giue glorie oure god notwithstanding ourfleshly reason comprehend huge depthes workes maye please graunt grace v c cj sermon fift vpon xxvij chapter first vpon xxviij chapter vvhen rich man sleepeth hee shall gather ought hee shall open eye nothing shall seene trouble shall come vpon vvater tempest shall carie avvay night east vvinde shall beare avvay hee shall gone shall hurle place like avvhirle vvind shall rush vpon spare shall flee hande men shall clappe handes togither hisse place xxviij chapter siluer hath spring golde hath place grovve iron taken earth brasse molten stone god hath set ende vnto darknesse vnto thing tende vnto end bound darknesse shadovve death ouerflovveth riuer inhabiter vvaters forgotten foote vvhen haue risen aboue man sinke againe one selfe earth commeth breade vnder chaunge vvere fire place vvhere stone saphyres moulde golde birde hath knovvne vvay neither hath eye kyte seene lion vvhelpes haue vvalked neyther hath lion passed layeth hand vpon rocke turneth vp mountaynes rootes according yesterdayes talke said heere riche man shall open eye finde nothing vvhereby ment rich men shall safe time thinke shall neuer want thing end shall bee hidden shall bee hope shall awake seeke succoure fynde summe although riche men sleepe wealth time bycause thinke shall neuer wante haue eye blynded ouerweening yet notwithstanding god doth afterwarde inforce seeke helpe without fynding perceyue trusting rich vayne confounded iudgement god dayly seene therefore wee bee warned althoughe god giue v wee wishe wee thinke wee shall neuer want wee must fall asleepe knowing life subiect many chaunges woulde wonder see therefore let v watch calling vpon god let v watch wee rest vpon thing haue owne handes let v watch knowe haue neede succored many way meane let v learne returne vnto god settle ground selues vpon prouidence goodnesse warning wee ought gather sentence seene alwayes therefore sayde let v learne make general rule although rich men ouerflow welth haue great trayne euery man laboreth doe seruice finally want nothing let v thinke god hath giuen ouer office hee reserueth selfe iudgemente executeth vpon ende wee shoulde thinke hee able accomplishe worlde pleased men take sentence somewhat otherwise wit referre saying bee shall open eye looke rich men men meening men shall looke folke become liued wealth bare great port worlde see according sayde seuen thirtie psalme sawe perking vp hie ceder mount lybanus hee touched clowdes heade anon came backe founde place yee see howe god maketh wicked vanishe away wise remembrance wyped world sense agree well text furthermore othersome vnderstande sentence neither death buriall expounded yesterday though sayde wicked man layeth downe rest shall finde none yet notwithstanding easiest interpretation saye wicked shall scape god shewe iustice vpon haue sayde commeth passe howebeit alwayes must euer seeke execution god iustice worlde euill principle would trouble v haue declared afore saw thing eye wee haue imagined vpon let v vnderstande lorde delayeth iudgementes hee thinketh good maketh manifest world nowe consequently sayde fearefulnesse shall ouertake wicked man rage water speaketh water hee meeneth sodaine storme te pest whirle winde commeth night iudgement god comon also notable wit god sendeth suche fearefulnesse vpon wicked know become co meth storme tempest night whiche man foresawe ne yet tooke heede spoken purposely bycause wicked doe beare selues hande god ought let alone rest yet notwithstanding though troubled throughly quiet bicause haue euill conscience yet behight selues wonder sayde prophet specially esay make couenant death thinke selues league attonement graue although earth couered floude vtterly drowned yet mischeefe could come neere yee see howe wicked puffed vp pryde god pincheth harden selues thereby surely man threaten tell shall ende attemptes litle moued therwith mock thus ye see sayd fearefulnesse shall come vpon rage water according also saying saincte paule thessalonian shal say peace safe shall sodainly ouerthrowne destruction thought doubted shall come vpon talke suche alteration god sendeth vpon wicked destroieth sodenly sent storme tempest night let v learne sotted foolishe presumption thinke god let v alone rest neyther let v flatter oure selues rather let v knowe lorde intendeth keepe v vnder lowlynesse ende wee haue myndes freer come vnto bee drawne awaye vanity worlde rather bee prouoked giue selues wholly vnto yee see howe behoueth v seeke peace god worldly goodes wee doe let v bee afrayde wee bee ouerthrowne sodayne tempest god sende fearefulnesse vpon v shall trouble v contrariwise suche presume vpon earthly prosperitie must bee fayne feele hande god although world yet world come must faine come account escape hand heauenly iudge vvherfore let v walke aduisedly furthermore though wicked nowe without feare let v thinke god hath forgotten wickednesse wee doe alwayes perceiue iudgements presently haue sayde therefore behooueth v tarie discouerie vntyll last daye assuring oure selues god sometymes trie oure faythe holding hande hidden v behoueth v note althoughe feare whiche god sendeth vpon wicked vppon despyzers woorde bee perceyued heere yet notwithstanding feele secrete feare continually heartes sayde prophete esay peace wicked lyke waues beate one long anye violent winde wee see water turmoyled waues breake one agaynst euen wycked withoute trouble men handes doe torment themselues hangman selues thoughtes affection shall quake falling leafe bodie foloweth fearefulnesse shal bee secrete outwardly set good countenaunce vpon matter also knowe selues dulled selues chafe god admit warning giueth moue repentance therefore let v learne seeke peace haue spoken whiche haue good pure conscience wee leane vnto god call vpon although send v trouble yet shall vtterly ouerthrowne shall haue whereof reioyce goodnesse sayde finally shal caried away east winde driuen place ouer whelmed misery shall flee away similitude eastwinde vvhirlewinds added one purpose respecte countrey iewrie easterne winde boystousest holie scripture sheweth ment wicked haue prospered become rich mightie shall neuerthelesse caught away thrown rose great tempest came sodainly suche winde shoulde beare downe thing compelled flee awaye whereas thought theselues wel fenced yea trusted also thervnto shall wel fele al restrein execution god iustice vpon although scare poore menne bee terrour euery man yet must bee fayne runne away themselues shall bee power withstand inconuenience shall well knowe must needes bee vtterly ouerthrowne bycause hande god persecuteth punisheth bee shorte shewed v heere suche bee bolde troubling others shall daunted hand god shall forget stoutnesse lionlyke courage pryde shall become cowardely curres shall feele god hande despyzed afore heereby wee bee warned foresee god iudgementes along aforehande wee maye wayte paciently althoughe god let v alone rest yet let v ceasse examine sinnes acknowledge oureselues worthie bee beaten hys roddes let v caste downe oure heades learne bridle selues bee bolde doe amisse let boldnesse calling vpon god despising sinne diuell world power vnder protection god yet therewithall let v walke alwayes lowlinesse modestie knowing suche haue sorte beene terroure vntoo others shall bee constreyned hyde selues shall finde safetie according certaine wicked shall bee forced flee needes muste thing bee fulfilled whiche sayde psalme lorde shall become maye scape thy handes shoulde flye aboue clowdes thy maiestie aboue stoppe mee get mee ouer sea thy hande ouertake mee goe downe deepes thou arte well able fetche mee backe againe wicked maye desire mountaynes fall vppon shall boote hande god shall take holde euer hyde themselues vvherefore let v assure selues wrong boxe seeke peace bee persecuted hande god may well shunne escape nowe although bee seene matter presently yet doeth god ceasse iudge worlde still poynte wherevnto wee must continually haue recourse finally sayde conclusion euery man shall clappe handes hee seeth wicked fashion euerie man shall hisse way scorne mockeris place say poore folke beene oppressed afore durst shewe selues abroad streats bycause robber fleeced readie eate vp shall reioyce lorde doth manner destroye beene credite authoritie much shall clappe hand mocke pryde ouerweening despizers god heere might demaunded whether bee lawfull good faythfull bee glad see fall wicked superfluous question place bycause tolde v lawfull doe barely shewed v worlde glad according also seene experience pillers pollers haue molested menne well great small die beaten downe hand god thing men reioyce haue bene enemy worlde yet wee muste marke caueat reioysing fleshly ne proceeded desire reuenge good holie allowable god wee bee prouoked reioyce aduengement fleshly affection oure gladnesse cursed condemned men moued passion whether gladnesse sorrowe surely ioy sorrowe commonly sinfull vvherefore man reioyce fal wicked must doe vpon fleshly desire onely allowing god iustice agreeing hee sheweth yet meane hee must alwayes bee established grounded feare loue also haue good gouernment owne affection thus see may bee lawfull v reioyce destruction wicked let v take good heed wee bee stirred therevnto fleshly affection ne intermeddle thing owne yet notwithstanding touching present texte let v marke howe shewed v heere wicked whiche full ambition vayneglorie seeke haue estimation whole world must needes become lothsome god bring hatred euerie man shall reioyce destruction yee see shall bee disappoynted expectation althoughe happen time yet let v think lorde hath therefore forgotten duetie let v tarie reuelation whiche promised v laste daye heere yee see iob declareth many secretes nature seene worlde therevppon concludeth man vnderstanding thinges hidden yet notwithstanding goddes wisedome surmounteth farre hygher take though sayde thinges chaunge worlde wee see continuance order nature fruitefull feeldes haue beene haue borne good corne menne see fire saye barreynnesse man woulde haue thought hadde beene grauell sande oftentimes hath beene golde precious stone vve see many chaunges world sayd hundred seuenth psalme matter whiche prophete treateth shewing reason men sinnes earth becommeth barreine muche seemeth men haue sowne salte place well inhabited become deserte men constreyned eschue famine heate colde greeue suche wise wote become also god goodnesse ouergoing naughtinesse man maketh feeldes frutefull barreine maketh store sustenance grewe one graine corne opinion iob meant heere make description conteyned sayde psalme haue alreadie shewed meening wit many thing worlde secrete wherein seemeth reason yet notwithstanding men shall finde reason last also finde thing hidden god wisedome men shall neuer attaine reach high comparison holdeth smallest greatest iob shoulde say go freendes verie hard thing man vnderstanding seeke meanes howe finde golde siluer precious stone true men neuerthelesse bring passe yet may well called secret nature also ther thing wherin men grauelled wonder somtimes ryuers runne place none euer thought bee according water sometimes rise sometimes fall man maye sometimes goe place drie foote anon water shall swell vp hys chinne one brokes shall drie another increase verely seemeth bee great secrete brokes increase melting snow great raine shall sometimes see spring dried vp anon gush water abundantly man say god mindeth shewe power chaunges therfore thing seene worlde serue present life yet darke yet true man reason may wel inquire studie vpon hee shall finde reason god wisedome maner thing vvhen come iudgementes let v thinke conteine brayne compasse wit let v reuerence thing knowe confessing maiestie god ouer hie v becommeth v goe abace suche wise imagine determine thinke good let v content ourselues god sheweth v assuring selues ouerlong distance betwene god v must bee fayne come vnto v else wee shall neuer come vnto howe comming v hys meening shall yet knowe thing wil shewe v last day thus yee see iobs meening notwithstanding necessarie nowe stande vpon thing spoken heere intent holie ghost shewe v cunning mynes would verie small profit bestow three foure sermon teach seeke mynes gold siluer thing haue seeke euery man would occupie trade must stand vpo euery peece wee finde mention made mynes gold siluer sayd vnto v gold grain mettall found sand ryuer ought suffise v see god hath put secret nature ende magnified v thus ye see effecte haue beare mynde ought acknowldge god infinite power wisdome yea euen least thing world muche ought secretes strange v golde siluer like thing ought moued mynds ought tobe better wakened may better perceyue vnderstande inestimable power god oure lord haue v dullardes like block wood would haue v behold workes hand indeede good reason wee knowe thinke vpon yea euen wise may yeeld due glorie moued thereby know worker become like vnhappie wretch walke worlde treading god workes vnder feete knowing maiestie therefore let v bee brutishe leastwise although heauie grosse consider god maiestie power common base thing yet whe come thing strage v let v moued case begin consider god worketh wonderful mean otherwise vnthankefulnesse wil vnexcusable thinke vpon therwithal let v mark god wil haue mynds tied thing world leuer shuld come vnto know profit ourselues warning giueth v vvese principal poynt haue marke strein meete god high excellent work shuld set mynds vpon consider wel considering shuld also glorifie god sayd expresly god hath bounded darkenesse yee see howe darknesse hideth thing day time men may discerne white blacke asunder night commeth beholde thing defaced oure sens fayle v discerne man stone wee discerne house hill yet darkenesse whiche bereeueth menne sorte syght discerning bounded god setteth stinte ende heereby iob meeneth althoughe bee greate diuersitie thinges worlde yea euen vnto verie darkenesse hydeth awaye syght thing yet notwithstanding menne go anon god sendeth light darkenesse continueth euer heere wee haue good verie profitable lesson whiche man reason may haue abilitie vnderstande iudge lower thinges whiche concerne present transitorie life concerning thing heauenly belong kingdome god concerning iudgement thing hidden v sayd doctrine profitable yea verely well vnderstood ought truely many euen smallest lowest thing cannot conceyue except god giue v abilitie according wee see howe many simple idiotes men terme know brute beastes manner folke set god oure eye looking glass humble v withall vvhen see starke idiot hath wit reason behoueth v looke well vpon mirrour nature vvhence come reason vnderstanding haue singular gifte god let haue reason vndersta ding know god hath indued wyth grace therefore bound vnto marke one point surely whereas lord hath made sharp witted others giuen handsomnesse compasse thynges vndertake forecast conclude bring matter passe wisely compasse many thing short time othersome slowe dull witted man must fayne beate head beetle learne thing diuersitie among men sheweth euidently haue power iudge discerne aright speciall gift god must fathered vpon nature acknowledge lord dealeth euery man according thinketh good lo haue marke furthermore sayeth man wit nature able conceyue thinges heere beneath whiche concerne presente life word nature barreth god gift serueth v vnderstand thing gyuen vnbeleeuers also whome god hathe forgotten holy ghost named spirit adoption bycause hee marke god imprinteth vpon child although haue holy ghost regenerated haue earnest pennie pledge hoped saluation yet may wee well haue vnderstanding common thing beleeuers vnbeleeuers iudge thing heere beneath yea oftentimes wicked despisers god sharper witted skilfuller doings according also lord iesus christ speaketh ye see must beare minde may well sort comprehend thing heere beneath haue abilitie god haue sayd afore neyther men haue like measure god distributeth euery man thinketh good yet notwithstading god putteth men intoo worlde without giuing portion reason may bee able iudge inferior thing moreouer also discerne betweene good euill vvhere shall wee finde beastly men wil condemne robberie murther whoredome nature teacheth v againe men haue lawes forme common weale see well cannot breake order guyde well matter perteyne present life furthermore haue also trade handicraftes one baker another plowman another shoomaker another clothyer trade gift god common well vnbeleeuers faithfull whome god hathe inlightned holy spirit howbeit giftes serue men bycause mankynde coulde bee maynteyned state without suche helpes meanes yee see effect thyng whiche wee haue remember although great number secret nature thing high belong present life yet hath god giuen men abilitie attaine vntoo example speake handycraft man come cunning occupation shall finde straunge thing yea woorkes require cunning yee woulde woonder possible done men say howe coulde men know gold lyeth earth beholde men make salt water howe commeth passe surely euen bycause god hath giuen men skill agayne golde siluer spoken heere beholde mettall mingled earthe hath much colour yea seemeth vtterly vnprofitable howe man discerne howe fine serue turne become precious metall meane traffike betweene man man according wee see gold siluer applyed vse might done agayne touching artes handicraft bace common first men seeke worke specially see men sowe corne growe say men make wine thing vvhen know thing wee thinke straunge yet god hathe giuen v skill otherwise seeke thing meane capacitie men comprehend natural thing notwithstanding darke first enterance although men harde grosse vnderstanding yet attaine cast earthly life bicause god giueth aydes meanes wherewith passe world commeth mounting aboue transitorie life finde v come short heere ye see wherein proude folkes misbehaue themselues beare themselues hande bycause bee sharpe witted suttle lower thing able also iudge god secretes whole doctrine law prophetes gospell god maketh double blind presumptuous fayth spirituall light insight god iudgements groweth v neither haue wee respect kind haue giuen v aboue god good pleasure ouer besides order nature yea see god punisheth pride suche trust owne wisedome base inferioure thyngs beholde lustie worldling come finenesse suttelties find hart mocke god world yea polytike theyr owne seeming nothing shall escape therevppon deuise wonder vndertake enterprise aboue abilitie god suffereth runne head fashion meane whyle blyndeth neede little child laugh scorne oftentimes commeth passe craftiest take themselues peerlesse policie destitute reason put soyle according scripture sayeth god catcheth wise owne wilinesse pitfall vve see possible man well aduised ouertaken dazeled small matter hath wit verely though god heauen blind thynke themselues see cleerely trust owne skyll wisedome standeth hande punishe suche pride inasmuch presume vppon themselues rob god honour must fayne reuenge himselfe trayterousnesse agayn forsomuch men apply wittes naughtinesse rather goodnesse behoueth lorde also punish misusing giftes hath bestowed vpon singular gift god giueth v good sharpe vnderstading turne craft naughtinesse reason god punish v defile thing appoynted onely owne welfare also common benefit neighbour god punish pride men trust much owne wit bace transitorie thing pray muste hee needes cut theyr combes plunge intoo bottome hell reuenge himselfe theyr pride statelynesse lostie would faine mount vp heauen priuie heauenly secretes knowe thing god hath reserued ought belong alone let v learne although wit serue v well ynough discerne thing concerne belong heere earthly life yet sayd able mount vp heauen enter god secret determination conuey thing wit braine lord hideth himselfe bee short let v assure selues thing concerne euerlasting life farre aboue reach lord must faine worke v yea euen supernaturally onely inlighten v manner men also giue v newe light whiche hidden v bycause proceedeth sayd spirit adoption haue spoken furthermore sith let v consider man free mad bee mainteine themselues wee haue free guide selues godward attaine euerlasting life would follow necessitie first wee shoulde haue faythe rightuousnesse holinesse wee see scripture condemneth v blind wretch telleth v wee must aduaunce selues high thynke attaine god secretes must confesse selues destitute wit reason thus ye see first lesson must learne come god schoole become fooles sainct paule sayeth truly seemeth straunge v yet muste passe way intend taught god hand play schoolemayster towards v must become fooles saye wee must acknowledge much one drop reason vnderstanding v destitute brute beastes haue lesse skill discretion v haue therfore let v learne humble ourselues end god may reach v hande sith cace standeth must wee doo nowe firste let v vnderstande comprehende god secretes hee muste bee faine giue v holy spirite inlighten oure darkenesse forsomuch wee bee farre seeke hee must shewe v v knowe must presume haue knowledge giueth v marke one poynt wee must also consider haue receyued heauenly light gift vnderstanding commeth holy ghoste must also come holy scripture take vpon v search god woorkes iudgements conteyned let v content selues wyth knowledge god sheweth teacheth v let v haue mildnesse say well lorde whensoeuer thou tellest v thou wilt haue v knowe let v receyue quietly thou goest let mind stay also two thing therefore haue marke owne behoofe doctrine first thrust foorth selues fond presumption know permitted v pray god gouerne v behalfe inlighten v holy spirit secondly hold selues word suffer selues taught coueting know nothing whiche conteyned according also oure lorde sheweth v whatsoeuer meete necessary welfare nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement sinnes praying hym make v feele better wee haue done beholding iudgements may always prouoked walke feare wee haue profited sounde vnderstanding may please hym make v go forwarde wee maye hereafter wrapped vtter destruction whyche prepared wicked hardened stubborne correcting vice wee may preuent iudgement obteyne grace mercy hath afflicted v world may giue v rest hee hath promised whyche witte deliuered misery whyche wee haue indure worlde wee may bee gathered vp heauenly glory made partaker hys goodes reformed hys image true perfection may please hym graunt grace v also people nation earth c cij sermon second vpon xxviij chapter cutteth riuers rockes eye seeth euery precious thing bindeth riuers ouerflovv bringeth light thing hidden vvhere vvisedome found vvhere place vnderstanding man knovveth value neither found land liuing depth sayeth sea sayth vvith fine gold shall giuen neyther shall siluer bee vveyed exchaunge shall bee valued vvith vvedge golde vvith precious onix vvith saphyre gold christall shall match neyther shall exchaunged plate fine gold shall mention bee made corall gabish vvisdome vvorth pearles topas aethyop shall made equall vvith hir neyther shall bee pryzed vvith vvedge cleane gold vvhence commeth vvisedome vvhere place vnderstanding hid eye liue yea hid foules ayre destruction death say vve haue heard renoume hir vvith ear god knovveth vvay vvisedome tell vvhere hir place beholdeth endes vvorlde seeth vnder heauen hath vveyed vvindes measured vvaters vvhich hath set lavv vpon rayne appoynted vvay roring tempestes see knovve dispozed ordeyned hath sayd vnto man feare lord vvisdome eschue euil vnderstanding ihaue declared alreadye iobs intent meeneth worde vvisdome intent shew men farre ouerseene comprehende god secret ignorant nothing wee may knowe word vvisedome meeneth hee taketh knowledge thing specially god concealeth v till hee giue v full discouerie thing dealeth v measure according knoweth profite haue sayd iob sheweth heere many secrete darke thing nature yet men attaine yea wee see reason farre foorth oure lord granteth v poynt must always come backe furthermore let v marke well measure therewithal let v vnderstand oure reason vnderstanding extend thing heere bylowe whiche concerne present life would mount vp kingdome heauen seeke thing perteyne euerlasting life wee fayle vtterly blind ye see demanded heere wisedome shall found bee found sayth among men aliue dead true many may take vpon bee wise also bragge carie wisedome selues yet god holdeth couert euen departed althoughe bee wrapped mortall fleshe sotted worlde doo notwithstanding comprehend thing secrete purpose god may well go heere seeke aboue beneath wee shall neuer come wisedome diligence man god holdeth owne hand againe man intend purchase rich beguileth himselfe men may beare theselues hand well become rich owne trauell become wise power yee see wisedome excellente treasure man cannot find equall thing exchange let man heape vp gold siluer let gather togither al precious stone shal match see effect iobs meening heere humble v end wee thinke selues able comprehend god secretes rather shoulde willingly bee ignorant thing passe capacitie furthermore wee intende knowe meete v lette v desire god shewe v hys holy spirite poynt must come way also let v come conclusion set downe heere god hath wisedome himselfe hee hathe well shewed creation worlde hee ordeyned counterpeysing windes water therefore lyke onely god hath wisedome hymselfe welspring thereof also hath ordeyned men wise fearing seruing hym vve see iobs conclusion wisedome men bee inquisitiue knowe thinges throughe fonde curiositie keepe themselues within bound knowe behoueth serue god submit themselues vntoo true wisedome muste men holde themselues brideled stay thus much concerning letter sentence nowe lette v consider howe wee may profite selues firste let v marke well hee sayeth wisedome bee founde among liuing alwayes admonishe men may trust theyr owne reason attribute sharpe suttle witte themselues comprehende reason god woorkes admonishment needefull considering pride v wee bee prowde presumptuous naturall thynges muche doo wee ouershoote selues thyngs euery one v taketh himselfe bee wittie nothing maye escape contend shall beare bell amongst v shall wiser fellowes fight god whiche horrible thing yet wee bee mad proofe whereof men trusted much owne wit haue much ado bring world order great small mount vp intoo suche presumption yeeld themselues plyable vntoo god suffer themselues gouerned specially god intendeth teach v vnskilfullest yea say veriest idiot v carp bicause euery man taketh himselfe wise saying tushe know gouerne selfe trow take beast behold god doth v honour shew v hys wyll yet notwithstanding wee cannot abide hee teach v seeing men cannot abide god bee master teacher must needes worse mad whereof commeth thys said ouerwening would v seeme wise therefore sayde admonishment worthy borne well mind bee practized euery man considering wee haue vice rooted v nature would fayne haue god let v alone owne fancie medle teachyng v bycause thinke selues sufficient abilitie selues therfore let v mark well whereas sayd heere wisedome found among men iob rather holy ghost iobs mouth meeneth heere effect beate downe loftinesse v wee imagine selues haue good sharp vnderstanding co prehend thing heere holy ghost auoucheth men beguile themselues vaunting sorte want wisedome wisedome wisedome know god secret hath bin saide wee may well haue vnderstanding thing heere beneath although darke yet god discouereth v knowledge called naturall bycause see men partaker thereof althoughe egall measure cace concerneth knowing god iudgements man reason must needes dazeled muche men thinke aduaunce themselues muche must beaten downe confounded marke one poynt iob sayth expresly wisedome purchased gold siluer precious stone bereue men vaine presumption man rich thinketh himselfe huge meruaylous man vtterly forgetteth himselfe bycause esteemed men iob sheweth whatsoeuer excellencie v therefore wiser neyther must ground selues therevppon needeth wee see wretched world beguiled rich men men great estate authoritie whe speake thing saying vvee may reply beholde one sayd men forepossessed suche estimation discerne bee rich man hath spoken although bee beast yet men dazeled authoritie amazed adayes hindreth many simple folke come vnto god truth frame themselues thereafter bycause looke vpo great one world saying behold gouerne behold rich men behold noble men none receyue doctrine therefore token nothing worth doubtfull v meddle withall vve see riche men put ballance men thinke wisedome tyed god wote cleane contrary yee shall often see riche men blinded vaine presumption rich bryng nothing follie rocke men asleepe make men vtterly brutish much sayde greate estate dignitie man meane smal degree wil know himselfe gather wittes lord gyueth discretion contrariwise highly aduanced forgetteth himselfe blinded lyke hee spreadeth vvings imagining himselfe bee lord suffereth reason vanish away become idoll vvee see thys eye wee consider wherefore lette v weigh well sayd heere witte wisedome purchased gold siluer least men trust much thing whiche may attayne heere beneath let v assure selues vnderstand god secretes speciall gift treasure shette vp v till god owne meere goodnesse come inlighten v giue v therof seemeth good heerewithall let v marke well conclusion iob sayeth heere god hath seene disposed wisedome creation world afterward hath sayde man beholde shall become wise say fearing heere iob compareth god v bicause vnpossible abate tame pride otherwise force meane bringing v god men may well ynoughe shew v infirmitie rudenesse oure wit yet euer draw backe neuer come poynte ceasse keepe still pride secrete althoughe conuinced wit weake pitie see yet notwithstanding giue ouer thys foolish opinion haue wise brought vnto god wee driuen knowe nothing wee must deceiue selues owne selfeweening see iob setteth god v heere end wee know wysedome alone hee setteth creation world eye vvell sayeth men sharpe witted comprehend god secret disposeth order nature hath weyed windes water thing true haue sayd philosopher haue well conceyued reason thing seene world men come creation woonderfull thing must needes abashed reuerence infinite wisedome god confesse themselues vnable comprehend thus ye see iobs meening sentence thervpon sheweth v must throughly beleeue oure wisedome consisteth searching examining seeking thing knowing profitable v according god ordinance behold heere excellent sentence one sayd god secretes knowne none himselfe body counsell sayd text scripture therefore must presume enter secret determination know lawfull v must learne onely pleaseth shewe v hys schoole assure selues wisedome cause sayde excellent sentence two vice hard correct one ouerboldnesse foolish vanitie touching ouerboldnesse men desirous knowe god hath appoynted short would wise whether god would whereas god onely fountaine wisedome thus yee see outrageous vice yet notwithstanding hard correct see men proceede furious outrage say know whatsoeuer come yea god permitteth setteth barre waye gate shut thee way wilt thou enter go yet mebe inquisitiue lawfull whatsoeuer come furthermore thinke attayne therevntoo owne power yea bragge alwayes owne reason wit standeth v hand fight boldnesse pride nature learne able nothing becommeth v know lorde haue v marke one poynt second vice sayd fond vanitie whiche men doo leaue thing profite whervpon ought rest whervnto ought apply whole study making none account meane fall tormenting themselues vayne thing nothing profite traueling discoursing would know say wouldest thou know liketh beholde wee bee led wyth fond desire know thing nother oure profite edifie v eyther fayth feare god cause lorde concealeth many thing v first intendeth humble v knoweth pride would intollerable wee knewe thing seeing notwithstanding ignorance yet men see hold v would seeme otherwise lo god abaceth v desire bee wisest become fonde euen little child may mocke v althoughe lord hold v awe yet cease wee bragge still beare selues hand yea perswade men also wisedome v doth god keepe v ignorant thing whiche hidden v bycause enuieth v hee meeneth learne v humblenesse thereby principall poynt wisedome modest sober yea feele owne infirmitie wee exalte selues yee see god hideth many thing v ende wee shoulde learne bee lowly whych thyng wee would nothyng vnknowen v agayne discerneth good v thing wherein intendeth occupie v hold v wholy wee finde scripture lord mynded feede curiositie let v know would desire eares alwayes itching tickling desire would fayne knowe fond thing doo good god redresse vanitie foolish longing v sheweth v onely thing oure behoofe let v remember well thys sentence sayde god disposeth wisdome yea keepeth himselfe yet notwithstandyng hath sayd vnto men feare shall wise heereby iob meeneth firste men beguyle themselues desirous breake neckes flie hie asmuch would flye without wing let learne content themselues whyche shall please god open vnto marke one poynt second poynt let v acquaint ourselues well whiche god sheweth v wherein hee haue euery one v exercise himselfe wee must knowe suche thinges may edifie v feare haue v wise bee heauengazers flitter ayre know wee ought liue matche oure wisedome knowledge rule life becommeth v see first must let god al one secret iudgemets presume know thing aboue v content selues discerne thinges god sheweth v knowing many thing reserued latter day time shall see thing fully perfectly must suffise v knowe thing part whiche lord vouchsafeth distribute vnto v thys shewed v heere say must couet know aught god secret iudgements meening wee must desire passe beyond whiche oure lorde teacheth v word wee knowe god guide v wee neede afrayde shall erre wee fall gazing owne fancie thinges god hath hidden v wee enter bottomlesse depth reason ouerwhelmed lo howe god punisheth pride many men cannot bee cotented knowledge thing meete iob correct two vice spake sheweth v god hath spoken thys vnto men saying god hath spoken vnto men great weyght one say god intended cut men occasion searching secret determination forth sheweth therewithal declareth doctrine wil haue men learne schoole profitable edifie holy lyfe might learne submit themselues vnto created formed walke hys obedience thus ye see wisedome god hath ordeyned v shorte iob setting feare god v whole wisedome meeneth lord plucketh v backe whiche haue moste mind vnto vaine speculation serue v purpose puffe v vp foolishe vaineglory haue said windie knowledge make v presume ouer far yet hath profit instruction iob hath set two thing one another one one side saying men wise must make themselues wise manner god beholde god hath perfection wisedome neerer wee preace vnto shall confounded v make selues like vnto god wisedome rather submit selues vnto lo wisedome vvee see happened oure father adam mother eue god niggardly indue wisdome knew good ye see adam formed image god haue vnderstanding thinges pertayned wise hee could wishe thing modest well ruled desire satan blowed eare like vnto god knowing al thing therevpon ouershot playd horse broken loose thinking wyth himselfe shall ignorant nothing vve see howe caught poynt whereof commeth beastlinesse wee haue thys day man speake v god needes must spight teeth know wretched beast delight suppose selues haue darkenesse scripture also sayth vvhereof commeth sense comprehendeth nothyng god misteries god call v one side wee shrinke backe side else lazie cannot fynde hart come hym wherof commeth payment adam pride contented bee farre foorth inlightned knowledge thing god spirite expedient welfare would needes become like vnto god lifted vp coulde meete god mightie hande cast downe horrible gulfe confusion wherin day ye see iob sayeth expresly god sayd vnto men hee say go aduise selues well way take become wyse bee desirous mount aboue clowdes search many thing ought vnknowne vnto v say dyd god delay creating worlde long hath moued wherfore disposeth thing sort suffereth thing passe manner wisedome consisteth thinges shall thinke selues wise maner shall go astray ye shall neuer bee able gette maze shall shrinke aside wise shall shamed euer vvhere finde wisedome belongeth sayeth god discerne determine good learne contented tel teach charge see behoofe feare honour therefore hold passe boundes wee see meening iob rather holy ghost let v learne gyue heede oure foolishe tickling lust know thing stand v steade enter god secrete determination purpose searche reason iudgementes thing wherein must occupie selues wherevpon must set mindes vvherevppon vpon suche thing may serue true edifying paule meeneth saying holy scripture profitable god hath sayde vnto men wisdome feare hym sayde also shewed deede hee published hys lawe expounded first prophet lastly gospell yee see god sheweth v wisedome feare make doctrine profitable let v note firste goodnesse god maketh v partaker wisdome knoweth bee good expediente v notwithstanding wee bee bereft shet nature hath bin sayd already wisedome found nother amongst liuing amogst dead man may go deepe tarrie euer confounded without finding wisedome god dead may say wee haue heard speaking know nother haue familiaritie behold lord doth v honour grace offer v thys wisedome secret inestimable treasure vve haue accesse selues god offereth v sort neede make long circuites finding let v suffer selues taught god treasure shall put handes singular benefite god hee vouchsaueth communicate thing vnto v vnacquaynted vtterly depriued banished heere ye see vpbraydeth men vnthankfulnesse eyght chapter prouerbs hee sayeth wisedome crieth streetes open place come yee ready shewe selfe knocketh gate declareth hir desire dwell among men yet man receyueth hir men mocke hir make none account great benefite offered ye see blame god vpbraydeth v withall wee may well knowe wisedome suche precious thing nother gold siluer may comparable therfore must needes say bee worse straught diuell hath betwitched v make none accounte sayd wisdome seeing offereth hir selfe vnto v needes greate seeking ransacking hir needes great paynes taking farregoing neede receyue hir set afore v yet see man make account hir vvhy weight pinne say occupy head ther one v al wedded owne selfe profite set gayne pennie shilling wee wisedome god agayne one thing letteth v according euery man giuen one vice hee easly turned aside drawne away god whorehunter bee weltred filthinesse eares shall stopped yea vtterly deafe speaking god may crie alowde vnto heare aught couetous persone doth like drunkard much short see let many turne aside suffering themselues taught god yet al vice god findeth fault withall text salomon ouercommon ordinarie wit sendeth treasure wisedome whiche ought common men knocking gate bidding feast euery man doth rather shrinke away tha draw neerer furthermore god place accuseth condemneth men beastly carelesnesse vnthankfulnesse sheweth faithfull greatly ought esteeme bee taught according sayde fourth deuteronomie behold thy wisedome vnderstanding haue thy god come vnto thee shew thee good thine instruction edifie thee lo wherevnto lord calleth v hee intendeth bring v himselfe shewing v true wisedome vnderstanding hearken vnto namely conceyuing sheweth v worde hee say ye wretched soules deceyue selues setting mind vppon vaine thing worldling vnbeleeuers hold ye tell assuring selues true wisedome vnderstanding fooles yea mad men ye attempt step boundes therewithall vpbraydeth new agayne vpbrayding sheweth wee vtterly without excuse walke aright seeing haue woorde say sayeth thirtith deuteronomie shall climbe vp intoo heauen shall go downe deepe shall passe ouer sea beholde woorde thy heart thy mouth lord declareth cannot alledge ouerhard v conceyue thing aboue v wee alledge dulnesse vnderstanding highnesse secretes heauen sayeth god haue prouided haue made way aforehande giuing lawe shewing wyll haue raught wisedome would fayne dwell among according also sayde eight prouerbes delight dwell among men ye shall neede therefore make long iourneyes come vnto ye neede stie aboue clowdes ye neede go downe deepes nother neede yee go ouer sea woord giuen mouthes put harte behold wisedome thing must rest vppon nowe first seeing case standeth men despize grace god offered communicating hys worde vnto make warre asmuch lieth therefore let v take good heede selues see heere saying ought wey greatly v sayd wisedome delighteth dwell among v god place bringeth hys owne wisedome sendeth v hys owne persone seeing delighteth god wee receyue wisedome let v assure selues refusing make warre haue sayde one would spite set purpose driue quite cleane away v ouerheynous thing furthermore whereas desire owne welfare god ready shewe v way calleth v end finde fulnesse welfare vouchsaue come runne backes vpon teacheth v end know transformed wee know image glory preferred thing therefore cannot abide taught asmuch would turne light darknesse deface god glory might seene knowne must men needes bee become terrible monster diuelles incarnate labour abolish god glory quench light euen light theyr whole welfare soule health ioy yet vice ouerco mon let v learne esteeme benefite god doth v vouchsaueth call v hys schoole openeth v dore end wee shoulde learne wheras nature bereft said wisdome commeth set oure eye offereth v familiarly yea tarieth till seeke knocketh dores calleth vpon v desiring nothing winne v seeing lord vseth gentlenesse towards v allure v curteously let v learne make account honour let v vnkind whe would haue v come vnto specially let v remember hath bene sayd namely owne nature requisite god teach v angelles heauen touching angells heauen although noble excellent nature although bee parttakers already heauenly glory although hold stil soundnesse creation yet notwythstanding exceedingly bound vnto god pleaseth make priuie needes must rapt astonishment grace hee hath giue cace standeth v first respect body bee earthly creature althoughe god hathe giuen v immortall soules yet dwell heere house mire clay hath bin declared heeretofore nothing corruption v wee heere brute beastes woormes thing base heauie ther seemeth infinite distance betweene v heauen yet worse thing berefte vnderstanding giuen father adam therefore forlorne creature vvhereas ass ox keepe still owne nature men corrupted marred god calleth steade loue goodnesse lesse moued brute beastes beholde god desireth earnestly wee partaker glory yea good thing enter aforehand possession woorde preached vnto v wee profite selues thing pray matter therfore seeing time suffer speake nowe let v aduise selues firste ignorant god haue v onely knoweth meete conuenient v therefore let suffize v bee taught schoole learne thing sheweth v secondly let v learne know suche wise conteyned holy scripture therewithall let v thanklesse reiect benefit hee mindeth bestow vpon v offereth vnto v let v attetiue indeuour put away euill affection suffer selues taught god may edified thing sheweth v profite desirous bee stablished tyme life nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement sinnes praying hym make v feele better may returne vntoo true repentance acknowledge misery wherewith wee bee fraught hee may voutsafe clense v bring v fully backe vnto reforme frowarde nature seeing wee helde darknesse ignorance nothing blindnesse v may please hym inlighten v hys holy spirite wee may despise worldly vanity keepe way heauely life whervnto calleth v furthermore wee may haue modestie keepe v word couet know thinketh good edifying whyle wee heere hys schoole may profite vntill hauing taken v fro earthly pilgrimage gather v kingdome gyue v full perfect fruition thing whiche wee knowe portion measure according capacitie doth beare may please grant grace v also people nation c ciij sermon third vpon xxviij chapter sermon yet still vpon former text haue told already iobs intent shewe menne ought hold themselues sobrietie couet know god permitteth also muste runne gadding astray folow way poynted cause iob setteth difference betweene god v sheweth reason mortall man shoulde presume seeke thing god contented ignorant nothyng let v contented subiect vnto whome cannot atteyne furtherfoorth pleaseth lifte v vp himselfe specially gracious vntoo v abace himselfe end shoulde know hym impossible infirmitie mount vp highnesse god therefore must fayne come downe vnto v let v thinke oure wisedome know al thing let v vnderstand behoueth v farre lower degree vnder highnesse god worship whiche hidden v witte wonderfull secret god ye see effect wee haue marke vppon texte sayd god creating worlde hath well shewed another wisedome attayne vnto oure power measure wind water dispose whole order world nature seeing thing surmount capacitie let v learne humble selues contented vnderstanding giuen v according whiche hath bin declared already let v wey well saying god hath sayd man serueth shew lawfull v know giuen v aboue furthermore let v mark well grace god graunteth v aboue creature iob sayeth expresly god turned himselfe vnto men giue wisedome measure therein sheweth like brute beastes liue without discretion god hath gyuen v excellent priuiledge haue vnderstading light reason know liue wee might haue modestie honestie v therefore let v learne esteeme grace god honour hath pleased v separating v sort brute beastes well worthy noted bycause wee see two extreme vice men reason whereof neuer keepe good measure would fayne wise full vnderstanding giue themselues many vayne curiosity gaze trudge vp downe vnsaciable desirous knowe neuer rest bycause labour alwayes vaine vnprofitable thing behold heere euill extremitie men cannot knowe owne abilitie flitter ayre plundge themselues intoo deepe dungeon neuer get againe cotrary part mind trouble themselues vayne sort become brutish see experience specially papacie pray haue wee fayre mirrour thys doltishnesse hold themselues within modestie know nothing shette themselues ought common men short feare ouershoote themselues curiositie become calues brute beastes without vnderstanding see vnderstande woord latine intent play beast speake thus latine mitte arcanum dei meening whereof must inquire god secretes see men retch bound continually cannot keepe good meane therfore let v remember conteyned streyne god sayeth expresly vnto men wisedome iob magnifieth thys knowledge god hath giue v separating v creature according said first chapter iohn onely haue life eate drinke exercise body also haue lyght vnderstanding asmuch benefite deserueth bee magnified let v take good heede depriued bereft oure owne vnthankfulnesse vvhe god openeth eye shut wee worthy blamed peruerters order nature god gyueth v discretion knowe good euil setteth v behold workes ende shoulde approch vnto parttakers image respect wee reasonable creature defile know thing manifest fighting agaynst god vtter renouncing benefite woulde bestowe vpon v yea benefite principal highliest esteemed al others ye see effect two thing ought beare mind one god hath set men world bereue al vnderstanding hee haue like ass horse hath indued reason would haue vse vnderstanding therefore sayd wisedome hee spake purposely vnto vvhy spake also vnto creature bycause listed like honour hee hath done v aduaunce high degree therfore sayd passe profit wisedome liue well shewe go withdraw themselues wholly creator marke one poynt second also haue beare mind lord hath set v bouds may passe wise politike muste stray rouers giue themselues fonde speculation dotage hold first lesson coueting thing whiche god sheweth lo wisedome let alwayes entraunce intend shew selues wise let v harke voyce namely lord holdeth v within listes haue v run receiue thinketh good teach v let v come fearing god oure wisedome feare god seemeth iob restraineth ma wisedome muche incloseth wholly within feare god know lord teacheth v thing also word yet whole wisdome harken vnto god speaketh beare minde whatsoeuer hee sayeth make ourselues wilfully deafe haue eye eares open whe sheweth v speaketh v according sayde deuteronomie behold thy wisdome vnderstanding profit schole thy god seing vouchsafeth thy schoolemayster rather bin meete haue sayde wisdome inquisitiue whatsoeuer liketh themselues come god worde wherevnto haue hold theselues submit theselues al wholly without passing boundes steade hereof iob sayeth oure wisedome feare god wee muste briefly marke besides modestye whereof mention hathe beene made sheweth v heere wisdome thing whiche edifieth v walke feare god obey meening withdraw v fayth dependeth thervpon wit knowing infinite goodnesse god rest thervpon doubt merciful vnto v bicause pardoneth sinnes lord iesus christ sake also hath adopted v wil loue v child procure saluatio vnto end iob say excludeth fayth place speaketh feare god hee sheweth briefly true wisdome speculatiue see many men trouble disquiet themselues much know wote certaintie man aske saying haue coprehended thing whiche hidden purpose shall profite certayne shall profit nother shall bee whit better ynough feede themselues winde foolishe fancie puffed vp paule speaketh saying knowledge puffeth men vp see men fondnesse cotrariwife iob saieth wise maner lord hath ordeyned shal well edified walke feare god ye see also sayd first chapter prouerbs feare god entrance beginning wisdome true take beginning apcee vvhy feare god beginning wisdome bicause thing muste begin like men firste dash set yong childe hie profounde science muste firste teach entraces principle take salomon word sense ground theselues vpon whiche sayde canonicall epistle iohn sayd true perfect loue doth driue away feare place iohn speaketh feare infidelles haue shunne god trembling maiestie bicause know cace whosoeuer haue caughte holde god goodnesse come vnto truste whiche nuber know god intendeth one v lord iesus christ therwithal forasmuch hath adopted v must doubt alwayes shew himselfe louing toward v receyue v mercy say haue tasted afrayde astonied men speake god like wretched offender could finde hearte iustice abolished yee see state vnbeleeuers half besides themselues esche god asmuch possible perswaded god mercy bee drawne gracious goodnesse ioyne wee come vnto oure head vpright time omit reuerence humilitie bycause fullye resolued god lyketh well v wee longer doubt vnquietnesse wherewith wretched vnbeleeuers tormented iohn speaketh sayde feare sayde salomon feare god chiefe beginning wisedome shew chiefe poynt short meening thing taught v iob men wise must learne walke feare god bee edified rule life accordingly giue themselues speculation holde mamering without certaintie surely heere see also salomon another text sayeth self feare god fountaine life woulde call fountayne life whiche draweth men destruction addeth except behoued v hold v wholly perfect felici wee see nowe meening texte namely suche edified feare obey god men right vnderstanding thing wherevpon muste set mindes vpon wandring speculatios easier vnderstad adde one goodly text prophet esay chapter speaketh true reformatio church scattering destruction thereof therefore sayeth thing seene bee turned vpside downe shoulde come state againe time ezechias verely inasmuch figure lord iesus christ doubt prophet esay treateth perfection comming iesus christe hee sayeth stedfastnesse strength saluation shall wisedome vnderstanding tyme ezechias feare god shall treasure see prophet declareth god knowen thing muste go hauocke vtter desolation like also said another text wher prophet coplaineth al turned vpside downe bicause knowledge god lande men giuen ouer euill woonder men abuse theselues wilfully sort god giue ouer lewde minde ashamed caste themselues outrageous haynous thing euen lothsome worlde yee see prophete esay sayeth people caried destruction bicause knowledge contrary part text haue alleadged sheweth churche set hir perfect state againe thing brought good order shall wisedome vnderstanding bee stablishment welfare strength shoulde say churche cannot otherwise stande good case men taught purely knowe theyr profite heere bee seene popishe churche haue pompe ynough see also dare face god diuelish pryde straine curtesie attributing braue title themselues haue holy gouernement heauen amongste assurednesse god truth doctrine carrie holy ghoste sleeue holde god locked vp betweene walles yet manner knowledge haue cleane contrariwise see seeke nothing make wretched worlde brutish wee may well conclude buylding god churche ouerthrowen put horrible confusion want wisedome whiche prophete esay auouched bee welfare strength stablishment churche thus muche concerning firste poynt fit sayde texte conteyned heere followeth feare god treasure ezechias people esay therfore doth well shewe whiche iob meeneth heere witte suche knowe thing god teacheth worde wedded small fonde suttleties bee well grounded knowledge rule life walk feare god vnder woorde treasure hee sheweth thing wherevppon men muste wholly settle themselues vppon full perfecte felicitie wherein muste take full contentation reste nowe wee see thing spoken true witte men shall wise skilfull shall haue profited farre walke obedience god holinesse lyfe furthermore lette v come backe hath bene touched already witte therewithall wee muste applie oure whole studie sette whole minde vppon thing conteyued holie scripture bycause nothing profite surely vnpossible feare god giue selues seruice vnlesse wee acquaynted goodnesse according sayde hundred thirtith psalme lorde thou art good mercie thee ende men shoulde feare thee vvee see men bee grounded feare god vntill haue knowen god mercie taken holde ende come free hearte seeke long wee shunne god fierce agaynste consequently rebelles men shall neuer conceyue ryghte taste goodnesse except bee taught scripture also place true feare wee muste thinke vnder woorde feare scripture meeneth bondage men shoulde yeelde vntoo god though enforced therevnto feare heere importeth wee muste bee fully minded suffer ourselues gouerned god hande aboue thing knowe goodnesse mercie yeelde reuerence wee may truely ioyned vnto vndoubtedly hee speaketh honor belogeth vnto alledgeth maiestie sayth master lord therewithall also sayeth father cryeth prophet malachie bee mayster feare bee father loue true place hee putteth difference betweene loue feare afterwarde hee sheweth two woordes come bothe one ende wit forasmuche wee ought acknowledge father mayster ought loue howbeeit suche reuerence oure life desire nothing ne seeke nothing obey wee see nowe iob farre heere intending reiect fayth hee rather leadeth v vnto also poynte whereat muste beginne walke feare god cause sainct paule hee speaketh wisedome prayeth god open eye ephesian ende may know howe hope saluation god hath prepared heauen resurrection lord iesus christ afterward third chapter sayeth behooueth v knowe kindnesse lorde iesus christ loue hath shewed assure v saluation insomuche hee oure length breadth heyghth depth shoulde say wee might well streyne selues side wee woulde mount vp neuer high could able go beyond coprehending loue whiche hath bin shewed person lorde iesus christ also may well seeke depth yet must hold certaintie haue gone fro euer behooueth v knowe conceyue howe god sheweth father sauiour according hath adopted v person sonne minding make v partaker goodnesse mercie wherin welfare consisteth see feare god behoueth v sure goodnesse iob hath set downe one particular whole purposely co demne fond toyes wherevnto men gyue themselues haue affection zeale edified feare god furthermore wee haue gather vpon text worde whiche giuen v also conteyned holy scripture excellent treasure canot set store ynough vve know wisdome shall esteemed yea euen ignorant veriest idiotes lorde hath giuen v insight nature wee knowe true wisedome bee amiable thing lorde decketh woorde honorable title telleth v wee profit therein thing wherein whole wisedome consisteth ought inflame v greatly seeke thing conteyned holy scripture short may profite schoole god must needes haue el wee shewe selues reiect thing desired owne nature yea would fayne bereft vvherefore let v learne inflamed suche zeale profite holy scripture wee may preferre doctrine conteyned oure owne fansies vanity worlde carie v away furthermore ynough v haue suche desire profite holy scripture muste learne also honour accordingly vve shal see many fantasticall person day despise god worde bicause seemeth
