nothing simple stuffe common people woulde dulling wittes shoulde set mindes vpon holy scripture lorde payeth worthie trie shall find double blind lorde bereueth common reason become veriest fooles doltes idiotes world see pray wage pride make account god woorde true first blush shall see great simplicitie lorde vseth high stile rather tempereth himselfe bothe greate small yet doeth imbace maiestie holye scripture vvhy shoulde god goodnesse deface glorie ought barre v humbling ourselues vnto yelding due honour cleane contrary cause lorde speaketh grosly holy scripture infinite goodnesse seeing wittes dull stamereth v seeing cace standeth let v learne yeeld reuerence holy scripture notwithstanding lord vse ordinary maner speach yea euen grosse speach serueth homely folk vnlearned yet paule telleth v must much better beholde heauenly power godly maiestie holy scripture seeing paynting filed language manner worldling studie rethorike colour theyr woordes fonde brauery holye scripture finde grosse language behold maiestie god sheweth selfe therewithall fleshly earthly thing set glosse vpon wee conuinced god discouereth owne arme yea constrayned feele speake therefore little ought simplicitie holy scripture cause v despise see proude stinking sorte doo whiche make account ought rather make v perceyue god needeth borow helpes elsewhere power sheweth selfe eyesight ende wee moued honour submitte selues wholly vnto therfore let v marke well ynough v haue good desire profite holy scripture also must come reuerence desire nothing embrace al conteyned hauing oure tongue filed prattle god bringing doctrine disputation pure doctrine scripture cocluding generally saying looke whatsoeuer sayde v whatsoeuer reade wee knowe truth god lorde seeing thou haste spoken ynough v v reply meete v stad thou hast vttered without gaynsaying ye see thing haue note worde vvisdome men drawen away theyr owne vayne imagination whe buyld newe wisdomes ayre must say lorde hath without cause intitled worde name wisdome qualifying sort shew v must come thither submit ourselues vnto rest wholly thing wherin lyeth whole perfectio touching sayde feare god like golde siluer tryed fornace tutchstone muste tryed may knowne whither haue profited holy scripture say whither wee bee edified feare god vve go sermon haue commoditie doo reade holye scripture also well good holy exercise would god wee yet much giuen vnto without comparison yet therewithall behoueth v know whither wee haue bestowed time well howe shall knowe wee skill talke giue fayre answeres mennes demaundes bee able resolue doubtes shall alledged giue fitte exposition texte say thus must vnderstoode true thing necessary howe shall bee knowne whither wee haue profited eyther sermon reading god woorde wee shall know namely life yeelde recordes wee feare god token wee haue studied well schole like side hath bene good faythfull schoolemaister wee oure side haue loste tyme thus muche haue wee marke furthermore wee see holye scripture intendeth giue good sure marke discerne faythfull despizers god sayeth let feare lord prayse feare lorde enter house let feare god glad reioyce let men feare god rest boldly vpon ye feare god blesse lord say true marke whereby discerne god flocke wilde beastes raunge abroade wee come sermon haue bible handes let v learne knowe god meeneth puffe v vp vayne presumptio knowledge scratch eares itch yet teach v nice poynts edifie v feare wee may honoure serue shoote marke shall roue holy scripture wee wont whereof cometh vice men cannot finde harte stoope take holde profite euery man forgeth wote himselfe whereof also procede many errours heresy false opinion far square bicause know wherevnto god would guide v word also cause cast feare god behind backes bearing ourselues hand holy scripture giuen v far vse seing men abuse godsword euery man vnhalloweth vngraciously much behooueth v marke well texte holy ghost giueth v maner examination whereby trie bee good right vnderstanding bring passe haue sayd already muste know god hee wee shall neuer feare aright vntill like sheweth himselfe v knowe bee god mayster sauiour father see also salomon text alledged first chapter prouerbes sayeth knowledge holy thing true vnderstanding spoken feare god setteth knowledge holie thing seeing holy ghost hath knit two thing togither vnseparable bonde behooueth v also knit togither hereby meeneth feare god neuer v till come poynt spake whiche know god mercy offered v lord iesus christe namely wee bee drawne vnto goodnesse allureth v haue boldenesse call vppon father wee returne vntoo euen wee bee vtterlye dismayed cause sayeth ieremie let wise man trust wisdome strong man strength let suche reioyce reioyce know mee mee sayeth lorde executeth iudgement rightuousnesse mercy ieremie prophet hath abated men pryde shewed wisedome thinke theselues haue despise god shrinke away smoke leasing bringeth poynte let wise man saieth boast thing knoweth god howe shall knowe knowing rule hath giuen v whiche hath appoynted men follow knowing protectour assuring ourselues office gouerne worlde holdeth thing hand therfore let v pray receyue v protection aboue thing guyde gouerne v holy spirite forasmuch ourselues alwayes confounded assuring ourselues also forasmuch thereis nothing w wretchednesse v must fayne watch welfare bring v perfection wherevnto willeth v tend trauell time life thus ye see wherevnto behoueth v apply indeuer wee may profite ourselues doctrine meenes whereby god draweth v vnto feare loue true many lightheadded person speake ynough grace lord iesus christ rigtuousnesse giuen v babble well fayth yet neuer tasted haue grace god except rauished come vnto haue sayde feare spoken good sooth seing god hath bought v derely meete euery man giuen himselfe owne iustes reason seeing hee hath purchased v euerye one v shoulde dedicate himselfe vnto become true possession heritage seeing hath gathered v housholde ought obedient vnto ye see thing wee haue marke heere lorde calleth v hee calleth v beeing assembled heare worde calleth v giuing v holy scripture commaunding v exercise wee muste come vnto wise acknowledge bee father mayster learne submit selues obedience seruice vnhallowe holy scripture seeking tryfling thing keepe forwarde continually sayde marke knowing god sheweth himselfe v vttereth himselfe word measure haue v passe turne aside whatsoeuer come heerewithall lette v marke feare god ought also teache v shunne euill according set downe heere conclusion namely desire submitte themselues vnto god rule life according must fight agaynst euill thing wherevnto wee inclined nature knowe wee beset many temptation thing turne v oure god wee haue greate neede resiste temptation oure fleshe allurementes worlde strengthen ourselues wicked affection prouoke v stryue agaynste god thing whiche stirre v vp thereto may rather bee cutte hewen downe let v marke briefly canot go forwarde feare god renouncing selues haue wee else nature sea bottomlesse pitte muste caste geare learne exercise ourselues thing god sheweth v worde ende fall confusion whereof wee haue spoken maye walke obedience god profite schoole may allowe v schollers wee yeld trial seruice side may accept v child shew himselfe father towards v let v fal downe face good god acknowledgement sinnes praying forgiue v faultes past call v wise vnto may increased setled grace holy spirit may rid fro vice fleshe therewithall forbeare v imperfection vntil haue taken v present life make v partaker euerlasting glory let v say almightie god heauenly father acknowledge selues confesse truth worthy lifte vp eye vnto heauen come thy face wee ought presume far thou wilt heare prayer thou haue eye v conscience accuse v sinnes beare witnesse agaynst v knowe thou art rightuous iudge iustifieth sinner vnrightuous punisheth faultes haue transgressed thy commaundements euen lord co sidering whole life c ciiij sermon first vpon xxix chapter iob tooke vp parable againe sayde vvould god vvere vvas time past vvhen god preserued mee vvhen lampe shined vpon head vvalked darke light vvas dayes youthe vvhen prouidence companie god vvas tent vvhen almightie vvas vvith mee seruantes round mee vvhen vvashed pathes butter rocke povvred mee riuers oyle vvhen vvent gate citie made chayre set mee seemeth first sight iob bewayleth heere time past grieued god chaunged state afflicting sharply wheras made prosper meening setteth himselfe iudged amisse affliction bene man forsaken god intent therfore shewe men iudged vntowardly bycause looked thing seene shall see knitting vp iob sheweth deemed shoulde rather haue eye tyme prosperitie vvherefore let v marke iob repineth one grieued losse goodes god gyuen rather reproueth aduersaries shewing take wrong way iudge bicause thinke man vtterly daned reason change see state remember al time past bene greate reuerence excellent chozen man among others therefore reading text let v learne take example bee oute pacience thoughe god afflict v wee ought rather remember haue hearde iob say sithe wee haue receyued good god hande wee bee pacient indure aduersitie also whiche sendeth vnthankfull god remembring benefites assuage oure griefes pleaseth exercise v bring v lowe behooueth v thinke nowe hath lorde dealt wise v heeretofore good reason receiue whatsoeuer pleased yea ought cofirme v god goodnesse doubt loueth v seing haue found good vnto v experience haue wee cause bee contented god sheweth loue towards v although thing fall wold wish thus ye see howe sort behoueth v remember former prosperitie god afflicteth v muste encrease heauinesse pricke v forward grudging must rather bridle v stormed much passion ouerheady sayd remembrance say ought assuage miserie whiche wee feele god hath made v taste goodnesse whiche sufficient matter comfort v againe seing hath care v good reason yeeld ourselues wholly vnto suffer whatsoeuer shall please right necessarie warning v aduersitie pincheth v wee last cast ought call mind god hath pressed v alwayes hath regard feeblenesse borne thereby witnessed loue toward v ende trust doubte hee shall haue tried pacience sort remedie aduersities bring v back agayne former state behold say behoueth v practise doctrine affliction let v returne principal poynt iobs intent haue tolde heeretofore heere iob meeneth shewe aduersaries blind iudge foolishly bicause stay vpon thing seene eye bicause iob greate extremitie imagined god forsaken esteemed cursed man wee haue seene heeretofore muste go worke must haue wisedome spoken psalme namely brydling selfe wee haue compassion suche aduersitie furthermore wee muste beginne point see man smitten god hand muste consider life hath bene hee haue bene wicked disordered person lorde sheweth v thing telleth v often namely threatnings vayne behooueth v learne mannes coste say walke feare wyll seeme nowe god looketh downehere suffereth thing go hauocke executeth iudgementes ought teache v rightuousnesse sayde prophet esay must consider playing god although wincke thing time end call account thought selues escaped whome worlde supposed abide vnpunished yee see wee must settle iudgement simply vpon affliction consider life hath bin whome god punisheth ende may acknowledge chastizementes according desert better profiting ourselues thereby wee see good man punished suche wise god may seeme haue forgotten yea euen persecute ought say behooueth v suspend iudgementes ouer great rashnesse v iudge thing secret vnknowne therfore let v know lord intendeth humble v must confesse rightuous although reason doings altogither apparante ought iobs freendes haue iudged codemned wrogfully inasmuch seene mirror holinesse perfectio whole life saw smitte downe seemed god ment ouerwhelme vtterly ought haue come poynt haue sayd know say wittes dazeled behalf man hath liued holily doubtles neuer wicked man whoremoger drunkard periured person looce liuer cruell person proude ther none al thing doeth god handle rigorouslye wee cannot tell therefore god mindeth humble v ende know somtimes iudgementes bottomlesse pitte v wade rather wee ought glorifie yea euen shetting eye vntill shew v hee woorketh yee see wisedome wherof psalme maketh mention sayeth man happy iudgeth rightly whiche aduersitie heerewithall behoueth v also apply instruction oure lorde sayeth god doo make greene wood bee burned sort shall become drie let v compare ourselues haue knowne bee good men haue god wee shall finde grosse faultes ourselues shal constreyned say ala see well god beareth mee pitieth weakenesse handling gently worse suche man see compared come farre short walking suche vprightnesse yet notwithstanding see howe god afflicteth still myne ease reste bycause woorthy god knoweth mee bee weake coulde beare affliction reason whereof hee spareth mee therefore muste impute goodnesse bee striken downe bee fayne indure affliction must therfore ceasse call stil vpo god assuring selfe profit welfare heare threanings muste therevpon prepare selfe beare aduersity end whe shall please touch v rodds wee may thinke straunge bicause haue bene prepared good hande thus yee see nowe iobs meening sheweth iudge present state thing outwarde appearaunce shall conuinced experience bicause hee walked sort vnblamable euery man rather woonder condemne lyfe must bee concluded bycause god afflicted therfore reprobate ouer done hypocrisie vntowarde dealing way although iob speake come accuse falsely yet written instruction god child lo let v gather whiche haue sayde already text namely wee must iudge radon chastizementes rod wherwith god striketh men verely must holde generall rule affliction witnes god iustice vpo sinnes vtterly pure innocent vndoubtedly god would hadle v another fashion doth therfore wheras see men miserable tormented many fashion frutes sinnes aswel seuerally comon yet notwithstanding must measure men one meatyard say bee diuers cause haue declared afore god sendeth affliction vpon world seeing god hath diuers respect must wrap vp togither make al passe vnder one collect say wee muste bee wise behalfe bridle owne reason passe measure compasse vvherfore sayd let v thinke vpon euery ma life afflicted haue despised god word led lawles life giuing theselues ouer naughtinesse let v assure ourselues lord instructeth v person ende shoulde open eye see faultes shall escape cleere without coming account heauenly iudge see cause lord punish man rather clean cotrary let v learne say lorde thou art rightuous howsoeuer world goeth true dazeled behalfe sinfull flesh prouoketh inforceth v murmur againste thee neuerthelesse wee wil say demaund god shold minded coulde finde harte go lawe wil quiet pacient tarry thy leysure till thou shewe thing yet hidden v yee see effect haue remember text herewithall let v marke also come iudging ourselues wee muste call doctrine minde intent wee fall despaire althoughe god presse v wee feele hande ouerharde vppon v wee take courage call vppon leaue comforte selues thus yee see howe behooueth v practise styll doctrine contrariwise tyme prosperitie let v bee sotted oure owne ease pleasure wee see worlde whiche abuseth god goodnesse suche wyse become vtterly blinde excepte god constrayne force thinke vppon sinnes god lette v alone reste wee haue spirituall drunkennesse wittes bee rauished play restie iades lette v keepe v mounting sorte pryde presumption god maketh v prosper rather let v knowe haue sayde already hee gyueth v leysure dispose oure selues receyuing aduersities whiche shall sende v beeing well assured pitie v handle v rigorously likewise wee see god letteth wicked runne rouers layeth brydle theyr necke destroyeth first brunt let v thinke make better market nother let v tempted enuy good fortune sayd seuen thirtith psalme let v exercise faith cace tarrying god leysure till shewe v iudgementes hidden v time according v determine day houre muste faithfull holde themselues stay often lorde sheweth himselfe fauorable wicked haue deserued bee quite cleane rooted wyped world although leaue prosperitie therefore fauor make vnexcusable need must pay deare abusing god pacience wise calleth repentaunce handling gently lo effect haue marke doctrine let v come particular word iob vseth vvhy sayeth tyme past god kept mee saying god kept iob meeneth hee nowe forsaken settled opinion eye owne naturall vnderstanding faithful diuers time praying vnto god may well vse maner speache say lord thou hast forsaken mee lord long wilt thou forget mee lorde howe long wilt thou turne thy face mee lorde long ere thou ease miserie whe faythfull speake sort think god hath forsaken vayne purpose call vpon god forgotten v vvhat shoulde gayne resorting vnto god desiring helpe v neede god would keepe v pray lost labour say vnto lorde helpe v faithfull coplayning god hath forsaken meene v double feeling conceiuing one oure naturall witte faith thing naturall wit doth rest vpon looke thing feele see touche therefore god leaueth v extremitie knowe shall become v seemeth thicke cloude betwene v vnder guiding yet notwithstading see god promiseth neere hand v vvhe thinke furthest fro v shall seeme eye shut haue v thinke thus hath god spoken let v hardly hold v promis see double co ceiuing faithfull standeth v hand practise well ynough say euery man must put vre himselfe vvhe aduersitie befalleth v canot think god hath turned back vpon v see wherevnto nature driueth v afterwarde behoueth v run immediatly promise god biddeth v call vpon day trouble willeth v call vpon token keeping protectio see fayth must ouerrule naturall reason ende wee may quiet mids misery wayting god succour walking hee commandeth v according herevnto iob sayeth vvhere tymes become wherein god preserued mee meeneth god hath shewed effect eysight preserued shold say seeing iob persecuted sayd god keepeth sayd god mainteineth rather god hath forsake wretched creature iob speaketh heere thing deede thoughe god time forgotte speketh might seeme perceyueth naturall wit howbeit resisted force faith resting himselfe vpon god promise fighting tetation put vnto yee see wise behoueth v take text therewithall apply ourselues let v vnderstande prosperitie muste terme good fortune according maner alwaies malicious rob bereue god honour belogeth vnto must vse language namely god preserueth v vvhat cause god prospereth v cause liue still mainteyned whe beseeged thousand deathes bicause god pitieth v protectour lo behoueth v alwaies resort god prouidece may yeeld prayse al benefites bestoweth vpo v yea eue respect tra sitory life furthermore whe lord chaungeth outward apperance suffereth v assaulted side one pilleth v another defameth v many aduersities light vpo v might sayd ma seeming god hath forsake v come v yet notwithstanding let v cease receyue promis god giueth v yea hope euen hope lesson taught v person father abraha paule speaketh iob addeth time god lightned lampe vpo walked lyght middes darkenesse let v marke diuers time said god inlighteneth v teacheth v worde cause termed lampe text hath another sense iob meeneth simply god taughte lawe reuelation holy ghoste god giuen comfort aduersities therwithall also good desirable issue vvhat lampe god iobs prosperitie god stoode according also see scripture likneth afflictios present life vnto darknesse exaple warre troubled famine pestilence night god countenace hidden v know side turne v contrarie part lord hadleth v louingly asmuche sunne shine vpo v see daylight maketh men glad co trariwise light maketh men sadde heauy also clowdie raynie weather sort beaten downe euery one v shrinketh let v marke iob doth cotinue matter saying lampe god shined vpon hee happie state euery man laughed vpon vvherein cofirmed yet better doctrine haue touched namely neede must father prosperitie world vpon fortune see worldling looke vnto god nother weale wo therfore muste rather whensoeuer haue prosperitie let v consider god shineth vpon v sheweth v louing countenance would haue v know father might glorifie behold lord sheweth v countenance prosperitie end seeing might haue occasion prayse goodnesse also drawen vnto gentle allurement might giue v courage loue yeelde oureselues seruice nowe wee see manner speech superfluons stead saying manner vnbeleeuers haue good fortune haue liued mine ease iob sayeth god shone vpon lampe addeth god giuen lyght middest darkenesse hee sayeth bicause possible must many inconueniences daungers worlde meane euen seeme haue thing would wish although perceyue man exempted trouble yet notwithstanding long vpon earth must nedes walke among thornes vve shall alwayes threatned many death though man haue garner cellers full yet sayde may made poore turning hand let v marke well middes worlde wee alwaies darkenesse say besette many trouble daungers insomuch lord prouided v could step one pace forward much stirre one finger shoulde stumble many misery god remedieth thing shewing v lampe making shine vpon v therfore let v learne yeelde prayse deserueth canot holde transitorie life vnlesse wee doo alwayes looke vpon v guide v let v pray guiding v also make v feele effect neere v hath v sort protection exempted many misery bicause suffereth v fall god deserue haue prayse yeelded vnto respect thing concerne state life pray deserueth respect instructio giueth v word log liue liue darknesse peter sayth blinde wretch moreouer respect wittes grosse headed necessitie fall confusion euery steppe wee inlightened lampe god word vve see great thicke darknesse nede know god goodnesse open eye beholde bee diligent marke ende may honour benenefites deuour depende wholly vpon prouidence thus much haue marke sentence consequently sayde iob time youth prouidence god also tent hebrew worde whiche hee vseth heere doeth signifie latertime similitude taken youth youth fifteene yeeres time man cheefe courage lustinesse yeres fiue twenty vnto yeeres fiue thirty man cheefe floure begetting child haue expouded fond grosse bycause man full ripenesse giue counsell doo thing belongeth man life age wee see men dispose themselues may bee put dooing seruice like latter time bringeth foorth frutes also age man fit yeelde frutes say bee imployed seruice texte man may well take worde signification sometimes otherwyse also similitude whiche would later seazon say time men gathered frutes mine aboundance lo iob meeneth vvhen spring tyme yere see blade shall beare corn shooteth foorth vynes beginne budde howbeeit yet nothing hope vve see meddowes spring vp greene grasse latter season cattell fatte well fed bycause haue pasture ryches earth gathered layde vp thus yee see tyme aboundance doubte iob ment saye ryches god gyuen mee greate aboundance good flowed house afterwarde hee addeth prouidence company god vpon tent pursewing matter talked already hebrewe word iob vseth signifieth prouidence company agree well therefore men neede trouble themselues much sense continueth one therefore meening prouidence god vpon tent say whe god watched ouer mee guide affayres else god kept mee company say found fauorable vnto neere hold lap heere iob continueth acknowledging god benefites lette v marke well man tormented sort notwithstading farre besides himselfe alwaies glorified god sayd v thinke vpon god whe letteth v alone quietly middes ease vve know man pinched aduersity dismayed hee remembreth nother god himselfe caried away wit amazed state iob haue seene neuer yet almoste creature tormented fashion yet neuerthelesse seene still directeth himselfe vnto god glorifieth confessing benefites receyued time paste fell casuall aduenture purchased owne trauell pollicie hee beholding vntoo men howe god sayth hath lighted lape vpon hath guided hath bene hand mee vvhen iob speaketh ought record co demne men double treble dismayed yet neuerthelesse doo forget god swallowe vp benefites without honor let v learne glorifie god thing example iob prosperitie aduersitie saying hee addeth state time god companion garde wit feete bathed butter riuers flowed vnto oyle similitude iob signifieth god set prosperitie wanted nothing sayth trode butter bathed steppe much say god made walke vpon pleasant thing according sayd fourescore eleuenth psalme faithfull shall borne vp handes angel feete shall stumble dash agaynst thing amisse maner iob sayth text beholde god hath delt time past treade vpon ground neither felt hard pauement vnder rather god made mee path butter sweete thing short meeneth instead common state men swimme pleasure sotted himselfe doo rauished loue theyr owne cace ouerioy ouershoote themselues thing glutton drunkard wanton folke iob intended thing meeneth god hilde great prosperitie hee able expresse excesse word herein sene magnified god benefites much could like also ought poynt ought marke well bicause inforced cofesse good god hath done v acknowledging magnifie highly great benefite ought bee rather diminish owne maliciousnes lo howe god abated due v though man coulde denie whole debt shoulde say thought bee much according see euill paymaster shamelesse say owe nought thing knowne euident ynough could find hart make hundred florens fiue possible euen play wee god wee nicke vnkindnesse vnfaythfulnesse diminishing gift ought magnifie contrariwise iob sheweth v whe god hath done v good wee must thinke discharge selues saying one worde much beholden vnto god commeth grace trifling ceremony must learne esteme god benefit according worthie good fayth pray let v consider state whence lorde hath drawne v let v consider side wee haue deserued hee shoulde stretch hande helpe v bestowe creature vpon v v seruice let v marke thing little surely shall find cleane contrarie wit god ought shake v altogither yet notwithstanding ceasseth v good therfore let v learne esteeme fatherly loue hee beareth v tast earnestly wee haue done hitherto lo wee haue marke similitude butter oyle say compare selfe others find selfe greatly bound vnto god possible acknowledge sufficiently herevpon sheweth honour wherein spoken rich saying feete bathed butter stone yelded honie say euen hardst thing turned vnto pleasure sheweth honour estimation gouerners sayth taryed gate made chayre set mee euery man yeelded mee honor reuerence vvhen iob sayeth way bragging beareth shame god layde vpon humilitie reproueth aduersaries say iudge mee nowe damned cursed man ye see mee wretched carkasse destitute helpe euerie man scorneth see whither ye iudge rightly long ago since honored men would haue douked therfore iudgement right indifferent bicause stay vpo visible thing wheras ought looke see iobs meening vvherefore according hath bin declared forasmuch wee go let v learne oft lorde doth v good let v learne say acknowledge commeth fortune hand god contrary part whensoeuer pleaseth afflict v let v know intent waken v meanes serueth put v hart humble v therefore let v ceasse resort still vntoo assuring selues hath beaten v roddes well cure v againe knoweth remedy fittest welfare nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v feele wise beeing hartely sorie may seke nothing rid selues fleshly affection wee may bee fully clothed holy spirite ende may yeeld selues obedience may know howe profite selues wise owne affliction affliction neighbour may still instructed feare glorifie iudgements bee wrapped present thing wee may alwayes looke higher middes affliction may ceasse resort vnto good god trusting wil continue goodnesse towards v euen till shew v thing effect experience nowe warranteth worde may please graunt grace onely v also people c cv sermon second vpon xxix chapter vvhen yong men savve mee hidde themselues prince rose vp stoode vpon feete gouerners left speaking vvhen spake layde hande vpon mouth prince hilde peace tongue cleaued roofe mouth eare heard sayd vvas happie eye savv vvitnessed vvith deliuered poore vvhen cryed helped fatherlesse vvas succorlesse blissing vvas readie perishe came vpon mee comforted heart vvidovv precious thing warelier ought man kepe wisely dispose put better vse see euery man doeth respect worldely good true spare nothing wast yet euen know vice reproued men know order good thing ought set store howbeeit herewithall although confesse honestie man cheefe treasure yet notwithstanding men make spare sell little naught proofe heereof loke vpon reputation menne make moste curtesiie estimation theyr vertues cleane contrarie man aske humble themselues great riche one moueth doo say bycause worthie owne conscience beareth witnesse moste parte starke naught vve see honestie quite shaken yet notwithstanding men well ynough say precious thing foule fault according also wee see howe saint iames scorneth also sharpely rebuketh honour wicked sort defiling thing god hath dedicated good vse vvhat ought men honour sauing god proceedeth therefore wicked men suche reputation thing belongeth vntoo god plucked giuen diuell true wicked man bee aucthoritie men may well honour respect owne persone respect office vice estimation praysed vertues mingle mangle ouerthrowe order therfore ought marke well text whereas iob speaketh honour done vntoo hee sayth reason ryches credite vertues young men sayeth bee hidde themselues sawe mee vvhat moued yong men hyde themselues man passe boundes yong men rather take boldenesse doo euill shall haue suche shadowe proppe beare vp men stoode much awe iob hid themselues sight signe vertues men inforced honour ryches lo haue marke first place herewithall let v marke also word hyde importeth shame feared god yet neuerthelesse hilde awe men loth haue lewdnesse knowne specially vertuous man haue grauitie come way meene euill hyde themselues hys presence purpose serueth shamefastnesse seemeth superfluous thing certaine man absteyne dooing euill onely respect person thereby sheweth hath yet profited also slender honouring god yet notwithstanding commeth double profite one like childe know reason haue discretion shall neuerthelesse bee inured good thing euen lord causeth shamefastnesse selfe naught serue drawe forward little little haue yet proceded farre loue vertue owne sake example looke vpon man vnconstant hath feare loue god yet rooted altogither dazeled taketh leaue euill ouershoote himselfe yet hath still bridle vtterly past shame vvee shall see diuers themselues commonly bee ouerseene euill companie man shall sooner intice suche amisse bend fro yet al haue shamefastnesse soone man whome reuerence doeth cast eye aside vpon bee abashed could finde heart bee buried man tell faultes haue word answere rather fal weping reply thus ye see token man altogither past hope amendment hee keepeth stil modestie knowing shamefulnes owne sinne neuerthelesse euident shamefastnesse vertue self howbeit man come home little little lorde causeth medicine serue sirop preparatiue agaynst disease end pacient may afterwards receyue strong medicine lo heere sirop doeth alter commeth healeth pacient yet good preparatiue man hath taken halfe chaunge sort hee readie aforehand medicine medicine hath force like cace shamefastnesse selfe able heale vyces clense v make v walke becommeth v prepareth v wee vtterly passe boundes thus ye see one vse profit lord picked shamefastnes wauering light mynded folke sayde haue foundation ought haue feare name well rooted yet one vse wit excuse taken v god giueth v marke hee ingraued brended forehead say cannot iustifie fault vvhy go hyde mee presence man cause shame whence commeth shame god hath printed mee searingiron insomuche whereas otherwyse woulde suffer sunne heauen earth men beare witnesse lewdnesse yet notwithstanding restrayned see men shall point finger shall bee hated abhorred vice cursed selfe vvee see shamefastnesse men haue processe god maketh agaynst v aforehande shoulde charge iewrie take information inditements agaynst v end cast notwithstanding al shift could alledge yet neuerthelesse brondmarke shoulde bewray vice vice worthy condemned although man bee otherwise blockishe touched whitte knoweledge sinnes yet inasmuch hath shamefastnesse meanes made vnexcusable nowe wee see doctrine wee haue gather streyne first lorde warneth v haue shame euill shun men presence would loth haue lewdnesse knowne wee must vnderstande thereby god aduertiseth v v flatter selues sinnes hide rather wee must learne condemne furthermore bee abashed men let v assure oure selues wee cannot escape presence god vvee maye well locke vp oure selues oure lurking hole wee shall gaine nothing eie must alwayes see v onely marke workes bee seene worlde also secretest deepest thoughtes therefore let v learne feare men specially heauenly iudge seeth v also let said shamefastnesse gouern v must stay haue sayd alreadie one childe abyde alwayes apcee else sick man content himselfe preparatiue afterwarde die vpon want taking phisick must shamefastnesse raigne alone v must leade v wit although men perceiue defaultes wee might haue couerings hyde selues withall beguile worlde yet neuerthelesse owne conscience may watch keepe ward iudgement god may presse v may dispose whole life wee may desire onely good reputation men also allowed god bringing heereof passe wee must onely absteyne open euill harte also must clensed must haue affectios corrected wee may haue backe nooke hyde filthynesse thus ye see haue remember streyne yet notwithstanding wee see tymes wee bee dayes like feare god shame men iniquitie doeth ouerflowe bee shamelesse valiant leastwise youth ought haue modestie vndoubtedly without cause paynim owne naturall witte knowe shamefastnesse peculiar vertue yong folkes yong folke yet well gouerned requisite full boylings stirre vp vnto euill fire heade therewithall lust violent hard represse herevnto lorde giueth remedie although yong folke verie headie yet notwithstanding conuicted constreyned know theselues perceyue haue yet stayednesse requisit cause haue shamefastnesse seene nowadayes wateth store yong russian behold yong cockerel sooner cropen shell must haue sworde side shall see vtterly voyde al shame think ought bee like brothel stewes whatsoeuer doo neyther reuerence iustice anye thing else ought gouerne bee short wee see youth become altogither diuelish feare god also honestie sith see let v assure selues floud iniquitie thing farre order past remedie appeareth thing ought bee imprinted nature al men specially yong folke say shamefastnesse modestie quite razed yong folk vtterly shamelesse stubborne passe though mocked vnshamfastnesse let v learn walke greater feare carefulnesse shall bee excused alledging euerie man dooth wee doo meanes acquite v god say bee better selues rather let occasion vnto v drawe backe wee bee wrapped vyces raigne men furthermore let v remember howe hath bin sayde must walke men looke onely vpon creature let v set god eye according also cannot scape presence true inclination hypocrisie wee seeke many windlass startingholes yet must god needes follow v euery seeing let v learne dedicate selues wholly vnto haue sight fastened vpon forasmuch hee inlighteneth v worde let v thinke also vpon apostle telleth v epistle hebrewes declareth worde wee heare nature god search thought try al v deuide asunder mary bone veynes v seeing lord sendeth v word make triall euer lieth hid men must come light let euery v walk brode day consider darknesse seing lord iesus christ reigneth among v gospel thus ye see ye haue remeber text iob addeth prince rose vp afore yea cheef men gouerners bild peace heard speake wee see order nature teacheth malapertnesse men peruerteth thing follow lord sheweth say euen according order nature certaine man gift teaching iudgement knowledge men harkned vnto euery would hold peace spake vvhat cause whe man shall speake good reason haue gift edifie others receyued dispised many bablers thrust themselues foorth needes heard tongue running ryot meanes whereof truth shall put backe thrust vnder foote cause thereof men cannot abyde god guyde gouerne say corrupt order nature malapertnesse rather madnesse needes must become wood beastes wee cannot abyde submit selues truth reason admitte ordeyned ouer v god steade therefore let v marke well text iob meeneth magnifie owne persone onely vndoubtedly meening vvhat yesterday shewed peculiar reason hee speake may gather also generall doctrine god giueth v iobs mouth whiche vpright vertuous man therewithall indued wisedome wee must giue eare receyue among v wee followe rule whiche shewed v heere wee onely doo wrong vnto mortall man also god taketh wrong done owne persone without cause man bee able gouerne v good doctrine thinke wee hee hath himselfe euerie manne well ynough say gyft god nowe god aduaunceth manne suche wise gyuing hym largely holye spirite intent hee shoulde purchase himselfe estimation rather common profite men hee indued wyth great giftes bounde muche neighbour must bestowe giuen menne maye bee partaker nowe wee vouchsafe heare man wee may profite vnder despysing spirite god scorning maiestie whiche hee woulde haue bee knowne hee sendeth v mortall man sort name furthermore pride matched vnthankefulnesse beholde god rayseth vp men able teache v let v onely heare shall bee welfare vouchsafe doo reiecting benefite god offereth v muche v lyeth nought tolde v heere bee vertuous man whiche hath skill oure selues hee deserueth haue eare gyuen men shoulde bee heedfull receyue whiche hee shall say haue declared alreadie men doo wrong offered vntoo god wee also vnthankefull wee gouerned yet wee ought heare men whiche haue worldely skill ought wee doo purposely sent bring v god worde furnished may say god sendeth v message saluation theyr mouthes according hee serued turne prophetes apostle lyues haue order gouernment bee day churche continue vntoo worldes ende wee refuse heare god worde preached ordeyned office double rebellion shall wee bee much blame wee bee warned keepe silence lord sendeth v worde maketh great small stoupe vnto bee dumbe deafe say wee muste bee tonguetyde god speaketh standeth v hand herken without replying receyue quietly whatsoeuer sayde vnto v conclude amen bee againe must bee deafe forasmuch see nature bee ill disposed heare god obey worde haue pray open eares correct dulnesse hearing v slownesse obeying specially gyue v vnderstanding else wee bee brutishe wee shoulde neuer conceyue thing welfare except inlightened holy spirite therefore let v learne brydle onely tongue affection thing hindereth v hearing god beeyng taught woorde onely wee bee talkatiue full babbling prittleprattle also bycause wee bee full lustes gainstryuings breake god talke let euery man looke well himselfe wee come sermon otherwise looke vpon holy scripture doubt wee shall well vnderstande good saying profitable sentence heere slippeth v forget againe combered owne gainstryuings therefore one great noyze v brake god worde receyued againe wee beare away hundredth part tolde v bycause bee fleshly affection carie v away haue sayde wee mynde fare better god worde must onely brydle tongue ouer lauish must also bridle affection ende may bee peasable obedience yeelded god thus ye see wee haue marke neuerthelesse wee muste also haue sayde sobernesse modestie beeing hastie speake rather yeelde oure selues teachable sayde wyse manne shall wexewyzer hearing salomon speaketh ignorant idyots much men take themselues bee great clearkes doctor fyrst day beare themselues hande haue profited ynoughe assoone haue anye little taste doctrine good sooth men swell bigge ynoughe euen lyke toades howbeeit theyr swolnenesse wynde forasmuche men haue suche ouerweening themselues therefore salomon sayeth wyze man hee groweth wyzer hearing vvhat bee done vvee muste bee forwarde speake wee muste also bee readie hearken heare tolde v lo wee haue beare alwayes mynde vppon streyne verely seeing iob sayeth expressely gouerners euen suche practyzed wisedome bare authoritie among men gyuen eare bycause hee excelled pray shall become chalendge suche skill themselues haue lyke practyze borne office whereby get muche vnderstanding yet neuerthelesse lesse wee see verye fewe nowe adayes abyde bee taught euery man taketh vpon teacher see howe ill practise lesson giuen v saint iames sayeth must couet bee many master contrarywise none v hee thinkes himselfe able guide whole worlde meane man abyde bee taught tolde thing though bee yong calfe much ought marke circumstance haue purposely touched concerning iob holy ghoste prayseth men wyse authorite notwithstanding yeelded themselues peasable refused taught seeing holy ghost sheweth v let v vnderstande onelye commende person vnknowne v day giue v example instruction wee haue present admonition needeth considering pryde v sayde euerie man bee wise man finde heart stoupe lowe confesse hee hathe neede bee taught others thus cause holy ghost setteth v downe suche instruction heere although wee excellentest men worlde yet must wee imagine perfection selues wee haue neede profite yet heerewithall let v marke well giftes god vvhen wee see man sent v teach v let v vnderstande god hath sent v treasure releeue oure want withall standeth v hande receyue god fountayne al wisdome true neuerthelesse hee maketh runne downe vntoo v ryuers chanels men receyue giftes hande distribute v meanes although man haue great gift yet must wee giue hearing speake reason truth yea though yong childe tolde v faultes yet hee messenger god sending nowe wee may refuze little childe silly idiot hathe authoritie excellente gift must receyue correction hande pray must wee needes wittes wee reiect manifest giftes god hee woulde haue bee magnified setting open place bee seene must bee sayde wee starke madde reiect forasmuch haue neede continually strengthened receyuing doctrine instruction meanes bee offered long liue worlde let v accept god gift sayd wheresoeuer see let v honour submit selues thus yee see wee haue marke streyne iob declareth hee beene honoured commended onelye hauing sharpe suttle vnderstanding also mainteyning right among men sentence well worthy bee noted true man meddleth teaching hys neighbor ynough bee honest man haue desire liue well giue good example men hee must also haue skilfulnesse god must haue giuen wit reason neuerthelesse man skilfull coulde bee wished tongue readie vtter blemishe speache yet euill conscience scorner god heathenishe man life hee deserueth bee heard life maketh suspected men hardly take tast doctrine meene wickednesse mennes lyues ought diminishe authoritie god worde speake common infirmitie v insomuche wee see man wicked frowarde withoute vprightnesse dooings scorneth vertue suche man speake angell yet woulde men vouchsafe heare woulde thinke themselues deceyued bycause see hee speaketh heart therefore requisite thing dealeth teaching haue sayde vprightnesse men may knowe speaketh heart feinedly telleth tale iest like player maye play part enterlude yet done iest cause sayde ynough speake well hee myndeth teache others must onely speake hys tongue also deale men may know commeth heart must ratifie see doctrine deedes men may see thing speaketh settled heart printed ingrauen hee speaketh presence god ye see wee haue marke sentence iob reported bin commended greatest honourablest sort men addeth bycause succoured poore afflicted blissing readie perishe bin vpon hee bin defender fatherlesse protector widowes vprightnesse purchased authoritie according sayd fiftenth psalme must honour aboue men haue feare god surely declared long ago seeing feare god wisdome yea euen true wisdome wee must also cosider whether man deserue heard furthermore man walketh vprightly giueth good assurance speech feyned dissembler doth babble teeth outward hath affection hart man bee one whole life warranteth hee intendeth teach men good earnest intent god may serued honored let v assure selues must take one mirrour looking glasse make recking good life ought teach v reiect assurance god giueth v doctrine true haue saide men cannot barre worde god continuing full state dependeth vpon vertuous behauiour men howsoeuer worlde go god gracious vnto v teach v men witnesse liues onely seeking men shoulde serue god say haue recorde sealing doctrine one god relieue infirmitie driuing pricking v forward bycause hee seeth v negligent slowe come vntoo signe bee slouthfull beastes wee make accompt let v marke well sentence touched iob therewithall let suche haue charge teach others looke wel themselues behaue themselues wise life may pattern men beare witnesse speak vaine speake word god thoroughly ingrauen let v also take warning person haue worde god estimation wee may yeelde selues obedience well thus ye see thing minister magistrate haue charge gouern people generally suche haue degree vocation teaching ought thinke vpon namely lord shew way calling office vpon condition shoulde onely speake also witnesse earnestly truely life yea doctryne extendeth men generall man hee ought teach neighbour tyme place conuenient neede requireth therefore let v consider condemning men wee hyde oure owne fault ne cause bee forgotten hee would good correctour neighbour must first correct himselfe teach men must first bee owne schoolemayster say must begin himselfe receyue good doctryne also let v forget wee haue sayde namely wee must readie receiue instruction euery man hand yeeld selues teachable without refusing great benefit lorde goeth teach v maner person touching whiche iob sayeth effect hee hath shewed himselfe bee man feared god led ambition woulde fayne shewe themselues bee men renoume neuer thing looke prayse commendation afore men contrariwise iob declareth bestowed doings hope recompence purchasing great fame renoume worldwarde hee indeuered good vnto men euen seemed dead hereby sheweth wel led vaine glorie sought hire beneath earth walked sight god man seeke owne preferment certaine hee ought man good turne hee looke twice vpon see whether partie bee able counteruaile render like like thus ye see none good turnes done worlde done freely rather wage therfore doings sayd vertue charitie leadeth good one another helpe haue neede euery man hath eye owne profit see whether good doth vnto others may returne home againe himselfe contrariwise shewed v heere seruing god wee must haue regarde worldly recompence couet commended praysed according wee see howe iob sayeth blissing readie perish came vpon let v marke well saying man deathes dore seemeth v whatsoeuer good shall haue vnto good lost also worldwarde quite gone veryly iob speaketh vtterly forsaken succour insomuch man vouchsafed thinke vppon buryed man wretched coarse succour respect bee purchace prayse among men certaine seeke man blase abroade goodnesse tell much hee beholding bounde vnto mee take poore man good halfe dead seemeth hee must perish hande token seeke prayse men agayne hyre shall looke man condemned death hope wee minde proceede vprightnesse wee must thrust ambition vnder foote muste couetousnesse leade v must looke right forth vntoo god thing iob ment betoken effecte also cause hee setteth downe heere particular haue touched namely widowes fatherlesse child suche bee despysed whole worlde vndoubtedly also party specially recommended vntoo v god haue meanes recompence good turnes shall haue receyued recommend themselues poore man destitute fauour hath neyther kinsfolke freendes goodes authoritie side wee succour signe wee looke rightfoorth vntoo god wee token charitie v truely forasmuche euerye one v wedded owne profit therfore doth lord expresly commend vnto v widowes fatherlesse extremitie able helpe themselues god say presenteth vnto v trie charitie behalfe yee see poynt iob standeth v hande marke yea marke suche wise wee muste assure selues thing spoken learning haue touched alreadie iob vseth brauerie neither maketh brag get estimation rather person holy ghost sheweth v esteemed namely appeareth outwardly hath fayrest glosse afore men oftetimes shal abhomination god vvhat man walketh hauing none record god doings leuelled marke say god hath commaunded thing wherein trie thing whervnto tasketh man walketh rule one banish worldly respect gather himselfe vnto god euen also must let v seke none alowance god let suffice content v let v turned aside drawne away ambition vainglorie vvhen intend serue god let v looke recompence man hande let v serue god vnfeynednesse soundnesse wee maye stay vpon thing haue fayrest shewe vpon thing commaunded v let v fully conclude resolued wee ought desire god obeyed therfore thing let v follow still example iob shew feare god yea let shewing bee wote ceremony wherein substance thing oure lorde commaundeth v especially hys lawe whiche wee shoulde execute iustice rightuousnesse mercie say wee shoulde yeelde euery manne right wee shoulde absteyne euill iniurie craft violence indeuour serue neighbour cheefely hauing pitie compassion vpon aduersitie ende succour abilitie god hath giuen v nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement faultes praying haue pitie vppon v make v feele oure sinnes wee may bee humbled true repentance come seeke person lord iesus christ hee shall haue receyued v mercie may please guide v holy spirite glory may shine v meane may couet bee honoured men holde selues contented glorie shineth v name bee exalted may please make v walke suche soundnesse vnder obedience wander go astray may bee brought way saluation meanes oure example v togither may serue one common accord tyme lyfe performance heereof may please styrre vppe true faythfull minister hys worde c cvj sermon third vpon xxix chapter blissing vvas readie perish vvas vpon mee comforted vvydovves heart vvas clothed vvith rightuousnesse apparayled selfe vvith iudgement vvith robe crovvne vvas eye blinde foote cripple vvas father poore sought diligently cace knevve brake chavves vvicked plucked pray teeth wee began yesterday shewe howe iob giueth triall vertues feareth god doth good without regard worlde without seking recompence led either ambition self profit walketh sight god make shew vertue yet notwithstanding walke vprightly good haue alwayes eye whether men able recompence may praysed comeded purchase credite menes man giue good freely say without hope recompence worlde sheweth minded serue god therefore iob declareth hee regarded whether good able recompence rather imploy vpo pore fatherlesse widowes lame blind herein sheweth whole intent serue god besides sheweth led ambition ne sought comend holdeth coteted blissing haue perished vpo importeth much shoulde say hath desire succour alredy good halfe dead semed shewed fauor good lost neuer spoken respect hindreth iob well bicause hee sure although men die god kepeth reckning doings continue register short see always iob none drawne hither thither fleshly affection alwayes eye vpon mark regarding following thing god aloweth ye see ought rule life iob preacheth owne prayses sheweth v ought behaue selues forasmuch nothing easier aduaunce selues world laugheth vpon v men prayse v reputation credit iob bringeth v vnto god telleth v onely iudge perteyneth authority gouern v lawmaker also must seeke please obey al say mark one point heerewithall let v marke also god trie loue beare offereth v person haue meanes recompence v behold true proof serue god wee serue neighbor haue neither pleasured helped v afore shal seme haue lost labor cost yet notwithstanding ceasse imploy selues styll vvhy inough v god alloweth doings thing make v play hireling seing let v well aduised whensoeuer see poore men aduersitie misintreated whe necessitie want worldly good wrested wronged men stand need counsell othersome lack helpe doth god meane trie charitie putteth hee v touchstone shrink aside poore cryeth giue eare thereby shew neyther zealous willing serue god let v assure selues threate poore cried thou wouldst heare therefore thou shalt crie heard neyther shall man pitie thee shall executed vpon heades shall find mercy neither god man wee haue bin pitilesse god hath sent v bee succoured thereafter hart shall haue beene hard vnkinde god shet eye see v pouertie shall haue remorse v wee may well complaine smart man shall regard payment wee deserued compassion distresse specially seeing god sendeth v tryall purpose know whether willing serue bee short wee see heere mercie one principall part life ruled god order importeth saying euen see man aduersitie hath neede helpe sorie hart suffer owne person thereby led according abilitie god giueth v ynough v helpe haue neede ayde must also hartie loue worde almes importeth much mercie men think haue done almes deed neyther regarde esteeme person dog suffer part grief short haue compassion prouided onely giue somwhat speak properly almes truly witnesse almes say mercie yet false witnesse man hath sayde compassion hartie affection spake let v marke well god alow life bee hard harted pitying aduersitie therby moued succor vttermost power deale may well say gouerned god spirit life allowable true god commaundeth v many thing law neither saide one principall part yet notwithstading man may little angell residue worlde may haue admiration yet bee cruell wild beast hardharted careth pore aduersitie certa god abhorre vertues might estimation desirous liuing cha ly soberly yeelding euerie man right offering man wrong violence deceit desirous say lord take thing good worth doings shuld acceptable seruice vnto let mercie matched inseparably like meates vnsauery without salt also pitifull relieue neighbor reach seeke succor god taketh neither tast sauor r u ye see haue bear away text iob saith blissing readie perish vpon hee bin father widow defender fatherlesse furthermore let v marke well according see want necessity neighbor one say v behold shew would haue men communicate togither god could well ynough bring passe euery man contented owne person liue alone see none v al hath need others helpe speake euen richest haue ease let v take man helthful lustie bodie hath store good welth shall seeme haue al thing liking yet notwithstanding hath need men al cannot husbandman al men cannot clothier al cannot tanner handicraft short see god bindeth v one another force necessitie cheyne hold v fast tied knit togither besides see lord costreineth v yet better sendeth one man sicknes another man pouertie one man another rich priuileged poore oftentimes set perplexity know side turne v say god bringeth thither neuer thought euen say seeming world wil cause hereof sayd afore god perceyuing men would set light one another euery one liue himselfe possible draggeth v heare head sheweth v ouergreat folly desire exempt selues state wherein hee hath set mankind therfore let v marke well neighbor wanteth according sayd lame blinde readie perishe widowes fatherlesse euery v ought cosider go ought behaue selfe cace god haue giuen v wherwith bindeth v hand help want haue consideration v disappointing neighbor rob thing god hath ordeyned helpe must yeld account keping back thing god comitted vnto v vse end want succored let euery v consider well abilitie giuen shal pay deare god gift bestowed ought specially cosider precious god sight therevpon vse purely comaundeth god gift smal worthy estimation done apply right lawful vse therfore god indueth man gift behoueth thinke self alone true god haue vse thanks giuing giuing also end haue wherwith helpe neighbor therefore must streyne self thervnto play niggard behalfe god ca wel shew steward good mine dispose list dealing committed vnto vvherefore let euery man consider wise god wil haue gift esteemed let euery v drinke owne water salomon sayth riuers may flow forth neighbor let v play gluttos selues alone let v haue spring may satisfie selues also releue wat let v drink fountain god hath giue v yet therwithal let v deal men also may feele let v like wilde beastes thus yee see haue remember sentence furthermore let v also marke side wee bee cruell verie necessity themselues ought moue v succor neighbour truely though wee neyther lawe written prophet aught else nature hir selfe sufficient good mistresse bowe v soften hart see men necessitie beholde one man blynde another lame third lacketh goodes world another wanteth defence another hath neede counsell cace wee see owne flesh prophet esay sayeth cannot renounce owne nature therefore see men made owne likenesse necessitie wee succoure ill worse brute beast let v bethinke selues may perchance alledge ignorace excuse v although one word teaching yet doth kynde selfe shew v blame worthy indeuer help extremity heathe men beare sufficiet witnesse nature man teacheth v behalfe asmuch needefull yea euery one v sufficiently conuinced experience see man aduersitie certayne haue instinct motion within v possible must needes runne thither euery v stoppeth eye turne backe plucke head coller vayne trifling shift neuerthelesse sayd inward motion shall proces v afore god haue indeuered help necessitie oure neighbor hath bin sayd already wee muste thinke men wanting ayde sorte commeth casual chaunce god hath appoynted fashion end charitie might tried else wee might conuinced haue beene cruell iob addeth made inquisition cace knowne vntoo bycause hee mynded know truth hande speaketh hys owne priuate person one authoritie iustice haue seene afore poynt wel worthy noted office iustice sheweth ought watchfull searching euery man right end suffer oppressed yet deceit wrog true herevpon haue also generall doctrine gather first formost behoueth magistrate men authoritie knowe holy ghost intended shew lesson giue sure rule end might faithfully discharge dutie listed bend themselues contrariwise might left without excuse discharge conteyned heere therefore let v marke well ynough iudge man wrong willingly pronounce sentence according seeth also hee must diligent boulting thing inough iudge tary tyll men haue made way ope afore pointed matter finger must haue care spie thing himselfe matter bee darke doubtfull must bend wit ende well informed diligence required iudges pray shall become shet eye willingly let thing passe fauour hatred bribe caried away spoyle one man goodes fauor another man incumber third vvhat horrible damnation shal haue whe deale therefore let v take good heede doctrine man intend serue god faythfully performe charge comitted vnto hym called office common welth must first vnderstande hee set idoll good sooth hath god promised giue spirit discretion king prince magistrate bycause haue neede singular gift aboue others therefore suche state haue need pray vnto god guide may haue wisedome right vnderstanding trye discern thing may wise deale vnaduisedly commended vnto god second poynt diligent finde truth thing matter vnknowne vnto must thinke themselues discharged saying knew nothing negligence shall cost deare god therfore iudge intedeth performe dutie must vigilant knowe thing go get instruction truth vttermost much possible meanes hereby seene fond excuse say wist yea men go enforme lye sit god seat pray deceyued willingly bee contented sift matter let mischeef slip truly oftentimes shet eye fond shift occupie god roome god idol hath curteyn eies canot iudge betwene white black dishonor iudges master wilfully ignorat fal aslepe find hart men beguile beholde man hath worst cace world goeth bleare iudges sight cast handfull ash eye set let hys way iudge contented sayth see awhit trayterousnesse god seat ought holy men go defile much villanouse defiling lye men suffer peruert iudgemente right sort peraduenture wil say reason reason stark lye iudges double minded men may bend like reedes wauer euery wind iudges like well stedfastnesse firmnesse pray shall therfore ceasse guiltie god shall see many well ease men beguile desire better haue colour gloze also become theselues aduocates vntruthes fall foysting lie ouerthrow right perchance cace shal throughly clere eue little child set could tell matter goeth according vnto truth yet iudges shall cast wote doubtes cace shall bee true cleare ynoughe selfe one shall come alledge wote intangle matter iudges say tary til proctor aduocate come bring lie lewd allegation turken whole cace themselues ready say tushe thus thus cace shall good vtterly cleare euident yet notwithstanding thrust lye snarle intangle vtterly short nothing bee seene villaynous shamelesnesse babe may iudge god nothing meane vvill hee suffer men scorne maiestie sorte defile sacred seate whiche hee dedicated owne name wee see suche set seate iustice shall haue terrible account make dreadfull curse prepared vnlesse bee vigilat searching thing iudge adue ture ne verefie prouerb sayeth foolish iudge gyueth hastie sentence doo indeuer learne thing go may always protest god also shew deedes afore men lette themselues wer fully enformed truth matter knowne vnto negligence bee punished roughly haue drawne curteines scape hande god shal become euill conscience corrupted bribe forepossessed parcialitie hatred fall flinging sort like wilde beast ourthrowe muche lyeth insomuch men know flee iustice refuge good plight among sort eues pray come point shall appeare god although winke time see harder thing minister iustice seeing god requireth watchfulnesse therwithall let v mark also euery particularly much lieth ought make inquiry good euil end grieue neighbor although iudges pronounce publike sentence yet notwithstading oftetimes neighbor wrong iudging amisse may harme many wayes want true information therefore let v set mind throughly try serch truth deceyued lying thereby wrong man furthermore iob hath treated wisdom carelesnes ought men authoritie addeth vertue whiche requisite say vncorruptnesse coscience set iues wrong violence suffer outrage done without redressing much lieth cause iob protesteth brake chawes wicked plucked pray fro betwene teeth cannot bee done vnlesse iudges magistrate haue stoutnesse cannot abide euill without resisting vertue also speciall gift god although stout courage yet notwithstading whe seeth men fal many incoueniences purchasing folk displeasure plucketh backe cooleth true many example found yea eue among paynim whiche neuer knewe god bowed cause mainteyned right gaue hand succour suche wrongfully oppressed man may wel see many example god worketh maner behalfe end take away excuse fro pretend name haue swarued dissembled suffred good men oppressed wronged wolues deuour sheepe yet notwithstanding sayd afore thys vertue inuincible stoutnesse costancie speciall gift god set seate iustice haue desired god giue wisdome iudge rightly indeuered themselues vttermost discharge duetie reach hand troden vnder foot ought set themselues sheeldes agaynst suche woulde take away men good force set foot vpo pore men throtes iudges ought applie themselues true men see wicked folke haue bridle lye looce neck body resisteth say cannot redresse excuse purpose god see men say man eareth company drag behind behalfe would dutie ioyne leaue lewd fellow twain gren quake feare wote fault woulde faine remedied cannot alone reason may wel cary colour men need must fal groud god haue declared holy ghost giueth common lesson haue charge committed vntoo lesson muste shew themselues flat enemy wicked see lyke madde beastes teeth sharpned eate vp one byte another must barre doings step employing credite authoritie god hath giuen small saying sayd haue broken chawes wicked plucked pray teeth let v mark god ordeineth magistrate say calleth office iustice armeth sword bindeth maintein good innocent take vpon defence right also set themselues al wrong misdealings violence iudge say know right wrong blame first god neuer faile giue wisdome aske also blisse labor trauell faithfully seeke right iudges farre fro making inquisition oppressed men complayne vnto ayre shall ring yet notwithstanding meane eares ought set hand remedie deafe haue paciently put vp wrong iudge made priuie cace excused cannot say came complayne fault committed thine eye thyne office redresse thou hast made account thinkest thou escape cleere god yee shall see poore folke complaine come shew right yet haue redresse cotrariwise euil hath bin done sword must drawne matter must hadled vehemencie mad n say zeale iustice much purpose vilanouse shamelesnesse wherein neyther rime reason suffer poore man troubled meane deale rigour may matter nothing poore man wronged comp ayn lay foorth right tush nothing come againe seuennight hence shall delayed long shal tired plaine man haue rent reuenues liue vpon haue men beck solicite matter handicraft man hee must sterue hunger hee recouer right matter neuer euident hath wrong done worlde seeth matter apparantly knowne yet ende hee haue right must hee haue full purse must shet vp shop must make account idle halfe yeare hath folowed hys matter good yet shall laughed scorne vve see disorder day therefore make account afore god placed holy seate iustice true cleare theselues men yet shall thys doctrine disanulled sayde ofward thing inquisitiue sith see thing brought light zeale succor misused oppressed yea also sene wicked becom bolder euen reason libertie giuen whe shal haue committed euill scape vnpunished al one libertie priuiledge giuen harme men vvell vse abuse therevpon proceede meane iudge still say indeede suche euill committed yea happened second third fourth insomuch length order yet meane redresse vvill god haue seate honored except sayd vertue stoutnesse constancie represse euill therefore bee libertie wicked sort may play lion beares wood beast let authoritie god remember themselues ought serue maister shall discharge selfe dutie shall haue side shall vphilde hys hande ye see wherevpon iudge ought thynke shall hee haue lion heart set himselfe woodde beastes plucke pray teeth breake theyr chawes good faith let v mark maner speech superfluous effect iob rather holy ghoste mouth ment declare execute iustice duly shall neuer bring passe except vse sword god hath put hande breake chawes wicked say except vse sharpnesse rigor iudge effeminate whe commeth punishing offender fall saying wote wote say destitute stoutnesse redresse matter order certayne hee shall neuer performe hys dutie therefore whereas heere mention made breaking wicked men teeth let v vnderstad lord warneth whome hath giuen sworde vse stoutly wicked whiche commonly ouerhardy like brute beast iusheers also must haue stedfast stout heart represse violence rage thus ye see haue marke streyne conclusion let v marke sentence iob setteth downe whiche hee clothed himselfe rightuousnesse hadde made iustice say vprightnes robe crowne saye hee decked vertue brauerie bee whome god hath aduaunced credite beare themselues hande world worthy looke face play peacockes spread wing abroade ye see decking day authoritie state iustice nothing bee seene pride nothing pompe brauerie yet thinke themselues bee mortall men contrariwise sayde heere man regardeth god indeuereth execute duty faythfully taketh rightuousnesse robe vpright dealing cloake apparell pray honestie sake woulde man suffer coate cloake bee plucked himselfe bee sent picke pagles prouerbe sayeth neyther whote colde woulde keepe cloathes still intent might honestly keepe company among men man bee stripped chaunce bee rayne winde hee left readie starue colde swelt heate coate pluckt peeces greeue hart yet notwithstanding rightuousnesse vpright dealing verie cloathes coates bee apparayled man haue behaued himselfe faythfully dooing duetie god mainteyneth hee fenced protection aboue hee shall bee god fauour although man made good countenance among men yee see sort wee ought cloathed apparelled god angel namely keeping said rightuousnesse vpright dealing wee haue beene spoyled destitute although diuerse tymes either flatterie briberie threatning hatred temptation men labour get away clothing apparell rightuousnesse vpright dealing v let v take good heede bee spoyled except wee haue shame dishonestie shewed openly god angelles furthermore touching worlde present life let v bee well ware lay selues open cold heate saye god suffer v fall intoo many wantes therewithall sende v succour wee haue beene cowardely slouthfull suffer selues bee spoyled oure cloathes good reason wee shoulde smarte afterwarde cloake couer keepe mee rayne haue let goe aduenture nowe woorthie bee wette skinne seeing hilde scorne cast cloake mee beholde god declareth vnto v intent wee shoulde bee well clad hee himselfe hath cloathed v owne rightuousnesse wee cast away rightuousnesse thing value make account sayd vpright dealing equitie hee commendeth greatly vnto v wee cast away wynd seeing wee vnclothe selues sort pray deserue oure lorde gyue v vp shame mocked skorned therewithall bee left vtterly destitute thing finally haue ayde succour neyther god man lo wee haue marke text truly wee neuer discharge selues throughly duetie meane onely magistrate haue highe harde charge also haue gouern themselues theyr housholdes vnpossible shoulde haue suche perfection bee garnished wyth rightuousnesse vpright dealing poyntes vvhat haue wee doo vvee muste resort oure lorde iesus christ twoo cause first wee finde selues thing conteyned heere bee slowe vntoo goodnesse swift vntoo euill neyther wisedome discretion v therefore behoueth v drawe iesus christ spirite wisedome strength gyuen sayde eleuenth chapter prophete esay wee bee clothed rightuousnesse oure lorde iesus chryst vprightnesse wisedome giue v holy spirite shall wee bee garnished decked conueniently appeare god forasmuch present life alwayes bee imperfection v alwayes bee amsse lorde iesus christ muste meere grace couer faultes may pardoned hys sake hee supplie wantes therewithall continually increase giftes holy spirite v guide v power vntill hee haue cleare ridde v infirmity corruption flesh bee come marke wherevnto going nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v feele vtterly dismayd selues wee may make recourse vnto hym trusting shall bee vayne bycause hee willing ready help seeke let v say almighty god heauenly father c cvij sermon fourth vpon xxix chapter sayd shall dye nest shall multiplie dayes sande roote spread vvater deavve shall lye vppon haruest shall bee verie great glorie shall renued bovve shall strengthned hande men heard vvith longing hilde toung counsell replyed vvordes talke dropped rayne vpon hearer vvayted deavv opened mouth desired rayne laughed vvith beleeued neyther suffered lyght countenaunce fall vvhen came vvay chief roome vvas among king vvith armie comforter mourned iob hauing spoken authoritie purchased hys vertues gift grace god putte doth nowe adde seemed state shoulde neuer haue chaunged therein sheweth like reigne ouer whether wil alwayes doubt vncertaintie according see attain honour authoritie wrogfully may well beare great sway make world quake vnder assoone winde turneth least chaunge world ouerthroweth vvhy bee feared hated suche crouch creepe wish hart see ouerthrowne short haue foundation iob sheweth hee fleeting credit continue two three day well grounded man might haue sayde state neuer haue beene chaunged well vnderpropped side lo meenig yet notwithstanding god smote wise hee became miserablest creature world therefore maruell though hee suche anguish hee coulde hee fell intoo aduersitie hee neuer looked cause hee ouershootes himselfe oftentimes hys talke althoughe haue alwayes eye vntoo god yet hee excessiue tootoo muche therefore muste bee thought straunge considering myserie whyche hee indured incomprehensible suche one men neuer thought afore must serue oure learning wee may alwayes stande vpon gard god sende v prosperitie let v bee sleepie lette v consider thys mortall life subiect chaunges deuise yea truly notwithstanding proppes wee haue although whole worlde seeme fauour v wee haue hundred thousande shoulder beare v vp yet must neuerthelesse thinke settlednesse heere bylow thing transitorie thinges chaunged turning hande lifted highest vp cast lowest downe beholde say lesson haue gather thys texte needefull doctrine v nothing easier man make himselfe beleeue hee shall alwayes continue happie state vvee see dauid hymselfe confesseth vvhen prosperitie sayeth sayd shall neuer remoued true tenth psalme putteth ouer despizers god speaking theyr prosperitie sayeth beare themselues hande although whole world shoulde bee turned vpside downe yet exceedingly well fenced shall continue safe still yee see worldling vnbeleeuers presume vpon owne power take themselues wel armed side nothing may hurt according also holy scripture speaketh pride dauid owne person forealledged text thirtith psalme sayeth fell asleepe since time god settled kingdome made prosper giuen vpper hand enemy therevpon made reckening neuer remoue state sayeth hee lorde thou hast well taught experience fauor thy good aduaunced maner soone felt thy hand behold plight vtterly wit end dauid sheweth euen child god althoughe bee puffed vp pride vnbeleuers themselues good fortune terme notwithstanding able stay fro promising theselues needefull imagine good dayes shall last euer prosperitie shall neuer fayle sith inclined suche vice insomuche euen dauid altogither clere haue else take heede ourselues sort dauid marking vice doth also shew remedie whe sayth lord surenesse safetie kingdome grounded vpon thine goodnesse acknowledge welfare dependeth vppon god good pleasure wee shall conclude certaintie settlednesse selues let v call vpon god wayte hande whatsoeuer shall please send v although wee hope hee continue goodnesse towardes v yet notwithstanding let v ceasse prepare oure selues whensoeuer shall please meeken v exercise pacience aduersitie let v alwayes bee readinesse thinke straunge commeth furthermore letvs marke well howe dauid sayth troubled one come vpon man fast asleepe vvill like trouble hand god striketh v let v dispose selues aforehand lette v preuent change seene eye god sheweth v ende euery v keepe good watch thus ye see say doctrine whiche conteyned heere necessary v must thinke dye nest manner similitude iob vseth heere must bird vppon bough remoue god pleasure inriched wee may impouerished list haue bin great honour estimation may come reproch shame maneral whole world may mocke v pleasure wee may take good woorth sayd readinesse hand end bee troubled lord shall visite v maner haue speciall neede warned heereof bycause state christian chaungeable paule sayth himselfe fellowes without rest vseth word ought constant behoueth v determine ourselues neuer swarue touching outward visible state worldward must faine fleeting without rest seeing god hath called v thervnto let euery one v take heed make hys reckening without host ne beare hand shall continue alwayes one state hee warranteth himselfe cannot performe behold heere two thing haue marke one prosperitie soeuer haue certayne abiding state good pleasure god lyke prince gyue man possession lordship feesimple holde tenant hath day day prince may reuoke hys graunt pleaseth hym like cace thinges god giueth v thys worlde condition inioy life deathe onely pleaseth hym according also hee knoweth expedient v lo first point seconde poynt must consider good god remoue v time tyme long world suffer v settle long surely would gather rust drawe muche superfluous baggage v god therefore remoueth v saye hee chaungeth state hee afflicteth v hee maketh v poore hath lifted v vp hee casteth v downe ende shoulde bee snarled good thys world become foolish keepe way continually heauenly life thus ye see haue beare away texte furthermore let euery v inure himselfe consider turning wee see world lorde sheweth v intent wee shoulde fare better specially wee see thyng neuer mistrusted looked afore man aduaunced great credit nothing went wind weather say hee shall haue gathered great rich gotten great freends haue alied hymselfe well gotten infinit stayes wee see one fall bycause god layeth hand vpon beate hym downe let v think ourselues behoueth v wake god declareth vnto v ther nothing certaine world ende come hide selues vnder wing also dispose selues aduersitie whensoeuer shal please send happen fall let v much astonied dismayde bycause haue minded long time hande verely sometimes god maketh alteration onely vpon men also vpon city country kingdom vvhen great courtier reputation thought aduanced aboue clowdes seene come decay chaunge ryght great woonderfull see citie shire yea reahn ouerthrown sayd afore man would haue thought bin muche help beene vnpossible haue come vnto say see ouerthrowne let v vnderstand lord setteth looking glasse eye end euery v shoulde thinke better vppon owne frailtie fall asleepe presumption vayne trust thus ye see ought profit oure selues text experience lord giueth v life long iob vseth mo similitude expresse sayde say deaw shall lye alwayes vpon haruest vpon braunches hebrewe woorde importeth twayn commeth one end againe dayes shall multiplyed sand hee shoulde saye without number againe glory shall renued bow shall beaten true men vnderstand saying concerne hope resurrection men may see whole proces matter iob treateth state present lyfe therefore must climb hye seeke curious gloze content selues naturall sense haue set downe already whiche iob meeneth heere say state well settled men thought euer haue seene fall intoo miserable plight sayd circumstance make many men wonder whe see change fall reasoning ourselues happeneth god thundereth vppon hye mountaynes smiteth great head possible consider god intendeth vtter power cace end men shoulde trust muche themselues learne referre themselues wholly vnto rest altogithervpon goodnesse promise themselues thing owne imagination much behoueth v marke wel circumstance iobs aduauncement onely day two three short time hee seemed vtterly exempted danger perill misfortune yet notwithstanding god smote roughly vpon hys hand vtterly defaced vvherefore let v vnderstand god ment giue v notable looking glasse heere end always kepe good watch whe haue called vpo god please send v affliction might receiue pacietly inasmuch sort forsene surely whatsoeuer vertu v must stir v vp whe ther hapneth change must vnderstad according lord hath giuen v gracious gift specially shal haue gouerned v holy spirit vse well becommeth v must serue stablish v pacientnesse notwithstanding weakened yea vtterly beaten body let v assure ourselues god come vtter strength spirit sustcining v end may fight temptation victory shall haue gotten may much glorious bycause goodnesse hath bin increased towards v lo heere wee haue marke iob goeth matter dealt great authoritie hee gotten vain reputatio wisdom grauitie bicause gouerned euery man reuereced therfore sayth expresly al herkned yea berkned sort waited word euery man gaped man athirst see earth dry doth crany desired rain drinke iob declareth himselfe one wit hee rain deaw heard altered word hung vpon talke vpo vnreuocable iudgement declared vntoo v purposely end know first iob see sore smitten god hand therefore let v complayne grudge god accuse cruelty afflicteth v see iob gayned namely abode vanquished co founded whe went striue chastizementes god sent yet neuerthelesse ye see holinesse life perfection hym therfore let v learn god always iust afflicting v compare ourselues iob shal find ourselues far short perfectio yet beaten sharply haue none shift receyue god stripe wyth lowlinesse pacience marke one point herewithal see iobs person reuerece ought beare god sendeth teach v faythfully sayd men hearkened longing wherein sheweth ought haue desire profit knowledge seing nature prouoketh desire eate drinke nourishment body must despise foode soules whiche knowledge lerning goodnesse wherby differ brute beast vvhe know thing good mainteine v neede neither master teacher teach v couet neither need prouocation body put v mind euery man sayd skil couet eate drinke euery man desire bee clothed vvhy know thing cocerne life soule excellentest part v ought interteyned eating drinking thing agreeable nature haue reason vnderstanding life brutish may shew ourselues creature formed image god verse shewed v blockish leastwise haue reason v wee oughte cotinually deuise may profit knowing end man borne
