world namely stablished knowledge god wee haue receyued wee see many retchlesse passe heare thing see othersom cannot satisfied dispising doctrin also hate vtterly absent theselues asmuche ca folk deserue counted men thing wherin wee differ brute beastes haue reason vnderstanding v discerne betwene good euil yet notwithstanding ther grosnes infirmitie wit haue neede furtherance yea though wee al furtherance could wished yet apparant still default v cause wee reiect benefites god offereth v bycause bee woise beast wee must needes conclude man knew ende creation hee liueth world would always moued profit knowledge set mind therevpon hee would neuer refuse meanes whe offred would think behold god intendeth teach therfore behoueth yeelde selfe willing learne giue eare doctrine setteth afore good auailable saluation lo desire ought v let v looke vpon oure owne retchlesnesse god gracious vnto v giue v word sendeth v man hath good wit vnderstanding also willing duty master himselfe although hee come downe heauen owne visible person yet haue law prophet gospel giue v infallible assurance record speaketh seing god openeth holy mouth teache v although hee vse mortall men instrument pray vnthakfull vouchsafe profit schoole yet neuerthelesse see fare behalfe vvherfore behoueth v remember well lesson shewed heere respect god vpbraydeth v according also iesus christ hath done iewes hypocrite saying ca skill discerne season tell sunne cheere earth know weather cleare fayre may go businesse discerne whiche belongeth oure soules bicause much wedded thys presente life none v wisheth raine knoweth needefull saying nowe good earth watered agayne haue neede heate faire weather thing else wee good skill forecast thing cocerne commodity temporall life lacke al v behalfe behold god sendeth v word know due time visitation enter whe gate opened v hee calleth v side wee take scorne come furthermore let v marke well similitude set downe without cause iob sayeth word wished wayted raine deaw moyses also vseth song ye heauens saith let wordes drop deaw raine season vnderstanding hereof must consider raine selfe also marke vse profit bringeth v rain respect may hurtfull vnto wet hard skin go abrode feelds men also keepeth within doores yet seasonable rayne bringeth v sustenance moysting earth whiche could yeeld frute without thus ye see rayne desired let v vnderstand wee oure part muche barreyn earth proofe heereof bryng foorth nothing shrewd weedes true respect euil frutestil respect good cannot bring foorth muche one grayne corne one braunch good herb much lesse wee bryng foorth one good nourishing frute wherewith feede selues shoote foorth one blade good corne vntil god haue chaunged nature hath god put good v must also faine water else bee either choked briar else grow wilde lorde must worke behalfe beholde meane intendeth keepe sendeth v word raine ende beeing moystned wee maye see woorking cheerefulnesse good roote hath planted v may perish increase bud bring foorth good frute furthermore let v take heede become like stone blockes god rayneth vppon v rain doth earth good well tilled good rock none rayne lost vpon eue men well tilled minded yeelde vnder obedience oure god maketh word raine vpon v certenly enter hart shal feele working shal disposed vnto goodnesse good work shal shewe haue bin watered vayne god minde grace lost v continue alwayes oure cursed nature many men wilfull froward shall like rock hee raine vpon v vvee shall haue disposition receyue raine cost v right deere therefore let v vnderstand raine god sending haue worde preached vnto v streameth downe vpon v make vanish aire suffer light vpon ground may sure vnthankfulnesse shall scape vnpunished thus ye see end behoueth v apply similitude iob vseth heere sayth wordes wayted longed rayne deawe wit must assure ourselues good doctrine whiche god sendeth vnto v oure welfare commeth v heauen although heare mortall man hand yet notwithstadyng god sending ye see god desire water v intent make v receyue good seede hand bring foorth good frute according added heere iob sayth hys word longed wayted also men receiued immediatly greate earnest good also replying co trary please god teach v thereof raise vp meete men induced grace holy spirit vnder whome wee may profite let v giue eare reuerence yeeld theyr good doctrine without constraint true ought examine spirit wee must aduenture receyue doctrine set afore v vntill wee sure god knowe god speaketh say wee sure taught hys name mouth replying wee must doo honoure settle ourselues fully vpon word may yeld ourselues obediet vnto may haue full course authoritie among v true many find hart suffer god speake without kicking know thing bee good preached vnto yet doo striue life thing wherein lord intendeth trie whether haue wee heard god word vve must reply must glorify god assuring selues nothing better v obey haue acknowledged let euery v retourned intoo oure house shewe oure deedes wee haue borne away doctrine alow good doth contrary whyche confesseth double condemnable surely bee folke doo muche woorse secrete wickednesse opened worlde also theyr replying againste god extendeth onely mouth also lyfe therefore folke lyue taught gospell work replye sufficiently agaynste god vvhen man troubleth neighboure riseth vp openly doth violence certayne suche outrage shall bee borne withall shall punished god hande howe long euer hee tarrie although oure going anoy neighbour suttle tie vndermining slight bee cheefly conueyed couered cannot reproued men nother man seeming finde fault v yet notwithstanding crye mounteth vp heauen craueth vengeance god hand extortion haue committed secret vvherefore let v marke well although haue yeelded reuerence vnto god word heare good holy doctrine receiue foode soules meane bring v euer lasting life saluation pretend desire yet behoueth euery one v take good heede hymselfe hee replye agaynst hys life nowe let v consider little man may euer find vertue world behold iob speaketh time god doctrine yet darke well knowne whither liued law moyses howbeit certayne hee auncienter prophet spoken prophet hee spoken man bin auncient time seeyng pray ought world day giuen receiue god doctrine tyme haue sayde doctrine god darke dayes god sent drop drop euen ther falleth small deaw night bee shorte men taught slightly comparison abundance grace god sendeth worlde dayes gospell haue infinite treasure wisdome knowledge god sheweth hymselfe familiarly vntoo v haue v filled throughly filled wyth perfection doctrine giueth cleere certayne vnderstanding possible yet reuerence iob speaketh desire amiable obedience nay contrariwise see skornefulnesse haue touched already againe doctrine preached many giue attentiue eare vnto nay parte busied theyr owne fancy earthly care haue wote matter within shut god dores play resty iades kicking doctrine theyr comming sermon fashion sake returne home wise went thither fewe folke whome reuerence founde spoken heere conforming themselues fully vnto rare vertue euery man wise cunning sort obeying god comming knowledge holy scripture nay mary say thynke thus thus seemeth men ashamed alledge theyr weenings god cheefe article fayth papist day opinion god ought set greate store thys theyr ouerdiuelish pride would haue men holde themselues deuises blaspheme openly theyr mouthes neuerthelesse seene theyr deedes rebell agaynste god wee see howe god doth nowadayes set whole perfection wisedome gospell commeth familiarly vnto v desiring fill v full yet notwithstanding wee finde tast hys worde vtterly despise declared vnto v wee go resist leastwise deface doings seeyng maliciouse shall heare iob beare witnesse v shall vpbrayde v wyth obedience whiche yeelded vnto iob deede prophete god yet suche recorde calling oure lorde iesus christ hathe giuen preache gospell dayes therefore let v marke well thys texte like sayd least kingdome heauen saye preache gospell dayes excellent ministerie iohn baptist prophet contrary parte despise doctrine god sendeth seeing commaundeth honoured certayne shall double giltie thus ye see haue marke thys text sayd immediatly iob iested beleeued vvhereby meeneth hee suche grauitie men durst beleeue hee woulde iest bycause conuersation shewed himselfe prophete god gotten greate credite reuerence whiche men beare vnto cause men thought hee would abace himselfe become fellow like companion others afterward hee addeth constreyned let light countenance fall say compelled hyde cheerefull countenance bycause although glad see yet durst shew like countenance againe feare offending manner way serueth confirme matter spoken already holy ghost sheweth v looking glasse reuerence whole people dayes towards man indued excellent giftes notwithstanding spirite rested speaketh day vnto v men honored wise durst shewe like countenance laughhed feare displeasing sheweth well obedience wee yeelde god worde wee ought esteeme honoure doctrine much wee knowe proceedeth oure welfare herewithall iob sheweth also sort behaued selfe among honoured gaue cheefe roome vnto king namely bene comforter afflicted therefore hee sheweth parte hee abused authoritie giuen taking vpon lorde manner false prophetes according sayde ezechiell whiche vse suche extreme sternenesse though woulde set feete vpon neckes feare god thundering storming meane haue humanitie regarde reach hand afflicted iob declareth grauitie tvrantlike saye sturdie statelynesse daunt poore folke make afraid although hee shewed himselfe familiar yet stoode awe durste dallie bycause knewe receiued god spirit abundantly vvherefore let v vnderstand like bin milde courteous vnto al men also lesson whome god hath called teaching neyghbors generally faythfull euery man owne behalfe god giue v authoritie replenishe v holie spirite wee honoured among men v aduaunce ourselues ouerrule like lord abusing god giftes wresting cleane contrarie meening behoueth v knowe oure lorde imployeth v comforting poore afflicted wit suche seeke serue god lowlinesse may cheered hearing seeing v like god worde hated wicked sort despizers thereof bicause telleth destruction also cast selues aduaunced pryde presumption stubbornnesse always lowly minded short scholers iesus christ must need cheered doctrine according saying come vnto mee yee labour heauie loden refresh let haue charge vtter god word loke well make doctrine carrie found sweete amiable oppressed ouerwhelmed selues knowledge owne wantes misery therewithall deale roughly let towards haue need roughly handled tamed reason hardnesse nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledging sinnes praying hee hath made v perceyue also giue v suche repentance wee may hartely desire healed remedy hee sendeth v much worde true medicine purge oure disease make worke effectually hee hath giuen v health hee feede v selfesame foode strengthen v therby may shewe effect howe liueth v therefore may liue worlde fleshe notwithstanding dwell liuing may feed soules worde vntill hee haue called v intoo kingdome heauen angel wee shall neede teaching haue meanes whiche requisite oure infirmitie nowe maye please graunt grace onely v also people nation earth c cviij sermon first vpon xxx chapter novve mocke mee vvhich yonger vvhose father haue refused set vvith dogges flocke vvhereto strength handes serue seeing age vvas perished destitute meanes dearth famine fled place vvas solitiarie dark desolate vvaste cut vp vveedes tree iuniper roote vvas meate vvere chased among men men shouted theefe dvvelt cleft riuers caues earth rockes roared among tree gathered themselues togither vnder bush child fooles yea child vvithoute renoume vvere brought lovver earth novv song matter talke vpon abhorre flee farre forbeare spit face haue seene honoure wherein iob bene time rehersing ende comparing reproche wherein hee hee might shewe howe cause bee sad intollerable greefe see himselfe scorned extremitie euen feared stood awe afore nowe man hath beene aduaunced great honour hyghe estate afterwarde seeth himselfe despized naturall thing bee greeued thereat looketh vpon thing left vpon excellent state whence hee falne poore man shall haue liued home countrie neuer tasted honoure pompe alwayes poynt selfe menne scorne disdayne shewe token contempt towardes person good men also shall haue lyued simplicitie bee greatly greeued ouerpasse hath bene brought vp pleasure hath aboundance rich abyde shame without deadly wounding heart bicause men hilde estimation althoughe men come spyte face yet bee anye crooked dealing tendeth shaking contempte greeueth sore yee see howe naturall thing haue bin honour vnable beare owne defacing bee greued thing iob declareth heere like declared reuerence men bere vnto much men gaue eare respecte rich bycause god giuen wisedome discretion aboue menne might rest vpon hee mirroure pattern al vertue take example whole life nowe sawe himselfe scorned euerie man pointed finger crosse much heauier bitterer beare neuer bene aduaunced heretofore heereof haue good lesson gather commonly man noozeled pleasure therby waxeth ouertender much profite brought vp honoure men shoulde neuer displease v speake thing v shoulde rather tickle eare scratch vvhy knowe lord commendeth v aboue thing pacient acknowledge faultes bee blamed face men yeelde v honoure rather scorne v let put v mynde haue honoured god whome honour belongeth therefore good reason wee receyue reward shame vpon head god intendeth trie lowlynesse behalfe oure meeke receyuing iniuries men doe vnto v withoute stomaking delicate bringing vp v pleasure sayde causeth v vnpacient wee beare thing soone man doth poynte v finger greeueth v yea corzie v wee wote whiche way turne v lorde inure v suffering wrong nd reproches let v learne therin procureth welfare profite intent bee whole sounde say cause sainte paule saith behoueth v armed side may passe shame reproch well honour god list haue v estimination let v therevpon gather shall alwayes continue state nother let v sotte selues vaine glorie ambition let v vnderstand lord bindeth v much vnto good edifying neyghboures vvhen man preheminence hee ought consider men looke vppon lorde hath set candle cubbard table giue light therefore standeth hande walke carefully beware hee giueth occasion stumbling vnto man thus yee see howe honoure god gyueth v ought bee applyed oure vayne glorie edifying oure neyghbours side also let v marke howe saint paule saith behoueth v throughly acquainted reproches haue eares beaten men slaunder v let v neuerthelesse take good woorth yet notwithstanding let v take good heede scoffing v may fault furthermore conscience bee cleere god wee sure raile vpon v backbite v malice without cause let v put ouer wholly vnto god contente selues allowance therewithal said let v vtterly inured thervnto long time lewde thing men tender haue eares nice able beare misreport thus yee see haue marke text muche doctrine harde practize let v also marke example giuen v scripture behold dauid take man renoumed among others bin king continued suche prosperitie openly seene god guided hand aduanced worldly mean owne pollycie suche sorte god meent shewe speciall working owne power bene honored behold afflicted turning hande yea owne sonne stone throwne heade semei owne subiect persecuted deede word spited saying thou murtherer thou receyuest thy payment vvherein vpbraideth god sente reward due cruelty hee committed house saule neuerthelesse dauid might well haue beene inflamed anger againste semei specially considering circumstance wee haue touched sawe owne subiecte bend selfe openly beeing excellent renoumed king firste formost calleth mynde god whiche exalted yea hee done owne meere grace whereas nowe cast downe came casualtie misfortune god wil would haue bayted men god saith hath appoynted semeis outrage pride allowed god bicause dauid knew came passe without heuenly prouidece therfore hu bleth selfe furtherance heereof booted greatly hee beene brought vp poore countrey cloyne sheepeheard netehearde wyth father youth hee kepte father lambes brought vp dayntily knowe bescorned bringing vp therfore greatly profite heere yee see sayde god waken v rather suffer v bee alwayes flattered men would bee oure behoofe vvherefore let v vnderstand men vse missayings raylings v god doth meanes prepare v ende shoulde strange v hee listed nowe abace v nowe extremity betide v lorde prepareth v pacience therevpon let v marke example dauid man subiect passion wee bee yet notwithstanding submitteth himselfe wiilingly perceiued bee god hee bee torne peeces yea though wrongfully matter must greeue v rather must bee good cheere conscience aunswereth well v god wee knowe men persecute v wrongfully saye thing ought vphold v better must foolishe say nowe cause men find scorne sort true wee reproched oure sinnes sake ought frame v much vnto pacience lord suffer v slandered scorned whe notwithstanding wee shall haue liued well haue giuen occasion wicked backbiter doe v iniurie let v assure ourselues lord hath graunted v singular grace exempting v spitefulnesse men ill towards v without cause therefore haue v suffer vniustly let v passe thorough thinke strange thus ye see doctrine haue gather vpon texte behoueth v marke although gracious giftes benefites shall haue receiued god hande ought comforte v affliction yet notwithstanding possible haue bin estimation great greefe dubble hartsore v see selues scorned afterwarde yet behoueth v resiste temptation pacience must bee senslesnesse consisteth fele thing declared iob yet neuerthelesse take courage walke stil god please wee shall bee wrongfully slaundered wee arme selues battels may bee foyled euer world go thing sathan practizeth stirring vp maliciouse folke inforcing slaunder backebite v wee conclude wee haue lost oure time dooing good vvhat haue indeuered lyue without blame haue streined selfe doe good euerie man man say haue eyther done hurt harme yet see persecuted manner vvhat haue gayned walking vprightly thus ye see craft pollicie sathan make v beleeue wee lose oure laboure good therevpon carrie v away sticke anoy hinder men otherside let v marke men vnkindnesse ought prouoke v much remit selues wholly vnto god beeing sure hee whome must yeelde account allowing v ought suffise v wee see men vnthankfull towardes v wee haue indeuered doe good turne spit oure face burden v false slaunders let v assure selues thereby god calleth v hee say haue walke face therefore shall recompenced nowe bylowe contented haue obeyed point vvheras men rayle vpon ende shoulde stay selues nother vpon vpon opinion beeled suche fondnesse say haue well deserued men praise vertues thus yee see sorte wee ought fight temptation spoken heere waye let v marke lorde ment giue v singular instruction chaunges heere meane chaunge happened vntoo iob chaunges see holie scripture behold dayly eye reade heathen story first declared yesterday aduaunced honoure dignitie haue bridle reine backe warranting selues continue alwayes state make know turning hande god onely shake also vtterly ouerthrowe hyghnesse wherein hath set stead honour hath gyuen shall see selues assaulted side wrong scornings slander yee see suche feare god ought brydle selues state dignitie make account earely late maye chaunge god proue meekenesse giue menne libertie scorne doe many outrage also see verie paynim knewe haue made many common prouerbes whiche serue take away excuse v true ill put vre bycause hard men hold themselues sober haue world fortune terme doth smile vpon common vice among men besotte themselues prosperitie wee well ynough say fewe v take heede although saying ordinary euery men confesse bee true namely man ought glorie prosperitie sotte beleeue shall tarrie euer ought thinke vpon change alteration may happen yet notwithstanding man applyeth indeuer doe therefore muche behoueth v take payne bycause wee see oure selues soone ouertaken delightes gloriousnesse world end therefore man suffer selfe caried away inordinate lustes behoueth v marke doctrine muche better set downe heere let menne feare god bethinke selues whyle honoure god well able bring downe yea muste promise selues eyther monethes dayes dispose themselues euerie minute haue shoulder readie beare burthen reproch euer shall please god put shame men marke one point surely considering frowardnesse see worlde noweadayes standeth v much hande take warning hereof wonder man walketh vprightly honoured day true wicked may bee held short spite teeth shall fayne leaue vertue yet misse afterward fall againe outrage slander good turne light darknesse although god haue ingraued suche insight despisers maiestie commend thing know proceede yet neuerthelesse fal rage shut eye become brutishe wilfully intent spue blasphemy raylings god giftes grace holie spirite therefore wonder though suche feare god walke soundnesse life subiect many slaunders reuylings specially seeing satan thrusteth forwarde wicked sorte bereauing modestie yea inflaming firie rage vve see thing commonly therefore behoueth v bee warned passe wrong slaunders world way euer god listeth haue v reuyled sort bee reason sinnes sayd afore haue much cause hold oure tung beare reproche quietly wee haue deserued iust hire fault therevppon behoueth euerie man bethinke selfe aduisedly sone man shall backbite v mocke v make v tale laughingstocke wee must learne acknowledge god putteth v mind make oure owne accusation euen heathen men could well skil say deadly enemy oftentimes profite v freendes freendes beare v causeth v feede oure owne vice although intent bee flatter v yet notwithstanding gentlenesse vse bearing v cause thinke vpon imperfection amend enemy doe prie vpon v seeke meanes lay open faultes v therefore man findeth faulte v scoffeth v behoueth v thinke thus gotoo see god citeth make mine owne proces accuse selfe may bee mine owne iudge condemne selfe shame may couered buried lo howe wee ought deale behalfe knowe speake euill v haue reason doe although doe malice yet notwithstanding let v reply say man led desire reuenge let v looke thing let v pleade guiltie pray god blot offence end may quit god worlde yea wee know reason partie shoulde speake euill v behalfe yet let v acknowledge though faultie poynte whereof blamed yet many vice whereof guiltie god spareth mee haue come knowledge men pleased stur abroade filthinesse stinke would bee let v consider say meanes god intendeth set secretely eye sinnes whiche wee would haue caste behinde oure backe make v hate euill v withoute anye flattering oure selues marke second point finally conscience cleere point respectes vtterly faultlesse like angel bycause wee see men haue cause persecute v wrongfully oursuffering haue followed god word executing oute office dutie faithfully say men blame v indeed ful rancour malice let v assure selues lordes oure receyuing rewarde shall ende wee looke better hande sayd afore see cause vtterly abashed selues let v therfore ceasse say lorde thou art rightuous euer come thus yee see poynt behoueth v come heerewithall let v indeuer profite oure selues chastizementes whiche god sendeth v day day let v vnderstand thereby god intendeth fashion v yeelde prayse glorifie euen wesee good men reproch like euerie v ought bee pacient pacience prayse god thing suffereth also muste wee blame wee see suffer good men slaundered vvherefore let v muche greeued wee see honest man slaundered reuyled men tung run riot vvee see happened vnto iob hee haue sayde patterne holinesse yet notwithstanding wee see reproche seemeth bee vtterly past recouerie blame god behalfe skorne nay rather wee see affliction happen vnto vertuous man ought humble selues although reason god doth apparant vnto v yet notwithstanding let v assure selues doth without cause therefore ought glorifie iudgements although incomprehensible v marke againe one point let v come proude disdaine disdayne also villanously reuile whome god hathe honoured giuing excellent vertues heere wee see person whome iob speaketh detestable vice man condemneth pryde rather shamefull beastlinesse rascal naughtipackes lifte vp themselues man whome ought honoure reuerence vertues behold dogges bark yea barke bite haue seene alreadie iob none credite rich authoritie worldly respect vertues bycause men saw markes god glorie yet yee see heere rascalles ribawdes suche haue skill either honoure honestie doe rushe raile vpon tung see ye intollerable villanie may man compare curre dogges barke gnashe teeth although bite vice borne withall bee conuinced verie truth reason condemned vvherefore let v learne follow mislike condemn others god maketh chaunges man falleth downe whereas bene great estimation afore let v farre ouerseene crie let come remembrance making alteration worlde god intendeth waken euerie v presumptuous according owne nature muche inclyned therevnto poore man neuer credite estimation world hath heard talke nowe see great personage cast downe mountaine fell downe else thinke oure lorde intendeth set muche greater brightnesse vpon iudgementes intente shoulde consider selfe heere sillie woorme doe creepe vpon earth suche one soare aboue cloudes yet notwithstanding see god hath cast downe myne eye vvell arte thou starke foole thou prayse esteeme thy selfe yee see howe little one ought take warning walke feare carefulnesse lord doth cast downe greate one eye must consider partes hee cast downe likewise soeuer go aduaunce selues stately soeuer men god able inough plucke high nestes setled degree shall seeme vnto fortune doe thing agaynste god shewe purpose men fancie fortune doe god stretcheth hande thing nowe prince great men worlde ought bee afrayde see god thunder vppon myghtie one aduaunced th hie degree pray ought meanest sorte doe furthermore let v well aduised also wee lifte vp selues men good sooth thing agaynste nature man hathe nothing hym worthie commendation doth vaunt himselfe others men may alwayes say arte thou put cace man deserue bee set light yet thee doe despise man bycause hee rich bycause wise bycause hee hath commendable quality bycause gentleman shal finde thing v vvhat bee doone lowe degree behaue themselues lowely thoughe wee great yet behoueth v stoupe according sainte paule admonisheth v wee god child hie degree must stoup make selfe equall little one yea euen least nowe bee destitute vertue knowledge nobilitie worldly goodes haue nothing boast yet rushe poore man troden vnder foote doe deserue bee abhorred whole worlde let v take warning text looke well selues man bee brought contempte let v consider much might befall vnto v therefore let v holde oure tung instruction whiche wee haue take nowe lesson well printed mynde wee see manye backbytings raylings scoffing worlde euerie v woulde take selfe nose saye truely thoughe man haue vertue ryches authoritie yet notwithstanding man shall finde selfe perfecte god gyueth many cause hang downe heade therefore euerie v examine throughly selfe surely wee shall bee hilde within boundes modestie wee shall despise vnder foote vaunt selues whome lord putteth reproch thus ye see haue beare minde nowe let v come iobs woordes sayth yong folke mocked yea euen whose father hee woulde haue vouchsafed haue made g eepers lde seme iob speaketh great scornfulnesse gathereth togither al possible disdain scorned saith father beggers helde scorne seruice rascalles poore steruelings scraped vp earth nayles gather rootes eate berry iuniper woodes nowe see self scorned seemeth say first blushe iob inflamed scornfulnesse presumptio like haue declared heretofore hee expres ed temptation hee felte yet consented vnto behoueth v remember text iob loketh vpon thing yet meane ceasseth fight againste gripe gnawed hart maree intent might paciently beare reproches surely scorned haue comendable thing much hard strange v vve bee despized honest men handes consider must sooth selues cace make excuse cause seing men find fault v wicked vnruly ful al shamefulnesse mock v surely extremitie maketh reproche seeme greater greeued thus ye se iob loked saying abiects lift vp theselues let v mark well howe iob hath declared heretofore honored rich high estate noble birth thing wheron grounded self bicause walked great vprightnesse perfectio sight vertues god put men constreyned yeelde reuerence abused grace ye see thought hard greuous cace despised whome nothing worthie praise howbeit forasmuch see iob brought low let v vnderstand lord send like day behoueth v strengthned example therfore although thing heauy hard v beare yet notwithstanding let v mylde stoupe often shall please god afflict v verely ther euen natural reason ought teach v vve must thinke strange though verlets suche haue neither honestie good qualitie maners rush rayling see come passe dayly thing custome ordinarie v ought seeme noueltie wee ought throughly acquainted besides naturall reason let v also cosider haue touched alredy lord intent trie pacience better casteth v manner contempt authoritie estimatio also veriest shakerags would thinke selues bee assaulted rather brute beastes men therefore lord afflicteth v mean meeken v vve see general thing euen vnto mankynd howe hapneth louse flea fly vermine make warre great small man exempt although al men bee combred filth stinck yet notwithstanding lord maketh v subiect wormes anoy v eue though king prince euerie one v must abyde wherfore humble v let v marke god wil putteth v extremitie person bace state vaut selues v alwayes ende take away vaineglorie presumption v vvherfore behalfe let v men haue put themselues hand god say lord see self vtterly vnderfoote last cast vouchsafe thou slake thy hand draw reproch wherevnto thou hast put butherewithall behoueth v also readie behaue ourselues well thing whiche wee see ordinarily whiche whiche crouch creepe play liamhounds man whe authoritie credit redie leap neck soone state chaunged see ouerthrowne excesse seeme take plesure hereby ye see maliciousnesse hid therfore like euerie v ought armed afore leaue reproches paciently also let euerie v trie himselfe ende may behaue himselfe wisely cace sometimes wee honoure whome god abhorreth perceiue peece hypocrisie v much god ouerthrowe oftentimes first shall runne vpon vve see example story souldiours haue risen owne prince looke vpon great captaines whiche haue borne sway made quake yee shall see great prince hath bin ouerthrowne euen hazarded liues defence shall either gratifie successour enemie fall practising treason committing cruelty enemy would haue done enemie woulde haue shewed pitie earst hazarded liues safetie doe passe outrage much cruelly furiously vvhen wee see example let v call wittes v beware infected vice moreouer man might say iob seemeth bee contrarie selfe sayth hee would haue vouchsafed haue set father keeper dogges flock last chapter shewed himselfe bee great curtesie hee father fatherlesse defender widowes also eye blinde fote lame say compassion poore folkes vsed kyndnesse towardes succoring therfore say hee vouchsafed match father dogges seemeth cleane contrarie let v marke iob speaketh heere owne disposition towards thing self say worlde counted father worthy keepe dogges thus yee see effecte iob ment signifie yet must beare mind although men haue thing woorthy estimation must therefore disdeyne know bee god creature suche resemble selues therefore let v honour whosoeuer hiest degree may perchance alledge sort himselfe rest men yet notwythstanding though king must haue brotherhood poorest shepeherds neatherds world except hee put owne nature doubt cheefe excellentest thing king hathe say manhood hath shepehearde aswell hee sayth king come suche princely stocke freends men discended adam afterward noe surely touching linage world seeth go noblest renowmed lynages best insomuch ofte time better bee shepeherdes sonne countrey borne honest father mother bee sonne great personage estimation world may oftentimes sonne theefe brothell notwithstanding aduaunced high degree therefore thing wherein ought glory contrariwise must come backe againe poynt hee spake excellentest thing king hathe himselfe man haue neateheards countrie well king therefore lette great honourable personage world boast selues much list may make great bragges behalfe yet shall men still veriest rascalles miserablest men whome despise well vvherefore let v consider god hath made v one selfesame nature set vnion among v behalfe end binde v one another thus ye see iob ment text therefore let v marke rehersall hee maketh liuely picture wherein god sheweth v chaunges alteration world ende wedded passe longing heauenly life shal haue continual stedfastnesse also let v learne know presente life nothing frailtie miserie shall always subiect vnto vntill god haue taken v hence make v parttakers euerlasting rest hath prepared v heauen nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement oure faultes praying make v feele suche wise wee maye learne condemne oureselues according deede wee haue cursednesse therewithall afflict v wee may meanes inured sorie oure offence mourne referring selues vnto praying deface fault haue committed wipe reme brance also men intent life may stumbling blocke edifying vnto men v greate small may learne frame selues obedience hauing mutuall felowship one may liue toogither good peace brotherly loue beholding chaunges worlde bee led hope heauenly life ende wee may passe heere bylowe pilgrimage wherein hee haue v rest may please graunt grace v also al people nation earth c cix sermon second vpon xxx chapter bicause lorde hath broken corde afflicted mee also haue broken brydle mee theyong men rise vp one side pinched feete yea beset pathes stumblingblockes marred vvay indeuered hurt man helped came ouerflovving riuer persecuted vvrongfully reason calamitie feare turned vpon pursued mine excellencie vvinde vvelfare passed avvay cloude soule vvas poured vpon time aduersitie caught holde bone perced night rest clothing hath chaunged coloure greatnesse miserie hemme garment cleaueth hath cast ground become dust ash vvhen crie vnto thee thou hearest although vvaite thou regardest thou art become cruell vnto art vvith strength thy hand bycause iob heeretofore declared menne value stepped vppe malapertly againste hee addeth suche thing coulde haue beene doone vnto god broken strength suche wise hee weakened yea vtterly made feeble worldward euerie man might despise thing meeneth similitude god broken sinew cord meening vphild hand god haue strong rope holde like god breake rope wee slide awaye longer abide goeth wrecke v thus yee see howe iobs meening rascalles beare countenaunce al assayled malapertly ne durste haue set themselues againste vnlesse god refte strength lefte nothing mainteyne state true expounde texte iob say men made beast one let looce another tied vp againe much streyned vvee see naturall sense pointe well worthy bee noted men doe rayle sorte v behoueth v always come back similitude god hath loozened v knitting cace bodie without sinewes like fagot sheaf corne like thing vnbounde thing holde togither selfe neede gathered vp hilde togither otherwise nowe selues haue thing keepe v togither therefore behoueth lord bind v vp marke one poynte contrarie parte also pleaseth vnbinde v wee fall asunder nothing mainteine v muche menne shall haue full scope ouer v meene euen veriest rascal vve haue seene heretofore howe office god girde king girdle also cut girdle asunder whereby signified vnto v king prince authoritie bycause god hathe committed sword vnto holdeth fast haue reuerenced contrariwise god listeth cut gyrdle asunder power strength authoritie woman much lesse heere wee haue generall doctrine euerie man must apply selfe whiche wee haue apparant vertue strength wee must imagin come selues bicause god strengthneth v therefore let v alwayes submit oure selues vntoo ende wee bee touched vaine presumption god seeth men imagine haue thing selues hee hath giuen hee bereeueth make better aduised knowe grace howe ought haue esteemed time hee made feele vvherefore sayd let v learne surmize vertue strength oure selues let v acknowledge vphild hand god like sheafe corne held togither band therwithal let v know also lord list vnbind v vntie cord immediatly shal fall asunder haue abiding state forth pleaseth continue grace towards v happen trampled vnder foote bee troubled incombered yet haue helpe meane reuenge oure selues let v call rememberaunce men shoulde haue aduauntage v except giuen aboue much lorde maketh v despised euerie man lift vp himselfe v behoueth v beare lesson well mynde humble selues withall vntill wee haue skill knowe god putteth v reproch also giueth men leaue persecute v shal neuer tamed wee ought bee marke one pointe iob hath spoken hee addeth like complaintes say yong men couched downe heeretofore rose vp one side tripped vp heeles make fall cast stone way dash stumble heereby hee meeneth mocked side reuerence spake short meeneth god layde open iniuries afterward addeth soule vexed vvherfore hee sheweth hee wounded throughe might fall man mocked passe greatly iob sheweth reproches iniuries men vnto touched hearte cause hee sayeth soule beene persecuted welfare plucked hebrue worde vseth doth properly signifie royall princely excellent also bou tifull liberall willing freeharted worde soule expressed therefore seemeth iob ment name soule terme royall princely noblest freest liberallest boutifullest part like king prince termed bountifull liberall bicause full liberalitie haue wherewith howbeit much manner hebrewe tung diuers time repete one thing twice else set two wordes neere signification one tende one ende verie meening text iob sayth highnesse ouerthrowne welfare taken quite first therefore setteth downe worde excellencie highnesse afterward addeth word welfare hath scope naturall meening whereas hee bene great dignitie nowe quite dashed whereas bin well garded might seeme aduersitie coulde euer haue touched welfare appayred oppressed men become almost vtterly destitute comfort vsed theretofore hereby alwayes put mynde touched yesterday fense oure selues chaunges seeing wee haue example iob excellent among menne time state bin noble man behold god setteth horrible gasingstocke euerie man bin readie serue hin seemed whole worlde haue fauored yet notwithstanding euen earst bin freends become wild beast raged bereaue welfare much see let v prepare ourselues please god afflict v sort let trouble v measure seeing happened vnto iob although god exercised seruaunt wise time hee might seeme haue vtterly forsaken yet notwithstanding see looked alwayes vpon pitie issue sheweth vaine haue wayghted leysure whose hand receiued many benefites haue called vpon haue fled refuge therefore let v like let v repose selues vpon god goodnesse let v hold v always promise make v feele ende shall none towards v towardes iob furthermore although stand vpon euery word behoueth euerie v mynde thing treated iob ment expresse vnto v state miserable able make hair stand vp vpon head first formost haue shewed excuseth himselfe impaciencie tormenting bicause affliction greued excessiuenesse caused doe meane let v doubt holie ghoste speaketh mouth intent oure aduersities seeme great vnable bee borne wee may compare thing hapned iob seeing scourged much must nyce childishe oure aduersities pinch v think god afflicteth v sore let v say happen much vnto iob yea miserie hee indured much excessiue outrageous yee see must learn pacience declared length touching aduersities iob suffered herewithall commeth purpose thing whiche haue touched wit miserie iob indured mocked scorned wronged men also cast downe although man enemy mocke perceiue well backebyte side yet rest himselfe man shall greatly tormented vtterly dismayed indure vndoubtedly man see suche crueltie men satisfyed miserie hee indureth also fall blowing fire greeuing see good halfe deade alreadie euerie man striketh murther increase torment wherwith alreadie afflicted vttermoste augmenteth greef anguish much thus ye see iob ment streine sayth terrour tooke hold rest pulse beat continually releef like man continuall ague tormented hath leysure take breath iob complaint signifieth hee onely mocked diuers yet forsake meate drinke myrth able defend theselues though men practize euil able bring passe contrariwise sheweth afflicted stoode feare vnder worde feare hee comprehendeth anguish wee feele either lord god men set themselues v yea word importeth much heauinesse anguishe heauinesse greef aduersities present feare sawe death threaten v wee besieged many daungers imagin indeede miserie alreadie nothing suche miserie may happen moreouer peraduenture also side yet another therefore foresee daungers seemeth vnto v bee escaped one death commeth second thirde short assayled side thing stryketh hart dead iob meeneth saying feare caught holde within text ought bee well marked v chiefe benefit wee haue men also naturally desire safetie god also hee speaketh blissings doeth aboue thing promise v rest custodie shall sleepe ease without feare beeing waked shall feare sleepe euen vnder tree highe wayes side although wee neither doore barre lock key chamber yet shall safe vnder protection neuerthelesse wee see iob sayeth possessed feare seemeth hee trust god consequently bereft souerain benefit desire god hath promised child verely faythfull shal always haue finally rest theselues may cheerfull aduersities bycause rest vpon god goodnesse know well neuer forget ye see rest neuer fail al faithful long trust god iob well feele part herewithall let v mark god cast seruants trouble meane little shall know ioy holy ghost ouerwhelmed choked cannot resort vnto god warrant themselues watcheth ouer sure say howsoeuer world goeth yet god preserue indeed perceyue minded succour yet tary leysure paciently faithfull may time scarce fully doubt shall tossed great waues stormes shall know becom shall caried violence tossed turmoyled fashion rest shall bee turned trouble done behoueth v vnderstande first peaceable yea euen middest aduersities standeth v hande flee god doubt promising bee alwayes v vaine therefore let v mind god promise may armed side may bee quiet middest aduersities none safetie v hope succour god hand long haue cannot fal vpon foot prouerbe sayth assone bee turned away god cannot beleue helpe v hath fatherly care welfare wee vtterly dismayed amazed knowe meanes world quiet selues therefore let v learne settle selues god promise wil ouerwhelmed trembling fearefulnesse middes aduersityes furthermore fore oppressed knowe become yet let v ceasse resort god hoping hee chace away oure darknesse suffer v continue alwayes suche distresse remedie asswagement sorrowes sith wee see like happened vnto iob also vnto dauid two myriours pacience fayth hope let v bee much discomforted seemeth infirmitie fleshe vtterly ouerwhelmed aduersitie seazed feare vtterly forlorne surely god worke continually faythfull one although woorke appeare eye yet shall feele truly although faythfull bee anguish feare seemeth bee hope goodnesse god yet shal quayle succored notwithstanding able perceyue succour natural reason thus ye see wee ought proceede heauinesse howe wee ought practise doctrine profite oure selues iob addeth god cast ground become like dust ash erst sayde garment chaunged cleaued skin thereby sheweth vtterly ouerthrowne one sparke hope lyfe left insomuch might haue bin sayde beholde man vtterly consumed reigneth nothing death wordes carth dust ash onely meeneth strength fayled also hee become dead coarse yea euen good halfe rotten iob sheweth right wel token life extreeme affliction indured rather hee condemned yea euen men wherein shewed v trust muste bee tyed thing seene wee muste trust god yea euen middest death wee seeme bee past recouerie yet notwithstanding wee must take holde life god hathe promised v continually imbrace herewithall let v marke also god power subiect humaine worldely meanes hee worketh fashion incomprehensible secrete vntoo v lo two thing wee haue marke text goe ioyntly one another haue wee sayde fayth muste bee inclosed thing wee see bycause grounded vpon power god power infinite may bee compassed ruled worldly meanes ought seene god able worke maner vnknowne v seeing behoueth fayth also inlarged lykewise better vnderstanding doctrine let v begin seconde poynt haue touched god power whereby intendeth work welfare bouded within lower thing therfore wee must say god thus thus bycause order nature bycause wee see likelihood bycause meane helpe compasse doo great wrong inasmuch thing infinite therfore must inclose god mightie power within imagination vnderstanding like god goodnesse endlesse bottomlesse pit also wisdome rightuousnesse said power would comprehende mightinesse power pray wee able inclose brayne impossible let v marke well god intendeth saue v doeth common fashion worketh miracle towards v insomuch rayse v euen death cause chalengeth office sending men graue talling backe againe also sayd psalme issue outgoings death hand god vvhen sayde god ende faythfull shoulde taste neerenesse god hee shoulde make feele thing experience conteyned heere namely hath issue death hande issue death shall haue reigned ouer v seeme vtterly ouerwhelmed hope life lord well quicken v yea euen wonderfull fashion vnknowne vntoo v men cannot perceiue vntill shewed effect cause also ezechiell vision giuen god vttered worde bone drye wherein substaunce came togither sinewes knitte againe breath liuelinesse came became liuing men thus ye see howe ought bee grounded vpon inestimable power god wit commeth trusting must fall reasoning hath god meanes thing likely haue wee thing v god knoweth howe deale therefore let v wayte hande sayde behoueth sayth bee inlarged vpon mightie power god seeing god mightie power measured inclosed made subiect worldly naturall meanes beleefe also must stretch hie lowe become infinite verely neuer perfect ought shal haue little pece yet must labor forward although beleefe weake haue receyued measure yet must alwayes tend marke vvhat marke euen rest selues god wayte helpe hande shall wayte must rest vpon earthly thing euery one v must stirre vp himselfe consider well lord thou art almightte therefore thou wilt saue v thy mightie power vnknowne v yet lo shewed v streyne seeing god hath giuen v proofe mightie power person iob let confirme v much ende iob hath spoken wrong reproches done vntoo complained feare wherewith seazed directeth himselfe vnto god sayeth althoughe turned himselfe vnto god call vpon heard yea ld wayted god leysure god pitied ne made countenance regard worse turned toward cruell person surely greeuousest temptation myghte bee aduersitie happen vntoo v wee knowe god setting v worlde condition wee tempted diuers wayes martyred many misery intent shewe v transitorie lyfe nothing woorth againe wee haue sorrowe frayltie beareth wee bee stoute ynough comfort selues impute still feblenesse nature flee vnto god yet feele ease hand rather dissembleth tyme seemeth bee lost praying vnto vtter extremitie vvhy soueraine remedie whiche god giueth v hee sayeth come vnto mee afterdeale yea good deade shall perceyue haue power quicken recouer quayled rayse vp dead fetch graues suncken yea euen deepe might seeme neuer come god therfore liberall ynough promise v wil neuer refuze prayer come seke shrinketh away seemeth deaf temptation able ouerwhelme v vtterly therfore let v mark well text iob ment declare come euen vnto hel chastized common fashion god outward appearance forsaken might coclude haue hitherto bin deceyued seruing god haue beguiled self hoping would helpe sauiour deed sayth seruants shall afflicted howbeit calleth saying cal vpon day thy trouble heare thee thou shalt glorifie ought hope life eue death power behold god openeth v gate sayth nere call vpon truth saith iob seeke thee nd thee call vpon thee thou answerest knock gate still kept shut vvhy sayth man might first demaund whether god hath performed sayd promise wich made al faithfull nere call vpon although textes yet written yet god cease haue pitie vpon continually howbeit causing written afterward declared one one hath always shewed iob lost labor praying vnto god promise haue bin false god wil nere vnto call vpon truth heare cal vpo graunt whatsoeuer asked name lord iesus christ yea readie succor v open mouth let v mark wel although iob perceyue god would succor yet notwithstanding knew end god also made feele according see eue come passe let v marke say wee must iudge god help according euery moment time great restrayning wee must tary end though see lord openeth eares request yet shall end affliction always happy continue calling vpon howsoeuer world go v let v surmize wil heare v besech see happened vnto iob sayth shall cry heard threatning light vpon none vnbeleuers crie namely fayth hope certaine promise spoken shal vnfallible forasmuch cry faythlesse howling roaring without trust god although know without forlorne fordone yet set mind vpon therfore heard vvherfore sith see temptation cry heard light vpo iob let v coclude god make cou tenace heare v reiecteth prayer passeth holdeth aloof make v cotinue praier inough haue praied haue said ala lord wilt thou pitie must hold delay wee must cease passe yet stil vntil know hath heard v furthermore let v mark wel although god pretend heare prayer yet notwithstanding sheweth heareth behold iob co plaineth hee cried heard bin vtterly ouerwhelmed lord heard request beit perceiued thus ye see lord worketh oftentimes v yet imagination cannot discern helpeth v stad scanning maner god helpeth v entreth vnderstading vvhy rude grosse neuerthelesse lord sheweth v time ceassed neere v eue thought forsaken v although neerenesse secrete yet ceassed make power droppe v cotinually let v inure ourselues temptation namely pray vnto god trouble feele ease rather mischeef increaseth god whetteth himselfe agaynst v greeue v wee seeke vnto wee must therefore hope tarie leysure paciently say truth lord battaile right sore seeing iob weake man wee bee hath passed way let v pray god strengthen v holy spirit grace hee shewed iob time dauid time rest faythfull theyr tymes abated day ye see behoueth v fight till haue fully gotten vpper hand temptation greatest others call vpon god herd yet iob sayeth thou hast turned thy selfe agaynst art become though thou wert cruell saying hee meeneth onely deliuered misery aduersities eased also fire seemed kindled gulf seemed open wider short appayred cace calling vpon god though hee put god mynde punishe may see great temptation man pray calamitie heard iob hath felt may also oftentimes feele farre greater greef looke neere vpon say calling vpon god doeth little auayle v seemeth rather prouoke dooing maketh feercer agaynst v thus ye bee importunate vpon mee giue much able beare rod light ticke little finger lay maine stroke drawe sworde beate downe ground seemeth erewhyles gaine nothing praying onely put god mind rough sharpe v vexe v make affliction greeuouser exceed farre consume v vtterly lo shall seeme vnto faythfull euery one v shall find done herevpon let v marke well declared hereby iob must think strange god listeth trie fayth sort say wee faint miserie shall increase although hee heare v first pretend bee yet still stirred v yet notwithstanding although thing come mind let v trust succour v according trouble increase also hee succour v sort hee suffer v quaile shall continually vphilde hande howbeeit vnknowne maner shall haue throughly exercised faith make v feele hee alienated v afflicted v thus ye see howe behooueth v practise sentence ende seeme heard may faint dismayed ouercome hold vttermost whatsoeuer temptation god sendeth v yea though see death present eye insomuch drowned gulf hell yet let v doubt like good god heard seruant iob also end giue good happie issue aduersities nowe let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement faultes praying touche v wise wee may turne true repentance exercised manifold want misery affliction linger vpon v temporall life may rightly humbled vnder obedience giue selues wholy seruice put selues hande acknowledging hath power authoritie ouer v middest distress wherewith wee bee combred may please asswage greefes grace holy spirit may still reioyce alwayes trust goodnesse euen till hee haue deliuered v necessity misery mortall life called v heauenly rest may please graunt grace onely v c cx sermon third vpon xxx chapter thou art become cruell vnto hast caught vp vvith force thy hand thou hast lifted mee vp aboue vvynde caused mee ryde vpon made vvitte fayle knovv thou vvilt put graue house appoynted liue yet shall none stretch hande thither although many crie affliction haue vvept vvith hard dayes hath soulebin sorie poore haue looked good euill come vppon mee vvayted light beholde heere darknesse bovvels boyle rest time aduersitie hathe caught holde mee go mourning crie congregation vvere brother dragon companion estriges skinne become blacke vpon bone dryed vp harpe turned vveeping organes voyce lamenting haue declared heretofore great temptation iob indured whe seemed praying god good last refuge aduersities souerain remedie neuer faile v seeme bee disappointed hope god doo make though deaf short profit prayer supplication hell gapeth open vpon v must needes fall vtter despaire god hold v back shew delaying succour v without cause god wrought singular power behalfe surely vtterly ouerwhelme finde relief misery praying vnto seing happened vnto iob let euery v dispose himselfe example god suffer v linger pain oftentimes commeth passe succored hand would wish let v tarrie paciently fight temptation yea let v indeuour also obey ynough v pray vnto god must also brydle affection aduersitie presse v troubled yet neuerthelesse must abide still stedfaftnesse spoken wee haue bin subiect good good god time let v continue end seemed v ouercharged yea euen mids aduersities let present example come remembrance end shew although god hyde himselfe seruaunts make feele working first yet neuer forgetteth heareth length perceyueth conueniet time let v remember apostle lesson faith must ioined pacience must exercised many battailes come triumph life ordeyned fight text followeth haue touched alreadie namely god shewed himselfe cruell towardes iob nowe hee speaketh accuse god vnrightuousnesse shewe extremitie paine felt tormented excessiue rigour wee maye well terme crueltie yet foloweth shoulde condemne god ye see iobs meening better conceyuing heereof let v beare minde hath bin declared heretofore namely faythful pressed hand god doo feele terrible anguishe possible bee expressed without cause dauid bewayling affliction god layd vpon vsed similitude namely brought bottome deepes light left bone rotten maree dried vp strength withered tongue cleaued roofe mouth condemned death remedie let v marke speaking expresse vehemencie greese wherewith poore faithfull one oppressed feele wrathe god mindes misgiue v god agaynste v passeth miseryes wee feare much doth distresse torment increase vnbeleeuers despisers god heathenish folke blockish looke vpon man hardned euill hee doth nothing scoffe religion vvell god scourge doubt shall enforced crie ala yet loketh hand striketh feeleth stripe hee thinketh god striketh whereas faythfull bycause knowe welfare consisteth fauor god fatherly goodnesse cofort themselues therewith middes aduersities god seeme become enimie haue shaken haue withdrawen fro although otherwise ease thing sell would haue yet notwithstanding conceiue hartgrief knowe become cause king ezechias sayd god cruel lion crushed bond asunder teeth ment ezechias find fault god stand contention vvhy doth liken lion wild beast commeth swallow vp pray crash breake asunder sayde afore expresse feare wherwith poore faithful one tormented feele god wrath perceyue owne sinnes see hee sheweth iudge must needes possessed anguish surmounteth bodily harmes therfore wheras iob coplayneth god turned crueltie meeneth god passeth measure vsed tyrannie vnrightuous expresseth grief excesse miserie wherin yet notwithstanding let v marke well iob speaketh doth man incombered wit therfore vtterly excused haue declared heretofore truely whensoeuer affection ouermayster v vnpossible think god speake reuerently ought vvhy affection blind speake god reuerece deserueth behoueth v gather wit v kepe quiet peasable seeing iob sheweth declareth former temptation dout speaketh vnaduisedly therefore must draw saying example though lawfull v follow let v consider although man indeuer bridle himselfe yet ouerrule infirmitie alwayes somewhat worthie blame condemned much ought heedfull brydle affection considering best cannot subiect vnto god requisite thus two thing haue note one god sheweth himselfe v stead receiuing v free goodnesse loue seemeth enimie owne sinnes reproue v see nothing signes curse vpon v canot must need extremely tormented marke one point necessarie lesson ende euery man may prepare afore hand wee come pinch may bee armed fall vtter despaire middest gulf may tast part god comfort wayte paciently good issue see therfore let v think thing bee desyred neuer haue anguish put feare meeter infidel despisers god become brutishe haue declared afore swine oxe feele miserie outward sense leadeth euen fare lewde persones doted vnderstanding would faine forget god thrust remembraunce name vnder foote contrarywise let v sure expedient v bee wakened drowsinesse feele god wrath ende may walk greater warinesse learne therby humble selues shall neuer know acknowledge owne weakenesse sufficiently till haue cyted themselues god sayd man happie trieth examineth himselfe behold retchlesnesse whe wit dulled high way destruction seing good expedient welfare bee carefull let v vnderstand without cause lorde maketh v feele wrath intent bethink v better sinnes mark one point second let v marke wee neuer bee brought well obedience god ruling affection ouergreat gainstriuings still according wee see although iob mirrour pacience yet notwithstanding well stayed ouermayster himselfe hee spake god proceeded reuerence hee ought haue done ranne hedlong temptatio wherof ouercome resisted although much ado seing passion v farre square let v learne hold prison haue well fought tame selues let v still consider much imperfection v god always find wherfore condemne v bare v infinite goodnesse lo haue note expresse great feare greef miserie iob touched withall addeth god lifted vp vpon winde made ride aire caused strength substance faile vvhen man caught vp caried away whirle winde dreadfull thing man beaten died woulde terrible god hoyseth vp aire sodaine tempest vve see iobs intent confirme matter hee hath declared wit god exerciseth tryeth seruaunts straunge fashion therfore let v conceyue god wrath onely according example wee haue seene eye felt owne experience let v vnderstand god try v meanes vnknowne v yea eue wise shall worse forlorne whe know let v also pray god strengthen v need although outwarde apparance wee see nothing side graue seemeth shoulde swallowed vp bodily death also hel yet notwithstading let v cease cotinue feare god rest always vpon trust goodnesse determining fully call vpon flee vnto alone refuge yea though sens withstood seemed v wee barred accesse vnto thus ye see haue minde verse let v thinke bee needlesse tale mention made windes stormes god making ride aire serueth shewe lorde hath straunge wayes chastice v pleaseth wee ought taken vnwares want hauing thought hand furthermore feele great outrageous affliction v let v assure oure selues bycause god beareth v ought suffer aduersitie grieued tormented reason may seeme vnto v let v take example iob thou art yet come extremitie good seruant god cause therof thy god hath respect thy feblenesse handle thee roughly though hee could well hath iust cause thou seest howe vseth gentlenesse still towards thee rigour soeuer thou feelest thou art yet martyred thou canst say come vpo thee cruel lio hath torne thee peeces thou canst alledge thing therefore thou mayst wel seeke thy good god returne vnto seeing sheweth himselfe kindharted pitiful towards thee wil stil thy father preseruer ye see comparison ought serue turne behoueth v master affection fele much hartburning repining selues tempted stomaking rebelling god behoueth v say thinke vpon thing set downe iob alledgeth vnto god poore fraile man neere vnto death therefore maruell god persecute roughly know sayth thou wilt sende mee graue house belongeth vnto liue seeing state men thou hast set heere make passe away moment shouldst thou trie thy self vtter thy force vpon lo iobs meening haue heard like sentence heretofore without cause repeated vndoubtedly god haue v pray vnto setteth infirmitie fraile state moue take v mercy ease v sayde psalme lorde knoweth dust haue passed world must faine come rottennesse seing know god spareth v pitieth misery ought promise moue v pray vnto sort another text said god forgiueth men sinnes bycause seeth shadow passeth vanisheth away therefore pray god deliuer v misery let v learne ought alledge wee selues nothing although haue life yet wee die turning hand insomuch euen cheef floure florishing time likened vnto grasse greene day cut downe tomorow ereth dryeth without moisture substance alledging thing vnto god make pitiful towards v deliuer v misery hath need put mind knoweth infirmity better selues therfore needeth aduertised like praying owne selues lykewise request reason alledge prayer owne vse profit man alledge vnto god poore fraile creature beholdeth teacheth lowlinesse think vpon state shall alwayes puffed vp pride else shal disposed ought obteine mercie lord bring v point ouerthrowne selues shal better disposed seke ayde yea greater earnestnesse desire forthermore lord also receiueth accepteth seruice demau deth aboue thing wit seruice broken lowly hart sayde psalme ye see alledging frailtie vnto god dust rottennesse yea bee nought worse nought must induce take v mercie let v mark also must repining mingled complaint wee may haue grudging hartburning surely iob good stay ought haue purpose sayth know must go graue euen house liuing creature doubt sheweth excesse passion wherewith hee tempted ouercome yet felt rebelling himselfe yelded peaceably god wil ought haue done say thou tryest mee thou persecutest must thou needes shewe thy selfe sharpe rygorous agaynst poore creature nothing behoueth v beware impaciencie heerein wee see corruption nature euen best thing v alwayes mingled faultinesse except god preserue v miracle sayd heretofore good holye thing men whiche smitten god hand obteining mercy alledge owne feeblenesse shewe life nothing haue anye strength death threatneth euery minute houre say good holye thing serueth humble v ende wee may offer vntoo god sacrifice pleaseth well yet notwithstanding turne thing euill according wee see present example man say vntoo god lorde thou knowest shadowe passeth vanisheth away strength smoke man say speake therewithall frette repyne bycause hee thinketh straunge god shoulde chastice doubt wicked cursed passing yet haue tolde complaint good profitable deede men withhold themselues mingling excesse alwayes peruerting thing good vngraciousnesse nature wee corrupt good turne euill much behoueth v stande alwayes vppon oure garde mistrust selues seeing wauering wee cannot follow right foorth thing god commaundeth v yet notwithstanding must therfore discofort selues lord take v good worth codemne excesse selues truly must vse flattery make selues beleue vice vice must codemne whe haue doubt lord receiueth v withall behoueth v returne iobs intet go graue sayth know none shal stretch hand thither god shal stretch hand thither natural sense neuer many men haue bewayled yet shall none stretche hande thither succour death hath caught mee remedie man helpe booteth vvee see iobs intent say seeing death taryeth v allotted v bee deade clean dispatched man succour v leastwise giue v truce wee bee heere vvhy vtterest thou great rigour agaynst v thus ye see effect iob ment say haue tolde alreadie wise may bee lawfull v vse complaynt witte without murmuring disputing way let v marke intent wee lift vp selues agaynst god ne stryue agaynst roddes wherewith hee scourgeth v extremitie behoueth v come one consideration although go forwarde vnto death haue alwayes one foote graue yet wee knowe god hath stretched hand deliuer v thence ende came iesus christ world yea went downe hell say suffered hee anguish due wretched sinner deliuer v men cannot nowe conceyue good hope bee comforted death al one would denie lord iesus christ hath suffered person whereas sonne god abaced farre subiect curse feele god hand agaynst end deliuer v death assure v victorie hath purchased v seeing hath power ouer death let resurrection alwayes come eies let v assure selues god hath stretched strong victorious hande deliuer v bondage satan therin let v consider although wee haue many aduersities suffer mortal life please god exercise v must thinke straunge enter intoo waylings complaint made say yea haue passed worlde must go graue man rescue wee shal rescued well ynough haue iesus christ redemer ordeyned bee pledge warrant hath abolished paynes death broken bandes satan burst open brasen gate set v free seeing know let v pacient middes al aduersities worlde assuring selues although haue battayls bylow haue rest prepared v aboue heauen fight manfully let v assure selues wee cannot triumph heauen thus ye see haue beare minde fencing arming selues agaynst temptation wherwith iob assaulted much ado withstand furthermore let v marke well thing addeth haut wept aduersitie hard sharpe dayes tymes soule sorrowfull poore afflicted haue looked good euill happened vntoo mee haue hoped light behold darkenesse hereby iob declareth seeth reason god dealeth roughly forasmuch prosperitie hee bene cruell pitifull towards poore heauinesse hee bene drunken pleasure alwayes considered misery man life hee wept weepe kept companie tormented aduersitie thus ye see iob alledgeth shewe reason afflicted surely god beateth v roddes commonly bicause seeth cannot beare owne ease flesh groweth ouerlustie else cruell towards neighbour lo heere two cause god doth ordinarily afflict v wee see also scripture hee threatneth doo passe bound prosperitie wo sayeth laugh shall weepe men cannot forbeare ouerreaching themselues bee rest thing fall woulde haue forget themselues think exempted aduersities drunken folkes like drunken man hath staye himselfe rusheth horne wilde beast euen fare part men god handleth gently say abuse goodnesse fling rouers giue bridle lust hath man meate drinke euen fill therevpon insueth whoredome shamfull wantonnesse yea blasphemy violence moreouer fond iests playes thing short man cannot hold good modestie long ease ye see cause god afflicteth men seeth behoofe corrected furthermore yet one inconuenience haue world passe poore men aduersitie despise set feete neck vve see respect sayde reproch sodom gomor behold aboundance bread therewithall pleasure crueltie vouchsafed succor need forsomuch ease wil intermeddle themselues trouble incumberances neighbor holde themselues earthly paradyse exempt themselues feeling greefs aduersities god must bee faine handle roughly turne commes forsomuch haue pitie compassion misery haue seene brother god must bee faine make fele force anon men would discharge themselues worldly misery god sheweth perforce must necessitie knowe themselues ye see doctrine wee haue mark god ordinarie afflicting men either bycause haue beene cruell time prosperitie bycause haue made themselues druken lawlesse pleasure erewithall let v marke also god might iustly keepe v occupied aduersities though foresayde cause hee hath secret determination wherof perceyue reason like hapned vnto iob cause iob complaineth seemeth god ought haue afflicted maner seing behaued aduisedly rather thinketh god shuld haue spared seing bin fellowlike freendly man bin sad sorie aduersitie hereby see wee haue two thing beare away one lord make v prosper haue peace rest necessarie v exempted greef time must delicate tender shrinking away fro shewing pitie compassion towards aduersitie must touched greefes neighbor mourne relieue power leastwise pray vnto god help none meanes thus ye see first doctrine haue marke furthermore let v fall slepe pleasure fo shold cotinually know thing certaine readie suffer whensoeuer shal please god first thing say haue beare minde must forget selues whe god spareth v cause prosperitie cotinueth stil v abuse haue said alredie secondly god send v affliction let v bethink selues wel examin whither haue bene sleepie time prosperitie hereby put mind know fault condemne god saying lord thou hast good cause punish v since time thou didst prosper v thy fauor haue forgotten thee layd brydle neckes taken much libertie therefore good reason thou shouldest punish v feele fruite sinne vnrulynesse lo howe wee ought call mynde former faultes god visiteth v affliction specially howe wee ought consider well whether wee haue beene vnmercifull towarde deserued succour wee haue made account others good reason lorde handle v roughly shuld lerne acknowlege fault lord sharpnesse rigor towards v mark one point yet although wee haue indeuored help neighbor haue compassion misery mourned mourne paul exhorteth v yet notwithstanding let v cease alwayes dispose ourselues suffering correction shall please god send v yea eue though know cause doth wee haue beene watchfull time prosperitie abused oure ease yet wil god misse handle v roughly aske doth reason manifest first doth humble v let v alwayes acknowledge rightuous cause sayd ought beare mind two reason distinctly first remeber threatnings written holy scripture agaynst vnmercifull neighbor play beast prosperitie secondly consider although men behaue themselues myldely soberly freendly yet notwithstanding god ceasseth afflict extraordinarie maner see hath happened vnto iob vvhat done stead sayeth heere haue wayted light beholde heere darknesse haue hoped good behold euill let v looke good according god promiseth paule sayeth feare god hath promise euerlasting life also present transitorie life let v always loke welfare god hand yet let v looke wise shuld readie receyue aduersitie whensoeuer shall please send v wheras god promiseth v handle v gently vse fatherly louing kindnesse towards v condicionally farre forth expedient saluatio temporall benefit behoueth deale forth distribute measure reason haue alledged alreadie namely impossibilitie leastwise verie hard matter men either abuse corrupt god gift bestow cleane contrarie meening may wel hope god done v good hee continue yea also increase still wee must also looke therewithall dispose selues wholy receyue aduersitie whensoeuer shall please send vvhy must make reckning wee haue euerlasting state oure life without chaunge let v consider life fraile also behoueth v bee subiect many chaunges haue prosperitie day god may disappoint v morow although see reason yet knoweth let v contented ye see sort faithful ought looke temporal benefit world inioy must beleue fully god continue dealing towards hath done thitherto howbeit looking prosperitie behooueth prepare themselues receyue aduersitie sort may bee taken vnwares thinke straunge hee bereeue benefit handled gently may bee time say must thinke noueltie god turne hande contrarie way smite thus ye see looking prosperitie must continuall disposing selues suffer aduersitie yea suffer paciently ende wee miscarie commeth vpon v furthermore let v conclusion marke well sayd concerning iob complayneth companion dragon brother estriges say wilde man number companie men god farre forsaken hee become wilde beast speaketh man liued holynesse perfection hee might rather haue bene compared angell mortall creature yet see hadled hereby warned put selues wholy handes god cease truste though scourge v roughly seme minded ouerwhelme v vtterly put thing vre haue seene namely though shoulde kill v yet would hope still mercie fight battails death grounding selues vpo promise hold owne still continue stedfast middest aduersities lo wee haue marke furthermore god scourge v sinnes must lesse plunged sorrow reason affliction take much meekely quiet mind considering haue neede handled sharply respect disease roted v meane forasmuch wee cannot bee mery offending god wee haue threatning added change harp mourning organ voyce lamenting vvee see world abuseth god benefit dayes euery man looke himselfe wee shall see lorde giue v rest wee start thinges prouerbe sayth againe come common state ala see world farre order may short seemeth men haue conspired greue god sheweth louing kinde towards v seemeth wee become much bolder prouoke sith may well afrayd turne harpes organes weping wayling sorow well worthie good reason cast v heauinesse anguish seeing wee haue abused benefit shamefully yet notwithstanding please god make v feele hand affliction whether know cause let v therfore cease flee vnto hope receiue v mercy yea verely condemne fault codemning suche wise assure warrant ourselues continue goodnesse towards v make v alwayes feele grace euen till hee haue filled v full nowe lette v fall downe face good god acknowledgement sinnes praying make v feele may bee bring v trewe repentance yet notwithstanding wee may ceasse tast cotinually goodnesse towards v put trust therin flee thervnto refuge name lorde iesus christe let v say almightie c cxj sermon first vpon xxxj chapter haue made couenant vvith mine eye haue looked vpon mayde vvhat portion god aboue inheritance almightie heauen cutting rightuouse confuzion suche conspire practize vvickednesse doeth beholde vvayes doth count steppe wee haue seene already heeretofore howe iob protested man friendes would haue made beleeue opinion hee reprobate afore god therfore declared hee lyued holily vprightly nowe hee returneth agayne matter without cause grieuous temptation men take hypocrite notwithstanding walked vprightnesse heart playne meening god furthermore regard owne reputation men thought god knewe true ought haue thought straunge hee sholde bee afflicted god hande although liued see yet good knewe ende cause god visited shall see fully winding vp chapter let v looke co tayned iob intendeth declare hath serued god faithfully induring grieuous excessiue misery offence committed secrete reason knowne vnto god men neyther know discerne firste giueth record soundnesse sayeth made couenaunt eye caste vnchaste looke vpon mayde liuing signe great angelicall perfection man able protest hath bin prouoked vnto euill may well man shall haue sodaine fleeting temptation yet notwithstanding consent therevnto rather shake hate truely great vertue man coulde haue wit sound vnattainted corruption could neuer inticed iob passeth beyonde better vnderstanding heereof let v marke three degree faultinesse ere sinne haue full shape meene euen although sinne come actuall vvhen iames speaketh sinne vseth similitude childebearing sayeth luste conceyueth afterward bringeth forth sinne sinne accomplished commeth actuall deede executing thing saye three degree faultinesse sinne although come outwarde deede firste fleeting imagination thought man conceyueth beholding thing thervpon one toy come head else although see nothing yet notwithstanding minde tickle vnto euill carieth heere maketh many fancy runne heade doubt faultinesse yet imputed vnto v sinne second degree vpon conceyuing fancie somwhat tickled feele wil swayeth way although bee consente agreeyng vnto yet notwithstanding inwarde pricking prouoke v vntoo nowe wicked sinne already conceyued afterwarde followeth consente wee settle wil vpon let v performance euill want occasion opportunitie ye see thirde degree sinne fully shapen v although bee outwarde deede well woorthy noted althoughe may seeme harde matter yet notwithstanding nother man woman hee findeth thing speake hath experience day day example wee bee afflicted come imagination thinke doth god minde v man holde himselfe suche conceytes oure nature corrupted inclined vnto euill vnpossible wee shoulde haue conceytes surely already faulte suche thing dooth come theyr minde notwithstanding wee chace away thinke thus oure selues nowe like blasphemie thinke god pitieth call vpon wil succour seeke one would denie gouerned worlde therfore whensoeuer suche thing come thought surely faulte behoueth v conclude ala lord wretched creature wee full vanitie sith conceyue monstruous thoughtes seconde poynt aduersitie presseth v griefe increaseth wee fall murmuring ala shoulde linger sorte god thought vpon mee woulde haue care helpe mee doeth dissembleth therefore seemeth hath quite gyuen mee vp vvhen conceyue thought debate ourselues whither god hath care v behoueth v consider one hath declared himselfe towards v receyue promise ground ourselues vpon say howsoeuer worlde go yet truste god flee refuge howbeeit although finally atteyne assurance vndoubtednesse yet notwithstanding wauer doubte come therevnto greater fault first already guiltie mistrust vnbeliefe god bicause haue receyued wicked temptation lastely commeth third degree vtterly ouerthrowen know say onely sort see miserie hath gotten vpper hande god hath forslowed long reach hand see quite paste hope recouerie vvhe cast downe call vpon god take tast promise rest vpon comforte selues third degree sinne like childe full shaped mother wombe remaineth shoulde bee borne cace wanteth comming outwarde deede let v come iobs woordes haue made league sayeth hee couenawit myne eye haue tolde token greate perfection man withholde sight hee conceyue thing might drawe vnto euill looking shewe true chastitie honestie must needes sayd cleere angel corruption iobs protesting heereof vayne wherefore let v consider hee liued worlde angell god true nature hee also wheras sayeth made couenaunt doone hee profited feare god hee thruste vnruly lustes vnder foote ouermastered affection hee able bridle keepe vnder say wil lust euill couet wishe wyll haue vayne mee shall tende displeasure god wyll brydle selfe myne eye mouth mine eares thus yee see wise iob made couenaunt hauing suche soundenesse nature man subiect affection bee doubte hee many temptation lyfe howbeeit hee walked suche wise hee inured feare god admit wicked lustes become habite men terme say inured vnto wauering starte one side pouoke himselfe short see iob met declare indeuered serue god also inforced himselfe wise tamed subdued affection fleshe insomuch nomore payne serue god bicause battails haue v reason frayltie yea reason corruptio nature let v marke came owne power neither could haue purchaced perfectio behoued god reforme wise holy spirit sort separated fro comon range men without cause dauid maketh request vnto god lorde turne away mine eies may see vanitie iob thing protesteth doubt dauid might haue obteined stedfastnesse well haue coceiued vanitie eye misseled caried away menes forasmuch dauid cofesseth neither could obtayne meere grace god followeth therfore iob coulde owne free make couenant say reason beareth suche sway could ouermaster affection meeneth yeeld god prayse benefit doth vaunte magnifie himselfe though purchaced grace owne trauell hee acknowledgeth god gouerned eyesight prouoke vnto euill furthermore whe iob speaketh let v marke side doth v vnderstand man behold wife mayde thereby tempted vnto euill sinne already god yea although outwarde acte putting forth man selfe deflowre beguyle woman consent man selfe wish although man haue intent resist sayd temptation wherewith prouoked yet notwithstanding fayleth offend god poynt better worthy bee marked verely wee heare sentence whiche lorde iesus christ gyueth vpon namely wee must thinke ourselues cleere discharged god absteyning fro whoredome respect body man looke vpon woman vnchaste looke already condemned whoremonger god moreouer haue sayd alreadie although consent vnto yet muste wee confesse haue done amisse god must humble ourselues papist wel ynough say man
