consent vnto euill say lust wise woulde fayne occasion serued graunt consent damnable sinne man haue euill liking hee consent thoroughly papistes say sinne horrible blasphemy said thou shalt loue lord thy god thy hart thy strength vvhat meant minde strength god hath limited loue owe vnto onely hart mindes sayde wit reason vnderstading stregth say al ability power nature muste also thorowly applied thervnto man coceyue euil although consent yeelde affection fully thervnto pray doth loue god al mind man haue neuer litle peece himselfe inclining corruptio although rest indeuour himselfe accomplish lawe doth loue god ought doo vndoubtedly sinne nothing else transgressing god lawe therfore lette v conclude vayne thoughtes prouoke v vnto euill sinne wee guyltie godward vnlesse beare v infinite goodnesse hee forgiueth neuerthelesse behoueth acknowledge sinne whosoeuer dooth flatter himselfe doth prouoke god wrath couer mischiefe owne damnation ende hypocrisie must discouered layd open punished rest whiche imagine amisse offende god bee tempted euill gayne nothing nother amend market needes muste hypocrisie grieuously punished vvherefore sayde afore although wee consent euill tickled haue liking howbeit withstand already fault ouersight v wee conceyue euill liking already bewrayerh corruptnesse nature surely euill dwelled v alredy turned away soundnesse cleerenesse god put first man doubt haue eyesight much pure chast sens hearing speaking rest pure cleane haue stayne proofe hereof let v consider well moyses sayeth satan came beguyle eue consequently hir husband giuen eare vnto bin corrupted desirousnesse like vnto god looked vpon tree knowledge good euill saw liked obteining knowledge howe looked vpon adam eue seene already god sayde vnto eate fruite haue forbidden houre soeuer eate thereof tell plainely separated codemned death ye see adam eue looked vpon tree doth moyses laye theyr charge sinne bycause beholde lyking say vngratious vntowarde luste thought good eate whereof came euen hearte beeyng corrupted immediatly marre eyesight lyke man hath eysighte marred ouermuche drinking inwarde disease burning vncome going losse eye lyke man becommeth blind went comonly rewme like thing processe time taketh away sight euen wicked lookes whiche bee condemned hearte already infected corrupted lewde liking eye sayde pure cleene himselfe wee might beholde god creature bee tempted wickednesse forasmuche wee cannot nowe open eye wee shall conceyue wicked luste say fayre good immediatly wee offende god greate vntowardnesse let v know cause thereof reygning sinne v doubtlesse hath hilde suche possession v euer since adam fall oure nature corrupted cannot looke vpon thing termed fayre bewtifull steade beeing prouoked loue god prayse goodnesse bestowing many benefites vpon v offende insteade glorifying god beeing prouoked loue cannot commend thing fayre good therwithall conceyte tickled yea stirred vp either couetousnesse whoredome voluptuousnesse short looke whatsoeuer fayre good vnder heauen turneth v away fro god whereas ought leade v vnto god welspring bewtie goodnesse yes surely sayd wicked lust nother reigneth ought reigne childre god speake naturally vntil time god haue wrought true faythfull shall bee peruerted haue wittes corrupted draw alwaies vnto euill yet shall alwaies haue remnant sayd infection bring mother wobe shall alwayes haue inwarde pricking moue vnto euil notwithstanding hate beate downe first rising vp good fayth sayd v coceyueth fancy god hath care soone wee indure aduersitie beholde blasphemy yea cursed blasphemie consent vnto minde doo rest neuer little vpon notwithstanding fully purpose nowe see man tempted euill although cosent vnto suppresse fight agaynst yet notwithstanding fayleth offende god transgressing law haue shewed already also canot proceede fro euill fountayne eye selfe shold corrupted nother doth sinne begin come first fro thence vvhence fro minde soule man doubtlesse euill must needes conceyued first within eye tende vnto euill bee prouoked therevnto yee see cause sayd iob protesting absteined euill vnchast lookes sheweth v suche infected therwith cannot cleere themselues god hath bene faultinesse vvherefore let v learne stande vpon garde flatter selues haue touched already say let v stad vpon garde hard matter pray rule eye wise shal tempted euill concupiscence disordered lust bee touched couetousnesse see good world moued long thing whiche god giueth v whe see ease delight pleasure euery stayned lecherousnesse ambition couetousnesse teptation see side impossible done leastwise without great difficultie surmouteth power insomuch maner impossible v ope eye without coceyuing offence agaynst god seing let v learn kepe good watch canot rule ourselues wise vtterly faultles haue neede flee forgiuenesse sinnes wherfore let v coclude behoueth v fight valiantly cosidering corrupted canot meanes vse sens apply thing ther shalbe renat wicked corruptio god misliketh thing ought prouoke v vnto hedefulnes secodly let v learn also huble ourselues seing diuel laboreth rocke v aslepe hypocrisie end shold know fault make worse worse therefore let v enter ourselues haue examined imperfectios let v crie god ala lord thou hast giuen thy grace go forward thy seruice indeuor inforce selfe resist passios fight agaynst selfe yet rightuous thee much amisse still lo faithfull muche paynes taking inforcing theirselues aboue strength ought alwayes minde condemne themselues shall faultinesse mingled good god grauteth learne yeeld theselues gilty humble themselues end may obteine grace poyntes haue marke streyne howsoeuer world go although haue many fancy running head night day therby perceyue maruelous corruption oure nature yet must harte marche still forward praying god hee hath begonne set v forth continue make v forward increase v strength holy spirit let v beseeche haue one foote alredy vpon wicked affection may set vpon may treade downe may neuer ryse agayne diuell commeth tempt prouoke v vnto euill may bring passe wittes may alwayes ouerreach short god spirit may reigne heartes although wicked affection yet may brideled fettered may lift vp themselues tosse v hither thither may alwayes stand stay bee fully resolued say meete oure god shoulde gouerne v shoulde follow holy yee see howe middest wicked thought behoueth v take courage walke stil goodnesse assuring ourselues good god wyll beare v confesse sinne hee contented pardon touching present matter poynt wherin differ papist papist say wicked lust sinnes man resiste cursed blasphemie god shoulde bee fayne renounce himselfe repeale whole law fleeting opinon conceyued onely simple ignorant people grounded determinatio agreed vpon great doctrours schooles rather diuelishe synagoges contrariwise wee say altogither sinnes howbeeit imputed vnto v god hand bicause owne free goodnesse mercie wipeth lord iesus christ sake whome beleeue seeing wee haue suche comforte wee ought inforce selues muche haue sayde already furthermore iob sheweth well knew offended bene blame woorthy vnchaste looke hee addeth portion god aboue heritage nightie heauen iob sheweth speaking vaunt himselfe afore men purchace himselfe reputation vertue holinesse seeke praise world hath eies fastned vpon god speaketh god presence desiring witnesse iudge point also must come hath bin declared heretofore long couet haue life allowed men shal full leazings startingholes suttle shift insomuch shal make v deface white turne black contrariwise make vertue vice lo taking indeuer comend selues afore men therefore whosoeuer desireth walke vprightly haue soundnesse whereof iob speaketh doubtlesse muste fayne gather himselfe ledde away say hee speake euill mee suche geere muste bee cutte hee muste summon himselfe god say go howe mee god haue deale though contented men worlde neuer better behoueth v haue mouthes shet god contented goodly countenaunce fayre disguysings outward shewes likelyhoodes hee looketh heart searcheth thought discouereth hidden darkenesse seing let v brydle ourselues walke soundly vprightly contrarie parte drawen giuen deuising shiftes fayre deckings coloure doings withall haue better stuffe ynough v couer selues leaues oure father adam vvherfore let v marke well lesson shewed faithfull whe intend walke becommeth v must behaue selues men nother muste wee rest eye vpon muste beholde heauenly iudge vnderstande whome wee muste make answere yeelde account marke one poynt furthermore haue touched alreadie iob acknowledgeth god suffer vnchaste lookes vnpunished sinnes afterwarde hee addeth vnrightuous man shall cut vvherein hee sheweth hee whiche hath giuen eye vanitie condemned sinner wicked man god notwithstanding hee haue consented fully vnto let v beare minde hath bene sayde concerning iobs tyme although know whither liued lawe yet notwithstanding liued afore prophetes time wee haue declared mention made man auncient tyme ye see iob time god yet giuen large vtteraunce doctrine suche lyghte came afterwarde prophet greatly inlighten thing darke law iob liued afore time therfore litle sparke respect doctrine afterward yet neuerthelesse knewe coulde tempted euill luste blameworthy god shall wee bee haue sunne rightuousnesse shyning vpon v highnoone day beholde iesus christ gospel bringeth vsso great light haue excuse wee say vnderstande high profounde matter haue wee doctrine large ynough seeing god shewed v full shoulde excused wee knewe iob knew heerein seene howe greate horrible god vengeance popedome seeing beast durst denie man sinneth hee tempted vnto euil hath prouocation conceiueth euill thought sobeeit consent throughly iob haue declared already doctrine coparison haue neuerthelesse know well ynough therefore let v looke neerely ourselues seing god hath graunted v grace priuiledge make truth much knowne vnto v tha time let v watchfull assoone ope eye espy vanitie euill affection v let v thinke selues euil hid vnder haue offended god therfore eye attaynted already seeing euill sheweth selfe abroade bee sparkes reason fire therfore must learn condemne ourselues vndoubtedly god mercy wee shoulde ouerwhelmed portion heritage prepared v aboue true men cannot iustifie v muste fayne appeare god iudge matter farre otherwise iob sayeth expresly aboue heauen repeating worde superfluous speache hee maketh couert comparison betweene god iudgement opinion purchace afore men ye see men may iustifie v poyntes know filthinesse pouertie reason whereof wee shall taken little angel thervpon thinke nothing amisse v haue gayned nothing behold iob calleth v vp aboue well true sinner may perchaunce cleere themselues easily allowed among men shall bee nothing vertue outwarde appearance muste come vp aloft god ouerthrow vayne opinion haue reigned time therefore lette v learne like blameworthy wee haue bene tempted wicked lustes also hyre prepared heauen say aboue except oure good god spare v vse fatherly goodnesse towards v thus yee see wee haue beare minde ende may magnifie goodnesse god punisheth v rigour also prouoked aske forgiuenesse fault day day sayde immediatly cutting vnrighteous punishment commit crymes doth god looke vpon wayes doth nuber steppe heere iob expresseth plainelye portion heritage whereof spake serueth wounde v quicke feeling sinnes true standeth vpon thing spoken lawe nother vseth many wordes yet doth holye ghoste gyue v heere common lesson mouth talke god iudgement punishment sendeth vpon sinner slow moueth v whit therfore lord fayne waken v make v feele better terrible wrath horrible thing haue v thus ye see iob addeth declaratio coteined saying cutting vnrightuous shall wicked man bee punished ment cutting wicked deserue rooted god vtterly ouerwhelme destroy according woord cutting importeth heyre heritage haue sayd men beare themselues hande shall scape light punishment like offender kepte pryson knoweth hath deserued haging beareth himselfe hand shall scape whipping hee shall banished euen say men conceyue god wrath neither knowe punishmentes woorthy bycause thinke euerlasting death vve see iob spoken portion prepared fro aboue wicked doth without cause adde cutting co fusion destroy vtterly heereby wee knowe god spirite reproueth v rechlesnesse attentiue first know god iudgemets leastwise vnderstad owne faultes haue neede doubling woordes ynoughe v haue bene warned one single woorde holie ghoste spoken portion god prepareth despisers lawe nowe addeth cutting bycause brutishe man telleth v thing simply conceyue possessed suche dulnesse feele stroke god hand though strike v hard shall wee bee wounded wee ought bee threatnings giueth v surely hee speake wil touched cast downe ourselues seing cannot bee sufficiently humbled blowes hande let v marke well carelesnesse dulnesse reproued vvherefore let v wake seeing god calleth vpon v earnestly lette v learne thinke better vpon ourselues haue marke verse conclusion whereas iob addeth doeth god looke vpon wayes keepe reckening steppe let v marke well hee applieth doctrine himselfe whiche hee set downe generall sayde hyre portion god aboue heritage god heauen iob spoken men applyeth doctrine owne vse declaring purpose spoken therefore often god iudgements come remembrance whither men l v ourselues reade let v haue wisdome enter ourselues looke euery one vpon owne person god iudgemets must lie buryed neuer bee spoken euerye man muste make auaylable himselfe put owne particular vse ye see haue marke iob set downe generall doctrine came beholding owne persone saying god sercheth knoweth wayes say forasmuche god iudge men cannot escape hand doth god sayeth knowe wayes dooth keepe reckening steppe thus much concerning first poynt touching seconde let v marke also stile iob vseth god marketh wayes steppe keepeth reckening serueth expresse god beholdeth aloofe onely looketh vpon thing apparant worlde also looketh neerely narrowly woorkes noteth marketh euerychone sighte dimme vieweth thing randon marketh counteth numbreth thing nothing escapeth nother thing forgotten pray haue better cause consider wayes recken owne steppe wee see present god cause scarcely know hundreth parte sinnes yea man shall commit one faulte hundred time day yet scarce thinke vpon cause hereof wee thinke god watcheth ouer v wee sight nothing may hidden forget workes thoughtes therefore lette v way well woordes coteyned namely god knoweth way reckeneth steppe say number set downe euery article thorough laste muste come account ye see shall gayne whiche haue cloked euill lying flattering muste come light vvhat remayneth looke neerely selues haue bene wont watche continually ende wee bee taken vnwares stales layde v side seeing daunger falling many vice wherewith oure nature stuffed let v examine well may bee sorie pleade guiltie god mourning lette v styll confesse dauid vnpossible v knowe faultes therefore lette v pray good god hath looked vpon faultes sinnes whiche ourselues cannot see may please blotte meanes thereof may repose truste welfare saluation thing receyuing v mercie lorde iesus christ sake also oure hauing washing wherewith hee hathe clenzed v say bloud hath shedde redemption nowe lette v fall downe face good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v feele beeing displeased ourselues may learne hate abhorre follow commaundeth appoynteth greater earnestnesse affection therewithall may please reforme v holy spirit may reigne quietly v ioyned suche perfection may seeke nothing bee wholly conformable rightuousnesse whiche thing shall accomplished shall haue taken v corruptible lyfe may please graunt grace c cij sermon second vpon xxxj chapter haue vvalked leazing foote haue bene hasty deceyte let god vvey vvorkes ballaunce iustice let trie mine vprightnesse steppe haue turned vvay hart haue vvalked mine eye spotte haue cleaued handes let sovve let man eate frute let plantes rooted vp iob hath protested liued chastly suche sorte eye defiled one euill looke nowe hee addeth hee liued vprightly among neyghbours foote stepped aside deceyte malice vve see toucheth another kinde soundnesse besides made mention yesterday hee also lay foorth principall poyntes man lyfe particular withoute cause ynough man haue absteyned whoredome except hee bee also cleere thefte guyle extortion god haue thing sundred hath set togither hath giuen whole law rule life hath forbidden whordome hath also condemned stealing lying extortion thing therfore man intend serue god ynough bee cleere one sinne must frame whole life law sayde afore otherwise separating thing whiche canot meanes put asunder without apeachemet god rightuousnesse thus ye see iob made protestation chaste cleane lyfe addeth hee beguyled man foote stepped aside tyme vntoo leasing malice well woorthy noted one principall part god requireth lawe shoulde haue sayd vprightnesse walke bywayes suttleties drawe neighboures good vnto v surely difficulte vertue howbeeit euery man desirous counted vpright nature alwayes giuen vnto hypocrisie much one worde hearde wherein somewhat amisse insomuch buy sell neyghboures wee alwayes disguysing thing drawe owne profite seeing perceyue roote deceitfulnesse v haue muche neede giue mindes vprightnesse soudnesse may protest god lyfe hath swarued aside vntoo leazing also another reason witte deceytes worse open violence like killeth man poysoning faultie slaieth man sworde trayterousnesse killing man vnder coloure making friendship making good cheere verye detestable thing cryme vtterly vnpardonable euen man beguileth neyghbour craftinesse creepeth bosome suttletie man cannot beware signe treacherous nature two reason therefore ought teach v follow vprightnesse soundnesse neyghbours may meanes beguiled v firste thing haue marke heere furthermore let v vnderstad truth precious thing god much taketh name vpon intendeth expresse one needes must vntruth guilefulnesse much detestable bycause full contrarie nature also sayde muste fashioned like vnto image god paule setteth downe true holinesse say whereas men giuen hypocrisie nothing counterfetting intent come neerer vnto god brought obedience hee printeth marke vpon may know child doth true holinesse reygne men gouerned god spirite reigneth nothing faynednesse slinesse flesh say corrupt nature short let v learne man walke soundly go streight businesse dealeth neighbour although vertues coulde bee named nothing hee wanted purenesse god would haue life well liked let v gyue mindes wholly vprightnesse soundnesse walke guylefulnesse vntruth furthermore let v marke also iob sayeth let god wey ballaunce iustice let trye mine vprightnesse similitude ballaunce notable sheweth v maner iustice wee shall haue account haue yeelde may liked allowed wit god weying v ballaunce iustice law hee hath declared vnto v ballaunce wherby know whither woorkes good receyuable like ware weyed men sel pounde euen also must workes iudged howe god ballaunce haue tolde doctrine profitable v bicause men chalege theselues meete beare themselues hand work shall go good eue gouerne theselues owne lust reason wherof would god shoulde gaynestande thing haue imagined vtterly disanull authoritie woonder man shoulde desire master owne life owne guide say god might comaunde nothing true men woulde ashamed speake say gouerne selfe wil follow mine owne brayne god shall meddle commaunding thing ye see horrible blasphemie vtter mouth folow owne opinion haue coceyued pray auaunce themselues aboue god labour thrust downe bereuing soueraintie might commaunde man doo whatsoeuer commeth owne head whatsoeuer himselfe deemeth good would god allow bring obedience say vnto euill bycause god hath forbidden good bycause god hath commaunded followeth owne liking imagination doth man go set himselfe god roume therfore diuelish presumption yet notwithstanding common thing vvherfore let v marke well sayd streyne behoueth v come ballaunce receyue iudgement either v v according god shall haue tried workes namely rule law owne lustes men imagine another ballaunce foolish grosse wit recompence faultes haue co mitted god meane wherby satisfaction brought papacie ballaunce haue allotted saint michaell put men good workes one ballaunce theyr euill work man haue done good euill papist opinion quit god see ape toy ouer grosse written doth thing shall liue god promiseth life saluation accoplishing one peece lawe performing whole respect contrariwise sayde cursed performe thing conteyned heere therefore breake one article lawe guiltie whole sayeth iames thus haue touched ouer doltishe beastlye imagination matche good euill sort one agaynst another thinking may exchaunge recompence made god haue said alredy ballance god law thither shal work come weyed looke founde conformable god lawe shall bee taken allowed good lyke marchandize lawfull put ballance men pay according theyr weyght euen also behoueth v come lawe god purpose haue sayde alreadie men bring owne weightes measure desire haue credited city common beame ballaunce euerye man shall haue owne weyghtes measure nother reasonable lawfull haue would go hauocke preseruation good pollycie order equitie neede bee one certayne euen ballaunce ruled therefore men go aboute make theyr woorkes good owne iudgemente opinion woulde forge newe ballaunce wee knowe falsehoode hee shall haue falsified common weightes shall condemned iustly man falsifie rule good lyfe precious god weyghtes world hath committed greater cryme hee forged ware seeing cace standeth lette v learne rule ourselues scripture sheweth witte let v workes consider well god hath appoynted let v without replying take good whiche alloweth lawe reiecte euill whiche hee forbiddeth wee deale sorte none foolishe deuotions among v reygned papacie whereof commeth menne doo lifte vp themselues euery one deuise meenes seruing god say good suche thing bycause bring false weyghts false balaunces euery wold preferre owne deuice god reiecteth condemneth euery whit therefore lette v haue meekenesse rule gouerne life commaundements god desire hauing sundry meanes serue god withall shall layde away wee shall haue one common certayne infallible rule onelye one ballaunce iustice one onely lawe god gouerne v although bee difference estate yet called backe one generall way vvhen hee sayeth thou shalt committe adulterie thou shalte steale thou shalt lye beare false witnesse sayeth well greate small seeing lorde sendeth aswell king handycraftes men generall rule lyfe shewing v broade way ende wee go amisse muche lesse excused wee couet holde v also laboure giue good example neyghboures ayde one another frame ourselues sorte vnto godwarde wee may v obey bee fully subiect becommeth v nowe men shunne ballaunce measure yet shall gayne sayde immediatly lette god trie myne vprightnesse vvherein iob sheweth belongeth onely vnto god iudge whether wee bee good euill true hee signifieth twoo thing firste god iudge mennes liues auenture onely lawe second competent iudge alone although men vsurpe prerogatiue yet notwithstanding opinion shall bee ouerthrowne bycause ouerweening vvherefore ought marke well poynt god iudge workes triall lawe serueth first beate downe vayne truste hypocrite whiche bring pelting trashe god haue content himselfe haue done haue done say according see papistes haue taken much payne deuotions thinke god debte else hee woulde neuer quite vnlesse broughte suche thing lette go aske theyr wage sette woorke god disalloweth euery whit hee affirmeth hee iudge men workes putting ballaunce say examining law deuise newe iudgement hee hath giuen v lawe god bothe lawegiuer also iudge thing go ioyntly togither howe thinke god ought iudge according whereby men haue bene taught aforehande wit lawe agreablenesse betweene lawe hath giuen v keepe iudgement must execute thus cocerning first poynt ye see hypocrite shall bee confounded vayne presumption thinke woorkes shall bee allowed yet yeeld reuerence god law beare themselues hande god shall owe ouerplus doings compared togither laide ballaunce wee warned haue indeuered followe god submitte ourselues therevnto workes acceptable vnto god world wil perchance condemne v according wee see howe papist haue liking thing bycause many gay pompes goodlye deckings among v synagoges man come church papistes hee shall finde full gewgawes stuffed yet meane ape make reckening doings seeming small matter come thither pray vnto god without gay ceremony glister amog ynough v god alloweth v howe let v looke vpon law vpon thing hee requireth v scripture thing must stirre vp faithfull giue courage serue god according knowe howe muste follow thing whiche agreeable respectes doctrine whiche wee haue receyued gospell woorde haue spoken sayeth iewes shall iudge furthermore lette v alwayes consider behooueth v come account greate iudge boote v haue bene flattered praysed men sayde god trie wordes signifieth tryalles made nowe haue certayntie stay reste god ouerthrowe vvherefore lette v learne walke suche wise wee may protest god labouring traueling hath bene towardes desire hath bene subiect vnto wee haue euer honored guyde gouernor lo wee haue marke streyne iob addeth consequently foote pace stepped way heart haue walked myne eye spot haue cleaned handes according talke whiche hee concerning vprightnesse soundenesse howbeeit expresseth thing yet hee sayde afore firste hee protesteth foote stepped way verely wee cannot lyue perfectly muste make many false steppe oftentimes swarue fro though ouersight frayltie heere iob declareth hee steppeth way hee vseth similitude way scripture woont serueth draw v better obeying god vvhen god lawe called way pray ought bee spurre pricke v forwarde walke god hathe ordeyned ought also bee bridle holde v subiection wee haue occasion go place desire keepe best way yea shortest easiest certaynest man beguyle v angry wee stray doth grieue v somuch euery step werieth v thinke haue clogge lead heeles wee knowe whither wee bee right whether go way seing men careful knowe right way trauayling may come wel iourneyes end great pitie way lyfe wee willing go astray seeme desirous negligent inquiring intente wee might starte aside step way also way eye god pointeth finger calleth v thither incoraging v follow warning v turne nother righthand left keepe hie way sheweth v willing take heede cause scripture vseth similitude way shew v misse way ignorance excuse v god hath shewed v wil obey good infallible way steppe aside run astray like wandering vacabounds contrariwise conforme themselues god lawe word may well run gad trudge vp prophet esay saith shall bee trie leg yet way whit like worde ballance iob hath vsed ought holde v awe presume thing head indeuor frame life god also worde way ought teach v walke wee thinke good hold v wholy god ordeineth thus ye see effect haue remember iobs protestation wit neuer amisse impossible man though respect frailtie ignorance said turning way doth v wit ran astray according addeth saying hart hath folowed mine tie hereby meneth notso euil minded consent vanity men conceiue beholding thing like sayde yesterday al lokes many sparkle kindle fire lust within v nature froward wee see thing faire good wee drawe occasion offending god thing faire straightwayes loue howe wicked lust good desire kindled wise vnto euill much lightminded consenting wicked lustes iob saith hart folowed eye howbeit might seeme contrarietie betwene maner speach talke yesterday vvhy told vnchast lokes attainted vice proceed hart token hart corrupted thervpon alledged spoke moyses adam eue namely loked vpo tree knowledge good euill sa liked therefore could ther alreadie leude lust within perswaded vnto euill eye itselfe woulde sinne vnlesse prouoked euil mind doth iob say hart folowed eies sayd therewithal yesterday open eye come many leude thought mind beit ofttetimes tickled god holdeth v awe holie spirit otherwise certaine onely tempted prouoked euill wee also fall bee ouercome hand may perchace conceiue euil thought first sight yet bee led awaye meanes one poynt therevpon also set downe three degree faultinesse first haue onely conceyte second heart somewhat moued third fully resolued determined vpo haue note asmuch men conceiued borne sinne wholly giuen corruption welspring whence haue wicked thought soone open eye temptation step v yea though sticke vtterly shake whit moued though thing waue mine eye yet notwithstading part hart inclineth therevnto vtterly abhor whence commeth conceit euen sinne dwelleth v wherin good buried god image v oure father adam beginning vndoubtedly al oursenses declared yesterday shuld pure clean infection lokes tend god sone looke vpon creature glorie god would vtter self led honor bee wholly inflamed loue would vanitie disorder much lesse would bee wicked rebelliousnesse muche see thing would v goodnesse let v marke vnchast lookes temptation conceiue mean eye spring sayd fountayne originall sinne say saide corruption wee drawe father adam frowardnesse nature much wee bee alienated god see two thing may wel stand togither namely man tempted euill wickednesse hart yet notwithstanding conceit commeth eyesight affection hearte howe haue told alreadie eyesight tempting v followe wicked lustes hart euill alreadie conceiued within ye see sinne goeth formost must needes concluded hart infected corruption eye shoulde bee cleane true yet true also sometimes tempted without inward affectio like iesus christ selfe often tempted yet notwithstanding anye vncleannesse tempted manner sound nature might bee outward sightes continued stedfast goodnesse corruptnesse sens otherwise v oure sens corrupted reason sinne neuerthelesse may corruption sens yet shal abide sound still according declared yesterday distinction set downe repeated euen darke treate yet againe little plainelier tempted hautinesse wee lift eye heauen tempted coue tousnesse loke vpon good world desire haue saying would suche house mine would owner somuch medowe many vineyardes wee see thing bee stricken couetousnesse oure hart imcline way haue inward desire feele burning within v long v wee haue thing liking lusteth doth hart walke eye say heart hauing conceiued amisse thought reason eyesight thorough corruption originall sinne hath followed say hath yelded motion contrarie god law haue bridled affection wise somewhat hath stirred v vp vnto euill wee haue conceyte say fayre yet notwithstanding stoppe else say thing liked yet therewithall haue suche stay ourselues say also meete mee contented god hath giuen mee say heart abyde fettled shaken tossed pricked prouoked stand stedfast contentation pouertie doe oure bodily sens make v conceiue euil thought yet notwithstanding heart settled without mouing short eye may pechance wander bee excessiue gasing condemned bycause proceede originall sinne god imputeth vnto v haue sayde furthermore whereas iob sayth heere heart walked eye haue mark thervpon eye created loke vpon god workes ende wee might taught loue reuerence feare become bandes satan inticers come beguile v worke destruction god say hath created eye ende ende while worlde wee haue abilitie discerne betweene thing might lead v vnto vvhither looke vpward downward see lord calleth v himselfe creature heauen earth meanes allure v come vnto god doth onely say come vnto also hee draweth v thither goodnesse according wee see howe hee sheweth selfe liberall towardes v therein also ministreth occasion v walke feare thus ye see ende eye made eye shuld haue meanes behold god glorie poyntes haue froward vse eye cleane contrarie god haue said eies dazel v deceiue v oft open hale v away make v run astray end become like brute beast full wilde vnruly lust besides two firebrondes set v fire vvheras ought receiue god glory transform v therevnto receiue satan firebronds kindle affection intent whole desire might offend god aduaunce selues thus ye see poynt ought marke wel end euery one v might beware furthermore much wee vtterly bee discharged frailtie corruption eye wil wandring drawe v away euer bee sodaine conceyts allure v vnto euill let v leastwise bridle heartes let affection bee gadding wyth eye make v straye way aforesayde let v learne holde selues vnder obedience god subiection feare ende hee addeth spot cleaning bandes yet one similitude whereby meeneth declare yet better vprightnesse life like hadle thing oure handes also wee haue deale men thing wee deale doe passe hads handled v iob meneth affayres dealing men hee neuer stayned craftinesse violence corruption thing surely greate vprightnesse neuerthelesse wee must alwayes marke iob speaketh selfe waye boasting rather holie ghost intendeth heere giue v myrrour perfection ende wee knowe spot v assure ourselues god calleth summoneth v accout escape vnpunished curse added let mee sowe saith iob let man eate let plantes plucked vp shuld say haue labored inrich vnlawfull gaine let god plucke away al substance let perishe goe hauocke yee see effecte shewed v therefore let v take heed walke carefully haue done men dispatche selues thereof lightly haue meane trade lyuing contente selues howe euer fare strayght wayes rightuous thinke selues nothing amisse yet wee muste bee fayne come ballance haue touched bycause lawe god moueth v holie ghost addeth one helpe example iob hee sheweth v howe oure lyfe ought bee ruled thus yee see howe way wee haue marke iob mente magnifie selfe shewe owne example howe ought liue besides also although wee haue indeuered walke suche perfection wee haue brydeled affection wandring lust haue haried v away haue alwayes preserued euerie man right wee haue vsed anye crafte malice man yet muste wee alwayes hang downe oure heades god wee haue seene heeretofore god scourge v although oure sinnes purpose namely humble v trie pacience yet must cast heades still furthermore acknowledge wee alwayes guiltie howsoeuer world go god shall alwayes finde faulte v might iustly reiect whole life thus ye see ought practise sentence neuerthelesse short behoueth v haue eye alwayes fastned oure handes say deale purely thing wee take hande doings may wise stayned hard v haue purenesse looke howe many dealing wee haue doe many peeces pitch passe handes howe possible scape without catching spotte god therefore must bee faine worke cace preserue v euen woonderfull fashion ought prouoke v greately prayer wee see suche vncorruptnesse required oure handes wee drawe cleane backwardes muche wee farre beeing cleane wee perceyue spottes blottes v remayneth none shiftes flie god refuge craue forgiuenesse faultes past also desire guide v holie spirite keepe hand cleane may restrained craftinesse malicious dealing thing haue men euer ouer let v marke well curse iob setteth downe although hee applie owne person yet notwithstanding pronounceth generally payment prepared defile handes sort wickednesse haue deuised neighbor couetous men indeuer inriche themselues men cost man giuen selfe passeth nothing worlde grow riche let v thinke shall indure long length god execute thing hee pronounceth heere wit haue planted shall eate fruite verie deede wee see suche haue heaped moste goodes togither inioy god bereeueth oftentymes man needes forbid eating drinking thing haue gotten themselues niggardly dare cherishe themselues pine awaye become owne tormentours afterward looke gathered togither long time great labour doth god plucke sweepe away child make fayre dispatch goodes reserued still bee last shall oftentimes make rope child drawe gallowes vvee see iudgements god eies therfore let v learne walk vprightly think haue gathered worlde happiest god curse alwayes taile misse haue pilled polled men goodes vvherefore let v bethinke v contented litle god shall giue v assuring oure selues wee walke continually feare hee bee good fosterfather v neuer faile v deale like child towards vse true loue brotherly vprightnesse towards neyghbours let v fal face good god acknowledgement oure sinnes praying open eye may walk presence seeing hath shewed familiarly vnto v worde also may behold hath declared himselfe wee may make triall whole life wee may peceyue wretchednesse v misery wherevnto subiect flie vnto remedie hee hath set forth vnto v goodnesse whiche haue recourse vnto mercie praye guide v wise holie spirite renouncing oure wicked affection maye seeke frame oure selues wholy holy walke vnder obeisance vntill come full perfection wherevnto behoueth v tende life long appeereth alreadie angel may please graunt grace c cxiij sermon third vpon xxxj chapter heart haue beene deceyued vvoman haue laide vvaight doore neighbour let vvife grinde vnto another man let stranngers bovv dovvne vpon hir loocenesse iniquitie condemned fyre deuoureth destruction yea vvhich plucke vp roote reuenue haue refused iudgement seruant maid vvhen striued vvhat shall vvhen god standeth vp vvhat shall ansvvere vvhen doth visit hath hath made made also vvombe hath fashioned v vvombe haue heere twoo protestation iobs making worthie bee marked one hee liued chastly hee cleere god seeking abuse man wife hee bin proud cruell towards vnderlings therwithal bin far fro vauting equal toke power shewed self gentle mylde behoueth v beare mynde hath bin said heretofore wit iobs protesting haue walked rightly god without wrong one kind alone whole law god according laieth forth thing conteyned therein ought also speciall warning vnto v haue shewed inoughe v indeuer discharge duty one point leaue rest vndone god haue thing separated dismembred hee hath ioyned togither lawe vvherefore let v beare mynd hath bin set heretofore let v follow order iob kepeth mark residue added touching speaketh aduoutrie mening offreth suffer shame hauing wife abandoned whoredome sought abuse man wife let men saith bow vpon wife let hir suffer reproch yea let indure well shee haue beene led away haue layde wayte neighbor doore say haue watched harme afterward declareth hee abhorred whordom much saith wickednesse yea iniquitie belongeth vnto iudges say worthy condemned deuouring fire thing would plucke vp welth roote thus yee see howe iob continued chastitie gaue self filthinesse whordom bicause knew cursed thing offence god could beare touching punishmet setteth iust reward whoremaster aduouterers wit like shuld done vnto haue done vnto others onely text mention made haue notable example aboue others person dauid although holie prophet king chosen among mankind hauing recorde god hath found according owne hart yet notwithstanding see punishment fel vpo stepping aside rauishing another man wife prophete nathan declared god curse vnto saying thou hast done secrete shal payd thee openly sunne shall beare witnesse dauid wrought wilily thought sinne neuer haue bene known world haue gone clere away much man reproch mutter god reuenged hypocrisie told although done wickednesse secret yet come open light shuld ashamed sinnes known men hideous thing owne sonne shoulde cause trumpet blowne assemble people ope sight world put king concubine al villanie behold incest nature yet god declareth hapned casualtie saith haue done say let men loke onely person absolon without going true ought abhor breaking order nature wise ouerthrowing honestie working suche villanie towards father neuerthelesse also sayeth lorde haue wrought cace men muste thinke haue happened casualtie aduenture haue done sayth lord seeing god spared suche prophete man indued excellencie led whole life sounde vprightnesse sauing fall wife vrias god say vsed rigoure towardes dauid whome chosen shall spare whorhunters make continuall trade ordinarie art abusing men wiues lie alwayes wayt bring wicked purpose aboute muste needes feele iudge heauen suffer suche wyckednesse vnpunished god therefore maketh reprochfulnesse return vpon themselues yet let vnderstande receyue iuste payment suche one haue deserued let learne humble themselues god furthermore heare threatned abuse men wiues owne wiues also shall bee rauished defiled god raise vp whoremonger execute iustice ought abate temptation haue feare god man haue st feare god reason surely bee hild awe hearing threatening whereby god warneth therfore let euerie man make profite text seeing god abide suche locenesse let v praye gouerne v wise wicked affection may tamed wicked lust may raigne v haue place v accesse vnto v marke one point furthermore let v marke also added concerning crime end thinke straunge god punishe roughly much wee alwayes would measure sinnes owne meetyarde wee bring false ballance sayd yesterday would possible finde fault god accuse ouer greate rigour punishing faultes cause sayde must marke well howe iob addeth ouer great loocenesse yea outrage worthy condemned burning fire deuour al thing euen destruction doth v vnderstand must iudge whore dome common opinion men make sport according see howe scoffer iest many despizers god heathnishe folke make game men shall heare diuelish blasphemie veniall sinne bee forgiuen suche thing thing haue begon late dayes cause also paule hauing spoken expresly whoredome saith freendes beware ye tempted vaine word reason suche thing wrath god commeth vpon vnbeleeuers sathan time imbrued worlde mockery whordome counted horrible thing ought paule saith shall purpose bable flatter themselues toyes god wrath shall neuerthelesse haue course hee hath shewed time time cannot beare whordom truly ought marke first defile body whiche ought temple holie ghost sin saieth paule committed suche wise soyle staine abideth much body soyle staine whordome doth seemeth whore whoremonger would wither owne body beare shame dishonestie god wee considered well whoredome men doe vnhalowe temple god holie spirite dismember body lorde iesus christ surely would abhor sinne wee againe aduoutrie whordome matched togither peruerting al right equitie among rob another good shal punished theef shalbe rebuked al men hand shal cried men spit face yet aduoutrie tha simple robberie therin men rob men good substance onely also honor honestie rob onely borne also vnfashioned mother wombes againe mariage holy league couenant lord nameth scripture man falsifie couenant made bargayning selling conueying secrete title interest himselfe suborning false witness ought bee punished beholde cheefe couenaunt bee worlde broken falsifyed solemne declaration made faith husbande oweth wife wife hir husbande come church presence god call vpon bee iudge eyther keepe promise hee hath made yet notwithstanding commeth nothing considered thing aright surely whore dome aduoutries suffred euerie man woulde abhorre yea would none would bridle selfe become owne iudge holde determination lawe rule anye wicked could hilde feare god religion yet notwithstanding feare thretning short certaine men would bee zelous cutte suche euill amongst v heereby see many make profession gospell thinke awhit told although thinke god speaketh yet notwithstanding moued sathan hath doted straught haue reason vnderstanding therfore let v remember lesson whiche conteyned heere wheras sayd whoredome great loocenesse wickednesse bee condemned let euerie v cite himselfe god iudgement take heede keepe oure selues vndefiled bycause aboue strength man doe behoueth god worke v subduing wicked lustes let v praye gouerne v holie spirite wee may abhorre sinne haue always eye vengeaunce spoken heere although god punishe whoremonger aduoutries sort set yet let v assure selues hath diuers mean escape hande man haue inueigled man wife god cause owne wife fall intoo like dishonestie may come passe wicked shall haue vertuous wife god shall pitie hir shee shall bee preserued giue ouer hir selfe vnto euill though hir husbande bee wicked yet notwithstanding let hir husbande therefore thinke hath made better market god shall well ynough finde meanes let v vnderstande hath chastizements inowe coffer according sayde song moyses hath terrible roddes vnknown vnto v bring forth euer thinketh good therefore let v preuent iudgement feare stand awe seeing sheweth v fauour warne v afore hand againe wee bee yet retchlesse consider warning giuen v heere let v marke well holie ghost doubleth sayde threatning saith fire deuoureth destruction plucketh vp wealth roote needes muste men bee worse brutishe leastwise doe waken sayde loocenesse sinne deserueth bee condemned fire consumeth thing goeth euen roote vtter destruction suffereth substance tarie vnwiped away seeing wee heare god manaceth v wise end afrayd wrath high time bethinke selues nowe neuer furthermore let v practise doctrine two sort witte let euerie v profite selfe manner ouer also let v indeuer much v lyeth euerie man according state calling amend euill amongest people keepe oure selues pure touching fyrste poynt let euerie v looke selfe keepe good watch ouer affection feare least deceyued haue shewed heeretofore inough man keepe selfe deede vnlesse hee set watch ouer eye hee haue vnchaste lookes hee looketh vpon man wife wicked desire alreadie condemned whoredome aduoutrie god shall become v goe heart shall become v proceed lying wayte watching deceyue men wiues much behoueth v bee vigilant watching ouer oure lust much stubborne let euerie v bethinke selfe holde selfe awe vnder feare god also let v haue eye horrible threatning god maketh whoredome zealous correct wee see raigne among v beare nourish negligence shall hild bawdes ruffian god man excuse selfe hee purblind beetleblind behalfe suffereth whoredome committed cleare selfe bawde god haue saide alreadie much v lyeth wee doe heape vp fyrewoode god wrath seeing house whoremaster must consumed fire deuoure wee indeuer oure behalfe quenche stoppe whoredomes hauing full scope among v may bee commonly suffered fyre must need spread whole town whole countrey wee muste needes feele god curse vnderminding v till bee vtterly consumed much expresse mention made iudges let suche haue charge office punishing sinne looke wel themselues shal double bawdes double ruffian god suffer whoredome slip eye themselues couer make reckening rather contented shoulde continually haue scope thus yee see wee haue marke texte furthermore let v beware wee bee onely restreyned forced feare committing outward acte whoredome much god gracious vnto v choose v bee temple holie spirite hath drawne v selfe let v pray graunt v grace serue purenesse bodie also mynde much graffed bodie lord iesus christ hath knit v mebers let v beware dishonor defile selues filthinesse ye see sort faythfull ought induce selues chastitie forced feare knowing grace honour god hath done vnto hath pleased come vnto sort therfore let desire nothing much come vnto meanes lord iesus christe thus much concerning protestation iob maketh whoredome let v come second protestation addeth far taking away men goodes vsed pryde crueltie eue towards vnderlings menseruants maid seruants day adays wage bound couenant bondslaues euen liue die men possessed ass ox well worthy noted although man lawe maister power life death ouer bondslaue yet notwithstanding see iob delt cace say restreined bridled bicause knew according god law haue superioritie must abuse play tyrant tread reasonable creature vnder feete therefore ought marke well state condition seruants time make v knowe better howe great iobs gentlenesse vpright dealing taking libertie world gaue leaue saw lawfull doe god let v marke word vseth f saith haue refused iudgement seruant maid striued word striue vseth signifieth quarell debate variace pleading iob meneth although hee might haue stopped mouthes men maides haue loden stripe listed none shuld haue durst quetch yet notwithstanding giuen leaue plead good cace although neuer angrie yet seruantes reasonable excuse might freely debate matter shewe theirright hee oppresse force vvee see pride crueltie sheweth therewithall howe hee able master affection wise could gentle bearing inferiours sayth made made also wee fashioned one may taken fashioned one wombe say wee come adam one nature howbeit must yet extende iob considered two thing hee bare gently seruantes firste wee haue one common creator come one god also wee one nature muche bee concluded men thoughe bee neuer base degree despyzed worlde neuerthelesse brother disdayneth acknowledge man brother must make selfe oxe lion beare wilde beast disclaim image god imprinted v lo heere two reason iob alledgeth thervpon concludeth shall god commeth visit lyft vp selfe mee might able stande face call life acc nt coulde aunswere haue beene churlishe seruauntes lo heere texte importeth verie great profitable doctrine bee wee vse well wee ought bee gentle towardes oure inferior lyeth hand oppresse must oure owne accorde bee lawe measure rule selues howe gentle ought towardes equalles seemeth man subiect vnto may vse suche authoritie ouer hee shall speake may list according wee see men beare selues hand may much may god giue inch authoritie take el ther ho measure surely behoueth v spare inferior aboue god hath aduanced v must haue deal equal superior master shall condemned god oppresse seruant violence presumptuous stately abyde seruant defend selfe good quarel shall become seruant bee stubborne maister vvhat shall become child setteth himselfe father subiect riseth soueraine surely thing lesse bee borne withall see wee heere generall doctrine comon men first aduaunced authoritie must knowe god setting state giue bridle vex others trample vnder fete behoueth refraine selues alwayes lowlynesse myldnesse marke one poynt authoritie amongst men ought haue suche preheminence serueth lowe degree therefore despized true man maister owne house souereintie noble therefore man woulde looke haue selfe heard obeyed owne house neuerthelesse wee see maister hath power ouer men maydes hee ought heare paciently wrong done ought vse gentlenesse towards vnderlings owne house ought haue authoritie iustice haue power master haue ouer seruants haue honorable authoritie preheminence lord ouer others bondage nay rather let king prince flatter themselues neither let beare selues hand world made rather made multitude hath god stablished principality kingdom common welfare aduaunce two three onely aboue rest ende order state gouernement among men therefore king prince ought beware liue suche wise ouer subiectes misuse execute tyrannie ouer shall much lesse excuseable maysters deale cruelly seruants muche lesse libertie haue whiche called state iustice set god officer yelde euerie man right forget selues bee caried awaye pryde god must needes punish roughly master haue doone outrage wrong brother serued furthermore haue authoritie ouer others must exalte selues vvhat shall equall state ought euerie one v liue neighboure man exalte selfe whereas hee ought acknowledge selfe equall fellowe like hee playeth bull praye muste suche pryde bee tamed man hath nothing headie rashnesse woulde take vpon anthoritie ouer neighbour hee vouchsafe looke vpon askew beare selfe hande worlde ought quake looke god set hande suche braueries let v marke well streine serueth onely teach mildnesse gentlenesse vnto master also much dutie men generall therefore see god haue inferior suffer indure suche haue authoritie ouer behoueth euerie v loke owne state calling learne frame selues vnto mildenesse neither maister oppresse seruaunt seruaunt striue againste maister euerie man discharge owne duetie god may serued aboue thus ye see haue marke streine conuicte v perchaunce farre wit euerie v woulde take vpon belongeth vnto let v marke wee fall bee proude become cruell towardes vnder v shall onely condemned mouth god prophet also verie heathen men must iudges last day sayde euen nowe lawes man mayster dayes power lyfe death ouer seruantes sayde heathen men thereof becommeth v vse seruantes hireling saye folke wee haue taken wage though vnderlings owne wordes vnbeleeuers time regarde humanitie seemed euerie man ought bridle selfe euen althoughe hee free libertie giuen doe listed seruants pray excuse v inlightned god word haue consideration least let v marke god aduaunce v authoritie trie oure modestie hee giue v men seruantes mayde seruants vnder v end inure v humanitie vpright dealing spoken heere end shewe god haue shewed v speciall fauour ought thinke selues beholden meanes thereof prouoked vse soberly seing hath power ouer v doth neuerthelesse spare v behoueth v follow willingly child resemble goodnesse towardes others furthermore man vnder coloure authoritie vaunt selfe cruelly others let v assure oure selues power vtterly peruerse yea say signe ouer malicious nature man aduaunceth himselfe sort reason credite contrariwise certaine myld louing nature alwayes spare inferiours authoritie god giueth restreyned yea euen owne accord heere speaking constraint commeth men lyke play lyamhoundes vse kynde flatterie able doe nothing afterwardes ouerpasse bound aduaunced shewing selues haue myldenesse slauish nature counted villanous detestable thing ought induce v myldenesse holie ghost commaundeth v streine cheefe thing well bearing away two reason haue touched heretofore wit haue one maker whome v come one like nature thus yee see wee haue consider beate downe pryde crueltie v tempted therevnto man haue household god hath giuen menseruantes maydseruants tempted vse vnmeasurable rigour let seeke remedie shewed v heere howe handle seruants cruelly plucke breade mouthes dare eate one morsell feare least grudge holde harde laboure bee short shewe selfe vnmercifull churlish towardes whome doe set selfe true mine therewithal hath god created fashioned haue one common maister heauen reason saint paule alledgeth hee exhorteth maisters beare seruants freendes sayth hee although ye haue superioritie ouer yet haue also maister heauen suche exalted ceasse therfore subiects god aboue therfore let beare mind must render accout gaue seruants must needes restreyned haue consideration haue wee oure selues righte come superioritie euery v hath owne behalfe pawne god hathe put hand keepe ought well aduised may vse according heathe men themselues intended frame king prince conformitie skill inough say true king make theselues feared redoubted yet scape hand heauenly iudge ther god aboue verified prince whiche highest superioritie shal become whiche mean authoritie maisters mistress furthermore sayde let v consider haue v one maker wee consider wee descended one god wee must need conclude true namely oppresse neyghbours god must offended therefore let man exalte selfe vanitie salomon saith hee mocketh blinde poore despizeth maker nowe poore man despize put shame true wrong first offered mortall man yet doth god steppe betwixt v taketh iniurie done himselfe thus yee see iob rather holie ghost ment betoken streine sayth created mayster created seruant also wee bee touched vayne presumption set selues men couet superioritie euery man stoupe v cast himselfe feete wee selues haue full scope let v come consideration saying yea although bee mayster god hath made seruant hath fashioned well mee vvhen wee thinke sort qnayle ouerweening hautinesse shall bee repressed herewithall also let v haue seconde regard spoken heere namely bee one selfesame nature true god hath also shaped brute beastes tree thing hath shaped men fashion brute beast hee hath giuen men vnderstanding printed image contrarie parte looke vpon another must needes see selfe looking glasse seeing god hath knit suche knot betwixte v pray doth hee goeth breake cut himselfe mankinde doth hee deserue bee cast vp among dogges seeing acknowledgeth nature whiche god hath put v yes verie fewe thinke thinges contrariwise yee shall see man bee exalted one finger heigth hee beareth himselfe hande hee state men therefore muche need haue marke well doctrine dayes ther yet light iob vnderstood seeing god maker v hath set v one ranke ought correct pryde men pull downe highe lookes highe stomackes praye excuse shall wee haue day god sheweth selfe bee father saith creator men well poore riche seruauntes well maysters also nameth himselfe father therefore behoueth v haue brotherhoode amongst v vnlesse wee renounce name god cutte oure selues house steade beeing householde vvee see howe iesus christ lord glorie abaced selfe lowe become seruant seruantes also wee haue one common heritage wherevnto called saint paule sayth seing let v learne humble selues therwithall knowe pryde crueltie doe shut v gate paradise vvherefore let v gentle curteous towardes ouer whome wee haue superioritie seeing oure lorde auoucheth bee child wee may bee gathered altogither suche sorte god may glorified v great small wee followe order euerie v maye discharge dutie according calling v yeelde honoure great lorde mayster common iudge v let v fal face good god acknowledgement sinnes praying receyue v mercie therewithall plucke v back wise may desire nothing submit selues wholy vnto notwithstanding authoritie giueth well one v another ouer men yet may consider one mutuall bond among v one v subiect another end discharge selues dutie walk sort brotherly vnitie may v one comon accord one mouth claim father let v al say almightie god c cxiiij sermon fourth vpon xxxj chapter haue disappoynted poore desire haue vveryed eye vvidovve haue eaten morsel alone fatherlesse hath part thereof youth hee hath beene brought vp vvere father shee hathe beene vvith vvombe mother haue seene man perish vvant coate poore vvant garment loynes haue blissed mee haue beene vvarmed vvith fleece lambes haue lift vp hande fatherlesse seeing helpe gate let mine arme fall shoulder let mine arme broken bone haue feared punishment god could beare burthen heere iob sheweth manner louingnesse hee succoure poore needie protested heeretofore done man wrong passeth yet namely pitying necessitie suche came succoure hee releeued owne goodes substaunce yea euen without making linger vvherein sheweth himselfe haue willing forwardnesse saye hee sooner requested employed selfe delayed day day loue lugged eare cause sayth haue disappoynted poore desire say succoured poore sawe want needie haue weryed eye widowe wee wayte anything longing eye alwayes vpon wee looke ouer earnestly vpon anye thing oure eye faynte dazel vvee see howe iobs meening hung downe groyne bosome say poore folkes came desire help succoured hand also hee addeth hee sawe men sterue colde wanted rayment rather delt loynes side blissed say felt fauour whiche shewed warmed fleece lambes short sayth eaten morsells alone deuoured himselfe goodes god giuen giuen widowes fatherlesse part whome sayth haue brought vp father vvherein doth v wit bin father fatherlesse mother womb sayth haue widow haue taken vntoo mee poore needed suctour haue neuer fayled bee let shoulder fall socket say let bee dismembred let fall peeces like rotten carren let mine arme sayth thrust ioynt let bone broken let world see god great horrible curse vppon body sayeth hee haue done wrong feeble able reuenge themselues like haue lifted vp hand fatherlesse although able wrong help shoulde haue ma hand iustice might vphold wrong yet notwithstanding haue attempted thing lette torne peeces rot aliue alwayes afrayd god scourge able beare burthen herein declareth hath done heeretofore respect men shame world consideratio lifted euill forasmuch saw god hys iudge therefore walked vprightly althoughe hee might haue gone vnpunished worldward without feare pursued way iustice otherwise might haue taken libertie doo harme meaner sort reason credit yet notwithstanding hee always consideration say verely god knowe thy wrath would terrible vnto shuld ibe able indure short iob sheweth heere absteyning sinne feare punishment sawe none eye consciece sake whiche compelled obey god feare iudgement come effect whyche conteyned heere first haue heere one lesson shew god child wee must pitiful help neighbor need almes deedes therefore commended v heere hath bin tolde often heeretofore word almes importeth much mercy see among tytles god chalengeth vnto himselfe gentle mercifull wee bee child neyther acknowledge v except labour follow example behalfe namely moued pitie see poore folke aduersitie go prouide euery v according abilitie true may giue substance yet shal counted vertue hand opened giue behoueth hart bee touched copassion haue pitie aduersitie behoueth v also succour power iames sayth say apoore man freend god help thee thereby shew haue loue say great pitie man yet meane whyle labour succour whome ought releeue mockerie hypocrite say see god sheweth mee pitifull cace much god gaue mee occasion imploy selfe thereby see hee calleth yet meane make countenance one drop kindnesse would indeuer help necessitie part wee haue beare mind text holy ghost exhorteth v almes deedes consisteth two poynts say pitifull towards neighbour see aduersitie also haue pitifull affection seeke meanes succour euery man streyneth power true cannot stead necessity wee see therefore christian man may well mourne heart without putting hys hand purse impossible euen best minded help time therefore pitifulnesse shall suffise god accepteth almes deede poore nourished fedde haue compassion vpon poore man great sacrifice vnto god hee gyuen delt dole full purse neuerthelesse behoueth v alwayes looke deale according habilitie knowing lord hath made v stewardes goodes hath put hand end euery v deuoure alone communicate suche haue neede true also man set certaine stint cace surely saint paule speaketh sayeth god constreyneth v necessitie haue v free deuotion way let v beare well minde poore passe v see neede keepe purse shet vouchsafe succour sure signe wild beast ther one mite pitie v selues shal one day feele like vnmercifulnesse god send v affliction although miserable yet shall man moued men shall looke vpon v disdaine shall bee shaken left vtterly destitute measure wage god wonte giue vnto hardharted towards neybours according sayd hee mercilesse shall haue iudgemente without mercie yea besides men shall cruell towards v according desert wee must also end appeare god handle v rigour bycause wee haue folowed goodnesse would haue rule example much behoueth v bee mindfull doctrine whiche shewed v namely god thinketh ynough wee absteyne euill hurting neighbour fro taking away men goodes substance true already kinde vertue wee iustly protest haue cleane handes giuen theeuerie deceyte extortion yet let v thinke wee cleare quitte god giuen v wherewith help haue neede blameworthey haue taken away god good put another vse ment seruant bee put trust receyue master goodes mayster hath appoynted giue thus much one pay summe money oweth haue set ordinarie sorte hee haue goodes spent seruant play niggarde one man commeth cry pay yet hee wyll part wyth pennie another commeth saying mayster willeth giue mee suche thing yet let thing go housholde cryeth oute vppon hym breade hee letteth sterue hunger labour maisters seruice pray tollerable seruant shall answere beholde sir haue touched one mite goodes beholde sir haue reserued vnto euer mayster maye say shame haue put goodes intoo thy hande ende thou hast done shame thou hast bestowed goodes appoynted thee nowe must beare slaunder thy niggardship pinching none thine mayster shall commen suche seruaunt shall hee condemne wicked lykewise god gyueth v hys goodes intent wee relieue oure brother nowe contrary parte wee bee strayght laced goeth penie purse one morsell bread table shall become v defrauding whome god hath ordeyned haue part substance robbing god thing hee hath put intoo oure handes sayd afore let v learne bee mercifull although man taske v say thou shalte gyue thus much yet neuerthelesse let euery man streyne hymselfe consider hys owne abilitie knowing well wee haue done doo yet wee discharged thus yee see particular lawe euery man ought haue charitie ought stretche selfe farre wide euen farre wee may still confesse selues bee sufficiently discharged towardes poore wee possible althoughe wee come full perfection bee niggardlynesse grudging free heart succour suche haue neede let v assure selues oure lorde accepteth almesse sacrifice sweete sauour yea euen though faultinesse wee tenth part bound heerewithall behoueth v marke circumstance whiche set downe heere wee cause suche linger haue neede vse delay token wee haue free hart neighbor good wee put another time exceprit bee vpon good consideration may well bee man maye bee pitifull yet notwithstanding inquire necessitie partie lingring whiche iob meeneth hee sayeth hee disappoynted poore man hys desire heere hee intendeth expresse lothnesse niggardes namely man desireth reliefe woulde fayne draw penie purse seeming man would plucke guttes belly therefore woulde alwayes fayne haue release like vnto yll paymayster men come demaund dette knoweth well must pay yea well able doth good bragge money purse day twayne else like man led hanging delayeth long hee commeth mounting vp ladder falleth preaching euery stoppe euen play holdfastes man cometh demand hys det maketh alwayes shrinke backe much man come aske almes wee charitable surely haue lothnesse v shoulde seeke suche respite poore linger afore v suche wise wee shoulde haue oure eares beaten euer cry wee would indeuer helpe presently much lay v ye see wee haue remember thys streyne namely wee wyll almes acceptable vnto god wee must tary till wee bee importunatly called cried vpon see neede must hie v take order presently like wee selues indure aduersitie seemeth v men shall neuer come time ynough succour v deale wee likewise others vvee neede take none measure true naturall rule vnto others woulde bee done vnto hastie desire succour piteously slow giue yee see cause wee ought better marke saying iob made widow linger disappointed poore hys desire nowe addeth eaten morsel alone giuen fatherlesse widowe part vvhy sayth haue brought vp widowe mother wombe haue nourished fatherlesse father heere wee see woonderfull example buontifulnesse liberalitie heere dooing little almes deede weeke three foure iob declareth heere hee beene father fatherlesse defender wydowes onely helping also finding hys goodes substance vvhen wee heare pray ought wee greatly ashamed vvee hardly scarcely finde oure harte succour one among hundred wee misse whole score tymes yet thynke selues well discharged lighte almes one man prouide requisite giuing little peece coyne passe wee woulde say go shifte thy selfe otherwhere great shame v iob giuen v heere mirrour persone lorde shoulde shewe v duetie yet notwithstanding wee nothing yet whiche conteyned heere ought serue oure learning instruction contrariwise serueth condemne v insomuche shall neede none recorde god reproue v beastly crueltie leastwise folow shewed v heere iob true although wee haue perfection yet god fayle accept v haue said insomuch althoughe almes deedes ought yet god take good woorth haue said compassion towards distresse indeuer good cheerefull mind meane cannot match iob full shall therefore follow shall wee leastwise labour aloofe fashion selues example shall wee go towarde marke vvell able bring vp fatherlesse yea though wee haue wherewith yet oure infirmitie holdeth v backe imploying selues vttermost yet least ought haue compassion let v somewhat though although wee cannot attaine marke iob came vnto leastwise let v trauel towards seeing god calleth v great shame nothyng else remoue one legge grinde teeth loyterers doo set forward one foote thinke draw whole mountaine againe lifted vp one arme frowne grinde teeth stead putting forward pull backward vvhen go worke fashion token willingnesse v therefore cannot come perfection iob declareth himselfe haue whiche thing hee declareth way bragging intente moued let v leastwise follow example god knowing wee become neuer better single teaching setteth v foorth looking glass end haue lesse excuse man aske must wee giue men withoute difference answer heereto holy ghost intendeth take awaye discretion almes gyuing men shoulde looke well bestowing go without discretion euery man drawne drie end poore left succourlesse boldest woulde beare away manner men boldest least pitied counterfeyte themselues bee poore onely rake themselues onely seeking haue double treble care though men suffer hunger thirst therefore good men shoulde vse discretion looke narowly whome gyue specially considering lewdenesse dayes worlde many hypocrite pitie see hardly shall man finde one amongst hundred woorthy bee succoured although bee poore deede yet notwithstanding men loth good bycause soone get thing fall gluttonie drunkennesse god maketh wast away short come full measure iniquitie insomuch ought vse great discretion narrowe search wee gyue meane whyle let v beware seeke couert niggardlynesse vnder shadowe discretion god misliketh men shoulde haue regarde whome gyue ende benefite may bee well bestowed behoueth v first bee fully resolued maner ourselues mynde spare according measure haue doo good according abilitie desire finde may succour vvhen man resolued let hym inquire whither almes may well bestowed man man may freely man say himselfe best wel aduised giue always take occasion excuse say find pouerty hee glad haue occasion stay giuing appeareth manifestly man seeketh nothing exempte himselfe releeuing haue need help intend inquire behoueth good go say seeking doo good let v boldly inquire may well first formost well minded seeke couert niggardlinesse thus ye see poynt must come yet notwithstanding searching also must bee narrowly impossible wee deceyued well although wee best trie thyngs yet notwithstanding wee muste needes ouerseene giuing almes vnwoorthy cause saint paule exhorteth v good without ceassing shall haue many lettes hinder v first shall see malicious person misreport v therevpon follow vnthankefulnesse whiche dealing able thrust v way yet must alwayes good courage holde still whatsoeuer come bee short according haue sayde already wee cannot set downe particular rule thing generall rule whiche god giueth v ought suffise v wee must haue kinde harte inclined pitie compassion desire benefite succour haue neede helpe must make linger wayting vpon v rather haue playne meening heart ende hand may open whensoeuer neede requireth thus ye see effect haue beare away heere let v marke well iob addeth immediately hee seene hym perish whiche wanted clothes suffered hym sterue colde rayment couer sydes loynes sayth hath blessed mee beene warmed fleece sheepe heere iob sheweth laboured kynde wayes almes deedes giuing meate drinke suche ahungred athirst also clothing naked truely wee intende mercifull behoueth v succour necessity neighbour sorte see ynough succour part true men cannot doo iob dyd wee haue many thousandes cattell hee might haue bin accounted amongst great prince dayes respect reuenue according see onely yoke hundred ox whole droues yea many coulde kept fiue sixe village rather whole countrey muche haue seene well ynough substance onely cattell cattell whole countrey euery man therefore cannot attaine howsoeuer world go let v consider owne abilitie according vnto behoueth v indeuer doo good like know saide widowe whiche gaue two mite praysed commended christ cast great summes money reason bycause giuen hir whole substaunce whereas others giuen small portion respect rich let euery one v consider owne state see neighbour want eyther meate drinke clothes leastwise able succour otherwise let v pray god haue pitie vpon help therewithall wise let ther fault v ayded succoured ye see haue beare mind iob spoken meate delt part hungrie addeth also hee clothed suche haue sterued cold bin help yea sayth loynes blissed vvherein declareth occasion cun thanke releeued sort therewithal sheweth v looked reward men hand sought discharged god ward good glad good done bicause knew acceptable god lesson ought beare well mind although men vnthankful towards v haue done good vnto grudge v render v euill good yet notwithstanding wee haue lost thing good spite teeth belly blisse v god haue fed haue succoured otherwise thing selfe answer v true sometimes wil malicious say yea mary much purpose wherefore beholding according wee see nowadayes poorest proudest man hath indeuered good vnto wil soonest speake euill shall see let v therefore bee wery cannot away vnthakfulnesse let v marke saying set downe heere thing haue done shall blisse v god man playeth verlet grudgeth murmureth another man hathe helped verywell yet doth carie side still man haue clothed body muste needes blisse god true hath intent howsoeuer fare god loketh vppon body clothed blissednesse shall come account man haue bin fed said belly must needes speake although mouth churlish turne good euill nothing commeth poyson yet notwithstanding lord accept blissednesse almes deede man shall haue done thus ye see end may prouoked succour haue neede v haue marke wee must respect whether able recompence v counteruayle good shall done whether thankfull put cace cleane contrary yet shall haue lost labour bycause god accepteth sacrifice done ye see imported saying sydes loynes man nipped colde doo blisse suche haue clothed contrary part let v marke although poore aske vengeance v co playne v yet notwithstanding side curse v suffering smart shet eye haue pitie say mine ease care howe othermen fare wee haue bene cruell harted certayne wee vouchsafe succour poore needie sterue want reliefe god wil make side loynes speake althoughe party themselues open mouthes coplain vnmercifulnesse yet notwithstanding anguish suffer crieth complayneth god vengeance ensueth according complainte shall come passe although men speake worde haue sayd afore iob hath spoken addeth hee lifted vp hand fatherlesse though saw help gate say although could haue done without punishment men time men sate iustice gate townes place resort iob sayth truly coulde haue made one man quake another run away could haue bin thunder amongst man shoulde haue opened lip vvhy man credit shall bee borne folke shall dare complaine iudges shall dare redresse although full sway iustice would haue suffered attempted yet notwithstanding abused credite neyther dyd trample poore folke vnder feete fatherlesse child sought profit selfe know fatherlesse child oftentimes put spoyle iob sheweth vpright minde coulde haue taken away men goodes neuer went neuer ment make owne aduauntage men cost though libertie man behalfe howbeit addeth reason sayth hee god punishing casting downe men made afrayde hee shoulde say dyd respect whether men would speake euill onely hilde mine eye fast vpon god heauenly iudge heere wee see first hath bin great corruption time men haue bene ordeyned yeeld euery man right haue discharged duetie therin new thing iudges nowadayes reach hand wicked sort bolstring bearing wickednesse hath alwayes bene ordinarie custome therefore suche state iustice ought looke better themselues discharge dutie god corruption hath reigned long time day hath full scope euer man say maketh matter seeyng mischeef hath bin great antiquitie truely excused also knowledge god time neither men well acquainted doctrine bee nowadayes vvherefore nowe sit seate iustice haue mace hande suffer extortion see poore man troden vnder foote make account winke men authoritie take vppon becommeth excuse ther seeing eares dayly beaten admonition warning told dutie toward god toward people comitted vvherfore let v marke vpon doctrine suche corruption ordinarily worlde iudges supported wicked behoueth v comforte euery man see like confusion day mustnot greeue v ouermuch though getneither right reason suche v wrong able bring matter standeth v hand armed pacience see hathe beene god exercise seruaunts sorte time could well haue stablished iustice time iob many poore folkes smart vvhereas like cace day intendeth meanes teach v suffer marke one poynt yet neuerthelesse behoueth seate iustice looke well themselues inasmuch men inclined vice shall soone bee thrust duetie take good heede according wee see many example also second lesson whiche behoueth v remember wee respect lawfull v worldward settle sight vppon god example iob feare may withhold v hurting wronging neighbour lesson needefull pray men regard nowadayes may scape reproofe menne ynough man bring matter passe meane season order iustice euen tyme iob ayd gate extortion deuoured widowes suche troubled poore folkes ala nowadayes come extremitie muche woorse insomuch poore man troden downe shall haue redresse take away men good beguile beate trouble poore folkes ouershoote themselues intoo wickednesse lawlesse person growne suche boldnesse thynke lawe restreyne againe magistrate side fearefuller woman stoutnesse god spirite else contented dissemble pleasure men yea halfe agree wicked although knowe thing go amisse yet notwithstandyng haue zeale represse yet worse seeke nothyng shoulde bee oute square worlde shoulde come extremitie euill shoulde bee feare god honestie thing else confusion lo poynt part men thinke nothing may scape haue done amisse looke vpon royster lyeth wayte men goodes warrant bee meanes trappe hee espieth yea hee must come account tush may bribe man sayth hee matter dispatched carie present thing win hart shall win two three mo againe thing shall bee sure fourth may make vp halfe dosen side matter crie see howe haue sworde iustice hand set sale lyke brothel haue shame regard honour thing else nowadayes shiftes pretende shall villaynous shal colur honestie vve see euery man taketh leaue rob poll oppresse commital maner extortion matter brought iustice marred therefore sentence well woorthy bee noted iob protesteth notwithstanding credit authoritie men stoode awe euen iudges themselues durst haue delt although ther bin complaint made yet hee absteyned hys owne accord euill concluded wyth himselfe might therefore thing bycause men permitted alwayes saying bridle wit god punishment made afrayd therefore let v learne walke soundnesse good conscience intend thing let v examine whether god permit see displeaseth god hath forbidden disalowed let v let alone although men sooth v yea giue v libertie list yet let v keepe selues behoueth v come heauenly iudge shall auayle v haue escaped hand men shall bee doubling vengeance bycause shew well deedes feare men god see wee offer heynous iniury preferring mortall creature wretched carions hys maiestie shall afrayd men meane mocke god maiestie shall nothing mee againe haue corrupted iustice eyther hatred fauour crooked meanes wee haue woon iudges see yee yet seconde outrage offer vnto god defiling hath halowed iustice holy thing vnhalow whe turne vnto euill set seate whome god hathe appoynted purpose authoritie name shine say go thrust aside poynte high treason god cause sayd double god wrath vpon v shifting oure selues men handes sort yee see wee must fasten eye vppon god looke vntoo hys iudgement intent may owne free accord refrayne euill wee may although bee permitted v men behalfe therewithall also lette v marke fearing god punishment must onely feele come v late man feele god iudge striken hande therefore let v afrayde god threatneth v stroke light vpon head ye see euery man may refrayn euill eye fayth foresee punishment farre prepared euill doer suche trouble neighbour god weth v great fauour warneth v aforehande end might preuent vengeance thus ye see haue beare mynd conclusion iob addeth shall beare burthen shew v thing spoken v apostle namely right dreadfull thing fall hand liuing god vvee afrayd men punishment touch body done fire god wrath whyche consumeth thing yet neuer goeth burneth wise must forced continue yea indure without end vvhy regard wee let v moued punishment god let v looke keepe selues euill shame punishment world let v consider well mind vnderstandyng let v assure selues men shall haue determined execute cruellest torment vpon v deuised yet notwithstanding nothing comparison god heauie vengeaunce though man layde vpon wheele nipped pinsons burned aliue notwithstanding bee greeuous torment yet passe away continue euer againe grieue body beholde wrath god whiche consumeth thinges flaming fire burneth without ende worme gnaweth biteth hart within vvhen scripture vseth similitude expresse full onely giue v little inckling therefore let v marke well vengeance god prepared wicked intollerable burthen let prouoke v walke feare pacience assuring selues men vse crueltie violence v iudge heauen
