reuenge wherefore let restreyne v euill doyng though may safely worldly respect let v take heede conscience pure knowledge god rule guide v let v alwayes looke vpward behold hath set v world declaring vntoo v wee must one day come account iudgement seate nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement sinnes praying hym make v feele wise wee may craue forgiuenesse sory may indeuer selues wholy amend profit day day obedience vntill fully reformed pitying necessitie may indeuer succour like minded vntoo praying oure good god haue pitie vpon succour v also although wee vnworthy yet notwithstanding seing hath already made v feele goodnesse mercie may doubt bestowe vpon v increase grace day day v flee help true humilitie according hee calleth allureth v dayly vntoo word may please graunt grace v also c cxv sermon fift vpon xxxj chapter sermon yet still vpon verse vpon text added heere haue set hart vpon gold haue sayd vvedge golde thou art hope reioyced rich bycause hand found abundance haue looked vp shining sunne moone vvalking hir brightnesse hart hath beene deceyued secret hand hath come mouth vvere damnable vvickednesse denyed god aboue yesterday wee sawe protestation iob made concerning vpright walking feare men bycause eye alwayes vpon god knowing iudge men behoueth v come make account sayd expresly trusted owne credite foolish imagination make himselfe feared riche men doo haue wherewith greater sorte alwayes puffed vp pride see poorer sort cannot reuege themselues troden vnder foote turmoiled men wrong iniurie shame iob sayeth absteyned iniurie towards men gone euil bicause knew hee coulde escape hande god vvherevpon haue shew euill bee bolstered heere bilowe behoueth v vse pacience seeing hath alwayes bin god exercise seruants sort wit suffer many outrage mainteyned good right iustice shoulde bee blinded rather turned vpside downe let v marke must thinke wee haue gayned thing scaping hand men kyndle fyre god wrath vpon v bycause hath defaced iustice guiltie treason god moreouer men abuse themselues thinke thing bee lawfull bycause shall bee punished men hand therevpon take boldnesse whereat god greeuously offended therfore curse must needes increase kindle vpon v iob hath protested abused fatherlesse done outrage weake hee addeth hee put trust golde sayd vnto rich rest selfe reioyced goodes increased vvee haue alwayes beare minde hath bin shewed heeretofore witte iob touched one vertue alone comprehendeth generally whole rule good life god hath giuen v deede ynough v haue performed peece law leastwise wee able behoueth v indeuer rule frame life throughout according thynges god commaundeth like manner iob hath protested shewed himselfe cruell towards fatherlesse poore sayth hee puffed vp pride presumption hymselfe set store himselfe bycause hee rich surely singular vertue see co monly man haue little thing brag shall scarce beare foolish ouerweening vve need king prince puff selues vp vaunt selues soone man hath little goodes vppon tiptoe spreadeth hys wing vaingloriousnesse men also woman surely see soone wome haue wherewith flowe pompe exceede theyr degree againe man doth chaunge countenance vouchsafeth looke vpon neighbor one side scarce open mouth shall scornfully proudly men wyll afraid speake thus ye see pride appeareth euery would come great heapes golde siluer thing iob sheweth rich multiplied hard thing man alwayes milde lowly hath coffer full gold siluer set nothing vvee see therefore god wrought marueylously iob suffered blinded vayne presumption rich caused possesse rich wise hee alwayes ready leaue set hart vpon looke iob protesteth hymselfe commaunded v according see sayd psalme ryches increase set harte thereon say make idolles put youre trust neyther bee puffed vp hautinesse respect doth saint paule also say couetousnesse idolatrie vnpossible man couetous gather muche therewithall bee possessed pride would estimation respect hys goodes thys pride reigneth vndoubtedly double idolatrie one beare h himselfe hande god would fayle hee wherewith helpe himselfe agayne bee riche hee despiseth god thinketh himselfe well fenced hee needeth thing short drunkennesse like man drunken maketh himselfe beleeue wonder man rich presumeth vpon rich remembreth mortall man forgetteth himselfe wise sticketh aduaunce god let v marke iob protesteth thing himselfe god commaundeth faithfull shoulde set myndes vpon rich though flowe vnto secondly let v marke rare vertue among men therefore wee haue neede imploy whole indeuer thervnto seeing wee cannot restrayne oure selues without greate difficultie withoute bringing oure selues vtterly vnder foote therefore let v indeuer holde selues suche stay rich may carie v away blinde v farre make v set heart mynde vpon let v marke intollerable vice man trust goodes exceeding heynous offence man robbe god due honour gyue dead senselesse creature doth hee make god rich sayd afore whiche presumeth much vppon yee see god bereft honour golde siluer whiche dead creature haue monstrous thing vvherefore let v learne cannot presume selues vnder colour goodes god giueth v wee must become ranke traytors god foule idolater saint paule termeth couetous folke iob also ment expresse saying haue set heart vpon golde haue sayd wedge golde thou art trust heere iob bringeth talke betwene himselfe money verely man talke vnto rich hee openeth chest coffer hee enter communication though hee body talke maner speeche iob doth well set foorth folly ouerweening riche men trusting rich haue secret conference conspiracie golde siluer true speake yet without speaking ceasse haue thing iob sheweth heere vvherefore often wee bee tempted put trust creature earthly thing let v call minde robbing god honour purloyning giue thing nothing therefore let v abhorre dealing therewithall also let v remember condemnation iob layeth heere vpon v let v compare oure selues vvhat shame man aduaunce himselfe gaze vpon fethers thinke himselfe oly fellow bycause hee woorth wote beholde iob possessed greate treasure gathered golde siluer heapes yet notwithstanding alwayes hild himselfe suche lowlinesse hee bin poore man vvhat shame v bee lifted vp little seeing iob blinded great aboundance god giuen hym marke one poynte furthermore let v marke great triall man riche yet notwithstanding becommeth proud continueth alwayes milde without presuming himselfe walketh better another man yee see heere good triall therefore let v thinke haue atteyned great vertue come point man found citie geneua whole countrey lyke vnto iob truly man gather richest togither would say nothing comparison iob possessed boast themselues nowadayes rich shoulde thinke themselues great men bycause mounted vppon blade onyon man compare theyr wealth iobs lord doth hold low ebbe let assure themselues profite greater wealth would burst would bee cause decay woulde mount hie shoulde breake theyr necke let v marke lord procureth benefite welfare suffereth v mount hie wee could weld good fortune terme see although wee haue occasion aduaunce ourselues oure state bee simple may yet notwithstanding alwayes desirous grow great yea euen despite god nature thing thyngs lo heere thing ought make v beare estate better pacience euen though neuer base small yea let poorest sort vnderstand god intendeth humble subdue end bee giuen vntoo pride al likelyhood would bridle hold short triall howsoeuer world go v let content v oure lorde knoweth meete v hath hande cannot letted giue v knoweth good expedient v thus ye see wee haue marke effect concerning sayde heere iob put trust golde vaunted hymselfe though saw riche yet well woorthy noted addeth wit bee reioyced hande coulde heape vp muche goodes came place reioyced behalfe shoulde seeme firste blushe iob spake himselfe possible bee found mortall man cannot man gladde hath goodes impossible block wood vvhat doth iob meene saying reioyced let v marke answer speaketh heere manner gladnesse naturall thing man sadde poore glad rich gladnesse euil selfe written thou shalt eate drinke mery lord thy god therefore lorde giue v goodes haue cherishe oure selues end merrie haue told already little doth mirth gladnesse displease god condemned selfe rather token faith feare whiche wee haue towardes somuch learne thereby praise goodnesse yeeld thanks benefites dealeth vnto v iob speaketh heere blind reioycing among worldling caried away goodes forget god remember frailtie exalted themselues frantike ioy inordinate ioy ioy turneth v away god maketh v drunken know bee iob ment heere bee short doth v vnderstande hilde minde bridled rich came indeede receyue god hande glad yeelding god thankes increasing sort yet notwithstanding withall repose felicitie rich principall poynt haue note wherein men abuse themselues rest vpon transitorie thynges whereas ought bee led vvhen speaking welfare felicitie men behoueth v tende vnto god assure oureselues wee bee separated hym wee bee vnhappie goodes pleasure honour whiche wee possesse many condemnation vppon v thus ye see would behoue v seeke god riseth question concerning oure welfare happinesse contrary part wee see men busie head corruptible thing insomuch make god one gold siluer another honour credite third pleasure vvhen man desireth rich behold marke shooteth hee setteth bee riche happie case meane letteth god alone giueth quite ouer man seeketh exalted dignitie credite rauished careth bee separated god one whoremonger giuen wicked lust beleeueth goeth well hee glad may inioy desire vve see whereas men ought tend trauell godwarde rest themselues vpon corruptible thing let v marke heere iob reioyced rich goodnesse god made rich yet could sufficietly vnderstood declared familiarly word ouerdarke themselues bycause wee woulde alwayes vse hypocrisie god though wilie ynough beguile men hope euer scape startingholes doo halfe knowe themselues therefore man say one worde wee muste reioyce rich god giueth veriest niggardes veriest pinchpennyes worlde wyll alledge excuse make protestation full mouth oh reioyce rich forsomuch god hath giuen glory onely guideth gouerneth lo men full hypocrisie seeke also fayre colour vernish filth withall therefore sayd needefull expounde better sentence reioycing god rich vvhat doth import hauing eye god hath giuen v goodes possesse vnderstande therein meeneth shew himselfe father towards v seing oure father good reason also wee shoulde bee chyldren oure sydes towardes hym god child wee cannot bee wee muste vse brotherly loue towardes men bearing mynde goodes whyche wee haue layde pledge hande god releuing neighbour haue neede let v vnderstande god wyll haue v tyed earthly thing wee regarde god wee wyll immediately haue eye endlesse life hee hath prepared v heauen shall wee bee wedded corruptible thynges neyther shall wee make rich bee dirt myre wallowe oure selues suche giue theyr heartes ouer vntoo ryches quamyre men say heere like haue plucked oute one legge sincke deeper cannot get put theyr truste worlde farre vnable rayse vp themselues godwarde stagger stumble reele bee shorte cannot get oute gulfe wherein bee plunged contrary beholde heere oure lorde offereth himselfe v calleth v heauenly lyfe hee shoulde say hye apace marche yee ouer worlde bee wedded therefore wee followe incouragement whiche god gyueth v certayne wee shall haue none desire go forwarde heauenly lyfe wee shall bee hilde backe good worlde heerewithall also let v marke reioycing god except contented alone according sayde sixteenth psalme lorde mine heritage portion longing nowe haue contentation certayne wee wyll passe worldely good whensoeuer shall please god bring v therevnto sobeeit wee possesse alone neuer taken away v vve heare also howe sayde vntoo abraham thine exceeding greate rewarde saying god intendeth driue v vnto holde heartes mindes faste settled without raunging heere wee see nowe reioyce god rich haue declared alreadie man reioyce god behoueth shewe well welth pouertie hearte wedded worldlye goodes wealth beeyng letted followe way god setteth afore discharge himselfe dutie towardes neyghboures pouertie beeyng pacient shall please god bereeue good hee cometh coclusion yet separated god ynough fauour therefore nowe behooueth bee quyet hee thing whome ought take reste effect whiche iob mente intendeth teache v example hee sayeth hee reioyced rich also bee noted reioycing carryeth thankesgyuing say wee haue wherewith reioyce god behooueth v also glorifie acknowledging wee haue thing meere goodnesse furthermore pryde also condemned saying whereas bee forbidden reioyce rich ende shoulde v unt ourselues thinke selues better men th sainct paule sayeth timothee warne riche men worlde bee proude hyghe minded truste lyuing god sainct paule sheweth haue touched alreadie namely rare vertue ryfe bee founde riche man lowly haue pryde prayse aboue yet al possible v reioyce god pryde must thrust vnder foote hart wholy ouermaystered forasmuch men cannot attayn therevnto without greate hardnesse greate streyning themselues aboue power sainct paule sheweth couenient remedie trust liuing god wist truste god certaine rich carie v away muste needes followe suche wedded rich know truste god neyther passe grace according also haue sayde alredy howe naughte paule place termeth couetousnesse idolatrie iob protested addeth haue looked vp sunne shined moone walking ir lyght haue layde hande vppon mouthe surelye beynouse thing renouncing god aboue haue expounded sentence though iob protest worshipped sunne moone bycause olde time common superstition specially east countreyes iob partes wee haue seene heeretofore shoulde seeme iob mente declare heere hee done men among whome liued say wondered gazed sunne moone attributed godly maiestie vntoo made idol surely god telleth people expresly moyses muste blinde woorshippe sunne moone sunne true hee hath woonderfull lyghte see markes god glorie like cace moone also cause sayde preache vnto v god speaketh vntoo v theyr mouthe ende shoulde allured come vnto therewithall god sayeth vnto woorshippe sunne moone vnthankeful ende haue created fashioned ende yee shoulde know mee euen mee creator yee contrarie vnthankefulnesse doubled sunne seruant vvhat moone handemayde vvherefore doth sunne shine giue light make earth frutefull according god giueth vse seeing creature howe noble soeuer subiect vnto v god hath ordeined v seruice foule vnthankfulnesse v make idolles exposition true yet agreeth present place iob ment vse another similitude purpose go forwarde matter haue treated alreadie namely hee presumption pryde wee see howe proude sorte caste vp nozes winde say take themselues bee common rate men make wote stately countenance though woulde separate themselues mortal life pryde extendeth onely neighboures also looke loftie euery preace god suche statelinesse sunne moone thoughe bee farre aboue v notwithstanding highe ynoughe ouerlooke saying wee nowe vvhiche v greater vvhich v higher iob ment expresse men foolishe hautinesse aduauncing setting themselues measure bee shorte vouchesafe holde themselues common trayne woulde greater god graunteth bee thus yee see looke vp sunne hee shineth vnto moone shee walketh hir brightnesse yet neuerthelesse see lord giueth v token feeblenesse wee cannot looke vppon sunne oure eye dimmed hande true god woulde haue v reioyce light sunne maketh walke skie v seruice vve see howe iourneyeth giue v light besides wee knowe also sunne giueth liuelinesse oure body wee see earth made frutefull warmth thence drawe substance nourishment yet therewithall lorde putteth v minde frayltie meeken v wee cannot looke vp oure eye shall bee dimmed whiche looke vp sorte vnto shining sunne moone hir light woulde fayne shewe themselues valiaunt fellowes spyte nature worlde beside iob protesteth hee none suche therewithall addeth also heart beguiled secrete hande shoulde layde mouth vvhen hee sayeth hee beguyled secrete heart serueth expresse better hee onely bene curteous lowly towards men also bene continually little one god notwithstanding men praysed although euery man reuerence dreaded wholeworld yet glorified thing insomuche anatomie beene made heart euer within bene sounded gaged bottome man shoulde haue founde hautinesse saying vseth afterwarde hee sayeth hee kissed hande hande came mouth bee kissed expound saying commended vertues make meritorious settle truste welfare vpon goodnesse holinesse life doctrine good exposition selfe notable vttered man liued corrupte tyme sainct gregorie men call lyued time ignorance corruption afterward bishoppe rome declareth beastly wickednesse yea vtter renouncing god man truste owne desertes yet adayes cheefe article controuersie betwixte v papistes say saluation grounded vpon free goodnesse god vpon death passion lorde iesus christe wee bee saued fayth onely contrariwise pope haue euery man owne sauiour yet one pope rome neuerthelesse ca skill say renouncing god outragious wickednesse kisse hand say trust work make meritorious vertues doctrine good profitable yet notwithstanding text muste taken simplie concerne iobs vertues true comprehended howbeeit haue seene afore hee speaketh generally occasion men take trust creature themselues therfore sayth mouth haue kisse say haue leaned mine owne credite thing else haue bene beastly make idolles good honour worde kisse betokeneth homage honour mouth haue kissed hande say vayne selfe truste homage honour selfe haue done sayeth let god curse mee doubt renouncing liuing god souereyne god heere wee haue marke sayde highmindednesse intollerable thing god manner speache looking vp sunne iob vseth bee marked well true naturally countenance looketh vpward god would difference betweene v brute beastes behalfe hee hath giuen beastes hanging lookes bycause looke downewarde grounde man hath countenance lift vpward bycause hee looketh better excellenter state heauen deede intent shoulde alwayes looke vp alofte seeke god heauenlye kingdome meane let shoulde humble selues also cause dauid protesteth hee meddled greate matter woonderfull thing highe manner speaking partly like vnto similitude iob vseth dauid sayeth lord thou knowest haue walked greate thing lawfull men deale greate matter state iustice honorable carrying aboute god woorde greate thing also bee shorte man findeth let vocation man instructe others hee take vppon teache child schoole eyther bothe creature fashioned image god ought refourme greate matter man haue whole countrey guyde excellent matter yes dauid speaketh puffing vp hearte woulde aduaunce selues know deale matter great weyght therefore hee addeth woonderfull thing aboue say desire deale thing passed capacitie iob sayeth looked vp sunne say cast vp noze playe royster aduaunce selfe agaynste god tyme reputation worlde heereby wee see touched afore foolishe luste men make themselues esteemed intollerable thing god vvhat bee done behooueth v come remedie whiche lowlinesse seeyng god forbiddeth v lift vp countenance high let v cast downe owne good wee haue sufficient cause wee looked well vpon selues woulde continually practize prouerbe namely hee knoweth himselfe beste set leaste store himselfe forasmuche lothe knowe ourselues state wonder though caried away foolishe pryde coulde finde heartes stie aboue clowdes vvherefore lette v marke standeth v hande examine well owne wantes ende wee may bee restreyned modestie able protest wee haue cast vp heades haue alwayes looked downward acknowledging haue whereof make boaste marke one poynte secondly sayde iobs hearte led away couert lette v beare minde humilitie lowlinesse consisteth outward apparace towards shal see many whiche meeke gentle outwarde likelihoode yet meane whyle ceasse foster foolishe selfeweening heartes haue estimation themselues vvee see howe hypocrite outwardly framed vnto lowlinesse notwithstanding inwardely proude ready bruste poyson agaynste god thing humble outwardly amongst men seeme simple sheepe meane whyle play buls iniustling againste god example glorie theyr owne vertues thinke earne paradise religious rabble popedome doo certaynely lifte vp themselues agaynst god insomuche make account theyr owne merites muche woorse pretende statelynesse towardes men bee man puffed vp vayne pryde setteth oute himselfe brauerie thinketh grounde beareth euerye man mocke stinking folly canot borne withall nowe suche presumption sette selfe god althoughe bee hidden inwardely pray muche villeynous lette v marke well ynough v beare sweete amiable countenaunce pretende milde behauiour towardes men wee muste looke heart led away secrete wee haue pryde hydden within althoughe appeare men yet shall fayle bee condemned god therewithall lette v marke couert pryde condemned shall scape whiche spreade wing vaunte themselues openly lette v vnderstande lorde setteth vpon scaffolde ende wee shoulde knowe vice wherevntoo wee inclined whiche reygneth v tyll god correct furthermore touching kissing handes haue tolde alreadie manner speeche importeth dooing homage honor without cause holy ghost hath vsed speeche thing wherein men falsely beguyle themselues taking vppon honor belongeth vnto god plaine spyting sainct paule declareth therefore concluded vntill time men vtterly distruste themselues mislike theyr owne vertues shall neuer bee throughly humbled ought neyther shall honour god becommeth deserueth nowe lette v fall downe face good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v feele better wee haue heeretofore done seeing miserable may throughly consider owne wantes learne shake pryde forasmuch lord sheweth v often welfare felicitie glory consist wee may learne seeke mortifie al fleshly lustes iesus christ may reygne peaceably vnto whome souerayne dominion giuen intent knee bow inasmuch behooueth v passe world thing may holde v backe conuenient necessity lyfe hee suffer v bee still intangled wee may trauayle towarde heauenlye kingdome vse creature hath ordeined vse wee may make idolles wee may nother thorough misgouernment thorough outrage wedded worlde passe thorough wee may alwayes still go forwarde bee gathered vp euerlasting reste purchased v lorde iesus christ may please hin graunte grace onely v also people nation earth bringing backe c cxvj sermon sixt vpon xxxj chapter sermon yet still vpon verse vpon text added heere reioyced aduersitie mine enemie vvere glad vvhen euill befell haue suffered mouth speake euill vtter curse agaynst houshold folke haue sayde vvho shall gyue v flesh eate vve satisfied straunger lodge streate gate vvere open trauayled vvay haue begonne already expounde sentence iob protesteth hee looked vp sunne moone effect saying hee declareth thereby hee puffed vp pryde whiche presume vpon themselues thinke great value trusting either rich credite thervpon despising men yea thinking themselues bee subiect vnto god iob protesteth puffed vp suche pryde chalenge worthinesse himselfe addeth renouncing god hyghe hee sayde afore heynous offence woorthie death heere wee see howe god abhorreth highmindednesse men woulde aduaunce themselues aboue measure thereof wee may gather lowlinesse sacrifize moste acceptable others also oure owne nature wee doo easily abace oure selues behalfe behooueth man bee broughte nothing hee may esteeme himselfe hee intende bee taken reputed humble god humilitie lowlinesse imbacing oure selues wee haue wherewith magnifie selues acknowledging nothing wretchednesse v wee woulde open oure mouth alledge thing ourselues wee shal finde nothing vtter confusion v hearte conceyue vaine presumptio winde may well brust v neuer feede v thus yee see true right humilitie lowlinesse importeth namely man esteeme himselfe according also truthe wee haue reason doo whosoeuer setteth himselfe muste needes bee ouer blinde brutishe hee entreth intoo himselfe examineth vertues thoroughly shall finde hee hath none god meere grace hee bounde vntoo yea vertues god giueth v matched many infirmity wee cannot caste downe eye therfore flatter themselues nowadaies thorough ouerweening onelye beguyle themselues also robbe god honour meanes become ranke traytours moreouer vtterly renounce liuing god sayde truely righte harde firste sighte howbeeit well considered easie iudge iob exceedeth measure reason saying hee whiche flattereth himselfe renounceth god vvhy ynough confesse one god behooueth v also knowe hee reserue due honour belongeth vntoo bereeue god parte glorie decke selfe withall shall wretched woorme earthe rotten carrion sette muche himselfe god shoulde bee abaced intente hee shoulde bee exalted mingling heauen earth toogither peruerting whole order nature agayne god robbed glorie put spoyle renouncing menne acknowledge bee suche one rather vtterly disclayme therefore lette v marke well impossible men aduaunce preferre themselues muste needes bee kinde renouncing god heere yee see also sayde psalme wee haue song proude whiche stande vppon owne vertue strengthe trusting therevntoo challenging muche themselues thinke harme may touche doo conclude hearte god vttermoste theyr power reiecte religion true speake mouthe yet deede holye ghoste whiche searcheth oure priuities declareth therefore lette v learne honour god put away false imagination pryde maye bee beaten downe v impossible man shoulde offer seruice vntoo god withoute humilitie haue sayde wee bee humble excepte wee acknowledge oure selues bee nothing nothing woorth glory ought reserued vndiminished vntoo god furthermore lette men esteeme muche themselues liste yet shall feele god agaynste mortall enemie vtter confusion hee exalteth himselfe rusheth agaynste god hee humbleth himselfe leaneth vnder hande wee knowe oure owne wretchednesse wyll beate v downe god reache v hande lifte v vp sette v lappe wee needes go aboute truste oure owne strength bee harde incounter v whiche shall serue breake oure heades bee wee neuer proude god muste shewe himselfe oure aduersary suche presumptuousnesse v yee see haue remember streyne lette v marke looking vp sunne moone saye mennes loftinesse presuming vpon themselues may twoo sortes one vnder coloure theyr rich honour wherein bee placed forget themselues thinke bee mortall creature vvhen come point god may wel punish suche blinde pryde according fonde thing woorthie bee scorned whole worlde lyfe appurtenaunces manner pryde whiche men flatter themselues thinke haue bothe wisedome power gouerne themselues deserue much godward men presume farre themselues chalenge prayse theyr owne saluation muste needes stumble deadly fall bycause principal poynt god reserueth himselfe know selues state damnation vtterly forlorne past recouerie recouer hope free goodnesse vvhen doctrine defaced asmuch exalt men ende god shoulde bee brought nought one men would put god honor spoyle vvherfore lette v learne caste downe oure heades assuring selues coulde glory god alone beaten downe selues hauing corrected foolish self weening wherewith wee puffed vp god woulde releeue v make v partaker glory might beleeue goodes hath doo belong vnto v haue wee nothing side god rich ynough supply wats may assure selues hee fayle v thing according scripture sayeth although men poore wretched nothing wherof may boaste yet notwithstanding god glorye wil couer al vnclennesse shal ashamed go cheeke cheeke angel heaue god child member lorde iesus christe thus much concerning humilitie lowlinesse spake iob hath spoken hee addeth protestation whiche hee reioyced inconuenience happened enimies gladde hee saw fall giuen mouth leaue cast foor h curse vpon yea persisted minde hee giuen eare housholde seruauntes prouoke reuenge neuerthelesse restreyne himselfe notwithstading came firebrand moue therevntoo yee see protestation iobs contayneth witte although men beare ill indeuered hurt put losse yet notwithstanding rendred like like whiche nourished secrete hatred hearte protestation well woorthie noted bycause one hardest thing god commaundeth v cause hypocrite papacie haue bene ashamed falsifie holye scripture saying lorde iesus christes willing v loue enimies counsell commaundemet vvhat moued vse blasphemy bycause measured god comaundements strength eye man abilitie saw thing surmount power concluded god comaund seeming god requireth nothing v whiche wee able performe verely ouershot themselues far poynt theyr hypocrisie grosse let v examine rest god commaundements see whether fulfill shall find cannot haue much one good thought beginne withall much lesse bee able stirre one finger apply al strength hypocrite abuse themselues false imagination man able performe lawe god diuell besotteth thervpon surmize impossible men loue enimies therefore shake god yoke say expresse commaundement ought obserued necessitie counsell iesus christ giueth furthermore sayd counsell cocerneth perfectio gospell vnder lawe blasphemie ye see iob protesteth know whither liued law moyses published howbeeit haue shewed heeretofore hee afore time prophet make mention man offormer time yet neuerthelesse declareth loued enimies whence came vnto came law whiche hath euer bene written heart faythful hath god set downe thing two table hath alwayes written holy spirit hart childre el doth day whole holy scripture set thing eye graueth v holy spirit insomuche coformitie betweene doctrine preached inwarde grace god giueth v holy spirite agree poynts respect see lord iesus christ came downe world iob protested loued enimies wise reioyced fal told behoued v marke well poynt shame shal v admonished lord iesus christes exhortation go seeke startingholes follow leastwise liued time doctrine yet darke shall double faultie yes surely shall wee let v marke first hath alwayes bin god wil louing enimies shoulde bee marke child proofe heereof let v harken sayde lawe moyses thine enimies oxe asse falle ditch thou shalt lift god comaudeth v good enimies brute beast shall best ca succour owne person bound procure mine enemy welfare shew eue cattell shall person muche precious haue conclude agaynst horrible blasphemie papist god wil hath time bin faithful loue hate indeuer doo good whiche hurte marke one poynt heerevpon wee haue also marke counsell may freely bee left vndone streyght comaundement wee cannot striue without offending god deadly nowe seing god woulde binde faithfull loue enimies euen time lawe muche reason haue sayde rule nowe haue large declaratio holy mouth lord iesus christ doctrine law darke selfe yea wrested awry scribe phariseys nowe hath iesus christe brought againe purenesse told v loue hate v indeuer helpe would hurt v shall acknowledged god childre surely horrible threate wee shall bee disherited god kingdome wil shake v bannishe v fellowship child seeyng lorde iesus christe hath suche threatening tolde v must beare good enimies let v learne frame selues doctrine therin acknowledge shamelesse boldenesse papist hath bene villeynous yea diuelishe saying iesus christes woordes simple admonition seeing matched sentence damnation god wyll renounce v banishe v oute kingdome wee ouermaster heartes farre loue hate v moreouer wee haue also mirror heereof lorde iesus christ offered himselfe suche deadly enimies vvherefore indured hee bytter death reconcyle v nowe behooued reconciliation bee made hatred god oddes behold lorde iesus christe yeelded himselfe death yea curse recouer v vntoo god father suche tyme wee enemy ought pledge breake heart though harder stone also wherevntoo sainct paule bringeth v backe epistle ephesian goeth subdue hatred wee haue coceyued agaynst enimies thus order whiche haue note whiche liued vnder lawe offended god intended reuenge themselues therfore shall become v haue declaration haue told already howbeit ynough v beare enimies euill must also haue minde seeke benefite welfare well woorthie bee noted diuers haue thoght discharged god ranne naked sworde agaynst haue offended done wrong mee say seeke reuenge pray god auenge mee would mee good heart might see mischiefe light vpon yea nay another manner practising doctrine iesus christ declareth vnto v muste pray curse v speake well backbite v good seeke hurt v contrariwise wee full poyson desire nothing god shoulde ouerwhelme side soeuer mishap befalleth glad done without ouerthrow conteyned doctrine lorde iesus christ others also found haue malicious heart suffer wicked lustes haue open libertie wyll say mee ready forgiue wishe harme selfe yet meane season cannot wish welfare profite haue displeased whome bee offended let v marke ynough v absteyne reuenging handes tongue nother ynough v put away euill wee would wish harme aduersitie enimies behooueth v go one degree muste loue iob loued enimies surely would haue reioyced misfortune lette v learne onely keepe heart locked vp bee prouoked agaynst offend v let v learne beare affection freendship may sorie euill happeneth vntoo also haue pitie copassion seeme hard v iob man subiect affection wee bee yet god get vpper hande behooueth v fight cannot done without great inforcemente true wee muste force oure selues howbeeit vpon truste owne strength praying vnto god giue v spirite meekenesse bring v thither wee see woorde leadeth v vvhat done looke vnto thing commaunded certayne nature draweth quyte backwarde shall angry man hurteth mee hath practized euill agaynste mee although loue vprightnesse good dealing yet shall fayle bee inflamed harteburning haue desire reuenge haue gone harme yet notwithstanding see heere iesus christ condeneth mee pronounceth dreadful sentence god shake mee shall razed number child loue mine enimies therfore seeing know onely infirmitie also frowardnesse nature behoueth mee pray god correcte vice mee knowe haue nothing bitternesse mee wel god hath spirite sweetenesse therefore behoueth mee seeke hande go mee certayne frowardnesse vexeth mee god hath spirite meekenesse gentlenesse behoueth mee desire make partaker wee haue recourse sort vnto god surely shall want thing furthermore lette v enter selues inforce selues shall wee gayne soothing selues true deede god commaundeth mee suche thing man feele mine owne infirmitie yea diseased behold phisition offereth himseife commeth medicine hande yet leuer continue still disease suffer medicine bee ministred vntoo mee nowe pray therefore bee excused vvherefore inasmuch knowe vice v lette v go remedie wee neede seeke farre although wee loth yet behoueth v fight againste lustes assuring selues bee madde beastes therefore greate force violence muste vsed oppresse heere yee see sayde behoued v streine inforce selues wee shall haue muche bring passe neuerthelesse wee go sorte god turne bitternesse nature louing kindnesse sweetnesse wil suffer v hate enimies consideration oft wee bee tempted hate enimies must cal minde request wee make wee desire god forgiue v oure fault forgiue offend v behooueth v cited god according deede come present selues god iudgement seate howe vvhen proteste vnto god forgiue mine enimies desire none pardon graunt yet meane nothing dissimulation mee vvhat shall prayer bee turned intoo cursing wee thought well vppon surely wee myghte breake wicked stomacke v lengthe god shoulde haue victorie easie v euen loue hate v wee maye better knowe euill v let v go degree scripture leadeth v possible wee shall bee styrred vp man dooth v wrong vvell one sinne already grudge agaynst hearte according lorde iesus christe sayeth wee haue already gayned euerlasting fire expressing hereof similitude hee borroweth maner iudgements time therfore make comparison three degree offending behalfe sayeth firste worthie punished iudgemente wee open mouth vtter woordes spyte disdayne agaynste hath offended v condemnation yet grieuouser feared condemned counsell cosistorie somewhat solemnely assembled according iesus christ alledgeth similitude third degree whe come open raging woordes thorough choler offence deserueth bee punished chiefe court iustice iesus christ leuing similitude sayth playnly one worthy hell fire meeneth three worthy yet notwithstanding sheweth degree euill man haue sodaine choler although settle hearte yet ye see hee hath already deserued euerlasting death god shall foster deadly hatred heartes full venemous rancour reuenged haue done v wrong wherefore let v learne correcte vice v vnderstande euill worde haue scaped mouth behoueth v sorie fall sainct paule sayth namely sunne go downe vpon wrath leaste ye giue possession vnto sathan heereby warned haue bene moued displeasure must passe away sunne must go downe vpon anger shoulde multiplie selfe punishment sainct paule addeth ought touch v neere sayth giue satan possession v demaund v whether would diuell haue masterie v reygne ouer v prince woulde vtterly abhorre yet notwithstanding oft beare euill agaynst enemy vve cannot make god lyer holie spirite speaketh mouth paule wee knowe let v passe thinke thus oure selues yonder creature god see hee wretched damned soule ought wee onely pray god way destruction agayne hath oure lorde iesus christe redeemed mennes soules true effect death cometh whole worlde neuerthelesse asmuche v discerne betweene rightuous synners go destruction iesus christe hath knowledge suffered death passion well v therefore behooueth v labour bring euery man saluation grace oure lorde iesus christe may bee auayleable furthermore bee heauie v lette v consider comparison betweene god v hee offendeth god dayly yet neuerthelesse assoone wee returne vnto hee giueth v libertie come familiarly thither without doubting wee shall receyued yet meane whyle man offende v meanes founde make v freendes agayne thus yee see haue gather sentence heare iob protest hee onely forbare reuenge also sory euill happened enemy hearte reioyced hee hearde speaking neuerthelesse holy scripture telleth v rightuous shall reioyce confuzio wicked true howbeit intent haue gladnesse god alloweth behoueth v scoured clensed priuy malice regarde oure owne person vvhen god child reioyce aduersitie wicked must ende acknowledge god iust rightuous yet therwithall must also take warning walke feare seing god sheweth himselfe iudge giueth example instruction men coste vvhen doo sorte beholding vpright iustice god learning walke feare carefulnesse example giueth v haue respecte owne persones reuenge selues prouoked wrath meanes euill done vnto v rather vtterly forgiue moreouer haue pitie compassion wretched soules perish thus ye see maner wee may lawfully reioyce fall wicked true behoueth v glorifie god iudgements executeth worlde let v beware mingle fleshly affection behooueth zeale pure wil reioyce aduersitie god sendeth vpon wicked furthermore iob addeth circumstance haue touched say housholde seruantes bene fyrebrandes prouoke woulde fayne haue reuenge himselfe yet hee bene mooued whit hee sayeth vnderstande sentence verie rudely though iobs seruaunts greeued entertayning straungers courteousely therfore wished deade paynes wherevnto hee put quite matter iob meneth declare heere although seruauntes prouoked reuenge sawe men doo harme wrong yet notwithstanding hee refrayned himselfe yeelded suche temptation well woorthy bee noted excellent vertue lesse moued wrong done household seruants man taketh owne wrog heart men cannot pacifie may perchaunce bee sayd man hath displeasure done stay selfe take wrong done owne persone let alone reuenge well ynough yet cannot contente minde affection farre order wee see contrariwise iobs seruauntes greeued men wrong master himselfe therefore must needes sayde spirite god wrought singular woonderfull fashion howbeit muste marke way hee dooth vaunte himselfe heere purchace estimation sette foorth mirrour patterne v god set vpon scaffolde ende wee shoulde laboure fashion selues like vnto bee doubt excuse v wee followe suche example vvhat done although haue temptation prouoke v reuenge selues oure enemy yea men also pricke v forwarde inflame v also flatter v sinnes yet muste wee therfore beleue flattery must settle eies mindes vppon god cause men doo easilye pardon iustifie themselues god condemneth gyue eare suche come picke thankes tale bearing lawfull v specially haue doone wrong seeke reuenge requyte like like needeth retoricke persuade v doo harme enemy vayne sinewe v forward ynough way yea wee rather furious cace yet meane beholde aduocates come cloke oure vice soothing v vp oure sinne much behooueth v minde diligently lord iesus christ commaundeth v namely loue enemy wise eares stopped agaynst thing may alleadged v men folke flatter v seeme maynteyners honour profite coulde finde heart imploy themselues wholly v let v suspect kind folke much better man rebuke v seeth v farre moued pacience shoulde labour assuage rage come set forward sort notwithstanding good according men affectioned towardes v see another doo v wrong come declare vnto v saying take suche harme bee myne owne reuenge suffer suche outrage done therfore may well come passe man shall haue good zeale whe seeth v disquieted meane shall gaine thrust headlong greater ruine beste freendes haue labour brydle v haue iniurie done v furthermore tempted makebates come increace mischeefe let v recouer wittes vnto god say notwithstanding men iustifie mee yet shall therefore quitte heauenly iudge therfore behoueth mee bridle selfe suffer wrong seeing pleaseth god take mee one child becommeth mee follow fashion selfe like vnto sith causeth sunne shine vpon good euill must indeuer good would hurt mee meanes heape cole fyre vpon heades manner must practize sentence morouer let v mark also iob addeth shall serue v ende namely straunger lodged streates gate alwayes open heere iob declareth freendly meane recompence also effect whereby wee shew haue right charitie towards men good able requite allied vnto v eyther kinred bonde true perfect proofe charitie true freendlinesse good ruled according godlinesse yet possible shall haue regard ourselues otherwise like oftentimes see man seeketh owne peculiar profite dooing good kinsfolke frends wee doo good suche able requite yea vnknowen v therein shew serue god holde right rule charitie thus ye see iob protesteth heere specially hee speaketh stranger whome god commendeth vnto v thorough holy scripture without cause home owne country shall haue reliefe ynough shall haue kinred many helpes succour man cannot lightly hurte cotrariwise poore stranger destitute al help haue nother frends kinsfolke nother haue ayde fauor towards world ye see right triall louing kindnesse intend shewe wee serue god truely without seeking owne peculiar profite surely lord doth rigorously condemne outrage done stranger tha done man owne neyghbours true twayne worthy co demned nothing shall scape vnpunished howbeit let v marke therewithall god receiueth protection safe keeping mainteyned men verely see howe god sheweth wee set ourselues agaynst mortall man wrong violence suche hee hath taken custodie offending maiestie muche better ought thing bee printed heart much see heathen men doo shame v behalfe intended shew man slauishe wicked nature wont say auaunt thou art churle towards stranger called whoremaister theefe drunkarde periured murtherer vvhen sayde go thou art enemie stranger much say thou art worse brute beast paynim spake manner made common prouerbe shall become v professe ourselues god child wee fight directly agaynste order nature token mocke god full wold spitefully prouoke maiestie agaynste v therefore let v marke well protestation iob maketh witte hee onely liberall towardes whome knew bee abilitie requite also imployed vpon able make recompence let v consider iob say god hath set one common general bonde among mankind behoueth v bestow charitie vpon suche resemble v haue pitie vpon succouring euery v according abilitie god child let v labour exercise true brother linesse towards men specially towards neerely knit vnto v bond sayth let v bend ourselues aboue good nowe lette v fall downe face good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v feele wee may bee sorie vice haue reygned ouermuche v yet still reygne wee may flee refuge mercie therwithall may please tame mortifie wicked affection beare infirmity guyding v himselfe drawing v neerer neerer vnto vntyll wee come ende race wherevnto wee trauell tyme life let v say almightie god heauenly father wee acknowledge confesse according truth worthie lifte vp eye heauen c cxvij sermon seuenth vpon xxxj chapter haue hid sinne euery man doth put mine iniquitie secret though vvere able breake great throng yet despized house astonished kept silence vvent doore wee haue protestation well worthie noted iob sheweth v owne example wee haue done amisse remedie hyde fault common custome men confesse misdeed willingly ashamed acknowne sinne haue comitted end may wiped god surely verie rare vertue therfore much standeth v hande marke shewed v iob speaketh himselfe onely giueth instruction may serue v therefore declareth hid sinne layde vp secrete say laboured cleere himselfe afore men yeelded hymselfe guiltie acknowledged offence marke one poynt therewithall sheweth men attainted vice hypocrisie fashio denie thing vse startingholes fault put vnder foote place hath vsed worde adam signifieth man sometimes taken euery man text iob ment say shall neuer bee founde well touched acknowledge fault rather finde vayne backshrinkings hide although vice doe raigne world yet doth iob protest hee cleare true adam began first trade shewed came race see conuicted streightwayes laboured hide himselfe leaues afterwarde god summoned appeare still found trifling excuse woulde fayne haue scaped meanes ye see adam first beginner shew hypocrisie posteritie hee learned lesson onely himselfe also wrappe men two three v onely v haue nature surely diuell winneth much handes hee maketh v cloake faultes wee acknowledge wee must needes bee ashamed wee haue couered euill wee thinke safe therevpon take leaue fall sleepe euerie v findeth himselfe experience pray prouoked mourne god craue pardon haue remorse sinnes bee sorie seeke remedie yes deuill blindeth v else tieth kerchers eye else disguyseth thing wise vnto v wee cannot discerne euill lo case wee bee therefore behoueth v much studie lesson putting vp wickednesse intoo bosome say hyde lay open true man knoweth sinne possible hee shall become desperate happened cain iudas neuerthelesse cannot come repentance desire forgiuenesse god hand finally deliuered offence vntill layd open hypocrisie set aside furthermore come knowledge sinne defiance himselfe desire hyde himselfe worldward according see haue alwayes vntruthes mouth iustifie selues withal thing v repentance bringeth true humilitie therefore conuicted god haue done amisse willingly acknowledgeth fault shrinking backe doubt also readie condemne offence men shew sorie let v nowe see thing iobs time increased nowe adayes muche nothing rife hypocrisie truely see text new thing men seeke disguise themselues take couert haue done amisse hath bene time sayd afore began adam hath continued vnto day howbeit see shamelesnesse worlde present dayes nothing comparison see one go warne man sinne hee shall finde brasen face denie thing altogither manifest partie shal know wel ynough euill knowne yet notwithstanding haue spoken would stoppe euery man mouth outfacing yea many time contenteth himselfe shamefull deniall also falleth quarelling threatning speake men hide fault iobs time doo much dayes yet sufficient defence nother shall receyued god according wee see text although men hardharted wilful man come reason folke labour drawe sinner repentaunce kicke agaynst lyke restie iades lette v assure selues iobs example set forth learning wee must followe common trade say euery man doth common custome let v looke vpon god draweth v contrarie way vvould men iustifie mee god haue euery v condemne men conceal fault end might vnknowne god haue v discouer yea euen lowlinesse behoueth v come poynt say see men doo euery man custome vvhat though men time iob condemned holy ghost therefore wee see men like adayes say noman confesseth faultes yet neuerthelesse let faythfull learne frame themselues whiche shewed wit onely mourne god also shewe menne bee sorie theyr harte condemne themselues wise may become iudges obteyne mercie heauenly iudge returning vnto short see hypocrisie condemned text best v absteyne vtterly sinne keepe selues forasmuch wee bee frayle wee cannot liue worlde without taking manye falles remedie stoupe mourne god moreouer go aboute saue honestie wise afore men wee shoulde yeeld selues guiltie often need shall requyre true god commaundeth man proclayme streetes hath done amisse say haue committed fault rather cast stumbling block yet standeth v vpon mark sayde holy scripture namely first al must lowly towards neighbour assuring selues wee bee infected many vice vvhat cause man despyseth al men beare nothing hand thundereth haue done amisse vvhat cause say hypocrisie wee knewe owne infirmity surely would brydle v wee condemne folkes auenture begin selues thus yee see first thing haue commauded v holy scripture wee milde gentle bearing one another kinde confessing owne sinnes second thing wee haue offended man behoueth v come reason wee see otherwise haue accesse vnto god according also lorde iesus christ sheweth v sacrifice offering shall accepted vnlesse reconciled neighbour haue offended therfore must learne sorie behalf knowe sinnes thirdly haue giuen cause stumbling let v come humbly amende yea amend euil may borne withall kick agaynst spurre thus ye see three confession scripture requireth v respect men herewithall let v marke commeth proceedeth sayd right meening haue sorowing god vntill fully sory hart haue offended shall neuer make pure right confession men whatsoeuer wee doo shall bee feynednesse certaine whiche shall haue confessed themselues god also haue modestie iustifying themselues afore men mockerie man shall say oh know self sinner god yet notwithstanding shall bee wilfull towards men reason truth wrung one sheweth diuell hath bewitched hydeth fault layeth vp bosome much hee possibly vvherefore let v marke well wee bee come poynt feeling sinnes beeing ashamed haue transgressed god lawe haue done rightuousnesse wee shall haue pride hinder v making pure confession wee ought make furthermore behoueth v also marke howe sayd iob put sinne secret importeth verie much men cannot beguile god beguile themselues therevpon seemeth haue gayned muche put sinnes theyr mynde thinke vpon man forget himselfe cast fault behinde backe thrust vnder foote without thinking vpon hee sad feeleth greefe sotted wickednesse starke rotten feeleth yet meane whyle god ceasseth doo dutie iudge thing registred althoughe hee make countenaunce tyme yet must come accompt men coulde finde theyr harte bee alwayes hidden say see faultes thinke shall neuer come light sin continueth still although bee buried respect men yet wil god bring light iob sheweth heere men beguile themselues couering sinnes sort muste needes appeare brought light howsoeuer world go let v remember best v vncloke owne fault god may deliuer v bring free hart codemne euill certaine shal vtterly away require therfore let v condemne euill find end co demned god long wee holde hart close labour conceale fault behoueth god fight v v feele belongeth scatter clowdes plucke away figleaues wherwith shal haue couered dishonesty insomuch shal inforced perceiue spite teeth shal knowne angel haue remember streyn metion made putting man sin secret short wil happe vnto doth vnto hide sore sore hidden body yet mean meane made purge man couereth wise shall knowne yet infection doubleth cloking rancor increaseth want clensing better opened haue issue purge self thing cannot bicause disease pent vp within euen fare wee go hide fault rotte sore wee would faine hold force stryuing kepe secrete breedeth greater rankling causeth mischiefe increase inflame vvhat done meanes haue spoken come god ashamed cofesse wretchednesse end may remedie knoweth couenient v also become owne iudges hee gracious vnto v make v owne iudges instead condemning v readie acquite v contrarypart drag backe much offend god prouoke greater vengeance v cause v shet vp fault secrete woont mention made expressely hydings clokings couerts bicause men nature find many prety shift sleightes shun god presence yea true may wel shrink aside yet doth god see v throughly neuerthelesse prophete esay sayth wicked dig themselues caues think vpon god iudgement seemeth haue verie well shifted matter serue turne fal flat contrary runne vp find new mousehole cranie safe beare themselues hand cannot hyde themselues altogyther play partriches yong childre think ynough owne eye hidden cause expresse mention made hydings naturally giuen hypocrisie seeke continually prety sleight beguile god wherein beguile selues seene doth foade v wickednesse meane cosider diuill doeth possesse v wee canot recouer selues vnto souerain phisition able heale cure al disease furthermore iob hath protested knowing fault addeth although bin able breake greate throng yet hee feared veriest rascolles went house hrwbeeit passe let v marke maner man speaketh iob lyued angell amongs men behaued himselfe vncorruptly like hardly bee seene whole worlde yet notwithstanding sayth e hid fault shall man compare rightuousest perfectest men iob hee shall finde come nothing neere holinesse vprightnesse man feare god liued vncorrupt life acknowledged himselfe sinner would stand mayntenance honour yeelded himselfe guiltie hee done amisse shame day great deale holynesse confesse theyr faultes playnely throughly pray muste worlde beeneedes worse blinde nowe adayes men cannot bee made yeeld glorie vnto god confessing sinnes iob hath declared vnto v eye vnto blinde feete lame father fatherlesse defender wydowes againe declareth hee common host poore straungers hee clothed naked wooll sheepe hee eaten bread alone done man violence although credite place iustice might haue beene borne yet neuer giuen man cause complayne declaration thing hee addeth hee hidden fault adayes none v hee infected many vice whereof iob cleere yet notwithstanding woulde seeme much rightuous hee muste diuell needes haue plucked eye see sinne haue forgone remorse extremitie vttermost poynt euill saint paule sayeth let v learne compare iob selues oft wee bee foolish ouerweening acquite selues let v acknowledge wee come farre short perfection iob therefore nothing v mourne god condemne selues vtterly wee condemned let v learne vse suche mildenesse towardes men wee haue offended neighbour amisse may amend haue done man wrong may labor recociled short may ashamed sinnes poyntes respect yeelde glory vnto god iob proceedeth mildnesse saying hee feared veryest rascat e men notwithstanding able breake beare greas throng people text taken otherwise men hebrew worde iob vseth heere meane word haue translated breake burst asunder signifieth sometime feare afrayde sayde worde signifieth feare bee afrayde also oppresse beare trample treade vnder foote breake broose burst asunder therefore expounde though iob declared feared great multitude say neuer abashed rebuke euill wheresoeuer sawe according wee bee zealous godward certaine suffer man offend without setting selues agaynst seeing god hath done v honour make v aduocates cannot leastwise declare misliking euill indeuer stoppe much may bee possible putting lesson vre sainct paule sheweth v saying must haue felowship frutes darkenesse must reproue many therefore expound text though iob protested hee set hi mselfe agaynst euill letted meanes wheresoeuer hee founde although might haue purchased himselfe displeasure hatred whole worlde yet notwithstanding ceassed condemne euill alwayes hee founde doctrine good profitable surely wee see howe necessarie thing stablish selues stedfastnesse wee intende stoppe euill wee must haue whole worlde say men enimies true god commaundeth v seeke peace men neere wee dutie behalfe shall sure set whole worlde toppes go rebuke sinne wee see howe euery man flattereth himselfe correction harde bitter specially adayes man able suffer seeing need settle selues stoutnesse although whole worlde rise vp agaynst v men without exception labour oppresse v yet wee shoulde swarue aside persist euen condemne euill doctrine surely good profitable consider order text wee shall finde naturall sense bee haue touched first worde iob vseth signifieth albeit although thinke protestation iob ment denie stoode feare neuer great multitude verbe commeth first woorde sayde signifieth feare howbecit commonest signification first word spake albeeit although therevnto verbe doth commonly signifie breake see iobs meening although hee able breake scatter great throng people say although great might credite authoritie yet notwithstanding ouerawe men stoppe mouth abaced himselfe farre feare despized ofcastes rascal common laughing stock proueth well former saying verie good signe iob ment hide face seing mildnesse feare basest sort vvee knowe man rich gifte shall authorised among men euery man shall feare stande awe open mouth although commit fault world yet men durst speak except muttering secrete man might haue libertie say behold man misbehaueth himselfe againe one aduaunced high haue brute going steppe forth say haue body speake mee take maruelously sauing honour worship vvee see common thing world maruel seeing euen time iob credite abused theyr ryches honour mainteyning themselues euill stopping mennes mouthes shoulde wise speake vnpardonable offence man shoulde rebuke prince courte lawlesse person authoritie iustice bee great sturre kept suche man honour bee touched although many thing worthy blame insomuch euen little child could tell faultes yet notwithstanding men must bee whist contrarywise beholde iob sayeth able breake throng people say able onely subdue mine enimies also bruse breake peeces although whole worlde sette themselues agaynst yet notwithstanding credite power could well haue gotten vpper hand hee sheweth meeke lambe hee suffered man reproue fault although rascall begger sayeth yet stoode awe ashamed hee spake mee acknowledged sinnes taryed till great armie raysed till greate menne came put mee shame giue care basest sort worlde see plaine meening text principall poynt learne take profit doctrine first let authoritie aboue others remember must make cloke couer filthinesse looking glasse see howe god hath exalted high degree ende euill noted vndoubtedly good reason god hath graunted degree honour aboue neighbour shoulde indeuer themselues shewe good example seeing highly exalted contrarie theyr offence much greeuouser god hath iust cause vpbrayde saying haue aduaunced thee haue reached thee hande end thou shouldest burning cresset giue light whole worlde seeing thou hast giuen occasion offence thy shame must needes greater therefore let whome god hath set state honour vnderstand ende haue greater libertie euill able stoppe plaine folkes mouthes must vse buckler go couer burie faultes sort god vtter greater vengeance agaynst laying open shame marke one poynt therwithall let meaner sort haue consideration none v commeth nere authoritie iob attributeth owne person wee able breake throng people beare downe great bandes men may ryse vp agaynst v hardly wee fight snayle therefore meanes god holdeth v humilitie although bee agaynst will vvhat matter would presume shet mouthes haue iust cause speake euill v nothing lesse tha nothing yet notwithstanding would still reputation haue honour mainteyned man touch man speake wee thinke heauen earth ought bee turned vpside downe taking away defamation pray fighting directly nature although god exalted v giuen v meane mainteyne honour yet heare sayde behoueth v stand awe basest sort nowe seeing god giueth v brydle reineth v short ende suffer fault bee knowne vvhat excuse fall striuing agaynst thus ye see meaner sort ought humble themselues double considering see suche mirrour person iob wheras hee able beare downe great multitude yet submitted sort suffer self reproued meanest sort yea euen suche counted beggerliest others vvherefore let v haue mildnesse suffer selues reproued great small thus yee see wee haue marke first place therewithall houeth v also wey wel word despised behold cause maketh v proude wee cannot corrected looking men whether equal seeme better selues wee thinke haue aduantage ouer v shall one take vpon rebuke mee better woorth furthermore contented esteeme men equalles though much better cast vnder foote wee good skill note mennes vyces yea inhaunce saying vvho men knowe hath done many thing amisse meane owne faultes smoothed cleare v vice made vrtue thing rocketh v asleepe pride cannot receiue yoke correction whe god sendeth men vnto v finde fault v shewe v howe greatly bee blame therfore much behoueth v marke howe iob sayeth feared despised say euen suche offscourings filth worlde yea euen veriest rascalles whome dignitie thing else wee see god v honour warne v men great estimation credit doth therefore followe despise warning men giue v proof hereof firsthing wee ought thinke man reproueth v messanger sent vnto v god insomuch little childe shoulde speake v conscience tell v hee sayeth truth resist god bee wilfull agaynst therefore let v say deserueth heard let v looke vpon message bringeth v bee god let v stoupe downe head receyue yoke mark one point seconde let v marke oftentimes wee despise much better selues nothing blindeth v owne hypocrisie bicause serche owne vice ought yet meane ouereagre neighbour cause maketh v reiect worthy heard receyued therefore let v strippe selues pryde learne feele owne wretchednesse yea feele wise wee may abashed wee well worthy therewithall let v haue eie vice neighbour looke vpon vertues god hath put intoo honour thus ye see cause v receiue correction paciently againe yet one respect wee bee warned men value estimation must thinke ourselues beholde god intendeth put shame deserue hee sende mee man reputation worldwarde could rayse vp prophete could send mee man wise honourable vertues hee haue subdued one despised reiected end make mee feele disease better warned man authoritie ouer would think wel shame thee striue agaynst man would cause mee nourishe still pride mee beholde god commeth buffet mee sort hee suffereth mee haue good freend counsell mee man good countenaunce warne mee safegarde mine honestie sendeth mee outcast seeing thus mee must needes acknowledge god doeth without cause lo wee meanes brought reasonablenesse fearing meanest despysed sort moreouer iob sayeth went doores meeneth vsed back shrinking refrayned himselfe willingly suffring bee condemned without gainsaying hyding man conuicted effect thing haue note true man may sometymes hyde himselfe yet cease chawe vpon bit seeke reuengement agaynst suche haue defamed whereas sayd iob went doores ment hee ende hee woulde heare reproch meane practise bee reuenged enimies suche slaundered hilde himselfe within house rid place gone rebuke faultes gaue full scope say set self send men mainteyn quarell let condemne mee whole worlde keepe mee locked vp prison vve know man prison men haue libertie inough commence action iob wil kept prisoner end suffer men condemne wel worthy noted see nowadays man giltiest world vnderstand men speake heare windie word remedie come open street iustle shoulder like boare keepe coyle mainteyn euill bring route saying get vpper whatsoeuer come haue spoken euill find meanes stoppe mouthes speake euill vvould god example hereof manifest bee man cannot open eies shall see ouerordinarie vice spite god world sowe abroade corruption euery vtterly shamelesse shew theselues possessed diuel come forth facing bracing forehead harlot haue wiped snoute well againe whatsoeuer matter offence shall shamefull aire shall stink yet shall men dare speake one worde must fayne giue place roysters seeing vice reigneth euery wee haue muche neede marke lesson shewed wit haue offended must willingly kepe selues prisoner seeke meanes bridle selues suffer men condemne v god may acquite v true holding selues must cloke sinnes keeping silence howbeit let v meane bee quiet come abrode like brazenfaced fellowes mainteyne vyces nother let v striue agaynst god rather consider wee blame worthie respectes maiestie therefore remedie v flee infinite grace mercie vseth towards poore sinner returne vnto nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement sinnes praying make v feele conuicted wee may followe father adam vsing outleapes thinke shalbe quiet shrinking aside rather may consider howe wee bee damnable thervpon flee mercie also lerne sory feele shame men intent wee haue discouered god angelles wee may bowe vnder maiestie shall dreadfull vnto v bycause reconcyled vnto meanes lorde iesus christ forasmuch cannot liue world without feeling vice imperfection ouermuch may please guide v continually holy spirit vntil hee haue clothed v throughly owne rightuousnesse may please graunt grace c cxviij sermon eight vpon xxxj chapter oh somebodie heare marke almightie ansvvere let mine aduersarie vvright booke beare vpon shoulder vvill take itto crovvne vvill recken steppe vvill present selfe prince lande crie agaynst furrovves thereof vveepe togither haue eaten foy son vvithout siluer haue oppressed ovvners vvith sorrovv let bring forth thistle steade vvheate darnell steade barley ende iobs vvordes haue seene heretofore iob co plyned god harkened might obteyne reason hande truly saying intent blaspheme though god bin cruell vniust meening hee knewe vvas afflicted lawfull go lawe god though hee knewe reason proceeding herewithall addeth desire god answere vvherein hee doeth v wit god would bee gracious shewe hee tormented knowledge shoulde suffize howbeit apparant reason handled roughly seing life bin without blame indeuered walk holynesse true word answer may expounded two wayes wit god come aduersarie partie lay forth reason article else answere say declare himselfe bee iobs side howbeeit forasmuch heeretofore hath oftentimes sayde god woulde condiscend shewe cause iustice shoulde suffice take text sayde desire god shoulde shewe reason scourgeth common respecte vtterly despize defie whole world let haue strong partie put accusation mee yea let make great booke shall greeue carry vpon shoulder shall heauy burthen mee rather shall crowne ornamet deck withall see effect iob ment say namely bin reputed taken according wee see freends codemned reprobate bycause indured greate torment seemed vntoo god ment vtter vengeance intent iob mirrour wicked men god doth vtterly destroy iob therfore protesteth man therewithall desireth haue audience men onely god answere say god shoulde make rightuousnesse knowne woulde hee mainteyne suffering sinnes namely thing might bee throughly considered god would pronounce sentence way ordinarie proces prerogatiue high secrete power men might knowe worketh maner wee haue seene heretofore without cause iob make wish diuerse time god chasticeth v according threatnings set downe lawe wit wee bee punished reason sinnes ordinarie maner ye see god suffered misdeedes vnpunished giuen v rule whereby liue well added threatnings saying ye breake commaundements punishe warre pestilence famin sicknesse pouertie diuers thing vvell beaten god roddes behoueth v lay life law find selues haue done amisse inditement throughly framed iudgement already giuen vpon v remayneth nothing execution thus see ordinarie maner god vseth chastizing men iob respect punished sin deserued creature rightuous exempt god correction yet haue declared afore god respect iobs offence hee punished measure reason misdeedes trie faith pacience seruant also make example al world meane iob mouth shet hee wist say therefore behoueth v enquire cause handled roughly secret vnknowne men without cause iob desireth god answere say enter plea suffer mainteyne owne soundnesse let know indureth torment herewithall let v marke lawfull men chalenge god sort good reason hee shoulde handle v hys owne pleasure stoupe although cause iudgements bee apparant vntoo v please god visit v rigour wee see hee doth yet must wee keepe mouth shet murmur agaynst neuerthelesse haue open still glorifie confessing although iudgements bee bottomlesse deepe yet cease iust rightfull thus ye see wee haue note good faith terrible thing god enter lawe v set himselse agaynst v ala shall become v fall prouoking desire go lawe great confusion doctrine well worthie bee noted wee see howe men doo dayly fall murmuring grudging themselues else prouoke god desire go lawe shall bring matter well passe true skirmish fashion bee afflicted say woulde haue god agaynst meane whyle marke shoote man bee impacient affliction holde himselfe quiet yeelding god good take correction hande pray doth lift vp himselfe intent god prouoked wrath maynteyne owne right let v kepe selues quarelling god stryketh v rod haue deadly enimie let v learne rather submit v vnto hande like well doth although reason thereof bee hidden v time surely wee ought desire earnestly may please god shewe v scourgeth v howbeeit must bee done ende profit selues correction applie chasticements instruction know cause therfore euery v feeling owne sinnes sorie hee hath offended god ashamed owne lewdnesse therevpon humbleth himselfe seeking remedie turne away euill say meanes indeuer apply god correction owne vse make turne discipline may shewe selues vtterly past amendment may well maner desire god make v vnderstande scourgeth v end hys correction vaine list vse power holde v ignorance wee know vseth great rigor v yet must wee suche extremitie cast downe heades flee refuge vnto haue declared alredie namely god rightuous respectes therefore although wee knowe cause hee afflicteth v yet wee must ceasse glorifie continually lo wee haue marke streyne heerewithall let v come iob sayeth marke sayeth hee almightie shoulde answere mine aduersarie wright booke behoue mee beare bee ashamed cary shall like offendour indyted condemned booke shall rather maynteyne soundnesse durst sayth dock selfe crowne vvhen iob speaketh hee meeneth accusation whiche layde agaynst false hee bene wrongfully slaundered cosidering liued innocently howbeeit saying meeneth bin vtterly cleare fault found seene yesterday hath confessed sinner yea protested hee hid faultes men woont doo according wee see men hypocrisie euery man woulde fayne hyde himselfe vayne tryfling lurkingholes iob declared intended thing hee freely condemned selfe done amisse yea taryed till men authoritie reproued suffered himselfe bee shamed despised sort humbled low receyue correction worthie looke vpon text iob meeneth vtterly without sinne stayne contrarietie wordes layeth forth cace according haue seene say hee reprobate although god handled roughly yet folowed heynous faultes secrete cause vve see effect iob ment exalt himselfe god pride many vphold theselues rightuous yea eue without feeling sinnes haue comitted although liued angel yet notwithstanding knew well god might find sufficient cause punish neuerthelesse mainteineth vncorruptnesse intent separate nuber despisers god hereby taught meane v mainteyne good cace vvee knowe faultie good bolde iustifie themselues rebuked although condemnation apparant ynough euery man doeth see bee nothing worth yet notwithstanding bee shamelesse mainteyning themselues bee faultlesse affirme themselues haue great wrong bee reproued contrariwyse although god child haue indeuered walke aright yet notwithstanding first thing yeeld themselues guiltie acknowledge themselues bee wretched sinner therevpon wee see man go iustifie himselfe without exception hee vndertaketh warre god whosoeuer sayeth sinner intendeth make god lier sayeth siohn canonicall epistle god hath pronounced one generall sentence vpon v experience also ought shewe v v ought flee god mercie refuge iustifie himselfe without exception warreth manifestly agaynst god iustleth shall winne ende nothing must wee haue acknowledged fault reproued thing feele selues guiltie let v cast downe heades acknowledge selues haue deserued god shoulde put v shame bee condemned men yea euen bacest sort haue iudges wee knowe wee haue offended thing whereof wee accused god meening humble v another sort neuerthelesse behoueth v receiue correction paciently finally men reproue v rashnesse beare v downe wee offender whereas knowe contrarie hypocrisie v graunt slaunders true man accused robberie whordome murther cleere might protest god angel thing hee doo condemne himselfe hee doth euill may well mainteyne clearnesse maner iob doth onely respect honestie vainglorious sort wise touched al tender honour cannot suffer bee touched though haue desamed themselues would haue shame couered yet meane whyle themselues blaze abroade euery man knoweth vve must go way worke euery man must case iudge himselfe hee ought neighbour must learne condemne euill allowe good without accepting person lo maner wee may maynteyne good quarell cause iob sayeth god would answere mee though men vpon earth shoulde bende themselues agaynst mine aduersarie partie alledge possible shall farre beeing ashamed beare shall take crowne deck withall shall ornament vnto herewithall let v marke also intende mainteyne owne innocencie ynough v hyde shame men oure princypall poynt must bee god may bee warrant answere v true answere iob speaketh ment haue declared wit god shoulde enter ordinarie proces shew cause scourge yet therewithall iob pretendeth god would giue libertie mainteyne case woulde make side reiected bicause extreme affliction founde lyers haue touched afore see purpose haue escaped must specially haue eye vnto god bring oure good cace sayd may warrant wee receyue sentence discharge hande would god well printed harte see nowadayes one v may bee released world seeke nothing god despised none v thinketh euer hee shall render account looke man may byte v man come assayle v may haue wherwith keepe therefore escaped worlde wee thinke safe meane whyle thing maketh v bolde exalt selues god wherfore let v think wel vpon doctrine wit wretched reward world shall soothe v god allowe v therefore aboue thing let euery man examin let done owne fancie according god lawe knowe bee competent iudges behoueth v receyue iudgement lawe thing sayd conteyned let god seat set vp hauing hys worde eye let v consider throughly whether wee haue walked hee commaundeth whether wee haue swarued worde wee haue done amisse let v learne condemne selues furthermore hee graunt v grace obey although many vice v yet notwithstanding cheef marke haue bin obey let content v bee allowed though worlde condemne v let greeue v world chargeth v slander god reache v hande accept v shewe liketh well life vvhe point let dogges barke v long cannot byte v although seeme report enimies bee wickeddest men worlde yet let v beare thing paciently thing haue marke text wee see two poynts note one must giue selues ambition vanitie seeke praise men exempt selues god iudgement contrariwise behoueth v feele howe terrible god wrath examin wel conscience end faultie vvhen haue obteyned say god hath graunted v grace walke vprightly sure alloweth v let v beare slaunders false accusation worlde paciently tary till god shewe soundnesse openly make shyne breake daye according hath promised seconde poynt yet notwithstanding touching iob sayeth beare booke shall bee made agaynst crowne say proces wherby shall charged sort fault ment alwayes honour vntoo v afore men haue good cace surely vnpossible finde better case sainct paules serued god faythfully office yet notwithstanding fayled bee charged accused falsly doth hee asmuch hee seeth men blinde ignorant iudge wrongfully appealeth day god appeale sayeth day lorde ye see saint paule constreyned vse remedie according oftentimes commeth passe bee defaced worlde holdeth v wicked disgraced bycause wicked shamelesse one speake euill men hooke crooke yet meane wee shall ceasse go still heades vpright may appeale vnto god warrant wee see prophtes doo vvhen ieremie sayeth lorde deceyuer thou hast deceyued mee bycause layd charge nothing beguile people vvell sayeth say hath god deceyued mee vvhen speaketh maner hee meeneth deceyt guile god doth boldly represse slaunders layde vpon saying arme selues agaynst god knowe maynteyne quarell esay reporting hee reiected men greatly reproched despised could sayth yet lord answere whensoeuer wee bee defaced oppressed men blamed whole world yet shal fayle haue crowne glorie wee haue recorde god cause iob sayeth hee ouerthrowe slaunders shall bee layde agaynst sayeth come offender condemned already information put agaynst hee conuicted owne conscience misdeede hee hath done come prince vndoubtedly child god iudges iudges whe wrongfully oppressed men certaine dare boldly appeare referring theselues wholly vnto god resting dare condemne malice violence tirannie vvhereas enimies truth adayes condemne faithfull burned therof sit vnder clothes estate think gallowes honorable whero martyr shall tormented stake set vp childe god turned yes surmounteth throne world king prince together iudges must needes wickednesse vnhallowe seat hallowed dedicated vnto god forasmuch sit must need full filthinesse infectio bycause followe wil hath set make place shamefull detestable whiche notwithstanding theirselues honorable contrariwise although stake gibbet lothsomething worldward yet notwithstanding certayne martyr childe god bringeth good conscience thither suffereth good quarrell sanctifieth sorte cursed nought iob sayth god wilbe gratious aunswere saye giue leaue mayntayne innocency heare declare life come lofty countenace like prince drooping like offendour boldly receyue bookes written taking ornament croune garland also ought comfort v namely walking vprightnesse god indeuering serue honour world vnthankfull men v wrong degrade v maketh matter protest god case good also able shewe drawne men shamefull thing say god witnesse rest doings aunswerable according many men call god record rashly yet knowne clean cotrarie allowed god must deale world may beare witnesse vprightnesse whe commeth hearing must haue mouth open declare matter goeth disproue slaunders shall layde v furthermore whe haue say whe haue good record faultie god also shewe deede although men make bookes v say although deface v many blame slauders shal seeme houge moutaynes yet shall heauy burthen v bycause shall vphild god hand rest ourselues vppon rather shall make crowne garland vnto v much better v blamed world god allowe v flattered side excuse v according see many take libertie euill despise god bycause world sootheth reason many runne square giue themselues bridle euill bycause haue bin spared menes eye haue ben shet wink wicked doings lo cause destruction much better lord shoulde bee warrant meane whyle whole world bee v praysed commended world meane whyle haue heaue crye vengeaunce v vve see pope exalted nowadayes holinesse although monster diuell incernate yet men bowe giue greater title honour god meane whyle cause augment damnation much sayd iustifie world ende world also receiue flatter sinnes contrariwise haue sayd let v learne looke continually vnto god meane whyle hee suffer v bee vniustly condemned men let v suffer paciently cease beare head still vpright furthermore according whiche sayd concerning reckening steppe let v bee ready yeeld account whensoeuer shall accused cryme let v thinke scape god iudgement concealing misdeede v let v consider behoueth v aunswere ourselues although men doo iustifie v yet cannot hyde thing v god iob hath spoken added last protestation full knitting vp land sayeth haue cried furrowes thereof complaine haue eaten foyson without money haue tilled complaine haue oppressed let mee eate tristles insteade wheate darnell insteade barley hereby iob concludeth whiche wee haue seene afore wit although bin greuously afflicted hand god yet notwithstanding men ought haue condemned though bene greater offender others whome god spared haue sayd god keepeth one rate afflicting men sometime hee punisheth sinnes otherwhyles whe intendeth visite owne seruaunts extreme rigor reserueth cause afflictios himselfe although haue serued indeuored frame themselues wholly righteousnesse yet therfore forbeare
