send right greate affliction case knowe say vntill last day god shall manifest thing vnto v whiche hidden iob sheweth wee must esteeme lyfe according state wherein although bee miserablest men outward sight yet doeth protest hee desire serue god wherein sheweth wee haue heretofore seene many protestation last land cried true earth hath mouth cry complaine nother hath feeling suffer wrong hand nother semeth earth wrong insomuch although could speake yet wold say cause either cry wepe make complainte v vvhat doeth iob meene saying land complayned furrowes wept meneth earth selfe hath cause complayne holy scripture vseth maner speche make v perceiue better greater vehemencie amisse god creature shall v beare witnesse v haue oppressed poore labourer til earth giue v foode haue vsed extortio haue plucked away good shall beare witnesse v earth whiche haue tilled shall also depose v haue bestowed sweate blood greate cruelty v whe think earth behalf hath opened bowel according order god hath fet yelded frute shee tilled earth hath hir dutie wrought hir labourer ther mutuall agreement betwixt yet notwithstanding behold seagulfes deuoure foyson earth taking away men good thousand extortion laborer complaine must earth also hir parte answere hath bin tormented yee see holy scripture vseth speech wee see hardnesse v much tel v sinnes think selues quite discharged may find prety starting hole although couicted god yet afraide bee sory feele dreadful wrath god therfore behoueth v spurred ass folke vtterly hardened insomuch whe god striketh vpo v mayne stroke vpon stone soften v make v yeld stithies anuildes except force thus ye see haue marke ofte scripture speaketh maner namely earth crieth hir furrowes aske vengeace let v vnderstand god reproueth stubbornesse sheweth v blinded sinnes cannot come knowledge except drawe v violent meanes marke well point therfore let v continue hardharted whe see lord vseth vehemencie v wake v withal leastwise let v enter examination fault bee cast downe lo haue marke therwithall also must come earth said righteouse wil haue care horse oxe asse wicked men turmoyle brethre neyghbours eating vp sustenance life without equitie therfore heare speaking earth beast let v vnderstand end indifferent towards neighbour flesh blood self nature wee selues vse tyranie crueltie thing must need fulfilled v said holy scripture namely withholding wage haue trauayled taken paine profit shall cry vnto heauen creature shall beare witnesse wrong extortio haue neighbour according also prophet abacuk speketh saying walles house builded deceyte extortion shal cry loude shirle play quirresters behalf terme shall answere one another either side one side singeth behold blud behold murther one behold deceipt behold crueltie one behold pilling polling behold couetuousnesse one behold periury behold robberie another behold spightfulnesse let v marke wel according wee shall haue abused creature god must aske vengeance v latter daye therfore let v take warning hereby walke coscience wee may go head vpright perfect god beare iudgement vengeance rather maye please receiue v infinite goodnes guide v holy spirit may apply indeuer serue good conscience according grace shall haue giuen v let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement fault praying make v feele wee may haue whole recourse vnto mercy therewithall euery v inforce himselfe walk purenesse life may able power holy spirit resist teptatios follow whether soeuer cal v iustly protest wee haue serued liuing god sought nothing glorifie name becommeth christian performaunce wherof may please graut time life may seke altogether please meanes edifie one another drawe euen silly ignorant sort light gospel whervnto good god calleth v grace end may please c cxix sermon first vpon xxxij chapter three men left speaking iob bycause esteemed righteouse eliu sonne barachel buzite house ram angrie sore displeazed iob bycause sayd rightuouse god also angrie three freends bycause made none aunswer yet condemned iob wee may fare better whiche conteined thing shall see hereafter must beare mind wee haue seene heeretofore namely iob hauing vndertaken good case hadle amisse came cofort hauing vndertaken euill case vsed good argumets apparat reason wherof profitable doctrine might gathered therfore ther fault bycause laid good foudatio faulte iob bycause builded amisse vppon foundation good selfe cause said eliu buzite angry inflamed wrath bycause said men disproued iob yet notwithstanding condened also angry iob bycause went iustifie himselfe god see anger elius without cause aswell iob three frends came comfort although iob iust reasonable quarrell yet farre ouershote although alledged good reason yet resist god reasoning euill purpose meane whole said iobs three freends left dispute bycause hee thought himselfe righteouse vve haue seene iob made great accompt owne righteousnesse thought many fault found therfore contrary parte protesteth wretched sinner howbeit wold condene iudged amisse afflictio opinion imagination iobs three freends iob castaway god bycause hee handled roughly sayd ought iudge discretly party god correcteth must coclude euery punished according offence time god spareth wicked wincketh misdedes sorer damnation shall pay right dere god goodnesse tarrying pacietly god sometimes make coutenance punishing haue deserued let v therfore think haue made better market nother let v iustifie bycause god spareth contrariwise whe see man beaten god scourge let v therfore think wickeder rest world may god trye pacience punish sinnes iob would co sent fonde doctrine freendes cause seemed iustifie himselfe though ment thing therfore hath ben hertofore shewed let v beware vndertaking euill quarrell shall blinded seeme v man agree fully v condemned ought haue talke enter disputatio let v wel assured truth nothing worse hasty know ordinary prouerbes continually put vre amongs v namely hast maketh wast foles bolt soone shot seing let v learne hold iudgement suspence vntill throughly assured truth herewithall let v marke oftentimes may happen shall wrogfully codemned men although backbite v haue mouthes stopped haue reason conuince v withall yet wil cease caried away spite slaunder v cast foorth wicked word v hereby warned men bee maliciouse codemne v without proof must take much hart noueltie happened iob excellent seruant god day see papist thinke ynough haue decreed lewd error superstition false doctrine good steppe maysterly style ynough haue determined entring disputation serching reason thing go owne seeming haue authoritie therevppon thunder v meane seazo know truth side fully resolued vvherfore let v resist temptation abashed seing tymes reason themselues haue notwithstading ceassed condene good case boldly without remorse coscience seing diuel blindeth let v always kepe ou course sticke stedfastly truth knowe owne part also let v take warning walk leysurely whe haue ben anywhit hasty oftentimes fall childre god shal ouerseene haue stay ynough ourselues therfore let v go still neither let rashnesse bee matched wilfulnesse truely hard thing hath ouershot himselfe doth commonly become wilfull howbeit haue done amisse must cotinue euill rather learne restreine selues saying haue exceded measure know well haue bridled self modestie ought vvhat oh must harden myselfe seing haue taken wrong way must returne backe againe ye see exaple iobs freends holy ghost warneth v first wel aduised take quarrel rashly god secodly happen ouerseene must wise wilfull proceede euil acknowledge fault labour amend hand concerning eliu mencion made without cause scripture sheweth v stock came according named buzite house ram wee see first aucientnesse touched heretofore principal point also god met declare vnto v hath always remained good seede religio among wrapped many fond fancy notable point knowe world hand fall away god men turned aside corruptio lie meene euen immediatly floud notwithstanding vengeaunce god horrible worthy remembraunce child noe whiche escaped hauing liued long time might tell child successor maner god taken vengeaunce wickednesse world notwithstanding yet fell away forsooke right religion turning aside vnto lie idolatrie disorder herein see men exceeding frayle nothing harder hold feare god good religion true respecte euill wee bee stedfast wee cannot bee bowed aside man wold go amend euill v knoweth ende begin nother bring passe bycause suche piteouse hardhartednesse v goodnesse wee forgoe byandby needeth nothing thrust v vvee haue faire mirroure hereof shewed v men went astray forsooke pure knowledge god soone flud notwithstanding told withall wee see example persone eliu god hath always left good seede middest darknesse hath alwayes bin good holy doctrine end vnbeleeuers shoulde bee left vnexcusable coulde alledge ignorance reygned ouer wherof came god serued woorshipped purely men turned backes vpon dyd simplicitie wherevnto might gyue colour honestie rather stubborne wilfulnesse men loth beguiled yea seeme beguiled whe cometh seruing god shet eye quench light shyned seeke nothing giue ouer themselues trumperie thing shewed v behoueth v way wel hath bin treated heeretofore namely althoughe men prophet god yet notwithstandyng doctrine proceeded maiestie might ryght well beseeme person prophet true haue sayd misapply yet notwithstanding excellent spirit deede haue declared afore thing haue bin set ought bee receyued schole holy ghost although personage excellent yet taught lawe moyses separated churche god lawe published time whych thyng vncerteyne yet distant countrey iury felowshippe might bee partaker doctrine whiche god simply appoynted people vve see men scripture thing saue doctrine whiche noe child spr abroade fludde prophetes god haue excellent spirit although dwelt straunge countrey yet see god giuen knowledge sufficient edifie common people thus ye see world could bee excused ignorance although idolatrie reigned time thare nacor themselues also idolators sayd last chapter booke iosua whiche came folowed theyr steppe yet notwithstanding elia house ram three exempted common corruption tyme wee see pure religion quite abolished among sufficient doctrine leade god conuince worlde wilfulnesse ignoraunce thus yee see haue marke first place also heare sayde god gaue men ouer walke destruction let v mark well bycause graciouse men giue peculiar doctrine whych hee reserued owne people churche yet excuse god therefore let men runne astray drouned destruction neuerthelesse continued alwayes seede theyr hart whereby conuicted could say knewe god religion nother could cleare hymselfe aboade ingrauen conscience world made selfe heauenly maiestie wherevnto must needes bee subiect verely sainct paule speaketh expresly record god hath imprinted creature insomuch order world booke teach v ought lead v vnto god howbeeit heerewithall behoueth v come treated second chapter romaine namely god hath grauen certeintie cosciences cannot wipe away knowledge haue good euill euery man hath muche knowledge wee heare iobs three freends yet notwithstanding shall neuer find man rude barbarouse hee hath remorse conscience knoweth god hath discretion condemne euill allowe good god hathe left trace crankes hart ignorantest ende men myght couer themselues excuse condemned inditement laid vp within themselues way let v marke foolishly done fight againste god maintenaunce doctrine reygned among seeing knowledge god hath shyned cleerely world men might inlightened wee haue seene afore possible gyue ouer themselues grosse beastlinesse worshippe stock stone honour sunne moone make puppet quite cleane forgette liuing god howe could come passe one man shuld wilfully runne headlong thing high noone like stumbling drunken man reeleth asyde though see right way eye vve see men swarued aside simplicitie spighted god purposed malice therfore let v consider well ende runne wonted shift say pray men bee dazeled know thing concerning god ought serue excuse man alledgeth let v contrary part take answere whiche sayd sainct iohn namely light shined darknesse see present example bin vnpossible men haue runne astray grosse outrageous superstition wilfully throwne themselues intoo ignoraunce therfore matched wilfulnesse stubbornesse forsooke right way saluation gaue themselues ouer idol lo haue beare away warneth v ware walking whyle haue light v haue sayd already god graciouse v shewe v way behoueth v make hast time v sleepe much lesse shet oure eye wilfully day see greate darknesse reigneth ouer parte world wretched papist go astray knowe god hath giuen ouer woorthy forasmuch haue forgotten truthe vengeaunce must needes come vpon waterflood ouerwhelme drowne destructio wee side haue iesus christe sunne righteousnesse shineth vpon v therfore must haue eye shet must walke whyle day lasteth following exhortation giuen v heere become guiltie wilfull defacing knowledge giuen v dayes thus yee see wee haue marke first place sentence touching anger eliu let v marke blamed heere inordinate passion good alowable misliking bycause proceedeth zeale eliu toward god truth hee saw iob iustifie hym selfe wise esteemed himselfe righteouse god iobs freends knowledge hyld opinion wicked man iob declareth hee indeede howbeeit haue sayde exceeded measure although cace good yet handle amisse tooke euil way eliu therefore marketh iobs ouershoting himselfe murmuring impaciencie therein hee wente iustifie himselfe aboue god agayne angry tooke vpon euill case vnaduisedly able compasse confounded came pintche behold eliu inflamed anger without cause forasmuch zeale good therefore holy ghost allowed anger wrath way behoueth v marke saying iob intended iustifie himselfe aboue god truely intent would rather hudred time earth swalowed vp neuer bin borne worlde haue thought blasphemie truly haue told often ouershot himselfe conclude fully raging hys passion according hard men stay selues many passion shall oftentimes escape ye see cace iob end hee alwayes condemned himselfe done amisse would excuse sayde hee intended iustifie himselfe aboue god saying conteyneth good profitable doctrine taught may sometimes happen blaspheme god thinke sort pleading allow thing good whiche god doth specially hee afflicteth v certayne wee would make selues rightuouse god true say neither wyll wee thinke thing sheweth selfe ynough condemne v wee doo glorifie god iustice allowing rightfull bee better vnderstood example behold iob knoweth god righteous yea vnfeynedly acknowledgeth hym owne part acknowledgeth himselfe wretched sinner many fault found yea quarell agaynst god hee shoulde bee vanquished thousande tymes hee coulde aunswere one poynte iob meeneth directly iustifie himselfe aboue god make hymselfe equall hym meane whyle sayeth hee maruayle god afflicteth mee thus vvhat fault mee agayne poore creature full infirmitie meete god shoulde stretche oute strong arme agaynst mee vvhy doth kill hande vvhen iob runneth intoo many murmuring grudgings doubt hee iustifieth himselfe aboue god seemeth god vnreasonable afflicting bycause hee knewe done hee desired god come thither aduersarie partie afterwarde agayne hee angrie god consumeth hand sendeth hym quite away seeing iob headie passion doubt made rightuous god tolde euen namely wee shall oftentimes blaspheme god passion ere wee thinke vvhiche thing ought cause v take heede wee giue oure passion brydle least fall wretchednesse blaspheme god ere aware doctrine profitable v holy ghost telleth v suche grudge murmure affliction cannot submit themselues mightie hande god confesse doings rightfull reasonable make themselues rightuous god although say protest hundred time neuer ment think yet neuerthelesse indeede behold competent iudge hath gyuen determinate sentence vpon therefore kicking shall gaine nothing remayneth learne first formost condemne selues bring inditement alwayes ready made come god say wretched sinner furthermore god iudgements shall execute vpon v seeme ouersharp vnto v lette v beare paciently without making great inquiry thinke strange god handle v great rigour see reason doth miserie seeme hard god spareth frailtie hath pitie v ought haue let v giue bridle fancy consent vnto let v always beare minde god rightuous howsoeuer world go true wee shall perceyue reason hee doth whereof commeth oure owne infirmitie rudenesse meete wee shoulde measure god iustice witte vvhat presumptuousnesse vvhat reason let v learne glorifie god al thing doth although hande bee rough towardes v yet let v ceasse co confesse still ala lord go law thee know well cace ouerthrowne beholde ieremie proceedeth behalfe sheweth v way thing haue although thing wer great confuzion might haue beene caried away madnesse murmure rest people yet notwithstanding vseth preface lorde knowe thou art rightuous truely would fayne enter disputation thee prouoked thereto fleshly desire bycause see thinges farre order woulde fayne inquire cause thou workest sort tempted therevnto howbeit lorde take leaue aske thou dealest thus protest first thou art rightuous vnpartiall nothing come fro thee worthy praise thus ye see manner proceeding whiche wee ought hold often wee haue deale god incomprehensible iudgementes consider oure wit able mount highe bee deepe dungeon v go downe let v practise thing cheefely selues inasmuche men full hypocrisie alwayes beleeue themselues bee cleare guiltlesse god although bee fully perswaded yet beare themselues hand god hath cause pursue great rigoure euery man flattereth himselfe lessen owne sinnes although bee fully conuicted vvell sayeth hee true sinner yet worst sorte worlde know greatnesse sinnes bycause tie scarfes afore oure eye forasmuche wee puffed vp pryde standeth v hand practize lesson specially god afflicteth v namely enter quarelling althoughe hys chastizementes seeme ouerrough v acknowledge measurablenesse doings hee excessiue ende may teache v frame ourselues quietly vntoo whensoeuer god chastizing v respect sinnes let v assure ourselues singular grace speciall priuiledge hee giueth vnto v alwayes iust cause punishe v althoughe rightuousest person world nowe farre perfection vvhat might god doo vntoo v neuerthelesse hee visite v trie pacience graunt v grace suffer name sake myght punishe v sinnes let v vnderstand hee doth v excellent great honour therefore let v humble selues euery one v owne behalfe haue modestie say well would fayne god vse another fashion seeming hee passeth measure afflicting mee yet know hee doth without cause sith afflicting mee sinnes muche fauour sheweth mee haue deserued much therefore behoueth stoupe submit selfe wholy good wyll ye see meane whereby god may glorifyed v yeelde vntoo hym rightuousnesse keeping mouthes shutte according sainct paule treateth thereof third romaynes saying ende mouthes myght stopped worlde acknowledge selfe bee indetted vntoo god hee onely shoulde iustified sort god shall bee iustified v according sainct paule witte v condemne oure selues haue boldenesse styrre againste god willingly confesse v indaungered vnto hym wee bee come point god iustifyed saye hys rightuousnesse commended v wyth suche prayse hee deserueth contrarywise men exalt themselues knowledge bee indaungered vntoo god hee may condemne confesse bonde dette whyche haue forfeyted vntoo hym althoughe protest minde iustifie say confesse hym bee rightuous yet neuerthelesse condemne furthermore whereas sayde eliu angrie let v marke great differen betweene anger proceedeth godly zeale anger v moued withall either h goodes honour respect ow hee angrie displeased priuat passion wise excused although hee al ledge good cause yet notwithstanding h offendeth god beeing angrie wee bee blin oure owne passion therefore marke poynte behoueth v bridle anger specially wee prouoked bee angrie neyghbours respect selues howbeeit one anger whiche good namely whiche proceedeth greefe wee conceyue god offended inflamed good zeale mainteyne god quarell bee angrie blame let v marke anger muste bee without respecting persones man bee angrie passion fleshe suche one hath respect hymselfe intendeth maynteyne himselfe agayne hee intende shewe hee beareth fauour hys freendes doth men accepting person bycause haue regarde ourselues vvee rather bee angrie selues wee woulde god shoulde allowe oure anger wrath thys thing whyche sainct paule speaketh hee alledgeth purposely whiche sayde psalme concerning oure beeing angrie howbeeit withoute offending howe done man entereth intoo owne conscience searcheth himselfe earnestly hath eye vnto others muche himselfe condemne hymselfe fighte againste owne passion yee see sort wee may bee angrie point must beginne oure anger haue allowed god witte euery man must beginne himselfe bee angrie hys owne sinnes vice cast vp choler see wee haue prouoked god wrath againste v full muche wretchednesse let v bee angri greeued let poynte v beginne afterwarde lette v condemne euill wheresoeuer bee founde well oureselues freendes let v bee ledde priuate hatred cast rage vppon man bycause wee bee fore possessed euill affection thys manner shall anger allowable shall shewe proceedeth true zeale godwarde true wee shall alwayes bee able keepe measure although godly zeale reigne v yet shoulde still doo amisse exceeding measure god restreyned v therefore zealousnesse behoueth v haue discretion stay selues yet neuerthelesse haue sayde alreadye anger shall bee allowable spring sayd fountaine say hate euill wheresoeuer fynde euen thoughe bee oure owne person nowe thyng wee haue marke thys streyne first formost wee muste condemne anger see man chafed choler must always take vice see scorner god say oh storme meete angrie might vse quieter fashion blaspheme despise god wickedly according many bee seene whiche could find hart ouerthrow al doctrine seeking nothing else spread suche corruption abroade men might knowe god truthe might buried whe haue done would haue men winke rather allowe theyr doings tell nothing fable pulpit rebuking well matter say preach withoute beeing angrie possible shoulde see mortall transitorie creature lift vp himselfe fashion god trample good doctrine vnder feete yet notwithstanding beare paciently vvee shewe thereby zeale god v sayde psalme zeale god house ought eate v vp wee worme gnawing vpon hart ought greeue v much reproche done vntoo god wee see truth turned lye let v learne winke vice let v discerne betweene godly zeale fleshly anger wherewith men moued inflamed theyr owne quarells according say de heere eliu kindled displeasure whote anger yet notwithstanding reckened hym vertue holy ghoste whyche speaketh say let v consider heereby must first dash reiect anger haue eye cause man displeased greeueth god offended truth peruerted let v consider anger springeth good fountayne furthermore according whiche haue sayd let v learne vtter choler see god honour wounded men go darken deface truth let v bee moued inflamed may shew selues child god cannot giue better proofe neuerthelesse let v heerewithall keepe measure wee mingle oure owne excessiue passion zeale god bee discreete putting differece betweene againe although hate abhorre vice yet notwithstanding let v labour bring person saluation truely practising heere hard howbeit god guide v suffer selues ledde holy spirite gyue whole gouernment v meane behoueth v marke well doctrine bycause dayes wee see infinite occasion angrie wee bee child god one syde papistes whiche seeke nothing abolishe religion true pretende mainteine christianitie whatsoeuer say intend nothing else suppresse maiestie god vvee see howe god truth torne peeces cursed blasphemy spued outby pray thing shoulde touche v quicke wounded man shoulde strike v dagger wee thereby shewe wee knowe god woorthy taken child vve bee chare owne honestie wounded meanes indure meane god honour shall put shame reproche wee make countenance must god needes shake v shewe haue affection mainteyne honour marke one poynt howbeeit neede go farre papist euen among selues wee see dog swine seeke nothing defyle thing thrust groyne god word labour ouerturne wee see mocker god heathenish villaynes whiche turne thing scorne mockerie wee see wicked men turken corrupt marre thing false slaunders see heretikes sowe theyr poyson abroade destroy thing pray see thing ought wee moued sayd men bend themselues god manner one would wound deathe shall see sayth scripture whome haue perced god telleth v men come strike dagger shall meane passe god telleth v spirite greeued sort payne shall wee laugh againe heare horrible blasphemy name lord iesus christ torne peeces talke adayes scorning reproching god name wise man might bee ashamed heare among turkes vve see naughtipackes committe one syde whoredome disorder syde outrage violence bee shorte wee see thing vtterly square doo wee shewe oureselues bee god child christian wee make accounte vvhat proofe doo wee giue oure christendome muche behoueth v haue another maner zeale haue heeretofore v angrie let bee sinnes specially wee see god greeuously offended shall wee haue anger allowed god lyke spoken heere holy ghost prayseth yet notwithstanding forasmuche easye v swarue aside let v therwithall beware giue bridle passion let v pray god gouerne v holy spirit zeale may altogither pure end may allowed nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement sinnes praying make v feele may sigh sobbe whereas haue bene ouermuche hardned heretofore soothing selues vice coulde greued see worlde farre order may learne hereafter sorie oure euill doings desire forgiuenesse intent may guyde v rest life holy spirite may seeke altogither serue honour al poynts according calling let v say almightie god heauenly father c cxx sermon second vpon xxxij chapter eliu vvayted till iob made end vvords cause vvere elder vvhen eliu savv three men haue reason vvas moued anger therefore eliu sonne barachell buzite aunsvvered sayde yonger yeares auncient therefore doubted vvas afrayde put forth myne opinion thought vvith selfe yeares shall speake length time shall bring foorth vvisedome spirit god vvhich men inspiration almightie gyueth vnderstanding great men shall vvise therefore neyther shall aged haue iudgement therefore say heare also vvill shevv doctrine yesterday treated zeale eliu whiche praysed v heere holye ghoste shewed wherevntoo example ought serue v namelye see god truthe defaced hys name blasphemed oughte wound heart also shewed wee haue affectio god honour must mainteine truth vttermost power true euery man shall haue learning yet neuerthelesse according abilitie measure behoueth v shew mind resist euil consent vnto withall declared zeale ought guided reason wee muste moued ouergreat headinesse must haue good respect matched thyng red euen namely eliu ouerhastie giuen eare saying beene alledged afore therein shewed modestie let v marke well man thrust himselfe foorth rashly without considering whether needefull hym speake shall bee reckened vnto zealousnesse example see many thinke long till may haue libertie speake yet notwithstanding possible shall much better able lay foorth matter yet owne seeming shall neuer speake soone ynough hastinesse neuer allowable proofe thereof knoweth speaketh instruct others whether men bee better able hee himselfe neede taught thrusteth foorth himselfe teacher yet fault ignorant persone one well grouded babbleth stoppeth mouthes haue grace better meanes edifie withall therefore let v marke well modestie zeale rash gouerned spirit god god spirit doth deede deale abroade gracious gift contrary himselfe seeing named spirit discretio meete v discerne needefull speake keepe silence true man may wel put foorth good matter although ability inferior others howbeit behoueth deale fearefully shew commeth adesire readinesse take profite hee leuer bee learner teacher man go worke although hee speake multitude yet hee fayle modest lowly man fyle speach make ende talke determine vppon thing therein sheweth vaingloriousnesse moreouer giueth roome god grace ought thus ye see shewed v example eliu sayd wayted till word end hee knewe yet wherevnto matter would come heerevntoo addeth bare reuerece vnto age saw iob talked auncient men forasmuch age bringeth experience grauite eliu thrusteth himselfe foorth knowing god suffereth manne liue long tyme worlde hee gyueth hym grace bee able profite suche yonger hee hath liued longer therefore ought also better settled haue gotten skill thing wee haue marke seconde place eliu acknowledged spoken afore auncients heere yong men haue good profitable lesson put well vre haue sayd already man hath liued long hee ought haue remembred thing god hath shewed experiece ought serue himselfe also giue good counsell others haue like experience also grauitie matched yong men ought thynke although god hath giuen vnderstanding yet want muche bycause haue seene much man want experience surely shall time time rashly ouershoote himselfe hee forecasteth end thing neither knoweth begin moreouer heate yong men alwayes contrarie reason good vnderstanding though yong man bee well stayed also haue good knowledge therewithall yet notwithstanding youth driueth hym headlong suche boyling hys nature hee cannot alwayes rule hymselfe vve see howe saint paule warneth timothie bee subiecte lustes youth lustes youthe hee meeneth disorderednesse playing whorehunting drunkennesse suche looce behauiour timothie myrrour patterne holinesse himselfe yea saint paule faine exhort drinking wine yet notwithstanding speaketh lust youth muche hee yong yeares possible bee ouerhastie diuers thinges nowe behoued timothie passed elder discretion grauitie receyue warning common sort neede therefore let yong folk looke well selues haue honestie hearken elder learne followe counsell surely vertues world one vice would staine defile ther common vice presumption much yong men haue beene acquainted difficulty manye thing therefore steppe forth boldely sticke thing nothing thinke vnpossible vnto youth doth alwayes carrie presumption ouercommon ordinarie inconuenience yet therefore borne withall sayde yong man haue many vertues besydes yet trust himselfe yea despize auncientes beare selfe hande hee able leade others god confounde pryde giftes shall bee defaced therefore muche ought yong folkes suche haue yet seene muche bridle selues yea much wee see nowe adayes worlde farre order yong folkes haue gathered suche diuelish pryde bee past receyuing maner nurture instruction suche haue feare god ought fight muche againste selues end caried away common fashion vve shall see yong roysters take vpon men sone bee vnder rodde notwithstanding yet worthy beare name child yong cockchickins three dayes hatching yet needes bee great men ought bee kept yet halfe score yeares vnder rodde beholde bee owne seeming fully men wherein malapartnesse shamelesse harlotte stewes may good willes vnder awe correction al world seeth seeing vice common contageous disease whome god hath giuen grace ought bethinke selues well take heed intangled shoulde bee caryed awaye others god hilde strong hand let god child stande vpon garde assure selues bee modest verie much although haue gay shewe albeit desirous set forth selues despise bycause go perking vp nebbes let assure selues much allowed god blisse honest behauiour make profit two yeres tha ouerhast efellowes shall foure vvee see hapneth vnto fruites fruite bee soone ripe come soone perfect colour doth also fade away incontinently fruite latewarde longer continuance euen put forth selues time truely may beare goodly shewe haue taste shall haue substancialnesle contrariwise shamefast honest presumptuous put forth selues hastily surely slowe yet meane season oure lorde giueth fruite longer continuance thus yee see good point beare away sentence true modestie vertue conuenient menne yet ought yong folkes marke sayde heere namely must yeelde honor elder acknowledging owne part may haue excessiue passion neede restrained sufficiently stayde owne nature againe haue experience bee skilfull requisite furthermore yong man hath behaued modestly must time conuenient viter thing god hath giuen yea eue though among olde men order nature letteth olde men discharge duty yong men may supply roome behalfe yea euen ehe shame haue liued long mispent time god hath giue rather vtterly lost ye see meane haue hold reuerence yong folk beare elder must hinder continuall maintenance truth god shuld honored vice suppressed may com passe elder sort shall destitute god spirit else leud person shall haue nothing craft vnfaythfulnesse else shal wilfull brainelesse caces ought yong folkes bee hilde vnder yoke authoritie elder turned away god word thing good holie let v marke modestie importeth yong men shoulde become sheepishe discerne know nothing ynough presume theselues skirmish cast froth time let hearken let teachable let bee alwayes willing keepe silence good matter debating specially let beware stepping men place beeing done see elder sort shew good example specially peruert good turning euill said mete god spirit shuld shewe selfe like oure time haue bin misled superstition poperie longer haue liued worlde haue still lesser knowledge nowe tarie till god shoulde serue turne meane commonly needefull aged men haue long experience haue beene plunged darkenesse ther knowledge god purenesse religion vvhat could aged men bring onely greater wilfulnesse haue beene saped errours wholly giuen vnto likelyhoode meanes bring nowe god list call yong men publish worde abroade reason holie ghoste bee brydeled yong men might speake olde men contented heare true like god calleth sort hath commonly beene bee serued elder sorte neuerthelesse hee hath declared also truth tyed vnto age wee see nowe modestie ought bee men generally specially yong men witte must yeelde selues quietly learne farre occasion shall bee giuen desire vaunte selues bee led fonde longing make shew receyue thing silence shall alledged others make much owne paynted sheath acknowledge haue neede bee guyded gouerned experience doone wee shall neede bee restreyned iudging vnder shadow eldershippe goe lyke sillie beastes holde thing come mouth word god bycause say muste bee discretion ought matched zeale according haue declared alreadie spirit god conteyneth bee modestie men must also zeale discretion wee must onely bee brideled authoritie suche haue liued long also whole world brought v yet oughte antiquitie preiudice thing rightfull necessarie howe haue tolde alreadie al old men popedome conspired gospell would haue men stande accustomed fashion ment ancientnesse shuld shet god word dores yong men shoulde bee letted maynteine truth although olde men set themselues would haue men holde themselues customes bycause haue mainteyned euil long time whome god hath giuen better grace ought steppe vp howebeit behooueth v passe man say vnto v howe nowe aboue hundred yeares ago since oure father forefather haue lyued sorte fiue hundred yeares yea thousand yeares ago since thing haue beene obserued since menne haue hilde lawe infallible rule say men alledge antiquitie time yea man shoulde alledge creation world yet must god truth bee oppressed vnder shadowe wee see nowe bee modest behoueth v blynde bussardes keepe meane measure whiche eliu meeneth adding sayde age shall speake multitude yeares shall vtter knowledge spirite god owelleth men inspiration almightie giueth vnderstanding marke howe order nature goeth afore witte must giue care elder men choose gouernours citie countrey shoulde take yong light headed brainelesse fooles haue skill gouerne owne person chosing iudges leader peruerting order nature yea shame might seem men intended spite god often men might choose settled personage men great grauitie ripenesse would let sit stil house meane take phantasticall fellowes little snales one nightes growth set seate iustice knowe meeneth like men marrie little babe would please well married bycause would sayde vnto shall eate rost meate pastycrust would like verie well therefore mariage euen say sette seate iustice haue neyther skill witte worsse babe bycause men consideration chose suche grauitie experience therefore behoueth order nature bee obserued firste whiche wee haue men yeares whome god hath indued grace put office guide others yonger sort humble themselues vnder shame yong men take vpon roome elder disdayne receyue instruction handes haue liued long pryde bindeth selfe againste mortall men resisting god hath settled order nature would haue men obserue much sayde v preacher state bearing abroade publishing god word well tryed man good experience knowledge men vouchsafe bee serued one take yong man auenture thing therefore behoueth v haue order estimation neuerthelesse must generall rule made oftentimes may come passe god shall giue much grace yong men suche haue lyued double time therefore sayde order wee haue spoken must hinder spirite god hee bee receyued hee sheweth selfe giftes bee applyed good vse according hee distributeth cause saint paule chose timothie though many elder men time hee seene excellent man recorde onely men also holie ghost preferred elder euen dealeth eliu heere hearkened vnto others sayth hee knewe spirite god men hee say true must iudge olde men doe dote excepte wee knowe howe matter goeth neyther muste wee fayle giue roome place must yeelde honour age say well man hath seene much able teache v perceiue discharge dutie hath lost time hath liued world spirit god yong man behoueth put forth selfe let v mark wel obseruing order nature must alwayes condition god indueth giftes grace shoulde serue church teach onely equal companion also euen oldest consequently rich men must sticke age therevpon vnpacient reiect warning say howe nowe haue liued long time shall yong ladde teach lesson let thinke thu selues ought haue profited suche wi e might haue beene leader others see ne haue need bee led selfe yong chylde comparison shoulde haue beene taught mee seeing god hathe disappoynted mee grace requisite leader behoueth mee bee scholler mayster yee see olde men ought yeelde themselues conformitie see god hath gyuen larger giftes grace oughte followe goe afore nowe haue wee good doctrine put vre whiche wee gather thinges sette downe heeretofore whiche better conceyuing thing conteyned let v marke eliu saying spirit god whiche dwelleth men ment expresse pleaseth god one man shall bee greater vnderstanding another speciall gifte granteth priuiledge true generally god hath made v reasonable creature thing wherein wee differ brute beastes god hath gyuen discretion vnderstanding men withoute exception yet notwithstanding wee see slowe dull othersome quicke witted phantasticall othersome good grauitie vvhereof commeth let v vnderstande god holdeth giftes hande dealeth pleasure whome hee thinketh good eliphas mente expresse place ende men thinke selues haue naturall inheritaunce mother wombe thing belonging dutie gotten owne purchase beholde eliu telleth v god hath created v true wee haue reason howebeit measure yet notwithstanding man haue knowledge wisdome behooueth knowe god hath reached oute hande vnto peculiarly therefore hee beholden bounde vntoo sayde vnto v intente wee shoulde bee exalted pryde thinke oure selues bee worth bycause wee haue knowledge vnderstanding wee shoulde consider muche hath pleased god giue v grace behoueth v walke muche greater feare wee much dette therewithall giuing benefites ende wee shoulde communicate neyghbours therefore vse glorifying oure god edifying suche haue neede cortaine wee muche blame worthy wee haue marke one poynt behoueth v also make comparison heere betweene two degree wit bee god giueth speciall vnderstanding vnto men discerne thing pertaine transitorie life bee saide doctrine gospell true pure religion haue wee nature wee purchase owne trauell ala wee must needes come farre shorte fall man bee good schoole maister teach chyldren good aduocate phisition good marchant citie good laborer countrey continually spirite god worketh thing man shall haue neede bee sharpe witted one thing like required greater skill handycraftes marchandize nowe euen thing seeme bee common value themselues god must bee fayne distribute holie spirit vnto men wee come doctrine gospell wisedome surmounteth man vnderstanding yea woonderfull euen verie angelles bee verie secretes heauen whiche conteyned gospell concerneth knowing god person sonne although oure lorde iesus christe came downe heere beneath yet muste wee comprehende godlie maiestie else wee grounde seetle oure fayth say concerneth knowledge thinges incomprehensible man nature nowe god must bee faine deale spirite respecte handicraftes worldly trade concerne transitorie life muche ought wee thinke oure owne sharpe witte able knowe thing concerne god secretes kingdome behoueth v bee taught meane season become fooles respecte selues saincte paule sayeth wee may bee partaker wisedome sentence giuen thereof namely naturall man doeth neuer comprehende doctrine god say long men abyde owne naturall kynde neyther knowe god time taste worde worse follie sainct paule sayth seeming vnreasonable doctrine therefore spirite god gyueth v fayth inlightneth v ought bee well marked wee see fewe know god yea many men whiche well stricken yeares haue liued long time worlde starke madde superstition fight feercely doctrine gospel oftentimes dazeleth eye amazed yea heere texte ought arme v stumbling blockes spirite god dwelleth men inspiration almightie giueth vnderstanding see wretched men blinded plunged ignorance cannot come gospel let v maruell man naturall kind discerne whit god secret vntill wee inlightned contrariwise wee see man knoweth god whether yong old see olde man hath bin saped long dotage papistrie come right religion let v assure selues god hath wrought miracle cace also wee see yong folkes come let v assure ourselues god draweth maruellous fashion easily receyue yoke bycause bee full presumption sayd afore god tame make teachable mightie hand hath brought vnto se text ought serue v two thing first seeing wit neuer reach highe knowe god truth ought put owne reason v renounce vtterly thing whiche saincte paule termeth bee made foole haue lorde fill v wisedome behoueth v become fooles say wee muste bring anye thing weene selues haue one thing shetting doore againste god vvherefore wee haue god continue grace holie spirite shall haue giuen v portion wee must learne exalt magnifie deserueth acknowledge one drop good vnderstanding v till god haue put v agayne must cause v persist alwayes obedience walke greate feare carefulnesse seeing god quenche light hath put v wee bee darknesse yea horrible darkenesse wee could neuer get firste vse place seconde although wee see greater part worlde goe astraye scarcely man willing submitte himselfe vnto god must thinke straunge men shoulde bee farre order playe wylde beastes spirite god gyueth vnderstanding vvherefore let bee ground v magnifie god grace shall haue receyued therewithall let v bee caryed awaye thoughe wee see suche rebelliousnesse men followe owne kynde followe owne heade meane resist god bycause doctrine gospell surmounteth man reason god must bee fayne worke holie spirite opening eye else shall abyde continually beastlynesse finally eliu concludeth therevpon great men alwayes wise sometimes aged menne haue vnderstanding skill discretion men truely eliu meeneth heere peruert order nature hee hathe protested heeretofore hee woulde hearken aged willyng submitte himselfe theyr doctrine meeneth haue touched alredie namely god bounde age state quality men vvhen pleaseth god aduaunce man dignitie hee haue serue welfare people hee indueth grace able discharge office otherwise leueth destitute higher degree shall hee bee knowne bee double beast example bee man chosen preach god worde god bee mynded shewe fauoure churche hee indue sayde man spirite hee gyue vnderstanding worde hee graunt cunning skill apply vse people gather good doctrine finally hee gyue zealousnesse thing requisite hee shewe selfe manifestly behalfe wee may say hee hath care v hee distributeth grace sorte vnto menne thing requisite welfare muche saye sitte seate iustice according haue neede spirite god shoulde bee doubled also god intendeth bee serued hee giueth mightie power discharge dutie contrariwise god bee g ie v shal haue preaching word shall bee beastes withoute vnderstanding men shall despise disguysing thinges good doctrine shall bee defaced defyled bee shorte scarsely shall bee good schollers therefore muche lesse good maysters yee see eliu ment shewe saying great men shall always bee wyze aged men alwayes men best vnderstanding hee shoulde say wee muste make generall rule say man aduaunced hie estate authoritie therefore hee muste needes bee man knowledge wee muste gather suche consequent god well forsake great one shall become grosse beast longer shall haue liued shall haue mispent breade beeing fed god cost muche beene better woulde say oxe beene fed beene better bestowed let v learne muche god distributeth hys spirite whome hee intendeth apply seruice ought muche better imploye themselues carefully feare god doe otherwise appeare taken bee wysest shall bee vtterly blinded shall know god according god threatneth prophet esay saying aged shall see whit wise shal become brutish vtterly dul vve see howe god declareth muche horrible vengeance againste great men olde men gouernoures againste common people heereby wee bee warned wee muste attribute infallible authoritie though coulde neuer errenor misgouerne others nowe god doe blinde olde men greate men suche authoritie sorte shall become pray god giue holie spirite let v marke well cause god maketh threatning mennes hypocrisie bycause serued countenaunce sake hearte farre protested serue mouth meane gaue selues tradition menne saye god raigned alone ouer worde men owne scope god abide authoritie bee diminished cause hee sayth binde wise take away vnderstanding reason aged vvherefore wee desire haue god gouerne v reigne among v inioye gracious giftes necessarie saluation let v learne behoueth v yeelde dominion soueraintie ouer v v great small must ftame selues obedience furthermore let v take worde rule suffer selues bee gouerned assuring oure selues otherwise wee muste looke holie ghost shall worke v therefore let v seeke meanes taught god woulde shepeherdes church preach word wee shoulde receyue correction warning shepeheards church preach word wee shoulde receyue correction warning handes done throughly ought bee let v praye god supplie defaulte vvherefore let v walke suche humilitie oure whole desire may god haue preheminence ouer v assuring oure selues wee haue reason vnderstanding wee bee inlightned holie spirite meane whereby hee neuer suffer v bee thrust way hee hathe begun guide teach v make v grow stronger wisedome according sainte paule sayth seeing god hath begon v suffer v want thing vntill latter day whiche time wee shall haue full knowledge thing whiche wee knowe nowe part let v fall face good god acknowledgement oure sinnes praying make v perceiue may vtterly beaten downe specially knowing number wantes misery bee v may pray reforme v clense v spot make v pure holie spirite hee maye alwayes acknowledge auowe v bee child wee also side may serue honour father shewe brotherly loue one towardes another commaundeth may seeke nothing exalt holy name among v euery v degree yeelde due honour may please graunt grace c cxxj sermon third vpon xxxij chapter beholde haue vvayted vvordes giuing eare vvhile prepared youre selues sought reason considered vvas none disproued iob ansvvered vvordes ende maye say vvee haue founde vvisdome god hath cast man hee hath directed vvoordes vnto mee neyther ansvvere according vvoordes vvere afrayde ansvvered left speaking taryed spake stoode still ansvvered also ansvvere turne shevve mine aduice full matter spirite belly constreyneth mee beholde bellie vvyne hathe vente nevve barrelles burst therefore vvill speake haue vent vvill open lippes ansvvere vvill novve accept person man neyther vvill giue title man shoulde flatter tell vvhether maker vvoulde destroye mee incontinently like declared yesterday man ought put forth himselfe hastily shoulde rather seeke learne teach others except necessitie costrayned v shewed v heere wee must thrust selues vnknown matter knowe well howe case standeth truely wee see disputing matter wel knowne runne astray speake vnto wardly therein perceiue owne want therefore haue marke shewed v heere example eliu namely must cast forth wordes auenture bee ouerhastie giuing sentence thing hidden v whereof wee duely informed true lesson perteyneth cheefly suche set seate iustice ought examine matter throughly iudge neuerthelesse euerie man ought obserue rule owne behalfe first wee haue marke heere according declared yesterday alwayes see sayd namely whe god spirit gouerneth man like giueth zeale moueth religion also giueth skill discretion one goeth neuer without man haue vnruly zeale bee counted anye vertue god spirite raigne shall perceiue thing inseparable much ought wee praye god giue v grace mainteine truth also shewe v time speake hold peace giue v vnderstanding reason runne rouers vnaduisednesse slender excuse say thought done well tooke matter bee true man sometimes ouerseen therefore much ought take heede ourselues considering weakenesse owne wit seeke bee gouerned god hande hauing good zeale wee may also haue reason weeld rule well nowe let v come eliu saith declareth discours shall men say saith haue haue founde wisdome god hath ouerthrowne iob men eliu betokeneth take another way disputing againste iob men done way hild thou art afflicted hande god say without cause therefore must concluded thou arte wicked man thine affliction great vnmeasurable neuer yet man worlde seene sore pressed thou therefore followeth thou passest al men wickednesse lo fou dation iobs freends toke going reproue eliu protesteth take way surely apparant gone forward sorte still made matter worse worse haue told iob able maintein soundnesse walked feare god offended thing sauing could settle mind wholy obeying god thought affliction strange howbeit respect principall point cace good iust surely vnderstand text though eliu say thinke ye shall become wise holding peace god confound wel inough though mortal men meddle man loke neerely matter hee shall finde naturall sense bee haue spoken namely eliu taunteth iobs freendes vpbraydeth expresly thought themselues haue founde wisdome like commonly say prouerbe man thinketh hath founde beane cake ther subtile mening thing windeth companie put forth opinion deuice bearing himselfe hande hath inuincible reson althogh fond trifling speaketh eliu semeth saith knot matter much god hath pressed iob sort punished roughly therfore hee enemie take bee good strong foudation nothing worth according haue declared already although god visit man doth therefore folow wicked albeit god threaten transgressours law punish person good child yet iob persecuted respect another cause although god thretned trasgressors ment reserueth libertie exercise pacience faithful whe listeth may shew rough towards although haue respect vnto offe ce haue comitted vvherfore humble reason ought well suffice beside god haue seruants example vnto others moreouer needfull mortifie fleshly affection oftentimes haue secret vice v god remedieth beforehand somtimes sendeth v affliction wee knowe cause hee seeth farre cleerer wee must fully conclude god scourgeth good suche haue prouoked wrath hee ceasseth shewe himselfe roughe towardes execute greate rygoure vpon muche shall seeme hee mynded ouerwhelme vtterly therefore sayd men shoulde count wicked fonde argument although iobs freends ground themselues vpon thought haue founde wisdome behalfe yet notwithstanding say childish thing vvherefore concerning texte let v beare thing mynde haue touched heeretofore behaue oure selues discretely god afflicteth men iudge auenture hee whiche beaten god rod forthwith codemned sinnes measured affliction rashe vnwise proceeding make generall rule howe let v vnderstande god hath diuers reason afflicte menne true ordinarie iustice punishe sinnes neuerthelesse sometimes trie obedience good men suche haue serued applyed whole indeuer followe commaundementes yea shall handled greater rigoure wicked god intendeth teache bee humble obedient seeing cace standeth behoueth v refraine hastie iudgement man afflicted god also preserue seruantes temptation hee sendeth true haue meanes prouoked displeasure hee remedieth euill afflicting nowe shall wee therevpon iudge suche handled roughliest wickedest vvhat thing see yee wee proceede cleane backwarde god quite contrarie intente purpose furthermore let v applye well oure neighbour oureselues wee see men afflicted many misery let v firste looke vnto life bee hastie giue sentence vpon consider howe haue liued despizer god vnruly person man giuen outrageous vice bee greeuously punished let v acknowledge therein god sheweth v picture hys vengeance haue iust occasion iudge thing selfe speaketh vvhen man hathe despized god spente whole life disorderly see god scourgeth behalf doubting matter selfe darke difficulte oure iudgement shall bee ouerhastie wee proceede sorte contrariwise wee haue sought reason god afflicteth men see none man walked vprightly cace must brydle selues know god purpose vntill hee shewe vnto v lo howe ought iudge respecte others herewithall see wicked punished haue deserued let v onely condemne also applye oure owne vse according saincte paule sheweth whiche wee shoulde walke feare god take warning mennes harmes beholde god punisheth vvhoremongers theeues rebelles ende wee learne walke obedience prouoke wrathe whome wee see roughly handeled thing whiche wee haue doe god maketh v beholde vengeance haue bene vtterly rebellious againste wee see good men visited behoueth v thinke ala greene tree bee cast fire shall become drie vvhen wee compare oure selues suche manner halfe oute worlde alreadie wee shall see verie greate vertues yet notwithstanding handeled muche greeuouslye wee therefore wee muste needes saye god beareth v hee pytied v shoulde become v wee bee wakened meanes let v assure selues ende wee shoulde take libertie doe euill restreyne v tye v vp intente wee shoulde submit oure selues wholly vnto oure god vvhen wee haue considered scourge affliction god sendeth vpon oure neyghbours let v oure side oure turne commeth bee punished god hande yea euen oure sinnes acknowledge needeth witnesse oure owne conscience also sufficient iudge condemne v afterward god time rough v see reason yet let heartes fayle v neyther let v vexe selues disputing god though hee doe wee woulde haue rather let v learne comfort selues although god seeme bee mortall enemie thunder v yet notwithstanding let v trust wee haue seene iob speake heeretofore thus yee see howe ought discrete iudging chastizementes god sendeth v also ought verie mylde towardes oure neighbour thing haue beare away sentence eliu hee sayeth follie men gaze much present affliction say bycause god hande rough harde sharpe vpon creature therefore hee vtterly ouerthroweth say must followe generall rule wee beguyled assayes haue shewed alreadie nowe herevpon eliu vpbraydeth iobs freendes confounded wayted sayth spake gaue ouer talke heereby betokeneth confounded bycause euill grounded wee knowe truth alwayes inuincible true hath good cace shall alwayes heard wee see good cace may bee oppressed brainelesse frantike folke haue full scope stoppe mouthes suche haue iust cause speake thinges goe orderly man haue good cace god gyueth wherewith mainteine truth sayd shall haue vpper hande naught eliu taunteth iobs freendes confounded middest way vvherfore let v assure oure selues knowe throughly thing true god also giue v argumentes reason mainteine ende vanquished suche laboure beate downe truth turne lye god say strengthen v wee shall neuer bee destitute reason doctrine well worthy bee marked cause oftentimes wee dare vndertake good quarell wee haue stoutnesse skill resist stedfastly requisite nowe ende suche fearefulnesse hinder v beeing zealous mainteyning truth wee ought let v marke god forsaketh haue courage maynteine good caces giueth victorie ende yea although bee oppressed subtiltie wilynesse may come passe haue sayde yet notwithstanding shall neuer bee confounded howe euer worlde goe let v trust promise referre oure selues vnto god wee shall finde sayd vaine true aboue al thing behoueth v discern whether cace maintein bee good god punisheth lightnesse take matter hande knowe howe leaueth assone haue opened mouth become laughingstockes vnto men beholde iust rewarde ouerhastie putting forth themselues wee bee sure goodnesse cace let v rest vpon whiche sayde vnto v heere witte god strengthen v wee shall bee ouercome furthermore wee see sometimes suche ought mainteine good cace play gosling stand deade abashed let v marke god punisheth fayntheartednesse giueth courage ought haue bicause called hung vpon muche thought holie ghoste able ynoughe giuethem strength vnbeleefe sheweth selfe adays good cace shall thrust vnder foot ye see wicked haue courage inough much set forth lie withstande comming forth truth wicked fayle apply strayne selues vttermost ouerthrowe thing bring matter confusion mean man setteth himselfe leastwise courage requisite willing well haue affection notwithstanding faint beleefe surely trusted god wold suffer thing bee confounded bee thus ye see haue consider eliu taunteth iobs friend confounded much saye thereby apparant euill cace made wrong matche iob hee addeth hee also speake turne worde also ought well weyed thereby eliu betokeneth hee putteth foorth aduice due time vvhy haue tolde alreadie bycause hee yong man ought haue yelded reuerence aged otherwise bin peruerting order nature therefore behoued modestie goe eliu suffer elder speake heare done much god giueth grace discerne cace better done also speaketh turne vvee see hee runneth heade say thrusteth himselfe matter aduenture holdeth peace till conuenient time serueth speaketh poynt ought mark verie well know god church thing ought bee handled orderly comely saint paule sayth therefore two thing requisite manner teaching first order bee obserued secondly order matched honestie thing may bee comely conuenient seeing let v beare mynde example eliu let v holde v doctrine saint paule giueth v sayde texte whiche disorder amongest v according also sainct paule sayth another streine text alledged althoughe god haue raysed vp many prophetes church many haue skill speake yea also wherwith teach yet notwithstanding vtter forth giuen behoueth order measure also certaine honest comelinesse kepte therefore thing shewed v heere example eliu sayth speake yea seeth thing misordered iobs freendes disguised truth mainteined euill false principle although vsed fayre apparant reason colour matter yet notwithstanding foundation whervpon builded good iob also side althoughe cace iust yet notwithstanding handle amisse vsed many wandring wordes therefore eliu hearkned quietly nowe seeth god giueth entrance accesse vseth besides hee also constreyned doe according sheweth hee addeth heart greeued hee like caske full newe wine man put newe wine intoo caske close vp giue vent caske bursteth wine boyleth euen sayeth eliu mynde shet vp caske full newe wine coulde holde longer muste needes burst heereby hee meeneth necessitie constreyneth put forth opinion end cace beene euill debated might nowe bee ordered reason bycause eliu speaketh heere great vehemencie perceyuing cause haue thought bee man loftie mynde full bosting first al see god condemneth vvhereas condemneth iob freendes sheweth doone amisse one way yet notwithstanding eliu iustified nowe seeing god condemneth mortall man shall take vpon authoritie iudge aboue god therfore great follie moreouer must bee thought strange thing must beare mynde howe hath beene declared heeretofore eliu one prophetes god church god published lawe hande moyses hee promiseth also people israell neuer destitute prophetes written deutr thou shalt goe sorcerer soothsayer thou shalt seeke reuelations heathen thou shalt run witchcraft vaine science neither shalte thou aske counsell deade thy god shall alwayes rayse thee vp prophete middes thee hee say heathen men seeke search many wayes taught knowe haue prophete certeyne doctrine leade guyde sayde god child israell alwayes giue prophete dwell familiarly among truth shall bee knowne vnto thus prophetes churche god according promise continually common thing eliu dwelled amog folke lawe promise god neyther lorde make couenaunt people either lawe else among idolater according haue told thare nachor great grandfather aunceters eliu idolater seeing eliu instructed god skill speake wee haue seene extraordinarie matter therefore must thinke strange great operation god sheweth heere vnaccustomed power eliu also feeleth selfe chaunged intent prophesies haue authoritie wee see god hathe time set apparant markes like god called saule kingdom changed renued seemed ite cleane another man beene afore texte selfe sayth saule also among prophetes god touched prophetes quicke called state according promise customable order say chaunged suche wise appeared menne rauished muche reason wrought heathen man church must needes notable marke behalf world might know god hand vpon howebeit much diuell alwayes ape god counterfayter workes like befell false prophetes also infidelles whiche brought reuelations name idol also rauished vvhen man came inquire secrete thing idolles fame renoume foretelling thing come prophet eyther men woman whiche halfe deade shoulde answere suche came inquire drewe wordes like falne intoo falling sicknesse fomed mouth eye turned heades done purposely bycause diuell would bleare eye ignorant wretch sot fashion moued reuerence whether would howe needes must bee heauenly power folkes say seeing men woman changed sayde doone satan pollicie certeine slight counterfait god workes disguise himselfe sort end men shoulde discerne rather thinke thinges came hell proceded heauen neuerthelesse see wel cause ought think strange eliu vehement pang mind god ordeined purpose vndertake incounter iob freends yea requisite god woorke newe fashion man youth selfe shall heard among men bicause old men make great account age thinke themselues great abilitie wisdome maketh much arrogant meanes thereof forepossessed foolish opinion cannot finde hart taught great hardnesse force therfore behoued god touch eliu quicke make great alteration mind end doctrine might haue entrance receyued amog elder short god met authorize eliu gaue vehemecie mind also reason haue touched namely sawe truth oppressed insomuch iob mainteyned quarell amisse although good men disguised thing made euil foundation abusing talke concerned god alledging good holy reason proof wrong principle taken therefore sight moued zeale conceiued himselfe heart boyle within would haue made burst discharged himselfe ought serue v double vse first sith see god hath printed marke doctrine eliu heauenly spirite apparant mouth much ought moued receyue saying purpose hath god marked ende shoulde haue reuerence among v forasmuch god hath put seale thing eliu shall discourse hereafter woulde doctrine thereby made certaine vnto v let v receiue doctrine mortall man let v learne hereby submit oure selues vnto let v bee sure fayth shall grounded vpon doctrine creature god speaketh mouth man vseth instrument lo haue marke howbeeit behoueth v passe namely marke dimme eliu ought serue make v receyue doctrine fuller obedience sayd great notable proofes god hath giuen v law prophecy true eliu bringeth pure worde god behoueth v take thing proceede mouth thing come holy ghost bicause god hath stirred vp vehemecie consider god hath magnified approued lawe doctrine prophetes wee shall see fashion much mightie lawe published ayre rored sky shaken thunder lightning trumpettes sounded cloudes earth quaked mountaynes remoued sheepe voice god short element gaue recorde doctrine shewing altogither heauenly also followed miracle prophet spake heauenly power appeared alwayes great proofe ought put eies see therfore seeing know god one onely marke gaue vnto eliu cause doctrine eliu receiued sufficiet authoritie let v vnderstand law prophet come question ought haue reaso moued stirred vp according thing spoken eliu appurtenance thus ye see haue mark first place second behoueth v also marke lyke eliu moued zeale saw men disguise god truth falsifie worde must also haue like minde least false prophet se vp deface good doctrine wicked men disguise blasphemy perswade world despise god worde euill cace mainteyned men go ouerthrow right let v bee dumbe carelesse let v haue vehemencie v shewed v heere haue godly zeale towardes god truth shewe selues bee none child therefore let v marke well example set foorth heere persone eliu yea let v make comparison betwene selues man brought vp god schole intangled among infidelles moued zeale god touched hee irned hee shoulde haue burst tyll hee discharged conscience pray shoulde wee doo god teacheth v familiarly woorde wee bee excused wee yeelde recorde vntoo men tyme wee see goodnesse defaced yea vtterly razed yet set selues agaynst seeing oure lorde calleth v therevnto layeth charge vpon v bee dumbe make account mainteyning good rather doo helpe wicked silence traytors god truth yes doubtlesse behoueth v moued sith see man bin instructed lawe god bodie church notwithstanding earnest mainteyne truth maner inforced true inforcement willing god intendeth bee serued men hee caryeth away make go constreynt meane prophetes true seruantes hee serue owne turne wicked whether speake heere whome hee giueth spirit prophecie whome hee maketh serue without giuing good coulde well speake mouth balaam yet notwithstanding wee see balaam still deceyuer holy ghost setteth forth reproche slaunder eliu god stirred vp prophete hee serued good say ouercame lettes might turne away mayntayning truth nowe adayes also see truth oppressed men mocke v othersome go aboute byte v yea eate v vp bycause wee maintein truth let v fight temptation inforcement ought sette v forwarde sometimes wee bee ashamed maynteyne good quarell bycause wee see men make mocke scoffer scorne god also malapert bleare theyr tongue v laugh allegation scorne god truth muste bee despisable vnto v though worlde reiect let temptation withholde v fighting valiantly agaynst wee see selues readie hated men practise mischeefs v mainteyning good quarelles let v giue ouer true ynough draw v backe stoppe mouth neuerthelesse behoueth v fight agaynst temptation example eliu ye see god seruants ought bee fully resolued swarue confessing truth neede requireth finally eliu sayth shall accepting person vse flatterie bycause sooth men cannot tell whether maker would destroy eliu meeneth say effect brideled authoritie man hee shoulde speake freely commeth mainteyning god truth bee layde forth length nowe therefore ynough v haue elius meening surely euill thing vtterly condemned call man honourable tytle howbeeit forasmuch doth oftentymes hinder v abashe v hande wee haue libertie requisite dutie speaking plainly flatly ought doo therefore dooth eliu say giue tytles men say exaltmen high truth shall bee aboue let v beare minde although lawfull v yeelde honour vnto men yea ought insomuch must honour onely superiours equal also inferiours according scripture commaundeth v yet notwithstanding whether toward equalles towarde inferiours towarde surmount v degree alwayes truth must preferred men although wee yeelde euerie man honour belongeth hee deserueth yet let v ceasse speake alwayes freely without accepting persones according wee knowe speake god name hee haue v without feigning intende honour god meete deserueth behoueth v vtter wordes freely speake men sayde bee impeachment yeelding euerie man due honour yet wee must haue mouthes shet euerie v must follow owne calling commeth turne speake must speake truth ye see haue beare away last saying elius ende beare office common weale shoulde speake freely ought euerie v although haue office teaching pronouncing sentence publikely shoulde neuerthelesse confesse truth freely requyred handes assuring selues god accepteth sacrifice honour done vnto wee onely keeping rule giuen v also honouring exalting aboue creature nowe let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement sinnes praying make v feele better wee haue done bringing thereof passe wee may presume aught selues knowing well cannot open mouth except hee guide gouerne v holy spirite therefore may please instruct v wise wee may haue mouth open speake neede requireth wee may followe owne affection lustes speaking life may agreeable therevnto bee bestowed suche obedience towardes god wee may seeke nothing frame wholy holy wil although wee bee subiect muche wretchednesse corruption passing worlde yet wee may fayle labour still full perfection wherevnto god call v wee shall haue glorified worlde may please graunt grace onely v also people nation earth bringing back poore ignorant soules miserable bondage errour darkenesse right way saluation c cxxij sermon first vpon xxxiij chapter sermon yet still vpon three last verse former chapter vpon text followeth therefore iob heare thou talke hearken vnto vvordes beholde haue opened mouth tongue shall speake palat vvordes rightnesse heart lippes shall vtter pure doctrine spirit god hath created breath almightie hath giuen life thou canst ansvvere prepare thy selfe agaynst debate thy cace stoutely beholde godvvarde thou according thine ovvne mouth also formed clay feare mee trouble thee although presse thee yet shall bee heauie burthen thee haue begonne alreadie lay foorth protestation eliu made speaking rightly without regarde men hath beene declared man speake rightly godlily must haue eye shet accept person led either hatred fauor nothing wel ruled v wil nothing trouble specially standeth vpon teaching god name behoueth v bee well aduised turne away fleshly affection eliu said purposely god might roote shoulde haue respect men greatnesse might seeme hard first sight god shoulde destroy one magnifying man greatnesse howbeeit let v marke first god graunteth v grace speake name behoueth v yeelde authoritie worde aduaunce estimation thereof wee bee turned asyde looking vnto creature speake freely wee ought doo dishonouring god man bee sent earthly prince suffer men scorne playeth goose dare preferre message committed vnto lozelrie pardoned beholde god receyueth v seruice euen v dust euen v altogither vnprofitable putteth v honourable commission beare abrode worde haue bee borne abrode authoritie reuerence nowe man doth dismay v wee disguise god truth turne lie else brue wise shal put quite owne nature pray great reproche bee done vntoo god god worde caryed abrode soundly freely men may honour maruell though punishment bee prepared eliphas speaketh thus haue double lesson gather text one preach god worde office teache shepeherdes must settle themselues constancie swarue howsoeuer worlde go according sayde ieremie must take foreheade brasse fight withall bicause worlde neuer bee without great stubbornnesse exalted dignitie honourable state cannot yeeld themselues subiection obedience vnto god alwayes set vp bristle nowe seeing forget themselues cannot stoupe hath created fashioned behoueth v haue inuincible constancie make reckning shall haue enmitie displeasure wee dutie yet neuerthelesse let v go throughout without swaruing aside lo haue marke side say ordeined pastor preach worde god notwithstanding behoueth people receyue generall instruction therefore come heare sermon let v carie loftie stomacke v checke agaynst god bee reproued sinnes let v cary bitternesse bee angry galled backes bee rubbed neither let v bee foolish ouerwise thinke god ought hold peace v neither let v seeke borne withall vnder colour good qualitie v though king prince yet behoueth v bowe downe neckes receyue god yoke loftinesse must bee pulled downe paule sayth second corinthian cause gospell preached end great small shoulde submit themselues vnto god suffer themselues gouerned thing cannot done except cast downe loftinesse paule sayth place exalteth selfe maiestie lord iesus christ must tarie till inforced compelled obey god euery man must owne good let estate vnderstand though king yet ought humble theselues preaching god truth must thinke thus themselues lorde maister sent preacheth eue soueraine lorde mankinde vntoo al men owe subiection meane degree pray ouerranke folly desire men shoulde beare v winke faultes cloake yea worde god shoulde bee falsified oure sake god transforme himselfe hee haue worde liuely image seeke bee flattered much wee woulde desire god shoulde chaunge nature renounce himselfe intent please v diuelishe rashnesse let v learne come hearing god worde al humilitie mildnesse assuring selues obedience must tried behalfe none must spared men faultes shewed rightfull libertie conuenient let v come eliu addeth iob sayeth heare thou mee truely speake tongue vtter wordes palat yet notwithstanding saying rightnesse heart thou shalt heare thing truth vprightnesse mouth see heere protestation eliu maketh intet heard wit hee speake feynedly double minded man set downe thing purely according knew bin reueled vnto marke first poynt secondly addeth behold respect god thou art according thy mouth worde vseth signifieth properly mouth howbeit sometimes taken measure nowe wee haue seene heeretofore iob desired god come without bringing terrour hee felt god match sayth iob could answere although hee haue authoritie ouer mee yet could mainteyn cace lo maner iob speaketh sentence might expounded thus beholde according thine owne mouth say according thou hast desired else thus beholde according thy measure say like vnto thee respect god neuerthelesse meening abide alwayes one therefore neede stande much vpon worde let v consider still wherevntoo eliu intendeth come witte hee god might make iob afrayde created clay iob say mortall transitorie creature hath strength himselfe sayth spirit god hath fashioned breath almightie hath giuen mee life bee short see eliu telleth iob wil speake su reaso shall ouercome thou shalt alledge sayeth god maketh thee afraid glory terrible thee thou canst haue right hande thou shalt bee able say beholde wretched lumpe earth myre true haue breath life howbeit haue god yet full frailtie thou shall nothing ouersway betwene v two reason thou must faine confounded vve see effect two poynts conteyned first eliu declareth wordes rightnesse heart wil speake thing hee hath thought conceyued himselfe well worthie noted therevpon may gather sort hee ought bee disposed beareth worde god namely hee must haue store bibblebabble tongue ende cast forth wordes aduenture yet play enter lude according god hath taught must deale forth thing printed heart vntoo ouer god hath giue charge serue god purely office behoueth v first brydle tongue speake thing printed hart surely heare said dauid likewise alledged paule applyeth minister god worde haue beleeued therefore speake true thing common christian child god ought cheefly obserued god hath ordeyned instrument holy spirite vvhensoeuer wee speake god heard person seeing hath done v great honour leastwise doctrine ought printed v take roote afterward mouth beare witnesse knowe bee short behoueth v haue beene taught god good maisters teacher specially preach let onely teach others let v comprehend selues number companie beholde say haue marke vndoubtedly man speaketh god worde without feeling operation himselfe doth else play part enterlude trecherie vvhat defiling god worde let v think v throughly oft go vp pulpit let v remember well lesson giuen v namely rightnesse hart must shew selfe tongue therewithall also wee see doctrine good man speaketh laboureth edifie v let v know vnthankfull vtterly rebellious agaynst god heare matter humilitie nowe eliu maketh preface speaketh maner men way curtesie sheweth sort god intendeth holde v himselfe meanes behold sayth heare mee nothing right talke one hee set downe rule god name doctrine preached bee good holy conuinced yeeld reuerence frame selues thereafter shall guiltie resisting man one spited liuing god let euerie v bee attentiue god worde preached seeing h gracious vnto v rayse vp men declare familiarly vnto v let v wilde folke let v yeeld ourselues teacheable thing know proceede forasmuch lawe prophet gospell haue conueyed vnto v maner men whose vprightnesse well ynough knowne witnessed let v marke whosoeuer submitteth himselfe doctrine needeth proces damnation bee short let v marke lord hath authorised prophet apostle end doctrine haue giue v doubted taken vnrepealable decree marke one poynt herewithall bee warned faythfull must become sheepish receyue whatsoeuer tolde must examine doctrine whether god cause sayd must trie spirites must well noted see wretched papist suffer themselues led without discretion fayth haue nothing meere sheepishnesse men must stoppe eies haue reason contrarywise god shoulde haue skill discretion abused seduced false doctrine men shall bring v shall done truely must presume iudge god truth according owne wit fancie must rather captiue reason vnderstanding scripture sheweth v neuerthelesse wee must therewithall pray god giue v discretion discerne whether thing set v good right furthermore let v al lowlinesse desire gouerned vnder hande assuring selues meanes wee shall knowe whether right matter told v also thing lorde iesus christ alledgeth haue v receyue saying seeke mine owne glorie sayth glorie sent mee therefore behoueth v alwayes searche ende man tendeth speaketh vnto v wee see marke whiche hee shooteth god shoulde glorified reigne ouer men must bee disputing agaynst wee must rest fully contrarie part doctrine tende defacing god glorie turning v seruice aduauncing ambition vanitie builde v vp bee true temple god grounde v vppon god remitte selues wholly vntoo call vppon purely rest selues vpon grace fatherly goodnesse doo wee see rightnesse true shoulde bee fore combred cace god first shewed v maner one rightnesse wee haue principle hee hathe gyuen v wee neuer swarue vnlesse bee long selues beholde god telleth v hee bee exalted haue men acknowledge goodnesse commeth againe also haue lordeship power ouer life therin holde v awe may gouerned according good haue men vtterly abaced bereft trust owne rightuousnesse wisdome strength haue v come draw water lord iesus christ fountaine goodnesse hee haue v call vpon purely haue sacrament hath ordeyned receiued warrant grace meanes helpes v serue much free earnest hart thing wherein glose darknesse difficultie let v always haue touchstone v come trying doctrine shall perceyue whether right wrong true false pure corrupted mingled according true rightnesse god hath shewed v say wee neede bee wrapped doubt behalfe onely let v open eye therewithall pray god guide v holy spirit without shall alwayes wander able discerne much little child according paul saith god spirit must cresset giue v light else shall neuer comprehend god secret spirituall nature fleshly earthly alwayes beare downwarde god inlighten v holy spirit wee iudge doctrine discerne wise cannot deceyued satan temptation although send v deceiuers rayse vp many turmoilers labour turne thing vpside downe yet cannot preuaile thing v long god spirit light haue sayde alreadie furthermore although god sometimes speake mouthes wicked according sayde kingdome lord iesus christ shal furthered occasion hypocrits folk haue feare god led vainglorie vanity shall serue time god make doctrine auailable saluation chosen howbeit greater codemnation themselues although say may come passe yet notwithstanding ordinarie meane pleaseth god haue v edifyed immediately hee rayseth vp men speake hartily zealously yea giueth marke worde commeth mouth men may knowe working holy ghost according also saint paule sayeth heere yee see office preache god worde
