ought much better practise whiche haue sayde witte learne well themselues teach others heart may speake mouth bringing hereof passe let pray god touch quicke may haue woorde well rooted theyr mindes may able serue neighbour perceyue thrust forth themselues aduenture drawne holy ghost ye see wee haue remember streyne nowe seconde place eliu protesteth hee transitorie frayle man hee cannot make iob afrayed neuerthelesse winne thing hand reason truth wee come cheefe poynt way wee haue marke maner speache vsed spirit god hath created breath almightie hath giuen life hee myre clay truely well worthie bee noted men could beare well minde shewed heere vndoubtedly pride would buried v cause men glory much themselues full ouerweening first knowe theyr owne originall beginning secondly haue skill consider good earnest looke whatsoeuer haue hold god heritage vnto haue life appurtenance therof bicause pleaseth god preserue men could first consider whence come secondly whatsoeuer goodnesse hold god mere grace certain rightly meekned therfore sayd fashioned myre clay let v go boast selues make great vaunt list yet shall able chauge nature vvherefore man feeleth himselfe tempted pride would exalt himselfe much let enter intoo himselfe consider whence hee came thing god tooke onely feete myrie seemeth v wee lesse woorth myre touch v thinke selues defiled yea doo hang shooes yet made clay therefore wee ought forget oure pedegree whence wee come namely earth dust true saying common ynough euery man confesseth meane season man acknowledgeth conceyte ynough purge v pryde vvhat else presumption ouerweening men onely windinesse bycause puffed vp ignorance haue forgotten themselues much ought wey wel speech wherein sayde wee bee created clay myre true worthinesse excellencie nature meete commended throughly whole sounde yet lawfull v proude seeing corrupted adam bee certaine ought double ashamed wee created image god maner image nowe disfigured one wee bee defaced marke god put v bee glorified thereby turned dishonour gracious gift bestowed vpon v become many recordes make v guiltie god bycause wee defile long wee continue owne nature wee abuse benefites wee haue receyued applie vnto euill ye see alwayes confusion increaseth giftes god hath bestowed amongest v yet let v put cace vncorrupted euer oure father adam fyrst wee therfore presume selues vnder colour god innobled v truely holde thing vvhat putteth difference betwene v brute beast maketh v excellent haue wee oure owne purchase haue gotten owne strength haue inheritance forefather haue god free gift owne meere goodnesse done onely humble selues thing haue gather ingenerall vpon streyne eliu confesseth himselfe bee made clay beholden god life breath bycause bestowed vpon meere goodnesse nowe way god haue serue state honour ought remember lesson better god reacheth men hand setteth degree honour ende shoulde vaunte themselues rather acknowledge howe much bounde vnto bee muche prouoked honour sharpening applying al wittes affection worke suche wise god might bee honoured according sayde candle must bee hidde set vpon table cupborde may giue light ouer house god hath shewed fauour exalt hie worthie calling ought inflamed inlighten theyr neighbour giue example grace haue receyued may choked thing haue marke seconde place herewithall let v marke generally men cannot yeelde god due glorie except strippe themselues starke naked long pretende reserue thing selues bee neuer little glorie god shall bee much diminished vvhat bee done vvhen wee haue well searched grace benefites wee haue let v make many item receyts account acknowledge wee haue nothing oure owne verie way men kepe themselues robbing god prayse indeuer know theselues remaineth one drop goodnesse euery whit must put inuentorie according also accountable afore god furthermore bee brought nothing selues susteyne losse shall fayle apparelled againe yea truly ioined vnto god yeeld vnto due prayse shall much richer full ouerweening surmizing theselues haue wote kind inheritance let v loth diminished vtterly stripped glory lord suffer v vnfurnished goodnesse yet notwithstanding behoueth v abaced haue said besides know nothing giue v fro aboue let v apply al thing god putteth v vse comandeth lord hath indued v giftes holy spirit shoulde otherwise applied good vse shoulde bee vnprofitable therfore let v well aduised thing haue receiued presented offred sacrifize vnto god seing wil haue welfare neighbour aduaunced let v aboue thing haue regarde edifie one another lo wee haue beare minde let v come talke eliu holdeth substance sayd spirit god hath created breath hath giuen life addeth terriblenesse mee make thee afrayde onely reason shall beare sway heere eliu sheweth duetie good teacher namely looke well view cosider open mouth haue knowne owne frailtie wil haue copassion neighbour fall rebuking suche haue done amisse go rigour shall rather make wretched wanderer stray bring way commeth comforting haue skill howe come teaching disdayne therefore teach god worde ought let v begin knowing owne infirmity bee well acquainted lead v modestie meeknesse wee shall milde heart viter worde god true forasmuch many full pryde stubbornesse worde god need vnto hammer broose breake hardnesse yet notwithstanding wee ought first formost teach yeeld theselues teachable may knowe neede haue beare beare cannot except feele fraile selues hee knoweth owne wantes hath compassion partake men sorowes comfort teach ignorant faythfully wee must vnderstande nothing ignorance selues bin worse v men god giuen v thing whiche wee haue receyued againe comfort wretched afflicted let v first vnderstande afflicted let v haue passed way selues let v touched greefe heauinesse may comfort selues others sorrow haue skill beare furthermore rebuke haue done amisse let v ouer great rigour rather let v pitie destruction true sometymes vehemencie must needes ioyned wee see wretched soules perish time cocker men bee wilfull stubbornesse must strike also wound quicke yea yet therewithall behoueth v haue poynt aforehand namely haue bin acquainted infirmity grieue v deale rigorously like although father beate child vse much rougher word would stranger yet notwithstanding hart bleedeth hee faine transforme himselfe sort let v marke man shal neuer meete teacher except haue put fatherly affection first knowe owne infirmitie ende may frame pitifulnesse may haue copassion al hath deale withal thing shewed v eliu furthermore let placed authoritie consider wel must abuse power vnto tyranie oppresse vnder shal haue double account make god vnder colour theyr authoritie haue men feare stande awe seeke cheefly honour god welfare committed vnto see ezechiell speaketh euill sheepherds haue misintreated god people tyrannie saith reigned ouer rigor lordlinesse yea contrariwise shewed v wil quite themselues faithfully towards god neighbour set hie degree must therfore aduauce themselues rather know intend carrie terror put poore folke feare god must faine shew minde set wilde beast scare flock goates push horne trouble water speaketh sayd text ezechiel god shew hath giuen swoorde seat iustice hath put pulpit teach worde set goates treade downe oppresse silly sheepe lo haue marke text herewithall eliu sheweth maner ought receyue doctrine wit know true right must hande passe without gainsaying although forced constrayned vnto ye see haue beare mind concerning circumstance place matter wit good doctrine propounded vnto v well mortall man speaketh wee see hee hath reason truth let v assure selues replying fight onely god also owne conscience sufficient iudge codemne v herewithall haue verie profitable warning gather whensoeuer wee come bee taught name god see doctrine offered v right must replying wee shall win nothing reason behoueth v submit selues furthermore ought hinder v setting god maiestie eies must iudge doctrine set forth vntoo v according owne wit fancie therefore two thing need matched togither one fully determine ready obey god concluding selues maker ought haue soueraintie ouer v ought subiect vnto preparatiue must made aforehand afterward must enter iudgement say must examine doctrine howbeeit pride opinion wee bee wise ynough selues praying vntoo god gouerne v holy spirit may follow doctrine shal haue shewed v thus ye see two thing ought bee matched togither matching mingling bringeth confusion prepared obey god leaue open eye consider ought discerne vntruth truth howbeeit herewithall let v learne frowarde haue regarde man speaketh let v consider god sheweth v great fauour pleaseth vse creature abace himselfe sort vnto v ende haue leysure consider worde come vnto v maiestie vndone offreth himselfe v men applyeth himselfe infirmitie intent wee might commodiously know truth setteth v ye see effect haue remember streyne rest shall reserued till another time let v fall face good god acknowledgement sinnes praying make v feele wretchednesse wee may bee taught chalenge thing selues bee abused vaine folly acknowledge wee bee altogither miserable therevpon desire succoured mercy thankfull benefites hee hath alreadie bestowed vpon v ende gracious goodnesse continuing towards v wee may learne apply glorifying holy name dedicate vnto seruice beseeching beare weakenesse vntill haue vtterly ridde v transformed v owne glorie let v say almightie god heauenly father wee acknowledge confesse according truth worthie lift vp eye c cxxiij sermon second vpon xxxiij chapter doubtlesse thou hast spoken mine eares haue heard voyce thy saying pure vvithout sinne cleane novnrightuousnesse hath found occasion agaynst taken enimie hath put feete stockes taken heede vvayes thou shalt iustified vvill ansvvere thee god greater thou vvhy striuest thou agaynst vvill ansvvere vvordes god speaketh tvvice men heare must call minde treated yesterday wit god doth v great pleasure vouchsafeth applie himselfe farre infirmitie speake familiarly vnto v mouthe mortall man whiche like vntoo selues ende beeing put feare maiestie wee haue better leysure think vpon thing sheweth v may haue quiet troubled minde conceyue well doctrine wee heare make profite true god spake v heauen woulde moue v consequently doctrine authoritie howbeeit meane season would agast master wittes consider sayeth man speaketh wee may better owne ease aste digest thing spoken yee see wise god beareth v surely wee see lawe bee published people israell sayde let lorde speake vnto v wee vndone must heare since time god begonne shewe maiestie feare striken intoo hart poore soules wist become insomuch concluded god shoulde haue spoken still haue bin destroyed vvhen moyses came abrode faine hang continually veyle face bycause god giuen marke glorie iewes able abide wee see god raysed vp men teach v therein hath respect vnto feebleuesse vttereth power vnto v intent shoulde muche dismayed might haue wittes libertie edified doctrine might familiar v wee haue leysure thinke vpon applie studie hereby warned must despise god worde preached vnto v men villanous vnthankefulnesse v god shoulde abace humble himselfe owne greatnesse intent applie himselfe vnabilitie take occasion thereat make account thing hee sayeth vnto v therefore although treasure god woorde bee set v earthen vessel say mortall men full infirmity yet muste wee alwayes esteeme deserueth knowing men speake owne name sent vnto v god heard mouth nowe let v come vpbraydings eliu offereth vnto iob doubtlesse thou hast sayde hearing haue heard voyce thy woordes thou art rightuous without sinne thou art guiltie iniquitie therefore therein thou canst iustifie thy selfe say thou canst maintaine thy quarell thou hast done amisse howe wilt thou answere god seeing hee greater thou thou accusest hee hath sought occasion punish thee hee hath set thy feete stockes thou hast libertie mainteyne thy cace think thou escape thou must condemned god must make thee feele hee doth iustly punish thee sort heere wee haue examine first al whether eliu charge iob wrongfully rightfully intent iustifie himselfe seemeth first sight hath mistaken iobs talke hee turneth slaunderously another meening proofe heereof iob neuer went chalenge perfection haue sinne wee haue seene contrarie therefore seeme eliu doth falsifie wordes heard apply contrary meening howbeit forasmuch god blameth shal see haue already herd protested would assaile iob maner done let v marke taketh iobs wordes iob ment wit iob eye present affliction say true poore sinner cannot denie haue committed many offence god finde selfe rightuous god vseth hys absolute power see reason tormenteth sort affliction ouer greeuous although iob ment iustifie generally yet notwithstanding ment iustifie himselfe cace affliction seemeth eliu doth wrong still behalfe also haue tolde alreadie deed god ment punish iob sinnes although hee might haue done iustly thought ynough trie pacience iob reason seing knew framed ordinance god answere receyuing affliction god sendeth v tryalles obedience haue perceyued god punisheth v respect offence angry v rather intendeth humble v knowe whether wee bee subiect vntoo poyntes also mortifie lustes wee forwardenesse wee muste immediately haue consideration whiche yet neuerthelesse god well finde good cause punishe v please although god spare v vse rygour towardes v respect sinnes yet notwithstanding may iust cause vvhy doth hee bicause goodnesse yet meane hee afflicteth v respect marke one poynt seconde god shewe v hee afflicteth v behoueth v cast downe heades vntil come neerer v make v perceyue hee dealeth v therefore wee ought tarie leysure giue brydle affection iob fayled two poyntes although acknowledged himselfe bee sinner yet notwithstanding gaue god glorie whiche due vnto reason whereof hee sufficiently minded poynt god hee listed might haue punished much rigorously yea euen sinnes againe haue seene raunged abrode chafed himselfe saying meeneth god wretched creature meere god stretch arme reason dealing seemed hee ment accuse god tyrannie concluded himselfe hee tempted thing wherein iob fayled therefore without cause eliu sayeth vnto thou hast ment iustifie thy selfe thou pure cleare without sinne therein thou shalt neuer acquit get better ende staffe intent may profite doctrine let v beare minde god punish v sinnes behoueth v first yeeld selues guiltie nothing expedient intende bee iustified afore god el haue looke vnto owne lyfe knowe well worthie beaten god scourge seeing haue offended many wayes notwithstanding god haue respect afflicting v yet handle v roughly altogither vnruly make vtter skorne god maiestie lette v marke bicause sinnes vvhy hee intendeth trie v make v knowe whither wholly long thing go wee woulde haue knowe wee whether wee forwarde serue god must fayne renouce owne subdue owne naturall witte vnderstanding short fight owne affection true triall oure seruing god therfore cace shall stand let v thinke selues truly god may iustly ouerwhelme hundred thousand time although haue graunted mee grace walke feare indeuer selfe serue yet nothing could stand one minute houre vnlesse vphild mee infinite goodnesse surely vpholde mee howbeeit therewithall maketh mee subiect vnder hande sheweth ought hang wholly vpo go doth good cause therefore behoueth v quiet wee haue inquired god vexeth v sore persecuteth v extremely perceyue cause behooueth v conclude god thy determination incomprehensible forasmuch able knowe reason rudenesse infirmitie vnderstanding wayte paciently till thou make perceiue cause lorde shall haue taried sort like poore blinde soule thou wilt open mine eye make perceyue wherevnto thing tende shall bee ende shall profite better yee see wisedome ought faythfull haue mildenesse confesse alwayes god rightuous although perceyue reason workes heerewithall also muste humilitie acknowledge themselues wretched sinner god mighte finde cause ynough make cleane riddance listed beare owne meere grace thus ye see effect haue gather text let v come addeth god sayth hath taken occasion picked quarell mee thervpon hath sette feete stockes tormented mee looked vnto pathes spieth mee hath eye vpon cannot stirre finger haue committed faulte true iob intendeth accuse god vnrightuousnes punishing without cause howbeit herewithall let v marke well caried away affection ther scaped many disordered woords fit whiche excused haue noted heeretofore opportunitie required came place haue shewed iob skirmished much god yet still pacient resting full purpose glorifie notwithstanding troubled time broughte lowe wist howe recouer well woorthy noted whereof wee may gather good lesson although caried away purpose blaspheme god yet notwithstanding assoone haue neuer little libertie immediatly ouershoote oure selues ho v pitie see man hee fraughte euill assoone hath little libertie giuen hee raungeth one side wil hold right way gaddeth astray yea euen euer thinke certayne iob bene asked whether god sought occasion handle cruelly would haue answered rightuous yea hee woulde haue sayde without hypocrisie yet notwithstading charged without cause haue striued agaynste god hee sought vayne shiftes cometh passe bycause iob tossed fro sorrowe nowe good stay himselfe ought haue let v marke although man well grounded feare god leuer die vtter blasphemie yet notwithstanding cannot giue passion bridle scape v euill woordes condemned specially pinched aduersitie passion sorrow vehemet canot ruled man skirmisheth wise iustleth agaynste god owne destruction ende sith see first let v consider nature sinfull frowarde ye see one poynt haue marke followeth necessitie corrupted seing canot thinke vpon god without wrog iniurie furthermore also admonished enter consideration holde selues subiection whesoener god scourgeth v say ala perceyue thou art disposed afflict thy vvhen god hath grauted v grace poynt let v assure selues haue well profited inasmuch ready obey receyue stripe roddes paciently howbeit god hath brought v much reason must slip aside rather say go thou art alredy boud vnto thy god hath made thee willing receyue chastisemets sendeth thee neuerthelater stil many infirmity thee turning h thou shouldest become impaciet rebel blaspheme also without thinking let v learne mistrust selues may stand vpon gard preuent temptation done let v know notwithstading good wil haue yeeld ourselues vnto god beare afflictios pacietly come yet paciece perfect faultlesse nuber euil imaginatios run heade although sticke rather mislike alwayes settle selues say behold god shall gouerne mee shall haue rule mee behooueth mee haue meekenesse huble self vnder euen though would traple vnder feete yea although would thrust downe depth bottolesse pit yet ought yeeld self vnto vvhe come point yet many euill thought mindes againe speake wil alwaies slip v shall neuer haue wordes well restreined still somewhat filthinesse naturall imaginatio lapped therfore let v learne codemne ourselues although haue bin pacient seeing iob reproued greuously eliu sentence let v sure shall founde muche blameworthy specially haue indeuored obey god yeelded honor belongeth vnto lo haue marke streyne way iob condened haue blasphemed god shall become v caried pacience v moste comonly seene beare condemnation haue charged god though sought vayne fonde clokings execute rigour vpon v certayne men confesse freely willingly god rightuous al punishment fully coclude rest vpo one shold say yea verely behold god tyrant vtter word horrible yet meening meane wee glorifie god rightuousnesse acknowledging grouded vpon reason equitie right much wee charged executing tiranie vpo v graut blasphemy shall alwayes alike nother shall alwayes consent iob ouershot himselfe far say reason god afflict howbeit forsomuch headinesse passios caried away wee haue seene heretofore therfore holy ghost fayne co demne text vvherfore let v sure danation shall greater quiet affliction fall grudging although mouth speake worde yet ful hartburning within play mule chaweth vpo bit whe haue bitternesse v god asmuche wee accused picking couert quarrel v punish v without cause touching said heere god hath set feete stockes eliu rehearseth iobs woordes iob ment god gaue libertie men hold offender stockes kind punishmet make cofesse would whither wil iob vsed sayde coparison saying god gaue meanes mayneteyne quarrell although good neuerthelesse true iob al sure god knew well reason afflict yet ceasseth wonder chafe afflictio though god pressed sore asked whether ment hee woulde haue answered would haue vnsayde hande neuerthelesse passion vehement prouoked sore saying scaped ere hee ware nowe iob rebuked worde scaped vpon suddaine vnwares shal befal v wilfull hardharted haue spoke worde vnaduisedly also purposed long afore wee bee willfully stubborne truely god warneth v therof sheweth v haue done amisse therfore wil receyue warning giueth v follow still owne wit naturall coceytes pray shal thisstubbornes codene v hudredfold ouersight iob worthy maked wel whesoeuer thinke god mighty power must take tiranical power say beholde god may v hee listeth creature seeth nothing frailtie v yet notwithstading ceasseth vexe v without cause vvhen speake fashion onely outrage also cursed blasphemie therefore let v match god mightypower rightfulnesse saying true power god terrible vnto wholly dismaide yet doth god ceasse rightuous doth thing rightfully thus thing haue gather vpon sentence astonished feele horrible torment may possible yet must therfore say god excessiue afflicting v shew able let v keepe v fro saying thing let v consider euen greatest extremity feele god mainteyneth v alayeth power consumed firste blow therwithall let v know although affliction sore v warde heauy may bee yet notwithstanding god ceasseth bee rightuous marke againe haue beare away sentence wheras god watcheth steppe let v sure doth without cause nowe let v come argument eliu vseth reproue iob heerein thou shalt bee quit sayth god greater thou present reason seemeth colde conuince iob decide present cace first al knoweth god greater men mad cofesse greatnesse acknowledge vve see many fantasticall heades despyse god yet sticke graunt god greater tha eliu sayth new thing although speech comon yet notwithstanding reason say god greater tha therfore followeth shall boote v mainteyne good cace seemeth rather eliu agreeth iob sayd wit god vseth rigour agaynst howbeit absolute power great able make part good maker poore earthen pot nothing infirmitie seemeth iob doth father absolute power vpon god say hee listeth agaynst men without reason equitie let v marke behoueth v take sentence otherwise woordes sounde whereas mention made god greatnesse ment go ioyntly euer truely must separate vertues god owne proper men may well haue vertues may bee taken god vvhen wee speake power iustice wisedome goodnesse speake himselfe thing inseparable cannot seuered say cannot taken away ioyned togither one cannot bee without god myghtie hee also good myghtinesse defeateth goodnesse yet iustice therefore whereas eliu sayeth heere god greater man meeneth greatnesse onely power also greatnesse power infinite iustice infinite wisdome thing infinite comparison therefore natural sense streyne see argument good put al men silence make stoupe humilitie may stand contention agaynst god cause murmur affliction canot suffer god handle v according hee seemeth haue done ynough much already demaud curiously god vseth rigor v cause wee thinke vppon god greatnesse certaine man considered god would firste brunt stay shet vp woulde take libertie grudge reply wise therefore let v marke ouergreat excessiue affectios al murmuring like thing proceede wee know god spoyle maiestie asmuch lyeth v cursed thing ther none v lotheth yet see experience happeneth vnto v ere thinke thing fall would wish breake aray enter disputation god doubt would well put cace zeale good yet woulde bring god dispose thing according liking happen otherwise yee see pacience whereof commeth bycause wee desirous god shoulde giue v leaue comon familiarly beare ourselues hand could shew thing ought go otherwise though wee canot yet notwithstanding canot cotent v shorte muste come poynt thing gouerned god prouidece seemeth vnto v al go cotrariwise ye see enter debate disputation agaynst god one wee would defeate greatnesse bereeue right asmuch v lieth without cause eliu vseth principle agaynste iob namely god greater thou wilt thou pleade agaynst hereby warned first whensoeuer much grieued affliction would haue thing go otherwise cannot abyde god gouerne v pleasure one wee would first rob right afterwarde make fellow copanion haue authoritie superioritie ouer v intent shall bee yet worthy blame therfore muche ought wee sory gather wittes v seing loftinesse v cannot thorowly subdued glorifie god thing sendeth v wold thing go cleane contrary taking vppon v taske god wee would desire one would take greatnesse marke one poynt furthermore lette v marke ynough v haue conceyued generally god greate behoueth v also consider greatenesse else wee shall wel ynoughe confesse god almightie hee created worlde hath thing hande gouernaunce vvee shall neuer sticke howbeeit fleing confession houering ayre shall fare neuer better go vvhat done behoueth v apply miracle god vse may come remebrance sort god shold great namely end may wholly giue obey whatsoeuer may thinke good soeuer dispose v may agree vnto acknowlege rightuous although tosse v fro wee may alwaies stande stedfast beleefe sendeth v thing rightful ye see acknowledging greatnes god grauting v thinketh good v generally creature know cofesse god almighty leastwise earnestly vnfainedly yet shal men neuer yeeld theselues obeying god neuer giue glory deserueth knowing theselues god vvhe haue made coparison perceyued nothing god surmounteth ca thinke hath infinite glory say know shal haue vaine trust exalt ourselues nother shal play wild coltes wont shall learne graut god infinite greatnesse know ourselues nothing better expressing heereof eliu addeth god answereth word importeth great substance eliu intendeth shew v canot coprehend al thing bicause god listeth reuele vnto v effect thing ment behoueth v marke god manifesteth vnto v part end left vntaught thing good expedient v neuerthelesse knoweth capacitie according thervnto reueleth wil vnto v reseruing meane whyle vnto himselfe thing could coprehend bicause passe vnderstading beare lesson minde wee shall haue profited well one day behold god hath taken vpo charge office teach v therefore must negligent hearing seing gracious v master let v wise schollers giue diligent heede sayeth howbeit let v marke therwithall whe executeth office scholemaster towards v open vnto v thing wold doubt wherof would inquisitiue vvhat thing hee knoweth edifying say knoweth behoofe behoueth v mark three thing one must haue eares ope receiue doctrine god teacheth v brute beast doth v honour apply indeuer profite vnder thus ye see first poynt vve muste wretched papist would know nothing say daungerous matter inquire god secret true must come lowlinesse reuerence ought wee therefore haue eares stopped deafe whe god speaketh v let v alwaies learne ready willing receyue whatsoeuer sayde set forth vnto v name god thus muche cocerning first point secodly let v mark god wil shew v thing must content selues paule sayeth first corinthian wit know parte see glasse darkely yet come day full reuelatio although gospell called brightnesse noone day yet notwithstanding referred measure god inlighteneth v sufficietly see face lord iesus christ behold transfigured howsoeuer worlde go wee see whiche prepared latter day behoueth v increase cotinually fayth faith presupposeth thing yet hidde according haue measure fayth scripture sayeth haue measure perfection thus yee see howe haue beare minde faithfull present lyfe ought content themselues taste god know portion wee haue fond desire say know thing ignorant nothing mad wisedome muche better v bee starke fooles therefore let v marke faithfull must cotent themselues reueled vnto far greater better wisedome inquisitiue thing without exception marke second point third god holding v point niggardly shewe v bicause knoweth conuenient v therefore let v marke well god teacheth v oure edification vvhat measure fayth doctrine holy scripture rule god knoweth expedient saluatio men neede co plaine may know thing conteyned holie scripture haue declared vntoo dayly sermon men know neede coplayne though vnderstanding ynough looke whatsoeuer good conuenient v lorde hath declared vnto v sith wee see god hath comaunded worde brought vnto v would hide thing fro v might bee saluation haue much thankes giue disclosing himselfe familiarly vnto v haue wherwith cotent selues rather curious wee see many desirous bee searching measure papistes also haue one side sayde must bee inquisitiue god secret vnder colour reiected al holy scripture side foolish curiositie seeking thing apperteyned vnto full fond dotage say thing howe suche thing done short nothing contented insomuch whole holy scripture better vnto tha apce ashamed spew diuelish blasphemie haue holy scripture ynough v must haue secrete mystery god hath reserued church vvhervppon haue forged like mahumet sayde alcora great perfection also pope sayeth certayne secretes reserued vnto besides holy scripture vvhat shame yet notwithstanding warned heere cause lord hath fitted doctrine capacitie measure behoueth v coteted bring thither wadring lustes say goeth wee therefore let v heare god speake let v open eye receiue sheweth telleth v worde agayne come point let v hold v quiet sheweth v sort must put trust maner must liue maner must woorship hath shewed v well lette v settle selues wholly bee contented sheweth v holy scripture knoweth vnderstading bruck also thing hath declared vnto v darke honor receyue lowlinesse mad ouerweening desire vnderstand haue hidden fro v graunt rightuous except shewe v cause according see many say tush beleeue passeth mine vnderstanding thou vile ade darest thou blaspheme god sort bicause giueth thee account doings disdaynest thou forbeare thing whiche hidden fro thee bicause thou canst coprehend reason thy beastlinesse lette v puffed vp suche pride might make v rush god let v content ourselues declared heere wayting paciently greate day wherein thing know parte tast behold glasse shall shewed vnto v face face full perfection let v fal face good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v feele better wee haue done wee may craue pardon also beseech renewe v holy spirite clense v fleshly affection forasmuch nothing vanitie v cannot stray right way wee followe naturall inclination may please redresse guyde v hande vnto end life may please graunt c cxxiiij sermon third vpon xxxiiij chapter god vvill speake tvvice men heare dreame vision night vvhen sleepe vpon men reste theyr bed openeth eare men sealeth chasticement vpon ende dravve man backe vvorke hydethe pryde men eliu goeth forward matter begonne alredy last sermon wit god yeeldeth account dooings saying vnto mortall men haue marke haue declared already namely eliu treateth heere doctrine god ought cleere easie vnto v god protesteth prophet esay speaketh vnto v couertly nother naught sayeth seeke worde darke vnto v commeth selfe blindnesse dull wit doctrine god hath set forth vnto v whiche conteyned holy scripture rightly named light eliu therfore speaketh determination god maketh owne secrete purpose hath bin sayde god setting forth woord vnto v hath regarde capacitie whiche slender meane reserueth thing himselfe wee could coprehend yet bicause profitable saluatio god taketh pleasure ignorance bicause knoweth good v therfore behoueth v conteted measure giueth v tary till day full discouery come time shal know thing hidden vvherfore let v profite according shal please god giue v power vntil behold thing opely darke vnto v ye see effect haue gather text namely treating worde god heare dayly haue taught v secret keepeth himselfe wil haue disclosed vnto men yet bycause able coceyue sayde heretofore god answere wordes say men nothing must presume call god account workes make priuie worketh one sort addeth god speake twyce men shall heare worse v many senteces cocerning god sheweth effect wherof notwithstanding reason vnknowen although god speake mouth yet somtimes heard wit matter cocerneth thing men co prehed yet buried fro till later day true present sentece expounded diuersly vnderstad god wil speake say wil speake word behoueth v rest vpo two come vouchsafe regard men must thinke repeale god ordinance shal alwayes stande vnimpeached true touching elius matter haue told already behoueth v continue thing sawe laste sermon namely god yeeld account wordes eliu graunteth libertie speake say hee yea euen suche wise men may carpe haue bene also whiche referre eliu addeth namely god speaketh vntoo men vision nyght sleepe troubleth also speaketh chasticements seemeth vnto two manner speaking vnto v god vseth sometime reueleth inspiration sometimes also toucheth v hande nothing purpose costrayned sense furthermore neede beate braynes much seking diuersities expositios seing naturall sense manyfest vnto v therefore let v follow haue declared alredy god shal speake twice yea yet vnderstoode thus know eliu ment say nowe remayneth apply instruction howe firste knowing owne slendernesse cause take highly vpon seeke search sort nothing may escape bicause thinke themselues able ynough finde thing man thorowly well tamed sorte chalenge nothing himselfe hee prowde loftie search god secretes farre measure intent may take profit text specially first let v humble selues yea euen acknowledging vnderstanding small grosse marke one poynte side let v consider also god secrete iudgementes dreadfull dungeon wayes incomprehensible lawfull men wade far must content themselues declareth ye see secod poynt haue marke whe thinke vpon highnesse god ought rauished honoring coclude must take vpon v able know coprehend al whither go wee crepe heere vpon earth know far surmouteth heaues seing let v honor secret iudgements assuring selues hee alwayes haue authoritie speake vtter listeth mauger al speke yea speaketh twice say sheweth pleasure men shall know nothing bicause rude conceyue thing one worde god hath determined purpose shal dayly see one thing yet withstading new seeke yea still dazeled euen end yeere ten although haue seene one thing ofte yet reason shall hidde fro vvere pride v sufficietly confirmed vnto v experience wee neuer come reason copulsion wil alwayes nedes selfwise eue though ignorace shew selfe ynough much neuerthelesse without cause bee warned text god wil haue determinatios buried hid vve see effect dayly know say sauing wonderfull thing behooueth v bridle selues wayting till lord reuele greater perfectio shal till bereft mortall flesh thus ye see haue marke according article haue touched already let v note also speaking iudgements god haue hidde bicause behoofe haue full knowledge yet sayd psalm god speketh dauid protesteth beare twice namely might mercie god treating god woderful iudgemets thing learn word brought remembrance set v cotinually one side god maketh v feele myghtie power end feare walk according side hee giueth v mercie ende take cofort ioy vvhat learne daily god word master behoueth v subiect muste liue lust god must reigne ouer v lawe bridle may taught vnder thus first poynt serue god know requireth alloweth second wee knowe father sauiour end put whole trust howe shall knowe grounding selues vpon mere mercie knowing nothing death damnation v acknowledging hee hath drawen v oute deathe owne meere goodnesse lord iesus christ sake thus concerning second poynt two thing wherein behoueth v cofirmed must resort resuge also forsomuche mercie set v dayly shoulde doubt wil receyue v texte dauids speaketh thing kept hidden knowledge thing god intendeth declare vnto v teache v therefore sayeth god hath spoken say god hath manifested speaking men ought doubt reply agaynste whiche sayeth haue hearde twyce sayeth hee herein betokeneth inough haue heard god glaunce behooueth v minde thing without ceasing hee speaketh although spake yet muste let doctrine slip settle throughly oure remembrance learne print heart thinke vpon early late bycause memory shorte see nowe dutie faithfull apply theselues throughly hearing thing god sheweth worde set whole minde vpon assuring themselues god wyll gyue knowlege thing telleth promiseth welfare marke one poynt howbeeit heerewithall let v keepe selues seeking let v couet wiser god haue v bee howe may bee learning schoole reserue secrete iudgements himselfe let v ignorant thing wil haue knowne vnto v vntill haue taken v world example sayde vnto v god gouerneth thing prouidence eliu speaketh purpose yee see god disposeth creature holdeth thing hand nothing happeneth worlde chaunce thing according doctrine gyuen v holy scripture behooueth v receyue without gaynsaying nowe wee inquire howe woulde god whensoeuer hee worketh shoulde yeelde v reason doings would enter disputation checke agaynst passe boundes see toades full poyson spewe blasphemy agaynst prouidence god saying god dispose thing author sinne euil bee fathered vpon lo heere cursed thing behoueth v holde selues within copasse holy scripture gyueth v bycause wee perceyue reason god doth thing therefore thinke straunge behooueth v stay like also holie scripture sayeth god choze whome pleased making worlde forsoke rest good reason receiue reuerence acknowledge saluatio proceedeth free goodnes god forasmuch hath chozen v forlorne damned lumpe furthermore vpon sayd poynt fall flittering ouer high speculation shall confounded rightly vvhy therein woulde know god hath graunted v asmuch fight agaynst thinke outrage shal scape vnpunished thus ye see howe ought practize sentence sayde god shall speake twyce without heard say without beeing vnderstoode bicause wit man weake let v come eliu addeth sayeth men bee layde downe sleepe rest asleepe god speaketh openeth eares purpose withdraw owne workes tame hyde pryde men say caste downe burie else seeke discipline instruction chastizing hee see hardeharted receyue playne doctrine instruction whiche giueth hee fayne stryke vpon tame roddes inforce taught truth effect thing treated truly eliu speaketh owne time haue tolde already hee people whiche god chozen communicate lawe vnto hee whome wee haue hearde speake iob himselfe tyme moyses thing vncertayne yet stranger church god knowledge giuen extraordinary manner asmuch pleased god inspyre cause hee sayeth god inspyreth men euen dreames asleepe god doth plucke eare gyue warning thinke vppon true god inspireth v also although heare worde instruction haue holy scripture reade yet doth hee ceasse warne v still giue v many heartbitings manye summoning call v backe himselfe gone astray see howe men bury sayde knowledge secke meanes forget god god commeth search within v therefore feele pricking thought stirre v vp let v vnderstande god putteth v remembraunce himselfe bycause wee inclined forget become brutishe specially nyghtetyme alone wittes gathered v wander heere come deepe thought wey v farre euen make v sweate tremble el bee disquietnesse mind though vpo racke god worketh cace summoneth v bicause seeth fugitiues like yong boy leaueth father house runneth abroade blowing feather winde god seing v run astray calleth v home vision night true shall suche eliu iob eliphas others haue help wanted wit word god preached v heare thus doth god reuele himselfe vnto v bicause haue law prophet gospell hads eares cotinually beaten doctrine hath willed preached vnto v therefore mustnot looke taught maner nother scripture preaching yet neuerthelesse see god woorketh sort men shorte haue marke heere although god sende v suche vision auncient father must discotented grudge great vnthakfulnesse bycause hath pleased god comunicate himselfe vnto v meane fitter v curious folk demaunde god appeareth heaue time paste thing perfourmed spake moyses namely would speake prophet visios figure dreames bicause day haue fully reueled vnto v vvere superfluous thing god appeare vnto v former time seeing hath giuen v another meane despyse woorde haue handes sufficiently fully perfectly instructed let v learne bee contented fashion god hath ordeyned instruct v let v note appearing vision vnto aucient father bicause yet lawe written else appearing vntoo prophetes bicause needefull haue larger declaration thing yet darke nowe god truthe cleare manifest ynough behoueth v take vision time paste confirmation fayth knowing sprang fountayne therfore let v walke simplicitie whiche god willeth v holde marke one poynt second let v cosider god goodnesse hath giue v worde writing raysed vp men expound still toucheth v stirreth v vp inwardly holy spirite giuing v remorces inspiration therfore let v consider care whiche hath saluation seing draweth v sweetely vnto meanes ye see effect haue gather vpon streyne eliu addeth god sealeth instruction men chastising hand article well worthy borne minde shewed v god must fayne speake vnto v many stroke hand say gratious vnto v allure v gently woorde seeth gentlenesse auayleth hee vseth greater vehemencie tame v rebuketh v sinnes maketh v afrayde citeth v iudgement end beware restrayne ourselues beaten downe vnder cofesse wretchednesse craue pardon sorie might clense v fault hath vsed meanes say hath laboured bring v backe swetenesse homelinesse woorkes vvee continue still wee afore become wilfull hardehartednesse therfore fayne lift vp mighty hand rune vpon v strike v hamer vpon anuilde seeth v hardharted word enter eares eliu ment say true sayde heeretofore god openeth men eares yea truely know well god worketh secret power v whe sendeth v inspiration spoke addeth bicause would fayne sotted shoulde none life v giue ourselues making good cheere vvee see howe men shunne god presence asmuch seeke meanes runne astray vanity god openeth eares toucheth v wise wee bee compelled bethinke oure selues theefe hardened wickednesse could finde heart remembraunce iustice abolished shall notwithstanding fayle haue pricking hartbitings sling withall whereof commeth euen bycause god openeth eares howbeeit let v marke double opening eares god woorketh v sometime openeth eares ende wee shoulde bee inforced perceyue hee speaketh yet wee ceasse bee stubborne still refuze doctrine correction hee giueth v wee receyue chastizement hande amende v opening oure eares better god softeneth hart willingly receyue saying giue heede yeelde oure selues wholly doctrine vvhen sayd god openeth mennes eares vnderstood men indifferently yeeld themselues teachable vnto disposed obey hee speaketh well reprobate god child reprobate shall haue opening eares insomuch shal fayne perceyue spite teeth god speaketh vnto howbeeit forasmuche shake thought thrust vnder foote continue alwayes deafe meane whyle good men take profite know striuing agaynste god whereas eliu addeth god sealeth instruction speaketh suche dull vppon spurre stubborne god subdue woorde therefore suche shake doctrine muste bee forced heare god speake fashion witte god must faine beate teach harde stripe shewe force mayster yee see howe streyne ought vnderstoode therewithall let v marke well manner speach eliu vseth god signeth sealeth instruction chasticements heereby sheweth chasticementes serue make instruction authoritie men reiect make count could except instruction god worde matched chasticements god onely beate without sending knowledge thing therefore behoueth teache v beating v father beate childe dragge heare head treade vnder feete yet speake neuer worde child shall vtterly dismayde bicause hee knoweth father meeneth choler come vpon childe shall neuer better father say thou naughty boy see thou hast done thervpon beate childe perceyueth father instruction profite learneth know fault hath obeyed ought haue done behold sayeth bicause receyued father single woorde hee sealeth instiuction gaue mee euen dealeth god men grauteth men grace haue truth preached vnto reade holy scripture giueth remorces hartbitings spake paule sheweth seconde romaynes wee selues feele sufficiently nature man hath inwarde record owne conscience god reueleth vnto men farre forth needefull make vnexcusable therewithall forasmuche seeth men suffer themselues bee taught hande stoppe theyr eares else count doctrine trifle make mocke warning hee giueth forasmuche men forget themselues sort standeth god hande seale doctrine make full authoritie whe men scourged may acknowledge themselues say wel see god sheweth power bicause haue honored reuereced maiestie ought therfore fayne know perforce consider instruction better haue done cause smitten mischiefe light vppon mee ere thought bicause made selfe beleeue might scape god hand holdeth mee faste shet vp thereby see doctrine ratified vnto mee say made suche fayne thinke spite teeth honor better haue done let v learne whensoeuer god afflicteth v sendeth v chasticemets must consider seales setteth vpon warning whiche giuen v afore euidence vnsealed men doubt alledged shall bee credited bicause autetik haue seale doubte sufficient instrument must receiued vvherfore let v marke god worketh maner afflicting v wherby sealeth doctrine althogh gospel preched among v law ought else conscience paynim turkes haue yet sufficient warning god wil knowledge ynoughe wee choke owne wilfulnesse seeing speaketh vnto v familiarly bothe lawe prophetes specially mouth iesus christ side hardharted stubborne wee receyue thing woonder lorde strike v many blowes inforce v come vnto therfore let v ouergreeued oure affliction manie men turmoyle god afflcteth neuer knowne word god knowledge haue must needes bee solde dearlyer vnto v bycause god hath spoken vnto v allured v owne holy mouth drawe backwarde voutsafe go forwarde one steppe must needes smitten double nothing else v kicking wincing lette v learne receyue chasticements god sendeth v quiet minde consider afflicting v vaine vvhy let v marke whither doctrine haue bin suche authoritie amog v ought say whether haue bene teachable meeke followe oure shepherde sheepe lambes assoone god speaketh ought print worde harte sticke vnto either go wipe else eares deaf else goeth one eare seeing one sort v haue giuen reuerence god woorde another sort haue stryued openly third mock seeing ill receyued hand god must fayne seale affliction yee see aduersities god sendeth v seales howbeit end chasticementes hard painfull v nature may made amiable vnto v let v marke well whiche eliu sayeth heere namely god intent draw men fro owne work hyde pryde heere expresseth god sealing doctrine affliction onelye respecteth magnifying word might haue full maiestie also therwithall procureth mennes saluation end therfore god ameth afflicting v ought suger seazon bitternesse whiche otherwise sheweth selfe affliction yee see god affliction combersome beare yea truely shunne al thing mislike morouer god wrath terrible thing vnto v nowe whensoeuer god punisheth v token angry v therefore cannot bee afrayde greeued distressed howbeeit god sweeteneth al shewing v ende intendeth hee meeneth frame v owne hande seeking make v followe obey thus yee see eliu addeth saying god intendeth drawemen theyr owne woorkes speaketh workes meeneth generally thing men take hand thing rashly owne heade knowe god hath created v labour hee haue v bee ydle vnoccupied euerye man apply able consider wherin may serue god neighbour euery v imploy himselfe therein according abilitie shall haue receyued therefore god afflicteth v hee meeneth drawe v work say make v vtterly good nothing true brought low sicknesse armes legges good broke men must fayne serue v worlde muste combered v wee able doe seruice yet doth god draw v vtterly worke pacience worke god esteemeth aboue thing short god draweth v work afflicting v work ment folish enterprise men take hand god let v alone laye brydle necke howe bold practize nothing sticke v muche wee would remoue heauen earth must say haue way go vve see adayes prince take enterprise vpon thing hande would make newe world pride sheweth self great men fayleth also lesser sorte play scorpio wrythe tayles cast abroade poyson none v al neuer mean vndertaketh thing auenture therefore needfull god bring v back maner say pluck v back oure rashe doings sending affliction vntoo v sayd haue good cause good comfort god afflicteth v seing stubborn nature neuer come freewill would become v restreyned force therfore considering men nature go cleane contrarie god fling abroad like wilde beast let v vnderstand god hath neede represse v sith know let v giue glorie suffreth v runne like wild colt doeth continually brydle v vnder obedience yea also tame v affliction seeth great headinesse v lo haue beare awaye streyne let v marke eliu addeth ende namely god intendeth hyde pryde men herein sheweth welspring enterprise pryde v vvhat cause men leape sort fling theselues aire make kicking wincing eue foolishe ouerweening blindeth men knewe themselues would tame ynough take selues maruellouse wight knowe borne created obey god vntill time pryde abated v surely wil ouerbold run astray therfore god intend withdraw v enterprise behoueth first cure disease pryde reigneth much v expresse mentio made hiding pride ynough bury end may shew self eliu vseth similitude oftentimes vse towards men make ashamed man shuld say go hide thy selflike villeine one made great countenance brauerie deface reproches durst shewe himselfe fame bury house lo sort pride hampered sort doth god worke towards v whereas would faine play wise men folly bewrayeth self god suffereth pryde always concealed bewrayeth vvel perceiued doth god hee afflicteth v intent meken v howbeit doth shame say buffeteth v therewithal worketh v reproche wee perceiue owne dishonestie faine goe hide selues like leude lozels went exalt themselues beyond measure reason ye see eliu ment therfore god couereth pryde men sheweth hee beareth downe thrusteth vnderfote yea euen wise men ashamed wheras erst bene bold thinking themselues able worke wonder let v marke god sheweth v singular fauor speaketh v seeing wretched brute beast taught agayne hee sendeth v hartbitings nip v quicke doe v good afterward afflicted hand let v assure selues bicause wee bee hard stubborne therefore must bee tamed wild beastes yet notwithstading let v consider al god seales wherby heleth ratifieth warning giuen v word therefore let v make much receiue paciently seing mean procureth welfare saluatio let v desire nothing life long shewe selues true child towardes giue ouer oure selues wholly obedience seruice nowe let v fall downe face good god acknowledging oure faultes praying make v feele better haue done much hee hath chosen v housholde let v desire wise guided hande simplicitie reuerece asmuch hath kindled light worde amongs v may gouerned vnto end mynds maynteined purenesse ought may day day growe increase knowledge worde vntill come behold glorie fully perfectly bee transfigured althoughe behoue v passe many battels fele vnto wretchednesse subiecte world yet notwithstanding may vphild alwayes power get vpper hand al temptation intent goodnesse may strengthen v walk obedience may please graunte grace c cxxv sermon fourth vpon xxxiij chapter sermon yet still vpon xvj xvij verse vpon text added heere plucketh backe soule graue life come svvorde chastizeth man vvith greefe vpon bed breaketh bone vvith chastizementes soule refuseth bread life pleasant meate fleshe consumed seene bone also vvhiche seene doe clatter soule dravveth graue life vnto follovve death eloquent messanger one among thousande shevve man rightuousnesse god hath pitie sayth deliuer end go dovvne pitte haue found attonement fleshe shall come agayne freshe chyldes shee shall returne dayes youth saw yesterday god must bee faine drawe v force foolishe enterprise bycause naturally wee bee presumptuous ther nothing would medling god warne v myld thrust forth ourselues ouerhastily inough ther folish boldnesse men held awe great violence man tie vp wild beast cheynes god therfore must faine deale v shewed v text man wil neuer turne away enterprise excepte god subdue mayne blowes cause thereof euen pride hath bene sayd alreadie therfore vntill pryde man nature beaten downe thrust vnder foote need always roisting starting one side yea flinging away like wild beast let v marke wel chefest thing haue doe affliction learne humble oure selues wee bee foolish ouerbold take vpon v god gyueth v leaue doe wee walke vnder gouernment asking counsell alwayes mouth holding ourselues stil comaunded chalenging aught strength power yee see lesson behoueth v remember earely late god afflicteth v eliu expresseth yet thing whiche haue touched wit god procureth welfare sayde meanes humbling v bycause destruction vndoing puffed vp exalt themselues lauful therfore meanes drawe oute ditch kepe stumbling deadly fal god hold back affliction ye see cause w e fall intoo graue god afflicteth v therewithall eliu sheweth v howe harshe medicine hee sayeth consumeth oure fleshe wee haue shape man like vntoo deade men taken earthe oure bone doe clatter without wee much take breathe continuall tormente wee haue release god persecuteth v extremitie thus sheweth god first blowe winne thing mennes hande desired wit knowe themselues wretched full infirmity vpon stoup vnto must faine ouercom strong hand continual torment else neuer yeelde submit selues vnto behold two poyntes wee haue marke touching firste let v learne beare affliction patiently sith wee see serue v medicine salues small thing v bee drawne graue wordes concerne onely bodily death whiche passeth awaye also similitude euerlasting damnation termed heere graue pit readie fall breake armes legges breake neckes also perishe euer wiped booke life cut kingdome heauen lo state pride bringeth v long flicker sorte ayre thinke wee haue anye strength selues build thervpon fancie say long possessed suche foolishe presumtio always ready stumble perish god hauing pitie v sendeth remedie knoweth conuenient afflicteth v beateth v roddes grudge pacient god doth chastise v extreme vnthankfulnesse suffer god remedie destruction draw v fro let v mark well holy ghost ment make god chasticemets sweet amiable v end beare quietly sent v marke one poynt verely seeme straunge fleshely reason oure fleshely reason saye coulde god prouide better meane oure welfare tormenting v sort behoued sende v death might call v vnto life surely incredible manner proceeding man debate according owne reason thinke foolishnesse god shoulde kill v pardoning v affliction signes wrath wee knowe disease messenger death sorrowes whiche conceiue drownings v lord sendeth v sorrow sickness tormentes holdeth v vpon racke till till wee faynte suche wise life draweth graue word concerne small affliction accustomed concern god sending v great extremitie remayneth hope v must god cast v bottome death end drawe v againe worketh must pleade shall alwayes haue worse end staf doubt cause holy scripture sayeth ordinarie maner kil quicken bring graue raise life let v vnderstad god intendeth heere exercise oure obedience trying v vttermost wee indure much drawe breath seeme bee vtterly choked therefore lorde bringeth v point end know whether wholly whether wee abyde gouerned hand howsoeuer world go tempted trouble greefes let sentence come mynde comfort v withall behold sayde god bringing men graue intendeth drawe againe consuming fleshe hee mindeth restore tormenting extremitie hee purposeth comfort bring rest seeing let v take hold comfort let suffize v assuage sorrowes let v hart although seeme vtterly forlorne let v alwayes passe strength doctrine let v learne raise vp selues euen wee bee cast downe hell thus ye see haue beare mynde afterwarde eliu maketh long description god chastizements shew v dreadfull wrath also profitable lesson v v thinketh greatnes god wrath spoken holy scripture sayd song moyses knoweth greatnesse thy wrath vndoubtedly although god wrath bee fire consumeth thing yet notwithstanding thinke vpon ouerpasse tolde v sermon reade goodly text touched nother doth rest vpon much make accout god iustice take sport ought marke wel counsell giuen v holy ghost like text saide tha god breaketh men bone say vseth great violence remaineth strength al vnconsumed flesh wasteth consumeth away remaineth image death man continually tormented like deade man without cause set afore v ende waken v god vttereth iudgementes v make v feele sinnes better thinke v tormentes terrible expressed according also wee see howe holie scripture vseth many comparison behalfe vvhy doth like god lion breketh brozeth thing teeth plucketh peeces pawes attribute crueltie vnto god couenient humble v bycause dull knowe feare god stande awe punishment sendeth vpon lift vp selues ende wee may bee possessed dulnesse holy scripture setteth foorth god likenesse lion commeth vpon v teeth pawes make v vnderstand intendeth shewe himselfe contrarie vnto men terrour aboue comparable yee see vse ought apply thing sayd warning ought ro serue v aforehand also sometimes trouble god falleth vpon v behoueth v put thing vre spoken heere end may knowe first haue bene delt withal yea vndoubtedly notable place wher sayde god consumeth man fleshe bruseth breaketh swalloweth vp hee killeth men quicken although anger dreadful vnto v visiteth v rigor driuen feele thing conteined heere yet notwithstanding hee cheereth v hope saluation mean bring v vnto life vvherefore seeing god giueth v hope first haue bene delt withal hee hath handled seruantes sorte tymes let v suffer selues bee swallowed vp sorrowe set gulfe truely wee see eliu following hath beene shewed foresayde song moyses speaketh without cause marke howe sentence ought serue v double vse first rest wee must take time bethinke v howe dreadfull god wrath ende wee may walke feare carefulnesse submit oure selues vnder hand seconde must much afrayd god visiteth v roughly knowing hath delt sort towardes whose saluation hath procured let v thinke strange deale v let v learne fashion ourselues like vnto haue wayted fully comforted god hand bin heauinesse yea euen bene swalowed vp sorowe therewithall let v marke also long continuance affliction wherof eliu speaketh heere hee sayth god afflicting man wise hee shall seeme vtterly forlorne shall one brunt releeue againe byandby contrariwise layeth hande vpon whome hee intendeth afflict hee maketh heuier heuier much poore creature sore tormented day shall bee double morrowe afterward bee increased shall seeme haue nother ende measure shall continue long shal passe hudred dethes god shall seeme releeue litle shall wee deliuered affliction immediately haue felt must increased good pleasure god fight againste many deathes truely seemeth right harde vnto v howebeit let v marke rough horse must haue rough ryder much wee bee tough wood behoueth v haue hard wedge hard stroke beetle true think ourselues rebel god consider thing without flattering ourselues shall find nourishing wilful stubbornesse v smal common thing chawe vppon brydle suche wise god although affliction increase yet ceasse gnashe teeth still playe wild beast sort pretend token humilitie bee fickle day morrowe quite head long man hild baye vndoubtedly say haue offended god behoueth mee turne newe leaf hee onely make countenaunce afore men thorough hypocrisie willing amende also thinke vtterly chaunged wicked affection god deliuer morrow morning become worse hee least wise bad see plight therfore let v think strange god increase strypes see wee wonne sturdinesse v must fayne correct v long behoueth worke roughly like disease rooted peraduenture diseased person thinke selfe rid soone hath taken sirup pill hath bin let bloud say seeme vnto throughly whole roote disease yet plucked vp therfore must fain take verie harshe bitter medicine bee kepte diet abyde vnder phisitions hande moneth twaine yea whole yeare euen maner must god purge v diuerse remedy make long ere hee cure v bycause vice pryde rooted ouerdeepely v entered euen intoo maree bone infected soundnesse v al corrupted till god renewe againe thus yee see mention made long continuing affliction till yea god must faine vse diuerse remedy afflicting v alwayes one fashion sending v time one kynde sometimes another thing let v assure ourselues doth without great cause taketh pleasure tormenting poore creature vve knowe nature make v feele goodnesse howbeit meane whyle forasmuch seeth fitte receiue good reason hee chaunge sorte transfigure self end conforme selfe vnto seeth fit v cause sayd chastizeth man greef vpon bed vvhen eliu speketh shew v god punishe v good earnest nother release truce al meening though seeke rest shall finde none god bee enemie say take hold wrath scripture sayth god enemie angrie v meeneth deede pretendeth bycause haue neede put feare may sorie sinnes let v marke well man tormented hee forced haue warre without end seeke haue rest shall find none hand god long shall able scape till bee reconciled thing ought bee vnderstoode sentence god giue v release let v assure ourselues bereth infirmitie ought serue singular comfort although god examine v roughly bring v euen pit brim yet notwithstanding hee giueth v still taste goodnesse wee may take breathe againe sayde heere hee hath graunted grace vntoo men persecuted sorte rest meeneth saying speketh reprobate chosen whose saluation procured furthered meanes let v vnderstande god suffereth v afflicted ouersore giueth v litle stripe hath respect feblenesse bycause seeth weake furthermore hee sayeth man forsaketh meate much findeth tast pleasaunt meates woulde fayne world shewe v touched feeling god wrathe haue conceyued quicke wee find tast thing vvhat giueth v tast benefit wee receyued go hand worlde grace true heathenishe sort despysers god whiche saped sinnes become vtterly brutishe feele sting greef doo finde taste ynough pleasure yea euen beastly pleasure haue yet conceyued wrathe god feele god must needes mislike al thing desirable owne nature yea vtterly lothe cannot take pleasure euen liue although life bee full much wretchednesse sea misery yet must set store bycause god hath set v preserueth v intent wee shoulde knowe bee creator father according deede end created mainteyned transitorie life know god interteyneth v feele fatherly goodnesse pleaseth haue care v gouerne v life ought deare vnto v respect sheweth angry life must need bitter impossible man desire bee fordon feeleth according wri ten shall say mountaynes couer v thus ye see point wee come therfore let v learne find tast first goodnesse god end rest benefit may pleasant vnto v wee may finde sauor say let v learne tast goodnesse god say let v giue worldly thing cheef marke say let v seeke obey god submit selues quietly vnder hand yee see must desire haue wee one whensoeuer inioy benefit giueth v whither eating drincking rest life let reioycing suche wise may bee wholly referred acknowledging fatherly goodnesse god say behold god doeth well shewe care hath welfare seing voutsafeth feede wretched body behold deade carkases yet god voutsafeth nourishe yee see behoueth v eate drinck sorte wee may thinke continually vpon goodnesse god furthermore thing tast v ouerpressed anguishe life hatefull v let v consider whence proceedeth bycause god hath hidden cotenaunce v feele fatherly goodnesse make v sinde tast sauoure benefites wee mourne bee perplexitie anguishe let v praye god make v feele goodnesse whiche yet vnknowne v feele let serue v take breth set v rest also restore v wise wheras vtterly dismayed afore may gather newe courage come againe floure age according sayde heere byandby thus ye see haue beare mynd short sayd flesh man shall waste awaye bee sayde aliue must brought nothing god doth vtterly disfigure v let v loke arme oureselues pacience enter disputation although come sayde extrametie sayd god hadleth chosen sort speaking intendeth ouerthrowe destroy whome hath ordeyned saluation hand whome guideth euen doth hee disfigure suche wise man would take vtterly forlorn seing let v pray although become like dead yethe wil kepe life hidde hand needfull although men afflicted roughly eliu speaketh god vse rigour wher listeth yet notwithstandding generally behoueth life kind shape deathe sainct paule sayth wee see winter time tree haue nother floures leaues freshnesse life drawne euen must life bee hidden hande god haue done honour put trust shall finde end hath bene good faythfull keeper therefore please bring v afterdeale time shall perceiue token fauour shall seeme quite alienated let v tary leysure mourne til giue v cherefulnesse spoken eliu hath treated affliction whiche god sendeth faythfull shewed must first bee cast downe god set vp hee addeth god intendeth make feele goodnesse fauor vseth word towards heere yee see meane whereby god quickneth bee alienated wit sendeth messenger hardly foud amongest thousande shall bring message rightuousnesse wit bringeth word god iustifieth sinner receiueth accepteth fauor yee see sort restored haue bin good dead goodly excellent sentence shewe v god sendeth v tydings goodnesse promise declared vnto v al one reached v hand drawe v graue vvhat would let v marke well howe sayde heere man shall gather newe strength haue assurance god goodnesse howe haue sayde alreadie lorde hath giuen propertie gospell giuing eare promise conteyned wee take comforte assured hee calleth v truely hard men battels wee haue fyght againste temptation ourflesh greatest battell vnbeleef specially feele god chastizementes bee wee darknesse much oure sorowe dimmeth eye although god promise set afore v yet notwithstanding apply vse seemeth alwayes somewhat betwixt v belong v lo plight euery v ought feele owne experience vndoubtedly sathan commeth intermedle himselfe cace true denie god promise wee stande mammering say heare well promise goodly one ought cheere vp whole world linger still vayne bycause perceiue ought pertayne vnto mee much therfore ought marke well sayde namely god sendeth v man certifieth v goodnesse one hee reached v hand sayde vnto v lo hitherto haue afflicted although hath bin great rigoure yet haue done iudge intended punish misdeed according deserued phisition heale true felte first fayne vse searing corzying searching bone verie violent remedy meane whyle procured health therfore consider goodnesse thus yeesee euer god giueth v holie scripture hande finde promise mercie hee sende v man able warrant v forgiuenesse sinnes behoueth v conclude thus soeuer word go god pitie mee indeede sheweth sending recorde specially benefite gospell preached vnto v knowe vse preaching vnbind v vpon earth intent vnbound heauen chief ende god haue worde ministred vnto v much hild prisoner vnder euerlasting damnation ordeyned bee minister god worde vnbinde v release oure sinnes saye warrant beare witnesse vnto v vvee knowe peculiar office god forgiue sinnes belongeth men lord iesus christe ment expresse power workefulnesse preaching saying therethroughe sinnes forgiuen v yea euen mortall men cause saincte paule sayeth expresly message whiche committed vnto v message attonement reconciliation christian church gospel preached purely let v bee sure god hath committed keeping keyes heauenly kingdome vnto men doe beare abroade word purpose end open v gate saluation let v assure selues hee hath giuen authoritie breake oure band according foretold prophete esay lesus christ bee sent preache deliueraunce poore prisoner hee hath done owne person onely accomplishing sayde promise hee doeth still also dayly minister true iesns christe partie hathe let v looce bondage sinne euerlasting damnation wherein nature yet hath hee committed charge peherdes church ye see thing whiche wee haue beare mynde eliu sheweth v meane wherby god restored hee sent vnto hell good drowned sendeth messanger able warrant rightuousnesse speaketh purposely ryghtuousnesse bycause whiche ought comforte v shoulde vse flattery make v beleeue wee bee ryghtuous preache vnto v oure owne vertues merites rightuousnesse speaketh heere god made one v howe bycause imputeth oure sinnes vnto v rightuous selues owne vertues bicause pleaseth god forgiue v poynt wee ought marke well world seeketh ryghtuousnesse bringing men desert vnto god imagineth although haue done amisse yet able make amendes behold thee common vse rather abuse wherewith men deceyue themselues bee combered heartgreefe feeling vengeance god fall considering selues howe nowe haue liued well haue serued god ought doe though haue committed fault ther meanes reco penny withall yes haue done behold say howe men would euer put barre god way end haue vantage thus seeke rightuousnesse owne merit god intendeth giue v rightuousnesse whereby may stande vseth contrarie kynde speach admitteth v accepteth v ryghtuouse couering oure sinnes vvhere shall ryghtuousnesse rest free mercie god bycause hee hath scoured awaye oure spot bloud sonne discharged v death damnation raunsome oure lord iesus christ payde vpon crosse wipeth oute sinnes layeth oure offence oure charge thus ryghtuousnesse preached vntoo v god messenger wee iustified accepted ryghtuous without cause holye scripture vseth continually word iustifie might wel sayd finde fauour grace god pardoneth v according also often said holieghoste thought ynough vse word long wee bee sinner god muste needes hate v wee knowe hee welspring ryghtuousnesse agreeument betwene vnryghtuousnesse therefore long sinner lothly god sight hee must needes reiect v bee short haue enteraunce vnto god till wee bee iust ryghtuous nowe howe become rightuous bycause god regardeth oure sinnes buryeth hydeth clenseth v sinnes wiped death passion lord iesus christ much wee bee taken ryghtuous god findeth fault v accepteth v sort sonnes sake ryghtuhusnesse spoken strayne furthermore whereas sayde expresly messenger recomforteth v one among thousande make v set store benefyte whereof wee sildome make account wit meane attonement reconciliation declared base common thing time stumbled vpon haue man sente god warrant saluation bee meane oure attonement therefore suche thing wee shoulde cast vnder feete cause prophete esay sayth beutifull feete bring glad tydings peace nowe feete prophet meeneth comming presence hee shoulde say worlde knewe benefite god declareth mercie vnto would loue esteeme preache gospell would acknowledge god hath committed suche treasure vntoo surmounteth good wishe sainct paule also alledging text applyeth shewe preaching gospell singular gifte god let v thinke commeth men let v fully assured resolued god seeketh v gospell preached vnto v god must bee builder thereof goodnesse must proceed therefore wee father vpon men great vnkyndnesse vvherefore let v beware wee deface goodnesse god church order haue preaching thing let v assure selues one god came seke v bring v saluation withall let v knowe hee granteth grace priuiledge al men good soth ther country esteeme also worldward esteemed yet notwithstanding haue message saluation let man go whole world let serch al natios yea euen haue bene excellent time past let go seeke greece al science world inclosed seemed let go italie fraunce estimation let go spaine shall hee finde vtter desolation onely ought messenger saluation vtterly dumme whiche worse yee shall heare mastie dogges barking oute blasphemy againste god yee shall see wretched soules led destruction diuell hunting euerie praye vndoubtedly looke howe manye preacher goe vp pulpit many dogges hunt fetche game bring sathans toyles wretched soules maye goe damnation heere wee haue god promise preached vnto v leade v saluation therefore wee see without cause sayde faythfull messenger god grace odde man among thousande rare benefite wee ought esteeme hyghly howe sayde make v esteeme person make v receyue benefite ministered vntoo v greater reuerence say make v receyue grace god much pleaseth drawe v iustifie v fatherly loue shewing v although wee bee wretched miserable bee nothing v deathe damnation yet hee leaue v deliuer v meane oure lorde iesus christe nowe let v fall downe face oure good god praying make v feele faultes wee may mortifie lustes bee withdrawn corruption world frame selues seeke vnto much mortal life subiect much wretch ednesse miserie may please reach v hand aboue deliuer v hee hath taken v gulfe death may please graunt grace onely v also people nacions earth c cxxvj sermon fifth vpon xxxiij chapter sermon yet still vpon xxiij xxiiij xxv verse vpon added heere shal pray god appease behold face triumphe man rightuousnesse shall restored vnto saw yesterday whe god afflicteth v procureth oure saluation mean although seeme v true wicked shalbe afflicted doth make hardhearted chafe god little fare better afflictio doth bewraye thire wickednes bring full measure whe god afflicteth chosen ouermastreth mortifieth wise tremble maiestie becom vtterly dismayed like half dead insomuch hope life respect themselues worldward finally ther remaineth nothing god shuld haue pitie eliu setteth meane whereby god maketh chastizemets auaileable towards faithful wit comforting goodnesse telling readie forgiue sin althoughe affliction bee oure profite serue v medicine salues shewed yesterdaye yet notwithstanding appeereth ende nowe ende shewed v heere whiche god reacheth v hande assuring v hee bee mercifull v howe euer worlde goe notwithstanding hee hath handled v roughly let v marke well life oure soules consisteth worde god whereby hee gyueth v assurance mercie goodnesse towardes v intente wee shoulde esteeme benefite deserueth sayde hee warranter remission oure sinnes odde man among thousande hee found aduenture treasure god reserueth whome hee thinketh good besides haue tolde god promising men forgiuenesse sinnes giueth charge commission minister word drawe death according expressely sayd keyes kingdome heauen committed preach gospell ende forgiue sinnes owne authoritie intent wretched sinner may better assured saluation doubt god receyueth mercie therefore minister tell name bee quit iudgement seate cause expressely sayde god haue mercie man hee sendeth good faythfull teacher giueth appoynted minister sayde charge office rescuing deliuering wretched creature way damnation howe ende thinges may bee better vnderstoode heere three point marked one eliu sheweth v cause foundation forgiuenesse oure sinnes namely god mercifull vnto v infinite goodnes wil haue v perish one point seconde office preach gospell drawe wretched soules death set libertie third done expresse commission giuen god according also belongeth mortall man take vpon hygh thing aboue abilitie touching first point see holy ghost bringeth v welspring grace wee obteyne god vvhen forgiueth v oursinnes worthy able bee beforehande bring thing ought procure fauour towards v bycause loketh vpon v mercy short holy ghost fathereth remission sinnes vpo free goodnesse god wee wretched nothing damnation v behold pleaseth god succour v doth thing hee findeth v saue infinite misery owne goodnesse moueth thervnto point ought marke well end come obteyne forgyuenesse god hand may imagin appeaze owne merit particausers remission sinnes looke vpon told v wit god haue pitie v receiueth v mercie hand eliu ment aduertize v god doth alwayes make v feele goodnesse although loue v bee minded prouide thing knoweth profitable v yet doth hee alwayes giue v feeling hideth vtterly v god afflicteth v sayde turneth backe v else hee voutsafeth looke vpon v else countenaunce louring towardes v able beholde let v marke well faythfull shal dismayed seke god able find hath forgotten reiected bicause hee make feele loue cause eliu sayeth expressely god mercifull v hee sendeth v witnesse forgiuenesse sinnes word hee bycause wee sure experience take possession goodnesse vnknown vnto v time seconde poynt office preache gospel forgiue sinnes notable poynt without vtterly forlorne past recouerie ther none meane giue v hope saluation assuring v oure sinnes forgiuen afore god wee quite cleane discharged hath bene sayd ryghtuousnesse whereby acceptable vnto long oure sinnes imputed vnto v god must needes hate v else beeing god wrath vpon v bottomlesse gulfe cursednesse againe wee reconciled vntoo gate paradise opened vnto v acknowledgeth v child heritage heauen alreadie prepared v howe may obteyned hauing good faythfull teacher preache gospel vnto v end whereat god ameth attonement reconciliation v according sainct paule declareth hee expresseth propertie gospel message attonement betweene god man iesus christ knewe sinne vnspotted lambe put himselfe vnder curse sinnes end finde rightuousnesse god saye wee washed bloud haue put oure selues vnder sacrifice hee hath offered wee bee taken reputed rightuous bycause sayde sacrifice power put away fault offence lo behoueth v marke place therefore euer reade holie scripture come sermon promis god goodnesse set afore v let v assure selues god warranteth loue towards v end deliuered death wherein plunged although wee heare mortal man voice sound disperseth vanisheth ayre yet must beleue god worke wise power sayde doctrine shall bee sufficient deliuer v damnation wherin bondage sinne shall passe bond satan bee set cleere god saying namely euer lose earth shal losed also heauen cannot faile v wee see importaunce worde sayde deliuer sinner set sinner free god giueth expresse charge speake vnto v drawe v gulfe death wee myght enter intoo paradise one voyce sounded heauen verie deed saint iames speaking priuate person sayth warneth brother shal saue soule lost take place al bring men good waye shall doe seeing wee haue speciall zeale oure lorde iesus christ hath giuen word suche time preached v sheepeherds church wit office release forgiue sinnes haue alledged already saincte iohn bynde vnbynde haue alledged sainct mathew short see power gospel receyue promise faith namely much god shuld reache v hande heauen pull v dungeon death herewithall let v marke third point done god ordinance serueth difference betweene gospell blasphemy pope pope vpholdeth chaplens haue keyes kingdom heauen office forgiuing commission shewe tye forgiuenesse sinnes shrifte god euer tell men behoueth men shriue secretes eare mortall man obteyne mercie god declareth sinner sighe sinnes hee mercifull beholde mortall creature presumeth make lawe shet men paradyse obserue notoriouse vsurping god power besides pope hathe bulle indulgence pardon suche thing ground forgiuenesse sinnes vpon therewithall mingleth bloude martyr hee meeneth expressely deface vertue deathe passion oure lorde iesus christe yet notwithstanding meane whyle hee hath promis gospell hee hath nothing toyes ceremony sorcery great cross vpon backe suche trashe whiche conclusion nothing satan gewgawes contrariwise sayde forgiuenesse sinnes withoute god message saye without preaching doctrine vvhen pope forgiueth sinnes dumme hee bringeth one iote god worde nother hath hee thing charmes sorcery sayde afore moreouer hee layeth tyrannous lawes vpon men neckes ouerthrowe meane lord hath ordeined againe abridgeth god himselfe libertie let disappoint god receyue sinner mercie ye see popishe churche diuels synagoge destitute forgiuenesse sinnes consequently damned long holdeth selfe tradicions antechrist impossible shoulde reconciled vnto god contrarie parte wee saye mennes sinnes forgiuen receyuing message gospell hath ceremony men haue deuised lawes whiche haue inuented owne pleasure onely wee must followe order rule oure lorde iesus hath stablished hath remission sinnes hande hath giuen v meane whereby haue done preaching gospell receyuing assured fayth therfore sticke simplicitie may sure commission commeth aboue men take ne vsurpe thing vppon owne brayne thus ye see haue marke vpon word sayd god pitie deliuer must euery whit come aboue none god must woorke behalfe free goodnesse according also protesteth prophet esay saying hee selfe hee whiche wipeth thine iniquity israell must benefite needes procede creature giue vnto v wee see substace text wel vnderstood immediatly sayd ende soule enter pit vvee haue seene already
