heretofore wretched sinner neere graue good deade consumed long god pursueth rigor eliu addeth god preuenteth mischeef sending said message release sinnes wee fall graue saye wee perishe cace standeth vppon temporall death vpon damnation wherin wee vtterly ouerwhelmed god preuent preserue v infinite goodnesse let v marke whyle wee afflicted wee bee couered darknesse death seemeth v getting yet notwithstanding euen time god susteyneth v couert although wee perceyue rest vppon yet notwithstanding hee sheweth v fauour without knowledge behoueth god worke behalfe although wee cannot conceyue vndoubtedly wee begin take hold goodnesse fayth must lay first point saluation wee must mount vp hygher namely choze v wee borne thence forth hee continueth goodnesse alwayes towards v let v marke god owne goodnesse choze v secret maner incomprehensible naturall vnderstanding agayne pleaseth manifest goodnesse vnto v thing hee doeth gospell preached vnto v hee sheweth v hee willing haue v deliuered graue therfore wee perceiue deliuerance saluation tast promise gospell done throughly first god giueth v small taste confirming v vntill wee see gate paradise wyde open deliuered fro graue lo haue marke vppon saying furthermore eliu sayeth god hath found reconciliation let v marke hee intendeth expresse yet better thing touched euen vvhich must father attonement god maketh v vpon god owne free goodnesse hee whiche worketh yea euen wee could haue thought mynd come vnto must fayne seeke v gone astray haue forgotten according saying prophet esay true often commaunded seke god turne vnto haue offended cannot done except teach v inwardly touche v quicke may inforced mislyke sinnes againe hee giueth v hope causeth v runne vnto god refuge himselfe inlyghtening v fayth without cause eliu addeth god found reconciliation hee afflicteth v hee prepareth v aforehand receyue grace hee intendeth giue v long bee puffed vp pryde god goodnesse hath entrance v long hardned sinnes beate back sayd grace greate way v long saped filthinesse surely cannot tast reconciliation whiche made lord iesus christ therfore god must fayne worke work must bee altogither worketh hee first bringing v knowledge sinnes hartbyting hee giueth v according hath bin sayd hertofore sendeth v inward feare souded trumpet summon v iudgement ye see god calleth v home secret inspiration seeth v gone astray distraught besides appointeth men warne v reproue v surely another greate benefite haue good faythfull teacher shewe v sinnes quicke threten v euerlasting damnation furthermore suffize wee see wee dull vppon spur god neede kick prick v roughly hee addeth correctious hand afflicteth v ye see wee must profit ourselues correction end like stithies beat back stroke neuerthelesse god working bring passe giueth v hart flesh softneth hardnesse cursed ature vvell hath god made correction take place hyghe tyme manifest mercye vntoo v make v tast see well th findeth reconciliation nothing aforehand rather wee still drawe backe vvhen god teacheth v plyght wee let v alone wee drunken lustes without thinking vpon although send v good warning conuicted euill yet notwithstanding wee labour still burie intent shoulde bee seene grind teethe chafe god sheweth sinnes little abyde doo nothing else byte kick othersome become vtterly senselesse dulnesse followeth amendment euer man say therfore behoueth god worke behalf againe hee shall haue afflicted v vttermoste yet shall ryght odedientnesse v yea wee bee euen confounded wee shall still like wretched mad men according wee see happened cayn iudas lo plyght wee shoulde bee god wrought v therfore wee haue message saluation shall become v although wee throughly tamed nothing else sighe grone yet notwithstanding would turne despaire v behoueth v acceptable tyme come vnto v according said another place esay behold acceptable tyme behold dayes saluation doeth terme tyme saluation acceptable time bycause god hath choze owne mere goodnesse cause also sayd another place esay comfort yee comfort yee people shall lord say thus comfort v affliction else wee bee swallowed vp sorowe therfore hee addeth hee repenteth hart hee scourged people telleth tyme comfort come herein wee see certayne declaration thing touched breefly god peculiar office find recociliation neuerthelesse god minister oft promise gospell offered vnto v wherin god calleth v sheweth himselfe fauorable lord iesus christ sake giuing v grace tast goodnesse assuring v ready receyue v mercye let v assure ourselues conuenient tyme whiche hee hath appointed saluation let v humble ourselues bee sure wee haue preuented hath sought v therewithall let v behind hand vppon suche occasion according sainct paule edging said text esay haue touched sheweth v wee must bee ready come lord calleth v must driue day day reconciliation found offered vnto v herevpon eliu concludeth man comforted message god sendeth becommeth yong agayne restored fleshe becommeth fresh yong chyldes vvherin hee sheweth true meane coforting v vvhich forget god seeke fond vanity sotte selues withall certified god goodnesse article wee ought marke well vvee see sort men labour comfort themselues namely forgetting god seemeth melancolike matter thinke vpon good sooth many saye stoutly ynough bee christian yet notwithstanding intend mery dryue away thought god eternall life also offend god set purpose cannot mery euill seing nature men atteynted disease let v looke well selues sure mirth shall blissed aboue except assured remission sinnes therfore wee haue god fauour wee call vpo eliu byandby adde therin consisteth true gladnesse alowed god lasting bring v saluatio long v know cace wee good god ne seeke reconcyled vnto lie routing stil filthinesse wee desire mery wee kindle god vengeance v increase still fire wrath wee plundge selues deeper bottomlesse pitte yee see needfull shuld shewed v much stadeth v hand well assured god mercifulnesse towards v also cause holy scripture treateth giuing ioy comfort vnto v doeth alwayes set v fauour god saying behold god mercifull therfore bee glad beholde redemer seketh ioyne knit god father therfore ye glad ye quiet bee yee rest conscience hereby wee admonished must need trouble vnquietnesse long knowe cace bee god true wicked seeke meanes ynough make selues mery good fayth ruffle see despizing god howsoeuer world go yet doeth god send pricking torment mynd bee sore distressed daunce fashion spoken moyses namely yet neuerthelesse sin dore wayteth like dog wayteth maister ye see wicked may ruffle yet go dores without gnawing conscience god must still hold bay therfore somuch ought wee thinke vpon doctrine wit wee turne backe vnto god ne bury sinnes whe would haue peace wee alwayes haue promis god comfort v wee see god allureth v saluation let v glad shall gladnesse bee blessed wee haue taste god father sanctifie ioyes without must needes quayle way v reioyce marke one point second wee haue also marke grace god ought suffize v though wee haue neuer many sorowes mingled according god excercise v hee wil send v full ioye myght laugh open mouth say yet notwithstanding behoueth v bee contented certeyntie wee haue father shall find mercy haue priuiledge abilitie call vpon god assure selues gate open v shall haue good accesse vnto name lord iesus christ say haue boldnesse thorough owne rashnesse hath voutsafed open holy mouth witnesse loue vnto v whiche thing hee doeth gospell published let v assure selues must rest wholy thervpon though haue neuer many sorowes incomberances yea behoueth v passe surmount reioyce misery tribulation seing god loue printed hart holy spirit wit seing god voutsafeth bee father sauiour hath shewed word also dede person sonne hath spared giuen death v thus yee see haue marke sayd man shall gather new strength restored againe flesh shal become fresh yong childes serueth shewe although wee feele many misery world certayne must haue many aduersities passing transitory life yet notwithstanding shall cease haue ioye shall ouercome get victory thing lord comfort v goodnesse sainct paule meeneth hee sayeth peace passeth man vnderstanding shall get vpper hand hart vvhen speaketh peace god meeneth gladnesse giue v remissio sinnes sayeth peace passeth al man vnderstanding afterward addeth getteth vpper hand victory hart meening whyle liue world shall haue many trouble greefes yea daunger death euery blowe yet notwithstanding sayd peace god getteth vpper maketh v conquerers fighting vndoubtedly syth wee see lord inlighteneth v ought suffize v according said fourth psalme welth world cannot make glad fleshly desire wordly thing making sporte mirth fare well haue good store eate drinke true shall see mery howbeeit god make countenaunce shyne vpon v ioye must need surmount thing worldling woont desire whe eliu hath spoken hee addeth immediatly man shall pray vntoo god appease finde fauorable beholde yet one point whiche importeth much without calling vpon name god know rightly frute ioye spoken wherin consisteth welfare euen wee may boldly come vnto god haue leaue rest lappe wee afflicted wee knowe mercifull v hath promised say souereine welfare men long liue world vndoubtedly prayer thing whereby come vnto god behoueth v walke faith god absent v respecte eyesight although dwel v power make v fele grace yet notwithstanding separated outward appeareance neuerthelesse prayer wee mount vp heauen present ourselues maiestie short ioyned vnto yee see band familiarity betweene god men libertie hee giueth v call vpon yet pray vnto ought except knowe goodnesse according sayd fifth psalme lord woship temple euen vpon multitude mercy vntill time god hath certified v father possible v dare come vnto mouth shet hart locked vp short wee vtterly excluded priuiledge calling vpo cause sayd holy ghost sealeth adoption ende wee may crye abba father wherby wee sure heare v place sainct paule sayeth iesus christ wee haue beleefe god beleefe ingendreth trust ende wee may come boldly throne god pray vnto yee see shewed v man comforted promise gospell byandby calleth vpon god findeth fauour hand let v marke first prayer whiche men make without tast god goodnesse dissimulation yea starke abhomination true wee cannot sure requisite although pray vnto god yet haue wee perfect fayth yet wee haue full purpose v go vnto god father bicause calleth v grounded vpon promise dishonour name praying prayer shal turned vnto sinne hereby man may see cursed wretched state papist wee ought well thinke vpon end may bee sory destruction magnifie god goodnesse somuch hath pleased drawe v dungeon papist thinke pray god deuoutly ynough yea meane whyle hold principle man must alwayes doubt god fauour yea haue ta stat god promise go aduenture cause make many windlass seeke many patrones aduocates deuise many meanes goe vnto god honour submit themselues word trust fully yee see papistes alwayes doubte yea needes doubte meanes wherof farre priuiledge calling vpon god herd hand rather continually beaten backe sainct iames sayeth man come doubting require thing god hee must neuer thinke obteine ought prayer must grounded vpon god word therfore wee see without cause liu sayeth man comforted pray vnto god let v marke wee disposed pray vntill wee knowe god calleth v one generall reason behoueth v hold according sayd prophet say people shall aunswere mee god god must begin thunder vnto v wee bee sure saluation shall bee good melody except god haue first thundered v say except haue giuen v boldnesse promis answere vntoo god therfore oft pray let v begin promise conteyned holy scripture consider god calleth v promiseth heare v wee may boldly go vntoo yea yet let v ceasse meane whyle walke feare let v consider wee come present selues maiestie god let say leade v humilitie reuerence according sayd text whiche haue alledged fifte psalme namely lord enter temple worship feare let v consider maiestie god wee may bee afrayde stoupe submit ourselues lowlinesse yet notwithstanding let v cease take courage continually become bold bycause hath pleased good god call v vntoo promise v comming shall vayne yee see wee haue marke although wee haue conceiued assurednesse god good fully beleeue receyue v yet notwithstanding must ceasse humble selues lowlinesse knowing wee shall alwayes find pitifull mercifull father towards v seking wee hold ryght way sheweth v let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement fault praying put away wee may doubte accept v ryghteouse lord iesus christes sake graunte v grace comming present ourselues vnto may bee discharged burthen sinnes also bee clensed hee may dwell v gouerne v holy spirit may walke obedience lawe holy commaundements hee hath giuen v let v say almighty god heauenly father acknowledge cofesse according truthe wee woorthye lyfte vp eye heauen present selues thee presume farre prayer c cxxvij sermon sixth vpon xxxiij chapter shall pray vnto god fauorable shall see face ioy render returne man righteousnesse looke towards men say haue sinned haue turned away goodnesse hath profited mee hath redemed soule ende go downe graue life ende see light according whiche declared yesterdaye eliu sheweth v men reconcilied vnto god maye call vppon quiet stedfast coscience true frute faith haue quietnesse may sure god loueth v flee refuge without wee cursed cace vndoubtedly although al good world wee bee sure inioy one minute houre except god maynteyned v possession moreouer let v put cace man myght co tinue ease pleasure tyme life yet god benefites turne destruction damnation vnlesse hee vsed purely sure sayd fatherly loue god vvee see wee cannot call vppon god certeinty hee heare v accept prayer pitie life somuch behoueth v marke well order shewed holy ghost god shal haue certified v goodnesse towards v wee knowing therein hee bee fauorable v pardon sinnes may seeke vnto boldy present selues cause added text god shew face righteousnesse shall returne vnto meane else man shall see face god wee must greately stand vppon word seing meening euident therfore one sayd long men accused owne conscience cannot think vpon god terrour could find hart neuer perceiue thing man speake might haue inckling doubt wee see long sinner asleepe euill desire nothing much forget god mention bee made intollerable torment offender brought iudge yee see long wretched creature buried sinnes cannot thinke vppon god greate greef haue assurance forgiuenesse sinnes come boldly god glad thinke vpon wee willing heare yea reioyceth v behold face sainct paule meeneth saying wee finde peace godward wee bee iustified fayth also saying hee meeneth wicked haue rest bee fallen asleepe rather dulled wise thinke vppon god thus yee see heathnishe sort seke feede selues vice labour forget god settle themselues thervpon god bringeth remembraunce wake yea euen sorowe cotrariwise certified god receiueth v mercy wherof fayth good sure warrant good boldly vnto haue peace neerer come maiestie trust haue wee saluation forasmuch hee desireth nothing bee father according hee hath shewed deede matter treated yesterday confirmed yet againe sayd righteousnesse shall restored vnto man eliu sayd heretofore wretched creature bee trouble hee feele god wrathe vengeance way comfort specially restore life except gospell preached god send man tel word purely wherby wretched sinner ouerwhelmee may knowe gate paradise opened vnto discoursing herevpon eliu sayd preacher gospel declare afflicted righteousnesse righteousnesse haue declared already men righteouse themselues able stand god righteousnesse god burieth fault imputeth vnto clenseth owne free goodnesse blood iesus christ spirituall washing soules namely watered holy ghost sainct peter sayeth yee see also vnderstanding text man righteousnesse shal restored vnto returne againe long god pursueth v iudge summoneth v yeeld vp account ouerwhelmed sinnes needeth processe witnesse agaynst v whe god calleth v sheweth v good remedie v bee discharged bond death wherin bound remedy put whole trust death passion lord iesus christ receiue imbrace promise saluation hee giueth v returning righteousnesse vnto v bin erst alienated v wherof wee bin vtterly bereft let v learne nurrish sinnes boosome wee shall gayne nothing laying playsters vpon sore hyde rottennesse increace wee must needes drop asunder ende altogither infected v flatter ourselues seke vayne startingholes must come right foorth vnto god suffer selues bee reproued wee feele remorse conscience let v receiue humbly sory misdoings wee haue profited litle warning god hath sent v leastwise let v past amendment chastizeth v beaten roddes let v cast downe ourselues may seke nothing mere mercy considering vtterly vndone helpe v ye see behoueth v deale meanes let v doubt righteousnesse shall bee restored vnto v according sayd prophet esay wee bee imbrued blood sinnes insomuch stayne soked v god make v whyte snowe wee returne vnto pure hart let v thinke herevppon god pardoneth sinnes let v fall asleepe ende wee seeke make priuiledge giuen v auaylable wit bee bold call vpon father assure selues heare v eliu hauing spoken addeth wil loke towards men say haue sinned haue turned awaye goodnesse hath booted hee hath deliuered soule pit text expounded men though eliu spake god saying hee looketh towards men man say haue done amisse wheras hee beene darknesse death god deliuereth soule pit restoreth light life howbeeit forasmuch word word set downe thus looke towards men say haue done amisse haue turned away goodnesse hath stoode stead meete conuenient mee man maye see easly gather eliu goeth still matter shewing brought lowe feele sinnes bee euen deathes dore god shew fauour call back againe giue hope life specially cheere hart able cal vpo true assurednesse faithe doo afterward turne themselues men declare misery intent magnifie infinite goodnesse god haue felt second frute forgiuenesse sinnes wretched sinner knoweth god hath shaken yet openeth way giueth accesse come vntoo like hee rested thervpon call vpon god afterward made frute faith auaylable also behoueth confesse sayd goodnesse god men ashamed shewe misery wherin hee vntill god deliuered mercy short like god hath sent v promise gospell wee ought acknowledge seeke vnto also behoueth v mourne ynough euery v pray god priuily himselfe behoueth v also set forth glory indeuer prouoke neighbour one v may edified another hee hath felt good mercyfull god must shewe vntoo others may take example agrement amongs v must also preache god praise togither according euery one v bound vntoo man may iustly confesse god hath hundred time plucked graue quickned ye see effect meening eliu howbeit may better profit sentence let v marke behoueth v first enter ourselues go vnto god afterward go vnto neighbour thus ye see three thing wee haue marke order wee ought kepe well first men examin owne conscieces haue eye whole lyfe ashamed sinnes vntill wee haue well perceyued wee bee worse wretched haue recourse vnto god vvee moued seke desire forgiuenesse requisite v begin sayd point namely feele sinnes greuouse bee also feele conceyue wrathe god intent wee may bee forlorne behold hell gaping vpon v swallowe v vp vtterly astonished may driuen say ala done may haue rest ourselues languishe misery wee may come earnest zeale seke lord thus ye see first steppe wee must begin second wee must come vnto god seeing hee taryeth till wee seeke infinite goodnesse preuenteth v somuch hee inspireth v end seeke flee refuge vnto mercie rest whe haue promise goodnesse set afore v seing hee seketh sinner bring death life wee must take promise apply vse saying euen god thou shewest thou art willing receiue sinner mercy behold one yea forlorne wote doo therfore doubt lord thou wilt make mee feele grace goodnesse lord rest although bee hemmed many trouble sorowes able turne thee yet rest vpon thy promise therwith call vpon thee assuring myselfe thou wilt strengthen mee satan temptation thus ye see behoueth v deale third point conclusion eliu maketh must declare god goodnesse neighbour farforth needfull edifying may praised one accord men may confesse welfare mercy damned goodnesse god remedy say three degree behoueth v keepe told must begin ourselues vvee shall see many blase abroade god praise full mouth haue well foremynded hart think themselues discharged haue sayd god haue pitie vpon mee haue bene one haue done euill deede true men haue feeling themselues speake altogither hypocrisie yet notwithstanding much wind mouth larger heart scarcely haue tasted god mercy yet would haue men thinke haue felt throughly full fraught vanitie ambition men wyden mouth sort speake well meane whyle haue mynded god grace feele accordingly myght well imprinted conscience themselues bee ryghtly nurrished cause sayd wee speake behoueth v haue considered well haue seene afore say haue examined well selues haue bene diligent serching wretched wee haue bene come verie point haue bene swallowed vp dungeon hell afterward wee haue bene brought afterdeele imbrace god promise haue lyuely feeling wee maye call vppon full trust true cannot bee doone perfectly yet must wee go towards yet must wee creepe neerer neerer wee must strayne ourselues come verie well haue wee made profers tyme open mouth prayse god goodnesse men may bee drawne example men may know none hope saluation infinite goodnesse pleaseth make death passion sonne auaylable take away sinnes wee may wasshed cleane spottes vncleannesse accepted ryghteouse matter concerneth shrift papistes confession christian ought put vre among v haue told heretofore one cursed blasphemy popedome tye forgiuenesse sinnes shrift made mannes eare god neuer requyred good sooth vnpossible euer men knowe hundreth part fault meene euen grossest fault shall doo go number offence haue doone vnwittingly therfore shrift amog papist gulf hell christian confession allowed woord god wee generally confesse sinnes v hathe giuen cause stumbling hee acknowledge fault amend euill say thing wee haue god shall haue afflicted v afterward remedied aduersities ment wee go blowe mannes eare tell offence also wee mount vp vpon scaffold tell particularly fault wee haue committed maner wee wee neede confesse defaultes generall therewithall consider lord hath bound v exceedingly hee hath giuen v happie wisshed end toubles would haue ouerwhelmed v hee reached v hand set v vp againe also wee haue offended neyghbours giuing euill example wee must acknowledge fault bee ashamed confesse sorinesse hart sayd latter confession ill practized among v wee see pryde men true dare say bee righteouse howbeeit confesse themselues sinner cloke hypocrisie say men wheras euery man ought feele owne misdooings wee fall couering mantle men playne mocking god wee intend confesse vnfeynedly wee bound vnto god humble ourselues let v speake according feeling owne conscience miserie wherin wee haue bene pludged deadlinesse wherout god hath made v way marke one point also othersome haue committed offence doo fall blaspheming god whole streete infected whoredome man reproue aske whither bring backe popishnesse bycause bee told fault would say god would haue stumbling block nurrished partie hathe troubled church fare better hardnesse wilfull stubbornnesse let v marke god discouereth sinnes ende wee haue caused trouble offence wee labour amend ashamed open mouth confesse wee haue doone thing shewed v namely sinner wil seeke vnto god pardon afterward come familiarly take father trusting mercy hee must also turne himselfe vnto men hee must pray secret say hart haue sinned sort aske forgiuenesse returne vnto god hee must also turne vnto neighbour wheras erst hee went aboute deceiue god would haue rocked owne conscience asleepe shall coceiue greef confuzion god shall glorified asleepe shall awake whose mouthes tast shall find auour grace god swalowed vp sorowe shall knowe god opened gate come vnto bee short despayre shall recouer hope life saluation ye see holy ghost ment effect declare text haue prayed vnto god euery man secretly wee must likewise offer generall sacrifice men acknowledging much boud goodnesse humbling selues sinnes considering wee bin damned creature pitied v therfore sayd hee haue eye vnto behooueth v mark order wherof haue made mention already eliu began point sayde entraunce sinner shall wakened namely god shal send remorse conscience hee receyue become better warning giuen bee afrayd god iustice threatnings made vnto hee shall feele hand hard heuie hee shall inforced perceyue owne confuzion greeued become dead afterward hee shall come quickening god shall cause gospell preached promise saluation bee offered vnto hee shall receyue benefit herevpon shall call vnto god conceiue confidence shall without douting go vnto god vnto father say seing god hath adopted number child may well take libertie coming vnto seing allureth mee sweetly vntoo must doubt receyue mee doone tyme looke towards men wee looke first vntoo men make fayre confession wee haue beene sorie throughly greeued within peruerting order nature wee haue felt well greeuousnesse god iudgements afterward able receyue promise gospell call vpon god trust rest vpon mercie fatherly goodnesse feeling fauorable v redie help v wee haue doone tyme looke towards men say edifie neyghbours inferior thing hath bin declared afore done looking towards men wee must say haue sinned haue turned aside goodnesse haue bene wretched man shewed v sort god ought glorified v wit must acknowledge righteouse nothing iniquitie v paule sayeth third romaynes whe sayth god iustified meeneth ourselues must first bee condemned god bee counted ryghteouse wee ryghteouse thing hee haue ryghteousnesse common intermedled men wee bee vtterly conuicted man dareth exempt cotrariwise willingly yeld ourselues gilty resort goodnesse god knowing belongeth iustifie v bycause fountayne righteousnesse ryght acknowledging bee righteouse vvherfore let v learne shewed v generall rule faythfull giuen mortal man holy ghost desirouse publish god goodnes shewed v forgiuing v sinnes behoueth v make confession mouthe saluation according also sainct paule sayeth tenth romaynes beleuing hart maketh v righteouse confessing mouthe maketh v safe sainct paule good faythfull expounder presente text sayd afore wee begin mouth bee wynd smoke therfore must first beleeue hart say must gather ourselues vnto god enter owne conscience therewithall bethinke v promise wee may flee vntoo vnto mere mercy refuge done mouthe must followe next confession mouth bee saluation wee shall haue beleeued hart vnto righteousnesse yet notwithstanding two thing must bee matched togither according wee see inseparable wheras sayd haue sinned haue turned away goodnesse hath profited mee holy ghost sheweth v confession must bee pure freeharted must speake halues hypocrite say true world sinfull men faulty owne seeming wel quit surely dallying sort god wee must set foorth sinnes vttermost say wee must feele bee intollerable burthen according also wee see daniell doeth saying lord wee haue sinned addeth wee haue delt wickedly wee haue trayterously transgressed lawe wee haue beene wilfull froward cause doeth daniell packe many word togither make heape shewe v discharge themselues lyghtly godward speaking word fault away hypocrite neuer felt offence let v marke wel superfluitie text eliu hee shewed sinner quit god hand cofesse fault sayth haue sinned also addeth haue turned away goodnesse vvherin hee doeth v vnderstand man must stick confesse det fully say haue bene vtterly froward maliciouse haue bin giuen wickednesse haue strayed cleane waye saluation haue elf god haue giuen myselfe wholy vntoo satan much thus ye see wee must deale wit countenaunce sake hart speke god mouthe also agree confesse men wee haue felt within ourselues effect thing shewed v let v apply selues cosider entraunce giue vnto god lay forth treasure goodnesse towards v man shall see nothing throughout hardnesse hart shamelessenesse many dayes humble theselues nay cotrariwise al wild beast bee faultie leaste ashamed mainteyne wickednesse set vp bristle men whesoeuer go amend yet notwithstanding men cease vaunt themselues gospell reformacion nothing worth yet apcee christian first lesson wee ought beare mind namely wee may inlightened knowe wrath god feele haynouse sinnes may bee sory vtterly ashamed wee may imbrace god mercy take hold ende reconciled lord iesus christ sake meane deth passion finally confesse wretchednesse men ende whole prayse may bee yeelded vnto god meete beholde say wherevnto wee ought inure selues haue touched afore men haue done amisse lyghtely greeuously one becommeth drunkard another whoremayster third swearer fourthe full malice crueltie another beater seek nothing hand man shewed fault shall see wild beast meanes tamed make skorne warning giue scarcely one amongs ten whiche hathe lowlinesse modestie confesse fault hee hath done amisse seing shet gate god reiect grace offered v gospell short cannot abyde god forgiue sinnes wee see preaching gospell vnto many men must bereue excuse drown deepe hell bicause could make profit neuerthelesse holy ghost prouoketh v receue exhortacion made vnto v vvherfore let v fight pride hypocrisie v two thing keepe v humbling ourselues god confessing fault men hypocrisie maketh v labour cotinually cloke sinnes preted giue ourselues vnto goodnesse meane whyle hart farre go cleane contrary way againe pride maketh v desire always good reputacion ala seke esteemed among men leastwise kepe ourselues reproche although know owne sinnes yet loth told meane whyle behold condemnacion increaseth doubleth god angel therfore let v learne tame pride vntill fully subdewed wee may come god humilitie cofesse wretchednesse also indeuer edifie neighbour demand cause shuld speake men two reason one god might bee knowne bee righteouse haue sayd grace might appeare shyne forth although god could forbeare confession yet notwithstanding hee haue openly manyfestly knowne det see impossible knowe goodnesse towards v wee vtterly cast downe euen point dispaire thus ye see first reason wee ought confesse neighbour goodnesse haue felt god hee hath deliuered v fro death fro destruction wherin plunged also second reson men edified example haue bin exercised affliction god hath bin gratiouse deliuer mee good knowe god shal afflict may think themselues behold god hand vpon summoneth druncke sinnes stray beast see intendeth drawe home set mee waye saluation therfore good men warned god working wee haue felt selues according see deede confession whiche faithfull haue made tymes past serue daye learning wee example dauid greate number afflictios hee felt ouercame soone wee felt small aduersitie wee forthwith bee point dispayre wee see issewe good profitable vnto dauid confesseth haue bin necessarie thing bee afflicted chastized god hand wee also doo trust god flee vnto assuring selues office raise men graue hee hath cast wee confesse sinnes report god hath visited v rigor time afterward quickned v againe serueth instruct neighbour may bee nouices thinke straunge god shall visit turne haue sayd may know themselues wretched sinner seeke remedie putting trust death passion lord iesus christ stirred vp serue honor shal haue felt goodnes grace experiece hath receyued mercy thus ye see thing shewed vnprofitable hu dred edified instructed example one therfore let v learne put away retchlesnesse whe lord shall haue shewed v fauour wee may magnifie goodnesse men may bee preached one common accord afterward said conclusion hath deliuered soule pit life entring graue truely cannot bee throughly dispatched must suffize v haue short abridgement neede requireth ioyning parte haue declared already discourse hath bin made cofessing sinnes ought ashamed codemne theselues afterward behoueth immediatly adde praise god haue knowne goodnesse therfore said haue sinned haue turned away fro goodnesse yea hath booted god hath drawne pit assone holy ghost hath taught v acknowledge wretchednes ashamed haue v immediatly preache god mercy according haue felt suffred v perish must need haue helped v let v marke wel sayd vnto sinner shal boote resist maker shal gaine hyde sinnes thinke vpo rather nourish fond selfelyking ala ala alwayes greater destruction god discouereth iniquity maketh v feele doth procure profit therein prouoketh v resort vnto thus ye see first point haue marke streyne lette v marke also god shaketh v layeth wickednesse charge remedy wee must forlorne vntill god pitifull v receyue v mercie therfore whensoeuer god forgiueth sinnes one raysed v fro death wee must conclude wee reconciled vntoo god hath hee wrought resurrection v vve dead hope lyfe respect selues reacheth hand make v alyue agayne drawe v vnto lette v learne magnify grace forgiuenesse sinnes acknowledging god doth rayse v life often pleaseth receyue v mercy forasmuch see satan ceasseth thrust v great benefite let v much inflamed prouoked exalt highly deserueth lette v fall downe face good god acknowledgemente sinnes praying exercise v iudgementes knowledge wretchednesse may alwayes learne serue honour yeeld ourselues true humilitie may strengthened mercy trust thervnto settle ourselues wholly vpon therby may learne confesse men howe gratious good god hath bene vnto v receyuing v mercy ende prayse saluation may yelded vnto alone dewe may ashamed abashed selues onely may exalted v bee humbled vnder yeeld due honor homage dooing heereof may please rayse vp true faythfull minister worde seeke c cxxviij sermon seuenth vpon xxxiij chapter first vpon xxxiiij chapter behold god doth thing thryce man avve backe soule graue may inlightened vvith light life marke iob heare mee holde thy peace vvill speake thou haue matter ansvvere speake desire iustifie thee heare mee hold thy peace vvill teach thee vvisedome xxxiiij chapter eliu spake agayne sayde vvise men heare vvordes men vnderstanding hearken vnto eare tryeth vvordes mouth iudgeth meates haue seene heretofore howe god prouideth welfare asmuch wretched creature ne parte muste fayne remedy vice else hope v yee see wee bee vtterly forlorne vndone god haue pitie vpon v meane hath bin declared vnto v namely teacheth v receyue grace somtimes chasticements giueth v somtimes affliction great stripe roddes see dull slow striketh harder copelled come vnto bicause wee vtterly quayled hold longer heerevpon coforteth v wise may come vnto call vpon feele fauorable v hauing felt grace acknowledge sight men cofirmed ourselues also cofirme neighbour eliu hauing treated addeth one time god iustifieth v sort reneweth sayd instructio oftentimes forsomuch wee bee good schollers profite sufficiently firste day god faine hold mortifying affectios v may draw v humbling coforting v againe done would forget returne owne nature wold strength v walke becommeth v thus haue meening eliu rather holy ghost necessary doctrine v besides papacie men haue buryed rightuousnesse commeth free gifte whereby god saueth v haue bene also somewhat modest men haue darkened intangled doctrine suche wise haue thought ynough say god iustifieth v goodnesse say whe recociled vnto thenceforth lyeth v deserue keepe possession grace whiche haue receyued meane bring man vtter despayre oure lord reach v hand onely set v good way pray shal able hold end considering frailtie flesh whereof haue much proofe also grace god werevnauaylable v continued v end renewed time time neede requireth furthermore see flesh lusty although haue beene tamed whyle wee seeme bee throughly disposed beare yoke seeking nothing obey god wonder shoulde changed one thing yet notwithstanding rebelliousnesse hid within v auaunceth selfe satan knoweth meanes howe thrust v way commeth beguyle v slightes vvhat become v god correct v euer let v alone ourselues become v cofort v one daye euer let v shift selues comfort receyued surely woulde euery whit fade away yea euen hande needefull god begin new agayne euery instant considering returne naughtinesse rod well printed v make v remember requisite earnest call vpon leuer gad aboute wander away oure owne vanity steade seeking oure saluation wee bee harried heere wittes wauering cannot reste shoulde therefore continually roue abroade without ceassing whereas eliu setteth three tune meeneth many time manner holy scripture vvhiche determine certayne number shew profite god shoulde afflict v sort variable inconstant therfore behoueth returne vnto v agayne againe el thing shal haue done wil serue purpose cofirmeth matter delt withall whe god hath deliuered soules graue quickned v light life sweetening rigor chastisement feele hand cannot shun vttermost power bicause cotrary nature vve woulde fayne god shoulde handle v owne lyking hee shoulde neuer bee roughe v wee might neuer disquieted mindes might alwayes liue ease would alwayes mainteyne v mirth reste yea verely according haue sayde good god handle v owne fancie hee vse discretion send v whatsoeuer thinketh expedient v let v haue eye ende issue affliction may cofort v say may serue salues medecines marke one poynt therefore although bitter first sight yet let v receyue god hande knowing recordes loue hee hath care v woorke oure saluation beholde say thing ought appease grudgings shoulde impacient god chastizeth v profite shoulde neuerthelesse ynough knowe affliction serue v medicine behooueth v also consider disease like better man bee sicke small light comon disease yet like well thing shall remedie hee wholly giuen ouer taken dead man yet recouer hee set store remedy giuen eue thing eliu sheweth hee sayeth god afflicting v doth remedy vice also fetch v graue quicken v hereby sheweth vndone vtterly drowned destruction except god plucke v backe vnto euen violent meanes sure coulde none otherwise bee considering hardhartednesse rather snarled sinnes canot easily woud seing god rayseth v agayne according treated large yesterday let v assure selues wee cannot sufficiently esteeme goodnesse hee sheweth v pleaseth chastize v therefore second poynt haue marke third must nedes passe way sayth intent draw backe betokeneth inforcing necessitie true god could well saue v without meane disputing god mightie power eliu hath respect oure state also poynt must rest vpon therfore let v learne god shold deale gently v let v alone quiet might sleepe oure sinnes without waking woulde cause destruction nedefull shoulde handled rigor oftentimes yea bare frailtie feeblenesse faine vse farre greater roughnesse towards v therfore howsoeuer man afflicted ought beare pacietly assuring himselfe god doth without cause euen without necessary cause also therwithall haue marke coparison set betwene graue lighte life vvhat god draweth v backe death doth bring v light life yee see one side extreme miserie yee see also one side souerayne benefite therfore let v learne god suffer v folow lust make hast alwaies towards graue say nothing plundge ourselues vtter destruction ca neuer get agayne lo would god giue bridle hereby haue good cause mislike ourselues cosidering frowardnes v true euery one v wil say desirous go vnto god attayne saluation meane looke vpon life looke vpon thought looke vpon whole doings seeme mad seeking owne destruction wee ceasse prouoke wrath god say coulde neuer come soone ynough depth misery seeing giuen euill nature though wee desyrous perishe wilfully let euery man learne knowe himselfe mislike himselfe therevpon suffer god gouerne seeyng owne guyding gouernment wretched vnhappy let v forget foolishe presumption wherewith worlde sotted euery man thinkes wise ynough may haue owne free lo howe men deceyue themselues making themselues beleue haue greate store wisedome strength contrariwise see god neede correct force cursed affection desiring knowe meete v therwithall side let v cosider whervnto god calleth v draweth v backe graue light life setteth v middle state say ye shall starke dead ye shall la guish hee calleth v light lyfe wit newenesse whereby regenerated incorruptible heauenly lyfe matter concerneth god deliuering v onely death also bringing v euerlasting kingdome although walke many corruption bylowe beset round yea dwell v euen bone maree yet god guyde gouerne v euen till wee come kingdome thus ye see coparison cofirmeth yet better infinite gracious goodnesse god end stirred seeke shall haue brought v right way indeuer selues go forwarde day day hee shall haue drawne v backe suffer teach v desire continue teaching styll withall let v marke also muste discouraged though oftentimes fall backe seeme clyue asunder god hath set v good trade throughly tamed vice fleshe happen nowe get vpper hande v driuen infirmitie groweth misbeleefe couered darkenesse let v therfore heart sayde god worke many time man intent bring light lyfe therefore come vnto god haue sure hope saluation fall trouble anguish suddayne storme seemeth ouerwhelme v let v therfore cease trust god sayde beginne woorke new agayne v giue selues brydle lette v beware meane shoulde put vre saying prophet esay whiche strengthen quaking legges cheere vp faynting heart man bee strong despysing god making accounte grace neede feele god iudgementes smitten hard wounded quicke feeble trembling knee quake haue strength v propertie nature gospell strengthen v againe according sayd prophet esay haue charge teach church commaunded strengthen weake legges cheere vp faint hart cherish vp trembling knee seeing behoueth v follow order according also apostle applieth euery faithfull man prophete esay spoken publike charge teach apostle epistle hebrewes sheweth euery man ought owne teacher behalfe let v looke selues wee bee astonished god iustice lette caste v wicked imagination make v fall despayre wee feele oure knee tremble armes legges good broken afflicted know yet lette v therefore ceasse strengthen selues day day eliu hauing spoken addeth iob heare mee giue good eare leastwise thou haue matter agaynste mee stoppe thy mouthe speake thou haue wherewith iustifie thy selfe hold thy peace heare mee speake teache thee wisedome desire iustifie thee shoulde say would fayne thou shouldest quitte thou haue good auaylable defence bring forth lette thy mouth bee shet nowe againe warned iobs person keepe silence god truth set afore v replie agaynst profitable warning considering hardnesse heart pryde men exceeding harde v submit selues vnto god vvee see bee alwayes striuings v oure mindes framed suche lowlinesse ought bee man alleadge v good holye thing mylde receyue haue suche pryde wee loth bee subiect thing owne yee see nature men lift vp themselues agaynst god alwayes kicke agaynst worde sith subiect wicked cursed vice let v marke well warning giuen v vvhich teachable god causeth men tell v truth iames meeneth sayeth behooueth v receyue god woorde meeke spirite without cause hath expressed meane vvould shew profite god worde behoueth v aboue thing haue meeke gentle spirite fierce courage surely shall turne euill neuer finde taste god worde ouerthrow goodnesse light shall turned darkenesse vvhat done vve must keepe silence god speaketh neuerthelesse must looke shall shew himselfe visibly heauen often worde preached set forth vnto v must hold true good assuring ourselues proceedeth fro reply make warre agaynst mortal creature aduaunce ourselues diuelish presuption agaynst liuing god therfore behooueth v hold peace may taught finally whole true wisedome men yeelde themselues teachable vnto god submit themselues wholly shewed name authoritie first point haue marke exhortation eliu maketh vnto iob speaking vnto man wise vnder person v warned duety haue sayde already aboue thing let v marke behoueth v keepe silence spoken god iustice reproued sinnes thus ye see circumstance haue yet marke ouer besides hath bene sayd already vvhat eliu treated hitherto shewed vntoo iob god ryghtuous yea sort men ought wholly gouerned draw backe graue bring vnto life holding continually mighty hande till haue brought perfection therin men beguile theselues vvhy men canot glorifie god take shame themselues wyll alwayes chalenge somewhat themselues although ought know owne lewdnesse bee ashamed yet notwithstanding alwayes puffed vp presumption dazeled vayne fancie saying haue haue although perfectly rightuouse yet vtterly destitute goodnesse thus yee see men desirous reserue somewhat themselues cannot yeeld vp vnto god cause wee cannot fully receyue doctrine free iustification sheweth v god receyueth v meere mercy accepting v respect owne workes altogither sinfull bycause pleaseth washe v clenze v bloud onely sonne hold v acknowledge v child notwithstading nature nothing v wretchednesse cursednesse cause eliu hauing shewed much wee bound vnto god thing haue much honor ought yeelded vnto beginner performer addeth men shoulde giue eare hold peace according also paule sayth third romanes alledged one dayes paste nowe eliu sayeth desirous haue iob quit thereby hee sheweth went fierce contentious minde wont wil mainteyne cotrary part purpose grieue man would faine iob could haue mainteyned rightuousnesse sith hath wherewith would haue huble himselfe god let v marke eliu speaketh instrumet god spirit hereby let v take warning whesoeuer god thudreth agaynst v holy scripture coueteth destructio bereeuing v thing belogeth vnto v thogh enuied v something worthy prayse hurt god whit diminished hauing truth side forasmuch behoofe vtterly throwne downe bicause cannot receiue benefite offreth v vnlesse quite clean voyde presumption vanitie therfore bereeueth v first vayneglory sheweth v haue nothing shame reproch v infected rotten filthinesse god say fayne bring v poynt grieued rightuousnesse well knowne faulte bicause profite remayneth v humble selues receyue promise giuen v saluation forasmuch diuell eggeth v stray obedience god harkening quietly vnto let v brydle mindes yea let v brydle short say yet must thy god raygne ouer thee thy maister thou muste bee scholler receyue whatsoeuer deliuered thee name lo heere effect haue remember concerning exhortation eliu maketh vnto iob heerevpon may also gather haue touched already namely shall neuer profite till haue learned hold peace holding peace whereof eliu speaketh wee shoulde wise owne conceite suttle reply god say howe wee muste contented whiche god sheweth v bycause obedience pleaseth beste thing yee see chiefe poynt faith quiet godward whe men presumptious take vppon theyr owne reason conclude vppon thing whiche ought stande vnto surely god wyll blinde must needes punish pryde vvhat bee done wee commaunded keepe silence say beate downe pryde oure nature may thinke selues haue wisdome owne may seeke god hand suffer teach v may profite let v come eliu addeth generall sayeth heare mee ye wise men giue care mee yee men vnderstanding mouth iudgeth meates whether bee sauery eare tryeth woordes eliu doth firste tell v aduertise v doctrine onely rude ignorant also men therefore man must hold skorne though learned inough already wisest may confirmed finde loose theyr time harkening whiche sayde conteyned vndoubtedly knewe v would attentiue heare doctrine dayly preached vnto v firste thrusting away god wee take skorne taught though hee ordeyned vnprofitable thing beholde god gospel preached men heare giue eare vntoo hath sayde ought bee done ignorant still theyr apcee spoken whole bodie church insomuch haue great small followe rule paule sheweth muste continue order till bee come perfect age euen age lord iesus christ shall finde perfect man founde mortall life muste bereft mortall body god muste haue taken v home himselfe wee come perfection seeing god wil whole body church shoulde taught yea euen perfectest excellentest sorte shall lewde ouerweening wee beare men inhande doctrine superfluous v wee haue neede lette v looke vppon example paule mirrour angelike holynesse yet notwithstanding hee sayeth indeueed still go forward dayly vvhen neere death foughten valiauntly honour god yet stil hee forgatte hee doone afore althoughe hee serued god faythfully suffered manye thing name sake yet notwithstanding hee eye alwayes vpon remayning sayde must regarde haue doone one thing meane fall asleepe indeuer selfe passe must keepe forwarde streyne selfe come remayneth herein say paule sheweth v well wee haue doo lette v marke muste nice shake doctrine set afore v though coulde serue v purpose though learned ynough already heere spirite god exhorteth wise men men vnderstanding heare receyue thing sayde therefore wee see god wisedome infinite neuer throughly comprehended long men liue worlde ynough haue tast profite dayly side let v marke wel wee haue learned thing wee keepe ill forget hande therefore wee neede put minde god gratious vnto v set mercie afore v ende vtterly desperate paste hope trusting vnderstanding thing brayne wee haue must ouer printed hart doctrine speculatyue gaze men may terme humane science ynough haue conceyued muste rooted heartes let v consider whether haue beleefe god wee neede dayly put minde shewed concluded wise men men vnderstanding counselled harken giue eare thereby sayde loftinesse must layde downe muste intend taught god much muste follow rule giuen v heere bicause wee see world findeth tast god worde ignorant bicause knowe shet dores loth time come good doctrine fickleheaded assoone heare woorde glaunce thinke themselues bee greate clarkes haue ynough therevpon ouerpasse according wee see muche experience dayes howe many haue eares stopped although woorde god dayly sounde foorth might partaker doctrine lyfe saluation yet notwithstanding make none account haue taste seene hauing vnderstoode small thing gospell doo beare themselues hande great clarkes neede heare vvhat number fantasticall lightheaded christian say vnderstoode truth thus many yeeres ago since knewe gospell knowe man may well eate flesh vpon frydayes man bounde shriue himselfe therevpon fall babling mingle cursed blasphemy slender thing know wote howe hilde skorne taught god schoole somuch see god doth punish men negligence wee ought take heede doctrine marke well howe salomon sayeth wise men shal grow continually wisedome hearing god punishe negligence ouersight men shall become theyr pryde shet gate wilfully agaynst good doctrine conceyuing disdayne agaynst swell like toades wise bee taught eliu hath exhorted wise men men vnderstanding heare addeth reason mouth sayeth doth serue tast meates eare trie iudge woordes hereby betokeneth disdayne giue eare god truth taught seeke confirmed thing haue heard already peruerte order nature become monster woorse brute beastes beast followeth owne kinde behold man whiche shall call himselfe wise hauing reason discretion created image god inlightened truthe shall notwithstanding gyue minde dayly eate drinke profit god woorde hath point comon brute beast bee nourished foode seeke man woulde excellent angle heauen doth notwithstading giue wholly eating drinking like beast meane season vouchsafeth vse eares whiche hee hath receyued noble pretious intent eating drinking serue maynteyne v transitory life serue giue v hope euerlasting life saluation man vse suche gift god muste esteemed monster agaynst nature haue sayde double beast see elius meening hee sayeth v freendes man refuse bee taught marke doth god created v hee gaue v mouth tast meates intent receyue foode dayly hand benefite ought esteeme lorde nourisheth v principall benefite hee gaue v eares also purpose taught communicate one another onely buying bootes shooes cappes bread wine vse tongue eares yet noble wit leade v truth meane god woord might know created incorruptible passed world heritage prepared v aboue shorte bring v vnto god fayth commeth hearing sayeth sainct paule seeing god hath ordeyned eares excellent vse lifte v vp heauen beholde god behold father witnesse vnto v hee receyueth v child sowe seede incorruptible life v middes corruption v seeing say wee may obtaine benefite eare shoulde wee play deafe men stop eares men speake vnto v tell v truth know saluatio ouergreate beastlinesse muste man boast perfectnesse wisedome vnderstanding cannot abyde taught contrariwise worse beast worlde haue shewed althoughe sentence selfe haue neede long exposition yet notwithstanding wee haue neede bee quickned styrred vp knowe see cace wee bee euery man busie ynough thing concerne present lyfe owne saluation glory god man cannot bring v thinke vpon vvee carefull ynough eate drinke onely dresse three foure houres aforehand also make prouision long time afore yea euen foure liues men haue greate care compasse transitorie goodes end may neuer haue want euer hand although haue inough find life yet beare themselues hand shoulde wante euen theyr deathe yee see howe gyuen transitory thing world without cosidering god hath created v brute beast haue giuen v excellent thing bodie hope eternall life looke seing nature brutish wee haue muche neede marke whiche shewed v wit seeing god hath created fashioned v parte v nother body soule idle al ought applyed vse wee ought make thing auaylable god hath giuen v seeing also buzied earthly care arre themselues eating drinking alwayes gluttony riot busie pinching gathering desire nothing heape vp followe theyr whoredome ambition get estimation credite worlde let v bethinke selues better seeing hilde fast beneath bee done let v indeuer turne away pluckings backe consider wherfore eye made onely beholde thing may serue life lust bicause fleshe liketh well chiefest cause behold god workes whereby calleth v wherefore eares made onely haue intercourse one another worldly matter businesse ende might bee taught come vnto god sticke wholly vnto atteine heauenly glory seing middes corruption body lorde hath set meanes bring v sayde incorruptible benefite namely giuing v sense hearing oughte put vse doo surely wee shall haue excuse nother must alledge manie men caste foorth namely skill god woorde high darke mee cannot fasten vpon yea wee distrust god giueth v witte discretion receyue thing saluation hath promised v teach lowly therefore let v distrust owne sens confesse wee wretched beastes inlighten v holy spirite let v trust promisse hath giuen namely wil scholemaster humble meeke instruct saluation suffer ourselues gouerned bring v right way hee hath set v hee make v go forwarde although wee bee nowe thruste yet hee set v agayne although wee fall yet hee lifte v vp hande thus yee see styll wee haue marke texte sayde onely eare shal heare say created heare also sayd shall iudge wordes matter eliu say lord hath giuen v opening eares receiue doctrine told v poyson end receyue doctrine serueth spirituall feeding soules like receyue breade wine afrayde eate drinke though wist whether poyson true must beware poyson pray god preserue v men foolishe starue themselues forbeare eating drinking feare least theyr foode bee poysoned skill meate disceme whether poysoned let v vnderstand lorde hath giuen v vse eares ende shoulde bee afrayde receyue doctrine bycause wee thinke high darke v behoueth v pray god giue v spirite discretion iudgement ende may apply thing profite whiche shall bee declared v worde therwithall gouerne v holy spirite wee may bee skilfull discerne thing good profitable let v fal downe face good god acknowledgemet sinnes praying make v feele may learn sory withdraw selues earthly thing contented visited hande maner way acknowledging selues wretched miserable creature deserue well bee vtterly ouerwhelmed yet forbearing resorte mercy assuring selues hee ready receyue v fauour therfore desiring make v co tinually tast goodnesse ende passing affliction worlde wee may ce e comforted reioyce blisse holy name fith hath shewed selfe father sauiour towards v may please graunt grace v c cxxix sermon whch second vpon xxxiiij chapter let v chooze iudgement consider among selues vvhat best iob hath sayde rightuous god hath ouerthrovven right also lier right mine arrovve greeuous vvithout sinne vvhat man like iob drinketh skornfulnesse vvater vvalketh vvith vvorke iniquitie vvalketh vvith vvicked sayeth man shall please god vvalking vvith therefore ye men vnderstanding heare ye mee god forbid vvickednesse god naughtinesse almightie cace standeth vppon yeelding account life muste looke haue iudge god notwithstanding appeale giue sentence v according owne knowledge vayne v reply wee shall gayne nothing howbeeit asmuche muche men rebellious finde theyr heart confesse god rightuous except compelled god vseth maner speach holy scripture cotented togo lawe v shall bee meane iudge agreed vpon betwixte v suche thing done ende shoulde reproued conuicted although wee might go lawe yet would auayle v whit hee speaketh maner prophete esay lette v chooze men sayeth hee iudge betwixt mee true haue said reason god shoulde abace himselfe farre meening shewe although wee libertie cyte pleade cace agaynste yet shoulde wee alwayes ouercome maner doth deale text eliu sayeth lette v chooze iudgement according hee protested heeretofore would afrayde speake forasmuche iob complayned god abashed maiestie hee hearing thervpon eliu sayeth go fray thee thou shouldest colourably alleadge reason thee come peaceably thee shall lawful thee speake thou listest thou haste thing defend thy selfe withall alledge bring foorth lette bee debated nowe wee haue naturall sense texte let v see howe wee apply instruction firste wee haue gather althoughe god haue power ouer v yet notwithstanding hee iudgeth v suche vprightnesse fault founde although wee leaue pleade cace yet shoulde wee bee put shame whiche hath bene handled sundry time heretofore namely god vttereth power agaynste v manner tyrante putteth difference betweene good badde intendeth trie vttermoste power god hath lawlesse power yee might terme power infinite doings indifferent rightfull true wee doo alwayes perceyue reason woorkes neyther oughte rightuousnesse bee inclozed within small measure vnderstanding yet notwithstanding behooueth v alwayes fully perswaded poynt god suche wise mightie hee dispozeth thing iustice vprightnesse furthermore lette v presume call lawe lette v assure selues wee muste thing yeelde selues gilty herewithall let v marke also lybertie pleade would profite wee shoulde alwayes founde guiltie although iudged v yet would owne coscience condemne v therefore let v learne humble selues god know hath power ouer v may iustly confounde ouerwhelme v yea rightfulnesse shal haue one worde answere hee cannot disproue list lette v nowe come eliutreateth cheefely findeth fault iob complaining plague greeuous vndeserued parte god peruerted right driuen lyer although deede hee wherwith iustifie himselfe yee see effect thing eliu chargeth iob withall lette v consider whether iobs meening haue declared heeretofore iobs meening directly blaspheme god howbeeit exceeded measure passion herken iob amisse knoweth himselfe sinner hee confesseth himselfe neither said god cause punish yet meane compared others thought god handled roughly thus chiefe thing wherein iob overshot himselfe conceyued rigor go thought bee ouersore ought haue pressed harde considering hee silie poore creature life strength nothing smoke herein cannot excuse haue told afore hadling good cace followed good order like aduersaries dealing euill cace vsed good argument substatiall reason therefore concerning iob although rightfull cace yet hee misguyde although hee pacient determined submit vnto god yet restreyne passion excesse like christen man indeuereth tame himselfe hold himselfe prysoner vnder obedience god canot perfection meane shall feele fleshe fighteth spirite good would paule sayth place speaketh fleshlye whiche giue themselues brydle euill haue best zeale serue please god surely setteth forth himselfe example saying although inforced asmuch possible mortall man frame himselfe wholly god yet able bring throughly passe temptation great violent iob impossible co stant shaken tickled suffer muche infirmitie battels wee haue agaynst fleshe vve see happened iacob hee wrestled angell therfore called israell say preuailing god yet notwithstanding halted fayne haue lame hip long liued ende might feele hee gotten victorie suche wyse feeblenesse example patterne v although god strengthen v power wee ouercome temptation yet done without markes infirmitie euen happened vnto iob eliu doth iustly reprooue heere yet neuerthelesse elius meening iob intended accuse god directly vnrightuousnesse crueltie hee sheweth glorifie god rightuousnesse ought truely hee speaketh roughly seemeth wrest iobs wordes make worser let v marke good reason holy ghost bewray vice v althogh seeme greate vnto v example iob confesseth generally god rightuous yea hee knowledgeth one eue person yet tosse roughly passion slipped say doth god punish mee sort reason shoulde might pleade cace would shew haue deserued shoulde bee violent agaynst mee suche wordes scaped iob without knowing sayde howbeeit man examine meening worst sort onely caryed away pangues coulde shoulde turmoyled passion skirmishe god vvhy doth eliu reprooue suche rigor bycause least doubt haue god rightuousnesse least disputing ca make blasphemie though seeme v let v marke wel holy ghost discouereth malady hidden ende vnderstand whensoeuer fancy come heade darken god rightuousnesse deface glory meanes although purpose yet horrible fault cannot condemne ynough nother venial sinnes papist make say man doubte god rightuousnesse yea haue many cursed imagination running minde yet deadly sinne cosent beastly doctrine yet among papistes men holde certayntie contrarywise let v marke well heere holie ghoste thundreth agaynste conceytes come thought although knowe contrary god glorie ouer although minde directly accuse god yet intangled wicked thoughtes passion tosse v fro peacheable glorifie god obey respectes cannot bee excused deserue bee reproued intended iustifie selues make god guyltie respect v wee charged iniquitie purposed mainteyne selues though faulte v ought warne v yeelde selues alwayes guyltie withoute disputing haue deale god although shiftes myghte bee allowed men wont also fall asleepe yet ende wee shall spyghte teeth feele god one woorde ouerthrowe long reply fayre colour wee shall pretende therefore come wicked thought diminish god glory make v doubte rightuousnesse let v learne knowe already entred blasphemie wee greatly condemned yea though thought passe away hand mind rest vpon agayne haue thought tendeth purpose accusing god onely intent iustifie selues blasphemie vvhat done let v learne confesse god rightuous condemne oure selues twoo thing cannot matche togither men go cleare themselues therwithall able glorifie god becometh woorthy god neuer hath whole right except confounded thing quite cleane dashed wee haue defence agaynste thing lefte v onely hang downe heades lo haue gather firste place texte neuerthelesse ende thing may bee better imprinted heartes let v marke howe eliu sayeth iob walked wicked howe dooth eliu accuse iob haue beene despyser god man disordered life seing heretofore protested walked suche perfection harde finde man like vnto wee haue seene hee eye blinde feete lame father fatherlesse bin shet poore suffered side acold curse house alwayes beene open neede bene freendly stranger although credite yet hee neuer abused although might haue bene borne place iustice yet walked simply oppressed person howe doth eliu accuse haue walked wicked according matter hath taken hand namely whe man replieth agaynst iudgement god hee walketh therefore let v marke well although man nother whoremonger theef drunkard murtherer quareler yetnotwithstading fayleth accessary greatest wickednesse hee glorifie god haue poynte pryde hee cannot submit himselfe god iustice rightuousnesse goodnesse yeelde god due honour wee wicked although reste life angelicall point ought marke well seeming man rightuous cannot charged worldwarde haue led vertuous life meane thinke sinne serue god humility ought vvhen wee haue yeelded neyghbours duetie god disappoynted robbed due must therfore needes rightuous still bee faultie robbing man deserue euerlasting death valewe fiue shilling rob god honour go aboute diminishe maiestie much haynouse crime robbery whoredomes murthers poysonings periuries thing world let v marke well whereas eliu chargeth iob haue walked wicked mente vice apparant worldwarde hee whoremonger theefe glorified god acknowledging rightuous rather contrarywise intended condemne howbeit directly hee murmured agaynst god reason torment miserie althoughe sayde impaciency mingled pacience yet notwithsta ding reiected blasphemie iob condemned euill doer heereby warned liuing without anoyance without working deceyte harme wrong neigbours must wise meane cheefe regard must god walke suche humilitie prayse may alwayes sound heartes mouthes may glorifie say heart tongue alike heartburning incomberance commeth mindes lette v yeelde selues guilty hand tary till condemned tyll god sende v iudges pronounce open solemne sentence v nother let v tary till thunder heauen lette euery v acknowledge euill himselfe mislike euen leaste flightest thoughtes enter oure imaginacions assuring selues bee horrible deadly sinnes herewithal let v marke wel god fayle receyue v mercie sobeit also readie willing condemne selues deale stubbornely needes dispute checke shal find end wilfulnesse shal serue purpose put double confusion wee see without cause god hath distinguished lawe twoo table shewe v seruice honour owe goeth formest followeth duetie wee owe brother seruice god therefore must foundation whole life must glorifie knowing ende wherevnto hee hath created v hee mainteyneth nourisheth v worlde afterwarde according bound one v another wee muste indeuer helpe serue neighbour without hurting man ye see haue remember text nowe also let v consider manner speach conteyned vvhereas eliu chargeth iob saying rightuous god hath ouerthrowne iudgement ment haue tolde afore iob intended flatly shortly accuse god ouerthrowing right let v marke manne doth precisely maynteyne owne right cannot without derogation god without aduauncing himselfe agaynst rightuousnesse therefore poynt well woorthie bee marked found v sometime bold say god hath ouerthrowne right herewithal let v marke well would faine rightuous enter extremitie according also paule speaketh glorifying god confessing bee rightuous hee haue mouthes stopped long men reply whet tongue maynteyne owne rightuousnesse must needes haue god aduersarie looke whensoeuer god afflicteth cannot yeeld confesse rightuous surely aduaunce themselues agaynst yee see haue wee haue god set himselfe agaynst v condemne v guiltie lifting vp selues agaynst accusing vnrightuousnesse vvee may well protest wee meening yet thing deede shall wee gaine denying seeing holy ghost hath giuen determinate sentence vpon thus much concerning first speach conteyned wheras sayde made lier mine owne right thereby signifieth hee admitted owne defence one iudge vnreasonable cruell would oppresse good rightfull cace authoritie lo howe eliu dooth heere vpbrayde iob blaming god sayd oh see pray must bee taken guiltie bycause god haue heare mine owne defence hee presseth mee mouth stopped alledge reason take place admitted iob ment step farre boundes howbeeit herewithall let v beare minde hath beene sayde wit acknowledge duetie simply one wee woulde say god vseth tyrannicall power ouer v procedeth reason equitie disposeth thing bicause bee pleasure although mouth vtter woordes yea heart quake thinking yet notwithstanding fully conclude defense v guiltie wee still enter pleading god wee must bee condemned defacers rightuousnesse touching sayd immediatly iob drunke scornefulnesse water ment dulled hee perceyued woordes hee vsed vncomely worthie reiected hee deserued bee scorned witlesse man yet notwithstanding wee haue seene iob spake many excellent saying yea instrument holy ghost wee may gather great learning thing hee spake seeing cast teeth hee drunke scornefulnesse water bycause mannes passion inflamed knoweth speaketh cannot must bee caried away sort nowe befell vnto iob pray shall become v pacience set downe rule haue tolde ende sheweth nothing better v abide good pleasure god chastisementes hee sendeth v whatsoeuer yet al accused shamelesse person drinketh lewdnesse fishe sucketh water layd charge rightly pray shall become v wee see selues hundred time impacienter hee needeth furtherance make v chafe fret agaynst god ought wee thinke wee worse dull wee see iobs persone holy ghost ment shew v bee aduersities comber v ouersore frayltie feeblenesse mingled knowe become gnashe teeth chawe vpon brydle straught neyther keepe way path haue marke streyne nowe let v come sentence eliu addeth accuseth iob haue sayd profiteth man haue walked god walking god importeth man giueth himselfe seruice god thinketh continually giue account acknowledgeth himselfe maner hath created formed gouerneth guideth cannot shun hand scape iudgement therefore must present eies shall see workes also thought lo walke god holy scripture doth purposely vse kinde speech bicause like coliers sack say make one black experience sheweth walke without hauing eie vnto god none v taketh libertie euill vnder shadow bad mean also giueth occasion neighbor euill insomuch day v giueth euill example meanes vice v haue owne therefore walke men wee walke horrible confuzion life like hotchpotch darke dungeon nothing discerned beholde say walke men done seeing walking worlde wee become worse worse euerie man draweth neighbor vnto euill foloweth fast peruerting order remayneth nothing v gather v vnto god frame selues wholy vnto sayd enock walked god bicause peruerted although whole worlde time corrupt might yet notwithstanding enock continued vncorrupted wherof came bicause hee gathered wit gaue himselfe bridle deale disorderly although iniquitie water floud vpon earth yet knew behoued walk presence god furthermore importeth also wee must regarde haue fayre shewes many thinke ynough praysed men absteyn euill worldward haue cleare handes outward sight ynough nothing worth except wee haue hart pure god therfore let v marke well holy scripture speaketh walking god meeneth purpose haue framed outwarde lyfe sort vice may appeare oure conscience also must agree therewithall bee cleane rid wicked frowarde affection thirdly walking god must bee frame oure selues wholy lawe lyfe bee allowed men wee flatter ourselues good intent nothing according wee see popedome suche imagine themselues deuoute thinke god verie muche dette yet bycause despise holy scripture leane theyr owne inuentions whiche haue buylded aduenture trash filthinesse therefore let v marke wee liue well haue right certaine rule behoueth v walke god say walke vprightly must frame thought deed vnto comandements vnto men deuices owne imagination thus much concerning saying let v come principall poynt howe ment iob shoulde say shall stande man stead haue walked god bicause astraught torment knewe god assisted hee serued conformed ruled life rightuousnesse true iob knew generally god rightuous must esteeme measure rightuousnesse present state worlde thing seene eies ye see also controuersie friend good men afflicted troubled worlde wicked doo prosper god hath higher iudgement whiche hee reserueth himselfe therefore wee must restraine vnderstanding thing wee see presently thinke god doth worlde render euery man whiche prepared much brutishnesse haue thought iob hath discussed cace alreadie meane hee ceassed dazeled whe came thinke vpon affliction hee caried away asked vvhat haue woon giuing selfe obeying god forasmuch iob dismayd started aside iustly vpbrayded vttering blasphemie shall boot man haue walked god hereby wee warned bridle selues whe behold thing done world fall imagination say doth god dissemble thus vvhy doth suffer church turmoyled vvhy great outrage done say let v bridle selues short imagine thing straunge asmuch blasphemed god true lord imputeth blasphemie vnto v howbeit goodnesse neuertheles guiltie person iob holy ghost reproueth v ende shoulde mislike blasphemie abhorre soone cometh euill imagination thought put away knowing woulde leade v greater blasphemie god withhilde v furthermore let v marke behoueth v much warer behalfe bycause see god seruants haue beene tossed tempest true ieremie asketh wicked prosper god fauoreth seemeth protesteth god rightuous iudgements rightful vseth preface bridle lord sayth know thou art rightuous yet escapeth vnshaken vvee see abacuk sayeth respect abacuk doth like therin sheweth restrayned feare reuerence god yet troubled mind dauid cofesseth hapned much vnto see said haue washed handes vaine giuing self rightuousnesse indeuering serue god hath beene lost time seeing dauid came poynt pray shall wee looke true reproueth himselfe therewithall confesseth foote vpon yee readie fall afterwarde addeth lorde beast man worthie bee called reasonable creature become vtterly brutishe like asse horse therefore lorde thou must holde strong hande else vndone seeing dauid confesseth hee exempted suche temptation pray shall saide afore cause also esay vttereth saying say ye rewarde rightuous common saying singular one exhorteth faithfull coclude fully resolue themselues reward rightuous say shall lose labor seruing god seemeth bee common saying yet notwithstanding prophete esay maketh singular one reason bicause thing order worlde shal tymes therefore faythfull owne vnderstanding vtterly dismayed saying dooth god afflict v rigour vve bee readie murmur immediately yea wee shoulde fall blaspheming god holdeth v backe declareth vnto v thing doth fauor vnbeleeuers although seeme haue forgotten v yet notwithstanding must assure selues pitie v middes rigor wil asswage stripe yea shall discharged hande bee ouerwhelmed hundred thousand time vtterly perish hee preserued v infinite goodnesse thus muche concerning thys poynt wherein iob condemned saying shal boot man haue walked god throughly perswaded bicause amazed sorowes considered god guiding ordinance ought true alwayes knew part yet condemned bicause hilde himselfe quiet peasable ought haue done hundred thousande time condemned learne owne iudges ende may acquit god sayd conclusion god forbid euer iniquitie god vnrightuousnesse almightie haue note summe elius wordes may take profite whole discourse shall see chapter behoueth v glorifie god rightuous summe whole chapter surely seemeth verie common neede speake bycause see man dareth denie god rightuous yet notwithstanding man shall hardly find one amongst hundred acknowledgeth god rightuousnes ought euen best fayle poynt say euen rightuousest shall bee tempted doubtes haue spoken vvhat shal become worldly brutish sort acquainted magnifying god haue giuen minde therefore let v assure selues whosoeuer shal haue borne away doctrine confessing god rightuous bee throughly perswaded shall haue profited greatly day twaine hundred thousande yeares hee liued long worlde howbeeit behoueth v consider sort wee shoulde confesse god rightuous truely matter cannot nowe bee treated length yet must speake worde open gap shall follow sort wee confesse god bee rightuous onely single counteruayleth reason v fully perswaded thing god doth good rightfull although know reason doth man acknowledge god rightuous himselfe able conceyue braine thing shoulde god subiect vnto v must fully conclude ourselues god rightuous bycause rule rightuousnesse insomuch whatsoeuer proceedeth behoueth v honour although finde straunge imagination although seeme v ought bee yet notwithstanding let v bee restreyned reuerence confesse forasmuch god fountaine rightuousnesse behoueth v think doings good thus ye see first place haue marke againe let v acknowledge rightfulnesse thing come imagination wise wee may alwayes beare minde god rightuous vve see wicked raigne haue ful scope greeueth v seeming god sleepe heauen hee remedieth thing first dash thinke doth dutie yet neuerthelesse behoueth v confesse god rightuous al thing againe bee troubled afflicted one good another person see whole church generall trampled vnder foot subiect tyrannie wicked vvhat said yet must still acknowledge confesse god rightuous seeing let v tarie till shewe v thing go vntowardly seeming let v assure selues disposing thing sort without cause vvherefore let v shet eye thing go clean contrarie lyking let v settle selues vpon said poynt say lord thou art rightuous content self thy rightfulnesse vntill thou make enter thy sanctuarie perceyue thou orderest state mankind sort truely shoulde follow mine fancie murmure yea repine agaynst thee see howe thing confounded heere forasmuche wee knowe thou gouernest whole worlde thine infinite wisedome iustice meete thou shouldest allowed confesse thy disposing thing sort rightfull although perceyue reason thus ye see ought practise lesson effect let v fall face good god acknowledgemet fault praying make v feele may sorie wee may hate wicked life past indeuer heereafter frame selues may receyue v mercie meane gouerne v holy spirite may seeke altogither please frame life holy seruice let v say almightie god heauenly c cxxx sermon whch third vpon xxxiiij chapter god forbid vnrightuousnesse god iniquitie almightie shall render vnto man according vvorke cause euery man finde according vvayes god vvill condemne nought neither vvill almightie ouerthrovv right vvho hee hath visited earth besides vvho hee vvhom hath set ouer vvorlde vvho hath builded turne heart tovvardes dravv avvay spirit breath shall flesh faile togither man shall returne dust haue lay foorth sentence seemeth bee meetely common namely vnrightuousnesse god euerie man confesseth fewe knowe fully perswaded wee bee rest god v wee desire easie v consent rightuous soone wee bee troubled harme aduersitie cumber v fall grudging acknowledge god rightuous wee done therefore ynough v protest one worde god rightuous cheefe poynt acknowledge doings bee good submit oure selues willingly mightie power wee come practising afflict v enter pleading discotented gouerneth v otherwise desire doth craue ye see wee ought consider text shewed v vnrightuousnesse god short vntill become much reason bee quiet obedient vnto god thing hee doth although thing fall oure fancie purpose iudgement wee accuse god vndirectly vnrightuousnesse hee gouerneth whole worlde nothing shall happen disposition ordinance power finde fault thing happen bending selues agaynst hath power let v learne submit selues god prouidence confessing doyngs good shall count rightuous yeeld due prayse wee replie agaynst fret finde fault doings asmuch wee blasphemed calling vnrightuous true cannot otherwise affliction shall haue heartburning yet must wee subdue passion holde prisoner conclude selues sith god wholy good wise hee dooth thing otherwise reasonably vprightly thus yee see howe wee ought fight agaynst passion rise v prouoke v aduaunce oure selues agaynst god nowe let v see howe eliu proueth vnrightuousnesse god sayth render vntoo men according woorkes make euerie man find according wayes ought wel noted knowe god rightuous himselfe bee done rightuousnesse shet vp shoulde knowne vnto v extendeth euery must knowne cheefly v vvill knowe god rightuous let v looke euerie v wee may well espie rightuousnesse considering world gouerned equitie fault founde surely euery man called right aray none shall haue occasion complaine men must needes confesse bearing infinite goodnesse punishing rightfull rigor lo wee haue gather vpon reason eliu alledgeth notable poynt haue sayde afore whereas speaketh v god rightuousnesse must imagine hee rightuous onely himselfe consider rightuousnesse becommeth v extende wee ought wit whole gouernment worlde wise god rightuous bycause guideth thing vprightly looke whatsoeuer see behoueth v allow rightfull bycause proceedeth meane sinnes men commit meane god disposeth thing suche wise souerain prouidence behoueth v think thing good proceede therefore v commeth examin let vnderstande couert pleade god neither god bee accused crueltie man say misintreateth must necessitie allow rightfulnesse gouerning guiding v furthermore wee comprehende
