matter throughly perswaded euery v must first search himselfe consider aduisedly one cause wee waywarde whatsoeuer god vnto v hee cannot content v wee alwayes malapert lift vp selues agaynst wee blinded vaine selfe soothings euery v thinketh himselfe rightuous bycause thinke vpon sinnes therefore haue skill knowe well owne faultes certaine replying agaynst god cease dispatched euerie v wil come humbly say lorde thou hast handled mee sort must needes acknowledge thy rightuousnesse glorifie thee vvee cannot beare beguile selues although wee haue thing replie yet wee alwayes lessen fault yea couer though neuer notorious forasmuch wee bee fast asleepe sinnes hypocrisie easie v lift vp selues agaynst god therefore men desirous acknowledge god rightuous ende yeelde deserued prayse true remedie first make owne inditement accuse condemne themselues bee hard matter acknowledge god rightuous sufficiently conuicted themselues hath misintreated done wrong chastising hath bin offence although hath vsed rigour towards yet notwithstanding hath alwayes borne goodnesse mercie thus ye see effect wee haue beare minde therewithall let v marke sayde god render vnto man according worke make euerie man finde according wayes ment though god punished breaker lawe hande mainteyned good shewe god dooth man wrong may well come passe happeneth dayly god beare wicked time seene hee maketh countenance men runne ryot euill seemeth thinke vpon see cause also harden wicked make bolder vnder colour god punisheth hande seemeth quite scaped discharged god doth alwayes punish euill doings hand nother doth eliu meene doth end god hath delayed long time prolonged term wicked length shew although wayted theyr repentance yet forgat misdeedes registred packed vp vpon great heape increase terror wrath delay therefore shall dearely solde vnto shall haue abused god pacience forbare punish first ende shoulde haue leysure know fault amend marke one point namely god executeth iudgement first day sort may perceyue eye recompenceth euery man according workes good fayth thing punish sinnes forthwith deserue vve would looke day accomplished worlde article fayth concerning rising comming iudgement seat lord iesus christ short neither reward good feare wicked rebellious also cause purposely sayd holy scripture god render recompence requite saint paule speaking rightuousnesse god sayth recompence day day recompence last day elius saying agaynst sentence saith god render hee presupposeth thing true namely behoueth v holde mindes stay vntill god shew v thing hidden v time faith say must exercised wayting paciently thing wee perceyue yet ynough v god giueth v token iustice sheweth v notable example wherby inforced feele hath eye vnto men punish offence god giue v record let v contented meane pacient vntill know thing reserueth thus ye see must take sentence applie vse second poynt god doth recopence euery man according workes hee also beareth punisheth sheweth fauour although one side rigorous make feele iudge howbeit v wit respect worlde god passeth punish sinnes measure deserue thing shoulde sende v disease wantes thing hee shoulde thunder vpon v ouerwhelme v first blow feele terrible punishment hee arme himselfe mightie maiestie confounde ouerwhelme v sinnes let v marke god punisheth sinner hande maketh feele vengeance full measure haue deserued beareth chastizementes wee receyue worlde god warning giuing leysure repent shall profit men wicked condemned alreadie bycause bee past amendment god hath onely framed theyr inditement also set downe condemnation readie bee executed whensoeuer hee howe soeuer worlde go wee consider well chastizements god sheweth v world nothing comparable vnto sinnes giueth v respite ende shoulde thinke vpon thus see yet one poynt wee haue marke text thirde god dooth recompence men according wayes hee reserueth power himselfe pardon listeth intendeth bring backe himselfe god doth punishe chosen pleaseth receyue mercie bee one owne free goodnesse hee burieth sinnes hee entereth intoo iudgement sayde psalme god hath libertie put away offence without punishing yet derogation iustice god listeth forgiue sinnes howe dealeth nourisheth euill v toucheth v sheweth v maketh v feele howe sore haue offended afterwarde giueth v mind sorie mourne sinnes vvhen touched repentance wee become iudges owne fault condemne meanes god hath executed office much manne condemneth himselfe hee condemned god gnashed teeth aboade still vnamendable stubborne wickednesse therefore god forgetteth office hee draweth v repentaunce hee pardoneth sinnes intent cocker v contrarywise intente double rightuousnesse one syde wee may feele euill wee haue committed side hee may make mercie shine vpon v discouer misery wherein wee till hee set v free therefore let v marke well god forgiuing offence chosen derogation al iustice saying alwayes true recompenceth men according workes maketh finde according wayes nowe wee see thing haue touched whiche glorifie god rightuousnesse behoueth v alwayes perswaded affliction wee suffer thing wrongfully god hath reason chastice v wee enter intoo quarelling wyth wee shall make cace worser furthermore let v vnderstand god doth beare v goodnesse wee haue alwayes cause perceyue wee exceedingly bounde vnto hee vseth extreeme rygour agaynst v ought finally let v vnderstande although make v feel vengeance yet spareth v although shewe himselfe rough sharpe yet doth hee intermeddle goodnesse therefore hee alwayes rightuous insomuche men shall gayne nothing thinke quit themselues best v see god calleth v allureth v come vnto wee fall feeling offence blowes come sorie mourne god may bee inclined forgiue v lo haue effect remember sentence according herevnto eliu greater confirmation sayth god condemne nought ouerthrowe right speaketh new thing ratifieth matter euen aunswering vnto alledged iob first therefore sayth god condemne nought say men neuer alledge hee doth wrong maketh beleeue haue done amisse haue according oftentimes poore innocent shall oppressed among earthly iudges charging thing nothing wherein faulty yet must fame passe way shalbe false witness face though righteousest man world man may oftentimes punished wrongfully without cause god iustice needeth shewe keepe great register proofes excuce himselfe slaundered men euery carieth owne indytement written well sealed say neede none iudge owne conscience though euery man knowe presently yet god waken v well inough spight teeth wee shall haue flattered selues long time yet must returne point conuicted namely iuste cause punish v cause also eliu addeth god ouerthrow right wee haue better shift flee startinghole god almightie doth list wee cannot resist dealeth crosly ouerthwartly v although wee speake yet haue wee crooked thought vnder colour god almightie poore fraile creature would make beleeue tormenteth v sore contrarywise sayd god peruerteth right say neuer punisheth men without continuall respect bearing according knoweth expedient cause spare surely would bicause knoweth meete let v practize well lesson humbling selues god whensoeuer chastizeth v let v keepe mouthes shut replie agaynst withal let v meeke let hypocrisie blinde v sooth selues misdoings thus ye see effect howe behoueth v condemne selues therevpon acknowledge god righteous punishing v ouerthroweth right v haue good cace mainteyne himselfe wee shall neede neyther proctor aduocate himselfe bee warrant desireth nothing much quit v wee condemned wee muste passe way acknowledge haue well deserued true well sayde ingenerall behoueth euery one v particularly respect owne person haue lesson well printed minde specially wee bee beaten god scourge one v pinched pouertie another sicknes third wrong done vnto side soeuer aduersitie come vppon v let v acknowledge hande god visiteth v good reason wee shoulde wee bee wretched sinner ranke rebelles wee must go aboute qualifie faultes say god punishment vnmeasurable though hee cause punishe v contrarywise thoughe hee shoulde execute muche greater rygour yea euen vtter ouerwhelming v yet let v confesse muche considering sinnes come full measure yee see sorte wee ought vnderstande sentence afterward addeth god hath ordeyned set ouer worlde besides himselfe albeit woorde eliu vseth dothe sometimes signifie visite forasmuchas sense one neede stande muche vpon worde bee short eliu ment say none god whiche gouerneth worlde hath fellow neither creator haue builded heauen earth hath hande guydeth gouerneth creature day nothing done without yee see effect eliu ment say seeme reason fitte mainteyne righteousnesse god mightinesse question besides haue touched alreadie somtimes vnder colour god almightie men would accuse tyranny though regard infirmitie weaknesse marke howe men take occasion aduance themselues agaynst god confessing almightinesse saying true souereine yet foloweth therfore hath good stay gouernment himselfe ought haue albeit men vex torment seruants yet seemeth hee passeth hath regarde contrariwise eliu intendeth shew god righteous sheweth onely sayth gouerneth worlde seemeth nothing purpose well considered peremptory reason term sufficient ynough stop mouth meeneth addeth immediately namely shall whiche vnrighteous gouerne true respect worlde wicked shall somtimes gouerne behold king borne woman come crowne heritage likewise prince bestow office vpon bawdes vpon men value well knowne maner one courtier else sell office iustice goeth wracke thing handled gouernors ordeyned electio voyce people feare god reuerence though ment ordeyne officer shuld raign iustice flocking tauerns comit shamefullest thing ca seeing king officer magistrate go election come degree diuelish meanes wicked must needes raigne god bicause naturally hath souerein dominion whole world due vnto chosen rascal woulde faine haue confusion raigne chose shoulde support euil nothing ouerthrow al good order common weale god chosen tauerne parcialitie briberie wicked practises hee called office fauor neither hath successio heritage though peeres agreed succeed mortall father none vvhat hee hath gouernment world nature insomuch immortall god authoritie gouerning thing inseparable sayd xviij chap gen abraham abraham reasoneth impossible god crueltie outrage iudge worlde sayth abraham destroy good wicked abraham sayth meeneth counsell god bethink himselfe one v might counsell mortall man moyses speaking iudges likewise iosaphat say bethink selues ye sit seate creature liuing god hath called throne whosoeuer sitteth must raigne man lieutenant god may wel admonish earthly iudges office may erre yea see men comonly swarue aside vnto euil hold themselues vnto good bycause wholy giuen vnto euill also bicause vertue stedfastnesse ought though good yet zealous indeuer requisite thus ye see earthly iudges neede put mind dutie discharge themselues ought abraham alledgeth vnto god iudge world codemne good wicked sayeth ende namely shew god cannot transforme himselfe alwayes rightuous well hee god nothing peculiar vnto god equitie wee accuse god vnrightuousnesse asmuch would make god idoll dead idle thing god gouerne world hath soueraine maiestie wise must need iudge iudge must needes bee vpright may nothing amisse according herevnto eliu sayth nowe thing gouerneth must needes done rightly vnrightuousnesse bycause hath created world mainteyneth vnder protection guiding thus haue true vnderstanding text remaineth gather doctrine fit instruction first let v mark well god hath created worlde leaue thing hauock fortune terme might gouerne hee intendeth mainteyning creature doth therfore call god maker heauen earth must restraine one instant must beare minde like god hath framed worlde power still hee disposeth thing beneath hath care v heares head numbred yea hee guideth footesteps nothing commeth passe foreappointed prouidence lo haue marke expresly said besides none set ouer world none set ouer earth betoken creating world gouerning thing go ioyntly togither imagin god gouerneth thing thing hapneth chance fortune followeth fortune goddesse hath created part world prayse due god alone beholde cursed blasphemie thinke diuell could thing without god leaue one make diuel particreator world therfore let v lerne inseparable bonde betweene twoo thing namely god createth thing hee gouerneth thing cause expresly sayde god hath builded worlde wee thinke hee nowe calleth companion helpe order creature true god doth vse inferiour meanes gouerne worlde howbeit diminish owne authoritie hee haue companion hee raigneth continually aboue vvhat else greatest king god handes hee serueth turne thinketh good according prophete esay vpbraydeth proude sennacherib thought himselfe haue made thing owne cunning yea sayeth god art thou else axe hande heweth man holde sawe knife cut withall serue turne pleasure toole turne selfe agaynst man shew man hath onely handes armes helpe himselfe withal also hath thing without comaundement power mortall creature liuing god holde nothing separated haue life mouing therefore let v vnderstande god vseth worldly meanes serueth turne men instrument lessen strengthen owne authoritie contrariwise shew hath guiding commaunde whistle sayth men must need go forward execute yea verie diuels hell compelled vnto although bee vnwilling vtterly agaynst intent yet notwithstanding god driueth violent power execute thing hath ordeyned prouidence see sort must consider god prouidence namely hee hath care whole worlde watcheth ouer al creature foresee may happen fantasticall person imagine god beholdeth thing aloof beneath prouideth afterward also much nothing may done hath determined rule thing thus yee see shewed v text therefore behoueth v minde well prouidence god intent aduersitie befalleth v wee may alwayes go first cause true diuerse tymes men shall v v wrong see howe robbed iob goodes men may spoyle v goodes deceyte violence may oppresse v slaunders wicked reportes yea man may bee wrongfully slaine thing behoueth v acknowledge god prouidence iob hath done set himselfe theeues robbed sayth lorde hath giuen lorde hath taken away yet notwithstanding satan bene worker iob knewe god made worlde dooth alwayes watch gouerne guide shewed heere therefore whensoeuer afflicted although come v wrong outrage let v assure selues god holdeth reynes bridle aboue haue v afflicted behoueth v receiue hand iudge may enter consideration sinnes yeeld selues guiltie hath bin sayde long since thus ye see haue marke streyne truely wee see wicked beare sway heere beneath let v knowe part god iustice vvhereof commeth thing troubled men attaine office wicked bryberie parcialitie purchase ende anon make hande againe poore people fleecing one deuouring another bycause god perceyuing v vnworthie bee gouerned giueth brydle satan ye see wrong raigne god scourge sinnes wee haue seene heeretofore seeing behoueth v consider prince iudges earth wicked god intendeth giue greater glosse owne iustice may knowne vnto v howe hee afflicteth v meane punisheth offence wee haue committed shewing wee deserue haue come neere v rather withdrawe himselfe v make v feele bycause wee disordered haue shaken yoke become wilde beastes worthie haue diuell raigne ouer v wicked men vnderlings setting vp wee see god deserueth bee glorified respectes whatsoeuer trouble perceyue worlde behoueth v alwayes come poynt seeing almightie impossible hee shoulde doo wrong hee worldly prince raigning men pleasure set vp wicked practizes policy nature hee god also rightuous rightuousnesse cannot bee separated mightinesse haue sayd afore nowe herewithall eliu addeth god turne heart vnto v take away spirite breath fleshe shall fayle shalbe changed dust eliu matcheth god mightinesse goodnesse hee sheweth bee gouerned god hande wee must needes feele good mercifull towards v perishe euerie minute houre needeth turne v dust bring v vtterly nothing looke god sayde god blowe vpon men immediately freshnesse chaungeth withereth fadeth away vvhen prophete esay speaking maner strength men likeneth herbe floure sayeth god breath vpon v hee sereth v vp blasting winde sereth grasse sayde song moyses true vsed another comparison howbeeit tendeth ende god withdrawe spirite breath perish according also sayde hundred fourth psalme agreeth moreouer text haue alledged paules sermon seuenth chapter actes apostle namely haue life mouing god seing haue longer pleaseth god shed spirite vpon v hee withdraw power must needes perish hand vve see creature continue longer pleaseth god mainteyne assoone hee withdraweth power returneth nothing conclusion thing wee haue touched standeth fast namely god mightie power heere matched goodnesse wee ought knowe neuer vttereth rigour agaynst v therewithall also spareth v bycause perish euery minute houre listed withdrawe spirite v v consider owne strength haue wee meanes preserue selues vvhat moueth god mainteyne v worthie inioy benefites bestoweth vpon v nothing againe pray bonde betwixt v furthermore oure strength vvhat meanes haue none must conclude cause god preserue worlde himselfe good fountaine goodnesse moued outward reason bestow great number benefites receyue dayly hande onely pleaseth make v feele mercie gracious goodnesse experience thus ye see onely life haue sufficient recorde howe gracious mercifull god towardes v although handled roughly possible pine away cumbred continuall trouble aduersitie yet notwithstanding wee bee conuicted onely breathing god maketh v feele goodnesse liue withdraw spirite wee perishe turne dust yet life precious thing whatsoeuer come thus yee see men alwayes indetted vnto god howsoeuer hee deale true poynt deserueth layde large howbeeit forasmuch time suffer shall suffize euerie v beare minde thing haue touched wee looke neerely selues acknowledge wee bee nothing esteeming god mightie power hee sheweth towards v ioyne goodnesse therevpon bee moued confesse namely submitting selues wholly vntoo beleeuing hee gouerneth worlde doth thing weight measure iust vpright workes must confesse bee although seeme straunge fleshly reason nowe let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement sinnes praying inure v considering knowing aright may learne confesse also condemne life euery v particularly thing v ingenerall exhorted therewithall suffer selues guided hand paciently receyue aduersities shall please sende v end may settle selues much vpo transitorie life aspyre vpwarde euerlasting kingdome wherevnto hee calleth v ioy felicitie shall bee truely accomplished may please graunt grace onely v also people nation earth bringing backe poore ignorat soules miserable bondage errour c cxxxj sermon fourth vpon xxxiiij chapter sermon yet still vpon verse vpon text added thou hast vnderstanding heare vvhat say giue eare vnto vvordes shall gouerne hateth iudgement shall vvicked condemne righteous vvill man say king thou art vnfaythfull vnto prince vvicked accepteth person great one neyther regardeth high lovve vvorke handes shall die sodenly midnight people shall take avvay perish mightie shall taken avvay euen vvithout hande haue tolde heretofore men heere put mind owne frailtie ende knowe god spareth wee abode one minute houre vpo earth ought thinke gracious turne haue life breath v haue god see maynteyneth v meere goodnesse seeing let v accuse great rigour hee haue iust cause roote v vtterly vvho hee coulde cleare himselfe god shoulde haue cause punishe yet meane wee see god preserueth world euery v kept still aray wee detters mercie farre hee vsing great rigour towardes v ought rather woonder pacience hee suffer suche iniquity thunder downe vengeance first brunt make cleare riddance v seeing ought man murmure agaynst wee thinke straunge hee beareth men hee may well replie agaynst v hee beareth v also therefore let v learne hereby glorifie god continually mercie lesse power although hee almightie yet notwithstanding hee restreyneth himselfe bycause hee loueth v also haue one verie necessarie exhortation gather text whiche knowing oure owne frailtie wee shoulde learne put life hande god thinke liue continue state owne power suffer god gouerne v pleaseth bee alwayes readie depart hence hee thinketh good take v worlde furthermore meane liue well knowe insomuch god possesseth v quickeneth v holy spirite good reason wee shoulde holde ende bee giuen wholy seruice liuing dying vvere doctrine wellprinted heart wee bee suche dullardes wee part men rise morning bethinke put themselues hand god fashion sake touched quicke knowing life little blast winde may vanishe away turning hande acknowledge much behoueth v remember lesson shewed v heere namely life shadowe vanitie therefore behoueth v put selues hande hee mainteyne v according good pleasure also take v worlde time conuenient wee counselled heere humble selues chalenge nothing selues owne power contrariwise wee haue whereon rest oure selues wee knowe life euerie man hande onely hande god keeper scripture sayth expresly hee withdrawe spirit breath wee die long god preserue v let v boldely defie diuell enimies true wee looke vpon rage men shall seeme rauening wolues wee sillie sheepe gape open throte swallowe v vp yet nothing v till god giue leaue without cause hee chalengeth reserueth himselfe power withdrawing breath hee hath giuen v therefore let v cotented assuring selues god holdeth life custodie protection vntill hee list take v worlde haue caused v finish course nowe man shoulde demaunde heere whether soules winde seeing sayd wee shall perish god withdraweth breath let v marke although men bee immortall yet notwithstanding haue themselues god free goodnesse besides else death departing soule bodie asunder god withdraweth breath himselfe hee sendeth v dust rottennesse yet neuerthelesse fayleth take vp soules kepe till latter daye short eliu ment shew weake transitorie also al strength nothing furtherforth vphilde onely goodnesse god hee vndoeth v outwarde appearance say effect hee doth thing determined hee thought good cause wee ought alwayes returne vnto content selues hath fatherly care v haue sayde alreadie let v like giddie heades trust owne strength thinke able worke wonder rather let v humilitie carefulnesse hide selues vnder wing god praying guide v wise may liue according eliu hauing spoken addeth exhortation saying thou hast vnderstanding hearken mee giue eare wordes sheweth againe beginning true wisedome yeelde selues teachable contrariwise puffed vp selfeweening receyue doctrine full owne seeming man tell suche vtterly past recouerie therefore without cause say first entrance foundation wisedome suffer selues taught let v loke selues see whether owne reason sufficient know discerne wee haue need nay contrarywise god telleth v wee brutish gay shewes men vanitie wisedome vtter follie seeing let v vnderstande wee haue need taught men handes god say might supplie want therefore whosoeuer desire haue well grounded wisdome let learne hearken doctrine profered name god let yeelde themselues teachable lowly receiue wee forepossessed pride wee may well brag crake afore men yea haue great reputation wise men beholde god telleth v vanitie leasing cause eliu sayth purposely thou hast vnderstanding heare mee hee sheweth man haue witte reason hee alwayes suffer himselfe taught may fare better life contrarie part must marke man stande stubbornly thing hee hath conceyued giue men leaue tel mind heare thing hee foole rather starke madde kinde verie madnesse man shutteth dore agaynst good doctrine weeneth himselfe wise hee hath neede taught refuseth thing setteth barre hee woulde say god shall come nerer haue good lesson marke text wee bee good vnderstanding must sheewe selues bee receyuing quietly thing spoken tolde v contrariwise let v sure god condemneth v fooles witlesse person voyde reason bee wilde headed giue eare thing men speake v reiect good warning say wee better brute beastes shewe wisedome soeuer bee v much know rude vnderstanding thing able know know part wee haue little taste vnderstanding come short ala perfection standeth v hande practise lesson life long therefore consideration thereof let v bee moued profite selues forasmuch god gratious speake euery day vnto v continue doctrine meet ruling life let v also continually receyue brought vnto v name still exercise selues ende wee may bee instructed wil behold say behoueth v practise doctrine therevppon eliu continue matter maketh comparison betwene smallest greatest saith vnto iob durst thou say king thou art vnfaithfull vnto prince wicked th haddest souereigne lorde reigned ouer thee thou wouldest stand suche awe thou durstest missebehaue thy selfe towards let v see diuelish furiousnesse men presume murmure agaynst god likenesse betwixt king may bee wicked maiestie soeuer hee haue prince gouernors wicked ill discharge duty yet notwithstanding beare reason state behold god whiche accepteth man person breaketh great one honored world razeth wel little one shewing well maketh none account loftinesse creature herevpon dareth open mouth agaynst wee see elius intent howbeit better vnderstading text let v mark although prince gouerners bee ought bee yet neuerthelesse god haue honored although themselues vnworthie yet hath god imprinted marke haue men honor say wel lord raigne thy name therfore behoueth v subiect vnto surely vaine triall authoritie rule like good father sawe eies thei none care gouern v well matter obey vve would respect selues obeying god regarding owne profit contrarywise wicked frowarde person haue authoritie ouer v see notable fault wee neuerthelesse mild hold selues vnder bridle yoke token reuerence god deserueth seing wee bee bounde sake obey whome sendeth whome ordeyneth superiours although bee vnworthie cause sayde lawe thou shalt rayle vppon ruler thy people god sheweth well shall bee tyrant manaceth people punishment saying expresly hee chastize sending wicked gouernours whiche shall seeke nothing pill oppresse raigne outrage yet neuerthelesse hee willeth men honour vvhy although deserue men shoulde acknowledge superior yet notwithstanding god haue receyued sake otherwise nothing worth ye see wee must subiect haue publicke power authoritie bycause knowe god humble v manner yea see child god haue bin faine submit themselues bondage vnbeleeuers god bring truely see also example daniell sheweth v hee acknowledgeth raigning wicked reason sinnes therefore must take scourge god cannot abide disorder wee striue mortall men heauenly iudge wee see effect wee bounde honour anie publike authoritie bycause bee aduaunced haphazarde god hathe ordeyned according written power proceedeth wee see anie disorder wee must wyte vppon sinnes therewithall forsomuch god hath stablished sayde order namely prince superiours shoulde bee obeyed subiect vnto must obserued kept among v notwithstanding whereas sayde lawe thou shalt speake euill prince thy people ment men allowe euill wheresoeuer bee ought dignitie man woorme earth ouerthrowe righteousnesse god ought sentence rather haue course namely cursed call euill good whereas god hath forbidden priuate person rayle vppon ruler make v liue peace without trouble yeelde reuerence seate iustice shoulde bee anie common weale among v wee shoulde become worse wilde beastes yee see whervntoo god eye besides wee knowe god sent prophetes giue king prince power doo euill man shoulde shewe sinnes rather sayde thou shalte rebuke mountaynes say highest state haue purposely set thee ouer realmes kingdomes sayeth god prophetes ende glorie bee cast downe shewe woorde cannot bee preached ought bee except preacher rebuke faultes defyle vnhallowe holie seate god abusing swoorde put intoo hande bee euill wicked gouernours must bee sharpely rebuked according deseruings sayde prophetes onely saint paule declareth wee also ought obserue like preaching gospell witte wee must pull downe loftinesse lifteth vp selfe lord iesus christ needes bee spared haue vyces vntouched bycause bee authoritie muste goe coyne newe gospell whiche number king oure dayes needes bee called annoynted holy yet cannot abyde haue sore touched meanes woulde haue libertie peruert thing man bee bolde open lippes wee neede go farre king prince euen manner nothing come anie small degree thinke themselues bee petigods needes bee honoured though bee laughed scorne worlde labour albeeit men see nothing newe promoted rascalles yet notwithstanding treade good warning vnder foote vnder colour bee little aduaunced therefore muste bee faine marke lesson giuen contrarie part whiche forasmuche softinesse theyrs aduaunceth selfe agaynste god bycause stoupeth great king lorde iesus christ v cace vse freedome god hath giuen v thus yee see meane obserue doctrine rayling speaking euill king prince wee muste muche v reuerence seate iustice bycause serueth procure peace welfare men auoyde trouble sedition yet notwithstanding suche doo amisse must bee rebuked highe state dignitie god aduauncing intent shoulde doo euill confounde honestie rather holde brydle restreyne thing confusion nowe wee muste god sake respect yeeld suche reuerence equall state v sauing god hath set seate preferment bee subiect shall wee doo wee come soueraine maiestie men degree authoritie soeuer bee whether bee king prince gouernours fayle bee wicked except god holde backe holy spirite cace standeth otherwyse god hee hath euermore soueraine dominion ouer worlde hee ordeyned wicked practyses hee set heauen alehouse knightes wote outlawes yet fauour brybing folke neyther chosen wicked men voyces might say hee beare v oute wee shall haue libertie doo wee list god came kingdome suche meanes neyther hee come heritage succession manner men chaunce inasmuche hee euerlasting god therefore hee also bothe king iudge worlde seeing hee dareth nowe open mouthe checke agaynst vvee feare king well done hee bee feared also wee stande awe oure gouernours good reason wee shoulde doo seeing god hath honoured whole worlde comparison holdeth thing hys hande hee needeth lay open hande holde worlde althoughe hee shette yet sayde prophete esay hee holde king gouernours whole multitude men one little graine dust seeing dare wee lift vppe oure selues agaynste vvhat boldenesse therefore needeth none euidence condemne suche chafe sette themselues agaynst god reuerence whiche beare men suche spewe oute iniuries sort god handleth owne lyking murmure saying cannot tell god meeneth meete hee shoulde plague mee manner vvhy suffereth hee wicked doo worst good bee turmoyled yet meane hee remedyeth saye man shoulde aske fellowes make suche disputation bolde cast foorth suche blasphemy whether durst go haue swoorde theyr hande rayle vppon spitte face say wicked dare would saye thou art afrayde mortall man bycause god hathe giuen little sparke glorie commest thou aduaunce thy selfe agaynste hathe made fashioned thee vvilte thou make accounte power whome whole world nothing vvilte thou checke agaynste like madde man thinke gette vpper hande vvhen thou ouershootest thy selfe sort shall bee thy confusion thus yee see sort behoueth v sende lift vp themselues agaynst god vntoo similitude set downe heere likewise euerie one v must owne accorde come wee bee tempted impaciencie surely temptation happen vntoo euerie man wee bee prouoked pleade agaynste oure lorde often hee doth wee woulde haue therefore wee moued vntoo let v thinke thus thou durstest speake agaynst king prince thy soueraine rule ouer thee feare brideleth thee bycause god hath imprinted marke maiestie darest thou lift vp thy becke thou wretched creature art thou sayde daniell god sheweth well prouidence king prince obeyed wee knowe nothing contrarie man nature bee subiection god gaue authoritie suche set publike state men woulde neuer obey cause expressely sayde god putteth feare birdes ayre intoo beastes earth men become vtterly brutishe yet muste needes keepe still vnderstanding suche aduaunced seate iustice ought bee obeyed yet notwithstanding verie small portion god glorie shall wee goe make open warre agaynste maiestie next way breake neck wee leape three steppe downe ynough brooze v wee leape oute windowe two strydes high grounde beholde wee deade would leape aboue heauen fetch gambaldes kicke god shall wee bring wee ought well consider infinite glorie god humble selues vnder thing expresly sayd accept person great without regarding eyther rich poore layeth hande vpon men rooteth one night euen strongest shalbe taken away hande vvhen wee heare let v vnderstande first suche greate muste truste rich credit knowledge thing else true worldwarde shall honored seeme able mainteyne themselues bycause bee rich haue well wherewith also bycause fauor thing nothing god therfore let man bee proude owne greatnesse suche stand gazing like peacock owne tayles run headlong owne confusion inasmuch flatter themselues become alwayes bolder euill kindling god wrath agaynst yee see great men ought put doctrine vre knowing god accepteth mennes person meanes thereof ought also looke trample little one vnder theyr feete suche vnder theyr power marke heere ende doctrine applied purpose tolde v god accepter person ende hee hath seruantes shoulde oppresse vse vprightly saint paule declareth hee publike authoritie shoulde haue regarde gouerning subiects know brother bycause v child god hath done v much honour make v membres sonne lord iesus christ let great men world learne absteine swallowing vp little vsing outrage towards let v learne absteyn aduauncing selues proudly agaynst inferiours accepting person god men trust shadow rich credite let v assure selues god iudge without regarde bee nowe yea damnation readie prepared shall bee forced feele part shape worlde whiche vanisheth hande saint paule sayeth heerewithall let v marke well howe sayd great small shall bee taken away turning hande god make bee wyped away midnight time folke giue themselues rest euery man seemeth ease yea strongest shall bee taken away without hande say without preparation god shall neede arme manie souldiours prepare himselfe greatly ouerthrowe greatest strongest hee needeth blowe vppon else turne away hys heart ende drawe spirite shall perishe hath beene declared heertofore hereby wee may bee taught euerie man owne state let great one knowe god aduauncing ende shoulde dispyse others vaunt themselues oppressing lesser sort rather let knowe muche bounde vnto god haue theyr owne seeing thing bee giuen ought therefore acknowledge whence come aboue thing let remember iames sayeth let brother sayth exalted worldwarde glorie lowlinesse rich honoured men skill credite glorie highnesse forget themselues vnthankful god throw themselues hedlong intoo destruction therfore behoueth looke neerly vnto themselues know haue nothing meere goodnesse god forasmuch hold behoueth dedicate themselues wholy vnto take occasion misintreat inferior rather stoupe applying themselues brethren slendernesse paule exhorteth v touching mean one true may well glorie greatnesse seeing god hath adopted child yet must therefore winke owne state specially whereas nothing worldewarde vtterly despised let acknowledge lesse nothing god sauing pleaseth preserue grace ye see wee haue one common lesson taught vntoo v therefore let euerie v calling learne referre himselfe vnto god holde life appurtenance thereof furthermore whereas sayde god wipe away strongest without hande ende wee shoulde learne put difference betwixt god men greatest prince intende bee auenged enimies haue neede arme men warre seeke meanes bring enterprise aboute god woulde ouerthrowe destroy whole world hee shoulde finde let hee shall neede craue ayde others wage men busie himselfe casting ordinaunce furnishe himselfe artillerie hee needeth none thing hee without man hande withoute worldely helpe without strayning himselfe say hee destroy hee needeth breathe vpon v looke sternely vpon v beholde wee ouerwhelmed vndoubtedly seeing hys looke maketh mountaynes rockes melt shall hee neede thunder vpon v destroy v shall wee able abide god looke casteth vpon v shall bee able abide breath bloweth agaynst v must wee needes vtterly quaile furthermore purposely expressed ridde v vaine fancy presumption haue wee bee well furnished worldwarde although men dare say sufficiently armed withstande god warde stroke hande yet doo thinke proofe thereof yee threaten riche man prouertie hee looke scorne say tush haue haue hee spight god open mouth howsoeuer game go trusteth still rich ye shall gaine muche hande perswade goodes shall warrant man strong lust flower age thinketh euer shal grow olde neither honor skill shame meeneth lo howe men presume themselues seene cheefly great men worlde stand stoutly god cannot tamed men haue fauor credit beare themselues hand haue bulwark god make rampire worldly helpes onely also man come tell faultes god correction haue place enterance vnto wil much heare short men neuer made humble force bycause vaine trustes wherein sotte themselues thinke well garded haue meanes ynough defend therfore purposely sayde god destroy strong without hand ende wee shoulde thinke scape thoughe wee haue furnished selues prouided long aforehande oure matter seemeth vntoo v god cannot come neere v let v ymagine vaine fancy god tell well ynough intrap v meane wee cannot conceiue destruction shall come without hande withoute inferiour meane lo wee ought minde sentence standeth vppon fearing god wrathe therewithall contrarie side wee haue comfort sayd god saue people withoute bowe withoute speare withoute swoorde withoute hande man therefore like wee bee taught humble selues knowe meanes worlde shall auayle v god enimie euerie v taught ridde himselfe vaine pride wherewith wee bee puffed vppe nature finally wee bee exhorted modestie ende wee shoulde present selues afore god consider hee turned away v hee could euery minute houre chaunge v bring v nothing pull downe highest v contrarie part bee misintreated oppressed heere beneath see great alteration tyrant become like woolues deuoure sheepe flocke god let v resort warrant god hauing promised saue church without man helpe put vre euen vnto ende although wee bee destitute worldly helpes wee seeme left vp spoyle enimies furnished thing may serue destroy v hundred thousande time yet let v trust mightiepower god whiche inuisible worlde vvee perceyue howe god maintaine v vndoubtedly straunge thing howe mainteyneth v daye ende wee alwayes confirmed doctrine wee shall bee saued without hande man say god vtter suche force yet hidden v wee conceyue shall please plucke v vvoolues throate mainteyne v nowe god must worke fashion preserue v temporall life pray shall hee saluation farre higher preciouser thing vvill god ayde himselfe man hande commeth drawing v hell deliuering v tyrannie diuell sinne aduaunce v heauenly kingdome defende v agaynst many temptation let v assure selues hee doth owne power owne meere goodnesse ye see one side behoucth v learne feare humilitie bee pussed vp vaine presumption despise god rather tremble vnder considering haue thing resist remedie present selues praying beholde v mercie afterwarde dismayed beaten downe let v come second point good chere bicause god hath promised saue v yea euen without hand man although perceyue done respect world let v therefore doubt hee performe saluation inasmuch needeth helpe letted accomplish promise performe shall perceyue trusting hath bene vaine nowe let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement sinnes praying ope eye may seduced hypocrisie presume aduaunce selues rebelliously may pacient eue aduersities shall send v learne humble selues vnder maiestie glorifie thing well ware resist wise neither hand tong redie frame ourselues peaseably good wil knowing alwayes iust vpright wee may liue whyle shall please keepe v world wee may consider life dependeth vpon otherwise fayle euery minute houre therwithall learne yeeld thanks pleaseth continue goodnesse towards v whereof wee vnworthie may please graunt grace c cxxxij sermon fift vpon xxxiiij chapter eye god vppon euerie man wayes seeth steppe man darkenesse dimnesse thick woorke iniquity maye hyde themselues god layeth vpon man walke god iudgement breaketh mightie without inquisition setteth others place bringeth workes light turneth night breake smiteth wicked place seer saw yesterday god list punish men needeth make great preparation arme men borrowe strength elsewhere hee coulde destroy thing onely looke therefore hee needeth serue himselfe man hande necessitie true sometimes hee doth shew howe thing subiect creature yeldeth itselfe seruice yea eue execute punishmets mindeth haue done yet needeth prepare long afore punishing v hereby wee put minde humble selues vnder mightie hande assuring selues way world fence selues agaynst v shall execute whatsoeuer hee hath determined owne purpose men may well exalt themselues pride ende shall feele power resist god folowing matter wee haue touched alreadie eliu addeth god dooth thing absolute lawlesse power bycause bee knoweth men wayes marketh step great chasticements happe mightie people ouerthrowne battel realme conquered let v assure selues god vttereth power without cause hee doeth iustice though wee perceiue reason god vseth rygour let v referre knowledge whole vnto whome belongeth let v content selues knowledge whiche shewed v heere namely wayes men knowne vnto howe happeneth oftentymes enter disputation god iudgements thinke straunge bycause see cleerely doth howbeeit forasmuch office iudge men wayes let v agree although see doth yet let v assure selues cace alwayes fall good rightfull seeing ought chastice onely particular person also whole nation countreys saying god marketh men pace taken two wayes scripture sometymes referred god promise bycause carefull gouerne v text also manie others sayde god beholdeth steppe bycause nothing vnknowne oure whole lyfe must come account therefore let v walke eye shall bee vaine v hide selues according also eliu addeth neither darkenesse mist thicke wicked bide themselues without cause thys added wee see althoughe euery man confesse god beholdeth workes must needes bee oure iudge yet notwithstanding men doo bleare owne eye consider god perceyueth surely naught sayde psalme wicked beare themselues hande god seeth craftinesse malice also vpbrayded prophet esay dig themselues caues vnder earth hide themselues god seeing hypocrisie doth blind men sore needefull marke sentence darkenesse thicke hide wicked god sight better conceyuing heereof behoueth v first remember haue touched namely men although bee sure shall one daye come iudgement seate god doo neuerthe lesse seeke startingholes therevpon ouersleepe themselues lurking hole though coulde beguile god see hypocrisie heerewithall let v marke men deceyue themselues shrinking away sort god bycause themselues haue lost remembrance thinke hee also hath turned backe remembreth misdeedes let v beguile selues imagination although discountenance thing time yet ende hee shewe hee forgat office iudge whole worlde onely bring euerie man work light also euen deepest thoughtes according propertie search men heart vaine chalengeth title therfore mark two point wee haue consider text one must bethinke v vice deeply rooted v wit thinke scape god hand startingholes drunken sinnes also thinke wee god hath eye shet blindfolded else hee hath curtaine drawne afore hee cannot perceyue thing wee hide howbeeit side seconde poynt let v marke howe sayde darkenesse shall bee discouered bee listeth therevpon let v take warning thinke selues haue made better market priuie naughtinesse cause sendeth many destruction go good men leastwise stop mouthes priuie wickednesse triumph dare spight god let v assure selues shal haue gayned nothing deceiuing world goodly shewes soeuer haue made ende wee must come heauenly iudge open bookes fast shet cause great day appeare intent bring darkenesse light nowe keepe thing huckermucker cause holy scripture speaketh often one place one tyme onely sayd darknesse god cause sentence often repeated bycause wee cannot bee persuaded wee haue eschued shame world wee beare oure selues hand god ought stirre filthinesse discouer let v assure selues hee make knowledge come euen vnto heauen seing wee cannot bee persuaded superfluous thing holy ghost doth often tell v god iudge another fashio mortall men doo adayes cause purposely sayd heere sinner shall hyde themselues eliu shoulde saye commeth dayly passe men eye dazeled take vice vertues yea euill minded dooth good bee flattered according see euill hath full scope condemning vice euery man vpholdeth may come passe seene experience vice shall reigne shall bee floud iniquitie thing shall bee turmoyled among men shall bee iudgement discretion yet must goe farre otherwyse god vvherefore let v learne lift vppe eye aboue worlde fayth beholde god iudgement nowe hidden knowing thing must bee discouered according saide daniell bookes shall bee layde open say recordes shall layde v vvhat maner recordes paper parchment owne conscience euery man shall bring araignment written ingrauen deepely shall bee disguising besides god himselfe shall bee person sonne light thinges shall bee knowne yea euen whiche nowe vnder deepe dungeon thing must bee seene angelles heauen creature let v bethinke v ende wee may walke maner feare haue done ridde selues hypocrisie wee cannot amende market flattering selues sayde afore finally let v learne make oure reckening withoute oure hoste often cace concerneth examining oure life let euery v cyte himselfe god presence therewithall consider sayde heere seeing office serche men heartes yea euen theyr deepest thoughtes purpose quitte oure selues nowe men bycause wee cannot thereby escape hande therefore let v learne examine oure selues sort furthermore suffer darkenesse bee lightned god woorde seeing poynte also attributed vntoo sayde sentence neyther darkenesse death ye mist thicke byde woorke wickednesse therefore apostle epistle hebrewes witnesseth like god knoweth mennes heartes hee haue worde bee two edged sworde cut asunder thought affection yea enter euen vntoo maree discouer thing hidden v sainct paules meening god worde preached wee must needes bee reproued though article written agaynst v whole life layde afore v wee maye bee conuicted vtterly cast downe ende glorifie god acknowledging howe greatly bee guiltie therefore let v onelye cyte selues god iudgement seate intent correct feynednesse also oft worde rubbeth sore rebuketh oure vyces let v take paciently presume bee willfull shall wee winne vve see many men adayes chafe frette vice bee touched woulde folke shoulde beare still one woulde god haue anie authoritie ouer bee theyr iudge considered well sayd would bee dull seene bee bee alwayes newe learne thing manne shew anye thing commonlye knowne scornefull may bycause neuer felt auayleablenesse doctrine darknesse god sight defyle themselues hanging groyne downe grounddwarde lyke swyne sleeping sorte shoulde seeme vntoo sinnes nothing notwithstanding number great may seeme bee saped yet filthinesse stinketh vnto bycause themselues rotten therefore would behoue thinke little vpon lesson would quiet whe men shew vice wonder see although many me wickednesse apparat world insomuche euen little child iudge yet notwithstanding aduaunce themselues agaynste god despise abyde rebuked shame speake thing vnknown neither stande wee vppon examination men thoughtes seeking vnder earth thing vnknowne men worlde seeth mischeefe doth ouerflow pitifull ayre stinkes yet notwithstanding good catholikes would bee taken good christian haue alwayes gospell mouth yea bite like mastie dog mad woulde men shoulde still dissemble thinke men great wrong discouer lewdnesse say truth discouered v onely spoken bycause men knowe yet neuerthelesse haue sayd cannot nowadayes abyde god lay open lewdnesse ende might bee ashamed repent shall feele end must faine come iudgement seate shall bee darknesse mist hide let v vnderstande greatly oure profite god doth nowadayes sende v worde inlighten v may well bethink v sinnes insomuch although wee haue knowne time yet maye come remembrance wee put thing vre whiche haue alledged oute saint paule cast selues downe ashamed god condemne oure selues feeling naughtinesse rooted deepe v beholde say god worketh saluation making v feele power affectualnesse worde indeuer examin whole life throughly ende mislike stubborne despise god come like straught men iustle agaynst cannot abide warning hee must send vnreasonable folke daye whereof eliu speaketh heere wherein shall darkenesse couert close shall layde wyde open yea euen creature cannot nowe indure god shoulde make ashamed ende burie sinnes euer howbeeit spight teeth angel men deuilles must knowe wickednesse must bee ashamed euery power light shall discouer secret thus yee see howe wee ought applie text instruction surely lordes threatniug men great daye ende shoulde preuent remedie readie v haue earst sayd god delayeth inditing v till wee appeare altogither executeth iurisdiction dayly gospell according also lorde iesus christ sayth holy ghost came iudge worlde therefore gospell preached doth god execute soueraine iurisdiction properly vppon men body bee day vpon soules hee haue v condemned welfare therefore haue touched alredie seing god doth much often warne v wee must ende come great light let v stil shet eye wilfully wittingly blinded sendeth v word discouer filthinesse shew v cannot hide selues sight let v profit selues meane giuen v daye wee play wilde beast seeke lurking hole still yet ende shall feele whether sayd vaine darknesse god make v beholde thing countenance glorious maiestie wee woulde see heere mirrour worde eliu addeth immediately lay vpon men come iudgement text dyuersly expounded take though god would lay burthen vppon man hee ought man coulde beare whole proces text well considered wee shall finde forasmuche treatise concerneth god iudgements eliu vpholdeth god afflicteth v sort may haue occasion pleade agaynst behoueth v alwayes consider matter hee dealeth withal man knowe ment sentence let consider cace concerneth thing groud treated therevnto must whole sequele bee referred thing bee considered generall grounde text men may peraduenture grudge agaynst god ende shall confounded although god seeme nowe handle v great rigour yet thing throughly well knowne mouthes shall bee stopped god shall bee glorified sayde one fiftie psalme let v marke well howe shewed v heere fayre pleading agaynst god cace shall quayle ende bee founde god hath handled v vnindifferently layde sore burthen vppon v say hee hath afflicted v measure although hee doo nowe strike men able beare yet reason haue deserued heereby put minde pryde rather rage v driueth v murmure agaynst god howe doo wee pleade shoulde seeme v iudge vmper whome hee bee iudged god make accounte bolder spight hee handleth v owne liking thinges come passe wee would haue let v learne men condemned diuelish pryde prouoketh pleade god howbeit behoueth v consider well god abace himselfe farre answere v wee summon lawe hee cace appeare oure counterpartie true haue declared afore hee doubtlesse come thither ende euen shewe thing tolde v heere wit although power cyte god make answere hee bounde cleere selfe doings might haue tung wil speake yet would stand v stead end come vpshot founde god hath charged v sore aboue reason bycause sinnes knowne vnto known tell measure chastizement wee deserue welspring whence pryde commeth would owne iudges iustifie selues hath giuen v great authority behold iudgement giuen vnto lorde iesus christ therfore behoueth v come al lowlynesse reuerence heare receiue euer pronounceth vpon v without gaynesaying euerie v beleued cace therfore graunt much god mortall men worldly iustice set iudgement seate muste bee iudge partie yet notwithstanding hee oftentimes iudge wrongfully men corruptible yet men chaunge behalfe touching outwarde order god hath set shall wee doe wee come glorious maiestie wee see also cause whence mischeefe proceedeth haue touched namely wee esteeme workes owne fancie neuerthelesse yee see heere god reserueth iudgement selfe belongeth sayth hee consider steppe doe marke search euen bottome meddle matter euer thrusteth himselfe play iudge taketh vpon dewe done lorde afflicteth v let v referre oure matter vnto assuring selues spieth many vice v hidde oure selues behold lorde true perceyue hundreth part faultes euen bycause blynde bycause shaped euill bycause deuill hath bewitched lord could first perceyue better iniquity haue committed thee yeeld self giltie neuerthelesse muche competente iudge consider myne owne fault yet thou hast done honour become iust iudge thy selfe put cace thy hande assuring selfe thou seest thing vnknowne lo expresly sayd texte although went law god yet bee founde daunger lette v presume pleade howe fayre shewes coloures euer haue men shall confounded take hand come god thus yee see effecte eliu ment say verse heerevnto addeth god breake mightie yea euen without inquisition put others place bring workes light turne night darke ende breake vvhereas sayth god breake mightie without inquisition ende make v feel better authoritie despize boldly bycause dull true steade word inquisition doe translate number sayde althoughe mightie infinite number yet notwithstanding god would fayle breake worde worde thus hee breake strengthes multitude men word importeth either afterwarde followeth shall inquisition muche worde inquisition signifieth properly search make inquirie doubt eliu ment say god needeth make inquisition earthly iudges muche creature ignorance therfore fayne helpe selues meanes prophesie thing muche thing open god iudge men withoute kynd proceding see common weales world yet eliu ment betoken god alwayes make v priuie executeth iudgementes shall blynde behalfe inquisition whereof speaketh properly referred vntoo god chastizing men sayde iudges make proces shall bee commoned forme style shall obserued men shall knowe thinges afterward sentence shall bee published men may knowe crymes offendour sorte conuicted must measure god mightie power authoritie law men hee breake without inquisition say without shewing v always publish sentence men offence shall alwayes rehearsed neyshal vttered punished shall hidde v yet meane ceasse put iudgements still execution nowe wee see naturall sense texte yet notwithstanding hee addeth thing done vniustly god sayth wil bring workes light although god punishe without inquisition say without suche forme proceeding requisite worldly pollicie yet doth thing reason vprightnesse bee perceiued first day let v tarie till thing discouered till bring thing light whiche nowe wrapped vp confounded together heere wee haue take warning wee flatter selues haue bene wont behold cause wee doe continually followe owne sway god seemeth spare v thinke wee haue libertie doe euill bycause vnpunished bycause god beginneth chastice v common maner perceyue forepossessed blockish fleshely carelesnesse afterwarde commeth great roughnesse dismayd know thunder vpon suddeine vvhich thing doth thinketh good hee hath borne long time hee needeth lift vp hand men perish twinckling eye hath bene sayd afore therefore end euerie v may stirre vp self earely late let v remember texte god make long proces punishing v bound law let v consider say must alwayes readinesse delay til smite v rather aduisedly preuent iudgement according sayd man happie hath carefull heart furthermore let v also remember horrible threatning wicked shall say peace goeth well v shall destruction fall vpon head let faythfull vnderstande god listeth punishe hee needeth beginne one poynt afterwarde delay ere goe forwarde worke mortall men reason let haue hee condemne execute sentence needeth trouble making long proces v wee shall haue leysure breathe vpon matter neither shall pine distresse till wee may bee quite dispatched hand shall bee confounded quickly heauen fell downe vpon heades ouerwhelmed god horrible vengeance let v feele owne faultes furthermore feele let v assure ourselues haue wherwith comfort ourselues leastwise sorie seke hide lay ope god sorowfully condemne may receiue mercie hand sayd quitteth condemne selues burieth sinnes haue owne eye willingly confesse vnto therfore let v doubt god wipe fault see confesse freely yea yet must passe way also namely beare mynde saying god punisheth without inquisition end euerie v dutie entering examining life throughly may ashamed humble selues nowe sayd god hauing broken great mightie men doth put place againe side sayd hee punisheth open sight yea punisheth offender haue sayd alreadie whereas said god discouereth workes punisheth sort end alwayes stand awe god iustice imagine hee vseth tyrannie crueltie therefore let v kepe v surmising power god shuld vttered without reason true reason holdeth vnknown vnto v must cotented onely single rule right howsoeuer world goe let v wickedly imagin god dealeth crossely ouer thwartly iudgeth otherwise reason contrariwise let v fully beleeue althoughe iudgementes seeme strange vnto v yet ordered best rule wit surmounteth rightuousnesse thing eliu declareth texte ought serue cheefly v man bee afflicted owne person ought alwayes consider god rightuous end may repent fault shal neuer haue true repentance except know god afflicteth v iustly neyther glorifie god confesse rightuous except haue first condemned selues haue sayd thus ye see must apply oure selues doctrine god discouereth men workes bringeth light hee punisheth verely although examine word worde sinnes offence haue committed yet notwithstanding chastizement whiche god sendeth v ought profite v behalfe therfore sayd god punisheth instead wicked say sort wicked signifie winne nothing replying alledge thing cleere themselues specially seeing appeere cleere men mark one point another sayth putteth others place end know cause chaunges happen oftentimes worlde according also sayd hundred seuenth psalme right exposition sentence vvee straught wee see plague vnpeople countrie happen famine land hath bin fruteful becommeth barren salte bin sowne vpon else thing troubled warres countrie layd waste prince therof changed see thing astonished know god prouidence raigneth aboue worldly meanes neither thinke vpon men considered sort men behaued theselues would thinke strange god make suche chaunges alteration thus ye see expresly sayde god putteth place namely end wee see thing change worlde wee shoulde thinke noueltie therin god sheweth iudge let v father vpon fortune let v assure oure selues god doth vtter arme bycause men mainteine selues possession benefites bestowed vpon therevpon let v consider vnthankfulnesse may amend sone lord hath made v fatte set v vp welth byandby wee turne selues kicking like horse much pampered wonder god layeth hand vpon v seeing proude vnthankfull let v marke modestie men nowe adayes vvhen god doth good behaue selues may possesse long contrariwise spight god ende bereeue seing pride vnthankfulnesse heydous haue sayd must grudge change thing great number alteration prouoke god vnto howbeit inough knowe god taketh away one people putteth another place setteth newe inhabiters countrey remoueth men sort ynough say knowe thing yea hee doth iustly also euen wee best state let v praye graunt v grace inioy benefit wise wee may still possesse bee guided euerlasting heritage prepared v heauen thus yee see ought put sentence vre rest shall bee reserued till tomorow let v fal downe face good god acknowledgement sinnes praying receyue v mercie therwithall hath humbled v vnder mightie hand made v feele iust correction amedment indue v gracious gift holy spirit increase v till fully refourmed glorious image righteousnesse maiestie let v say almightie god heauenly father acknowledge c cxxxiij sermon sixth vpon xxxiiij chapter striketh vvicked place seer bicause haue turned avvay haue considered vvayes make crie poore come vnto make heare outcrie afflicted vvhen sendeth quietnesse vvho make trouble vvhen hideth face vvho shall see vvell vpon nation vpon man saw yesterday sort god punisheth offender without inquisition yet notwithstanding hath iuste reason doo cause blame nowe eliu addeth purposely doth place seer vvherein sheweth v god iudgements ought throughly knowne vnto v euen instruction god punisheth sinner intent euery man know offence haue committed intent take example according sayd iustice commeth vpon earth god doth execute punishment correcting well notorious offender men nought saying added god chastiseth offender sight men place seer looker hereby warned take better heede wee haue done noting marking god iudgementes great fauour sheweth v teacheth v men harmes wee shet eye play dullardes excuse haue therfore oft god punisheth sinnes let euery man thinke vpon owne cace let v receyue common instruction end correction lost among v surely cause one hath bene chasticed euery man must haue turne could profite selues god sheweth v punishment one man might serue instruction fiue hundred yea thousande asmuch wee lette warning slip god giueth v make account therefore euery one v called course must answere owne person punished offence see vnthankefulnesse sayde god punisheth wicked breaketh peeces sight men wee well skill talke thing whiche shall sayde although wee see reporte taking towne sacking discomfiture like thing newes shall caried abroade men debate much wee wel discourse thing see eye meane purpose dothe serue v wee learne forethinke v faultes humble selues god wee followe still owne trade although wee bad whome god visiteth correcteth roughly yet wee beare selues hand blowes shal neuer come v see ye exceeding great intollerable vnkindnesse much behoueth v marke well tolde v god punisheth offender secretly man might perceiue correction openly v might fare better long selues god shold set vp scaffold execute chasticements vpo could perceyue euidently blindnesse behalfe commeth owne wilfulnesse vnkindnesse haue sayde afore marke one poynt reason also sette downe namely bycause turned away considered wayes ouer besides wee haue seene already god striketh men wrongfully punish sinnes shewed v welspring euils wit withdrawing selues fro fountaine righteousnesse life ought ruled wee obey god seeke walke presence therefore man gone away fro cannot run confusion cause men destruction haue profitable lesson text shewe v may keepe selues fro going destruction holding selues shet vp vnder god wing clinging vnto obey wee haue wisedome v thing wherein welfare lieth contrarywise wee forget god wee scape hand lyfe stray wee vndone damnation backes sayd god open sight terrible maner punishe run away lette v marke well eliu speaketh bene brought vp lawe prophet bene taught doctrine god familiarly heathen small taste light yet notwithstanding much gaue themselues vnto euill sayd withdrawne god although neere vnto vnto whome giuen lawe yet notwithstanding wee must holde generall rule muche god hath set v world created v owne image according order nature ought tende vnto make marke ame therefore run astray giue lustes bridle raigne ouer v turning away god euen ought al one sort eliu blameth paynim turning away god albeit doctrine lawe yet instruction haue spoken according also saincte paule declareth seconde romaine namely needed paper wryting shewe one god difference betwixt good euill euerie man hath written heart nowe heathen menne condemned straying awaye god withdrawing selues obedience shall become v whome god familiar without comparison god thought ynough haue created owne image haue printed therein knowledge good euill hee hath also giuen v worde haue published vnto v dayly hee sheweth v familiarly waye moyses protesteth wee stray haue excuse ignorace behold rest sayde prophete esay therfore seeing oure way layed afore v wee knowe whiche way take yet notwithstanding euerie man start aside take leaue euill wander owne affection lustes much worthy blame neuer hearde one woorde good instruction heathen men called backslider bycause turned away god seing god commeth neere vnto v dutie scholemaster teacher among v entertain v schoole end shuld learne hande person whome appoynteth preach worde name therefore wee make account doctrine giuen v must condemned double renegates backslyders yes surely let euerie v looke neerely consider value estimation grace god hath owne mouth open warrant v thing good conuenient saluation seeing haue although wet finger say yet let v assure selues despise blessing god muste needes bee withdrawing selues much seeing haue worde dayly preached sermon may also haue lecture besides hold v awe make v sticke throughly god indeuer serue needes must vttered much roughly terrible vpo v tha vpon order nature guide aright thus much concerning poynt sayde immediately considered wayes vvherin signified vnto v men neuer ignoraunt vnskilfull naughtinesse ynoughe make giltie bereue shift god heere hath bene declared alreadie eliu speaketh generally whole worlde hee iewe might haue lawe haue spoken like yet notwithstanding hee sayth whome god hath giuen naturall wit hee giuen men considered wayes hee sayeth doone amisse erred bycause could better bycause light doctrine howbeit might haue beene sayde heere spirite god ment vrge men ende knowe condemnation iust could alledge cloke done amisse throughe ignoraunce wante one gouerne whereas themselues good vpright mynd men pure hartie desire come vnto god surely would faile side vndoubtedly promise shal disappoynt men knocke gate shall bee opened vnto seeke shall finde wee see men doe raunge ouer feeldes run astray let v mark haue pure rightmeening mynde goe vnto god true maye well haue shew deuotion see among papist many seeme bee best mynded world likelyhoode vtterly rauished deuotion godward man loke narrowly vpon doings shall finde hypocrisie god doth giue bridle sort without iust cause ye see thing haue marke texte althoughe wretched paynimes dwell darknesse may likened blind men grope se way haue nothing grosse ignorace yet notwithstanding excused maliciousnesse stubbornesse wilfull turning away good vnto euill euen set purpose written considered way god thinges wyted vpon brute beastes vpon stone whiche haue vnderstanding therefore must bee concluded whiche rude barbarouse euen say haue refuzed go right good desire bene lefte destitute god grace yet therefore sayd able well abilitie v wee bee able seeke god wee intreate matter papist make conclusion shewe themselues starke beastes said men sin ignorance certain wilfulnesse papist conclude seing foloweth haue sufficient reason gouerne selues well wee bee cleeresighted bee short haue freedome good euill great beastlynesse reason manner thing vnable matched togither men shoulde haue eye piked bee able see discerne thing yet therewithall also altogither wicked therefore neuerthelesse conuicted haue considered god wayes haue bene led right way caryed away pride ye see wise ought match one namely reason sinne al v bereft reason vnderstanding see heritage haue father adam myndes combered confounded discern thing oure welfare drawe cleane according sayd euen light turned darkenesse vntill god inlighten v holie spirite yet neuerthelesse oure ignoraunce suche wee bee corrupted oure affection wype goodnesse whiche god might put intoo v bycause nature froward therfore enemy vnto god oure thoughtes imagination enmity rightuousnesse according sainct paule speaketh eyght romaine wee ignorant yet meane whyle ceasse frowarde vvee knowe way go yet therewithall goe astray wilfully mynde come vnto god wee must fayne bee inforced thyther else must inspire v grace inlighten hart full rebelliousnesse vntill suche time god hath reformed v surely wee alwayes shet eye may see wayes bee spoke meanes god giueth vnto v shall become v behoueth v come backe againe point haue touched sayde euen heathen men excused turning awaye god therefore muche double backslyders say god drawne vnto nowe bee sayde heathen men haue regarded god goodnesse lyued walked accordyng godlynesse praye cace wee whiche haue farre knowledge gyuen vntoo lorde poynteth v finger way shall go texte alledged moyses namely way walke therein greate importaunce take heauen earthe witnesse sayeth hee daye haue shewed life death goe amisse yee shall bee withoute excuse god appeareth seeke owne destruction muche god teacheth graunteth prerogatiue declare vnto one put way handes refuse choose death nowe men make suche choyce must needes become starke diuels protestation moses ought perce hart make v bethink selues better sith see lorde setteth doctrine v whiche behoofe glasse liuely picture let v playe blynde bleare eyde folke nother let v drawe curten v intent bee ignorant wee ought knowe whereas deede thing manifest ynoughe vnto v heerewithall let v mark god speaketh v leaue v doubt wee knowe wordes ment contrariwise ende wee shoulde receyue good doctrine instruction worde another poynt well worthy marked many pretend god word deepe men cannot tell take followe accusing god mocked v putting v hope deceiue v therfore let v marke wel god speaketh end receiue good doctrin wee become wise skilfull followe thing good according sayd word god giueth wisdome ignorant knowing owne slendernesse may yeld theselues vnto shall alwayes find sayd vse owne profite worde god wee haue wisdome desirous goe forwarde right way saluation keepe v man turne aside bycause hath considered god wayes said hath erred want better abilitie contrariwise cause al euil ought wyted vpon yet one saying noted speaketh wayes god vvherein wee aduertized ynough v content v parte serue halues must throughly wholy frame liues altogither giue eare al saith submit man selfe without exception come one end vndoubtedly two commaundements inseparable like god cannot deuided also let v marke rightuousnesse deuided vvhat maner one rightuousnesse god hath comprehended whole lawe saith man shall absteyne whoredome nother hath forbidden theft nother hath codemned murther hath ioyned ten commaundements togither haue men hold one man obey god chastitie another absteining fro fleecing neighbour third keeping himselfe dooing wrong violence taking leaue hurte harme men rending god rightuousnesse peeces said al commaundements inseparable holy bond ought bee kept vnbroken let v marke well blissed god must take good heede one part wayes thus ye see eliu ment note heere heereby see euerie man ought bee diligent looking himselfe therefore intend examine life wel square work thought haue sound outward actuall sinne v let v proceede see whether wee haue wicked affection thervpon let v learne condemne selues pray clenze v euill feele selues lo howe ought practize sentence furthermore shewed v also men haue begon ouershoot themselues run astray become euerie day worsse till haue renounced god quite caste vp vve malicious giue selues ouer al vice first day shall hild feare god take liberty runne rouers god happen winke sinnes iniquity satan taketh possession soules body thenceforth carieth v away wise become vtterly vnrecouerable ye see men haue left frame themselues wholly god wil giue themselues soudnesse simplicitie appayre consideration greeue god one sinne meanes caces vtterly reiect al wayes furthermore wee see heere yet better afore howe rightfull god iustice chastizing v done amisse rebelled still god ranne away taught good gaue themselues ouer vnto euill wittingly willingly high time god set hande correcte nowe neuer seeing let v alwayes fully persuaded god neuer punisheth v till haue bene much prouoked anger wee haue deserued long time afore bee thundred hand therefore followeth hath wincked v ende wee must needes come conteyned namely open sight notable fashion hee breake peeces turned awaye lo wee haue beare away sentence sayd immediatly make crie poore come vnto make heare exclamation afflicted heere eliu noteth one kynde sinne whiche god punisheth men true wee offende many wayes howebeit much men bee brought knowe faultes vntill conuicted eliu hath set downe kinde sinne apparant easiest bee seene outrage extortion committed one man polleth another goodes greeued haue redresse crye oute vnto god men heare complaintes euerie bodie rueth abhorreth cace thus yee see one kynde wyckednesse whiche well known great small see iustice might ouercommeth right wee dwell among theeues hee listeth make hand pillage taketh thought hath done wickednesse bee bycause redresse order taken vvhen suche thing happen euery man speake cause holie ghost hath chozen sinne notorious intent better conuicted herewithal let v marke vnder one kynde whole comprehended wise euer offend god hath alwayes iust cause punish v haue declared alreadie law cannot deuided must continue whole one comaundements must knit togither al may make one rightuousnesse howbeit much hypocrite euery man writheth like snake intent hide sinnes god intendeth draw v force compell v confesse dette poore man haue wrong outrage done vnto hee aske vengeance partie coplaints shall come abroad ayre shall ring seeing thinke hidden god think let slippe done first haue said alreadie let v marke although man world complayne v yet sinnes crie againste v sounde offence mount vp heauen thing bee remoued wee see maketh great noyse wee breake rightuousnesse god wee ouerthowe house thinke ther anything precious order god hath stablished make v walke according vve goe destroy sayd ouerthrowe building thinke noyse commeth eares god let v marke well oft breake god lawe crie mounteth vp vnto heaue sinnes aske vengeance v although men bee dumme open mouthes say thing yet sinnes fayle bee registred god lo haue marke first place men themselues crie v euill spoke oure wickednesse heare complaintes grudgings much reason thinke god heareth cry let v euery way marke nought sayd crie sodome come vp vnto therfore come see whither let v assure selues lord eares deaf offence shuld alwayes come knowledge neuerthelesse cry vpon v confusion must needes note truth haue touched already thing smal waight go sort ouerthrow thing lord hath stablished good sooth rule good life image god shining amongs men wee goe ouerthrowe pray confuzion howbeit let v mark way god leaue vnpunished haue wrongfully vexed troubled poore true great one wexe bold see poore men destitute succour releeued haue freends kinsfolke sticke therevpon seemeth vnto may doe list cause fall outrage let v marke howe sayd god hath care therfore poore folk left vp al wrong man succoreth much doth god declare hee hath care reuenge well considered would bee lesse hastie trouble neighboures specially make part good breaking protectio hath set vpon person end wee must feele aduersarie see pore man let v stopped harme violece outrage god step althoughe poore man beare paciently wrong done yet shall crie misse come vp heaue heard god hande like doctrine ought serue warning euery v may bridle abstein fro euil also poore ought well comforted sith see god hath protection though wicked trouble vex yet god bridleth rage watcheth ouer poore end shewe neuer forgate seing god taketh quarell vpon let v refer vnto let assuage sorowe greef wrongfully afflicted men doe eate vsvp haue remedie seeme sheepe wolues throate go lorde hath promised crie extorcions men doe shall come vp seeing wee haue buttresse let v contented tarie till hee shewe effect neere v hath care welfare lo howe wee ought practize sentence followeth god giueth rest shall make trouble hideth face shall see well vpon man vpon nation eliu ment represse iobs person quarels wee make god wee would controll doings yea wee woulde couenaunt hee gouerne v owne liking truely say yet meane seene haue pryde v vvhat man could finde heart abace maiestie god ende thing might fall owne liking wee discontented god doth otherwise wold wish much would put barre say intend thing shall go ye see nowe sayd god giue rest make trouble hide countenaunce see nowe rest god giueth diuers sortes faithfull haue rest whereof scripture speaketh leane vnto god put trust goodnesse doubt gouerneth heerevpon may sleepe ease according prophet speaking thereof sayeth euerie man shall sleepe vnder figge tree vnder vine hee god custodie shall knowe peace verie frute faith holie scripture sayth yee se cheefe rest men haue inioy commit themselues god prouidence respecte fatherly care ouer say god commit life vnto thee thy hand order thou thy pleasure meane time kepe course marke one point besides also another rest god doth spare wicked outwardly although beat within conscience alwayes gnawe according said prophet esay although sayd thought like waues beating one another yea sinke filthy within bicause vnbeleefe must alwayes bring vnquietnesse yet notwithstanding god casteth sleepe bycause hee doth punishe oute hande sayde god giue rest shal make trouble hereby shewed v god deferreth prolongeth punishment wicked wee must ouerhastie wee shall gaine nothing pleade god say doth punishe offender hande much trouble whome god haue rest therefore let v learne submit selues paciently god beware wee runne heade sort sayd becommeth anye mortall creature make trouble god haue quietnesse therewithall let v vnderstand purpose haue bodily prosperitie except wee haue god fauoure feeling thereof maye make v quiet heartes againe haue quietnesse let v vnderstand belongeth god giue v peace w r hand giue trouble quietnesse listeth tra sitorie state world much hath spirituall rest far greater excellenter let v consider lyeth v quiet oure selues wee bee trouble wee muste resorte vntoo god singular inestimable treasure commeth holde v quiet wee may alwayes middest turmoyles worlde abyde still vpon feete tossed great stormes tempestes yet neuerthelesse wee may haue anker fastned hold still owne say singular priuiledge god giueth child combred full anguishe trouble perplexitie bee done let v take v settlednesse knowing abideth within v true must alwayes seke mean god offereth v keepe v indeuer attaine howsoeuer world go let v fully resolue v onely god office quiet v deliuer v al vnquietnesse thing haue marke although faithfull haue sayde peace bee quiet midst affliction misery world yea betake selues vnto god tempted distrust yet let life subiecte much vnquietnesse therefore let v storme thoughe please god turmoyle v sayde hee handle v worlde wee must bee tossed fro yet wee must hold selues fast bee vtterly shaken downe temptation lo wee haue remember sentence contrarie part sayde god hide face see heerein wee warned v searche farre aforehande god doth wee must content selues knowledge hee sheweth v vvhat face countenaunce god shape like vnto man visage whiche hath nose eye mouth face god record giueth v knowe wil god therefore sheweth v face hee telleth v hee doth thing one wee sawe oure eye contrariwise hee hideth face v afflicteth v thinges seeme straunge v wee knowe reason hee worketh sorte therefore god holdeth v ignorance hiding face v let v marke well sayd may well straine selues see wee shall neuer attayne diuelish presumption men doe enter disputation god workes storming chasing god thing otherwise thinke good desiring frame euen though woulde looke vpon whither hee hee hydeth himselfe thoughe would pull downe may bring passe bee done wee may take profite saying truely lesson deserueth bee layde foorth large howbeeit time intent matter broken let v marke whensoeuer pleaseth god shewe himselfe vnto v behoueth v knowe consider workes sheweth v attentiue mark reason doth hee worketh straunge fashion vnknowne v let v reuerence secret acknowledging neuerthelesse alwayes rightuous howe euer world go let v dwell continually beleef hold v quiet wayting paciently til shew v fully thing hidden v assuring selues life knowing muste onely part nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement sinnes praying make v feele time oure life wee maye mourne desiring forgiuenesse acknowledging selues exceedingly giltie vntill hee free goodnesse deliuer v damnation wherein wee danger wherewith besieged long world acknowledging infirmitie weakenesse may suffer gouerne v guide v right way saluation wise may neuer shaken downe euer temptation
