befall v wee may stande stedfast calling god till haue taken v world bring v heauenly kingdome wee shall inioy euerlasting rest hath prepared v may please c cxxxiiij sermon seuenth vpon xxxiiij chapter vvhen hee hideth face vvho hee shall see hee vpon nation vpon men togither ipocrite reigneth stumbling blocke people belongeth god say haue forgiuen vvill destroy vvhiche haue receyued teache thou mee haue doone vvickedly vvill doe partly declared yesterday maner god hideth face v seene wit troubled worlde see reason ende dooings like contrarie part god graunt v grace see gouerneth thing perceiue fayre well disposed order thoughe countenaunce shone vpon v sunne doe see state worlde troubled wee wote say one god hild face v cace v hu ble selues according sayd prophet time aduersitie wise man lay mouth ground hold peace verely one knowing wee shall gayne nothing striuing god listeth handle v extremitie ye see end wherevnto sentence tendeth exhorte v modestie sobernesse bycause wittes rude grosse comprehend god secret moreouer bicause god intendeth purposely humble v withdraweth v done saith eliu well vpon whole nation vpon one man generally particularly god ca intangle thing shal know reason speake know end beginne better expressing mynde addeth muche hypocrite reigneth true present sentence may layde forth diuersly sequele texte sheweth wel ynough meening wicked man naughtypacke reigneth stumbling blocke snare caste among people wordes import eyther trouble v wee see wicked reigne nothing tyrannie equitie vprightnesse remayning bee vtterly folorne god seene enormity bee committed quareling snatching side snare bee layde poore folke knowe howe scape god withdrawne v true neuer v hath lesse care v howebeit wee see side able consider done seemeth v god regardeth v see nothing darknesse light ought guide v shineth vnto v nowe shrinke head hold mouthes shet wayt god leisure paciently til remedie inconueniences trouble v also let v always point neuer inquire lawful v behoueth v think well god doth thing without cause must enter consideration sin wee enter curiously discussing god secret incomprehensible determination pride wil vtterly ouerthrow v therfore haue said afore let v learne otherwise knowing god somtimes lead v like poore blind soules touching sentence said wicked man reygneth let v marke although bee sore temptation see reygne naughtypackes despizers god giuen euill see might ouercometh right man tell whither go refuge surely great hard crosse ouercome neuerthelesse holy ghost intended set v intent shold armed hath vnrightuousnesse gotten full scope wicked growne iustie confound thing handle matter corruptio may remedie holy ghost aduertizeth v god hide face maner intent trie obedience therfore let v rarie till inlighten v shall wee knowe hath sent trouble among v without cause thus ye see effect maner wee ought put sentence vre eliu addeth belogeth god say haue forgiuen wil destroy say god holdeth raines hand guide men pleasure please punish sinnes wee haue nothing replie condemne v hee beare v yea list forgiue v altogither shall resist shall let shewe v fauour true straunge man vnderstanding first sight seeing god accepter person wee aske forgiueth one rather another vvhy doth beare wicked man hee seene bee altogither order may well trouble heades seeke god dealeth maner conclusion must wee make saue onely referre thing himselfe owne purpose knowing v rule yea wee able comprehende thing highe v pleaseth god humble v hath meanes meanes sinke naturall vnderstanding lo effect sayde vntoo v heere whereas heere mention made god iudgementes whereby hee chastizeth sinnes let v beare minde hath beene sayde namely rightuousest man shall finde himselfe guiltie twice yea hundred tymes suffereth therefore haue cause complaine furthermore please god forgiue v let v vnderstande hee dooth desertes thing findeth v owne free mercie ought marked well bycause thing haue tolde alreadie come naturally intoo men imagination hath beene cause bringing false wicked doctrine christendome papistes still imbrued errour god pardoneth sinnes turne vntoo euen bycause hee seeth good motion vvhen papist speake forgiuenesse sinnes alwayes imagine man must owne syde depose himselfe afore hande purchace grace god although bee full worthinesse yet notwithstanding must bee certaine meeting togither say good reason god seeing good disposition man shoulde helpe respect hath caused dotage bee alledged euen bycause men conceyue god hath libertie giuen heere wit belongeth say forgiue forasmuch thing hath beene conceyued therefore papistes haue forged diuelishe imagination god forgyueth whitte disposed good motion purpose repent although haue done many good deedes may deserue accepted yet notwithstanding god receyueth mercie bycause good disposition hee findeth contrarily let v holde doctrine conteyned namely whereas men bee alike damnation common men bee intangled god pardoneth leaueth residue damnation wherein alreadie vvhy doth v dispute let v holde humble selues withall let v forge meanes owne head holy scripture speaketh good sooth giueth motion vnto man mislike sinne god hath alreadie touched holy spirit naturally euill wee haue committed wee still disposed vnto hypocrisie blindeth v flattering v therefore sinner mislyketh sinne token god hath already touched true cain iudas greatly greeued feeling offence misliking nay rather gnashed teeth god hardned themselues euill therfore sinner feeleth remorse touched humble god must coclude marke holy ghost god giue v plyable affection mislike selues draw vnto token hath shewed v mercie surely good warrant mercie shall wee say man hath deserued haue sinne forgiuen god bycause therevnto disposed wee see papist haue behalfe falsified disguised god doctrine fathering thing vppon man belongeth vnto therfore much better ought marke remember saying men haue cast themselues destruction hild thraldome sin satan possesseth none god hath authoritie say forgiue forgiueth must tie grace neither one thing let vse owne minde dispose thing according free goodnesse therfore forgiueth one man hee may well leaue another damnation according also sayd moises alledged saint paule recorde great importance aboue others forgiue forgiue shewe mercy shew mercy saying god sheweth v must inquyre hee doth hee cutteth away question vvhom doth god pardon euen pleaseth mortall man ordereth matter liuing god declareth hee sheweth mercie wee must aske hee doth whether one man bee better disposed another whether therhath beene desert good motion meane aforehand god haue men content themselues doings therefore whereas hee sheweth mercie vnto vnto behoueth v magnifie goodnesse shew apparance iustice let v assure selues hee bounde vnto v vndoubtedly diuersitie sheweth v much better whe draweth v eue death selfe hee dooth owne free minde wee oure part shoulde bee vtterly forlorne damned wee succoured thus yee see howe wee may bee prouoked glorifie god knowe mere grace towardes v saluation grounded onely vpon good receyuing v mercie wit contrarie part hee forsaketh hee listeth sheweth like mercy letteth alone raysed saluation thus ye see haue remember streyne addeth destroy hath pardoned herein haue one good lesson god spareth sinner reconciled vnto fully one true sometimes god punisheth wicked although sinnes told brought remembrance seeme escaped hand time saying performed god destroy forthere forgiueth nourisheth wicked men fat ox swine ende kill vve see oxe hath bin leane life long man intend kill hee bestowe cost vpon likewyse hee swine make well larded nowe prophete vseth similitude shewe v state reprobate despysers god neuer better punished hande according wee haue seene bothe leremie ezechiell reserued make neuer better market long tariance worse god haue pyled vp great heape cursednesse vpon heades also must god poure greater rigor vpon although lord punish first day yet ceasseth holde still vnder wrath vengeance therefore text belongeth vntoo lorde dooth set menne quite cleare punishe bycause hath forgiuen theyr sinnes tolde lesson verie profitable first wee bee fleshly wee passe sobeit god make v feele rigor although angry v reiect v banishe v house toucheth v like diseased persone good rotten inwardly bodie yet notwithstanding one long feeleth greefe vvhen man hath ague feele alteration paine heade backe well hee ouerpasseth yet notwithstanding disease lurketh within becommeth deadly contrarywise sore athirst good indure time remedie ague cheefe disease man sensuall careth nothing taking away greefe passion present fitte troubleth euen v although god bee offended v seemeth nothing wee perceyue bycause dulnesse therefore wee heape sinne vpon sinne continue alwayes harde harted much behoueth v marke howe sayde streyne wee shall escape god hande except hee forgiue v sinnes behoueth v go roote let v desire god onely deliuer v sickness wantes thing let v specially pray bee mercifull vnto v haue forgotten wee shall bee deliuered inconueniences yet better conceyuing doctrine let v marke although wee bee prosperitie yet meane god bee enimie mischeefe shall continue still v benefites shall turne bane wee vse god giftes vntoo displeasure benefites hee bestoweth vpon v must turne oure greater condemnation lyke contrarie parte wee bee reconcyled vntoo god hath pardoned oure offence although hee chastize v shall bee medicine v affliction shall bee blessed much shall turne saluation saint paule sayth eight romaine beholde howe right necessarie poynt knowe shall alwayes bee shet vp vnder cursse god vntill time hee hath pardoned sinnes herevpon let v learne bee afrayde misery aduersities onely specially god wrath ceasse prouoke shall haue done amisse let v begin outward affliction say returning vnto god end afflict v let v pray bee gracious purge clense v oure sinnes ende may bee nothing v may kindle agaynst v displease true chastizementes correction god sendeth v stroke spurre pricke v forwarde seeth v dull hee driueth v meanes repentance yet must wee poynt say well content god withdrawe hande mee wee must doo wee shall haue gayned verie little get nothing vvhat let v go vnto god pray bee one v muche v wee haue beene gently chastized wee maye knowe hys goodnesse towardes v pray marke cause god doubleth strypes striketh muche roughly vppon v vvhy man bee chastized hee feeleth god visiteth perceyueth thing go better man humbleth himselfe hee hath offended god desireth bee deliuered god take away aduersitie first brunt meane poore soule hath wit enter himselfe search owne faultes atteyne much reason say ala must seeke recouer fauour god thinkes ynough pressed like dogge doth shake eares hee hath scaped blowe cudgell one goeth farre ought hee resteth outwarde part therfore god followeth striking still see howe lightly men dispatche themselues god chastizeth make come repentaunce may well haue conceyte passeth away oute hand nowe sith god seeth although man perceiue harme yet filthinesse doth settle still within fayne presse ende hee may know disease would increase purged bottom let v vnderstand growe worse worse vntill god haue shewed v mercie therefore wee must onely desire giue v health soundnesse whatsoeuer else flesh desireth also blotte sinnes gouerne v holy spirit may bee thing v prouoke displeasure agaynst v cause dauid holy prophetes felte themselues beaten tormented god hande say onely lorde deliuer mee affliction true desired first desyred god forgiue sinnes angrie spake sawe well whence affliction come howe frutes recordes god anger therefore went alwayes roote mischief euen must wee thing whereof wee warned place sayd god punish hath forgiuen true followeth god forgiueth v bicause hee maketh countenance displeasure dooth winke oure sinnes prosper though loued fauored v rather destruction neerest hande according see howe sodomite destroyed come fulnesse delightes pleasure muche despysed god worlde besotted sawe one whit vndoubtedly tooke greater libertie vnder colour god visited long time men drunke dregges wine prophet terme wee haue seene ieremie ezechiell god beareth wicked settle lee soked vice bee imbrued ful remedy remorse scripture sayeth consideration let v marke heape vp wood god wrath although fire put hand yet must wee looke thinke wee haue gayned thing except wee bee reconcyled vnto god eliu hath sayde addeth haue perceyued teach thou mee haue done amisse thing added skorne eliu bringeth god speaking vnto iob offering himselfe bee reproued amended hee haue done amisse true much wordes somewhat cut men haue taken another sense howbeit naturall exposition vve haue seene heretofore eliu hath exalted god libertie soueraintie mortall menne must needes stoupe vnder open lippes hath priuiledge hee thinkes good meane must acknowledge al euer dooth rightfull reasonable hee sheweth reason hee intendeth reserue authoritie ouer v himselfe eliu therefore hath shewed alreadie nowe hee scorneth iobs ouerweening hee disputed agaynst god misvnderstoode cause affliction iob acknowledged secrete rightuousnesse god ought measured man imagination iob acknowledged meane season wee haue seene passion tossed chafed agaynst god oftentimes hee boyled ouer spake vnaduisedly haue seene nowe eliu rebuketh howbeit way mockerie see sayeth god must bee fayne come account say vnto thee well haue done amisse thou art able teache mee time better shoulde say god little childe furthermore let v marke spoken muche vnto iob vnto whole worlde haue neede warning wee knowe dulnesse vnderstanding god speake vntoo v earnestly grauely wee awhit moued wee see men wedded owne opinion haue conceyued thing easie turne man speake plainely v maiestie god shewe v howe frayle wee bee wee haue alwayes reply seeing men capacitie god shoulde shewe faultes distinctly grauely suche phrase speache might bee plainely ledde vntoo reason god seeth wilfull hee must bee fayne mocke put shame folke woorthie bee spoken directly vnto see foole haue laboured winne good meanes hee ende vtterly past recouerie hee altogither vnruly blasphemeth god shall shall speake hee good discretion shall scorne beastlynesse else see lift vp ouer great pride shall threaten maner doth holy ghost proceede nowe sayeth go god must bee fayne come vnto say haue done amisse amend rebuke surely bee sayde v wee checke god dayly according euery man knowes findeth fault himselfe discontented thing go minde effect woulde haue god turne brydle cleane otherwise doth seeing malapert pray wee bee dealt wee bee mocked vpbrayded pride must man needes wit aduaunceth himselfe sort agaynst maker maketh anie doubt ye see haue remember streyne seing word couched scorn certaine conuicted man spake v ordinarie stile vttered maner go god shall come say haue done amisse rebuke mee shewe mee lesson shame v bee spoken yes surely vvhat must god come downe v confesse faulte submitte himselfe correction wee see detestable monstrousnesse none v heares woulde stande staring vpon heade heare spoken yet notwithstanding oure doings tende vvhen menne frette chafe sort haue touched alreadie make vagary woulde make god subiect ymagination one would bereeue soueraintie subdue suche lawe lysted laye vppon though hee little babe men therefore vndirectly thing woulde bee loth afrayde heare spoken wee see holy ghost hath taken good waye spight diuelish malapertnesse v murmure agaynst god hee sayeth go see god must faine come aske forgiuenesse contented taught haue shewed ought holy ghost speaketh sort shewe men verie diuelish presuming maner set vp bristle agaynst god murmure hee worketh lyking much therefore ought wee wey well wordes conteyned oft wee bee tickled intent bee inquisitiue god doings bring vnder coram let v consider maze enter one would rob god maiestie abace world make subiect thinke good ala great despyzing whether go therefore thing commeth minde thinke v ought let v remember saying thou grudge maner thou settest thy selfe agaynst thy god beholde holy ghost hath alreadie declared told thee confuzion thou puttest thy selfe namely much thou wouldest become creator thy god malapertnesse wert thou worthie drowned bottom hel greater pride desire darken rather abolish maiestie god thou silly worme earth thou cursed creature thou wretched cario thou art sink filthinesse wilt thou take vpo thee check thy maker vvhen haue thought v let v beware put away yea vtterly burie shet fansies doores stand vpon reputation say lorde bee thou glorified ignorance let v say nothing else lorde thou art rightuous thy doings although wee see awhit nowe wee shall one day bee inlightened thee nowe great wisedome v rest simplie vpon seeing haue v ignorant tyme ye see standeth v hande put sentence vre furthermore whereas sayde teach god thing perceyueth behoueth v make comparison betweene god v hath bin euerlasting snayles one dayes breede yet wee put horne immediatly water vvherof snayles made wherof come ye see snayles chaunged incontinent meet shoulde poke horne agaynst god strength courage haue cotinuance time bee threescore fourscore yeares worlde speake eldest sort vnderstanding cotrary part let v mark continuance god wisedome knowledge euerlasting worlde made thing present hee hath increased wisedome neither abated thing knewe thing euen world made must men needes bee worse madde giue theyr affection head sort say matter ought haue gone thus hath god consydered thing ought done wise ynough himselfe ouerturning marring thing like mortall men except haue debated vpon matter afore hande taken counsell nothing good profitable hath god neede consult hath neede debate matter aforehande sayd afore thing haue bene present tymes vvhat done suffer selues taught knowing vnderstanding v glide worlde life vanisheth away shadowe blinde wretch although bee reason vnderstanding v yet able guide v muche lesse aduise god serueth make v vnexcusable reason wee haue standeth v stead conuict v condemne v therewithall holy scripture sheweth v wee bee blinde wretch yea wee sufficiently taught experience therefore take vpon v teache god whither wee rushe cause sayde behoueth v knowe first ignorance secondly belongeth vntoo god dispose thing wee vnderstande want selues may bee doubt belongeth vnto onely remedie lack vnderstanding let v craue sayeth saint iames welspring giueth without vpbrayding god dealeth nigardly v men doo goodes diminish greeued much called vpon god neuer ceasseth v good therefore let v learne offer selues vnto wee want wisedome let v doubt hee giue v much shall bee necessarie v doctrine whiche haue touched exceedingly behoofe hath bin cause many corruption christendome insomuch good doctrine hath bin peruerted imbaced bycause men haue bene desirous bee ouer wise though god bene well aduised vvhen men presume put forth owne inuentions say bee good must done thing must bee remedyed sort owne fancie god foreseene howe happeneth afore vvee see god pronounceth theretoo must hold v haue v receiue thing good holy speaketh beholde men step play stickler rowe betweene twoostreames could finde hart god much wrong say scarce wel aduised themselues wizer shall knowe thing better taking thing grosse easie bee vnderstoode pope hath gone deuide thing god hath ioyned togither wit hee hath bereft people cup lord supper told must content themselues one kind namely oste cup serued priest sing masse withall alledged hee woulde many inconueniences true inconueniences grounded vpon beastly superstition make men beleeue wyne wyne turned bloud lorde iesus christ marke heere allegation pope sayeth would many inconueniences cup giuen people better priest drinke behalf whole company short one sayd bee wiser god see thing saw therefore must prouide maner putting away ordinance iesus christ beholde lorde iesus christ sayth drinke ye cup sayeth expressely drinke ye behold pope commeth cutteth worde saying true ordinance iesus christ haue without good reason prouide inconueniences haue foreseene shal say god sonne infinit wisedome selfe light worlde see nothing making institution vve see men ouershoote themselues beyond al measure whe consider god doings brought infinite rightuousnesse wisdome let v hold v follow way sheweth v afrayde shall erre shewe v suffer selues gouerned quietly nowe let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement sinnes praying make v feele better haue done may sorie aske forgiuenesse therwithall may knowe help v put selues mercie hee may spare v little time may bee alwayes vphild power assured mercy may doubt guide v euen vnto ende vntill haue deliuered v aduersities misery wherevnto subiect may please graunt grace onely v c cxxxv sermon eight vpon xxxiiij chapter vvill god performe thing thee thou hast misliked wilt thou chooze vvhat knovvest thou speake ye men vnderstanding speake let vvise men heare mee iob hath spoken vvisdome neither hath vvords bin vnderstanding desire iob shoulde bee tried vtter ende vve might see ansvveres men vvickednesse vvill multiplie sinnes iniquitie vaunteth himselfe agaynst v multiplieth vvordes agaynst god haue seene heeretofore god scorne mennes folly offered heare mennes counsell saying hee vnderstoode thing shewe done amisse would therevpon declared without cause god scorned presumptuousnesse see men exalt themselues agaynst take vpon controll euery turne therfore god hath neede dandle maner eliu setteth forth maiestie god saying performe thing thee like heretofore hee dalyed ende men might know better fonde ouerweening also contrarie part sheweth dalying great lorde god wee haue replied neuer much meete hee subiect lustes shoulde aske counsell handes knowe shoulde vvere ouerthrowing whole order nature wee see howe holy ghost hauing declared men worthie bee spoken vnto reason grauitie doth nowe touche quicke euen setting maiestie god eye telling v set lawe rule thus much importeth saying hee performe thing thee although men ouer labour themselues yet shall winne much god yeeld vnto bee subiect pleasure therefore spight teeth muste passe waye god hath appoynted according hee listeth dispose thing wee say v rule matter true might bee obiected eliu doth sufficiently defende god rightuousnesse alledging mightie power behoueth v beare minde howe hath bin declared afore god mounted vp seate hee doth glorie absolute lawlesse power hee therewith iudge world nothing peculiar vnto equitie vprightnesse insomuche hee bereft owne side cace standeth heere vpon shewing god intendeth making men feele owne frailtie therfore comparing thing contrarie one side god sheweth al power belongeth vnto without exception side warneth v cosider well selues sinfulnesse beware mortall man worme earth shoulde take stoutly vpon dare stande contention god desire ouerrule surely often murmure god cannot accept thing good worth come wee knowe let v mark wel holy ghost doth bring men backe owne state neuer durst bee bolde grudge agaynst god except forgotten themselues vvill lowly mild glorifie god becommeth v let v enter selues examin well nature knowe bee men holde v short presumption thus wee see wee haue beare away text sayde thou hast mislyked thou shalt chooze heere againe streyne god brought complayning men pryde pleading agaynst surely cannot content themselues god doo mislyke doings meanes pretend haue choyze election though free saye well done god must leaue true would abhorre blasphemy demaunded whether v would take vpon let god executing determination euerie v would answere god forbid euer shoulde intende aduaunce selfe diuelishe pride haynous blasphemie yet meane wee haue tongs filed find fault whensoeuer god doth thing contentation ye shall see v grinde teeth make complaint neither shall wee haue neede haue gone schoole learne rethorick grudge god plaine mislyking doings poynt men yeeld quietly god good mynde haue choyze thing saye god must thus god must page beholde outrageous vice raigneth euerie yet men indeuour put awaye amende much ought wee marke well text howe god commeth owne quarell agaynste v sayeth wretched creature intend see murmure dayly vvheras cheef poynt haue obey myne ordinaunce take good woorth holde peace humble selues afflict farre dooing none ryseth vp agaynst mee must bee subiect vnto vvhat reason alledge bound vnto seeing god brought sort surely wee worse blockishe touche moue v though oure heartes swolne lyke toades yet shoulde fylthinesse brust oute thoughe harde rockes yet ought clyue asunder whereas god addeth mislyke mee mislyke fall accuzing sort wee finde faulte rightuousnesse vvhere welspring light god woulde wee reiect doings vvhether go agayne importeth therewithall wee woulde haue souerayne dominion ouer hee owne libertie wee thinke good cause hee sayeth shalt thou choose bycause menne cannot finde theyr hart condemne themselues except bee compelled heere god addeth conclusion knowest thou speake shoulde say hee reproueth v ignorance tongue bee nimble may bee hastie speake thing haue conceyued god telleth v one droppe reason wee shoulde bee dumme man speake hee wote sure recorde folly yet notwithstanding wee bee talking insomuch oure lorde needeth crosse v somewhat mi keth v whetteth v murmure agaynst nowe let bee knowne wee skill whereof talke v throughly examined shall bee nothing founde ignoraunce many wordes little wit tongue shall runne vpon pattins meane reason shall bee vtterly sencelesse rashnesse vvee see howe waightie conclusion god knowest thou speake shoulde say giue leaue speake sobeit shewe doings bee wise men menne vnderstanding starke fooles nothing ignoraunce must take vpon libertie speake haue saye nowe wee make profite streyne conteyneth good lesson first wee see rule lyfe namely yeelde god due authoritie hee may dispoze v say may thing yet aduice v set god lawe nd poynt lesson must agree vnto doeth marke one poynt true wee may well demaunde thing thinke glory welfare church owne priuate benefit sheweth familiaritie towardes v say vnto v discharge hart care according also saint paule sayeth wee must make priuie desyres therefore wee bee vnquietnesse let v referre selues vnto god pray thing wee thinke good howbeeit let v rule selues alwayes worde notwithstanding please graunt desire yet muste wee vse thankesgiuing sainct paule sayeth place desire must headie neither must constrayne god require contrariwise although hee say v nay minde therein excercize pacience let v alwayes blisse glorifie name acknowledging hee doeth thing inestimable iustice vprightnesse wisedome wee selues knowe good poore blinde wretch therefore hee must bee faine see v thus yee see first poynt wee haue marke heere put vre streyne god must thing appoyntment howbeeit stretcheth yet witte wee finde thing scripture whiche straunge vnderstanding let v assure selues wee must leane owne reason god shoulde wee thinke ought bee done let reigne let men stoupe vnto hee ought aske counsell v behoueth angel heauen menne vppon earth humble themselues god onely beare sway yea euen freedome bee confessed belongeth doo whatsoeuer doth side warned cannot worse thing repine grudge god thing fall wee would wish mislyking onely rule rightuousnesse thing man fall euill amisse frailtie hee therefore bee excused commeth fulnesse sinne hee contented offende god breake lawe abolishe order also would quenche god rightuousnesse haue light turned intoo darknesse might bee discerning betweene good euill oueroutrageousnesse yet notwithstanding often men repyne god cannot paciently beare dooings glorifie therein mislyke though woulde vsurpe authoritie ouer iudge also condemne rightuousnesse outrageous beastly dealing therefore wee bee tempted grudging impacience let text come remembraunce let v say thou wretched creature doest thou vvhat maze enterest thou intoo simple temptation pushing wyth horne agaynste god thinkest thou blot rightuousnesse vvith doest thou matche thy selfe fleshe bee itching make v bende oure selues agaynst god let bee barre holde v backe suffize let v adde thus muche greate malapertnesse v desyre chooze specially taking awaye god choyce menne shoulde haue libertie say must bee done god shoulde haue soueraintie gouerne v hee lysteth twoo thing cannot stande togither vvee agree god fire water vvee bee verie well sighted looke halfe finger length v wee dazeled soone wee open oure eye commonly wee iudge thing bee euill good desire corrupt affection thought agree god infinite incomprehensible wisdome vnto whose rightuousnesse behoueth v bee subiect seeing contrarietie betweene god men haue choyce god must packing else tyed stake lust must bee like chaynes cordes say thou shalt stir presumptuousnesse wee bee tempted grudge afflictios thing state worlde order thing fall liking let v thinke thus selues true may wish thing thy god giueth thee leaue aske done humilitie subiection whe thou hast made thy request thou must hold thy self quiet though thing fal thy liking euen though thy god seeme minded greeue thee set purpose yet must thou yeeld behalf play beast seing let v mark well sentence lorde sayeth vvhat whither would go shall haue choyce shall meddle one would bereeue god beeing abace wise might maisters ouer verie nature teacheth v contrarie often wee murmure maner storme thing bycause fall wee woulde wishe much would thrust god vnder feete true think yet must fall blockishnesse let v thinke vpon thing enter sayde consideration ende bee rebellious ende let v also marke well speech sayde knowest thou speake haue touched alreadie wee meane twit man foole say thou knowest thou sayest wote say followeth wee knowe nothing doubt skill throughly tryed searched top toe bee founde nothing v dotage maketh v go astray yet must alwayes pratling whatsoeuer come speake follow owne sensualitie well sayde haue beleued therfore speak marke howe may speake wizely wit vttering haue learned god schoole word good speaking allowed god yea sacrifice good sauour vnto namely confesse thing good hath shewed v rest wholy vpon saying yee se wise wee haue speake man aduaunceth throusteth foorth himselfe speake soeuer hee hath ymagined owne brayne hee checketh agaynst god knowest thou let man trie well thy strength vnderstanding thy mind shall finde stark folly therfore whensoeuer tongue lauishe talke let v remember sayde knowest thou certaine place lorde ment condemne man wit like place holy scripture sayd god knoweth thought men vaine sercheth secret ouertaketh wilie wilinesse men maye well beare themselues hande bee sharpwitted suttle yet smoke vanisheth away strayght text lord sayth go haue wisedome shewe haue skill speake heere haue generall doctrine must clayme thing owne wit trust vnto therefore oft wit runneth rouers wee presume talke iudge matter reshly let v assure selues holy ghost setteth aduersarie partie sheweth nothing foolishe rashnesse v wee haue skill true god hath giuen v reason vnderstanding onely v wit light god shyneth darknesse purpose make v vnexcusable insomuch wee haue knowledge except god speake vnto v inlighten v worde way whereby may menne vnderstanding according sayde psalme wisedome profite vnder therfore let v marke must vtterly distrust owne reason knowe till lorde haue inlightned v worde vtterly voyd discretion neither modestie honestie v lo haue beare minde furthermore speake let v sure aforhande lord hath taught v wee haue thing wee vtter imagined owne brayne well practized see world another order two thing displace right one wise owne conceyts wee giue bridle affection lustes wee knewe well thing spoken heere wit haue skill al speaking bewray owne folly say wee throughly perswaded doubt god exalted men would hold themselues word one comon accord would somuch disputing proofe hereof papist debate much vpon article controuersie betweene v bycause cannot finde hart bee subiect vnto god also bycause bee sawcie step forth lordly conclusion determine binde men conscience resolution papist coulde hold themselues pure simplicitie god worde surely wee shoulde one minute houre agree vpon thing doubt day againe touching phantasticall heades creepe amongst v defile pure doctrine pray whereof commeth diuelishe pride cannot finde harte receyue thing quietly holy scripture speaketh man aske madde heades woulde nowadayes abolishe god free election also prouidece like thing reason haue answere thinkes verie straunge ye beast though man sharpest witted skilfullest could paterne cunning learning yet hee sillie worme earth finde faulte god doings behold stark beast haue nothing pride wherewith readie burst stincking poyson yet notwithstanding take vpon ouerturne holy scripture vnder colour saying perceiue cace haue sayde let article bee marked men haue skill ought holde peace kepe silence ende god alone may exalted vvere doctrine throughly put vre surely wee see quiet obedience v woulde say amen whensoeuer pure truthe god layde afore v second mischeef affection vnruly giue leaue run rouers reason wherof god afflict v thing fal looking fal stormiug euery man caried away worse ynough v take libertie speake agaynst god also seemeth seeke occasion rayle iustice bee agreeable fansies vve see time therfore much behoueth v marke haue sayd namely sentence put well vre see angelical order world vvhat done let v followe owne reason attempt thing vpon owne heade contented bee taught god againe syde affection carie v away bitternesse greeued vexed let v shake thing bycause good reason god shoulde reigne haue al superioritie ouer v obey confesse doings good rightfull glorified v acknowledge ought gouerne v also hee doeth rightfully thus ye see wee haue note furthermore whensoeuer finde men aduaunce themselues sort god let v vnderstand maner desperate vnrecouerable sith cannot submit themselues good god acknowledge good rightfull therefore let example teache v humble selues say ala asmuche woulde betide thee thy god preserued thee whence commeth modestie holy ghost thou seest nature euery v seeing cace standeth wee see light headed person doo aduaunce theselues passe bound god let euerie v thinke muche might befall mee withhilde spirit god gouerned mee make mee meeke might glorifie take good woorth whatsoeuer hee sendeth mee lo herein effect haue remember sentence sayde consequently let men hart speake say let men vnderstanding speake let wise men herken heere first sight eliu seemeth speake thing contrarie speake herken agree togither yet notwithstanding without cause hee willeth wise men speake men vnderstanding herken man shall neuer speake well except willing heare neither shall euer fit teach vnlesse bee willing also receyue good doctrine vve see eliu matcheth two thing togither whiche ought neuer bee separated asunder thing haue spoken afore namely may well speake howbeit haue learned afore haue beleeued sayeth psalme therefore haue spoken therefore behoueth v keepe lesson howe beleeue vnlesse haue giuen suffered selues taught must teachable good thing set afore v according also sayde wise man shall become wyser hearing ye see heere saying salomon sheweth full well speake let man shoulde herken according also herken let man may speake wherefore lord maister intent shuld heare euerie v teache neighbour thereby make thing auaylable wee haue receyued god haue giuen mee gift grace bounde vtter neighbour see amisse speake hearken twoo thing onely agree verie wel also inseparable leastwise thing well disposed considered good order true speaking heere set foremost neuerthelesse eliu sayeth wizemen therein presupposeth whiche spake first learned afore knew say againe whereas seconde place setteth downe herken doo v wit speaking must maner must neuerthelesse giue eare another man hath speake god hath reuealed v according also sainct paule setteth downe order prophecying let prophete saith speake let two three auoiding confusion calleth prophet sheweth behoueth haue say none must thrust himselfe forth vnlesse bee called like hee sayth xij chapter first corinthian haue receyued thing lordes hande communicate neighbour must man take vpon office church except hee called haue wherewith furnishe roome recorde god serued v dealeth gracious giftes v holy spirite paule declareth presupposeth suche speake furnished aforehande neuerthelesse addeth god hath reueled another man first must hold peace giue roome spirite god thus ye see sayd although wyse men speake god alloweth also bee furnished wherewith yet notwithstanding must also harken contented hold theyr peace another man speaketh better prophet alwayes yeeld themselues subiect holy ghost fountaine vnderstanding also although man haue receyued large giftes grace yet doeth god deale vnto measure intet abridge al occasion aduancing ourselues much though man might sufficient god therfore hath set band loue among v one v haue neede another behoueth v mainteyne brotherly communicating cause except rebel god behooueth v willing receyue good doctrine hads although god haue inlightened v word neuerthelesse certayne heere eliu intendeth reprooue iob sayd iob hath shewed euill taught surely althoughe iob man greate learning yet caried away passion manner dulled wordes order thing eliu ment say streine haue good admonition gather firste iob whome god indued greate grace bee condemned man voyde wit reported haue bin excessiue passion yea although hee streined himselfe represse yet notwithstading toke much libertie wandred beastly word bee thought v let v take heede preuent condemnation whensoeuer oure minde ouersore shaken haue fretted god would haue entred disputation pleading agaynst let v end suffer ourselues reproued holy ghost iob angell comparison v spared shall bee specially seing heady vnruly wee wil yeeld one poynt inforced know proceede hande god mindes lofty wee woulde rule heauen earth woulde say correct magnificat seeing bolde shall done v shall blamed hundredfold iob thing ought make v sory heart see passion outrageouse furthermore haue marke generall man shall neuer meete teach except hee humilitie suffer men reproue hath done amisse lo howe god intendeth hold v awe text therfore let euery apply owne instruction sayd men vnderstanding must aswell heare speake must haue vnderstanding neuerthelesse wee see adayes wise speake harken haue spoken bee haue full scope speake babble make men holde theyr peace vvitlesse folke whome nother skill discretion iudgement drunckarde dulled gluttonie insomuche hee riseth morning hee hath scarse disgested euenings wine ready go tauerne playeth beast day double beast night suche man shall nowadayes haue free libertie speake men must keepe silence afore giue hearing howe full shamfull vve see haue least shame haue libertie speake men vnderstanding must haue mouthes shet may wise bee broughte lightheaded disordered folke cheefe al mischeefe despysers god haue full scope true although wittiest men worlde sober settled minde yea also greate skill yet certayne alwayes beastes haue feare god beholde despizers god starke beastes drunkard glutton vnthrifts suche haue nother honestie shame euen haue sayd nowadayes royst speake list bold quetch lo poynt agayne bee hearde howe dare man nowadayes tell men faultes althoughe sinnes bee howge mountaynes yet may man see man say howe nowe ought suche thing bee borne withall answered hah see ye wretched beast ye eye ye lesse condemned sufficiently conuicted none hath sting conscience short although ther nother preaching warning thing else yet heartbytings gnawe within might make see nothing euill yet aske still hah far putting doctrine vre said let wise men speake let men vnderstading heare vvhereas none fooles witlesse folke mad men haue libertie speake binde men stake haue authoritie yeelded yet notwithstanding haue eares heare receyue correction man woulde tell fault suche cannot abyde bewraying neuerthelesse wee go agaynste thing god hath stablished oure stryuing ouerthrowe shall bee vayne harde wall v therefore lette suche rushe agaynste assure selues shall ruine destruction lo wee haue beare minde therefore sith knowe howe thing confounded nowadayes lette v learne returne thether god calleth v whiche doctrine shoulde bee heard take place amongs v v shoulde diligent receyne knowes hee hath done amisse seeke amend meanes myght doo honour ought haue souereyntie ouer v consider iob condemned gyuing himselfe brydle muche hee mortified affection hilde sufficiently awe ala shall become v let v thinke vpon ashamed see wretchednesse hath reygned muche amongst v pray purpose v speake reformation gospell meane season wee stryue sort god whereas wickednesse hath full scope nowadayes farre men fro repressing rather mainteyned tooth nayle insomuch man take vpon speake shew faultes lambe doth alwayes trouble water stinking goates croude theselues intoo god churche trouble defile holinesse god hath set amongs v word meane whyle silie lambes muste accuzed though cause euill sith wee see let v learne strengthen incourage ourselues wee see euill others may take heede bee also ourselues furthermore whe feele lord graunteth v grace submit ourselues vnto mildnesse suffer ourselues bee taught although see wickednesse raygne onely let v cosent vnto also let v resist stoutly vttermost power dissembleth draweth curten eye whe wickednesse rangeth abrode deuill carieth away vnderlings sort gilty god iudgemente hee maynteyned euill thus ye see ought practize doctrine wee god dewe seruice acknowledge lord souereygne ouer monarchy principality worlde nowe lette v fall downe face good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v repente beeing gouerned holy spirite may fight mansully agaynst temptation affliction worlde whyle shall please keepe v heere wee may seeke bee altogither subiect holye commaundementes let v say almightie god heauenly father acknowledge confesse according truth wee woorthie lifte vp eye heauen present selues thee presume farre prayer c cxxxvj sermon first vpon xxxv chapter eliu proceedeth saying diddest thou thinke aright vvhen thou saydest rightuousnesse aboue god thou hast sayd vvhat shall profit mee vvhat shall auayle mee haue sinned vvill ansvvere thee thy freendes likevvise looke vp heauens behold looke vp ayre aboue thee thou sinnest vvhat dost thou thy sinnes multiplied vvhat hurtest thou thou rightuous vvhat giuest thou vvhat shall receyue thy hande eliu continueth heere still blame iob sor blaspheming ryghtuousnesse god groundeth vpo poynt iob ment owne rightiousnesse surmounted god vttered word pretended thing cause hee mainteyned owne rightuousnesse wise though god tormented wrong fully without cause therevpon shoulde haue insued god dealte reasonably afflicted measure howbeeit better conceyuing hereof behoueth v call mind hath bene sette downe heeretoofore vvhen iob spake owne ryghtuousnesse onely ende shewe hee punished offence hee ought bee iudged wicked bycause god afflicted greeuously aboue men haue told god afflicting men hath alwayes eye punishing theyr sinnes intendeth trye pacience bee sell vnto iob god gaue satan brydle bycause iob naughtye packe prouoked god wrath greate offence although satan founde faulte yet notwithstanding obteyned leaue torment cause god afflicted iob sorte angrie intended trye obedience might mirrour vnto v therefore iob fought well saying punished offence respect therein deserueth condemned faulte beeing troubled vehemencie passion thought firste god vsed measure sore agaynste poore creature oughte bee punished sorte hee murmure behalfe true iob flattered himselfe infirmitie yet good stay himselfe hee ought haue agayne greatest mischeefe hee thought vppon nothing anguishe insomuche tymes fayth choked hee looked heauenly life reward promised faythfull theyr manfull fighting coulde atteyne bycause forepossessed greefe troubled vtterlye ouer whelmed yee see iob confesseth ryghtlye generall god hath prepared euerlasting heritage cannot fayle wicked also cannot scape hande although triumphe world take pleasure heere yet shall pay deere iob knewe thing generall hee ment apply doctrine himselfe coulde bring passe bycause hearte distressed hee stormed muche vvhen hee afterdeele hee gazed coulde see three foote afore without dazeling eye wit sorte berest cause could cofort hope reste promised hee assuaged anguishe remitted vnto god say euen lorde yet haue alwayes hoped thou wilt make mee feele shall haue suffered affliction paciently shall happy end lord thou giuest mee knowledge waite vpon thee shall neuer disappoynted hope thou wilt still prouide al aduersities giue good end although thy helpe appeare hand yet wilt thou neuer fayle iob ought haue thought thing passion hild pryson fayth sayde afore manner choked like wether bee sore troubled darke wee shall peraduenture haue manner light yet shall wee see whyt farre darke cloudes doo dimme eye wee cannot discerne thing euen v bee afflicted according experience sheweth man vexed conscience hee seeth nother funne moone darke vnto true hee holde still principle whiche faythfull oughte haue hee shall knowe god goodnesse yet hee take comforte cheere vp himselfe middes sorrowes hee cannot conclude thus himselfe go yet holde still god reacheth mee hande shall get oute distress perplexity wherein man therfore pressed vp anguish god afflicteth maketh feele sinnes dismayed cannot come farre say god hath declared drawe seruaunts graue therefore although seeme bee vtterly ouerwhelmed yet god mighty power diminished towards mee lo taking iob althoughe hee knewe heauenly life prepared v oure heritage wee shall haue euerlasting ioye yet coulde hee comfort himselfe affliction ouerraught much affliction made feele god hande agaynste eye sorte blindfolded wittes amazed coulde cheere comfort himselfe take holde god promise suche taste might assuage misery lesson well woorthy noted see continually afflicted hartgreefes wee amazed man giuen v knocke vpon heade beetle yea wee may well haue feeling thereof also bodily affliction winter greate froste bee able maner ryue stone could finde heart fire wee haue presente passion eye wee haue forgotten quite heate meeneth cleane contrariwise sommer ouerwhote wold full yce come mind asmuch passion muche excessiue doubte able oppresse v muche yee see also howe wee ought go ryght foorth vnto god wee myght bee comforted imbrace promise whiche lift v aboue world make v beholde glorye whiche nowe inuisible oftentymes wee cannot come poynte firste brunte doctrine verye necessary v whereintoo myght wee fall wee take holde reste whiche prepared v heauen wee shoulde fall intoo despayre blaspheme god nothing bring v yeelde glorie confesse hee afflicteth v iustly rightly excepte wee feele presente affliction auaylable saluation god ruleth suche wise serue v dicynes beleeue howe wee glorifie god howe wee stoupe vnder myghtie hande yeelde selues obediently sainct peter exhorteth v impossible nay cleane contrarywise wyll bee nothing v fretting gnasshing teeth befell vnto iob wyll befall vntoo v true iob mente nother woulde wee doo yet notwithstanding wee bee blamewoorthie wee woulde pleade agaynste god make selues rightuouse haue good cause pray vnto god afflicteth v hee neuer suffer v forgo taste sauoure promise may alwayes hope hee bring misery ende yea ende wee shall haue cause prayse good father hath procured welfare furthermore wee feele infirmitie bee suche wee bee maner dazeled affliction cannot mount vp rest taryeth v aboue let v vnderstande wee bee hye way blaspheme god hee remedy yea althoughe wee meene make selues ryghtuouse god yet notwithstanding let v assure selues ayme alwayes marke wee fall grudging repining cursed blasphemy behooueth v condemne passion greued vexed wee knowe whiche side turne v let v consider say affection boyle feruently therfore condemned holy ghoste iob could well haue replyed therevnto haue sayde neuer intent blaspheme god magnifie rightuousnesse aboue yes hee doeth god rightuouse wee mouth stopped condemne selues wee alledge excuse take leaue grudge agaynste pleaseth afflicte v sorte soeuer beaten downe confesse god doeth thing iustly certeyne would aduaunce rightuousnesse aboue one would spurne sunne sith warned thereof let v learne sayd preuent mischeefe whensoeuer afflicted let v fully persuaded resolued selues god knowes doeth although wee see reason therof furthermore muste troubled aduersitie lyeth vpon v shoulde hope god deliuer v forasmuch hee hath promised neuer fayle vvherefore let v ouerpasse trouble afore oure eye whiche hinder v looking lette serue comfort v wee may say yet god haue pitie vpon v end therfore let v passe still boldly go thorough course lo wee haue marke streyne sense suche appeareth eliu gathereth layeth forth saying thou hast sayde shall boote mee haue sinned shall profite mee thing wherein eliu vpbraydeth iob hee woulde make himselfe rightuous god thought vnprofitable thing haue walked feare god haue absteyned sinne imagine god rightuousnesse become good abolished god rightfulnesse cosisteth onely man wrong also gouerning world equitie disposing creature sorte truste shall disappointed serue good conscience sure haue reward god forsake feare passe reward heauen surely shoulde ceasse rightuouse according also apostle declareth epistle hebrewes god sayeth vnrightuouse remember affliction gyue releefe hee faythfull vvhen sayeth god vnrightuouse hee sheweth ryghtuousnesse thing inseparable beeing although exercise men many affliction world haue behaued themselues stedfastly vocatio yet must cofort themselues promis poynt well woorthy bee noted shall see many imagine god asleepe heauen howbeeit godhead vayne imagination importeth thing haue spoken co cerning gouernment souereyne dominion worlde namely like hath created thing also man beast thing else hade protection thing muste brought good end sake although thing order heere bilowe yet meane whyle respect himselfe nothing order although suffer thing otherwise disposed wee woulde haue yea appoynt many confuzions also yet hee well skill set thing perfect state agayne thus yee see thing belongeth vnto god peculiar beeing lette v marke glorifie god yeeld deserued prayse rightuousnesse must beholde hande power thing doubt hath iust cause whatsoeuer doeth although wee knowe doeth lo effect haue beare minde furthermore perfectest men may sometimes tempted say booteth thee haue sinned according alledged yesterday dauid entered doubt sayd haue loste time clenzing handes loste labour haue kept myselfe filthinesse infection dauid tempted heerewith faythfull nowe shaken fancy specially aduersities oppresse v sore reason infirmity deuill assayleth fayth thorough oure vnbeleefe wee cannot bee sore afrayde enter present doubtes vvell done meane whyle vve muste beate backe condemne onely condemne also abhorre saying wretched creature needes muste thou full vanitie thou darest set vp thy brystles thy god outrage ye see howe behoueth v thruste farre v wicked imagination wherwith diuel laboreth peruert v howbeit time mischiefe greate sufficiently strengthened withstand assault according happened vnto iob fell length repining sayde woulde man might thinke vpon mee sorte speaketh iob heathenishnesse yea brutishnesse say would graue feele misery hope faithfull becommeth threatenings god maketh wicked muste bee fayne feele dreadfull hand ende iob become brutishe remembreth thing behoueth v mistrust owne affectios may say perfecte man whiche like angell heauen recorde god owne mouth haue seene afore neuerthelesse ouerraught anguishe cannot consider go graue medled together confuzedly god separateth owne seruants reprobrate soules custody hee keepeth safetie iob farre driuen hee coulde remember betide v true iob infidel deny resurrection reiect doctrine euerlasting life hee wanted presente aduisednesse bethinke time neede armour alwayes readinesse like man shoulde perhaps bee taken vnwares amazed coulde drawe sworde shrinke backe stagger yea peraduenture receyue blow ere coulde defend himselfe euen like case iob true sworde buckler taken vnwares diuell aduauntage insomuche hee began shrinke haue shewed afore coulde lift vp minde heauen behold hope god giueth faithful seing let v learne distruste ourselues knowe frailtie v wee shoulde bee borne downe neuer rise vp agayne lorde pitie v reach v mighty hand end might cal vpon refer ourselues wholly thus ye see wee haue marke effect vpon text byandby eliu addeth answere thee thy copanions saying hee sheweth men stryue maner god shal gaine nothing though neuer great band trayne god able ynough beate backe one worde theyr confusion iob companion spake alone mayntenaunce quarel eliuze intent say although thou haddest greate army thee conspyred toogether accuze blaspheme god one mouthe yet notwithstanding myne answere shall bee sufficient heere see howe strong god truthe vayne fight although wee fenced haue many partaker yet muste god alwayes haue vpper hande rightuousnesse shall continue vnappayred vvhen haue barked fill agaynst wee shall bee able byte shall bee sayde anone marke say haue remember strayne therfore firste let v learne lauish tongs god afflicteth v thing go minde let v bee impacient therefore affliction let v alwayes humble selues vnder acknowledging rightuouse howsoeuer world go wee bee bolde barret wyll greate confuzion shame yee see men ought brydle imprison themselues ende may neuer murmure agaynste god blaspheme furthermore though haue many partaker yet shall boote v god wyll suffer himselfe bee ouercome neuer greate multitude men shall bee vayne v assemble men owne retinue wee shall v bee put foyle together worlde made confederacie spyght god woulde passe woulde laugh scorne according sayd seconde psalme king earth haue consulted together people haue stormed muche liste hee aboue laugh scorne thus ye see second point haue marke muste thinke cace bee better haue many adherent partaker god condemne whole packe v furthermore wee see also parte wee haue god truth side must sticke mainteyne giue v mouth wisedome also power beate backe al enimies wee haue greate neede dayes bee armed assurance see furiousnesse enemy gospell set vp themselues bycause wee handfull people greate multitude manner whole worlde agreeth practyze oure deathe beare themselues hande goale goeth theyr side nothing triumphing amongeste anye stroke bee stryken vvhat thing wee knew shewed v heere wit forasmuch haue truth side one v may alwayes fight agaynst hundred thousande neede bee afrayde papistes come stoutly agaynste v theyr ergoes although bee greate hoste wee fewe none comparison let abashe v saying answere thee thy companion written alonely persone eliu holye ghoste giueth v promis intent wee shoulde sticke enter battell stande stoutly vttermost sith wee knowe cace good god fighteth v bycause wee mainteyne quarrell therefore haue suche certeintie let v fight boldly enimies muste needes bee confounded ende thus yee see haue beare mind may put texte vre apply instruction specially present tyme wee see whole worlde imbattayled agaynst god multitude enimies greate myght vtterlye discourage v oure lorde comfort v telling v wee haue wherewith answere though bee neuer many gaynsayers confederate toogether nowe let v come answere eliu maketh beholde sky sayeth looke vp greatest heauens hygher thou thou cannest neuer reache seemeth bee rawe answere none reason whereby shewe ryghtuousnesse god yes saying bee applyed oughte ynough stoppe mouthes blaspheme god beholding heauens hee leadeth v another consideration whiche dooing well profiteth oure god dooing euill cannot hurte shall hee bee woorse seeing hee bee measured according vnto men hee reuengefull woulde say angrie man doeth wrong ledde affection lyke man lookes bee pleased think himselfe beholding another man seruice god none suche wee muste measure owne meateyearde imagine fleshlinesse sky vnder feete doo shewe well hee lyke v medled v haue part nature therefore wee see reason sayde behold sky looke vp aboue thy head sufficient beate downe dare lift vp themselues god nowe needefull laye followeth peecemele ende may bee better vnderstoode vvhen eliu sayeth thou doo good profite doth god receyue sheweth therby god bounde vnto v marke firste poynt second affectioned men pleasure doone mooued bicause passible god nother shew frendship fauour hee like vnto v touching first point namely god meanes bound vnto v true thing notwithstading see men grow proude yea euen without cause occasion woulde make god beleue beholding although ca bring nothing draweth mischeeuouse tayle superstition vvhy papist labor much day ceremony gewgawes bycause thinke god receiueth profit make many gewgawes haue babbled trotted place place thinke haue made fayre worke churchstuffe well decked haue well trimmed washed puppet man made goodly banquette decked vp house bestrawed russhes thing papistes saye surmyze god delyghteth nyce toyes hee taketh pleasure muste imagine wee bring thing vnto god cause sayde sixtenth psalme lorde goodes cannot come thee howe honour thy sainctes earth forasmuch god receiue benefite v commendeth neyghbours vnto v good necessitie lyuing freendly vprightly among men indeuering imploye selues faythfully able help succour god accepteth suche thing sacrifice lette v remember doctrine sayde cannot bring thing vnto god serueth abate pryde v intent might thinke god thing beholden v led vnto foolish superstition gad vp downe doo many thing valewe though god tooke pleasure wee bring nothing muste also apply doctrine present intent eliu god like mortall men whiche moued touched bicause haue neede one anothers helpe cannot set lyght men force thus ye see cause wee bee mooued caryed fro muste suche dotage enter oure heade concerning god hee behaueth maner nother good contrarywise also sayd sinne wee hurt true wee end god much v lyeth impeach rightuousnesse meanes ill delt withall therfore sinne wee blamewoorthy lesse wee hadde impeached maiestie god vvee knowe rule rightuousnesse commaundeth v whe go contrary asmuch would barre reygning plucke seate trample vnder feete al thing men giltie yet cannot god either increased diminished therfore let v marke well sinning hurt god neuerthelesse touching blaspheme god true spew venime therby deface glory according sayde name euill spoken glory diminished acknowledge bee good rightuouse wise confessing men reygning diminished howbeeit respect v respect himselfe meane season sinning haue done neuer somuch cannot anoyaunce let best archer worlde shoote vp see hee shall hit skie vvhen wee haue practized possible wee come god meanes touche surely cast vpward must fall downe vpon owne heades shoote man hit wound cannot hit god sayd afore vve may well runne casting stone may wel shoote bothe bowes gunnes yet shall god bee alwayes farre ynough dinte oure stroke true haue already sayde wee may well barke wee neuer byte vvhen men caste vp theyr blowes lyght shall passe aboue sky shall fall backe vpon owne heades men cannot auaunce themselues agaynste god cofuzio thus ye see text well worthy noted vvherein eliu sheweth amisse god hurt thervpon haue double instruction gather one god sheweth singular infinite goodnesse towards v pleaseth accepte seruice although hee receyue profite touche marke one ought vnderstoode one word forasmuch ignorant person heere requisite declare fully yee see god might reiect v without making accounte v haue sayde lette world streyne selfe muche yet shall wee bee able thing profit god yet notwithstanding hee telleth v indeuer good walke commaundements dooings acceptable sacrifice vntoo nowe singular comfort gyueth sayeth accept doings although worthy estemed hande yet take good woorthe bind selfe beholding souereyne goodnesse god doeth owne accord let v learne magnifie mercie god accepting work wheras deserue side thing bounde also let serue incourage v well wee see god receyueth thing hande whiche nothing woorthe putteth poynts workes article bookes accounte acceptable thorough owne goodnes e good soothe inestimable goodnesse god one asought rauishe v woonderment wee thinke vpon vvee see howe graciouse sheweth himselfe towards v side wee muste consider poynt sette downe neuer somuch euill burt god therefore lette v assure ourselues god punishe v sinnes reason spyght beareth vnto v desireth bee reuenged man doeth offended man hath wrong doone hee harmed owne person hindred good seeke bee reuenged god say moued consideration vvherefore doeth hee threaten v bycause haue v perishe sheweth fatherly regard hath welfare meane whyle punishe v indeede therin sheweth iustice cace going lawe priuate quarell v punisheth v iuste iudge according office nature afford seing god proceedeth manner haue consider fatherly loue hee chastyzeth v meane hee draweth v backe waye damnation wherein wee therefore feele hande rough soeuer let v alwayes consider sheweth himselfe rightuouse vvhat done onely truste comforte selues therewithall desire haue pitie vpon v although wee haue offended yet hee may forbeare receyue v mercy heerewithall let v bee fully perswaded resolued god wyll beare suche stomake towardes v proude stately man doo forasmuche hee fountayne goodnesse mercy wee come vnto make v feele howe mercifull minded bee towardes v although chastice v yea eue roughly would yet make v perceyue doth welfare end perishe brydling v shorte humble v make v bow vnder mighty hand chasticements nowe lette v fall downe face good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v feele better wee haue doone ende wee may finishe oure race greater patience oute misery calamity worlde therewithall learne seeke perfection rightuousnesse wee may neuer bee wery learne schoole go forwarde waye saluation vntill wee come race ende whiche beeing bereft infirmity fleshe may clothed euerlasting glory may please graunte grace onely v also people nation earth bringing backe poore ignorant soules miserable bondage c cxxxvij sermon second vpon xxxv chapter thy vvickednesse toucheth man like thy selfe thy rightuousnesse sonne man reason multitude oppressor men cry hovvle bycause mightinesse maysters man sayeth vvhere god hath fashioned mee vvhiche gyueth v song nyght vvhich teacheth v beast instructeth v bird ayre conclusion declared yesterday wee haue consider eliu vttereth wordes misdeedes touch men god likewise rightuousnesse end imagine god cholerick reuenge haue offended contrary part boud vnto v seruice good let v thinke god like vnto v nother let v measure wit true abaced owne good doth speake vnto v maner men yet must derogation highnesse god despized bycause pleaseth infinite goodnesse yeelde rudenesse men nay contrarywise deserueth magnified handes greate wrong iniurie transfigure bycause hee frameth slendernesse thinke angry bycause men haue prouoked thinke hee ought recompence men hee bounde say abolishing maiestie number let v yeelde vnto men vnto whome belongeth behoueth v honour incomprehensible hyghnesse thus yee see wee haue gather vppon firste verse nowe remayneth see manner god rightuouse gouerneth worlde equitie yet meane whyle thing order wicked haue theyr full scope oppresse pyll powle god dissembleth maketh countenaunce prouide howe ment god hath guyding world dispozeth thing ryghtly yet notwithstanding men see greate trouble outrageouse iniquity withoute redresse eliu therefore comprehendeth thing sheweth muste woonder though god beeing pacient let thing go amisse prouide soone call vpon wee doo hartely god suffer men afflicted doeth iustly bycause returne prayer thanksgiuing ought neuerthelesse behoueth v tary leisure although hee delay iustice seeme sende soone ought come yet notwithstanding must wayte paciently honour truste although hee hidden v say first poynt set downe first eliu declareth men woorthie god shoulde succoure neede bee oppressed haue harme wrong done true crye oute storme skill bewayle cace yet neuer flee vnto god man shall heare screekes howling indure aduersitie yet god heareth although office reskowe bee wrongfullye oppressed bycause haue eye vnto direct themselues vnto make complaynte without order shoulde god leaue owne wilfulnesse remedy know god doth chalenge title vaine wil succour oppressed therevpon go directly vnto wee doo therefore cry purpose deserue shaken hand shet eye regarde helpe v seeke written seeke ye shall finde go quite another way thus ye see point well woorthie bee noted stumblingblocke troubleth v sore see god suffereth men languishe maner seemeth pitie misery come moste extremitie thervpon conclude regardeth iniuries farre withdrawen v hath care prouide necessity meane consider deserue wel bee destitute helpe bycause go right forth vnto truely euen daye confusion great horrible worlde cannot thinke vpon without shuddering looke vpo warres many place ye shall see whole countrey wasted poore folk know house burned goodes vtterly spoyled meanes whereof people suche anguishe bene better haue throtes cut firste pine sorte yet looke vntoo god man go straunge countreys hee shall heare many complaintes hee shall neede go farre matter wheresoeuer bee tax imposition wheresoeuer men warre passe like floudes water man hee shall crie shall galled vnto harde bone doth worlde amende doeth come true humilitie seeke god say ala lord sinnes thou handlest v roughly would behooue v thinke therevpon nothing v pryde disdaine rebelliousnesse agaynst thee therefore lorde thou hast shewed thy selfe souerayne shew v also fauour may feele thee father succoure v ende dooth worlde vse speeche ala farre men doo rather chafe vppon bitte meane whyle thinke vpon god rather record hee cannot beare despising grace like prooueth truth hee helpeth seeke sue hee sheweth thereby promising mercifull suche seeke disappoynt theyr truste hope like ratifieth truth sheweth himselfe faithfull trustie helping call vpon also contrary parte suffereth rotte whiche seeke letteth wast consume length time perceyued hee regardeth hath care necessitie wherin sheweth rightuous hee punisheth negligence rather pryde bicause despized grace offered freely true also su dry time god doth first help seeke truth commeth passe continually happeneth yet iustlye wee muste binde oure lyking althoughe god forslowe succour seruauntes euen call vppon theyr hearte yet dooth hee neuer forsake bee thing eliu treateth common ordinary maner scripture speaketh goeth aboute doctrine shewe thing may bee seene moste often yee see wee may conclude vvhen wee haue considered worlde wee shall finde suche e smitten vexed well ynoughe lamente theyr misery theyr cry vntoo god like beastly howling caste oute shreekes intoo ayre reache theyr heartes vntoo god caste theyr care sorrowes vpon hee commaundeth v cause hee sheweth himselfe fauourable vnto v vvee muste blame crueltie vnrightuousnesse nother muste wee imagine hee doeth men wrong wee see woorthy punishmente receyue wage vnbeleefe bicause rested vpon promise gyuen mooued themselues resorte vnto god ought haue doone sayd men call vpon god per dueture prayer bee made eliu sheweth nothing say god made mee giueth song night instructeth v beast teacheth v tha foules yr touched euen nowe serueth answere might alledged wretched men call vpon god afflicted yea sayeth eliu faynedly therefore vayne inasmuche prayer moste parte worlde maketh bypocrisie therfore god heareth thus reason eliu setteth downe go vntoo god maker hath fashioned comforteth men gyueth many benefites ought magnifie mercie miserie soeuer indure acknowledge god suche one hee sheweth himselfe towards v esteeme gracious gift haue receyued hande say wee come thus minded nothing seyning falshood v therfore muste maruell though shette gate agaynst v make countenaunce heare request behold text right woorthy bee marked ye shall see dayes papist make procession god layeth hand vpon bee plague famine aduersitie true turne vnto god doo paynim well doo call vpon true rightmeening heart ala far wyde ceremony proofe heereof let v marke well men cannot seeke god rightlye excepte know one feele experience first al whe call vpon god must remember hee oure maker wee hand let v examine make countenaunce praying man serche hearte shall hee finde haue skill say seeing god hath fashioned mee hande belongeth rule mee lyfe prouyde necessity holde therefore behoueth mee suffer selfe bee gouerned hande according pleasure shall man finde one among hundred thus minded speaketh true hearte yeelde honour god maker confesse well ynough theyr mouth ye say wee made hee hath gyuen v life meane whyle theyr confessing yet fully resolued cleane contrary prayer woorthie beare name men brutisheas acknowledge god suche one hee sheweth himselfe towardes howbeeit matter consisteth onely acknowledging god bee maker wee muste also therewithall esteeme gracious giftes whiche hee ready gyue v according sayd expressely text giueth song nyght men expounde saying sorte namely byrdes doo cheare v theyr singing oughte bee imputed god goodnesse men shewe theyr vnthankefulnesse acknowledging take god doeth comforte v making starres shine gyueth v occasion set forth goodnesse although sun downe darknesse ouerspreade v yet doeth god lighten v candels say maiestie quenched altogither hidden v exposition much streyned therefore wee muste take simply god gyueth song euen time men asleepe night seemeth make al thing dead vvhen sunne thing whist still seemeth kynd death god holdeth v shet vp graue eliu spoken song daye time beene great magnifying god grace day time men followe worke doth cheerefulnesse shew selfe wit awake therefore bin excellent thing haue said god giueth song day time whe assigneth night singular goodnesse god wee sort deade spirit oppressed liuelinesse v yet notwithstanding lord doth still giue v song whe men wake night haue wherof reioyce feeling god hath protection ought consider continue without sleepe meane god watcheth therefore ought reioyce behalf say ala lord cannot call vpon thee long asleepe behold heere blocke timberlog yet thou keepest mee meane breathe throughe thy goodnesse yea sleeping doeth feede refreshe mee gather newe strength without feeling men think vpon thing haue cause glad say ala god thou shewest thy self father towards eue seeke thee yea haue sense like dead creature seing much likely thou wilt neerer mee commit self vnto thee cal vpon thee howsoener cace stand whither sleepe whither wake shall alwayes thy hande safekeeping vvhen men haue suche thoughtes singing vnto god see wherat eliu ameth namely oftentimes whiche afflicted haue truthe pretende pray vnto god would become v gather togither god benefites call mynd good hath done v without end ceassing intent might cheere v vp slothfull pitie see yea wee fall disputing howe may go vnto god meane come whither regarde v yee see thing haue cheere vp mind greate number benefit hath bestowed vpon v ceasseth deal vnto v still day day first serueth confirme v suche wise wee must doubt come vnto vpon trust heare v also make v come thanksgiuing wheras haue tasted goodnesse benefites haue receyued hand grudge repine therefore haue well weyed thing tolde v heere doubt shall howe much bounde vnto haue throughly ir way acknowledging benefit god thou giue ed cleane contrarie nough rauishe knowledge god maker fore seeing thou hast nefits haue receyued wardes mee ought specially seing acknowname thou afflicte mee b image forget god benefite nge though god suffer foote therefore call vpiseries perearnestly thing whiche wee worthy pon streyne eliu speaketh texte god neuer ceasseth v good mu e time whiche seemeth deade h ewould say euen god selfe hidden seemeth bee mynded continue fauoure towards v ceasseth giue v occasion still magnifie goodnesse seeing ought touched another manner desirousnesse come vnto eliu addeth vniuersall benefit god hath bestowed vpon men true euerie man ought owne behalfe mynde benefit god according neuer one v excedingly bound vnto god great benefit hath done vnto desire know god good liberall neede looke hath done men indifferently enter selfe consider whole course life marke benefites haue felt hande god shall rauished aboue worlde say lorde go comprehend thy goodnesse deepe gulfe neuer able bring passe take little portion token recordes thou hast giuen mee beholde wit end bring lo howe behoueth euerie man owne behalfe marke priuate benefites hee hath receyued god yet notwithstanding wee thinke onely vpon thing common general amongst al mankynde ought bee ynought cause v magnifie god yea euen suche wise wee come pray deliuer v affliction wee ought therewith reioyce yeelde prayse shewing himselfe good father towardes v doe therein wee shewe owne vnthankfull malicious minde perceiue apparant nothing hypocrisie v effect thing eliu ment say word god teacheth v beastes giueth v vnderstanding foules ayer maketh comparison betweene men beastes heauen earth coulde speake certaine needes prayse god though haue vnderstanding aduaunced dignitie great honour god hathe done worke handes creature god haue inhonored heauen earth senselesse creature hee hath voutsafed create haue inhonored beast though haue made voyd reason hath done man hath giuen vnderstanding cause eliu doth compare v beast wherof long god made page duplicate page duplicate v ass horse noblest excellentest man vpon earth say made selfe made one god could well haue made dog swyne made must wee seeke grounde selues god made v reasonable creature must comende goodnesse towardes v specially seeing hee hathe greatly honoured v onely make v number creature also aduance v aboue brute beastes giuing v wit reason hee hath doone earthly creature thing told v first chapter sainct iohn namely thing haue life god life hath euermore bin inclosed eternall word howbeit one life whiche light life serueth men vvhereas sayde life men say light iohn sheweth haue brutish mouing eate drinke haue discretion god giueth v vnderstaning know good euill attaine euen euerlasting life perceiue one onely god ought honour father much god doth inlighten men see selues bound farre greater straighter bond simply made v creature god hath created v hande yet behoued v giue thankes seeing hath pleased make difference betweene v brute beastes giue v noble excellet life wee see may well say lord yet notwithstanding hath pleased thee set v nu ber thy child giue v thy marke whence commeth vnto v find thing selues say wee haue moued thee heerevnto thou werte led vnto worthynesse proceedeth thine owne free goodnesse nowe wee see conteyned text namely wee haue cause ynough praise god though thing generall benefite extendeth mankind hath giuen v wit reason aboue brute beast neuerthelesse true reason god gaue first man verie sore corrupted nowe nature peruerted cannot iudge thing god blinde wretch nothing vanitie v moreouer lustes carie v away stay modestie v much worse wee bee compared brute beastes bee found soundnesse horse oxe horse hauing reason doeth notwithstanding retaine giuen man sotted reson turned maliciousnesse stead honoring god benefit hath receiued become proud vtterly rebellious furthermore wee see reason thinke ourselues haue vtter beastlynesse come thinke vpon god see men intangled superstition vvhat men conceiue god vtter vanitie scripture sheweth men bee dazeled thinke vpon god forge suche heape superstition woulde serue reason vnderstanding eliu magnifieth much true haue sayde light haue nature turned darknesse reason sinne corruption haue drawne oure father adam howbeit looke euill sinfull must wee impute owne fault according also nature wee haue receyued eue oure firste creation whereas wee bee inclyned confusion trust owne wit wee say commeth first creation saye wee must impute vnto god god created v image image marred sinne adam behoueth men acknowledge owne faulte yeelde selues giltie god disfiguring oure selues turning light darkenesse waye heere yet one poynte marke midst ignorance errour superstition lord doth hold v still conuicted bounde vnto inestimable bonde aduaunceth v aboue brute beastes leauing v discretion imprinted heartes discerne good euill sainct iohn meeneth adding forealledged texte light shineth darkenesse hee say althoughe sinne haue peruerted mennes vnderstanding vtterly defaced nature yet notwithstanding god doth still inlighten wise man may perceyue print firste creation although haue thing giuen beginning oure father adam scarsely holde little portion yet ought well perceyue god hath giuen v inestimable benefite hathe pleased make v men separate v sort brute beastes see heere howe greatest least man haue occasion murmure god must alwayes come poynt inquire wee vvhat haue giuen vnto god vvhat wee alledge vnto hee shoulde bee bounde vnto v nothing contrarywise behoueth v yeelde vnto muche hee created v owne image made v menne therein wee exceedingly bounde vnto therewithall let v marke nowe god put difference betweene man man haue cause grudge wee see fantasticall person man speake god election tel choseth vnto saluation thinketh good kicke winch saying howe vvere reason god hate creature vvere indifferent dealing yea shoulde say god tyed men authoritie ouer seeing god choyce power make v brute beast yet hath printed image v giuen v far higher dignitie grudge put difference betweene man man owne secrete ordinaunce without making v knowe cause shewing goodnesse seing hath made man beast wheras might haue done doe loue nature haue cause grudge see rayle god election wit specially seeing behoued returne matter shewed v namely known euen vnto paynim appeareth euen among painims haue vsed manner praysing god therefore suche phantasticall heades must set schole infidel worthie haue maliciousnesse matched pryde god reproued holy scripture consideration benefit god hath bestowed generally vpon al mankinde ought prouoke v magnifie haue much greater occasion cal vpon thankesgiuing benefites haue receiued hath giuen v much say hath reformed image v offered v worde shewed selfe familiarly vnto v therefore heere must proceede degree firste must vnderstande seeing god hath inhonored v making v creature wee alreadie bounde vnto thoughe none cause hee hath preferred v brute beast yea euen owne meere goodnesse without finding cause v yet another thing wherein hath shewed selfe louing come seeke knowledge must make way v ope v gate beholde come god manner doe seeke hath created also hath vttered fatherly loue towardes created owne image likenesse vvhat cause hath aduaunced aboue brute beastes sufficient matter occasion boldnesse come vnto furthermore scourged hande foresayde reason ynough assuage oure misery howe greeuous euer seeme wit seeing wee haue receyued benefites god hande ought wee suffer oure selues chasticed hee list vse roughnesse towardes v thus sugar may terme seazon sorowes withall call god benefit remembrance time affliction acknowledging saying verie well mortall creature god hath put difference betwene brute beastes howebeit moreouer haue bene baptized name lorde iesus christe second marke hath set vpon shew minded keepe stocke howbeit much haue defaced baptime haue bin faithlesse wretch yet beholde god hath drawne back againe himselfe hath inlightned midst thicke darknesse wherein verely plunged bottome hell god hath reached hand iesus christ daysunne rightuousnesse doeth inlighten mee beholding face doctrine gospell see gate paradyse opened vnto mee seeing lorde cheereth v suche wise haue wee good cause magnifie humble oure selues nowe let v see howe many bee founde doe true haue declared alreadie suche ouerpressed misery calamity crie vnto god sort haue throughly considered aforehande howe much bounde vnto haue made way acknowledging benefit haue receyued cleane contrarie forasmuch men acknowledge god maker call mynde benefit haue receyued without ceassing specially seing acknowledge hath created image wee must thinke straunge though god suffer v pyne wither away misery perceyue helpe hande wee worthy thus yee see haue marke texte nowe must wee doe contrarie parte much holie ghost doth heere mouth eliu reproue men frowardnesse tell god comfort deliuer aduersities bycause seeke truth let v bee well aduised make god former benefites sheelde set aduersities oppresse v saying true affliction bitter thou looke inoughe tumble thee dispaire hath thy god shewed father towardes thee many way
