thou must needes feele fauor goodnesse behoueth thee shet vp thy sens suffer thy affection debate ouermuch beholde say wherevnto behoueth v come furthermore haue well bethought v god gracious gift let serue v double vse first must bee certifie v shal disappoynted praying seing god hath alreadie shewed beneficiall towards borne continued time life goodnesse infinite thing doubt heare come cal vpon ye see howe ought take god benefit persuade selues lost time seking vnto againe point wee must arme selues pacience therefore wee thinke vpon god benefit let serue comfort v time trouble let v bee malicious grudge rather let v thinke thus seeing god hath created reason haue right ouer gouerne pleasure come referre selues sort vnto god goodnesse shall ceasse submit ourselues vnto affliction hee layeth vpon v haue receiued benefites hand therfore must nowe presume plucke head yoke thus yee see two thinges wherevnto behooueth v apply knowledge god benefit call vpon truth nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v feele better wee haue doone therewithall open eye may dulheaded forget despyze benefites maye magnifie according worthinesse thinke vpon wise may prouoked serue honour walke aduisedly according good take suche example chasticementes hee sendeth oure neighboures may serue v correction shal please chastice v oure owne person make v feele stroke hande wee haue neede turne furtherance oure saluation passing trouble worlde hee may strengthen v continually power vntill hee receiue v euerlasting rest whiche hee hath prepared v kingdome may please graunt grace v c cxxxviij sermon third vpon xxxv chapter shall crie god vvill heare bycause pryde vvicked surely vanitie god heareth nother doth almightie regarde thou hast saide hee seeth thee iudgement vvayt novve visiting anger nothing visiting wrath nother punisheth hee greatly anger iob hath opened mouth vaine multiplyed vvords vvithout vnderstanding much first sentence haue nowe rehearsed ought ioyned matter handeled yesterday behoueth v beare mynde hath bin declared whiche god heareth trouble sheweth blame muste wited vpon selues bycause come right pure heart according eliu hath declared come seeke god must consider benefites gracious giftes haue receiued hand else trust vvhat foundation faith free promise god hath giue v yet experience haue goodnesse confirmation thing knowe word haue conceiued tast benefites come vnto hypocrisie moreouer know much bounde vnto god impossible wee bee pacient obey continue quiet without murmuring therefore eliu addeth nowe shall crie say verie well true men shall crie vnto god troubled plight come minded ought nothing lesse thinke benefit haue receiued hand nother doe profite selues settle trust vpon men shal crie anguish shall come god opennesse hart therfore god heare must blame owne sinnes say god hath forgotten worlde doth dutie asleepe therefore men seeke god truth hee neere hande sone shewe selfe succor long houle like wilde beast looke right forth marke whiche ought ayme cry shall purpose let v mark well day god heare v leastwise make v feele helpe thoughe wee storme neuer somuch cry stand vpon sure grounde cheefe poynt knowe one hee sheweth namely father sauiour rest vpon goodnesse euen calling remembraunce record haue erst felt therof end may giue v courage seeke wee ought doubt wee shall soone finde yea shall neede make long windlass come v see prayer consisteth ceremony rightnesse hearte afore god yea onely feeling misery must make v desire remedie also wee muste throughe fayth desire shewe selfe oure father sauiour fayth beeing grounded vpon promise muste also bee confirmed good token giueth v shall haue found experience good mercifull must able apply oure owne instruction wee may bee ryghtly fenced furthermore requiring god mercifull vnto v must bring sacrifice prayse benefites wherewith hath bound v vnto alreadie nowe eliu hath sayde addeth toke hold god prouidece sayde tushe vanitie god heareth nother doth almightie regarde obiection made person vnbeleeuers although bee tolde god doeth iustly leaue men weltring owne wretchednesse bicause come fayth obedience yet notwithstanding cannot conceiue reason imagin foolishly god hereth seemeth let world goe hauocke thing ruled beneth fortune ye see faithlesse brutish suddeine conceit catch hold thing shewed eies without discerning though loth consider reason cometh next hand would say see yonder hath done thing yea thou must seeke vnderstand reason marie inquisitiue wilfull bereuing selues wit reason shetting eye light euen much vnbeleeuers see god heareth crye therevpon fall storming yea accusing god therefore maruell thoughe god make succour fauour felt suche doe nothing chafe aduersities yeelde obedience ne seke vnto mind ought god hath iust cause let perish maner bicause calleth come way ought tel faithlesse thing shet eye think vpon much said prouidence god al regard v vtter burying yet neuerthelesse thing whereto fleshely reason carieth v restreined brydle lowlynesse modestie deeme god workes iudgements according worde sheweth v rehersed eliu person vnbeleuers nought holy ghost hath set downe blasphemie ende euerie v bethink vve haue seede frowardnesse nature euerie brayde caried away rage chafing god conclude doth dutie much stomack ful much pryde passe bound far ouerthrow reason set afore v teach v humble selues come iudge god doings ordinance vvherefore let v giue bridle nature heare god speak way well reason hee bringeth aboue thing let v marke wel eliu ioyneth making said obiection addeth although thou sayest god seeth iudgement looke thou eliu remedieth said frowardnesse hath bin discouered end bethink v euill v giue ouer true word crased reason shortnesse bycause set thus behold thou sayest else albeit thou say shall see saying may bee taken also person iob thoughe eliu vpbrayded haue thought thus thou shalt see god nother shalt thou know well considered sentence must knitte together therewithall muste also bee distinguished thus although thou say shall see hereby eliu signifieth men aduaunce themselues muche ought consider rudenesse small capacitie see god say serch bottome true must alwayes looke vnto god howbeit must first beseech giue v eye furthermore also must behold glasse offereth v say word work must walke sobrietie must desirous seke lawfull giueth v leaue doe one maner seeing god good holie behold farre forth pleaseth shewe selfe vnto v distrust owne vnderstanding wee desire bee inlighten holie spirite ouercurious presumptuous knowe hee permitteth wee looke god face suffer thing bee hidden v enter incomprehensible determination euen verie bottome depthes intollerable pryde men vtterly confound selues let v learne meane wee must holde see god vve must goe ouermuch hast must sober knowing small measure vnderstanding infinite highnesse god maiestie furthermore seeing hee hath declared self vnto v farre forth knoweth meete conuenifor welfare let v holde v content knowledge hath giuen v fall raunging heere marke howe eliu sayeth nowe vnto iob although thou say shall see sayd thou art ouerhastie speake thou thrustest thy selfe thou shouldest consider thou arte consider god cast downe thyne eye forget pryde thee afterward addeth iudgement face iudge thou saying may set downe two wayes take iudge thou exhortation humilitie repentaunce eliu shuld say wretched man see thou liftest vp thy self god maketh thee bicause thou iudgest thy selfe therefore enter intoo thy selfe looke vpon thyne owne wretchednesse thy pryde bee plucked downe thus yee see remedie giuen v heere holie ghost reproue v wee runne astray haue vnbeleefe conceyued wicked hastie imagination againste god wee bee brought right way must goe downe owne selues examine oure owne ignorance sinfulnesse shall wee bee ashamed forget wandering conceytes wherewith caryed fro lo sense doctrine wee ought gather saying take bee set downe iudge thou verie true meening texte iudgement god therefore eliu concludeth men loke counterviewe betweene face god oure sight eliu shoulde say god ceasseth bee rightuous although appeare vnto v knowe god gouerneth worlde ordereth thinges vprightly wee must measure thing perceyue god iudgement high v wee reach vnto firste brayde therefore let v marke well god seeth good rightful wheras commonly blind vvhat done nothing else euen tarie according faythfull man must fed hope hee may yeelde himselfe peaceable obedient vnto god wee knowe behoueth v hope thing visible v nowe haue wee naturall sense texte remayneth wee apply oure owne instruction although thou say thou shalte see sheweth v must haue tong libertie shoot forth whatsoeuer thinke concerning god must bridle tongs hold thoughtes prisoner assuring selues god intendeth keepe v humilitie concealing reason workes v therefore let condemned spirite god take heede rushe farre marke one poyet ought well considered wee bee able see god howbeit haue said alreadie true god graunteth v grace priuiledge shewe selfe vntoo v howbeit farre foorth hee knoweth bee expedient v god beeing inuisible selfe sheweth selfe glasse farre conuenient v wit worde workes yet must wee inquisitiue also cause sendeth v alwayes meane hath hilde allure v knowe knoweth ouerboldnesse also ficklenesse wit wee vnconstant pitie see truely two great vice men ouerhardie also haue disordered lustes otherside ignorance rather beastlinesse moreouer also frowardnesse therefore haue neede bee restrayned meane god hath giuen v bee contented thing coteyned holy scripture assuring oure selues wee shall bee danger straying wee followe way without stepping consider god workes iudge owne fancie liking onely hearing telleth v worde suffering selues taught mouth wee desire haue none cunning furthermore muche sayde lorde iesus christe liuely image wherein beholde whatsoeuer good conuenient v know let v rest according also sayd another place al treasure wisdome knowledge layde vp let v marke well blinde wretch wil inquire god owne wit shall hidden v shall neuer come neere much lesse able come therfore must learne condemne selues vtterly confessing nothing v meere brutishnesse haue wee acknowledged let v praye god inlighten v holie spirite may full presumptuousnesse pryde say able seke self let v kepe selues diuelish presumption let v hu ble oure selues god praying inlighten v herewithall also seeing hath ordeined word meane shewe selfe vnto v let v bee tyed attempt passe beyond thus much concerning first poynt shewed v heere nowe let v come sayde iudgement face must wayte haue touched alreadie must esteeme god iudgementes eyesight short dimme pitifull vvhat let v vnderstande god dwelling vnapprochable light scripture sayeth reserueth himselfe knowledge thing profound v therfore let v conclude god rightuous although wee see whensoeuer finde doings straunge offended must thinke thus wretched creature thou hast eye deede dimme yea starke blinde althoughe thy god inlighten thee yea euen good portion yet wil still restraine thee end thou maist honour confesse rightuous seeing thy wit vnderstanding weake thing thou wouldest comprehende infinite wisedome god therfore refer thing vnto thy god passe thine vnderstanding thou seest reason behalf vntil thou beare wel mind fully beleue lesson thy hart iudgement face god marke say behoueth v correct ouerboldnesse v end may cofesse although might seeme haue cause enter disputation god yet notwithstanding seeth thing hid v comparison contrarie thing spake euen whereas sayd iudgement god sight also declared vnto v sight eliu say god seeth men god knoweth man ignorant vvil reserue vnto god due honor vve must rid ourselues vaine presumption wherein wee puffed vp nature would wise alwayes tickled diuelishe lust desirousnesse inquire thing belong vnto v therefore let v contented glorify god yelding vnto namely wisdome surmounteth al vnderstading capacitie impossible shuld done without hope stay holdeth v obeying god thing nourisheth v modestie lowlinesse dout hoped thing shuld go better god would giue end cannot perceiue certein mind neuer quiet let v marke giue god glorie belongeth vnto confessing rightuous behoueth v hopeful although thing go amisse broile semeth heauen earth co founded togither yet must rest vpon promise hath giuen v asmuch turneth darknesse light hath shewed creation world knoweth draw good euil wil dispose thing seemed vtterly order shall perceiued ende hath wonderfull wisdome neuerthelesse first brunt therfore good doctrin warning namely must iudge thing first sight hastie rash iudgement hope must go v lampe shewe v way oyle lampe say inlightned sticking god promise wait paciently til god worke according hath spoke mouth vntil hand vtter self conuenient time shall learne modest glorify confessing rightuous doings notwithstanding troubled heere seeme midst many gulfes true studie christian furthermore marke nowe adayes easily caried rather vtterly driuen way bicause wee haue settlednesse tossed vnquietnesse yea eue boyling vnquietnesse would haue god make hast according fancie thing imagined minde seemeth v thing forlorn past recouerie bicause vnderstand long think vpo selues causeth v pacience obedience founde v therefore much doth stad v put doctrin vre whe see al thing hurlyburly god seemeth haue shet eye haue turned back vpon v let v vnderstand bycause sinne yet neuerthelesse let confyrme oure fayth let v bee quiet assuring selues god office inioyne v silence vntill conuenient time bee come yea vntill hee knowe bee conuenient v binde stake say thing must done manner thing must learne repose ourselues god shall pryde bee beaten downe shall thinke god doings bee good ryghtfull iust although seeme straunge v first sight thus yee see haue marke texte nowe eliu addeth god present visiting punishing anger hee knoweth multitude greatly truely text somwhat hard playne meening effecte although god nowe shewe rough sharpe yet notwithstanding knew dreadful terrible wrath would say none thing wee see world hee examine thing vttermost hee searcheth thing deepe doth passe ouer glaunce men terme heereby eliu ment shew afflicted vttermoste god seemeth thunder suche wise vpon v would ouerwhelme v behoueth v consider wrath hee would vtter full able destroy one man also hundred thousand world yea consume vtterly bring nothing yee see whervnto brought holie ghost furthermore verie profitable admonishment assuage affliction god sendeth v causeth v think tormented measure bicause seeming god could worsse offend god part coceiue suche opinion according haue shewed let v learne cosider god wrath say dreadfull although hee shewe rough towards v yet notwithstanding let v assure selues hundred part whiche feel would execute rigor vpon v haue deserued seing may know god wrath suche able one minute houre destroy hundred thousand world neither earth angel heaue able abide heauen earth al else besides shuld melted away like snow yea brought vtterly nothing ought humble ourselues notwithstanding god deale sharply v send v rough punishmets much ought stil pacient seing god spareth v bereth v good sooth haue cause giue thankes seeing vttereth wrath v wee worthie sufficient matter giue v heart cheere v vp throughly midst affliction wee consider say selues true good ouerwhelmed seemeth god shall vtterly perish yet rigor nothing great vpon might feele respect feeblenesse muche god beareth trust ceasse seeke hee giueth still signe may haue entrance come vnto behold say howe haue cause rather blisse god affliction wee knowe beareth v therewithall also taught trust seing openeth v gate end might still aske forgiuenesse oure sinnes beseech haue mercie vpon v therfore let v wey well word eliu sayth god present punishing nothing respect wrath wherefore must say miserie great indure certaine man haue eye god wrath compare indured world shall finde verie deede bee layde vpon v heere nothing seeing nothing god searcheth v extremitie passeth ouer v lightly would say glauncingly maketh countenance trie v examineth v straightly bycause wee bee able beare let v learne restreyne murmuring oure fleshe prouoke v impaciencie ouermuch giuen vntoo let remedie serue correct vice howe nowe wretched creature intendest thou doe vvilt thou spight thy god thou seest hee beareth still thee thou haste prouoked wrath sore thou mightest well deserue rooted world hundred time thou art worthy bee drowned deepe hell yet thou seest maketh sunne shine vpon thee hee nourisheth thee breade maynteyneth thee presente lyfe owne charge thou arte worthie bee number workes hath created yet giueth thee respite still returne vnto vvhen thinke vpon thing wee haue wherewith comfort selues might much cumbred impaciencie thus effecte yee see doctrine wee haue gather texte heerewithall let v marke although lord nowe visit v wrath examine thing vttermost must thervpon fall sleepe great day come wherin nothing shall forgotten nowe god winketh thing punisheth wicked take libertie thoughe scaped iudges hande neuer yeelde account shall paye deare time shall abuse pacience woulde allure vnto goodnesse giuing respite amende seing wicked mocke god horrible vengeance must needes fall vpon heade ende shall great day furthermore god spare v let v ceasse bee watchfull hee chastice v beate v roddes let v alwayes consider howe terrible wrath therevpon conclude hee doth summon v ende wee preuent last iudgement therefore let v alwayes thinke vpon great daye tarie till wee bee taken tardie comming oure lorde iesus christe let euerie v condemne himselfe god stirreth v therevnto furthermore let v alwayes beare remembraunce god oftentimes myndefull mercie middes displeasure cause hee examineth great multitude oure sinnes great multitude oure sinnes praye euerie man would examine himselfe ought finde infinite number sinnes yea heynous offence would vtterly dismay cause consider greatnesse sinnes hypocrisie hindereth v keepeth eye blindfolded man would examine himselfe throughly hee shoulde finde selfe hundred thousande time confounded hee came halfe wayes ende god seeth muche cleerely wee doe vvhen haue spyed one fault god wil spie hundred thousande yea euen million shall heauenly iudge doe let v marke god forbeareth v owne mercie ende would trie v multitude oure sinnes say search v vttermost eliu sayth expresly multitude greatly great number signifie impossible creature shoulde stande god goodnesse spare continually abate rigoure punishmentes wee haue deserued sinnes heerevpon haue sayde alreadie wee must needes thinke farre iudgement bee perceyued worlde howbeeit wee knowe yet god beareth v wee bee come lowlynesse condemne ourselues craue forgiuenesse hande let v doubte wee shall appeare iudgement seate latter day sinnes shal wyped let v vnderstande examining v hee doth nowe put v part end may examine thing al latter day remembrance offence may bee abolished may come account may bee receyued rightuous thoughe bin nothing v al innocencie soundnesse ye see behoueth v apply doctrine vse may learne walke hope wee may alwayes goe forwarde comming oure lorde iesus christ also profite selues wee see oure lorde sheweth v token wrath vengeance present ala calamity seene whole worlde wee might say god vtterly alienated v wee doctrine fense v withall surely wee doe throughly consider outrageous iniquity reigne euerie appeareth playnly god beareth worlde proceedeth suche rigour men haue deserued therefore let v learne hereby returne vnto better heart doubting hee receyue v besides let v holde thoughtes affection fettered brideled much eliu hath condemned al wicked thought wandring wordes false ymaginations let v beseech god first clenze heartes wicked fancy wherein bee much intangled therewithall bridle tongs may vtter thing honour according request dauid maketh saying lorde open thou lippes mouth may set forth thy prayse wee haue good cause praye god gouerne myndes tung thought wordes may honour dauid holie prophete needed craue hande neede euill taught seeing let v bee well aduised whensoeuer wee thinke god wee esteeme good wise rightuous respectes euer wee speake maye bee call vpon yelde thankes goodnesse maketh v feele dayes wayting till wee bee filled full nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement faultes praying touche v quicke may learne returne better vnto true repentaunce bethinking v oure life paste wee maye amende heereafter henceforth learne giue selues wholly seruice following holie commaundementes shewed lawe whereby wee ought rule oure whole life let v say almightie god oure heauenly father wee acknowledge confesse c cxxxix sermon first vpon xxxvj chapter eliu spake againe sayde heare vvill argue vvith thee yet haue vvordes speake god vvill extend knovvledge farre proue rightuous vvhich made vvordes shall voyde vntruth perfect knovvledge shall vvith thee god mightie yea mightie strength mynde enuieth reiecteth quickneth vvicked giueth iudgement afflicted vvill turne avvay eye rightuous heeeretofore vphild god leaueth sinne vnpunished world beguiled hath bin declared fully alreadie sure see god reserueth punishment many faultes ende make v looke execute full iudging wherin nothing missing haue occasion hope coming lord iesus christ shuld haue iudging world would done afore hande god punishing sinnes world time one rate ynoughe hee gyueth v token markes iudge world like also perceyued mainteyning godly said god gouerneth seruants preseruer co mit themselues vnto deliuereth aduersities yea howbeit done wise suffereth godly nowe afflicted yea seemeth minded succor though call vppon therefore behoueth v acknowledge god prouidence consider reserueth many thing till last daye matter eliu treat chapter importeth none thing open eies wee maye easily see god holdeth brydle worldly thing sheweth himselfe bee carefull ouer v true wee see perfect good state wished farre wide howbeeit reason apparant namely god mynded exercise v heere mayne battayles againe hee intendeth drawe v namely make v knowe day come wherein thing shall bee stablished againe whereas thing go amisse nowe ende wee shoulde bee prouoked desyre appearing sonne god sette thing order againe according office hee hath promised doo eliu treate foresayde matter namely god gouerneth worlde disposed thinges suche wyse iustice sheweth experience hee vseth heere preface heare mee sayeth hee haue yet matter speake concerning god matter extende knowledge farre sayeth hee proue e made righteous eliu saying hee yet speake god sheweth faithfull man must giue ouer maintenance god quarell ende stoppe mouthes whiche murmure agaynst blaspheme truely wee little peece zeale commaunded v holy scripture woulde much earnest mainteyning god honour bee sayde psalme reproches offered vnto god ought light vpon heades touch v wee may feele heart bee greeued sorie men v outrage possible bee thought wee wee hundred tymes misused ought owne honour bee much set handes honour god yet wee see cotrarie v defamed hee reuenge himselfe leastwise seeke iustice neuer contented til honor bee repayred yet honour nothing wee name god shall bee rent peeces one shal villaynously skoffe another shal spewe cursed blasphemy agaynste thirde shall rayle geere passeth slippeth away amongs v man moued wee speake one worde agaynst wee thinke wee haue done ynough therefore wee suffer god doctrine slaundered maiestie blasphemed name runne mennes mouthes reproch therein wee shewe one droppe good zeale oure heartes cowardlynesse oures deserueth god shoulde disclayme v child wee tooke oure father coulde wee abide men shoulde aduaunce themselues sort agaynste childe good nature woulde couer reproch carnall father although hee value shall wee matter concerneth wellspring righteousnesse king glorie deserueth prayse scripture speaketh effect selfe sheweth wee clayme father yet notwithstanding haue mouthes shette men go peruert truth name reuiled bee short hee made open scoffingstocke wee bee touched greeued wee woorthie bee acknowledged child wee ought marke text better sayde yet hee spoken god worde yet importeth faythfull man hath sette himselfe agaynste wicked whiche impeache god honour hee discharged shewing onely hee consented vnto much v lyeth wee must vttermost withstande resist offer wrong vnto god go aboute diminishe deface glorie maner meanes vvee must say bee enimies vttermost neuer giue ouer battaile holye iust quarell meane see wicked alwayes readie mainteyne euill caces dayes wickeddest man shall finde bearer bolsterers insomuch man might conclude hee bee fauoured borne hee must giue himselfe euill againe euerie man sell conscience tongue little good cheere suche corruption thing manifest yet meane whiche say haue zeale god dumbe dare open lippes seeing villaynes outrageous pray shall neede recorde condemne haue courage stoutenesse mainteyne god honour wickednesse seene wicked doo linke togither euill thus goodnesse yee shall finde man hazarde himselfe wicked maye spight god theyr mainteyning wicked matter vnder colour present shall bee giuen meane man shall haue minde mainteine goodnesse therefore let v learne zealous god glorie wee haue beene first wee see men go ouerthrow good pure doctrine let v shewe fayth v make confession withstanding satan lie seeke nothing bring trouble stumblingblockes church god one poynt againe see god scorned dallyed withall men talking holy scripture bring religion disdaine let v bee inflamed holy anger cause whiche ought moue v greeue v wee see god honour wounded religion misused let v shewe wee haue yet talke god thirdely wee heare blasphemyes flying abroade streetes market vittayling house let v labour resist vttermost power wee may ridde clenze away abhomination among v vvherefore muche v lyeth let v suffer god name bee reuyled conclusion whensoeuer wee see euill raigne let v cast stoppe labour amende god doo v honour acknowledge v proctor aduocates wee doo otherwise wee giue satan vpper hande guiltie betraying name god wee made account thing principall ought taken wee haue marke vppon wordes eliu sayeth yet hee bath still speake god afterwarde hee goeth forward sentence according also cace well woorthie faythfull shoulde imploy themselues vttermost yea streyne themselues aboue force sayeth wee extende knowledge farre therby hee sheweth wee speake god wee must lift vp mindes higher oure naturall vnderstanding mounteth good sooth shall man euer attaine vnto god hee iudge according owne fancie fleshly reason wee shall rather darken glorie wee glorifie god let v learne reach knowledge farre wyde according example giuen v heere howe man shall neuer reach knowledge hee ought doo speake god except hee knowe maiestie higher vnderstanding therefore must bee faine come downe v lift v vp vnto thus must wee humble selues reuerence ende god may lift v vp shewe himselfe v make v partaker doctrine whiche otherwise wee coulde neuer attaine vntoo yesee wee must reach knowledge farre wee haue deale concerning god nowe well obserued wee profite another maner wee doo sermon lecture come sermon howe disposed receyue doctrine set foorth ynough come church shewe themselues therefore goe theyr wayes ill came rather worse good reason god punish blindnesse doo despise inestimable treasure gospell vvhen men come thither lazily without minde fall dumpes consider god speaketh vnto might honour receyue thing gone oute hys mouth traytors god yeelding little honor doctrine saluation cause god blindeth vvhen read holy scripture either wee bee proude ouerrun matter vpon trust owne wit though wee sufficient iudges determine vpon thing else mingle god worde worldly affection furthermore wee farre reaching knowledge farre wee bee forepossessed owne fond trifling imagination wicked lustes holde v locked bowed downe wee cannot lift vp heades vntoo heauen cause see slender profiting suche beare name faythfull knowe god neither desire knowe therefore let v learne example eliu lift vp knowledge reach farre talking god let v learne also honour dispose ourselues looke reuerently vntoo also accomplishing saying holye scripture god neere vnto lowly sheweth himselfe distrust themselues without challenging drop goodnesse themselues finally often speake god let v giue owne braine bridle let v learne reach knowledge eliu addeth hee proue righteous made see whervnto talke ought tend whe speake god namely mainteyning glory doctrine soeuer referred end must hold good holy like men reason dispute diminishe honour god certaine nothing frowardnesse howe faire colour soeuer pretend whensoeuer wee speake god let v beare minde proue righteous say yeelde duetie hee may bee magnified handes wee acknowledge suche hee woulde bee knowne bee mouthes may bee shette haue occasion mislike thus yee see talke wee ought haue concerning god must bee sanctifie name according also v wee desire prayer wee vse euerie daye eliu addeth immediately woordes shall bee voyde vntruth shewe vnto iob knowledge perfect heere hee protesteth hee mingle anie thing good doctrine go disguise surely one poynt whiche wee ought marke well wee open mouth treate god workes worde must bee mingling purenesse must kept euer wee speake whole sound mingleth good matter euil matter togither dooth else bring good meate well seasoned taste yet notwithstanding poysoned eue make faire shewe indeede alledge good true saying yet notwithstanding interlace lye errours let v marke well hee executeth office teacher must onely regarde haue good saying specially indeuer haue simplicitie hee neyther adde diminishe anie thing god pure doctrine therefore wee haue well ruled fayth must go lyne take good heede teaching wee vse nothing guide v pure god wordes referred conformable therevntoo wee handle thing otherwise deale soundnesse vprightnesse god requireth wee say haue worde preached singlenesse say haue minde v shall perceyue ende haue beene way heere wee taught receyue pure holy doctrine wee ought doo see bee mingled thing mingle poyson good drinke good meate thing wee haue consider elius wordes whereas hee sayeth hee bee perfect knowledge towardes iob men referred vntoo god eliu shoulde say ende iob perceyue set god schoole wee haue seene heretofore hee went doo sette purpose bycause murmuring might seeme hee woulde haue ruled god owne manner bycause hee contented himselfe hys dooings hee woulde haue founde fault haue reserued ordinaunce cause thinke eliu sayth god shall bee found perfect knowledge howebeeit saying ought rather bee referred speaketh hee shoulde say thou shalte perceyue faythfull teacher meening forasmuche hee speake god name iob ought well admitte woordes bycause hee woulde mingle adde thing owne handle true doctrine perfectly euen hee receyued god therefore man preacheth god magnifieth doctrine must bee taken though aduua ced himselfe much must exalt god truth aboue loftinesse nothing may deface thus yee see maner eliu speaketh vaunte himselfe owne person ende doctrine whiche hee bringeth according god might bee receyued euery man humble himselfe vnder doubtlesse monstrous thing men fall striuing agaynst vvherefore let v vnderstande suche perfection worlde ought holde mouthes shette acknowledge god shoulde bee honoured speaketh v euery man ought obey nowe let v come generall matter conteyned heere hithertoo eliu hath vsed preface nowe entereth pleading god cace sayth god strong despyseth man verely sayth strength courage heere hee taketh grounde separate god men take number intent wee shoulde thinke oure selues verie cause wee iudge amisse wee woulde alwayes fashion smalnesse shoulde say infinite difference power betwixt v men go resemble god vntoo mortall man defacing maiestie yet ordinarie insomuche wee finde caces experience god vse rigour wee fall surmising take occasion repine agaynste hee threaten v wee awhitte moued wee beare oure selues hande anger passe ouer cause beastly presumption wee discerne god creature also contrary part god promiseth receyne v mercie wee cannot bee perswaded wee bee letted hindered oure owne imagination whiche make v thinke haue offended muche muche vvee make alwayes lyke mortall man therefore sayd psalme looke howe farre heauens earth farre thoughtes hee confirmeth saying prophete esay howe nowe sayeth hee thinke yee angrie manner thys serueth shewe v although wee haue prouoked hym vttermoste yet hee bee mercyfull still although wee bee totoo vnwoorthie yet hee ceasse reache oute helpe vntoo v wee see doctrine eliu superfluous exceeding muche oure behoofe bycause verie withholde mingling god men difference bee perceyued betwixte creature yet notwithstanding tolde v greater difference betweene god v distaunce betweene heauen earth therefore wee muste measure thoughtes speake thing oure owne imagination vtter peruerting let v rememberhowe elius meening effect god ought bee exalted aboue creature menne may presume iudge owne naturall reason disposition thing whiche see heere bylowe consider hee farre thing farre differing v daye differeth night proofe heereof hee sayeth god beeing strong reiecteth man cause mortall man seeketh hurt neighbour puncheth elbowes ouerthrowe make stumble meanes euen enuie spight one beareth another also feare haue whiche maketh saye one may doo mee harme suche man bee aduaunced shall bee plucked backe bycause manie infirmity men alwayes afrayde least theyr neighbour shoulde bee aduaunced muche cause full contention quarelles cause woulde alwayes haue diminished great authoritie credite cause menne labour sort bring neigbours lowe nowe let v see wee finde anie suche poynt god hee greate enuie v hee passeth men say coulde wee eyther hurt god diminishe honour though wee neuer great king prince aduauce throne aboue clowdes god hee aboue heauens yea aboue angelles men prophete esay speaking mennes pryde woulde aduaunce themselues sayeth like grashoppers yee see grashoppers skippe make great leape bycause legges bee long yet fayne fall grounde againe else bee frogges thus yee see comparison prophete setteth downe scorne vainegloriousnesse men admite wee coulde flee aboue clowdes admit wee fellowes angelles yet wee see doo worshippe soueraine maiestie god feyne hyde eye winges according sayde prophecie esay god afrayde wee doo hurt neyther hee beare v enuie thoughe wee able anoy maiestie shall alwayes continue vnappeached spight oure teeth seeing wee must conclude proportion betwixt v imagin god offended hee hath good cause bee angrie feare least men bereeue right true men blameworthie yet thing preiudice infirmitie hee shoulde enuie hys creature hee great eliu addeth moreouer hee great streength heart hee mightie vertue minde herein eliu toucheth another vice men euen whiche mightie ought enuie inferiours notwithstanding womanish hearted afrayde according wee see euen king prince whiche spightfull nature sorie see vertuous man true noblenesse themselues say god hath ordeyned aduaunce men vertue esteeme honour cleane contrariwise forasmuche bee bace minded themselues would haue world like ashamed see honest man bee prince would wallow filthinesse keepe stewes court greeueth haue lewdnesse discouered whereas whoredome reigneth euerie yet doth seeke still get libertie giue himselfe lewdnesse asmuch men seene bee bace minded eliu sayeth wee must imagine god bee fashion besydes hee mightie men notable reache vntoo hee also mightie vertue minde hee lyketh well vertue iustice pleaseth hee alloweth goodnesse hee seeketh meanes shewe vertue men better serued honoured thing wherein glorifying god consisteth men shoulde bee vertuous king see subiectes woorthie commendation himselfe mislyketh greeueth vvhy bycause thing whiche others wanteth himselfe god haue men goodnesse owne nature wee must bee faine receiue god wellspring whence must come seeing god needeth feare honour darkned men vertues marke heere wee haue consider shall neuer knowe god bee righteous mightie himselfe wee ought doo wee consider naturall wit mindes grosse heauie mounte high wee see vertues grace whiche hee dealeth vntoo men fayre myrrours liuely picture wherein hee sheweth himselfe men walke righteousnesse hee continually magnifyed thing wherwith hee serued honoured wee see nowe wee must match god men iudge guize fancie must vtterly sepatated according verie deede heauen farre earth distance betwixt v haue alledged alreadie psalmes prophet esay nowe eliu hathe spoken hee addeth whiche haue touched alreadie witte although many thing bee order worlde yet man maye perceyue markes god prouidence vndoubtedly although god nowe keepe one vnchaungeable rate yet notwithstanding well seene god aboue thing worlde hee guided sterne woulde bee horrible confusion euerie therefore let suffice v haue heere markes god prouidence ende wee may giue due glorie say lorde thou arte iudge worlde howesoeuer thing fall althoughe thou leaue many sinnes vnpunished cause righteous innocent suffer many affliction yet neuerthelesse wee perceyue thinges guided thy hande thou haste souereyne dominion ouer thing yee see eliu treateth heere first hee sayeth god quickneth wicked hee giueth iudgement afflicted hee turneth away eye righteous sentence whiche eliu taketh generall also behoueth v generally conclude god righteous euen wee perceyue signe righteousnesse wee must remember thing hath beene declared afore wee see thing set good order perfection wee woulde wishe muste put v minde god one daye iudge worlde person sonne according article beleefe iesus christ muste come iudge quicke deade truely haue sayde thing disposed bee wished matter vvee shoulde looke last resurrection doo wee see god executeth iudgements reserueth himselfe let confirme v hope last daye comming lorde iesus christ vntoo whome god father hath giuen power intent hee shoulde appeare maiestie right thing order set stay wee see god punisheth offence delyuereth whether bee selues others let susfise v allowe prouidence see god hathe punished suche fault muste conclude hee hath shewed mee myrrour iustice wicked shall come account hee accepteth person hee earthly iudge wil doo good iustice startes bee fault committed shall bee punished great rigour meane many others shall bee let slippe briberie parcialitie shall iudge bee quite cleane chaunged euident insomuch iustice worlde yea euen best bee founde theeuishnesse bycause proceedeth good sounde minde holdeth continually suche thing god hee moued fauour corrupted rewardes vvhat hee iudgeth according truth seeing wee muste needes conclude god punisheth offence therein sheweth v nothing escapeth woorkes must come account although bee hidden daye bee perceyued first yet wee shall bee neuerthelesse guiltie wee come thither let v learne practise lesson shewed v heere wit god turneth away eye righteous quickeneth wicked howe shall wee knowe alwayes one rate haue sayde afore yet god giueth v sufficient proofes conclude hee watcheth ouer godly ende maynteyne hee keepeth protection pitying deliuering daungers say wee see suche example heereof muste needes haue matter fully settled concluded v furthermore wee see also god lifteth vp mightie hande represse mennes iniquity howebeeit alwayes hee leaueth many vnpunished winking yea making countenance thoughe hee fauored wicked many caces haue shewed alreadie muste confirme oure fayth wee muste bee fenced agaynst suche stumbling blockes knowing god reserueth thing till latter daye whiche hee accomplisheth nowe howesoeuer worlde go wee see inasmuche god punisheth suche offence hee hateth abhorreth sinne therefore behoueth v iudge therevpon hee quickneth wicked doctrine set downe heere teache v glorifie god respect also let v marke muste edifie oure fayth teache v feare god wee see god turneth away eye godly hath pitie vpon helpe let v bee stablished truste hys goodnesse wee may resort vntoo oft wee bee afflicted haue wee seene god hath deliuered man hee hath deliuered selues let make v returne say howe nowe god hath made mee feele experience hee readie helpe suche trust scripture sayeth vntoo v come vntoo mee yee labour heauie loden refreshe yee see recordes god giueth v witnessing hee turne away eye godly muste confirme v promise goodnesse whiche hee giueth v also contrarie part whereas sayde god quickneth wicked let v learne take vse wee see crime punished let prouoke v walke feare say dallying cace god vvhy hee chasteneth one intent instruct v harmes great fauour god sheweth v hee giueth v example rigour wrath wee neuerthelesse without touched may take warning eschue vengeance readie v hee might haue made v feele thus yee see example chastisement correction god doth worlde ought serue learning true wee well say god righteous one hath due reward wee skill condemne haue done amisse allowe correction god sendeth meane wee applie thing owne vse yet principall poynt vvhen see god punisheth man must enter intoo selfe looke bee attainted vice whether bee guiltie respectes therevpon must humble selfe walke aduisedly haue earst done furthermore wee haue yet one frute bee taken chasticements god sendeth therein wee see also god hath care child god beate downe haue troubled one wronged another doth hee take quarrell hande wee ought better minded serue god wee see set himselfe agaynst enemy thunder vpon hee hath suffered haue scope tyme therefore haue declared afore ought confirmed leane vnto promise fayth without doubting shewe himselfe father towardes v therewithall must bee hilde feare wee may preuent vengeance wee see light vpon wicked vpon despisers maiestie nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement fault praying make v feele wise wee may learne bee sorie yea bee angrie greeued vice sinfull lustes wee may seeke earnestly haue righteousnesse raygne v bee refourmed holy moreouer forasmuche wee haue fight agaynst temptation present life hee giue v armour defende selues withall althoughe wee knowe much miserie wretchednesse selues yet wee may doubt hee vphold v supplie wantes grace according wee knowe perfection vertue goodnesse giue vntoo v according hee knoweth v haue neede may please graunt grace onely v also people nation earth bringing backe poore ignorant soules c cxl sermon second vpon xxxvj chapter quickneth vvicked giueth iudgement afflicted vvill turne eye avvay righteous hee vvill set king seates shall bee exalted euer stockes bound cordes affliction hee vvill shewe faultes make feele sinnes shall bee touched vvith hee vvill open eare ende amende hee vvill speake vnto make depart iniquitie heare obey shall passe dayes prosperitie yeares glorie heare shall passe svvorde consumed vvithout knovvledge hypocrite heart put vvrath crie euen vvhen bounde therefore soule shall die youth life among vvhoremongers eliu hath generally sayd god turneth eye fro righteous hath care contrarywise hee quickneth wicked addeth particularly better proofe god prouidece giueth iudgement afflicted poore man vtterly destitute succour outcast world neuerthelesse deliuered vexation trouble muste needes proceede god yea say muste needes bee fathered vpon god haue stay worlde yet haue strong mighty enimies sayd vndone hope life wee recouer manifest god worketh behalfe without cause eliu dothe purposely set downe saying proofe god gouerneth thing heere beneath also hee setteth downe second example god prouidence namely gouernement prince men sit seate iustice wherein wee perceyue god righteous haue thing bee order although bee continuall rate euenly kept tymes declared yesterday yet notwithstanding wee see order world therein may see glasse god hath lette looce reynes confuzion doth still shewe v signe token iustice vndoubtedly man consider one side nature man side maner gouerners magistrate haue swoorde iustice hande discharge themselues hee shall see easely discerne bee miracle god common weale amongs v yea must needes know perceyue say nature men euery man would bee lord mayster ouer neyghbours noman good would bee subiect seing lord suffereth strongest preuayle feare obedience towards preheminence therein bee seene god doth onely brydle also fetter men nature ende sayd pryde auaunce selfe high publike gouernment shoulde bee aboue agayne wee see men giuen euill iustes boyling euery man would haue libertie list man vnder correction therefore bee concluded state gouernment commeth god therein hee sheweth creating men end behaue themselues honestly modestly second poynt see king prince meaner state behaue themselues god hathe armed swoorde iustice turne thing vpside downe somuch seemeth intended spite god disanull ordinance ought mainteyne peaseably order god hath set inforce themselues ouerthrowe fight set purpose bring thing confuzio yet state gouernement continueth still worlde thing vtterly confounded abide stil mark thing god stablished bee seene therein god double righteous therefore without cause eliu hee hath spoken succoring poore god addeth immediately one kinde namely god stablisheth king one daye intent order shoulde stand euer world true many chaunges fall great alteration vppon principality lordshippes therein god shewed also office pull downe prowde yet neuerthelesse euen despite men rage shall order remayne still heere belowe say euen respecte tyrant king reygne wrongfully hee bee despizer god full crueltie outrage vnsatiable couetousenesse yet notwithstanding hee muste bee fayne keepe shadowe countenance iustice hee cannot go beyond vvhereof commeth bycause god sheweth himselfe therefore lette v learne profite selues wise thing seene world god may glorified hand hee deserueth specially wee see deliuer poore vtterly oppressed nother haue hope succour men hand let v consider mightie power goodnesse dispoze selues yeeld due prayze say thing haue note howbeit herewithall intent proue selues god childre let v beware lend helping hand wrongfully persecuted according abilitie god giueth v succour trode vnder foote haue meanes reuenge beare themselues vvee must say indeuer behalf streyne selues good earnest secondly sith wee see gouernours men authoritie froward spitefull yet notwithstanding god suffereth fall quite disorder let v humble selues honour prouidence assuring selues hee restreyned wickednesse wee ouerwhelmed horrible fludde shoulde bee swallowed vp drowned hand therefore behoueth v magnifie god wee see remayneth iustice good order although reygne holde swoorde hand vtterly wicked giuen naughtinesse let v consider let v asmuch v maynteyne order iustice much soueraine benefit god bestoweth vpo mankinde therein also haue prouidence knowne vnto v sith see hat prince magistrate officer iustice far square let v bee sory see order peruerted god dedicated welfare men let v abhor enimies god withstand order gouernment set ouer also let v know frutes sin intet may impute fault cause whole mischiefe selues thus ye see haue remeber text let v come eliu addeth sayeth good men else great men spoken god exalted high degree dignitie aboue rest worlde bee time set stockes say time brought downe euen shame reproch men put pryson fetter bee tied confuzion coardes yet notwithstanding god forsaketh necessitie maketh feele sinnes telleth fault haue committed ende vpon knowledge may amend returne right way openeth care ende bethinke theselues better know theselues eliu sheweth whe god seemeth vnto v shet eye regard nomore gouerning men hee hath iust cause although wee thinke straunge yet muste wee acknowledge hee iuste rightuous doings wee haue cause oo glorifie truely behoueth v beare continually minde thing haue beene treated heretofore wit thing ruled worlde one rate god reserueth great part iudgements intendeth execute vnto latter day intent always liue hope wayting comming lord iesus christ must suffize v haue token whereby perceiue thing olde v heere nowe intent eliu preuent stumblingblocke menne might conceyue whe see good rightuous folkes trampled vnder foote god layeth open tyrannie wicked worlde troubleth without cause although haue done bodie wrong yet neuerthelesse menne ceasse molest wee see seemeth v god thinketh vpon worlde ne looketh farre vnto v letteth fortune alone rule thing lo howe oure eyesight immediatly dazeled beholding thing order nothing easie v stumble cause eliu sheweth v heere although good menne persecuted else aduaunced great estate bee ouerthrowne god seemeth confounde heauen earth togither wee muste therefore bee sore dismayed oure mindes god hath iustereason wee able conceyue firste brunt let v tarie pacience wee shall knowe god make affliction v good tende good ende sayeth doth god shewe sinnes tormented maketh perceyue ende bring good amendment nowe wee see first wee must deeme thing outward apparance gage deeper seeke cause moueth god doo thing wee thinke straunge first sight seemeth cleane contrarie reason good man bee persecuted euery man ouerrunne howbeeit god knoweth hee doth therefore wee must haue eye end hastie shoote foorth verdit first dash iudge auentures ende affliction make v perceyue sinnes notable poynt whereof wee may gather profitable lesson true wee heare oftentimes spoken neuerthelesse wee cannot heare much wee know affliction irksome v euery v falleth chafing soone wee feele strype rodde god hande wee cannot comfort selues keepe selues pacience therefore much behoueth v marke well doctrine god suffereth v bee vexed euen wrongfully respect world euen doth worke welfare make v feele sinnes shew v time prosperitie wee bee blinde surely wee shall know aright conteyned vnlesse god bring v chastyzements wee ease pleasure euery v falleth asleepe flattereth himselfe sinnes somuch prosperitie drunkennesse cast soules dead sleepe woorse god letteth v alone peace although wee haue offended thousand wayes yet wee ceasse sooth selues bearing selues hande fauour loueth v bicause scourgeth v ye see menne cannot perceiue owne sinnes driuen force knowe selues therefore seing prosperitie maketh v drunken sort rest euery man flattereth sinnes standeth v vpon suffer god paciently scourge v affliction true schoolemistresse bring men repentance ende may condemne themselues god condemned learne hate sinnes wherin weltered asore therefore wee knowe frute chastizements god sendeth v wee beare meelder quieter minde wee doo piteous case see howe rechelesse wee bycause wee know god procureth welfare afflicting v maner furthermore lette v marke well wee muste looke vpon visible hande god feeling sinnes may come passe god giue menne brydle shall persecute v yea euen vniustly wee shall haue done wrong yet euen cace behoueth v learne god calleth v vntoo schoole forbearing smyte v owne hande putting v intoo handes wicked tame v meeken v better doth hee put v shame wicked haue full scope lyeth hande torment v doo woorst vnto v one god shoulde tell v wee bee woorthie bee beaten owne hand intendeth shame v much therefore must wee bee prouoked thinke vppon sinnes bee sorie therewithall marke eliu addeth god dooth open eares saying betokeneth twoo thing holy scripture sometymes signifieth speake v sometymes signifieth touche heart wise wee heare sayde v god therefore openeth eares hee sendeth v woorde causeth bee sette v agayne hee openeth eares hee vncouereth vnstoppeth hebrewe woorde doth conueniently importe muche wee suffereth v bee deafe doctrine giueth enterance v ende wee may receyue bee moued power therof may shewe selfe say two sortes opening eares wee dayly perceyue god vse towards v also hee openeth eares hee afflicteth hee giueth signe wrath thereby teach bethinke themselues better haue done man demaunde dothe god speake v wee bee prosperitie yes surely doth voyce canot come vnto v fraughted aforehad owne delight worldly affection vndoubtedly wee see men haue fill good cheere may make merry owne pleasure liue helth welth ouerioy themselues none talke sporting wise god heard among affliction messenger wrath wee touched greefe offending call selues home againe affliction muste generally serue instruction receyue may drawe homeward vnto god haue hilde themselues aloofe marke one poynt yet notwithstanding men suffer themselues bee gouerned god vntill hee haue softened hart holy spirite opened passage warning hee giueth perced men eares may yeelde seruice obedience sayd psalme wee haue marke therefore wee afflicted first let v remember one god speake vnto v shewe v sinnes indited v intent drawe v repentance howbeeit forasmuch wee dull vpon spurre wee bee vtterly stubborne deafe vntoo warning hee giueth v behoueth v pray perce eares open wise instruction may turne profite hee suffer ayre onely beaten without touching heart hee moue v come returne vnto otherwise let v bee sure wee shall doo nothing chafe reiect correction accordings experience sheweth moste men smitten god scourge amende rather wexe woorse woorse sith wee see example let v learne purpose till god open eares say till haue made v heare speake v woorking holy spirite also obey wee haue heard lo haue marke vpon streyne addeth immediatly heare obey shall spende dayes weale yeeres glory berken shall passe swoorde dye without knowledge heere eliu sheweth v yet better profite wee haue aduersitie vndoubtedly great benefite cannot bee sufficiently valued drawne repentance whereas wee high way damnation lord bringeth v backe himselfe say thing ought asswage sorrowe affliction howbeeit yet much namely lorde sheweth v proofe profitable v ende wee may bee deliuered aduersities succored shew himselfe fauorable v meanes seing found experience haue wee cause bee glad god deliuereth v sorte hee suffer v sotted pleasure worlde ende wee woulde growe paste grace therefore hee fayne remedie due season hee afflicting v therevpon deliuer v intent wee perceyue hande singular proofe fauour fayth god suffer v welter filthinesse settle owne lee prophet terme wee would rotte away haue sayde afore besides would esteeme grace towards v hee sheweth taking v aduersities wherevnto wee fallen lo heere double benefite redoundeth vnto men god correcting manner first formest bee brought backe vntoo secondly perceyue fatherly goodnesse bee deliuered grace thus ye see wee haue marke streyne nowe man might demaund yea wee sure god intent drawe v repentance hee scourgeth v himselfe hee suffereth v troubled man vvhat wee tell whither purpose herevnto answere asmuch wee see affliction last time god deliuereth v lette v vnderstand thereby hee mindeth vndo v vtterly contented bee beaten downe humbled vnder hand neckes brasse withstand bowe correction hee sendeth v wee nothing else continually double stroke contrary parte feele sinnes craue forgiuenesse perceyue v rightly touched maketh hee aduersities turne wholesome medicine v therevpon hee deliuereth v vve see say euen eye lette v grudge wee see god sende trouble worlde nother lette v offended though eye shet hee knoweth well ynough doth hath infinite wisdom appeereth v first dash ende wee shall see hee hath dispozed thing good order measure also let v learne herewithall much greeued wee afflicted manner assuring selues god doth meanes saluation agayne would wee healed wee trouble payne woulde haue good desirable ende let v followe way shewed v heere namely heare obey heare taught whe god holdeth v schole affliction may many instructios resort vnto let v heare thing let slippe one eare whiche entered let v obey say let v yeelde god obedience ought let v seeke thing else tha frame ourselues wholly vnto lo meanes may ridde aduersities muste maruell though men linger payne yea bee plundged dayly deeper deeper misery giueth eare vnto god hee speaketh apparant number afflicted tormented euident god scourge occupied euery nowadayes thinke vpon ye shall see whole realme oppressed warres till yet shall yee scarce finde dozen men among hundred thousand heare god speake beholde yerkes lasshes whippes sound roare ayre horrible weeping wayling euery men cry ala wo mee yet whyle looke hande smiteth according prophete vpbraydeth stubborneharted whereas feele stroke yet perceyue god hande vve see lyke plague time dearth woonder god sende incurable woundes put thing vre sayde prophete esay namely sole foote crowne heade soundenesse people lyke leprosie bee rotten filthie sore paste recouerie wondered seeing nowadayes men thanklesse godwarde shet doores heare myghte obey wherefore whensoeuer beaten god scourge let v learne come vnto herken warning giueth v may feele sinnes mislike doone lette v hartely sorie ende may please haue pitie vppon v wee go woorke sorte god forgette owne chardge instructing v delyuering v aduersities wee needes play restie iades hee hamper v well ynough according sayde heere wee shall passe swoorde bee consumed without knowledge say owne follie vvhereas sayde wee shall passe swoorde meening woundes shall bee vtterly vncurable must hope healing shall bee remedie v wilfull god warneth v faultes shewe himselfe good phisition towardes v purging v leastwise wee paste amendement nother reason amendment v chawe vpon brydle without feeling sinnes sorie lette v assure selues affliction worlde shall bee deathfull vnto v wee learne returne vnto god calleth v giueth v space repentaunce say wee come tyme conuenient enter gate open v say chastizements giuen v welfare turne greater damnation muste many summoning insomuche fulnesse miserie muste bee accomplished vpon v muche muste wee bethinke ourselues wee prouoke suche vengeance god vppon v wilfully small matter sayde v wilfull sorte must wounded god owne hande namely bycause men asmuche possible de ie yeeld vnto fauorable wa ne giueth enterance vnto good sooth menne checke god wi open defying atreading grace vnder foote god cannot away suche spitefulnesse prophete esay sweareth owne maiestie menne make scorning saye lette v eate drinke god calleth repentace sinne shall neuer bee blotted beholde say god displeased sinne hee sweareth hee wyll beare remembraunce euer muche therefore ought prouoke v humble selues god gyueth v forewarning assuring ourselues procureth welfare behalf end shake yoke intendeth laye vpon v beate backe stroke rod whiche hee gyueth v though h smote vpon stith sayde expresly suche giue care vnto god shall die without knowledge say owne folly shall vndo sayde end men left without excuse true wee shielde selues ignorance wee go qualifie fault else wipe quite away vvee say thought thing wist let v learne know mention made men ignorace condemnethem bicause played beast reason euen doth prophet esay speake thereof cause sayeth lorde hell open graue swalloweth vp thing people consumed knowledge god complayneth sinner casting themselues wilfully destruction therewithall sayeth befe want knowledge yea immediatly hee vpbraydeth iewes become brutish lorde behalfe doth sufficiently warne v long none selues well taught truly god good scholemaister bee ill scholers god speaketh v deafe el stoppe eares intent would heare ignorance whereof eliu speaketh wilfull bicause men cannot finde heart god poynt lesson teach come vnto ad leuer folow continually common trace therfore shet eye stop eares thus ye see ignorace full wilfulnesse stubbornesse true time wicked like well theselues feele god hande howbeeit muche worse wee see example day day man speake vnthrifts giuen al naughtinesse threaten god vengeance nodde head make mocke bearing themselues hande sporting matter agayne take sermon scorne turne holy scripture skoffing ende shoulde haue reuerence authoritie vvee see eye howbeeit alwayes impayre cace surely saying shall fall ground namely whosoeuer heare god affliction muste needes perishe without knowledge say ignorance wherin ouersotted must cause haue greater fall plundge deeper god curse sith see let v learne beteachable assoone god speaketh let v gyue care ready submit ourselues worde let nothing hinder v returning vnto thing taught sentece surely nature would otherwise alwayes egge v striue agaynste sayd furthermore appeareth men folishnesse although counted fooles vnaduised yet labour excuze themselues follye ignorance commeth making theyr account afore god shal auaile al therfore stadeth v hand labour humilitie betimes resort comfort god giueth v sayeth hee teacheth v double meanes one side maketh woorde preached vnto v otherside hee beateth v rod ende euery v owne behalfe moued returne right way therfore let v haue eares open receyue doctrine set afore v name god ende speake deaf folkes block wood therwithall also let v bee pacient abyde affliction shall send v thing falleth liking let v therfore ceasse magnifie god grace still assuring selues meanes maketh v feele sin intent shouldnot saped perishe yee see vnlesse wee spite god wilfully haue heard woord behoueth v also vnderstande intendeth chastizing v sending aduersities vpon v whiche side soeuer come shall neuer happen v thing hande eliu addeth hypocrite heart doo put wrath cry bound soule shall die youth shall perishe whoremonger hee sayeth hypocaites heart doeth terme hee meeneth imbrued naughtinesse haue backenooke shrinke god cannot bee drawen soundenesse wee shall see many poore soules sinne ouersight bycause bee vnconstant bee easily thrust way yet malicious rooted wilful stubbornenesse othersome whiche hypocrite heart say whiche haue roote contept al stubbornnesse mocke god haue reuerence worde diuell hath bewitched condemne good folow euil lestwise allow could find hart delight feede therfore let v marke well whereas eliu speaketh heere hypocrite hart meeneth wholly giuen ouer vnto satan sinne ouersight wholly framed vnto euill fully bent say mischeefe mocke god maner many exaples bee seene man copare vnconstant offend frailtie wicked despisers god number wicked bee far greater let v marke without cause eliu calleth hypocrite heart frowardharted say vtterly giuen extreme naughtinesse maliciousnesse aduersities meanes submitte themselues vnto god rather put wrath let v marke well saying putting wrath asmuch kindle fire still throw wood increace good sooth froward sorte striue stomake agaynst god wise amend cace state ala doo heape vp wood wrathe god muste needes burne whotter let v marke resist god chastizemets thinking beate backe wilsulnesse frowardnesse wee shall increace wrath god curse shall augment till vtterly cosumed whe heare haue wee pray god firste purge v suche wise may haue sayde rooted stubbornnesse priuie spytefulnes v although haue done amisse infirmitie yet may alwayes bee roote feare god v become vtterly past amedment also let v euer indeuer inure selues sayd sobernesse singlenesse hart ende bee snarled sinnes like wel foster moreouer let v marke well wee worke wyles pollex god market shall amended awhit wee shall rather increace wrath towards v ye see men ought looke wel ameding euill doings seing god curse shall increaced vpo expresse mention made increasing god wrath bycause men thinke themselues scaped whe god hath deliuered fro one mischauce thinke worst paste thinke vpo meanes hidden v namely god anon bring foorth new roddes draw new swordes suddenly thunder vpon v looke asmuch wee sufficiently afrayde god wrath therfore purposely sayd increaceth heape vpo v insomuch hundred thousand death muste needes way te vpon v wee shall haue despised message god sent v bring v backe agayne guide v right way therefore wee shall haue despized god warning sort muste fayne feele horrible vengeance vpon v whereas otherwise protesteth alwayes ready cofort submit themselues willingly good let v fal downe face good god acknowledgemet fault praying correcting v feeling stripe may vayne may learne thereby returne vnto may tary till shewe v signe wrath forasmuche wee dayly allured word louing gentle fashion see may grow hardharted rather giue diliget eare shall say wee may preuent iudgement whensoeuer listeth execute rigour vpon v sinnes wee may therefore ceasse haue eye continually promisse hope hee hath made v feele owne misery deliuer v namely vpon conditio wee learne sorie forsake may please graunt grace onely v also people nation earth c cxlj sermon third vpon xxxvj chapter setteth aside poore affliction openeth eares oppression truly vvoulde plucke thee mouth distresse set thee large place vvhere streyghtnesse rest thy table full fat thou hast filled iudgement vvicked yet shall iudgement iustice holde behold vvrath ende hee destroy thee vvith thine abilitie multitude giftes deliuer thee vvill regarde thy greatnesse thy prouision thy force haue seene heeretofore men gayne nothing stryuing god rather impaire cace hardhartednesse increaseth god vengeace kindleth fire nowe moreouer sayde conclusion needes play rebelles maner god shall die floure youth whoremonger man shoulde say comon language looke vpon yonder vile ribaulde hanged euen sayde despizers god shall dye theyr strength see theselues ease full fiercenesse pride yet shall god consume well ynough eliu doth new againe set downe sayd afore namely god openeth eares whome hee afflicteth without cause repeted forasmuch hard make beleeue yet withstading may well cosider doctrine necessary v affliction hard cobersome v much chafe fret cannot abide god hand rather thinke doth v wrog bycause know frute commeth therefore cannot told v oft god openeth men eares whe hee afflicteth cause sayd also god setteth aside sholeth affliction true translate deliuer according also taken sense howbeeit ment god taketh oute theyr affliction sette downe affliction similitude eliu vseth hee shoulde saye god sholeth gathereth himselfe whome chastizeth bycause menne prosperitie wander dote owne imaginacions soone god layeth hande vpon maketh feele rigour one take aside himselfe shew fault bring repentance see effect eliu ment say lette v marke well opening men eares affliction bycause whyle wee lyue ease pleasure oure eye blindfolded according psalme sayeth men prosperitie eye stroute fatnesse see whit therefore vtterly sotted sinnes also wee haue eares stopped prosperitie cannot heare whit therfore lord neede open affliction truely doctrine sufficiently prooued common experience wee neede seeke exposition darke thing see suche pinched aduersitie cannot awaye correction assoone spoken chafe seene euery seuerall person also whole body realme long warre pestilence famine see men rebuked sinnes murmure nothing resistance tooth nayle haue sayde bicause men eares stopped fatnesse cannot abyde god shoulde wise tell sinnes else men proude striue admonishmentes yet shall little auayle speake purpose finde fault passe vvhy euery man full fraught aforehande owne delyghtes pleasure bee shorte wee neuer touched tyll god hande nyppe v chastyzing v cause many calamity happen worlde asmuche men giue eare vntoo god ne make account worde longer vseth force hand agaynste hee seeth puffed vp pryde cannot otherwise weeld hee tameth subdueth folke mayne force yet ynough time howe many bee seene resist god hand wilfull stubbornnesse continue alwayes hardharted growe woorse woorse feele strypes common thing place preciselye spoken whome god intendeth shewe fauour afflicting men hee ameth twoo endes reprobate purposeth make vnexcusable godly hee intendeth tame wise may returne lowly mind sentence mention made god suffer perishe cause doth chastize nowe needefull god worke towards chozen neede generally mankind mention made whome god knoweth auoweth child whose saluation intendeth procure gouerning holy spirite yet notwithsta ding euen haue eares stopped shoulde bee sotted owne pleasure god drewe affliction therfore let v learne heere horrible frowardnesse nature furthermore although lorde haue touched v haue good desire come yet let v sure haue still nede help namely lord pricke v spurre v forward meanes possible subdue v standeth v hand serue owne turnes trouble aduersities sendeth v may apply sayde vse assuring selues would nothing rebellion fleshe subdewed maner thus yee see haue beare minde furthermore lette v learne stubborne god hee afflicteth v seeing knowe intent open eares let v pray afflictios may auayle profit v may come vnto make v go forward still good way hee hath brought v bring passe let v learne gad lust see moste men caryed away god calleth runne finde way come therefore let v set selues aside say lette v bee gathered vnto god sotted owne vanity wicked affection wee see selues much giuen thus yee see effecte wee haue remember sentence nowe hee addeth immediatlye god plucke man rim properly mouth anguish affliction set large place shall bee distresse reste table shall full fatte woord rest may taken well thing set vpon table shall bee furnished good thing also ease quietnesse shall table purposely spoken vnto iob bicause felt god bountifulnesse doubtelesse eliu vpbraydeth vnthankefulnesse come sayth hast thou knowne heretofore god made thee prosper vvhence came al rich whiche thou diddest possesse bounteousnesse whiche god shewed towards thee surely would still shew himselfe thou wart meete hadled gently hand certaine would go began thou hast perfourmed iudgement wicked thou seest thou canst abyde god thee good true iob accused partly wrongfully neuerthelesse withoute cause eliu condemneth grudging god telleth iudgement iustice shall hold withstanding murmuring meane whyle wee may gather good lesson verse whe god scourgeth v must cal minde good hath done v end troubled consider chastizemets hande done without cause poynt also wherevntoo dauid bringeth v god exalted seate kingdome giuen many victory enimies came extremely afflicted seemed vtterly ouerwhelmed acknowledged forasmuch god creature behoueth v hee may dispose v pleasure wee muste beare patiently chastisemets sendeth therfore let v learne apply sentence instructio beate god roddes may cal minde benefites hee hath bestowed vpon v ende may yeelde selues wholly acknowldge good reason hee shoulde turne v fro pleasure therwithall remebring also serue assuage greefes neuer felt tha rigor god hand would far pacience affliction haue heart call vpon god flee refuge wee knowe hee hathe shewed himselfe father towards v drawne v gentlenesse maketh hee v feele suche truste suffer themselues bee gouerned hande happie thus ye see giueth v courage comfort euen middes trouble therfore let v marke well wee bee pinched aduersities affliction thing wee feele presently muste amaze wittes shoulde thinke vpon god goodnesse vpon comfort hath giuen v goulfe hell thinke vpon nothing present chastizements vvhat lette v mingle god goodnesse rigor haue receyued good god hande lette v ceasse flee vnto afflicteth v hoping bring trouble good end seing hath made v feele already experience referre themselues vnto doo finde good pitifull father thus yee see holy ghoste ment teache v heere mouth eliu nowe let v come verse sayde iob fulfilled iudgemente wicked true wordes may also taken though sayd filled iustice iudgement iudgementes iniquitie true meening iob ouershot himselfe farre cupple himselfe wicked men neuerthelesse ment life though bene theefe whoremoger murtherer though hee bene blasphemer looce liuer eliu ment none thing meening iob glorified god aduersities repyned muche agaynst yea gone aboute exalte himselfe though god done wrong vsed crueltie towards thus ye see wherein iob condemned led leude life hee borne aduersitie paciently ynoughe called fulfilling iudgement wicked say agreeing theyr fashion enormity wee haue also note nothing precious vntoo god glorie owne name true menne gyue themselues whoredome outrage gluttonie therein god iustice impeached order hath sette among v peruerted broken much v lyeth god maiestie alwayes defaced yet notwithstanding man blasphemeth god openly humbleth himselfe vnder hand doubte exceedeth sinnes bee condemned greeuously therefore wee ought marke well streine iob vpbraided fulfilling iudgement wicked nowe wee may take profite sentence behoueth v marke firste soone man steppeth way streytwayes beginneth intagle wicked much bereeueth himselfe god grace howbeit stumble grosly first brunt wyll seeme vntoo v faultes bee meane ende runne farre blaspheme god despize suche sort diuell himselfe shall stirre v agaynst shall inflamed rage madnesse spyte cannot bee done destruction lo befalleth vntoo men iob liued holily mirrour angelical perfectio vve haue seene hath protested heretofore namely bene defender fatherlesse maynteyner widowes eye blinde foote lame table bene free poore folk come vnto clothed naked wool sheepe abused credite oppresse body withall although worlde might haue done many extortios yet notwithstading see ouershot himselfe god hand pressed vehemecie vvhat thing wee despite god wittingly willingly tolde euen men steppe way forthwith much separate themselues god take hygh way caste themselues satan snare therfore let v take good hede selues though haue liued neuer rightuously let v sure wee hilde still grace god holy spirite shal soone giue slip insomuche wee shall good giuen ouer euen turning hand suche frayltie v wee may soone fall euill shall become v wee shall haue gone foreward cotinued long time prouoking god wrath asmuch lay v quite quenched light holy spirit vvherefore let v bethinke v well walke suche feare vpon knowledge owne feeblenesse wee may blinded presumption rather pray god guyde v hold v mightie hande suffer v wise fall happen suffer v swarue neuerthelesse hold v vp may come full poynt iniquitie soone shall haue done amisse may bee sorie flee mercie thus yee see haue marke verse may hild better feare god lette v marke well eliu addeth iudgement iustice shall hold still say men may well play mad bedlems yet shall god continue still ful state end force become theyr iudge though men aduance themselues neuer somuche yet shall come vnto maiestie god vve may well take cou sell agaynst shall neuer atteyne high although could plucke sunne skie yet could touch god herfore let v learn men warned skirmish agaynst god woont though able ouermatch get vpper hand know told v iudgement iustice shall hold still see intent eliu lette v apply saying vse haue told already men make boanes pleade agaynst god measure knowledge haue themselues conceyue infinite maiestie would soone dash prittleprattle therfore whesoeuer wee tempted set ourselues god grudge iustice let come remembrance thinke shall gayne yet shall iudgement iustice hold still say cannot let god shoulde reigne nother ca deuice al seing god iustice infinite iudgements shall co tinue euermore full strength force remayneth v shrinke head submit selues wholly vnto haue beare minde purpose receyue good instructio text lette v beguyle selues vayne presumption see men bleare eye wilfully let v yeelde god duetie wit ryghtuousnesse cannot bee diminished v iustice whiche wee meanes preiudice vvhen wee haue concluded shall aduised sober haue bene woont bee shal haue tongue filed plead god wee shall humilitie acknowledge fault sorie wee haue offended wee bee trouble wee shall perceyue behoose bee chastized hand schoole passing profitable v cosidering herken woorde excepte hee dryue v thereto force thus ye see haue remember concerning lesson nowe sayde beeing angrie ende man shoulde bee confounded abilitie sayeth remedie hee passe golde siluer force worlde lo heere goodly confirmation wee haue touched already wit god causing v feele wrath ende vtterly destroyed hee spare v wee doo nothing else harden vvhen men haue stepped awry god beareth hee forbeareth growe brutish although vsing gentlenesse towards v intent winne v meane yet notwithstanding nature frowarde steade comming wee dragge still shorte wee see common thing amog men dally god vseth gently nothing else mocke goodnesse pacience forasmuche god muste needes vtter wrath else shoulde v perishe long forbearing v would augmenting damnation sainct paule meeneth sayeth god afflicting v ende perish worlde therefore behooueth v good comfort middes trouble seeing god hath regarde saluation procureth shewing himselfe rough towards v cannot abyde louing father v shoulde handle v tenderly wee abuse goodnesse continually therefore hee fayne make v feele displeasure else wee shoulde vtterly perishe effect whiche eliu ment say nowe well put vre truely would peyne v blisse god name oure aduersitie steade wee gnashe teeth euery v stormeth thinketh god dooth v wrong else conceyue suche bitternesse heart shet vp cannot consider sinnes shoulde bee gentle meeke take pleasure minding god graciouse goodnesse although confesse doctrine true yet commeth putting vre shew still well wee haue quite forgotten yet notwithstanding without cause holy ghost doth often laye afore v bring remembrance god shewing himselfe angrie v bycause hee loueth v alwayes shewe v louing countenaunce woulde ouerthrowe v destroy v therefore behooueth v feele anger effectually neuerthelesse record goodnesse meane whereby calleth v intent wee follow way destruction whereinto wee entred lo howe wee ought bee put minde ende marke whereat god ameth scourgeth v heerewithall wee wained agayne howe stubborne nature shame whereas woulde handle v gently dandle v lappe wee spurne feete scratch shorte cannot away goodnesse gentlenesse woulde readie vse continually towards v sayde slauish churlishe nature truely scripture auoucheth god nature gentle long suffering louing beare weake shewe mercie although men haue offended seing surely hee transformeth himselfe sorte followeth owne nature chastizeth v sheweth himselfe hard sharpe towards v neuerthelesse fayne vse suche roughnesse reason oure wilfull stubbornnesse bycause wilde beast sling farre square woulde gather v gently home fall biting kicking therefore behooueth v thinke vppon owne frowardnesse ofte god vseth rigoure towards v therewithall must also take comfort aduersities forasmuche wee see god doeth neuer forget mercie somuche euen hee seemeth full minded thunder downe vppon v hee striketh v one hande setteth v vp agayne send v graue lift v vp afterward aboue heauens seing god doth middes anger shew v goodnesse yeelde v record haue wee wherewith comforte selues comforte ought hand ingender quietnesse coscience afrayde god rigour thinke hee destroy v vnpossible shoulde bee pacient contrariwise also seing god sheweth v hee minded destroy v vtterly father v flee refuge repayre humilitie ought rid heart rebelliousnesse bitternesse make v submit ourselues obeysance wee may say lorde itl thou art good mee suffer striue thy hand specially seing fatherly thus ye see ende may bee comforted affliction behoueth v yeelde selues subiection vnto god hee may gouerne v thinke well iustice ende wee kindle fire wrath thorough rebelliousnesse hath bene sayde afore sayde purposely ende god vtterly ouerthrowe consume abilitie serueth abate men pryde needes strengthen themselues continually god hand cause eliu addeth shallbee raunsoming wee may well bring great present yet shall nother gold siluer able deliuer v hande god rather shall bee occasion destroy v muste vnderstande god intendeth abate men aduauncing themselues agaynste one man riche another good credite third good estimation woorshippe make bulwarkes thing agaynst god thinke ourselues well ynough senced withstande hande wee haue foolishe conceyte yet alwayes bee blockishnesse v vntill time men brought nothing knowe nother strength ought else thinke themselues able withstand god vvhat done let v learne abilitie lesse nothing speciallye wee haue deale god hee blowe vppon vvee may well gather togither strength worlde onely whiche might one man yea though strogest euer also strength creature aboue beneath yet shall bee nothing woorth wee haue hande god agaynste v therefore let v marke wel humble ourselues god must dispatch away vayne presumptuousnesse thinke wee haue thing remayning v somuch although thinke haue courage strength v time yet behoueth v know smoke please god consume v therevpon let v returne vnto god praying giue v abilitie power say make v rest alwayes vpon knowing hold life appurtenance thereof free goodnesse thus ye see haue marke streyne sayd god destroy men abilitie shallbee consumed notwithstanding theyr strength wheras sayde shal raunsoming serueth ex pesse better thing come say although men graunte nother gold siluer able raunsome man god yet see fall asleepe ryches credit thing haue graunted cannot withstande god yet make bulwarkes thoughe able beate backe harmes fight
