agaynst god whence commeth suche presumptuousnesse beholde woorme earth carion rottennesse aduaunceth selfe god must needes bee horrible beastly blockishnesse yes surely specially man riche hee thinketh hee hath wote bee esteemed hee would purchace estimation vaunting himselfe farre lifte vp himselfe god although hee speake one woorde yet doted beareth himselfe hand gold siluer able deliuer muste regarde men confesse mouthes wee muste haue eye theyr dooings giue true proofe sayde diuelishe pryde namely trusting gold siluer steade putting good vse gather suche pryde meanes therof fall iustling agaynst god seeing behoueth v thinke well therevpon holy ghost vseth superfluous speache true firste blushe may seeme needelesse tell v god regardeth nother golde siluer hee knoweth babe haue skill say muche yea meane whyle wisest say take themselues wisest counted among men blinded euery turne beare themselues hande may bought gold siluer vnder colour somewhat haue men feare honour yee shall see besotted take themselues mortall men thinke god one moment ouerthrowe beleeued shoulde neuer haue sayde diuelish pryde exalting theselues fashion agaynst god nowe sith lette v learne profite ourselues better god chastizements haue done furthermore although smyte vpon v yet let v haue wit fare better correction sheweth eye god vseth goodnesse teach v me harm set suche chastizementes v may serue instruction therefore let v thinke vpon aduaunce selues agaynst moreouer seeing wee cannot bring thing redeeme selues hand let v resort raunsome hath giuen v persone owne sonne according also peter telleth v bought gold siluer precious bloud vnspotted lamb thus ye see poynt whervnto must come concluding texte knowe bereft meanes scape god hande necessitie vtterly cosumed vseth pitie towardes v must vnderstande hath giuen v good remedie pleased offer vp onely sonne sacrifize v wee fully raunsomed sufficient discharge put away fault diuell shall haue interest v although ouerwhelmed infinite multitude sinnes yet notwithstanding bloude iesus christ answere v sufficient satisfaction offence inough appease wrath god ye see whervnto refuge must cannot come bloud iesus christ vntill bereft statelinesse wel past come paste ende may consider vtterly perish sinne quite cleane ouerwhelmed god giuen v meane purged bloud sonne come end caryed away rage lift vp selues god though could scape hande rather holde selues suche awe euen willing minde wee looke god shoulde cheyne v vp like wilde beastes euery v may bridle himselfe owne accorde let v haue suche modestie v attempt thing whensoeuer shall please chastize v let euery v thinke thus go god chastiseth sinne maner behoueth mee make profit therfore let v deafe god warneth v fashion let v looke narrowly selues bee watchfull according example giueth v intent grow past grace thing befall v spoken heretofore namely heape vp continually greater wrath horrible vengeance god vpon v let v fall face good god acknowledgemet sinnes praying giue v repentance may resort wholly vnto submitte selues fully guyding holy spirite wee may walke rightly according good wise name may glorified v life long let v say almightie god heauenly father c cxlij sermon fourth vpon xxxvj chapter consume night roote people vnder keepe thee turning iniquitie thou hast chozen rather affliction behold god exalteth povver vvho like teache vvhome hath set ouer vvayes hath ouerlooked way vvho shall say vnto thou hast done amisse remember thou magnifie vvorke vvhich men beholde knowe good profitable thing thinke vpo god work also thing whence muste fetch oure learning wisdome whole life speciallye night time whe alone selues wee haue leysure occupyed applying mind study ouerpasse thing see day time night thinke vpon leysure settlednesse coprehed better neuerthelesse must keepe measure musing vpon god work wit high v passe reache vnderstanding wee muste stoppe glorifie specially pleaseth conceale reason doings v cause sayeth text must spende night musing muche bowe people rooted vnder good seeke howe god rooteth nation end learne humilitie behoueth v reason wise namely god passe destroy whole countrie inhabiters thereof shall become one poore man shall one man proude thinke haue euerlasting state whe setteth eye god sweepeth away great multitude people minute houre ye see profitable comparison god spare whole countrie haue offended shall become mee knoweth exceeding great number sinnes wretched creature furthermore shall haue muzed vpon thing mind troubled amazed reason sundry doubt come heades able resolue haue else holde selues within sobrietie reuerence god iudgements although comprehend therefore behoueth v take good heede god work yet must beware ouershoot selues making log depe search cause forbidden text consume swallowe vp night marke one poynte furthermore let v marke wheras said people rooted vnder magnifie god power causeth sinke bottomlesse pitte place shall haue giuen dwell whole nacion driuen eye co ueyed far countrie continued still matter make v wonder much suddeine change come world seeme god maketh melt away like snow dede see countrie hath bin well peopled day layd waste vvhat become inhabiters true scartered yet remebrance razed forasmuch man cannot poynt know become thus ye see imported sentence sayd nacions shall rooted place vnder foote though earth opened swalowed vp man might perceiue print path vvhen god worketh fashio wonderfuller thing people remoued place place seene god dislodgeth whole countrie giue new dwelling hereby warned considering god iudgementes wee muste looke hygher owne wittes reach vnto cause feare god much wee ought yet notwithstanding wee diminishe power fearing highnesse whiche ought make v afrayde therfore oft set mindes considering god iudgements executeth world let v learn consider ourselues high thing v haue throughly thought vpon must faine stop short wittes reach far wide besides heere also one good admonition god needeth vse inferiour visible meanes hee liste consume v stande fastest hee make v melte away earth beareth v day shall fayle v tomorrow although haue none enimy assaile v although god sende greate army agaynst v truly nedeth giue v one angry looke shall consumed yea euen without putting hande vnto v hee shall neede chaunge place hee shall neede remoue v farre hee shall neede caste v downe breake neckes stand surest vpon feete seeme best able hold ourselues good plight euen shall soonest perishe god agaynst v man shall able rid v hande seeing tolde v lette v learne humble ourselues haue foundacion souereyne power aboue forasmuch god promiseth reache v hand let v truste therevnto referre selues wholly vnto therewithall acknowledging oure owne vanitie vnsufficiencie end puffed vp presumption maketh v drunken thus ye see effect haue beare away verse sayde immediatly keepe thee turning iniquitie thou baste chozen rather affliction else bycause affliction hebrew woorde manner speach importeth twayne first formost iob warned hee shoulde turne euill vnder terme wee meene eyther robberie murther spitefulnesse suche like thing vnderstande hartburnings againste god grudgings rebellings proceede impaciencie cause sayd lob must keepe himselfe turning vnto euill shewed himselfe bee pacientynough submitting himselfe vnto god acknowledging rightuousnesse time aduersitie purposely sayd vnto stand vpon gard harde thing forbeare falling pinched aduersitie agayne looke sayde vnto iob ought serue v let v take saying exhortatio holy ghost v al comon watchfull whe bee afflicted swarue aside vnto euill vvhat reason assoone god hand toucheth v greued measure needeth put v patience specially affliction greate violent vtterly dismayd stoutnesse soeuer v afore whereas man would haue thought v inuincible bee quite hart wote become seeing frailtie v standeth v hande looke well selues doo indeuer holde fast good yea verily although man streyne himselfe vttermost yet shall hee haue much ado stande hee stumble meanes yet notwithstanding wee haue cause bee good cheere forsomuch see spirite god considereth howe hard battels wee labour keepe selues euill let v doubt god holde v vp euen seeth v last cast wee holde inforce ourselues therevnto although bee feeblenesse wee dutie full yet god accept paynes indure take good woorth beholde thing ought giue v courage yet must diligent behalf according shewed v therefore let v flatter selues sticke wee turne aside vnto euill say ouermuch greeued god beateth v roddes say let v labour keepe selues striuing agaynst wee murmure iustice haue seene heretofore extreeme wickednesse men lift vp themselues sort agaynst god stubborne cannot thinke well doings glorifie although appeare bee euill iudgement men yet doth god esteeme heynous crime without cause vvherefore oft wee feele aduersitie let v looke well selues quiet submit selues wholy vnto god thing eliu sheweth euidently hee addeth iob bad chozen euill rather affliction bycause affliction translation tende one ende iob bare cace peasably humbling himselfe lyfted vp agaynst god affliction considered behoued haue stouped vnder hande hilde power man aske howe iob condemned sturdinesse seeing set v myrrour pacientnesse haue answered question already namely god accepted pacient certesse vertue commended onely recorde mortall men also recorde holy ghost yet notwithstanding let hee imperfection amisse respect iob hauing indeuered himselfe bee quiet hee might glorifie god knowe publish mightie power blamed neuerthelesse pray shall become v make comparison betweene pacientnesse hartburnings repinings v wee coy god ticke v little finger pelting chafe nothing else v murmuring spyting seeing bee farre vertue iob deserue hundred time condemned hee therefore let v vnderstande first although affliction bee sent v tame v withall yet doth stirre v rebelling agaynst god owne nature bycause sinfulnesse vvhen god chastizeth v end deale better v according sheweth v sinnes intent condemning wee flee refuge hauing knowne iudge beseech pardon grace learne delight sooth oure selues oure vyces thus ye see end god chastizeth v turne affliction contrarie steade stouping vnder god hande nothing fret grinde teeth storme short wee cannot abide bee either poore sicke suffer miseryes worlde woulde faine god shoulde let v alone peace yea hee shoulde gouerne v owne fancie ought misliking reason affliction wee swarue aside vnto euill seing frowardnesse v meanes god ordeyneth holde v awe vnder obedience turned v cleane contrarie much make v play wilde beastes chafe agaynst kicke agaynst spurre seeing say sinfulnesse v lette v learne resist muche possible seeing iob hee could blamed haue chozen iniquitie affliction let v consider much happen vnto v looke well v furthermore whereas sayd rather affliction conuenient fit translation notwithstanding sayde come one end maner speaking hath certaine grace whereof may gather instruction sayde iob choze iniquitie rather affliction howe vvhen man chafeth agaynst god doeth hee therefore scape hande hee holdeth himselfe aray aduersitie ought make v stoupe wee fight agaynst hande god true vayne wee shall bee disappoynted hope wee shall gayne nothing yet oft gnash teeth maner god impaciencie meening possible bee subiect vnto god cause sayde saying importeth good doctrine perceyued throughly yeelde meekely vnto aduersitie loth subiect vnto god coulde finde harte beate backe force wee woulde abhorre impacientnesse muche yea would thinke intolerable blasphemie wee sticke chafe turmoyle god hande vppon v token bee acquainted sayd text namely vnpacient loth bee subiect vnto god woulde fayne haue soueraintie authoritie abolished hee hath ouer thing ought put v minde pacient haue bene wont whensoeuer pleaseth god frame v humilitie eliu addeth god exalteth power like teaching lawmaker hee othersome translate hee rusheth casteth forth doth hebrew worde betokeneth also cast throw neuerthelesse processe text sheweth forasmuch god wisedome treated better take woorde teach taske men lawe doctrine according worde betokeneth commonly nowe behoueth v take sentence first maner god bath like teaching referred simply woorde god also inwarde power god vttereth pleaseth touch v quicke pierce hart wise come truly whensoeuer god woorde preached men reade holy scripture god teacher go schoole may wel sayd teaching like vnto shall haue bene taught men life long yet shall nothing vanitie v vntill grounded wisedome god bicause substantialnesse thing vanishe quite away good fayth wise men worlde neuer highly learned sharpe witted yet vnderstanding darkened continually cloudes much certaintie euer newe seeke much sayd taught men therefore verie true saying teacher like vnto god shall neuer taught perfectly till haue knowne worde god eliu procedeth yet wit taught god pleaseth touch harte inwardly holy spirite hee woorketh sort wee knowe maiestie obey creature founde peculiar office god holye spirite yea reserueth wholly himselfe experience sheweth hee onely worthie prayse though wee reade holy scripture continually without ceassing expounded v men excellent skill great cunning yet shoulde labour vnauaylable shall profite nothing vntill god inlighten v holy spirite touch hart soften perce eares hath bene seene heretofore open eye harte hard flint may turned flesh bow vnto obedience vntill time god shal purpose men speake v teaching slip vanishe away v yet shall neuer bee able take roote mindes therefore without cause tolde v heere teacher like vnto god furthermore sayd onely ende wee shoulde repayre vnto bee rightly taught also ende learne selfwise discourse imagination conceiue next way shet selues oute doore wee might come god schoole vvhat done let v learne vtterly ignorant till lord haue taught v morouer let v cotent selues knowledge haue learned hande whatsoeuer else commeth head let v thrust vnder foote assuring selues euery whit leasing falsehood thus ye see eliu ment streyne also cause sayeth beholde god exalteth aduaunceth power heereby sheweth god worke v must go knowe vttermost thing doth may trie workes men inasmuch wee haue eye wee beholde looke euery corner also able handle hand tosse turne oure pleasure wyth workes god exalteth power say hee woonderfull doings therefore men must attempt preace farre search vttermost doings iudge aduenture giue bridle rashnesse comprehend seeing god woorkes high proceede infinite power behoueth v also stay wee bee couched heere lowe great distance betweene v cannot flie high vvherefore let v holde v contented god sendeth suffer selues bee gouerned holy spirite neither couet desire knowe thing saue shall haue shewed v short let v scholers assuring selues wisedome consisteth brideling owne fancy raunge abroade nowe wee see meening eliu therefore better confirming matter haue dealt heretofore let v follow sayd admonition hath bene sayde good thing apply minde considering god woorkes bee wee deale soberly acknowledging slendernesse owne vnderstanding therefore whereas sayd god exalteth power let v vnderstand hee intendeth let v wander owne liking therfore let v proudas say workes esteemed men workes let v assure selues haue men magnifie honour furthermore forasmuch wisedome fayleth v yet notwithstanding fleshe tempteth tickleth v desirous seeke lawfull v know let v beare minde none like god teaching therfore behoueth v come ende may inlighten v mindes may bee gouerned hande direction vvhen taught schoole wee shall profite ynough god workes therewithall wee shall haue wherewith barre owne curiosity vndoubtedly behoueth v alwayes watchfull may restrayne selues although faythfull bee modest framed long aforehande receyue instruction god hande yet notwithstanding still curiosity flittering head haled away many imagination come mind causing say let v alwayes come backe conclusion forsomuch able comprehend god woorkes creature else power behoueth v come vnto hee muste onely teache v woorde also inlighten v order thought bring v vnder lure holde v fully awe thus yee see effect wee haue remember sentence sayde anon shall ouersee way shall say thou hast done amisse else hath set ouer way hebrue worde signifieth giue preheminence lordship sometime visite ouersee neuerthelesse meening eliu euident inough namely mortal creature controll god make search finde fault doings blame though misaduised knewe howe order thing bee summe conteyned intent wee may gather familiar doctrine sentence let v set downe grounde men muste bee iudged god haue authoritie bee iudges ouer thing shewed v heere woordes eliu vseth vvill wee iudge god high treason wee vsurpe written knee shall bowe come iudgement seate saint paule declareth fourtenth romanes seeing god reserueth iudging v himselfe alone remayneth v absteyne diuelish boldnesse desiring control striue though fault bee founde doings hee blamewoorthie wee better discretion skill hee nowe well put vre see another maner modestie men lyke god whereas blasphemy flush men mouthes wee shoulde heare god prayses sounde euerywhere shoulde one agreeable melodie magnifie hys inestimable rightuousnesse wisedome power goodnesse although eueryman confesse first blush good reason god shoulde woorke maner man might aduaunce himselfe agaynst yet notwithstanding men verie fewe refrayne pryde see themselues inclined thereto nature therefore standeth v hand holde fast doctrine giuen v eliu rather holy ghost wee must bee mindefull magnifie god woorkes yea euen woorkes knowne men nowe eliu hath sayde man reproue god workes telleth v wee must remember magnifie length shall finde men bee conuinced experience god dooth thing vprightnesse equitie therefore lette v consider mindes may restreyned end wee fall straying gadding ouer fieldes behoueth v ioyne two sentence togither matched first hee say vnto god thou hast done amisse wee must remember magnifie truely moste menne well ynough presume farre accuse god misdealing deede man shall heare nothing grudgings agaynst god although hee vpright poynts yet men ceasse finde fault yet bee able reach vnto cause eliu scorneth foolish ouerweening hee sayeth man able charge god misdealing men may well spewe blasphemy yet shall vanish shed away like water meane god shall continue perfect state still laugh presumptuousnesse menne scorne needes rushe maner agaynst let v marke well hold themselues modestie haue shewed ought shall auaile haue replied neuer much god hee hath set persone ouer himselfe herein shewed v men ouerfoolishe distitute reason dispute agaynst god vvhy hath set office man shoulde take vpon iudge ouer whome hath authoritie set taskes tallages vpon giue sentence vpon doings woulde world thinke well presumptuousnesse would take man starke foole wee bee farre fonde lifting vp selues agaynst god poore begger shoulde giue away dukedomes lordship appoynt iudges lieutenantes countrie euerie man woulde laugh scorne much wee take vpon v rule god giue lesson presumptuousnesse wee would take hande subdue prince lure great furious statelinesse nowe eliu sheweth wee tempted iudge ouerhastily god woorkes reason wexe bolde prowde must come poynt say vvhat thing throughly considered meere v looke vnto god controll spie doings finde faulte haue passed handes haue ouersight v examine wayes wee fully resolued poynt bee ynough barre curious question hold v awe short behoueth v conclude god shewing workes vnto v end vnder looke vpon consider sayde heere hee shall ouersee ouerlooke saying importeth much two sortes looking vpon god woorkes one perceyue owne smalnesse acknowledging wee creepe bylow lift vp mind aloft fayth assuring selues bee able comprehende high profound secret bee short fayth matched lowlinesse honouring thing vnknowne v thus yee see one good maner looking vpon god workes vnder therfore lowly meeke harted hauing considered owne measure lift vp heades cast vp eye desiring reuerently knowe pleaseth god shew v looke vppon god woorkes vnder contrarywise sayde text shall ouerlooke looke aboue wayes lo contrarie way looking men aduaunce themselues mount aboue ergoes desire ouerlooke god workes though vnder mount maner muste needes breake neckes maner ladder haue againe let v labour much wee vaine imagination certaine wee shall haue foundation beare v vp vntowarde cursed fashion looking vpon god woorkes men steppe though would thrust doings vnder feete call account sit iudgement vppon thoughe superioritie ouerrule let v keepe v diuelishe pryde added appurtenance wee must remember magnifie god workes seconde sentence sayde bee matched former one sayd wee must remember seemeth eliu might haue sayde one worde magnifie thou workes god sayth remember thou vvhy bee willingly occupied owne wicked imagination hinder v yeelding god deserued due glorie therefore standeth v hande quicken vp remembrance minde seeing forgetfull god example vvhen thinke vpon god first thing come thought shal illusion satan make v fall rage cast v dispayre snarle v distrust else make v tumble destruction ye see wittes ouerwrapped ignorance thinke vpon god meanewhile satan wilie ynough put wicked fancie head turne v away god possible true many men know meaneth vtterly blockish knowe warned bethinke disease rooted men forasmuchas wee may bee tempted wicked conceyts therefore sayde wee must bethinke selues suffer god buried call remembrance god himselfe hath printed men wit creature muste exalt hymselfe agaynst maker muste serue v brydle holde affection captiuitie thrust vnder foote wee may say wretched creature art thou commest thou heere dispute agaynst thy god subdue reason thou shouldest take vpon thee controll make passe vnder thy hande malapertnesse men enter intoo suche examination themselues driue away lewde imagination come mindes hinderance magnifie god workes becommeth therefore let v beware diuell put lewde conceytes heades let v warde farre magnifying god workes bee woorthie howe shall wee magnifie iudging owne knowledge wee muste honour although passe reach although wee perceyue reason bee done yet let v ceasse say lorde thou art iust rightuous full equitie thus yee see thing wherein wee must occupie selues tyme oure life knowe greatnesse excellencie god workes cannot yeelde prayse deserue without aduauncing aboue ourselues eliu also sayeth expressely men know v wit menne haue fought fill agaynst god according see pryde alwayes v yet end must needes ouercome god peraduenture suffer v inquire vnaduizedly wee haue giuen brydle fleshly lustes satan hath caried v away foolishe affection ende wee shall perceyue late god rightuous shall continue spyte teeth seing experience sheweth god workes deserue prayse done shall wee take vpon v inquire doings vttermost let v shunne let v rather learne honour humilitie yeelde rightuousnesse deserueth confesse wisedome iustice goodnesse mightinesse appeare wise workes must needes knowne one wit louing father towardes iust iudge towardes hath forsaken let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement faultes praying touch v wee may vtterly condemne ourselues namely ende wee may bee acquit mercie therwithall may also please remedie vice v clenze v may draw neerer neerer heauenly life forasmuch wee bee much inclined pryde presumption cannot bow vnder requisite let v pray graunt v grace submit ourselues humilitie feare may fit receyue instruction woorde holy spirit intent poynts respect wee may yeelde due honor guide v obedient child vnder gouernment father may please graunt grace c cxliij sermon fifth vpon xxxvj chapter men behold euery man seeth farre behold god great number yeares knovvne counting hee restrayneth droppes vvater aftervvarde maketh raine moysture poure dovvne maketh come heauen sheadeth dovvvne vpon multitude men vvho knovv diuersitie clovvdes vvhat heape tent stretcheth light couereth rootes sea doth execute iustice vpon people giue abundance vvherevvith liue clotheth drie streames vvith clovvdes commaundeth go agaynst companion brings tidings strife anger mounting vp wee haue beare minde matter glaunced yesterday namely shewed v heere although men woulde shet eies yet bring passe god shoulde set himselfe afore work knowne hereby warned man knowe god commeth simple ignorance rather stubborne wilfulnesse bycause hee turneth away haue sayde afore god workes manifest vnto v shew themselues euery therefore bee ignorant except list ourselues respect whereof sayde men beholde farre similitude importeth bee excellent greatnesse maiestie although farre distance betwene v yet able see vve knowe man farre v eye sight reach thither fadeth way bee great castell seeme little cabban looke farre whole towne wil seeme two three house thus doth farre distance diminish outwarde appearance thing great wee see neere hande vve haue experience ynough sunne seemeth bee scarcely two foote broade yet notwithstanding man knowe reason thing philosopher acquainted secretes nature shew shall perceyue sunne much greater whole earth sayde expresly men beholde god workes farre farre farre eye sight must needes vtterly dazeled yet farre perceyue god worketh therefore followeth maiestie god woorkes wee ought duetie honour therein nowe let v marke glorifie god cloke themselues ignorance vaine couert bicause work cannot knowne vnto muche wee alledge eye sight weake god working high v replyed although god woorkes nigh v yet wee ceasse perceyue farre forth needefull magnifying although eyesight verie feeble yet greatnesse excellencie worthinesse god woorkes wee haue inckling therfore let v lerne apply mindes knowing thing god sheweth v furthermore let v marke also behoueth v know god workes according owne measure shew farre let v content ourselues therewith true may well desire haue come neere v part also behoueth v streyne selues day day haue familiar full knowledge workes yet must walke humilitie god list bee knowne full onely part let v holde selues pleaseth meane sayde let v play purblind starkblind bussards wilfully let v suffer god shew himselfe v hath shewed himselfe wee knowe let v honor yeeld deserued prayse nowe herewithall eliu sayth bycause god great knowe neither numbring accounting yea e sentence shoulde seeme rep gne haue sayd alreadie know know thing vtterly contrary vve saw last verse although god far v yet notwithstanding workes great see sayde god cannot knowne knowing spoken ment cannot comprehende god wise maiestie wee come farre short ynough v wee haue little taste able comprehend infinite light suffizeth wee haue little sparkes therof thus ye see wise god knowne namely capacitie small conceyue comprehend yet notwithstanding meening vtterly hid fro men sheweth inough honoured handes therfore knowledge haue god bee able determine say throughly yet neuerthelesse vnexcusable wee honour forsomuch hath shewed himselfe portion vnto v hee knoweth v able beare profite see maner beholde god howe may knowne v wit looking glasse claddeth himselfe visible maiestie seene heauen earth lo wize ought looked vpon cause sayd creature seate ornament prince appareleth himselfe royaltie haue reuerence euen god ornament heauen earth must looked vpon substance inuisible hidden v vttereth vertues suche wyse although wee blind yet might grope according also paule vseth similitude actes seeing let v learne see god consider workes mightie power appeereth sheweth v deserueth well bee glorifyed handes yet must wee presume knowe perfectly able define glory passeth vnderstanding wee must cast downe eye confesse hee dwelleth vnapprochable light therefore knowing god part therewithall behoueth v confesse bee ignorant weake ynough v haue tast god maiestie must holde ourselues stay sith see wit fayle v good forlorne say behoueth v holde ourselues within owne slendernesse praying god rid v mortall flesh intent may behold become like vnto sayd iohn furthermore wayting day reforme v presently owne image end may beholde better thereafter god clenseth v fleshly vice heauie drosse wee feele ourselues maketh hee v meeter beholde vpon knowledge weakenesse owne wittes haue pray vnto god reforme v ende wee may profite increase knowledge vvheras mention made numbering yeares whereas sayd cannot reckned truely man may thinke rude geere first blushe inasmuch god beginning needeth bee sayde euerlastingnesse yeares thereof cannot bee reckned therefore saying might seeme superfluous wee consider eliu amed wee shall finde saying greatly profite haue sayde heretofore men caried away pride find fault god doings needes controll whereof commeth saucinesse effect think themselues wizer god nowe beate downe ouerweening sayd man cannot recken number god yeares therfore whensoeuer would iudges ouer tempted sayde presumptuousnesse desire mount higher beco meth v lawfull v lette v bethinke selues thus wretched creature thou snayle past three dayes ago since thou camest first vpon earth meene euen liued foure fiuescore yeares yet thou wilt take vpon thee iudge thy god plight art thou thou shalt haue reached verie creation worlde nothing comparison euerlastingnesse thou seest nowe thine owne follie thou art thy wittes thou enterest maze go aboute iudge therefore let v learne told v god age endlesse muste also compare shortnesse life according warned knowe transitorie slippe away like shadowe must compare sayde shortnesse life endlesse time god euerlastingnesse hathe neither time bound wil serue well keepe v aduauncing selues presumption wee haue bene woonted thus wee see effect eliu telleth v must come declaratio sayeth concerning god workes hee alledgeth raine thunder vapour like thing hayle tempest whirlewinds vvhen wee see thing god giueth v suche signes maiestie wee must needes honour else wee bee vnthankfull blockish true god hathe woorkes higher harder comprehende intent holy ghost teach v grossely according rudenesse homelinesse therfore eliu setteth example work nature say common vvee neede go schoole great clerkes haue knowledge rayne hayle faire weather chaunges see ayre true reason verie common ordinarie man aske poore sillie soule raine ingendred could resolue bicause wee see howe water mounteth vp also howe water bee ingendred ayre might seeme thing agaynst reason playne countryman cannot discusse thing knowne philosophie howe rayne ingendered drawing vppe vapour steames much sunne stryk th vpon earth forasmuch earth full hole close shet little vaines draweth vp vapour aloft little little become thicke middes ayre ingender rayne meanes moystures drawne vp little little vntil al grow ripe giue v raine againe countryfolke vnderstand wherof commeth passe great heate middle roome ayre although neerer sunne cause heate setteth self vpo earth vpon harth whereas ayre spreadeth abroade wise cannot rest cause hayle ingendred see straunge matter much would hardly beleeue common thing among v hayle thicken ayre although sunne neerer therevnto v yet notwithstanding see must needes bee great coldnesse ignorant therefore haue knowledge thing neither find oute reason amazed howbeit although wee knowe reason yet thing selfe sufficiently knowne insomuch appeareth drawing vp vapour earth maner ingendering raine afterwarde also holding raine ayre ingendered according sayde clowdes bottels barrel tubbes woonderfull woorke god good sooth barrelles ayre holde water notabler myracle see clowdes hanging ouer v vvhat letteth fall downe ouerwhelme v destroy earth muste needes bee excellent power whereat wittes must amazed cause sayde without going schoole without curious great booke learning man shal find sufficient knowledge god workes order nature make vnexcusable bycause common among v example wee looke vppon rayne hayle thunder like thing shewe v certaine maiestie god make v afrayde wee must needes bee moued spyte teeth meanes lord inforceth v know maiestie notwithstanding vnthankfulnesse indeuer quenche vttermost oure power see mention made vnto v raine like thing bicause god hath workes wonderfull excellent ende pretende ignorance holy ghost setteth v thing seene knowne whole world seing haue wee worship god yeelding deserued honor beate downe pride selues learne submit selues ordinance allow whatsoeuer doth disposeth howbeit bee good mee expounde wordes gather generall doctrine sayde god restrayneth holdeth backe droppes water serueth expresse better excellent power would beleeued men sawe theyr eye man tel v droppes water hild vp say water fine suttle thing sheadeth soketh away hath fastnesse neuerthelesse hild vp ayre notwithstading great number droppes greate quantitie would thinke straunge experience water firme substantiall thing might well mountayne god hold togither wheras hundred million drop one little clowde euery droppe nature readie fall away disperse rest bodie soothly nothing sheading slipperie water somuch looke many little portios many diuisions yet notwithstanding hild togither knew perceyued wee would neuer beleeue must wee needes acknowledge infinite power god see thing could beleeued eliu saying god holdeth togither droppes water ment expresse better mightie power god sheweth v holding vp rayne ayre afterward sayeth vapour maketh rayne man demaunde whereof rayne ingendered say nothing vapour owne selfe would ryze vp earth whiche hath hir steames within hir hole hir nature ryzing vp drawing sunne whiche sucketh vp moysture hale vp high otherwise rope needed drawe vp vvere possible beleeue wee sawe seene manifestly yee see vapour nothing say appeered sight rize vpward nature vp aloft rayne made fashioned afterwarde earth moystened bringeth forth frute men take nurrishment thereof behold lorde drieth earth drawyng vapour maner asmuch man shoulde drawe sappe iuice thing leaue nomore strength ye see withereth god findeth contrary meanes vvhen hath dried earth drained bloud substance moysteth agayne see rayne giueth abundance frutes according shewed seing wee perceyue muste needes couicted maiestie god would cosider although shet eye yet doth god spite teeth shew v maiestie visible v sortes immediatly declared god hath pauilions tent according wee know howe hath bene declared heretofore clowdes cope heauen termed god pauilions tent diuers time said clowdes chariotes namely bicause guideth maketh go foreward else doth walke vpon make triumphes thus ye see god presented vnto v prince vseth heauen palace maiestie sheweth selfe agayne clowdes yee would say pillers pauilion ende wee shoulde moued consider royall workemanship seing let v learne yeeld god whiche owne let glorie defaced ou vnthankfulnesse moreouer nought whereas similitude hath bene set downe already heretofore eliu repeteth yet know foolish curiositie men needes behold god owne cannot much heede therefore must take maner speaches whiche agreeable infirmitie behold god visible vnto v maner dwelleth palace wil preace vnto would know according capacitie cabeare let v go palace howbeit let v enter frentike boldnesse comprehende god secretes seyng dwelleth palace must leastwise haue much power worldly king frayle creature let v content selues sight excellent palace honour maiestie please come neere vnto v behoueth v come reuerence passe bound behold say wee haue consider maner speach clowdes termed pillers god palace sayd holde vp pauilion else ioyned parte serueth shewe ynough v taste god maiestie farre foorth vttereth v workes eliu speaketh also effect rayne sayeth god executeth iudgements vpon men giueth abundantly whereof liue vvherby meeneth god hee listeth make rayne serue set forth goodnesse minde shew himselfe fosterfather towardes men clowdes shall bring wherwith like prince intend succour countrie suffereth famine appoynt menne bring victualles thither farre lande water euen clowdes bring v god prouisio namely vttereth infinite goodnesse towards v contrariwise purposeth shewe rigour cloudes execute vengeance vpon v vttereth displeasure raynes outrageous doo great harme make flouds bothe hay corne swepte away moreouer follow wasting also according diuerse tymes seene sea drowneth greate countrey yee see howe god dooth rayne execute iustice also contrarie parte make v feele goodnesse cause sayde couereth rootes sea wee beholde rayne clowdes first brunt toucheth v maketh v afrayde meete also wee shoulde stricken feare god withholdeth water poure downe vppon worlde e swallowe v vp first dash maketh v perceyue god prouidence better wee see elius intent finally sayeth god willmingle darknesse light togither sunne shineth commeth nowe suche sodayne storme menne abashed sommer tyme weather shall bee calme fayre bee deuised turning hande ye shall see tempest shall seeme worlde shoulde go wrecke dooth must hee needes bee excellent maister commaundeth must excellencie god wonderful furthermore sayde god commaundeth cloudes mount vp againe commaundeth fire aire say hee comaundeth steamings firie nature whote drie god commaundeth iustle agaynst cloudes mount vpward therevpon followeth battell two army incountered togither mortall anger euen incounter betwene cloudes drie gleames aboue anger creature meete eche yee woulde say deadly foade doth need god comaunder say done haphazard bee brutishe verie babe might laugh v scorne man hee knoweth god worketh herein ruleth aboue ye see effect wee haue gather wordes cheefest matter gather doctrine conteyned truely wordes right worthie bee well weyed intent may referred end haue touched howbeit way wee haue remember needeth great cunning proue vntoo v one god reigneth guideth worlde disposeth order nature according owne vvhy wee haue liued neuer little worlde wee haue seene raine three foure tymes beholde god yeeldeth v sufficient recorde maiestie excuse v wee shette eye spite teeth shall vnderstande god ouerruleth thing see heere beneath thus ye see haue remember hereby wee see scoffe religion moued maiestie god good bewitched satan sayde wee neede haue gone schoole learne lesson yet notwithstanding men euen great skill thinke themselues wise ynough despise god possible become beastly sayde bycause god hath vtterly giuen ouer bee dulled satan raigneth yea euen darknesse bee worthie bee accounted men notwithstanding let v marke therewithall haue alwayes sore hartbytings although labour wipe knowledge god yet haue hartburning conscience faine spite teeth feele maiestie whiche woulde vtterly abolish cannot shift god must pursue shew himselfe let v conclude thing conteyned seene experience men open eye must needes beholde maiestie order nature although shet eye yet doth god make feele lo wee haue marke first place truly doctrine deserueth layde large howbeit forasmuch haue spoken heretofore sufficeth call minde haue earst declared without tarying long vpon way let v marke holy ghost doth set downe workes god best knowne men great small intent vpon knowing euerie man shoulde take courage prayse honour god knowe vvhy maner teaching holy scripture curious high none could fasten learned sort woulde drawe backe men would take occasion say ala neuer went schoole god vouchsafeth shewe himselfe learned men see god chaweth morsel v dresseth v like little child frameth rudenesse giuing v thing suche wise euen smallest ignorantest may haue part share men terme pray ought wee take courage learne vnderstande god comfort selues great goodnesse sheweth towards v hee inestimable care welfare hee woulde vouchsafe come downe lowe sith stoupe vnto v creature forsomuch hee seeing meete v sheweth himselfe v wise wee may conceyue perceyue wee therein howe much loueth v howe heprocureth saluation yee see haue beare minde therefore mention made vnto v raine cloudes vvhir lewindes haile let v imagine god could reason clearkly v lysted gaue witte heathen philosopher treate well skilfully secretes nature god gaue knowledge meane teacheth v another fashion hee haue men preach set forth doctrine saluation vnto v guide v owne kingdome hee haue onely make v king prince also list v vp aboue whole worlde make v fellowes angel mount aboue heauens asmuche god intendeth lift v vp high commeth downe vnto v make v partaker benefites conteyned worde vvherfore let v learne despyse holy scripture common thing let v vnderstand god mind frame himselfe infirmitie maner ye see wee haue marke heere withall let v learne also despise god workes bycause common among v vvhat cause esteeme god doings myracle wee bee inured custome see raine verie well moued whit cause ordinarie matter surely villaynous vnthankfulnesse whereas god doth dayly woorke myracle dulled thereby thinke vpon although raine haile rising tempest order nature ordinarie thing yet let v forbeare marke well thing consider peacemeale lord layeth forth infinite treasure power may end honored hand thus ye see wee haue beare minde howbeeit passe might demaunded purpose eliu alledgeth thing seeing reasoneth farre matter shewe god incomprehensible dooings men must presume striue mainteyne owne quarelles though rightfull god cruell afflicting seemeth nothing purpose haue resolued question alreadie onely say worde sle ghtly renue remembrace thing hath bin spoken heeretofore length vvhich inferior thing set generally heere afore v make v mount vp higher god secrete incomprehensible iudgements vvhen see raine clowdes stormes hayle surely naturall thing men terme serue transitorie life concerne worlde thing beneath yet notwithstanding cofounded inforced reuerece maiestie god wee shall haue inquired possible thing done wittes fayle v remayneth nothing v humble selues god small lowe thing compell v honour god infirmitie bewrayeth selfe therein shall become v fall mounting aboue clowdes yea aboue sky wee come euerlasting purpose god holdeth hidde come point pray shall become mennes wittes may well flitter fiske man may sooner breake necke hundred thousande time attaine vnto god ye see manner elius teaching heere thing seeme small bycause custome hath made common among v sheweth god highnesse ought duetie honoured handes wee shall neuer comprehende vve comprehende clowdes wittes misse see striuing behalfagainst god doings shall go set order clowdes say must bee tale tubbe raine ingendred vapour earth sunne draweth vp thing heere beneath maner heate beames shal say stoppe god dispozing thing according order hath set nature ala damnable outrage euerie man graunt seeing weakenesse sheweth selfe small thing ryfe commo god setteth eye yet neuerthelesse wee knowe behoueth v fall god worship confesse vnderstanding nothing specially sith comprehendeth thing wee see day day much reason brydle wittes reyne short wee come secrete determination iudgements hee executeth euerie day common ryfe among v diuelishe pride man wil mount high therefore must needes fall vtter ruine neuer get vp againe let v kepe v statelinesse desiring rise vp god namely secrete determination whiche surmount whole order nature thing able comprehende vnderstanding effecte thing eliu looked amed nowe way let v marke ende knitting vp whereas sayde god execute iudgements giueth men abundantly wherewith liue ende wee shoulde knowe order nature god hande ayre gouerned selfe raine commeth appoyntement sunne see contrarie effect beholde water drowneth men sweepeth quite away againe mainteyneth yee see heere two contrarie woorkings nourishment one side wasting god destroyeth ouerwhelmeth twaine see cause thereof god ouerruleth thing aboue let v learne magnifie god wee see applie creature vse hee thinketh good furthermore one side wee see rigour seeing hee myndeth punishe sinnes wee ought consider therein hee sheweth himselfe iudge ende wee shoulde condemne selues flee refuge mercie forsomuch vttereth treasure goodnesse sheweth himselfe liberall vvhich thing hee doth time declareth himselfe haue care v sending v prouision clowdes wherby maketh earth frutefull ende yeeld v sustenance vvhen wee see side let v bee satisfyed goodnesse god put whole trust therein rest therevpon concluding sithe hee sheweth father cherishing bodyes fraile carkesses much reason seeing hath fashioned v anewe vnto owne glorie doubt charie saluation sheweth himselfe father rest haue marke streyne see god nowe applieth creature owne pleasure vsing one syde roddes execute iustice otherside making serue turne euen imploying releeue necessity present lyfe therefore let v beare thing minde wee may bee taught feare reioyce rest goodnesse also settle trust wholy vpon nowe let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement sinnes praying make v perceyue better haue done therewithall may knowe must mislike selues still ende correct sinfulnesse v forasmuch hath pleased god drawe v alreadie vnto may consider grace hee hath begonne v thervpon take courage go foreward still till wee bee come perfection calleth v vnto neuer bee weary traueling thitherward meane season wee may haue eye open behold goodnesse power iustice wisdome hee sheweth v reforme v wholly obedience may seeke nothing dedicate whole life seruice may please c cxliiij sermon first vpon xxxvij chapter also hart trembleth feare leapeth place herken noise voice sound mouthe directeth vnder vvhole heauens light vpon vvings earth againe brayeth vvith greate sound thundereth vvith myghtie voice taryeth voice heard god thundereth terribly vvith voice dooth vvonderfull thing vvhich man cannot comprehend hee commandeth snowe fall dovvne vppon earth likevvise svveete shovvers raynes greate force serueth leastwise whyle bee world wee haue eye open consider woorkes god neere v easie bee seene though wee bee learned deepewitted folk euen veriest idiot perceyue order nature see maiestie god mirrour true ought lift vp ourselues yet hygher consider well god sheweth v howbeit sayd ought least wise consider thing present afore v notwithstanding ynough vnderstand god hauing created world doeth also gouerne behoueth v knowe ouer ende thing ought referred wee knewe god sendeth rayne faire weather god thundereth god maketh lightening run flasshing ayre attributing soueraine power vntoo shoulde hee bee knowne bee almightie yet god sendeth rayne shewe sometymes mynd chastize men sinnes time intent yeeld forth treasure goodnesse bountie ynough haue knowne god almightie creature hande disposition wee must marke also howe maner hee vseth wit iudge world hee hath borne long ynough sinnes againe make v feele fauour knowe father sauiour partie maynteyneth nurrisheth v vve see god iustice goodnesse wisdome must linked almightinesse intent may oneside taught feare walk obedience side rest selues vpon seeing haue fayre recordes loue wee may call vpon assuring selues hee regardeth v pitieth v vnder protection resort vnto destitute counsell hee instruct v holy spirite nowe wee see order nature beeing well considered serueth onely set soueraine power god ende men shoulde honour acknowledging almightie also make v immediatly take holde grace goodnesse rest therevppon seeke whole refuge also behoueth v knowe men shall scape vnpunished bycause sheweth hande thing must come accounte thing whiche eliu hath treated according shewed yesterday raine hayle tempestes god doth sometymes iudge worlde sometimes giue men abundantly wherewith liue hee addeth heart leaped place hee afrayde sight thing say knowing god must gazing ayre owne lyking meane coceiue dead thought must bee liuely touching heartes power quick generall men vnbeleeuers muche kill feare wherewith ought bee touched whereas faythfull make theyr profite willingly prouoke themselues sayde awfulnesse ende doo homage reuerence maiestie god let v beare minde god manifesting himselfe vnto men onely put fleeting conceyte intoo might say god fall reasoning also therewithall giue liuely instruction inwardly maye become better minded say ought bee men howebeeit wee see vnbeleeuers doo vttermost power beate backe feare whiche haue conceyued labour playe god get libertie quite cleane oute awe lo poynt faythlesse sort fight agaynste owne naturall vnderstanding indeuer themselues become brute beastes may ought trouble god agaynste forsomuch bee giuen euill see god cannot away therefore shunne labour ridde quite away lyke outlaw theefe woulde faine ciuill magistrate worlde ende sinnes might escape vnpunished like cace wyth worldelings forasmuche cannot disbarre hande god long hee sitteth maiestie iudge would fain exempt themselues iurisdiction cause sayd labor quench light reason giuen cannot bring passe therefore mule chawe vppon theyr brydles fall repyning agaynste god howsoeuer worlde go growe hardhearted wexe euerie daye blockishe till god haue giuen quite ouer feele remorse mynde sainct pa speaketh surely extreemest misery verie vpshotte theyr decay feele greefe say haue remorse conscience beare themselues sinning go still common trace according also salomon sayeth wicked man come gulfe dungeon iniquitie hee hath feeling returne vnto god humble himselfe mislyke faultes contrarywise faythfull touched maiestie god kindle fyre like man hauing alreadie coales svrebronde shoulde kindle euen deale couet walke vprightly god hath touched themselues beholding order nature haue perceyued soueraine maiestie guideth gouerneth thing applie reuerende feare owne instruction pricke prouoke themselues heartes resort vnto god bearing continually remembrance oft haue occasion looke vpwarde downewarde prepare themselues knowing god gaze aboute aduenture bethinke themselues throughly aforehande must looke vpon god maker thing vvee see whereas wicked heathenish sort labour become blinde therewithall wexe hardhearted god finally become brute beastes voyde vnderstanding discretion faithfull take profit knowledge god giueth meanes creature cosequently said light increaseth groweth strong inforce themselues vttermost power eliu met saying heart trembled leapt place true wicked shall afrayd thunder lightning spite teeth maiestie god must touch make secrete alarum within yet dispatche away thoughtes treade vnder foote contrarie part suche desire knowe god vppon occasion beginning set applie whole studie aduauntage themselues feare dreade god sendeth heartes furthermore eliu vseth goodly similitude describing thunder lightning frost tempestes hee sayeth man may heare god voyce yea euen voyce great noyse sayeth hee sounde proceedeth mouth heere eliu speaketh woorde dayly preached vntoo v v take learning wherein god doth familiarly shewe v goodnesse god roaring voyce noyse proceedeth mouth hee meeneth thunder made ayre hee declareth similitude lorde hath maner speeche able make creature quake onely place also nine twentith psalme sayde voyce god thundereth voyce god maketh mountaine libanus rore voyce god clyueth greate tree voyce god maketh hindes cast calues voyce god hearde mountaynes voyce god maketh whole earth shake voyce none thing noise made thunder neuerthelesse serueth reproue men vnthankfulnesse giue eare god thundering according also common prouerbe men play madde men say lowde man could heare god thunder yee see scripture vpbraydeth v blockishnesse bereeueth v excuse men say tush neuer learning scripture neuer opened vntoo v neuer thunder life god neuer speake haue conceyued maiestie ought right stoupe honour submit selues vnder obedience purpose wee bee bad brute beastes madnesse v matched pride cannot consider hee hath authoritie ouer v ye see men sufficiently conuicted thundereth ought consider voyce god namely greate lowdsounding noyse whiche maketh ayre roare againe men say bee ignorant darkenesse matter make lightning clyue asunder sky wee see suche brightnesse god sheweth himselfe sufficiently ye euen take couert v man might flatter himselfe hypocrisie go iustifye himselfe though wee knowne nothing god lightning ynough v glorie thus yee se eliu speaketh heere greate noyse sounde proceedeth oute god mouth hee argeth matter bycause menne retchlesse one tell fewe woordes matter go aboute lay forth haue greate regarde slippeth away hand therefore eliu standeth longer vpon matter pursueth bycause wee ought consider well order thunder lightning also rayne deawes stormes wee perceyue speaketh expressely sweete gentle shower also boystuousnesse violence seene oftentymes behalfe pursuing touched alreadie concerning god iudging worlde sometyme sending raine heauen somtyme giuing abundance food sweete rayne come due season make earth frutfull otherwise raine marre destroy benefites whereby looke sustenace therefore wee perceyue twaine thing god deserueth well considered also cause sayd god dooth wonderfull thing comprehende thunder hee sendeth verie deede hath flashed lightning hath flowen throughout thunderclappes haue beene heard immediately commeth tempest god letteth raine storme hayle poure downe without tariance whersoeuer dint tempest lighteth insue incredible thing ye shall see man consumed ash shall keepe still shape hardly shall yee finde hole bigge pea yet notwithstanding man shall bee quite consumed hard swoorde shal vtterly molten scabber yeeldeth shall whole still tree shall sometime rooted vp somtime wrung asunder somtime vtterly consumed shalbe nothing left much done house bee short man consider effectes tempest bee thing could bee beleeued knowne experience therefore standeth men hande humble themselues considering weakenesse owne witte mightinesse god workes worse blockish wee must needes learne heereby submitte selues vnto honour yeelde glorie soueraintie effect eliu sheweth v first let v beare minde hath beene touched wit ynough v conceyue god maker worlde father power vpon wee must also knowe father hee draweth v gentle louing care wee owne child vvhat earthly father doth much descended knowe rightly god behoueth v taste goodnesse hee vttereth v maketh v feele whereof wee receyue frutes inioyment euen mortall lyfe nowe wee taste god goodnesse leade v witte wee trust consider hee hath put v intoo worlde ende wee perishe brute beastes bring v euerlasting heritage hee hath promised v therefore wee may well ground right must god reason benefites wee receyue wee may well conclude soules precious bodyes hee vouchsafe sende v thing requisite mainteine v world hee leaue cheefe point vvee see wee eye open beholde god prouidence order nature set afore v would serue teache v put whole trust wee repose suche trust wee may also call vppon assuring selues sith watcheth ouer v prayer shall bee vnknowne vntoo hee accept lo wee haue put vre surely woulde bee true wisdome wee could minde thing settle thought vppon vve shoulde fare better lyfe long vve nothing else wander fonde speculation therefore wee reape none rewarde oure owne vanitie vve see howe men intangled earthly thing bodie speake heauenly kingdome vnderstande surely bee worthie muche behoueth v take heede conteyned heere namely wee acknowledge goodnesse god hee nourisheth v wee bolde call vppon father flee refuge seeing hee sheweth himselfe bee father haue good gage onely telleth v hys owne mouth also hath hande open make v feele wherewith syde let v learne feare wee see execute iudgements yea euen meanes whiche sometymes welfare let v learne god myndeth subdue v himselfe teach v serue prouoke anger wilfully rather come vntoo reuerence sith wee knowe hee armed suche power reuenge himselfe dispysers maiestie least hee poure greate terrible puissance vppon v also cause sainct peter bringeth v consideration namely god destroy worlde wipe away inhabiters earth water notwithstanding beginning thereof man demaunde whereof stuffe worlde made wee see holy scripture confuzed matter whiche god set downe first beginning water wherein nothing depth confuzednesse vvell ye see originall beginning world god intended destroy mankinde wherewith armed hee himselfe sente floud ye see water whence wee drawe oure lyfe whiche hathe beene ground woorke whole worlde hath neuerthelesse beene destruction thereof sith wee see let v consider wee haue lowe without hand god whereas lightened sunne whereas draw breath ayre whereas wee nourished fedde bread creature themselues doo giue mainteyne lyfe god turne death listeth instrumentes hys goodnesse shall bee turned intoo deadly swordes destroy v let v learne god sendeth v either hayle noysom rayne sore frostes shewing himselfe terrible thing ende wee shoulde knowe sinnes entering intoo ourselues beseech forgiuenesse offence past learne stande awe hereafter obey better wee haue done heretofore moreouer whensoeuer wee haue felt one stripe hande let sticke minde one day onely let serue v thinke vppon euer hath god sente v drought hath hee sent v raine vve must beare remembraunce looke haue beginne againe bethinke v thus go tyme haue liued worlde haue seene sometymes rayne hathe marred seede layd intoo ground steade corne men haue darnell nothing againe god hath parched earth heate hath beene seared away else hath beene winde hath shaken downe blasted sustenance man beast haue seene haue seene also suche meanes god hath sent famin nowe must tary till god strike againe must learning mee tyme lyfe thus ye see wise wee must put doctrine vre moreouer oft heare thunder let v vnderstand sounde proceedeth mouth god wittes must friske wanze awaye ayre though thunder ingendered without commaundement superiour maister let v come vnto god assure selues thunder must needes bee ingendered power mouth ayre troubled rore let v vnderstand dead thing order god hath stablished whereby power manifested vnto v ye see haue remember perceiue god moueth men heart lightning rayne tempest let v assure ourselues doublefolde guiltie wee familiarly taught confused noyse worde offereth v doctrine certaine wherein may edified doubtlesse wee deserue much greeuously condemned take profite hearing voyce whereby hee dooth strike v feare comfort v true soeuer god worde preached ende whereto tendeth make v feele wantes withoute cause god woorde tearmed twoo edged sworde examine men search thought affection cause sayde also must bee sacrificed vntoo god meanes gospell must bee kinde dying v else god worde shall neuer preuaile v vve must renounce selues whatsoeuer owne nature must bee beaten thus ye see lord thundereth lightneth worde side selfe worde hee also quickeneth v coforteth v short giueth v full ioy calleth v offereth v sonne guide v thither telling v wee bee assured saluation seeing god speaketh familiarly vntoo v hearken vnto glorifie lyeth greeuous horrible damnation vpon v vppon suche neuer teaching theyr onely beholding order nature hearing thunder yet moued inwardely true perceyuerance shall ynough condemne v haue sayd alreadie although men neuer heard eyther lawe scripture yet notwithstanding lyued worlde haue excuse god sufficiently declared vnto reproue malice wilfull stubbornnesse vndoubtedly see god hath tormented racked greatest despysers maiestie euer thunder reade storyes heathen men ye shall see greatest scorner god euer haue beene frayde afflighted mauger heartes haue shewed hearing thunder yea confessed god aboue thunder tempest whome inforced feare god hath distressed wise set ye would say vppon scaffolde open execution done vppon man wrought high treason agaynst prince euen greatest prince worlde haue taken knowledge thunder tempest god heauen gouerneth proofe thunder ought bee ynough bowe hardest heartes bee seeyng marke god maiestie needeth none thing tempest lightning seene ayre condemne dogges swine make mocke religion although neither lawe doctrine wryting yet doth onely thunder holde conuicted spite teeth must bee faine graunt god heauen voyce whereof mencion made heere ynough condemne men worlde although neuer heard read much one worde doctrine bee wee must always come comparison haue touched god thundering ayre confused sounde bee sufficient speaking condemne vnbeleuers making lightning flash abroade sufficient light condemne blinde shall followe hee speaketh gently vseth amiable maner teaching yea euen lispeth v intent wee might vnderstande better vvhen onely affrighteth v also allurerh v gentlenesse curtesie come vnto wee bee stubborne agaynst shall become v vvhat excuse bee v heere ye see psalme haue alledged sayde temple god euerie man shall giue god glorie prophet spoken mightie voyce god maketh mountaynes remoue rockes melt away earth quake tree fall downe mounte libanus wylde goates slinke kiddes forrestes moueth shaketh whole world afterward hee addeth god shall bee glorifyed temple howe vvhen lightning flash throughe wing earth say ouer border earth thunderclappes hearde one side worlde ought god bee knowne thing ought greate small doo homage yes verely wherefore doth prophete speake specially temple god according comparison haue touched god affrighteth wakeneth heathen men hee thundereth howbeeit bring saluation onely conuince vtterly ende shoulde pretende tryfling excuse knewe god maiestie knewe sufficientely vtter condemning v god intent drawe v saluation hee speaketh vntoo v hee thundereth make ayre rore neyther maketh hee confused noyse haue sayde hee speaketh gently familiarly hee vttereth heart vnto v hee sheweth v way life inlightneth v brightnesse worde shineth vpon v thus ye see god deserueth bee glorified hys temple although hee manifested whole worlde creature inuited prayse yea bee constreyned inforced therevntoo yet farre mightie royall power worde preached vntoo v god sheweth vttereth himselfe suche sort wee must needes bee worse brutish blockish wee thinke vpon submit selues spoken v name authoritie thus ye see wee haue beare minde way let v consider howe malicious worlde seeing woorde god well preached knowne notwithstanding ill receyued men little reuerenced insomuch shoulde seeme men purposed spight god reiecting doctrine notwithstanding knowe fully assured see ye howe rebellious papistes day let v go farre let v come home among selues men professe themselues bee minded holde gospell yet notwithstanding let bee spoken name god let thing laid open let matter bee made plain vnto euen veriest diuels conuicted thing preached taken holy scripture yet cotinue still stubbornnesse without making conscience striue agaynst god maliciousnesse matched shamelesnesse insomuch men come point neede go geneua see manifest rebellion setting light god see diuelish pride say tushe god shall raigne ouer v let prattle talke list yet yeelde whitte verily rebelliousnesse seene men make muche account thing spoken sermon fable thing notorious example thereof open would god great confusion yet ende haue dallyed great mayster must faine knowe whome haue wounded pricked prophete zacharie sayeth behoueth v marke well sentence marke wee may bee apt willing bee taught god hande wilde beastes sharpen themselues agaynst reiect concerneth doctrine pure woorde yet shamefastnesse papistes vvhen fight agaynst holy scripture maintenance idolatryes abhominations seeke false glozes shiftes bee short although couering themselues bee wette yet notwithstanding confesse intent resist god men steppe foorth vngodlinesse cannot finde heartes receyue one worde knowne bee god truth frette chafe agaynst much honestie admitte thing knowe good doo cleane contrarie manifest therein wee bee much worse wretched papistes vvherefore sayde leastwise let thys serue v warning bee doublefolde condemned specially aboue thing sith hee commeth vnto v speaketh v gathereth v togither name ende hearde sitte wise among v v great small may referre selues let v bethinke v glorifie mouth confessing slightly wee also deedes giuing proof effect desirous heritage sith vouchsafeth incomprehensible benefit grace honour vpon v giue himselfe v life let also bee interchaungeable gift side let v put selues wholy hande let possesse v let inioy v furthermore whereas sayde god dooth great mightie thing thundering sending forth lightning tempest wee comprehende let v sure speaking lawe gospell hee intendeth lift v vp aboue vnderstanding verie deede wee shall neuer profite doctrine god word set forth vnto v haue principle wit god exerciseth v secret surmount capacitie according sayde god hath prepared suche thing loue neuer eye man sawe eare man hearde neuer entered intoo heart anie creature wee haue grounde wee shall neuer taste thing preached v euerie day nowe intent wee may taste well done let v consider lorde calleth v heauenly kingdome minded draw v worlde intend good schollers profite doctrine lorde iesus christ sith see plunged ouer heade eares worlde corruptible thing let v labour wade let v day day fight owne affection may draw neere vnto god made al one lord iesus christ according saint paule sheweth v thirde collossians wee minde haue part heauen cleaue vnto iesus christ gone vp aloft bee made one behoueth v mortifie whatsoeuer earth furthermore let v consider oure wittes rude feeble conceyue god full perfection insomuch wee shall neuer haue small taste except hee guide v holye spirite according also sainct paule maketh conclusion foresayde text touched hee cyteth saying prophete esay therefore hee hath sayde sensuall man comprehendeth secretes god sayeth bee renued holy ghost ende wee may haue knowledge true wee haue beene counsell god according hee declareth againe afterwarde yet dooth hee admit v counsell farre foorth expedient v therefore wee knowe owne infirmitie let v pray inlighten v holy spirite wee may know thing otherwise would bee high profounde v nowe let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement fault praying make v feele wee may touched condemne selues mislike selues meane worke holy spirit may renued obey walke feare may profit therin vntill tyme quite rid fleshly corruption clothed againe righteousnesse heauenly glorie let v say almightie god heauenly father c cxlv sermon second vpon xxxvij chapter sealeth handes men ende knovve men vvorke beastes shrinke dennes keepe themselues vvithin lodging hee maketh vvhirlevvinde come heape colde commeth scattering vvinde breath god frost giuen againe aboundant vvaters narrovve place hee maketh cloudes labour moysten sendeth rayne maketh cloude shedde light hee maketh circle turne gouernanee ende doo vvhat hee commaundeth ouer vvhole vvorlde vvhither scourge earth mercie taketh avvay wee saw yesterday astonishment whiche men conceyue thunder proofe god maiestie power according therevnto sayde heere god thundering doth set seale vppon men handes keepe close namely ende knowe men making beastes also faine shrinke intoo dennes sayde god draweth men apart bodie shoulde gather folke togither householder householde meynie prince subiects capitaine souldiours intent muster thus yee see cheefe intent streyne extendeth euen wilde beastes shewe euen also hande god hee proueth commaundement pleaseth nothing else yet uen thunder compelleth bee shet vp prison verie deede verse commonly translated god setteth seale vpon mennes handes intent shoulde knowe owne woorkmanship shoulde say forwardnesse men haue applie themselues one thing reason god hath printed marke vppon haue otherwise instruction giuen heauen text suffer bee vnderstoode vvorde worde ende knowe men making folloueth therefore god doth knowe men holdeth maner locked shet vp within house ende may bee vnderstoode better men haue libertie go run seemeth bee exempted subiection fayre weather one go feeldes another streetes men seeme bee hilde vnder subiection bee fowle weather thunder blustering winde abrode men faine keepe within doores therefore like man shoulde assemble housholde say know behaue themselues euerie men doth euerie man shall make account lo howe god appoynteth men time gathered togither ende make muster shewe subiection vntoo sayde extendeth euen wilde beastes beastes wander abrode seeme subiection god maketh tempestes bee driuen home dennes must men needes perceyue god hath secrete bridle holde listeth vvee see thing treated yesterday declared heere yet expressely witte thunder messanger god maiestie onely astonisheth men also compelleth hide themselues house one god shewed hee holdeth men hys hande mennes going comming abrode bicause hee giueth leaue howebeeit hee could holde shette vp pleasure sith wee see let v learne yeelde obedience vnto god tymes wee acknowledge subiection wee owne vntoo god thundereth shall haue profited slenderly doctrine neuerthelesse putting v remembrance consider hee ruleth steppe wee cannot stirre one finger withoute guiding therefore let v acknowledge learne bee subiect tymes suffer selues bee gouerned lo wee haue beare away streyne haue aduisednesse discretion v behold verie beastes able teach v wherefore lion beares vvoolues wilde beast keepe themselues caues dennes bycause god sheweth bee superiour ouer therefore wee needes runne astray suffer god holde v shet vp vnder hande shake signet seale spoken heere beastes shall condemne v example beholde yet wee haue beare mynde wee may better profite selues whole sentence hebrewe woorde eliu vseth heere signifyeth properly seale men seale letter ende shoulde bee looked intoo also man maye seale cofer cupboorde setting seale vpon haue anie bodie looke intoo god vseth dreadfull kinde sealing hee sendeth thunder tempest heere printing waxe ring materiall seale hee compelleth men keepe themselues shet vp bee sort close prisoner theyr owne house owne good wittes therefore let consider mayster aboue part whole life owne hande thus yee see howe similitude set downe heere ende wee shoulde compare incomprehensible maiestie god thing see among worldly creature sayde immediatly god maketh tempest come beape clowdes againe scattering winde northwinde causeth colde come chaunges heere set forth god mightie power better ende hee shoulde bee glorified thereby truely god kept alwayes one ordinarie rate neuer greate heate great colde anye winde raine ayre alwayes temperate suche measure kept men might continually feele themselues disposed one manner thing lyking wee delt oure owne desyre w ulde finde oure heartes haue continuall sprin might bee oure profite like th v also colde greeueth v wee wou ine bee exempted haue ayre temperate nothing might bee misliked nothing go agaynste oure myndes meane god glorie better perceyued chaunges made hee causeth raine fall vppon grounde anone scattereth clowdes remoueth rayseth vp whirlewindes causeth colde succeede heate doth better set maiestie also waketh v ende shoulde thinke thereon see howe dull men wittes therefore requisite wee shoulde touched quicke true wee witte looke vpon god cleare pure eyesight giuing v life sustenaunce worlde woulde ynough v forsomuch grosse therwithall also malicious neuer come vnto except driue v perforce behoofe bee touched chaunges made see weather fayre sodainly ayre troubled clowdes thicken heate raine commeth cleareth ayre followeth frost suche drought maye seeme earth shall bee brunt vppe anon god sendeth clowdes maketh labour releeue v hee intende giue v reasonable weather say see alteracions must wee need woorse blockish thinke vpon god vndoubtedly sayd afore bringeth rememberance sheweth himselfe manifest visible maner thing alwayes kepe owne course cause eliu standeth much vpon text lay foorth expresse alteration made ayre fayre wether fowle heate cold clowds cleere wether whirlwind frost diuers thing cause also sayd god gouernment maketh circle turne expound though sayd world renewed alteracions happen one season yeare long thing woulde looke alwayes one sort sunne shyneth one daye anon suddeinly hidden couered behold twoo diuerse world varietie prouoketh v consider better god gouerneth thing howe possible thing alter suchwise bee turning god woorketh aboue vve see one whyle earth shet v cold ayre also possessed contrarywise see set libertie fayre pleasant wether lo heere newe worldes without cause eliu addeth conclusion god maketh circle say world turne making chaunge one fashion another intent wee bee sufficiently taught one meane wee lift vp countenance heauen looke round v leastwise beholding sodein alteracions made wee myght bee prouoked knowe god hee myght glorified according also haue occasion haue remember streyne wee see mo meanes god giueth v come myght bee taught feare honour much lesse wee excuse vnthankfulnesse much shall wee bee blame wee cannot profit ourselues therfore nother fayre weather fowle heate cold hayle tempest shal set self v iudgement god shall beare witnesse agaynst v discouer shewe lewdnesse v bycause wee haue honored hath shewed many wayes side allured v behold maiestie therefore oft weather chaungeth although alteracions bee troublesome v first sigh yet let v vnderstand welfare meanes god wakeneth v sayd afore hauing faire weather ynough besotte v bee chaunge rayne come wee thinke ourselues verie well god make new world turning hand yea euen without perishing substance howbeeit fashion shall defaced shall seeme new turkined wee consider wee knowe god vsing alteration see welfare saluation furthermore let v marke well fashyons speeche set downe heere greate drought skye seemeth yron brasse maner also doeth holy scripture speake vvhen god threateneth punish men taking away rayne sayeth giue earth yron heauen brasse earth shall bee shet vp shee shall open hir brest giue sucke heauen also shall hard shall giue rayne rayne come great drought woonderfull men would haue looked chaunge seene come passe therfore maruell woontednesse dimmeth eysight maketh v esteeme god miracle ought neuerthelesse wether soone chaunged altered suddeinly darkened thing selfe sheweth singular woorking god also sayd god maketh clowdes labour moysten earth namely though clyued asunder emptied selues earth might receiue nourishment mark labor whervnto god imployeth cloudes seruice dreepeth rayne afterwarde haue sucked vp moysture beneathe yeld ouer nourishment back againe ende wanze away consume nothing therfore whe wee heare god guideth creature maner imploy vse shuld send v men seruantes maydseruants wage let v therein acknowledge infinite goodnesse sayd cloud also sunne mone right noble creature yet neuerthelesse god voutsafeth imploy vse seing much sayd sunne moone whome god imployeth seruice therein wee see loue hee beareth v highly fauor howe precious life vnto truely commeth worthynesse yet notwithstanding behold god submitteth heauens vse much haue men playd beast worshipping sunne moone cause god telleth way vpbraiding appointed seruice therefore seing god maketh cloudes earth also labour trauell sorte let v remember aboue beneth sheweth v fatherly loue making v feele goodnesse intent co sider deare welbeloued notwithstanding wretchednesse v wee worthy reckned amog residue creature men compared earth ayre brute beast certaine vnworthy nourished bicause corrupted marred therfore haue somuch cause magnifie god goodnesse towardes v furthermore whereas sayde chaceth awaye cloudes bryghtnesse yet one chaunge whiche woonderfull oughte make v perceyue hande god beholde wether close seemeth v wee haue quyte cleane lost sight sunne wee acquainted suche alteration wee woulde thinke water threatned burie v hande good sooth cloudes haue ouercast whole ayre earth wet men see graue god maketh cloudes vanishe away minute hour whome may imputed truely wee say order nature say custome howsoeuer yet must needes perceiue hande god blockish therefore let v beare mynde superfluous talke eliu vseth diuersitie matter shewe maiestie god setteth foorth worlde saide varietie time intent draw v vnto sayth expressely sendeth clo de whirlwindes doe thing hath ordeyned whole worlde hee say behoueth v alwayes consider god mightie power dominion ouer thing wee see may learne perceiue owne sinnes hee punisheth v adde againe anon also end may taste goodnesse may throughly filled pleaseth handle v gently end may knowe thing let v consider creature gouerne selues god disposeth thinketh good whatsoeuer commaundeth vpon e th hereof haue good lesson gather cause afrayde thunder thing feare god iust punishment vnbeleefe men feare god whither sendeth eue senslesse creature put greater shame loke vpon despizer god trampleth religion vnder foote caried away diuelish rage shaketh al difference good euill yet notwithstanding inforced afraid thunder insomuch wittes traunce marke payment deserue loth yeelde obedience vnto god stand awe senslesse creature let v learne graunt oure god mightie power belongeth vnto end may exempted fearefulnesse ignorant vnbeleeuers haue cankerdhearted sort despizers religion knowe god guideth gouerneth tempestes shal perceiue hande shall free danger pleaseth thuder nothing although see flie abroad shoote heauen earth moment yet still hand god therfore like sworde cannot wound men either flat vpon earth scabberd euen thunder lightning nothing simply themselues god darteth hee listeth wee knowe wee shall bee afrayde thunder true abashe v therewithall serue v spurre pricke v forewarde wee may bee confirmed feare god profite therein neuerthelesse euer come wee bee dismayed thunder bycause wee sure god dispozeth ourselues also custodie thunder doe thing againste v pleaseth likewise wee must bee afrayde hayle sendeth vvee must bee ouerfearefull tempest wee bee dismayed wee must tremble maiestie oure god wee haue trembled must mortifie fleshly affection take comfort giueth v contrarie part shewing selfe father towardes v beholde say howe wee ought put sentence vre creature also must serue v example sith wee see rayne windes stormes thing doe execute euer god commaundeth ought wee doe hath rayne eares heare god appoynteth nother sunne earth cloud ayre haue reason vnderstanding yet wee see creature serue obey god falleth one droppe rayne grounde without sunne doth nother ryze set otherwise god hath limited pace assigned course muche hee misseth one twincling eye much sayde creature v haue speech whiche haue eares heare haue vnderstanding reason haue sufficient euidence condemn v apply al thing obeying god seing whole order nature nought else tha proof obedience creature aboue beneath yeeld vnto god vvee hath bene sayde alreadie men making also sayd psalme man made selfe god made seing hold thing ought strength hath giuen v furie rush resist stoppe hauing free course yet notwithstanding marke indeuers shoote consider wherein men frowarde wee shall finde neuer leaue resisting god fighting seeking abolishe truth wherein wee see muche greater spitefulnesse therefore let v bee sure rayne wyndes stormes tempestes like thing shall giue glosse diuelishe rebelliousnesse ceasse prouoke god wrath plucke men obeying submitting selues bee quietly gouerned lo wee haue marke seconde place sentence sayde throughe vniuersall worlde creature doe euer god hath ordeyned nowe effecte see heere prouidence god order nature howbeit must come backe treated yesterday eliu bringeth v hee sayth whither scourge earth mercie saying sheweth touched yesterday ynough knowe thing vnder god hand nothing done disposing must also marke ende purpose cause hee worketh nowe wittes feeble muche although god chawe meate v yet wee disgest mindes doctrine set foorth vnto v percelmeale god maketh familiar yet bee dulheaded wee vnderstande requisite howe wee doe wee generall knowledge god gouerning world wee better particular instruction whereby knowe goodnesse iustice wisdome ende wee might bee drawne feare settle selues vpon truste mercie cause sayde heere agayne whither bee scourge earth mercie vvhereas sayde whither bee scourge thereby eliu sheweth god chastizeth world raine heate cold tempestes stormes euerie one god scourge wherewith smiteth v sinnes yet notwithstanding v onely hee hathe created world considering hee pitieth earth saying also men woorthie hee vse mercie towardes howbeit myndeth maynteyne earth owne workemanshippe afterwarde serueth may hee sometimes haue eye himselfe thing hee hath created hee restreyneth rigour executeth full moderateth notwithstanding haue prouoked therefore behoueth v consider gracious goodnesse poynte aboue vnlesse hee forgiue v sinnes leastwise beare time surely earth shoulde perishe vnder v world consumed yea euen vtter destruction god giueth right great record mercie pleaseth spare v manner conclusion ought serue v double purpose one confirme hath bene set forth alreadie told yesterday make v feare god serue put whole trust say discourse concerning god gouernement respecte worlde better warranted wee see diuers fashion varietie chaunges example peraduenture god chastize v sendeth dearth nowe dearth commeth one cause afore mencioned namely eyther frost drought noysome
