rayne tempestes ayre punisheth v ayre senslesse thing rayne bethinketh selfe correcte faultes men may alledge v natural reason say rain windes stormes ingendered meanes philosopher well bring reason say hath beginning dispozed inferiour cause meane season doe chastizementes god sendeth vpon v come shall man father vpon inferiour cause beholde countrie misgouerned meete god hande passe vpon according wherevnto commeth rough scourge vpon shal say nature working ought wee acknowledge iudge heauen chastizeth coutries sheweth v cannot scape hande haue done amisse let v bee sure god vttereth fauoure goodnesse sendeth v seasonable pleasant weather contrariwise punisheth sinnes transgression sendeth v foule vnseasonable wether nowe knowe namely rayne rayzed owne naturall mouing stormes tempest ingendered without god sending appointing euer thinketh good doctrine shall bee muche better ratified lo howe speciall conclusion leadeth v muche better vntoo god also seconde poynt seeing rayne whyrlewyndes hayle god scourge wee must learne humble selues hee correcteth v let strike vpon v vayne let v bee plyable vnder ende humble oure selues suche wise hee may reygne quietly ouer v truely foule shame v wee must driuen seruice force main stroke cudgel seeing hee allureth v gently nature childe looke inforced loth come father compulsion yet notwithstanding god faine worke fashion v considering oure stubbornesse vntowardnesse bee handled constreyned vse roughnesse leastwise yet let v bow vnder wee feele rough stroke striking v hayle rayne thunder wynde frost tempestes drought therefore wee feele smart blowes hand god maketh v quake feare serueth dismaye v bring v vnder lure wee might craue forgiuenesse oure sinnes let v learne wee bee worthie beaten let v vnderstande wee shall ceasse prouoke vengeance except giue v hart holie spirite ye see howe god scourge ought stirre v vp come vnto intente feare honour heerewithall let v marke whereas sayde earth god hath respect self destroyeth v vtterly doe see god suffereth v liue although many aduersities yet doe wee see fauour forbearing needes wee bee vtterly wyped away first brunt hee deale v deseruing therefore let v marke howe sayde god doth earthes sake yea bee worthie haue done sake therefore shetteth eye voutsafeth think vpon shamefull creature ye see heere disdeyne set forth vnto v witte god none consideration v hee might rende vp heauen earth destroy v serueth bereaue v pryde make v much ashamed ende might leaue flattering ourselues see wold fain hide filthinesse plight soeuer cesse like well selues conceyue wote vayne imagination bee great value sayde heere god esteemeth valueth earth deserue esteemed neuerthelesse intent dismayed hee addeth purposely therethrough god setteth foorth mercie hath hee abashed v saying hee disdeineth haue respect v turneth againe saith yet vse pitie make feele mercie spare yea howbeit bycause bee worthie wee must alwayes conclude euer god v hath respect vnto thing v come humilitie acknowledge wee haue deserued destroyed god hande doth hee shewe v hee goodnesse surmounteth oure naughtinesse cause hee addeth ende god doth euen meere goodnesse mercie nowe hereof haue gather rayne come due season faire weather also wold wish wee haue deserued god deale gently v nother must myndes rome vpon wage yeeldeth v though hee bounde v side dutie ought vse tenderly child vvhat meere mercie deserued wel starue hunger reason sende v nourishment bycause good pitifull vvee deserue rooted world hee reacheth hand feede v father doth child therin therefore wee see vndeserued goodnesse lo howe ought magnifie god benefit dealeth vnto v taking wage hyre sayde ought pay v wee haue deserued hande free giftes meere goodnesse liberalitie towardes v heerevpon haue conclude muche hee beareth v euen haue offended ought ouerwhelmed ceasseth play father still yea euen vpon oure body whiche carions smoke thing nought inasmuch say lord worketh bountifully towards body ought bee confirmed right trust hee receiue v mercie readie forgiue v faultes euer aske forgiuenesse hand see lord doth dayly call v saluation eate one bit breade vse temporall benefit hee bestoweth vpon v hee openeth heauen vnto v say come bee father haue mercie vpon sinnes ye shall alwayes finde readie receyue ye desire bee maynteined meere mercie nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement sinnes praying touch v quicke misliking ourselues may desire earnestly clenzed grace therwithall much order nature giueth v faire lookingglasses glorie goodnesse iustice wee beholding may bee rauished walke feare may serue honour yelde ourselues wholy obeysance end may lead v peasably whither pleaseth may c cxlvj sermon third vpon xxxvij chapter heare thing iob stay thy selfe consider vvonders god knovvest thou hovv god hath set lavve hovve hee maketh light shine clovvde vnderstandest thou scattering clovvdes myracles perfecte knovvledge hovve thy clothes vvarme vvhen maketh sovvthvvinde blovve vvart thou vvith stretch heauen vvhich fast molten glasse tell v vvhat vvee shall saye vvee order oure matter bicause darkenesse thou speake vvho vvill report ifany man tell shall hee svvallovved vp vvhen sunne hid men see light againe vvinde blovveth bringeth cleerenesse fayre vveather commeth north therefore god ought bee exalted vvith prayse hee mightie goodnesse hee strong povver iudgement iustice hee afflicteth therefore doe men feare hee vvill regarde vvize ovvne conceyte wee knewe sayde heere work god wit wonderfull none v hee would take much paine consider specially seing wit slender frail think selues skilfull euen one little cast eye wee haue learned bee knowne meane whyle esteeme god workes according worthynesse common thing v bycause wee accustomed ouerpasse lightly therefore behoueth v mark wel conteyned verse one syde eliu protesteth god workes myracles side saith behoueth v stay vpon namely bicause wit feble haue true knowledge hand therefore neede bestowe studie therevpon furthermore commaunded expresly bea ken except god speake vnto v v may well apply al wittes considering workes shall neuer come cheef point yee see haue three point beare mynde one concerneth excellencie maiestie bee seene god workes bee despized second much men rude grosse witted looking vpon thing god setteth afore muste bee casting eye aside glaunce awaye must stay vpo settle mind throughly diligent vttermost third must trust owne reason thinke selues haue skill ynough iudge consider belongeth god shew v worde haue conceyue point whereat must beginne till haue bene god schole wee shall haue dim eyesight workes shall passe away v wee perceiue requisit v short wee shall haue discretion vntill god haue made v wise yet thing neede greatly layde foorth length well weyed euerie v therefore ofte come considering god workes let v lifte vp wit alofte reuerence say honour god infinite wisedome power rightuousnesse appeere let serue one point bee shorte euer thinketh vpon god work without reuerencing say without yeelding honour without acknowledging full wisdome power goodnesse vnkynd traterous vnto god therefore oft man speakes v god work let v yeeld reuerence take miracle surmount wit wherein god vttereth maiestie suche sorte wee haue good cause honour besides haue touched already must side consider ourselues end take ourselues bee sharpwitted knowe thing moment let v contented breathe vpon thing conceiue first sight let v bee wearie studie wee haue lyued good worlde still nouices haue perfecte vnderstanding bee wished yet let v heart go forward stil without studie wee shall haue profited much oure whole life haue learned vnderstande wonder conteyned workes god howbeeit true behoueth v go still foreward whereas place mention made staying ment wee bee ydly occupied gazing aboute musing vpon god muste hinder oure seruing imploying selues thing hath appoynted cleane contrariwyse wit man considereth god workes ought bee stirred vp duetie ought hee prouoked thrust foreward therevnto truely stay thinking vpon god workes doe goe backe leape better end wee bee wanderer wee see men runne trotting vp downe place place could find hart remoue world letted enterprise may well breake armes legges yet neuer soreward hold right way vvhat bee done let v bee guided sober aduisednesse let v stay wise vpon god workes wee may bee restreyned wandring sort become straggler howbeeit therewithall let v also apply selues god commaundeth let bee marke shoote furthermore let v assure ourselues owne nature haue nother wit reason giue eare vnto god belongeth shewe v wee ought consider workes may fare better true heathen men haue disputed curiously secretes nature manner nothing hath beene hidden yea musing vpon worlde comming vnto god else suche wisdome confuzed dungeon vnthankefulnesse men curiously search god workes thinke vpon maker whit regarde therefore cursed wisdome buzieth selfe curiouse searching inferiour lower cause meane whyle despyzeth maker yet notwithstanding certayne god gaue vnderstanding treated curiously order nature howbeeit much heard god speake worde guide aright missed way cheefe point haue submitted themselues vnto god considered glorie whiche appeereth v workes let v marke well whensoeuer reade great philosopher heare speake perceyue howe knew thing seeme incomprehensible v lookingglasses blindnesse men vntill god haue taught schole sharperwitted men vve come farre short yet see taste god therefore desirous comprehende god workes let v trust skilfulnesse nother let v presume vpon owne naturall power let v herken god speketh v taught wordes let v go guiding shal know work sorte wee shall apply oure vse instruction thus much concerning first verse nowe eliu goeth forward immediatly matter asketh whither iob tell commaundement god hath giuen creature ordinance hath set cloud shedeth light whether know order disposition cloudes woonders perfect knowledge vvhen hee sayth knowest thou god set lawe creature two thing noted one god onely hath created workes also hee gouerneth still applyeth vse thinketh good according haue declared former dayes howbeit much saying set downe newe againe let v wey throughly importeth good lesson thing man shuld tell v god create world thing fall may verie slender cold tale yet heathen men almost euerie one meane good sparke religion let passe braynsicke beast opinion world without beginning wizest euer meene aristotle suppozed neuer match yet notwithstanding hee resteth vpon poynte diuell carie away hee knewe maker worlde although knewe god yet knewe creation worlde yee would say face god haue men looke vpon whiche seede religion although knewe god created worlde yet vnderstood prouidence wherin thing conteyned much thing created power continue stil goodnesse wisdome iustice thing vnknowne heathen men therefore let v remember well doctrine conteyned heere whiche conformable saying lord iesus christe father worketh yet still wisdome whereof salomon speaketh eyght prouerbes wee knowe surely god maker heauen earth confesse let v therewith call remembrance hee guideth thing hee hath forgotten creature ordereth owne pleasure therby wee may conclude cloud gather togither aire auenture nother ingendered pleasure earth god guideth thinges setteth order bothe fayre weather foule bothe come souerain dominion insomuchas neuer falleth one drop rayne nother euer fayre wether nother euer little puffe wynd lorde hath commaunded creature although bee senslesse haue secrete mouing gouerneth aboue al thus much concerning first point second place shewed v vnderstand sharpwitted ynough know therefore must stoupe vnder word god fayth must vnderstanding ye see one side god prouidence warranted vnto v intent doubt thing gouerned wil therwithall behoueth v take knowledge rudenesse v ende although wee cannot iudge thing many thing passe reach yet shuld therfore think nothing run backe sayd concerning herkening wit small feeble let v resort god shewe v thing hidden vnknowne wee must iudge oure owne fancie horrible confuzion th n mannes reason submit selfe god worde nowe iudge visible thing thing concerne worlde furtherforth god inlighteneth v holie spirite guydeth v worde doe concerning god euerlasting kingdome whiche farre hygher without comparison thing spoken heere vve able iudge worldly visible corruptible flyghtfull thing shall iudgement reache spirituall kingdome god must needes come short therefore let v learne humble selues modest meanes come knowing thing belong saluation wee mynde profit well therein let v first acknowledge wee bee able knowe aught otherwise god teacheth v therefore let v referre selues vnto contented guyded worde wee see thing wee couet knowe let v assure selues lord intendeth humble v let v cace play braynlesse sorte iudge imaginacion contented remember lesson shewed v god worde thus yee see howe wee ought put sentence vre nowe way eliu speaketh thing seene yet reason incomprehensible true men may say somewhat end must needes conclude god wonderfull workes high v therefore sayth come canst thou discusse mee thy clothes warme whe god giueth rest earth south wind say sommer wether whot sunne beareth power wynde drawe northward south wynde reigne yet notwithstanding wind none man may perceiue l ke sommer time wether calme true coole gale come peraduenture fro south yet winde may bee perceyued weather shall bee still man shall perceyue wynd stirring doe men swelt heate bycause weather whottest cause sayd god maketh earth quiet southwinde canst thou suche time muche iudge sweat issueth thy bodie thou seest thy clothes wet besides thy clothes shall burne thee sunne haue shone long vpon heat shal able fence heat thee canst thou tell reason hereof againe wart thou god saith spread heauen vve see work mirrour molten glasse lo maruellous molten work spreading heauen art thou able comprehend inestimable power god sheweth self al thing haue effect gather vpon saying although naturall cause heate cold yet doth followe wee vnderstande specially southwind beareth sway sommer time men burne heate without feeling great blast gale wynde wee may well perceyue inferior reason thereof neuerthelesse haue known yet must come power hidden god yea hidden wittes forced faile dazled hereby see howe proude men flinging rouers dispute god set schoole reply vpon murmure doings shewe token misliking diuelish pride wee able perceyue much cause sweating heate sunne vve perchaunce say sunne whot yea howe sweate ingendred bycause bodie loozened loozening doth open bodie moysture cannot tarie within cold wether poares shet vp moysture shrinketh inwarde nourishe man life whereas contrarie doone heate agayne heate ingendereth feeblenesse feeblenesse maketh humor melt ye see cause sweting men may well dispute sorte done must needes acknowledged maruellous secretes bodie man god hath planted workmanship wee bee wittes ende haue well considered thinke much shame v vnthankfulnesse beastly againe perchaunce discourse howe heauen made roundnesse much bigger earthe moreouer matter substance made wit firie matter howe maynteyned suche perfecte state order finally maner wheeleth whe sayde must needes acknowledge god worketh greate reason behalfe howe great euen infinite whereat mennes wit must needes stoupe say surely wonderful workmayster god worketh suche sort must needes honor secret worship work acknowledge power atteyne hyghnesse thus ye see wherevnto holy ghostintendeth bring v texte therfore ofte see reason thing doone nature perceiue meanes god worketh therewithall vnderstande iustice power wisdome let v always learne conclude yet notwithstanding cannot comprehend hundreth part much haue litle tast wee get licke tip tung yet haue tast nother excepte giuen v aboue howbeit let v way marke well knowledge wee haue serueth make v feele rawnesse vnderstanding wee might humble selues god vpon knowing vnabilitie seke taught profite furthermore let v neuer werie setting oure mindes considering god workes seing may get inestimable treasure learning neuer small portio yea though entering taste sayd afore shall haue spent whole life shall haue done much haue come half way vntill time lord gather v wholy fully himselfe thus ye see touching heate spoken touching workmaship see sky molten lokingglasse yet notwithstanding scope infinite therfore need must workemaister wonderfull lo ought put lesson vre sayd immediatly tell v shall say order matter bycause darkenesse heere eliu mocketh iob meane doctrine toucheth v whiche presume take hold talke god reply must tel v shuld speak vnto god may alledge end may shew fault found work one holy ghost say go ther none selfwise take vpon picke quarel god work soothly consider ouerboldnesse al men wee shall see god content v oure power euerie v would put peece haue snatch saying vvhy thing doone good bee short would terrible hotchpotch god shuld herken wish follow wherof commeth diuelish pride needes bee wise finding fault god doings behold heere howe holie ghoste scorneth suche presumptuousnesse sayth seing euery taketh vpon bee great craftes maisters ell v shal speak vnto god ye come say goe haue thing done ye must shewe reason reason ye bring vnto god told v set purpose bycause men intangle selues owne fantasticall imaginacions disconteted god workes beseech giueth v leaue missebehaue ourselues god reply regard maiestie regard certen would quake feare nought holie ghoste bringeth v speaking god say go tell v shall say fall muttering behind backe cowardly wretch would seeth corage authoritie whose doings misliketh one wil find fault yet hee dare open lippes face go away moyling worke spite forge slaunders behinde backe among mate spueth conceiued afore saying behold pray man think selfe verie wise great skill like maruell howe men suffer talke fashion manner deale wee god bee hardie speake openly verie deede nature teacheth v ought make v shudder lift vp selues hathe made fashioned v meane whyle wee ceasse bee spitefull wicked grudge repine huckermucker picke quarels vvherefore oft tempted find fault god work let v learne come bethink v conteyned heere namely shall speake vnto poynt may begin shal haue cause represse ourselues folie v must needes subdewed fall vtterly grounde thus yee see must take sentence sayd tel v may say vnto god wheras said cannot order matter bycause darknesse therein ignorantnesse men better expressed vnto v heere wrapped darknesse see whit order matter behold god dwelleth light seeth sunne shyneth mortall man doeth man walke hygh nonedayes seeth way giues himselfe thing light sunne guide direction intend view ground possession looketh round god therfore hath also dwelleth gret infinit light nothing hidde al thing open vnto time past time come reacheth euen deepes dungeon haue seene heretofore teach lesson seing dwell darknesse man wereshet vp sawe whit light yet say another man thou wotest thou doest shall blinde wretch tell welsighted man knowes way seeth hee doth compare selues god certein worse blind seeth maner men hath far maner fight therefore must need worse mad presume gainsay find occasion reason cause darknesse spoken heere let v consider state also state god shall shet mouthes presume pleade libertie doe shalbe lowlinesse v fal low whatsoeuer god doth confesse nothing rightfulnesse wisdome goodnesse equitie iustice remaineth thing v glorify respect knew one litle peece doings yet need condemne owne infirmitie cannot glorifie god ought reason ignoraunce heere way let v marke well men rebuked rashnesse make haste speake knowe thing vvee see howe tickle tongue specially talke god wonder vvee descant vpon howe aduenture yet notwithstanding wee bee darkenesse therefore let v learne rule talke according smalnesse howbeit therewithall side let v consider infinite goodnesse god inlightneth v middest darkenesse word although vnderstande perfectly poynts howe made world perceyue meanes whereby worketh still yet ceasseth make v priuie minde farre forth needefull v cause sayde god wisdome kept companie hee made worlde rayzed vp mountaynes sunke valleyes stablished order wee see sayde also wisdome cryeth streetes saying come giue selfe redie talke familiarly men yea delight whole pleasure dwell inhabiters earth seeing god wisdome selfe incomprehensible v protesteth hir delight pleasure dwel v bee familiar v pray haue wee cause good chere watchfull take profit thing god sheweth v howbeit sobernesse modestie wee may couet knowe ought teacheth v glorifie yeelding deserued prayse thus yee see haue marke verse nowe consequently sayde speake shall reporte vnto shall bee bee swallowed vp dareth vtter one worde eliu expresseth yet better thing haue touched afore witte vnaduised wordes whiche wee shoote foorth concerning god wanderingimaginations wee conceyue braynes grudgings made huckermucker therevnto tendeth similitude whiche alledged cowarde durst stirre one finger yet notwithstanding falles moyling whome god hath giuen discretion seketh wise backbyting men euen deale godward none v hath much boldnesse skill reply god doings yet al brabble hee voutsafeth heare oure word eliu sheweth men shal gaine nothing settling selues maner god shall reporte begger speake great king say meete king shoulde better aduized might answered freende muste get messenger goe giue aduertizemente whiche speake seeing kyng hath aduice wisedome ynoughe excepte counsell best go giue aduice else finde messanger send counsell poore begger speak euery man would mocke cause mocke follie take vpon v speak vnaduisedly god workes therefore let v marke well manner speaking whiche set downe namely shall report debate matter heere lowe yet meane whyle wee bee frogges frogges make great crooking well ynoughe marishes puddle yet men passe stay crooking euen talke men hold reason babble yet beare themselues hande god hold peace doe would haue cleane contrarie therefore let v learne euer lifte vp neb god shall winne nothing wordes shall slip ayre vanish away smoke neuerthelesse let v marke way word shal fall ground must registred great horrible confuzion pryde dare murmure againste god suche blasphemousnesse muste needes come reckening scape vnpunished therefore let v imagine gayne thing god whensoeuer tempted stand contention let v call saying remembrance namely shall report true god hereth nothing escapeth yet voutsafeth stoupe bibblebabble thoughe wee match tush frogges sayd afore short serueth shewe v wee shall neuer get vpper hande pleading god moreouer reaso shuld abace self much answere v toucheth cannot come neere babbling although wee fyle tung cut slyce smoothely aire yet shall god abyde still safe sound hee needeth streyne himselfe reply againste v find excuse needelesse let v learn speak reuerence word shall vtter may bee made praysings god may accept may purging oure tunges say vttering nothing commeth word haue learned schole conclusion let v marke eliu addeth man speake sayth shall swallowed vp sheweth v heere confusion prepared dare set themselues god would fayne finde fault workes vvhat shall gayne end shall swallowed vp vve see creature must needes tremble god maiestie shalbe done manifest rebellion god one frown make mountaines rock melt emptie sea destroy whole world list surely rebellion nother earth water rest suche creature behold man handfull dust needes wage battle maker pray hold world perish sone came vnder god hand behold worme wretched carion wil put god silence wil also rob god honoure haue bee counted wyse ryghtuouse hee woorthie ala must needes worsse blynd come rushing boldnesse therfore let v marke well according haue touched set vp bristle sorte god wee seeke owne destruction bee quyte swallowed vp vvill mainteyned vnder hand keeping god let v learne humble ourselues pray shewe selfe v according shall haue pleased shewe himselfe also graunt v grace walke continuall modestie haue eye alwayes vpon marke namely hee deserueth bee honoured hand acknowledging selues owe suche reuerence may learne submitte v wholly vnto thus ye see howe may approch vnto god without feare fyre terrible wrathe nay rather let v sure bee refreshing vnto v wee shall mainteyned grace condicionally wee come humilitie withoute preacing ouer farre inquire secretes therefore wee must contente selues sheweth v worde assuring selues reach v hand v go hee guydeth v nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement fault praying make v feele continually much pleaseth graunt v greate aboundance worldly benefites haue applyed ordeyned creature vse wee receyuing suche bountifulnesse hande may learne knowe father assuring selues seeing hath care body world hee fayle v thing concerne spirituall life soules although world bee tangled many affection comber wittes bee libertie consider god workes accordingly yet wee may therefore ceasse take courage muze vpon meane season guide v suche wise holie spirite wee may learne like well doings glorifie iustice truth goodnesse vertues sheweth v dayly workes may please c cxlvij sermon first vpon xxxviij chapter lorde ansvvering iob vvhirlevvinde sayde vvho darkeneth secretes vvordes vvithout knovvledge girde vp thy loynes like valiant man tell thing shall demaunde thee vvhere vvert thou vvhen layde foundation earth tell thou haste vnderstanding wee haue seene heretofore eliu intending rebuke iob protested mortall man iob end co plaine hee handled high power shewed god win reason gentlenesse according also dealeth towards v beareth v making worde bee preached v men like selues may come familiarly heare thing telleth v doctrine chawed put mouthes vve see god pitieth v appoynteth men bee minister worde teach v name authoritie knoweth abilitie forasmuch feeble hand swallowed vp maiestie ouerwhelmed glorie cause stoupeth downe lownesse instructing v meanes men yet requisit also touched yeeld reuerence deserueth without wee woulde abuse goodnesse whereas commeth vnto v ende woulde play haile fellowe wel met rehersed v presently god perceyuing iob sufficiently subdued matter reason eliu alledged maketh feele greatnesse whirlewind ende therwith put feare yeeld himselfe acknowledging fault wholy obey whatsoeuer bee sayde see god applieth v fashion intent win v one wile stoupeth downe vnto v bicause perceyueth v grosse rude mount vp vnto neuerthelesse forasmuch ouergreat pryde nature behoueth v feele hee ende may learne feare heare worde humilitie diligence point ought mark well therein see loue beareth v care hee hath welfare need must carefull v doth ye would say transfigure himselfe voutsafeth talke familiarly v also stammer lispe v hee seeth meete conuenient v againe forasmuch seeth goodnesse might turne contempt hee doth also aduaunce magnifie himselfe meete intent knowe owne state submit selues wholy vnto much ought wee desire taught worde sith agreeable capacitie therein god hath ouerslipt thing requisite profitable saluation seing good god hath vouchsafed stoupe downe wise vnto v yet therewithall aduaunceth himselfe frame v obedience let v bee willinger heare speaketh let v make fonde excuce god worde high darke v terrible simple shall haue well cast vp account shall find certaintie lord setteth v forth maiestie woorde able make creature quake yet also simplicitie end make bee receyued ignorant vnskilfull moreouer great light wee may vnderstand without going schoole leastwise bee teachable without cause hee calleth purposely schoolemaster lowly little one thus ye see thing wee haue marke first streyne god speaking v mouth men intent wee shoulde come freely receyue thing better leysure behalf telleth v astonished measure howbeit forasmuch dul vpon spurre yeeld honour deserueth hee maketh v feele exalteth himselfe maiestie intent bring v honour purposely sayde lorde spake vnto iob whirlewinde ynough haue giuen token presence also rayse vehement tempest vve shall finde scripture sometimes god raysed thunder sort hee listed speake faythfull one haue specially marke heere circumstance place forsomuch iob sufficiently tamed god saine shewe terrible force cause hee thundered raysed whirlewinde iob shoulde know lord deale generall commonly sayd god dwelleth darke cloud rather compassed light therefore cannot come insomuch woulde looke vpon god sens dazle reason thicke darkenesse betweene v verie well spoken generall glorie god ende wee presume bee ouer inquisitiue incomprehensible determination tast farre pleaseth discouer vnto v therewithall consider sens fayle v vouchsafe come v else lift v vp yet neuerthelesse another respect wit bycause sturdinesse god must faine shewe himselfe terrible v true would faine drawe v gentlenesse see men bee well disposed submit themselues vnto vseth sayd louing maner inuiting vntoo gently may perceiueth sturdinesse must need first make v stoupe otherwise shoulde win speaking v cause publishing lawe hee rayzed thunder blew trumpet ayre made shake insomuch people afrayde sayd let lorde speake vnto v dead wee vtterly vndone vvhy god shake earth maner voyce rore terriblenesse ment hee driue away people shoulde heare truely cleane contrarywise sayde hee gaue lawe vayne ment giue people certaine rule ende might knowe way lyfe raysing whirlwindes tempest ayre scare v say part meening serueth preparatiue subdue loftinesse folke would neuer haue obeyed god word neuer haue acknowledged authoritie spake without token whiche added therfore let v mark wel god speaking iob fashion whirlwinde needed nowe holy man applied whole indeuer honouring god needed bee subdued maner wee neede let v compare selues iob mirrour angellike holinesse wee haue heard protestation made although extremely afflicted reason therof murmure let slip many wilde word yet alwayes hold grounde woorshipping god humbling himselfe vnder hand hilde still generall poynt though swarued aside particular bee fleshly may vanity carie v away bee maner starke drunken hardely wee discerne god heauen man set woorde afore v make slowe haste yea bee duller ass lorde neede make v feele maiestie touche v good earnest nowe truely god needeth rayse vp stormes whirlwind make v know speaketh hee must dispose v another maner come vntoo according also hee doeth one man haue hartbitings trouble conscience another afflicted disease thirde bee touched aduersitie let v vnderstande god calleth v bycause wee come owne accorde drawe neere heare worde subdueth hardhartednesse meete shoulde ende mindes humbled true obedience doeth god see rebelliousnesse v hee muste needes vse maners meanes aforesayde draw win v himselfe ende wee may heare hee must fayne speake v whirlwinde preuayleth men wee see kicke prick play restie iades although god quicken vp yet winneth nothing hand many wretch seene god chastiseth many wayes stri ing hard blowes vpon heades beetle neuer harde must needes bee softned yet notwithstanding neuer leaue gnashing theyr teeth vve see cannot trayned neither meanes moued full pride stubbornnesse shewe themselues agaynst god euen spyting vttermost theyr power much behoofe god chastizeth disposed come vnto intent therefore let v beware disappoynt god oft sendeth v aduersitie let v learne resort well though hee spake thunder thundered vpon v make v heare let v consider let v cosider mindes may truly subdued vnto whole seeking may bee wholly humbled vnder obeysance lo haue marke streyne let v marke although god doo dayes thunder heauen yet notwithstanding signes haue bene giuen olde time warranting worde ought serue v also daye vvhen god lawe preached vnto v wee must immediatly match therewithall thing spoken ninetenth exodus lawe hath beene duely warranted lorde gaue full authoritie therevntoo hee sent thunder lightening heauen made ayre ring noyse trumpet done intent lawe shoulde bee receyued reuerence euen worldes ende much imported verse wheras sayd god appeared whirlwind behoueth v vnderstand intent warrant thing conteyned booke must also extende authoritie vnto whole word yet one thing considered god begin call v louing maner shew rough sharpe end must think strange rather examin well life knowe whether wee haue obeyed let v one side acknowledge apparant goodnesse side consider must needes vse second meanes win v hee seeth gayneth nothing fauourable dealing hee shewed v example god doth sometimes cocker v intendeth take v owne haue v flocke hee setteth foorth worde vnto v without sending v affliction verie well wee see wee like well yet meane profite selues bee confirmed goodnesse wee ought renounce owne wicked lustes forget worlde giue selues wholly vnto hee beareth v time ende seeth v retchlesse beginneth smite heerein ought perceyue speaking v whirlwinde without cause forsomuch heare spake graciously vntoo v kindeharted fatherly maner therefore requisite god speake v vehemence sith hee perceyueth wee neuer come till hee haue prepared v fashion true hee winneth bare worde howbeeit hee seeth othersome stubborne sendeth trouble aduersitie doubtlesse number neuer come gospell neuer bene touched rightly heart obey god sent token hee minded chastice heerevpon felt affliction nothing wretchednesse world inforced mislike themselues cut pleasure wherein bin plunged heeretofore ye see god draweth men diuerse sortes let v profite selues meanes vseth towards v againe speaketh v whirlwinde let v side bee familiar suffer selues ruled sheepe lamb spie hardhartednesse v must needes subdue v whether although suffer v play looce colt time yet length shall feele terrible maiestie make v afrayde leastwise please shew v fauour god doth v singular good turne wakeneth v maner thundereth voyce entereth hart woundeth v say priuiledge granteth men againe thudering vpo vnbeleeuers late hope returning vnto hee summoneth heare condenation much ought wee receyue quietly helpe god giueth v subduing stubbornnesse oure flesh rayseth whirlwind say maketh v feele maiesty ye see effect haue mark vpon sentence let v come said wordes darkneth secretes wordes without knowledge gird vp thy loynes like valiant man answere demaundes first place god mocketh iob bicause striued borne hand could mend cace disputing cause sayd art thou scripture sheweth v make v vtterly nothing true men make great account themselues beare themselues hand great woorthinesse well may esteeme highly themselues god meanewhile knoweth nothing al filth stinch therfore shaketh yea euen lothing although bee foolish ouerweening glorie wisdome vertue v yet notwithstanding god deface v put v shame vseth word art thou thou art man pronouncing vtter bereeuing v occasion boasting wee knowe much one drop goodnesse v haue wee cause vaunt selues maner wise cause also god addeth girde vp thy loynes like valiant man say set much store thyself thou listest beare thy self hand thou art gyant bee thou furnished throughly bee thou armed top toe shalt thou gaine ende thinkest thou stande set agaynst thee thou wretched creature vvhat hast thou heere see god meening sayde afore foolishnesse selfe estimation selfeweening wee bee value rooted v verie hard bring v right vnderstanding owne wantes wee might bee cleare pryde presumption much behoueth v marke text scripture shewed v thing estimation v let v wey well spoken one part worlde onely mankinde generall therefore let great small learne bee ashamed themselues seing god byndeth vp one bundle togither hee sayeth wisedome men foolishnesse vanitie strength weaknesse rightuousnesse vncleannesse dung god speaketh suche termes two three men men vniuersally therefore let v greatest least learne stoupe acknowledging glorie confuzion shame god cause let v thinke vpon saying let v take bee ment onely persone iob mortall creature lorde say malapertnesse man pot brittle earth man vessell ful filth naughtinesse man lesse nothing malapertnesse dispute agaynst mee bee inquisitiue afore hande whether go vvho art thou man according also see saint paule setteth woorde stoppe way saying vvho art thou man whiche reasonest god pleadest setteth downe hee hath alledged obiections wherein men thinke themselues haue fayre colour dispute agaynst god demaunde destroy hath created put difference betwene one another without knowing cause one bee called saluation bee reiected saint paul athe set downe thing although men take pleasure obiections yet sayth man art thou settest thy self fashion god haue marke vpon saying therfore whensoeuer man tempted pride lette thinke himselfe ala art thou entering battell selues agaynst match need bold inquisitiue god secretes l fancy tongue looce imagine vnprofitable thing talke god honour wee must faine thinke ala euery v shall haue entered himselfe considered owne feeblenesse perceiued effect nothing shall cooled well ynough prittleprattle former conceytes layd water yea imagination brideled imprizoned shall declared yet fully hereafter sayd expresly gird vp thy loynes like valiant man v wit whole world hath layd force togither vttered nothing ye see god spiteth defyeth iob bidding furnish come armed weaponed gyant valiantest man could found hereby expresseth yet better thing haue sayde alreadie wit condemning men scripture ment simply common sort despised credite estimation extendeth euen greatest thinke touch cloud heades although men imagine themselues haue apparaunce honour let assure themselues nothing god example excellent comparison neighbour surely conceyue opinion well lyking themselues man bee counted skilfull good wit good behauiour set much selfe respect haue quality finally man bee indued great commendable vertues afore men hauing speciall induements perchaunce make heart hoppe belly say set much store selues come vnto god must quite quaile lustie stoute fellow hath cace one whit strength holinesse wisdome euer else fayleth vtterly behalfe therfore worde let worlde knowe furniture shall boote god must vtterly desaced emptied god leaue one drop power strength v wee shail take way borrowing acknowledging proceedeth meere goodnesse see worde valiant man importeth doth v wit speciall power vertues soeuer wee haue must puffe v vp pride agaynst god furthermore sayd also iob wrappeth darkneth secret wordes without knowledge hereby god sheweth haue deale secret must bethinke selues well may proceede soberly reuerence vnder worde secret god intended signifie high thing wherof iob spoken vve may well dispute many petie trifle yea discourse randon talke shall vaine fond yet shall blasphemie neither shall god name vnhallowed enter doctrine saluation god work fal disputing prouidence wil must go vnaduisedly wrap vp intangle secret vnskilfull wordes vve see wherein god rebuketh iob namely speaking hastily thing outreached capacitie althogh excellent giftes grace yet ought alwayes haue humbled himselfe acknowledgement infirmity also haue brydeled himselfe sith hee well neere wittes wist think god iudgements forasmuch hee felt himselfe afterdeale haue eie feeblenesse owne vnderstanding acknowledging self n rtall man haue said ala nothing ignorance foolishnesse herewithal also haue looked vp inestimable maiestie incomprehensible purpose god shoulde haue meekned howbeeit neither one although quite strayd right way went forwarde still true marke yet doo wee see hee rebuked god owne mouth text putteth v mind reuerence god haue v beare mystery thing concerne heauenly kingdome reason owne matter need go precise carefulnesse earthly thing passe away whensoeuer wee fall talking god workes truth thing conteyned worde must come reuerence feare open lippes flush whatsoeuer commeth tung end orhaue witts busie inquire thing belong v lawful v must restreyne desyres brydle tongue secretes god say darke high thing v meddle therfore must think atteyne furtherfoorth god listeth instruct v owne mere goodnesse woulde god thing wel put vre haue bickering nowadays whole world seene verie fewe touched maiestie god vvhen wee treate worde doctrine saluation holy scripture euerie one falles aduenture euery man shootes forth verdit though reasoned mooneshine water thing passe vnderstanding man yet notwithstanding manifest bolder treate god high mystery ought rauish oure wittes wonder ought honor awefulnesse say wee bolder babble spake matter fiue shilling value trifle wote cause men haue considered howe god hydeth ouercasteth owne secrete determination hath holy scripture vttered vnto v wherevntoo behoueth v bee subiect vve see one side howe papist blaspheme god wresting falsifying marring corrupting whole holy scripture sticke scorne god woorde neuer tasted woorde secrete meeneth also drunkard among v coulde find hart subdue god fantasticall minde though wisest men worlde best seene holy scripture yet bee fayne come poynt god secrete determination aboue v vtterly dull brutish neither skill reason wine ouermaystreth lyke swine yet needes playe diuines controll thing wise man shoulde nowe adayes beleeue hee shoulde driuen frame forge newe gospell therfore let v remember shewed v heere wee talke god wee must take libertie pleade babble wee oure selues thinke good consider hath reueled secretes vntoo v holy scripture bothe greate small must submit themselues therevntoo honour cause heere mention made wordes without knowledge nowe god sheweth v heere whensoeuer wee speake workes matter secrecie high matter side bring forth little wee conceyue vnderstanding woordes without knowledge let men put themselues balance shall bee found lighter vanitie selfe sayde psalme much behoueth v marke doctrine neither skill aptnesse v treate god workes except hee teach v way v become wise gouerned spirit word god therfore finde thing god worde desire knowe let v vnderstand behoueth v abide ignorant therevpon keepe mouthes shet whensoeuer go speake shall knowledge thing vntruth v accusation god setteth downe heere agaynst iob thervpon sayth answere demaundes leastwise thou haue vnderstanding make also vnderstande woulde knowe thee heere god proceedeth mocking foolish ouerweening men weene themselues fine witted able dispute pleade agaynst therefore sayth verie well doubt verie able men owne seeming speake let raunge also must haue turne speake replie vpon mee shall well see default vvhat cause men rashe aduaunce themselues foolishly god take libertie speake occupie place bearing themselues hand god hath nothing reply beholde remedie god giueth v abate foolish rashnesse thinke v hee may demaund god begin question v shall wee answere surely bare thing well minde wee vtterly restreyned although mindes verie egre owne seeming wee bee able remoue whole worlde yet wee bee brought home owne state followe thing simply lorde sheweth v condicionally say think selues ala come god mouth open well hath authoritie maistershippe question v shall answere vnto ye see wherevnto behoueth v come thing haue consider text rightly instructed forasmuch hastie speake say forasmuch haue naturally vice thrusting selues forwarde becommeth v let v learne restrayne tongue cause runne libertie flushe thing wee skill consider dutie rather answere god put foorth selues speake peruerting order nature mortall man nothing shoulde incroch vpon maker cause audience bee giuen himselfe god meanewhile shoulde holde hys peace vvhat dealing yet withstanding oft murmure god teare worde peeces cast foorth wordes randon say thus thus doeth seeme mee vvhat cause hereof woulde put god silence haue selues heard aboue starke madnesse therefore correct statelinesse v let v learne presume answere god knowing come hath authoritie examine v yea euen according owne oure lyking appoyntment shall toto much shame shall haue stopped mouth begon speake selfe vvhereof god examine v thing hidden v wherein wittes faile v lo wherevnto god bringeth v shewe v beastlinesse frentike presumption seeing god hathe question put v able alledge thing shall confounded let v learne humble selues may learne hand haue lerned may make v see light middes darkenesse worlde meane season let v learne also serue honour respectes poynts shall haue profited well god schoole shall haue learned magnifie yeelde glorie haue good opinion proceedeth moreouer let v also mislike selues ende wee may resort vnto finde goodnesse wanteth ourselues therevpon may please gouerne v holy spirite replenished glorie wee may haue whereof glorie selues onely nowe let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement sinnes praying make v feele wee may returne true repentance thervpon vouchsafe reforme whole life whole seeking may bee submit selues holy commaundements let v say almightie god heauenly father acknowledge confesse c cxlviij sermon second vpon xxxviij chapter vvherevvast thou vvhen layde foundation earth shevve mee thou hast vnderstanding vvho hath layde measure thereof canst thou tell vvho hath set compasse vpon vvherevpon foundation thereof stayed vvho hee hath layde cornerstone thereof vvhen starres morning reioyced togither child god soong triumph vvho hath shettevp sea vvithin doores vvhich emptying selfe commeth foorth vvombe vvhen made clovvdes garment thereof darknesse svvadling bandes thereof haue stablished mine ordinance vpon haue shet vp vvithin barres doores sayde hither shalt thou come passe heere shalt thou stay lifting vp thy vvaues graunt well ynough rehersed concerning god work wee see bothe heauen earth wee minded earnestly coulde hardly made speake one worde neuerthe lesse wist howe profite selues thing conteyned doctrine woulde bee ynough teach v lowlinesse wee shoulde open mouthes grudge agaynst god complayne hee doeth thing lyking geere woulde layde awater incomparable greatnesse highnesse oure god hys woonderfull power might infinite goodnesse wise dome whiche shewe themselues woorkes woulde suffise humble v make v astonished wee woulde nothing honour homage feare reuerence vvee haue two thing consider heere one god speaketh power therewithall sheweth v face euen thing may see needeth consider thing il though neuer manifest v secondly behoueth v come end intent god purposeth ynough v confesse god made earth setled middes sea true god shetting vp sea sort though inclosed great walles wonderfull thing good right ought wee confesse workmaister excellent howbeit behoueth v passe yet applie whole indeuer glorifie god wise confesse doings bee iust full equitie right meanes bee bridled bee tempted grudge repine finde fault workes let thing conteyned heere serue subdue v holde v humblenesse modestie wee may doo nothing else honour reason workes bee vnknowne v let v therefore ceasse take good rightfull rest therevpon without gaynsaying let v come word conteyned first question god demaundeth iob layd foundation earth shuld say wretched creature dost thou set thyself would behoue thee first bee match would behoue thee come neere mine vnderstanding howe farre art thou againe sayeth come let see thou hast vnderstanding bath layde measure earth tellmee thou knowest hath set compasse vpon make well proportioned hath setled earth vpon hir corner whervpon stayde iob tell thing sayeth god truly wee beholde greatnesse weightinesse earth wee bee abashed hougenesse dazeleth witts able comprehend vve see well ynough wee bee constreyned confesse made great reason bee yet come short wherin god sheweth v frailtie feeblenesse noweseeing euen thing seene eye wee want sufficient iudgement comprehende pray shall god narrow hidden secretes whereby hee ordeyneth appoynteth hee listeth heauen wee espie reason thereof shall say meete v selfe wise iudge fancie seeing surmount vnderstanding shall comprehend verie angel cannot comprehende ouergreat folly rather madnesse men preace farre let v well aduised purpose sayde better vnderstanding therof let v make comparison take mee mason carpenter worlde yea cunningest builder bee chozen yet neyther mason carpenter excellent art hee neede lyne compass rule plummet lyke thing buylde withall else building bee crooked shall raise twoo pole highe without fault nowe woorkmaysters howe cunning excellent euer theyr art faine helpe themselues lynes compass measure yet greatest palace castels shall bee builded hundred pole high comparison building earth sea man shall curstly combered hee intende make castle hewen stone first good foundation sure groundworke building vayne layd vpon againe reering bee good proportion order working wel borne pray palace castle put togither comparison sea lande vvhat proportion betweene one seeing men bee neuer cunning haue neede helpes seeke heere ayde succour yea euen thing nothing co parison excellent houge woorkmanship appeareth earth alone god hath setled vpon water see made goodly order must need worse tha witlesse take vpon v controll god doings farre beyond coparison hidden v thing seene order nature therefore whensoeuer thing come remembrance let serue rauish v wonderment glorifie hath made building onely long continuance time vvee see men cannot first day builde make perfect thing go hande fayne bestow much labour time god see hee quickly finish goodly workmanship seene heauen earth bee short see heere god mocketh men pride presume controll work spake meane worke cunning masonrie carpenter craft say better thus thus would play maystermason yet haue skill matter shoulde maistermasons carpenter haue iust cause laugh mee scorne say fellow skill make windowe halfe foote ouer yet hee falles controlling v vvill skilfull art take scorne man come foolishly control workmanship wil send ouerweener backe againe apcee yes surely nowe stande awe maistermasons carpenter wee dare speake woorke modesty protestation vnable iudge shall come vnto god behoueth v bee much humble modest vve know maner men speake handicraft workmanship craftsman themselues true say seene occupation trade neuerthelesse ye shal heare mine aduice howbeeit referre still wholly haue skill wee vse modestie standeth vpon iudging building someother meane worke handicraft mannes making pray honour ought yeeld vnto god cace concerneth workes estimation ought haue see god intended text speaking line compasse say mortal corruptible creature yet would men beholding workes honor say beholde excellent skilfull workman cunning worke speakes yea handicraftes man sayde afore done meane peece work men would bold find fault leastwise would vnderstading workmanship haue made excellent worke haue created heauen earth sea nothing haue finished goodly order aray men see men take vpon neuerthelesse controll dealing vvhat work men layd workmanship shall come neere mine haue wrought incomprehensible power wisedome yet shall bee free mennes iudgements shall man dare say doest thou doest thou better thee doo vvhat pride shall men preferre mortall creature mee liuing god almightie alwise intollerable vnthankefulnesse mortall manne make peece woorke men doo honour iudge without great modestie haue deserued bee honored hundred tymes haue builded worlde let v learne looke better vpon god woorkes haue done wee cast eye vpon earth wee may bethinke v terrible hougenesse thereof great castell well wrought wherevnto none commeth neere see weight hath insomuch may well seeme impossible foundation bee founde able beare vp wherevpon grounded euen vppon water earth muste needes hang ayre doeth deede hathe water rounde aboute truely euen philosopher considered god maker thereof well perceyue reason howe water compasse earth whole masse togither hangeth ayre haue disputed verie curiously thereof alledged reason yet constreyned spite theyr teeth graunt thing aboue nature say water shoulde shrinke aside intent men might haue roome dwell coulde come selfe needes must working diuine prouidence maner spake although blinded owne vnthankefulnesse yet neuerthelesse coulde denie howbeeit haue sayde ynoughe acknowledge god created earth wee muste also beholde woonderfull wisedome therein acknowledge myracle wittes come short vvheras said god created nothing hath settled earth vpon water thing rauish v wonderment wee looke round v shal see water inuiron whole earth yet notwithstanding wee see earth abideth stable myracle true sometymes men shall see earthquake seeme go wreck also might come passe god prouided howsoeuer worlde go wee see bodie whole earth standeth stedfast still wonder v excuce pretend find leysure thinke vpon worke god doeth vtter power mightinesse therein many wayes must need sufficiently conuicted therby see see one whit magnifie god work lewdnesse vnexcusable men fall asleepe heere take paine thinke vpon god work worse vnthankfull churlish howe ignorant soeuer none excuse v wee alwayes blame woorthie glorifie god workes open manifest ye see wee haue beare mynde streyne nowe way whereas mention made compass measuring earth see well needed wonderfull power incomprehensible wisdome setting thing order earth woulde neuer haue settled stood still doeth middle ayre suche iust measure proportion suche conueniencie temperature nothing amisse furthermore wee beholde greate farre distance onely betweene earth clowdes also betweene skie starres planet abashed consider highnesse wee see skie aboue earth earth greate masse weightie houge men see bee compare greatnesse heauen must wee needes confesse philosopher little ball vvhat proportionablenesse betweene one yet neuerthelesse wee looke vpon mountaynes earth wee shall finde euen whereat maruell wherefore glorifie woorkemayster made againe side behold steddinesse earth ought rauishe v woonderment althoughe wee see great varietie yet doeth alwayes abyde place without fleeting ye see high mountaynes doo imbosse earth vnleuelnesse place seeme able shake yea ouerturne quite cleane god hath peysed earth proportion measure keepeth alwayes owne place still although seeme mountaynes shoulde ouersway yet notwithstanding one answerable another counterpeyse abydeth alwayes stedfast short whatsoeuer betydeth earth shall stande stedfast bee preserued still ende proportionable euenleueled counterpeyse selfe shall bee whit remoued whatsoeuer happen neuerthelesse wee see howe inuironed water houge mountaynes aduaunce themselues tumble sea yet notwithstanding continueth steddie still must need sayde god hath wrought passing woonderfull fashion behalfe yes certainly vvhat done onely woorship god confessing selues come farre short houge greatnesse incomprehensible wisedome truth good reason shoulde walk humblenesse feare come considering god woonderfull workes shewe themselues euerie order nature wee see verie cleerely conteyned heere yet notwithstanding behoueth v come backe poynt namely god setteth earth v looking glasse ende wee might beholde infinite glorie wisedome power might guide v leade v hande considering woorkes whiche exceeding greate excellent thereby bee rauished woonderment purpose humble selues vnder incomprehensible greatnesse honour vvee see god adorneth himselfe excellently replying agaynst entering intoo boldnesse desyre controll though hee done amisse vvho hee shall comprehende infinite highnesse let v open eye wee shall bee confounded side wee looke earth fostermother feedeth cherisheth v yet notwithstanding wee wote howe vve see well ynough howe tilled tell well ynough howe talke yet must wee needes bee astonished euen behalfe conclusion text seing haue mirrour god incomprehensible power wisedome euen verie earth wee treade vpon shall wee haue wee looke vp heauen farre aboue whereunto able atteyne meete v reply agaynst god aske doth suffereth thing ala let v marke well haue looked well vpon earth ought serue hold affection awe ende wee attempt aduance selues aboue sky rather yeeld glorie oure god thing pleaseth knowing soueraine god hath perfect substantiall glorie woonderfull power might matched infinite rightfulnesse wisedome fault bee found conceiue well shall haue profited greatly one day let v come said starres sung prayses child god reioyced triumph creating worlde wordes god betokeneth soone starres made sette song melodie glorifie starres sung sensible creature somuch god therin set owne greatnesse goodnesse consider purpose shoulde serue v yet notwithstanding behoueth v applie text instruction end may fare better sayd first part starres began sing theyr first creation maner haue tolde alreadie tongue hath set eye howbeeit moue v yet better glorifie sayd angel reioyced sight hearing melodie speechlesse creature muche made triumph hereby ought bee moued glorifie god ioy shall bee right true ioy farre one ioy madde worldelings vnthrifts cannot merry displeasing god vve see farre gladnesse set afore v angel heauen leape ioy sawe excellent course wonderfull order heauen god appointment moued reioycing mencioned heere seeing angelles guide v glorifying god singing prayses vnto ought glad beholde goodly order skie poynt wherevnto wee ought come oft lift vp eye aloft bee farre putting thing vre wee bee exhorted heere truly heare text doctrine slippeth away although warned neuer muche ought glorifie god looking vp heauen reioycing lighte sunne although sufficiently put minde yet doth slip v seing cheef seruice god requireth men praysed hand make none account whiche woorse doo rob honour disfeate glorifie deserueth surely wee shall pay deerly commeth reckening true lord knoweth well ynough hee cannot drawe thing v whereby magnified worthie yet contented men exalt glorifie work moued prayse beholding wee wee woorse traytours yes doubtlesse wee let v learne profit doctrine conteyned way let v marke angel termed god child ende wee persuaded runne triumphe spoken heere ioyne triumphing god prayses glorifying one common accord wee heare sayde melodie aboue beneath inasmuche god hath spred glory euery truely title beeing termed child god graunted angelles speciall priuiledge bicause approch neere vnto haue suche noblenesse bee aboue creature god messangers also called principality power bicause hads executeth whatsoeuer thinketh good beholde angel surely child god yet called well vvhy bicause god created v owne image likenesse although defaced sinne adam yet repayred agayne chozen comming lord iesus christ liuely image god exalted spirite set former state againe iesus christ hath done v honour come line abraham say clothe himselfe nature ende reconcyle v god father seing let v marke god sheweth v text sort may bee sure child cosequently possesse heauenly heritage ordeined v well v angel paradise although creepe vpon earth creature wretched fraught infirmity may ashamed want wretchednesse yet god finde meanes couple v angel heauen heerewithall let v vnderstande angelles tremble beholde heauen earth although excellent creature yet driuen bee abasshed beholding suche sighte heauen earth seeing angel excellent aboue men bee neuerthelesse abashed greatnesse god ought wee bee rauished woonderment wee open eye behold god woonderfull woorkes wee heare goodly melodie woorks ala vnthankfull shet eye wee myght see nothing shoulde wee playe deafe men wee myght heare nothing lette v followe angel set foorth v guide intent god myght bee glorified handes wee glorifie woorkes take auowe v child shewe himselfe alwayes father towards v thus ye see haue cosider vpon sentence sayde god child reioyced triumphe sawe starres morning reioycing togither purposely sayd ende myght know giue mindes earnestly magnifying god power whiche hee vttereth woorkes shall cut house vnwoorthie reckened number child nowe let v passe lorde commeth sea vvho hath set barres sayeth hee sea hath shet vp within barres doores thou shalt passe thus farre shalt thou come vvhen sea swelleth seemeth drowne swallow vp yet notwithstanding see whyle pryson yea god holdeth nource shoulde holde little babe hee hath set clowdes mistes sea little swadling band garment couer sea seemeth litle babe whome god weeldeth listeth heerein also continueth magnifying woorkes shewevs excellencie ought suffise make v walke humblenesse bolde set vp bristle agaynst according also speaketh prophete ieremie feare ye mee sayeth hee haue set bound sea sayeth bycause sea aboue v true simple ignorant perceyue sea ouerpeareth v higher earth suppoze water vnder earth farre beneathe cleane contrarye wee bee neere sea wee see perceyue euen eyesight hygher earth nowe seeing sea aboue v whereof long wee bee swallowed vp euerye minute houre seeing water mounteth farre aboue heades specially mention made fludde drowne whole earth sayde god opened spring windowes heauen also hee opened deepes water restreyned let looce dreadfull iudgement fludde god shewed v mirrour thing continually vpon earth hilde water miracle vvee see sea shoulde ouerwhelme letteth see yee open miracle wee conuicted woorse churles cause v worshippe god feare according power hee may haue souerayntie ouer v vtterly beaten downe men presume set vp bristle god let picke quarell sea see shall heard aboue else sea greate surge hideous waues signe power made nowe waues sea astonish v ala much terrible muste maiestie god v vvhen sea casteth vp boylings hideousnesse see wee tremble shall wee feare maker rather bleare tongue vvhat dealing must nedes sayd men starke madde cause god vpbraydeth men prophet ieremie according haue alledged text saying feare ye mee mee haue bounded sea sand euerlasting ordinance let v come againe word placed heere god sayeth hath bounded sea boundes like erewhile made mention compassing earth nowe speaketh sea yea maner bound better expressing sayd addeth sea hande little babe wombe mother child lieth stil mother wombe doth sea within bound true maketh great noyse specially tossed windes tempestes swell seemeth world shall ouerwhelmed yet passe beyond bound restreyneth like wesee miracle child kept close mother woombe graue howesoeuer hee fare yet hee getteth till day byrthtyme fully expyred according common order nature euen sea besides god addeth yet another similitude mistes serue restreyne sea shoulde passe boundes border like swadlingban e keepe yong babe childe woulde fayne pull oute armes legges make sport hild swadlingclothes hee fayne tarye like prysoner euen sea ryseth suche wise would likelyhoode onely leape one place another rather haue sayde already swallow vp put whole worlde confusion vve see sea fareth ther cheyne restreyne headynesse wee see although neede bee greate lettes shoulde restreyne furiouse creature yet dooth god vse violent meanes stay hath appoynted mystes holde backe therby see handleth little babe according owne saying proofe thereof wee see mistes nothing vapoures ingendred ayre wonder get vpper hande sea soone myste ryseth sea becommeth calme vvhereof commeth nothing vvhat shall man say sea little babe tyed vp swadlingcloutes although similitude seeme verie straunge firste blush yet notwithstanding impossible finde fitter kindes speache make v perceyue incomprehensible maiestie god vve neede mount vp maiestie knowe woonderfull workes setteth dayly eye proue greatnesse highnesse sufficiently wee cannot denie fowle shame v wee acknowledge incomprehensible power sayde heere sea restreyned mystes little babe hilde swadlingclothes though sea bee hideous men see yet hilde within bound may well leape mount aloft cannot passe therefore let v learne glorifie god wonderous woorkes better let v ashamed carlish vnthankfulnesse towards acknowledging goodnesse power wisedome myght yeelde prayse belongeth thervpo let v returne god principall intent whiche wee muste stay vpon sea consider thing simplie selfe true men myghte take good instruction beholding howe god restreyneth sea swallowing v vp vvhen know euery v conuicted life god giueth v giuen myracle yet ynough wee went behold god sheweth v wonder maketh v perceyue visible thing notwithstanding high dazeled nowe constrayned honour acknowledging wittes weake comprehend highnesse thing sene eye shal incomprehensible secretes priuy hidden determination generally particularly hee woorketh fashion seemeth straunge v farre outreacheth capacitie becommeth v presume cace iudge aduenture giue verdit vpon though wee able comprehend thing doth beyonde wit capacitie sendeth many aduersities misery one man looseth good another smitten sicknesse another falles reproche slaunder another wronged beaten might thought god far ouerseene handling men roughly thing behooueth v learne confesse god alwayes rightuous knoweth cause handle v cause good rightfull though vnknowne v acknowlege yet forasmuch still hande shall gayne nothing grudgings wee see wieked vngodly haue full scope worlde see despisers god liue ease see credit authoritie maisters lord worlde see spite god dayly yet notwithstanding punished firste brunt see contrary part wee fayne indure one whyle shame another whyle trouble another bee intrapped treason god succoureth v soone would haue let v wayt paciently till god deliuer v knoweth expedient v therewithall let v vnderstande wonder thing doth bilow euen owne person thing may beholde feete much reason shoulde wonder yea honour secrecie surmounteth euen capacitie angelles therefore let lower thing teach v settle ourselnes magnifying glorifying god long shal world let v suffer ourselues guided gouerned holy spirite ende may order v good pleasure let v fal downe presence good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v feele better wee haue doone specially knowe frayltie v faile point wit rude grosse cannot attaine glorie thereby may learne vtterly cast downe ourselues yet ceasse seeke bee lifted vp fayth good god namely bee alwayes sobrenesse modestie knowing howe muche wee beholding bounde vntoo number benefites bestoweth vpon v dayly may stirred vp yea wholly inflamed yeld thankes example poore ignorant misbeleuing soules may drawne one selfsame fayth knowledge truth men may one common accord praise magnifie exalte hee deserueth bringing heereof passe may please rayse vp true faithfull minister worde c cxlix sermon third vpon xxxviij chapter sermon yet still vpon verse vpon text added hast thou since dayes commaunded breake day hast thou appointed light place myght take holde corner earth vvicked myght bee shaken transformed clay vvhereon marke set holde themselues garment light shall hidden vvicked arme lifted vp shall broken haste thou entered intoo deepe vvaters sea hast thou searched bottome depthes gate death knovvne vnto thee hast thou seene gate shadovv death thing causeth men iudge folishly god work make muche haste tarry ende might know god hath prouided thing v put prouerbe vre hast maketh wast therfore haue need refraine selues hasty casting forth iudgemet aforehand thereof thing ought well warne v whiche spoken concerning sea wee loke vpo mouting vp waues semeth shold ouerwhelme worlde swallowed vp perchaunce say god ought haue remedied waues retire agayne breake theselues cannot passe bound perceiue god woderfull wisdome power better forasmuch see although sea rush foorth suche headinesse yet notwithstanding holdeth back man weeld litle babe declared yesterday able comprehend god workes p ection shall haue wherfore glorifie respectes fall shooting foorth iudgement post haste woont rashnesse shewe selfe confuzion shall befall v ouerboldnesse therfore let v beare wel minde sayde heere god hath giuen sea lawe say thou shalt go thus farre sea euer calme neuer storme tempest men shold well perceiue god prouidence fatherly care whiche hath men maintaine hath planted whe sea hath leaue lift vp selfe high mightily yet cannot passe bound restreyned ordinance god therby may perceine god hath dispozed thing good measure reason may extended whe see warres moued seemeth thing high lowe shoulde bee mingled togither wee woulde condemne god lay power else wee fall iangling suffring thing go maner tary end paciently shal perceiue one side god chastizeth men iustlye styrring vp warres among side thereby hee intendeth shewe power fire kindled shall anone quenched minute houre doeth god execute office wherof sayd xlvj psalme belongeth breake speares knap asunder swoordes ouerthrow chariot appease thing againe troubled afore vvee muste haue god ordinance alwayes eye mind whereby hee guydeth gouerneth trouble seeme tend euill end turneth altogither vnto good god thinketh ynough cure mischefe also vseth good end insomuch driuen confesse much better v trouble shoulde happen shoulde alwayes liue peace rest therefore consider well cause whiche moue god sende trouble worlde murmure although conceiue yet let v therfore ceasse honor reueretly secret determination god kepeth let vstary leysure paciently acknowledging owne small capacitie rudenesse shall folow rule giuen v according saide hast thou thy dayes commaunded morning light hast thou made knowe place ought come forth heere lorde proceedeth mocke men pride take vpon iudge saying long since borne vvas light day seeing ye wise find fault mee much say order world borne morning light wist whence come whither go without bin orderlinesse nothing bin made bin sith ye thinke selues wise needes control aske whether haue time appointed fro whence light shall arise although ye neuer yet stil finding sault doings haue alwayes set difference betwixt light darknesse euer since beginning worlde haue appoynted night tyme darkenesse caused breake day come foorth pleasure haue set euerlasting order ought bee wonderfull ye churlish ye could confesse thing excellent nowe done borne aunceters yea euen man created meane fall controlling mee vvhy set vp bristle recken yeres little world hath continued haue gouerned hitherto yea suche wise creature muste nedes cofesse astonished sight shew yet seeming haue done nothing time ye knowe howe light disposed draw darknesse wise yee weene selues bee heere first lorde bringeth v backe birth hee shoulde say recken yeares howe long ago since yee came worlde beholde men snayles assoone bee borne death threatneth go god graunt liue tyme heere doo make walke sayde fourscore tenth psalme must backe againe haue made twoo three urnes leaped like frog god draweth away yet notwithstading euen shortnesse life whiche passeth winde slippeth away incontinently men rottennesse needes contend go lawe theyr maker dealing lette men consider little euerlastingnesse therfore soeuer tempted buzy aforehand god work let v consider time legth since borne time life haue scarcely lifted vp eye vnto heauen consider whit euerlastingnesse god contrariwise shortnesse owne life bethought selues throughly would soone stop mouthes wit shoulde shet vp woulde meanes go murmur agaynst god nowe let v compare life long continuance world yet must passe wit god continued maiesty world made sith let v learne referre ourselues wholly knowing intollerable thing shold passe bouds desire rauge iudging thing knowe one point haue marke vpon saying haste thou thy dayes commaunded breake day created god hath already set thing order yea well shall purpose carpe vvherefore let v humble selues seing god fatherly care v sent v worlde prouided thing necessarie v aforehande furthermore whereas metion made morning light let v therin acknowledge god infinite wisdome power therwithall inured see breake day shold sore afrayde hauing seene darknesse daunte dull v afore sodaynly turning hande wee see whole worlde inlightned vvoulde say impossible wee acquainted wee esteeme god working knowne vnto v woontednesse whiche hee gyueth v bringing v vnthankefulnesse selfe thorough naughtinesse vvherefore without cause dooth god say whe man looketh vpon morning light must needes abashed consider whence commeth although east standeth alwayes one certayne coaste yet notwithstanding men see sunne riseth sometimes higher sometimes lower according season yeare vvinter time bycause sunne somewhat v hee riseth coast againe sommer time draweth neere v riseth higher higher till seeme bee almoste ouer heades shorte like east also morning light seeing order set payre compass sunne swarueth one hearebreadth circuite god hath appoynted commeth alwayes iumpe poynt thing may well woonder vvee see sunne neuer goeth way insomuche man marke thing well hee shall finde diuersitie euery daye yeare yet notwithstanding compare one thing another yea euen whole yeare shall perceyue goeth one continuall race though sunne ryse one poynt sky day another morow likewise set yet yeare commes returneth agayne followe trace whiche hee hath continued euer since making worlde keeping orderly course wise man nothing neere make clocke keepe iuste compasse sunne doeth going aboute masse thing much greater whole earth agayne verie muche hee greater race go throughout whole yeare goeth one day yet neuerthelesse seeing keepeth order iust thing ought rauishe v woonderment might honour incomprehensible maiestie god yes wee woorse brute beastes vvee haue eye see god maketh dumbe creature sounde imprinting glory heare nothing melodie long nothing oure owne naughty lewdnesse take hold god glory whiche visible v sheweth selfe v creature order hath stablished worlde whiche hee maynteyneth stedfastly hee doeth nothing sayde breake day spreadeth abroade lighteth vppon wing say vpon vttermost partes earth hebrue tongue woorde wing signifieth border vtmost partes thing yee see lighte casteth selfe abroade spreadeth ouer worlde soone vvhen wee beholde darkenesse night wee woulde say muste needes bee greate battell chace awaye howe vvho coulde rid earth darkenesse men might see euerywhere wheras earste good shette vp dungeon vvho woulde thinke light shoulde preuayle without great terrible battel yet notwithstanding morning doeth sooner open eyelid sheddeth forth light ouer vttermost partes earth anone sunne commeth take possession dominion according god hath giuen soueraintie ouer day execute office hath committed vnto vve see entereth possession swiftly cascarcely coceiue thought soone wee open eye sunne stryketh beames darknesse driuen quite away shall father vpon sun lifelesse creature impossible must go vvorkeman acknowledge maiestie bee excellent men ought humble theselues sinke vnder giue neckes yoke honouring greatnesse excellencie appeare god workes repine againste whatsoeuer wee must nedes cofouded wit faile v thing visible open v nedes must good right stoupe wayt full discouery last day cace concerneth incomprehensible secretes let nowe suffize v conceiue thing faith cannot yet perceiue till wee haue learned shall good god hath bereft v mortall flesh drawne v home himselfe fashioned v like himselfe glory sayd immediatly wicked shall shaken earth expoud sunne ingendreth many disease therefore day breaketh yee woulde say clensing worlde wicked men asmuche disease dispatcheth agreeth wise matter firste formost breake day doth rather releeue men forasmuche time haue body weeldie best disposed yea euen poore soules sicke haue beene turmoyled nyght somewhat cheered morning come insomuche yee shall see well eased cause prophete malachie speaking lorde iesus christ calleth sonne rightuousnesse wherein hee taketh similitude daysunne thing finde experience namely hee bryngeth v health hys wing say beames clenzeth earth cheereth oure bodyes dumpishe humor according wee knowe night bringeth suche thing truely breaking day ingendred disease good men shoulde subiect well ill men therfore fittest exposition wicked shall shaken earth say shall discerned spyed darkenesse continually men coulde discerne blacke white god hath spreade light ouer worlde seene howe euerie man behaueth himselfe true wicked ceasse misbehaue themselues daye long haue feare god although bee ashamed men yet fall licentiousnesse insomuch ceasse play looce prankes euen high noone day yet perceiue footesteps spoken thing order worlde yet notwithstanding god order appeareth seene wee may say true god giueth satan head restreyneth wicked much could giueth libertie triumph naughtines thing broyle one side yet notwithstading preseruation mankind god intet sending light represse wicked thing wicked bridled secret prouidence god surely shoulde perish euery turne yea rage would satan driuer thrust headlong god wrought behalf vve know satan deadly men desireth nothing much make cleane riddance creature wipe remembrance god worlde therfore needes must order come god trouble disorder come men although wicked still dwell vpon earth broade day light put theyr disorder practise yet doeth god continually discouer meanes brydle earth sort clenzed rising sunne meane vapour raigned night corruption gathered toogither ayre thickned meene god purgeth clenzeth earth wicked foll abridgiug theyr lybertie bycause men poynte oute naughtipackes finger somwhat asnamed say euen shamelesse whiche haue ye woulde say sealed vp owne eies haue notwithstanding inward remorse suffer themselues rushe extremitie theyr lewdenesse thus yee see breake daye purgeth earth sort howbeit altogither god maketh dayly purging addeth one effect sunlight whiche earth taketh newe shape thing whiche earth conteyneth serue garmente sunne shyneth manner nyght season earth shapelesse man seeth nothing ye woulde say great quamire nothing bee discerned sunne beginneth rise man taken pottes oute lumpe earth made well trimmed earth fashioned withoute fashion therefore god sendeth light daye one hee fashioned whole earthe giuing beautie ende shoulde beholde woondering whereas naked shet vp barreyn afore leastwise respect eye clotheth againe heere cace concerneth men sight earth night desert waste nothing seene vpon daytime clothed agayne bycause whiche waye soeuer wee turne eye see goodly deckings god hath put vpon according sayth crowneth yeare blessing insomuche hee replenisheth earth frutes one hee put goodly garmentes crownes garlandes suche thing vpon vvhen see god worketh maner haue whereat bee astonished yea cause confesse greatenesse woorkes surmounteth wittes vtterly fayle although wee may parte taste goodnesse power wisedome iustice yet notwithstanding muste fain length conclusion crie dauid lord wonderfull deepe thy workes bottomlesse pit shall reherse vnto thee true dauid restreyneth himselfe recken vp god work babble without knowing ought god shewed sayeth also may partly well iudge thing god sheweth v whole creation worlde order hath stablished therein shall see footstep iustice goodnesse power wisedome touched comprehending al thing perceiue vttermost point shall come farre short must fayne cry woonderment lorde maruelous thy work lo haue marke effect vpon streyne sayde earth taketh new shape fashion thing god hath set vpon garment wherwith decked whereas done day day yet common custome inured v vnto surely would say wonderful thing vvherfore let v learne measure worthinesse god workes dayly inioying much stirred vp say worker whome must touche carpe doings rather submitte selues humilitie god addeth immediatly wicked shall inioy light loftie arme shall broken serueth preuent question might obiected howe might man say seing god hath ordeyned sunne giue light world set thing goodly order suffereth hee wicked inioy benefite hee ought haue sette aside owne child whiche serue honour shoulde seeme therefore hee doth amisse cace light sunne common good bad truely heerein ought consider god goodnesse better according also lorde iesus christ telleth v follow heauenly father sayth maketh sun shine euen vpon vnworthy therefore good enimies haue done harme iesus christ would haue spoken iuste cause glorifie god inlightning whole world maner notwithstanding moste parte bee nought woorth wicked howbeeit streyne yet somwhat shewed wit god calleth v sort iudgement say true sunne doth tyme shine vpon wicked well vpon good one liueth well tarrie whyle wicked heyres worlde although receyue belongeth haue theyr eies open receiue light sunne yet shal vtterly bereft end therfore sayeth theyr light shall taken vvhen sayeth light hee sheweth present tyme wee haue aduauntage outward appearance despisers god heathenish sort haue draw aire well haue light well wee eate drinke well ye see behoueth v beare paciently suche mingling nowe neuerthelesse without cause god dooth heere lende lyght vntoo wicked make vnexcusable yea verie deede suche light shal continue euer wheras part homage vnto god well life appurtenance therof shall heyres worlde child without cause doth paule fourth romanes couey abraham faithfull therefore let v learne whensoeuer sunne shineth part inheritance forasmuche god hath adopted v child sunne detter vnto v may recken parte goodes muche bee thought eating drinking oure inioying thing earth bringeth foorth due v god
