behalfe proceedeth meere liberalitie forsomuch hath chozen v childre pure hart claime father earth oweth v nourishment al creature hand say may vse freely vse shal continue v euer wee shall haue neede eate drinke gone world terming vse bee continuall euerlasting blessed blissefull oure presente vsing god creature helpe saluation meanes god maketh v feele goodnes loue made partaker heauenly glorie worlde shall euer notwithstanding shall haue neede meate drinke rayment yet shall haue better perfecter possession wee haue daye without cause doth god adde heere light wicked haue claime themselues shall taken may serue v declaration whiche touched afore namely wicked shall shaken breaking day say disguise themselues oure lorde doth restreyne although bee disorder yet men see order intermedled whereby greate trouble asswaged whiche without ynoughto destroy whole worlde therefore nowadayes wee see wicked maye boast hauing light well wee yea woorse haue full scope poore child god troden vnder foote troubled put open shame scarcely haue wherewith feede themselues slenderly behooueth v beare paciently ende light shall bee taken wicked sayde also loftie arme shall bee broken loftie arme god betokeneth power credit wicked haue worlde asmuch hee giueth full scope exercising child behoof tamed world know beare god yoke therefore behooueth v passe trouble disorder seene also trie faith paradise worlde hope vve coulde moued seeke spirituall life yea although wee miserable may yet perceyue better state desired would thing woulde wishe requisite god quicken v vp seeke kingdome cause giueth wicked full scope suffreth lift vp arme truely sore trouble temptation see wicked sort lord master world wherof commeth bicause god hath reached hand minded magnifie fashion vve see sillie weakling shall troubled let v content ourselues said namely armes mighty shalbe crushed broken end oft see wicked beare sway pride crueltie vaut theselues credit let v resort doctrine cofort wit wheras haue armes vpo v seemeth break head god welynough broose breake asunder therefore let v tary paciently till god performe hath spoken shall disappointed mindes quiet giue place prouidece knoweth conuenient time working v appoynte thing furthermore wicked ought bethinke themselues wel true doctrine ought serue chiefly comfort faythfull may vphilde mids aduersities oppression men trouble wrong let suche tymes call remembrance armes wicked muste aduanced time vntill god breake yet notwithstanding holy ghostement also threaten wicked bicause bee outrageous beare themselues hande able woorke woonders remoue mountaynes god sayth v one worde tarie yee till armes nowe lifted vp bee broken muste needes come passe vvill wee haue god bee enimie aduersarie partie lette v lift vp armes say let v stretch scripture sayeth committe outrage let v go aboute hurte harme neyghbours let euery v modestly consider lawfull lette v restreyne armes may ruled god woorde man presume beyonde owne calling proceede maner god wil alwayes giue v new strength although armes wearied yet stregthen againe end according also sayeth doctrine gospell must serue strengthen v weake soeuer lyfteth vp arme alofte say whosoeuer taketh vppon ought doo muste ende haue armes broken god god enimie greate taker vppon whiche mounte vp hyghe pryde haue myldnesse thus muche concerning poynte nowe sayde diddest thou euer atteyne drop sea hebrue woorde god vseth heere betokeneth teares commeth worde signifieth weepe shedde teares man translate vnto greate deepes sea woorde also well agree waye behooueth v marke similitude whiche god meeneth spring whiche greate deepes teares vvhence commeth infinit abundance water sea droppes whereof flowe water nowe sayde abundance teares surely welsprings termed ye woulde say eye earthe looke eye doo shedde foorth teares man doo fountaynes ooze oute moysture earth god therefore streyne vseth similitude sayth come diddest thou euer go downe bottome sea searche drop yeeldeth forth say didst thou euer enter depes see water sewe know whence abundance cometh thou seest wherat thou art abashed better confirmation heere hee addeth haste thou seene gate death hast thou behilde gate shadowe death thing adde afterward concerning greate roomth largenesse earth intendeth shew effect wittes slender feeble coprehende thing apparant neere vnto v must need spite teeth confesse god sheweth v wo ders serue rauishe v aboue vnderstanding inforced confesse wisedome god yea euen respect work open v sheweth v finger shall doo thing hidden reserueth himselfe till last day suffereth appointeth many thing done world seeme straunge secrete v wherin perceyue reason perchaunce spirituall secretes vvhat say wee cannot comprehende thing heere feete wherevpon wee treade say wee fasten vppon shall wee saye thing aboue heauen whiche surmounte creature outreache common order nature lo effecte god meening nowe lette v learne wittes eger iudging thing lawfull v let v learne say thinke vpon sea vppon deepe place water say go wretched wight intendest thou doo sayde god secretes deepe gulfe man neuer come bottome gulfes doo farre exceede gulfes sea canst thou drayne ryuer see whence water spring thou canst muche conceyue spring little fountayne whereoutof neuerthelesse issueth greate brooke vvhen thou hast bethought thee throughly thou canst tell howe drayne riuer fountayne howe canst thou enter gulfes sea spie inchmeale whence abundance water commeth gathered togither nowe thou comprehendest materiall thing darest thou pleade god rash ful presumption reply iudge go subdue vnto thee lo haue marke vpon streyne true doctrine seemeth common among v man vnderstandeth fare euer better see euery man taketh leaue libertie iudge foolishly god work bicause acquainted oure owne smalnesse haue tyme learned god intendeth holde v awe ende wee shoulde presume aught selues giueth v instruction bilowe vve nede mount aboue cloudes know incomprehensible maiesty god let v cast downe eye looke feete haue sayd afore shall confounded hand possible v enter secret purpose god know al thing nothing might escape v nature rather go downwarde mount vpward vvho hath giuen v wing stie high nay lu pish fall alwaies ground yet notwithstanding looke euen vpon thing heere beneath beholde bottomlesse pittes swallow v vp howe shall wee mount vp heauen searche thing god hath shet vp muste needes marueilous ouerweening one cometh forgetfulnesse one drop settled witte surely would rather learne modest yee see doctrine superfluous leastwise men woulde put well vre conclusion let v learne god hath granted v singular benefite forsomuch weaknesse rawnesse vnderstanding hee hath gyuen v farre better thing sight bottomlesse deepes vvhy lookingglasse gospel maketh v behold secretes heauen farre foorth expedient v yea say farre necessary v v follow owne foolish inordinate lustes must cotent selues god openeth vnto v curious searching beyond word let contente v hee inlighteneth v holy spirite ende wee may iudge woorkes becommeth v shall thing fulfilled whiche moyses sayeth namely say shall go downe deepes vvho shall climbe vp aboue clowdes vvho shall go ouer sea beholde woorde god thy mouthe thine heart content thy selfe seeing god granteth v prerogatiue teaching v thing schoole hee knoweth profite good made v passe ouer sea go deepes climbe aboue clowdes short come bosome vvhat desire let v bee contented knowledge whiche hee gyueth v nowe woorde learning gospell wayting till hee discouer fully largely vnto v shall come passe hee maketh v see thing face face see part nowe lette v fall downe face good god acknowledgement sinnes praying make v feele may thinke better vpo wantes corruption nature wee haue done end distrusting ourselues vtterly wittes end may run vnto desire thing gouerne v wee may bee clenzed vice reformed image sinfulnesse nature may beaten downe killed ende feeling power hath wrought v may glory nothing meere goodnesse may please graut grace v also al people nation earth bringing backe al poore ignorant soules fro miserable bondage errour darknesse right c cl sermon fourth vpon xxxviij chapter hast thou considered large place earth tell thou knovve vvhich vvay vvhere lyght dvvelleth vvhere place darkenesse thou maist receiue boundes vnderstande pathes house hast thou knovvne thou vvert borne though thy dayes many number hast thou entred treasure snovve hast thou seene treasure haile vvhich haue layde vp tyme aduersitie day vvarre battel vvhat vvay light parted east vvinde scattered vpon earth vvho hee hath deuided course rayne vvaye lyghtning thunder make rayne vpon land vvhere person vpon vvildernesse vvhere fill vvild vvast place make budde herbes come foorth vvho father rayne vvho hath begotten droppes deavve vvhose belly came yce vvho hath ingendred frost heauen vvaters hidden stone face deepe frozen canst thou restreine pleasantnesse pleyades vntie bandes orion canst thou make mazzaroth come forth time canst thou guyde arcturus vvith sonnes although matter rehersed heere seeme bee none commoly knowne already yet wee looke well thing euery man deeme needeful ouerweening repressed woord twayne long declaracions god maketh although haue grauted wit weake comprehend god work yet notwithstanding needeth turning hand leade v foolish curiositie presumption foolehardinesse caryeth v away headlong like madnesse therefore let v thinke straunge lorde vseth long talke make v perceiue v iudge work ynough wee know part according rudenesse giue v taste meane wherby shall profite beare away thing shall bee spoken thereof let v looke vpon sayd heere mention made earth god demaundeth whither man able measure dubble measuring earthe one knowe largenesse worlde inhabited may sort comprehended coniecture also whole earth self comprehending parte couered sea seene impossible iudge greatnesse put cace men could determine euery whit yet notwithstanding men knowne miracle ought bee abasshed glorifie maker without cause god demaundeth whither able neuerthelesse impossible sayd afore scarsly haue men substantiall proofes whereby know length bredth world inhabited man speake whole masse bodie earth impossible bring passe largenesse therof bee knowne wit man atteyneth thervnto thing go inclose maiestie secret purpose god within vnderstanding sayd god holdeth earth hild three fowre graynes dust hand neede open hand keepe hand shet yet hold dust still within god vseth similitude prophet esay shewe wee speake think must measure thing seene earth infinite respect v yet notwithstanding hold cloce fist wit proportionable respect betwixt incomprehensible inestimable glory whole masse earth great earth nothing comparison yee see thing whiche haue marke streyne consider earth greate largenesse outreacheth vnderstanding behoueth v well assured holdeth able hold fist hath another maner greatnesse therefore v confesse owne feeblenesle wee bee rude grossewitted herevpon let v honour acknowledge doings perfection fault found v replie bicause ignorant thus ye see haue effect gather vpon sayd speaking way light afterwarde thunder lightning according mention made afore without cause matter repeated wee sawe yesterday soone breake day appereth whole world lightned throughout wing earth say vttermost partes discouered earth taketh newe shape al done one instant time seyng miracle appeareth eye reason god bee gloryfied thereby wee needes play iolie felowes deserue punished ouerweening laughed scorne god hand foolish lust haue comprehend thing high v path light go v appoynt would appoynt way farre wyde spreade possible v go beyonde whole masse earth nd attayne vttermost part worlde vvhat furious madnesse v presume iudge god wonderfull workes sith cannot conceyue howe commeth passe light soone spredde abroade hath taken possession name sunne reigne ouer day let v learne exalt god wise creature greatnesse highnesse workes wee oure side acknowledging owne slendernesse may brideled humble selues way men honour god accordingly mean glorie themselues take thing vppon aboue magnifie god neuer muche meane whyle needes bee companion purpose vvee cannot doo god greater wrong compare selues desire abace vnto v say hee shoulde bee mate fellowe god shall neuer bee duely honoured v excepte wee bee firste brought nothing wee acknowledge nothing v wretchednesse lo wee haue beare minde mention made heere way whiche hilde light eyther setteth ryseth worlde sayde afterwarde man knoweth treasure snow hayle god vseth similitude treasure speaketh chastizements whiche hee sendeth vpon men sayth hath terrible sortes layde vp treasure man knoweth similitude importeth twoo thing one greate store man say dozen frenchecrownes treasure must bee greate masse quantitie treasure hidden layde vp therfore whe god speaketh treasure snow hayle meaneth store far passing vnderstanding man wee muste needes bee astonished thinke vppon therewithall betokeneth also cause thereof hidden v vvee see snowe hayle wellynough doo wee perceyue thing making hayle snowe doo wee knowe howe commeth passe true philosopher well dispute men shall see cause alledged yet verie small insight wonderfull order god hath set nature hee hath secrete priuitie himselfe whiche reache capacitie wee come short nowe wee perceyue wherefore god speaketh maner treasure hayle snowe remayneth put doctrine practise vvhiche v able make one handefull snowe arte cunning vvho turne water vapour hayle hoarefrost let men beate braynes aboute much list yet neuer able compasse vve cannot make one heare head white black sith haue cause magnifie inestimable power god couereth whole earth snow vvhence taketh hee greate quantitie water truly men say ingendered middle roomth ayre colde great quantitie vapour bee drawne vp thither length cometh togither freezeth thereof ingendreth snow stuffe harder bound hayle ingendred bicause thing become faste substanciall men may well say true yet strauge thing short time great store vtter selfe whiche bene hidden afore sometimes weather shall fayre winter within two three dayes snow shall fall twoo three foote deepe vpon ground pray ought change make heares stand vp stiffe vpo heades leastwise dull ende leade v feare god furthermore wee bee rightly minded ought moued beare reuerece god acknowledge power high aboue v yea euen visible earthly thing giueth v cause glorifie cofessing ignorance yee see haue gather vppon worde treasure well applying thereof owne vse besides let v call minde sayd song moyses god hath chastizements layd vp treasury comprehende ende steppe square wee see men oftentimes worke spite agaynst god bearing selues hand scaped god hand hee haue deliuered incouenience seemeth worst past doo shake eares prouerbe sayth let v call minde god telleth v know ye sayth roddes layd vp treasure say whe shall haue beaten one fashion afterwarde haue pitied thinke selues quit haue meanes cannot coceiue vvhen wee haue bene chastized one maner doozen scourge mo whiche neuer thought therefore stand ye feare preuent mine anger tempt hereafter least vtter scourge vpon cause sayde god keepeth treasure time aduersitie day incounter battell would say artillerie speares sword wherewith fight agaynst enimies doubte god vsing similitude incounter battell ment betoken wee haue warre fenced furnished alreadie suche sorte wee muste needes go worse wee haue strength power stande agaynst hande vvee may well put armour assemble ayde world v scape hande shall haue set al creature battell maner v commaunded gyue charge vppon v therefore lette v learne firste godneedeth borowe helpe would auendged enemy ynough determine owne purpose speake woorde shewe immediatly heauen earth bring army number sith hee couereth earth foote twayne thicke snowe hee able ouerwhelme v listeth thinke wee power abated hee cannot sende snowe thirtie pole deepe aboue head againe sometimes wee see earth frozen winde dothe binde becommeth harde yron letteth god shoulde leaue alwayes plight lette v marke god needeth make great preparation incounter enemy put foyle let onely say woorde whole world shal fire creature shall serue destroy men sith heare lette v learne stoupe vnder mightie hand god make warre mighty lord shall gayne let v learne obey eyther must vphild hand else must haue v meane betweene true god beare v time according sayd wayteth menne couert yet must needes vnder protection else haue enemie appeare ende therefore lette v yeelde selues vnto may preserue v wee continue vnder gouernance keeper welfare lette v assure selues wee safe agaynst bothe hayle stormes tempestes hayle ingendered selfe nother doth snowe fall without commaundement bothe treasure vvhen man listeth lay forth thing keepeth locked vp euen creature god sendeth foorth pleasure therefore neede feare haile stormes long god keeping contrarywize must needes disquieted vexed continually god agaynst v herewithall let v marke howe sayde reserueth day battell day aduersitie say men neede vaunt themselues wont god scourgeth prosperitie doth rocke v asleepe bethink v fault nother enter account selues know cace godward long wee haue respit like euill paymaysters vnthrifts wast away passeth owing hundred crownes long called vpon day payment come maketh good cheere long hath one pennie purse euen play wee god giue v respite wee nothing else ruffle thinke nomore vpon therefore according whiche shewed v god sende nother hayle thunder skare v one way heauen wee muste therevpon runne astray fall asleepe spie fitte time chastize v lette v preuent tarie till day battell come trumpet sounde alarme battell ioyned late say let v fall compositio let v deuize meanes agreement yea yea tyme past vvherefore whyle god forbeareth v giueth v leyzure bethinke selues wee haue time truce looke v enter iudgement ourselues let v preuent rigour become owne iudges end iudged let v codemne selues intent wee may bee quit infinite grace goodnesse thus ye see haue marke vpo streyne metion made god reseruing thing day battell namely serueth shew wee haue warre come giuing onsette like warre proclaymed betwene two prince enemy many bickering go abrode booty forage cometh pitched field knowne hath wone lost euen v displease god plucke selues hand become stubborne open warre proclaymed side vve defie god mouth nother send herault defie yet forasmuch sinnes proceede furious rage proclayming warre agaynst seing enemie tarie neuerthelesse battell giuen first day god letteth v alone wee stand vp still time let v looke come ioyning hand stroke length howbeit looking let v linger say lette v bethinke v long whyle afore hand let v welter sinnes wicked deedes least wee kindle fire wrath casting wood make consume v vpon knowledge hereof let v take aduauntage tyme craue pardon hand beholde wee haue marke yet true god doth oftentimes punishe rightuous well vnrightuous hayle tempest affliction common bothe part contrarywise maketh sunne shyne vpon good bad yet behoueth v bee alwayes persuaded scripture telleth v god scourge whereby intendeth correct sinnes sending v hayle tempestes suche like thing yet notwithstandyng rightuous haue whereof reioyce know god chastizing fatherly good ende perish paule sayeth temporall chastizements ought put v minde sin according record god displeasure neuerthelesse walke feare put trust alwayes pitie v handle v mercie rigour although correct v yet shall profit welfare god sheweth well outward signes maketh warre agaynst serue walke feare yet soeuer befall redoudeth welfare bycause abateth rigour towards maketh temporall chastizements serue medicine salues notwithstanding generally correction put v minde sinnes therewithall shewe v warre god deserue haue fight agaynst v arme creature destruction lo effect wee ought practize texte nowe consequently sayde god rayne vpon wildernesse noman dwelleth earth shall moystened shall yeeld frute vvherin matter still co tinued namely god worketh sorte euen common order nature wee bee abashed wittes bee dazeled doubt wee shall see doings yea conceyue reason yet wee haue cast cardes throughly wee shall alwayes bee driuen conclude god wisedome hidden v meene euen manifest thing cause aboue v wherevnto wee bee able reach therefore behoueth v alwayes come backe poynt comprehende throughly conteyned vvee see rayne fall wee know effect ingendered vapour wee see rayne causeth earth budde yea wilderness dwell inhabiters wexe greene also wee see thing wonder iustly trouble man curstly water garden trauell labour bring nothing except god giue influence heauen watering worlde good vnlesse rayne dewe fall heauen one hath workfulnesse water brought mannes deuyce therefore wee see desertes growe greene therein god intendeth shewe assured token effectualnesse rayne whiche sendeth little gardines men continually watering afterwarde commeth rayne dewe thing growe euen apparantly sight looke vpon waste grounde whiche burnt vp day noman watereth soyle drie selfe yet notwithstanding god maketh bryng forth abundance hearbes grasse meanes rayne sith wee see thing familiarly god sheweth himselfe v iuster cause haue wee glorifie canot meanes excuse selues vnthankfulnesse greate matter see god miracle eye yea poynteth v fingar thing seene onely man life beginneth newe agayne day day yet notwithstanding wee thinke rightly vpon vvee tread vpon grasse feete yet vouchsafe caste eye thither say blissed god maketh earth beare frute sorte furthermore let v therewithall bethinke v owne rudenesse dulnesse cannot tell one braunche hearb springeth forth see mine eye cause hidden wittes end see whe grayne corne rotteth earth springeth agayne bringeth forth number graynes nurrishment men see thing miracle god yet cosider ought surely man woulde thinke first blushe lesson superfluous needelesse thing treate growing corne grasse doth euery man see wee well ynough acquaynted yes truely yet yeeldeth god due honour deface glory maiestie asmuch therefore knowledge wee weene haue shall make v guiltie bicause vnthankfulnesse wrayeth self therein howsoeuer world go let v alwaies beare minde euen basest thing incomprehensible wisdome god vve perchaunce say knowne great small come souerayne cause bee found euen wizest v seeke behalfe would shew finenesse wit god auendged pryde according also good reason shoulde make v perceyue wonderfull woorkes haue knowledge parte thereafter pleaseth deale vnto v hath bene sayd alwayes reserueth stil part somuch keepeth cause thing hidden secrete owne minde whereinto v presume enter goodly lesson know put difference maner betweene thing god reueleth vnto v thing keepeth himselfe according also moyses speaketh thereof god sayeth keepeth secret himselfe thing reueled belong v child according coteyned law true moyses speaketh lawe published sayde let v bethinke selues god hath graunted v singular benefite vouchsafing shewe v gyuing v peculiar instruction howe walke commaundements therefore let v receyue record let v suffer god schole v let v good scholers meane whyle let v let alone secretes say lette v hold v contented doctrine hath set downe vnto v let bee meeteyard lette v passe vvhy lordes secretes sayeth belong thing reueleth belong vnto v way wee may apply text sette downe vvhy see god sheweth v order nature howbeit small porcion intendeth holde v alwayes shorte shewe v wee bee dull simplewitted mount high know god secret let v learne take instructio god giueth v profit selues let v go necessarie admonition considering one side rechlesnesse otherside fond presumptuousnesse men god hyde secretes v seeme would go know whither apparant howe desirous eager menne knowe thing reueled vnto say would fayne know woulde fayne knowe therewithall streyne themselues enter discourse thing thing concealed holy scripture lo menne haue alwayes ouer labored theselues knowe thing god ment teache bycause knoweth good vvee see madde presumptuousnesse men desirous conceyue brayne thing graunted enter god secretes whither againe otherside retchlesse take holde thing god teacheth v god declareth v farforth behoof chaweth meate v intet might swallow downe easlier bicause knoweth v weakling teacheth v familiarly according owne nature verely holy scripture plain discouerie thing good god appeereth outright wee applied mindes therevnto finde thing whiche requisite welfare god applieth himselfe rudenesse hee talketh familiarly v yea lispeth sorte nurce would hir little babe yet wee carefull profite selues folowing therefore seing wee rechlesse negligent profite holy scripture yet meane curious inquisitiue rather foolish madbraynd couet know tha meete v let v beare mind moyses telleth v lord secret belog therfore must inquisitiue thing whiche god listed discloze vnto v contented taught meane hath ordeyned meane whyle let god alone secret without assaying reach aboue glorifie knowing yet come perfection beholding face face behoueth v first trasformed image thing shall fully done till haue ridde v cleane fleshly imperfection let v remember effect haue tasted god wisdome iustice goodnesse creature wee muste conclude come highest degree fayle thereof middes way thereby let v take warning honour submit selues wholly nowe mention hath bene made earth deepes water snow rayne moysteneth suche thing speaking skie starres lorde setteth downe thing haue seene whiche order sky man shall perceyue many recordes goodnesse loue towardes v also many signes wrath pleaseth visite v sinnes make v feele iudge cause sayd purposely come wa thou borne created planet starres nd signes heauen wa thou arte thou able bid go may go canst thou restreyne pleasantnesse pleyades canst thou vntie vnknitte loozen handes ion certayne celestiall signes named wherin hebrues selues agree yet notwithstanding man may perceyue first worde set downe betokeneth certayne starres appeere springtime bring sweete rayne open earth make yeelde frute cause sayde canst thou bynde vp restreyne pleasantnesse pleyades whiche cause earthe become fresh greene canst thou restreyne god sending men pleasant spring time glad withall afterwarde hee speaketh orion cleane contrarie signe bringeth great blustring stormes waterfloudes othersome translate arcturus whiche termed keeper thing shet vp restreyned vapour haled vp ayre needefull stande muche vpon point ynough v know signe betokeneth great tempest rage water therefore sayde art thou able vntie band would say wee beare sway sky muche wee rauished wittes thinke vpon nowe first let v marke texte men warned shortnesse life serueth represse would ouershoote selues farre thinke selues much ado haue borne yet wee needes blame god doings yea shall teach lesson though hee skill gouerne worlde time thing created counsell god helpe thing put goodly wonderfull order nothing v much wee could hardly get mother wombe yet notwithstanding wee take vpon v iudges fayre sight yong babe coulde scarce speake shoulde take vpon gouerne whole world chalendge wisdome discretion bee selfe alone wee comparison god although come fourescore hundred yeares age respecte euerlasting time wisdome god worlde created againe respecte gouernement hath continued long time therefore euer wee thinke vpon shortnesse life let v bee sure meanes god rebateth pryde intent wee selfewyze take vpon v dispute againste firste cheefe lesson wee haue learne god schoole verie well doubt wee shall haue whereof make boast shall haue profited poynt therefore long wee bee conuersant worlde let v bee contented heare god speake beare mynde euer hee telleth v wee may profite moreouer let v goe aduaunce selues onely saying life nothing ynough holde v awe meeldnesse lo wee haue beare away one side heerewithall haue also good comfort gather much wee see god hath preserued world long time good state wee borne wee neede doubt prouide time come therefore whensoeuer vexed troubled great thought minde therby prouoked let v put selues god hande knoweth howe gouerne hee yong beginner sith wee see order hathe continued euer since creation worlde chaunges haue happened meane whyle men perceyue thing haue bene well dispozed world hath still bene preserued right state say wee bethinke v well thereof haue cause glorifie god seing iustice goodnesse wisedome power appeere therein let v contented therewith assure selues hee aswell continue ende hee hath begonne lo haue marke agayne whereas mention made commaunding celestiall signes let v alwayes marke impossible orderlinesse wee see come eyther starres themselues mouing hande god gouerneth aboue although starres haue season mount aboue v likewise go againe sight yet notwithstanding lette v assure selues happeneth auenture god commaundeth although hee haue giuen influence heauen yet hath guyding ouerruling still proofe hereof planet moue yeeres alike yet apparant greate oddes mouing vvhat cause earth freshe springtime bycause pleyades reygne howbeeit god reygneth ouer although hee haue giuen celestiall signes influence yet doe thing owne peculiar motion thing vve see spring time cotinue one euen measurable rate say neuer nother ouermuch heate ouermuch cold neuerfal one droppe rayne one yeere another neuer bee alteration sith suche diuersitie wee see yeeres farre vnlike one another thereby wee perceyue nother rayne snowe ingender owne power god althoughe hee haue giuen property starres reserueth still ruling himselfe declareth hee hath souerayne gouernment disposeth thing knoweth expedient muche behoueth v marke text wherin god telleth v although star haue naturall course property yet notwithstanding driuen owne power nother giue influence world otherwise god commaundeth obey souereygne dominion hee hath ouer creature therefore let v learne gaze starres thoughe power selues either good harme let v pray vnto good god pleaseth make creature serue vse also graunt v grace profite thereby onely may bee glorified moreouer wee see thunder lightning tempest stormes let v assure selues seing commaundement maketh serue pleasure shall safe protection shall haue inward witnesse hee hath receyued v mercie taketh v child furthermore euer wee thinke vpon god work let sobernesse modestie may learne inquisitiue god maiestie holde selues contented bee taught according measure capacitie withal openeth thing v ordinarie meanes worde let v open eye consider wee ought yeelde eares herken telleth v may rechlesse behalf thing high profoud v let v let alone wayt day ful discouerie wherevnto good god calleth v shall time transformed glorie nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v feele better wee haue done generally also bewray wantes intent deface v vtterly make v seke whole welfare therewithall apply v seruice hee may bee exalted among v wee oure side may acknowledge god side acknowledge v people let v say almightie god heauenly father acknowledge confesse according truth c clj sermon fifth vpon xxxviij chapter first vpon xxxix chapter knovvest thou vvay heauen canst thou set rule thereof vpon earth canst thou crie aloude cloudes aboundance vvater may couer thee canst thou sende lightening canst thou make vvalke vvill say vnto thee lo heere vve vvho hath put vvisdome heart giuen vnderstanding vvho vvisdome appoint heauen vvhat doe vvho stay barrel heauen vvhen dust cloddeth earth hardneth xxxix chapter vvilte thou hunte praye lyon giue lyon vvhelpe vvherevvith satisfie vvhen dennes vvhen lie lurking corner vvho prepareth meate rauens vvhen yong one crie vnto god vvander vvithout meate knovvest thou time vvhen vvilde goates yeane knovvest thou caluing time hyndes canst thou tell time going vvith calfe vvhen calue bovve selues make yong one parte caste ovvne sorovves yong one vvex fat grovve vvith corne go returne againe heere matter pursued still hathe beene treated former dayes whiche men comprehende whole order nature rather conuicted owne vnskilfulnesse ought take warning humble selues god admitte doings good well done therefore sayde men knowe way heauen say wote order bee kept yet notwithstanding much see god hath done ought bee amazed great wisdome shewed put building heauen side would wee beginne nay making bodie one starre planet could wee bring passe nowe great number starres therwithall great diuersitie moreouer great distinction distance betwixt yea planet placed order moone neerest vnto v sunne far aboue planet yet far aboue suune starres skie hold highest roome considering suche varietie heauen v able compasse vnderstanding might parcelmeale set forth al course order wise see therfore without cause doth scripture say star ye would say host army heauen god hath furniture ought astonish v sith let v learne honor god muche sheweth infinit wisdome thing see sky let v acknowledge hath wrought aboue capacitie yea euen suche wise great wisdome v thing seene eye say know reason refer right end nowe followeth bicause haue thing estimation therfore able ourselues looke vpon singular peece worke wee shall bee constreyned commend made meane euen among mortall men yet doth therefore follow well contrary wise welliking record vnderstand nothing comparison let v come vnto god ynough v commend person hath made excellent peece woorke ought rauished doings seing let v come backe poynt namely submit oure selues wholly vnto attempt thing aboue abilitie bee hastie iudging haue bene wont sayde immediatly hee shall restreyne stay barrelles heauen cloudes terrned text also psalme make v vnderstand god wonderfull power holding backe water nature wee knowe water sheadeth sinketh downeward bycause heauie nature yet water hanging ayre stay neuerthelesse wherof commeth staying bycause god holdeth fast shet vp barrelles tonne tub hebrue worde set downe place betokeneth properly tubbe water potte yee see cloudes god vesselles bee made wood earth without thing holde god onely commaunding water keepe selues suffyzeth make stay withall shewed v also standeth v greatly hand god shuld shet vp heauen might rayne continually thing earth always one clodde men could sowe likewise contrarie parte come rayne earth woulde bee hard coulde yeelde frute would become like yron men could get nothing nowe needefull god make rayne conuenient seazon hee also shoulde reserue time fayre weather vvee see wee thinke thing worthie admiration must wee bee ouerfrowarde glorifie god confessing belongeth order thing according belongeth vnto v accepte doings good rightfull euen acknowledging weakenesse owne wittes whosoeuer presumeth murmure god maketh selfe wyzer hee euen despite wee yeelde god deserued prayse acknowledging owne ignoraunce wee take good heede iudge workes see wherevnto wordes tende alledged also sayde expresly v sende foorth lightening planetes stormes haue wise oure commaundement shoulde say lo heere wee hee vve may well commaund sunne moone wee cause make euer haste wee eyther hinder course whit seeing wee perceyue one commaundement god gaue creating world said haue sunne reygne ouer daye moone ouer nyght shall bee diuersitie season springtime sommer vvinter forth say sith wee see one commaundement heauen mainteyneth course keepeth perfect order ought wee confesse belongeth god gouerne thing wee take doings good woorth diuelish pryde v shall scape vnpunished therefore lette v wey well speech sayde wet sende foorth planet thunder lightening true iosua stay course sunne saying sunne stande thou still thy place go forewarde owne power nay rather god shewed mouth mortall man howe mightie effectuall worde iosuaze wordes sounde vanished away ayre muche hee spake authoritie god attempted thing vpon owne heade sunne could obey sunne obeyed mortall mannes voyce bycause commaundement god muche mightie thing god hathe owne maiestie glory euerlasting spoken settled course sun moone order heauen therefore marke well wordes oure owne profite make v exalt god hee worthie submitte selues wholy vnto hold al conceit thought captiue ende wee take vpon v lawfull v surely purpose v start bound sayde heere planet say heere ought commaundement vvhen men need take vpon meete neades worke spite yea leape farre oute square blaspheme chaunge thing order nature make sunne ayre parte worlde stande awe creature moue god therefore doth mocke follie pryde speaking maner contrarie parte wee see sunne moone starres say vnto lo without speaking whatsoeuer god appoynteth haue nother witte vnderstanding yet led secret inclination execute god euer bade creation worlde sith wee see ought wee reuerence maiestie euen senslesse creature obey ye see wee haue gather vpon saying nowe foloweth consequently v hunt praye lyon feede lyon whelpes fill giue rauens whereon feede nourishe yong one crie vnto god vve knowe manner feeding lyon wilde beastes craue two three morselles satisfie require much sustenance bycause beastes deuour swallowe vp muche nowe finde prouision true prince may well keepe lyon pleasure wylde beastes prince able finde foode sustenaunce lyon worlde nowe nothing else wylde beast see haue wherewith susteyne specially god prouision sufficient miracle stirre v vp acknowledge goodnesse god wee shall see god meening texte yet better wee haue eye selues vvhat letteth lion wylde beastes deuour men world happeneth wee pray god let looce lion beares elephant al wild beastes many number diuers kind pray destroyed hand cause lion satisfied notwithstanding haue need great nourishment therwithall worlde preserued continued state god prouideth remedie matter according also sayde light sunne driueth away wild beast maketh get denes men may haue libertie go businesse god shet vp wilde beast maner giue men earth traffike labour vpon thing shoulde wee haue one corner hide heades yee see thing ment text god gaue lion foode men quyte cleane ridde earth go hauocke destruction god working manner compelleth v commend gracious goodnesse pitieth v holdeth v vnder protection wee perish wee must needes haue done fatherly care preserue v true sometimes lyon may well deuour men happeneth cheefly deserte country hote landes greate store wylde beastes commeth passe god warneth v thereby mischeefe vniuersall prouided otherwise see wilde beast deuour men sorte therein wee haue fayre lookingglasses vvhereof long followe forewarde raunge vnto men house consume muste setting stop way needes god hand man pollicie preuenteth let v magnify god vouchsafing feede wilde beastes wise liue worlde inioy benefit hath bestowed vpon v furthermore vpon reading text let v remember also sayd foure thirtith psalme althoughe lyon bee strong seeke praye violence yet suffer hunger although passe mannes power satisfie suffer hunger yet god alwayes nourish comparison well worthie bee marked god feede lyon whiche wilde terrible beastes yea irkesome nature shall feede men created owne image termeth child specially ought doubt nourish whe call vpon father true fayth holie spirite reigneth heart thinke god forsake v wee flee vnto refuge seing feedeth wilde beast giueth foode rauens shall sayde anon see serueth v double vse one must hold god wonderful goodnesse prouideth food lion al beast preserued midst god feede lion wilde beastes much likely carefull feed v bicause child seing comaundeth v come vnto seke wil deal v ordinarie bread feed v bicause haue thing hee giueth v effect thing haue marke vpon texte sayd immediatly rauens god feedeth yong one cry vnto true litle bird haue vnderstanding cry vnto god nother haue speach speake much lesse led cace true faith yet notwithstanding much lacke foode haue mean susteine themselues world therfore sayd crie vnto god according sayd psalme selfe maner speach vsed saying ought bee weyed well great confirmation thing haue bin sayd wit god feede wylde beast houle crie bray without knowing maker nourish ought sure god hath set worlde reserueth selfe office maynteyning giuing euer haue need thinke fayle agayne let v first marke ment worde crie rauens birdes crie vnto god vvhy crie fayth vnderstanding praye men taught crie want mean helpe theselues behold rauens bird hungred dame flie abroad seeke pray sometimes finde none meane whyle yong one halfe starued bodie prouideth nowe god fayne put helping hande whether bee giuing wormes iobbe secret meanes thus yee see yong rauens crie vnto god like may sayde beastes namely bee helplesse resort vnto god vnderstading cace may well wander world still destitute al succour shift god must reach hande goodnesse giue thing haue neede let v returne foresaid comparison betweene ourselues brute beast seeing sayde god sheweth himselfe bountifull beastes destitute naturall meanes help themselues one repayred vnto ought although haue abundance euen till readie perbrake good vp againe yet must wee alwayes vnderstand thing haue giuen v god owne hande happen suffer penurie want much prouoked repaire vnto therfore men must shrinke backe chafe vpo bridle find themselues destitute help vvhat must let thinke thus themselues behold god calleth v good soth declareth protesteth mind sort prouoke beast repayre vnto therein also shew himselfe soueraine gouerner otherwise shuld leaue nothing world lie wast howe much ought repayre vnto let v marke well whensoeuer want prouision wote become way turne v asmuch god tolde v charge giue v whatsoeuer meete v mean haue whole trust settled wee haue beleef inward feeling prayer supplication must matched hand whosoeuer braggeth wayteth sustenance foode god hand yet meane vouchsafeth call vpon doth shew nothing el hypocrisie leasing therfore fayth must stirre v vp driue v cal vpo god end may confesse fosterfather receyue foode hand vpon receyte thereof acknowlege selues nurrished mere goodnesse thus yee see maner wee ought put text vre furthermore behoueth v come yet hygher comparison sith vnderstand god feedeth bodyes sorte muche reason wee shoulde also seeke nurrishment soules hande although wee meate drinke worlde wee needed bow head filled yet foode soules precious thing found bylowe neuerthelesse euen corruptible foode giuen v godshande hee sheweth expresly onely belongeth feede body present trasitorie life behoueth men repayre vnto cheefly fed spiritually haue consideration skill v yong rauens fowles ayre beast worlde must witness iudges condemne v god sheweth v eyesight calleth succorlesse hee call brute beastes hee office behalfe ought wee haue right minde true beleefe towardes wee may bee throughly perswaded wee shall bee disappoynted demaunding whatsoeuer wee haue neede effect wee haue remember text sayd afterwarde knowest thou time wylde goates female doo kidde knowest thou tyme hyndes howe bowe themselues caluingtyme truely example mankinde wee haue ourselues ought ynough reproue mennes follie selfewize take vpon reason god man shoulde aske howe wart thou created begotten wart thou caried nurrished space nine monethes thou wart begotten haddest taken shape thy mother womb howe camest thou agayne ende couldest thou answere directly thing would stande abashed man without stepping whit himselfe shal finde sufficiently proued god worketh wonderously begetting vvhat thing little creature bee ingendred yea euen corruption filthe yet notwithstanding receyue shape wee see fashioned body agayne thing childe shoulde bee nurrished vncleannesse infection mother wombe euen among excrement yet notwithstanding receyue sustenance growe big finde meanes come world maner thing excellent miracle god ought bee rauished therefore haue sayde already wee needed bee sent wilde beastes hyndes sheegoates bene ynough euery v considered maner hee borne nurrished mother wombe hee came mother worlde neuerthelesse without cause god sendeth v wilde beastes woman haue yet helpe come deliuerance haue woman seruice one succour another agayne bee taught custome experience keepe themselues daungers consider expedient prepare furnish themselues aforehand yee see ought esteemed greter miracle brute beast woman poore beast great yong know beare onely feele cubersome burthen may greeued may rush belly agaynst something make yong one slinke struggling yong one within may maner cast despayre howbeeit god preserueth wize keepe theyr frute although heauie troublesome yet preserued miracle seene redde deere ne hyndes cannot indure owne fatnesse somuche growe fatte fal fasting propertie cannot beare thing hindereth yet notwithstanding carie theyr yong calues still yea euen great payne specially reported haue exceeding great payne greefe caluing according also mention made thereof text sayd howe though shoulde cliue asunder strayne themselues exceeding sore true woman also sayne streyne themselues streyning hyndes greater somuch haue skill secretes nature say fayne vse medecine taking certayne hearb help themselues withall otherwise stand stay tooke somewhat haste deliuerie vvee see heere nought god sendeth menne hyndes sheegoates kinde altogither certayne matter importance straunge cace beastes know beare notwithstanding haue wit beare burthen fence themselues though god taught sayd vnto behoueth preserue owne kinde offpring seing beastes haue suche inclination god worketh aboue woulde become gouerned againe beast come bee deliuered brutishnesse suche telling muste keepe theselues quiet muste haue yong one shall bee gladde sayde vnto woman shall haue wherof reioyce see manchilde borne worlde none thing bee sayde beastes knowe shall passe body nother tell whither thing carie shall burst belly make bowells fal yet notwithstading keepe stil afterward come bringing foorth yong know remedy needes without succour make yong one cleane peyne haue yet go abroade miscarie default seing wee perceyue haue wee cause magnifie god specially wee consider diuersitie beastes yet see multiplie maner pray proued face god stretcheth arme worketh way miracle neede go schoole vnderstad neede high capacitie haue matter debated great profound reason slenderwitted ignorant person knoweth well begetting menne ingendering cattell beastes miracle god god hand must needes perceyued according also beareth whole sway knowing ought also wonder goodnesse god extendeth selfe euen brute beast vvhen wee see pitifull behalfe ought wee glorifie wee leastwize yeeld sacrifyze prayse see power wisedome lo howe ignorantest conuicted vnthankefulnesse set minde considering god wisedome power iustice goodnesse shewe vtter themselues euety yea euen toward brute beast although mention made precisely hind shee rockegoates wilde goates yet haue wee generall lesson gather beastes namely god muste needes stretch hand guyding sayde order intendeth multiply liuing creature guyding thereof haue ofspring increace without guyding thing woulde come horrible confuzion specially sith wee know sayd secrettes peculiar difficulty hyndes ouer beast sayd afore therefore god giueth skill seeke sayd hearbe let v profite selues knowledge hath beene phisitio hyndes schoole haue learned skill seeke hearb know expedient deliuerie voyding yog one body vvho hath shewed vvho hath beene teacher ought god knowne glorified cace wee ought marke well particular kindes set downe heere eye wherein god glory sheweth selfe liuely yet must also gather foresayd generall lesson god worketh throughout shall bee sayd hereafter egges fowles lay whereoutof yong birdes come euen also must god prouidece acknowledged howbeit haue applyed whole indeuer consider god doings wilde beast behoueth v also come backe selues cheefe poynt men know god goodnesse power wisdome iustice according bee shewed vnto perceyue partaker therfore whereas sayde heere caluing tyme hyndes knowne vnto men say men appoynt let v vnderstand must trie maystries god going aboute wreste ourselues subiection wee borne god hath shewed life owne hande order disposition well ynough knowne long tyme hyndes go calfe men may iudge certayne coniecture men looke narrowly man marke time male female go rutte hee shall finde go full eight moneths well caluingtime may wel knowne sayd knowest thou caluing tyme hyndes yea purpose god speaketh yet hath ordered v know long hynds go calfe say haue appoynted eyther monethes dayes vve bee skilfull folke nowe seing god haue hyndes go calfe full time terme expi ed deliuereth giuing helpes guyding matter himselfe hath ordeyned behoueth v conclude therevpon hath reserued lordship beast himselfe asmuch fedde dammes belly holdeth subiection bee come foorth guydeth owne pleasure whe haue thought vpon beastes lette v come selues would fayne start play suttleheaded fellow replying god saying doth god deale thus thus mee vvhy doth hee sende mee mine owne desire enter murmuring lift vp selues fashion god let v come backe birth say ala howe camest thou thy mother wombe tooke thee true helpes yet must wee come sayde two twentith psalme god tooke v mother wombe woman worlde may beate braynes nothing cace except god worke euen wonderful power therfore thinke vpon birth must needes stroupe say lorde came world thou diddest well shewe thy guiding cace thou tookest mee mother womb yea whyle thou diddest maynteyne mee vvere passing straunge thing shetting vp child ordinarie matter among v vvee liue ayre whensoeuer cannot take breath choked hand life man consisteth breath stop breath dispatched immediatly true little babe haue vent take breath mother wombe whereby euen nauill meane wherewith childe susteyned maner corruption hee lieth among maner excrement kinde wretchednesse somuch considered borne space eyght moneths howe hee maynteyned man may see god mightie hande yea passingly wee must needes bee amazed thinke vpon acknowledge god gouerneth thing hath ordering v wee bee moued mightie workes god stand astonished pray must wee needes bee worse hardharted wee bee touched owne record brute beast must condemne v beare witnesse agaynst v last day let v learne profit selues doctrine specially confesse god wonderful woorkes order nature tootingglasse wee must needes rauished wonder knowledge thing seene howbeit let v alwayes knit vp bridling selues knowing certaine wee power wit capacitie iudge god doings therefore wee must sall controlling aske done let v vnderstand soeuer go find fault doings shall bee confounded yea bee driuen perceyue owne ignorance weakenesse euen vndoing wee presume auaunce selues beyond bound sith let v learne conteted pleaseth god reueale vnto v let v restreyne selues diuelish ouerweening see men specially cace concerneth matter passe capacitie like sayde god doth dispoze thing v finde fault doings notwithstanding bee guyded performed prouidence herevpo reply mee canot beleeue vnderstand therefore conclude naught howe thou vnhappie wight wilt thou shet vp god small roome thy foolish brayne one thou shuldst say beleeue god except may see mine eye betweene legges dealing wee must vve must presume draw downe god maiestie vnto v behoueth v mount vp alofte send vp wittes thither honour incomprehensible greatnesse yea wee muste mount vp thither humilitie without presuming thing selues rather acknowledging nothing creepe bylow thus ye see behoueth v put doctrine vre according also set v end letvs fal face good god acknowledgement sinnes praying open eye wee may learne perceyue howe ought beaten want wretchednesse wee may cleerely bereft pride wee attempt waunt selues chalendge thing vnto v acknowledging goodnesse v altogither vnprofitable may resorte good god receyue power strengh hande follow ende walking according wee may brought yeelde prayse thankesgiuing thereof may please tame pride v hindereth v prayse deserueth end v made cleane may returne vnto one comon accord framing selues pe sably vnto woord may please c clij sermon second vpon xxxix chapter vvho hath set vvild asse libertie vvho hath loozed bondes vvild asse vvhich haue set house vvildernesse dvvelling salt place laugheth multitude citie skorne heareth crie extorcioner seeketh mountaynes pasture searcheth euery greene thing vvill vnicorne serue thee vvill tarie thy crib canst thou tie sayd vnicorne vvith line labour furrovves vvill hee breake cloddes earth vallies thee vvilt thou trust bicause strength great yeeld vp thy labour vnto vvilt thou beleeue vvill bring homethy corne gather togither thy barne hast thou giuen peacock goodly vvinges feather storck estrich vvhich leaueth hir egges earth maketh vvhot dust forgetteth foote maye treade vppon beast fielde maye breake shee shevveth hir selfe cruell tovvards hir yong one though vvere hirs though hir labouring vvere vayne vvithout feare god hath depriued hir vvisedome giuen hir vnderstanding vvhen time shee mounteth high skorneth horse rider one onely kinde thing looke vpo whole world yet ought suffyze make v giue glorie vnto god anythig wherein sheweth himselfe one towards v wee compelled honour god perceyuing men still negligent slowe knowing purposed stirre vp suche varietie excuze themselues knowing seene infinite number thing offer theselues sight aboue beneath say man thinke vpon without passing well haue wherfore magnifie god else hee looked vppon one kinde creature wee may say like wee make circuites discourse haue seene god glory one part world wee turne eyesight another make numbering perusing creature certayne wee must needes moued confesse perfection workes v able magnifie sufficiently lo god doth set v downe many sundrie sortes perfect storie full reckening vp property liuing thing yet notwithsta ding example set downe haue much ought suffyze v like mention made wilde vntamed ass god sayeth v giue libertie one sayd behold wild ass must thinke whole world gathered togither could giue wilde ass nature haue therfore lette v confesse god hath disposed thing aboue abilitie power finding fault commeth foolish rashnesse v lyft v eye honour sheweth v infinite power mightinesse mention made wilde ass hee speaketh vnicornes kinde beast bee men commonly agree vnicorne spoken sayd vnicornes subiection v wee cannot occupie wee ox horse ass meanes tame might till ground drawe home corne ne vnto threshingfloore sith let v vnderstand v ouerrule god workes wee may well streyne selues shall neuer bring passe wee cannot tame wilde asse wood beast shall rule whole worlde wee cannot dare wee lift vp neb maker hath ordered thing wisedome fault foud finally speaketh peacock estridges el haue vnderstood storkes howbeeit although storkes spoken second place yet notwithstanding thing added ende cannot agree estridges wit despise horse seman reason swistnesse agayne forget egges foolish lay san e thinke great fondnesse soule agreeth estridges rather storkes effect one mirrour god glory able content men leastwise great varietie sheweth felfe euerywhere ought stirre v vp moue v seeke god submit selues haue founde yea euen obedience although perceyue reason work yet may ceasse hold selues prisoner grudge wyze let v come euery part vvhere wilde ass spoken sayde god vntie setteth libertie go seeke feeding mountaynes dwell wilderness salt place therewithall skorne city subiect tallages impost charge wilde ass knowe thing meane haue free state god speaketh maner rebuke men setting themselues forgetting owne state men vnderlings yet wee see brag themselues seemeth earth woorthie beare whereof commeth ouerweening compare themselues wilde ass shall find ass haue desirable thing haue wit libertie freedome euery man cofesseth freedome chief benefite enioy wee bondage wilde ass free yet notwithstanding fal boasting beare selues hand excellent woorthinesse v ought bee caried aboue clowdes god ought reach hand set v vpon shoulder thus see wee folie men behalfe therefore lette v marke well god ment humble v correct pryde v bicause cannot refrayne fro esteeming selues beyond measure bicause wee thinke vpon vpon workes howbeeit neede mount high vnto maiestie humble v beast teach v schoolemaysters wee woorthie haue teacher neuerthelesse might bee de maunder whither wilde ass preferred rome abroade euery hilde awe subiection bee tamed man answere men continued vncorruptnesse haue beene subiect reason way bondage euery man haue rule god haue reigned euerywhere shoulde haue needed lawes iusticers swoorde haue executed menne euill shoulde haue needed none thing euery man haue bene lawe rule himselfe haue god lawe printed hart willing subiection haue bene noble excellent dominion world asmuch wee corrupted behoueth v hilde thraldome therein god sheweth v wee bee able rule selues sith haue v brought vnder awe others onely lawes ciuill order men hild vnder yoke also god suffereth hard combersome charge layd vpon according see druerse time tyrant beare sway world farre father subiects vexe pill poll bite asmuch behalfe state serueth shame v god teacheth telleth v beast respect haue better time yet notwithstanding sayd god hath respect vtterly reiected beast better cace wee see hee compareth people israel wilde asse prophete osee shewe nother reason manhood thou wilt alone thy selfe sayeth say cannot tame thee lord intendeth hold v flocke haue woord meening play teacher among v wee cannot abide gouerned hand kinde wee shew selues haue vnamendable nature moreouer certayne subiection god hath layd vpon men wee see still print goodnesse much mennes behoof subiect yea though handled amisse rigorously wilde ass bee vntamed stray abrode mountaynes meane men warned sinnes god chastizeth roughly mayne blowes draw backe repentance againe whatsoeuer come sheweth difference betweene good euill whereas ass let alone still brutishnes e let v learne whatsoeuer subiection god hath layd vpon men yet hath ceassed vse continuall goodnesse fauour towards howbeeit warning giuen text tendeth poynt men needes bee prowde make great account owne worthinesse nobilitie deserue well bee sent wilde ass god mocke saying go ye wretched soules seemeth ought reygne ouer ought fellowlike yet shall subiect many charge ye shall able liue togither without many trouble complayntes outcry euery man shall stand doubt according wee see men cannot liue one another shall mistrust hartburning one shall another wrong guyle still practizing one thing indeuering ouercome enimies treacherie maliciousnesse full poyson grinde teeth see cannot redresse owne harmes lo state men meane wilde ass sport themselues mountaynes seeking pasture scorning policy wherewith men tyre themselues much seing let v learne set lesse selues wilde ass wander mountaynes must teach lesson make perceyue ye weene selues make vaunting wee see maner behoueth v apply text instructio one side let v vnderstand god intendeth humble v example beast ende sub due pryde v side let v consider although state bee respect woorse state br te beast yet notwithstanding god neuer ceasseth holde graciousgoodnesse towardes v turne euill intoo good somuch whereas wee haue free vnbridled life worlde meanes wee bee taught come vnto subiection men becommeth better libertie beast bo dage behoofe beastes stray abroade without mayster restreynt without knowing lawe aught else thus yee see one side wee haue consider god grace side stoupe wee exalt selues worthinesse vnderstand lord subdueth v mention hath beene made sort wilde ass speaking vnicornes matter like vnto god sayeth vnicorne cannot bee tamed wee cannot vse commoditie although strong light yet bee till earth pleasure drawe plough nother draw carte bring home come barne short hee serue man turne altogither himselfe heere wee haue note first whereas beast v seruice bicause god tameth putteth hand end wee inioy proofe thereof doth horse suffer himselfe bee ruled man draw plough harrowes carie rider burthen backe happeneth men breake mule ass ox horse strong ynough withstand man wee see hee stoute coragious beast howe doth man get maystrie surely man acquaynted taming ox horne terrible thing look vpon shaking head ynough abashe man great eye thicke neckes would agast bend horne ynough runne came neere againe see huge body haue could men haue vse pleased god giue v maystrie well might vnicornes tamed horse ox god giuen diuerse nature let v behold god goodnesse applying beast seruice otherwise able amase v looke durst come neere little childe rule ox somuch accustomed yoke shall keepe little sticke hee shall make bow downe thicke neckes stoupe brode horne short shall weelde sorte whereas able beare downe thing afore shall resistance sith wee see let v acknowledge god hath shewed bountifull towardes v seing hee hath maner made beast subiect v able haue made v afrayde sayd afore neuerthelesse haue apply themselues seruice menne may tame beholde elephant tamed passing terrible beast looke ouercommeth beast truly mountayne seemeth serue purpose destroy v yet notwithstanding subdued becometh sort tame hee keepeth still incling owne kinde yet wonder v maner ouermayster make serue turne contrary part vnicorne small beast hauing certaine nimblenesse keepeth alwayes sturdinesse somuch men world cannot cunning strength bring subiection sith wee see let v conuicted leastwise comparison haue learned acknowledge god goodnesse applieth beast vse profite v seruice lette v marke also side v rule snayle ye would say lord giue v power ouer true creation worlde beast giuen vnto adam haue lordship dominion ouer haue lost possession thereof gone away god like subiect committeth lewdnesse treason agaynst prince good forfeyted himselfe quite fauour euen men haue reigned peasably ouer beast beene vnthankefull god breaking allegeance wee ought vnto cause wee bereft lordship souerayntie giuen v ouer beast nowe seing beast rise vp v wee could inioy god reserueth vse vntoo v yea subdueth v according wee haue neede thereby wee warned exceeding great madnesse v lift vp selues maker beast well ouermaister v neede require god needeth arme lion vnicornes giue v battell lyce flea hee thinke good make scorne pryde therefore seing sometimes cannot mean rule beast lette v remember whence commeth wit adam sinne naughtinesse wee stubborne agaynst made v prince worlde put creature hande let v consider sorie sinnes oft wilde beast v harme let v thinke v thus behold god sheweth v owne want therevpon lette v pray graunt v grace obey wise may beare mark beast may know power hath giuen v child yet lette v assure selues intendeth holde v alwayes awe lo haue marke second place might aske question god keepeth still kinde beastes seing men seruice shoulde seeme cause ceasseth god shoulde nurrish longer let v marke ceasse bentifyings world end men might behold maiestie god one reason sufficient ynough selfe againe haue sayde already serue learning god sheweth v diuerse sight teach v varietie vnderstand power goodnesse iustice better side good instruction v bicause sith cannot haue vse must presume exalt selues high euen horse ox would rushe v ouerrun v somuch although god haue put vnder v haue serue v yet notwithstanding one stroke horse foote ynough slea man sith wee see haue wee alwayes good lesson shrinke head giue ouer making great braueries yee see wee haue beare away heere furthermore whereas mention made breaking cleddes tilling ground carying corne barne ende men bee better warned neede prouided many help god hand vvee could continue world meate drinke could liue two dayes nurrished hee giueth v bread men able themselues till earth alone may well imploy strength armes may well digge delue ala ynough make corne growe sustenance shall clothe tilling earth shall get coates hozen shooes shall furnish necessary wee see subiect many thing onely meate drinke serue turne vvhat number helpes haue wee neede mainteyne v wretched life considering god neede giue v suche innumerable sorte helpes let v therfore thinke vpon great number benefites hee hath bestowed vpon v hath ordeyned horse ox till grounde v bring home corne barnes furthermore giuen v skilfulnesse wee haue done amisse haue remedie hand seing god hath made v beholde goodnesse maner eye let v also cosider deepely wee bound indetted vnto serue lowlinesse behold chiefe poynt shewed v booke menne shall neuer yeeld god due honour except stoupe vntoo without presuming grudge without taking vppon teach lesson vndoubtedly schoole hee ought come vnto hee hath wisedome himselfe hath bene shewed heretofore shall shewed hereafter constreyned say wee constreyned abashed sight god doings wee abashed behalfe also behoueth v learne glorifie wee let v come sayd peacockes estridges vvho hee sayeth god hath giuen goodly wing peacockes god sheweth v one woord one fether ynough proue v starke fooles cannot contented doings let v looke vppon peacockes fether wonderfull workemanship wote say glorifie god say euen vnbeleeuers compelled therevntoseing pray wittes able reache high skanning god gouerneth world thing much higher without comparison must notneedes come short one feather peacocke rauish v hold v gaze shall workemanship appeareth whole worlde shall speciall gouerning mankind yet notwithstading thing whereat men vtter blasphemy thing chafe storme god beyng desirous hee gouerne aduice fancie bicause haue owne liking dealt god hand theselues would wish yet must wee needes proued haue fayled duetie wee consider hee telleth v thus yee see god meening texte afterward hee maketh comparison winges estridges rather stay vpon added concerning fondnesse lightnesse strength also speaketh storkes may rather bring v reasonablenesse kindnesse bee found oftentimes men yong storkes growen great reknowledge dammes feede old age requite youth surely well cosidered needed none doctrine condemne vnthankfulnesse child stubborne father mother could finde heart bottome sea therfore would loth spend themselues behalf spare meate mouth giue vnto ye see fayre mirrour wee haue birde guiltie seing acknowledge souerayne father created v nurrisheth v whose hand wexeth old hee might haue neede v giueth v innumerable good thinges consider somuch yeelde due prayse seing lewde froward neede witness storkes condemne v howbeit asmuch god strayeth longer vpo estriche lette v come spoken behold sayeth hee estrich mocketh horse rider serueth shew nimblenesse great birdbeast half bird ayre half beast earth hee hath weightie bodie mount vp flie aloft flickereth wise hee cannot bee outgone man may well runne poste hee cannot ouertake halfe leaping vppon clees halfe flying winges passeth swiftnesse bee horse beastes marke one poynt swiftnesse matched pollicie beastes take vp stone way throwe follow thus see yee two thing birdbeast one side foolishnesse howbeeit matched aduisednesse gathering vp stone runneth casting backward pursue say one wonderfull thing seene estridges otherside foolishnesse may hide head thinke body hidden yet huge carkesses seene still touching egges sitte vpo asmuch keepe whote country hide sand sunne giuing warmth vnto doth meanes hath consider one side sorecast birdbeasts defending themselues otherside foolishnesse hiding egges shall hee see wonderfull worke god guyding sort furthermore whereas mention made strength swiftnesse birdbeast lette v vnderstande thing surmounteth v vve may well make brag estriches go beyond v cace marke one poynt men must set much store themselues haue beene wont god sende backe continually example serue mocke foolish boasting otherside wee see birdbeasts haue strength nimblenesse yea policie also thing fond one poynt shewe nother wit skill ought wee glorifie god goodnesse towards v hath giuen v vnderstanding estridges haue haue menne gotten owne power eyther gold siluer buy marchaundize let euery man acknowledge much wee bee bound vnto god giuing v discretion lette v beare minde behoueth v yeelde due prayse thus ye see god meening text also whereas sayd god hath bereft estrich wisedome let v vnderstand warne v asmuch wee haue reason discretion wee bee much bound vnto god giuing v inestimable benefite priuiledge thing discerne betweene good euill know duetie onely walking worlde also attayne euerlasting lyfe principal thing know god hath created v owne image prepared heritage v aboue seing wee haue skill discerne betweene honestie dishonestie betweene vice vertue moreouer god doth inlighten v holy spirite heauens asort opened vnto v passe aboue world come companie angelles endlesse glorie purchaced v lord iesus christ asmuch say wee haue much ought wee make treasure way giueth v haue erst sayde wee bee lyke foolishe birdbeastes spoken heere wee shoulde haue witte estriches god prouideth otherwyse v thus yee see howe men ought bridle themselues apply wit reason honoring god aduaunce themselues agaynst cheefe thing muste obey consider infirmitie still themselues ynough small quantitie discerne greatnesse height god workes creeping vpon earth go foreward still hublenesse modestie knowing well cannot yet atteyne depth god secretes thing touched beginning better confirmation texte namely god one side intendeth make v perceyue goodnesse ende wee haue cause greeued patience though giuen better state wilde beast v yet neuerthelesse intent humble v wee see serues plight reason corruption wee caught sinne beastes passe v respect particular poynts true wee shall alwayes bee preferred beastes bee placed higher degree aboue yea whereas haue great strength nimblenesse beast haue profite wit humble v withall otherwise wee would neuer bee tamed vve see although wee put minde weakenesse many thing wee behold yet notwithstanding god fayne complayne v like wilde beast hath bene sayde woorse oxe know owner cribbe hee fedde asse horse know maysters stable know maker short meanes tame v therefore good v wee haue force strength wilde beastes haue thing could delt withall moreouer way let v alwayes beare minde wee must haue recourse number benefites god hath specially bestowed vpon v vpon beast according sayde heere reason vnderstanding howbeeit lette v simply consider reason common men let v also come hath pleased god inlighten v wisedome conteyned gospell open eye holy spirite wee bee able see secretes else hidden incomprehensible v therfore let v learne magnifie two thing haue beare minde way lette v marke whereas mention made heere estridges egges god extend prouidence hatching hir egges euen left forsaken much likely hee neuer forget v v say excellent creature good sooth wee see hee hath prouided much better mankind cattell behold hennes foolish forget owne egges chicken shoulde come lord hath printed kindnesse woman know yong babe nurrish bloud substance seing lord hath set order mankind thereby wee know hee hath fatherly care v howbeeit wee muste measure goodnesse let v come sayeth prophet mother forget hir child although al mother world forget child yet forsake thee sayeth lord god one side sheweth himselfe father holdeth mother stay giuing themselues willingly charge nurcing child true see mother number tender nice thing cannot finde heart take payne owne child nurce shall bee kinde childe none hir owne tha owne mother neuerthelesse sayd kindnesse appeereth commonly whence proceedeth euen god whose maynteyne mankinde meane moreouer wee know fatherly goodnesse sheweth selfe creature well surely god doth afore hande make v feele fauour care hee hath v howbeit let v vnderstand himselfe surmounteth euer perceyue worlde wee come vnto humblenesse hee alwayes shewe himselfe wit welspring mercie pitie aduersities succour v therefore let v haue sayd trust although wretched creature yet let v therfore ceasse trust glorifie assuring ourselues yeeld v teachable obedient people side shewe v acknowledging god vayne let v fall face good god acknowledgemet sinnes praying make v feele better generally open eye wee may puffed vp pryde presumption drunken vayne fancy stande owne conceyt boast selues wee may rather learne submitte selues holde goodes honour acknowledging continue mercie towards v vtterly vndone euery minute houre meane wee may bee alwayes hild feare subiection profite therein moreouer hee may vouchsafe beare v still long seeth v yet hemmed many infirmity corruptios vntill haue vtterly bereft v transformed v vntoo glory image may please graunt grace v also people nation earth bringing backe poore ignorant soules miserable c cliij sermon third vpon xxxix chapter hast thou giuen strength horse inuironed necke vvith neying vvilt thou make horse afrayd grassehopper locust neying nosthrilles terrible diggeth earth foote reioiceth goeth boldnesse armed passeth scaring feareth nother shunneth svvoord let quiuer rattle steele speare shield hee svvallovveth vp earth rage fiercenesse hee passeth noyze trumpet vvhen heareth trumpet sayeth ha ha smelleth battell far noyze captaynes shouting armie vvill hauke take fethers thy vvisedome vvill hee spred vvngs tovvardes south vvill eagle mounte vp thy commaundement make hir nest high place shee dvvelleth vpon rocke abideth vpon high mountaynes infortresses thence shee espieth hir pray hir eye looke farre hir yong one sucke vp bloud haunt vvhere dead body lorde ansvvered sayde vnto iob learning striue vvith almightie let reproueth god ansvvere dispozed bee taught god hee also parte woulde deale v teaching shoulde lift v vp hande vnto himselfe yea familiar fashion father talketh child howbeit forasmuch harde bee gouerned steade yeelding selues teachable needes ouerwize god fayne send v schoole beast haue seene heretofore proceedeth heere still speaking horse theyr nature hee sheweth men know workes wil nedes auaunce themselues sorte agaynst therewithall sheweth vnlesse please hee vouchsafe answere replyes shall ynough v disproued brute beastes yea euen horse household v shall neede go farre stoppe mouthes shal haue aduocates inough plead cace stretes field house wil ray sevp great oratours among men sayde content himselfe haue brute beastes pleade furthermore curious discoursing nature horse god ment deale manner processe hee alleadgeth simplye thing knowne ignorantest sorte man neede greatly practised vnderstanding thing spoken heere little child knowe like spake starres planet manner greate doctours philosopher vvhy bicause fewe folke haue fared better haue capacitie conceyue hee spake grosly sunne moone thing seene vvhosoeuer hath eye although haue nother skill aught else bee greate clerke may notwithstanding comprehende thing haue bin spoken alredy concerning sunne starres needeth astrologie behalfe like cace speaketh beast kepeth self course intent none v shoulde take excuse wherevnto wee inclined truely men lothe confesse owne ignorance yet commeth excuzing themselues god make buckler saying passeth mine vnderstanding curious geere mee cannot fasten vppon forasmuche moste men take lurkingholes sayeth euen ignorantest sort shal haue proued face haue bin vnthankfull malicious haue knowne thing vtterly apparant vntoo thus ye see cause mention made heere horse thing rehearsed simply suche sorte bee knowne men bothe great small yea sayeth god man giue strength seene horse speciall giue lustie coragious nature besides horse strong limmes wee see partly bred purpose warres men see howe caste themselues middes daunger inflamed furiousnesse man woulde say one minde trumpettes greate shoutes yea doo euen incourage men sith wee see terriblenesse euen nozethrils dreadful beast himselfe yet men know small peece god working behalfe hath vttered power full hath onely giuen little signe marke hee able men consider throughly ought stryue checke dare nowe set themselues liuing god durst answere horse durst rubbe vpon backe woulde bee afrayde yet afrayde infinite power whereof see small droppe horse worlde ye see haue remember effect vpon streyne euen wee see god hath vsed superfluous language speaking heere hardinesse horse theyr strength men cannot scare grassehoppers runne vppon speares arrowes needefull speake wee bee hardie bolde ynough carpe god knowe glory owne blockishnesse giueth v boldenesse asmuche drawe curtayne eye whiche keepeth v fro sight god glorie thing maketh v brutishe bycause playe sharpsighted men nedes comprehende thing owne fancie knowe infinite power god therefore doth god treate horse set v strength power ende rauished wondering guyding behoueth v alwayes come backe poynt god hath vttered power altogither horse giuen v vnderstand vttermost able hath set forth one drop prouidence yet cosider well sayd accustomed sight handling horse euery v woulde runne away would terrible beast v specially sight theyr boldnesse shew battell thus yee see muste apply thing instructio rehearsed particularly cocerning horse yea side must note goodnesse god tameth horse sort subdue vnto men apply seruice thinke wee horse whiche vntame nature yea bred purpose battell would suffer himselfe bee ruled weelded god cooled great corage intent men turnes might serued durst doo ourselues let v coclude god sheweth v power hath giuen boldnes vnto horse made fierce hath also giuen v singular record goodnesse loue nothing able breake horse maner owne vse suffer v trauell put chariot carte labour tilling ground take backes ride vpon seing horse suffer theselues gouerned doubt lord sheweth v beneficiall towards v maketh v know thus much concerning poynt chiefe poynt lesson haue touched namely must serue v represse boldnesse therfore tempted murmur god gaynsay thing must cast eye vpon brute beast ca teach v also worthie schooling harken peaceably god obey simple voyce afterward speaketh haukes eagle hast thou sayth giuen wing hauke fly thy commaundement soreth towards south semeth would stie vp sunne hast thou shaped eagle sayeth thou giuest nestes rockes tower mountaines say high loftie place art thou able set order nature wheras yong one feede vpo bloud bredde thervnto thou hast invred fedde nurrished suche sustenance eagle finde dead body smell farre yea sharpsighted e able spie euerywhere surely certaine foule hath sharpest sighte others thou hath giuen nature eagle sayth god vve see god aboue beneath offereth v mirrours rather liuely image wherein wee may perceyue mightie power humble ourselues yet notwithsta ding must cosider also wherewith stoppe v foolishe madde runne rushing agaynst needeth pleade owne cace open mouth speake one word looke howe many creature aboue beneath many witness cofound v vtterly doubt bolde ynough aduaunce ourselues god though woulde plucke seate blasphemy wee beare ourselues hand may preuayle ourboldnesse hath stoppes ynough cast wayes nother beast earth bird ayre shal beare witnesse agaynste v vvee see god cace shall bee pleaded creature troubling himselfe yet notwithstanding wee shall haue deuized agaynste muste returne vpon owne head nowe although lesson easie ynough yet ill minded men behalfe proofe heereof wee see foules flye ayre wee see beastes go vpon grounde yet howe fewe v wake vp thinke vpon god dayly haue store temptation diuell breatheth v spirite grudging hartburning agaynst god wee handled owne liking wee fall carping wrangling saying aware shewed doone heere vvee graunt well ynough thing vtterly apparante yet notwithstanding wee forget neuer commeth minde againe easier commoner lesson lesse excuse shal v blamewoorthie shall god minding thing ought haue knowne vnspoken without putting remembrance ought vnderstoode euery one v wee thinke vpon god diuell commeth pricke v letteth v owne malice vnthankfulnesse seing slowe thing ought bee euer readiest v come minde ought much marke touched euery man shoulde furnish himselfe aforehand warning looke mee vpon haukes flye ayre straunge thing onely see liuing creature caste forth selfe mount vp suche force seemeth shoulde pearce clowdes doubt would exceedingly abashed accustomed surmyze done haphazard vvere possible birdes mounte vp fashion god giuen nature nowe see god hande apparant birde v shall take vpo teach god lesson cofounded small thing proportionablenesse nerenesse shall make coparison betwene god creature agayne copare hawke residue whole worlde nothing small portion god work ought rauish v amaze v ought workes come full numbring fall discoursing thing whiche wee see aboue beneath moreouer wee consider maiestie god yet hygher aboue al heauens farre v wee cannot reache vnto dooth become v stoupe honour reuerence bee restreyned passing whensoeuer diuell shall labour make v carpe agaynst grudge manner meane thing spoken heere concerning nature eagle maye bee take yong one sucke bloud anone bee vnclozed bycause one kinde eagle doo caste yong one neste bee driuen shifte themselues sayde bring vp none blacke one howbeeit wryte matter varie poynte saye eagle cast away yog one bastard eagle
