sight strong ynough looke full vpon shining sunne wee haue curious poynts philosopher ynough v god doth shew v nature eagle wise knowne vseth ye would say grosse fashion intent shoulde haue cloke excuse ignorance looke mee vpon eagle bredde pray yea euen shell haue propertie sucking bloude straunge thing birde shoulde feede nourishe selfe bloude beholde crueltie put intoo needes therefore muste haue nature giuen another whence commeth diuersitie betweene birdes liue pray foules muste difference bee god putting thereby sheweth v suche signes prouidence wee forced cofesse gouerneth ordereth al thing birdes made owne body also gaue theselues inclination haue commeth elswhere god sheweth himselfe wise must nedes woorship maiestie thus ye see chiefe poynt haue remember text therfore man needeth go schoole matter let open eye meene euen veriest idiot thing shewed v knowne men therefore muste needes condemned brutishe blockish know thing vtterly apparant specially seing added eagle resort thither perceyue dead body bee smell dead carkesses farre spie pray make theyr flight thitherward nowe see thing lette v vnderstand lord hath put secrete mouing impossible eagle haue themselues g hath inured imprinted wote thing whereby hee sheweth himselfe woderful looke v behold diuersitie work inforced spite teeth know creator maker beareth sway beastes one nature inclination god prouidence shoulde darkesome likelihood seemeth bee sayde nature beareth sway according see whe philosopher themselues searched considered thing throughout steade worshipping magnifiyng god workes bent witte vnderstanding forge nature serue deface god glory therein diuell ruled great horrible damnation see suche varietie one birde one nature another another beast also differ canot sayd one nature might liuing thing went one line men sawe one answerable conformitie beast thing dispozed men woulde saye nature nature would neuer thinke vpon god sith see one birde hath fearefulnesse another hath therein god working appeereth better dooues see fearefull foules contrarywise wee see gossehawkes birdes pray hardie againe foules greate whiche yet notwithstanding giue themselues praye example looke vpon swannes wyll feede vppon carion byrdes pray eagle seing commeth diuersitie eye god doeth therein shewe v prouidence apparantly much conuicted thing well woorthye bee marked without going men one countenance woman likewyse one stature one colour one making one looke one minde well know creator shaped v hee dealeth forth grace giftes holy spirite measure pleaseth would seeme mother wombe shaped v seede oure father gaue v substance shape euer wee haue short men would thinke themselues beholding god thing yeelde honor see diuersitie men one bigge another small disposition differ one sharpewitted another dull one great eloquence vtterance speache another good halfe dumbe wee see thing muste wee needes wee bee malicious frowarde confesse god owne pleasure distributeth vnto v gyftes holie spirite hath made v fashioned v according wee haue seene heeretofore like woman hath mylked hir kyne shee maketh hir cheese fashion shee hir selfe lysteth god also dispozeth v suche wise wee wote saye hys hande woorketh yea euen marueylous fashion therefore lette v learne bee blinde suche diuersitie thing god setteth afore v whensoeuer open eye many thing come sight one hath shape another hath another cleane contrary lette v vnderstande god draweth v himselfe forasmuch seeth v slow comming cheereth v vp pricketh v foreward maner forced go onward except malicious stubbornnesse withstande carpe saying see see yet another poynt sayd eagle gather togither place caryons wit sith bird liue pray haue skill seeke feeding speciallye eagle doo smell farre aught feede vpon much reason wee shoulde resort place god sheweth v life therfore seeing birdes resort togither corruptible foode yea runne thither take payne excuse v wee side refuze spirituall foode offered v haue wit resort place life shall neede witness v eagle according also lord iesus setteth foorth similitude vnto v hath spoken greate trouble shoulde bee worlde sayeth wheresoeuer deade carkesse thyther wyll eagle resorte according wherevntoo wee countrie may say lyke rauens yee see poore byrdes haue naturall inclination seeke meate pray shall side finde life shoulde wee bee witlesse lord iesus christ calleth allureth v vnto telling v wee come thither wee shall finde want bee inriched maner good thing shal fully replenished nurrishment strength euen full contentation therefore let v thinke vpon seeing haue assurance muste eagle beare witnesse v great day retchlesse let v come back principall poynt touched beginning according also god concludeth namely learning contend almightie lette correcteth god answere serueth shewe v purpose many thing haue bene discoursed man might thinke straunge god inteding mainteine rightuousnesse stoppe men mouthes carpe agaynst shold speake starres tilling grounde maner sayling set foorth nature beast purpose shoulde seeme god seeketh rouing reason yea wee shall haue considered poynt touched wee shall finde muche auaylable v hee maynteyneth rightuousnesse manner hee disputed without setting creature afore v wee muste come backe conclusion although hee shoulde let v alone babbling yet shoulde wee winne nothing wee coulde crye lowde beate eares hee coulde set many stoppes waye looke howe many creature heauen earth sea rise vp bend themselues agaynst v wee shoulde bee able come nigh god nowe see manner dealing whiche god vseth daunt iob person suche impacient needes aduaunce themselues high fit may could haue taken better way teach hath hilde heretofore cause sayde behoueth v marke well conclusion doth shewe himselfe bee wise contendeth almightie true forasmuche hebrew woorde sette downe heere signifieth well teach correct woorde woorde thus learning correcting striue almightie might taken though sayde doeth man quarelleth striueth god prepare himselfe bee chastyzed contrariwise hardeneth himselfe nowe true wisedome haue skill chastize selues knowe want may sory ashamed haue none helpe pray god receyue v mercy pitie v true wisdome men must conclude contrary part lift vp themselues agaynste god starke fooles meening come alwayes poynt diuersitie matter doctrine wil tende alwayes one marke namely men onely misaduised also vtterly destitute witte reason take vpon plead theyr maker better vnderstanding heereof let v holde twoo degree haue spoken let first true wisdome ouermaister oure selues long man standeth owne conceyte looketh loftily ouer sconreful hee dooth nothing throwe himselfe headlong intoo decay ende cannot bee deadly therefore nothing better v correct amende ourselues say beate downe selues wise god may weelde v acknowledge bee nothing wee bee full wretchednesse hee muste bee fayne gouerne v take selues bee beholding good thing agayne second poynt seeing needie vnfurnished destitute thing lette v runne vnto welsping power wisedome rightuousnesse shorte let v vnderstande whome holde life appurtenance thereof yee see way well taught learned ashamed selues flee vnto god therwithal condemne wicked deedes sinnes acknowledge oure nature nothing frowardnesse corruption vvhen haue learned hate selues maner sure wee haue greatly profited nowe man amende himselfe intendeth plead god surely euen good draught poyson make v mad diuell bring v poynte take pritche god discontented accuse wrong take displeasure handle v otherwise ourselues woulde haue say diuell putteth furiousnesse heades become starke madde awke thing v chastise ourselues chafe chawe vpon brydle although god afflict v yet notwithstanding steade humbling ourselues ceasse fire therfore teaching v say seeking true good learning nother right wisdome stande contention god lo heere poynt co prehendeth much skill put vreas forasmuch giuen toyes wilfull withall god addeth take vpon v correct must answere say thing hath alledged afore v true restreyne saying verse must answere wee pleade agaynst god correct forasmuch see cannot bee altogither apparant muste therefore conclude wee haue cause pleade bee throughly considered certaine god ment make heere generall conclusion matter hee discoursed heertoofore let v marke wee wyll correct selues willingly yea euen vtter absteyning murmuring keepe mouthes shet go finde fault god meanes muste bee inforced come wee haue pleaded fill god hath ynough wherewith reuenge himselfe foolishe attemptes hee wyll arme creature hee shall haue many aduocates proctours law agaynst v bird ayre fish sea beastes lande shorte man needeth go himselfe bee disproued see woonderfull woorkemanship god euery tip finger endes oure nayles witnesseth god excellet workemaister ought cofouded oft thinke vpo least thing sheweth v haue true naturall meening sentence sayd let reproueth almightie answere howbeit behoueth v mark howe profitable doctrine v true v first sight say lewde heynous dealing go reproue god meane forbeareth vve wil well make coutenace haue modestie yet none v hee starkleth god hande bee thing rough v thing fall oure liking whome starklings push thought affliction came v god hande trouble whiche seene worlde iudgements proceede euen good persecuted wicked beare swaye wyl exercise pacience meanes clenze v vanity short mortifie v worldwarde say wist offended see church hath peace reste good men troden vnder foote vexed one pinched sicknesse another pouertie meane wicked haue ful scope free suche inconueniences say wee knewe wee woulde learne humble selues contrariwise ranckle inwardly cannot hold ourselues murmuring god though eue within teeth pray accuse god crueltie though reason handle v manner vvee open mouth saye god cruell vniust truely say yet tende ende see lesson belongeth men namely take vpon v reprooue god finde fault must answere workes nowe let v apply wittes let euery v hee yet wee haue debated vpon thing afore rehearsed pray possible v answere reply vnto god thing hath done disposed nature creation thing doubte shall finde store ynough follie selues according see howe men ouershoote themselues diuell also blindeth wise sticke carpe maker behooueth v come pithe wee say gaynesay order nature settled wee denye prouidence god abolishe power sheweth selfe ca say hath disposed al thing wisedome agayne wee displace iustice whiche appeareth v matched goodnesse wisedome wee bryng thing passe impossible nowe muste men needes bee blockishe wyll aduaunce themselues maner agaynst theyr maker done intent may fare better doctrine muste beginne ende namely feele howe weake wee answere thing god put v seing wee bee able furnishe selues lette v learne humble oure selues sorte lette v runne foresayde wisedome correct selues therfore men haue looked well themselues considered want cause stande vppon theyr owne reputation sooth themselues beare theselues hande able shall fayne fall theselues bee ashamed theyr owne filthinesse hate abhorre themselues mortified shall behooue offer god sacrifyze spoken psalme witte sacrifize broken hearte vvhen wee bee come poynte true wisedome lette despyzers god ruffle lette fling abroade randon muche lyst worke theyr owne mischeefe ende mounting vp muste tumble downe agayne lette v bee sure humbling selues shall haue good foundation stay shall vphilde grace oure god thus see wisedome power god whiche houeth v magnifie respect creature sith maketh v inioy many benefites worlde also ye see wisedome looking vpward downward behold diuersities creature hee sheweth v wee must alwayes resort vnto certified prouidence seing hee hath graunted v grace call v vnto lette v learne come quietly vnder hand lette gouerne v pleasure meane time hee handle v fashion seemeth hard combersome v lette v take paciently pray comfort v strengthen v wyse loue howsoeuer fare maynot time go murmur nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement sinnes praying may touched may throughly beate v downe make v flee onely mercie onely remedie v hee onely forgiue sinnes past also gouerne v wise holy spirite hencefoorth oure whole desire may bee walke obedience let v saye almightie god heauenly father c cliiij sermon fourth vpon xxxix chapter first vpon xl chapter iob ansvvering lorde sayde bace degree vvhat shall ansvverc thee vill lay hande vpon mouth haue spoken vvill ansvvere yea tvvice vvill turne againe xl chapter lorde speaking vvhirlevvinde sayde vnto iob gyrde vp thy loynes like valiant man aske mee vvill make thee vnderstand vvilt thou disanull iudgement vvilt thou condemne mee iustifie thy selfe hast thou arme like god thunderest thou vvith voyce cloth thy selfe vvith glory maiestie excellent put thy costly apparrell spread indignation thy vvrath looke vpon proude bring dovvne haue seene alredy god teach iob ryght humilitie spake whirle wind although onely voyce ought ynough astonish v yet notwithstanding thereby hee sheweth yet better howe harde fayne vse meanes abate pryde else bring true humilitie proceedeth god spirite suche stubbornly bent vnto naughtinesse doo neuer submitte themselues willingly vntoo though hee gyue sufficient warning experience leade dryue therevnto yet god vsing violent meanes towardes whome gouerneth holy spirite intendeth therby shew v lewdnesse frowardnesse nature considering fayne thunder rore else continue blockish still perceyue maiestie power submit selues vnto nowe shewed v frute thing god hath done wheras sayeth iob graunted himselfe bace state behoued hold peace keepe mouth shet therein appeareth god magnified himselfe vayne speaking vvhirlewind without effect iob tamed little lambe goeth aboute replie heretofore striued taken vpon contend god mainteyning owne cace geere layde water sayeth dare speake whereas gone farre forward matter leaueth forbeareth vtterly lette v learne god thunder vehemently v welfare although thinke rough first sight god say must faine scare v side dull vpon spurre easie bee brought subiection therefore wee haue neede greate violence abate pryde v nature howbeeit let v marke also heerewithall god shall haue spoken whirlewinde excuse v wee followe iobs example acknowledging wretchednesse v end become altogither quiet poynt woorthie bee noted see dayly howe sharpe rough god ende ouermayster men bring home yet bee neuer better god touche one sicknesse chastize another pouertie one hee spake oute whirlewinde yea doth rappe v mayne blowes vpon heades yet verie fewe v doo amende vvee shall see gnashe theyr teeth fal furious rage rayling othersome become wilful hardhearted god shall mooue iobs example wyll condemne suche bluntnesse sturdinesse although iob impacient caryed away pang yet ende gaue eare roring voyce god whirlewinde strake suche feare corrected himselfe hilde peace euen must therefore let v bethinke selues come conformitie god hath bene boysteous towards v scared v continue wilde beast still surely shal paye deere although wee haue ouershotte ourselues yet let v stad canot yeld ourselues vnto god first blow yet leastwise let v beware wilfull whe see presseth v compelleth v maner force obediet god vse ordinary meanes let v resist hope wee gaine ende must sunken vnder hand thus ye see haue marke firste place heerewithall let v learne beare paciently stripe god giueth v assuring selues meane whereby intendeth make v ready subiect vnto asmuch good v wilde beast make v become sheepe lambes let v take preparatine heart iobs example let v say lord see bace state truely seeme saying caryeth great pith consider well foolish ouerweening men wee shal see iob profited greatly could say bace state bee demaunded whence come answere wretched creature taken earth frayle pitie see fraught store infirmity vve wyll confesse thing mouth yet meane whyle wil ceasse esteeme selues forget whence came whither wee muste return presente state none commeth minde men yee woulde saye drunken bearing theselues hand much worth chalenge worthinesse fantasticall imagination therefore whensoeuer man dooth truely vnfeynedly knowe howe despyze himselfe hee hath aught wherefore shoulde aduaunce himselfe muche yea great wisedome let v marke well shall neuer come suche reason till wee throughly touched maiestie glorie god long men looke one vppon another take occasion esteeme themselues saying well bee liked comparison men make one another blindeth maketh thinke alwayes bee wote come vnto god sheweth himselfe ouerweening muste fayne vanish away disperse come nothing wee haue beseeche god make v perceyue glory ende wee may enter sayde examination oure owne wretchednesse disable ourselues wise none v may beguile himselfe owne foolish imagination also cause abraha god appeared sayde ala dust ash vve wel ynough say maner v though god far minde wee thinke howbeit hypocrisie feynednesse neuer hartily earnestly till wee haue felt god therfore let v marke well order set downe god hath spoken iob whirlewinde iob confesseth himselfe nothing ought bold speke one way howbeit let v bethinke v well also whensoeuer god fauorable appeare v wee muste foolish make account ourselues vertues maruell thoughe wretched papist imagine freewill ground obteyning paradise vppon men owne merites weening make god detter neuer acquainted light gospell bewrayeth men wantes inasmuche god vttereth owne rightuousnesse sily soules neuer hauing felt power god abuse themselues suche deceytes v seeing god telleth v perfect rightuousnesse therwithall discouereth filthinesse sheweth v nothing abhomination v must tyed dotage vtterly disable selues pryde may bee beaten downe v oure god bee glorified therfore haue bin taught purely gospell must come poynte wisedome vtter disabling themselues cause wee say fayth bringeth men loftinesse god reuealeth goodnesse vnto v must assure selues dooing bycause nothing cursednesse v vtterly vndone forlorne vouchsafeth succour v mercie doctrine gospell bringeth v meeldnesse vtter abacing disabling ourselues al thing herewithall iob sayth lay hand vpon mouth whereas hee hath spoken hee fall agayne whereas hee hath spoken twice hee vvheras sayeth lay hande vpon mouth signe protestation proceede manner speeche rife scripture serueth v vnderstand must restreine foolish appetite fleshe tickleth v speake wee muste resist putting muzzle bridle vppon mouthes refreyne man wise himselfe woulde tempted speake amisse hee shoulde neede laye hande vpon mouth hee woulde refrayne owne accorde shoulde neede neyther stoppe barre nowe contrarie parte whereas sayde must lay hande vpon mouth v wit haue fight agaynst fonde lustes liking continually make v hasty speaking insomuche tongue shall still sharpe sette caste forth thing nought woorth agaynst god heere wee warned vice great wicked hurtfull needes sharpe witted pleading agaynste god set foorth ourselues brauerie ende cloke wantes vayne excuse ye see thing whervnto tend wholy inclined woulde fayne cloke themselues hypocrisie rather condemne god suffer themselues bee brought reason alwayes haue lye startinghole yea ende fall spewing oute blasphemy tongue venemous altoogither soked lying falsehoode laste bursteth euen god sith know haue good cause mislyke selues therefore whensoeuer heare maner speeche holy men layde theyr hande vpon mouth let v remember howe forwarde wee bee speake amisse specially wee compare selues iob hee could holde peace without streyning himselfe ala shall wee come farre shorte profiting much ye see touching first poynt men ought alwayes mistruste themselues whe haue occasion speake knowing wel nature doth continually prouoke speake emisse tung nothing else warehouse leasing hipocrisie end appeareth nothing poyson according sayde psalme poyson aspe vnder tung vnreformed vntil time god hath made cleane mouthes skill vtter nothing cursednesse bitternesse therefore let v learne hereby refrayne selues euen hatred towarde euill haue bene much accustomed frame selues meeldnesse obedientnesse shewed v holy ghost inasmuchas forward speake amisse standeth v hand indeuer amende suche faultinesse doubt ynough haue acknowledged haue co demned behoueth v also redresse iob lay hand vpon mouth haue holy prophetes doone muche lette v followe dooing witte whensoeuer prouoked grudge agaynst god though haue neuer fine shift disguyse truth turne lye let v resist suche lewdnesse fight agaynste suche vngraciousnesse seeing vntowarde condemned god shall laying hande vpon mouth say putting stop owne way behooueth v brydle selues wilde beastes therefore let euery man looke neerely himselfe happen afflicted crossed ouerthwart thing one v fretteth another chafeth thirde ranckled poyson bee prouoked speake amisse let v restreyne ourselues good wee wyll man say finde verie hard mee alwayes incline syde yea ynough re woorthie condemned though ouercome imagination conceyuing thought wicked sinfull god infinite goodnesse taketh good worth whe seeth euill liketh v labour represse god perceyuing v haue inclination fay leth accept v vvherefore seeing gracious towardes v wee ought haue muche courage stoppe wicked wordes blasphemy moylings might bruste agaynste god sayde iob hauing spoken leaueth yea seeing hee spoken tw e would vvhereby betokeneth first haue gone farre speaking amisse must therefore harden selues see many haue ouershotte themselues raunged farre square bee brought backe againe play double quit say vve muste although euill continuance wee haue followed farre alreadie yet muste turne heade soone god warneth v therefore let men play bedlems haue done amisse long time togither doubled euill haue cast forth foolishe woorde vnaduisedly clapped twoo three mo necke let therefore grow spitefull agaynst god let condemne themselues double treble therevpon returne agayne ryght waye thus yee see thing whiche wee haue marke streyne although wee haue continued offende god long time neuer season v turne new leafe second poynt must atter selues though haue many occasion see iob many fayre colour alledged one reason alone mayntenaunce cace greate store doubled proofes diuerse sortes insomuche seemed haue matter ynough yee woulde haue sayde hee beene fully perswaded hee looked determinately haue gone away victorie hee sooner set downe one article hee able haue come another yet notwithstanding nowe hee giueth ouer replyes goodly likelyhoodes pleade god vvhereas haue spoken twice sayeth hee renounce euery whit heereby wee bee taught sayde although wee neuer many fayre clokings thought selues haue verie good reason well grounded maynteyne cace bee nothing worth muste fall grounde therefore let v flatter ourselues fondnesse ende must fayne come hath bene treated heeretofore namely god haue thousande article one let v keepe v entering contention also let v stoutly withstande fancy whiche diuell putteth heade go make v chafe agaynst god hee tempte v set v fire grudging stubbornnesse lette thrust downe though whole hundredes replyes myght seeme fay e good done sayde god began yet againe speake whirlewinde saying vnto iob gyrde vp thy loynes like man saying haue heard heretofore nowe man myght thinke straunge god shoulde still speake terribly vnto iob defie mocke presumptuousnesse seeing vtterly cast downe himselfe hereby may see humbled yet stil remnant pryde hidde v appeareth god must fayne purge v certaine iob confessed himselfe bee wretched creature man value vsed feinednes spake hart gaue yet see fully tamed come meeke humble minde desiring bee wholy obedient vnto god yet needed chastized still bee better schooled ende might acknowledge himselfe therevpon yeelde glory prayse vnto god bicause sayde alwayes backenooke although men brought vnto god desirous frame themselues god wyll yet throughly clenzed pryde firste god perceyueth still secrete disease behind behoueth amende lo heere notable text haue wee slightly consessed god afflicting v rightfull acknowledged sinnes wee woonder hee shoulde go forwarde still handling v roughly make v say howe ought god rigorous towardes mee hee knoweth haue humbled selfe whereas haue done amisse haue acknowledged faultes yea euen faultes consesse accuse selfe ynough vvhat woulde hee haue seemeth v god sort doth v wrong hee stryke v styll wee haue woorde twayne confessed selues sinner yea lette v looke iob hee onely confessed himselfe bee man value also thought hys hearte restreyned himselfe replying striken feare glory god appeared vnto yet notwithstanding needed styll haue god thunder shewe himselfe terrible whirlewinde make afrayde iob hauing bin throwne downe sorte neede bee put feare styll ende hee myghte knowe himselfe better see owne wretchednesse forget rebelliousnesse ala nede yet notwithstanding ye shall see number haue nothing hypocrisie yea shamelesnesse wring theyr mouth aside say true haue doone amisse haue said word way scorne mockerie men accept posthast rightuous handle nicely secmeth bee vnreasonably dealte sayde afore although wee haue felte sinnes yea euen earnestly confessed withoute feygning desired hartely god shoulde gouerne v haue dominion ouer v yet dooth followe naughtinesse lurking styll behinde thoughe bee knowne truely owne seeming pride v bycause see presently within day twoo woulde bee seene god remedied therefore let v thinke straunge god shoulde speake vnto v whirlewinde thunder euen shall haue scourged v till let v woonder though god continue speake vntoo v hee knoweth good cause although perceyue fault v yet let v cease condemne selues yea although none v presently yet doth god knowe might fall day morrow yea euen euerie minute houre therefore god chastizing v vseth preseruatiue medicine vvherefore let v beare paciently affliction god sendeth v assuring selues meanes procureth furthereth welfare nowe let v come matter god handleth first defieth iob saying girde vp thy loynes like lustie stoute follow true hebrew one worde man howbeit importeth much valiant hardie stoute couragious man meening shewe thy valiantnesse therein see god speaketh person iob also mankinde without exception shoulde say let men bring force let put themselues good aray list let come furniture shall gaine agaynst mee therefore defiance god maketh great small shewe cannot bring power shall bee able match first poynt howbeeit seemeth verie commonly knowne man hee woulde bee adrad take vppon matche himselfe god demaunded whether intent mount highe dispossesse god superioritie ouer woulde answere trowe wee worse madde yet notwithstanding carping agaynst wee wee iustifie selues excuze faultes spyting god warning agaynst therefore wee enter intoo battell wee beare selues hande wee able make part good according verie deede man bee afrayde god maiestie hee presume compasse thing taketh hand meanes bee hilde backe rashnesse doo carie v farre away fight agaynst god token wee imagine great power selues therfore without cause doth god defie v heere eueriechone v greate small shewing madnesse v bid battell sort wee shall neuer bring enterprise let v marke well god sayth girde vp thy loynes like man therein declareth presuming vpon owne strengthes purpose vvhat maketh v bolde presume bee rightuous desire seeme wise wee surmyze thing wee ouertaken wyth fonde opinion valour v wee woulde neuer bee bold incounter fashion god therfore expresse mention made men power strength end shewe weene themselues haue smoke may well make theselues beleue strong yet god knoweth taketh bee herewithall sheweth haue counterfeyt humilitie wee see woont many men lie pretende humilitie god say confesse thing mouth thinke hart among papist much preaching humilitie yet al saying wretched sinner ceasse haue cleane contrarie meaning whiche deserue well god although bee sinner yet haue satisfaction redeeme themselues yee see papistes swolne pryde lyke toades yet meanewhile pretende condemne themselues alwayes guiltie god yea number euen among v full fraught maner pride bee short men cannot shewe fignes humility way mockage bycause beleeue themselues valour cause god declareth heere wee haue throughly tryed owne strength well considered v shall finde ende nothing v arme apparell selues encounter agaynst yee see thing wee haue marke effect lord bereueth v thing haue ende haue aduauntage v wee haue well looked v let v onely consider maner one shall well see ther neither power strength v wherewith bende selues agaynst vvhereas mention made girding vp loynes spoken maner time countrey also bycause men went long garment set foorth eyther battel iourney girded vp loynes weld themselues better god sheweth men haue done al end shalbe co founded therfore let v attempt vaunt ourselues shall alwayes argue foolish pride v let v win spur condemning selues onely meane v get fauour god sight according sayde shall bee quitte hand learne condemne selues pride fall iustling hand strog v wee muste needes bee crushed broken peeces vnder feele heauie load v beare nowe sayde vvilt thou ouerthrowe iudgements condemne iustifie thy selfe thou intende see first thou beest able beate downe proude folke worlde heere god entereth cace hee hath pleade agaynst iob wit whether shall bee rightuous iobs intent blaspheme god lewdly haue sayde afore hee woulde rather haue dyed hundred thousande time haue conceyued cursed thought purpose condemne god yet al soeuer man iustifie himselfe hath imagination running head must need condemne god needes mainteyne owne cace hee must needes ouerthrowe iudgement god matter hath bene layde forth afore neuerthelesse must needes brought remembrance againe superfluous repetition holy ghost setteth downe therefore let v marke well whensoeuer man vndertaketh mainteyne owne cace rightfull hys meening codemne god howbeit directly although intend set purpose hart yet doth effect vvhy god cannot beiust iudge also vntill damnable long men haue rightuousnesse themselues shall god iudge hee condemneth v bee rightuousnesse v dooth hee v wrong therfore must owne rightuousnesse cast say wee must acknowledge nothing iniquitie v haue one sparke vertue v allowable starke filthinesse dung infection till wee bee come poynt god cannot bee iudge worlde therefore whosoeuer mainteyne owne quarell make himselfe men beleeue pure innocent ouerthroweth god iudgement vttermost power therewithall condemneth cruell sayde ende god may bee rightuous mouthes muste bee stopped worlde confesse themselues indaungered vntoo god sainct paules wordes thirde romanes sith contrarie part shall bee rightuousnesse god hee shall bee vtterly defeated wee syde haue mouthes open wee may come replie agaynst pleade owne cace vvee see naught sayde heere vntoo iob hee ment ouerthrowe god iudgement condemne iustifying himselfe nowe befell vnto iob angelicall holinesse alwayes euen middes temptation protest himselfe willing giue glorie vntoo god yea gaue without feyning ala shall become v frayle haue beene trayned long aforehande feare god hee haue wee practise haue wee giuen selues haue wee knowledge giuen vnto haue wee humilitie ala farre wide yet notwithstanding wee see hee ouershotte yea euen farre condemne god cleering himselfe let v consider murmuring god layeth affliction vpon v howe go wee woorke like woode beastes passion headie pitie see therefore may rightly layde charge labour ouerthrowe god iustice intent might bee iudge worlde wee condemne going aboute mainteyne owne rightuousnesse ought teach v well holde selues short oft intende pleade agaynst god thinke selues haue good cace ought make v say thus harte ala shoulde fall exalting selfe agaynst hath made fashioned mee shoulde intende rob rightuousnesse cannot god hath perfection rightuousnesse himselfe therefore ouershoot selfe sort striuing agaynst must hee confounde must needes turne destruction lo ought holde v awe therfore whensoeuer happen grudge agaynst god cannot receyue affliction hande let v enter owne minde consider selues one wee woulde bereeue god rightuousnesse put beeing iudge worlde seeing let v keepe selues blasphemy abhorre come vntoo knowing wee bee entered intoo deepe dungeon whereout hard v get againe let v lift vp selues agaynst god rather let v caces humble selues lo ought residue shall reserued till morow morning nowe let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement sinnes praying make v feele better haue hitherto done may learne glorifie yea eue wise may vtterly throwne downe knowing nothing wickednesse cursednesse v glorifying wee side may haue mouthes shette respect presuming thing caried away example proude thinke themselues beare much rule god learne knowe wee bee ende may yeelde selues wholly subiect maiestie meanes may acknowledge v auow v people part consider howe much bound vnto may please graunt grace onely v c clv sermon second vpon xl chapter sermon yet still vpon verse vpon text added cast thine eye vpon loftie pull dovvne destroy vvicked rase place hyde dust binde face darknesse vvill say thine ovvne hande saue thee looke vpon bemoth vvhom made vvith thee vvill eate hay oxe strength loynes force nauill bellie setteth vp tayle ceder sinevves coddes interlaced togither bone brasse small bone barres yron beginning god vvayes made casteth svvorde agaynst mountaynes bring forth grasse beastes feeld play keepeth among reedes moyst place shadovves shall couer vvillovves riuer hide beholde hee drinketh vp riuers astonished hopeth iordan shall passe throte man vvill take nose vvith hooke strike wee sawe yesterday men chafe frette aduersities go lawe god intending condemne iustifying themselues although man speake mouth yet verie deede hee go cleere himselfe hee condemneth god shall haue better ende staffe cause sayde haue layde strength togither shall nothing neither shall euer bee able match hath created v holdeth thing hande shewed vnto v bee respect god ende make v lay away crowing good sooth looking men state considering therewithall glorie maiestie god thing bring vnto lowlinesse men looke singly vpon themselues leaue presume lift vp themselues still vnto vaine trust lift vp eye aloft behold god afterward come downe themselues combes quite cutte therefore sayde thine arme like arme god rorest thou voyce doth man looke vpohis arme yea vpon force worlder shall find comparison infinite power beareth sway ouer true haue sayde alreadie men foolish ynough think owne strength great long loke soone god weth himselfe al thing must need brought nothing ende thing may touch v better iob willed cloth himselfe glorie power maiestie maner speaketh scripture god thing selfe sheweth else heauen tha imperiall kingly roabe god bee inforced reuerentnesse beholding creature thing serueth set foorth maiestie god end honour becommeth v deserueth nowe let v go seeke like apparellings shall either tayler make imbroyderer decke vvhere shall find stuffe may cloth selues like glorie god clothed nedes must men wittes blinde forgetfull grudge god take part prouoke themselues deserue horrible condemnation ye see thing haue marke effect whereas mention made god arme haue exposition howe god arme selfe inuisible hath armes hand speaking meene whole god himselfe vnknowne vnto v howbeeit hee sheweth himselfe woorkes insomuch heauen sayde garment sometime termed seate therewithall sayd also visible shape maiestie much bee sayde earth short aboue beneath god sheweth himselfe v beeing sayde afore thing able comprehende insomuch witnesse v infinite maiestie god therefore let v learne although cannot attayne mount high knowe god yet notwithstanding forasmuch leaueth v without witnesse sheweth himselfe v much behoofe let v learne say beholde euen ereatures applie thing vse namely wee may perceyue howe one god hathe made doth gouerne thing moreouer touching sayde roring voyce true men crie loude according see whet tongue blaspheme spyte god sayde psalme wicked think ynough bee proude among men accuse one falsely defie another worke treason wicked practises also cast vp groyne agaynst heauen assault god himselfe pride great dare buskle agaynst maiestie god nowe yee see men rore yet god make holde peace well ynough hee list maner vvee haue seene heeretofore according also sayde psalme thunder god voyce sith thunder maketh hilles rore ayre sort clouen asunder earth quaketh tree torne vp rockes shaken say wee heare v shall presume speake agaynst god hee hath voyce well ynough put v silence let v crie aloude full throte yet god bee heard spyte teeth moylings must fall grounde furthermore although god thunder fashion yet must hee needes stoppe mouthes shewing v make outcryes layde downe needeth come downe heauen doo shewe himselfe heere visible shape like hee made thing woorde thing vphilde power thereof hee bythe cause v folter tongue also wit al power god hath diuerse maners speaking wherby putte th silence would carpe agaynst shall haue audience therfore let v learne holde peace willingly put vr yesterdayes lesson lay hande vpon mouth say resist diuelishnes pride notwithstanding naturally bold aduance selues god therwithall learne giue glorie simplie vnto god confessing nothing wretchednesse selues vvhen confounded owne good god voyce onely dreadful vnto v also wil cheere v vp open mouth may speake freely vvherof cometh faithfull vaunt themselues diuell despise death vvherof commeth boldnesse call vpon god father protest selues bee child bicause hild mouthes shet condemned haue learned wee bee nothing vanitie therfore haue mouthes shet sort chalenge thing selues ne maintein quarell passe vnder condemnation willingly god infinit goodnesse giueth v libertie speake onely among men also call vpon frankly doubting voyce caried vp throne angel heard accepted ye see thing gaine simplie holde peace graunt glorie belongeth vnto god disable themselues vtterly haue mouthes opened hath bin declared contrarywise talkatiue puffe vp themselues pride maintein owne rightuousnesse must faine feele terrible god voice besides let crie much list yet god spite teeth breake peeces shall cry ceasse vanish away shall bee done hee hath ouerterrible voyce nowe speaking also another reason alledged humble men withall god defieth witte whether destroye proude looke whether roote wicked shew themselues haue somewhat whereof boast cannot dare commence quarell agaynst god heere still comparison haue touched knowe god nature office wee must fall considering selues syde ende may giue greater glosse god incomprehensible glorie also manifolde miseryes selues bee short wee bee done vnderstande text belongeth god destroy proude onely looke roote wicked vtterly insomuche shall seeme haue theyr full scope bee cheefe ruffe shall swept away cleane earth god chalengeth himselfe nowe men doo like haue wee looke able destroy enimies specially make cleane riddaunce wicked furthermore let v marke heere god speaketh absolute lawlesse power haue sayde earst power matched rightfulnesse cause mention made purposely proud wicked sort therefore let v marke well two thing namely god doth magnifie himselfe forasmuch onely looke ouerthrow destroy wicked yet notwithstanding spareth creature vttereth sayde power vpon proude wicked god almightie yet howsoeuer worlde go haue rightuousnesse knowne go haue men confesse according thing selfe sheweth vanquish affection lustes suche yeelde submitte themselues maiestie contrary part thundereth vpon presume much vpon themselues become prowde vse replying incountering god make mortall enemie wee haue spoken god voyce must wee nowe speake looke countenaunce faythfull beseech god shew countenance thing wherein consisteth al ioy happinesse welfare according sayde psalme lorde shew v thy countenance shalbe safe al welfare contentation wish vvhat thing desired v god countenance like contrarywise turneth backe vpon v hideth himselfe v must needes forlorne heart thing wherein man may finde rest onely knowing god hath care long god vouchsaseth haue eye vppon v wee haue whereof glad bee sure mainteine v wee shall neede bee afrayde thing god forget v wittes ende without good cause wee bee left vp satan pray vpon hundred thousand deathes beset v round remedie v vve see god looke thing wished specially come humblenesse desirousnesse true intent stick vnto loke aloft sayd another place haue foreheade brasse puffed vp vaunt selues god spite must bee faine looke vpon v another maner countenance shall serue cheere v vp destroy v vtterly needeth one looke god ridde men quite cleane worlde cast proude looke agaynst aud therefore let v learne sayde heere namely god looking vpon proude sort destroy vtterly bycause haue wicked looke vvherefore let v cast downe heades go vnto god obeysance therewithall let v pray lighten eye may seeke father looke vpon v wise may haue thereby perfectnesse ioy true contentation rest selues vpon way shewed v streyne scripture speaketh oftentymes god office ouerthrow aduaunce themselues according sayde whosoeuer exalteth himselfe shall bee brought low let v mark well god deadly vnreconciliable foad kepe within bound ne acknowledge owne slendernesse humbling themselues needes make themselues great men god must fain incounter two must iustle togither vvere throughly considered need many sermon bring v lowlinesse horrible thing wormes earth come set purpose fight agaynst god yet presume themselues think valour al beare themselues hand either wise vertuous rightuous say make warre god though speake mouth yet one deed therfore god telleth v man cannot iustifie himselfe assaulteth heaue throughly persuaded doctrine proude folkes god enimies prouoke wrath themselues would walk another maner meeldnesse simplicitie seemeth v god ought shrinke away make v roome marke pray men besot theselues neuerthelesse woulde nowadayes herken doctrine frame selues thereafter shoulde length perceyue experience nought sayde countenance lorde vpon loftie one roote worlde none meeke one haue euerlasting heritage howbeit intent may profit lesson let v marke well proude one pryde alwayes knowne vnto men condemne whosoeuer trusteth owne strength whosoeuer presumeth vpon owne rightuousnesse wisedome whosoeuer sotteth himselfe owne greatnesse credit short whosoeuer wilfully ouerpasseth bound thing proude bodie god men ouerpasse boundes euen thinke themselues haue sparke goodnesse themselues vntil time wee bee ye woulde say quite cleane emptied neither meekenesse meeldnesse v furthermore god shall haue giuen v grace bestowed giftes holy spirite vpon v let make v set vp bristle agaynst offend wee haue good sharpe vnderstanding commeth owne moother wit therefore wee must take occasion exalt selues much bound vnto god againe let greatest indeuer serue smallest let despise god hath inhonoured setting like degree imagin thing v puffed vp pride disdaine neighbour reason god gracious giftes presumptuousnesse offendeth god prouoketh vengeance agaynst v vvhat bee done wee haue god agaynst v let v learne distrust thing selues conceyue presumption may lift v vp short one worde let v say nothing agayne god aduaunce v honour aboue men indue v vertues let v acknowledge come furthermore let v louing forbeare neighbour wrong despise god child well leastwise created one selfe likenesse nature v thus much concerning sayde god office b e downe pride men looke addeth therevnto w cked shewe enimie wicked folke generall howbeeit forasmuch hardly auoyded pryde loftinesse shoulde beare sway forsomuch wicked sort rushe foorth euill bee despysers god therefore heere expresse long discourse lof ie one forget themselues beleeue bee able woorke woonders owne power men proude dispise god surely would holde themselues still giue bridle theyr lustes needes therefore muste pryde carrie v awaye wee vse violence outrage towardes neighbor deuour one fleece another al goodes shewe spite malice token feare god v know much mortall men knowes howe hee hath iourney passe worlde life brittle transitorie certainly brydle himselfe euen onely one respect therefore needes must men bewitched vtterly ignorant themselues theyr state ouershoote themselues verely cause prophet abacuck sayeth rightuous man shall liue fayth auoucheth contrarie part loftinesse shall beaten downe vvhat meeneth loftinesse meeneth sturdinesse god scornefulnesse agaynst men howbeeit hee vseth woorde loftinesse bycause men forget themselues wittes ouershoote themselues sort chafe agaynst god nowe might bee demaunded whether god doth roote proud folk worlde lykelyhod rather spareth layeth reynes brydle looce theyr necke tryumph theyr pleasure howbeeit let v marke v appoynt terme say suche houre god shall confounde destroy proude folke hee howbeeit due season therefore although proude folke beare sway god seeme let doo list yea laugh sleeues though power represse yet hath still office belongeth vnto namely rooting proude wicked sort looke yea sayde scripture sometymes hydeth faythfull one euer forgetteth carefull sheweth himselfe outward working intent trie fayth pacience may seeme v god hath forgotten v daunger specially wee feele blowes finally wee see death present meane wee perceyue god myndeth reach v hande yet euen wee crie vnto ala lorde art thou vvhy hast thou forgotten mee complaint make wee according fleshly vnderstanding god seemeth looke vpon proude hee suffereth cast foorth poyson fashion beareth number outrage enormity commit yea forasmuch time yet come let v tarie till god open eye vpon shall destroyed bee borne withall time god winke let v assure oure selues theyr turne yet come wherein hee looke vpon wrath roote sayde afore lesson ought serue double vse faithful ought take comfort although god deliuer tyrannie wicked first brunt yet haue cause rest vpon vvhy hath giuen ouer office though exalt themselues time yet come shall feede men ox like men know time kill oxe doth god know well ynough day destruction proud wicked ye see first faithfull ought bee pacient see god delay rooting proud wicked sort therfore must holde themselues quiet till thing done meane let proud sort bethinke themselues let v afrayde flatter selues god spare v let v thinke bee scaped hande neither let v gather boldnesse attempt one thing vnder colour beareth v winketh v ende hee looke vpon v shall fault bewrayed greater confusion let v marke well although men perceiue god iudgements eyesight day day yet must therfore ceasse walke feare carefulnesse rather brideled worde god herein also doeth fayth shew selfe namely middes aduersities fasten eies vpon god gracious promise side state wicked seemeth better state godly let v ceasse hope continually euerlasting life although seene vvhy bycause god hath promised whatsoeuer commeth mouth cannot deceiuable ye see sort ought put lesson vre let v see like thing reported heere god wee destroy wicked one onely looke wee rid earth proud folke god thinketh good ala let v learne giue glorie sheweth himselfe iudge worlde hath power hande vseth order vprightnesse fault bee found therwith although thing seeme oftentimes troublesome order v yet let v ceasse looke still power god sheweth therwithall goodnesse haue cleare eies surely wee shall neuer misse espie discerne god gouerneth worlde rightfully yee see way put lesson practize wee knowe god himselfe hath vttered himselfe effect experience must come downe selues examin owne weaknesse wee may humble selues attempt quarell god hathe perfection rightuousnesse power effect wee haue beare minde specially let v wey well saying added conclusion wit man power hee able saue himselfe owne hande sayde god confesseth man might passe therefore v hathe power spoken heere hee needeth resort heauen refuge call vppon god saue euery man might saue hymselfe saying bring men knowe haue neede another bodie saue themselues haue life hand neither meanes warrant let v consider wee liue selues haue meane mainteyne selues yea although whole worlde fauored v might seeme wee thing yet nothing must faine depende wholy vpon god saued hande let serue one poynt nowe first sight seemeth bee meetely common thing men taught nature resort vnto god yet see yee drunkennesse rather madnesse whiche caryeth v away euerie v opinion hee saue warrant himselfe hath tolde v satan hath put false dotage intoo braine power rightuousnesse wisedome selues let v marke god vpbrayding v none v bee saued owne hand common schoole poynt serueth shew v must distrust selues al owne power bee vtterly disabled may haue rest stay contentment onely vvhat saueth v hande god wherefore euen owne mere free goodnesse onely man thing himselfe god woulde enuie woulde rather say verie well let v part stake mine thine hath god neede borrowe v hath hee neede catche due right v furnish hymselfe withall let v imagin conceyts let v confesse much one droppe safetie selues wee must runne simply vnto god wee haue marke thys streyne neuerthelesse true somtimes wicked shall bee destroyed throwne downe man hande ende iustice ordeyned sit seate iustice holde sworde hande thing themselues bycause god hath appoynted bycause pleaseth bee serued instrument meete meanes god hath ordeyned world set maiestie power rightuousnesse shoulde deface hinder knowing glorie rather shoulde giue greater brightnesse furthermore wee see howe hee worketh pleaseth without putting man hande conclusion tolde v heere god hath created beastes sea lande euen terrible beastes able make v quake intent shuld bee sawcie come set selues heere expresse mention made behemoth nowe woorde behema signifyeth simplie beast vnder name ox beastes comprehended heere sayde plurall number looke vpon behemoth created thee although worde behemoth bee plurall number hebrew yet spoken one beast mo howbeeit forasmuch god ment betoken heere one sort beastes cause setteth behemoth plurall number neuerthelesse cannot bee coniectured kinde beast speaketh except bee elephant reason hougenesse beastes bodie euident speaketh neither ox horse beastes sayde looke mee vpon behemoth cateth ay oxe god maketh expresse difference betweene kinde beast whereof hee speaketh ox therefore without troubling selues much matter let v marke god text hath chozen kinde beast woonderfull v elephant hath strong bodie sayde great bone brasse little bone gristle men terme barres yron incredible thing v acquainted see beast ought afrayde onely looke bignesse houge seeme bee thing made arte nature wee wize ynough needed go selues behold maiestie god howbeeit men must bee sent beastes bycause vnthankefulnesse know god sheweth himselfe vnto therfore reason blockishnesse vnthankfulnesse wee haue neede mirrours set v respect elephant like beastes seeing perceyue god hath created beast bignesse shape although wee none warrant power yet haue wee good cause holde downe heades woorshippe high maiestie sheweth selfe wilde beastes purposely sayde elephantes created v intent shewe v god hath made difference betweene thing himselfe listed hee hath set woonderfull order worlde men must needes bee rauished besides themselues thinke thereon leastwise haue discretion marke thing wide open behold man hath little bodie neuerthelesse appointed bee lorde maister worlde vvherefore thing created onely vse see elephant strong able strike great sort one stroke foote sith wee see suche thing order worlde doth well shewe vnto v god hath done v great fauour making v little bee yet notwithstanding hath shewed brute beastes also insomuche knowledge thing put selues ynough v wee looke vpon beastes wee shall finde thing astonish wittes therewithall also let v marke well gouerning shoulde go greatnesse might elephant well reigne ouer v wee see suffer themselues bee ruled men like little coltes stable also see side god hath left destitute many thing beholde houge body yet notwithstanding cannot bow legges faine stande continually elephant downe vpon ground hee cannot get vp againe see force one side default wit beastes cannot bow legges faine sleepe standing insomuch elephant layd flat cannot ryse againe alone man good rayze vp whole house ought sight make v glorifie god goodnesse whereof long elephant deuour v eate hay ox seing beast able execute crueltie roote mankinde worlde doo feede grasse mountaynes hyde themselues vnder shadowes tree yet notwithstanding breake rage might doo reason hougenesse whereof commeth god tame ende giue v roome dwell heere beneath againe whereas wee bee hemmed sydes many sortes wilde beastes coulde wee continue vndeuoured one day worlde god restreyned rage secrete brydle therefore let v learne looke vppon god workes wee may worthily magnifie power goodnesse wisedome rightuousnesse humbling yea euen vtter disabling selues according deede nothing nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgment sinnes praying make v feele may learne walke feare put v wholy handes without presuming thing vpon selues rather acknowledging weaknesse infirmitie beseeching helpe v forasmuch shoulde bee ouercome hundred thousande time day defence sheeld safegarde may please garde v froal spirituall foe deliuer v temptation giuing v power outstande tyll haue taken v earthly lyfe continuall battell may please graunt grace onely v c clvj sermon third vpon xl chapter first vpon xlj chapter sermon yet still vpon last ten verse vpon text following canst thou dravv vp leuiathan vvith hooke binde tongue vvith corde vvilt thou put hooke nozethrils perce chavves vvith angle vvill make much intreatance thee vvill speake thee fayre vvill make couenant vvith thee vvilt thou take seruant euer vvilt thou play vvith vvith littlebird vvilt thou bind thy yong maydes shall companion make feast shall merchant deuide among vvilt thou fill basket vvith skin fisher dorser vvith head lay thy hande vpon remember battell go behold hope disappoynted shall fall dovvne sight xlj chapter man cruell dareth vvake vppe vvho hee shall stande presence vvho vvill preuent vvill satisfie vnder heauen mine vvill conceale member povver comlinesse making vvho vvill open foreparte garment vvho shall come vvith double bridle vvho shall open gate face rovves terrible teeth scale strong sheeldes fast set print seale one clozed another vvind cannot get shet one vvithin another cleaue togither cannot sundred neezing like shining light eies davvning day mouth go lampes sparkes fire leape smoke steameth noze seething pot cauldron breath setteth cole fire flame flasheth mouth neck dvvelleth strength labour reiected face partes flesh knit togither euery one substantiall selfe vvithout fleeting hart substantiall stone hard neather milstone mightie afrayd vvhen riseth vp vvaues troubled vvhen svvorde toucheth hee vvill stay speare dart habergeon regardeth yron stravv brasse rotten vvood archer cannot put flight stone sling turned stubble vnto esteemeth dart much stubble laugheth shaking speare vnder sharpe stone spreadeth sharpe poynted thing vpon myre maketh deepe seeth like cauldron maketh sea like pot oyntment maketh path shine esteemeth deepe olde thing dominion vpon earth made afrayde nothing beholdeth high thing king ouer child pride shewed yesterday god set forth many liuing thing earth witnesse power glory bringeth one side elephant side whale serueth conclude matter although men see god yet ought perceyne maiestie beholding beastes hee hath created specially able fray v looke ende god might glorified much hand againe sawe yesterday discoursed concerning elephant terrible houge beast ynough scare v wittes tremble sight beast play bold fellowes god contende chastizeth v stomacke matter hee intendeth humble v fooles murmure iustice gainsay thing desire deface diminish soueraintie seeing beastes make men tremble let consider owne madnesse matching themselues god howbeeit go whereas heere long discourse vppon sayde kynde beastes lande whiche sayde elephant albeeit bee named heere generall terme behemoth also vppon leuiathan wee haue marke therevpon howe menne haue beene opinion allegorie diuell spoken heere rather eyther elephant vvhale haue gone aboute proue fantasticall deuice theyrs ende sayde sayd vvhale king child pride speaking kinde beast touched yesterday sayde god maketh eate hay grasse like ox vvee see intent shewe v god mightie power thing bee seene describe diuell v touching woorde leuiathan whole scripture signifieth vvhale see bee hundred fourth psalme hebrew woorde leuiathan translated vvhale well ynough knowne prophete speaketh god wonder men see sea yea much vpon lande one peremptorie reason shewe v must take text simplie standeth shiftingly haue seene heretofore god intent teache men grosse homely maner according owne small capacitie dooing therof end mightie power better proued vnto moreouer ment also vpbrayd follie dare set themselues forsomuch verie beastes able reproue vvherfore let v marke well heere god giueth men lesson thereby skorne pryde sending brute beast could take place spoken diuell wheras whale king child pryde beast hath affection rather sayd compare men vvhale lord say true men lift vp sheelds verie hygh fetch leapes aboue cloudes haue gathered force presumed vttermost comparison vvhale vvhen man hath vaunted himselfe vttermoste let come incounter whale whale shall haue cause vaunt man compare house tower man compare artillerie man compare mountayne hee shall finde quality yea hee shall finde terrible force able turne vp shippes vpside downe man approche vntoo strength vvee see god hath shewed expresly wee shall always ouercome vvhales therfore pryde fond specially become bold lift vp ourselues go plucke thing belong robbe ryghtuousenesse wee must needes bee put shame yea euen without god comming downe heauen without shewing maiestie verie beast ynough maynteyne honour neuerthelesse truely conueying discourse one man myght well vse similitude whale elephant make men perceyue greatly power diuell ought fray v seing termed prince aire world without cause doth god giue title intent seing bee weake selues haue myghtie strog enimie walke feare therfore may well one take good warning subiect god must bondslaues satan hee shall ouermayster v well ynough wee shall haue strength withstand example wheras creation worlde spoken moyses treateth angel ment teacher little vnlerned one therfore setteth thing seene eye yet present lyght perceyued must leade v yet wit espying lyght heauenly kingdome fayth though bee hidden v presently forasmuchas wee see god maiestie shyneth foorth euery lette v vnderstand farre greater fulnesse perfection lyght angel thing concerne heauenly lyfe ye see good conueyance go degree least thing greatest lowest hyghest yet howsoeuer deale must hold v still simplicitie text euill thing dally holie scripture transforming intoo allegory nother ought allegory bee drawen naturall meening wee see sainct paule doth epistle galathians place therfore let v come backe againe matter wee began god doth make triumphes bothe sea land ende men shoulde knowe shall alwayes bee confounded pryde set themselues hee spoken manie sort beastes heere setteth elephant v terrible must needes amaze v howge bignesse body wee behold miracle without number vve see one side surmount v see side god hath giuen thing hee hath voutsafed giue v yea euen owne free goodnesse therfore let v learne shall gayne nothing exalting ourselues shal surmounted brute beast haue done yet notwithstanding vnthankefulnesse bewrayeth selfe yeelde slender nigardly recompence vnto god benefit hee hath bestowed vpon v long wee brute beastes said yesterday elephant created v made preciouser mould qualitie v excellent nothing maketh difference betwixt v god wee see elephant haue terrible force notwithstanding bold bend themselues agaynst v go hyde themselues moyst place cannot haue couert commodiouse seing see one side greatly bee bounde vnto god therfore wee ought good reason acknowledge owne weaknesse mention made brute beastes durst come neere much looke vppon god restreyned god leadeth v sea sheweth v also haue wherwith pull v downe reason greate multitude diuersitie fisshes seene insomuch euen heathen misbeleeuing wryters constreyned say wheras men sawe manie miracle vpon land sea true storehouse woonders nature also eue respect anye one sorte kynd exaple let v take whale incredible thing see houge creature liuing water able fashion mould great howge strong beast seene lykelyhood come foorth pray vpon land shuld foode ynough suffize water also see bone backebones bone see yron steele woonder looke vpon flesshinesse therfore man neede greate rich shuld interteyne bodye sted turne god hath appointed world keepe therfore hath prouided thing vvherfore sith wee see let v learne submit ourselues else shall neede none iudges condemne v brute beastes nother shall neede euidence cast v creature dispersed world well water vpon land away singlenesse stand v better sted curiouse exposition deuysed allegorimakers serched ribbes backebones treated also skin short pece wherin found toy make holie scripture noze wax transforming naturall sense vvherfore wee beare away one foresayd article shall neede none witnesse cast v god tha thing shewed brute beastes shall wee haue profited greatly howbeeit come condemning god sight haue good instruction giuen v receyue first intent wee may ashamed taught vvhales elephant let v vnderstand god sending v euen bycause vntowardnesse wee bee spytefull froward wicked crabbed nature cannot bee brought reason therfore god fayne shame v sending v beastes also wilfulstubbornnesse v whatsoeuer told v though want layd open face yet euer seeke startingholes shun god iudgement vttermost power god must bee fayne breake hardenesse mayne force make v bow vnder therfore elephant treade v vnder feete tra ple vpon belly v well woorthie seing wee glorifie hath made well v yeld due honour howbeit let v take good worth god sendeth v schole learne humble selues besides deserue swallowed vp vvhales haue sea ouerwhelme whole earth hath bin declared heretofore god graciouse goodnesse voutsafeth lodge v heere maynteyne v notwithstanding deserue drouned euery minute houre vvherfore let v contented god giueth v instruction bothe vpon sea land al thing ordeyned turne welfare according also shall wee turne away owne rechlesnesse ignorance naughtinesse thus yee see che f poynt wee haue marke text howbeit vnfold description peece peece let v marke sayd god declareth intent speaketh vvhale vvho sayeth god stand presence seing man dareth waken vp whale com neere sayth dareth maynteyne himselfe mee comparison haue touched alreadye witte creature nothing themselues small portion power god astonish v infinite maiestie doo vvhat whole world respect god sayd holdeth bothe heauen earth needeth stretch armes imbrace greate circuit al shet cloce hand whale houge masse fleshe euer hee haue yea though hee neuer much sea verie small peece besides infinite number fisshes greate smal sea god hath made gouerneth whale also comprised seing god glorie comprehe deth thing yea comprehendeth nothing ought wee sore astonished sillie beast scareth v shewed confirmation therof sayd thing man say true whale terrible thing god yea would god answer whale dart shall cast stone sling behoueth v knowe god hath printed marke power whale greate beast intent men knowe proceedeth hand hee serueth turne apply vse hee listeth insomuch whale ought sight bee considered god shuld cast stone sling ayre rang astonished seing thing hand haue good cause tremble neuerthelesse lord meeneth driue v yet must wee need bee abasshed first brunt end wee may yeeld deserued reuerence calleth allureth v intent find ioyfulnesse yet come till haue bene vtterly beaten downe therfore must first go feare daunt v wise may able stand may find ourselues vtterly vndone east away god shuld vtter power v behoueth v knowe shall feare asswaged wit wee hold father yet shall neuer yeeld due reuerence except daunt v tame v wise v knowe become thing wee haue remember streyne let v followe generall lesson vnpossible mortal creature stand god stand first formest must need cast v flat ground afterward set v vp againe wil hold owne fall playing lustie tall ladds shall neuer bring purpose passe shall rather bee cause decay woord stand betokeneth man neuer haue good cace maynteyning ryghtuouse wise must first vtterly disabled acknowledge god hath myght power ryghtuousenesse cannot ouerwhelmed owne nature true god would stand also lifteth v vp aboue heauens respect body yet raysing v vp beaten downe let v marke well greate oddes betweene mennes desyring somwhat themselues taking vpon bee wise ryghtuouse betweene vtter disclayming goodnesse therevpon resort vnto god pray set good state forsomuchas vtterly bereft glorie haue nothing themselues shamefull confusion vvhen haue learned lesson able stand god acknowledge nothing v filthinesse dung gay likelyhod wee weene ourselues haue nothing vanitie opinion haue conceyued beguile v whe throughly persuaded wil god lift v vp wil think ourselues beholden mere grace thing wil glorifie father giuer vnto v yea euen without bound thervnto without finding anie desert v generall principle faith flesh must keepe silece behoueth v vnderstand bee lustinesse v withereth away hand needeth one blast vpon v wee fade away without hartinesse strength ryghtuousnesse cursednesse pray marke generall principle fayth ende grace manifested v lord iesus christ may knowne haue recourse thervnto looking eyther beginning full perfecting saluation elsewhere god voutsafing worke freely say without bynding side without bringing thing owne behalfe cause hee expresly addeth preuent mee satisfie hee say wee pleade agaynst hee must needes bee det bee bound vnto v wee must haue ryght interest shall man bee found may preferre title vntoo god say god bound vntoo wee see cleane contrarywise wee hold thing side oweth nothing vnto v yet notwithstading wilful needes coted let extended generally teach v wee must humble selues vnder god mightie hand confessing bothe wise rightuouse mightie thing doeth sainct paule sheweth eleuenth romaynes although alledge text taken holie scripture yet doeth reherse doctrine purpose treateth god free election sheweth god choze listed heires ouerlasting lyfe also forsooke listed man demaund reason v knowe nother lawfull v seeke ought bee sted reason vnto v hee doeth thing vniustly bycause secretes mynd hidden incomprehensible v wayes vnknowne v howbeeit forasmuch hard men hold themselues quiet doctrine according see doggs bark nowdayes gloriouse beggers intending play greate doctor say comprehend art thou thou wretched dogge doest thou comprehend get thee vp vpon thy dunghill learne knowe thou art forasmuch men proud cannot find hart submit themselues doctrine sainct paule twiteth saying vvho hath giuen aught vnto god step foorth heere greate boldnesse yee alledge owne vertues strength therfore meete shewe god hee nothing bee doone otherwyse appoynt greatly bound vnto ye pretend matter come let v knowe haue giuen yee knowe hee nothing beholden vnto dare yee murmure seing sainct paule dealeth maner wee knowe meening cace god euerlasting election therevpon wee haue remember one principle fayth beleeue god holdeth thing v alledge hath receyued aught hand glorie must giuen vnto wee thinke hee vnderling hee thing bownd vnto v matter lieth well practizing lesson specially flesh tempteth v presumptio pride may restreyned bridle consider matchest thou thyself thou wilt go lawe thy god behoueth thee well armed answer wilt thou say seing thou haste nothing wretchednes cursednesse thee would stad thee hand submit thyself obedience humilitie let v marke also word rightuousenesse men beaten downe shewed v euer imagin concerning merit deseruing work drunkennesse satan hath bewitched mennes vnderstanding opinio deseruing godward kingdome heauen made wage poperie nothing common say men purchace heauen meritorious woorks terme although papist bee forced confesse wee nothing without god grace wee haue alwayes imperfection v yet doo mingle owne woorks god grace man say must prepare receiue god grace worthinesse forced graunt owne vnwoorthinesse conueniencie bycause say conuenient seemely man offer dispoze afore hand receiue god grace expresse belying holie ghoste behold heere saying cleere ynough needeth gloze hath preuented bene afore hand sayeth lord let v marke well heere god bereeueth mankynd false diuelish opinion wherwith besotted saying hee bound vnto v wee vnto wee cannot bring aught vnto nother doth receiue recompence hand seruice wee vnto hee hath neede v see effect wisdome rightuousenesse man beaten downe brought nothing twoo thing make v lift vp ourselues god one wee weene ourselues wise wee think haue rightuousenesse woorthinesse ourselues howbeit god sheweth v one part may wel pratle prate end put v silence well ynough vvhyso title wee pretend let v forbeare selfwyse learne sober lowely let v acquaynt selues god woorkes farre foorth sheweth v always restreyning selues bridle wee passe shewed v holie scripture wee shall guided alwayes holie ghost let v keepe ourselues saying would faine know thing let v selfwise seeking whatsoeuer haue mind vnto ought know let v contented opened v holie scripture specially thing may edifie v fayth feare god meete thing seemeth straunge v yet let v consider god hath spoken therfore must receyue without gaynsaying furthermore god let thing alone tel v behoueth v stoppe without going must inquisitiue owne fancie therfore mark schoole point behoueth v bridle toungs suffer ourselues schollers god seing doth v honour teache v well owne mouthe also holie spirit second point concerneth rightuousenesse conuicted haue woorthinesse v haue done neuer much yet wee bring nothing vnto god wee yeld ourselues giltie much worse men farre giuing themselues good imploy force power euil vntill god haue reformed knowe put vre must pretend haue worthinesse deseruing selues yeeld god honour graunt almightie throughly humbled respect effect thing wee haue beare away text knit vp matter although needfull expedient stand vpon euery woord long discourse made whale yet let v assure selues superfluouse vvee looke slyghtly glauncingly vpon recordes god giueth v maiestie witts well setled marke god sheweth v end might honour accordingly wee needed go selues wee shuld find president ynow bothe power wee behold bothe myghtinesse goodnesse within v without going paule meeneth saying asmuchas haue life mouing sufficiently conuicted though ope eye yet doth god make v feele fingars dwelleth v hee setteth forth himselfe wise wee ought dutie honour notwithstanding fall stubbornesse wheras wee well aduised good discretion neede ye would say tippe one little fingar hold v obedience vnto god bee asmuchas wee ouerpasse make greate reckning god woorks therfore heere made long discourse yea altogether vpon beast seing god maketh heere long anatomie seemeth long deede yet superfluouse bycause wee fleeting wee despize god miracle greate noble euer bee thus ye see wee haue marke first place herewithall sayd wilt thou hold thy seruice wilt thou put bookes noze wilt thou play spaniell bird v wit wee much lesse excuzed wee acknowledge maker seing finde selues confounded making comparison betweene v whale yet men dispute god woorks owne brayne control contented hee woorke lyking one would ouerthrowe possible behold brute beaste men canot tell tame true comparison peculiarly fit respect nother requisite similitude shuld match fully answerably euery poynt serueth shewe sillie beaste hath nother reason vnderstanding hath force make v afraid runne away shall hath made fashioned thing men dare waken vp whale dareth hee step forth make warre liuing god fall carping quareling much lieth behold lord would fayne shewe gentle louing towards v verie deede see willing beare weaknesse play madman wild beastes fall carping openly though wee defiance wee able abyde presence shall bee much terrible v presence vvhale seing sayd whale doo make deepe see like cauldron iumble sea together like pot oyntment according also sayd elephat tha would make riuer iordan passe throte pray wee agast see beaste poynt swallowe vp houge water much agast ought wee maiestie god myght seeme v vvhale might choked middes water yet notwithstanding hee greate houge beaste hee cutteth sea asunder maketh boyle like pot snorting neezing termed ouerturneth shippes like swallowe vp commeth way shall lord neezing greater whale yes hath snorting spoken prophet esay also hundred fourth psalme insomuch god puffe blowe vpon v must needes destroyed first blast seing terriblenesse nozethrils beast breth god welspring power eyther set v vp quicken v ouerthrowe v vndoo v vvee see part set downe touched without cause kind beast picked good instruction leastwyse haue discretion apply thing god make comparison haue spoken vvheras mention made hardnesse whale flesh bone behoueth v come cosideratio vvhat shal become v god lift vp hand v see whale ouerturneth greate shippes drouneth sea hath god barres yron farre harder strike v downe hee list touche v hand let v go iustle seing perceiue well infinite power god arme specially whe armed v may well see treating sort vvhales flesh bone superfluouse talk side let v consider also beast haue power insomuch sayd laugheth shaking speares afrayd swoord weapon thereby shewed v wee armed power god good suretie haue cause afraid take thought thing vvee see god hath giuen strength vnto beast trust protection furthermore let v mark wel al strength power vvhales beast shall perishe terrible euer according also doth perish pleaseth god therfore behoueth v beare mind wee must trust ourselues great follie wee must repaire hath power might self may profit better lesson let v mark forasmuch see god lifted vp trouble whole world must one side learne distrust ourselues disable selues knowing owne infirmity yet notwithstanding ceasse glorie god seing vphilde power lo ought walk lowelinesse one part side whe resorte god leane vnto fauour protectio may defie al enimies world also eue sata al power al euer able practize thus ye see two thing requisite specially lord warneth v perill see thing order wee must haue eye owne weakenesse vtterly distrust selues yet notwithstanding disabling selues ceasse looke vp heauen douting haue good warrant forsomuch wee mainteyned wise presuming vpo ourselues thinketh hath power ca ouerthrowe let v learne chalendge aught ourselues rather abace ourselues vtterly yet notwithstanding conceiue boldnesse vpon trust god protection wee may doubt able ynough defend v hundred thousand deathes sobeit referre selues wholly vnto trust wil always guide v hand although must faine passe trouble disorder world inuironed hundred thousand deathes yet notwithstading make v feele help giue v power get till haue drawne v fully bee come endlesse rest hath prepared v let v fall face good god acknowledgemet sinnes praying make v fele poore miserable vpo knowing goodnesse loue towards v wee may couet nothing yeld due glorie bestowing many graciouse benefites vpon v hath made v lord maisters creature bylowe able scare v witts may vnthankful priuiledge prerogatiue hee hath graunted v homage benefit haue receiued hand wayting haue increase euen till haue brought v ful perfectio let v say almightie god c clvij sermon first vpon xlij chapter iob ansvvered lord sayd knovve thou canst doo thing thought shall kept backe thee vvho hee darkeneth secret vvithout knovvedge spake vnderstoode thing vvonderfull aboue mee haue knovvne herken therfore vvill speake vvill aske thee end thou mayst teach mee haue herd thee vvith myne eare novv myne eye hath seenethee sawe heeretofore frute grew declaration god made vntoo iob whereas hee doubled woordes appeered euidently vnto v much hee profited correction alredye repented touched quicke see god hath taught v oftentymes profiteth v part although think nothing amisse come right point yet shall little preparatiue god therfore must fayne hold teaching v doctrine wee haue herd may better rooted hart wee bee moued settle selues wholly short see repentance perfected first dash god hath planed v neede also poolish v like man maketh peece woorke wood stone hee must haue much heawing way also must lord take v else shall haue small entrance repentance vanish away else continue rude vnperfect thing cause must suffer god patietly correcting v fault cotent one stroke rodde pay v double profit furthermore wee haue herd good instruction welfare haue receiued let v assure ourselues smal tast yet rightly repented haue neede go new vvherfore let v leaue doctrin haue herd let v indeuer profit dayly knowing behoueth v draw neerer nerer vnto god day lyfe stablished still feare loue else without vnstedfast returne old byasse whe think ourselues wholly brought home shall nothing smoke vanish away hand yee see wee haue beare mynd also according iobs example haue cosidered fault one day let v streyne ourselues knowe yet better next day greeued think haue discharged dutie saying one word conceyuing one good thought wee deceyue ourselues repentance must alwayes conquerout insomuch vnfeyned must doubled let v come sayd heere knowe thou canst thing thought shall bee kept back letted thee expound though iob yeelded power might vnto god therwithall also infinite forecast prouide thing guide though say lord knowe thou haste al thing thy hand nothing hidden fro thee thou art priuie thing common maner speche amog hebrewes say thought shall bee letted thee say whatsoeuer thou haste ordeyned commaunded yea whatsoeuer thou haste intended thy mynde shall euery whit bee redily executed thou shalt neede trouble thyselfe though thou letted though thou couldest fayle thing let v marke spoken simply god infinite power twoo saying verified bothe one thing god therfore almightie looke hee purposeth minde execute byandby without lette shoulde seeme iob heere confesseth hee ought protested heretofore god ruleth world yet ceassed murmur seemeth hath profited whit returneth stil foresayd article although god almightie yet fayleth vse ouergreat rigor poore creature suffer much tormeted excessiuely hand howbeit must cosider iob acknowledgeth god almightinesse another maner doone afore wit humbling vnder god mightie hand acknowledging mortall men resist checke sometymes wee say god hath thing hand guiding meane whyle wee ceasse fret repyne thing lyking wherof commeth euen haue throughly conceyued hygh power submit selues considered almightie guideth al thing iustly vprightly good reason handle v weeld v listeth wee keepe mouthes shet without replying thing doth acknowledge god almightinesse vtter disabling ourselues vnder confessing good reason reigne haue authoritie ouer v obey yea constreynt meeke meeld mind doubtlesse true cofessing god almightie wee take vpon v aboue handle mind haue followe will according conceyts imagination ala euill acknowledging almightinesse wee would bee fellowes yea would aboue point therfore let v mark well iob treateth god almightinesse another sense heere hath done heretofore woorshippeth god souerein dominion acknowledgeth al thing must need guided office gouerne men haue cause murmure hee afflicteth v although thing hard troublesome yet must always come point inasmuch rightuouse canot deale amisse becometh v please yeeld ourselues prisoner handled guided pleaseth moreouer hold good thing hand thus ye see wise ought acknowledge god almightie second meber iob defineth god almightinesse behoueth v coceiue speaketh god thoughtes vve see many fantastical person talke god almightinesse fal gazing saying god almightie doth thing god almightie yea must raunge abrode imaginacios god almightinesse ameth dotage common thing vvhereat god almightinesse wil thing inseparable god almightie whatsoeuer man hath forged brayne fie accomplish whatsoeuer hee hath ordeyned owne purpose let v learne knit two thing togither namely almightinesse cause iob said thought shall letted kept backe re reyned fro shuld execute thing men coceiue determine haue will thing god hath ordeyned knoweth good see maner god almightinesse ought knowne v namely end shuld doubt al thing shal done shal haue determined taking co sell hads bycause assignement appoint good done forsomuchas fou taine al wisdome al thing hand nothing hinder accomplishing whatsoeuer hath deuised bee better vnderstoode practising blame god
