almightinesse without cause reason fall seeking matter saying vvhy doth god thing seing hee almightie yea v make play trick fro belo geth determine apoint afterward bring also passe yet notwithstading foreward fellowes take heed grauting power vnto god whe cometh point trust yet verie thing whervnto apply god almightinesse faile keepe promis forasmuch welfare hand wee sure none euil betide v sith hath v protection doubt enimie shall preuayle v say cause minde god almightinesse according shewed v sayd man shall plucke v christ hath taken v keping father hath committed v stronger al vvhy end hath iesus christ alledged v inuincible power god father end wee shuld quiet doubt wil saue v notwithstanding al attepts sata deuise god almightie herein see wee must ioyne god almightinesse good wil euen sheweth word point shall giue ourselues bridle gaze raunge abrode yet shall haue also wherwith beate back skornes find hart play god almightinesse tennisbal example looke vpon papist wil need haue bread chaunged bodie iesus christe thing whiche bread shuld become god proue saying alledge god almightie yes end wil darken sunne turne moone water make earth heauen heauen earth playne mocking god fall treating almightinesse maner ouerthrowing peruerting order laboring might difference betwixt whyte blacke wicked rending asunder god mightie power laying open reproch wherof cometh bycause papist haue yet learned lesson shewed v heere wit god almightie accomplish whatsoeuer purposeth doo purpose god behalf becommeth v looke whither god wil therfore haue god warrat must also extend mightie power performing thing hath ordeyned let v think lord wil haue make almightinesse roue raunge thinke good vvherfore let v beare lesso mind shewed v seing god hath shewed v wil concerning welfare soulehelth assuring v wil mainteyne v end succour v necessity lift v vp whe downe strengthen v weaknesse seyng say haue god apparant al thing let v doubt hath stretched performe whatsoeuer hath spoken v ye see god mouth must agree togither mouth say determinacion must go afterward hand must bring passe thing hath determined haue two thing wit first must submit ourselues wholly god ordinance world good besides wee knowe also charge office gouerne good reason creature suffer themselues ruled take libertie rule themselues submit themselues al point al respect vvhen fully persuaded shal haue profited greatly al life heere followeth immediately bydeth secret without knowledge god hath heretofore vpbrayded iob herewith shuld seeme iob met cofesse deede wit wrapped vp god wisdome folish word reason god woorks owne abilitie take vpon v iudgers hyding wrapping vp secret say brabling men terme euen without skil would wise whe talk fashyon haue bene taught afore ye see wee may take text confessing thing bin cast iobs teeth say ala lord rightly haste thou condemned heere tooke vpon mee wrap vp thy secret without knowing whervnto word reason teded know nowe haue delt folishly mee haue accepted simply whatsoeuer pleased thee apoint haue taken vpon mee play mayster gone schole self lord acknowledge thou hast good right bewrayed follie nowe take maner dothe iob make confession wherin attributeth vnto god matched al knowledge cotrarietie betweene god men god keepeth determinacion secret howbeit knoweth cause doo hath always reason redy shaped side go discouer god lawfull v intangle done without skil insomuch wee go shewe ourselues skilful bewray beastlinesse one side let v learne god keepe secret himselfe without making v priuie specially seeth surmount small capacitie god openeth thing vnto v knoweth meete expedient v hath bin declared heretofore yet muste reserue many dark thing himselfe wee bee weake yet mount hygh thus yee see god may coceale secret howbeit knowledge ignorant thing nother bycause able v doth bycause able conceyue thing incomprehensible v nowe v truly wee would knowe permitted v wee well ynough alledge cunning shifte deuize many cause yet length wee must needes confounded owne woordes whereas men streyne themselues wise without following god woorde alwayes shewe owne fondnesse wauering wittes nothing lying vvill wee haue pure cleere vnderstanding speake god woorks according skill let v come schoole let v heare speake let v beare away saying specially lette v haue suche sobernesse couet knowe sheweth v vvhen wee come poynt shall speake rightly edifying neighbour shal bee confirmed passe bound god hath set v needes gad astray wee haue leaue nothing vanitie vntruthe doings thus ye see haue remember vpon verse therefore iob addeth haue spoken wist thing mar elouse aboue mee haue vnderstoode confirmeth thing sayd euen iob confesseth spoke without skil bicause vnderstoode thing spake sayeth much sayd haue put forth self vnaduisedly bycause thing maruelouse mee haue knowne heere wee haue marke cause iob graunted ignorant hyghenesse secret wherof would haue spoken god made feele hand yet conceyue cause afflicted therevpon entered deepe teptations say meeneth pinched extremitie ca god finde hart dispatch mee hand would fayne destroyed mee maketh mee linger peyne knoweth nothing frailtie wretched creature suffereth mee long time extremitie wickeddest wight world could worse yet notwithstanding knoweth haue serued vncorruptly persone ought cast fro among men debatings whereinto iob entered preaced farre god secret correct sayeth thing woonderfull therfore let v marke well come vnto god fall talking work ought co sider highe secret weake wit reach vnto say behoueth v haue persuasio wel god prouidece general thing belog spiritual kingdome told v god ordereth al thing thing done world without secrete behoueth v mark wel although euery man graunt god soueraine lord gouerner yet notwithstading whe come point thing whiche see troublesome order ceasse guided secret prouidence god holdeth sterne aboue turneth thing end thinketh good wote done cace vve must reuerently consider able mout vp high secret therfore honour god thing know vntil reuele vnto v thing hidde fro v yet vvere throughly well known dogges barke god prouidece rayle vpon doctrine coteyned holie scripture wold sone ceasse pratling day certaine drukards braynlesse fellowes wil say god gouern al thing must follow men sin else sin ought fathered vpo blasphemy shal heare bicause naughtipackes cannot finde hart yeeld vnto point god prouidence maner gouerning worlde wonderfull doctrine outreaching capacitie leaue nothing vnto god wil need determine thing owne mind raunging therefore let v marke well iob telleth v heere general principle god work skanning al thing done heere bilowe come questio behoueth v bee alwayes reuerend minded aforehand think heere dungeon deepe v therefore must presume speake owne vnderstanding simply woorship god sober without inquiring ouerfarre meane whyle conclude yet notwithstanding god guideth al thing nothing commeth passe aduenture according hath determined doctrine hath often bene handled large heretofore marke one point second let v learne whatsoeuer thing concerne spirituall kingdome god ought taken woonderfull thing aboue v accordingly paule speaketh sensuall man sayeth vnderstandeth secret god according said benefit god hath prepared aboue chosen excellent eye ca see minde man conceyue seyng let v learn pray god inlighten v holy spirite make v stye aboue heauens namely power faith naturall wit neuer atteyne thither haue obteyned may also haue foresayd modestie passing beyond measure faith iob treateth therof anon ye see first point haue mark streyne god work specially promise cocerning euerlasting welfare coteyned gospel woderfull thing aboue v therfore must step rashly malapertly presumptuously reuerently pray god make v taste secret farre foorth behoof open thing day day dark v suffer v passe bound wee may take profit thing shall open vnto v tarie increasing faith let v neuer speake thinke god secret reuerence humilitie furthermore wheras iob confesseth spake wist forasmuch accuseth himselfe rashnesse let v also learne example codemne al talke shall haue cast foorth wee haue bene taught mouth god let v bee ashamed confesse owne follie wee haue shewed beastlynesse speaking without good ground let v clatter whe rebuked gather poyson thinke well done go matter say tush wil neuer say otherwise stil mind let v haue hardhatednesse v wee haue bene ouerbold speaking hastily wandering woords haue scaped v wee wel grounded god truthe let v acknowledge follie renouncing ouerhastinesse speakyng aduenture lette v say iob spake wist herewithall behoueth also bee well aduised afterward practize forealledged lesson beleeuing beyng sure matter wee speake lette v beware wee beleeue aught whiche god hath shewed v wee must come poynt fayth grounded vpo woord god holie scripture wisdome vvhen wee come knowledge may wee speake yea wee may speake thing passe vnderstanding asmuche god shall haue shewed v fayth wee haue sayde afore howbeeit ynough v acknowledge fault must also resort remedie according iob hath giuen v example therof sayd put foorth without vnderstanding wel spake addeth heare wil speak aske thee end thou mayst teache mee heere iob pretedeth represse bicause sawe plaid looce colt keeping within bound confessing fault fashion many men think themselues quite discharged saying one word haue done amisse byandby returne old byasse alwaies new begin doth sayeth lord seing hath bene foolish rashnesse haue farre ouershot self run astray poze thou haue bin well taught thy schole let speake simply thou haste taught mee let befal mee put foorth thing wherof haue skill effect matter coteined verse wheras iob sayeth heare mee wil speake meening craue audience speake hee listeth hee done much alredy excuseth himselfe saying immediatly questioning god shall taught hand therfore let v mark two fashion speaking vnto god one pleade lay forth interrogatory make obiections thinke themselues wise lewd maner speaking presume enter disputation god reply doings let v keepe ourselues kind speche better tung plucked head although ouercommon vice yet detestable vice one wyse borne therfore hath bin sayd afore let v learne keepe mouthes shet speak head imaginacions come mind let fall ground wheras say lawfull v speak meene behoueth v haue stay ourselues tung also al affection able much still feele tickling lust desirousnesse seeke somewhat farre disputing god bicause behoueth v fight beat sobrietie whervnto behoueth faithful brought gospel may simply giue glorie vnto god cofessing theselues know nothing must god child practise point namely presume speake rando whatsoeuer thing thinke good another kinde speaking good holie must followe inquire god may teache see many foade theselues beastlinesse labour bring truthe loth come play brute beast might knowe nothing become vtterly dul therfore behoueth v speake howbeit asking counsell god wit desiring teache v wee haue cofessed haue skill void light reason vnderstanding nothing darknesse lying owne wit wee haue confessed let v come aske counsel god hand saying lord besech thee voutchsafe shew v whatsoeuer good v know neuerthelesse verily behoueth v eue behalf also haue bridle hold v backe else might aske god shall bee requisite many men would haue al thing passe head peraduenture come vnto god aske hand howe excessiue curiositie asking neuer ende aske aught god must alwayes exception lord shew v thing thou knowest expedient welfare knowledge may edifying trusting thy goodnesse feare thy name forasmuch thou lorde knowest slendernesse shewe v thy according abilitie eate honnie doubte sweete taste yet notwithstanding wee see man shall swolne sweetnesse go neare make burst euen v wee seke high knowledge wil end turne bitternes vve may beguiled beginning bicause seeme goodly thing suche one wee may attaine knowledge yea let v cosider hapned father adam would nedes know difference betweene good euill god giuen thereby threw himselfe headlong dungeon wherein wee yet still day sith let v couet great glorie end wil glorie v salomon sayth like honnye euen reason sweetenesse turneth bitternesse man eate much v wee bee inquisitiue god work lawfull v therefore let v couet know may well away except inted ouerwhelmed nowe expresly sayde heare mee speake aske thee intent bee taught wee come god learne hande behoueth v yeelde selues teachable first poynt teachablenesse take mayster obey fully thing shal list tech v yong child come first schoole needes chooze bokes lyking say learne science bee taught suche thing thing haue gone apcee great doctor hee haue meane whereby bee taught come place wher learning pray scholerlyke modestie scholer take man teach ought submitte wholly ought god vvhat co parison cace lette v marke well desire vnfainedly taught god wee followe owne lustes say hee shew v whatsoeuer wee haue conceyued owne heade wee holde v contented whiche hee knoweth bee welfare discerne belongeth vnto cause iob concludeth heeretofore hee hearde speaking god nowe hee hadde seene eye hee sayde lorde true heeretofore haue hearde speaking thy maiestie nowe knowe another manner ende submitte myselfe wholly vnto thee iob maketh comparison heere betweene knowledge hee hadde hadde reuelation wherein god opened himselfe manyfestly vnto hee vtterly abashed touched suche feare hee coulde doe nothing glorifie god wee see hee dothe howbeit ought suffyze v haue hearde god spoken thereof also proceedeth knowledge fayth sayth saint paule commeth heering fayth bringeth v perfect wisedome sayde another place desire know child god known fayth sainct iohn sayth canonicall epistle agayne paule sayth first corinthian fayth enter god secret yea eue deepest spirit dwelleth v warrant v thing enter intoo fleshly vnderstanding faith proceeding hearing bringeth v true perfection wisdome therfore ought satisfie v haue heard god spoken iob ment betoken knowledge whiche heare speaking thing haue seene see thing surer let v mark well iobs meening refuze doctrine wherwith taught god woord preached v v vnderstad doctrine beate eares dead thing vntill god reuele wise know eyesight done dayly gospell preached must god speake v two sort speaketh v meanes man whiche appointed minister teach v againe speaketh v working spirit touched inwardly fare better doctrine haue hart perced without voice vanisheth away vnprofitable sound many gospell speak dayly preached grow hardharted spoken prophet esay go people tell shall see eye heare eares shall vnderstand bicause haue hard hart cannot meanes softened vve see god worke grace men shall alwayes continue stubborne therefore god speaketh v must bee faine discouer shewe v make v see bodily sight perceyuing maiestie wise wee may learne reuerence put ourselues wholly may haue authoritie dominion ouer v let v fall face good god acknowledgemet fault praying make v feele end may come true repentance suffer dayly calling vppon v well doctrine preached v gospell correction sendeth v vnprofitable v wee may learne confirmed feeling sinnes wee may craue forgiuenesse hande seeke remedie goodnesse therewithall desire altogither taught schole yeeld selues teachable vntoo euen till hee haue rid v ignorance stripped v quite cleane vayne trust wherein wrapped may please graunt grace onely v c clviij sermon second vpon xlij chapter therfore abhorre repent dust asshes lord spoken vvoordes vnto iob sayd vnto eliphas themanite vvrath kindled thee vpon thy tvvo companion ye haue spoken rightly mee hath seruant iob therefore take yee seuen ox seuen sheepe get ye seruant iob offer sacrifize selues seruant iob shall pray vvill accept face end folly layd charge haue spoken rightly concerning mee hath seruant iob sawe yesterday perceyue god presence touched glorie bycause without impossible come good order whatsoeuer sayd vnto eyther play deafe folkes else let slip spoken experience sheweth much therefore requisite god speaketh also shewe v giue v liuely perceyuerance maiestie intent wee may feare cause iob protesteth discontented misliketh hee spoken men neuer vtterly mislike workes woordes except feele god bee iudge vvee knowe howe euery man giuen soothe fond flatterie eies dazeled none v seeth owne shame see yet doth willingly regard god muste fayne shew come much reason mislike ourselues take hold shall done fayde v howbeit contrarie part also wil colour vice seeke excuse wee haue true repentance rather wee confesse wee haue done amisse yea euen bee hartely sorie sinner returne rightly vnto god onely acknowledge offence yeeld himselfe giltie also condemne presuming maker therfore let v marke well true repentance importeth hating sin yea euen vttermost insomuch man misliketh hateth bycause one ought loue god rightuousnesse hee condemneth seeketh meanes possible vncaced old skin wherin wrapped true trial repentace herin see shamelesse say repentant yet man cannot get one woord mouth sheweth token lowelinesse farre intending yeeld themselues whole hart vnto god indeuering make amends offence haue done still maynteyne themselues wickednesse put cace acknowledge fault yet nothing worth except vtterly mislyke hate himselfe sayd afore vvherfore one bee well wee see mockerie say man repentant meane season hardharted towardes god shamelesse towardes men nowe iob stranger hee neuer churche god say corporation chozen linage abraham spake maner knew true repentance damnation shall lie vpon v brutish rude dayes wee wote difference betweene cheef ground faith lo wee haue profited gospell prophet yea bodie iewes people god chosen visible churche could skill declare true repentance except men vtterly condemne abace themselues vice nowadayes wheras taken christian vse woord repentance stayne vnhallowe leawd filthie mouthes coueting haue men take repentance flat mocking god much behoueth v marke conteyned heere namely intend shewe wee truely turned vnto god behoueth v haue eye owne shamefulnesse looke vpon wise v may condemned learne owne iudges ende may quit desireth nothing pardon come backe vnto true lowelines iob addeth purposely repent dust ash say redie yeeld wretched offender vnto god may well repent without putting sackloth vpon backe without casting dust vpo head neuerthelesse men old time vsed ceremony intented make solemne protestation vtterly codemned god remedie god graciouse miserable offender therfore let v marke well iob speaketh common repentance acknowledgeth offence greuouse outrageouse deserueth well come halter necke shew ope signes nothing else cursednesse till god receiue gather home true matter myght bee layd foorth length neuerthelesse suffize v effect asshes dust spoken heere cheef poynt repentance outward token furthermore token alwayes requisite make open protestation outrageouse crime behoueth faithfull wel aduised repent mislike themselues life long passe one day without many misdooings comit infinite fault without knowledge yea eue thinking well examine ourselues throughly shal alwayes find somewhat still amisse v therfore haue cause sorrowe yet notwithstanding shal neede make open protestation men may repentance well without outward signes ioyned fault grosse god wrath sheweth selfe towards v must sorie mislyke selues also consideratio may edifie neighbour must adde outward signes man haue giuen stumbling blocke seeth god name blasphemed god discouereth shame hee must mislyke hate himselfe also match outward humilitie men record seale ratifie repetance must euery particular persone also whole people according wee see hath alwayes bin practize churche moreouer let v marke wel ynough v haue outward token hart must specially wounded throughly greeued prouoking god wrath v may conceyue sorinesse condemne ourselues vtterly dismayed ourselues sorrowe wherof sainct paule speaketh sayeth must shun bycause saluatio therfore sayd also prophet ioell rend hart garment true vnto offended greuously desirouse god heare prophet giueth commandment returne sackloth dust asshes confesse themselues offender craue forgiuenesse declare solemne protestation haue deserued death haue pitie howbeit forasmuchas men sore inclyned hypocrisie wil needes content god fayre contenaces forget ought first cheef point prophet sayeth expresly hart must rent hardnesse must put away wee see effect iob ment say repenting vnaduized speeche hee addeth light small sin heynouse hee readye shewe himselfe wretched offender committed crime woorthie death hath none hope refuge mere mercie god yea euen make protestation willingly men end haue bene offended may set vp againe men knowe desireth nothing humble himselfe vnder god hand seing side haue doone fault let v learne lessen hyde acknowledge yea euen vtter abacing ourselues againe haue begonne mislyke sinnes hart iothe sorie end god enter account v let v also haue modestie men vse protestation god liketh namely confesse respect haue deserued death god admit v mercie let shame sin hinder v making amends offence whiche wee haue giuen dooing amisse herevpon sayde god spoken vnto iob turned himselfe eliphas themanite sayd vnto wrath kindled thee thy companion yee haue spoken rightly mee seruant iob hath done vvee haue seene heretofore god found fault iob nowe secondarily findeth fault companion yea much roughly come comparison made betwene iob freends wee haue marke order sayd god hauing spoken woordes vnto iob turned talke wrongfully condemned hereby warned although god chastize fatherly ge tlenesse yet notwithstanding hee executeth iustice throughly vpon according sayd punishment chastizements begin owne house churche yee see god rebuketh iob meane whyle letteth alone whiche offended grossely might demad yea vvhy doeth god set himselfe alonly iob partie least offended although done fault yet bee borne withall fault companion yet god seemeth vtter rigour alone lo man might say howbeit rebuked first bycause thing haue alledged prophet must sulfilled wit god beginneth chastize householdfolke first vvhen intendeth execute iustice beginneth vnbeleeuers letteth alone spareth though forgotten fault throughly recorded shall come account suffereth sin loueth ripe yea rotte yea meane chastizeth hath adopted auoweth child sheweth signes roughnesse whyle stranger take rest welter ease pleasure thus ye see shewed v text verie profitable lesson v wee see dayly state faithfull miserable state despisers god godly seeme vtterly forsaken drag wing pine away world meane whyle wicked set vp crest merrie make iolly chere euen skorne god would trouble men see thing wee doctrine iudgement beginneth god owne house according also sayd prophete esay god shall haue finished woork vpon mount sion spare wicked prophet sayeth purposely god must performe al correction church forsomuch owne hee setteth moste store therefore must visit first clenze sinnes reforme may bring home himselfe must one day away till haue made end whole woorke horrible vengeace prepared abused patience hardened harte whyles bare peter also warneth v ala freends sayeth let v bee greeued child world god letteth alone peace wee meane chastized hand state hard troublesome beare let v beare paciently sayeth seyng wee muste bee faine passe furnace bee tried maner shall become god hath vtterly forsaken let v acknowledge goodnesse god according also prophet sayeth god hath long borne likened frutes reserued ende yeere good rotten gathered sooner shal neuerthelesse eaten men shall honour notwithsta ding gathered let v learne god procureth furthereth welfare pleaseth chastize v first al others wicked giue themselues making good cheere howbeit wee cannot say eliphas companion vtterly reiected god contrariwise hee accepted yet alienated tyme iob must faine meane else shall find meanes fauour forgiuenesse compare iob wee say one household church others yee would say banished time till god haue reconciled yet ye see iob rebuked meane god speaketh woord others therfore let v consider haue erst sayd god loueth v hastie visiting v hee seeth haue stepped awrie gone right way saluation watcheth ouer v bring v home againe speede let v come comparison set downe heere betweene iob freends sayd iob spake rightly god howe god notwithstanding condemned ignorant ouerweening vnpacient persone sayd rightnesse haue told heretofore iob vndertake good cace howbe proceeded amisse iob therefore ouershot himselfe following matter yet cace good stil corrariwise iobs freends vsed goodly reason wee haue gathered holie doctrine yet ground worke euil tooke general ground quite besides cace iob punished misdeed taken wicked cursed creature seing god vsed rigour towards furthermore also set downe false vntoward doctrine saying god doth euen world hadle according desert much take away hope euerlasting life shet fauorablenesse god frayle transitorie life turning al thing vpside downe therefore behoueth v call twoo point remembrance wee may knowe ryghtnesse spoke short wee must note text haue alledged psalm heretofore namely man blissed iudgeth discretly poore aduersitie prophete sheweth v wee see man aduersitie god wee haue discreetnesse condemne first dash looke vp hygher wit consider aduersities sometimes befall men chastizement sinnes sometyme tryall pacience sometime preuent fault might fall also god setteth foorth mirrours end seing obedience might edified therby sometymes secret cause vnknowne v therfore let v eschew rashnesse wee see god afflict man roughly let v swift iudgemet say woorthie handled commend liue ease though better beloued god vnaduised iudging haue discretion v consider cause noted v scripture shall find diuerse time excellent seruants god handled moste rigorously seeme v god wee muste iudge owne fancie wee vse modestie god alwayes succour v wee afflicted cruell foolishe giuing hastie sentence like measure must bee moten vnto v also furthermore better vnderstanding whiche sayde heere namely iob hath spoken ryghtly friendes amisse behoueth v take generall rule man forewardnesse followe god feare shal accepted notwithstading commit grosse fault whereas another man haue true feare god rooted although haue apparant vertues commendable men yet nothing worth starke filth looke say vpon man feareth god rightly purely mynded giue himselfe welldoing yet notwithstanding shall haue many infirmity hee halteth staggereth reeleth yea sometimes falleth flat downe yea faultes hee doth forgiuen god doth still reach hande lifte vp insomuch falleth benefite bycause marke aimeth goe vnto god minde leadeth still thytherward contrarie parte maye come passe sayde man shall bee greatly commended hee shall haue goodly vertues shall doe thing worthy honor yet meane hath good roote eyther despyzer god vnmercifull towards neyghbors bee one none thing men honor ca please god hereby may vnderstand taking iob iob haue erst said al life long bin giue weldoing bene ryghtuouse man one feared god yea sayd singlenesse hart purposely attributed vnto heretofore shewe life shal neuer wel ruled till cleane rid faynednesse walke sight god men doubleminded substantially grounded giue ourselues wholly vnto god hath bin spoken expresly iob cocerning present cace indured afflictio patiently neuerthelesse end tormented extremitie hee fretted thafed specially men fell stinging forgate ouershot seeming minded resist god scaped fro many vnaduised word iobs fault pacience hilde ought haue done playd fole talk namely particular saying yet kept stil marke spake beginning howsoeuer swarue aside yet flingeth quite away holdeth race though go altogither rightforth like archer shooting mark although hit whyte full yet men see amed well hee shoote somewhat neere euen stoode cace iob cause god attributeth rightnesse vnto let v learne haue pure holie intent seeke earnestly good although weake although wrapped many vice although happen stagger fall although effect deserue forsaken god yet notwithstanding hee beareth v hath eye infirmity vice codemne without forgiuenesse cause sayd scripture giue lues seruing god keping law rightuouse maner zacharie elizabeth ryghtuouse god rightuouse found sayd psalme must v need condened wretched sinner v haue mouthes stopped yes verely howbeeit besides god receyued zacharie elizabeth gouerne holie spirit also accept desirousenesse wel nothing perfectio desire vtterly vnperfect obedience ought yet doth god accept good woorth bycause men earnestly desirous serue hee layeth imperfection charge thus ye see accepteth rightuouse although fault v yet god forgiue shall buried mercie faile take v iust rightuouse hart bend thitherward honour giue ourselues wholly obedience sayd afore ought serue v vnto two purpose see first al papist witts take text ground merit vpon say behold heere mention made rightnesse ergo deserue godward haue pure right hart come vnto ala wherof commeth rightnesse deserue comendacion mouth god might also condemne v hundredthousand tymes without shewing v fauour howbeeit forasmuchas hee wypeth fault forgetteth intedeth haue regard therfore accepteth v rightuouse therfore cace let v acknowledge mere mercie goodnesse let v honour furthermore seing sayd lord cotented v accepteth thing good comendable notwithstanding defiled although much amisse many great fault imperfectios work deserue abhorred god bicause bring nothing filthinesse yet notwithstanding accepteth receiueth work stained vice sacrifise sweete sent ought take corage well seing ought inflamed serue honour ye see haue mark verse way let v mark also may well heroical act men terme behaue ourselues vertuously courteously deuized men may carie v vpo shoulder yet shal nothing except wee haue liuely roote hart desirouse serue god mark haue taken shoote much better go right way limping make greate leapes yet neuer foreward yea make great shewes meane whyle haue hart snarled wicked affection let v beware wee couet praysed much men let v alway come vnder gouernance lord may hold brydle ouer v bethinke v giue ourselues obedietly way haue sure infallible record thing hath bin treated although iob fayled point yet ceassed haue good cace seing god copetet iudge therof auoweth cotrarie part although frends faire colour reason fauorable seeming yet misliked haue shewed two reason wherof one condemned iob bicause strike god hand wil haue iudgement reuersed aboue let v learne leaue iudging aduenture god chastizeth men let v cosider wel cause conteyned holie scripture let v towards neyghbours also towards ourselues doth god afflict v let v wise according also whe iames speaketh patiece purposely termeth wisdome surely gretest wisdome haue knowe god father haue receiued grace hee offereth v lord iesuschrist ca take afflictios meekly sendeth v bowing downe shoulder vnder fal coforting ourselues misery cheering vp ourselues sorrowes way v rightly taught schole god whe soeuer god scourgeth v let v coceiue hartburning bitternesse shall gayne nothing rather let v beare mind holy scripture sheweth v namely needfull v bee mortified bicause much giue world loth think vpo heauenly life desire plight yet moreouer god knoweth many secret rebellion flesh therfore neede bee subdued mayne hand againe wee know obey shuld handle v always liking ease therefore faine chastise v play rough play v howbeit therin procureth welfare trying v sending v rough troublesome thing wee grudge time obediece well allowed thing haue mark iudge discretly afflictios god sendeth v likewise neighbour shall haue said rightnes wherof god beareth witnesse heere owne mouth coclusio said god sendeth eliphas copanions vnto iob comaundeth offer sacrifice sayth iob shal find grace end sinnes may forgiuen heere first haue marke although god rebuke eliphas companion maner yet woulde driue quite away although condemnation pronounced vpon yet ende shoulde suffer lie still vtterly throwne downe without remission two sortes condemnation god pronounceth vppon men two first may also deuided intoo two generally god condemneth v either ende acquit v hee shall haue found v humbled else destroy v vtterly doth vnbeleeuers yet notwithstanding two sortes condemnation welfare one alreadie faythfull god chastizeth dayly although god account v housholde wee bee fully reconciled yet haue neede condemned stirred vp thereby continually wee may ashamed selues bee sorie hate sinnes seeke remedie end magnifie mercie hee sheweth v wee obtayne forgiuenesse hand thus ye see condemnation god layeth vpon chosen notwithstanding one hath taken flocke yet another condemnation healthfull also sort straungers god church haue none acquaintance according see hee condemned saint paule tyme hee persecuter euen person saint paule wee may better vnderstande thing intende say shoulde alledge twoo seuerall person thing woulde easie vnderstood beholde saint paule wicked man yee woulde haue thought bene vtterly past recouerie yet one god chosen hee marked afore hande mother wombe apostle yet notwithstanding hee seemed bee god church rather vtter enimie neuerthelater god condemned beate downe ridde pride wherewith inflamed made cace poore slaue burthen verie heauie condemnation yea yet welfare meete pride shoulde bee subdued beaten downe force ye see healthfull condemnation yet man vtterly estraunged god seemed bee quite past hope recouerie nowe saint paule condemned fashion thereby brought folde god flocke became sheepe yea therwithall also shepheard onely one lambes iesus christ also shephearde flocke yet behoued condemned againe howe god buffeted hee sayeth god gaue satan leaue giue hym buffet way reproche intent hee shoulde exalt himselfe reason highnesse reuelations god giuen behoued haue counterpoyson driue poyson pryde keepe thus wee see saint paules person twoo maners condemning welfare vvee see like present place iobs freendes bee condemned owne saluation thereby god openeth gate sheweth maye hope pardon come true repentance yet doth draw backe hee commeth familiarly vnto iob neither graunteth accesse entrance vntoo meane expressed heere wit iob shoulde make intercession heere therefore wee see two diuerse example god mercie although handle men diuerse fashion yet must wee alwayes consider hee procureth welfare hath vtterly forsaken thereby taught take correction paciently whiche god sendeth although seeme handle v child take v straungers yet let v ceasse hope pitie v length turne condemnation whiche wee shall haue indured time benefite soulehealth although wee cannot lay forth spoken heere concerning sacrifizes yet must wee note one worde god time receyued men mercie without sacrifice betoken obteyn forgiuenesse sinnes wee must haue recourse sacrifice offered vp redemption long iesus christ meane betweene god v must continue accursed forlotne hopelesse beholde god welspring righteousnesse sheweth enimie sinne sin dwelleth v therefore must god needes open warre v vengeance must light vpon v yea tarye vpon v euer shift scape resorting sacrifize whereby wee haue beene reconcyled vnto therefore let v marke wee bee much lesse excused nowadayes christ hath suffered death passion thinke quit god meane clensing christ hath made cause hee hath made satisfaction v discharge v condemnation death wherein seeke obteyne mercie haue need onely meanes wherby v come vnto god wee must alwayes beare minde death passion lorde iesus christ sacrifize redemption attonement vvhen go way woorke let v doubt inasmuch lorde hath shewed himselfe pitiful towarde offended time figure lawe yea extended mercie bodie peculiar people hee also receyue v day seeing gospell published thorow whole worlde hath made common league well gentile iewes wal put difference betwixt let v doubt say haue recourse vnto god meanes sayd sacrifice preuent v intent hauing obteyned fauor hande may assured saluation let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement fault praying clenze v whensoeuer bee rebuked therwithall make v feele fatherly goodnesse soo wee may haue whereof take comfort aduersityes bee greeued though hee beginne chastize v meane spare wretched vnbeleeuers knowing meanes hee declareth v seeing hath chosen v himselfe hee haue v rishe therefore let v pray hee suffer roddes vnprofitable v shoulde abyde still hardened oure sinnes hee wyll drawe v throughly wee may lowlinesse acknowledge sinnes bee sorie heartes yea also protest men much bound vnto mercie ende neighbor may edified v one v draw another glorifying whole life hereof may please stirre vp true c clix sermon thirde vpon xlij chapter sermon yet still vpon eight verse vpon text insuing eliphas themanite baldad suhite sophar naamathite vvent god commaunded lorde receyued face iob lorde turned captiuitie iob vvhen prayed freends blissed latter state iob first brother sister came vnto bin acquaintance vvith house compassion comforted aduersitie lord caused come vpon receiued eche peece siluer ech ornament golde lorde blissed latter state iob first insomuch hee xiiij thousand sheepe six thousand camel thousand yoke ox thousand sheeasses also seuen sonnes three daughter called name one iemima name another kezia name thirde kerenhapuk vvere founde fairer vvomen countrey iobs daughter father gaue heritance among brother thing iob liued hundred forrie yeares savv sonnes sonnes vnto fourth generation died aged full satisfied vvith dayes wee haue seene howe god rebuking iobs freends would leaue hopelesse called repentance telling hee woulde heare haue pitie vpon ye see correction profitable v god shetteth gate agaynst v sheweth v readie receyue v mercie otherwise boot v couicted sinnes vve drowned dispaire toke hold god mercie shoulde wee neuer bee touched true earnestnesse repent v euill doings rather wexe hardhearted chafe vpon brydle none amendment v therfore let v marke well god worketh men singular benefite causing feele theyr owne naughtinesse sheweth yet notwithstanding shal obteyne fauour seeke heerewithal haue seene also god commaunded men bring sacrifice iob end pray humble although god shewe himselfe gentle welminded towardes v yet haue neede partly shew himselfe hard intreated v yea make v haue disliking sinnes oftentimes seemeth sufficient v haue giue one good sigh away commonly say tongue dally god repentance ought make v vtterly dismayd ought sttike v feare whe consider god wrath able ouerwhelme v vtterly vve thinke vpon wee passe ouer wee would passe ouer whote burning cole say respect good profitable v lorde reine v short shew v yet still naughtinesse lurking v standeth v hande perceyue better god afoording large penywoorthes mercie vnto men intent alwayes bee humbled cal mind fault haue committed therfore reason said text iob pray offended yet notwithstanding doubted well sacrifice iobs person god ment shewe men haue neede meane mediator make way cause finde fauour according see law god ordeyned high priest enter alone sanctuarie name people men else stande aloofe acknowledging themselues vnworthie preace neere presence god betoken without mediator go vnto god oure behalfe shoulde neuer bee lawfull v pray vntoo good right also wee shoulde bee hilde scorne shette nowe iob hilde heere roome office preest hee made intercession frendes hee toke vpon owne head beene great presumptio behoued sewe vnto god mennes pardon yet could hee himselfe come thither withoute mediator aduocate howe coulde haue obteyned grace rest god inioined charge touching present act god appoynted iob preest behoued apostle sayeth man ought take honour vppon sauing appoynted god one true lawfull preest like iesus christ himselfe thoughe hee bee mayster churche heade men angelles sitteth glorie god father yet notwithstanding thrust himselfe called therevntoo solemne othe sayde haue sworne repent thou art preest euer order melchisedecke let v marke wel whereas iob set foorth preest ende wee gather thereof whensoeuer haue seeke forgiuenesse sin euery v must thrust forth himselfe without hauing better meane consider office iesus christ giue v accesse open v gate bring v presence god father end may herd throne maiestie may terrible amyable v done time lawe yea euen among whome god communicated himselfe familiarly shall dayes wee haue full declaration iesus christ aduocate maketh intercession v intent sutes may well receyued heerein appeareth vnthankefulnesse worlde hath beene cause seeking many aduocates patrones euery man hath seuerall deuotion bring himselfe vnto god bycause men haue knowne office lorde iesus christ let v marke whensoeuer v offendeth hee must steppe rashly heauenly throne come thither meanes appoynted purpose sure god shake v haue promise whiche cannot deceyue v wee come thither geerishly aduenture shall boote v awhitte like cace sacrifice spoken heere prayer neuer heard without sacrifice god intended shewe good right men vnworthie come vnto bycause haue deserued death fore coming thither shuld destruction therfore euer minded obteyne fauour haue brought sacrifice cofesse daunger god iudgement could deliuered otherwise sacrifice verie heathen men haue also followed vnderstode ende therfore onely witnesse agaynst themselues neuerthelesse god leaue president whole world acknowledge nothing damnatio themselues could ridde except sinnes blotted making amedes nowe haue truth reueled vnto v gospell oft pray god wee must haue recourse death passion oure lorde iesus christ cannot otherwise reconciled vnto therefore prayer must besprinckled bloud shed wash away spottes thus ye sehow may become acceptable god notwithstading good right mortall enimie haue made warre vnto vengeance curse lie vpon v wit coming vnto sacrifice offered lorde iesus christ applying vse intent prayer may blissed throughly accepted god hee faile receyue v intoo fauour howbeeit noted whereas god sayth end follie vntoo worde worde text maner speech woulde bee somewhat hardest wee marke written eightenth psalme wee shall haue plaine easie declaration saying sayde god handle men according hee findeth vvith frowarde sayeth hee deale frowardly may seeme verie straunge neuerthelesse proueth god chaungeth purpose like vntoo v onely importeth wee shall finde god bee rough ryder rough horse prouerbe sayth bee stubborne stiffenecked wee bowe god come vppon v maine blowes beetle might seeme vntoo v god terrible feerce according therefore wee finde god bee wee conceyue bee fancy hee stryketh vppon v one hee sayde bee althoughe chaunge light vppon maiestie muche sayde text sayde ende doo follie thoughe lorde shoulde say ende handle according follie frowardnesse woorde importeth also intent execute vengeance vpon say intent handle suche fashion haue deserued looke ye go seruant iob according haue sayde alreadie namely forasmuch iobs freends hauing knowledge offence yet sufficiently subdeued god faine discouer shame make perceyue hee shoulde handle worthie woulde terrible dealing therefore iob came meane betwixt prayer woulde one therewithall obedience declared god commaunded heerein see howe men chaunged god speaketh effectually making heare voyce eares also making receyue hart time iobs frends taken reprobate gaue iudgement vpon without admitting excuce spake lustily agaynst though bin sillie worme earth vyler thing worme nowe come yea euen intreatance god hath bereft pryde blinded lo chaunge followeth humbled god hath spoken heart knowe wee bee nothing keepeth v walking feare fro vtter abacing ourselues bee sotted foolish ouerweening thinke selues therfore god must faine teach v men worlde cannot mend foolishe pride wherewith puffed vp till god haue put hande besides iobs freendes forgotten pride wherewith erewhyles beene caried away also shewe theyr repentance obeying god verie deede true frute sheweth roote good otherwise lie hidde heart indeuer obey god ordinaunce also cause sayde actes men brother shall wee doo vvhen saint peter thudered agaynst erewhyles despysed oure lorde iesus christ sayde beeing wounded theyr heartes pricked inwardly remorse said shal offered themselues vnto god followe whatsoeuer shoulde commaunde therfore wee see like frute repentance text iobs freends vpon knowledge putting away fonde ouerweening wherwith bene hild come god willed whensoeuer wee bee throughly humbled god displeased selues shal also haue willingnesse desire submit selues god woorde one peece ouerweening thing haue ymagined owne braine wee needes bee ouerwise wee cannot obey god vtterly bereft pride know god ought haue authoritie tel v good v doo nothing else v doo submit selues without gainsaying nowe added immediately god receyued face iob turned captiuitie turned repentance prayed freends seeing god regarded face iob accepted prayer forsomuch appoynted bee pr est pray haue wee much better certentie seeing euerlasting aduocate entered sanctuarie heauen wit lorde iesus christ shall neuer refuzed wee neyther come god hys father meanes holding euermore way furtherance hee hath giuen v beholde iob poore man euen entering high way blaspheme god although hee holde himselfe pacience winding vp yet pangues made fling ouer feeldes somuch fended god greeuously haue declared heeretofore yet god inioyned office praying heard onely himselfe also straungers yea suche bene enemy good well neere separated fro god vtterly peruerted woorde beaten downe destroyed hope endlesse lyfe come haue sayde afore yet notwithstanding iob obteyneth grace nowe sayde god made thing auaylable little dimme shadowe shall bee done nowe hee hath appoynted owne onely sonne bee priest commaunded offer vp goates calues sheepe offer vp bodie soule sacrifice seeing sonne god hath owne person offered himselfe redemption away sinnes ceasseth make intercession v still shoulde wee doubt obteyning forgiuenesse sake beeing alwaies receyued louingnesse fauour god hande haue touched alreadie naughtynesse worlde sheweth selfe men content themselues one mediatour alone papist runne seeking hee saincts sheesaincts bee patrones aduocates cause thereof yeeld muche woorship vnto iesus christ acknowledge hath bought deathe passion well ynough call sonne god redeemer acknowledge aduocate neyther flee succour know pray heare tydings among side dutie becommeth v speake duely taught oft wee shoulde pray vnto god euerlasting sacrifice wherby redemption hath bene purchased v ought come remembrance eye wee neuer thinke vppon glaunce many grosse beastly although ought haue eares deafe hearing iesus christe aduocate yet discerrie betweene god lord iesus christ somuch shoulde call vpon father name lorde iesus christe wote whither bee aduocate maketh intercession v maruell though lorde oftentimes dazle men eye end turne away meane furtherance whiche hath giuen worde turned away maliciousnesse haue shet gate themselues might haue none accesse vnto god call vpon according also know opening except wee haue iesus christe spokesman whome haue forsaken bicause diuell hath time laboured put forth fonde imagination carie away men hither thither let v keepe selues gadding rather sith see god hath heard men meanes sacrifice priestes law entered vaine sactuarie made man hand corruptible brought better thing bloud beast let v sure nowe lord iesus christ make v find god pitifull fauourable towards v shal receiued mercie doubtlesse prayer grounded vpon sacrifice hee hath offered acknowledge belongeth carie worde v cause v heard heerewithall haue also marke sayd heere god made iobs captiuitie tuine turned repentance may woordes bee taken playnest translation turned iobs captiuitie anguish wherein taken away else captiuitie say cattell substance bene taken away restored againe howsoeuer betokeneth end god pitie vpon seruant yea purposely expressed haue come passe iob prayed freindes say persecuted wee haue seene afore herein see wee loue enimies procure welfare saluation shall owne benefite profite god make blessing returne vppon v vvee bee diuerse time afrayde least wee bee gentle kinde hearted men haue offended v diuelish prouerb man play sheepe woolfe eate vp muche practised cause wee bee wedded owne reuenge men haue troubled v done v wrong seemeth v forgiuing wee layde open reproche enimies take boldnesse agaynst v behoueth v let fancy go god hath taken charge v himselfe hath giuen v good shephearde euen lorde iesus christ hath promised keepe v furthermore let v marke well wee pray vexe v blissing light vpon v please god take place verie well whereas enimies shall bee brother continue wilfull malice yet lorde make requestes redounde selues shal haue made thus ye see purposely sayd god looked mercifully vpon iob whe prayed misvsed haue seene behoueth v call mind iames saith haue heard paciece iob seene ende issue god gaue sheweth v afflictios god sendeth vpo child laste ende right happie farre better afflicted time liue alwayes ease god spare much would fall asleepe world vve knowe obedience lustes flesh would play reslife iades wee would thinke vpon nothing present transitorie life therefore let v vnderstande god afflicteth faythfull one first purpose presse vttermoste hee knoweth bee able beare sainct paule sayeth accordingly forasmuche god faythfull suffer v bee tempted beyonde able beare furthermore sheweth ende haue cause wishe beaten god scourge according dauid saith lorde good thou didst chastise insomuch may alwaies glorie aduersities correction thing whiche behoueth v marke streyne iobs sake written god blissed latter state hys first hee doubled goodes substance whiche verie great afore hee gaue sonnes daughter lengthued life saw child came owne race vnto fourth generation seene himselfe lowe ebbe true holy ghost ment leaue memoriall gracious goodnesse god shewed vpon person iob howbeit instruction without cause saint iames hath set v downe selfesame mirrour saying freends true hard troublesome thing kepepacience men tormented agaynst nature howbeit ende god turneth thing wise welfare perceyue much better haue beene afflicted haue beene much tenderly borne withall cockered short whe soeuer troubled aduersitie meane onely b also haue hartbytings set v chafe tempt v dispayre carpe god let v bethink v thing haue read iob pacience wee compare aduersities aduersities able beare wee shall certenly finde god ment set mirrour passed temptation trouble dayly befall godly see iob one side spoyled substance hee beene rich prince countrey vtterly bereft thing hath neither house thing else left besides yee see also bereft child hys wife spyted agaynst bodie behold rotten carion one men would bee loth looke vpon according wee haue seene complaine skinne cleaued bone yea hath beene sayd scraped rottennesse fleshe potsherd terrible sight yet thing iob suffered bothe goodes child wife hys bodie cheefe thing indured nothing comparison anguishe hee abode hee sawe god agaynst also thing whereat hee greeued hee made complaintes saying vvhat nowe vvhy doth god take away vvhy raced worlde must singer heere sort seeing poore frayle creature doth god presse greeuously iob great trouble saw god aduersarie partie side wist seeing must greeue v wee bee meanly afflicted god chastice v according infirmitie euerie man owne behalfe wee must thinke straunge let v resort storie written learning therevpon haue eye ende wee looke extremitie wherein iob time god persecuted ala wee shall bee vtterly dismayde none v hee shall vtterly quayle saying vvhat booteth man serue god seeing suche haue walked feare vnfortunate looke vpon ende thing wherein haue wherewith comfort selues namely first haue sayde bycause affliction god child last secondly serue salues medicine moreouer end alwayes happie insomuch haue euer cause glorifie god onely hee deliuereth also bycause hee mortifyeth wicked lustes also therein haue better confirmation doctrine whereas lorde iesus christ liuely image faythfull child god bee made conformable saint paule declareth eight romaynes aduersities wee shaped like image lord iesus christ eldest sonne house god truely looke onely vpon crosse iesus christ cursed god owne mouth shall see nothing shame terrour short seeme verie gulfe hell open swallow vp iesus christ whe ioyne resurrection death behold wherwith comfort v beholde wherewith asswage sorrowes ende ouersorowfull whensoeuer shall please god afflict v purposely fulfilled lord iesus christ intent knowe written one person onely intent v vnderstand sonne god make v partaker lyfe die partaker glorie wee beare shame aduersities shall please god lay vpon shoulder according also paule speakecth another place vve see cause reherced v bee vtterly dismayde wee see god afflicteth v conceyue sorow shet vp hart hold v prisoner might receiue comfort wee alwayes haue eye end god hath promised child according hath shewed effect well iob also dauid others cheeflyest lorde iesus christ true cheefe patterne faithfull true doth comonly fal god doubleth benefites towardes haue beene afflicted may seene farre rycher haue child ofspring desired worldwarde alwayes seene god handleth v one egall rate kn weth fitte euery man behoueth v frame selues receyue portion suche wise shall please deale vnto v householder hande knoweth well meete household howsoeuer worlde go behoueth v take generall rule god onely bring affliction ende also make turne welfare wee shall perceyue forgat v time hee afflicted v rather wed himselfe continually father towardes v suffered v fall fast asleepe worlde temporall blisings well may wee take also god sendeth howbeit let v haue eye principall nothing else bee confirmed god goodnesse wee haue e greater assurance ayde fayth alwayes exercised bee afflicted verie much man scarce knew auaylable god fauor helpe v need doth affliction see god strengthneth wise holy spirite beareth affliction meekly whe deliuered knoweth god put hand thervpon gathereth seeing god hath assisted one brut wil neuer faile none thing one side see helpe god giueth v secondly worketh v holy spirit intent quaile finally sheweth v experience redy help v al time say estimable profite yet god maketh v perceiue infirmity wee knew therby prouoked cal vpo though wherted v therevnto otherside whereas taken correction come haphazarde taught receiue hand make profit whe striken bee better dispozed seke heauenly life suche royst worldward turne away fro god contrariwise bee ouermaistred god hath cast v downe ground brought lowe feeble wote become end make v cleaue vnto taste better spirituall welfare prepared v wee none thing ought know thing written iob performed v haue true example therfore let v suffer god handle v deale benefites v himselfe shall see good howsoeuer fare let v assure selues end shall alwaies happie none thing afflicti rue bring v glorie lord iesus christ taken world shal companie sonne god angel honor although sharpe ard flesh yet notwithstanding haue reioyce continually yeeld thankes vnto god specially hee deliuereth v present mi erie howbeit forasmuch could discharg length ynough haue short summe ings sayd forbeare speake iobs daughter effect scripture met betoke god made prosper suche wise worldward may see eye fauored yea euen beyond commo rate let v thinke aunge god woulde dayes vtter loue towardes faithfull earthly transitorie prosperitie heauenly life perfectly discouered nowadayes gospell iesus christ yet manifested came downe hither lift v vp clothed himselfe flesh shew god dwelleth v hath ioyned v glorie immortalitie thing yet come passe therfore behoued faithfull handled partly like little child cause auncient father spoken scripture purposely said god blissed ofspring cattell possession thing specially length life helped meanes wee must bee contented life haue liued whensoeuer shall please god take v world true scripture speaketh iob abraham died olde men full satisfied dayes expresse temporall blissing haue spoken howsoeuer haue large declaration god fatherly loue towards v therfore behoueth v satisfied life dispose selues die shall please god may go hence glad hart gnashing teeth vnbeleeuers liued hundred thousand yeres disposed themselues depart whensoeuer god listed take hence himselfe ought side nowadays haue told alredie must loke liue long take knowledge god fatherly loue therby liued three dayes world inough
